Meanwhile, as that torrent of Magic Power coursed throughout his body, entering each cell, the Blue Young Dragon’s aura soared ever higher, creating a whirlwind on the ground.
At the same time,
Crackle!
Arcs of electricity danced around his body, crackling noisily, like hundreds of birds chattering simultaneously...

chapters.title: Chapter 12 - 11: The 2nd Talent Magic
chapters.content:
Chapter 12: Chapter 11: The 2nd Talent Magic
A surge of magic power spread from the stomach like magma, burrowing into the blood vessels and then merging into every part of the body.
With the influx of magic power, the Blue Young Dragon seemed to break through a certain boundary, and the aura suddenly swept away, catching the nearby Kobold off guard and knocking them back.
"His Highness Austin!"
All the Kobolds stared wide-eyed at all this, but seeing the electric arc sparks leaping outside his body, none of them dared to approach him.
However, soon Austin’s aura calmed down, and the surrounding anomalies vanished as well.
At the same time, whether it was an illusion of the Kobolds or not, the Blue Young Dragon seemed to have become stronger, and the color of his scale armor appeared to have deepened.
Simultaneously, the Blue Young Dragon slowly opened his eyes, a sense of enlightenment surging in his heart.
Just now, he had awakened his second talent magic.
"Thunder Strike Technique, huh..."
Austin focused his mind, and the magic power inside him began to circulate along a fixed circuit, immediately stirring the air in front of him as the magic power moved.
In the next moment,
Boom!!!
A bolt of lightning suddenly descended from a clear sky, as if tearing through the air, striking a large tree in front of him.
In an instant, white light flashed, and the entire tree burned fiercely in a very short time, its branches and leaves turned to ashes, leaving only a few massive charred trunks standing quietly, continuously emitting white smoke.
"Hiss, what power!"
Seeing the scene before him, even Austin couldn’t help but gape in shock.
This talent magic was far stronger than the first useless ability he awakened, Electric Shock Paralysis, which couldn’t attack at a distance. Just the power produced by Thunder Strike Technique, if Austin were to use it on the previous Ghost-headed Crocodile leader, it would surely be crippled or killed.
"It’s a pity that while the Thunder Strike Technique is incredibly powerful, it also consumes a lot of energy, and being able to use it even once in battle is considered good."
Feeling that more than half of the magic power in his body was almost depleted, Austin couldn’t help but smile wryly.
Nevertheless, having awakened his second talent magic, Austin’s strength significantly increased, at least he now had a very formidable trump card up his sleeve.
"With this, I’m more confident in dealing with that group of beasts."
Recalling the pack of Blood Wolves still lurking nearby, a cold glint flashed in the Blue Young Dragon’s eyes.
The Ghost-headed Crocodiles in the lake reservoir have already been cleaned out, and next, it’s time to clean up the site, especially the corpses of those slain Ghost-headed Crocodiles, which need to be made into smoked meat before they spoil.
This smoked meat is naturally a product of the knowledge and experience Austin brought from his previous life to this world.
In this otherworld, the Kobolds have no effective means of food preservation, or rather, for these races living at the bottom of the continent, maintaining their own survival is tough enough, and having leftover meat to store is virtually impossible. During the harsh winters, the most they could eat were nuts picked from the forest in the summer, starchy tree roots, fruit seeds, and some wild rice and wheat, but more often they relied on grass roots and bark to barely get through one cold, hungry winter after another.
Lacking the need to store meat naturally means they didn’t know how to preserve leftover meat.
If not for Austin’s guidance, the Ghost-headed Crocodiles from the past two days probably would have already gone bad.
"You guys go do your own thing, no need to mind me. And, you did well today. Aside from this one Ghost-headed Crocodile leader, the rest are your brave rewards."
Austin pointed to the Ghost-headed Crocodile’s corpse on the ground and said to the Kobold leader Vini beside him.
This Ghost-headed Crocodile leader was a Magic Beast; besides the Magic Beast Crystal Core in its head, its body also contained quite a bit of magic power, so Austin certainly couldn’t afford to waste it lightly.
"Thank you for your generosity, His Highness Austin!"
The Kobold leader Vini exclaimed gratefully, deeply appreciative of the Blue Young Dragon.
Subsequently, under the leadership of the Kobold leader, the Kobolds skillfully packed the dozen or so Ghost-headed Crocodile corpses into a basket and carried them back.
Next, they would gut the dead Ghost-headed Crocodiles, with their solid muscles being cut into pieces and placed into a furnace for smoking, to be made into smoked meat.
The tough crocodile skin would also be peeled, processed, and dried, made into a dozen sets of armor to protect the Kobolds, with the rest stored in the warehouse. If one day they ran out of food in the harsh winter, they could cut it down and boil it as winter survival food.
As for the innards, the Kobolds didn’t let them go to waste either, squeezing out the residues from the intestines and stomach, boiling it into a large pot, and eating it nonetheless. Though it didn’t taste as good as meat, to these often-starving Kobolds, it was already a rare delicacy.
Soon, beneath the Blue Young Dragon’s lair, in the fledgling village the Kobolds had hastily set up, all the Kobolds were bustling about, with even the Kobold child Nina doing her utmost to help. Everyone was making preparations for the upcoming winter.
Cooking smoke curled upward, and although this so-called village only had one or two simple huts made of straw and thatch, it had a cozy homey feel to it.
...
Meanwhile, while the Kobolds were using their wits and courage to prepare for the winter,
beside the lake reservoir, after determining there were no fierce predators in the lake reservoir that could threaten him, Austin leapt into the water, diving to the lakebed.
Since this reservoir could support a Ghost-headed Crocodile leader, a Magic Beast potent enough to form a Magic Beast Crystal Core, there might be some hidden secrets below.
Austin jumped straight into the water. The underwater was slightly dim, the churning muddy water obscuring his view, but the dragon race’s eyesight well compensated for this shortcoming, allowing him to still see the scene ten meters away under such dim conditions.
Under the dim water, a huge shadow slowly submerged, causing the surrounding fish to scatter and flee in all directions.
Seeing the density of fish underwater, Austin estimated in his heart, roughly guessing that even if he did not catch any food throughout the entire winter, the fish resources in this lake reservoir would be enough to support him through the cold winter.
Of course, the Blue Young Dragon wasn’t down there looking for fish.
The lake reservoir was very deep, Austin roughly calculated that he had swum at least a hundred meters down, but still couldn’t see the lakebed, while the nearby fishes appeared to be getting bigger.
"So deep..."
The Blue Young Dragon’s brow furrowed slightly, he wasn’t a fish, even with a dragon race’s strong body, he couldn’t stay underwater indefinitely, especially since the deeper he went, the pressure in the water grew stronger.
"How exactly did this lake form?"
Seeing the astonishing depth of the lake reservoir, and recalling the location of this reservoir on land, Austin suddenly discovered some clues.
The area around this lake was clearly a vast plain, and there was only a tiny river leading into this lake reservoir.
With such a geographical location, such a small river, it was apparent that this lake reservoir couldn’t have formed naturally...
Gazing at the profoundly dark lakebed below, Austin pondered for a moment, gritted his teeth, flapped his wings, creating massive splashes of water, and then darted down towards the lakebed like an arrow...

chapters.title: Chapter 13 - 12: The Secret of the Lake Bottom
chapters.content:
Chapter 13: Chapter 12: The Secret of the Lake Bottom
When they reached two hundred meters below, the water pressure rose exponentially. Just as Austin felt he couldn’t hold on any longer, he suddenly saw a faint blue light emerge from the pitch-black lakebed.
"Have we arrived?"
The Blue Young Dragon’s face lit up with joy, and it sped toward the lakebed.
In just a moment, Austin felt as if he had entered a magical world. On the ground of the lakebed, dandelion-like plants swayed with the current, emitting a ghostly blue glow.
One after another, they connected into a patch, illuminating the entire lakebed.
At the same time, the seeds of the "dandelions" detached from their mother plants, gathering together with the water flow to form radiant bands resembling the Milky Way. They hovered in the blue world above, drifting upward with the wind.
The tiny lights, upon reaching a height of over ten meters, seemed to exhaust all their energy and extinguished. Immediately, schools of fish, coming from unknown places, darted down to devour them.
The blue dandelions absorbed unknown energy from the lakebed to grow and glow, releasing seeds that rose with the water flow, only to be devoured by strange fish, forming a peculiar symbiotic system.
"This is..."
The vast blue light reflected in his pupils, illuminating the entire world.
Anyone who had never witnessed this scene could hardly imagine the grandeur and wondrous beauty of this world.
Even Austin was stunned for a long moment by this scene.
"What exactly are these dandelions? And what lies beneath the lakebed to sustain these strange plants’ growth..."
A cascade of questions surged in Austin’s mind as he flapped his wings and darted toward the lakebed.
However, just when the Blue Young Dragon entered the blue light band area, the dandelion seeds on Austin abruptly exploded, and ghostly blue flames spread across the Blue Young Dragon’s scales, roaring with the ferocity of an overwhelming blaze, as if intending to engulf Austin.
"Oh no!"
Feeling a sharp pain coursing through his body, Austin’s face changed dramatically. Just as the blue flames were about to envelop him, he frantically flapped his wings and fled upward.
The turbulent water oscillated until he exited the blue band range, and only then did the blue flames on Austin’s body extinguish completely.
Even so, the scales of the Blue Young Dragon turned pitch black, as if they had been singed by smoke and fire.
"What on earth is this thing!"
Grimacing at the pain and looking at the extensive burns on his body, Austin gasped.
No wonder the fish chose to consume the extinguished dandelion seeds from above; these things were surprisingly dangerous. Even Austin, with his Dragon Race body, was so beleaguered upon contact. If ordinary fish had been touched by it, they likely would have been reduced to ashes.
Austin gazed intently at the fantastical fairy tale world beneath him. If he hadn’t personally tested it, he wouldn’t believe that such dazzling beauty concealed such terrifying threats.
The sea of light below continued to sway gently with the current, quietly emanating brilliant rays. The light bands that Austin had disturbed gradually returned to their previous order and appearance, as if nothing had happened.
After watching for a long time, Austin felt only a heavy sense of threat and a faintly peculiar sensation from that sea of light; he discovered nothing else.
"Forget it, I’m not capable of unraveling this mystery now, but someday, I will uncover everything."
Realizing he couldn’t stay beneath the lake any longer, Austin glanced deeply at the sea of light below before turning away.
The ghostly blue dandelions continued to quietly spread their tiny lights, extinguishing after hovering over ten meters high, only to be devoured by eager fish.
Everything was as usual, as if nothing had occurred.
However, Austin didn’t notice that those fish which had devoured the "dandelion" seeds briefly showed a weak blue glow between the scales beneath their bellies, flashing quickly...
...
As time passed, the cold winter days drew nearer. The vast blue sky became even clearer and more azure, like a gigantic block of ice, with visible cold spreading across the heavens as if sealing the entire sky.
The Kobolds filled their days completely. After the morning’s routine drills, they spent every remaining moment gathering food. Although they had already collected enough provisions to survive the cold winter, an inherent instinct drove them onward.
Memories from their ancestors reminded them that every cold winter brought unbearable hunger, and only by preparing more food could they survive the harsh winter season.
To prevent blizzards from eroding their shelter, the simple houses once on trees had been relocated to the ground. Wooden stakes were pounded in, sturdy branches reinforced the construction, and straw was woven with vines and tied to the poles.
Meanwhile, beside the houses, a small warehouse was built right against them. Inside, a layer of dry straw was laid on the ground; on top of that were pieces of sun-dried and hardened crocodile skin. Above lay several large baskets of smoked meat and nuts, seeds, and various wild grains gathered from the forest.
With the arrival of cold winter, the trees in the forest also cycled through their final stages, releasing fruits born from nine months of stored summer energy. This time was when the Kawa Forest was richest in food.
Every time the Kobolds ventured out, they returned laden with goods, rapidly filling warehouses. They amassed supplies far beyond their winter needs.
Seeing the warehouses overflow with food, it was said that one day the oldest limping Kobold in the tribe opened the warehouse doors and, gazing at the bounty, couldn’t help but cry.
The sight was like a dream; in the old Kobold’s decades-long life, they never imagined that something only dreamt of would become reality.
Everything was improving. With time on their hands, the Kobolds even constructed a fence around the houses, faintly giving the appearance of a tribe.
Time meandered on, and a few days later,
the world changed color overnight.

chapters.title: Chapter 14 - 13: The Arrival of the Cold Winter
chapters.content:
Chapter 14: Chapter 13: The Arrival of the Cold Winter
Throughout the night, the cold wind roared like a demon, and the icy chill swept across the heavens and earth. All living beings trembled under the divine might of nature.
The pitch-black sky seemed to collapse, the biting wind howled with snow as sharp as knives; on this night, countless unprepared creatures perished in the darkness.
The violent blizzard raged all night long.
The next morning, as the sun rose, Austin poked his head out of the cave.
All he could see was an endless expanse of white, even the sky was white.
The once vast sea of green was now covered by thick white snow. The giant ancient trees, with leaves not yet fallen, had long icicles hanging down, shimmering with a crystalline glow, like sharp ice spikes.
If some animals happened to pass underneath and accidentally hit the trees, they might be skewered into porcupines by the falling icicles in the next second.
"It feels like the world changed overnight!"
Just yesterday, the sun was high in the sky, though the heavens had already taken on an icy hue, the heat was enough to make one sweat. But today, the endless earth was already blanketed in snow.
This miraculous transformation from summer to winter in an instant was still fascinating for Austin, who had crossed into this world for over two years.
"Indeed, such a winter is quite cold."
On the first day of the cold winter season, the residual chill carried by the passing Water Attribute Magic Power lingered in the air, making the first few days exceptionally cold. Even with Austin’s powerful Dragon Race body, he could feel the icy chill piercing his scales.
"Never mind, the food is enough for a few days; I might as well stay cozy in the nest for a while."
Looking at the icy world outside, Austin shifted in his nest and ultimately decided against leaving the warm dragon’s lair.
Just as the Blue Young Dragon was about to pull his head back for another nap, a loud and orderly military command sounded from the cliff bottom.
"One-two-one, one-two-one, one-two, one-two, halt..."
Austin poked his head out and saw, beneath the cliff, thin smoke rising from the few simple wooden huts of a village, and on the snowy open ground, perhaps out of habit from over a month’s military training, the kobolds did not slack off despite the arrival of the cold winter; instead, they continued their morning training as usual.
Standing at attention, marching in step, turning left and right, spear-holding and shooting exercises—various tactical movements.
The biting cold wind swept through from above, and the breath from their mouths condensed into icy mist in the air. Despite having fur to resist the cold, the kobolds still shivered when standing at attention.
However, even without Austin present, the kobolds trained rigorously in the cold winter, without a hint of negligence.
Soon, their bodies warmed, sweating, and white mist rose into the air.
The kobold leader, Vini, gazed at the group training habitually even in the cold winter, feeling greatly satisfied.
During the month-long training period, Austin had instilled in them a behavioral habit of discipline. Although their physical fitness wasn’t impressive, their discipline had formed a genuine "army" prototype.
"Under Lord Austin’s leadership, the glory of the kobolds will illuminate the entire continent!"
Having experienced over a month of various events, Vini firmly believed this.
This was not just wishful thinking. The other kobolds also sincerely believed that, under Lord Austin’s leadership, they would undoubtedly head towards a better future.
Having been in the so-called "Great Tribe" in the north, the kobolds came to realize how respectable and profound Austin’s knowledge was.
No one could imagine, just after a mere month’s training, a weak group of kobolds underwent an unprecedented transformation, successfully slaying beasts several times fiercer.
Neither would anyone have thought that, with Austin’s simple guidance, the kobolds could peacefully get through this cold winter without worrying about food.
"Well done today, everyone. Dismissed!"
With a series of tactical movements completed, the morning training was over, and Vini dismissed the group.
In the cold winter season, unless compelled by necessity, the kobolds usually did not venture outside.
Only by huddling together for warmth and minimizing winter expenditures could they conserve more food to survive the dreaded cold winter.
However, having relocated here and become Austin’s subordinates, the kobolds had stocked up on more than enough food and naturally did not need to huddle in corners for "hibernation."
To better build the village, the kobolds planned to head to the forest to cut down suitable trees with stone axes. By the time summer arrived, they would dry them out for suitable building materials. Simultaneously, to fend off the cold, they needed to gather more dry wood to improve the simple village’s survival conditions.
Just as Vini, too, prepared to leave and get to work, a massive shadow suddenly descended from the sky, fanning the snow into a swirling storm.
"Your Highness Austin..."
Seeing the Blue Young Dragon arrive, Vini was initially startled, but quickly responded with a respectful address.
"Yes, you did well. I saw it from above."
Training continuously during the cold winter showed that this group of kobolds already possessed the necessary military qualities, making future tasks that much easier.
"All belongs to the glory of Your Highness Austin." Vini placed his right hand on his chest, his voice filled with devotion.
"No need to be humble; I merely laid the groundwork."
Austin shook his head. During the month-long training, he personally led at the start, but later, once the kobolds knew the training content, he left most of the training to Vini, the kobold leader, himself not being one to steal the limelight.
Just as Vini wanted to say something, Austin continued:
"By the way, Vini, do you kobolds have any cultivation or combat techniques?"
This question had just occurred to Austin.
Actually, while dealing with the Ghost-headed Crocodile leader, Austin had realized the kobold’s limitation: their bodies were too weak. Even well-trained, they could not withstand powerful Magic Beasts.
The only way was to elevate the kobolds to extraordinary beings, much like ordinary humans becoming Knights through cultivation, acquiring Extraordinary Power to truly contend with formidable entities.
However, achieving self-cultivation was no easy task, with one major difficulty being the need for suitable cultivation techniques.
Unfortunately, the Dragon Race’s inheritance only included world knowledge, and due to the unique nature of Giant Dragons, they didn’t require any cultivation techniques to grow into the Legendary Sanctuary. Thus, Austin had no knowledge of this area and decided to ask Vini.
If Vini truly had kobold cultivation techniques, imagine a legion comprised solely of kobold Professional Knights—what a terrifying force that would be!

chapters.title: Chapter 15 - 14: Searching
chapters.content:
Chapter 15: Chapter 14: Searching
When Austin first met Vini and the others, they looked like a group of refugees.
The cultivation and battle techniques that can systematically enhance one’s own strength are not something an average person can possess. According to Austin’s estimation, even among the numerous scattered Beastman tribe bases in the Kawa Great Forest, only the medium-to-large tribes with a population exceeding a thousand truly possess them.
Thus, the Blue Young Dragon did not place much hope in Vini, merely seeking some information from him.
"Cultivation and Battle Techniques?"
As expected, upon hearing this, Vini pondered quietly for a moment before shaking his head.
"I’m sorry, Your Highness Austin. When we fled, we were merely low-level members in that Beastman tribe, not familiar with the details. But I did hear within the tribe that the tribal leader, Bear-Paw Leader, was already High Tier Bronze. If it’s that tribe, they should have cultivation and battle techniques and such."
High Tier Bronze corresponds to a combat power of at least third-level magic beast strength, even the current Austin is no match. Of course, it’s impossible for that leader to capture Austin.
However, such a truly extraordinary ability user is not someone ordinary people can deal with. Perhaps it would take a thousand or two thousand people to exhaust its strength to kill it.
Yet, if the tribe Vini mentioned truly possesses cultivation and battle techniques and such, then the tribe would not have only the leader as an extraordinary. Other extraordinary elites must exist besides him, plus the numerous ordinary Beastmen within the tribe—this kind of power is not something Austin can provoke at present.
"However, one day there shall be a battle!"
Though aware of the disparity in strength, Austin still couldn’t forget it. Though now there seems to be little conflict between the two, as things develop, the Great Tribe where the kobolds once stayed is bound to become a roadblock.
To prepare for the future, the Blue Young Dragon asked the kobold about the situation of the Beastman tribe.
Yet the Blue Young Dragon still overestimated this group of kobolds.
As one of the lowest races on the continent, the kobolds were also at the bottom tier within that Great Tribe, struggling hard along the line of life and death daily. Their impression of the tribe was limited to being very smelly, very dirty, very large... As for how many extraordinary professionals were inside, Vini didn’t know. The size of the tribe and its population were unclear to Vini, but he knew there was a lot.
The inquiry results were almost fruitless—not completely without gain.
At least Austin knew there was a strong neighbor to the north, which was over a hundred kilometers away.
This was inferred from Vini’s words. According to him, they were expelled by the Beastman tribe and traveled south for almost two months, amounting to at least hundreds of kilometers.
This could be considered a rare piece of good news—a considerable distance separating them, less concern about conflicts before growing stronger.
Moreover, that large Beastman tribe serves as a barrier, resisting those Adventurers from the Central Earth Civilization Continent and various bankrupt peasant wanderers seeking gold within the Kawa Great Forest, providing Austin with a certain degree of safe space for growth.
"However, although the large Beastman tribe in front provides safety, it also limits development here... It seems I’ll have to find a time to explore nearby and see if any smaller tribes can be annexed."
Though the Beastman tribe ahead repels much danger, it also blocks the influx of fresh blood.
Relying on the seven adult kobolds under Austin, even if kobolds have considerable reproduction ability, forming a thousand-strong army would still take at least ten to twenty years, which Austin can’t accept.
Fortunately, within the Kawa Great Forest, tribes are numerous, countless Beastmen live here forming various large and small tribes. So as long as Austin expends some effort, he won’t lack enough population for development.
"Alright, go about your business."
Thinking of this, Austin casually gave an order, then spread his wings and soared into the sky, the airflow sweeping up numerous snowflakes.
"Yes, Lord Austin."
After respectfully seeing the Blue Young Dragon off, Vini, finding nothing happening around, also began to join in the work of building the home.
...
High above, the cold wind howled.
The lingering cold air from the cold front swept through the heavens and earth, and carelessly plunging into that dispersing cold current might instantly freeze one into an ice statue.
But the robust body of the Dragon Race afforded Austin the benefit of ignoring such dangers; at most, encountering the chill would make him shiver, but his life wouldn’t truly be at risk.
The Blue Young Dragon was flapping its wings at several hundred meters altitude, its large eyes staring at the snow-covered earth below.
To increase his clan’s population and expand influence, Austin personally set out today. During a heavy snow, he went out searching for traces of small Beastman tribes around his territory to gather them under his banner.
Many people make strong power. Utilizing the kobolds he trained as the core, then training and reforming newly joined clanspeople, his power must inevitably soar quickly.
"Such a beautiful scene—only the first one or two months can wander freely."
Snow blanketed the earth like a thick quilt, the entire land covered in white, giant ancient trees adorned with crystal ice spikes, reflecting dazzling light.
It’s the beginning of the cold winter season, due to the sudden chill, those fierce magic beast hunters are just fed and curling up in their dens unwilling to come out. It’s the safest time of the year in the Kawa Great Forest.
A little later, those magic beasts will have consumed most of their fat reserves, and without sufficient preparation, the fierce wild beasts, driven by hunger, will leave their warm dens—either freezing to death in the icy world or fortunately encountering another living creature on the snowy land. Driven mad by hunger, they’ll relentlessly attack and devour each other, at which point the Kawa Great Forest becomes most dangerous.
During his first cold winter after rebirth, Austin nearly perished in that frigid season.
"This snow is too thick. I hope to find other traces before that."
The Blue Young Dragon sighed inwardly, flying north about twenty miles but still failing to find any trace of tribes or villages.
Perhaps they’re there, but the snow has covered up the tracks, leaving Austin without results.
"Though the initial cold winter season is safe, the snow makes it difficult to find traces of other beastman tribes... Let’s fly another ten miles, if still no sign, forget it."
With determination set, the Blue Young Dragon flapped its wings quickly toward the distant sky.

chapters.title: Chapter 16 - 15: Rout Soldiers
chapters.content:
Chapter 16: Chapter 15: Rout Soldiers
A range of thirty kilometers is not small; in the previous world, it would have been about the size of a city, taking an hour or two even by car.
However, perhaps due to the arrival of the cold winter, all creatures were hunkered down in their nests, not venturing out, and as a result, the Blue Young Dragon flew all the way without gaining any results.
"Damn it, it seems we can only let the Kobolds search slowly later."
Having gained nothing, Austin did not continue to fly forward but directly returned. After another hundred miles or so, he should reach the place the Kobolds mentioned as the Great Tribe, and the present Blue Young Dragon had no intention of running around stirring trouble.
On his return trip, Austin did not follow the original route back but took a wide detour, returning from another direction.
Although the chances of discovering other tribes were slim, it’s always good to cast a wide net and search more areas.
Subsequently, the Blue Young Dragon was immensely grateful for his decision.
When he flew back to the old nest from another direction, about ten kilometers from the nest, he saw thick smoke rising from the mountains not far away.
In this cold winter, the probability of natural fires is almost zero.
Where there’s fire and smoke, it represents the activities of intelligent life in that place, either Beastmen or humans, and judging by the situation in the Kawa Great Forest, evidently, the former is more prevalent.
However, that column of thick smoke was quite grand...
Austin flew forward swiftly, harboring various thoughts.
In no time, Austin flew above the mountain from which the smoke was rising.
What appeared before him was a village that had just experienced the ravages of war.
The whole expanse of snow-covered white land in that area was mucked up, dirty snow mixed with muddy water frozen into ice, stained with dried blood, but there was no corpse to be seen.
This tribe seemed to have just endured a "battle."
The victor was evidently quite frugal, taking away all valuable items. The scattered five or six simple wooden huts were first dismantled, whatever could be taken was taken away, even the beams supporting the houses were dismantled and dragged away. Ultimately, whatever had no value was burnt to ashes.
Austin hovered above a few times but did not discover anything of value, not even a person, as if they had already withdrawn.
The Blue Young Dragon pondered for a moment, hovered around a few times, and finally landed on the ground.
Everything around was chaotic; Austin was no Sherlock Holmes, unable to deduce anything. However, from the ruins of those houses, he could simplistically guess that the population gathered here wouldn’t exceed thirty people. As for the main kind of Beastman, that’s something the Blue Young Dragon didn’t know.
"Hmm, although there are bloodstains, they’re not extensive—probably not many died, it looks more like they were expelled from the tribe after a defeat, or maybe captured entirely..."
If it had been a brutal blood feud slaughter, the battlefield wouldn’t be so easily tidied up.
"Let’s search nearby; there might be some clues."
Resolute in his decision, Austin flapped his wings and soared into the sky.
If I can find scattered people and incorporate them into the Kobolds’ ranks, this would greatly benefit the expansion of Austin’s forces.
Even if this battle resulted in the tribe being captured and annexed, finding the victor’s tracks and planning slowly in the future wouldn’t be a bad idea.
After all, capturing populations through war is much faster than the natural breeding of Kobolds.
The Blue Young Dragon turned in the air and followed the trails on the ground.
....
Meanwhile.
In the Kobold village beneath the Blue Young Dragon’s nest, a group of Kobolds was preparing lunch.
On the mud-brick stove was a giant stone pot, with raging fire below boiling the water inside.
Then, eight pieces of smoked ghost-headed crocodile meat were taken from the storeroom, not washed to avoid losing the oil on the meat, directly thrown into the stone pot to cook, then adding wild grains previously harvested along with some dried wild vegetables. After simmering for about half an hour, the wooden lid was lifted, and a big pot of aromatic food was ready.
Due to the smoking on the surface of the meat, the whole pot of soup looked somewhat black, and with the wild grains not husked, it tasted smoky and scratched the throat.
This kind of food, in Austin’s view, was the worst kind of dark cuisine, but for these Kobolds, it was the most abundant food.
Having oil and meat and still being able to eat to fullness, this kind of life was something they never enjoyed before.
Especially during the cold winter, in previous cold winters, Kobolds managed with just one meal a day, consisting of dry grass roots.
Using bamboo ladles, the stew from the stone pot was scooped out into each Kobold’s wooden bowl. Then, the Kobolds gathered in groups, slurping the food down.
The aroma of the food permeated several hundred meters around.
...
At this moment, a mile away from the Kobold village in the dense forest, a ragged team was fleeing in distress.
"Chief, Chief!"
The Fox-faced Man, Quik, hurriedly caught up, grabbing the arm of the tribe leader, a strong Lizardman, who was frantically running ahead.
"Chief, we’ve run far enough; Simon’s group shouldn’t be able to catch up, let’s rest for a bit!"
Fox-faced Man Quik looked somewhat grim; this tribe was a small newly established one this year, led by Lizardman Rodney, who once punched a forest lion to death before Quik’s eyes.
It was seeing Lizardman Rodney’s strength that motivated Fox-faced Man Quik to assist him in establishing a small tribe, gathering other Beastmen to share warmth and collectively survive the dangerous cold winter.
But who knew that as soon as the cold winter arrived, a nearby Jackal Wolfman Tribe would accuse Rodney’s group of encroaching on their territory, directly attacking the village Rodney and his people had spent most of the summer building.
The Jackal Wolfman leader was a Jackal Wolfman named Simon, a transcendent being, approximately Bronze Lower Tier. Despite being the lowest level of transcendent being, for Quik and other Beastmen, he was akin to a superhuman, his very form comparable to the leader Lizardman Rodney in size.
Without suspense, the tribe Rodney established was easily defeated by the Jackal Wolf People, expelled from the village, along with their food gathered over the summer falling into the hands of the Jackal Wolf People.
If it weren’t for the Jackal Wolf People valuing the food more than these defeated gravely injured individuals, they would likely have been slaughtered entirely.
Nonetheless, even as things stood, Lizardman Rodney and his group dared not linger, fleeing in panic for nearly ten kilometers.
"Lord Rodney, everyone is tired. Let’s find a place to rest first."

chapters.title: Chapter 17 - 16 Attack
chapters.content:
Chapter 17: Chapter 16 Attack
"Alright, let’s stop and rest for a while."
In the prior "war," facing the terrifying Jackal Wolf People leader Simon, Rodney’s heart was still in turmoil, his gaze unfocused, seemingly afraid a Jackal Wolf might appear from somewhere.
Only when Fox-faced Quik pulled him did Rodney reluctantly snap back to reality.
"But... what about food?"
Fox-faced Quik’s complexion grew more bitter, causing him to doubt whether his initial decision was correct.
Looking back, aside from the Lizardman leader Rodney, there were two other Lizardmen, seven Kobolds, ten Goblins, and himself, one Fox-faced Man.
This was all that was left of their tribe.
Their tribe originally had more than thirty people, but in the war against the Jackal Wolves, some died and others scattered, leaving only about twenty of them to escape.
Sometimes having more people is an advantage but also a disadvantage, especially during the cold winter season when food is difficult to procure.
With not enough food, even the edible roots outside are covered by the heavy snow, without prey coming out to forage...
In such a situation, it was simply their doom.
"Food?"
It was only at this moment that Lizardman Rodney realized they had fled too hastily and indeed hadn’t brought along any food!
No wonder the Jackal Wolf People didn’t pursue, because they knew that ordinary Beastmen without food in the cold winter season had only one outcome,
that was death!
The entire group, at this moment, fell into despair.
No food, no shelter from the wind and snow to keep warm,
death was truly their only end.
"No food? Just go and rob some; there should be Beastman Tribes nearby. I refuse to believe every tribe has Extraordinary Professionals like the Jackal Wolves!"
Rodney said fiercely, swinging the War Axe in his hand, which whistled.
At this time, the morale of the crowd slightly improved.
Yet Fox-faced Quik felt even more hopeless in his heart, for robbing did seem like a good plan, but they still needed to find a target!
Those small tribes were usually well-hidden, especially in this icy winter; most tribes had already entered hibernation and wouldn’t go out to show traces. How to find targets in the vast, snowy land?
However, just as Quik was about to speak, he suddenly caught a whiff of a scent.
The smell of food, the smell of meat.
Looking around, it was obvious everyone had smelled it too.
"Hahaha, heaven indeed doesn’t forsake us. Let’s go and rob to our heart’s content!"
Rodney laughed loudly, holding high the War Axe, leading the Beastmen as they walked toward the source of the food aroma.
Quik was about to say something, but his stomach growled, the hunger surged in his heart, pressing down his words.
A group of ragtag soldiers cautiously passed through the forest, the aroma in the air growing stronger, making mouths water.
Logically speaking, being able to eat meat at the start of the cold winter season meant the tribe’s food supplies were ample, and their strength wouldn’t be too weak, not something this group of remnants could provoke.
But clearly, the hunger in their stomachs overcame their fear of the potential foe.
Passing through a patch of woods, the Beastmen crouched in a small hollow, secretly observing the "Great Tribe" at the cliff’s bottom in the distance.
"How is it? How many Beastmen are there? How strong are they?"
Rodney patted the Fox-faced Quik beside him and asked.
Though driven by hunger, this did not mean Rodney lost his reason, foolishly leading people into another tribe’s camp just to die. At least he needed to assess the opponent’s strength.
"Lord Rodney, this..."
The Fox-faced Man stared at the simple tribe below the cliff, his voice somewhat hesitant.
"Their number seems to be only seven... no, seven and a half."
"Seven and a half? Are you joking?"
"No, I counted; there are indeed seven, seven Kobolds, and one Kobold child. Look, their village has only two houses; one should be a food storage warehouse, and that kind of wooden house can hardly fit ten people at most. I shouldn’t have miscounted."
The Fox-faced Man hesitated for a moment but still confirmed.
"Seven Kobolds? Then how could they have such good food?"
Even Rodney didn’t believe it, and Fox-faced Quik couldn’t believe it either.
Kobolds are one of the lowest races on the Seta Continent, weak and without special skills; when did they live so well, even with meat?
"No matter!"
Leader Lizardman Rodney turned to the group of ragtag soldiers behind him and shouted:
"You see! Ahead are merely seven Kobolds; for the sake of food, charge together!"
Rodney flipped over the hill, raised the War Axe high, and charged at the Kobold village, followed by the hungry Beastmen, who also jumped out and rushed down.
A gathering of assorted troops charging together; for a moment, there was a feeling of mighty momentum like thousands of troops.
The Kobolds, eating food, felt the ground tremble and immediately discovered the incoming Beastmen from afar.
"Enemy attack! Rise up!"
The Kobold leader Vini reacted first, shouting swiftly, tossing aside the wooden bowl, and grabbing the Wooden Spear by the wall.
"Grab your weapons, assemble, and form ranks!"
At Vini’s command, the Kobolds reflexively picked up Long Spears and assembled, forming a neat line with sharp spears protruding.
By this time, Lizardman Rodney was rushing at them, swinging the War Axe.
"Kill!"
Rodney roared angrily, brandishing the War Axe aggressively as he charged at the Kobolds ahead.
Despite these Kobolds acting strangely upon seeing someone much taller than them, instead of fleeing in panic, they stood still like some strange formation.
But that didn’t matter; Rodney believed as long as he charged into the Kobolds’ ranks and killed one or two, the rest would inevitably flee in panic, leaving their collected food in Rodney’s hands!
Rodney was very brave; mere Kobolds—did they think they could overturn the tables?
Then,
he was utterly stunned.
"Stab!"
Accompanying a loud shout, the spear formation thrust forward, and Rodney’s vision blurred.
Thud, thud, thud!
Long Spears tore through the air and pierced into his body, blood splattering, with immense force propelling him into the air.
Rodney, with his strong physique, ran faster than the tribe members behind him; when he clashed directly with the Kobolds, his tribe members were still about ten meters away.
When Rodney was overwhelmed and flung into the air by the opposing Kobolds immediately, the Beastmen behind stepped on the brakes hard, bodies rolling clumsily and dropping onto the snowy ground.

chapters.title: Chapter 18 - 17 Ore
chapters.content:
Chapter 18: Chapter 17 Ore
In the wars of the Civilized Land, elite Knight Orders form the core, with numerous peasants wielding pitchforks as support, creating armies of tens of thousands engaging in decisive battles on the battlefield. Often, the outcome of the war hinges only on the success or failure of the elite Knight Orders.
So, what about the war conflicts within the Kawa Great Forest, outside the Civilized Continent, amongst these numerous small tribes? Well, it’s like this now.
With the strongest tribal chief as the core, leading a few trusted aides charging at the front, no discipline is needed, no tactics required, but the leading aura must be formidable and fierce.
As long as the tribal chief can cut down a few opponents first, the morale of the subordinates behind will soar, rushing forward in a frenzy to slaughter and defeat the enemy.
In fact, it’s nothing more than the street brawl style battles from Austin’s previous life, where nothing matters except for momentum.
If the momentum is established, then victory in battle is achieved.
It was precisely based on this that Rodney, upon seeing the Kobold village and knowing its strength, confidently jumped out.
In his mind, with his size towering above those Kobolds and his hard-earned Iron Weapons, it should be a simple matter to rush in, slay one or two Kobolds, and secure victory, shouldn’t it?
With this thought in mind, Rodney charged forward at full speed.
And then,
Rodney crashed headlong into the well-organized ranks of the Kobolds, emerging battered and bloodied.
He could easily defeat a single Kobold, and even a large group, but against a group of Kobolds with army discipline and seamless cooperation, his defeat was certain.
When Rodney was struck and sent flying, all the charging Beastmen were thrown into disarray, coming to a sudden stop.
Even though there were only seven Kobolds in front, their orderly formation and lined-up Long Spears presented a copper wall and iron bastion, exerting an immense pressure akin to a gate of hell ahead.
After all, their leader, the strongest Lizardman Rodney, was impaled and sent flying right in front of them!
All the while, the opposing Kobolds stood motionless, their formation undisturbed by a single misstep.
In fear and astonishment, the rapidly charging Beastmen ground to a halt, many tumbling and rolling on the ground in confusion, turning the entire Beastman group into a panic-stricken, headless flock of flies.
Seeing this opportunity, Vini was certainly not going to let it slip and immediately gave the order:
"Raise spears, charge!"
The Long Spears were lifted in unison, and the Kobold ranks charged forward in perfect order.
That unit, filled with iron discipline, was like a blade, invincible and unstoppable, causing Rodney’s Beastman subordinates to collapse at once, fleeing in panic and disarray.
However, having already suffered a great defeat against the Jackal Wolf People earlier and fled here, they were already exhausted. By now, they were spent forces, unable to flee far.
More of the Beastmen collapsed in the snow, exhausted, and were subsequently captured by the Kobolds.
This conflict, rather than being a battle between Austin’s Kobold clan and the defeated Rodney Tribe, was more akin to a one-sided brawl.
In less than a minute, Rodney’s subordinates had completely collapsed, were annihilated, and became the captives of the Kobolds.
"Get to the corner, hands on your head, no looking around!"
Over twenty Beastmen were captured by the Kobolds and placed in a corner. To prevent escape, seven Kobolds stood guard with weapons, continuously patrolling and tightly monitoring the Beastmen in the corner.
The fate of these Beastman captives was to be decided only upon Austin’s return.
...
Meanwhile,
Twenty or thirty miles away from the Dragon’s Nest, in a certain mountain range, a Blue Young Dragon soared above the sky. Its sharp eyes spotted a simple village built in a hidden mountainside location, over a kilometer away.
If not following the tracks on the ground and the wisp of smoke rising from the village, Austin might never have found the village’s location.
"A tribe made up of Jackal Wolf People?"
Austin landed on a large tree atop a distant hill, gazing at the village across the mountainside, calculating silently.
Orc tribes surviving in the Kawa Great Forest usually mixed with other types of Beastmen. A single-race Beastman tribe was rare.
Unless there was something special about this Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
"I’ll note it down, and deal with it when the opportunity arises."
Judging from the range of this tribe, there should be about a hundred Jackal Wolf People living there, which was quite a force. Even if the seven Kobolds under Austin were well-trained, sheer discipline would be futile before hundreds of their kind.
Moreover, in terms of physical strength and combat, Kobolds were clearly weaker than Jackal Wolf People.
This Jackal Wolfman Tribe was beyond what Austin could "devour" at the moment.
"But this Jackal Wolfman Tribe is somewhat close to the territory. To launch a surprise attack before they discover the Kobolds, early planning is necessary."
If these Jackal Wolf People discovered the Blue Young Dragon lurking nearby, they would surely prepare. Austin didn’t think his mere presence would dominate, making the Jackal Wolf People bow in submission.
If it were an adult dragon, perhaps these Jackal Wolf People might willingly submit to its clan.
But for a Blue Young Dragon, its power indeed fell short. It might take over a hundred years to fully grow, especially as a wild orphan dragon, making its comprehensive strength even weaker.
In this world, strength was supreme, especially for intelligent beings struggling for survival in such Barbaric Lands.
To conquer these Jackal Wolf People, Austin’s only way was to capture them, bringing them under his command.
"Their strength is a bit too much for now, but no hurry. Since a gathering place has been found, there should be other Beastman Tribes nearby. First, annex some smaller Beastman Tribes."
Having made up his mind, Austin took flight, preparing to return to the nest.
But as he soared up, his sight unexpectedly caught an irregular basketball-sized stone, half-buried in the soil, showing a greenish hue on its surface.
Initially, Austin overlooked it, but as he turned away, a thought struck.
A green stone?
Isn’t this Copper Ore?!!!
The silhouette of the Blue Young Dragon sharply turned back, landing on the ground, and grasping the stone with his claw to inspect it closely.
It’s indeed Copper Ore!
Moreover...
Austin suddenly recalled something, and his claws began digging into the ground, unearthing several similar pieces of Copper Ore. Furthermore, he discovered that beneath the soil lay more and larger Copper Ores, almost integrated with the entire mountain range!

chapters.title: Chapter 19 - 18 Transformation
chapters.content:
Chapter 19: Chapter 18 Transformation
The color of copper ore comes in many varieties: yellow, gold, blue, green, and several others.
What left the deepest impression on Austin, however, was this green copper ore before his eyes, because in his past life, he had seen a remarkable person on video handcraft various tools and refine copper and iron in the wild.
His admiration for the video creator was so profound that Austin remembered the steps and refining methods very vividly.
At that time, he had also fantasized that if one day he were to traverse back to the primitive world, possessing this skillset might help primitive people enter the iron age ahead of time and dominate the primitive world.
He hadn’t expected life’s unpredictability, finding himself truly in a situation where this knowledge could be utilized, although he didn’t actually travel back to the primitive world.
"I didn’t expect there to be copper ore here, and from the looks of it, quite a substantial amount too."
Austin stared at the copper ore before him, his eyes flickering as thoughts rapidly churned in his mind.
In this barbaric zone far from the civilized continent, items like copper and iron were exceptionally precious, with many large tribes of over a thousand people still stuck in the stone and bone tool stage. The few iron weapons they had were defective goods traded from the civilized continent.
Conveniently, Austin recalled the steps from that past-life genius who refined copper and iron by hand in the wild.
If he could seize this place and start a large-scale copper and iron refining industry, then arming his clan with copper weapons and clad in copper armor, combined with a well-trained army, wouldn’t they sweep through the entire Kawa Great Forest?
"In that case, this place cannot be easily abandoned."
Initially, Austin had planned to wait until his forces were stronger before waging war against and annexing the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, but now it seemed imperative to make them an imminent target.
"I will return!"
The Blue Young Dragon took a deep look at the distant Jackal Wolfman Tribe, spread its wings, ascended into the sky, and disappeared beyond the horizon, while the jackal wolf men, reveling in their victory, remained blissfully unaware...
....
In the Dragon Nest Territory.
"His Highness Austin, thanks to you, the invading enemies have been defeated and captured. Whether to kill or keep these captives, we await your decision."
Kobold Vini stood before Austin, reporting everything that had transpired in the territory to Austin, quietly awaiting his response.
Looking at the respectful Kobold Vini beside him, Austin felt quite speechless.
He had gone to great lengths to search for new clan members, but returned empty-handed. Although he unexpectedly discovered copper ore, it was only after braving the cold and traveling dozens of kilometers.
Yet these kobolds seemed to have captives delivered to their door while they feasted at home.
Such is the hardship of the dragon’s life; truly full of unpredictability!
"We shall transform them first, then incorporate these beastmen."
A heavily wounded Lizardman Rodney lay dormant, alongside a Fox-faced Man, two sturdy Lizardmen, seven chaotic kobolds, and ten goblins, forming a total of 21 beastmen. If he could annex and absorb them, Austin’s clan strength would triple!
Once these beastmen were integrated into the kobold ranks, Austin would be able to organize a nearly thirty-strong beastman army, providing him with confidence against nearby Blood Wolf packs and even the nearby Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
"Transform?"
The Blue Young Dragon’s thoughts were, of course, beyond Vini’s hearing, rendering him somewhat puzzled by the term.
Based on past experience, defeated captives were either killed by their conquerors or enslaved as tribe members, so what did transformation mean?
"Yes, transform them."
For Austin, manpower was an incredibly valuable resource, not to be wantonly discarded. As for enslaving, that would result in extremely low production efficiency, which Austin could not accept.
Incorporating them post-transformation into the current Kobold military system was the approach most beneficial to Austin.
As such, on orders from the Blue Young Dragon, a rigorous transformation process began for these captives.
In the early days, these captives were divided into three groups according to race, fed only half-full each day, and tasked with heavy labor dawn to dusk. Exhausted, they would collapse into sleep upon returning to their shacks.
The various tasks of tree-felling, hut-building, and wooden spear crafting became ordeals too agonizing for the captives to bear.
Especially after one day, when Austin noticed the new captives had littered the nearby forest with waste, he immediately ordered Kobold leader Vini to build a latrine at a distance, provoking much discontent among the captives.
In Austin’s plan, his clan’s population had surpassed thirty, within his manageable territory of a kilometer radius. Continuing with the old nomadic gathering methods was unsustainable.
This meant that raising the beastmen’s civilization level from gathering to agricultural civilization was imperative.
In the bountiful Kawa Great Forest, wild rice and wheat were not uncommon and were primarily used by Kobolds for winter storage.
Given the climate within the Kawa Great Forest, if they could collect and plant rice seeds collectively, supplemented by communal livestock breeding, it would yield enough to sustain the clan’s survival under Austin.
After the cold winter season, Austin planned to teach this clan the slash-and-burn method of farming to support the growing population.
This latrine under construction wasn’t just for hygiene but was also a critical component in post-winter land cultivation.
The world had yet to develop a fertilizer industry, and dung was the best fertilizer in these times.
But during this cold winter, the frozen earth was as hard as steel. Attempts to dig with wooden sticks only resulted in lost sticks and mere pot-sized depressions.
Fortunately, Lizardman Rodney’s leader had an iron axe, promptly claimed by the kobolds as spoils of war, which enabled the creation of more wooden tools, sparing the captives from digging with stones or bare hands.
Even so, each day’s labor left the captives utterly fatigued.
This coincided with Austin’s goal of wearing out these captives’ energy to the fullest extent, ensuring they never had a moment of idleness.
Following several days of high-intensity toil, these beastmen had been worn out of all vigor and resistance. As the village beneath the Dragon’s Nest finally began to take shape, most of the work was complete.
The next step initiated the second phase of transformation.

chapters.title: Chapter 20 - 18 Military Training
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Chapter 18 Military Training
In the cold winter, large snowflakes fluttered from the sky. If you stayed outside for too long, you’d turn into a snowman.
And at this moment, in the village beneath the Dragon’s Nest, amidst the colorful snow, stood such shivering snowmen.
"You bunch of trash, waste, scum! Polluting the air while alive, and wasting land when dead! Do you have shit for brains?"
Kobold leader Vini stood in front of a group of prisoners, shouting curses loudly, looking very spirited.
At this moment, facing more than twenty shivering prisoners, and the eyes filled with fear and awe, Vini felt his life had reached its peak.
Even though he didn’t understand what polluting the air and wasting land meant, those curses were learned from Austin back in the day.
But it was indeed very satisfying to curse like this,
Thinking back to when they were training, they were also cursed at by Austin until they doubted their very existence.
But now, finally someone else could enjoy the same treatment.
Seeing someone suffer the same fate as they did back then, it felt like drinking a cold cola on a hot summer day, refreshing from head to toe.
However, what Vini didn’t know was that everything he was doing inside the Dragon’s Nest was seen by Austin.
"This guy..."
Seeing Vini’s proud and complacent look, Austin slightly shook his head, already considering whether to add some burdens to this guy in future training.
At this time, the transformation of these prisoners had reached the second step.
After wearing down the various thoughts in their hearts through heavy labor, the next step was military training.
In Austin’s previous life, military training was a necessary pre-academic training for middle school, high school, and university students.
This training not only brought new classmates closer but also cultivated a sense of discipline among them, having many benefits.
Austin’s purpose for using military training as the second step of transforming prisoners was also due to this.
Through strict training, these prisoners would develop a collective sense of discipline.
And by enduring tough military training together, these newly joined prisoners would develop a sense of collective honor towards Dragon Nest Village, bringing them closer to integrate these Beastman prisoners into Austin’s rule.
This was also the fastest way for the Blue Young Dragon to absorb these Beastman prisoners.
....
In the morning, as the sun just rose, a team started running around the entire Dragon Nest Territory, shouting as they ran:
"Strive to reform, become a new person!"
In the middle of the team, Goblin Gulu took a deep breath, the chilling wind felt like ice knives entering his throat, but his moving body was hot and sweating, his lungs seemed to burn, and under the contrast of the cold wind, there was an extraordinary sense of comfort.
After completing the fifth lap of the morning run, with an order:
"Line up, fall in!"
A group of Beastmen who just finished the morning run automatically formed into three queues, arranged in three even lines, from shortest to tallest.
Goblin Gulu mixed in with the Goblins, returning to his place in line, keeping perfect order.
In fact, he didn’t remember which row or column he belonged to, but as soon as the line was there, he could find his spot, it became instinctive.
At the very start, Gulu had no idea of his spot, and it was the same for other Beastmen.
When Coach Vini told them to form ranks, they all huddled together randomly, uneven in height, gathered chaotically.
Naturally, Vini got furious, and as a result, they all went without food for the morning.
Later, everyone remembered.
Firmly remembered.
In this Kawa Great Forest, food is always the most important thing.
Hunger is the main theme for the bottom races living on this continent.
Beastmen have strong reproductive abilities, especially those of lower races like Goblins and Kobolds, even stronger.
But in this Kawa Great Forest, the lower races with strong reproductive capabilities haven’t conquered the whole forest, only clinging to a corner, because of the omnipresent famine.
Every year during the cold winter, half of the Beastmen living in Kawa Great Forest starve to death, as nature uses extremely cruel laws to maintain the life cycle of this world.
The craving for food seems to be ingrained in these Beastmen, and it was precisely because of this that when Vini cut off their morning food, all the Beastmen desperately memorized their lineup positions, completing Vini’s demands with incredible efficiency.
Unfortunately, although Vini rewarded them with a meal of meat the day after due to their efficiency, he later often threatened them with famine, making all the Beastmen suffer.
However, under such effective means, together with the assistance of seven "old-timers" who had undergone military training, this group of Beastman prisoners underwent a significant transformation within a month, forming the prototypical shape of a "military."
Moreover, this military prototype could directly integrate into the previous team of seven Kobolds, truly forming a collective, greatly enhancing the power of Austin’s Clan.
"Attention, at ease, attention!"
Looking at the rows of Beastmen standing straight like trees, unmoving, Vini nodded slightly, then looked at the morning sun on the horizon, calculating in his heart.
"It’s not time yet, stand for a few more minutes."
After the morning run, it’s breakfast, but apparently, these Beastmen ran a bit fast, it’s not meal time yet.
But it’s okay, standing for a while is fine.
It trains the Beastmen’s discipline and their patience, after all, how nice is that?
However, compared to Vini’s leisurely "inspection" on the side, Gulu in the queue felt like dying.
Inside the village’s stove, the firewood was burning fiercely, and the aroma of the food steaming in the stone pot wafted out with the white mist, sneaking relentlessly into his nose, causing the worms of gluttony in his stomach to tremble, and almost making his mouth water uncontrollably.
"Big head root, Tsumugi fruit, Valley Fragrance, and... meat?"
Before these Beastman prisoners completed their transformation to become part of the Blue Young Dragon’s Clan, of course, they couldn’t be given the best food.
It was basically chewable tree roots, edible fruits, and grains made into a large pot.
That taste.....
Could only fill the stomach.
But today, it seemed like there was a rare addition of smoked meat.
"Ancestors of the Goblins, why does time pass so slowly!"
Gulu dared not move a muscle, but internally he was constantly wailing.

chapters.title: Chapter 21 - 19 Food Crisis
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Chapter 19 Food Crisis
After training was over, it was time for breakfast.
Each Beastman held a wooden bowl, neatly lining up to orderly approach the stove for breakfast.
Those who got their meal first did not start eating immediately.
It wasn’t because they weren’t hungry or for any other reason, but because of the collective consciousness that Vini mentioned. They are a collective, so they eat together.
Once everyone had taken their share, they all sat on two long logs. Only after the last companion sat down did the Beastmen start devouring their food.
That breakfast was exceptionally delicious.
"Burp!"
Goblin Gulu burped, a white mist emerging from his mouth.
For him, since birth, he’d never known the feeling of being full; his memory was always of a hungry belly.
But during these days of captivity and transformation, Goblin Gulu finally tasted the sensation of a full meal.
Although this life of captivity wasn’t particularly pleasant, with aimless toiling each day until exhaustion, compared to his previous days, Goblin Gulu clearly preferred the period of his captive life.
He even thought that if these days could last forever, it would be wonderful.
A person who’s used to hunger will never want to return to those starving days after experiencing the taste of a full meal.
"His Highness Blue Dragon is truly benevolent!"
Recollecting the political lessons, the Kobold leader told them:
All our happiness stems from His Highness Austin; only His Highness Austin can save us; it is thanks to the benevolence of His Highness Austin that we can have a happy and wonderful life...
and so on and so forth. Goblin Gulu found himself deeply agreeing with these words.
However, Goblin Gulu didn’t know that with continuous brainwashing, both he and the other Beastmen, even the Kobold leader Vini, developed a wholehearted worship towards the Blue Young Dragon.
And as time went on, this worship would one day evolve into an unparalleled fanaticism for Austin.
...
Just as Goblin Gulu reminisced about past hardships and present circumstances, the Kobold leader Vini approached Austin with a troubling issue.
"His Highness Austin, if things continue like this, we won’t have enough food. Should we halve the food portions for the captives? Otherwise, we won’t make it through this harsh winter."
Vini’s face looked rather conflicted, carefully considering his words as he reported to the Blue Young Dragon.
Before the cold winter season, the Kobolds had actually prepared enough food to get through it, but who knew twenty or so Beastmen, having lost their tribes and escaped, would join later. Austin decided to transform and incorporate them into the Kobold army system.
This caused a direct increase nearly threefold in population, significantly increasing food consumption.
Although they gained a large amount of meat when they besieged the Ghost-headed Crocodile, and the Kobolds had prepared well before the cold winter,
originally only needing food for seven and a half people, suddenly an additional twenty-one required consumption four times the initial calculation. Yet, the Blue Young Dragon was unwilling to reduce the captives’ food.
Thus, a food crisis loomed over the Kobold tribe.
"A food crisis..."
Upon hearing Vini’s detailed report, the Blue Young Dragon pondered silently.
Honestly, he hadn’t noticed this situation either.
But solving it wasn’t that difficult.
"There’s no need to reduce the food portions for those captive Beastmen. As for food shortages, wasn’t there a lake reservoir filled with fish from when we exterminated the Ghost-headed Crocodile? After daily training, spare some time for them to fish there for food."
Back then, when clearing the Ghost-headed Crocodile, the Blue Young Dragon had already planned to utilize fishing in this lake as a food source during the scarce winter.
He also planned, after the cold winter, to see if he could start a fishing industry in that lake.
"Fishing? But the lake has already frozen over with thick ice! Even if we break a hole, no one would dare to jump into the water in this weather."
Vini thought about the scene: in the icy world, a group of Beastmen, armed with stones and sticks, breaking a hole in the ice, then selecting a Beastman to jump into the water to fish. The result was that, just after one dive, the chilling water would freeze the person stiff, and after laboriously climbing back up, they’d already become a "popsicle."
Vini quickly shook his head, dismissing such a terrifying thought from his mind.
"His Highness Austin, that method really won’t work!"
Thinking about how each dive into the water to catch fish would freeze a Beastman to death, the voice of Kobold leader Vini trembled slightly.
The Blue Young Dragon glanced sideways at Vini, who barely counted as a competent lackey standing in front of him, his eyes looking as if he was gazing at an idiot.
"You don’t need to jump in, just heat up a hole on the ice with fire, and the fish under the water will float up. You can also pour hot water down that hole to gather the fish faster, and then you just catch them from above."
The cold winter’s chill had sealed the entire lake surface with ice, and the air in the water below was constantly being consumed. During the whole freezing season, the fish under the water were in a state of hypoxia.
By opening a hole in the ice layer, those oxygen-starved fish would naturally flock over.
As for pouring hot water, that’s because the fish can’t withstand the frigid temperatures, and boiling water contains more oxygen than the water under the frozen lake surface.
The warm currents and oxygen rapidly spread to the surroundings beneath the lake, hastening fish gathering.
Catching fish by opening holes in winter was a technique Austin had seen on TV in his past life.
"That’ll do?"
Vini said, his tone cautious, his voice a bit hesitant.
Would fish really gather just because a hole was opened? Were they really that dumb?
"Just do as I say. If it doesn’t work, come back to me."
Austin shook his head, not bothering to explain further.
No wonder the numerous Beastman races in the Kawa Great Forest lived in hunger; many things were yet undeveloped, living in ignorance, their lifestyle resembling the ancient ape-man civilization of Austin’s previous world.
"Didn’t you have plenty of vines left from your previous gathering? Use those vines to weave a basket, and then you can catch fish from above the hole using the basket."
After thinking a bit, Austin continued:
"After you’re finished fishing, don’t forget to reseal the hole with ice before you leave, otherwise, the next time you make a hole, you won’t catch any fish."
Sealing the hole was to ensure the fish beneath the lake become hypoxic again, facilitating fish gathering for future fishing sessions.
"Also, you need to speed up your training; time is running out. This time, the enemy you’re dealing with is not as easy to kill as the previous Ghost-headed Crocodile. Carelessness could lead to death."
The cold winter had already lasted more than a month, while the Blood Wolf pack Austin planned to eradicate still roamed freely around their territory.

chapters.title: Chapter 22 - 20: Breaking Ice on the Lake
chapters.content:
Chapter 22: Chapter 20: Breaking Ice on the Lake
It’s not just that Austin is petty and vindictive, begrudging the Blood Wolves for nearly leaving him stranded there. Having such a group of hunters wandering within Austin’s territory is ultimately a threat.
If the Dragon Nest Village intends to expand its development in the future, this Blood Wolf pack must be eradicated.
And during the cold winter, it is the easiest time to track down the Blood Wolf pack.
Hunters like the Blood Wolves don’t have the concept of storing food for the winter. Even in the cold season, the Blood Wolf pack has to venture out to hunt, which provides Austin with the optimal time to find them.
For the elimination of the Blood Wolf pack, the sooner it is done during the cold winter period, the better. Recently, while Austin was flying out for hunting, he had already spotted traces of some hungry and ferocious hunters venturing out. If the eradication of the Blood Wolf pack later attracts other hungry and mad wild beasts, that would not be good.
The more the action is delayed, the more dangerous it becomes.
Fortunately, the captured Beastmen have mostly completed their training now, integrating into the Kobold military system, greatly enhancing the strength of Austin’s clan underlings.
At least, with the number of forces doubled, the confidence to face the Blood Wolf pack has increased significantly.
...
Not to mention that the Blue Young Dragon was constantly contemplating how to deal a severe blow to the Blood Wolf pack and frequently ventured out to search for enemy traces.
Over at the Dragon Nest Village, efforts began to address the lack of food.
The next day, there was no more snow, the clouds in the sky had all settled, and the entire sky resembled a massive ice cube, a vast expanse of blue.
In the Dragon Nest Village, a joint military exercise took place early in the morning, with the previously trained Kobolds also participating.
Ranks stood neatly like steel, forming an unyielding formation. Long spears waved in unison, their simple movements exerting significant visual impact, with shouts echoing across the skies.
The newly integrated Beastmen, although untested by blood, with the fusion of experienced Kobolds, weren’t expected to lack much in combat power.
After the military exercise, instead of the anticipated military training, the Beastmen, following the command of Vini the Kobold, took up their tools and went to a nearby frozen lake.
"Mom, is fishing in winter really that simple?"
Among the team, the little Kobold Nina also joined in, helping to drag a wooden basket woven with vines on the side.
The basket was as tall as she was, swaying side to side as she walked, yet she refused help. During the cold winter, Nina found herself doing very little, which made her feel uncomfortable being idle, so she volunteered to come and help this time.
"This was personally instructed by His Highness Austin, so it should be possible."
The mother Kobold appeared slightly hesitant. However, those who had been the earliest followers of Austin had long regarded the Blue Young Dragon as a deity, with unwavering faith in the Blue Dragon’s words. Despite some doubts about catching fish so easily, they followed Austin’s instructions without hesitation.
"Yes, for sure the Blue Dragon’s words are correct."
Nina nodded promptly. Sometimes, what children believe in is purer than adults.
In some sense, the earliest Kobold clans, intentionally cultivated by Austin, had become the prototype of his fanatic followers.
The lake wasn’t far from the Dragon Nest Village, and soon, the group of Beastmen arrived at the frozen lake.
The cold winter chill was indeed severe, covering the entire lake with a thick ice layer. Vini walked a circle on the lake, feeling the ice beneath his feet was quite solid.
Vini looked around the white expanse, exhaled into his palms, releasing white mist into the cold breeze that dissipated in the air.
"Where exactly should we dig the hole? Oh well, since His Highness didn’t specify, let’s just pick any spot and start digging."
Having no other options, he randomly chose a spot near the shore and called over the Beastmen to help dig a hole.
Choosing the shore was out of concern that during the digging, if the ice cracked and they fell into the cold water, they could easily climb out.
Under Vini’s command, the Beastmen divided into three groups, each working within the outlined circles nearby to continuously chisel the ice.
Since the hole didn’t need to be very large, too many people crowded together would hinder the process, thus dividing them into three teams worked perfectly.
However, after the Beastmen pounded the ice with all their might, even the strongest Lizardman using a sharp rock could only chisel out a bowl-sized dent, still far from reaching the ice beneath the lake water.
As for the short and slight Goblins, it was even more laborious.
"This..."
Faced with the steel-hard ice in the cold winter, Vini the Kobold leader was speechless.
No wonder no Beastmen had discovered this method to catch fish before. First, when the cold winter hits, the Beastmen mostly stay in their dens and don’t venture out. Even when starving and forced outside looking for food, who would bother wasting energy to dig through the ice layer? Yet how did His Highness Blue Dragon know about this method?
Various thoughts flashed through Vini’s mind, but he soon brushed them aside. The priority now was to dig the hole and catch fish; otherwise, the cold winter would be hard to endure.
Fortunately, Austin gave another method for digging holes on the ice surface. Earlier, the plan was to use stone tools to try chiseling a hole simply; now, that approach seemed unfeasible.
"Go to the forest and find fallen dried branches to prepare for burning."
With no other choice, they had to use the method suggested by His Highness Austin.
Soon, a Beastman returned from the forest carrying a bundle of dry branches. Fortunately, in the cold winter, the moisture within the dry wood had already settled, making it decent firewood.
But when the bundle of dry wood was piled onto the ice, Vini the Kobold leader faced another major issue.
They couldn’t light the fire.
In the extremely low temperatures outside, with the cold wind blowing, the heat generated by striking stones quickly dissipated into the air, making it impossible to start a fire.
Helplessly, they sent a Beastman back to the Dragon Nest Village to bring fire using wood.
During this process, due to rushing or the kindling quickly burning out before reaching the lake, the fire went out several times.
However, good things come with perseverance, and they finally managed to start a fire on the ice.
Watching the fire on the ice surface, burning fiercely, melting the layer beneath, the Beastmen quickly drew out the melted water using leaves and other means, repeating the process, about ten minutes later, a pit about the size of a stone basin, around ten centimeters deep, appeared on the ice.
Through the thin ice layer at the bottom of the pit, the water underneath was already visible.
"Bring a Wooden Spear."
Removing the firewood, they grabbed a Wooden Spear and jabbed it into the thin ice layer at the bottom of the pit.
Crack!
With a crisp shattering sound, the last layer of ice fragmented like glass, revealing the flowing water beneath. The Beastmen all leaned in to look.
The hole had been made, would they succeed?

chapters.title: Chapter 23 - 21 Successful Capture
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Chapter 21 Successful Capture
"How is it? Have any fish come over?"
One by one, the Beastmen poked their heads out, looking toward the hole, their eyes filled with anticipation.
They saw the ice hole, the size of a stone basin, with calm lake water below, not a ripple in sight, as if even the water had frozen to death, unmoving.
All the Beastmen held their breath, not daring to make a sound.
A minute passed, ten minutes passed, half an hour passed...
There was nothing.
A group of Beastmen eagerly waited near the hole, the falling snow almost turning them into snowmen.
One couldn’t say there was nothing; through the hole, one could still see some shadows swimming leisurely beneath the surface, each fish about the size of a Kobold. However, the imagined scene of countless schools of fish rushing to the hole for oxygen did not occur.
The fish that gathered here basically didn’t surface, any slight movement caused them to flee.
There was, however, a Goblin who, during this time, speared a half-pound fat fish, but that was it.
"It’s not bad; having sharp-eyed Beastmen guard the hole daily can still yield some meat..."
The Kobold leader Vini felt a bit disappointed in his heart, but although the bountiful catch His Highness Austin described wasn’t realized, it was at least a food source.
One must know, in the cold winter, being able to find any food is already very good.
Beastmen shouldn’t be too greedy.
"Leader Vini, what next..."
All the Beastmen turned their gaze to Vini, waiting for his next idea.
"First, widen these holes and then get a few people to take turns spearing fish here."
This matter still needs to be reported to His Highness Austin, but to overcome the food scarcity crisis of the cold winter, His Highness Austin would likely not oppose it.
However, the ice hole appeared somewhat small, and it needed to be widened to operate smoothly; otherwise, it’d be inconvenient.
"Let’s do it this way..."
Although this trip didn’t completely solve the Dragon Nest Village’s food crisis, being able to find a relatively stable food source in the cold winter was already great. His Highness Austin’s knowledge was astonishingly profound, truly worthy of being born noble among the Dragon Race.
Just as Vini was preparing to lead the team back, he suddenly realized he had forgotten something.
Hot water,
Ah yes, hot water!
Earlier, he was so nervous that he even forgot about this.
