The Blue Young Dragon had mentioned yesterday during a conversation that pouring hot water down might speed up the fish gathering.
But... does this work?
A trace of doubt crossed Vini’s heart, but he quickly snuffed it out; His Highness Austin was absolutely correct, whatever His Highness believed was sure to be right.
"You guys go back to the village and boil a bucket of hot water."
Randomly pointing at a few Kobolds, Vini instructed.
While those Kobolds went back to the village to boil water, Vini led the Beastmen to widen the hole.
With a hole already there, smashing ice along the basin-sized opening’s edge made it faster than before, no need for fire to melt it.
Shortly after, they had smashed the ice to create a hole about half a meter wide. Then Vini ordered that the rattan basket they brought be submerged into the lake water through the hole. The rattan basket was tied with rattan strings, so when fish swam in, a quick pull could catch them. It was much better than spearing fish.
However, the fish underwater were not fools; after catching them a few times with this method, it became very difficult to catch more fish.
Hopefully, the hot water method works, Vini felt a bit anxious.
Soon, a few Kobolds came hurriedly carrying a stone basin steaming with hot water.
"Alright, quickly come over and pour it down!"
Vini instructed the Beastmen nearby to make way, and the Kobolds lifted the steaming hot water and poured it down the ice hole.
Splash!
Vigorous waves surged up, shrouding everyone present in heavy mist.
"How is it? Any results?"
Clearing away the mist, the Beastmen eagerly craned their necks toward the hole.
The rippling waves gently settled, and the mist over the water gradually dissipated.
Yet, amid their hopeful gazes, nothing unusual happened in the lake water inside the hole.
"Sigh."
Vini sighed, and the Beastmen around him looked deflated.
It seemed the hot water method was unfeasible.
"Forget it, let’s head back first."
Just at that moment,
Splash!
Suddenly, the sound of surging water erupted, and the lake water within the hole noticeably surged.
"What was that just now..."
Vini hadn’t yet reacted when, simultaneously, the splashing water resounded again, but this time it didn’t immediately settle; instead, the rippling waves continued to churn.
"Fish, fish!"
Shadows quickly rushed over from beneath the ice, gathering at the hole’s edge.
The surrounding Beastmen excitedly pointed at the densely packed fish swarming the hole, shouting loudly.
The lake water beneath the ice hole was occupied by a dense school of fish appearing out of nowhere. Some even jumped out of the water, and one accidentally fell on the ice, quickly caught by a nearby Beastman.
"Successed!"
The Kobold leader Vini breathed a long sigh of relief; there was now hope for food this cold winter!
Though he didn’t understand the principle, nor why pouring a bucket of hot water attracted so many fish, it didn’t hinder Vini from following Austin’s guidance and reaping unprecedented success.
"Raise the basket!"
Taking advantage of the mass of fish gathered, Vini quickly ordered the previously submerged rattan basket to be pulled up.
Splash!
A great amount of water flowed down through the basket’s gaps, leaving a large number of fish flapping inside.
"Great!"
When the basket was pulled up, Kobold Vini looked inside, seeing it half-full with big and small fish bouncing at the bottom, and couldn’t help but smile.
Meanwhile, the fish gathered at the hole seemed unaware of their kin disappearing, still eagerly swimming over, filling the gap left by the basket-caught fish, occasionally jumping out of the water.
Seeing this scene, all the Beastmen felt reassured, thinking they could now eat well and get through this cold winter.
An indescribable joy surged in the heart of every Beastman, a joy of harvest, an excitement of looking forward to better days.
Ever since their birth, cold winters in their memories were spent in hunger, but now seeing hope of eating meat daily made them thrilled beyond measure.
At the same time, in the hearts of many Beastmen, the respect for His Highness Austin, who suggested this method, increased once again, elevating his status further.

chapters.title: Chapter 24 - 22 Crisis Strikes
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: Chapter 22 Crisis Strikes
A bountiful harvest during the cold winter season made the entire Dragon Nest Village excited at this moment. Obtaining a sufficient food source during the resource-scarce winter season was something the Beastmen couldn’t even imagine in their past experiences.
But now they had indeed succeeded, and seeing the way the fish swarmed at the bottom of the lake, it would take quite a while to catch them all. At least it could provide enough food for the tribe to get through the cold winter, and all of this felt like a dream.
Getting enough food from the lake reservoir meant that the Beastmen no longer had to worry about starving during this winter. It also meant that before the arrival of the scorching summer, these Beastmen could freely reproduce, allowing the tribe’s population to grow naturally by next year.
A group of Beastmen carried several baskets of fish and returned to the Dragon Nest Village. After that, the Beastmen repeated the process a few more times, fishing until the initial hot water completely neutralized by the cold water and the warm current disappeared, causing the fish to scatter and leave, before they finally stopped.
However, just these few attempts provided enough fish to sustain these Beastmen for nearly ten days.
On the way back, the Beastmen were in high spirits. Compared to their previous hesitation, every Beastman now bore a smile on their face.
Spurred by the moment, they even started singing loudly.
At this time, the sun was setting, casting a layer of yellowish glow over the white earth. The shadows of the departing Beastmen, elongated by the sunset, weaved back and forth.
Returning to the Dragon Nest Village, the entire village became busy.
Although the extremely low external temperature during the cold winter acted as a natural refrigerator, preventing food spoilage to some extent, the fish still needed to be processed.
As the Beastmen were busy in the ice and snow, the Kobold leader Vini came before Austin and reported everything that happened today to him.
"Is that so..."
After breaking the ice hole, it wasn’t the oxygen influx that attracted the fish schools, but rather the hot water that did the job.
Austin contemplated for a moment and vaguely guessed one or two reasons.
This might indeed be the result of the varying environment in the Otherworld; perhaps due to the mysterious plants at the lake bottom, the area beneath the ice wasn’t severely lacking in oxygen. However, the fish at the lake bottom were also cold-averse, and under such circumstances, it wasn’t impossible for them to instinctively swim towards warmer areas. Thus, when the hot water was poured, it gathered many fish. Coupled with the cold stunting their reactions, it allowed the Beastmen to easily harvest them.
"You all did very well; you’ve worked hard all day today, so take a day off and no training tomorrow."
"Yes, Your Highness is merciful."
Watching Vini’s departing figure, the Blue Young Dragon already began plotting in his heart how to deal with the lurking pack of Blood Wolves nearby.
While out today, he discovered the footprints left by those beasts nearby. Although he hadn’t actually seen them, Austin believed those beasts approaching here surely had bad intentions.
"The cold winter has lasted for over a month now, and it’s likely harder to find food. Hmph, let’s take care of them within these few days!"
Having made up his mind, the Blue Young Dragon then yawned.
He’d been feeling drowsy these past few days, and Austin clearly felt his body had grown slightly, with his magic power beginning to grow slowly.
"Is this about to be a slumber?"
The Blue Young Dragon pondered quietly. From the Dragon Race’s memories, a Young Dragon’s slumber was a necessary phase of growth, easily sleeping for years.
But Austin, unlike those Young Dragons with parental care, estimated that sleeping for one or two years might not starve him to death, but he’d probably end up as excrement among the other fierce beasts.
"Fortunately, I can still control it."
Perhaps due to crossing over, Austin’s spirit was stronger than an ordinary Young Dragon, allowing him to resist such sleeping impulses.
During the slumber period, he could remain awake and active, though his nighttime sleeping hours increased.
Forget it, sleep first, deal with the Blood Wolf Demon Beasts in a few days.
Though staying awake during the slumber period wouldn’t affect development, the drowsiness was indeed tormenting. Soon Austin surrendered to his instincts, lying down within the Dragon’s Nest and fell into a deep sleep.
...
Meanwhile, within the Dragon Nest Village.
Having finally processed all the fish amid this ice and snow wasn’t without getting wet; the cold water felt like icy thorns. The Beastmen’s hands and feet had become chilled, yet each Beastman, upon seeing the processed fish hanging on sticks, turning into fish-sicles under the cold wind, wore a satisfied smile.
Afterwards, the Beastmen lit a great bonfire in the middle of the village, hosting a primitive bonfire feast using the offal left from processing the fish.
In this cold winter, eating hot food, surrounded by the bonfire, they sang and danced.
This harvest was worth celebrating for all the Beastmen.
During the festivities, a few Beastmen presented a primitive wrestling match to celebrate. Some Kobold couples made eye contact under the firelight and took the matter into their own hands, showing no concern for the other Beastmen around.
The Beastmen didn’t possess human concepts of shame, remaining in a primitive state. Affairs between male and female Beastmen were akin to handling elimination issues at the beginning without caring about the venue.
If it weren’t for Austin’s anger, ordering the establishment of toilets, and mandating the Beastmen to solve personal hygiene there, the entire tribe might have been littered with "landmines."
The entire banquet was harmonious and continued until late at night, only then did the Beastmen finally return to their houses and retired to sleep.
As the last Beastman lay down, the whole village calmed, with the firelight quietly dancing.
Apart from the increasingly loud wind outside, there were no noises.
The cold wind howled outside, the wailing sound seemingly resembled cries of ghosts and wolves around.
At this moment, when all the Beastmen were asleep, unbeknownst to them, something was happening slowly.
The sleeping Beastmen naturally didn’t know, the fishy smell emitted during their fish processing was carried by the cold wind, drifting over snow-capped forests, spreading over ten kilometers and entering the nostrils lurking beneath the snow-laden grass.
Under the leadership of a large silhouette akin to a bison, covered in blood-red fur resembling burning flames, shadows cautiously followed the origin of the fishy smell.
Before long, outside the silent Dragon Nest Village, shadows began to move within the dark forest, encircling the Dragon Nest Village from all sides, with occasional green flashes.
Silently, the deeply asleep Beastmen were utterly unaware...

chapters.title: Chapter 25 - 23 Night Raid
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Chapter 23 Night Raid
In the deep of night, a biting cold wind howled, echoing with ghostly wails.
In the darkness, among the blood wolves, the Blood Wolf Leader, with a body as robust as a calf and fur as if dyed in blood-red flames, stared at the village illuminated by flickering firelight up ahead, baring its sharp, cold teeth.
Hundreds of blood wolves beside it shifted their gaze with gleaming green eyes toward the leader, waiting for its command to charge forth and tear apart the seemingly fragile village!
Today could truly be called the blood wolves’ lucky day.
Having gone without a hunt for three consecutive days, their stomachs growled with hunger. To obtain enough food, the Blood Wolf Leader had even led the pack into the dreaded territory of the Blue Young Dragon.
Unexpectedly, just as they ventured into that area, an alluring fresh scent wafted through the air, guiding them here.
Looking at the village ahead, the enticing aroma of food drifted out, making their mouths water.
About thirty Beastmen, along with an abundance of food.
This was a feast!
The Blood Wolf Leader bared its mouth, white vapor puffing out as corrosive liquid dripped onto the ground.
"Roar!"
A low growl reached the ears of all the blood wolves.
This was the signal to attack!
About thirty Beastmen, though troublesome, they were confident they could slaughter these opponents for food, and together with the fresh fish, wiping out this village would see them through the cold winter!
Although the village had that detestable smell, the Blood Wolf Leader couldn’t care less about that.
With its command, countless shadows emerged from the darkness, surrounding Dragon Nest Village from all sides. They moved with extraordinary silence, making not a sound, and in no time, they had slipped over the village’s crude fences, stealthily approaching several wooden houses.
Silence,
Deathly silence.
Invisible, a terrifying killing intent permeated, quietly seeping into every corner of the darkness, with danger looming silently.
Inside the houses, the Beastmen were oblivious to the impending danger, their snores vying as they remained in a deep slumber.
Yet, just as the blood wolf pack encircled the houses, with a few wolves preparing to slip inside and kill the Beastmen,
creak!
The door opened, and Goblin Gulu rubbed his eyes as he stepped out of the house.
"Jeez, it’s so cold. Does His Highness Blue Dragon have to build a toilet? In weather this cold, we used to do our business directly in the nest..."
Awoken by his bladder, Goblin Gulu got up to go to the toilet, shivering as he was hit by the cold wind. He couldn’t help but grumble inwardly.
The construction of the toilet was troublesome for those Beastmen. In the cold of night, handling hygiene requires passing through the unsheltered courtyard, enduring the cold wind for a good while.
He was about to step out when Goblin Gulu suddenly froze.
On the white ground ahead, shadows surrounded the village, pairs of green-glowing eyes all focused on him.
Gulu was stunned. The blood wolves creeping toward the house paused as well.
The air suddenly grew quiet,
then,
"Wolves! Wolves!"
Gulu burst back inside, slamming the door shut with a bang, his shrill voice piercing through the night sky.
At the same time, the wolves outside reacted as two strong blood wolves charged ahead, ramming into the door.
Bam bam!
The flimsy wooden door shook, about to shatter, scaring Gulu senseless as he pressed against the door with all his might.
"Quick, get up! Wolves! Wolves!"
Gulu’s screams and the banging on the door finally roused the slumbering Beastmen, with Kobold Leader Vini waking first. Seeing the wolves outside lunging at the cabin through a crack in the door, his dog eyes narrowed sharply.
"Everyone, get up! Form up!"
With the familiar, loud military order, the Beastmen instinctively stood up, quickly shaking off their drowsiness.
"Rodney, Dickens, Eleanor, you three grab wood and charge out, everyone else follows behind!"
The three named were the strongest Lizardmen.
There was little hesitation; a month of military training had induced a reflexive obedience to commands.
The three hulking figures, nearly two meters tall, each grabbed a wooden log used as a seat, opened the door, and stormed out together.
The wolves originally preparing to assault the cabin were caught off guard as the behemoths rushed out, the objects in their hands slicing through the air, directly sending the wolves flying.
The blood wolf pack prowling and circling outside recoiled in fright, retreating some distance, and growled lowly.
By this time, the Beastmen had rushed out of the house, clutching the Wooden Spears usually used for training and leaning against the walls of the building.
"Form up, defend against the enemy!"
With a command, the formation swiftly adapted,
short ones at the front, tall ones at the back,
leaning on each other, spears bristling, forming a hedgehog-like circle in no time.
Outside, the hundreds of blood wolves surrounded the Beastmen, prowling at the boundary, growling in a display of menace.
Meanwhile, the Blood Wolf Leader, hidden among the wolf pack, looked at these different breed of Beastmen, both in reaction and demeanor, instinctively feeling uneasy, as if it had overlooked something.
In the past, they had besieged Beastman tribes before.
But among the Beastman tribes they had encountered before, never had they seen Beastmen react this way.
In previous attacks on Beastman tribes, once discovered, the strongest Beastman leader would charge out, followed by a chaotic mass of Beastmen. Once they overwhelmed and killed the strongest Beastman leader, the rest would crumble and flee.
But now, the strongest one among these Beastmen not only didn’t charge out but stood still with a stick in hand.
The Blood Wolf Leader suddenly felt a wave of unease, but the hunger for food suppressed the discomfort rising from within.
Just mere Beastmen!
"Awooo!"
The Blood Wolf Leader howled into the sky, and the surrounding blood wolves’ eyes flared with red light, growing frenzy and violent, immediately charging ferociously toward the Beastmen.
In an instant, shadows surged like a tide...

chapters.title: Chapter 26 - 24 Departure
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Chapter 24 Departure
Austin was not particularly a military enthusiast before crossing, nor was he any military expert, so he didn’t quite understand military tactics.
But even being a military illiterate, one would still learn some basic maneuvers from modern society, such as now, the circular long spear formation where the kobolds leaned on each other, is the best way to face these wolf packs.
Initially, one of the purposes of the Blue Young Dragon gathering the clan was to deal with the wandering blood wolf pack nearby, so during the military training process, this circular formation was often trained, showing complete order.
Long spears stood like a forest, and more than thirty Beastmen ranged from short to tall, resembling a giant hedgehog.
The Kawa Great Forest is still an undeveloped barbaric land, and what’s more, the place where the Blue Young Dragon nests lies in a very secluded corner. When had these blood wolf packs ever witnessed such a formation?
They only regarded it as inexplicable behavior driven by fear, as the wolves growled lowly and charged forward eagerly.
If these wolves had seen the power of military formations in the civilized land, they would never attempt to assault such a tight formation, but alas, these blood wolves have not.
Then, they smashed into the long spear formation, experiencing a severe blow.
Splatter splatter splatter!
Amid the successive dull sounds of long spears piercing into flesh, scalding fresh blood splattered, with the fierce blood wolves charging initially being impaled by the sharp spears in a short time, becoming dead wolves. The rear wolf pack continued to charge, but those bloody spears blocked them, making no progress.
After three successive failed assaults, the blood wolf pack finally feared, staring at the corpses under the dense spear formation, the rear wolves halted, slowly retreated, keeping a distance, and looked at the iron wall-like defense line in fear, emitting low growls.
The blood wolf pack perpetually roamed but dared not charge again.
The Beastmen didn’t move an inch; beneath them lay the piled bodies of over twenty blood wolves from the previous assault, with blood spilling all over, but not a single blood wolf had penetrated the Beastmen’s dense formation, none were injured.
The two parties confronted each other. At this moment, among the wolves, the Blood Wolf Leader gazed at the unscathed Beastmen, feeling unprecedented rage.
During its past encirclement of Beastman Tribes, it had never suffered such massive damage.
More than twenty casualties among its subordinates constituted substantial harm to their group.
"Roar!!!"
Amidst the earth-shattering roar, the Blood Wolf Leader’s full body seemed to ignite with blood-colored flames, transforming into a blood-colored bolt of lightning that darted out from among the blood wolf pack.
In a normal wolf pack, the alpha wolf is the most cunning entity, staying hidden within the pack, rarely moving easily to attack.
But this blood wolf pack is not a normal wolf pack, maintaining wolf pack habits, yet still being a group of magic beasts.
Among magic beasts, the strong are revered.
The alpha leader can only be the most powerful existence within the blood wolf pack!
"Careful!"
The commanding Vini at the Beastmen group’s center only managed to glimpse a flash of blood-colored lightning before the giant figure arrived before them.
Facing the imposing Blood Wolf Leader, the Beastmen were instantly startled, but their hands and feet instinctively swung the long spears here, several wooden spears pierced through the air, thrusting towards the Blood Wolf Leader.
But this time, they faced a real magic beast!
With a swipe of the Blood Wolf Leader’s claws, the piercing wooden spears made a snapping sound, breaking under great force, with the immense power crashing into the Beastmen, sending several flying.
The entire spear forest circular formation immediately showed a gap, the rear blood wolf pack howled madly upon seeing it, and with frenzied glints flashing in their green eyes, charged together alongside the Blood Wolf Leader.
If the blood wolf pack pushed through the breach, the entire spear forest circular formation would surely collapse, and the Beastmen would become lambs slaughtered by the blood wolves.
Fortunately, the kobold veterans who experienced encircling the Ghost-headed Crocodile reacted, quickly moving towards the gap, sealing it.
Previously smashing and breaking the wooden spears, the Blood Wolf Leader who sent several Beastmen flying leaped away urgently upon seeing this, but the rushing blood wolf pack from behind couldn’t brake in time, crashing directly onto the wooden spears, becoming skewered like candy-coated fruits.
"Roar!!!"
Seeing its kind once again die before these peculiar wooden spears, the Blood Wolf Leader completely enraged.
A thunderous roar exploded in the open land, visible waves of air surged, sweeping forth, raising a gale on the open ground.
At this moment, the Beastmen array, having been somewhat shaky due to the previous breach, appeared ready to collapse under this horrifying roar.
If the Blood Wolf Leader attacked once more, this spear forest circular formation couldn’t withstand, it would be submerged by the blood wolf pack!
In the perilous moment, a thundering roar echoed in the sky, the shadow rapidly enlarged.
"You beasts dare come here!"
Austin, awakened from sleep by the Blood Wolf Leader’s howl, furiously swooped down from the Dragon’s Nest.
Originally, the Blue Young Dragon intended to trouble those beasts in a few days, but unexpectedly they came first?
Unacceptable!
With massive wings carrying terrifying force swooping down from the sky, arcs of electricity sparked among the scales, stirring a huge gust.
Bang bang bang!
Several blood wolves on the snow couldn’t dodge in time, immediately being flung away, like rag dolls smashed over ten meters away, ending lifelessly.
The Blood Wolf Leader, twenty meters away among the wolves, observed the descending figure in the field, still deeply enraged at the losses from this venture, but reason told it not to linger longer.
Especially since that bothersome big guy had also arrived.
"Awoo!"
Decisively, the Blood Wolf Leader howled skyward, signaling retreat.
With the wolf howl reverberating in the air, the wolves perpetually circling the Beastmen group, attempting attacks, gazed at the Blood Wolf Leader, scattered and swiftly departed, the previously dense wolf pack faded into the darkness like a tide.
"Bastards!"
Watching the blood wolf pack vanish into the dark forest, Austin wanted to pursue but ultimately stopped, angrily glaring at the place in the distance where they disappeared.
If they lured the tiger from the mountain, then his hard-earned Beastman "army" would be done for.
Right now, the priority is to figure out the Beastmen’s damage situation and mitigate losses.

chapters.title: Chapter 27 - 25 Aftermath
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Chapter 25 Aftermath
"How’s the situation?"
At this moment, the entire village was in disarray, with corpses of Blood Wolves strewn about and blood spilled everywhere. Several simple wooden huts had holes punched in them from the earlier Blood Wolf raid, allowing cold wind to sweep in.
A group of Beastmen were cleaning up the aftermath, carrying the injured Beastmen into the huts, and using simple tools to repair the huts that had been damaged by the wolf pack, at least blocking the openings.
The Blue Young Dragon landed in the midst of the scene, glanced around at the tragic situation, suppressed the fury in his heart, and asked Kobold leader Vini with a deep voice.
"How many of our people were injured?"
"Reporting to His Highness, three of our people are severely injured and incapacitated, and eleven are lightly injured, with wounds caused by Blood Wolves, but they don’t seem to be serious."
The severely wounded were those who faced direct impact from the Blood Wolf Leader, and the lightly wounded were mostly bitten by Blood Wolves when they rushed out of the huts without weapons initially, or caught by wolf claws during the pack’s assault.
Despite the densely packed wooden spear formation being effective against the wolf pack, under high-intensity pressure, it was inevitable that some Beastmen were accidentally injured.
"Fortunately, a Goblin discovered the tracks of the wolf pack first when they went out to relieve themselves; otherwise, if they’d snuck into the houses, it would truly have been a disaster."
Talking about this made Vini shiver with fear, imagining the devastation if those beasts had quietly entered the houses. The Beastmen would surely suffer heavy losses without even having time to form a defense, let alone considering any counterattack later.
"The village guards were careless. Remember to assign people for night watch in the future. I don’t want incidents where the enemy sneaks in and is barely discovered afterward. Also, give credit to the Goblin who first warned us."
This incident served as a harsh reminder to Austin that places like the Kawa Great Forest are far from peaceful.
Although he chose a rather isolated spot for the nest, surrounded by terrain that offered some safety, experiencing such attacks in the environment of the Kawa Great Forest isn’t rare.
This Blood Wolf attack was somewhat fortunate, just as the Goblin discovered their approach while relieving themselves; otherwise, the Beastmen sleeping at night might have been caught off guard.
"Yes, Lord Austin, but there’s one more thing..."
Vini lowered his head in acknowledgment, a hint of hesitation in his tone.
"What’s the matter?"
"We found while cleaning up that the food in the storeroom was stolen by the wolf pack."
Today’s catch from fishing throughout the day, along with the leftover smoked meat of Ghost-headed Crocodile, was mostly taken by the Blood Wolf pack.
During their retreat, the Blood Wolf Leader even made sure to take the food, and in the chaos within the village, nobody paid attention to this detail. It wasn’t until tidying up afterward that it was found the storeroom was nearly empty, leaving only some cereal grain and fruit seeds.
"Hmph! Those beasts!"
Upon hearing Vini’s explanation, Austin finally understood why the Blood Wolf pack attacked the tribe; it made sense that he noticed their tracks nearby. They likely came here due to food shortage, attracted by the fish scent when Beastmen were fishing and processing catches during the cold winter.
Given the sensitivity of the Blood Wolf’s nose, they couldn’t ignore the scent left by Austin’s activities nearby, yet they still invaded, clearly disregarding the presence of the Blue Young Dragon.
"For food, use these Blood Wolf carcasses to hold out for now. If it’s not enough, fish in the lake’s reservoir. As for those beasts, we’ll deal with them in a few days."
With over twenty Blood Wolves, Austin providing undistributed resources would sustain the Beastmen’s food supply without issue for a few days.
Once the injured Beastmen recover, that will mark the death of those beasts!
The following days entail recuperation and recovery.
From this attack, three Beastmen were seriously injured, including one of the Lizardman fighters struck by the wooden spear wielded by the Blood Wolf Leader, akin to a heavy hammer hitting several Beastmen head-on, even breaking several ribs, leaving them to gasp on the ground.
Fortunately, the Beastmen’s life force is astonishing. Recovery wouldn’t be a problem after ten days to half a month of rest.
Austin personally visited the wounded, specifically instructing Vini to take good care of the three severely injured Beastmen. They were heroes of the Dragon Nest Village, and it was crucial they recovered their health quickly.
However, what the Blue Young Dragon didn’t know was that his casual exhortation profoundly impacted the captive Beastmen within the Dragon Nest Village.
In the harsh Kawa Great Forest, severe injury equates to death.
In other Beastman Tribes, losing mobility and the ability to acquire food would deem someone invaluable.
Due to food scarcity, wounded Beastmen incapable of gathering food either starve or perish in agony, as no Tribe would squander limited reserves on those without value.
But Austin was different. His soul originated from another world, holding views entirely distinct from this one.
Moreover, under his guidance, sufficient food was obtainable even in icy conditions, eliminating any need to deprive injured Beastmen of their rations.
Besides, Austin currently needed to continuously expand the population of his growing Clan forces as, when the cold winter passed, developing land near the territory would require substantial manpower—how could he afford to easily abandon any Beastman.
The three severely injured Beastmen received excellent care, instantly causing a significant stir within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In their past memories, the practice of abandoning wounded immobile Beastmen to fend for themselves was entirely reversed, as His Highness Austin not only personally visited the huts to offer comfort but also praise their valor, specifically instructing leader Vini to take good care.
All Beastmen watched all this unfold, fixing their gaze upon Austin.
At that moment, each Beastman present felt a sensation impossible to describe with words.
It was from that moment, a profound sense of belonging and unwavering loyalty toward Austin surged within all Beastmen’s hearts.
If prior attachment to Dragon Nest Village was due to ample sustenance, then now, it was further stirred by the Blue Young Dragon’s behavior, truly winning their hearts.
"A soldier dies for the one who knows them,"—this saying encapsulates the inner conviction of all the Beastmen present.
A seed of loyalty was planted within each Beastman’s heart, and it’s imaginable that, over time, this internal strength will grow into a towering tree.
Then,
Where the spear points, nothing can withstand!

chapters.title: Chapter 28 - 26 Provocation
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Chapter 26 Provocation
In the snow, the Blood Wolf Leader casually bit to death a small deer that had come out to forage, shook its head, and looked up at the vast expanse of white land in the distance. The sunset was setting, its afterglow emitting the last rays of light, gradually dimming away.
By the reckoning of time, the cold winter season was almost in its final phase.
The last hours before dawn were evidently the darkest moments.
During this final period, lacking food, fierce beasts that had starved for two months would be driven by hunger to leave their dens, wandering everywhere, hunting anything they could see alive.
During this time, even the Blood Wolf Pack dared not roam freely, staying in their lairs as much as possible to minimize time spent outside.
Of course, as the top hunter in the nearby area, the Blood Wolf Pack didn’t need to worry too much.
Given their agility, encountering a hunter of equal standing, even if they couldn’t win, they could still outrun them.
The real threat came from enemies in the sky, and those terrifying Magic Beasts that could casually crush them to death, threats which were not many even in the vast Kawa Great Forest.
And once they really encountered one, it would be the time for their total annihilation.
The Blood Wolf Leader climbed onto a high snow mound, looking at the scattered Blood Wolf subordinates around, nodding silently.
It had been nearly ten days since the last attack on the Dragon Nest Village,
although that raid was one of the rare instances where the Blood Wolf Pack suffered heavy losses, the gains were enormous. At least after bringing back the meat from the storehouse, the subordinates had grown considerably fatter these days, alleviating the previous food crisis, making it a huge gain.
Perhaps, once they were short of food again, they could make another attempt in that dragon’s territory, to see how dragon meat tasted.
Such a thought suddenly arose in the Blood Wolf Leader’s mind.
In the next action, they would definitely move with more confidence. If it weren’t for that pesky Goblin sounding the alarm, the losses wouldn’t have been so heavy.
Also, after witnessing the Beastman’s spear formation, the Blood Wolf Leader wised up, never foolishly charging forward again.
Regarding prey, having suffered once, it would never suffer a second time.
"Awoo!"
Throwing away various thoughts from its mind, the Blood Wolf Leader howled to the sky.
It was calling its subordinates.
With sunset already at hand, it was time to return to the lair.
Figures flitted through the forest, following the path back to the lair.
But right then,
Whoosh!
Suddenly, a fierce wind arose, a massive shadow broke through the snow-laden forest from the sky, gigantic iron claws tearing through the air, scattering electric sparks in the emptiness, grabbing a Blood Wolf before the pack could react, soaring skyward again.
With a tremendous twist, the Blood Wolf caught in mid-air was immediately twisted with terrifying force, accompanied by the snapping of bones, the spinal column inside the Blood Wolf was shattered, the skull fractured, no longer making any sound.
At this moment, the shadow in the sky loosened its claws, and the lifeless Blood Wolf plummeted down like a cannonball toward the Blood Wolf Pack.
Bam!
The Blood Wolf’s corpse tumbled several times on the ground, scattering bursts of snowflakes, causing the surrounding Blood Wolves to scatter.
At this moment, the massive shadow in the sky turned, suddenly swooping down again upon a gathering of Blood Wolves.
The Blood Wolf Pack had no time to evade, once more a Blood Wolf was taken, and the shadow repeated its trick, twisting the neck of the Blood Wolf in its claws before dropping it from the sky.
"Roar!!!"
The Blood Wolf Leader erupted with fury, roaring skyward, visible waves of air surged upwards, rippling out as rings of waves.
The shadow in the sky was none other than the Blue Young Dragon Austin!
The Blood Wolf Leader felt immeasurably angry, relying on aerial combat advantage to hunt, such tactics were employed only by that shameless Blue Dragon.
A year ago, the Blood Wolf Pack had suffered greatly from this shameless dragon, if not for later plotting and giving that dragon a hard blow, the Blood Wolf Pack would have long been harassed incessantly by this shameless dragon.
It’s like while you were hunting and walking, a big fly kept buzzing overhead, occasionally giving you a bite.
And a year later, encountering the annoying tactic once again, the Blood Wolf Leader immediately became furious.
However, the Blood Wolf Leader’s anger did no good, Austin repeated the same tactics, once again hunting a hapless Blood Wolf.
At this point, the repeatedly attacked Blood Wolf Pack finally gathered rapidly, leaning on each other to form a dense pack that as soon as Austin descended again, several Blood Wolves would surely leap onto him to bite and fight.
In response to this pack formation, Austin was not annoyed, leisurely flying back and forth in the sky.
A pack of wolves, once gathered, was no longer something a lone wolf could compare to.
This formation, even Austin dared not to recklessly dive down.
Don’t think because these beasts can’t fly that they pose no threat to Austin, in fact, the Blood Wolves’ jumping power was quite astonishing, and with mutual assistance they could use a fellow pack member as a stepping stone to perform a double jump.
A year ago, it was only due to carelessness that he was almost trapped by these Blood Wolves.
"No rush, after all, these Blood Wolves have no long-range attack methods, eventually there will be a flaw."
Austin was leisurely flying above, while the Blood Wolf Leader roared furiously below, yet to no avail.
After half an hour, the Blue Young Dragon had been flying in the sky all along, sometimes landing on large trees to rest, without hunting further.
After confronting the Blue Young Dragon for over half an hour to no avail, eventually, the Blood Wolf Leader helplessly led the Blood Wolves back to their lair.
However, just as they moved, revealing a flaw, the Blue Young Dragon in the sky launched another rapid assault, swiftly hunting a wandering Blood Wolf using the speed of a Blood Wolf.
Repeatedly, Austin hunted a total of nine Blood Wolves, and each time after twisting the head of a Blood Wolf, he would throw the dead body towards the Blood Wolf Leader.
Under such provocation, the humiliated Blood Wolf Pack, and even the Blood Wolf Leader, was finally overtaken by rage.
Nine of them,
A whole nine! Were all killed using such shameless methods by that detestable Blue Dragon!
"Roar!!!"
Almost explosive anger roared from the Blood Wolf Leader, announcing a war against the Blue Dragon.
From this moment, they would never rest until one of them perished with this shameless Blue Dragon!
Seeing the shameless Blue Dragon in the sky escaping fearfully in a direction, the enraged Blood Wolves below, their anger burning away reasoning, pursued relentlessly in the snowy ground.
Today, that dragon must be turned into a dead dragon!

chapters.title: Chapter 29 - 27: Trap
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Chapter 27: Trap
The Blue Young Dragon soared through the sky, a series of shadows trailing across the snow behind it. Although the dragon posed no threat from above, the pack of Blood Wolves pursued relentlessly.
Under Austin’s relentless provocation, the Blood Wolf Leader was utterly enraged, chasing him with unyielding determination.
In the midst of this fierce chase, it didn’t take long for the Blue Young Dragon to dart ahead to a critical canyon passage. Before them, towering cliffs stood, with steep mountains on either side forming a narrow ascent to the sky.
Though the Kawa Great Forest is the largest primeval forest in the southern part of the Seta Continent, its landscape within is diverse, with mountains, hills, canyons, cliffs, and basins. The tropical rainforest-like climate allows ancient trees to flourish, making the vast region appear flat.
Such canyon terrains are not uncommon within the Kawa Great Forest.
Austin, without the slightest pause, tilted his body slightly, and with a whoosh, a gust of wind swept him into the canyon.
The Blood Wolf pack, engulfed by rage that burned away their reason, charged in without hesitation, rumbling closely behind.
Austin’s continuous provocations had made them so angry they lost all caution.
Just as the last Blood Wolf followed the pack into the canyon.
On one side of the mountain, a Goblin observing everything below picked up a sharp Stone Knife and smashed it fiercely against a tightly drawn vine. The vine snapped with a crack, and suddenly, a latch at the peak released, causing a massive pile of rocks, ice, and snow to tumble down from atop the mountains on both sides of the canyon.
In an instant, it was as if the earth shook and the mountains trembled.
Rumble!!!
Amidst the deafening roar of thunderous rolling, the entrance of the canyon was immediately sealed and covered by the falling mass of rocks, ice, and snow. The canyon’s entrance was completely blocked at that moment!
The colossal vibration instantly snapped the enraged Blood Wolf pack to their senses, causing them to stop in disarray, frantically scurrying like headless flies.
The Blood Wolf Leader looked up at the sky, just in time to see the path behind them obstructed by falling ice, rocks, and snow, cutting off their retreat completely.
This is bad!
Though not highly intelligent, the Blood Wolf Leader sensed danger at that moment.
That shameless Blue Dragon must be plotting something!
Sure enough,
At the narrow canyon’s exit, unbeknownst to them, a group of Beastmen armed with Long Spears had appeared, completely sealing the canyon’s exit.
A group of Beastmen, moving in unison, holding Long Spears, slowly advanced toward them.
It was as if a mighty mountain’s pressure swept over them.
The Blood Wolf Leader’s pupils shrank suddenly,
The painful lesson from that night’s attack was still vivid in his memory. In the face of such dense spear formations, they had suffered severe injuries!
This terrifying formation was their natural nemesis!
But now, with their retreat cut off and their advance blocked, and sheer cliffs on both sides, there was no other escape route ― they were completely trapped here!
The only way to survive was to face the Beastman Long Spear Array ahead. Only by breaking through this array could they possibly survive!
The overwhelming pressure, following the orderly advance of the Beastmen, drove the Blood Wolf pack to involuntarily retreat.
That day’s disastrous scene was still fresh in their memory.
Meanwhile,
In the sky above the canyon, the Blue Young Dragon flipped and soared to a protruding rock edge, looking down at the Blood Wolf pack trapped below, driven back by the Beastman line. It grinned viciously.
"You filthy beasts, you’re doomed!"
To entirely eradicate this pack of Blood Wolves, Austin had put in a tremendous effort.
Unlike the previously exterminated Ghost-headed Crocodiles, which had grown accustomed to reigning over reservoir-like lakes and had temperament flaws easy to exploit, the Blood Wolves were cunning hunters.
After the previous ambush failure, the Blood Wolves, who had experienced the army’s might, wouldn’t foolishly repeat the same mistake. As soon as the Beastmen positioned themselves in the open, the Blood Wolves would avoid direct confrontation rather than charge and die.
Given the Blood Wolves’ swiftness, if they chose not to engage, the Beastmen could do nothing.
Thus, to maximize the advantage of his clan, Austin aimed to force the Blood Wolves into an impasse where they had no choice but to charge the Beastman Phalanx, thereby potentially eradicating the pack.
"Thank goodness I loved reading ’Romance of the Three Kingdoms’ in my past life, or I’d have no way of dealing with these beasts."
Reflecting on his near-perfect strategy learned from his previous life, Austin couldn’t help but feel a bit proud.
The Blood Wolves’ cunning couldn’t surpass human wisdom.
"It’s just a pity the terrain doesn’t allow it. Otherwise, using rocks and snow to cover the back and front and having Beastmen throw stones from the mountain sides would be much safer."
This canyon wasn’t an ideal narrow-slit structure; the cliff distance from the entrance to the exit grew wider.
The entrance could be sealed from above, but the exit couldn’t; it had to be guarded by an ambush of Beastmen.
This would inevitably lead to some damage.
"Well, there’s no such thing as perfection in this world. Burying these beasts here is already enough!"
Austin had considered using his aerial advantage to slowly wipe out the Blood Wolf pack.
But this method failed a year ago.
When Blood Wolves gathered in groups, Austin’s dive-bombs were met with densely packed Blood Wolves leaping up to latch onto him, biting fiercely.
A year ago, Austin nearly died to this pack tactic, proving it ineffective against the Blood Wolves of this world.
Now, after painstaking efforts, he had lured the Blood Wolf pack into this dead end,
as long as he could annihilate these beasts completely. Even if the Beastman army suffered damage, the Blue Young Dragon could bear it.
Moreover, with him keeping an eye on the Blood Wolf Leader from above, coupled with the Beastmen’s extensively trained army, any damage wouldn’t be too severe.
"Attack!"
The Blue Young Dragon roared, its massive form descending from the sky, hovering low, stirring up a fierce whirlwind with gusts of air.
The Beastman lineup received the command to advance, the sharp Long Spears standing aloft, pressing forward in unison, pushing towards the Blood Wolf pack ahead.

chapters.title: Chapter 30 - 28: Slaughter
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Chapter 28: Slaughter
The beastman ranks steadily closed in, the panicked blood wolf pack continually retreating, yet their path was ultimately blocked off by rocks and snow, rendering escape impossible.
"Awoo!"
The Blood Wolf Leader’s eyes flashed a blood-red hue, and it let out a long howl towards the sky, the sound echoing through the heavens.
This was its order to the wolves,
Attack!
There was no way back, only forward to carve a bloody path.
Bam bam bam!
Upon hearing the leader’s command, the wolf pack immediately gathered together, charging fiercely toward the beastman ranks ahead.
Each blood wolf bared vicious teeth, sweeping forth like a tide, ferociously attacking the beastman array in front.
Facing the charge of over a hundred wolves, if it were any other beastman tribe in the Kawa Great Forest, they might have fled in panic.
Yet these Austin clan members, rigorously trained and forged in bloody battle, stood firm as steel.
"Stab!"
As the blood wolves drew close, a command rang out, and the sharp long spears thrust forth, the leading wolves crashing into a solid wall, blood splattering as eight or nine immediately fell beneath the spears.
But this did not scare the blood wolves; the pack kept charging forward, directly attacking the beastman formation.
If it were during that night raid days ago, the wolves’ relentless attack would have torn open the beastman ranks, leading them to break apart.
However, Austin had made adjustments to the beastman ranks for today’s battle.
Because of the canyon’s width, Austin’s beastman forces were divided into three lines. The front line was a group of ten goblins.
Short goblins holding spears in one hand, and a half-person-high rattan wooden shield in the other, served as makeshift gun shield soldiers.
Given the goblins’ stature, the first line was not intended to do much damage; their spears mainly deterred the blood wolves’ advance, while their shields protected the lower body, blocking wolves outside the formation.
Behind them were the taller kobolds and lizardmen in the second and third rows, tasked with damaging the wolves.
The short goblins ahead did not hinder the spear attacks of the second and third lines.
Thus, the three lines intertwined their attacks, transforming the beastman army into a grinder within the canyon, exterminating the blood wolves.
Blood wolves kept charging, but hitting the collaborative killing machine, the canyon filled with blood splatter, the wolves unable to even approach the beastmen.
In just over ten minutes, more than half the wolf pack was lost.
At this point, the Blood Wolf Leader, commanding from behind, began to panic.
"Roar!!"
The Blood Wolf Leader let out a raging roar, visible airwaves rising.
The massive blood-colored figure dashed ahead, streaking like thunder over its wolf subordinates, heading toward the beastmen’s formation.
At the previous raid on Dragon Nest Village, the Blood Wolf Leader almost broke open the ranks with a single strike.
This time, it intended to repeat the strategy, leading its followers to completely crush the beastman army!
Yet as it leapt high, blood-tinted phantoms flickering between its claws,
Crash!
Suddenly, a shadow fell from above the canyon, steel-like talons tearing through wind and thunder, blasting toward the airborne blood wolf.
Boom!
The Blood Wolf Leader had no time to react, being hit with enormous force, sent flying like a cannonball.
Bang!
The Blood Wolf Leader crashed heavily to the ground, rolling several times, its mind blank.
Yet at this moment, Austin seized the advantage, swooping down from above with claws tearing the air, aiming at the wolf leader’s head.
Seeing their leader in danger, the blood wolves around immediately sprang up, leaping at the descending Blue Young Dragon.
With blood wolves ascending, even Austin dared not trap itself in encirclement, forced to beat its wings, lifting itself against the torrent to ascend.
The Blood Wolf Leader, crashed to the ground, also regained clarity from dizziness.
It shook its head, looked up at Austin flying above, its blood-red eyes full of murderous intent.
However, the Blood Wolf Leader refrained from madness, refocusing on the slaughtering beastman ranks advancing before it, its body trembling, emitting a low roar.
"Roar..."
Traces of blood-colored mist rose from its wolf body, the blood-hued fur now fluttering, an invisible pressure spreading, the blood wolves backing off to leave space.
The Blood Wolf Leader’s entire body seemed ablaze with blood-colored flames, rising with immense momentum, mouth opening, its form growing savage.
"Is this... Talent Magic?"
The Blue Young Dragon hovering above suddenly sensed a foreboding.
"Watch out!"
Austin urgently warned, but at that instant, a sphere of yellow flame appeared from the Blood Wolf Leader’s mouth, spewing forth like a cannonball.
Beastmen barely reacted as the basketball-sized fireball streaked across the sky, striking the beastman ranks.
Boom!!!
Upon hitting the ranks, the fireball erupted, igniting a three-meter-long flame, raising immense heat waves.
Although the fireball hit the goblins’ wooden shields, its powerful shockwave and scorching flames blasted open a gap in the beastman ranks, nearby goblins fell, life uncertain, surrounding beastmen severely burned.
"Awoo!!!"
Successful from the strike, the blood wolves grew frenzied, charging the beastman ranks anew.
Simultaneously,
The Blood Wolf Leader opened its mouth again, blood mist rising from its body, threads of energy gathering in the air.
"Damn!"
Austin, poised to attack, saw ordinary blood wolves eyeing it as imminent threat, ready to leap should the Blue Young Dragon drop to a reachable height.
Any descent could mean those wolves pouncing without fear, tangling Austin persistently.
"Blast it!"
Austin fiercely outraged, as it prepared to descend and fight, eyeing the focused, unmoving blood wolf leader conjuring its Talent Magic, an idea suddenly sparked in the Blue Young Dragon’s mind.

chapters.title: Chapter 31 - 29 Annihilation
chapters.content:
Chapter 31: Chapter 29 Annihilation
If it were just a normal wolf pack, Austin alone would be enough to massacre hundreds of wolves, without the slightest worry that ordinary wolves in a chaotic battle could harm him. Although he was only a two-year-old super young dragon, dragons are still dragons, and scale armor defense is not something ordinary beasts can damage.
But this pack of blood wolves is not an ordinary wolf pack. Within these blood wolves flows the extraordinary aura of magic beasts, capable of piercing Austin’s scales, which have yet to fully develop.
To be classified as a magic beast already makes them vastly different from ordinary beasts.
Even though Austin could ignore one or two blood wolves, if an entire pack pounced, even the blue young dragon would have no choice but to flee. Otherwise, if he got entangled by four or five blood wolves and was then attacked by their leader, whose power rivals that of a Tier Three magic beast, escape would be impossible.
It is precisely because of his apprehension towards the elite guards surrounding the blood wolf leader that Austin dared not descend from the sky easily.
But at this moment, when Austin saw the blood wolf leader close its eyes to gather a talent magic, he suddenly remembered that he was no longer the young dragon from a year ago without long-range attack capabilities.
Back then, the blue young dragon had only awakened the first talent magic called Electric Shock Paralysis, forcing him into close combat.
But now, he had awakened a second talent magic.
"The Thunder Strike Technique causes a lot of commotion before it’s ready, making it likely for this cunning beast to dodge. But now, perhaps I could..."
Austin had previously considered whether he could directly use his newly awakened second talent magic to seriously injure the blood wolf leader. However, considering the blood wolf leader’s cunning nature, directly using that talent magic might result in it dodging and leaving Austin’s efforts in vain. Moreover, even at his peak, he could only use the Thunder Strike Technique once or twice, so he initially had no intention of using that magic.
Yet now, circumstances had changed, and perhaps he could use this opportunity to launch a surprise attack.
With this thought, the blue young dragon immediately soared into the air, using the wind to glide into the rocky walls on either side. His iron-like dragon claws tore through the rock layers on the sides as if they were made of tofu, causing large chunks of rock to fall from the sky, crashing onto the blood wolf pack.
The blood wolf leader was alarmed by this commotion, looking up at the sky in frustration as the sand and stones poured down like a waterfall, though it did not cause any harm, it disrupted its process of gathering talent magic.
"Roar!"
The blood wolf leader let out a low growl but was not further provoked by the blue young dragon, standing still in place to once again gather its talent magic, ignoring the changes above.
Seeing the blood wolf leader beneath ignoring the changes above and refocusing its magic power, Austin’s mouth curled into a grim smile.
What the blood wolf leader hadn’t noticed was that under the cover of the dust from the falling rocks, the magic power within the blue young dragon’s body began to circulate. At some point, the moisture in the air began to rise, and amidst the large rocks falling, an occasional electrical spark flashed in the air. The atmosphere began to ionize with the circulation of magic power, silently gathering terrifying power.
At that moment, the blood wolf leader remained unmoving, threads of magic power extended from its body, accumulating in front of it into a mass of flame emitting intense heat, continuously growing larger, as though even the air was burning and warping.
As a result of the blood wolf leader’s Fireball Talent Technique, an opening had been created in the beastman ranks, and under the assault of the blood wolf pack, they were already on the verge of collapse, barely maintaining their stand.
If the blood wolf leader’s talent magic were to strike the already crumbling beastman formation again, the next moment their ranks would be breached entirely, drowning in the blood wolves!
Just as the flames gathered before the blood wolf leader, the forming flame ball was about to be launched,
BOOM!!!
A thunderclap suddenly resounded throughout the canyon in what seemed like a clear sky, an enormous peal of thunder echoing mightily.
The blood wolf leader immediately sensed an imminent threat of disaster enveloping it, as if it were about to face the abyss of death, causing its fur to stand on end.
However, before it could react, a thick bolt of lightning suddenly descended from the sky, tearing the air and striking its body instantly.
ZZZAP!!!
The thunderbolt hit the blood wolf leader squarely, electric arcs scattering in every direction, and the surrounding blood wolf elite were struck by the lightning, turning into charred remains.
Struck directly by the thunderbolt, the blood wolf leader was overwhelmed by a terrifying electric current, its entire body engulfed in flames, and the fireball it had been about to launch lost control and exploded violently.
BOOM!!!
With a loud explosion, flames surged eight or nine meters high, the terrible shockwave sweeping out like a torrent, the ground shattered into web-like cracks, and fragments of stone scattered like bullets in all directions, affecting over a dozen nearby blood wolves. They were swept away by the shockwave, their fates unknown.
"Good!"
High above, the blue young dragon’s eyes gleamed brilliantly as his Thunder Strike Technique struck home, not only severely wounding the blood wolf leader in an instant but also causing its talent magic to explode uncontrollably, killing it, while gravely injuring nearly one-third of the remaining blood wolf pack.
"Kill!"
Seeing the blood wolf leader struck down and the blood wolf pack reeling from the explosion, the previously faltering beastman army was galvanized, like caged tigers unleashed, crushing towards the panicked blood wolf pack.
Simultaneously, having lost the blood wolf leader’s intimidation and with his strength nearly exhausted, Austin also descended from the sky, joining the fray to annihilate the remaining blood wolves.
Without their leader, and pushed to the edge of desperation, the remaining blood wolves went berserk, frenziedly attacking Austin and the beastman army.
Yet the combined strength of the two forces was beyond what they could challenge.
Soon, the entire blood wolf pack was completely wiped out, without a single one left alive.
"What a pity. If they were intelligent beings capable of communication, there might have been a chance to subdue them. But since they’re just beasts, it’s not worth it."
Within the canyon, with wolf corpses scattered everywhere, the beastmen began to clear the battlefield. Austin stood in the center, licking the blood off his claws, gazing at the bloody scene before him with a slight sigh.
Until the very last moment, these blood wolves were fiercely attacking and biting, rendering any attempt at communication or subjugation impossible, forcing him to slaughter them all.
"There should be wolf pups in the wolf’s nest, so perhaps raising these magic beasts isn’t just a daydream."
An idea flashed in Austin’s mind, already deciding to explore the wolf’s nest.
However,
what matters most now is that....
Austin shifted his gaze back to a charred corpse significantly larger than the other blood wolves, a thirstful look glimmered in his eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 32 - 30 Harvest
chapters.content:
Chapter 32: Chapter 30 Harvest
Crash!
The Blue Young Dragon flapped its membrane wings, soaring upwards with the airflow, gracefully crossing more than ten meters to land beside the corpse of the Blood Wolf Leader.
During the growth of a young dragon, a large amount of magic crystals, magic ores, and other magic power materials are needed. It is through the absorption and digestion of these vast magic resources that adult dragons can stand at the pinnacle of this world.
For other young dragons in their early years, the resources needed for growth are naturally provided by their parents. Unfortunately, Austin is an orphan dragon, and everything depends on himself.
At first, Austin chose to build a nest and camp nearby, largely because the area was resource-poor with few fierce hunters roaming about, making it more suitable for his own growth.
This advantage allowed the Blue Young Dragon to barely survive until it was two years old, but naturally, a place of poverty had its drawbacks, which was the scarcity of magic power resources.
Over two years, apart from some magic potions occasionally found and the magic beast crystal core swallowed after the last hunt of the Ghost-headed Crocodile, and the body of the Ghost-headed Crocodile Leader, Austin hadn’t acquired any other magic power resources.
The more magic resources are absorbed and digested, the stronger the power of the Dragon Race.
This Blood Wolf Leader before him, at least a top-tier two, had battle power nearly reaching tier three, and the magic power it contained was certainly not inferior to that of the Ghost-headed Crocodile Leader, and it might even form a magic beast crystal core.
The Blue Young Dragon opened its fierce maw and tore apart the head of the Blood Wolf Leader.
Sure enough, within the skull, a crystal core emitting a faint red glow hovered silently.
A magic beast crystal core, a true magic beast crystal core, unlike the prototype inside the Ghost-headed Crocodile Leader back then!
Without any hesitation, Austin swallowed it in one bite,
The digestion ability of the Dragon Race was sufficient to let the Blue Young Dragon completely digest this vast source of magic power.
With one gulp the magic beast crystal core was swallowed down, simultaneously Austin took a look at the Blood Wolf Leader’s corpse before him, and in a few bites, he ate it and swallowed it into his belly.
Gulp!
The meat, containing strong magic power, entered his belly and was digested by the powerful digestion ability, while the previously swallowed crystal core of the Blood Wolf Leader also dissolved and melted in the stomach, surging waves of immense magic power running through his blood vessels, fusing into his muscles.
In that instant, Austin felt as if magma was flowing through his veins, the scorching pain like a tsunami drowning his mind.
At the same time, waves of aura rose from his body, the surrounding air ionized to various extents, arcs of electricity and fire crackled and jumped in the air, a hurricane swept in all directions.
After a while, all the anomalies dissipated.
Austin looked at himself, feeling as if his entire body had grown by over ten centimeters at this moment, his scale armor becoming more profound, with tiny electric currents flickering through the gaps between the scales, reflecting the sunlight around him.
"The magic power within my body has increased by at least twenty percent!"
Feeling the overwhelming power within his body, Austin murmured to himself.
If previously he could use the Thunder Strike Technique only once or twice in a battle, now he would be able to use it at least two to three times, and he would be able to wield the two talent magics more skillfully, with their power also seeing some enhancement.
Not only that, the Blue Young Dragon clearly felt that the scale armor on his body’s surface had become more solid, his overall strength had increased by at least thirty percent or more!
And this was just part of it.
The magic core within his body and the blood wolf leader’s bones and blood hadn’t been completely digested, the magic beast crystal core had only melted about half, with a lot of meat remaining, needing further digestion.
When Austin fully devours and digests the Blood Wolf Leader, his overall strength could be improved by at least fifty percent.
Although no third talent magic had awakened, this improvement in strength was already quite impressive.
"Indeed, only by devouring materials containing magic power can a dragon grow the quickest before reaching adulthood!"
Of course, if too much is devoured, the young dragon would need to sleep to digest the magical food, thus reducing the efficiency of digestion and growth.
Austin shook his head, dispelling the many distractions in his mind.
What’s important now is handling the aftermath properly.
"Vini, how are the casualties?"
The Blue Young Dragon turned his head to ask the Kobold leader Vini, who was commanding the Beastmen to clean the battlefield beside him.
"Your Highness Austin, except for one Goblin who was burned to death by the Blood Wolf Leader’s talent magic directly, there are six severely injured, eleven lightly injured, and the rest are basically fine."
Upon hearing Austin’s inquiry, Vini quickly and respectfully replied.
After devouring the Blood Wolf Leader, Vini instinctively sensed that the Blue Young Dragon before him exerted a more tremendous pressure, even feeling a slight trace of draconic majesty from that aura.
"Very well, you all did a good job, the casualties were beyond my expectations."
Austin nodded, accepting the casualty rate, as the Blood Wolf pack was no simple group of wolves.
"Clean up the battlefield and prepare to return, don’t forget to bring back the Goblin who died in battle, for they died for us. Build a grave next to the Dragon Nest Village, always remember these warriors who spilled blood and sacrificed their lives for us."
Following Austin’s command, the Beastmen quickly swept through the canyon.
Each Beastman had their duties, soon completing the cleanup of the canyon battlefield. The team achieved a great victory and mighty triumph as they proceeded back towards Dragon Nest Village.
Those hundreds of wolf corpses lying on the ground were piled onto Vine Shields, bound with vines to make a makeshift sled and pulled back to Dragon Nest Village, similar treatment was given to the heavily injured, sitting on Vine Shields pulled back to the village by uninjured Beastmen.
Luckily, from the ambush to returning to the village, they didn’t have the misfortune of encountering any fierce hunters, although some famished hyenas were drawn by the smell of blood upon return to the village, upon seeing the Blue Young Dragon soaring down from the sky, they scrambled away chaotically.
The Beastman army returned safely to Dragon Nest Village unharmed.
Upon return to the lair, Austin picked several keen-scented Kobolds to track the Blood Wolf pack’s trails and locate their den.
Unexpectedly, within the Blood Wolf’s den, the Blue Young Dragon discovered a tree that remained lush in the heavy snow, and found a few blood-red fruits on its branches, fruits containing magic!
Perhaps the formation of the Blood Wolf pack was related to the lush tree amid the cold winter, Austin then planned to move this tree to his own nest for protection after the cold winter passed.
Aside from the magic-containing tree, Austin also found a skin-and-bones mother Blood Wolf and over a dozen hungry, howling young wolves in the den.
Maybe it was because Austin had become stronger, awakened a trace of draconic majesty, or perhaps with the Blood Wolf pack absent, the mother wolf growled aggressively yet with fear at the arrival of the Blue Young Dragon.
But as Austin approached, the mother Blood Wolf finally let out a strange cry, lying on the ground in surrender.
Thus, the Blue Young Dragon naturally took the mother and young wolves back to Dragon Nest Village for breeding, and come next summer, these fierce hunters would certainly add more power under Austin’s command.
```

chapters.title: Chapter 33 - 31: Situation
chapters.content:
Chapter 33: Chapter 31: Situation
The blood wolves, the most cunning and cruel hunters, in the extreme hunger of the cold winter, would even tear apart and kill the old and weak of the tribe as food.
Among the blood wolves, there is only a sense of pack mentality and no family concept, so Austin is confident in taming these young wolves.
Once these young blood wolves grow up, they will not only help the beastmen clear various ferocious beasts near their territory, but when the blood wolf tribe multiplies enough to be strong, they can select some robust beastmen to train as wolf cavalry.
With bows and arrows as weapons and the powerful mobility of the wolf pack, the combination of the two forms this advanced unit, which is undoubtedly a deadly weapon in this jungle.
In such jungle warfare, it almost proves to be invincible.
However, realizing such a wolf cavalry army is still some distance away in the future.
After feeding some food to the emaciated mother wolf and the ten or so hungry young wolves, the young wolves became less resistant to Austin and the kobolds.
Thus, under the guidance of the Blue Young Dragon, the mother wolf and the young wolves were brought back to Dragon Nest Village.
This cold winter season, with a great victory over the blood wolf pack and the fish caught in the lake reservoirs, there was no shortage of food in the Dragon Nest Village, and they could bear the cost of feeding these creatures.
Before leaving, the beastmen searched the entire Blood Wolf Lair.
Unfortunately, apart from some white bones, the whole lair contained nothing of value. However, Austin did find quite a few fruit pits on the ground, which were the seeds of the fruit from the nearby magic tree.
These fruit pits seemed worthless and did not contain any magic power, but Austin still instructed the beastmen to collect them.
Once the cold winter season passes, and it is time to clear and plant in the Dragon Nest Territory, these fruit pits could be planted; perhaps in the future, more magic trees might grow, yielding more magic-infused red fruits, constituting a substantial magic resource.
As for the tree beside the blood wolf lair, Austin intends to leave it in its place and see if it can be transplanted next to the Dragon Nest Territory after next year’s hot summer.
After cleaning the Blood Wolf Lair thoroughly, Austin and the beastmen returned to the Dragon Nest Tribe with their harvests to begin a phase of recuperation and rest.
The battle had thoroughly exterminated the blood wolf pack wandering around the Dragon Nest Territory, and henceforth, there was almost nothing in the entire territory that could threaten the Dragon Nest.
However, after that bloody battle, the Beastman Tribe also suffered significant losses. Although only one goblin died on the spot due to being directly hit by the Blood Wolf Leader’s talent magic, many other beastmen were severely injured.
Plus, after the beastman formation was blown open by the pack of blood wolves in a frenzy, many beastmen were injured, and the strength of the Dragon Nest Village dropped to its lowest point.
Fortunately, the battle exterminated over a hundred wolf packs, not only solving the immediate food problem for Dragon Nest Village; the wolf pelts provided also made life warmer for the beastmen in the village during the cold winter, so there were no major issues.
The time has reached a little more than the second month of the cold winter season, as the end of the cold winter approaches, hungry fierce beasts have begun to appear frequently wandering near the Dragon Nest Territory, attacking the village, just without any magic beasts attacking.
Moreover, ever since the night raid by the blood wolf pack on Dragon Nest Village, they had built a simple fence around the village, with beastmen guarding it every night, so the few attacks by fierce beasts were detected early by beastmen, with no damage inflicted.
Nonetheless, Austin instructed the beastmen to reduce their time spent outside, mostly staying within the Dragon Nest Territory to prepare for the plans post-cold winter next year.
"Simply surviving by hunting and gathering cannot sustain or support a large population."
From the evolutionary history of human civilization in past lives, it is known that for a clan’s power to grow and prosper, it must eventually settle down and develop agriculture to sustain a larger population and develop a more substantial civilized power.
However, in this world, particularly in the Kawa Great Forest, perhaps due to various reasons or the presence of extraordinary power, the many beastman tribes living in the Kawa Great Forest have not transitioned to an agricultural settled development and remain in the hunting-gathering civilization stage.
Even those tribes active at the edge of the Kawa Great Forest, bordering human territory, do not have the concept of agriculture and animal husbandry. From the mouth of the fox-faced Quik, it was known that those great tribes, due to population issues, could not gather enough food from the forest. Thus, when cold winters come, great hordes of beastman tribes spill out of the Kawa Forest like a flood into human civilization’s frontier to plunder.
Over a thousand years of mutual slaughter and skirmish have stained every corner with blood, making the frontier region where the Kawa Great Forest meets the Civilized Continent renownedly feared by humans, called the Bloody Defense Line.
During the thousand-year war, humans gradually built a giant Great Wall, spanning thousands of miles across the Bloody Defense Line, to block the southern beastmen from the Kawa Great Forest.
According to the fox-faced Quik, with the successful construction of the Bloody Great Wall and the formidable Iron-blooded Duke guarding the border, in recent years, the large beastman tribes at the Kawa Great Forest border have rarely been able to breach the Bloody Defense Line to enter the human realm, and their situation hasn’t been good.
Moreover, due to poor conditions in recent years, the major beastman forces north of the Dragon Nest Tribe have had continuous conflicts, even going to war several times.
However, none of this currently concerns Austin, and he did not ask the fox-faced Quik how he knew about these matters.
Those major beastman forces have tribes numbering over a hundred thousand, and even golden or legendary realm powerhouses exist within, not something Austin, with his small group, can provoke at this time.
In these last days of the cold winter season, although Austin has reduced the beastmen’s excursions to avoid attacks from hungry beasts,
it does not mean that the beastmen idly stayed in the Dragon Nest Village. In addition to daily training and catching fish, the beastmen had gained another task.
That was to create tools like hoes and wooden shovels, in preparation for next year’s farming season.
At the same time, they must preemptively fell down some trees in nearby wooded areas, so that after the cold winter, the dried fallen trees can be set alight, creating clearing land ready for the cultivation of various wild grains.

chapters.title: Chapter 34 - 32: Reclaiming Wilderness
chapters.content:
Chapter 34: Chapter 32: Reclaiming Wilderness
Adhering to the principle of not spoiling the nest, the Blue Young Dragon did not allow these beastmen to randomly cut down trees near Dragon Nest Village, only cleaning up the area surrounding the village a little.
Small changes were beneficial for improving the living environment of the beastmen, while not causing the natural barrier to be overly cleared; having some trees surrounding as protection was still very effective.
As for lands to cultivate and farm, they found a flat area not far from Dragon Nest Village and near a water source. Austin marked out an area of about twenty acres, intending to start cultivation there in the coming year.
Under Austin’s command, the beastmen arduously chopped down the ancient trees one by one. Fortunately, when the Lizardman leader Rodney attacked Dragon Nest Village, the Blue Young Dragon confiscated an iron axe from him, greatly speeding up the tree-felling process.
Otherwise, without iron tools, even if it was just ten acres of land, these beastmen using stone and bone tools would probably take a month to clear it.
In the icy snow,
A small piece of land had already been cleared, with several strong beastmen hanging ropes made of vines on the tree tops, and the massive ancient tree trunks had been mostly axed down. Following the kobold Vini’s command, the beastmen quickly grabbed the ends of the ropes.
"One, two, three... pull!"
With the rhythmic command, the beastmen quickly seized the rope ends and pulled forcefully.
Groaning!
The tree, already half-chopped, broke with a miserable sound under the powerful traction, collapsing with a crash as the beastmen at both ends quickly scattered.
"Alright, take a break, we’ll continue later."
Vini wiped the sweat off his forehead, seeing the beastmen were exhausted, suggesting a short rest.
Although it was cold winter with ice and snow, the heavy exercise had left every beastman sweating profusely and panting heavily.
The Kawa Great Forest had been formed for countless years, and these trees were at least as thick as one could embrace. Although they had an iron axe, chopping down a tree still required enormous strength.
Fortunately, after these trees were felled, they could be left alone. As the Blue Young Dragon said, after the cold winter, these trees on the ground would dry out and could simply be burned down.
However, the remaining tree roots were problematic. After the trunks were chopped, the stumps remained firmly rooted in the soil.
According to the Blue Young Dragon’s plan, after farming and cultivation in this area, wild rice and other crops would be planted. The soil needed leveling, and during this process, the roots would be a hindrance.
There was no way around it, they could only avoid them, allowing them to slowly rot in the ground over the years.
"Farming, is it really feasible..."
Looking at the resting beastmen scattered around, Vini suddenly had this thought.
Farming was said to be the exclusive knowledge of humans on the northern Civilized Continent, and throughout history, no one had seen beastmen who could farm.
Beastmen usually obtained food through hunting, gathering, or plundering from other tribes; tribes relying on farming for survival and development were almost nonexistent.
This was related to the beastmen’s way of life and environmental conditions. Additionally, the beastmen’s coarse mindset couldn’t comprehend the humans’ intricate farming knowledge, resulting in beastmen not developing agriculture.
Although Vini was puzzled by the Blue Young Dragon’s plan, he continued to execute it unwaveringly.
The events of recent days—slaying the ghost-headed crocodile, ice-fishing, hunting blood wolf packs—had made the beastmen blindly believe in the Blue Young Dragon.
Even if Austin’s decisions were wrong, they would follow through without a doubt.
"Once rested, we’ll continue working. After finishing this tree, we’ll have a meal!"
After resting on the ground for a while, Vini called out loudly, finding another snow-laden tree and beginning a new round of work.
Meanwhile, as the beastmen were enthusiastically working,
Austin stood on a hill not far away, looking down at the beastmen diligently clearing the trees in the flatland.
"It’s been two days, and only this much has been cleared. It seems metallurgy must be developed quickly."
Currently, the beastmen’s tools consisted only of the war axe seized from the Lizardman leader Rodney and some stone, wood, and bone tools, severely affecting work efficiency.
Though, with the Blue Young Dragon’s power, joining the clearing work would increase the speed several times over.
Not to mention the power within, even a Thunder Strike Technique could char a huge tree.
But who was he?
He was the lord of these beastmen, their superior.
In this world, there was no such thing as a lord doing the work personally.
He was the boss, not a nanny.
Moreover, farming and clearing were vital for the beastmen’s future food source, but dispensable for the Blue Young Dragon.
The clan’s development required its efforts and struggles to overcome difficulties and ultimately achieve results rather than Austin assisting and growing them prematurely.
Even if the target of clearing twenty acres this cold winter couldn’t be achieved, Austin wouldn’t personally help.
