After completing the morning routine training, the Beastmen grouped into formations under their respective captains, who received today’s tasks from the Dragon Nest Tribe Village Chief Vini, whether hunting, fishing, gathering vines, searching for stone tool materials, making wooden spear wood, weaving nets, land clearing, etc.
With the day’s schedule laid out, there was hardly any idle time for the Beastmen.
While the captains received tasks, the Beastmen relaxed nearby, chatting and bickering.
"I really envy Rodney and those guys—they don’t have to work or do military training, just lie down and get fed every day."
"Ha ha, if you want, you can go too. Anyway, you don’t have to do anything, just lie there for a few days without working, and after the experiments, you can get stronger—how great is that!"
Austin didn’t hide the fact that he used Beastmen as test subjects—news of it spread early in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Of course, with daily brainwashing propaganda and the "generous" life of having enough to eat, these clan members wouldn’t have complaints even if they sacrificed their lives for Austin.
After all, this world didn’t really have any concept of human rights, especially for Beastmen who lived day to day. Sacrificing themselves for the revered Blue Dragon was their honor.
However, the Blue Young Dragon’s experiments didn’t take their lives, but the experience wasn’t pleasant. The electric stimulation was something ordinary Beastmen couldn’t endure, especially when one day they saw Rodney emerge from the lab twitching, incontinent.
Saying they envied them was just banter.
"I’ve heard that if His Highness’s experiment succeeds, we will all gain extraordinary power."
"Extraordinary power, huh? It used to be that only leaders and elites could possess that power in our tribe."
In conversation, some Beastmen showed longing expressions.
Living in a place where the strong prey on the weak, the desire for power was an instinct for every creature.
"Gather and deploy!"
Not long after, the captains, having received tasks from Vini, returned, shouting orders.
The Beastmen stood up one by one, approaching their own captains to form ranks, and then dispersed in various directions within the Dragon Nest Territory under their captain’s lead.
"Brother, if His Highness succeeds, will we also get extraordinary abilities?"
In a small group, Aisha asked her brother walking upfront.
This small group consisted of juvenile Beastmen from the Dragon Nest Tribe. They handled tasks that were manageable for them, as not all tribal duties were suitable for these young ones.
Aisha and her brother Meng Bi were among this group, tasked with clearing the field for planting kudzu root. After half a month of growth, the vines had sprouted thick tendrils. To increase sunlight exposure, Austin ordered branches to be cut and inserted into the ridges for the vines to climb and increase sun time.
Works demanding physical strength were generally handled by adult Beastmen, while these young Beastmen attended to these kudzu vines, handling tasks like weeding.
"This is an experiment personally overseen by His Highness Austin—of course, it will succeed. His Highness Austin is a mighty Giant Dragon; how could it not succeed?"
Meng Bi patted his sister’s head and said.
"Then can I fly in the future?"
"Mm, you definitely can."
Amongst the chatter of a group of young Beastmen, the team soon arrived at a green expanse.

chapters.title: Chapter 58 - 56 Education
chapters.content:
Chapter 58: Chapter 56 Education
Perhaps due to the differences in species in the Otherworld, after half a month of growth, the kudzu vine in the first plot of reclaimed land has become very lush. Rows of branches are inserted into the ridge ground, and the surrounding vines climb over them to gain more sunlight, looking lush and emerald green. From a distance, they resemble rows of trees one or two meters high.
Under the care of the beastmen, even though these kudzu vines originate from wild kudzu roots in the wild, their growth and other traits are much stronger than those in the wild.
During the initial reclamation, weeds and various leaves and branches on the ground were burned into ash and used as fertilizer when the kudzu roots were planted.
During the cold winter season, Austin ordered the beastmen to build toilets and set up a small biogas fermentation pool next to them. In the hot climate of the Kawa Great Forest, the beastmen’s manure ferments very quickly, turning into excellent fertilizer in just over ten days. Although the biogas could not be utilized, the remaining fertilizer played a significant role in the reclaimed fields.
For the first reclaimed field of about twenty acres, the originally gray-brown soil has started showing signs of turning black, which is a sign of increasing soil fertility.
Perhaps after planting kudzu for one or two years, it will be possible to plant wild rice.
"You, you, and you, pull the weeds from these three rows. The rest of you, pull those four rows."
The pig-headed woman in charge of supervising the young beastmen casually assigned them tasks.
The newborn beastmen are cared for by their mothers until they can walk. These nursing beastman mothers will be grouped with pregnant females, responsible for net weaving, handling prey, cooking meals, and other tasks that do not require too much strength.
Once the young beastmen are old enough to walk and work, they will be assigned to another team led by the current pig-headed woman, responsible for teaching survival skills and doing various simple tasks within their abilities. This can be considered an Otherworld version of kindergarten.
However, this kindergarten does not teach literacy or cultural knowledge; instead, it requires them to perform various labor tasks. Of course, simple math calculations are taught, but hunting experience is the primary focus.
In Austin’s plans, this cohort of young beastmen will achieve roughly a first-grade level of cultural understanding once they grow up. Although some math and cultural knowledge can stimulate the beastmen’s rigid minds, Austin does not plan to establish schools like elementary, middle, or high schools or universities, at least not anytime soon.
For now, regarding education, Austin hasn’t figured it out yet, but it is certain that he will not spend massive resources on education.
No matter how you look at it, food has to be eaten bite by bite. Even if a few beastmen who understand calculus were to be taught now, it wouldn’t do much for the current Dragon Nest Tribe.
For the time being, what Austin needs are Clan Warriors who can obey his orders unconditionally and prove useful. In the short term, all that is needed for cultural education are indoctrination political lessons and a bit of basic math.
Undoubtedly, there is a reason related to educational resources. The Fox-faced Man Quik, who can calculate numbers within a hundred, is already considered a rare talent in the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, and Austin has no interest in teaching them. If education changes in the future, it will likely be not until Austin can establish a stronghold in the Kawa Great Forest and truly build an Empire.
Austin has another goal in separating the young beastmen for education, which is to instill loyalty from a young age. Even though the entire Dragon Nest Tribe already holds maximum loyalty to the Blue Young Dragon, some things still need to be done.
Regarding the separation of mothers and children, there’s nothing to worry about. The Dragon Nest Tribe isn’t that large; everyone lives in the same place, meeting early in the morning, at noon, and in the evening. It’s merely grouping the young beastmen together for teaching, which isn’t actually a separation.
Previously, when the mother beastmen worked, they also had to watch over the young beastmen running around. Now that there is someone specially tasked with care and supervision, the mother beastmen can focus on working, increasing production efficiency.
In front of the fields, the pig-headed woman has already assigned tasks. The Jackal Wolf People Meng Bi look at the seemingly endless kudzu fields with a slightly worried expression.
"Aisha, can you manage? If not, I’ll help you later."
Perhaps due to the climate, as the kudzu grows rapidly, weeds in the fields are also growing quickly, filling the ridges and competing with the kudzu for space.
If they were beastmen, they naturally wouldn’t care about these weeds. Without planting experience, they don’t have the concept that weeds can affect kudzu growth. However, Austin wouldn’t just stand by, so he ordered Vini to arrange for weeding work while observing these reclaimed fields during the trials.
Of course, weeding is a physically demanding task and cannot be entirely completed by the young beastmen. They are responsible for a very small part, viewing it as labor course training.
Under Austin’s requirements, these young beastmen must try every task out there, combining teaching and practice, training them to be the future mainstay of the Dragon Grass Tribe’s development.
"No need, brother."
Aisha quickly shook her head. It’s just pulling weeds, and although the work is somewhat dull, it’s far better than the days of enduring hunger and cold in the icy snow.
Thinking back to those times struggling between life and death, she wouldn’t forget that easily just because she had a few days of full meals.
Compared to those cold, foodless days of constant hunger, simply pulling weeds, having a full belly, and living in a warm house is nothing.
In contrast, Aisha feels that this is already much better.
The young beastmen obediently enter the fields in batches, pulling weeds alongside the kudzu. Having undergone military training even at a young age, they already understood the importance of following orders. Unlike the unruly children in Austin’s former life, they didn’t disobey or cause trouble, nurtured in hardship.
While the young beastmen were weeding the kudzu in the first plot of reclaimed land, further away, other reclamation work was also ongoing.
Lack of enough farming tools made the beastmen’s reclamation work not very smooth. Even though the beastmen’s physical strength is somewhat superior to humans, after more than half a month, they had only reclaimed about a hundred acres of land.
In the newly opened fields, the kudzu planted two days ago has just sprouted, but it will soon grow into a lush kudzu field. And in the near future, these reclaimed farmlands will become the most solid grain source for the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 59 - 57 Livestock
chapters.content:
Chapter 59: Chapter 57 Livestock
"These goblin things, really can’t be trusted."
In the forest, a kobold from the hunting team picked up a broken trap loop from the grass and tossed it to the ground, muttering.
This loop was said to be a trap crafted by goblins working in the "Manufacturing Workshop," as guided by His Highness Austin. It was supposed to catch earth gray rabbits effortlessly by placing it along their paths.
However, they set the trap on the path yesterday, and upon checking today, they found the trap loop bitten in half, completely ineffective.
"It’s already passable. I heard the second team caught a boar using goblin-made traps—a boar, something no hunting team could capture before."
Another beastman clicked his tongue in admiration. The boars in this Otherworld seem like mutated versions, weighing nearly a thousand pounds. Running like a tank, they crush trees along the way.
Such fierce creatures could only be handled by Austin. Yet now even the traps caught them, which speaks volumes about their power.
"It’s just thanks to His Highness’s guidance; otherwise, how could these goblins have done it?" The kobold grumbled in discontent.
"Alright, alright, let’s get to work. Today we need to catch ten live earth gray rabbits."
Due to intensive hunting, beasts near the Dragon Nest Territory suffered, and animals within a ten-kilometer range of Dragon Nest Village became scarce. To hunt enough, they had to explore farther.
For sustainable resources and to address Dragon Nest Tribe’s meat issue, Austin began a beast domestication plan.
During hunting, they would bring back young beasts to domesticate within the livestock pens set up in the village.
Especially boar and earth gray rabbit younglings, which are not picky eaters and breed quickly, making them ideal for focused farming.
Just after the harsh winter ended a month ago, food started becoming abundant again. With sufficient food, beasts began breeding their next generation, making it not too hard to bring back younglings. Thus, Vini assigned the hunting teams quotas to bring back enough younglings daily along with their hunting tasks.
This hunting team, led by a few Blood Wolves, soon followed earth gray rabbits’ tracks to a fist-sized hole.
"This is it."
Seeing the Blood Wolves digging at the entrance, the beastmen, after over a month of acclimatization, understood the Blood Wolves’ meaning—the earth gray rabbits were inside this hole.
The Blood Wolves then sniffed out the exits of two other holes from this burrow.
Thus, the earth gray rabbits inside the burrow were trapped inside.
Before, capturing earth gray rabbits inside a burrow required extensive digging, opening the entire hole.
But that’s no longer necessary.
As the leader of Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin didn’t just stand idly by.
Early in the harsh winter, while drilling the ice fishing holes, Austin noticed that the beastmen’s hunting techniques were primitive, lacking developed techniques or traps.
Though not a hunter in his previous life, Austin frequently watched survival shows like Bear Grylls and recalled some basic hunting techniques, gradually teaching them to the beastmen, including some rural tricks he picked up living in the countryside.
Among these was the technique for dealing with earth gray rabbits hiding in burrows.
That technique was smoke.
Austin recalled his childhood in a rural area in his previous life, joining a group of kids to smoke out field mice.
Stuffing a bunch of weeds into the field mouse hole entrance, and then lighting it and blowing smoke inside, the dense smoke followed the burrow’s paths, forcing field mice out of another exit, where friends would wait to catch them.
The same method dealt with earth gray rabbits.
The beastmen stuffed dry weeds into the burrow entrance, ignited them, and blew vigorously from outside, sending smoke rapidly into the burrow.
Soon, smoke began billowing from the other two exits, as beastmen vigilantly watched them.
Moments later, rustling sounds were heard, and two plump earth gray rabbits dashed out from the smoke, followed by a clutch of young earth gray rabbits.
Predictably, the earth gray rabbit family was completely captured by the beastmen.
With the help of the Blood Wolves, finding earth gray rabbit burrows became easier, and combined with the smoking method, this hunting team caught three to four dens of earth gray rabbits by midday, though only the first den yielded younglings.
The hunting team returned triumphant, bringing back a bunch of lively earth gray rabbits in nets woven from vines to the village. The livestock pens in Dragon Nest Village already housed over a hundred earth gray rabbits flitting around, with piles of wild vegetables and grasses in one corner and earth gray rabbits chomping away at the leaves.
"Hmm, not bad, with these we should have enough, so we won’t need to catch more earth gray rabbits."
Kobold leader Vini examined the earth gray rabbits held by the hunting team, tossed them directly into the pen.
Earth gray rabbits have a short growth cycle, maturing in about a month given enough food. Now, with the rabbit population, a pen was already a little overcrowded.
"Help me expand a few pens with wood later, and reinforce the boar pen too."
The earth gray rabbits’ strong breeding ability caused excessive density, complicating hygiene and fostering disease, thus expanding a few pens was imperative.
Of course, this wasn’t Vini suddenly becoming knowledgeable, learning and understanding many things without guidance—it was merely conveying Austin’s instructions.
As for the boar pen, the problem was visibly obvious.
Though the adult boars were all smoked meat hanging near the village, the boar younglings were still naturally aggressive, frequently ramming the pen, rocking it dangerously from their hits, necessitating reinforcement.
For now, Dragon Nest Tribe only planned to domesticate these two types of animal younglings due to their fast breeding speed and high value.
With this start in livestock farming, coupled with the grains from reclaimed farming, it’s foreseeable that the Dragon Nest Tribe’s food supply will reach self-sufficiency in the near future.

chapters.title: Chapter 60 - 58: Urgency
chapters.content:
Chapter 60: Chapter 58: Urgency
The Dragon Nest Tribe is continuously developing, growing stronger day by day.
However, Austin’s experiment with extraordinary power has remained stagnant, with no progress in sight.
"Where exactly is the problem?"
In the laboratory behind the village, looking at Quik, the fox-faced man who was still twitching after sustaining an electric shock, the Blue Young Dragon kept pondering.
When modifying the beastmen with electric shocks, Austin felt a faint resonance in his bloodline with the beastmen undergoing modification. This resonance was unfounded, intangible, but when Austin used his magic power to convert into electric current to stimulate the beastmen, he could sense its existence.
This should be the instinct of the Dragon Race.
And bestowing the power of the Dragon Vein to the Beastman Race seems to be an innate privilege of the Giant Dragons.
"Could it be that my power is too weak, resulting in this outcome?"
Austin found himself deep in thought.
Since the electric current stimulation temporarily enhanced the beastmen’s power, it suggests that the hypothesis of Giant Dragons having the natural ability to impart power to their clan might be correct.
But right now, he can only grant temporary power enhancements to the beastmen, unlike the results seen in the inherited memories where adult dragons bestow power permanently to their clan.
In the inherited memories, the Dragon Vein Mages modified by the adult dragons were not like the beastmen modified by Austin, whose powers were depleted after a few days. Those modified by adult dragons experienced an enhancement in the essence of life and could continuously advance by devouring magical resources, even reaching the Legendary Realm.
But what about the beastmen he modified?
Not only did they lack the abilities of those Warlock Warriors, but even the enhancements in physique seemed temporary to Austin, like a battery charging during the electric stimulation. Once the charge finished, it gradually depleted and returned to its original state, far from the results of empowerment by dragon modification.
"Adult dragons are destined to be beings above Legendary, with no need for lower-tier clan members like Dragon Vein Mages, and most young dragons remain dormant during their early years, protected by their parents, without needing to develop a clan... Damn it, there’s too little information."
Austin felt a bit frustrated as the knowledge gleaned from inheritance was mostly common lore of the world and the continent. For beings that naturally reach Legendary at adulthood, there is often no need to involve deep, intricate knowledge.
Rationally, even if Austin doesn’t want to admit it, he understands deep inside that it is likely because his powers are too weak.
If calculated by the tiers of an Extraordinary Professional, Austin is merely at the quasi-Silver stage now, far from the Legendary Realm, thus naturally incapable of freely creating Dragon Vein clan members as adult dragons can.
He is well-aware of this point. Nonetheless, at this stage, the only method Austin has to significantly boost the power of his Beastman Race subordinates is through their modification towards the extraordinary path using his power.
Even though the Dragon Nest Tribe is developing rapidly at present, Austin can still clearly see the shortcomings within the tribe.
Maybe leveraging strict discipline and tactical prowess of military groups, the beastmen within the Dragon Nest Tribe have achieved peak among ordinary beastmen.
At the very least, Austin dares to say that within the entire Kawa Great Forest, in absence of an extraordinary individual, the army of the Dragon Nest Tribe is undoubtedly the pinnacle elite force.
Only, this world is ultimately a world with magical power. Putting aside everything else, even just Austin himself can handle an entire tribe without any issue.
Because the wooden and stone spears the beastmen use simply cannot pierce his scale armor.
Earlier, the clan members of the Dragon Nest Tribe could still assist Austin, but as Austin went through two transformations, the beastmen’s power could no longer keep up with him.
Take the last incident at the Spider Cave; the beastmen clan without extraordinary power were overwhelmingly outmatched by the Spider Magical Beasts, rendering them completely ineffective.
Even gathering more beastmen without extraordinary beastmen, unless one risks their life, it’s hard to provide significant assistance to Austin.
Austin gathered his clan to develop a powerful force, intending to plunder enough resources for his future progress, not to act as a caretaker for the beastmen.
Moreover, the sooner the extraordinary system is initiated, the greater the enhancement in the power of the Beastman Tribe will be.
This is why Austin even put aside the important task of pioneering and focused intently on experimenting to open the path to the extraordinary.
The failed experience at the Spider Cave increased his urge to press forward.
"If this path doesn’t work, I can only consider other methods."
In the laboratory, Austin sighed.
While his own modification ability is currently the easiest route for Austin to provide the beastmen with extraordinary abilities, an insurmountable obstacle suddenly appeared on this path, forcing him to consider alternatives in the end.
"Do we have to attack that Jackal Wolfman Tribe? But lately, that Jackal Wolfman Tribe has gathered over 500 Jackal Wolf People. According to Rodney, the Jackal Wolfman leader alone makes it a one to five disparity even if the entire Dragon Nest Tribe attacks..."
The Dragon Nest Tribe population has reached 133 people, but excluding the elderly, young, and pregnant beastwomen, gathering even around 100 is already quite good, not to mention that goblins, kobolds, and other naturally weaker beastmen than Jackal Wolf People make up half of them.
Even though Austin is confident in his military-formed army, this numerical disparity still worries him a bit.
Moreover, within that Jackal Wolfman Tribe, the Jackal Wolfman leader is a genuine extraordinary professional, possessing Bronze strength.
And given the sudden surge in the population of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, there must be some significant secret within it. Otherwise, it wouldn’t suddenly increase by so many, with enough food to support it.
Such a tribe might even have some secret weapon. Even with Austin’s own power added, he still doesn’t have enough confidence to bring down that Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
Just as Austin was pondering, Quik, the fox-faced man on the experiment platform, stood up, still twitching from the aftereffects of the electric shock, and said haltingly:
"Your Highness, I might have figured out the reason."

chapters.title: Chapter 61 - 59: The Extraordinary Path
chapters.content:
Chapter 61: Chapter 59: The Extraordinary Path
"Oh, how so?"
Quik, the fox-faced man, was considered the wise man of the Dragon Nest Tribe, knowledgeable about many things. Perhaps he could truly discover the reason.
"Your Highness, I’ve heard that in the human civilized world, ordinary humans need to activate the Fighting Qi Seed or Magic Seed with the help of some magic potions when advancing to become Extraordinary individuals, be they warriors or mages, in addition to learning the Breathing Technique. Our experiment failed, very likely because we missed the step of involving magic energy."
Quik cautiously spoke out his conjecture.
"Magic Energy?"
Austin was initially taken aback but then came to a sudden realization.
Indeed, it’s magic energy!
Even in this magical world, it’s impossible to create something from nothing. Without the involvement of such Extraordinary Abilities as magic energy, how could one step onto the path of the Extraordinary!
Adult Legendary Giant Dragons have reached unfathomable levels, capable of triggering magic power tides with every move. When endowing the clan’s orcs, they naturally attract and infuse magic energy, transforming the essence of orc life with ease.
But now, Austin is merely at the quasi-Silver stage. Even with the innate privileges of a dragon, how could he possibly invoke the ambient magic power in the air to perform a comprehensive transformation of the orc’s life?
The electric currents produced by Blue Young Dragons indeed have the ability to stimulate the potential within the orcs, but precisely because of the lack of magic energy, this stimulated potential reverts to its original state once it passes, failing to be maintained.
"That’s it, that must be it!"
Austin became excited. It seemed that after the Spider Cave incident, he was indeed too hasty, resulting in neglecting such an important matter.
However, it’s not too late now. Understanding this point, then Extraordinary Orc Warriors will emerge within the Dragon Nest Tribe!
"If transformation requires magic energy, then it’s necessary to have substances containing magic power. Magic Beast Crystal Cores? No, they’re too rare... the Blood Red Fruit in the Blood Wolf Lair? But they’ve just blossomed on that side of the Blood Wolf Lair..."
Magic Beast Crystal Cores are also extremely important to Austin, not to mention he’s only encountered them twice, making it impossible to expend them on orcs.
As for the magic tree previously encountered beside the Blood Wolf Lair, the Blood Red Fruit it produced might be useful, but that magic tree has just blossomed, and it would take at least half a year for the fruit to mature.
After pondering for a long time, Austin finally found a suitable item.
After the Spider Cave expedition, the orcs not only brought back a nameless plant used for detoxification but also carried away the corpses of four large spiders and those stones emitting a faint, faintly glowing light beneath the nameless plants.
The previous harvest, the plants, were used to detoxify Rodney and others, with only a few left hanging to dry and preserve by the village.
As for the corpses of the four large spiders, they didn’t contain Magic Beast Crystal Cores, but their shells were incredibly sturdy and were made into weapons.
And those stones that emitted a faint blue glow, although they felt weak magic fluctuations from within, Austin thought of how the Spider Cave had existed for an unknown number of years, with various prey rotting there, leaving layers of spider excrement covering the stones. Despite the orcs scrubbing them clean, he couldn’t get past the mental barrier of consuming stones buried under who-knows-what for who-knows-how-long.
Moreover, the faint magic within them was of little use to Austin, who had matured to this stage.
Therefore, these stones containing magic power were ultimately preserved, pressed at the bottom of a box, waiting for a day they might be useful.
And now, it seems Austin has found the time to use them!
"We’ll use those magic stones brought back from the Spider Cave!"
Austin hurriedly flew outside, just as Quik breathed a sigh of relief, rejoicing that he was no longer being shocked, Austin rushed in, clutching a stone emitting a faint azure glow.
"Quik, lie down, I want to try again!"
Seeing Austin’s excited expression, Quik grimaced and dutifully lay down on the experimental table, becoming a guinea pig once more.
Although Austin exercised control to avoid endangering their lives with the electric current, just thinking about the terrifying sensation of electricity coursing chaotically through their bodies left few eager for the experience.
Disregarding Quik’s grimace, Austin grasped the magic stone with his forepaw and pressed it onto Quik’s chest.
Electric Shock Paralysis!
Magic power inside him circulates along a certain trajectory, subtly affecting the surrounding air, triggering an unknown change in the ethereal space, ultimately transforming into electric current.
Brzzzt!
Arcs of sparks danced and leapt out in the air, erratic electric snakes darted, brushing against Quik’s body and spreading outward with the magic stone as the center.
That mysterious sensation emerged once more, and like countless experiments before, a resonance seemed to occur between his blood and something else.
Simultaneously, under the stimulation of electric currents, the magic stone experienced an unknown change, wisps of blue light drifting from within the magic stone like a drop of blue ink dispersing in water, spreading over most of Quik’s chest and following the electric currents into Quik’s body.
At that moment, Quik, originally shaking uncontrollably and rolling his eyes, feeling despair,
suddenly widened his eyes!

chapters.title: Chapter 62 - 60: Plan
chapters.content:
Chapter 62: Chapter 60: Plan
As the magic energy within the magic stone was stimulated by Austin’s talent magic, a blue ghostly light spread out, suddenly flowing like a current into Quik’s body.
"Ah!!!"
A loud, miserable scream echoed.
In an instant, Quik only felt as if a mass of burning molten lava surged upon his chest, scorching muscle and skin, seeping along the veins, spreading to every corner of his body, like magma flowing through his veins.
It was a pain like piercing and drilling, as if every piece of flesh was being ground to mush, then reborn anew.
And at this moment, his limbs had completely lost their ability to move, rigid on the experiment table, unable to twitch, as he could only stare with bloodshot eyes, enduring this extraordinarily painful transformation.
"It’s going to succeed!"
Seeing Quik’s reaction, Austin’s expression was focused, the feeling in his heart telling him that this time he was really going to succeed.
The air at this moment began to swirl, forming a tiny vortex, with visible ripples spreading in all directions — a sign that the magic energy and the omnipresent magical power in the air were resonating.
A mysterious and unfathomable power was at work in the shadows, and if there were a microscope to observe minute details, it would be discovered that the cells within Quik’s body were being savagely destroyed by the infusion of magic energy. Meanwhile, under the influence of the "authority" of the Giant Dragon, some of the cells eroded by magic energy survived, rapidly dividing and proliferating, replacing the necrotic cells that had been destroyed.
In just a short few moments, the magic power contained within the magic stone was completely unleashed and dissipated, and Quik’s body was now fully affected by the magic energy, achieving an enhancement at the level of life’s essence.
"How about it?"
Austin withdrew his claw, the magic stone in his palm now transformed into an ordinary piece of rock, cracking with webs of fissures, then crumbling into dust, cascading down from his fingertips.
Quik’s face still held a grim expression, but as the cells regenerated within, the relief after intense pain made him feel as if he had opened the door to a new world, an indescribable feeling of transformation from death to rebirth.
"Your Highness, it should have succeeded."
After a short rest, he slowly stood up from the experiment table and exhaled a long breath.
Compared to before, it was impossible to notice any obvious changes in his appearance.
But his pupils became remarkably deep, his fur shone with a faintly ghostly light, swaying with the breeze, even emanating a magical fluctuation.
And now, standing before Austin, Quik gave him the feeling that something drastic had changed.
The difference was like a piece of wood versus a piece of glowing wood — the essence of life’s aura had fundamentally transformed.
If before, in front of Austin, Quik’s life aura was like a spark, now it was at least a burning charcoal.
The extraordinary experiment should have been successful!
"Have any abilities emerged?"
For what was likely the first genuine success, Austin could not help but place significant importance.
Quik pondered and stretched out his palm, closing his eyes.
Concentrating his heart spirit, constantly gathering the newly generated power within his body into his palm, tiny dots of light slowly emerged from the center of his palm, transforming into an azure-blue flame, the size of a match burn, then suddenly,
Puff!
The blue flame was instantly extinguished and dissipated, while Quik, as if drained of strength, half-kneeled on the ground, drenched in sweat, panting heavily as if the effort had completely depleted him.
"Sorry, Your Highness, I am incompetent."
The power of this tiny flame was useless in battle.
In Quik’s view, His Highness Austin’s experiment had failed again, and he had wasted a seemingly precious magic stone imbued with magic power.
Thinking the experiment had failed, Quik hurried to apologize to Austin.
"No, you did well, very well!"
Contrary to Quik’s disappointment, Austin was immediately overjoyed.
Compared to the previous experiments that only temporarily enhanced the Beastmen’s physical strength, what was revealed now in front of him was truly extraordinary power!
And this also meant that Quik officially entered the realm of extraordinary life!
Even though he couldn’t condense even a spark, in Austin’s eyes, Quik entering the realm of extraordinary life through his modification was more significant than the Dragon Nest tribe’s population surpassing a hundred.
"The plan might be able to start!"
In Austin’s pupils, the beast called ambition was roaring fiercely from within, occupying his entire vision.
The starting and end points of extraordinary life and ordinary life are different, and within the Dragon Nest tribe, the training and combat power of Beastmen may have nearly reached their limits.
Yet if it were extraordinary life forms, with enough food support and rigorous training, despite the lack of a cultivation breathing technique, their achievements would far surpass ordinary beings.
Quik obtaining extraordinary power also meant that Austin had truly overcome the obstacle in the plan for extraordinary beings, using this method to endow his subordinate Beastmen with the potential of extraordinary beings as well.
Once all his subordinate clan Beastmen were successfully transformed, and after a short period of training, a force of nearly a hundred extraordinary beings even Austin could not underestimate, let alone on the battlefield, where the formation of Beastmen with extraordinary power could play a role far exceeding what Austin could achieve.
And as long as there were extraordinary Beastmen, Austin could boldly step out of the Dragon Nest territory’s bounds and expand in all directions.
At this moment, Austin already had a comprehensive plan in his mind.
Expend all the magic stones to transform his robust Beastmen subordinates, then form an army with these extraordinary Beastmen at the core, sweeping west, south, and east to conquer all surrounding Beastman tribes within a fifty-mile radius, capturing prisoners, and then gathering a thousand strong Beastmen soldiers to march north and utterly defeat the mysterious Jackal Wolfman tribe located just over ten kilometers north.
Since the Jackal Wolfman tribe settled north of the Dragon Nest tribe has a Bronze Level Jackal Wolfman leader, it likely possesses a breathing technique.
As long as they captured the Jackal Wolfman tribe and seized that breathing technique, the entire Dragon Nest tribe was set to soar to new heights.

chapters.title: Chapter 63 - 61 Dragon Vein Attendant
chapters.content:
Chapter 63: Chapter 61 Dragon Vein Attendant
Austin had always confined himself within a ten-mile radius of the Dragon Nest Territory, refraining from expanding outward largely because his Clan lacked the power to support such expansion.
When Austin first selected this area for the Dragon Nest, it was primarily because this part of Hell was relatively remote, lacking any Magic Beast nests. If explored further, not only was there a likelihood of encountering more powerful Beastman Tribes, but also strong groups of Magic Beasts. In Austin’s current state of being stretched thin, this could easily lead to losses among the Beastman Race.
Now that the beastmen have embarked on the path of Extraordinary Power, if they also acquire a Breathing Technique that allows ordinary life to continuously advance, and use the Extraordinary Beastmen as a base, Austin is confident he can gather a massive Empire and establish a vast Empire within ten years!
Quik’s successful experiment invigorated Austin’s spirit.
Then, within a day, using Quik’s successful experiment as a template, Austin transformed his most elite beastmen into the Extraordinary.
When originally exploring the Spider Cave, they had retreated hastily, managing to collect only ten magical stones. Excluding the one used by Quik, Austin eventually could only transform nine elite beastmen.
After the transformation succeeded, Austin reorganized these nine beastmen and named them the Dragon Vein Attendants, symbolizing the Imperial Guard, with a status surpassing the three formal military units.
This was the first Extraordinary Beastman Legion of Austin’s subordinate Clan!
Of course, calling it a legion is premature now, as a legion of only nine beastmen seems somewhat meager. But Austin believes this Dragon Vein Attendants Legion will one day grow to a thousand, ten thousand, and eventually, shake the entire world.
Compared to Quik’s mage-type transformation, the Dragon Vein Attendants are all warrior-type Extraordinary Beastmen.
This perhaps relates to the outcome and talents, for Austin initially chose the nine strongest in constitution as candidates, while Quik possessed far more wisdom than the average beastman, likely leading to these results.
Though they are warrior-type extraordinary beings, this is actually the most suitable outcome for the current Dragon Nest Tribe. Take the fox-faced man Cook, even though he has embarked on the path of extraordinary, without mage knowledge, he cannot fully utilize his power.
In contrast, the Dragon Vein Attendants who successfully tread the extraordinary path, whether in physical ability or strength, are more than several times stronger than their former selves, growing in size and displaying an overwhelming presence in front of ordinary beastmen.
As of now, the warrior-type Dragon Vein Attendants are much more crucial to the Dragon Nest Tribe than the mage-type fox-faced man Quik.
.....
Three days later, on the open ground outside the village.
"One, two, three! Throw!"
On the open ground, the nine Dragon Vein Attendants, each larger than regular beastmen, carried enormous stones weighing up to a ton on their shoulders, taking heavy steps as they moved ten meters forward and stopped before a marked line.
At the command, the nine large-bodied Dragon Vein Attendants’ skin bulged with blue veins, muscles swelling, and a thin layer of blood mist enveloped their hair, forming a line like impending flames.
"Ha!"
In unison, their voices like thunder, they hurled the boulders overhead with immense force, sending them flying into the distance.
Huge stones, each weighing over a ton, blotted out the sky, hurled thirty meters away by these Dragon Vein Attendants. Apart from some reddening faces, they only appeared slightly short of breath.
Bang, bang, bang!
The consecutive crashes of boulders hitting the ground caused tremors on the earth.
At this moment, ordinary beastmen watching from the side were dumbfounded, their mouths agape wide enough to fit a goose egg.
After the Dragon Vein Attendants’ appearance, Austin organized a military exercise against the ordinary beastmen. The nine Dragon Vein Attendants formed a squad with stone shields carved from chunks of stone, assembling as Shield Soldiers, tearing through a spear formation of over a hundred beastmen.
Even when ordinary beastmen combined their strength, they couldn’t match them.
At that moment, other beastmen within the Dragon Nest Territory understood the prowess of the Dragon Vein Attendants, yet they hadn’t expected them to be so formidable, capable of lifting such enormous stones and throwing them such distances.
If any other tribe engaged in warfare, the Dragon Vein Attendants could likely decimate the enemy by hurling stones from afar before the battle even started.
"Roar!!!"
The Dragon Vein Beastmen roared in unison, their massive voices swept the field, stirring up a whirlwind with a hint of dragon might, which, like a rushing stream, pressured the ordinary beastmen scattered around.
"Not bad."
From afar, watching from a high vantage point, Austin nodded in approval.
After using magical stones for modification, the Dragon Vein Beastmen had notable differences from the previously transformed half-finished products, with life quality fundamentally changed from its roots, not to mention the greatly enhanced power, already surpassing the early prototypes.
Moreover, as true Extraordinary Lives, the Dragon Vein Beastmen experienced not only physical and power enhancements but also possessed actual Extraordinary Abilities.
The Dragon Vein Attendants, for instance, awakened a talent akin to a game-style berserk mode.
Following conversion into Extraordinary Life, the Dragon Vein Beastmen could voluntarily ignite their blood, enveloping themselves in a mist of bloody aura, dramatically boosting their strength and speed for a brief period, though after this burst, they would fall into weakness for about a day.
As Austin’s successfully modified works, he took it upon himself to name the beastmen’s ability as Blood Burning.
In the Blood Burning state, the Dragon Vein Beastmen’s hair was tinged with faint misty red light, aptly named.
"Unfortunately, the Spider Magical Beasts inside Spider Cave are far too difficult to deal with. Otherwise, sweeping the cave and gathering enough magical stones to transform all beastmen into Dragon Vein Beastmen would be ideal."
Austin thought greedily.
With the ten magical stones used up, even if Austin wished to expand the number of Dragon Vein Attendants, the resources were unavailable.
Moreover, considering the intractable toxic mists within the Spider Cave, purging it entirely remained out of the question, and in its shadowy depths, Austin once vaguely sensed a faint hint of a deathly threat.
Given Austin’s strength, if he felt threatened, the dangers lurking deep within the Spider Cave were unimaginable.
"Though it’s impossible to increase the number of Dragon Vein Beastmen for now, what we have is sufficient already. It’s time to conduct a massive sweep to expand the Clan’s number!"
Austin spread his wings, creating a surge of air as he soared into the sky, a relentless ambition reflected in his eyes.
All forces,
advance!

chapters.title: Chapter 64 - 62: Minotaur Tribe
chapters.content:
Chapter 64: Chapter 62: Minotaur Tribe
Saru was a very ordinary Minotaur, living in an ordinary Minotaur small tribe, composed entirely of Minotaurs with a population of around two hundred.
Although the Minotaur in the Beastman tribes of the Seta Continent are not at the very bottom, they hold a lower-middle position, but the situation of the tribe wasn’t much better either. The entire tribe had only about ten simple thatched houses perched on a hillside, surrounded by muddy wastewater exuding a rotten stench, with flies buzzing around in the air.
The Beastman Tribes are pretty much the same, even in the human Civilized World, there’s no hygiene awareness, let alone the Beastman Tribes inside the Kawa Great Forest.
Saru’s tribe was split off from another Great Tribe two years ago.
In the Kawa Great Forest, when the area of activity of a tribe could no longer provide sufficient food for the entire tribe, a small part would automatically split and go explore elsewhere, searching for survival.
Of course, saying it was automatic separation, if one wasn’t abandoned and forced to leave, who would be willing to leave the tribe’s territory?
Every year, when the Beastman Tribe’s population exceeds its limit, the teams sent out to find new homes almost face a deadly peril in the dangerous Kawa Great Forest.
Saru and his comrades were somewhat lucky, after leaving the Great Tribe and enduring some losses, they finally found a relatively safe place to settle.
Minotaurs are good at cattle herding, relying on the group of domesticated wild cattle they brought from the tribe, Saru and his comrades managed to get through their hardest times upon settling in the area, laying a foundation near here.
Though during the recent cold winter, they lost over a dozen members due to hunger, but as the cold winter passed, the Kawa Great Forest saw all things reviving and growing. The entire forest entered a new cycle, and various food sources became plentiful again, allowing Saru and his tribe to gather enough food from the forest to get through the crisis.
However, good times didn’t last long; soon, a Storm Tiger appeared in the eastern valley at some unknown time. It released magic just like Wind Blade, and by now, several Minotaurs have been killed by the Storm Tiger. The herd they domesticated suffered heavy losses as well. If the Storm Tiger’s appetite wasn’t relatively fixed, their entire tribe and herd would have been devoured by it.
Even so, the Storm Tiger posed a severe threat to all production activities in the Minotaur Tribe. If it wasn’t restrained soon, the entire Minotaur tribe might be destroyed by the Storm Tiger.
But that’s easier said than done.
Undoubtedly, the Storm Tiger was a purely Extraordinary Magical Beast. Although Minotaurs are stronger than the Kobolds, Goblins, and other bottom-tier Beastmen due to their physique.
But so what, ordinary Beastmen can’t even resist against usual Magic Beasts, let alone a top-tier predator Magical Beast like the Storm Tiger.
"May the Beast God protect us, if there’s no other choice, we might have to move."
In the simple thatched house conference room, the Minotaur chief discussed with a few strong Minotaurs.
The whole room felt particularly gloomy.
"I don’t agree, the unexplored areas are too dangerous. Remember when over five hundred of us left the tribe, but what happened? More than three hundred companions died on the road before we finally found this relatively safe place. How can we give it up so easily?"
"Staying won’t solve anything, will you face the Storm Tiger?"
"I don’t agree, so what?"
Indeed a Minotaur, inheriting the bull’s stubborn temper as too. As soon as speaking out, it was on the verge of a clash.
"What are you pulling?"
"Pulling you!"
"Are you looking for a fight?!"
"Bring it on, I’m not afraid of you!"
As the argument heated up, two stubborn Minotaurs were about to fight.
"Enough, you two stop arguing!"
The Minotaur chief, already worried and irritated, immediately spoke up. Already annoyed, they made it worse, he said very disgustedly:
"At this point in time, still..."
The Minotaur chief wanted to rebuke them but hadn’t finished speaking when,
suddenly a change occurred.
BOOM!!!
With a loud bang, the thatched roof suddenly collapsed, opening a big hole, pieces of shattered wood and dust fell like snowflakes, while a huge stone with horrible power crashed into the center of the room causing the whole thatched house to tremble, the ground even dented with web-like cracks spreading everywhere.
What is this???
Looking at the huge hole in the roof exposing the sky and the gigantic stone taller than a person in front, the Minotaurs blinked blankly.
Did the stars fall from the sky?
Just as the Minotaur chief and his followers were at their wit’s end, the sound of breaking wind spread in the air,
then,
BANG BANG BANG!!!
The sound of continuous muffled explosions came from outside, shaking the ground in waves, as if welcoming an earthquake.
At that moment, a lung-splitting roar sounded outside.
"Enemy invasion!!!"
Finally, the Minotaurs realized, while the Minotaur chief slapped the board beside him, sprung up, anger erupting:
"Let’s see which clueless fool dares to come here and wreak havoc!"
Holding two large Iron Hammers, the Minotaur chief stormed out of the thatched room in rage.
At this moment, the entire Minotaur tribe was in chaos, more than half of the thatched houses had collapsed, huge stones scattered in the open space of the village, or crushed through houses and stood in the middle.
The stones falling from the sky didn’t cause many casualties, but thrown the whole Minotaur tribe into a state of extreme panic.
"Bastard, who is wreaking havoc here!"
Stepping out of the thatched house in a few strides, looking up, he saw rows of Beastman troops lining into neat formations, charging toward him.
"Kill!!!"
Amidst the murderous shouting, Beastman Long Spears were erected, led by nine towering Beastmen holding massive Stone Shields, charging fiercely.
The orderly formation, erected Long Spears, strict troops. This formidable scene,
at that moment,
made the Minotaur chief feel as if a mountain was crashing down, rocking him.
"Good! Three Lizardmen, a group of Jackal Wolf People, and Kobolds dare to come wreak havoc here?! Brothers, counter-attack them with full force!"
That shock lasted only a moment before the Minotaur chief regained his composure. Upon seeing the composition of the army, his anger turned into rage, raising his Stone Hammer to rally, leading the disordered troops to charge down toward the Beastman army formation.

chapters.title: Chapter 65 - 63 Chaos Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 65: Chapter 63 Chaos Battle
Austin’s Dragon Vein Attendants immediately began intense training once formed. Once they were trained to cooperate with ordinary Beastman armies, they launched their campaign and embarked on the path of conquest.
The Jackal Wolfman Tribe, numbering over five hundred, was still able to maintain peace and stability, but other tribes immediately met disaster.
Austin established his territory with the Dragon’s Nest as the center, extending ten miles around, rarely allowing Beastmen to cross this boundary. However, that did not mean he didn’t send people to investigate the conditions of nearby Beastman Tribes.
Early on, when Austin asked the Fox-faced Man, Quik, how to quickly increase the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Quik proposed two methods.
One involved lighting smoke pillars to attract wandering Beastmen, raising the Dragon Nest Tribe from a micro-tribe of over thirty to a small tribe of a hundred.
The other was to sustain war through war, absorbing and annexing antagonistic Beastman Tribes, thereby rapidly increasing the power within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Due to the lack of strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe and other reasons at the time, Austin temporarily shelved the second method but also sent Quik to contact some micro-tribes living in hardship to see if they could be absorbed into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Austin also understood early that for the Dragon Nest Tribe to rapidly grow and expand in a short period, war was the most effective means.
Therefore, Austin restricted the Clan Beastmen to operate within the Dragon Nest Territory but also instructed Quik to explore the conditions of nearby tribes to facilitate war in the future.
This exploration task was only assigned to Quik, without exerting real effort, mainly recording information about other Beastman Tribe members encountered during hunting trips.
Now with the appearance of the Dragon Vein Attendants, the biggest shortcoming of the Dragon Nest Tribe was rectified, and Austin had no hesitation, expanding rapidly in all directions.
Previous recorded information was searched out, and this time the entire Dragon Nest Tribe truly emptied out, majorly scouted and discovered several small tribes either ten, twenty, or thirty miles away east, west, and south.
Austin temporarily did not plan to deal with the Jackal Wolfman Tribe in the north, only after defeating and absorbing several tribes in the east, west, and south would he fully engage with the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
The Minotaur Tribe, where Saru resided, was one of the target tribes of this Dragon Nest Tribe’s campaign.
Minotaurs, bold and straightforward, yet careless, were completely unaware when the Dragon Nest Tribe approached their vicinity, resulting in the entire tribe being almost stunned by an unexpected rock assault from above.
Fortunately, the Minotaur leader was fierce, quickly boosting the courage of his subordinates, charging down towards the Dragon Nest Tribe’s military formation advancing from the mountain’s base.
"Kill them! Crush this bunch of bastards!"
Saru followed in the chaos of the Minotaur Tribe, carrying a giant wooden club, and charged alongside the Minotaur leader.
"Charge!"
At the mountain base, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastmen army also roared with deafening battle cries, long spears standing tall, and they charged fiercely, appearing more organized than the scattered Minotaur Tribe. Their steps were almost in unison.
However, Minotaurs were naturally stronger in physique and strength, not to mention there were over two hundred Minotaurs in the tribe, while the Dragon Nest Legion, composed mainly of Kobolds, Jackal Wolf People, and Goblins, collectively only numbered around a hundred.
Under these circumstances, the Dragon Nest Legion was at an absolute disadvantage in terms of numbers and individual combat power.
Moreover, coupled with the terrain advantage, the Minotaur Tribe’s superiority was heightened.
Under normal conditions, the Dragon Nest Legion should have entrenched at the mountain base to ward off the enemy, rather than directly charging at the Minotaur Tribe.
But now, at the forefront of the Dragon Nest Legion, there were nine Extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen as vanguards, whose aggressive momentum was difficult for ordinary Beastmen to withstand.
Furthermore, Austin started this war against the Minotaur Tribe largely to annex and absorb them. If he could break the Minotaur Tribe’s morale at the outset, integrating them into the Dragon Nest Tribe would be much simpler.
Just as they say, once a thousand people gather, they can cover the earth, and once ten thousand gather, they can encompass the entire land.
Though the total number of Beastmen on the entire mountainside battlefield only totaled around three hundred, the Minotaur Tribe’s scattered formation covered the entire mountainside.
"Kill!"
Close-quarter combat followed, as the enraged Minotaur Tribe collided with the Dragon Nest Legion.
However, in the next moment, the Minotaur leader’s envisioned scene of shattering the opposing group of midgets did not materialize; instead, it was as if they had collided with an incredibly hard reef.
Bam!
The Minotaur leader leaped high to lead the charge, a massive Stone Hammer crashing down, but a half-human-high Stone Shield slammed down like a wall with unstoppable momentum. Under the enormous force, the great Stone Hammer in the leader’s hand was knocked away, and he was thrown backward.
With several thudding sounds, the Minotaur leader flew back several tribe members before stopping, rolling eight or nine meters.
"Damn it, how can these bastards be so strong!"
The Minotaur leader, gasping for breath, cursed and swore as he scrambled to his feet in a clumsy tumble.
He shook his head, slowly regaining some clarity.
However, at that moment, he was horrified to see that under the onslaught of the Dragon Nest Legion, his Minotaur deployment was like a loose heap of sand, penetrated and torn apart. With nine gigantic Stone Shields at the core, Long Spears thrust out from behind, skewering each Minotaur before they could even land a hit, toppling them to the ground.
In just this brief moment, the entire Minotaur tribe had already lost a fifth of its forces, yet they hadn’t inflicted even the slightest harm on the Dragon Nest Legion.
"Not good!"
A shiver ran through the Minotaur leader’s heart, the previous anger incited by those dwarves had long vanished.
Though he was reckless, he wasn’t stupid. Seeing the defeat was certain, he immediately had the thought of fleeing.
"Retreat for now! I’ll find another time to show these damned bastards my might!"
You just wait for me, I’ll definitely be back!
The Minotaur leader looked hatefully at the Dragon Vein Beastmen charging left and right as though no one was there, no longer caring for the subordinates who had already lost their courage, he turned and fled in embarrassment.
Yet at this moment,
Boom!!!
The sky above suddenly turned gloomy, an overwhelming pressure spread out in all directions, the entire firmament seemed to press down like a tsunami into an abyss, the terrifying pressure descended like a mountain.
The remaining resisting Minotaurs immediately went weak in the knees, collapsing like wheat before a gust of wind, their bodies trembling uncontrollably under this dreadful pressure.
The Minotaur leader, facing this impact head-on, staggered a few steps back, staring up at the sky in astonishment.
In the sky before him, unbeknownst to him, was covered by a pair of enormous dark blue wings. The shadow it cast seemed to plunge the world into a pit of despair. Simultaneously, a hideous head descended slowly from above, its blood-red eyes carrying a frightening pressure, gradually approaching in front of him.
At that moment, the Minotaur leader felt himself sinking into an icy pit, as if a bucket of cold water was poured over him in midwinter, an endless chill surged into his heart.
The battlefield around instantly fell into dead silence, the previously noisy battleground was devoid of any sound.
He stood there transfixed, watching the menacing head slowly draw near, his heart flooding with infinite fear.
Fear,
Unprecedented fear,
Fear that the head would suddenly open and bite his head off.
Yet despite the terror, he remained motionless.
His hands and feet were ice-cold, as if every muscle in his body was frozen stiff, unable to move even a finger, only able to watch as the terrifying head approached.
All the Minotaurs on the ground shivered under that terrifying aura, not daring to move at all.
This was the suppression of higher life forms over lower ones, the absolute rule of the strong over the weak!
Even the Beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe, even the Dragon Vein Attendant, were half-kneeling at this moment. However, compared to the Minotaurs’ fear, the Beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe were more filled with excitement and fervor.
The Blue Young Dragon appeared, wantonly exuding its terrible majesty, sweeping through the heavens and earth,
exhibiting the mighty power of dragon prestige, bringing thousands to their knees in submission.
He glanced at the Minotaur leader, whose limbs were stiff in front of him,
Cold, ancient, solemn,
A voice without any fluctuation resonated in the air,
as if carrying the decree of the Heavenly Dao:
"Submit, or die!"
The Novel will be updated first on this website. Come back and continue reading tomorrow, everyone!

chapters.title: Chapter 66 - 64: Conclusion
chapters.content:
Chapter 66: Chapter 64: Conclusion
Gulu!
In the midst of a dead silence, facing the terrifying shadow in front, the Minotaur leader was drenched in cold sweat, involuntarily swallowing a mouthful of saliva.
"I, I... surrender..."
The Minotaur leader stammered, slowly kneeling on the ground, signifying submission.
The atmosphere on the entire battlefield eased significantly, and with the Minotaur leader’s submission, this war also came to an end.
The Minotaurs generally have a stubborn nature, but it was not surprising to see them surrender under such circumstances.
In the previous war, the Dragon Nest army, with the Dragon Vein Beastmen at the core and the Legion as the rear guard formation, displayed strength far beyond what the Minotaurs expected.
Even though they held various advantages, they were still utterly defeated in the contact battle during this war.
In this war initiated by the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Dragon Vein Attendants, relying on strength far surpassing ordinary Beastmen, directly pierced through the impact of the Minotaur Tribe, invincible wherever they went, and with the help of the indestructible Dragon Nest Legion from behind, utterly shattered all Minotaur morale.
Subsequently, with Austin descending from the sky, sweeping the surroundings with dragon might, the Minotaurs lost all will to resist, making their surrender anticipated.
The Minotaurs indeed are single-minded, but when their morale is thoroughly crushed, and faced with power far exceeding their level, resistance was nonexistent, making them easily captured by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Very well, Rodney, Vini, clean up the spoils and bring them all back to the tribe!"
With the surrender of the Minotaur leader, the war was completely over and entered the closing phase, and Austin ordered Vini to handle various post-war matters.
In this battle, the Dragon Nest Tribe also lost over ten people; however, due to the Minotaurs’ penchant for blunt instruments, most injuries consisted of fractured bones and damaged organs, ranging from minor to severe, but with no fatalities. With the Beastmen’s recuperative ability, they might recover shortly.
In comparison to the losses, the gains from this victorious war could not be underestimated.
Not only did this battle defeat the Minotaur Tribe entrenched in the surrounding mountains, but it also completely subdued them. Even though the Minotaurs suffered significant losses in the previous battles, there were still over 150 intact Minotaurs left.
The actual death count in this war was not high, amounting to no more than about ten.
Therefore, it can be said that the Dragon Nest Tribe’s number of Beastmen has more than doubled in a short time, reaching a total of three hundred!
With nine Dragon Vein Attendants at the core, combined with the nearly militarized Dragon Nest Legion, the combat power formed is formidable, not fearing the Jackal Wolfman Tribe located north of the Dragon Nest Village.
Of course, for these Minotaurs to fully integrate into the Dragon Nest Village system, they must undergo military training, and during this period of training integration, the Minotaurs cannot yet be considered a part of the combat force.
The population growth is not even the biggest gain for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
To Austin, the biggest gain was the herd of nearly five hundred wild cattle herded by the Minotaur Tribe!
Wild cattle are valuable; not only can they provide meat when the Beastmen lack food, but if used properly, they can also help Beastmen with pioneering work.
Early in the cultivation of the first field, Austin considered the issue of using livestock for plowing. With the help of livestock, the Beastmen’s pace of land reclamation would quicken significantly. However, although the hunting team occasionally hunted wild cattle or horses, taming them was far from feasible, let alone using them for agriculture.
Now, with the help of Minotaur prisoners, initiating livestock-powered farming is bound to be possible, greatly increasing the Beastmen’s pace in land reclamation.
Knowing that with Dragon Nest Tribe’s population growth, the gap in food supply will expand further, land reclamation and farming will become one of the primary sources for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Take this herd of wild cattle back to the Dragon Nest Tribe, and upon return, search around the village for any good pastures. These wild cattle are crucial for farming and land reclamation work."
Looking at the herd scattered across the mountains, being leisurely driven away by the Minotaur prisoners, Austin instructed Vini beside him.
"Understood, Your Highness."
The Kobold leader, Vini, who was beside him overseeing the packing and transport of the tribe’s various resources and spoils, promptly responded affirmatively.
There were still some food reserves left in the Minotaur Tribe, mostly matured wild fruits, seeds, and starchy roots, with no meat and very little quantity, enough for two hundred Minotaurs to consume for about a day or two—not much to speak of.
It can be said that the greatest wealth of the Minotaur Tribe was that herd of domesticated wild cattle. Coupled with Austin’s recent achievements with sheep, soot rabbits, and wild boars, even without Austin’s instruction, Vini would focus on those wild cattle.
"By the way, Your Highness, Wage just told me something."
Wage was the name of the Minotaur leader. As the leader of the Minotaur Tribe, after Austin accepted the Minotaurs’ surrender, it was natural to discuss various matters with him.
"According to Wage, a storm tiger suddenly appeared in the eastern mountains not long ago, capable of spitting wind blades, causing significant losses to their tribe. Based on Wage’s description, it might be a Tier Four or higher Magic Beast."
Vini’s expression showed a bit of concern as he spoke.
A Tier Four Magic Beast, according to the classification of Extraordinaries, would be at least at the Silver Level.
"A Magic Beast... leave it for now, and continue the plan to level the nearby tribes first."
After pondering for a moment, Austin made a decision.
At Silver Level, the combat power already exceeds his own. Even with his intrinsic dragon combat power bonus, it is uncertain whether he could eliminate it without harm. Moreover, finding its traces in the vast forest isn’t a simple task.
After returning laden with spoils from the war, settling the Minotaurs and the domesticated wild cattle, the Dragon Nest Tribe resumed their campaign, sweeping in all directions.
In just ten days, they destroyed a total of four tribes of varying sizes, annexing them completely, and the Dragon Nest Tribe’s population reached seven hundred.
Among them, the majority were Kobolds and Goblins, with a few Lizardmen, Minotaurs, and a few Boar People among other sturdy Beastman minorities, though these were few in number. Not every tribe, like the Minotaur Tribe, was composed of a single Beastman race; more often, mixed races gathered together to make a living.
After swallowing five tribes in succession, even though a few tribes’ traces were discovered externally, Austin decided to end this military operation.
From a tribe with a little over a hundred to swallowing nearly six hundred Beastmen, the most critical task at this stage is to transform the captives to integrate them into the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 67 - 65: The Trouble of Incorporating
chapters.content:
Chapter 67: Chapter 65: The Trouble of Incorporating
The population of the Dragon Nest Tribe suddenly surged from over a hundred to more than seven hundred. Although, due to Austin’s natural boost as a member of the Giant Dragon Race and the lifestyle of the Dragon Nest Tribe ensuring they have enough to eat daily, the orc captives were generally content and even felt good living in the Dragon Nest Tribe, willingly submitting.
However, the management of these newly added six hundred people remains a significant issue.
Initially, after Austin transformed into the Dragon Vein Beastmen, in his excitement, he decided to launch a full-scale attack sweeping across nearby Beastman Tribes. However, at that time, he hadn’t thought about the aftermath of the battle, hence a lot of things were not prepared.
First is the housing issue. The Dragon Nest Village has expanded several times, but those ten or so simple grass huts can only accommodate about two hundred orcs at most. For more, new houses have to be built, and even the walls surrounding the village need to be dismantled and rebuilt.
In the process of constructing new houses, Austin once again felt the difference between having discipline and lacking discipline.
Due to time constraints, the task of building new houses initially involved the orc captives as well. However, instead of speeding up the construction, the orc captives ended up significantly lowering work efficiency.
The most fundamental reason for this is the lack of discipline.
The orc captives made a chaotic scene during construction, greatly hindering progress, which was in stark contrast to the cooperative building efforts of the Dragon Nest Tribe orcs.
"Indeed, orcs must go through the baptism of military training to clear away that idle and chaotic atmosphere before they can join the Dragon Nest Tribe."
Seeing the situation where more people led to less power, the construction site of the Dragon Nest Tribe was in complete disarray, further solidifying Austin’s commitment to implement his military-government policy.
Undisciplined orcs are just a pile of loose sand.
Perhaps as development progresses, this kind of collective, military-civilian integrated system might limit the country’s further development, but at this initial stage, it’s the best development system.
"It seems we can only cooperate through division of labor."
Eventually, out of helplessness, Austin had to divide the orc captives into several groups, specifically tasked with chopping trees and transporting supplies, while the collaborative work of house construction was handed over to the more disciplined Dragon Nest Tribe orcs.
If other tribes were waging war, the victors would consider the losers as slaves, casually leaving them clustered in a corner. Issues like sanitation and housing needn’t be considered. They’d squeeze them relentlessly in peacetime, and then gather them as cannon fodder in wartime.
Thus, no pressure would arise, but Austin’s Dragon Nest Tribe is not comparable to the other Beastman Tribes within the Kawa Great Forest.
Captives are seen as expendables in other Beastman Tribes, while in Austin’s view, they are invaluable assets.
It’s not out of some saintly sentiment, but rather that by integrating captives into the Dragon Nest Tribe system after military training, forming a collaborative military-civilian group, it can achieve maximum efficiency in both warfare and production, which is incomparable to the backward driving methods of other tribes.
The increase in the number of orcs brought numerous troubles to the Dragon Nest Tribe,
Chaos abounds in aspects like discipline, sanitation, and housing, and besides these, there’s one extraordinary trouble.
That trouble is food.
Orcs naturally have little leftover food stored, especially not two months after a cold winter. After annihilating those few Beastman Tribes, the collected food was only enough to sustain the orc captives for a few days.
Even though the Dragon Nest Tribe has always had food surpluses, the hunting activities over these two months have turned a large amount of prey into cured meat, along with gathering fruits and roots from outside, there’s enough to sustain the Dragon Nest Tribe orcs for several months.
But once the Dragon Nest Tribe’s population surged five to six times, that little food became insufficient.
The herd of wild oxen raised by the Minotaur Tribe is ultimately an exception, moreover, those wild oxen not only need to be used as labor for pioneering agriculture in the future, Austin even considers establishing a Cow Cavalry Corps in the absence of Snow Wolf Cavalry, thus the wild oxen cannot be moved.
Thus, even if the Dragon Nest Tribe’s animal husbandry has already seen some achievements, it’s still insufficient for the massive food shortage.
"The orc captives need to undergo the baptism of military training, inevitably shortening the time for out collecting food. Besides, the territory within a ten-mile radius can barely sustain two hundred inhabitants, looks like we can only expand outward... It’s inevitable then, luckily the Extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen have already taken shape, their combat power has greatly increased, so there’s no need to overly worry about safety..."
When Dragon Vein Beastmen appeared, Austin launched a war in a moment of impulse, beginning to expand blindly, without anticipating the bitter outcomes that followed.
"Sigh, I was too rash back then."
As Austin was worried and racking his brains to solve the food issue for the orc tribe, even preparing to use Dragon Vein Beastmen as the core to explore farther areas, a piece of good news arrived, thoroughly solving his current concerns.
After about a month and a half of planting, the first plot of land reclaimed by the river plain can finally be harvested!
Perhaps it’s related to the different Otherworld kudzu, or maybe the Magic Power contained in the air sped up kudzu’s growth, in any case, the kudzu in the first reclaimed plot of land finally grew successfully.
In the field, the once green vines winding along the branches had now turned slightly yellow, many leaves started falling, sporadically.
The whole field, originally lush and green like a summer forest, overnight changed to a scene of autumn desolation.
And this change also signifies that the kudzu buried in the soil is ready for harvest.
The first reclaimed plot of land is not far from the Dragon Nest Village. Stepping out of the village’s gate, walking southwest for about a mile, you can see a winding river, and the first plot of land sits beside it.
The harvest day stirred the whole Dragon Nest Tribe.
Big and small orcs gathered by the field, craning their necks to watch.
Even the orc captives undergoing training stole a rare moment of leisure, following the official members of the Dragon Nest Tribe, gathering by the field to watch the excitement.
On this significant day with special meaning, the orc instructors also ran to watch the excavation scene.
Among the anticipation of all, Vinek and others wiped their hands, grabbing wooden shovels, and dug in.
All the orcs held their breath, wanting to know whether the farming plan was a success or failure, no one knew in advance,
whether the efforts of more than a month were wasted or worthwhile.
As the shovel went down,
everything was about to be revealed.

chapters.title: Chapter 68 - 66: Great Harvest
chapters.content:
Chapter 68: Chapter 66: Great Harvest
The success of pioneer agriculture largely determines the future direction of the Dragon Grass Tribe’s development.
The current primitive hunting and gathering lifestyle within the Kawa Great Forest can scarcely support the numerous large tribes, capable of hosting over a hundred thousand beastmen, which generally resides at the borders where the Kawa Great Forest meets human territory.
This is because the beastman’s backward production methods are utterly incapable of supporting populations over a hundred thousand. The large beastman tribes at the borders exist because they invade human realms during the cold winter to loot enough food to sustain themselves.
If the attempt at pioneer agriculture fails, even though Austin has quite a few tricks up his sleeve, lacking sufficient food supply makes it even more troublesome to increase the population of beastman clans under his command.
Even though the growth of kudzu during the pioneer planting process has been consistently smooth, and under careful nurturing, its exuberance cannot be compared to wild kudzu, but until the outcome is truly revealed, no one knows.
As Vini swung the spade down, all the surrounding beastmen spectators held their breath.
His hands gripping the wooden spade trembled a bit, but he still stomped firmly, causing the spade to deeply penetrate the soil, and then he levered the wooden handle downward.
Crunch!
A crisp muffled sound came from the soil, and simultaneously Vini felt resistance, as if there were a huge wooden root beneath the soil. But under the beastman’s strength, this resistance was negligible, and soon a large clump of soil was turned over.
Along with it appeared a kudzu root, broken at the tip, about one decimeter long, and the size of an arm!
Success!
All the beastmen in attendance widened their eyes, gazing at the huge kudzu root picked up by Vini, with expressions ranging from excitement to awe.
Several nearby beastmen couldn’t help but take tools to dig along a row of land, as the soil turned over and one kudzu root after another was unearthed, the surrounding beastmen’s atmosphere became more fervent and finally erupted into excitement.
"As expected from His Highness Austin, it truly worked!"
"It’s really possible; I’ll work hard in the future pioneering so we won’t lack food anymore!"
Food issues are a sore point for every beastman struggling to survive within the Kawa Great Forest. Among the beastmen present, who hasn’t faced days without harvest and gone hungry?
Though beasts’ heads are simple, it doesn’t mean they don’t understand the significance of this large batch of kudzu roots before them.
Previously requiring traversing mountains and waters to find, where it might be there one day and gone the next, but now it can be gathered and planted on a plot of land, producing consistently; planting kudzu here each time could mean a fixed food source?
Moreover, with just a small segment of land excavated, there’s already this huge pile of kudzu roots dug out; both in size and yield far exceeds that of wild kudzu, looking at this vast kudzu patch, if it’s entirely excavated, imagine how great the harvest would be!
Seeing this, the spectating beastmen couldn’t help but start grabbing tools and joining in the excavation of the kudzu roots, working energetically and enthusiastically.
With the beastmen’s excavation, the kudzu roots on the clearing piled up higher and higher, nearly forming a small hill; when all 20 acres are fully excavated, it indeed has become a small mountain.
The output from the 20 acres of pioneer land roughly estimated at about ten thousand pounds, with a per-acre yield of five to six hundred pounds.
This output is several times less than the kudzu’s two thousand pounds per acre yield in Austin’s past life, but kudzu seeds then were specially cultivated with various fertilizers incomparable to the rudimentary planting conditions now.
Furthermore, in his previous life, from planting to harvesting took nearly half a year, whereas here in Otherworld, it only takes about a month and a half, incomparable.
The kudzu roots grown here, through concentrated planting and care, yield several times more than wild kudzu roots.
If venturing out to gather, even if the entire Dragon Nest Tribe spent a whole month dedicated to digging wild kudzu roots across mountain ranges in dozens of kilometers, it might still not reach ten thousand pounds in quantity.
But now, merely 20 acres have produced this quantity of kudzu roots; how could the beastmen not be astonished?
Furthermore, after pioneering this piece of land, future kudzu planting would no longer require such exhaustive Kung Fu as at the start.
Calculating in this way, even if beastmen were simple-minded, they’d deeply understand that the food obtained through pioneer planting is far superior to gathering food outside.
"Success!"
Seeing the beastmen on the field plunged into celebration and the kudzu roots piled like a mountain beside, the Blue Young Dragon couldn’t help but exhale lightly.
Coupled with the hunted meat and various wild fruits and seeds collected, the beastmen in the Dragon Nest Tribe each consume about one to two pounds of kudzu root daily.
