Of course, if they’d only eat kudzu roots each day, probably each would consume around three pounds daily, but given the current strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, alongside raising wild rabbits and wild pigs, they won’t run out of hunted food every day.
Calculating like this, the twenty acres, with around ten thousand pounds of kudzu root output, can sustain the Dragon Nest Tribe’s seven hundred members for about ten days, and if the beastmen’s rations can be compressed, even up to twenty days.
And this is just the output from the first 20-acre pioneering land!
As of now, under Austin’s command, the Dragon Nest Tribe has pioneered around one hundred and fifty acres of land.
Due to the relation of pioneering followed by planting, the planting time for each plot varies; the next batch of around thirty acres of pioneering land kudzu roots will ripen in about ten days or so.
Thus calculated, with sequential planting on the one hundred and fifty acres of pioneer land, the kudzu output will be sufficient to sustain the entire Dragon Nest Tribe’s beastmen.
This food crisis has thus been entirely resolved.
Nevertheless, Austin will not halt the pioneering land work.
Although the current one hundred and fifty acres’ yield can sustain the increasing population of beastmen in the Dragon Nest Tribe, following this grain incident, Austin has decided to store food in large quantities.
Before initiating the next war to annex other tribes, it’s crucial to ensure sufficient food is budgeted in the warehouse to prevent a scenario of population surging causing food shortage.
Moreover, with the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe growing, labor force has increased, speeding up the pioneering work by the beastmen, thus producing more land and subsequently more food.

chapters.title: Chapter 69 - 67: Results
chapters.content:
Chapter 69: Chapter 67: Results
Previously, due to food issues, Austin had to pause the momentum of clearing nearby tribes, something he hadn’t foreseen at the time.
A mistake made once should not be repeated. Austin has decided to consolidate the foundation within the next month, integrating the beastman captives into the Dragon Nest Tribe’s system, greatly expanding farmland to plant kudzu. Only when the troops are well-prepared and the granaries full, will they attack again.
The first plot of farmland had a bountiful harvest, which was unimaginable excitement for the entire Dragon Nest Tribe. If reality were a game, the morale +100 would be visible on the game panel.
Motivated by the agricultural harvest, the beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe have shown immense enthusiasm in both training and fieldwork these days. With such high work efficiency, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe is transforming day by day.
The training of beastman captives, village expansions, and farmland development are all proceeding at a brisk pace.
Aside from the kudzu harvest, Austin also hasn’t forgotten to check the results of wild rice cultivation in the wetlands where beastmen are planting them.
Initially, Austin replaced wild rice with kudzu in the first farmland plot for various reasons, but this doesn’t mean he completely abandoned wild rice cultivation.
At the time, Austin had the beastmen remove weeds from the wetlands where wild rice grew and sowed wild rice seeds. Now that kudzu is ready for harvest, the rice should soon follow.
Sure enough, as Austin expected, when he and several beastmen arrived at those wetlands, they saw that the rice leaves had already begun to spike and fill. Although not yet ready to harvest, they were close, and it had only been about a month and a half since the wild rice seeds were sown.
This unusual growth cycle of crops in the Otherworld contradicts the cycles of Austin’s previous life, but considering the entirely different seasonal climates of the two worlds, it’s understandable.
However, the rice yield is not high, roughly thirty to forty pounds per acre, far less compared to the yield of kudzu.
Although rice contains more starch and energy than kudzu, at least rice can potentially serve as a staple food, while kudzu cannot.
Austin was not too satisfied with the rice output, yet it was as expected.
Moreover, he already had plans on how to increase rice yield.
After harvesting the wild rice, Austin would set up a trial field and have beastmen carefully nurture the rice, selecting the rice with the most spikes and fullest grains as seeds for the next planting in the trial field.
Through generations of selection and elimination, improving the rice seeds manually would enhance the yield of wild rice through seed quality optimization.
While much of Austin’s high school knowledge has faded, he still remembers these basic seed cultivation methods.
Of course, this primitive method requires ten or even twenty years to genuinely domesticate these wild rice and increase yield; it cannot be rushed.
Although manual seed improvement takes a lot of time, it’s essential to do these things, and the earlier they are done, the more beneficial it is for future development.
This method of improvement is also applicable to kudzu, which Austin plans to apply since the current yield is far from its potential.
During each harvest, Austin plans to select the strongest and highest-yielding kudzu vines from the fields for replanting.
Thus, while improving these wild kudzu vines, they also produce a considerable amount of food, solving the Dragon Nest Tribe’s food shortage.
Having made up his mind, Austin assigned Quik to handle this task.
As the leader of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin can’t personally attend to every detail, hence delegating tasks to others is the way to go.
After assessing the rice growth and giving instructions, Austin spread his wings and flew back towards the Dragon Nest.
Soaring high in the sky, the fierce winds blew past him. Looking down from above, he saw plots of newly developed farmland radiating from the cliff where the Dragon Nest was located.
To prevent soil erosion from excessive deforestation, every farmland plot was separated by a stretch of forest ten to twenty meters wide, creating a picturesque view from above.
In the fields, beastmen, as small as ants, labored away. The trees felled during development were piled together, emitting white smoke from burning.
Around, on the flatlands, captive beastmen stood motionless, receiving military training from Dragon Vein Beastmen.
At the foot of the cliff, houses were rising one after another. Although the beastmen’s craftsmanship was not too refined, it gave the village a primitive and rugged appeal.
This is the result of Austin’s efforts over the past six months.
Although the strength of the Clan Tribe is still somewhat small now, it has achieved self-sufficiency and autonomous development.
Furthermore, Austin believes that one day the entire clan will grow into a towering tree, becoming his greatest protector.
"Next, it’s time for the tribe’s development plan."
Returning to the Dragon Nest, Austin began to contemplate the next steps.
"The food problem is basically solved, but the land development must continue... Hmm... The captive beastmen can train while developing land. With the growth cycle of kudzu, in a month or two, food will no longer be an issue... The war to annex other beastman tribes must continue, set for a month from now. This time, there’s no need to mobilize the entire army."
With the success of land development, removing the food constraint, the main theme of the Dragon Nest Tribe will be
War! War! War!
War sustained by war, never-ending warfare.
This time, the war will not only annex the remaining tribes from last time, but after gathering enough military strength, Austin plans to wipe out the largest nearby Jackal Wolfman Tribe in one go, to seize the possible presence of the Breathing Technique.
With the Breathing Technique, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s strength will significantly escalate, ultimately preparing for another cleansing operation in the Spider Cave.
After finalizing the plan, the whole Dragon Nest Tribe entered a latent farming phase, intensely practicing inner power, while integrating the captive beastmen and aggressively developing farmland.
A month slipped by in the blink of an eye.
During this time, nearly six hundred beastman captives had been integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe, and the developed farmlands had advanced significantly, with rabbit and wild boar farming also starting to produce meat.
The war annexation plan has entered the second stage.

chapters.title: Chapter 70 - 68 Ratman Priest
chapters.content:
Chapter 70: Chapter 68 Ratman Priest
In the middle of a plain, tall thatches stretched into a dense patch, obscuring the field. The thick and continuous root system had almost taken away all the survival resources, making it impossible even for trees to grow here.
The edge of each blade of thatch was as sharp as a knife, a careless touch could cut the skin. Even herbivores disliked these spiky thatch leaves and stayed far away to forage elsewhere.
As a result, this field of thatch became the sturdiest barrier for the tribe of mouse-people living here.
The tall thatch leaves stood upright, the mouse-people stood within, their figures completely obscured by the tall leaves. The dense thickets, which might be an obstacle for others, were like a fish to water for the mouse-people.
The root system of the thatch provided food for the mouse-people, and the leaves could help them block their enemies from chasing. All along, this group of mouse-people lived steadily here, with a population steadily increasing, reaching over three hundred.
The vast thatch plain had always allowed the mouse-people to live securely, without being overly concerned about the threat of external enemies, but recently, the leadership of the mouse-people tribe found themselves plunged into panic.
The Dragon Nest Tribe had been sweeping through nearby beastman tribes extensively. Naturally, the mouse-people couldn’t be oblivious to this, and it was precisely for this reason that the mouse-people were thrown into a state of terror.
One tribe after another was ravaged and destroyed, flames rising high into the sky with thick smoke, leaving their settlements in ruins. Rows of beastmen were tied up and taken prisoner, lined up and marched toward the distance.
The "marauders" jubilantly turned the remaining traces into ashes.
The fate of the beastmen after being captured was clearly understood by the mouse-people, even if they hadn’t personally experienced it. It was undoubtedly a difficult situation with a slim chance of survival.
"What should we do? Another tribe was just wiped out by those marauders. I saw Hada and the others captured with my own eyes. Are we just going to sit here and do nothing?"
At the center of the thatch plain, beneath a constructed grass nest, a mouse-man paced back and forth, panic-stricken, his face full of terror.
"If not, what do you propose we do? Those marauders’ power is something we cannot withstand. Are you suggesting we go out and fight them?"
"I don’t mean that, but at least we should make some preparations."
"There’s no need to fear, with the great Beast God’s protection, those marauders can’t invade."
The entire great thatch plain was an inherent barrier for the mouse-people. During the development of the mouse-people tribe, it had stopped countless enemies and predators, so some mouse-people, although afraid of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s actions, were not overly terrified.
"But I’ve heard the leader of those thief marauders is a dragon. In the face of a dragon, not even the gifts from the Beastman Emperor can hold up!"
Inside the central house of the mouse-people tribe, chaos immediately ensued, with mouse-people chirping and panicking.
"Enough!"
At that moment, the Ratman Priest sitting above slammed the scepter in his hand, which was as tall as a person and had a red crystal embedded at the top, and the beastmen below instantly fell silent.
The Ratman Priest glanced around, coughed lightly, and slowly spoke:
"The Giant Dragon Race is truly a race blessed by heaven, immensely powerful, but it’s just a still-growing Young Dragon, and we’re not that bad. Not to mention we are favored by the Beast God, even the Sacred Artifact in my hand can give that Young Dragon a tough fight."
The Ratman Priest shook the scepter in his hand, and the red crystal on top immediately flashed with a dark red light, like a Demon God lurking in the abyss casting them a gaze, making all the mouse-people feel a chill down their spine.
"Blessed be His Majesty the Beast God, thank you for your mercy..."
The mouse-people immediately bent down, lowered their heads, and sang hymns of praise.
The Ratman Priest, seeing this, maintained an aloof demeanor, but inwardly felt a subtle sense of pride.
In fact, the reason he could become the Ratman Priest was simply because he found a red crystal in some unnamed ruins and could summon fireballs from it, which he used to demonstrate miracles and set himself above his tribe, becoming the Ratman Priest.
He did not possess any of the skills that a real Beastman Priest should master, such as medical care, communication with the Divine, and spell-casting.
That’s why, actually, this Ratman Priest still held some fear toward the Blue Young Dragon that occasionally soared through the skies, only comforting himself that since the mouse-people were active under the thatch plain, the dragon might not discover them, hoping nothing would happen.
With the worship of the mouse-people before him, the Ratman Priest was filled with a surge of grandeur.
"If that little Young Dragon dares to invade our territory, I will give them a lesson they won’t forget!"
The Ratman Priest’s tone was filled with authority, his voice firm and resounding.
At the same time, a visible wave of magic power rippled and spread in all directions. The dark red light in the red crystal on the scepter flowed like lava, gathering at its center, raising the temperature of the entire space, as if the next moment it would spew out scorching flames to engulf everything before it.
With the scepter in a semi-activated state in his hand, the Beastman Priest felt emboldened.
Indeed, with the Sacred Artifact in hand,
and so many of his kin here, what should one small dragon be afraid of!
The Beastman Priest spoke in a manner even he seemed to believe, his voice booming with bravado.
However, the next moment,
BOOM!!!
The ground suddenly shook, as if awakened by an enraged dragon, sending the mouse-people inside the house almost tumbling.
"An earthquake?"
The mouse-people were filled with uncertainty,
SWOOSH!
Suddenly, a visible torrent swept down from the sky, the entire thatch house seemed to be caught in a level twelve storm, teetering precariously.
The next moment, two sinister scaled giant claws suddenly descended, tearing through the thick layers of thatch, ripping the entire roof apart like it was made of paper.
The entire roof was lifted and flung away inch by inch under an overwhelming force, with blades of thatch swept into the air like dark clouds blotting out the sky.
"This!!!"
The mouse-people, terrified, looked up, stunned by the horrifying scene, while the Ratman Priest’s mind went blank, losing the ability to speak.
"A group of little mice..."
And at this moment, a grand, imperious voice rang out from the void.
On the now bare roof, an enormous and sinister head peered in from the sky, looking down at them all.
"I just felt a surge of magic power. Was that you, little mice?"
In a voice ancient and stern, those blood-red eyes swept over all the frozen mouse-people, finally landing on the red crystal on the Ratman Priest’s scepter.

chapters.title: Chapter 71 - 69 Magic Artifact
chapters.content:
Chapter 71: Chapter 69 Magic Artifact
The whole room was deathly silent, and the surrounding ratmen looked at the huge head above, feeling their limbs stiffened and unable to move.
To talk about it, the reason Austin discovered this ratman tribe and appeared here was entirely because the Beastman Priest had previously flaunted the use of the "Sacred Artifact," thus attracting him over.
With the mobilization of the Dragon Nest Tribe, a large number swept through the nearby Beastman tribes, bringing disaster to the surrounding tribes.
One Beastman tribe after another was conquered, and many Beastman captives were taken to the Dragon Nest Territory, leading to a rapid increase in the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The fires of war were raging in the surrounding tribes, and with the ongoing sweep, the Dragon Nest Tribe began to expand rapidly through annexing other tribes, swelling its population.
During this war, the Dragon Nest Tribe originally had nine Dragon Vein Attendants among the Beastmen, and with nearly six hundred Beastman captives later annexed, the current strength of the Dragon Nest Legion could easily defeat local tribes even without Austin sitting in the central army.
Because of this, after easily sweeping away several tribes, Austin planned to let them act on their own while he flew high and began exploring outward.
Originally, this ratman tribe was covered with tall thatch, and the houses were built with a large amount of thatch, making it really hard to detect if one stumbled carelessly.
But as he flew, suddenly Austin sensed a wave of magic power coming from below. Although it was weak, in a world of magical dead silence within a few miles, that wave was like a beacon in the dark night, drawing Austin over.
That’s why the previous scene happened.
To say this, blame the Beastman Priest, for if he hadn’t activated the scepter’s power, how would it attract Austin over?
"Is it that one?"
Austin’s gaze focused on the scepter beside the Beastman Priest, and his keen senses told him that the wave of magic power earlier was caused by that Red Crystal!
"Little mouse, was that magic wave earlier something you created?"
Austin turned his gaze, focusing on the Ratman Priest.
"Not me, I didn’t say anything, I don’t know."
The Ratman Priest’s mind went blank, and in a panic, the words suddenly blurted out.
Austin: "...."
All ratmen: "...."
At this moment, the Ratman Priest finally reacted, panicked, raising the scepter, visibly seen red glow rippling out, the fire attribute magic power in the air began to gather like a tide toward the Red Crystal under an absorbing force.
In extreme fear, the Ratman Priest accidentally activated the scepter in his hand, and his blank mind couldn’t even think.
The next moment,
Flame Flame Flame!!!
A massive flame burst forth out of nothing in the air, roaring and crashing upward, sweeping all the heat around, carrying a terrifying force and crashing toward Austin.
The terrifying heat twisted the air, sweeping in, and all the ratmen present gave birth to hope in that moment.
Surely worthy of Priest, even facing the giant dragon without any fear!
This mere dragon, how could it be a match for Priest and the Sacred Artifact!
Facing the incoming fireball, Austin reached out his paw, grabbing toward the giant fireball.
Boom!!!
Instantaneously, just like bursting a balloon, the giant fireball was immediately crushed between the giant claws, and fiery serpents shot out from between the claws, then dissipated into nothingness in the air.
Instantly, all the ratmen were like ducks with their necks pinched, unable to make a sound.
"It’s a nice thing, I can tell you don’t know any real magic; this fireball relies on that Red Crystal to be activated, doesn’t it?"
Austin shook his head, snorted, the scales in his paw visibly scorched black, its power seeming unimpressive.
Despite this, Austin could clearly feel that from the momentum of the magic power gathering, the power of the fireball fired was certainly not weak, just reduced when reaching Austin due to the Ratman Priest’s lack of control during its flight.
"Little mouse, are you going to rebel against me?"
Austin fixed his eyes on the Ratman Priest, his voice echoing in the air eerily.
"No no no, I didn’t mean it, Your Highness spare me, please show mercy..."
The Ratman Priest loosened his grip on the scepter, both legs weak, directly kneeling on the ground.
What have I done!!!
Overwhelming fear surged in his heart, the Ratman Priest continually kowtowed begging for mercy, his whole body trembling.
"Sacred Artifact, right, Sacred Artifact! Giants love shiny things!"
Suddenly thinking of something, the Ratman Priest hurriedly picked up the scepter from the ground, raised it high with both hands.
The surrounding ratmen had already been stunned by the change, as the Ratman Priest knelt down, under the frightening dragon might, all the ratmen were crawling on the ground, trembling horribly, ratmen were naturally timid, even more so than kobolds, seeing the Priest’s attack didn’t have any effect, everyone was scared out of their wits.
Austin remained noncommittal, extending his paw to grab the scepter, bringing its fist-sized, smooth Red Crystal to his face for careful examination.
With sharp magical perception, he naturally knew that the wooden stick was just a random decoration, the true effect was caused by the dark red glowing Red Crystal.
Through the flashing light inside, Austin clearly sensed a profound mysterious magic rune hidden in the core of the glow, with strands of fire attribute magic power automatically gathering into the Red Crystal, as if automatically charging.
This Red Crystal probably resembles a magical artifact.
Thus, even ordinary Beastmen could use it to generate fireballs, although the power didn’t differ much from a fireball technique cast by a basic mage.
To truly utilize its effect, it should be handed to a mage-type extraordinary, even a mage just stepping in without learning much else, as long as they can spiritually control the aggregation of fire attribute magic, they can genuinely utilize its effect.
In Yi Austin’s view, if handed to a magic extraordinary, what the Red Crystal would activate wouldn’t be a fireball technique, but a flame burst technique.
"Interesting..."
After observing it closely for a while, thinking for a moment, he already had a suitable candidate for ownership of the scepter in his heart.
"Little mouse, tell me, where did you get this thing?"
Austin turned his gaze back to the Ratman Priest, his voice filled with undeniable authority.

chapters.title: Chapter 72 - 70 Shock
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: Chapter 70 Shock
"Y-Y-Your Highness..."
The Ratman Priest stammered as he recounted the origins of the red crystal.
It turned out that during one of his trips for food gathering, the Ratman Priest accidentally fell from a high mountain into a cliffside valley.
Luckily, he was fortunate enough that the branches and leaves cushioned his fall, allowing him to survive with only minor injuries.
While trying to find a way back from the valley, the Ratman Priest discovered a hidden, spiraling cave entrance nestled among the grass. Driven by curiosity, he entered the cave and discovered a spacious area inside.
Inside that space, there were several large stone tables covered with dusty, peculiar bottles and jars, and some sheets of beast-skin parchment. The corners were piled with white bones, making the whole space appear quite eerie.
The Ratman Priest was a bit afraid at that time, and coupled with his injuries, he randomly took a piece of glowing red crystal and left.
Later on, the Ratman Priest figured out how to use the red crystal and fooled a group of Ratmen, becoming the priest of the Ratman tribe.
"Oh, do you still remember the way to that place?"
Upon hearing this, Austin’s interest was piqued, and he hurriedly asked.
Falling off a cliff but surviving, discovering treasures in a cave, and thus embarking on a path to greatness.
This scenario... why does it seem a bit familiar?
"Uh, Your Highness, I remember, but later on, I went back to the valley intending to see if there were other good things inside. At that time, a Centaur Tribe occupied the nearby mountain range and settled around the cliff near the valley. I didn’t dare to risk going through several times."
The Ratman Priest answered honestly.
According to his observations, the Centaur Tribe probably settled near the valley for its favorable environment because he hadn’t seen any Centaur venture to the bottom of the cliff. If they had discovered the cave, things wouldn’t have been so calm.
This was sheer bad luck for him. After assessing the strength of the Centaur Tribe, the Ratman Priest gave up on the place entirely.
"Very good, from this moment on, you all belong to me, understand?"
Austin glanced at all the Ratmen lying on the ground, his thunderous voice echoing in the air.
"U-Understood..."
The Ratmen’s status in this world is similar to that of the Kobold, one of the lowest races of Beastmen on the Seta Continent. Assessing situations and taking appropriate actions are what they excel in.
"Stay here and tidy your belongings. Soon, someone will come for you, and as for you, follow me."
There were only about a dozen high-ranking Ratmen in the room. Due to the commotion caused by Austin’s strong landing, the surrounding Ratmen scattered everywhere, with even the braver ones shivering under the thatched roofs, staring at the massive shadow.
Austin wasn’t worried about whether these Ratmen would run away afterwards. He had already gauged their courage, and besides, the biggest value of the tribe for Austin was the red crystal and the information about the cave at the base of the cliff.
In comparison, the population of three hundred Ratmen was important, but the matter of the Ratman Priest was evidently more crucial.
The cave might just be a remnant laboratory of a Mage.
Austin extended his massive claw, and before the Ratman Priest could react, he was snatched up and held in his palm.
Then, spreading his wings, Austin took to the sky.
The massive membranous wings blocked the sky, generating a huge current, and his entire body soared into the air, leaving the Ratmen Tribe in growing panic below.
The fierce wind blew by his side as the poor Ratman Priest, clutched under Austin’s claw, was already scared limp in the high sky. Looking down at the distance, his little mouse heart was almost about to burst with fear, forcing him to keep his eyes tightly shut.
After about ten to twenty minutes, Austin finally descended from the sky.
The Dragon Nest Tribe, arrived!
"One-two-one, one-two-one... transform well, remake as Beastmen... serve His Highness..."
As the speed decreased, the Ratman Priest began to hear loud chants coming from below, one slogan after another rose into the air, even overpowering the sound of wind rushing past his ears.
Unable to hold back, the Ratman Priest opened his eyes, and his entire mouse head was stupefied.
Below, a vast field, piece by piece of land cleared by manpower, stretched orderly across the landscape. Green vines completely covered the area. Although the Ratman Priest didn’t know what it was, for the first time witnessing such human-altered nature, he felt like he was facing a tidal wave of an impact.
At the same time, on the open plains, Beastmen held their heads high, forming neat squares, marching, standing still, and practicing spear thrusts, with all sorts of drills going smoothly. The battle cries soared to the heavens. Even though the Ratman Priest didn’t understand, he could feel the mighty military aura rising fiercely.
In fact, what the Ratman Priest didn’t know was that many of the Beastmen training below were captives recently captured from other tribes.
With the mass reformation works underway, the clan members of the Dragon Nest Tribe had already found a series of methods to quickly and effectively reform the captives, teaching them basic commands and maintaining a proper military formation in no time.
The skies were clear, and looking down, the entire tribe was bustling with activity, teeming with vibrant life.
But all this wasn’t what shocked the Ratman Priest the most. The greatest surprise was the orderly and well-established village in the center.
Among continuous wooden structures stood a tall, two-story building constructed with "stone"!
A building made of such "stone," which the Ratman Priest had never seen since birth, but he knew that having a stone house was a symbol of a tribe’s wealth and strength!
At a rough glance, there were at least over a thousand Beastmen walking around near the village.
From the moment he opened his eyes to now, everything he saw had left the Ratman Priest with his mouth agape in shock.
Descending, Austin was naturally unaware of the Ratman’s thoughts. If he knew, he would only find it amusing.
Country bumpkin is truly a country bumpkin.
Those aren’t stones, just bricks that have been fired.
The Goblins assigned to the manufacturing workshop seemed to have unlocked some skill. Throughout continual production, their various crafts improved rapidly. Not long ago, they successfully fired bricks according to Austin’s description and used them to establish a "City Hall," which was the "stone" building that had such an impact on the Ratman Priest.

chapters.title: Chapter 73 - 72: Scepter Ownership
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: Chapter 72: Scepter Ownership
With the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the tools consumed by the entire tribe daily have also increased significantly. In response, a dedicated manufacturing workshop has been set up, with fifty goblins to barely meet the orcs’ work and house construction needs.
Perhaps some hidden conditions were unlocked, or maybe goblins have a natural talent for manufacturing. From initially being somewhat clumsy in making simple wooden spear tools, they have now evolved to be able to autonomously create new tools and crops based on Austin’s scant guidance.
The bricks used in building the "Municipal Center" were fired by the goblins in the manufacturing workshop according to some information provided by Austin. Besides bricks, the goblins have also successfully fired pottery, greatly facilitating the daily lives of the orcs in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Moreover, when making wooden spears and stone tools, the goblins developed some new grinding tools, such as grinding wheels, to save labor, which significantly improves the efficiency of various manufacturing tasks.
For the goblins’ spirit of invention and creation, Austin is quite appreciative. During inspections, he not only praised the person in charge of the manufacturing workshop in person but also encouraged them to be innovative and to foster a spirit of active exploration.
Whaclalal!!!
A huge gust of wind swirled in the high sky, and Austin descended from the sky, holding the stunned Ratman Priest, landing in the large stone-brick-paved square.
Due to the rainy and hot climate of the Kawa Great Forest, the ground is often muddy. Thus, once the bricks were fired, Austin ordered the orcs to pave the village with stone bricks to improve sanitation and civic appearance.
Now, the open space in front of the village houses is only about halfway paved, but it already forms a tidy square.
"Your Highness Blue Dragon, you have returned."
As Austin landed, the orcs working around busily saluted quickly, and the village chief Kobold Vini also ran over swiftly.
"Hmm, take this guy away, and then send someone to the east. After crossing twenty-three mountains, you’ll see a mountain resembling an Ox Head Peak. On the opposite side of Ox Head Mountain, there’s a plain covered with thatched grass. Send someone to take over the Ratman Tribe there."
Austin threw the Ratman Priest to the ground and instructed Vini to take over the Ratman Tribe. As for whether the Ratmen would resist, given Austin’s previous imposing entry, the Ratmen’s courage had already been scared away, so there probably wouldn’t be any issues.
"Also, go call Quik for me; I have something to discuss with him. Meanwhile, prepare an army and try to bring all my Dragon Vein Attendants. I want to personally lead an expedition against a Centaur Tribe."
Since Quik established the traditional Chinese herbal medicine treatment system, he has been taking a few orcs to collect various plants all over the mountains whenever he has time and has set up a simple hospital within the tribe. Of course, the injured orcs are temporarily afraid to enter, but they have no choice.
After turning Quik into a Dragon Vein Beastman, his perception and mental abilities seemed to have greatly improved. Although the hospital can only treat a few simple illnesses temporarily, with the orcs’ "selfless" contributions as test subjects, records of various herbs’ properties are rapidly increasing, laying the groundwork. It’s believed that with more trials, this affordable and beneficial treatment system will ultimately be established.
Upon receiving Austin’s orders, Vini started making arrangements swiftly.
Meanwhile, Austin returned to the nest and began to examine the scepter in his claw meticulously.
Within the crimson crystal, brilliant red light flickered, with strands of light intertwined in the red glow, seemingly hiding very profound and mysterious magic runes.
Suddenly, a thought arose in Austin’s mind.
Buzz!
A vibration suddenly spread through the air, with visible red light ripples expanding outwards in all directions.
The next moment,
Boom!
A massive fireball rose out of thin air, shot out swiftly, and hit one of the Dragon Nest’s walls with a bang.
In an instant, the entire Dragon Nest space seemed to be swept by flames, with the scorching heat filling the space until it vanished into nothingness.
As the firelight faded, there was only a black mark on the wall.
"What a shame, it’s just a little trinket..."
Austin shook his head slightly; this power was only one or two times stronger than the Ratman Priests, and it mainly lacked the mages’ ability to gather and bind the fireball through spiritual power, which resulted in too much Fire Attribute Magic Power and heat loss during flight.
This level of power is of no use to Austin, and it could only be given to some subordinate for use.
Dismissing the matter, Austin began to have the Ratman Priest brought over for a thorough interrogation.
After extracting information about the Centaur Tribe and the cave from the Ratman Priest, Quik returned to the Dragon Nest Tribe, dusty, carrying a large basket.
"Your Highness, were you looking for me?"
"Yes, I just received something good, take a look."
Austin tossed the scepter directly to Quik.
"Your Highness, this is...."
Quik was puzzled at first, but upon sensing the magic power tremors from the red crystal at the scepter’s tip, his expression suddenly changed.
"It should be a kind of Demonic Artifact. Try it and see how powerful it is."
Quik’s expression became serious as he used his spiritual power to activate the red crystal at the scepter’s tip.
Buzz!!!
Red ripples spread through the air, and at the same time, Austin sensed that the Fire Attribute Magic Power in the air was gathering under the operation of those mysterious runes.
The next moment,
Boom!!!
A huge fireball suddenly rose and shot out, hitting a pile of wood not far away.
In an instant, the whole pile of wood was blown apart and burned into ashes by the scorching flames, dissipating into the air.
"This.....!!!"
Seeing the fierce blaze ahead, Quik was also dumbfounded, speechless.
"Not bad, as a reward for your hard work these days, you can use this for now. I hope you don’t disappoint its power."
Perhaps due to the spiritual power and mage tier differences, the power Quik unleashed was much stronger than Austin’s, although Austin sensed that it still fell short of the Fire Energy contained in a fully gathered fireball when it was at its peak.
After all, Quik is not a true mage, only awakening his talents through transformation, and being able to exert half the power of the Flame Burst Technique is already quite good.
"Your Highness, thank you for your generosity."
Quik held the scepter with an expression of excitement.

chapters.title: Chapter 74 - 73: Leading the Troops to Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 74: Chapter 73: Leading the Troops to Battle
As one of the few wise men of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Quik knows very well that whether young or old, the Giant Dragon Race is naturally obsessed with wealth like gold coins and crystals, and he also knows how hard it is to take a single gold coin from a dragon’s side according to legend.
And now, the honorable His Highness has handed him this scepter due to his somewhat unworthy efforts, which is a great honor to him.
For a moment, the Fox-faced Man was moved to tears, making Austin feel inexplicably surprised.
Speaking of which, if Austin could hear Quik’s thoughts, he would surely find it genuinely amusing.
Although Austin is a dragon, he is actually a soul from the Otherworld, possessing various rich experiences from his previous life, and has no special feelings towards gold coins and crystals that cannot be eaten or worn now; at most, he feels that the Red Crystal is somewhat beautiful.
If a Red Crystal of little use could be used to significantly enhance the power of the Clan, Austin felt it was perfectly normal.
At least at this stage, Quik is the beastman who can exert the power of that magical artifact, the Red Crystal, the most in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Not long after, Vini had already mobilized an army according to Austin’s orders. With the rapid development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, each time they set out to clean up other tribes, they no longer need to mobilize all forces, and now having more manpower, the Dragon Nest Tribe can wage war while also developing production.
With a larger population, manpower mobilization has become easier. The army dispatched with Austin totals two hundred people, all of them elite fighters, with six out of nine Dragon Vein Attendants accompanying them, while three stay behind to guard against any attacks during Austin’s expedition.
This time, Austin intends to take the Fox-faced Man Quik along.
Not only because this guy just got the Red Crystal Staff and wants to test Quik’s combat power after getting new equipment, but also because the Fox-faced Man has a broader knowledge base than ordinary beastmen, maybe knowing something about the things left in that cave.
The army was already assembled in the square, with orderly formations, without a hint of noise, resembling iron forged with strict discipline.
When the Ratman Priest, carried by Austin, descended from high in the air, he suddenly saw these burly men standing in orderly rows silence, and the long spears glistening with sharpness, the scene of the army’s killing intent rising to the sky. The Ratman Priest was immediately shocked, staggering back and nearly falling.
The army accompanying this expedition is comprised of well-trained elites, hardened in wars of extermination.
Even in Austin’s previous life, ordinary people who had never seen military formations would feel mentally impacted when suddenly encountering a well-trained iron-blooded army, let alone a Ratman Priest.
This kind of army, never seen before in the Otherworld, almost turned the world upside down for the Ratman.
"You did very well."
Austin’s wings stirred up a mighty torrent, descending from the sky, while the beastman army stood still amidst the swirling air currents.
Looking at these elites trained from ordinary beastmen, Austin felt somewhat satisfied.
Except for the initial period when Austin would support them, in the subsequent wars outside, Austin had completely handed over to them, and they lived up to his heavy expectations, continuously succeeding in annihilating several tribes and constantly plundering, gradually strengthening the Dragon Nest Tribe.
What Austin wants in a Clan is a group that possesses both discipline and a wolf-like aggression, capable of plundering resources during his growth, with enough power to deal with various potential crises.
Hence, Austin has always emphasized cultivating the self-reliance of the Dragon Nest Tribe. Apart from some initial hands-on involvement, he left it to the beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe to develop independently, mainly controlling some directional issues himself.
And now it seems, the results are indeed good.
Even if Austin disappeared from now on, the Clan he left behind would continue to grow and prosper.
"My legion, move out with me!"
Austin waved his wings, grabbing the Ratman Priest and soaring into the sky.
Behind him, units of silent elite beastman troops poured out, their orderly footsteps raising dust rolling towards the sky.
According to the Ratman Priest, the cliff of that valley is somewhat distant. Although Austin alone could fly there from the sky in half a day, the beastman army below couldn’t fly, so it took them a day and a bit more time to get close to a mile away from the Centaur Tribe.
"Is that the valley?"
In a certain mountain range, Austin looked at a distant cliff recess visible to the naked eye and asked the Ratman Priest beside him.
"Honorable His Highness Blue Dragon, that’s it. At the time, I fell down from there and discovered that cave."
The Ratman Priest gestured and explained beside him.
"It’s a pity that later the Centaur Tribe relocated to the nearby hillside, and those Centaurs often patrolled around, so I dared not approach it again."
In this world’s beastman breeds, Centaurs are considered a mid-tier race.
And in this ruthless Kawa Great Forest, unless they’re from the same tribe, invading other tribal territories would mean direct attacks without a word, and being captured as slaves would be good compared to many who are killed instantly as enemies.
No wonder the Ratman Priest didn’t dare to have designs on the valley cliff again; the Ratmen are naturally timid, and timid ones tend to live longer.
Austin flapped his wings, effortlessly ascending and landing on a giant ancient tree nearby, his form hidden among lush leaves, his eyes peering into the distance.
With good eyesight, he saw that group of Centaurs, seated on a mountainside thousands of meters away; clusters of huts appeared intermittently in the woods, flames rising, and the whole Centaur Tribe seemed to be dining.
"About three hundred in number, and they’re dining, so they’re all gathered inside the tribe, perfect opportunity!"
Since most Centaurs were gathered in the tribe, it gave Austin a chance to capture them all at once!
"Quik, number one, number two, take a hundred men for a frontal attack."
"Number three, number four, take fifty men to swing to the left, wait until Quik breaks through the Centaur Tribe from the front, then charge out."
"Number five, number six, also take fifty men to swing to the right..."
Descending from the tree, Austin began issuing orders to his beastman troops.

chapters.title: Chapter 75 - 74 Charge
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Chapter 74 Charge
Numbers One and Two are codenames given by Austin to the Dragon Vein Attendants for convenience in the army.
As Dragon Vein Attendants who have half-stepped into the domain of extraordinary power, they naturally don’t receive the same treatment as ordinary soldiers. In previous battles, they mostly played the role of leading the vanguard. One could say the army behind them mainly centered its tactics around supporting their combat.
Soon, the troops split into three groups: one large and two smaller ones, according to Austin’s orders.
"Attack!"
Without much delay, Austin directly ordered the army to attack.
With the strongest frontal force to crush the enemy, then the left and right wings strike forth, completely breaking the enemy’s morale. Leaving one side open in a three-sided encirclement, offering an escape to dissuade desperate resistance from the enemy, would eventually lead them to flee backwards in defeat.
Of course, the so-called open side is impossible. When the demoralized centaurs flee to the rear, exhausted, Austin will personally appear, descending from the sky to subdue them decisively.
The Centaur Race holds a mid-tier position within the Beastman Race. Coupled with their running speed and stamina, if they eventually flee after defeat, Austin’s Clan troops would not be able to catch up.
The three-sided encirclement tactic is the best method Austin currently has to defeat and subdue this group of centaurs.
"What a pity. If I were already an adult, simply showing myself would likely have made this group of centaurs submit. Then again, if I were an adult, I wouldn’t need this Clan’s strength anyway."
Austin sighed slightly.
Adult dragons are essentially legendary level beings. Even without speaking, they would naturally gather a strong Clan of Beastmen who inherently admire strength. But before reaching adulthood, whether young or juvenile dragons can at best attract the favor of lower-tier beast races such as goblins and kobolds, while mid-tier races and above barely pay any attention.
Given Austin’s current strength, the chance of subduing the centaur tribe ahead without shedding a drop of blood is slim. This is why Austin intends to defeat them, completely shattering their morale before revealing himself.
A troop defeated and fleeing is easiest to capture, and only when the centaurs lose all morale would there be a significant chance for Austin to subdue them.
Thinking too much is pointless. Austin lifted his body swiftly, concealing himself above the forest to carefully observe the battle and seek opportunity.
Perhaps because the centaurs were gathered in the tribe for feeding, the first attacking team managed to sneak within two hundred meters of the centaur tribe before being discovered by a centaur who had just finished feeding.
"Enemies!"
The orderly military formation moved silently under iron discipline, with long spears standing tall. Seeing the fully armed Beastman Legion approaching the tribe, that centaur naturally wouldn’t assume they came as guests.
With the centaur’s shout, the entire tribe erupted into commotion. Their ability to survive in the peril-ridden Kawa Great Forest itself spoke of their keen vigilance.
The centaurs hurriedly grabbed their weapons, noisily emerging from all around the village, faces grim as they prepared to give the audacious intruders a heavy blow.
"Charge! For the noble His Highness Austin!"
With their exposure, the Beastman Legion no longer bothered to hide, directly shouting as they charged forth.
The sound rose to the heavens, as the Beastman Legion charged as a group, with no sign of disorder.
Meanwhile, the first batch of centaurs rushed out from the tribe, wielding wooden spears and clubs in chaos, but full of momentum as they charged at the Dragon’s Nest Beastmen Legion.
The Beastman tribes living in the Kawa Great Forest exist in a primitive state of gatherer-hunter civilization. Food sources limit the tribe population size and hinder the development of metallurgy and ironworking skills. Copper and iron tools within Beastman tribes mainly come from the Human World, occasionally ending up in Beastmen hands.
As such, in the Kawa Great Forest, Beastmen tribes in hunting combat use primitive items like wooden spears and stone tools.
Yet, wooden spears do not equate to a lack of lethality. The raw material for wooden spears largely comes from a tree called hemlock, widely distributed in the forest. These trees are not only extremely hard but also straight and uniform, making them ideal for crafting wooden spears. Although inferior to real iron tools, when sharpened, they can easily penetrate an unprotected Beastman’s body with sufficient force, serving as a sharp weapon in Beastmen hunting and combat.
Centaurs are large in stature, taller than common kobolds by half a body, and when they charge, they stir up a cloud of dust. Though not as mighty as tanks, their momentum surpasses that of rumbling thunder motorcycles.
In the charging of these dozen colossal figures, they came down like a torrential mountain flood.
If it were a regular Beastman army, they might already scatter in fear upon collision, but the Dragon’s Nest Beastmen Legion, seasoned by many battles, stood unperturbed, halting to form ranks and confront the centaur’s charge.
"Kill these offenders!"
In the blink of an eye, the centaur ranks charged with grins towards the Dragon’s Nest Beastman Legion, the fighting spirit leaving them blind to the Legion’s spears and the threat they posed.
In past conflicts, centaurs counted on their size and speed to group charge, and after trampling through enemy ranks, the latter would scatter in defeat, allowing the centaurs free reign to chase them.
Even if their foes wielded spears, as long as they reached the front lines, their charging momentum would leave no beastman daring to raise a weapon but rather flee.
Repeated victories in war gave the centaurs fearless momentum in charge.
They assumed this group of little shrimps would collapse like past foes once driven to the front.
But in the next moment, the centaurs felt as though they had struck an iron plate.
No, it was an iron wall!
"Hah!"
At the moment of collision, a pair of Dragon Vein Attendants crouched at the frontline suddenly launched at the centaurs, their roar shaking the skies as the enormous shields in their left hands slammed towards the leading centaurs like walls.
Bang!!!
The centaurs, unprepared for a counterattack, flew back amidst a mighty sound as the shields crashed like a tidal wave against the strongest side of a centaur, sending two of them flying several meters.
At the same time, the Beastmen Legion behind finally revealed its hidden teeth. With a whistling sound, spears broke the air, launching forth, striking the unprepared centaurs, blood splattering as their bodies fell with a crash.

chapters.title: Chapter 76 - 75 Injury
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: Chapter 75 Injury
The expected scene of a one-sided collapse didn’t happen; the centaurs felt as if they had crashed into an indestructible iron wall, hitting it with bloodied heads.
Long spears thrust out, and the centaurs, galloping swiftly, couldn’t stop within such a short distance and had no choice but to charge into the dense forest of spears ahead of them.
Puff, puff, puff...
The muffled sound of spears piercing flesh rang out continuously, blood splattered everywhere, and huge bodies collapsed to the ground with a crash. In just a breath, the entire centaur unit had lost more than half of its members. The centaurs at the back, horrified by this scene, tried to come to a halt, but their massive bodies continued to charge forward due to inertia, eventually impaling themselves on the sharp spears ahead.
Blood splattered, and the entire battlefield instantly turned into a meat grinder. In a flash, the centaurs suffered heavy losses, but the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion also wasn’t left unscathed.
Even though the beastman troops had strict discipline and neat formations, the frontline beastmen facing the centaur charge were pushed back several steps by the massive impact. The previously tidy rectangular formation of the entire legion was now uneven, nearly on the verge of breaking apart.
This was due to the disparity in size and power, something discipline and cooperation couldn’t reverse. Under the enormous impact, even several beastmen found it hard to resist, their bodies forced back by the sheer force, spears bending almost to the point of breaking.
Even though the centaurs couldn’t wield their weapons to attack, suffering heavy casualties in front of the beastman legion, the massive momentum they carried also sent several frontline beastmen flying. One centaur even soared into the air unexpectedly and crashed down into the formation, instantly crushing a kobold to death, while nearby beastmen suffered varying degrees of injuries.
This battle was unprecedented in its ferocity, with blood and corpses flowing everywhere, the splattering blood painting the sky as if a blood rain had fallen.
At this moment, within this assaulting centaur squad, after witnessing the tragic deaths and injuries of their comrades at the forefront, the last few centaurs finally came to a stop a few meters away from the legion, choosing not to linger for a moment longer, hurriedly turning around, and fleeing back in the direction they came from in sheer panic.
Ultimately, only three or four centaurs managed to flee back. This skirmish resulted in a casualty rate of over seventy percent for the centaur squad, leaving the few centaurs who fled back utterly demoralized, their expressions filled with fear and shock.
Meanwhile, the centaur leader who had gathered his kin in the tribe was almost overcome with anger upon witnessing this scene, his eyes bloodshot, questioning when in their tribe’s history had they ever suffered such heavy losses!
Unbeknownst to the centaur leader, the orcs within the Dragon Nest Legion opposite him were also shaken.
In the Dragon Nest Tribe’s past campaigns, when had there ever been such fierce slaughter and sacrifice? Even in battles against several times the number of enemies, thanks to the Dragon Vein Attendants and their united formations, the most severe results had only been a few orcs being gravely injured, but deaths had never occurred.
But now, just to deal with a small squad of ten or twenty centaurs, one orc had already died, and no fewer than ten others were seriously or lightly wounded!
Although compared to the centaurs’ casualty rate, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion’s losses seemed negligible.
Nevertheless, this was already considered the most painful loss in the history of the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion!
"Charge! His Highness is watching us from behind!"
Despite the fact they had suffered heavy losses just upon confrontation, the two leading Dragon Vein Attendants let out a furious roar in the next instant, and the orc legion beneath them immediately felt a surge of hot blood rushing to their heads, their gazes towards the direction of the Centaur Tribe seemingly ablaze.
"His Highness is right behind us!"
Upon hearing these words, moments ago receiving a harsh blow from the centaur squad, the Dragon Nest Beastmen were immediately enveloped by a burning morale. Instantly, they reformed their ranks and charged angrily towards the Centaur Tribe with overpowering momentum.
Under Austin’s leadership, all orcs in the Dragon Nest Tribe underwent a tremendous upheaval in their lives. Every orc living in the Dragon Nest Tribe harbored an indescribable awe for Austin. Moreover, whether in military training or during daily routines afterwards, Austin always ensured to brainwash the orcs in a subtle manner.
Now, every orc in the Dragon Nest Tribe possessed a willingness to die for Austin.
Noble and kind His Highness Austin watching from behind, what is there to fear of mere centaurs!
The invigorated Dragon Nest Beastman Legion surged forward like a tidal wave from afar, instantly impacting the centaurs in the tribe who felt a wave of overwhelming force as if they were about to be engulfed by the rushing tide.
"Everyone, use bows and arrows! Kill the invaders!"
The centaur leader, at this moment, also drew a sharp breath. The relentless momentum of the bloodthirsty orc legion, combined with their orderly lineup charging forward, made him feel as if he were swaying in a storm.
In this crisis, the centaur leader even abandoned the pride of their kind, commanding his kin to use bow and arrow.
Centaurs, with their tall stature, rarely found any enemy able to withstand their group charges. Precisely because of this, they seldom resorted to bows and arrows unless facing an indomitable foe.
Using bows and arrows against kobolds, jackal wolf people, minotaurs, and other "weaklings" would be considered a disgrace by their kin.
But at this moment, the centaur leader no longer cared.
Buzz, buzz, buzz...
With the centaur leader’s order, continuous bowstring sounds echoed, arrows shot out swiftly, piercing the air like dense rain to cover the advancing Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe.
Puff, puff, puff...
Within the arrow-riddled Dragon Nest Beastman Legion, there were instantly orcs struck down by arrows.
Even though for group charges, the orcs maintained about a man’s distance between them during the charge to loosen the formation and somewhat reduce losses, there were always some unfortunate orcs who were hit directly by arrows.
The two leading Dragon Vein Attendants at the forefront were each carrying a massive shield. With the shields’ deflection, the incoming arrows posed no threat to them, and the frontline orcs were clad in crocodile soft armor made from crocodile skins so that even if struck by arrows, they only penetrated an inch or so deep.
But the orcs further back weren’t as fortunate. Although most arrows missed or fell to the ground, two orcs had arrows pierce through their eyes and out of their heads, killing them instantly. Five had their bodies penetrated by arrows, and over twenty had arrows lodged in their shoulders or arms, with blood streaming down.
The entire Dragon Nest Beastman Legion faced its greatest losses to date!

chapters.title: Chapter 77: It’s about to be launched, come and check it out.
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: It’s about to be launched, come and check it out.
It’s about to be launched,
Looking at the data in the background, I’ve been writing for 634 days in total, which is almost two years.
In two years, from Naruto: Rise of the Main God, to Martial Movement of All Heavens, and now to Don’t Mess with That Dragon. Although I occasionally got lazy and took breaks, although the results have always been dismal, both books were completed with effort and not abandoned.
And the author has successfully upgraded from an unknown failure to a small-time failure on the eighteenth line at Qidian....
(ŎдŎ;)
The bitterness within, who can understand it.
The journey of the new book hasn’t been smooth either. Initially, the choice of the title discouraged many readers, and the clicks were pitifully few. Although the name was later changed, it didn’t seem to make much difference.
Also, after finishing Martial Movement of All Heavens, I was somewhat bored with writing about heavens. Coupled with reading a novel about metamorphosing into a dragon, I wanted to write one myself.
Writing this book is essentially to fulfill a farming genre dream of mine.
When I was little, I was a book fanatic who loved stories, starting with encountering four great classical novels in elementary school: Three Kingdoms, Water Margin, Journey to the West, and Dream of the Red Chamber.
I have almost forgotten how many times I read Three Kingdoms, but it must have been no less than twenty times. At that time, I could almost recite the entire plot, especially when Liu Huangshu received guidance from Mr. Shui Jing, visited Zhuge Wulong thrice, and from there things went smoothly—occupying Jingzhou, entering Chuanshu, and claiming the title of King Han, I was deeply impressed and felt excited.
Of course, in the end, the big generals of Shu Han back then died one by one, Zhuge Liang passed away at Wuzhangyuan, leaving plans to retreat Sima, slaying Wei Yan, and until the surrender of Shu’s later lord, Zhuge Kongming’s disciple Jiang Wei’s death in battle, the grand curtain of Three Kingdoms finally fell. Even though I was only eleven or twelve then, witnessing Luo Guanzhong’s conclusion that "unity is followed by division, division followed by unity," a feeling of pity welled up in my heart.
It’s been many years, and that Three Kingdoms has long been lost, but the scenes of the world as a chessboard, the clashing armies still echo in my mind, impossible to forget.
Next was Journey to the West. Although I watched the TV series adaptation many times as a child, the text version offered a different taste. However, I almost forget the main plot now.
As for Water Margin, it must have been about ten times. Not sure how old I was initially, probably around sixth grade. When I first read it, I only felt the heroes of Water Margin possessed a sense of pride, with stories of the 108 generals almost familiar in detail. Despite being saddened by the tragic ends, my fondness for reading it remained. Yet, each time revisiting, I never read the section about Liangshan’s campaign against Fang La.
No other reason, just felt too sad.
Later on, maybe after one or two years passed, reopening Water Margin brought another kind of feeling unexpectedly.
Except for a few, the whole book was filled with "wanton slaughter."
Not to mention those who ate human flesh. Song Jiang, appearing righteous, slaughtered nearby cities and states impersonating Qin Ming to incite rebellion, causing many innocent deaths; later, for Lu Junyi’s ascent to Liangshan, he maliciously plotted, leading to Lu Junyi’s ruin; then, to draw Zhu Tong to join, kidnapped the prefect’s child, and Li Kui killed the little boy...
Many, many examples could be listed. They say it’s government oppression leading to rebellion, but mostly, it’s Liangshan forcing the rebellion that I see.
Speaking of Li Kui, when Song Jiang was framed, many heroes planned to rescue from the execution ground. Then, as they rushed out of the city gate, vendors lined up on Moat Bridge selling vegetables, obstructing the heroes’ path, which led Li Kui to wield his Three Axes, slashing helpless vendors as if cutting vegetables, making another wave fall into the river. Even as civilians fled in panic, Li Kui relentlessly pursued.
Pity those hard times, how many impoverished families, anxiously harvesting vegetables to sell for a meager wage, awaited by their family at home, only to receive a headless corpse. Li Kui’s "excited to kill," left countless orphans and widows.
And Song Jiang? Lightly uttering "my fault," and the matter was brushed aside.
Since then, I never touched Water Margin again.
About Dream of the Red Chamber, forgive my lack of a lady’s heart; after several attempts, I couldn’t finish it. Eventually, borrowed a classmate’s simplified version, which was about ten thousand words, to roughly follow the storyline.
After reading it felt nothing really, seemingly less captivating than Three Kingdoms.
In high school, I began to encounter foreign classics. I read two parts of Gorky’s trilogy, Childhood and In the Mortal World, but My University bought in college didn’t intrigue me anymore, perhaps due to web lit.
Among them, the most memorable ones probably are Verne’s Mysterious Island and Defoe’s Robinson Crusoe, considered early works of the farming genre, having read them multiple times, perhaps just a notch less than Three Kingdoms.
Though I didn’t read many foreign classics, in senior year, accidentally discovered a delightful manga in Zhiyin Manga called Fights Break Spheres.
At that time, borrowed every past issue I could find and searched online extensively, eventually finishing its entire backstory, but found the manga too slow and opted to read the original novel.
Thus, I officially entered the realm of web novels.
Indeed, once in, web novels are as deep as the sea, all other literature became strangers.
From Fights Break to Douluo by Tang Jia San Shao, Divine Seal, then to The Mortal Cultivation Chronicles by Wang Yu, from fantasy to immortal cultivation, immersing in countless grandiose and fantastical worlds....
Uh...
Suddenly realized time is running short, so I won’t boast anymore and will stop here.
.....
Finally, let’s talk about the situation of this book,
This book is only 160,000 words in, might be a bit early, but despite multiple recommendations from the editor during the new book phase, results remained at the lower end. Reviving recommendations also failed, leading to losing hope in new book recommendations, compounded with numerous great authors releasing works this month. Being a small-time, less visible writer with the book’s inherently niche topic in the upcoming public phase means enduring being cast aside and bare-launching.
As per the editor’s suggestion, only launching early to see how it fares, avoiding queuing behind renowned authors for app pushes, and hoping to garner some support...
༼༎ຶᴗ༎ຶ༽
Thus, I’m seeking first subscriptions here,
Based on current collections,
Three hundred first subscriptions, barely passable.
Five hundred, quite satisfactory,
Seven hundred, very happy.
One thousand, I’d wake up laughing from my dreams. If there truly are a thousand first subscriptions, I wouldn’t mind doing head-down writing for the next half month, achieving daily updates of ten thousand words. But I think that’s basically impossible, so I don’t expect too much.
Post-launch, a minimum of two updates, and for additional updates, since there are no saved drafts, maybe four or five on the first day, then I’ll try for three later.
Anyway, the leisure of the public period for the new book won’t continue.
Sigh, so struggling.

chapters.title: Chapter 78 - 76: Defeat (Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Chapter 76: Defeat (Please Subscribe)
"Bow and arrow?"
Amidst the jungle in the sky, Austin saw this scene and furrowed his brows.
Near the Dragon Nest Tribe, there was a bamboo grove. In the early stages, when there was a food shortage, Austin had taught the Beastmen how to remove the bitterness from bamboo shoots, turning them into food to increase the food supply of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastmen.
At that time, Austin had wondered if he could use those bamboos to make bows and arrows to enhance the strength of his Clan subordinates.
It’s known that the use of bows and arrows marked humanity in Austin’s past life as the definitive apex predator in the food chain.
Austin had also envisioned at the time that if every Clan subordinate had a bow and arrow, a wave of arrow rain would sweep through all obstacles, unstoppable.
But when he actually began making them, he realized that ideals were rich, but reality was bleak.
After all, in his past life, Austin knew nothing about bows and arrows. The Bamboo bows guided by Goblins could only shoot lightweight arrows six to seven meters away, incapable of penetrating even the skin of a wild rabbit. Unfortunately, no matter how they were modified, it was hard to increase their power. Therefore, Austin quickly gave up the idea, leaving the task to the Goblins in the manufacturing workshop to experiment and find a solution gradually.
Austin vaguely remembered some old information about making longbows, like using year-old oak wood and horse mane for strings. After passing this rough knowledge to the Goblins in the manufacturing workshop, Austin threw it to the back of his mind.
Who would have thought that now, in this Centaur Tribe, he would see real bows and arrows, and with impressive power.
Seeing the Beastman Legion taking significant damage, Austin, although wanting to train his Clan Beastmen’s independence, did not intend to let the Beastman Legion suffer needless losses.
Just as Austin was about to step in,
Hum!!!
Suddenly, a red light emerged among the Beastman Legion charging through the rain of arrows, spreading ripples visible to the naked eye, sweeping like a tide.
It was the Fox-faced Man, Quik!
He had wielded the Red Crystal Staff he had obtained not long ago.
The next moment,
A massive Fire Attribute Magic Power gathered, forming a gigantic fireball, scorching the air. Intense heat swept through the sky, suddenly shooting toward the Centaur Tribe, trailing a long tail flame.
Boom!!!
The Centaurs still in the village hadn’t reacted before the enormous fireball descended from the sky, exploding violently.
As the fireball exploded, intense flames spread in all directions like fiery serpents, sweeping outwards. The searing heat ignited the dry thatch of nearby houses, instantly causing a raging fire.
Roar, roar, roar!!!
At this moment, the sky was clear, and the dry thatch and tree trunks were set ablaze in an instant. The fire spread to four or five houses, showing signs of engulfing the entire village in flames.
Not good!
The Centaur leader felt a pang in his heart. As the fire spread, Centaurs around the village ceased shooting arrows and scrambled to avoid the scorching flames. The entire tribe fell into chaos amidst the blaze, unable to shoot any more arrows.
At the same time, withstanding the arrow attacks, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion finally charged in front of the Centaur Tribe village.
One by one, the Beastmen crossed the outer fences like a tide, and stormed in directly.
In group charges, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion couldn’t match the Centaur, nor were they superior in long-range arrow combat. However, in close-quarters combat, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion stood streets ahead of the Centaur.
This was the well-trained confidence of the battle-hardened Dragon Nest Legion!
The Centaurs, originally scattered in panic due to the fire started by that micro Flame Burst Technique, couldn’t organize any counter-power before being submerged by the overwhelming Dragon Nest Beastman Legion.
With flames burning, Centaurs fell in droves amidst the tightly packed spear formations, screaming and wailing on the ground. Centaur comrades ran over from afar, but in the narrow passageways within the village, they couldn’t gather enough charge power and were easily overthrown by the Beastmen.
"Retreat! Fall back!"
After the Dragon Nest Beastmen stormed into the Centaur Tribe, their compact military formations trampled everything in their path. In the chaos, the scattered Centaurs were no match for them.
With flames and obstacles all around the village, Centaurs couldn’t play to their strengths at all. Meanwhile, the dense formation group’s attack was exactly where the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s greatest advantage lay. The situation leaning to one side was quite expected.
Seeing one clansman fall after another in the sea of fire and spears, the Centaur leader’s eyes reddened with rage, his eyes nearly bursting. Those bodies lying on the ground were his former clansmen.
Yet, after the Beastman Legion charged into the village, the general trend was irreversible. Fighting on would only increase casualties.
"Escape! Everyone, run outside!"
With the Centaur leader’s furious roar, the terrified and confused Centaurs within the village came to their senses, fleeing out of the village in all directions.
This war was already unwinnable.
The pride of the Centaurs had been stomped ruthlessly by a bunch of dwarfs.
One by one, Centaurs bolted out of the village, fleeing in disarray.
However, at this moment,
"Kill!"
"Kill them!"
"For His Highness!"
A roar of battle cries erupted, and in a panic-stricken state, they saw Beastman armies charging from both left and right, like a tsunami overwhelming everything in their path.
Earlier, after the fierce battle within the tribe, the Centaurs had no courage left to face them, swiftly turning around and fleeing, raising a cloud of dust as they hurriedly retreated to the back hills of the tribe.
In panic, some Centaurs rushed straight into the Centaur’s military formation, losing their courage. They were easily overthrown and captured by the Dragon Nest Beastmen. Even some who twisted their ankles in retreat howled on the ground and were effortlessly caught by the Beastmen.
Finally, the Centaurs that could successfully "escape" from the back road numbered about seventy to eighty, each mostly injured, with their spirits crushed by the earlier battle, posing little threat.
As for the group of Centaurs fleeing to the rear, the Beastman Legion did not pursue because they knew that the last "path of survival" was watched by His Highness Austin. They only sent part of the forces to track and receive the Centaurs captured by His Highness, while the rest handled various post-war affairs like extinguishing the fire, collecting captives, and treating the wounded.

chapters.title: Chapter 79 - 77: Consolidation (2nd update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Chapter 77: Consolidation (2nd update, please subscribe)
The Centaur leader Chiron fled in disgrace through the forest, his head disheveled, face smeared with ash, and the air of confidence and pride he once had completely gone.
After running far enough, until he was gasping for breath, Chiron finally stopped, panting heavily.
He turned his head,
The defeated soldiers following him all looked dejected, crestfallen, with sorrow and loss spreading through the remaining troops, all the arrogance and bravery evaporated in the one-sided battle just fought.
"What the hell happened?!!!"
Even now, Chiron’s mind was still blank, a muddled mess.
How could they lose? And lose so miserably!
Due to their physique, Centaurs naturally had an advantage over other Beastman races, and once they charged, they were usually unstoppable, especially against those lower races; no matter how many there were, they couldn’t shake them in the slightest.
Centaurs are by no means a peace-loving race, and in the harsh world of the Kawa Great Forest, there is no soil for a peaceful tribe to exist. From the tribe’s establishment, they’ve been through countless battles, using their size advantage to rout their enemies with every charge.
Don’t mention one or two hundred people, even five hundred or a thousand enemies, Chiron’s tribe has faced before, winning with fewer numbers has been their tradition.
Because of this, the proud Centaurs even disdain to incorporate other races into their tribe, with the entire tribe consisting solely of Centaurs.
But now, they were defeated.
Three hundred against one hundred, an unquestionably devastating loss!
The battle had become a nightmare they didn’t want to recall.
A large number of their clan were killed or captured, their hard-built settlement abandoned, leaving them as defeated wandering souls that, if they didn’t find food soon, might become another set of bones buried within the Kawa Great Forest.
The future looked bleak.
Meanwhile, as the dispirited remnants gathered together,
Swish!!!
The sky obscured by lush leaves suddenly tore open a great hole, a massive figure descended from above, overshadowing the sky, an overwhelming pressure like mountains falling from the heavens, weighing down on every Centaur, as if faced with a tsunami and abyss.
Chiron looked up in terror, seeing the sky covered with huge membranous wings, air currents swirling, dim light reflecting, atop the terrifying and fearsome head, a pair of blood-red eyes staring down at them.
The Dragon! It’s a Dragon!!!
In that instant, Chiron felt as if he had plunged into an icy pit in the dead of winter, a bucket of cold water poured over him, boundless coldness surging into his heart.
His troops fared even worse, many collapsing under the formidable dragon’s presence, unable to stand up again.
"Centaurs, submit, or die!"
The fearsome head slowly lowered, its indifferent gaze fixed on Chiron.
Its ancient, solemn voice reverberated through the air with no trace of emotion.
At that moment, Chiron was motionless, feeling as if a mountain was pressing on his back.
....
When the fire within the Centaur tribe was extinguished, and the Dragon Nest Beastmen Legion settled the injured companions or prisoners, Austin brought the captured Chiron and the Centaurs back.
Normally, Centaurs’ pride wouldn’t allow them to submit to a Young Dragon.
Unfortunately, first experiencing an unprecedented defeat, their morale diminished under the dragon’s presence, they lacked any courage to resist.
And when Chiron and the Centaurs learned that the Beastman Legion attacking their tribe were part of Austin’s clan, whatever reluctance they had vanished.
Certainly, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion had killed many of their clanmates during the attack, but the rule of the Kawa Great Forest is survival of the fittest, and every Beastman living there has the awareness of being attacked and enslaved while plundering others’ tribes for food and captives.
Among Beastmen, the concept of blood feuds often differs vastly from humans.
Revering strength is their innate nature.
With such powerful clans, the Blue Young Dragon named Austin couldn’t be lacking in strength.
Great strength also implies a life of stability and sustenance.
Although the Centaurs aren’t weak, often plundering food from other tribes to support themselves with their formidable strength, they aren’t always able to eat well, often facing days of eating coarse food. Now submitting under the Blue Young Dragon might allow them to live better.
Returning to the Centaur tribe, Austin directly handed the captives over to his Beastman Legion subordinates.
They confiscated the weapons of Chiron and the remaining troops, binding their hands together with vines, then escorted them to the prisoner area, waiting to take them back to the Dragon Nest Division.
Having conquered and annexed other tribes many times, the Dragon Nest Beastmen were very familiar with this process.
"Your Highness."
Seeing Austin approaching, the Fox-faced Man Quik, originally directing the Beastmen to tidy up the battlefield, quickly bowed in salute.
"What’s the situation?"
"Reporting to Your Highness, in this battle, we lost six soldiers, with seventeen severely injured, the rest bearing some injuries here and there."
This loss could be said to be the most severe the Dragon Nest Legion has suffered since its formation and campaigns; since the appearance of the Dragon Vein Attendant, the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s attacks and annexations of other tribes have rarely resulted in casualties, not to mention direct deaths.
This couldn’t be blamed on them, Centaurs have a natural advantage in physique, combined with their archery, being able to defeat the Centaur tribe with fewer numbers is something other tribes wouldn’t dare imagine.
Especially compared to the Centaur tribe’s losses, the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s damages seem negligible.
"Take care of those injured, and of the comrades who died, gather their bodies back too."
Now on the path of war, casualties are inevitable, presumably the Beastmen are prepared for this.
After some careful instructions, Austin began sorting through the spoils of war.
First were the captive Centaurs, excluding the deceased, a total of two hundred and thirty-two Centaurs were captured, actually, the Centaur tribe’s true deaths weren’t that high, most were skewered by Beastmen’s spears, heavily wounded and fell.
This battle’s capture of two hundred thirty-two Centaurs significantly enhanced the Dragon Nest Tribe’s military strength.
Once the Centaurs are brainwashed and trained, they can directly join the military, becoming a vital force in future campaigns.
With the integration of Centaurs, the Dragon Nest Tribe has also addressed its shortcomings in cavalry.

chapters.title: Chapter 80 - 78: Military Types (3rd update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: Chapter 78: Military Types (3rd update, please subscribe)
The Dragon Nest Legion, rigorously trained, could easily face any Beastman Tribe with their group assault power in a direct confrontation. However, against enemies like the Centaurs that rely on speed, they found themselves at a disadvantage.
Such agile and mobile enemies, once they see the situation turning unfavorable and start fleeing, there’s no way to catch up with them.
When exterminating the Blood Wolves initially, Austin had to use the strategy of trapping them in to deal with the Blood Wolves. In hindsight, if the Centaur Clan had been used back then, there would have been no need to waste strategies on those beasts.
Austin had long considered establishing a cavalry force. After exterminating the Blood Wolves, he once obtained several Blood Wolf cubs. Now these cubs had grown somewhat, but establishing a Wolf Cavalry force still seemed far off due to their insufficient numbers.
Two months ago, the Dragon Nest Tribe had broken through a Minotaur Tribe and acquired a herd of domesticated wild cattle. Back then, Austin also thought about establishing Cow Cavalry.
