In terms of arrow shafts, basically, every Centaur was equipped with two arrows made of Arrow Wood. Ordinary arrows are not yet equipped, and the idea of smearing ordinary arrowheads with poison mushrooms is still being tested.
Moreover, besides bows and arrows, the Centaurs are also equipped with a Wooden Spear for close combat or when serving as cavalry charging.
With equipment in place and after a period of training and coordination, the three major legions have taken shape. As for their combat power, it’s still undetermined without actual combat, but with the orderly division of legion assaults, it’s far better organized than before.
Currently, the Dragon Nest Tribe is well-armed with bows and steeds ready, and the Beastman soldiers are fervent and eager, fully prepared for war.
However, Austin did not immediately dispatch troops but had the three major legions continue rehearsals in the square.
Austin is not a rash dragon; before deploying troops, he had to at least gather intelligence on the enemy.
After deciding on the expedition plan, Austin took to the air from the Dragon Nest, heading toward the Centaur Tribe to the north.
He didn’t bring along any other Beastman Clans, believing that flying alone gave him more advantages for reconnaissance. Bringing Beastmen would only be a burden.
Even though Austin acted independently, it didn’t mean the ground Beastman Legion was idle. At least the elite Ratmen scouting team Austin meticulously selected had already set out, exploring toward the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
After all, the Beastmen, unlike Austin, are constrained by terrain when marching.
Thanks to their timid and cautious nature, the Ratmen are best suited as scouts to detect danger.
Flying northward, Austin kept a constant watch on the forest movements below. After over an hour, he finally neared the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s territory.
While it only took Austin a little over an hour to fly, it would take the Beastmen at least a full day of marching.
Upon nearing the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, Austin didn’t immediately land but instead hovered and flew above, observing the tribe from the air.
Ahead, on the vast plain of mountains, there was a large section of trees missing in some area; that spot was where the Jackal Wolfman Village was located, surrounded by wooden walls as primitive barricades.
Inside the walls, a chaotic mix of wood and straw houses stood haphazardly, varying in height, creating a mess of a village. Despite the disorder, the number of these structures reached almost a hundred, with the center being a massive stone house constructed from stone, exuding an aura of rough intensity and dominance.
Centrally located around the giant stone house, other houses radiated outward, and the outermost wood-straw houses were the most disordered.
Judging by the number of houses, the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s population wouldn’t be less than a thousand. Moreover, in this Kawa Great Forest, each tribe could become combatants with a Wooden Spear, meaning Austin must face over a thousand enemies if he attacked the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
"What’s going on here?"
Circling from a distance, Austin’s sharp vision allowed him to notice the Jackal Wolf People moving in and out of their homes, arousing confusion in him.
The sense of incongruity grew stronger.
Those Jackal Wolf People in the village were mainly adults, robust and tall, with no signs of any children or elders. Furthermore, the tribe was not just Jackal Wolf People; there were many Half-Beastmen of various other races, all strong and powerful, upper-ranking within Beastmen races.
The Jackal Wolfman Tribe seemed not focused on production. Most members engaged in construction and transporting materials using giant beasts resembling rhinos.
To Austin, the whole tribe resembled... a military fortress!
Harboring many doubts, Austin turned and swiftly approached the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, especially targeting the transport convoy to get closer and gather intelligence.
In nearly primal Kawa Great Forest, plenty of giant beasts occasionally soar through the skies, so the Jackal Wolfmen paid little attention to Austin swooping from a distance, unaware it was a Blue Dragon.
But as Austin got closer, he instantly alerted the Beastman below.
"Dragon! Dragon! A dragon is attacking!"
With a chilling shout, the entire tribe instantly descended into chaos, like a flock of panicked sheep.
Some Beastmen scattered in all directions, while more raised their weapons, hurling them skyward.
Austin didn’t initially worry about the power of these projectiles, as over half of them fell before reaching his flying height, and those that did were weak and ineffective after traveling such a distance.
Yet the next moment, an eerie light flared in the Beastman crowd, and a ripple of Magic Power spread. A sense of foreboding suddenly surged through Austin.
"Not good!"

chapters.title: Chapter 92 - 90 Dark Elf
chapters.content:
Chapter 92: Chapter 90 Dark Elf
A flash of cold light appeared, and a sense of danger suddenly surged up in my heart. Austin, who was originally flying high in the sky, flapped his wings suddenly, causing his enormous body to sway to the side under the force of the generated whirlwind.
At the same time,
Whoosh!
An arrow glowing with magical brilliance shot out abruptly from the group of Beastmen below, tearing through the air with a sharp, icy aura, and flew closely past Austin’s side.
Austin’s heart palpitated intensely, and he felt a wave of lingering fear. If it weren’t for his sharp eyes spotting that trace of magical light earlier, he might have been hit by this arrow.
There was no doubt about the power of the arrow that narrowly missed earlier, just seeing the magical runes shining on the arrow shaft was enough to confirm its potency.
Even though Austin’s body was much larger compared to other young dragons due to frequent electric stimulation training, he was still just a three-year-old young dragon.
With the lifespan of an adult Giant Dragon often reaching up to a thousand years, compared to humans, he was just a three-month-old baby. His dragon scales might provide resistance against magic and could fend off a Fireball Technique, but against this kind of enchanted arrow, it was impossible to be instantly killed by the wound, though he would surely be injured.
"Damn it! How could this Jackal Wolfman Tribe have such enchanted arrows!"
Austin cursed inwardly, cold sweat dripping down, not daring to linger any longer. His form twisted in the air, quickly fleeing away.
The Jackal Wolfman Tribe before him was evidently not to be trifled with. If he got injured by an arrow and fell from the sky, the entire Jackal Wolfman Tribe would likely come out in full force, and he would probably die before achieving his goals.
"Enchanted arrows, either inscribed and enchanted by human mages or totem enchanted by Beastman priests—this stuff, while more common than magical artifacts, is definitely not something an ordinary tribe can acquire. Could this damned Jackal Wolfman Tribe have a Beastman Priest?"
After flying far away from the domain of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, Austin gazed in their direction. If dragons had brows, his would certainly be furrowed tightly now.
In dragon heritage, there is naturally no lack of introductions to weapons like enchanted arrows, which are among the greatest threats to the Dragon Race, making Austin feel even more troubled.
This place is quite distant from the Human World, and even the borders of the Kawa Great Forest, making it highly unlikely that the enchanted arrows were made by mages.
That leaves the possibility that they were created by a Beastman priest.
If a Beastman priest is indeed involved, it becomes even more of a hassle, as a Beastman priest adds considerable strength to a Beastman Tribe.
"What is going on with this Jackal Wolfman Tribe? Could there be a Beastman priest in it?"
Previously, Rodney mentioned that the entire Jackal Wolfman Tribe was led by someone named Simon, who very likely was a Bronze Level Extraordinary Professional. He settled here after the tribe was established, moving from some unknown location. When the cold winter arrived, they were attacked by Jackal Wolf People, and if not for fleeing quickly, they probably couldn’t have escaped at all.
At that time, when Austin passed by, he discovered the ruins of Rodney’s destroyed tribe and followed the traces to locate the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
Back then, the entire Jackal Wolfman Tribe, all of whom were robust adults, numbered at most around two hundred, occupying a corner on the mountainside. It was during this time that Austin discovered a Bronze Ore near their location.
Now, combining his observations of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s circumstances, it became apparent that there was something uncanny about this Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
"No, perhaps the Jackal Wolfman Tribe has a Beastman priest, but the rapid expansion and development of the whole tribe would not be solely because of the priest."
The entire tribe consisted purely of able-bodied members and did not engage in production, only busy with transporting materials...
It seemed more like an army.
"If that’s the case, then it’s all the more troublesome."
At this moment, an indecisive wavering had arisen in Austin’s heart about whether or not to attack this Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
Not attacking would be due to the unknown strength of the opponent. The power of his entire Dragon Nest Tribe might not decimate the enemy as easily as before and, perhaps, might not even be a match for them.
But attacking raised concerns about why such a strange and powerful Jackal Wolfman Tribe was situated here in the first place, and fear of them becoming more formidable and potentially sending raiders to slay dragons in the future.
"Forget it, let’s go back first."
Reluctantly, with full of vacillation, Austin flew towards the direction of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Although today’s exploration might have alerted the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, Austin did not regret it. At least if he hadn’t taken the risk to investigate from the sky and discovered the deeper-seated hidden strength of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, waging a war in ignorance could have resulted in greater losses and possibly even failure.
...
Right after Austin departed, in the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
A figure bearing a bow and arrow, with a face hidden under a cloak and a well-proportioned build, stepped away from the transport team, exited the tribe gates, and walked towards the stone house hall.
Upon entering the hall, the light suddenly dimmed.
The figure then took off the cloak, revealing two pointed ears.
With black skin exuding a constant dark aura, a well-proportioned body, an elegant face, and two pointed ears, it was undoubtedly a Dark Elf.
"Lord Grom, a Blue Young Dragon just flew over and I drove it away."
The Dark Elf knelt half-heartedly on the ground toward a shadow in the hall resembling a small hill.
"Is it the Blue Young Dragon that Hog mentioned to the south? We ignored it before due to lack of time, but since it has come, we can only kill it."
In the darkness, the shadow sat on a massive main seat, speaking in a voice as deep as muffled thunder, resonating with an imposing pressure like a mountain throughout the hall.
"Go, take Hog and Simon with you, and bring back that young dragon’s head for me!"
The mountainous shadow, seated on the main seat, issued an undisputable command to the Dark Elf, with a thunderous sound akin to a mentally oppressive tidal flood.
"Yes, my Lord!"
The Dark Elf placed one hand on his chest, bowed with respect, and slowly retreated.
Upon walking out of the hall doors, the Dark Elf glanced at the sun in the sky, frowned slightly, and pulled the cloak’s hood back over his head.
For some reason, the Dark Elf felt in his heart that things wouldn’t be this simple, but orders from Lord Grom were not something he could oppose.
"Better go find Hog and Simon first; they were the first to arrive here and the first to discover the Blue Young Dragon among the Jackal Wolf People, they should know something."
Thinking so, the Dark Elf concealed within the cloak, headed towards the village’s gathering area.

chapters.title: Chapter 93 - 91: Initial Movement (3rd update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Chapter 93: Chapter 91: Initial Movement (3rd update, please subscribe)
"The Blue Young Dragon in the south? I investigated it during the last cold winter when I was scouting the nearby environment. How should I put it? It’s the strangest dragon I’ve ever seen. Although its size suggests it’s only in its juvenile stage, it has already gathered a clan of over a hundred people. However, it seems like it might be a wild orphan dragon without parental care, so there’s no need to worry too much."
The Dark Elf found the Jackal Wolfman Hog and heard this kind of introduction.
"Hog mentioned the dragon to me before, but at that time, the camp was in the construction phase, and it coincided with welcoming Master Grom, so we didn’t pay much attention. Lord Adinlek, does Master Grom have any instructions?"
At this time, the Jackal Wolfman leader Simon also spoke.
When Simon initially came here to establish a forward base and clear the surrounding tribal area, Hog, following his orders, discovered the Dragon Nest Tribe along the southern smoke column.
However, later on, Simon and the others were busy with other matters, and even though it was just an infant Young Dragon, combined with a clan tribe of over a hundred people, their Bronze Level strength might not be enough to handle it. So they reported the dragon’s situation to Master Grom and didn’t pay much more attention.
In fact, during this time, the entire tribe was busy transporting and constructing. Nearby small micro tribes avoided moving away from this area. They were not very aware of Austin’s repeated war activities nearby and didn’t focus on the Dragon Nest Tribe, so they were unaware of the changes within the Dragon Nest Tribe over the past half-year.
Indeed, who would have thought a Young Dragon’s tribe could grow from seven people a year ago to thousands now? The Dark Elves, bound by common sense, naturally believed the Blue Young Dragon only had a clan of one or two hundred people.
And this also doomed the tragedy of their operation this time.
"That dragon just flew over. Lord Grom commands: bring back its head to present to him. You go gather some manpower, prepare a hundred, no, three hundred people, and bring along the Black Rhinoceros Horn."
Understanding the Blue Young Dragon’s strength, the Dark Elf conveyed Grom’s order to the two.
Just because of a faint unease in his heart, the Dark Elf decided to take more troops to ensure safety.
"Do we really need three hundred people to deal with just a Young Dragon..."
The Jackal Wolfman leader Simon was a bit puzzled but ultimately didn’t voice it and went down with Hog to assemble the army.
Meanwhile, the Dark Elf also prepared to return to the great hall to report to Leader Grom about taking troops out, but upon reaching the great hall, the surrounding hall guards informed him that the leader had already left, seemingly having received news from "over there" to head over.
The Dark Elf calculated in his mind that even with Leader Grom’s speed, it would take ten days to reach "there" from here. So he decided to lead the troop to eliminate the Young Dragon first.
In this primitive Beastman Tribe, mobilizing for a dragon hunt was not a quick affair. At least with the primal social structure of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, the initial preparations alone took quite some effort.
By the time the Dark Elf led a group of Beastmen away from the tribe heading south, it was already the next day.
....
Meanwhile, within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Rodney, during the last cold winter when the Jackal Wolf People attacked your tribe, weren’t there any signs?"
Returning from the Jackal Wolfman Tribe to the nest, Austin, wary of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s strength, ultimately decided not to act rashly and called Rodney over for inquiries while training the three major armies created under his command.
In the last cold winter, the small tribe Rodney established with Quik’s assistance was crushed by the Jackal Wolfman Tribe. They fled to the Dragon Nest Tribe and were defeated by the Kobolds during their attempt to break through the Dragon Nest Tribe, were captured, and eventually absorbed into the Dragon Nest Tribe’s system.
"No, we spent a cold winter there, and by the second cold winter, the Jackal Wolf People suddenly appeared and occupied the nearby hill. We thought we’d be fine, but suddenly the Jackal Wolf People attacked and defeated us."
Rodney didn’t have much regret about his small tribe being dismantled. Compared to his current life, being the leader of a micro tribe didn’t seem that great.
But he knew little about the Jackal Wolfman Tribe that defeated him and his people.
Under Austin’s persistent inquiries, it turned out that before creating his micro tribe, Rodney was a member of a Great Tribe, and after that tribe was destroyed by enemies, he snatched an axe amidst the chaos and escaped. He met the Fox-faced Man Quik while wandering in the forest, and together they established that micro tribe of twenty or thirty people, peacefully passing the first year.
Austin showed some interest in Rodney’s original Great Tribe, but Rodney knew little. In fact, Beastmen tend to have simpler thinking and live day by day, rarely taking the initiative to understand their environment or other things.
What intrigued Austin was discovering that some large tribes in the Kawa Great Forest had interaction, and Rodney had followed teams to trading places among those tribes, though he couldn’t clearly remember the routes.
This surprised Austin. It turned out Beastmen didn’t just live by survival of the fittest but also traded and interacted. Ironically, he had been sweeping nearby small tribes without saying a word.
He wondered if it was possible to establish communication with the Jackal Wolfman Tribe and obtain copper ore peacefully.
Of course, it’s just a thought.
It’s not like he held a grudge over an arrow from the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
Aside from copper ore, the wealth of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe included something crucial: a Breathing Technique that could evolve ordinary Beastmen towards an Extraordinary path.
That’s what Austin desired most.
If he could acquire that Breathing Technique and spread it in the Dragon Nest Tribe, the power within the Dragon Nest Tribe would fundamentally change, and that was more important than copper ore.
Because of this, even if the Jackal Wolfman Tribe wanted to make peace with the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin would eventually lead a force to crush the entire Jackal Wolfman Tribe and seize that Breathing Technique for the sake of benefits.

chapters.title: Chapter 94 - 92: Change of Mind?
chapters.content:
Chapter 94: Chapter 92: Change of Mind?
"Ultimately, it’s just a lack of strength..."
Faced with the situation in front of him, Austin became even more aware of this point.
If he had the power of an adult dragon, no, even just that of a young dragon, what would a tiny Jackal Wolfman Tribe have to be afraid of?
Or if his clan consisted of extraordinary professionals, their formidable strength would be enough to sweep away any vile creatures, then Austin probably could have breached the Jackal Wolfman Tribe that very day and begun large-scale refining of copper and iron industries.
"Strength, I need more materials infused with Magic Power!"
Austin could clearly feel it, the magic crystals he had previously consumed from the Ghost-headed Crocodile leader and the Blood Wolf leader had been completely digested, and his body was starting to feel a kind of hunger. If he could devour something containing a large amount of Magic Power, he might be able to grow again and unlock a third Talent Magic.
And if he could grow once more, his body and scale armor would elevate again, then his strength could fully reach Silver Level.
This growth speed, compared to an average giant dragon, undoubtedly seemed quite astonishing, because young dragons of the same age might still be in their first slumber, not yet awakened. Perhaps it was because Austin often used electricity to stimulate his body growth that his size, bigger than that of the same age, concealed his actual age, thus in the future, it wouldn’t shock people too much.
Where could there be a large amount of Magic-infused materials?
Austin suddenly thought of a place, the Spider Cave.
Back then, Rodney and the hunting team mistakenly entered that Spider Cave, were bitten by the spider magical beasts inside, and when Austin led the team to find antidotes in the cave, he conveniently took away the magic stones buried in the soil that contained trace amounts of Magic Power.
It was precisely because of those magic stones that Austin used the authority of his giant dragon talent to transform Quik and nine beastmen, successfully turning them into extraordinary lives, greatly enhancing the power of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Perhaps, it’s time to make a trip to the Spider Cave."
Compared to that time, Austin was obviously much stronger now. Although he hadn’t acquired new Talent Magic, the gusting winds from his wings were enough to dispel those pervasive corrosive poisonous mists.
Furthermore, with nine Dragon Vein Attendants and the fox-faced man Quik, who had two Magic Power items, this force should be sufficient to face the dangers inside that Spider Cave.
And the magic stones containing Magic Power buried in that Spider Cave might help him advance further; at the very least, they could be used to transform a large number of Dragon Vein Beastmen with extraordinary life.
Thinking of this, Austin planned to put aside the Jackal Wolfman Tribe matter for a while, first cleanse the Spider Cave, and then strengthen himself and his Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Go find Vini and draw fifty Minotaur Gun Shield Soldiers and two hundred spearmen from the three major corps, prepare to set off, and have Quik and the other Dragon Vein Attendants ready as well."
Resolute in his decision, Austin wasted no time, immediately giving orders to the Dragon Vein Attendant beside him.
"And also, bring all the collected pine oil with us."
Pine oil, also obtained from a plant Austin named "pine" in this world, was collected by cutting holes in the trunk of a pine tree with a stone axe, allowing the thick sap to slowly flow out, which was then collected in a container placed beneath the incision, becoming pine oil.
This sap from the pine tree, crystal clear and viscous, burned with a pine scent. When this yet-to-solidify pine oil was smeared on twisted bundles of straw and allowed to solidify, then lit up, the bundle of straw burned not only brighter but also longer.
The use of pine oil as fuel was naturally Austin’s idea, and even the method of extracting pine oil from pine trees was taught to the beastmen by Austin, as he had seen people extract pine oil from pine wood in his previous life.
The primary reason for extracting pine oil was for lighting.
During the previous cold winter, due to the blood wolf pack’s night raid, Austin made certain changes, such as sending a small squad of beastman militia on rotation every night to guard against the sudden enemy attack.
Moving around at night was inconvenient, with lighting being the simplest issue. Even though the vision of the beastmen was much better than that of ordinary humans, without firelight at night, it was difficult to see the enemy’s tracks.
However, using burning wood as a light source, the fire would be extinguished by the wind when taken out of the campfire, making it unsuitable for the illuminating needs of night patrols.
To solve this issue, torches made from pine oil appeared in Austin’s mind.
Austin remembered clearly the scene of exploring the Spider Cave for the first time; those spiders were creatures afraid of fire, so it was only natural not to forget to bring along the pyrotechnic pine oil.
"Yes, Your Highness."
The Dragon Vein Beastman respectfully answered, striding out quickly.
Shortly, the army Austin needed was drawn, gathered in the plaza, waiting for Austin to appear.
"This time, I want to completely clear out that Spider Cave. Quik, you set off with me. Vini, you and Rodney guard the tribe; yesterday, I went to scout the Jackal Wolfman Tribe in the north and got discovered by them. They may have been alerted, potentially causing trouble, so keep a closer eye and send more ratmen for reconnaissance."
Speaking of ratmen, Austin remembered sending a ratmen reconnaissance squad the previous day to explore the route to the northern Jackal Wolfman Tribe, and after a night’s time, they should have returned.
"By the way, have the ratmen reconnaissance squad sent out yesterday returned yet?"
Back then, Austin, using his aerial advantage, flew directly to the Jackal Wolfman Tribe for reconnaissance, while also sending the ratmen reconnaissance squad to explore a suitable campaign route on the ground.
With the aerial advantage, Austin returned that same day, while the ratmen were still exploring, as their speeds couldn’t be compared.
Since he decided to set aside the attack on the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, it was natural not to waste too many resources on it.
"Your Highness, part of them has already returned."
"Alright, tell them not to rush, be sure to avoid the activities of giant beasts, and also avoid being discovered by the Jackal Wolfman Tribe. There’s no hurry."
Originally, Austin intended to call them back, but thinking about possibly launching the assault on the Jackal Wolfman Tribe right after clearing the Spider Cave, it made sense to make additional preparations and gather more intelligence on the enemy.
Just as Austin was about to lead his troops to the Spider Cave to clear out those spider magical beasts, a ratman suddenly ran in hastily from outside the village, out of breath. Seeing Austin, his eyes lit up.
"Your Highness, Austin, Your Highness, there’s a beastman team coming towards our tribe from the Jackal Wolfman Tribe!"

chapters.title: Chapter 95 - 93 Ambush
chapters.content:
Chapter 95: Chapter 93 Ambush
Among the towering dense forest, the Dark Elf was leading a Beastman troop, slowly weaving through the massive trees. These Beastmen were generally robust, with a few particularly brawny bear people mixed in, larger than the other Jackal Wolf People.
These bear people held roles clearly akin to small leaders within the troop, even carrying iron weapons in their hands.
It’s quite remarkable, for Beastmen do not know how to forge iron. Iron weapons typically come from the Human World, obtained through invasion, plunder, or trade, making them extremely precious within the entire Kawa Great Forest. Yet, these bear people, as leaders of the Beastman troop, each wielded one.
And these iron weapons matched their owners perfectly, being mostly crude, large, and black, including huge iron hammers and wolf fang clubs. With the bear people’s massive frames swinging them, the force might even crush a Minotaur with a single blow.
The status of bear people in the Beastman race is quite high, even higher than Centaurs, because it’s said that a trace of blood bearing Extraordinary Abilities flows within them. Even without activating and entering the Domain of Extraordinary Professionals, their strength outmatches ordinary Beastmen by a fair margin.
No wonder the bear people held positions higher than ordinary Beastmen, becoming small leaders within the Beastman troop.
Even though there were only about three hundred Beastmen in such an elite group, it could undoubtedly hold its own against twice or even thrice that number of enemies.
"Hog, how far to the Dragon’s Nest?"
Looking at the undulating mountains ahead and the seemingly endless vast forest, the Dark Elf frowned slightly and asked Hog, the Jackal Wolfman leading the way beside him.
For some reason, upon entering this area, a faint sense of unease gripped the Dark Elf’s heart, as if something were about to happen, yet nothing did, as if it were just a figment of the imagination.
It must be overthinking, the Dark Elf thought to himself.
After all, it’s just a young orphan dragon with only about a hundred Clan members. Perhaps stronger than an average Giant Beast, but under their powerful troop, it would at most hold on a bit longer.
"About half a day’s journey remaining, perhaps."
Hog glanced around and provided a somewhat uncertain answer.
The last time he was here was when Austin lit the signal smoke pillar to attract people; the skyward pillar of smoke was visible nearly ten miles around. Adding that it’s been more than half a year, it’s normal for Hog not to remember clearly.
"Then let’s take a break here midway."
Having traveled such a long distance, the Dark Elf felt hungry as well, intending to camp here for a rest. After the Beastmen finished eating, they would proceed.
The individual strength of these Beastmen was quite formidable, with physical qualities stronger than the Dragon Nest Tribe, but in terms of discipline, they fell far short.
With the Dark Elf’s announcement to camp, the previously loose ranks quickly turned into chaotic dispersal. Some sat down, others wandered; there were those eating jerky and drinking water. Additionally, some Beastmen lit fires, and about a dozen, led by a bear person leader, entered the forest, hoping to hunt fresh food or find edible fruits.
The Beastman troop, now dispersed into complete disarray, had no sense of security or awareness of defense, with only the Dark Elf occasionally eyeing the surrounding jungle for any signs of danger.
This wasn’t unusual since even during wars among large tribes in Kawa Great Forest, the combat was primal, resembling battles of primitive hordes, lacking tactics or command. Everyone just followed powerful leaders forward, either killing enemies or being killed.
The Dark Elf’s vigilance was merely due to concerns about potential Giant Beast assaults within the forest.
After resting for about an hour, the scattered Beastmen had finished eating most of their provisions, and the campfires had been stoked several times.
"What’s going on? Why hasn’t that hunting party returned yet?"
The Dark Elf furrowed his brow. While foraging for food during marching wasn’t forbidden—since the required food for a campaign couldn’t be fully carried—suiting up for hunting or gathering fruits during camp was necessary to supplement supplies.
Take the Dark Elf’s group, for instance; they carried just two or three pieces of jerky, while the more impoverished brought only some tubers, enough for just one meal. Supplementing food while camping, then receiving more rations upon breaching that Blue Dragon’s lair, was naturally expected.
The Beastman troop’s outings during camping had practically become an unwritten rule; nonetheless, since they were on a march, the Beastmen hunting or foraging wouldn’t typically be delayed too long before regrouping.
But now, why haven’t they returned after so long?
"Milord, perhaps they encountered some formidable prey. Let’s wait a bit more,"
Hog advised from the side.
The Dark Elf gave no definitive response. For some reason, a sudden irritability rose within him.
He rose to his feet, pacing the clearing, frowning occasionally at the outer sky and the green overgrown forest without a single gap.
Upon the fifth loop around, a sudden chilling sense jolted his mind.
"Not good, there’s danger, quickly get up and prepare for battle!"
Finally, he understood what felt wrong.
No matter how perilous the forest, the occasional sound of insects and birdsong would emerge.
But now, everything was too silent!
It was deathly still, devoid of any sound, as if something terrifying lurked in the darkness, with its ominous threat causing even birds and insects to tremble in fear, refusing to utter a sound.
The Dark Elf abruptly grasped the longbow on his back, flipping and fastening it tightly in his hand, attentively scanning the surroundings.
At that moment, the scattered Beastman troop around the campfire looked bewildered. Many instinctively stood up, yet knew not what transpired.
It was at this moment that
swish, swish, swish....
An unending whistle through the air resounded as arrows swiftly sliced the air from above, raining down upon the Beastmen in the clearing. Arrows fell like locusts, dense as a downpour, instantly enveloping the area where the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s Beastmen stood.
This rain of arrows descended with such suddenness and speed that before the Beastmen of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe could react, the arrows pierced through the air, immediately penetrating their bodies, spilling crimson sprays of blood. Immediately, twenty to thirty were struck, crashing heavily to the ground, their fates unknown.
"Enemy attack! Quickly hide!"
Only now did the Beastmen of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe scream in fright, scattering in panic like headless flies, rushing in all directions.

chapters.title: Chapter 96 - 94: Defeat
chapters.content:
Chapter 96: Chapter 94: Defeat
The sudden downpour of arrows caught the Jackal Wolfman Tribe off guard, and under the deadly rain, the Beastmen panicked, scattering in all directions.
"Don’t panic, hide behind the trees!"
The Dark Elf spun into the air, turning the longbow, deflecting an arrow that shot towards him, and swiftly darted like an agile rabbit behind a nearby large tree.
Although the sudden attack shattered the morale of the Beastmen of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, there were many elite fighters among them. Perhaps accustomed to such wars, the death of their comrades did not cause them to lose their minds, and they quickly sought cover.
However, just when the Beastmen were scattered everywhere, the rain of arrows suddenly ceased.
Simultaneously,
"Charge! Attack!"
From within the jungle, a minotaur army numbering over a hundred suddenly charged out, each holding a long spear and wooden shield, forming a neat formation as they advanced.
The Jackal Wolfman Tribe, who had not been alert, finally paid the price for their negligence.
At that moment, the Beastmen of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, still shaken by the arrow attack, were standing scattered everywhere. Some had even dropped their wooden spears to the ground, and with the sudden charge of the Minotaur army, the Beastmen hadn’t had time to react before the Minotaurs were upon them.
Were it any other tribe, first being demoralized by the arrow rain, then facing the torrent-like charge of the Minotaur army, they would have likely been in full collapse by now.
But the Jackal Wolfman Tribe was clearly not an ordinary tribe, and the Beastmen in this expedition were not ordinary either.
Several fierce Grey Bear warriors immediately charged toward the Minotaur army, wielding metal weapons, with the seasoned veterans of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe following closely behind, forming groups and rushing to the front.
Whoosh whoosh whoosh!
"Crush them under Lord Kam’s mighty hammer!"
A brawny Grey Bear warrior swung a colossal iron hammer with a whirring wind, accompanied by furious roars, the hammer, with the weight of a thousand pounds, crashed towards the charging Minotaur army.
Thud thud thud!
The iron hammer smashed into the wooden shields raised by the Minotaurs, a series of muffled thuds resounded, as the shields splintered, and those Minotaurs behind were sent reeling by the tremendous force, their arms broken, bodies almost launched into the air, causing a depression in the previously straight Minotaur battle line.
Just one swing of the hammer severely injured multiple Minotaurs, rendering them combat ineffective. If not for the collective bearing of the shields, one or two Minotaurs might have been killed on the spot.
Yet, the Grey Bear warrior’s ferocity only extended so far. After swinging with full force, he fell into a state of exertion, with neither new strength nor agility left.
Simultaneously, long spears pierced through the air, driving towards his massive body.
Thwack thwack thwack...
The sharp long spears penetrated thick fur and embedded into flesh, with crimson blood splattering forth, and searing pain surged like a tidal wave, overwhelming the Grey Bear warrior’s senses in a berserk frenzy.
"Roar!!!"
With a furious roar, the Grey Bear warrior swept the heavy iron hammer wildly, splintering the spears stuck in his body in midair.
Without giving him time to retaliate further, more spears shot forth like venomous snakes, quickly penetrating his body, the array of long spears lifting his huge form into the air.
This skirmish lasted only moments, and the elite leader among the Beastmen was overwhelmed by the Minotaur charge, either injured or dead, while the rest had no chance to resist.
The thrusting spears were shielded away, and under the terrifying group assault, one Beastman after another was flung away, almost leading to a complete rout.
Side by side with those on the front lines being scattered in combat, the rest, who hesitated to join, lost heart and fled into the forests.
Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen were fleeing everywhere, while only a small number remained, resisting in futility against the Minotaur charge.
The abrupt arrow attack to the shield and spear corps breaking their lines took less than a minute, yet left the Dark Elves agonized by the chaos.
"Don’t run! Damn it! Get back to fighting the enemy!"
The Dark General grabbed a retreating Beastman, tossing him back into the fray.
Yet intercepting only one or two made little difference, as continued attacks completely shattered morale across the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
In war, sustaining morale is crucial, as it was for Austin in ancient times, much like the Beastmen battles in this world’s primeval forests.
Ignoring the Dark Elf’s commands, the Beastmen scattered in the chaos,
And then,
"For His Highness Austin!"
Loud shouts echoed from left and right, as two new forces emerged from the underbrush, advancing upon the scattered Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen.
"Damn it!"
Seeing their ranks split and enemies swarming in, the Dark Elf no longer intended to remain and fight, immediately turning to flee.
As for Simon Hogg and others trapped at the center, they were left to their fate.
But only after a few steps, a sudden magic burst rose below him.
"What?!!!"
The Dark Elf was alarmed but responded swiftly, rolling to avoid the spot he stood upon.
Meanwhile, massive black vines burst from the ground, intertwining at a rapid pace.
"Damn!"
The fleeing Dark Elf cursed as he glimpsed the ensnaring vines, narrowly escaping capture.
Next moment, as he darted up, leaping nimbly in mid-air, he deftly drew an arrow, targeting below.
Locating the target, he drew, aimed, releasing in one fluid motion.
Mid-air he was, already aiming at the fox-faced Quik who had triggered the Vine Technique.
At that moment, Quik had just finished casting the vine spell from a magical ring, standing exposed. The drawn bow was zeroed in on him from above.

chapters.title: Chapter 97 - 95: The Warrior Who Challenged the Giant Dragon
chapters.content:
Chapter 97: Chapter 95: The Warrior Who Challenged the Giant Dragon
A series of fluid actions transitioned seamlessly from the ground to the air, the sharp arrow on the string already emitting a faint magical glow, poised to kill the foolish fox-faced man in an instant.
The Dark Elf showed a sinister smile, never had prey escaped the lock of his sharp arrows.
The wind moved.
He liked the feeling when the wind moved, at that moment, following the current in the air, he seemed to have already seen the destiny of the fox-face man, shot through the head, as he prepared to release the fully drawn bowstring.
The next moment,
Swish!!!
Suddenly, the sky above the Dark Elf darkened, the daylight obscured, as an immensely vast shadow enveloped the sky, sweeping through with a massive gust, creating a rustling sound as it whisked past the leaves.
What?!!!
The Dark Elf, startled, sharply turned his head to the sky, only to see an enormous claw descending from the sky, covering his view, accompanied by a powerful gale and an oppressive force rushing straight down towards him!
Within a fraction of a second, as his body still soared high, hands drawing the bowstring, before he could react, the massive claw swatted him away like swatting a fly, flinging him backward.
Crash!
The Dark Elf felt as if a wall had slammed into him, a surging force flooded his body, sending him crashing to the ground like a cannonball, instantly shattering a huge tree, the impact creating a crater as the surrounding soil collapsed inward.
As the dust settled, the Dark Elf lay distorted in the crater, staring blankly at the sky, his limbs twitching involuntarily...
With disdain, Austin descended from the sky, the torrents stirred by his wings whipped up a whirlwind in the forest, the surrounding branches and leaves bowing in surrender in a single direction.
The terrifying dragon presence descended from the sky, sweeping through like tidal waves, as Minotaur and other Dragon Nest Beastmen cheered loudly, their eyes filled with fanaticism.
Meanwhile, under the encirclement of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, the Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen who were fiercely resisting suddenly paused their battle, staring blankly at the blue dragon in the sky.
"Insects, surrender, or die!"
A deep voice echoed through heaven and earth, carrying a visible pressure in the air that seemed to resonate in every corner of space, the immense voice rumbling like thunder in their ears, an unrivaled pressure engulfing the heart of every beastman.
"Long live His Highness Austin!"
The Dragon Nest Beastmen, thoroughly brainwashed, became more fanatical, raising a thunderous cheer.
In contrast, the Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen, already at their lowest point, had completely abandoned their wooden spears, trembling in terror on the ground.
Meanwhile, amidst the Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen who were resisting a moment ago, the Jackal Wolfman Leader Simon looked at his companions who had completely lost their fighting spirit, facing Austin.
With Austin’s appearance, as the Dark Elf was casually swatted away, there was no longer any resistance from the beastmen present,
They were now utterly surrounded by the Dragon Nest Tribe beastmen, their escaped companions mostly captured, leaving them with no escape at all.
The surroundings fell silent.
Simon, pale-faced, took a deep breath, his burly body, with a contorted face gradually calming down, spoke slowly to Austin:
"Blue Dragon, it’s common for warriors from tribes to submit to stronger warriors, and I also know that facing you, I have no chance of winning."
Simon, his beard bristling, veins bulging on his forehead, roared out with almost his last strength,
"But I, Simon of the Blood Claw Tribe... will never yield!"
As the last word fell, the aura within Simon burst forth, his fur rising in the surging atmosphere, his resolute determination reaching its peak.
With unwavering momentum, Simon, veins bulging, leapt up, the giant axe tightly gripped in his hands glowing with a faint white brilliance, as if moonlight filled the sky, carrying an infinitely sharp essence that slashed towards Austin, tearing through space.
The momentum of his axe upward, like a fearless warrior waging against divine demons for freedom!
All the orcs present, even those of the Dragon Nest Tribe, were momentarily awed by the indomitable spirit of the Jackal Wolfman Leader Simon, hearts swelling with endless admiration.
However, amidst hundreds of admiring gazes, when Simon’s battle-axe rose with the tearing air, carrying the spirit as if he could cleave anything in front into halves, rising into the sky,
Suddenly, a blur flashed in the air.
Snap!
The indistinct blur flitted through the air as inconspicuously as swatting a mosquito.
The next moment, Simon followed the Dark Elf’s fate, like a missile smashed at an angle, crashing through a tree and then slamming to the ground.
As the dust settled, Simon lay limp, sprawled in a sunken pit, limbs trembling,
dejected beyond hope.
"Anyone else?"
Articulated slowly, the ancient and solemn voice sounded like thunder rattling in their brains.
Looking at the massive shadow above, the sky’s sharp-edged, formidable dragon head, the terrifying dragon presence of the blue dragon sweeping over.
Then at the once fierce now despondent Jackal Wolfman Leader Simon lying in despair.
On-site, silence pervaded.
...
A war initiated by the Jackal Wolfman Tribe’s "invasion" ended in their overwhelming defeat.
Initially spotted by the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Ratman scouts, they blundered into Austin’s ambush, systematically struck by layered tactics and the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s army capabilities, easily overwhelming the Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
Furthermore, with the formation of a Centaur cavalry force, the fleeing Jackal Wolfman Tribe Beastmen during the war were not spared from the pursuit, all swept up and captured by the outer Centaur cavalry.
Returning in great victory, Austin had no intention of relaxing.
The routed forces before him were likely just vanguard troops; the main base of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe still lay there, its hidden strength not to be underestimated. Before understanding the actual conditions of the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, Austin wouldn’t relax for a moment.
Confined the captured beastmen in a POW camp, while higher-ranking leaders were brought out for interrogation.
Yet the intelligence Austin received next was rather grim.

chapters.title: Chapter 98 - 96 Breathing Technique
chapters.content:
Chapter 98: Chapter 96 Breathing Technique
"Silver-grade peak, nearly at a gold level, is it?"
In the spacious City Hall, Austin’s massive figure sat cross-legged on the platform, his brows furrowed.
Having captured all the prisoners, naturally he had to interrogate them for information about their tribe. The ordinary beastmen only knew that their tribe was called the Blood Claw Tribe, a very large super tribe with countless strong companions within. The outpost to the north was established by the Blood Claw Tribe, dispersing some of its members there.
From the mouth of that dark elf named Adinlek, Austin further learned that the tribe entrenched in the north, a branch of the Blood Claw Tribe, was temporarily managed by a Grizzly-man leader named Grom, whose strength had reached the silver-grade peak, approaching the gold level.
This disparity of one tier in strength meant that even Austin, when facing Grom, would probably have to flee in embarrassment.
Given the current level of the Dragon Nest Tribe, with a certain cost, they could defeat that Blood Claw branch. Even with a casualty rate of seventy to eighty percent to exhaust the strength of that Grizzly-man leader named Grom, perhaps Austin could still kill him.
Extraordinary professionals are not invincible either,
Ordinary bronze-level extraordinary professionals become exhausted dealing with a hundred or so peasants, silver ones last longer, able to handle a level of a thousand, but the Dragon Nest beastmen under Austin are not ordinary beastmen; not only do they have nine Dragon Vein Attendants, but also Quik, a pseudo-mage, and the cooperation among Dragon Nest beastmen in the entire Kawa Great Forest is top-notch.
With such strength, employing 1,400 beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe, without regard to life or death, to besiege that Grizzly-man leader, there is truly an eighty to ninety percent chance of exhausting his strength, allowing Austin to come forward at the end to snatch his life.
But this cost is too great!
Such a price-blind siege would result in at least ninety percent casualties of the Dragon Nest beastmen. Even if Austin went first to pin down, with the Dragon Nest beastmen as the main force in the siege, the losses would definitely not be insignificant.
The beastmen painstakingly accumulated would be consumed in this kind of battle, which is definitely not what Austin wants.
Moreover, if just the leader of a Blood Claw Tribe branch has peak silver strength, then what kind of behemoth is the actual Blood Claw Tribe?
"Forget it, if worse comes to worst, I’ll just move. At that time, I’ll take the clan to hide in some deep mountains or forests, with such a vast Kawa Great Forest, what can the so-called Blood Claw Tribe do to me?"
Austin pondered secretly,
Of course, he was just thinking.
Now the Dragon Nest Tribe has more than 1,400 people, having cleared nearly 400 acres of land. How could the established foundation nearby be easily abandoned? Once they move, much would have to start over.
Precisely because of this, unless absolutely necessary, Austin would never easily take the clan to flee in disgrace.
"Dark elf, according to you, if the Blood Claw Tribe is so far from here, why extend their tentacles here?"
Facing the dark elf, hands and feet bound and half-kneeling, Austin’s deep voice echoed in the hall.
"I do not know about this matter, we act on orders, the real purpose perhaps only the Grizzly-man leader Grom knows a bit."
"So the person in charge is a Grizzly-man leader named Grom? Where is he now?"
"Before dispatching troops, the guard informed me that Lord Grom received news from headquarters and went back once, even at the fastest, it’ll take more than ten days to return."
In answering Austin’s questions, the dark elf revealed everything he knew, which piqued Austin’s curiosity.
Through further inquiry, he learned that the dark elf came from a certain underworld, subscribing to the law of the jungle. Surrendering to a stronger enemy wasn’t surprising.
The dark elf’s presence in the Blood Claw Tribe was because he’d been captured in a skirmish and had to serve a new master.
This time, Austin defeated him, and the dark elf didn’t reject serving Austin.
Whether out of fear or cowardice, the dark elf’s attitude saved Austin a lot of trouble.
"Dark elf, do you know any breathing techniques?"
From the high platform, Austin asked the final question in a deep voice.
"Breathing technique?"
The dark elf was momentarily surprised, but quickly realizing Austin’s intent, he didn’t hide anything and continued:
"Mighty His Highness Blue Dragon, I indeed know a breathing technique that can lead beastmen to an extraordinary path, but it belongs to the dark races’ techniques and will inevitably taint with a dark aura upon use."
"What happens if it taints with a dark aura?"
Upon hearing this, the excitement that bubbled in Austin swiftly quelled, as the breathing technique was naturally intended for the clan below, but the term dark aura didn’t evoke good thoughts.
"Uh, noble His Highness Blue Dragon, it’s not a huge issue. After tainting with a dark aura, they become more perceptive at night but also slightly suppressed during the day. Moreover, those beastmen utilizing this breathing technique will automatically transform into dark creatures upon reaching the legendary stage."
Fortunately, it wasn’t a significant issue, at least in emergencies, Austin didn’t mind this trivial matter.
At this moment, the dark elf added:
"Moreover, the breathing technique I possess is quite basic, with efficiency even lower than an ordinary technique."
"It doesn’t matter, I’ll assign five Dragon Vein Attendants to your command later. You understand what I mean, don’t you, dark elf?"
If the only trouble is bonus effects in darkness and attribute suppression during daytime, it indeed isn’t a big deal.
At least, with this, Dragon Vein Attendants embarking on the extraordinary path would gain advantages in night battles or dark environments.
Nevertheless, even so, Austin wouldn’t place all his bets on this.
"Willing to serve you, mighty His Highness Blue Dragon."
The dark elf half-kneeled on the ground, placing a hand on his chest to show allegiance.
This dark elf named Adinlek evidently had a deeper story; otherwise, why would a creature from the underworld end up in the surface world, serving a beastman tribe?
But regarding all this, Austin refrained from further questions, as long as he submitted and shared the breathing technique, that was sufficient; everything else could wait.
Yet, accomplishing anything with breathing techniques couldn’t occur in a short time, which is why Austin required other methods to enhance himself.
"Still more than ten days... I have no choice but to pay a visit to the Spider Cave."
Inwardly, Austin mumbled to himself.

chapters.title: Chapter 99 - 97 Magic Crystal
chapters.content:
Chapter 99: Chapter 97 Magic Crystal
Next day, inside the Spider Cave.
Whhoooosh!!!
Fierce flames swept through the cavern, mixed with a terrifying storm gale. The fire aided the wind’s power, and the wind boosted the fire’s strength, sweeping mightily through the air.
In the darkness, the spiders that originally surged like tides were caught in the massive flame storm, immediately curling up and losing the breath of life, as the flame storm swept through, a smell of roasted meat filled the air.
After a while, the intense flames finally subsided.
At this time, a shadow two to three meters tall, along with many figures, slowly appeared at the cave entrance.
"They should all be dead, shouldn’t they..."
Austin slowly retracted his wings, folding the membrane wings onto his back, gazing at the scorched and smoky scene before him, secretly pondering in his heart.
Austin didn’t know flame talent magic, nor could Quik’s red crystal demonic artifact produce flames sweeping through every corner of the cave like a storm; the spectacular earlier scene was only the result of the vast amounts of pine oil, dry wood kindling, and the turbulent storm gale created by Austin’s wings.
Though the method seemed a bit crude, the effect was indeed excellent.
At least upon entering this spider cave, those small spiders resembling a black tide had already lost signs of life; maybe there were survivors deeper inside, but if they dared to come over, a fire would suffice once more.
"Begin digging."
At Austin’s command, the beastmen behind him started bustling around, wielding stone shovels and stone axes, banging on the ground and walls. Whenever they knocked out a pebble-sized stone emanating a bluish glow, they carefully collected and placed it into baskets.
Without the spiders’ harassment, the beastmen could freely dig these glowing stones.
"Your Highness, this is your target for coming here, I never thought there really was a Magic Stone Vein here."
Following Austin, the dark elf who accompanied him gazed at the glowing stones being collected by the beastmen, eyes shimmering – like watching money.
He even couldn’t help but squat down and put his hand on them, stroking them.
Although the dark elf was recently subjugated, there were indeed few extraordinary ability users under Austin’s command, and his advantage in the dark cave became even greater, hence he was brought along.
"Oh, Adinlek, have you seen this kind of thing before?"
Though the Magic Stone was quite useful, enabling Austin to transform the beastmen’s biological bloodlines, he really wasn’t clear about these stones’ intrinsic nature.
In the inherited memories, there existed something called Magic Crystal, containing a high purity of magic power crystal, extremely rare worldwide, also precious collectibles of giant dragons.
Magic Crystal and Magic Beast Crystal Core were different; the former was produced naturally in certain veins, while the latter crystallized inside powerful magic beasts.
Moreover, the magic power within Magic Crystals was far larger and purer than what was in Magic Beast Crystal Cores.
Yet, compared to the inherited memories’ Magic Crystals, these magic stones were too far-reaching from those translucent, shimmering gems.
"Sub-Magic Stone, a derivative vein of Magic Crystal Mine; your Highness, there must be Magic Crystals deep within the cave!"
The dark elf spoke with utmost certainty:
"Your Highness, you wish to advance your realm by consuming substantial amounts of sub-magic stones, correct? However, for your current state, sub-magic stones are of no use, as the magic within is too little compared to the vast magic power within you – merely the size of a hair strand. Only true Magic Crystals could possibly shatter that wall of strength."
Austin’s eyes flickered momentarily; indeed, he felt the same after beastmen experiments.
Compared to the dragon’s body’s magic power, the amount of magic in a sub-magic stone was less than a fingernail’s size.
Sub-magic stones could trigger the beastmen’s extraordinary evolution path mostly due to that little bit of magic acting as an initiator, activating the dragon radiation transformation authority; therein lay not much magic power, and Austin was crystal clear about it.
"Alright then, the magic power in sub-magic stones is indeed too little."
Austin silently contemplated; although there might be dangers deeper within the cave, the problems ought to be minor.
With a team organized from the beastmen, instructing others to continue digging sub-magic stones, Austin led the beastman squad along with Quik Dark Elf and several dragon vein attendants into deeper cave exploration.
Even if, as the dark elf declared, these sub-magic stones weren’t quite useful for him, they could ignite the beastmen’s potential, and through Austin’s dragon radiation transformation, transform the beastmen into extraordinary life, thus the more, the better. Even if Austin himself didn’t use them, he could provide them to the clan beastmen; hence Austin parted with the majority of the beastmen to mine sub-magic stones in the cave’s passageway.
As for himself, he led the elite deeper into exploration; anyway the ordinary beastmen would likely just suffer needless casualties facing more formidable magical beasts.
With the progression of the team, firelight flickered on the walls, rugged and uneven, light and shadows crossed, and it seemed the spiders were frightened by that large fire and didn’t come out again.
One dragon and the group slowly pressed forward, and the deeper they delved, the cave’s shape became ever more bizarre, while Austin felt the surrounding rock layers contained more sub-magic stones increasingly.
"Adinlek, have you seen a cave produced with Magic Crystal veins?"
Being able to instantly identify sub-magic stones and ascertain Magic Crystals were deeper in the cave, the dark elf ought to have seen something similar before.
"Indeed, Your Highness, long ago in the Underworld, I once made a livelihood under an underground lord, and he happened to possess a Magic Crystal Vein."
"Oh, the Underworld...then your vein also had magical beasts inhabiting it?"
"That’s correct, Your Highness; wild Magic Crystal veins typically have innate powerful magical beast guardians, but once cleared away, there’s nothing much to worry about. Since this cave houses spiders, then the deepest entity should be akin to a Spider Empress or such spider magical beast."
Austin nodded slightly, without speaking.
Yet if truly arriving at the cave’s end, then the confrontation might involve not just the Spider Empress, but also those large spiders from before and numerous small spiders driven into the depths by the flames.
Soon enough, the space ahead suddenly brightened, becoming more spacious.
"Everyone, be careful."
Feeling the faint unease in the air, Austin’s steady voice echoed in the space.

chapters.title: Chapter 100 - 98: Spider Leader
chapters.content:
Chapter 100: Chapter 98: Spider Leader
As the view in front expanded, the dark blue light illuminated the entire space, revealing translucent crystals scattered at the end of the huge cavern, emitting this dark blue light, like crystallized air or enlarged snowflakes.
However, at this moment, the group of Beastmen had no intention to pay attention to these magical crystal ice formations, because as they entered the space, they saw huge shadows flickering between the magic crystals.
Hiss, hiss!
As soon as everyone appeared, they heard hisses from the darkness. Giant spiders leapt out from all corners, agilely extending their massive poisonous claws toward the group.
The enormous figures, each as tall as a Beastman, had fangs flashing with ominous light under the glowing illumination, sending gusts of dizzying, nauseating wind.
"Kill!"
Several guarding Beastmen immediately responded, forming a circle with them, brandishing their sharp long spears to pierce the darkness with precision.
Several large spiders collided directly with the sharp spearheads, getting pierced instantly, with their foul-smelling green blood splattering out. However, more large spiders followed closely behind, seemingly aiming to shred the group to pieces.
Bam bam bam!
In a critical moment, the Dragon Vein Attendants took action, swinging their stone shields loudly like walls, smashing several large spiders flat and sending them flying.
The Dragon Vein Attendants participating in this action had learned the Dark Elf Breathing Technique. Though the duration was short, they showed improved strength, wielding their heavy stone shields with ease.
Forming the core, the Dragon Vein Attendants blocked the front, while the Dragon’s Nest Beastmen attacked from behind, stabbing with long spears, forming an impenetrable defense line against the onrushing large spiders.
One by one, the large spiders leapt from the shadows, only to hit the sharp defensive line and suffer a head-smashing defeat.
Concurrently, the Dark Elves also drew their bows, firing arrows swiftly. The arrowheads gleamed faintly, coated with a thin layer of Fighting Qi, cutting through like sharp swords. An arrow pierced one large spider, continued its momentum, piercing the two spiders behind it before finally embedding in the rock layer.
At the same time, the Fox-faced Man Quik also raised his scepter, attempting to cast a Flame Burst Technique.
But Austin stopped him. Though Quik’s demonic artifacts could automatically recover Magic Power, it took time, and for now the Beastmen could hold their ground, saving the spells for strategic moments.
With the Beastmen forming a killing formation, along with the Dark Elves stealthily shooting from the side, the large spider swarm suffered heavy losses, their corpses piling up like a mountain.
"Could it really be just a group of mutated spiders occupying here without a ruling Lord?"
Seeing this scene, Austin felt a surge of doubt in his heart.
The attacking large spiders, though aggressive, were swiftly killed by the combined forces of the Dragon Vein Beastmen and ordinary Beastmen.
Moreover, so far, there was no sign of any superior Magic Beast appearing beyond the spiders.
"Could it really be that I’m overthinking?"
Seeing this scene, Austin felt a sense of suspicion rising within him.
Just as the spiders’ assault seemed to wane, looking like only a few remained.
Suddenly, an abrupt change occurred.
The remaining few large spiders emitted a green glow, their chest and abdomen inflating like balloons, and under tremendous jumping power, they leapt towards the Beastmen.
Watch out!
Austin felt a sudden rush of unease.
"Retreat quickly!"
However, before he finished speaking, those mutated spiders were already close, the Beastmen’s long spears were thrust out.
Boom! Boom! Boom!
The long spears thrust out, but didn’t pierce the spiders as before. As the spears touched the mutated spiders, they exploded, releasing a terrifying forceful shockwave.
The Beastmen in front were immediately blown away by the impact, only a few Dragon Vein Beastmen barely maintained their stance.
Yet, the worst was the poisonous green liquid erupting, splashing onto the Beastmen’s skin. Immediately, cries of pain echoed as they rolled on the ground, moaning loudly.
The Dragon Vein Beastmen fared better, at least having stone shields to block, but the liquid still seeped into their skin, causing a large swollen bruise.
Ordinary Beastmen fared worse; where the poison touched, blue veins spread like a spider web, burning like magma. Some hit directly by the green poison had their whole bodies turn blue-purple, gradually stiffening, seemingly dying.
"Damn it!"
Austin was furious but had no time to spare.
Because at this moment, a huge shadow descended from above, hanging by a silk thread and crashing to the ground, stirring a cloud of dust.
The massive shadow, even bigger than Austin’s body, stood three meters tall, with limbs resembling the claws of a Demon God, menacing and terrifying.
"Hiss!!!"
A hiss that more resembled a mighty roar.
The entire cave roared with tidal waves, sending visible shockwaves rolling through.
The severely injured Beastman Clan gathered together despite their pain, clutching their wooden spears tightly.
"Fall back, leave the rest to me."
Austin stepped forward, shoving the Beastmen behind him, focusing his gaze on the towering creature.
It was an even larger spider, its armor glistening with a dark hue, on its shell, a face as fierce as a demon was etched, vivid and fierce, spreading its massive venomous fangs, roaring continuously at Austin.
"Dragon Vein Attendants, take everyone back, Adinlek, and Quik, be ready to support me."
Even just standing opposite it, a fierce aura hit Austin, realizing this Spider Leader’s power reached at least Silver level, with potentially toxic Talent Magic, making all actions risky for the Dragon Vein Attendants.
However, Silver or not, death is certain!
Roar!!!
A loud dragon roar, Austin unfurled his wings, electric snakes danced wildly in the sky, his massive body lunging at the shadow before him.

chapters.title: Chapter 101 - 99: Kill
chapters.content:
Chapter 101: Chapter 99: Kill
Boom!!!
The two Giant Beasts clashed inside the cave. Even though the space inside was vast, with ceilings reaching dozens of meters high, the entire cavern felt as if it were experiencing an earthquake.
It was a melee between Giant Beast and Giant Beast, with dust rising to the sky with every collision, causing the ground to tremble violently. Large chunks of rock fell from above, seemingly about to collapse.
Austin’s fierce teeth sank into the leg of the Spider Leader, with electric arcs sparking wildly all over his body, extending to the Spider Leader, causing it to convulse and paralyze.
The Spider Leader screamed in pain and fury, emitting a green mist, while its tail spewed white webs that entangled Austin’s huge body like steel cables.
The green poison mist was so toxic that it even corroded the rocks on the ground. Meanwhile, the white webs were not only strong but also sticky, gradually putting Austin in a predicament.
The two Giant Beasts entangled together, rolling on the ground continuously, shattering rocks wherever they went, the earth trembling, and spider-web-like cracks spreading widely.
At the same time, blue electric light and green poison mist, two types of Extraordinary Energy, began to gather in their respective bodies’ spaces, colliding and merging.
The several-meter tall figures tangled in combat, with ordinary Beastmen and Dragon Vein Attendants unable to assist, having to constantly retreat.
The Dark Elf drew the bow and shot swiftly, but even with arrows imbued with Fighting Qi, they could only penetrate half an inch into the Spider Leader’s shell, driving it mad but causing little actual damage.
"Quik, use Flame Burst Technique quickly!"
The Dark Elf saw the Spider Leader’s webs continuously shoot out, almost wrapping Austin entirely, and quickly shouted to the Fox-faced Man Quik beside him.
"Okay!"
With this shout from the Dark Elf, Quik understood his intention: use flames to burn those obstructive webs.
Seeing Austin entangled by the webs, Quik immediately raised the Red Crystal Staff.
Visible red light gathered under the staff’s absorption, forming circles of visible halos in the air, with intense Fire Attribute Magic Power accumulating, generating terrifying heat.
Hoo, Hoo, Hoo!
A huge fireball suddenly conjured, the air faintly twisting with it, with terrifying heat blasting toward the two Giant Beasts fighting fiercely.
But compared to its peak power, Quik deliberately adjusted the power of the Flame Burst Technique lower, and at this power level, with Austin’s inherent Magic Resistance, he should be fine.
Boom!
The enormous fireball streaked out, crashing onto Austin, who was battling the Spider Leader, instantly causing a fierce explosion, flames sweeping outward, and the webs ignited in a roaring blaze.
"Hiss!!!"
Perhaps due to natural suppression, the fire greatly harmed the Spider Leader. It cried harshly and retreated a bit, the poison sacs within its body spraying a large amount of poison mist, trying to extinguish the flames.
"Quik, well done, prepare to use Vine Technique!"
As it sprayed poison mist, the Spider Leader released Austin, and the intense flames burned off the webs on Austin’s body. Seizing this opportunity, he flapped his wings, broke free from the entanglement, and soared up.
Quik’s Flame Burst Technique didn’t heavily damage Austin with his inherent Dragon Race strong Magic Resistance, and the flames burned off the sticky white webs on him, freeing him from restraint.
While the space here was not small, inside, movement was ultimately inconvenient, so Austin didn’t initially consider flying to suppress, instead diving into melee, unintentionally getting entangled with the Spider Leader, almost being enveloped by webs.
With a tremble, Austin naturally moved away.
Boom! Boom! Boom!
With too much force, Austin’s entire body collided with the ceiling rocks, his iron wings flapping, breaking apart the rocks like tofu, making rubble crumble.
At this moment, hearing Austin’s command, Quik once again raised the ring at hand, aiming at the Spider Leader ahead.
Buzz!!!
Visible waves emanated from the ring’s vibration, spreading in the surrounding space, with intangible magic gathering and shifting.
Suddenly, below the Spider Leader still spraying poison mist, unexpectedly black tree root-sized vines burst from the ground like lively venomous snakes entwining, tightly binding the Spider Leader.
"Hiss!!!"
Suddenly bound, the Spider Leader sensed something amiss, cried out sharply, its piercing sound creating visible sound waves, causing Quik to stagger, almost falling backward, and threatening to unravel the vine Technique maintained through the ring.
Just at this critical moment,
Whoosh!
A point of cold light suddenly swept through the air like lightning, cutting through the void, piercing into the mouth of the Spider Leader, directly interrupting its cries. The arrow shaft along with the Spider Leader’s mouth penetrated deeply into its body, green liquid spraying out.
Meanwhile, within the entire space, a vast power of Magic Power began to sweep.
Only to see Austin above spreading his wings, electric snakes dancing wildly in the air, with magic guiding, an extremely powerful force brewed in the air.
The Spider Leader sensed danger, struggling continuously, breaking vines in its mad struggle, on the verge of breaking free.
But just at this moment, Austin’s Talent Magic was finally ready.
Thunder Strike Technique!
Boom!!!
In the earth-shattering sound, it was as if thunder cracked on a clear day, a lightning bolt as thick as a barrel shattered the air, descending from the sky, striking the Spider Leader.
Thousands of volts of electricity discharged instantly, producing large amounts of light and heat, bringing tremendous destructive power, countless electric snakes splitting and dancing wildly, sweeping the void, electric arcs penetrating the rock, pieces of debris exploding and soaring.
In this intense electric light, both Quik and the Dark Elf couldn’t help but retreat.
Within moments, as the electric light dispersed, smoke billowed around, and as the smoke slowly cleared, the charred body of the Spider Leader gradually emitted smoke, dissipating into the air, exuding an aromatic scent.
Clatter!
Austin retracted his wings, landing from high above, tearing the Spider Leader’s skull open with two giant claws.
Sadly though, this Spider Leader hadn’t formed a Magic Beast Crystal Core within.
"Such a pity..."
Austin sighed gently, but soon tossed aside that little regret.
Because the more important harvest was already within reach, namely the abundant Natural Magic Crystal filling the cavern!

chapters.title: Chapter 102 - 100: The 3rd Talent Magic
chapters.content:
Chapter 102: Chapter 100: The 3rd Talent Magic
Although Austin couldn’t find a Magic Beast Crystal Core on the body of the Spider Leader, it doesn’t mean that the body is useless. As a powerful Magic Beast of Silver Level, its shell is as hard as copper and iron. Even if a regular Beastman used a wooden spear with all their might here, it wouldn’t do any harm. That’s why Austin asked the Beastmen to step back.
If this Spider Leader’s body were made into Shield Armor and its sharp limbs and tail tip attached to a wooden spear, the equipment produced would be no less than equipment made of copper and iron—perhaps even superior.
These materials from Magic Beasts are specifically acquired for making weapons in the Human World. However, Austin doesn’t possess similar knowledge, so he can only make use of its durability attributes. If he could meet a Professional like an Enchanter, these materials could already be used to create Extraordinary Weapons.
After defeating the Spider Leader, there is no longer any danger within the cave. The magic stones acquired here can continuously enhance the Clan Beastmen, upgrading them to the Extraordinary species. This is very significant for the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
Upon discovering the cave’s value, Austin’s determination not to relocate increased further.
"However, speaking of which, after the Dragon Vein Transformation, the Dragon Vein Attendants’ appetite has greatly increased. Each individual basically consumes over ten pounds of meat daily. Major transformations for the Beastmen can’t be done just yet; otherwise, we can’t supply the food. It seems we can only first transform a guard squad of thirty people."
Although cleaning the Spider Cave provides enough Sub-Magic Stones to transform the entire Tribe population, greatly enhancing the Dragon Nest Division’s strength.
Such transformations would exhaust the Tribe’s resources to support so many Extraordinary Beastmen, especially since Austin’s plan for the Dragon Nest Tribe’s future emphasizes an elite policy, rather than everyone becoming like dragons.
Focusing on a large base of Beastmen, promoting the Breathing Technique, selecting the excellent ones for Dragon Vein Transformation, and channeling a certain amount of resources to the elites is key for further strengthening, ensuring the Dragon Nest Tribe doesn’t become a burden.
"Let’s deal with these matters later."
After killing the Spider Leader, many thoughts arose in Austin’s mind, but he quickly set them aside.
"Take good care of the injured, hurry and find antidote plants for the poisoned, arrange for the deceased, and tidy up here."
After providing post-battle instructions to the subordinate Beastmen, Austin turned his focus back to the Magic Crystals in front of him, as clean as ice shards on the rock layers.
"A very powerful Magic Power. With these, I can absolutely advance further before Grom returns!"
...
Several days later, the sky was gloomy, covered with dark clouds. Lightning flashed and thunder roared as rain fell heavily.
A sudden downpour came quickly. Beastmen working on opening and planting fields in the grassland barely had time to run back to their villages and had to shelter from the rain under large trees.
Meanwhile, atop a mountain peak, Austin stood on the summit amidst howling winds and torrential rain, arcs of lightning tore the dim sky, piercing through the gloom.
Austin’s whole body appeared to endure an unimaginable, intense pain, as his eyes shot out red light. Arcs of lightning flashed from his mouth and nose, and dark red steam like molten lava.
"Roar!!"
Suddenly, Austin spread his wings and roared skyward.
Instantly, thunderbolts seemed to descend from the heavens, creating a rumbling sound that echoed miles away, striking Austin with terrifying power.
However, the thunderbolts containing immense power became tame like obedient sheep when they fell within Austin’s surrounding area. Arcs of lightning circled around Austin, the terrible power piercing the air, splitting the rock layers underneath inch by inch, causing stones to rise as if losing gravity, before finally being shattered by the rampaging electricity in the air.
Amidst blinding electric light, Austin slowly opened his eyes. The vast and boundless dragon’s aura swept out, and intangible pressure spread like waves, expanding in every direction.
"Electric current control...?"
Looking at the circles of electric light surrounding him, crackling sounds emanating, with thunderbolts flickering like tame sheep, stabbing and jumping around him, Austin pondered in thought.
Feeling the thunderbolts respond to his will as if moving his limbs, Austin’s expression changed, revealing a fierce grin.
Crackle!
Lightning tore through the air as thunder gathered together before his fierce maw, converging into a shapeshifting Thunderous Paste Ball suspended inside, consolidating terrible power.
In the next moment,
Whoosh!!!
A pillar of blue lightning shot out from Austin’s mouth, slicing through space, sweeping past the area in front.
The forest in the distance seemed to be cut by a smooth mirror, burning a void into the tree trunks, leaving the upper sections suspended in the air, as if the lightning laser was so fast that the trees didn’t realize they had been cut in half, falling to the ground the next moment with a rumbling sound.
The forest ahead was entirely cut through!
"Nice!"
It had been seven days since the Spider Cave clearing operation. During this time, Austin had consumed a large amount of natural Magic Crystals, replenishing his magic power to a level that he couldn’t immediately process, requiring pauses before consuming more Magic Crystals to increase his strength.
Using these abundant magic materials, Austin’s strength significantly increased. Not only had he grown larger, but his scales and claws were also tougher and sharper, and Austin had successfully unlocked a third Talent Magic.
Electric current control, or more aptly termed Thunder Control.
This Talent Magic is similar to the first Talent Magic according to gaming terminology, both falling into the category of passive skills.
With this Talent Magic unlocked, Austin could control electric currents at will, even directing the formidable thunderbolts of the world to produce powerful and terrifying forces.
The thunderbolt beam Austin expelled earlier was born from extremely condensed Thunder Liquid, forming into a line before discharging as a terribly powerful lightning beam.
Mastering this Talent Magic, Austin could essentially become a controlling force over the thunder above the nine heavens.
Of course, the extent of control is limited; the magnitude of magic within the body determines the scope over which thunder can be wielded.
The thunderbolt beam used earlier almost drained the majority of Austin’s internal magic.
But even so, this magnitude significantly enhances Austin’s current power.

chapters.title: Chapter 103 - 101 Dark Dragon Guard
chapters.content:
Chapter 103: Chapter 101 Dark Dragon Guard
After clearing out the Spider Cave, in the foreseeable future, Austin no longer needs to worry about the magic power resources needed for his own growth. Once this batch of Magic Crystals is fully absorbed, Austin will be able to consume more Magic Crystals to continue his evolution and growth.
