With the Sub-Magic Stones derived from the Magic Crystal Vein, Austin can significantly increase the number of Dragon Vein Beastmen. Of course, before transformation, they need a certain level of training and selection to maximize the potential of the transformation.
After Austin successfully activated his third Talent Magic, the return of Grom, the leader of the Blood Claw Tribe Branch and a nearly Gold Level Bear Man, was imminent. Austin planned to conquer the Blood Claw Tribe’s branch before his return and then ambush Grom with superior forces to completely annihilate him.
If everything goes smoothly, then it will be the cold winter season.
With the three-month freezing period of the cold winter season, and considering the branch tribe is several hundred miles away from the true headquarters, it would take at least half a year for the powerful Blood Claw Tribe to figure out what happened here. Even if they seek vengeance, it would take at least half a year, and given the action efficiency of the Beastman Tribe, a delay of one or two years wouldn’t be surprising.
With more than half a year’s time to develop, considering the growth level of the Dragon Nest Tribe, combined with the Dark Elf’s Breathing Technique and a large number of Natural Magic Crystals, both Austin and the Dragon Vein Beastmen will reach an incredibly powerful level.
According to the Dark Elf, the large tribe named Blood Claw Tribe has a population of only tens of thousands, and the Blood Claw Race Leader is about Gold Level. Moreover, the distance between them is not very close, so there’s a chance they can contend when the time comes.
Although it’s unclear why the Blood Claw Tribe chose to branch out to such a distant place to establish a tribe, if everything goes well, Austin wouldn’t fear even if the Blood Claw Race Leader came personally.
Of course, all of this is predicated on Austin first slaying the Bear Man Grom.
With the plan set, Austin flew back to the Dragon’s Nest to carry out the modification plans for the elite Beastmen.
The Breathing Technique provided by the Dark Elf has already been widely promoted among the three major legions. Time is always set aside for daily training, although its effectiveness hasn’t become visible yet, it has shown some benefits, at least the Beastman soldiers have gained a bit more strength.
Unfortunately, this Breathing Technique comes from the Dark Race, and its usage inevitably bears dark aura, which affects the Beastmen who enter the realm of Extraordinary through it. While they gain night-time advantages, they also acquire certain disadvantages.
However, as of now, this is the only Breathing Technique available, so Austin has no choice.
After cultivating the Breathing Technique, the transformed Beastmen are noticeably stronger than the first batch of Dragon Vein Attendants. The trace of dark aura absorbed into their bodies has also morphed through Austin’s modifications, turning their skin black and shrouding them in wisps of black mist; their black muscles appeared as hard as steel, making them appear like an army forged from steel from afar.
"Roar!!!"
On the plaza, a transformed Beastman with black mist surrounding him, as if burned with black fire, roared, sending airwaves sweeping in all directions like tides.
In the next moment, as he stomped on the ground, the Earth cracked open like a mirror, cobweb-like fractures spreading rapidly. Cut by the strong recoil, the transformed Beastman shot out like a black lightning bolt.
The black mist gathered on his fist, turning his entire arm ink-black, as if carrying massive force, punched at the giant rock in front.
Bang!
With a loud crash, the person-high boulder shattered instantly, sending rock shards scattering like bullets, smoke and dust enveloping the sky.
Whoa!
The surrounding onlookers, all Beastmen, shouted in shock, displaying emotions of great surprise.
Though a Beastman’s physique is much stronger than a human’s, it’s merely several degrees stronger. A regular Beastman’s body is still considered mortal, unable to smash rocks or crush the ground.
Yet, transformed ordinary comrades gained such tremendous power all at once; how could the surrounding normal Beastmen not be surprised?
"It’s not just because of the Breathing Technique, but because I’ve become stronger..."
From atop the high platform, Austin overlooked everything, silently speaking to himself.
After activating the third Talent Magic, Austin began to focus on modifying the selected elite Beastmen. During the modification process, he distinctly felt the bond between his bloodline and the clan becoming more intimate, even being able to vaguely feel the blood flow inside the transformed Beastmen.
When the magic power from the Sub-Magic Stones flowed into the transformed Beastmen, strands of magic power coursed through their blood vessels, not only unlocking the potential of their flesh and blood cells but also incorporating the trace of dark fighting qi refined through using the Breathing Technique within these few days. With the influence of Austin’s innate Authority as a Giant Dragon, they began undergoing an indescribable mutation, culminating in these transformed Beastmen.
"With such a dark aura saturating their whole bodies, henceforth they shall be called Dark Dragon Guards."
A total of twenty Dark Dragon Guards were created, chosen from among the elite of the three major legions.
Perhaps because of the Breathing Technique, these Dark Dragon Guards are a bit stronger than the previous Dragon Vein Attendants, all possessing Low Tier Bronze Level strength, and with such prowess combined, even Austin would have to exert considerable effort to destroy them all.
Moreover, possibly due to the boost in Austin’s strength, several among the nine Dragon Vein Attendants from before have broken through to a certain extent. Coupled with the Breathing Technique given by the Dark Elf, their strength is comparable to the Dark Dragon Guards.
In this way, nearly thirty Low Tier Bronze Extraordinary beings, coordinating with each other, can exert a considerable restraining effect, even if Grom is a powerful close-to-Gold Level leader.
In addition to Austin being of Silver Level battle power, he is quite confident in the mission to exterminate Grom.
"Next, I must completely destroy the Blood Claw Tribe Branch!"
Staring at the hard-won Dragon Nest Tribe below, a glint of cold light flashed in Austin’s eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 104 - 102 Dark Bull Cavalry
chapters.content:
Chapter 104: Chapter 102 Dark Bull Cavalry
From the very beginning, Austin coveted the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" in the north merely because there was a copper mine nearby. However, as time went on, the rapidly expanding "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" had already reached the point of threatening his own safety.
The invading forces led by the Dark Elves were defeated by Austin, yet the main strength of the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" remained, making it not so easy to deal with.
Fortunately, the gray bear chief Grom had left the tribe due to some affairs, otherwise, it would have been even more difficult to break through the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" at that time.
"With nearly thirty bronze low-tier modified Beastmen, this force should be enough to break through that tribe. No, I need another force capable of a frontal assault!"
To thoroughly break through a tribe with comparable population strength, Austin needed not only the organizational and disciplinary level of the army but also another unit capable of launching a frontal assault to shatter the morale of the enemy tribe.
He remembered the ten Cow Cavalry established initially to form a cavalry unit!
Several months ago, the Dragon Nest Tribe had broken through a Minotaur tribe, capturing nearly three hundred Minotaurs and obtaining a herd of wild oxen.
At that time, Austin had not yet recruited the Centaur Race, leaving a gap in cavalry, so he chose Beastmen to domesticate the wild oxen to form Cow Cavalry.
Unfortunately, the oxen’s burst power and endurance weren’t strong, other than the shock impact of the group charge, they had no other advantages. Coupled with the fact that at the time, there were no tribes needing the heavy cavalry of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin ended up only training ten Cow Cavalry, accumulating experience and leaving a seed for potential future situations.
When facing the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, these ten Cow Cavalry might not play a significant role, as they were composed of ordinary Beastmen and wild oxen.
But now, Austin was not lacking resources like Sub-Magic Stone, which might allow for some level of modification on the wild oxen and Cow Cavalry!
With this in mind, Austin got to work immediately.
He summoned the ten Cow Cavalry to the modification lab, using electric currents to stimulate the magic power within the Sub-Magic Stones and employing the natural "Authority" of the Giant Dragon to modify the wild oxen and Cow Cavalry Beastmen.
Although the Cow Cavalry was not one of the three major legions, they practiced the Dark Elf Breathing Technique, and post-modification, the Cow Cavalry Beastmen were not much different from ordinary Dark Dragon Guards.
However, the wild oxen as mounts had undergone a dramatic transformation in appearance and other aspects.
Perhaps due to their masters, the wild oxen as mounts were also stained with a trace of dark aura, their entire bodies turning gray-black. Perhaps due to the influence of Austin’s Giant Dragon "Authority," scales began to grow indistinctly on their skin, covering vulnerable areas like joints. The entire head of the ox became more angular, with two horns soaring upward, gleaming a dark and sharp luster.
After the transformation, the wild oxen appeared more fierce and primal, seemingly carrying traces of an ancient savage beast.
After modifying the wild oxen, the Cow Cavalry conducted a charge on the square, and the momentum was like a tank rampaging, overwhelming and terrifyingly mighty.
In the face of such formidable heavy cavalry, even an equal number of Dark Dragon Guards might be easily torn apart. This power was evidently beyond Austin’s expectations. Unless there were Silver Level Transcendents, in front of these modified Dark Bull Cavalry, they would likely only be torn apart.
Elated by this, Austin commenced tactical drills for coordinated combat, facilitating inter-unit cooperation to minimize losses while destroying the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe."
Hundreds of Beastman soldiers drilled, complemented by forty modified Beastman Transcendents, creating an earth-shattering momentum, enhancing the Dragon Nest Tribe’s overall strength significantly in comparison to just a few days prior.
The next day, the predicted date of gray bear chief Grom’s return was not far off. To be safe, Austin led the entire army of the Dragon Nest Tribe, nearly emptying the nest, to sweep towards the direction of the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe."
...
Inside the Blood Claw Tribe Branch.
"Get to work quickly, you lazy wretches!"
Despite the absence of the chief, various constructions continued within the village. On the work site, a sharp-eyed ratman overseer wielded a cracking whip, driving a team of Beastman slaves to hurry in digging trenches while cursing incessantly.
Under the scorching sun, the slaves on the work site were emaciated, drenched in sweat, while the malicious overseer’s eyes were as keen as a hawk’s, lashing out at any slight hint of loafing.
Under the scorching sun, the kobold Gary arduously carried a basket of dirt on his back, stumbling as he tried to haul it out of the trench, only to unexpectedly slip, tumbling into the trench with the basket dirt spilling down.
"Damned, you worthless slave, daring to slack off again!"
The sharp voice rang out, and the whip transformed into several afterimages, lashing down.
Smack! Smack!
In the crisp sounds, the fur on Gary’s body split open, revealing two whip marks that broke the skin and drew blood.
These two lashes nearly left him dizzy and faint, barely maintaining his balance to get up before collapsing again the next moment.
He had no strength left, had reached his limit.
Gary was originally a Beastman from a nearby small tribe, struggling daily to scrape by, barely making ends meet. Sometimes, when the yield was low, Gary would starve without a meal, although during harvest times, he managed to have a few decent meals with the tribe.
Such small tribes, surviving meal to meal, were plentiful throughout the Kawa Great Forest.
Under normal circumstances, the kobold Gary’s tribe would either be annexed or fade away in the Kawa Great Forest due to unviability, seldom developing smoothly as small tribes perished daily like strands of hair in the forest.
However, last year, a group of Jackal Wolf People settled on the hillside nearby from unknown origins. Initially, Gary’s tribe did not pay much attention, or even if they did, there was nothing they could do; their small tribe was far outmatched in population and quality compared to the newly relocated Jackal Wolfman Tribe.
But who would have known, once the Jackal Wolf People secured their footing, they instantly tore away their facades and began attacking and cleaning up tribes on all sides, creating a bloody massacre and countless small tribes were obliterated.
Gary’s small tribe was also annihilated under the Jackal Wolf People’s attack, and he was captured and became one of the slaves under the Jackal Wolfman Tribe, forced to endure various burdensome labors under the supervision of the ratman overseer.

chapters.title: Chapter 105 - 103: Raid
chapters.content:
Chapter 105: Chapter 103: Raid
Beastman slaves are not uncommon in the Kawa Great Forest. Whenever a tribe defeats and crushes an enemy tribe, they capture many prisoners.
Generally, these prisoners are either killed outright to save the tribe’s scarce food, or they are used as slaves, working themselves to death for their captors’ tribe.
Gary is one such Beastman slave, and the life of a Beastman slave typically doesn’t last more than a year.
Severely lacking food and excessive labor have drained every bit of strength from Gary, so much that he could no longer feel the whip striking his body.
"Am I going to die..."
The strength quickly drains from his body, and Gary feels as if his body has become like wood. Ever since being captured by this tribe and forced to build various structures, he has noticed that once a Beastman falls on the work site, they never stand up again.
In a way, this is good. It’s too exhausting; he just wants a good sleep, never to work so hard again...
His vision becomes blurry, and Gary’s consciousness slowly sinks into darkness.
"Damn, another one died!"
After several lashes with no response from the Kobold on the ground, the ratman overseer curses and retracts his whip.
"You two, come over here, throw him to Lord Grom’s mount as fodder."
This tribe also keeps a ferocious carnivorous beast, tamed by the Gray Bearman Beastman Grom as his daily mount, which consumes a large amount of meat daily, including the captives who can’t hold on and die on the construction site.
Two emaciated Beastman slaves come over, dragging Gary out of the pit and walking towards the tribe.
The Kobold Gary still has a faint trace of consciousness, but he no longer has the strength to resist, only able to watch helplessly as he steps closer to the abyss.
"Beast God above, your humble servant Gary prays to you..."
Mustering the last shred of his consciousness, knowing his fate, Gary prays in his heart, as the elders in the tribe have said that every Beastman returns to the embrace of the Beast God after death, to live a life free of hunger and war.
"What are you looking at, get to work quickly, or you’ll have no food today."
Casually determining the fate of a trivial life, the ratman overseer yells at the nearby Beastman slaves, cracking a whip at the one standing closest.
The emaciated Beastman slaves dare not speak, slowly dispersing.
Though yet another companion dies before their eyes, the Beastman soldiers of this tribe are not to be trifled with. There have been slave revolts in the past, but the captives here are mostly from small, scattered tribes captured by the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe," and any elite Beastman Transcendent from the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" can easily crush them single-handedly.
"Damn it, what a bastard, one day he’ll get what’s coming to him."
An ill-tempered Beastman captive curses under his breath.
Perhaps the Beastman’s cursing caught the attention of some ethereal Divine being, or perhaps it was something else, for before his voice faded.
Whoosh!!!
A massive shadow suddenly crashes from the sky, bringing with it a chilling gale. The arrogant ratman overseer has no time to react before he hears a splat, being smashed into pulp.
The surroundings fall into silence.
Staring blankly at the soft ground, at the gigantic stone embedded and stained with gore.
What is this?
"Enemy attack!!!"
The first boulder falls from the sky, followed by a second, a third... densely packed boulders plummet from the sky like meteors, crashing into various parts of the tribe, toppling buildings. The falling stones roll with terrifying force, killing and injuring those they contact.
Slaves on the construction site flee in panic, and the Beastmen within the tribe are terrified, faced with what seems like divine punishment.
"Gather, quickly gather! There’s an enemy!"
After all, it’s a branch of a Great Tribe, and elite fighters are present within. Under their hasty rallying, the Beastman army begins assembling within the tribe.
However, at this moment, through the dense forest, squads of troops charge from the woods outside, shouts shaking the heavens, sweeping in like a tsunami.
The Blood Claw Tribe Branch, still in chaos from the earlier stone rain, has its elite Beastmen only just starting to regroup the scattered comrades. The tribe’s outer walls are sparsely manned by scattered patrol guards, who are quickly overwhelmed by the advancing army.
Bang bang bang!!!
The formidable strength strikes the outer walls of the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe." The wooden walls soon collapse under the assault of the Dragon’s Nest army.
"Kill! Kill them!"
"For His Highness Austin!"
The black, orderly army surges through the breached walls into the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" with overwhelming momentum, the defending Beastmen unable to resist and are scattered, fleeing in all directions.
The outer "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" Beastmen can’t withstand the fierce assault from the Dragon Nest Tribe. Beastmen emerging from the buildings are easily scattered, the outer defenses shattered by the Dragon Nest Tribe as if cutting through soft wood.
Victory seems in sight.
But this easy advance doesn’t last long; with the hindrance of the outer Beastmen, the inner elite Beastmen finally gather enough troops and charge forward.
"Attack! For the glory of the Blood Claw! Deliver a painful blow to the vile enemy!"
The outer forces scattered, but the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" has no shortage of brave elite Beastmen, brandishing massive weapons and shouting as they rush at the Dragon’s Nest formation.
These elite Beastmen are mostly Bronze Level Transcendents, leading fierce and strong troops of Beastman soldiers.
With elite Beastman Transcendents at the fore, the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" finally mounts a makeshift resistance.
Boom!!!
As the two armies clash, blood sprays into the air. Despite the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" being caught off guard, then having their defenses breached by the Dragon Nest Tribe’s unstoppable advance, leaving their counterattack chaotic, the elite forces of the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" manage to fill the gap, struggling hard in the face of Dragon Nest Tribe’s coordinated formations.
Though the Dark Dragon Guard and Dragon Vein Attendants serve as vanguards, along with the well-coordinated Beastman army behind them, both sides are locked in a grueling battle, blood and limbs flying, the battlefield heavy with the stench of blood.

chapters.title: Chapter 106 - 104: War Demonic Artifact
chapters.content:
Chapter 106: Chapter 104: War Demonic Artifact
One by one, the orcs of the Dragon Nest Tribe charged into the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe" through the collapsed walls. The tightly-knit army formation, akin to a meat grinder, found itself embroiled in a bitter struggle within the inner area. The number of elite enemy orcs compensated for other shortcomings. If it weren’t for the adept cooperation and tight formation of the Dragon Nest orcs, they might have already been overturned by the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe."
Centaurs formed ranks, moving around the perimeter to unleash volleys of arrows. Arrows rained down one by one, killing enemy orcs and continuously striking at the morale of the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe."
Yet, even so, both sides were still locked in a fierce battle.
The Blood Claw Tribe was a large tribe located hundreds of miles to the north. Although it’s unclear why they diverted forces here to establish a base, they lacked neither food nor reinforcements. The tribe’s elite orcs were mostly Bronze Level Super Professionals, with many of middle and high tier. Even the ordinary orcs were exceptionally elite.
As for the Dragon Nest Tribe, the reformed Dark Dragon Guard and Dragon Vein Attendants barely had the strength of Bronze Low Tier. If it weren’t for the well-trained army and their ability to cooperate and triumph against stronger enemies, they might have already been routed by the "Jackal Wolfman Tribe."
Amid the bloody battle, orcs were pierced by long spears or had their limbs smashed by the massive weapons swung by Extraordinary orcs. The battle had entered a vicious hand-to-hand combat stage.
If there were no unexpected events, this brutal fighting would continue until one side could no longer hold out.
And given the current evenly matched situation between the two armies, with faith and discipline providing an absolute advantage, the Dragon Nest Tribe was destined to be the last to collapse.
However, when that time comes, the Dragon Nest Tribe might suffer heavy losses.
Austin naturally wouldn’t allow such a situation to occur. Even if they managed to attack the Blood Claw Tribe branch successfully, he would still have to face another formidable enemy.
That would be the ruler of this Blood Claw Tribe branch, Grom, who had not yet returned from the Blood Claw Tribe’s headquarters.
According to the Dark Elf, Grom’s strength was already close to the Gold Level standard.
If it were a solo fight, Austin certainly wouldn’t be able to defeat him alone. The Dragon Nest Tribe’s clan would have to exhaust his stamina or restrain him on the side, joining forces with Austin to encircle and kill him.
For this reason, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s clan must not suffer too many casualties.
Just as Austin in the dense forest at the rear was about to move out, suddenly,
Woo, woo, woo!
From the central hall of the tribe came the deep and resonant sound of a horn, as if a spirit of war emerged from the horizon, covering every corner of the world.
Upon hearing this horn, the orcs on the Blood Claw Tribe branch’s side were immediately invigorated, as if something in them was awakened by the unseen. Even the tribe’s most elite Extraordinary orcs became ferociously brave, as if each orc gained a few extra imposing forces from nowhere.
Instantly, the balance of war tipped toward the Blood Claw Tribe branch.
Facing the seemingly berserk Blood Claw Tribe orcs, the Dragon Nest Tribe struggled to hold on, but as the sound of the enemy’s horn echoed across the sky, they couldn’t help showing signs of defeat.
"Is this... a War Demonic Artifact? Hmph!"
In the dense forest behind the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin, initially preparing to step onto the battlefield, was clearly taken aback, then let out a cold snort.
The so-called War Demonic Artifact is naturally a magical artifact crafted for war, possessing group enhancement effects. For instance, the current horn sound faced by the Dragon Nest Tribe contained Magic Power, able to awaken the fierceness within their orcs and even subtly hypnotize them, achieving the effect of significantly enhancing the combat power of their soldiers.
Apart from the mysterious horn of the Blood Claw Tribe, similar simple War Demonic Artifacts exist worldwide, some capable of greatly augmenting the output capabilities of Mages or Warriors. In the legacy memories of Austin’s Dragon Ball, humans used plenty of these War Demonic Artifacts or similar War Enhancement Scrolls while hunting dragons.
"A War Demonic Artifact, hmm, time to take matters into my own hands!"
With a sigh, Austin unfurled his wings and took flight.
Behind the Dragon Nest Tribe, a massive shadow flapped powerful gales, descending slowly from the sky, landing behind the Dragon Nest Tribe. The dragon’s might swept across the land, and visible shockwaves rolled outward.
"Roar!!!"
Austin bellowed into the heavens, his thunderous voice ascending to the skies and sweeping every corner around.
"My subjects, annihilate them!"
The voice, like thunder, swept across the land. Its ancient and solemn tone even overshadowed the horn of the Blood Claw Tribe, the airflow and windstorm rising alongside it.
Initially, there was silence all around; the next moment, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe erupted in cheers.
"Oh! For Lord Austin!"
"Charge!"
With Austin’s appearance, the Dragon Nest Tribe orcs immediately seemed to surge with adrenaline, madly brandishing their weapons and charging forward. The deeply ingrained steadfast belief, the individual faith in Austin’s utmost reverence, was instantly ignited with his entrance.
The impact of this belief far surpassed the horn of the Blood Claw Tribe, leading to a counterattack by the Dragon Nest Tribe that directly suppressed the Blood Claw Tribe’s side.
But that is not enough!
Austin understood that although the Dragon Nest Tribe temporarily subdued the enemy’s morale, it was far from defeating them thoroughly.
To crush the enemy swiftly and defeat this tribe with minimal cost, he would have to act personally!
His membranous wings slowly unfurled, generating a savage whirlwind as Austin’s massive form ascended, hovering in mid-air.
Crackle!!!
With the activation of Talent Magic, the Magic Power inside began converting into currents of electricity flickering around, thick lightning like a thumb dancing wildly in the air, as intense gales surged around.
Thunder Strike Technique!
But it wasn’t merely Thunder Strike Technique. With the third Talent Magic activated, Austin could control the electric currents and lightning within his range, with Thunder Strike Technique’s thunder being one of them.
Previously, when Austin used Thunder Strike Technique, the resulting lightning struck directly from the sky onto the enemies.
But now, with the Thunder Control Talent Magic, the thunder generated by the Thunder Strike Technique was completely under his command.
Strands of electric currents danced wildly in the air, emitting dazzlingly bright light, piercing the sky with rumbling sounds, gathering terrifying power amid the fierce wind above.

chapters.title: Chapter 107 - 105 Thunder Roar Cannon
chapters.content:
Chapter 107: Chapter 105 Thunder Roar Cannon
Rumble!!!
Amidst earth-shattering booms, a mass of lightning was born from the void, streaks of electric light turned into long serpents dancing wildly in the air, the lightning interwoven, like an overwhelming net spreading into every corner of the surrounding space.
Under the flickering thunder and lightning, the surrounding Beastmen quickly dodged, leaving a vast space around Austin. The formidable dragon’s aura was like thunderous wrath; none could approach within ten meters of him, and the Blood Claw Tribe opposite felt as though they were facing the onslaught of an avalanche and tsunami.
"Dragon! Dragon! Dragon!"
"Quick, stop him!"
The elite Beastmen of the Blood Claw Tribe were visibly panicked, terror overflowing in their expressions.
Ignoring Austin’s natural intimidation as a Giant Dragon to ordinary Beastmen, watching the streaks of wind and thunder lightning surrounding his body sweep the air, every Beastman, no matter how foolish, understood that nothing good could come of this.
Yet with Austin’s appearance, the Beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe were like getting a shot of adrenaline, their erupting momentum suppressed the Beastmen of the Blood Claw Tribe, and no one could break through the army’s defense lines before them to reach Austin.
At that moment, a pitch-black, mountain-like cloud drifted in unnoticed in the sky, dimming the heavens and casting a vast shadow.
Suddenly, a strong wind swept through the world, responding to the wind and thunder, ribboned with lightning, seemingly tearing through space, an astonishing aura rising, as if the soil beneath suffered some heavy pressure, large areas crumbled, fist-sized pieces of earth floating weightlessly, swirling among arcs of electric light.
Meanwhile, as the Blood Claw Tribe’s Beastmen were distracted, staring in terror at Austin enveloped in electric light, like a divine demon, the Dark Bull Cavalry initially ambushed behind the Blood Claw Tribe began their charge unknowingly.
Seizing the moment when all focus was on the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen and Austin, the Dark Bull Cavalry lined up, decisively charging from behind the Blood Claw Tribe.
Rumble!!!
In the deafening sound, the ground trembled lightly, at the rear of the Blood Claw Tribe, a line of Dark Bull Cavalry charged out like tanks driven by elementary sound waves, smashing the earth, raising rolling clouds of dust, their horrible impact force instantly crushing the outer walls, destroying everything in their path; not just the Beastmen, even houses were destroyed and collapsed into a pile of ruins, devastation wherever they went.
Simultaneously, the Centaur cavalry, skirmishing peripherally, had unknowingly reached the back of the Blood Claw Tribe, laying down their bows and arrows, forming into a military formation, long spears in hand.
"Centaurs, charge!"
With the Legion Commander’s order, the Centaurs lined up neatly, gripping their wooden spears tightly, charging directly down the route opened by the Dark Bull Cavalry.
The Dark Bull Cavalry, with their overwhelming impact, swept past the rear of the Blood Claw Tribe, clearing the path for the Centaur cavalry charge.
The cavalry group charged swiftly, with a terrifying force like a tidal wave.
The resisting Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen, caught off guard, were overwhelmed instantly as the cavalry stormed into their midst, plunging their entire resistance force into chaos, even with elite Beastmen barely recovering to counterattack, the resisting force was on the verge of collapse under the swift, successive cavalry assaults.
And at this moment,
Austin had already unleashed the Thunder Strike Technique five times in total, the thunder and lightning produced by the Thunder Strike Technique were entirely controlled by the Talent Magic Thunder Control; streaks of crackling electric snakes gathered, sounding like sharp chirping birds.
Next, Austin spread his massive wings wide, opening his menacing jaws.
Zzzlaa!!!
The lightning gathered violently yet obediently under the power of Thunder Control, surging ahead, as streaks of thunder formed a basketball-sized, unstable thunderous paste ball in front of the opened jaws, emanating a dazzling white light.
The next moment,
Swoosh!!!
The tightly compressed thunderous paste ball suddenly opened a fissure, instantly spewing forth thunder, a blue lightning laser beam shot from Austin’s mouth, slicing through space, sweeping across the void in front of him, crashing into the heart of the Blood Claw Tribe.
Rumble!!!
In an instant, an earth-shattering boom swept over, accompanied by blinding light illuminating the world, as if knocking out the sun and moon’s luster, the Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen hit by the lightning beam didn’t even have time to react before being incinerated to ashes, the surrounding ground suddenly collapsed under a visible shockwave, the floor cracking like glass, nearby Beastmen caught by that terrifying energy storm were swept off their feet, tossed high into the air.
Simultaneously, as the terrible shockwave spread, ribbons of lightning erupted in all directions, blinding electric furrows sweeping the earth, scorching the ground into cracks, pebbles rising into the air.
The lightning beam’s arrival was swift and sudden; the explosion’s impact and the streaking electric snakes caused enormous casualties, instantly reducing the Blood Claw Tribe’s resistance force by half, leaving only two to three hundred barely standing, all wounded, their combat and morale plummeting to rock bottom, dispersing completely.
"The power, it’s somewhat lacking....."
Watching a single shot from the Thunder Roar Cannon decimate the Blood Claw Tribe, scattering them, Austin pondered silently to himself.
Back when he broke through, this technique he invented based on Thunder Control swept through a vast forest, its power simply terrifying.
However, at that time, he borrowed the sky’s thunder, while this time he used the Thunder Strike Technique he triggered himself, the energy gathered each time being vastly different.
Nevertheless, it’s enough; the Blood Claw Tribe is utterly done for.
"Oh! For His Highness Austin! Kill!"
"Kill! His Highness is right behind us!"
With Austin’s roar obliterating the remaining resistance, the Dragon Nest Beastmen, as if invigorated, charged back, their momentum overwhelming, utterly overwhelming the already collapsed Blood Claw Tribe, scattering like headless chickens, wholly consumed by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Surrender and you won’t be killed! Surrender and you won’t be killed!"
A powerful voice shouted, and the fleeing Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen defected en masse, with only the occasional elite Beastman resisting helplessly before being engulfed by the morale-boosted Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Seeing victory assured, with the Blood Claw Tribe on the verge of utter defeat.
At that moment,
"You damn reptiles, you’re courting death!"
From the distant sky, a voice as wrathful as the heavens boomed like thunder rolling across the land, filling every corner of the world, shaking heaven and earth, making the whole terrain tremble. The Dragon Nest Beastmen found it hard to keep their ground under the surging pressure, their eyes darting around in shock.
Simultaneously,
Rumble!!!
The sky was filled with a thunderous boom, a pillar of overwhelming force swirled past, leaving the ground in ruins, earth lifted in massive volumes, obscured by stormy winds, blotting out the sky!
The Novel will be updated first on this website. Come back and continue reading tomorrow, everyone!

chapters.title: Chapter 108 - 106: The Terrifying Grom
chapters.content:
Chapter 108: Chapter 106: The Terrifying Grom
The earth shook violently, accompanied by a huge roaring sound, as if an earthquake had arrived. Cracks spread across the ground, shattering and collapsing, and the Beastman standing on the earth couldn’t keep their balance, falling to the ground with faces full of fear.
At the same time, a massive air blast surged from afar like a flood, turning everything in its path, be it giant ancient trees or collapsed houses, all into powder.
Like a steel-like gale tearing through the earth, large patches of soil rose up with the airflow, rolling in as if an apocalyptic catastrophe had arrived.
Rumble!!!
The terrifying air blast swept across a vast area, crashing into the crowd. Countless Beastman were caught in the fierce wind, thrown into the air, then smashed heavily to the ground along with the soil and rocks that blocked out the sky.
From above, the Blood Claw Tribe, already mostly collapsed from the previous attack, was now a wasteland. At this moment, a horrifying air blast poured through and penetrated, creating a massive deep chasm, splitting the entire Blood Claw Tribe in two.
The Beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe along the direct path of the air blast were swept into the high sky, scattered everywhere, emptying a large area instantly, suffering egregious losses.
As the storm subsided, the sweeping dust in the air gradually dissipated.
The fortunate surviving Beastman, still in shock, stared blankly at the massive chasm extending from the distant forest, running through the entire tribe, their faces filled with fear and terror.
And at that moment, at the end of the chasm.
Bang, bang, bang...
The sound of footsteps pounding the ground came from the darkness surrounded by dust, like battle drums from the ancient times, reverberating in every Beastman’s heart, each step resonating heavily upon them.
At the starting point of the chasm, among the dense forest, an enormous figure, like a demon overshadowing the sky, slowly emerged from the dust, carrying an overwhelming aura that covered the four directions, making every Beastman felt as if a mountain was pressing down on them.
Even Austin felt an indescribable pressure at this moment, gazing solemnly at the end of the forest.
Rustle!
A gentle breeze blew from one side, sweeping away the dust surrounding the shadow, revealing a terrifying figure like a towering iron pillar.
It was a one-eyed Grey Bearman, three meters tall, with bristle-like fur all over, a body that seemed forged of steel, emanating a tremendously powerful aura.
On his shoulder, he carried a giant two-meter-long Wolf Fang Club, which glowed faintly. Just standing there, he was like a giant covering the sky, casting a grim shadow over all the Beastman present, making the surrounding space dim down, plunging every Dragon Nest Tribe Beastman into a dark abyss.
"Grom, the leader of the Grey Bearman, trouble is brewing this time..."
Austin had seen Grey Bearmen before, whether during the dark elf-led attack or assaulting this Blood Claw Tribe Branch, Grey Bearmen always served as the main elite force resisting the attacks of the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastman.
However, none of the Grey Bearmen exuded such a terrifying aura as Grom, the mere sight of him was like facing a towering mountain.
Just the three-meter stature alone vaguely oppressed even Austin, coupled with that terrifying aura, had Grom returned during the assault on this Blood Claw Tribe Branch, the scales of war might have fully tilted in favor of the Blood Claw Tribe, even if Austin personally entered the fray.
"A bunch of tiny reptiles, and an oblivious Young Dragon, just fitting, there’s a spot for a dragon’s head on my throne!"
With a loud boom, Grom planted the massive Wolf Fang Club into the ground, causing it to quake.
The grim one-eye swept over the crowd, an indescribable pressure weighing heavily on every Beastman’s heart.
Tremble,
Fear!
Faced with a mountain towering to the sky, they fell into the shadowy abyss of despair.
"If you want my head, let me see if you have the guts!"
Austin would not stand by idly while his clan Beastman were so easily suppressed, spreading his wings wide, he soared into the air with a mighty airflow, heading fearlessly towards the Grey Bearman leader Grom with a thunderous roar.
Rumble!!!
In an instant, Austin transformed into a fleeting shadow flying across the void, appearing above Grom in a blink. A gigantic shadow descended from the sky with rolling torrents, amidst electric flashes, the monstrous iron claw tore through the wind and cloud, bearing down on Grom with the weight of a thousand catties.
This terrifying claw seemed to tear the entire space apart, with such frightening power it could shred even a cliff into pieces.
Yet against such overwhelming power, Grom remained unmoved, a sneer appearing on his fierce face:
"Don’t rush, little Blue Dragon, that’s no way to die either!"
With a forceful swing of his massive wrist, the giant Wolf Fang Club of two meters rose with a howl, intercepting upfront.
Sssss!!!
The giant Wolf Fang Club flickered with light, clashing brutally with a dragon claw potent enough to shatter mountains and ridges. The air was immediately filled with a sharp, piercing whine, as if in the moment of collision the air shattered, a horrifying sonic boom swept in all directions, transforming into a tangible storm.
The ground around Grom sunk abruptly as if under some invisible force, large chunks of soil crumbled, and cobweb-like cracks spread widely.
The terrifying sonic boom and gale from the collision swept around, raising a monstrous storm of scale twelve, throwing up large patches of soil, sweeping away countless Beastmen into the torrent, rolling and tossing them over the ground, while the distant forests swayed violently under the fierce gust, almost snapped in half.
"Hey, little Blue Dragon, if you were an adult, I might be wary, but how dare a hatchling just a few years old act arrogant in front of Lord Grom, die!"
With a furious roar, Grom burst with Fighting Qi, launching a volcanic torrent of air blast soaring skyward, causing the surrounding ground to sink again.
Under this volcanic eruption-like torrent, Austin staggered violently. Even before he could steady himself, the massive Wolf Fang Club descended with an earth-shattering might.
Rumble!!!
In just a blink, Austin’s body morphed into a huge projectile surging backward, crashing heavily onto the ground, the soil within ten meters around caved in like tofu dregs while Austin’s body kept rolling and scraping backward, shattering the entire ground along the path into pieces, forming a gigantic chasm. The devastating force turned everything along the way into dust, crashed far into the forest, enveloped by towering clouds of dust...

chapters.title: Chapter 109 - 107 Blood Burning
chapters.content:
Chapter 109: Chapter 107 Blood Burning
"Your Highness!"
"All beastmen, block that guy!"
Seeing Austin being knocked out of the air by Grom’s club, the remaining beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe instantly snapped back to their senses. Within the previous experiences of the Dragon Nest Tribe, every beastman had already regarded Austin as an absolute lord-like existence, an incomparable admiration accompanied by unmatched loyalty.
"Charge! It’s time to sacrifice for His Highness!"
Accompanied by a roar, the beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe charged forward fiercely with wooden spears, their eyes blood-red, as if Grom held a vendetta against them.
"Do you think a swarm of ants can take down an elephant?"
Grom roared, sweeping the massive wolf fang club across the air, causing a storm of wind to ravage the ground, smashing large pieces of the earth, and sweeping beastmen into the air with powerful gusts.
Yet how could these beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe possibly feel fear?
Having undergone multiple brainwashing sessions and led by Austin from hunger to prosperity, all the beastmen in the Dragon Nest Tribe had a resolve to sacrifice for Austin.
One group of beastmen was blown away, and the next immediately charged forward, even if the front line was swept into bloody mist by the giant club, they were unafraid.
With wave after wave of attacks, despite Grom’s explosive rage, he was firmly held back by Austin’s clan.
"Damn it! Cough cough..."
Within the collapsed forest, Austin staggered to his feet, his scales cracked open, and blood flowed out like lava from the wounds, dripping onto the earth.
Previously, Grom’s club launched him into the air with such terrifying power that it even cracked his durable scale armor.
But Austin had no time to worry about his injuries, watching the beastman clan charging up only to be knocked away repeatedly, his heart ached.
These beastman clans, whom he spent great effort to gather and train, were now dying like cannon fodder in rows.
"All ordinary beastmen fall back, Dragon Vein Attendants and Dark Dragon Guards, hold them back!"
Ordinary beastmen, facing Grom, would be injured or killed on contact, using their lives to delay his steps and deplete his energy. Only the modified Dragon Vein Attendants and Dark Dragon Guards could barely survive a strike.
"Use Blood Burning!"
The leader of the Dragon Vein Guards, in a fit of rage, roared, his entire body exploded, igniting in a fiery blaze, veins bulging on his skin, his aura swelling mightily, as visible energy waves spread out.
At the same time, the modified beastmen, like Rodney, all exploded, unleashing the greatest power within their bodies.
Though initially, during the Dragon Vein Attendant modification, they gained a talent magic akin to berserk, forcibly boosting their power by activating their blood. Austin named this talent magic Blood Burning back then.
After Blood Burning’s burst, the Dragon Vein Attendants fell into extreme weakness, and in subsequent wars, Dragon Vein Beastmen had no use for this desperate measure, thus it wasn’t used on the battlefield.
But now, facing the terrifying bear leader Grom, there was no choice but to gamble everything.
Boom boom boom...
With the explosive burst of the Dragon Vein Attendants and Dark Dragon Guards, they fought jointly to barely fend off Grom’s attack. The bear leader roared repeatedly, but modified beastmen who had unleashed their greatest power, one after another, rushed forward. Despite his superior strength to any modified beastman, he had to focus all attention on the foes before him, amid the siege.
"Damn it, I’ll crush you all!"
Grom roared repeatedly, his wolf fang club shattered the ground, his dreadful Fighting Qi whipped up a stormy torrent, yet these Blood Burning-modified beastmen were far beyond ordinary Dragon Nest Beastmen. Originally, even without bursting, the Dark Dragon Guards could smash a rock with a punch. Now, with Blood Burning exploded and supported by numbers, they managed to hold Grom completely.
"No, I need to figure something out!"
At this moment, the Dragon Nest Beastmen kept retreating, leaving a large area empty in the middle, where the ground cracked and rocks splintered upwards amidst fierce battles, sometimes a modified beastman was blown away and crashed out.
Austin knew very well that even if these modified beastmen all used Blood Burning, they could only hold Grom for a while, slightly draining his power. It was impossible to rely on them to completely defeat and slay Grom.
A decisive force is needed...
Austin was acutely aware that only by unleashing power capable of defeating Grom in a single stroke, could final victory be achieved.
However, earlier, to crush the Blood Claw Tribe’s resistance, Austin consecutively used several Thunder Strike Techniques, and finally formed Thunder Roar Cannon with Thunder Control, even with Austin’s improved power, it was taxing. The magic power stored within him was already more than half depleted.
If he attempted the same strategy again, the power generated might not be enough to kill this fearsome Grom.
"I must gamble it all once!"
Watching modified beastmen being blown away one after another, Austin’s face showed a fierce expression.
His third talent magic, Thunder Control, if placed on other indigenous Blue Dragons, would probably become an electric shock paralysis akin to worthless ability, but Austin was not a native dragon. Even for obscure abilities, with his imaginative thinking from a previous life, he could turn it into something unique.
Actually, after unlocking the third talent magic, besides developing it into a powerful attack like Thunder Roar Cannon, Austin had envisioned another attack inspired by a comic he read in his past life. However, restricted by conditions, he hadn’t tried it yet.
But now, it seemed necessary to unleash it.
Rumble!!!
Under the cloudy sky, bolts of lightning descended in succession, then under Austin’s Thunder Control, blinding electric light swirled around him like tamed animals.
Zap...
Amidst the harsh lightning blooms, electric snakes spread, extending into every corner of the air, then forming a ring.
As grand currents unfolded, an immensely powerful magnetic field formed in the void. All around the Blood Claw Tribe, scattered iron weapons, even iron weapons held by Dragon Nest Beastmen, were at this moment pulled by a strong force, as the gathered lightning assembled before Austin, hovering in the air...

chapters.title: Chapter 110 - 108: Cannon Blast Kill
chapters.content:
Chapter 110: Chapter 108: Cannon Blast Kill
Bzzzzz!
The air violently vibrated, as in streaks of electric arc and fire, the drawn iron weapons twisted and fused under the terrifying electromagnetic force, melding into a massive iron ball.
Through the magic power perception within his body, Austin distinctly felt the thunder and lightning causing the invisible and untouchable magnetic field around to undergo drastic changes, and the rapidly changing magnetic field generating enormous currents in the metal iron ball, heating each piece of iron weapon red-hot, fusing the entire iron ball into one in a brief moment.
At the same time, thunder operated as he willed, and the glaring electric light intersected in the air to form a circle, suspending in the void in front of him, encasing the iron ball in the center.
Thunder Dragon Electromagnetic Cannon!
In an instant, the ground ten meters around him suddenly collapsed under the force of a tremendous power, and cobweb-like cracks spread rapidly, with Austin’s entire body being pushed down by the invisible might.
The next moment,
Boom!!!
The heavens and earth changed color in an instant.
The iron ball burst out with a roar, transforming into a beam of yellow laser sweeping across, filling the sky with yellow radiance that shrouded the daylight, making the entire world seem to dim down, leaving only the blinding yellow light reigning between heaven and earth.
The beam seemed to pierce through space, arriving instantly in front of Grom.
At this moment, the grizzly bear leader Grom had just swung a Wolf Fang Club to blast away a few Dark Dragon Guards in front, only to have the beam of yellow laser thrust directly towards his face.
What?!!!
The light, more dazzling than gazing directly at the sun, filled every corner of his pupils, leaving Grom no time to react as his entire body was engulfed within the ocean of glaring light, and his consciousness sank utterly into darkness.
Rumble!!!
The pillar of light instantly penetrated through Grom’s body, spanned across over a thousand meters of dense forest, and blasted onto a mountain peak with a thunderous roar.
Immediately, a cataclysmic explosion erupted, as if a massive sun rose on the distant horizon, with an orange glow inverted upon the earth, forming a gigantic mushroom column rising upward.
The colossal shock waves visible to the naked eye surged in waves spreading in all directions, seemingly ushering in a Category 12 storm, uprooting each massive ancient tree in its horrific gust, which were subsequently shredded into powder in the air by the gale.
The dreadful shock waves swept up a turbulent tsunami flood, with all present beastmen holding onto the ground desperately, their forms swaying amidst the waves, staring blankly at everything before them, unable to utter a word.
Where the beam of yellow laser passed, a gigantic rift had split the earth, with the soil and stones at the edges still glowing a dark red as if molten, and the trees and leaves along the way burnt to ashes.
The rift extended over a thousand meters, until reaching that distant mountain peak, which had already been blasted out with a massive gap, resembling an inverted crescent peak, from which wisps of smoke slowly rose.
"Hiss, this power...cough cough..."
The power of the Electromagnetic Cannon unleashed by employing thunder, even Austin couldn’t help but gasp in shock.
But before he could reminisce about the feel of shooting that electromagnetic cannon, his entire body began to cough violently, with large mouthfuls of fresh blood spewing from the cracks in his shattered dragon scales, splattering on the ground, immediately dyeing the earth in a bloody hue.
The dragon blood resembled sulfuric acid, sizzling as it dripped to the ground, emitting plumes of white smoke, with all the remaining grass roots decaying en masse, though one or two resilient blades of grass managed to survive beneath the fiery blood.
At the moment, Austin had no mind to pay attention to these trivialities, feeling as if his body was on the verge of disintegration, with his massive form swaying, seemingly to topple over at any second.
He could distinctly feel it; his body was already suffering severe damage, with the force of that recent electromagnetic cannon certainly frighteningly strong, yet the backlash force also severely damaged his underdeveloped dragon body, nearly to the point of fracturing.
"In the future, I can’t recklessly use this move."
Austin couldn’t help but silently admonish himself; until his body can withstand this massive counterforce, it would be wiser to keep the electromagnetic cannon shelved, lest every use tears apart his body, and he might not be this fortunate next time.
Moreover, after annihilating Grom, there’s likely not to be any significant threat for some time.
"There’s still about a month before the cold winter season arrives. Given the mobilization abilities of the primitive Beastman Tribe, even if those from the Blood Claw Tribe headquarters get word and send reinforcements for revenge, it would take at least half a year; during that period, with the Natural Magic Crystal in the Spider Cave, it’s enough to elevate my Power to another level. By then, what would I have to fear? Besides, it’s uncertain whether the Blood Claw Tribe would even care much about a branch being wiped out."
Having forcefully slain the greatest threat Grom, while breaching the nearby Blood Claw Tribe Branch, eliminating potential threats completely, the Dragon Nest Tribe, with its center, would undoubtedly become the dominator within a radius of several dozen or even a hundred miles.
With the Magic Crystal within the Spider Cave, it would be enough for Austin to transform into a formidable Beastman army, coupled with the Breathing Technique, the future remains untold.
Nonetheless, those matters are for later.
For now, the priority is to pack up and return to the tribe.
"Vini, tidy things up, prepare to go back."
Calling the leading Kobold of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Vini, and enduring the collapsing body, Austin casually delegated the aftermath matters, soaring into the sky and flying away, enduring the pain within.
In this battle, the Dragon Nest Tribe suffered considerably, with a rough estimate of casualties possibly exceeding half.
But Austin had neither the time nor the inclination to scrutinize the Beastmen’s casualties; avoiding collapsing at the scene and being ungracefully carried back to the Dragon Nest by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, seizing the last thread of strength within him to fly back alone was Austin’s best choice now.
Despite the significant damage on the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s side to eliminate that Blood Claw Tribe Branch, it’s hard to say if it was worth it, but at least the potential crisis was dealt with, concerning his personal safety, which Austin remained very vigilant about.
As Austin went further away, underneath the ruins that had turned into a wasteland, thunderous cheers erupted from the participating Dragon Nest Beastmen, echoing toward the sky, celebrating the victory and Austin’s immensely powerful display of strength.
Austin glanced back momentarily, then turned and flew away.

chapters.title: Chapter 111 - 109: Post-War Gains
chapters.content:
Chapter 111: Chapter 109: Post-War Gains
A great victory over the Blood Claw Tribe Branch eliminated any potential threat and once again strengthened the power of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This time, all three major legions of the Dragon Nest Tribe were deployed, and even the newly transformed Dark Bull Cavalry was sent into battle. However, under the final counterattacks of the Blood Claw Tribe and Grom, the Dragon Nest Legion suffered direct deaths numbering in the hundreds, and there were no shortage of wounded Beastmen being carried back by comrades, with even the transformed Beastmen losing over half during the final fight.
However, alongside sustaining heavy casualties, the Dragon Nest Tribe captured a significant number of enemy Beastmen.
From the surprise attack of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, to the unstoppable advance into the tribe’s inner areas, followed by the Dark Bull Cavalry’s rear assault, the Centaur Army’s flanking charge, and finally Austin’s Thunder Roar Cannon that wiped out the remaining resistance of the Blood Claw Tribe.
A series of strikes left the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, despite having a force of over a thousand Beastmen, being defeated step by step by the Dragon Nest Tribe’s side. Even when the Grizzly leader Grom made a sudden return, no resistance force could be organized.
In the end, when Austin’s Electromagnetic Cannon seemed to break through the heavens and earth, reducing Grom to dust, the terrifying aftermath ruined everything, and the remnants of the Blood Claw Tribe lost all will to resist and were completely captured by the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
During the end of the war, many local Beastmen scattered into the jungle, but with the high mobility of the Centaur Army, during the post-battle scavenging, most were captured and taken prisoner, with only a few remaining individuals slipping away, which likely wouldn’t cause any trouble.
Thus, it could be said that the entire Blood Claw Tribe Branch had been completely annexed by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Eventually, nearly seven hundred Beastmen captives were gathered, including many elite Beastmen at the Bronze Level of extraordinary professionals. Of course, most of these captives were wounded, and their spirits were broken by Austin’s Electromagnetic Cannon, leading them to docilely allow themselves to be bound with ropes and driven towards the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The Beastmen within this division of the Blood Claw Tribe were generally strong and robust, and after recovering from their injuries, going through military training, brainwashing, and other methods of integration into the Dragon Nest Tribe, would greatly enhance the overall strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Among these captives, what Austin valued most were those elite Beastmen who were extraordinary professionals.
Although the elite Beastmen of the Blood Claw Tribe also suffered significant losses, they themselves were an important asset. Moreover, the breathing techniques in their minds could greatly enhance the foundation of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
As for the issue of loyalty, the truth is, in this grassland, the civilization of the Beastman tribes is still in a primitive civilization stage, not having developed copper or iron, and their concept of home and country is exceedingly thin.
The cohesion of the large tribe systems is based on the brutal rule of survival of the fittest; the weak willingly submit to the strong. Just like the Dark Elves, since Austin defeated their tribe and killed Grom, it represents that he is stronger, and they are more inclined to seek shelter under a stronger person’s power.
Moreover, compared to other tribes in the Kawa Great Forest, the Dragon Nest Tribe has a mature brainwashing system, so after some time, the induction of these elite Beastmen into the Dragon Nest Tribe system is not a concern.
Vini, while organizing the captives into groups, also began to loot this now-ruined tribe.
The sweep of the battlefield didn’t yield much; a pile of wooden spears, a pile of grass roots for food, moldy jerky—iron weapons had already been consumed in attracting the magnetic field during Austin’s use of the Electromagnetic Cannon. In general, there was a lot gained, but the value was limited.
However, some items were quite precious. From the remnants of the tribe, the Dragon Nest Beastmen found the war horn that could boost Beastman morale. When this war demonic artifact was used, the Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen were able to withstand the Dragon Nest Tribe’s counterattack against the wind, playing a significant role in the war.
Also, within the remaining rubble, the Dragon Nest Beastmen found a crossbow carriage covered in runes, glowing with magical light, which seemed to have been passed down from the civilized world of humans, along with several armor-piercing crossbow arrows. When Austin came to explore initially, he was shot from afar; it was likely with this crossbow carriage.
Fortunately, when Austin led the Dragon Nest Legion, the timing was too precise, and the Blood Claw Tribe couldn’t organize sufficient resistance. Moreover, with Grom the leader absent, no Beastman thought to use the weapon stored in the library. Otherwise, if a sudden arrow were shot during the chaos, it could have been troublesome.
Apart from this magic armor-piercing crossbow carriage, the Dragon Nest Beastmen also found some breathing techniques recorded on worn-out Beast skins in the ruins, which Vini solemnly protected to personally deliver to Austin upon return.
After the sweep, there seemed to be no more valuable items in the ruins, so Vini began to lead the troop to retreat, first lifting the heavily injured Beastman comrades, with those less wounded supporting each other, binding the captives in lines with ropes. Centaur cavalry patrolled the surroundings, and the entire large troop majestically moved towards the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Of course, part of the forces were left behind to station at the remnants of the Blood Claw Tribe.
Although the whole tribe had been devastated, and most buildings had collapsed, the foundational materials like wood and thatch remained. Austin would need to start the significant task of refining copper here, and thus leaving a part of the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen to establish a bridgehead was fitting.
Not to mention, there were still large quantities of food within the Blood Claw Tribe, which weren’t easily transportable, necessitating a guard presence here.
The main force busily worked back, spending considerable time before finally returning to the Dragon Nest Village.
The population of the Dragon Nest Tribe burgeoned again, various intricate matters causing some chaos within the whole Dragon Nest Tribe, although issues of food, accommodation, and training would be addressed later.
Currently, the most pressing issue the Dragon Nest Tribe faced was the large number of wounded.
The brutal warfare led to a significant number of casualties among both the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastmen and the Blood Claw Tribe’s captives. Although Beastmen’s life force is stronger than that of ordinary humans, without comprehensive follow-up aid, a large number of them might still perish.
In this context, the medical system previously ordered by Austin and established by the Fox-faced Man Quik, proved extremely important.

chapters.title: Chapter 112 - 110: Sleeping
chapters.content:
Chapter 112: Chapter 110: Sleeping
In this world, there is no such profession as a doctor, or rather, the emergence of magic and other extraordinary powers has significantly suppressed the emergence of the doctor profession.
Similar to Austin’s previous life in the Western Middle Ages, the so-called "doctor" treatment methods were mostly bloodletting treatments, and there was no discovery of certain herbs in the wild that could treat certain diseases of the body.
With the popularization of divine techniques by the church and various healing potions, the intellectuals at the upper echelons saw no need to research these things. Those with knowledge strived to become scholars or mages, and those with means would directly receive divine healing from the church or purchase potions when ill. Consequently, without the involvement of intellectuals, even if farmers or other lower classes occasionally discovered a secret recipe or two, it would ultimately get lost over time and fade away.
In this world, the soil for the survival of the doctor profession is exceedingly barren.
Even among the many beastmen in the Kawa Great Forest, apart from one or two tribes occasionally discovering and cherishing certain plant properties, they ultimately failed to form a complete medical system.
During the initial stages of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s construction, Austin discovered this flaw.
In fact, Austin was well aware that as the Dragon Nest Tribe expanded in this world where one struggles against the heavens for survival, a mature medical system is incredibly important for the development of a tribe. After all, there was no beastman priest under Austin, and the costs of those divine techniques or magical potions meant these treatments could not be widely accessible.
Just like in the human world, for the lower-class farmers, falling ill essentially meant death. Burdened with heavy taxes every day, they could not possibly save up to buy healing potions or avail themselves of divine healing opportunities. That was precisely because these treatments were far beyond the affordability of ordinary farmers and couldn’t be popularized.
As the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe gradually increased, until it gathered thousands, or even tens of thousands of people in the future, even if beastman priests appeared later, they wouldn’t be able to provide for the sick beastmen at the base level.
To solve this problem, after Rodney and others were bitten during their exploration of the Spider Cave, and Austin found the antidote within it, Austin came up with an idea.
An idea to recreate the herbal treatment system of traditional Chinese medicine from his previous life in this otherworld.
It was an enormous project, and Austin didn’t spend his energy on it. Instead, he let Quik, the fox-faced man with an interest in it, begin various accumulation experiments, attempting treatment on beastmen injured during daily production, and recording all kinds of data to see if they could recreate the traditional Chinese medicine treatment system from Austin’s previous life in this otherworld.
At the same time, during the conquest of various tribes, they interrogated the remaining members of each beastman tribe, recorded the properties of certain plants occasionally discovered by those tribes, or collected their fortunate discoveries of secret recipes, to comprehensively try and gradually establish the medical system of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Initially, the medical system established by Quik was practically synonymous with dread among the beastmen in the entire tribe.
But as time passed and various attempts were made, the envisioned medical system eventually began to establish its foundation step by step and gradually started to show its impact.
And now, amidst the heavy casualties of this great war, Quik’s medical system finally played a significant role.
Under Vini’s coordination, houses were cleared out as infirmaries, and large amounts of herbs were gathered from the mountains and forests, either applied externally or decocted as medicine. Broken bones of beastmen were straightened and tied with sticks, and many beastmen lay resting in the infirmaries, with the air filled with the scent of herbs.
Although the medical system was not yet fully established, because of the many unforeseen injuries that occurred during the heavy production activities of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Quik and the others initially didn’t lack injured beastmen to experiment on, so they were already able to provide simple care and treatment for external injuries.
Fortunately, the injuries from this war were mostly external, and the experience accumulated from daily production activities could also be smoothly applied to these injured beastmen.
With medical care and the assistance of various herbs, many beastmen began to recover.
If it were other beastman tribes, lacking treatment and food support, perhaps only a tenth or two of the injured beastmen would survive after the battles. But now, with the medical system Austin had Quik establish, the survival rate of the injured beastmen reached over ninety percent.
Moreover, with the experience gained from this extensive treatment, the treatment system became more mature, gaining more experience in treating external injuries.
It is conceivable that with the passage of time, someday this rudimentary medical system will eventually develop into something significant.
....
As time passed, the injured beastmen began gradually recovering under medical care, and the entire Dragon Nest Tribe gradually entered a state of steady development.
However, as the master of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin didn’t show up much. Perhaps due to the severe injuries from the great battle, or maybe it was growth, Austin hid inside the Dragon Nest, in slumber, not remaining awake for long periods as before. Only occasionally did Vini or Quik and others come to see him, reporting on the tribe’s affairs and making various decisions.
During the times he was awake, Austin provided the general strategy for the future development of the Dragon Nest Tribe. He could clearly feel that this time he genuinely needed to slumber for a while.
Though perhaps due to his soul, Austin wasn’t like other young dragons who would sleep for a decade or two. His various production habits and growth rates also differed greatly from the dragon species in his memory. However, slumbering for a while was inevitable.
In the past dragon life, Austin had never truly tried to slumber, at most just feeling drowsy for a time. However, back then, being alone and weak, if he truly slept, he might have found himself becoming another giant beast’s meal in his slumbering state. After toughing it out for a while, things would be fine.
Now, having gathered a group of clan forces under his leadership, there’s no doubt that within a radius of dozens of miles, it could be considered an undisputed overlord-level force. With sufficient security and protection, Austin didn’t mind slumbering for a while.
After arranging the general strategy for the Dragon Nest Tribe’s future development, Austin could no longer resist the drowsiness and fell into slumber.
But it’s fortunate that he feels his slumbering growth period is estimated to be only between half a month to a month and won’t delay too many matters.

chapters.title: Chapter 113 - 111 Food
chapters.content:
Chapter 113: Chapter 111 Food
Austin’s slumber within the Dragon Nest Tribe didn’t cause much of a stir. Apart from the daily prayers in the morning and evening, the lives of Dragon Nest Beastmen continued on the usual path, gradually moving forward. Under various divisions of labor and cooperation, the Dragon Nest Tribe is steadily expanding, with its strength growing rapidly and swelling.
The Blood Claw captives are also obedient, not causing any trouble because of Austin’s slumber. Through successive treatment and subsequent military training and transformation, the captives from the Blood Claw Tribe have started to integrate into the entire Dragon Nest Tribe system.
It is conceivable that soon, the Beastman captives will completely integrate into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This also allowed the upper echelons, including Vinek, to breathe a sigh of relief. In fact, before his slumber, Austin had handed over the War Horn and Magic Crossbow Arrows confiscated from the Blood Claw Tribe to Vini as an emergency precaution in case of any accidents during his slumber.
Now it seems, they can indeed breathe a sigh of relief.
...
With the addition of a large number of Beastman captives, the total population of the Dragon Nest Tribe now steadily exceeds two thousand, with over fifty extraordinary Beastmen among them.
Such a large force has become an undeniable dominant force in the nearby region, justifying Austin’s decision to enter slumber and delegate security defense to his clan.
Given such a large population, the daily consumption of food is also enormous. Fortunately, after the previous cold winter ended, the Dragon Nest Tribe started reclamation and planting. After half a year of reclamation and development, the tribe has accumulated a large amount of food. Although, due to time constraints, planting only Earth rice can sustain the Dragon Nest Tribe, which has expanded to over two thousand people, for only a little over two months.
However, now there are still half a month away from the cold winter season. Coupled with the Earth rice and various grains harvested from the reclaimed fields, the tribe can barely support itself through the three-month cold winter period.
Of course, this calculation is purely based on consumption. In reality, Dragon Nest Beastmen, apart from the harvest from the reclaimed fields, can also go out to gather and hunt.
As the cold winter approaches, whether it’s fruits or various prey, the forest has become very abundant, and all living creatures seem to be having their final celebration this year.
Sending Beastmen out for hunting and gathering each day yields a large amount of fruit, Earth rice, and seeds. Additionally, with the joining of Centaur Beastmen and the urgent efforts from the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop, enough arrows have been produced to allow Centaurs to exploit their long-range advantage.
During each hunting expedition, due to the excellent discipline among various hunting regiments and their teamwork, combined with the Centaur Beastmen’s strong running endurance and ranged advantage, they basically return fully loaded.
After a few days, the harvested prey not only supplies the tribe but there is considerable surplus.
Although the Beastman hunting teams can hunt a lot of prey each day, a large part of the daily harvest is directly made into jerky by the Beastmen, with only a portion mixed with Earth rice and other grains consumed on the same day.
Besides reclamation and planting, and hunting and gathering, some of Austin’s previous plans have also begun to show their effects.
For instance, the mushroom room led by Finn produces a large amount of mushrooms daily, which the tribe can’t consume entirely. Many nontoxic mushrooms are dried, stored, and taken out to enjoy when they can’t cultivate mushrooms in the Banyan Forest during the cold winter.
Also, in terms of animal husbandry, the wild cattle herd obtained after capturing the Minotaur Tribe doesn’t need much mention; hundreds of wild cattle are enough for the entire Dragon Nest Tribe to eat for over half a month. Of course, the Dragon Nest Beastmen wouldn’t squander them like that. Wild cattle not only accelerate the reclamation speed of the Dragon Nest Tribe but, once trained, the Cow Cavalry can exert extremely powerful strength, whether for production, transportation, or combat. The wild cattle herd plays an incredibly strong role unless diseased, injured, old, or weak, Beastmen wouldn’t easily eat the wild cattle.
Although wild cattle cannot be slaughtered, the wild boar herd raised is easier to slaughter.
Despite Earth rice harvested after planting and Beastmen’s leftovers can be used as feed for the penned wild boar herd, to save feed during the cold winter, the Dragon Nest Beastmen picked out over a hundred wild boars for slaughter, leaving only around thirty as breeding pigs for next year.
Of course, those over a hundred penned wild boars are presumed to be slaughtered after the cold winter sets in because the entire Dragon Nest Tribe is preparing for its arrival. Hunting outside, gathering, harvesting from reclaimed fields, everyone’s workload has reached the limit. Even the Blood Claw Tribe captives, after a few days of simple training to develop some discipline, have increased their labor hours significantly, thus reducing military training and transformation time, which can only be resumed in a strict phase after the cold winter arrives.
Also, it is indeed convenient to pen these hundred or so wild boars and slaughter them after the cold winter sets in as the cold and snow will preserve them.
Regarding animal husbandry, besides wild cattle and wild boars, the wild rabbit population has also exploded.
Under the Beastmen’s management, comfortable living, sufficient food without worrying about sudden threats from Hunters, the wild rabbit population has exploded, initially only a few dozen, growing to over a thousand silently in six months. To corral these creatures, Beastmen had to build several beast pens to accommodate them all.
Compared to the penned wild boars and wild cattle, the fate of these penned wild rabbits might be even less fortunate, as Vini plans to slaughter most once the cold winter arrives, leaving only a small portion as breeding rabbits.
Even though the Dragon Nest Tribe’s population has surged by seven or eight hundred, breaking the two thousand mark before the cold winter arrives, thanks to the harvest from reclamation, hunting, gathering, and various methods of animal husbandry, the Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe hasn’t faced a "food crisis."
It is expected that if nothing unexpected occurs during this cold winter, the food within the Dragon Nest Tribe will suffice to support the tribe’s survival and development for half a year, which is far beyond the duration of the cold winter. We can anticipate the Dragon Nest Tribe will be free from hunger this cold winter.

chapters.title: Chapter 114 - 112: Brickmaking
chapters.content:
Chapter 114: Chapter 112: Brickmaking
"Hurry up, you lazy bunch!"
"Bring over all that prepared mud, damn it, Sharu, move faster!"
"Alright, put all the mud bricks in, light the fire, quickly, if you don’t burn enough bricks today, you’ll be sleeping in the hut during the cold winter!"
Not far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, by a certain riverbank, a limping Kobold stood on high ground, energetically commanding a group of Beastmen to work.
Not far from the river, on the bank, beside a yellow clay hill was an excavated area, forming a square mud pit. The edge of the hill had a lot of yellow soil dug out and placed into the pit. One by one, Beastmen poured water into the pit, then several hulking Beastmen trod back and forth in the mud pit continuously.
It didn’t take long for the soil to be mixed into clumps of mud slurry.
Nearby, Beastmen came over, transporting the mixed mud in batches to a simple workshop not far away. Inside the workshop, mud-covered artisan Beastmen grabbed large clumps of the dough-like mud and stuffed them into rectangular brick molds made of four planks of wood, pressing hard to fill every crevice of the brick mold with mud, then scraped off the excess mud protruding from the brick mold with a wooden piece, threw away the extra mud, flipped the filled mold so that the empty side faced the ground, and lifted the wooden mold upwards, revealing a clay brick on the table.
With the artisan Beastmen swiftly working, a large number of brick prototypes soon appeared on the side.
Then, another team of Beastmen came over, taking the bricks away to an open area to dry.
Afterwards, yet another team of Beastmen placed the previously dried bricks into a nearby kiln, using wood or charcoal for firing. After burning for a day or two and then cooling them down, a kiln of red bricks suitable for construction was produced.
Indeed, the limping Kobold was in charge of directing the Beastmen to carry out the brick firing work.
Long before this, the Goblins’ manufacturing workshop had successfully fired bricks based on Austin’s description, and to prevent fire hazards, Austin ordered the Beastmen to start renovating the houses of the Dragon Nest Tribe, replacing the entirely wooden ones with mixed brick-wooden structure houses.
However, this reconstruction project consumed a tremendous amount of human resources, so the renovation work had to be progressed step by step, and the work of remodelation hasn’t completed until today.
Though the cold winter is approaching, manpower is in serious shortage across various departments.
