Nonetheless, constructing enough housing before the cold winter arrives is exceedingly important, hence the number of people involved in brick firing hasn’t decreased but rather received substantial support from the tribe’s manpower.
Brick firing isn’t a difficult job. Once the manufacturing workshop’s Goblins recreated this brick firing technique, they passed it on to other Beastmen, and now the limping Kobold takes charge of this domain.
"Faster, faster, faster!"
With the cold winter nearing and the Dragon Nest Tribe’s sudden increase of seven or eight hundred people, although the Dragon Nest Tribe continuously expanded, the sudden population influx made it difficult to free up enough housing for accommodation, hence the brick firing work was on a very tight schedule.
Fortunately, during the recruitment of population for constructing the Smoke Tower in the beginning, the Dragon Nest Beastmen had fired a considerable amount of charcoal on the hill where the Smoke Tower is located, partly solving the fuel issue, otherwise needing to go out and chop wood would be even more troublesome.
"Uncle Ge, our teacher asked us to bring you some drinking water."
Before long, a few young Beastmen strenuously carried over a half-person-high wooden bucket-like object covered with a lid, led by the half-person-height Kobold girl, Nina.
"Alright, everyone take a break."
Looking at the sky above, the limping Kobold felt they had been working long enough, so he announced a break.
The entire tense team then relaxed, gathering in small groups on the open ground. Nina quickly distributed wooden bowls to the exhausted Beastmen, then used a ladle to pour the soup water from the wooden bucket into them.
For a moment, the entire open area resonated with the sound of "gulu, gulu" of drinking water.
The soup brought by Nina and her companions wasn’t just plain boiled water; it contained a peppercorn-sized fruit that would release white salt grains on its surface when ripe. These fruits were called salt fruits by the Beastmen and were the main source of salt for the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen.
With the increasing number of Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen, the demand for salt fruits has gradually grown, so after collecting the salt fruits, the Beastmen even removed the weeds around the salt fruit trees, cut down surrounding trees, loosened the soil, and applied some fertilizer in hopes of making them more flourishing and bear more salt fruits in the future.
Meanwhile, Vini also planned to carve out a dedicated grove for planting salt trees, but salt trees take a long time to grow, so they had hastily planted a bit, much like the red fruit seeds Austin had found at the Blood Wolf Lair, which were left unattended after planting.
Boiling salt fruits in water created a kind of lightly sour and salty water. The salt water was crucial for restoring strength.
Brick firing is labor-intensive, and it’s best for the Beastmen, who sweated a lot, to replenish with salt water.
"Little Nina, do you listen to the teacher usually?"
The limping Kobold sat on a log, taking the wooden bowl Nina handed over, and his rough hand patted her head.
In the Dragon Nest Tribe, newborn and young Beastmen were managed by a separate department because their parents had to work and couldn’t spend much time on the children. They organized the young ones together, managed by several elderly Beastwomen.
These Beastwomen not only managed the Beastmen cubs but also taught them various survival skills, basic knowledge, and the simple cultural knowledge Austin needed to spread. Of course, more activities involved practice, helping with things the tribe could use, such as leading water delivery teams as they did now.
This kind of system, unprecedented even in the entire Kawa Great Forest, had the Beastmen calling Austin those who managed the young ones, "teacher."
"Of course, I listened. The teacher even praised me yesterday. Also, Uncle Ge, could you stop patting my head? I heard kids won’t grow tall if their heads are often patted!"
Nina pouted with dissatisfaction but continued handing the wooden bowl filled with soup to the limping Kobold.
"Ha ha ha..."
Hearing Nina’s innocent words, all the Beastmen present burst into hearty laughter, which swept away the fatigue from their earlier labor, filling the open area with joyous waves.

chapters.title: Chapter 115 - 113: Work Points
chapters.content:
Chapter 115: Chapter 113: Work Points
After drinking the saltwater and resting for a while, it seemed that the beastmen had mostly recovered, and the limping kobold stood up.
"Alright, Nina, thanks for the saltwater. Hurry back, don’t keep your teacher waiting too long."
The cold winter was approaching, and the beastmen’s task of brick-making was still heavy, so they could only rest occasionally; there was still a large amount of work to be done.
Originally, after annexing the 780 people from the Blood Claw Tribe, the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe had again increased. It seemed that there shouldn’t be a lack of manpower, but in reality, the needs for food, clothing, and shelter for the new population had to be addressed. Moreover, with the cold winter approaching, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe needed to make more preparations for the winter’s food supply. Even though the beastmen captives hadn’t completed their full military transformation training, they were all brought out to be assigned to various teams, which highlighted the labor shortage.
"Goodbye, Uncle Nage, goodbye everyone."
Upon hearing this, Nina bid farewell to the limping kobold and the group of beastmen, and led a group of beastman children with empty wooden buckets back into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Watching Nina and the group of beastman children leave, the limping kobold then turned around.
"Alright, alright, everybody get up, let’s get to work!"
"Oh, Captain, can’t we rest a bit more? This work is really exhausting."
"Get lost, you lazy bunch! Whether you want to work or not, if you slack off any more today, you won’t get any work points!"
The beastmen, originally covered in mud, also started to move, albeit slowly. But as soon as they heard the word "work points" from the limping kobold, all of the beastmen immediately stood up with a buzz and began working swiftly.
"Hmph, a bunch of lazy bones, if I don’t give you a hard time, you really think you’re somebody!"
The limping kobold cursed as he directed the group of beastmen to start working.
The concept of work points was naturally devised by Austin, as a reform undertaken to better fit the current military and political system of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Initially, under Austin’s command, there were only seven and a half kobolds, and hence the distribution method was like that of a lord and his peasants. The peasants worked within the domain, and more than half of everything they produced was to be turned over, with the remainder kept as their own.
At that time, the number of Austin’s clan members was small, and the kobolds joined in a single tribe manner, so Austin did not introduce any other system reforms but continued the tradition of the Seta Continent.
However, as the Dragon Nest Tribe developed, the population of the entire tribe grew, and every beastman underwent military training, with daily tasks assigned accordingly. Beastman groups collaborated on various tasks. Under such a united command and labor cooperation system of all-out effort, if the beastman tribe continued the previous lord-peasant siphoning method, it would inevitably clash with the military arrangement of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After all, just like the goblins in the manufacturing workshop, who handled a large amount of wood daily inside the Dragon Nest Tribe to turn it into various weapons, although weapon production was crucial for the tribe, there was no source of food for them.
If the relationship between Austin and the clan members of the Dragon Nest Tribe still adopted the tax levy arrangement of a lord and dependent peasants, then the goblins in the manufacturing workshop would not get any food, which was clearly impossible.
Therefore, with the expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin gradually reformed the distribution method of the entire tribe.
From the initial tax levy to a large-scale communal system when the population increased, to step-by-step evolution into the current work points system.
This was also normal. Considering the military-civil unity and task directive tribal system of the Dragon Nest Tribe, it was fundamentally impossible to use the lord-peasant distribution method.
And now, almost all the adult beastmen in the entire Dragon Nest Tribe had undergone military training, were integrated military and civil, similar to those fiery times of the fifties and sixties in Austin’s previous life, thus Austin gradually started steering towards those times, launching communal meals, and with the richness of various foods in the Dragon Nest Tribe, extending to the work points system.
By working hard, one could earn work points distributed by the beastman captain, and more work points meant better food.
Before joining Austin’s Dragon Nest Tribe, many beastmen struggled to have consistent meals, often going hungry or having inconsistent meals. Now, as long as they worked hard, although it was a bit tiring, every meal was ensured to be filling. How could those beastmen who had just escaped those previous harsh living conditions not work hard?
Of course, at the start of the work points system in the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin also knew that these systems were basically good in the early stages, but various issues would gradually arise as time went on, though those would be dealt with bit by bit later.
For that Blue Dragon overlooking the entire Dragon Nest Tribe of over two thousand people from above, the limping beastman naturally didn’t understand its thoughts.
He stood on high ground, directing a team of beastmen to work back and forth, then glanced toward the majestic tribal settlement slowly rising from the forest, feeling a great sense of contentment welling up in his heart.
The beastmen under his command were only a small part of the tribe. The entire Dragon Nest Tribe, with more than two thousand people, worked orderly under this system, continually contributing to the tribe’s rise.
What wisdom it was, never before had such a beastman tribe appeared within the Kawa Great Forest. And the Austin who made all of this happen had long occupied a god-like status in the heart of every beastman.
"Who would have thought that this day would come?"
The limping kobold was among the initial seven and a half kobolds recruited by Austin.
He still remembered being expelled from the main tribe, enduring countless hardships along the journey, losing companions one after another, and feeling directionless. Eventually, his foot was injured during a hunt, an injury that spelled death in a life of wandering. As he was about to fall into utter despair, unexpectedly, a turn for the better came, and the honorable, kind, and wise His Highness Austin took them in, incorporating them into the clan.
At that time, the entire tribe only had a total population of seven and a half kobolds, suffering from hunger and thirst, and they were at risk of not surviving the cold winter.
And then, who could have imagined that today would come, that the entire tribe would expand to a great tribe of two thousand people in a short period, that they would build one warm house after another, cultivate one plot of land after another, train soldiers who swept through tribe after tribe, and have grain in the warehouse piled like mountains, without worries of hunger, cold, or enemies.
Reflecting on the panic and helplessness of those times, standing proudly in the Kawa Great Forest today, the limping beastman can’t help feeling a deep sense of emotion.

chapters.title: Chapter 116 - 114: Mighty Power
chapters.content:
Chapter 116: Chapter 114: Mighty Power
The Dragon Nest Tribe, which started with just seven and a half Kobolds, has now expanded to dominate an area spanning several tens of miles. Not even the lame Kobold could have anticipated this, nor did Vini, the current Governor of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Under Austin’s decision to establish the tribe, it has grown into this massive entity within a year.
The speed of this expansion and growth is shocking to every Beastman who joined early; no one could have imagined that this monstrous group built by Austin, the Blue Young Dragon, using various insights from his previous life, would develop to such an extent.
This force, organized using the systems and knowledge Austin knew from his past life, still harbors an incredibly frightening energy. Although Vini and the other top members of the Dragon Nest Tribe are not extraordinarily gifted individuals, following Austin for a long time, and with significant daily management training, they are now capable of seeing much further and wider.
This is a colossal entity on the verge of awakening, poised to shock the entire world when it reveals its claws.
"What a great power, this wisdom is beyond our imagination..."
Vini stands high in the City Hall, overlooking the neatly arranged houses, where Beastmen are organized in an orderly fashion at the village’s edge. From Vini’s vantage point, they appear as ants working together to steadily construct and expand the tribe.
The strict organization and coordination between various tasks are closely knitted by the bonds of military and governance, with every Beastman in the Dragon Nest Tribe becoming like screws twisted tightly together, forming this vast system.
Among the initial seven and a half Kobolds who joined under Austin’s banner, their fragmented tribe was originally driven out from internal strife within another Great Tribe. As their leader, Vini had once lived in that tribe, and owing to this, when compared to that old tribe, the system created by Austin for the Dragon Nest Tribe is even more astonishing.
In fact, throughout the Kawa Great Forest, strictly speaking, every tribe living here is merely a gathering place for groups of Beastmen banding together for better survival. They have no survival systems and very little cooperation; their battles are scattered, not even comparable to street brawls from Austin’s previous life.
Under such a scattered organization, neither the production capability nor the construction ability can compare to that of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"When we first joined under His Highness Austin, my clan and I were already in dire straits, unable to foresee any path ahead. At that time, we only had seven clansmen, a few broken wooden spears, leftover animal skins, and a tattered stone bowl. Every clansman was starved, skin and bones, with no hope in sight."
"Back then, His Highness appeared before us. Initially, we thought we were going to die, but in the end, His merciful Highness took us in, allowing us to survive under His protection. At that time, we had just escaped a life-and-death crisis, sleeping directly in nests under the Dragon’s Nest for the past few nights. Every morning, our fur was drenched with dew."
"At that time, our greatest wish was merely to live safely under His Highness’s protection every day, obtain enough food from the nearby territory, and build a small makeshift shelter to shield from the wind and rain for the coming cold winter season."
"No one could have imagined that all these changes would happen so swiftly. His Highness taught us many things, from coordinating to kill the first Ghost-headed Crocodile, to annexing the remnants of Rodney’s tribe, to besieging the Blood Wolf pack, recruiting populace, reclaiming lands, and attacking to annex other tribes, progressing step by step from nothing to the current state."
"Now, even if His Highness Austin were to slumber, with the Dragon Nest Tribe’s capacity to rapidly muster a fighting force of two thousand, along with the power of dozens of Extraordinary Beastmen, we are enough to dominate a vast area of a hundred miles without any rivals."
Vini stood high, gazing down at the continuously expanding tribe houses, his voice filled with awe.
"Indeed very great, His Highness’s wisdom is as boundless as the sky and sea, which is why I so easily surrendered to serve His Highness originally. His Highness is unlike any Lord I have ever seen, not just on the surface but internally. I have never heard of such a Dragon Lord, who not only started such an enterprise before coming of age but also didn’t indulge in plundering gold coins and crystals. Instead, He spends a tremendous amount of time on managing and developing the clan, treating the clan differently from other Dragon Race lords. Even among the Beastman Great Lords near the Border Great Wall, I have not seen anyone more capable than His Highness."
On the rooftop, the Dark Elf, Adinlek, standing behind with a longbow, spoke softly, his eyes flickering, lost in thought.
If this continues, perhaps it could...
The Dark Elf secretly plotted in his heart, some buried things deep inside began to slowly sprout.
"What’s the matter? Did you come to see me for something?"
Vini turned around and asked the Dark Elf.
"Yes, it’s about food."
Hearing this, the Dark Elf snapped back, suppressing his plotting, and started to explain the purpose of his visit.
There exists an unbridgeable gap in strength between Extraordinary Beastmen and ordinary Beastmen. Even a Bronze Level Lower Tier Extraordinary Beastman can easily defeat several times more enemies, let alone the talent abilities that can be awakened once one becomes Extraordinary.
But similarly, the greater the power, the more food and energy must be consumed. Substances like arrowroot starch from plants simply cannot suffice the consumption, necessitating a large intake of meat.
Currently, with the transformed Beastmen and captured Extraordinary Beastmen, the Dragon Nest Tribe has a total of fifty-six Extraordinary Beastmen. The meat consumption required by these Extraordinary Beastmen each day is an enormous number, even with the current scale of the Dragon Nest Tribe, supporting so many Extraordinary Beastmen feels strenuous.
Though Extraordinary Beastmen and transformed Beastmen can hunt enough food in the wild, the problem is that wild animals are ultimately limited. In recent days, the prey caught by the hunting party has gradually decreased.
The wildlife within the territorial expanse of several tens of miles cannot sustain the entire tribe, especially the consumption of several tens of Extraordinary Beastmen. Therefore, the Dark Elf has come this time hoping to lead a team to hunt Giant Beasts, to solve this issue facing the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 117 - 115 Submission
chapters.content:
Chapter 117: Chapter 115 Submission
Giant Beasts are powerful creatures that roam throughout the Kawa Great Forest, classified as something between ordinary beasts and magic beasts.
Giant Beasts do not possess Talent Magic, but magic power grants them extremely formidable physical conditions. Their massive bodies crush almost all hunters and are one of the top-tier monsters in the food chain within the Kawa Great Forest.
If one could hunt a Giant Beast, the meat from their mountain-sized bodies is enough to sustain the entire Dragon Nest Tribe for a day!
Giant Beasts are not uncommon in the Kawa Great Forest. When Austin initially chose the location to establish the Dragon’s Nest, it was away from the roaming grounds of Giant Beasts. Therefore, neither the last cold winter nor other times have seen much of their tracks.
However, as the Dragon Nest Tribe developed and its hunting teams continually explored outward, several sightings of Giant Beasts have occurred. It is imaginable that within a radius of over a hundred miles, many Giant Beasts are active among the mountains and forests.
Given the current strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, organizing Beastman Transcendents along with sufficient elite beastmen might be able to surround and kill them.
Giant Beasts are carnivorous hunters by nature. If they are slaughtered, they can provide the Dragon Nest Tribe with a substantial amount of meat and clear out top-tier hunters like them, increasing the animal population in the surrounding areas of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Hunt Giant Beasts?"
Vini frowned slightly upon hearing this, thought for a moment, and shook his head:
"The power of a Giant Beast isn’t much different from an Extraordinary Magical Beast and may even surpass it. It might cause significant casualties. This isn’t urgent; let’s decide after His Highness awakens."
"With His Highness in slumber, it’s best to prioritize stability during this period. Cold winter is approaching, and the more than seven hundred beastman captives don’t yet have enough housing. The most important issue now is the Dragon Nest Base."
"Alright, but with the addition of Extraordinary Beastmen, the manpower for the hunting team’s expeditions is now excessive. If needed, part of the hunting team could be redeployed for other tasks."
Although Vini rejected this suggestion, the Dark Elf did not find it strange, as after Austin fell asleep, the Dragon Nest Tribe immediately lost half its combat power. A contraction strategy is normal, with everything being for His Highness Austin.
With Austin in slumber, the Dragon Nest Tribe entered a stable period.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen were heavily training the beastman captives while continuously constructing the tribe’s base and quickly harvesting crops like kudzu root, obtaining food from the external forest and storing it in the warehouse.
Externally, after the war with the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, the Dragon Nest Tribe didn’t advance further or sweep across larger areas of other beastman tribes but instead began retracting its claws. Even the Dragon Nest Tribe’s hunting teams didn’t venture far from the Dragon Nest Base.
Yet even so, within tens of miles around the Dragon Nest Tribe, other scattered beastman tribes felt a sense of terror.
The terrifying power of that day’s battle, visible even from over ten miles away, when later the beastmen cautiously investigated, they could see the ruins of the Blood Claw Tribe and the partially collapsed hill nearby.
Such power, who could withstand it?
In addition to the earlier period when the Dragon Nest Tribe launched multiple offensives, swept through, and annexed beastman tribes one by one, this overwhelming force already instilled deep fear in other, more distant beastman tribes. Now, the battle at the Blood Claw Tribe Branch had completely shattered their willingness to resist.
With cold winter approaching, it’s impossible for these tribes to leave even if they wanted to. Compared to the unknowns of life and death outside, their old nests, cultivated over many years, with houses and food, increase their chances of surviving the merciless winter.
Amidst such circumstances, the beastman tribes around the Dragon Nest Tribe united and made a decision.
That is to prepare to submit and affiliate themselves with the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The law of the jungle is the principle of this world, especially in the Kawa Great Forest, affiliating with the strong is not something unbearable, on the contrary, it is quite natural, especially when the Lord is of the Giant Dragon Race.
The remnants of the Blood Claw Tribe, beside the half-collapsed hill, have already frightened the chiefs of these beastman tribes to the core. Instead of waiting for the Dragon Nest Tribe to come and sweep them away, turning them into prisoners, it’s better to go over with their followers now.
Creating such a significant force in the Kawa Great Forest, certainly marks someone worthy of following, not to mention those beastmen from the beastman tribes who were conquered and annexed are still alive and well, aren’t they?
Therefore, under the guidance of various factors, the remaining small beastman tribes around the Dragon Nest Tribe decided to submit.
The renown of the Dragon Nest Tribe was so great that these weak tribes surrendered almost without a fight, as emissaries brought "precious" gifts to the Dragon Nest Tribe, offering sacrifices to the great His Highness Austin in hopes of becoming his subjects.
When they entered the Dragon Nest Tribe, seeing houses neatly arranged, an orderly and disciplined army, complete armor and weapons, and the tall City Hall in the center built purely of bricks, they were even more resolute in their intentions to seek affiliation.
Now that Austin is asleep, he certainly couldn’t be aware of this. Everything is handled by Vini, the current Governor of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For the sudden appearance of dozens of beastman tribe "envoys," the Kobold leader Vini felt both happy and anxious.
He was happy that the Dragon Nest Tribe’s reputation could make these small tribes around the Dragon Nest Territory surrender without a fight, actively requesting to join and affiliate with the Dragon Nest Tribe, a far stronger result than defeating each tribe in the past and annexing them.
His anxiety came from having no precedent for handling these affiliations and relationships with these subordinate tribes. Now Austin is in slumber, there’s no way to report and obtain guidance, and he was unsure if his decisions were right or wrong.
After some deliberation, Vini finally decided to take these affiliates into the fold, expanding the scale and population of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Simultaneously, he had requirements. Firstly, it was non-negotiable that all affiliating beastman tribes must undergo the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s military training transformation to be integrated into the Dragon Nest system.

chapters.title: Chapter 118 - 116: Results
chapters.content:
Chapter 118: Chapter 116: Results
Military training was originally an idea proposed by Austin to enhance the combat capabilities of his seven kobold subordinates, with strict regulations binding group cooperation to exert powerful collective strength.
Later on, after overcoming numerous difficulties to train the kobolds into an army, Austin indeed achieved the results he desired. Following military training and strict group coordination, the kobolds vanquished the Ghost-headed Crocodiles, each of which was several times stronger than themselves, producing power beyond Austin’s imagination.
Moreover, after the baptism of blood, those initial seven kobolds seemed to be reborn, becoming increasingly powerful, like forged iron swords undergoing quenching to reveal a sharp, chilling gleam.
Even the routed soldiers led by Rodney, several times the number of kobolds, were badly defeated under the tightly coordinated formations of the kobold tribe.
Subsequently, Austin used the seven kobolds he trained as seeds to continually train the beastmen who joined later, gradually incorporating them into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The military structure extended from military training not only firmly controlled every beastman in the Dragon Nest Tribe but also maximized the group’s power. During this period, the entire tribe entered a rapid development phase, quickly achieving a position akin to that of a regional overlord.
As the tribe developed, the beastmen underwent military training, directly changing their food acquisition and distribution methods, gradually aligning towards a governance model resembling that of a major country in the fifties and sixties from Austin’s past life.
Although history proves that this model faced numerous problems in the future necessitating reforms, it is undeniable that at the beginning, when the nation was extremely impoverished, this system mobilized the people’s strength, allowing the country to win an almost unwinnable war. Subsequently, a complete industrial system was established, developing nuclear and hydrogen bombs, launching satellites into the starry sky, astonishing the world time and again.
No matter whether problems arise in the future, at least at the current stage, this system plays a tremendous role in uniting the Dragon Nest Tribe’s power to accomplish extraordinary feats.
It is precisely for this reason that military training, as the first seed Austin planted to influence this world, runs through the entire developmental process of the Dragon Nest Tribe, and naturally, it cannot be abandoned lightly.
Thus, even those tribes that willingly surrendered must undergo transformation through military training.
Through military training transformation, the beastmen’s laziness and lack of collective awareness are eradicated, filling their minds with obedience to orders. Moreover, through the military system, these beastmen are fully absorbed and integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe, thereby unleashing the maximum power of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
In the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, apart from the three main corps, even the civilian militia, goblins in the manufacturing workshop, and even beastman cubs spend time each day in group training to enhance order-following and group coordination awareness.
Under such circumstances, it is natural for the surrendering beastman tribes to undergo military training transformation. Even if Austin awoke, he would likely insist on this point; thus, Vini made this the first condition for their submission.
However, this meant that after military training transformation, the original beastman tribe would be disbanded and reorganized, and the original beastman tribe leaders would have no power left. How could they readily accept this?
"Lord Vini, is there truly no room for negotiation in this matter? I am willing to give up all my wealth, just to continue commanding my team after joining the Lord..."
The beastman envoys requesting to join and submit to the Dragon Nest Tribe were generally high ranks within a beastman tribe, including possibly the tribal chief.
Although beastmen think simply, they inevitably contemplate matters concerning their own interests deeply. If after submission and joining, their teams are gone and their status is the same as ordinary beastmen, akin to the once-defeated beastman tribes, they must think seriously about surrendering and joining.
"I don’t care who you are; if you want to submit, you must move entirely into the Dragon Nest Tribe and undergo military training transformation. On this point, there is no room for discussion."
Inside the City Hall, Vini looked down at a group of beastman envoys, his calm voice echoing like a mountain in every beastman’s heart, causing those around to feel a chill.
Clearly just a kobold, yet he exudes such domineering pressure...
The beastman envoys’ thoughts flickered, momentarily plunging the scene into an awkward silence.
Indeed, Vini had the capital to be so exalted. The system within the Dragon Nest Tribe differed entirely from other beastman tribes. Successfully reclaiming land allowed the tribe to be untethered from the forest’s food output, obtaining sufficient food from the fields to support the Dragon Nest Tribe’s rapid development and expansion. Therefore, once the Dragon Nest Tribe stabilized and absorbed the Blood Claw Tribe’s captured beastmen, as Austin awoke, a new round of sweeping was inevitably going to occur.
With the Dragon Nest Tribe’s current scale and power, within a hundred miles, no force could rival it. Whether these tribes surrendered or joined made little difference, as the ultimate result would be the same: complete absorption and integration into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For this reason, Vini’s tone brimmed with firmness, displaying little concern for these beastman tribes that would soon submit. Whether they joined or not made no difference.
Before long, these beastman envoys who came to surrender all left the Dragon Nest Tribe one after another.
Watching the distant figures of those beastman envoys, Vini revealed a cold smile. After putting forth conditions, only a few tribes understood the overwhelming power and decided to unconditionally join the Dragon Nest Tribe, returning home to bring people to move into the tribe.
However, more held onto a glimmer of hope, hoping for some future change, enduring with a "one day at a time" mentality.
"What fools, but it’s okay, let them jump around for a few more days."
After defeating the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, the Dragon Nest Tribe became the undisputed overlord-level power in the nearby area. Given the Dragon Nest Tribe’s uniqueness, a sweeping war was destined to launch soon, and waiting a while was not difficult to accept.
The submission of those scattered small and medium beastman tribes near the Dragon Nest Tribe was ultimately just a minor episode during Austin’s slumber and did not stir much of a wave.
However, those beastman tribes that had not decided to relinquish their power and join the Dragon Nest Tribe sensed the looming threat akin to a stormy cold winter.

chapters.title: Chapter 119 - 117 Giant Beast
chapters.content:
Chapter 119: Chapter 117 Giant Beast
As the cold winter approached, the entire Kawa Great Forest was engulfed in an undercurrent of tension, as the war of blood and fire once again sounded the horn at the Bloody Border. The Beastman armies, lacking sufficient food to survive the winter, surged from all directions to invade the Human World’s civilized lands.
It was a grand battle for survival, with countless lives lost each year along that narrow and wide strip. However, none of this had much to do with the Dragon Nest Tribe in the center of the Kawa Great Forest.
Crossing the vast sea of trees, due to the scarcity of food, the further south one went, the fewer traces of Beastmen there were, and the more potent the hidden dangers became.
Unlike the Beastmen at the Bloody Border who could plunder enough supplies from the Human World, the Beastman Tribes further south had no choice but to aim their long spears at their own kind.
Near the interior of the Kawa Forest, sporadic fires of war also spread between tribes. In this desperate world, food was always insufficient. To survive the harsh cold winter, unprepared Beastman Tribes had no alternative but to take up arms and attack other tribes in raids.
The law of the jungle, unveiled starkly in this final moment.
Meanwhile, the great migration began. Some tribes, when strong enough, started pruning the old, weak, sick, and even some of the young and strong were driven away, increasing the number of wandering Beastmen in the Kawa Great Forest.
And for some top-notch Hunters, this was an extremely rare feast!
Wham!!!
A torrent roared in the air, with vast swathes of trees being flattened by the gale, a shadow blotting out the sky appeared above.
Gazing at the terrifying giant figure, with its menacing teeth dripping dreadful acid, drooling, the Beastman team in the forest was instantly filled with terror, scattering like headless flies.
Gah!!!
The Giant Beast let out a strange cry, with a visible sound wave sweeping through the air. The wandering Beastmen, who had barely gathered for rest in the forest, all lamented their parents had not given them a couple more legs, scrambling away in all directions in panic.
But no matter how fast these wandering Beastmen ran, where could they escape to? The Giant Beast stretched its head, pecking the running Beastmen one by one like a rooster pecking rice, splattering crimson blood across the sky, severed limbs raining down to the ground, creating a gruesome carnage amidst the collapsing forest.
One wandering Beastman after another perished, and at the front, the Boarman Dom, hearing the hopeless screams behind, felt his legs go weak, but his survival instinct urged his bulky body into a desperate sprint for life.
This was the perilous Kawa Great Forest, where stopping to rest at any random spot could lead to an unavoidable disaster from above.
Having been cast out for eating too much and lacking special Skills, the Boarman Dom joined a group of wandering Beastmen, collectively sourcing enough food from the forest.
However, everyone in the group knew such days with plentiful food would not last long.
The cold winter was coming soon; by then, the whole forest would turn into a white desert of death. Without a tribal alliance or ample food storage, they would only have a few more days of jumping around.
To find a tribe that could take them in, the temporarily united wandering Beastman team decided to head north, hoping to join the powerful Beastman Tribes at the Bloody Border, securing strong protection to barely endure the cold winter.
Yet, none had expected that, while casually resting at a spot, they would suffer such calamity from above!
"It’s over, it’s all over!!!"
A fierce wind blasted overhead, accompanied by an all-encompassing shadow, a great disaster and dread engulfed their hearts. The Boarman Dom could clearly feel the enormous beast behind had locked onto him!
Stumbling underfoot, the Boarman Dom fell to the ground, turning around in fright to see the blood-salivating jaws of the Giant Beast rushing at him, about to swallow him whole.
Despair instantly consumed the Boarman Dom’s entire being.
At this very moment,
Whoosh!!!
A streak of light pierced through the sky, penetrating the Giant Beast’s mouth with fearsome Power, the force even skewing the Beast’s head, causing it to sink its teeth into a giant tree, crushing the trunk into fragments.
The Boarman Dom widened his eyes, his face still stricken with terror.
Gah!!!
Meanwhile, the Giant Beast let out a strange cry, angrily turning its head towards the source of the arrow.
Seen not far beyond the forest, a Dark Elf frowned slightly, slowly retracting his longbow. Behind him stood a well-organized team of Beastmen, facing the moving-mountain-like Giant Beast. Their eyes filled with tension, but not a flicker of fear.
"Gah!!!"
The Giant Beast roared loudly, abandoning the Boarman Dom, flapping its ugly meat wings, charging fiercely at the Dark Elf and the team behind him. The moving mountain of flesh surged forward like rolling ocean waves, toppling trees to both sides, stirring up huge clouds of dust, its force was immensely terrifying!
"Everyone, prepare for battle!"
The Dark Elf’s expression was grave. The previous policy of Governor Vini was to consolidate forces and avoid provoking these powerful Giant Beasts, but with time, the Giant Beast’s path was getting too close to the Dragon Nest Tribe, so they could only strangle the threat in its Cradle.
This time, he brought out more than half of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastman Transcendents, the rest were highly mobile Centaur Ranger cavalry. With the Transcendents taking turns confronting in the front, and the Centaur Rangers encircling and shooting, they might slay the Giant Beast at minimal cost.
"Plan One, forward!"
With a wave of the Dark Elf’s hand, a team of extraordinarily strong Beastman Transcendents, noticeably taller than the other Beastmen, rushed out with massive Stone Shields, charging at the Giant Beast.
At the same time, the Centaur cavalry behind split to both wings, swiftly galloping around the Giant Beast, drawing bows and nocking arrows. Instantly, arrows rained down like a storm, enveloping the Giant Beast.
Meanwhile, the Dark Elf silently pulled his longbow, the arrow shimmering faintly with Fighting Qi light, the arrow flew swift as lightning, piercing the right leg of the charging Giant Beast.
Suddenly, the Giant Beast stumbled down like an out-of-control speeding truck, crashing down, shattering trees and ground alike into debris.
Concurrently, the Beastman Transcendents bearing huge Stone Shields had already reached the front!

chapters.title: Chapter 120 - 118: The Stray Beastman’s Choice
chapters.content:
Chapter 120: Chapter 118: The Stray Beastman’s Choice
Ga!!!
Rolling clouds of dust surged into the sky, large swathes of trees were crushed down, accompanied by a painful shriek, the giant beast with scars all over its body collapsed with a boom upon the ground, breathing its last breaths.
"Whew, it’s finally dead!"
The sweat-drenched Dark Elf lowered the drawn bow and arrow, exhaled deeply, while the exhausted Beastmen surrounding him also relaxed, with many collapsing directly onto the ground.
This siege had exhausted them too much.
The giant beast’s strength had surpassed their imaginations.
Even with nearly half of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s elite gathered here, quite a few Beastmen were crushed to death by the terrifying power of the giant beast during the encirclement, aside from the previous attack on the Blood Claw Tribe, this was the Dragon Nest Tribe’s second casualty during an expedition.
But fortunately, with the perseverance like water dripping through stone, they finally wore out and killed the giant beast in front of them.
"Everyone take a rest, then quickly pack up and head back, this is not a place to linger."
Although it was rare for giant beasts to appear near the Dragon Nest Tribe, but with the cold winter’s arrival, giant beasts began to roam about, it’s possible for them to stray near here, the corpse of the beast in front of them is proof, and having the first one means there might be a second. In their current state, encountering another giant beast would be troublesome.
Though utterly exhausted, the Beastmen understood the urgency of the situation, and thanks to their military training, they knew to follow orders, hence they quickly stood up, dragging their tired bodies and tied the giant beast’s corpse with ropes, pulling it towards the direction of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Dust rolled and dispersed into the sky.
A long while passed, as Dom, the bewildered boarman sat on the ground still shaken.
"Complete, it’s over? I’m not dead?"
The almost terrified Dom stood up frantically, checked himself hastily, and after realizing no parts were missing, breathed a sigh of relief, yet inside he felt more like he’d survived a catastrophe.
Almost, he almost died!
For the first time ever, Dom felt a surge of fear towards death.
The sky gradually dimmed, the remaining stray Beastmen seemed to notice the upheaval here, and gathered from outside.
Yet this time, the wandering team originally had fifty or sixty, now only twenty or thirty were left.
"What do we do next, where’s our next destination?"
The disoriented wandering Beastmen gathered together, the day’s events left them all still shaken, confused about the future.
That horrible giant beast, along with the Beastmen army that easily slaughtered it, no matter which side, were forces they absolutely could not provoke.
Thinking of the dangers ahead, just like this, all the wandering Beastmen shivered, feeling as if the air grew colder.
"I’ve decided, maybe we should seek refuge with those people."
Suddenly, a Beastman spoke up.
"Are they the powerful Beastman army that appeared today?"
"That’s right, with such powerful strength, surely food won’t be too scarce, their immense strength must be able to shelter us through the coming cold winter season."
"But will they accept us?"
"Who knows, but not trying feels unsatisfactory."
The wandering Beastmen gathered around the fire, discussing slowly, while the boarman Dom sat silently in a corner, many thoughts crossed his mind.
But undeniably, at this moment, he was indeed tempted. Unlike those scattered fleeing wandering Beastmen, Dom had witnessed the strength of Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastmen firsthand.
The belief in the strength of the domineering, was the acknowledged law in this Barbaric Land. If they could join such a tribe, it would be immense fortune for them.
With the shelter of the strong, not only could they forego worries of safety, but the stronger the tribe, the less chance of food shortages, which was one reason why wandering Beastmen were eager to join strong tribes.
"But, do you know where that tribe is?"
Just then, another wandering Beastman asked.
"At that time we can ask the nearby tribes, surely they’ll know something, after all, a tribe strong enough to hunt giant beasts surely won’t have a small reputation."
"Alright, starting tomorrow let’s ask around one by one."
Anxiously, the wandering Beastmen spent an uneasy night in the forest.
When the sun rose the next day, the wandering Beastmen began searching for nearby tribes, inquiring about the powerful tribe and its situation.
Unexpectedly, the inquiry directly shocked them.
Within a radius of several dozen miles, the only tribe capable of hunting giant beasts was the Dragon Nest Tribe on the distant cliff, and the entire Dragon Nest Tribe’s size surprisingly surpassed two thousand, a medium-large tribe with quite a few elite Extraordinary Beastmen within.
And from the vague words of these Beastmen, they learned the Lord of the Dragon Nest Tribe was even more terrifying, rumored to have once roared and shattered the sky and earth, causing half a mountainside to collapse, easily defeating and annexing a mid-level medium tribe of a thousand, truly fearsome beyond comparison.
Though the Beastmen of these tribes tried hard to portray Dragon Nest Tribe as a cruel demon, it couldn’t deter these wandering Beastmen’s longing hearts, as they set off towards Dragon Nest Tribe after learning detailed information.
If they could submit and enter the Dragon Nest Tribe, they’d safely endure the cold winter season, under the care of such strong figures, what dangers could there be within the entire tribe? And once the saying spread of Dragon Nest Tribe recruiting wandering Beastmen through smoke signals, these wandering Beastmen hoped, like their predecessors, to have a chance to join the Dragon Nest Tribe.
With the growing reputation of Dragon Nest Tribe, more Beastmen sought to join, and those Beastmen tribes within the surrounding region didn’t hinder the wandering Beastmen’s journey towards Dragon Nest Tribe, instead subtly feeling joyous.
Such a large group of wandering Beastmen consumed massively daily, if they could just overpopulate Dragon Nest Tribe until it burst, that would’ve been wonderful.
Of course, that was merely wishful thinking.
Following Dragon Nest Tribe’s growing fame, the wandering Beastmen continuously came from afar, wanting to join the tribe, bringing only slight trouble compared to the immense gains.

chapters.title: Chapter 121 - 119 Mercenary
chapters.content:
Chapter 121: Chapter 119 Mercenary
Pfft!
Within the dense forest, an arrow swiftly cut through the air like lightning, piercing straight through the Kobold fleeing in a panic in the distance.
The ragged Kobold stared incredulously at the blood-stained arrow protruding from its chest, finally collapsing to the ground with a thud.
"This damned place, it’s full of these things."
Nearby, there came a rustling sound, as two figures approached, reaching out to retrieve the arrow stuck in the Kobold’s back.
"Come on, we’re better off now. If we were crossing the Bloody Border a few days ago, we’d have faced more Beastmen."
Sunlight filtered through the dense canopy, illuminating the figures—a pair of humans!
These two were dressed in somewhat worn leather armor, covered in dust, as if they’d been traveling for a long time. One, tall and thin, held a bow and arrow, while the other, more robust, carried a war axe, both displaying a fierce demeanor, appearing to be mercenaries.
"There shouldn’t be any Beastmen left, we’ve already delved deep in, their traces are much sparser."
The tall, thin man with the bow and arrow surveyed the surroundings uncertainly.
"We’ve done two rounds of patrol, they should be gone. This isn’t the border, it can’t gather as many Beastmen as over there."
"It’s really troublesome. If it weren’t for the gold coins, no way anyone would take such a task."
"Haha, it’s fine. Young Master Edward said we’re almost there. Soon, we’ll be out of this damned place. How about I treat you to some merriment at the tavern once we’re out?"
The two conversed as they kept an eye on their surroundings, gradually retreating into a hidden cavern.
Inside the cavern, a young man with handsome blond features sat by the campfire, perusing a few worn-out notes by its dim light.
This man was named Edward, a noble Knight, though his identity was extremely mysterious. According to these mercenaries, he likely hailed from nobility; no ordinary knight would casually wear such expensive magic armor or easily spend a large sum of gold coins to hire the best mercenaries at the border.
Along the journey, his humorous demeanor and extensive knowledge further confirmed their suspicions, leading them to respectfully refer to him as Young Master Edward.
The reason this group was here was due to a commission a month ago, protecting him as he ventured deep into the Kawa Great Forest, seemingly in search of some ruins.
Regular mercenaries didn’t know much about the specifics, but given that Edward was willing to pay so much and risk entering the depths of Kawa Great Forest, it didn’t seem like a simple matter.
"Edward, how’s it going?"
At this moment, a bald and powerful middle-aged man walked in from outside the cavern, sharp eyes hidden beneath thick brows, asking in a deep voice.
Valen, a renowned captain of the Black Bear Mercenary Corps in Bloody Border City, had a deeper relationship with Edward than regular members. It was this connection that led Edward to enlist Valen’s help for this journey into Kawa Great Forest.
Though the members weren’t entirely aware, everyone knew that Captain Valen and Edward had a deep private connection, which was why Valen would address Edward directly by name rather than referring to him as Young Master Edward like others.
"According to the Great Mage’s notes, we should almost be at the destination now. Valen, if we truly find that place, I owe you a huge favor."
Edward looked at Valen, speaking earnestly.
Valen, with his imposing build, leaned closer, patting Edward on the shoulder:
"What’s there to owe between us? Without you back then, I’d have died in the barren wilderness, taken by wild dogs. Besides, you’re paying handsomely for this trip, just regular employment."
"Regardless, thank you all. If I can truly find what the Great Mage left behind, it would be crucial for my future path."
"Don’t be too optimistic yet. Although you say we’re near the destination, this area isn’t exactly safe."
The bald, burly Valen poured a cold bucket of reality over Edward, reminding him with a serious tone.
"What do you mean?"
Picking up on the heavy tone in Mercenary Captain Valen’s voice, Edward quickly asked.
"Nearby, there’s a very powerful tribe roaming, and their leader is a Blue Dragon."
Every time they approached a location, they would capture some Beastmen to inquire about nearby forces or dangerous territories, to avoid those hard-to-resist dangers and preserve the team’s strength.
"An adult Giant Dragon? That’s troublesome, let’s hope the destination isn’t too close...."
Upon hearing this, Edward furrowed his brows, pondering in a low voice.
Many wild Beastmen liked Toby, serving under powerful creatures, among them Giant Dragons being one of the favorites. If a Clan Tribe was strong, it meant that as their leader, the dragon’s power was also formidable.
And for an adult Giant Dragon, their power was above Legendary.
Though their mercenary team was quite capable, facing a Legendary would mean no chance of survival.
"No, it’s not an adult Giant Dragon. It’s said to be a Blue Young Dragon, no older than ten years, but the clan under its command already numbers over 2,500 Beastmen, including many Beastman Transcendents, extremely powerful."
Seeing Edward’s reaction, Valen knew he misunderstood and explained.
"A Blue Young Dragon?"
This clearly surprised Edward, showing astonishment.
A Blue Young Dragon, not even ten years old, had managed to gather a tribe exceeding 2,500 members?
Not to mention that most Giant Dragon Race members before the age of ten would typically grow in their parents’ nest through deep slumber, yet how did such a young Dragon gather such formidable forces?
Many adult dragons typically only had a few Dragon Vein Beastmen and two to three thousand ordinary Beastmen under their command!
For some reason, Edward felt an ominous premonition that this dragon might be the greatest obstacle in his journey.
"Indeed, just a Blue Young Dragon, but the clan under its command is the most dominant force in this region."
Recalling the information gleaned from the Beastmen’s mouths, Mercenary Captain Valen couldn’t help but furrow his brows, even with their extensive background, bewildered by this occurrence.

chapters.title: Chapter 122 - 120 Threat
chapters.content:
Chapter 122: Chapter 120 Threat
It is said that the young dragon appeared in the nearby area in recent years, and at first, some beastmen found its traces while hunting and gathering.
However, the terrain here is remote, and the magic resources are scarce, so powerful magical creatures rarely appear. The beastman tribes living nearby are just ordinary beastmen. No matter how you look at it, a young dragon is an extraordinary creature, and thus these beastmen didn’t entertain any delusions of slaying a dragon. Anyway, the dragon doesn’t really eat beastmen, so in such a vast area, just avoiding it when encountering it was enough.
But two years ago, something inexplicable happened. The blue young dragon suddenly grew rapidly, its body expanded significantly, its power increased dramatically, and it gathered a group of beastman clans under its command. Leading its army, it began to wage continuous wars outside, winning every battle, and capturing one beastman tribe after another. The blue dragon’s influence expanded rapidly, its numbers quickly exceeded a thousand, becoming the most powerful overlord of the nearby region.
This is simply unbelievable because any beastman living nearby knows that this barren area has never seen a medium to large tribe capable of gathering over a thousand people because such a barren land simply cannot support so many beastmen for survival.
In the hunting civilization stage, relying on the inefficient method of hunting and gathering to obtain food from the forest could never support the consumption of large tribal groups. They could only split into small tribes scattered across the vast area, obtaining enough food for survival from the extensive forest.
But this blue young dragon made it happen. In just a year or two, it gathered a large tribe of over 2,500 people. Judging by the fearful expressions of those beastmen, it’s clear that the beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe are not to be trifled with.
"You mean to say that a blue young dragon managed, in just two years, to build an extremely powerful Dragon Nest Tribe with over 2,500 people from nothing and dominate the nearby area in a short time? How is that possible!"
Even Edward was dumbfounded upon hearing the information Valen extracted from the wild beastmen.
This is absolutely impossible!
Diving deep into the Kawa Great Forest for months, Edward has become well-attuned to the current conditions of these beastmen living here. He felt confident that even the wisest and mightiest king or duke from the human world couldn’t achieve this.
"Or perhaps there’s some powerful support behind the blue young dragon?"
Edward spoke with a grave expression.
Young dragons are typically looked after by adult giant dragon parents. Perhaps what this young dragon is doing is merely playful antics supported by its dragon parents?
There might be such a possibility. However, even for adult dragon parents, the resources required to support their playful offspring to such an extent would likely be a huge number. The daily food consumption for over 2,500 people would not be an easy task for even adult giant dragons to resolve.
"No, according to the beastmen, there has never been a trace of giant dragons in the vicinity. They did not sense the mighty dragon aura of an adult giant dragon when they went to investigate. If I’m not mistaken, it should be an orphan dragon."
Once a giant dragon reaches adulthood, it becomes legendary. Even if it doesn’t unleash its power, the dragon aura it emits in normal activities can strike fear into ordinary beings. However, the beastmen living in this nearby area have never felt that overwhelming, terrifying dragon aura that can be sensed from miles away.
All signs indicate that the blue young dragon is an orphan dragon without parental care.
And this only makes everyone feel an even greater sense of absurdity.
"If that’s really the case, Brother Valen, we might be facing big trouble."
After a long silence, Edward spoke in a heavy tone.
"It should be alright. As long as we carefully avoid them, that Great Mage’s ruins might not even fall within the Dragon Nest Tribe’s territory."
Valen hurriedly replied to comfort him.
"No, that’s not what I mean. Compared to this, the Great Mage’s ruins are nothing..."
Edward lowered his head, his golden curls casting shadows over his handsome face, and he murmured to himself in a voice only he could hear.
Unlike Valen, who came from poverty, Edward clearly understood more about what all this means for the Kawa Great Forest and human civilization’s world.
"Brother Valen, tomorrow let’s go to the blue young dragon’s tribe. There are some very important things I need to confirm."
After a long silence, Edward finally looked up and said to Valen, who was sitting nearby with a puzzled expression.
"Alright then."
Mercenary Captain Valen originally didn’t want to bother with these matters, but seeing Edward’s determined gaze, Valen, knowing his character, hesitated and then agreed.
He then turned and left, evidently going outside to discuss this decision with the team members.
Edward silently sat on a rock, his pupils reflecting the golden firelight, appearing especially profound.
"If this is really the case, then it’s troublesome. I hope I’m just overthinking it..."
Even though he hadn’t met it yet, a baseless premonition suddenly arose in Edward’s heart. That blue young dragon might not only be the biggest obstacle on this journey but could also very likely be the greatest enemy he will face in the future...
....
Inside the Dragon Nest Tribe,
With the cold winter approaching step by step, the Dragon Nest Beastmen were in their final busy stage. Through overloaded production, a large number of bricks were fired, and with the orderly cooperation of teams of beastmen, neatly designed houses rose from the ground and continued to spread outward.
Hundreds of beastmen, united in cooperation, were building houses, but there wasn’t a hint of chaos — everything was orderly and organized.
At the same time, teams of spear-wielding beastmen marched in order from the Dragon Nest Tribe’s gate, heading to the large training field outside. They lined up in squares, training uniformly, with their voices rising to the sky and movements perfectly synchronized.
In the more distant fields, civilian beastmen were turning over plots one by one, and another team of beastmen was loading them into baskets and carrying them back toward the Dragon Nest Tribe.
On the edges of the fields, many beastman women were processing the harvested kudzu vines, removing the leaves, sorting them out, rolling them into bundles, and taking them back to the tribe to weave into ropes. Even the fallen leaves were not wasted; they were gathered and stored as fodder for buffalo livestock over the winter.
From a height, one could see a large number of reclaimed fields radiating outward with the Dragon Nest Tribe at the center, as beastmen, either building houses, training, or harvesting fields, engaged in energetic activity, filled with vibrant life.

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - 121 Differences
chapters.content:
Chapter 123: Chapter 121 Differences
"Damn it, how is this possible!"
A few days later, in a dense forest far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, a team of mercenaries hid among the foliage, their eyes peering through the thick leaves to see the slowly forming "small city" in the distance.
Yes, a small city!
This vast and orderly cluster of buildings could be called a city even by the standards of the Human World.
This is simply unbelievable!
In such a barbaric zone, in a place untouched by civilization, the fact that a city had been built by beastmen was shocking to them.
What shocked them even more was the beastmen training on the open space outside the small city. Each held a long spear, standing uniformly on the open ground. Both their footsteps and movements were coordinated, well-trained, and their aura was clearly that of seasoned veteran warriors, not merely ornamental displays.
Even from afar, there was an aura of stalwart bravery emanating forth, comparable to the elite troops of some large duchies in the Human World, and perhaps even more disciplined.
"Is this the Clan Tribe of that Blue Young Dragon? If everything here was orchestrated by that Blue Young Dragon, then we’re in trouble!"
Mercenary Captain Valen stared intently at the lines of beastmen filing out, speaking gravely.
Having experienced countless battles, they could naturally see the prowess of these beastmen armies—their organized warfare, stringent collaboration, and the sight of spear formations moving flawlessly at the sound of orders. Mercenary Captain Valen imagined if they were the opponents; without unleashing a powerful Fighting Qi to crushingly break through this tight formation, it would be impossible.
However, according to the intelligence they had, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe’s beastman population exceeded two thousand five hundred. Even dragging it out could overwhelm them, not to mention the presence of numerous powerful extraordinary beastmen within the tribe, whose cooperation made them even more formidable.
This Dragon Nest Tribe was beyond their capacity to handle.
Just one look and all the members of the Black Bear Mercenaries made the same judgment.
"Indeed, it’s a big trouble, a huge trouble at that."
Beside him, Edward peered intently at the city being built bit by bit through the gaps in the leaves, his gaze profound as he spoke.
Compared to the mercenaries, Edward, who had seen more, saw even more.
As they passed by, he saw vast expanses of cultivated farmland, the beastman militia working in harmony, and large harvests of kudzu root being gathered at the field’s edge.
All of this seemed to show him a power unlike any other, even an unprecedented empire slowly rising above the Barbaric Zone in the Kawa Great Forest, engulfing everything.
And when that time comes, if it truly establishes such an empire encompassing the entire Wilderness, then the Civilized Continent would be in trouble.
"Let’s go, Edward. Before they find us, let’s detour around them."
Mercenary Captain Valen came over, his eyes looking deeply at the faraway, slowly rising beastman tribe, speaking to Edward.
From his many years of rich experience, just the strength showcased outside this tribe would make taking it down impossible without a thousand well-equipped elite regular soldiers, not to mention the depths of that mysterious Blue Young Dragon. Seeking fortune and avoiding calamity is an instinct for mercenaries.
"No, Brother Valen, I hope you’ll help me overthrow them. If we can’t crush this tribe and slaughter that dragon, it will definitely become a big problem in the future!"
Edward remained where he was, instead earnestly looking at Mercenary Captain Valen as he spoke.
"Are you crazy!"
Mercenary Captain Valen’s eyes widened in disbelief as he looked at Edward.
To Valen, for their team of only about ten mercenaries to attack a beastman tribe of over two thousand, well-trained and possessing the Dragon Nest Tribe with beastman transcendents, seemed like sheer madness!
"No, I’m not crazy, Brother Valen, listen to me."
Edward measured his tone, looking gravely at Mercenary Captain Valen’s eyes:
"Brother Valen, throughout the journey, you’ve seen many beastman tribes situated in this barbaric land. When we crossed the Bloody Border, we even closely scouted a large beastman tribe with over ten thousand beastmen. Think carefully, what difference is there between the beastman tribes we’ve seen on this journey and this Dragon Nest Tribe?"
"Filthy, hungry, bloodthirsty, mad, desperate... Every day, skeletal beastmen die in the alleyways and are dragged out and piled up outside in heaps, with flies buzzing over them and maggots crawling from rotting eyeballs. In the distance, wild dogs bark with joy, carrying away decayed heads into the forest... This is land filled with despair and chaos. No matter how big the beastman tribe, no matter how many beastmen gather, I never believed they could pose any threat to the northern countries."
"But now, look, a city cleaner than the royal capital, an army more well-trained than the kingdom’s elite, a roar louder than the temple’s divine followers... In less than two years, from nothing, such a formidable tribal settlement was established. If given two more years, three years, or even ten or twenty years? Remember, that’s a dragon! A Giant Dragon with a lifespan of hundreds or thousands of years! If we don’t stop them now, in the future, that alien dragon is bound to command its clan to dominate the entire Kawa Great Forest, establishing an unprecedented beastman empire, and then the Human World would be in trouble!"
Edward spoke more passionately, as if seeing the Border Great Wall, built over a thousand years by humans, being breached, several duchies near the Kawa Great Forest border becoming a playground for beastmen, hundreds of thousands of humans dying under beastman weapons, and even more displaced.
"What does it have to do with us? Edward, I’m just a small mercenary captain. I have to be responsible for my team members. I can’t send them on a suicide mission!"
Mercenary Captain Valen patted Edward’s shoulder heavily, his calm voice brimming with firmness.
Edward looked around, but all the mercenaries avoided his gaze instinctively. Without needing words, he understood their choice.
Indeed, no one is willing to risk their life for a thankless task.
Even if the future turns out as Edward said, what does it matter? Whether or not these mercenaries who live by the blade survive that long is still uncertain.
Could it be that they really will ignore the rise of this Dragon Nest Tribe before them?
For a moment, Edward was filled with despair.

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - 122: Secret Plot
chapters.content:
Chapter 124: Chapter 122: Secret Plot
No, there must be a chance!
Edward’s thoughts raced as he tried to find a way to break the deadlock. As a knight, he couldn’t just sit by and watch the northern border face the rise of the Beastman Empire. He had to do something.
"Edward..."
Mercenary Captain Valen patted him on the shoulder, shook his head, and turned away in silence.
The rest of the mercenaries also prepared to leave. Each person here was a veteran mercenary who had survived many battles. No one was willing to undertake a mission that meant certain death.
What did the future disasters on the border have to do with them? Whether they could live to see that day was still unknown. Although minstrel songs often told tales of certain unnamed mercenary groups overcoming countless obstacles to ultimately thwart the evil dragon’s plot, slay it, and become a legendary hero team in the entire Prime Material Plane.
But those stories were really just for children. Reality was not a novel; there were always some enemies that couldn’t be defeated by mere hot-blooded bravery.
"But are you really satisfied with this? Such a great opportunity is right in front of you; what does some danger matter?"
As the mercenaries prepared to leave, Edward suddenly spoke up.
"A young dragon, an orphan dragon without the protection of an adult giant dragon. Finding a surviving orphan dragon in the wild is hundreds of times more difficult than finding an adult giant dragon. If you slay this young dragon, even if it’s just a young dragon, you will become legends, dragon slayer warriors spoken of by minstrels!"
"Money, fame, status, and even power are within reach! Once you slay that young dragon, you could even gain rewards from kings upon your return, becoming noble and your descendants will take pride in your deeds. Are you really going to give up such a good opportunity?"
"Even if there are more than two thousand beastmen tribes, so what? They’re just mere beastmen!"
Gradually, Edward’s voice became filled with irresistible temptation.
In fact, it was true. Even slaying a young dragon made one a legendary dragon slayer warrior. That title was enough to make them honored guests in any duchy, forever passing down their name in family history.
Moreover, after slaying a dragon, if they bathed in dragon blood, their power and level of life would experience a leap.
As Edward’s words fell, the mercenaries suddenly hesitated in their footsteps.
"Edward, don’t talk nonsense. These are not enemies we can handle!"
Mercenary Captain Valen’s face looked somewhat distressed. Although he also felt tempted, he ultimately suppressed the thrill in his heart.
He was well aware that with their strength, dealing with such a medium-sized beastman tribe was simply courting death, not to mention that the blue young dragon had not shown up till now.
"No, Brother Valen, how could I send you to your death in vain? I already have a plan to deal with them. As long as you help me, we can surely win!" Edward hurriedly said, his tone serious.
"Everyone, remember the storm tiger we encountered nearby earlier? As long as we provoke that beast and lure it over, those mindless creatures will surely go mad and attack the Dragon Nest Tribe. Once they’re both heavily damaged, we can catch them off guard, wipe out the entire tribe, and finally slay that dragon."
Hearing this, the mercenaries were somewhat moved.
While exploring, they passed by remnants of a beastman tribe that had been attacked. Near it, they found traces of a storm tiger. Judging by the powerful magic power aura, it had at least grown to tier six, with combat strength reaching at least the silver supreme level.
At that time, they didn’t disturb the storm tiger, only quietly passing by. Now, under Edward’s plan, they finally remembered that terrifying and powerful magic beast.
"At the time, we were only afraid that the noise of the battle would be too great, so we didn’t hunt the storm tiger. Just one storm tiger isn’t enough for this Dragon Nest Tribe to be severely damaged."
Valen shook his head, but his flickering eyes revealed his growing heart’s desire.
The surrounding mercenaries also seemed eager to try.
"One storm tiger isn’t enough, but what about adding several giant beasts? Don’t forget, it’s the season when giant beasts roam for hunting, and we also discovered many traces of giant beasts nearby on our way here. If we lure them too, we’ll surely succeed!"
Edward spoke firmly, filled with confidence in this plan.
Meanwhile, he looked around at the mercenaries, seeing the uncontrollable ambition burning deep in their eyes. Edward knew in his heart that everything was settled!
...
Swish!
The dense bushes were parted as a team of fierce and well-trained beastmen emerged from the grass.
This was a patrol team,
A few days ago, traces of a giant beast had been spotted near the Dragon Nest Tribe. To guard against these terrifying predators, Quik specifically set up several patrol teams to monitor the area around the tribe.
However, during the midday roll call, they found a patrol team missing and still hadn’t returned after lunch.
The beastmen, modified through military training, were now no less disciplined than Austin’s previous life army, making it impossible for them to be absent without reason. Therefore, squad after squad of beastmen units were dispatched for patrol.
"Look, what’s that over there?!"
A beastman shouted, and all the beastmen looked in the direction indicated.
The leading beastman captain parted the grass with a few strides to reveal the bodies of their companions, hidden within.
"Damn it!"
The beastman captain cursed, staring at the once-companions now turned into corpses, his long spear thrust forcefully into the ground.
A patrol team had been silently killed not far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, causing a massive disturbance within the entire tribe. The smooth wounds on the corpses indicated the enemy’s weapons were exceptionally sharp, beyond what ordinary stone tools or bone implements could cause.
Some powerful and unknown enemy was roaming nearby!
The loss of this beastman patrol team immediately raised the Dragon Nest Tribe to the highest alert. Everyone was in wartime status, the beastman militia halting production. Be it young or old, male or female, all took up long spears ready to fight. Well-trained units marched out of the tribe’s gate in columns, starting a unified sweeping search outside the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 125 - 123 Search
chapters.content:
Chapter 125: Chapter 123 Search
Edward and his companions naturally did not expect that the orc patrol team they casually killed on the road would become their greatest vulnerability.
Indeed, even among human nations, a noble doesn’t know how many peasants are beneath him, let alone these lowly and ugly beastman tribes. In some large tribes, members often go hunting and are bitten by poisonous snakes, or are killed by prey, or encounter unknown dangers and never return.
For those great tribes, maintaining core strength is enough, since new beastmen join every day and others die as well. Who would care if some beastmen have encountered enemies and been killed?
Wan Lun and others led their team across the Kawa Great Forest, entering the central territory without any trouble, precisely because of this.
But how could they have known that the Dragon Nest Tribe’s system was completely different from other beastman tribes? This became their greatest mistake.
One by one, orc armies poured out of the Dragon Nest Tribe, like an unstoppable steel flood, with terrifying and fearsome momentum in their orderly steps, as if everything in front would be destroyed under the impact of this torrent.
At the forefront of the team, Rodney led the way, with the orc隊長s bristling with long spears silently following behind.
As one of the earliest orcs to undergo the Dragon Vein Transformation, and an early elder who joined when the Dragon Nest Tribe was weak, Rodney has now become one of the top figures in the Dragon Nest Tribe, commanding the orc infantry corps within the three major armies.
Back then, Rodney led remnant forces to attack the Dragon Nest Tribe, which only had seven kobolds. Ultimately, they were counterattacked by the blood-hardened kobolds and were defeated and captured, thus beginning the process of submitting under Austin’s banner.
As an orc who joined relatively early, he personally experienced Austin leading the beastmen to fish by cutting through ice, encircle and slay the Blood Wolves, open up wastelands, and battle in all directions, a phase of iron-blooded rise. In these events, the Dragon Nest Tribe grew from a small gathering of a few cats in a yard to the undisputed overlord of the nearby region.
He almost watched the rise of the Dragon Nest Tribe from nothing with his own eyes.
A year ago, Rodney had led remnant forces in a desperate escape, fearing the many hidden dangers of the forest, living from hand to mouth, with no guarantee of the next day.
And now, a year later, he leads hundreds of elite beastmen, with more than ten or twenty extraordinary orc captains under his command, whose strength is enough to challenge the giant beasts roaming the forest.
All this was successfully achieved under the leadership of His Highness Austin.
In daily life, Rodney already feels an immense admiration for the great His Highness Austin, willing to devote his life to fighting for the grand cause of His Highness.
Now, Quik, the fox-faced man from the same tribe has received significant responsibilities from His Highness Austin, becoming an important figure in the Dragon Nest Tribe, while Rodney has also become the leader of one of the three major corps.
But that is not enough. With the increasing popularity of the Breathing Technique and the growing number of transformed extraordinary orcs, the pressure he faces from the many excellent subordinates grows.
Rodney set a small goal for himself, like becoming the first warrior of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
And now, the emergence of those hidden unknown enemies in the darkness is the perfect opportunity!
"Everyone, move out!"
Rows of troops set out with a roar, divided into four streams, searching in all directions.
Judging by the wounds on that orc patrol, the enemy’s strength is likely formidable. The top ranks of the Dragon Nest Tribe gather, guessing that it might be retaliatory action from the headquarters of the Blood Claw Tribe.
To prevent being defeated one by one, the search parties are divided into four, heading east, south, west, and north, while maintaining considerable cavalry squads between each group for communication.
Meanwhile, during this search, they are not allowed to exceed a ten-mile radius from the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After sweeping through once, if no trace of the enemy is found, all orc armies will return and defend the tribe, waiting for His Highness Austin to awaken.
The reaction of the Dragon Nest Tribe is not excessive, considering the strength of the Blood Claw Tribe headquarters, being cautious is not unwarranted.
.....
Boom! Boom! Boom!
In a certain dense forest, massive ancient trees tower up high, an endless sea of forests undulating ceaselessly.
Not far away, a giant beast as colossal as a mountain walked through the forest, each step left an imprint on the earth as if causing earthquakes, making the ground tremble, while the surrounding giant ancient trees fell like wheat in its path, breaking and shattering.
The beast resembled an elephant, but it was ten times larger than a normal one, making the whole world tremble with each step.
Roar!!!
The giant beast raised its head and howled, its long trunk lifted high, instantly turning its roar into a visible tsunami, sweeping in all directions. The enormous sound stirred the air like rushing tides, causing the surrounding trees to bow and scrape under it.
"Every time I see such giant beast creatures, I feel an awe that comes from the heart."
In the distance, between forests, several figures stood on the branch of a giant ancient tree, looking at the mountain-like giant beast, sighing as they spoke.
"Indeed, only the vast and endless Barbaric Land like the Kawa Great Forest can harbor such massive beings. These creatures are among the largest in the world; luckily they don’t exist in the human civilized world, or dealing with them would require at least several hundred elite troops or Silver and Gold level adventurers to kill them."
"This is already good. We’ve searched so far and found just one or two. It’s said in this vast wilderness, some magic power-rich places harbor very large groups of giant beasts. In those areas, even eighth or ninth-level magic beasts tread cautiously. No wonder that Blue Young Dragon chose to nest here; the position is indeed good, even signs of giant beasts are rare."
"Let’s start; the appointed time is almost here. Let’s first lure this giant beast over. Hopefully, others have found similar prey. If we can draw five such giant beasts to the Dragon Nest Tribe and let them hurt each other, stepping in to clean up the aftermath, then achieving the feat of dragon slaying might not be as challenging as it seems."
The few exchanged glances, then swooped down with a whiz, disappearing into the forest.

chapters.title: Chapter 126 - 124 Intense Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 126: Chapter 124 Intense Battle
Rumble!!!
Amidst the earth-shaking roar, towering trees collapsed one by one, sending dust swirling into the sky.
