Within the billowing dust, the frenzied giant beast, eyes bloodshot, like a runaway heavy truck, charged madly toward the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"All Dragon Vein Attendants, get up front and block them for me!"
At the front of the tribe, staring at the colossal beast barreling toward them, Rodney’s eyes burned with fury. He shouted angrily and charged ahead with a massive Stone Shield.
This attack came too swiftly. When five giant beasts accompanied by a Storm Tiger appeared, despite the Dragon Nest Tribe’s preparations, they could only barely resist against such a terrifying enemy.
Fortunately, the Storm Tiger, being a crafty Magic Beast, quickly fled upon seeing other giant beasts enter the battlefield.
But the creature did not leave; instead, it lingered in the dense forest surrounding the area, seemingly coveting something.
Although the Storm Tiger did not join the siege, under the assault of these dimwitted, easily-frenzied giant beasts, the Dragon Nest Beastmen could only barely sustain themselves.
Boom boom boom!
One Extraordinary Beastman after another rushed up only to be flung away by the giant beast, while ordinary Beastmen behind them tossed ropes twisted from vines, trying to bind the giant beast entirely. As more ropes joined, soon each of the giant beasts seemed caught in a web, immediately easing the pressure on the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
"Good thing we prepared in advance! Otherwise, we’d be in trouble today."
Vini stood at a high vantage point, overseeing the five battlefields, unable to suppress a surge of gratitude in his heart.
A few days ago, although the disappearance of a Beastman patrol team alerted the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, and they sent out large groups for reconnaissance, the enemy seemed to vanish without a trace.
Despite not seeing the enemy, to prevent a surprise attack, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s Beastmen decided to contract their defense and dispatched numerous Rodent Scout teams to patrol.
Thanks to the Rodents’ scouting, they detected the giant beasts charging from over the mountain early, allowing the Dragon Nest Tribe to prepare in advance and prevent the beasts from invading the tribe’s interior.
"Forward for the great His Highness Austin!"
Amid the overwhelming roar, orders were given without confusion.
Extraordinary Beastmen were at the forefront, ordinary Beastmen wielding long spears behind them, throwing their spears for support. Simultaneously, teams of Beastmen cast ropes woven from vines, trying to bind the giant beasts. Meanwhile, Rangers roamed the perimeter, raining down arrows.
Through united collaboration, the Dragon Nest Beastmen finally halted the giants’ advance, causing victory to sway increasingly toward the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Damn, this can’t go on!"
In the dense forest, hidden within the trees observing everything, Edward cursed fiercely.
"Indeed, we underestimated these Beastmen’s strength, Edward, you were right. If that Dragon’s Clan continues to grow, the Southern Countries will face immense trouble."
Beside him, Mercenary Captain Valen looked at the giant beasts starting to falter in the field, his expression grave, and the same was true for the other mercenaries.
Although anticipated initially, when the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen’s true strength was displayed before them, everyone was taken aback.
With coordinated efforts, the Beastman army attacking the giant beasts remained unfazed, responding to each other, and drove back enemies many times stronger, while suffering minimal losses themselves.
This level of fighting power, this disciplined collaboration, reminded everyone of the most elite disciplined armies in certain duchies.
If they had attacked directly from the start, their outcome would surely not have been favorable.
"Never expected their strength to be so formidable, and they seem to have devised a strategy for slaying giant beasts long ago."
Neither Edward nor the mercenaries knew that previously, as a giant beast neared the Dragon Nest Tribe’s borders, the Dark Elves had to lead an army to eliminate it.
Although they ultimately killed the beast, the Dragon Nest Tribe also suffered significant losses, prompting the leadership to devise another method for hunting giant beasts post-battle.
That method involved using a multitude of rope nets to confine the giant beasts’ movements within certain boundaries. A large harvest of arrowroot vines provided ample material for weaving ropes, instructing production Beastmen to prepare these ropes for future use against giant beasts. Subsequently, Beastman Legions practiced formations for combating giant beasts several times.
Thanks to the timid and cautious Rodent Scouts, who had spotted the giant beasts before they reached the Dragon Nest Tribe, the preemptive preparations were already in place, leading to these results in the end.
"No choice but for us to take action."
Edward looked at the five giant beasts being steadily suppressed by the Dragon Nest Tribe and spoke in a deep voice.
"If we let them kill the giant beasts, we will lose all opportunity! Now, while they’re at a standoff, let’s circle behind for a surprise attack and set a fire in that Dragon Nest Tribe. I refuse to believe they won’t collapse!"
"But if we proceed like this, the losses might be substantial."
Mercenary Captain Valen’s voice was somewhat somber, but he knew now was the best time to strike.
"If we want to gain enough benefits, we must pay the corresponding price. The title of Dragon Slayer is right before us; what’s your decision?"
Edward scanned the gathered mercenaries, speaking with finality.
"Since I was the one who suggested slaying the dragon first, I will personally enter to draw some Beastmen’s attention. You quickly circle behind for a surprise attack, setting a fire within the tribe swiftly. Once the fire is ablaze, these Beastmen will likely collapse, and when the giant beasts storm into the tribe to wreak havoc, decimating the Dragon Nest Tribe’s resistance — that’s when we will have our chance to slay the dragon!"
...
At that moment, the organized Dragon Nest Tribe army was already dispatched outside to fend off the giant beasts, leaving the Dragon Nest Tribe somewhat desolate, yet the guards were not relaxed, instead becoming even more vigilant.
Three primary companies had already mobilized, also drawing a large number of Beastman militia.
However, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, many production Beastmen also picked up Wooden Spears, constantly patrolling within the tribe to prevent any enemy from sneaking in during the chaos.
Despite these production Beastmen being inferior in physique and other aspects compared to the real Beastman army, and even to the Beastman militia,
Yet, with intensive training, their collaborative fighting strength was no less than the combat personnel from average Beastman Tribes outside.
And they were the final defense line for the entire Dragon Nest Tribe!

chapters.title: Chapter 127 - 125: Invade
chapters.content:
Chapter 127: Chapter 125: Invade
At this moment, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, Goblin Gulu led the remaining army composed of Beastmen turned into producers, constantly patrolling the tribe, casting worried glances toward the violent tremors and the battlefield covered in rising smoke and dust outside the walls.
At this time, almost all the combat-ready Beastmen had already been dispatched to the battlefield against the Giant Beasts, leaving only some very weak Goblins and the old, weak, sick, and disabled Beastmen inside the tribe, barely taking up wooden spears to patrol to prevent the enemies from exploiting a weakness.
Of course, there was still a final elite Beastman team within the tribe as the last line of defense.
As one of the early joining Beastmen, Goblin Gulu was defeated and captured by the Dragon Nest Beastmen when attacking the Dragon Nest Tribe with Rodney. Eventually, he was transformed and integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe and later witnessed the various stages of the tribe’s development, watching it rise from nothing.
Later, due to the Goblin’s physical disadvantage in hunting and other activities and talent in equipment manufacturing, he was transferred to the Manufacturing Workshop. Gradually, he rose and now, with his exceptional talent in tool manufacturing, he was appointed to manage the workshop.
Nowadays, with the enemy assaulting, they, the logistical personnel, were also organized to defend the tribe. Gulu also received the command from Governor Vini to oversee the last defense of the Beastman Tribe.
To heighten vigilance, Goblin Gulu even armed the young Beastman cubs. Fortunately, every Beastman had undergone military training before integrating into the tribe, so organizing them did not pose much difficulty.
Of course, organizing these Beastman cubs was merely to ensure they could evade danger in an orderly manner when encountering danger. In a real bloody battle, they wouldn’t really be used. If the Giant Beasts broke through the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s blockade, even if these old, weak, sick, and disabled were to pile up, it wouldn’t be much use.
"Let’s hope nothing unexpected happens."
After living in the Dragon Nest Tribe for a whole year, witnessing the tribe’s development from nothing to its current scale, Goblin Gulu developed an unprecedented sense of belonging to the entire Dragon Nest Tribe. He was even more in awe of His Highness Austin, who created all of this.
Beastmen rarely have a concept of home, but the Dragon Nest Tribe gave Gulu a feeling akin to a home.
Once starving and obscure, like a wild grass that no one would care if it died by the roadside, after joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, his talent in tool manufacturing was spotted by His Highness Austin, who assigned him to manage the normal operation of the Manufacturing Workshop.
No one could understand the feeling of going from being a despised goblin, who others couldn’t bother to glance at, to suddenly becoming the focus of envy among many Beastmen.
But at that moment, having been highly praised and assigned a significant responsibility by Austin, he was moved to tears.
From that moment on, Goblin Gulu had made up his mind, even if it cost him his life, he would repay the lifelong favor of His Highness Austin.
No one would understand the feeling of originally being ignored in a dark corner, yet in the end, having someone reach out and pull you into the sunlight, a favor hard to repay even if one’s life depended on it.
"Absolutely can’t let those guys disturb His Highness!"
Looking at the intense battlefield not far outside the tribe, Gulu swore silently in his heart.
"Patrol carefully, absolutely cannot let the enemy sneak in!"
Taking one last look at his many followers behind him, Gulu ordered in a grave voice.
However, before his words fell,
Boom!!!
With a huge roar, the tribe’s wall beside him exploded under a massive force, scattering wooden chips and smoke, as two figures landed heavily on the scene.
"Enemy assault!!!"
With a sharp cry, teams of Beastmen rushed over from all directions and surrounded the figures who burst through the wall.
"Edward, you owe me a big favor this time."
In the collapsed wall, the burly Mercenary Captain Valen carried two large axes, looking solemnly at the advancing Beastman army ahead.
Within the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, combined with the old, weak, sick, and those Beastmen unsuited for battle, there were more than four hundred. Though their individual quality was considerably weaker than ordinary Beastmen, the power unleashed by their close formations was almost on par with the elite forces of other Beastman Tribes.
There were four hundred enemies, and they were just two.
"Brother Valen, I indeed owe you a big favor this time. If we survive this, you can ask anything of me."
Edward glanced at the oncoming Beastmen, offering a wry smile but with a slight sense of relief in his eyes.
"Hahaha, you said it, don’t renege when the time comes!"
Mercenary Captain Valen laughed heartily, his laughter resonating as if even the air was trembling.
Simultaneously, Valen roared, releasing a visible surge of black Fighting Qi from his body. The black Qi interwove, condensing into a gigantic black bear three to four meters high in the air, its illusory form roaring at the heavens.
"Just a bunch of Beastmen, die for me!"
With unmatched might, the two massive axes fell with a powerful gust as if to cleave the earth. The tremendous sound waves roared, while the surging force swept through like a torrent.
Simultaneously, Edward’s body glowed with golden light, forming what seemed like a golden armor around him, as the Holy Light illuminated the world.
"Humility, bravery, honesty, compassion, justice, sacrifice, honor, soul... these are the Eight Virtues of a Knight!"
Edward and the Mercenary Captain exploded with maximum power and clashed with the surrounding Beastman army. A burst of Fighting Qi rays erupted, sporadically sending Beastmen flying, but the surviving Beastman troops showed no sign of retreating. As one fell, another emerged to entangle the two in battle.
...
Simultaneously, inside the governing hall.
As the most iconic building of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, its capture would signify the tribe’s complete collapse and demise. Before the tribe was overrun, it was one of the safest places.
Thus, all the young Beastman children of the Dragon Nest Tribe were gathered here. Jackal Wolf Person Meng Bi led the larger Beastman cubs in patrolling and vigilance. Though these young Beastman squads couldn’t assist much in the larger theatre of war, they at least possessed some self-defense capabilities.
The much smaller group of Beastman children was led by several pig-bodied aunts from the kindergarten, sitting quietly to one side, their expressions filled with unease.

chapters.title: Chapter 128 - 126 Urgency
chapters.content:
Chapter 128: Chapter 126 Urgency
Thanks to the policy system of the Dragon Nest Tribe at this time, the entire tribe has been integrated systematically, exerting maximum power.
Due to the fact that the beastman cubs spend most of their days in nursery-like institutions led by several pig-bodied grandmothers, even amidst current war disturbances, where parents are mobilized to fight the giant beasts, they are organized together and supervised, preventing any chaos from occurring.
If it were other tribes, facing such an attack from giant beasts, lacking military training modifications and systematic command, even if the entire tribe’s population stepped forward to resist the giant beast’s attack, the rear would be in utter disarray.
However, by initially adopting the military governance system, the Dragon Nest Tribe inadvertently prevented the emergence of various chaotic scenes when danger descended.
"Damn it, have the enemies already infiltrated the tribe?!"
Jackal Wolf People youth Meng Bi looked at the fighting qi radiance blooming not far away, along with the final defense armies continuously rushing over from various directions, with some anxiety in his expression.
As the class leader, he has already tried his best to organize all the beastman youth’s power, forming a team protected on one side, but if the enemies indeed break through here, their power is utterly incapable of resistance.
During the cold winter season a year ago, he and his sister Aisha both fled their original tribe, attracted to join the Dragon Nest Tribe by the smoke pillars rising from it, successfully integrating into the Dragon Nest Tribe, starting a new life.
From the days of struggling for sustenance, with dangers looming every moment, to settling down in the Dragon Nest Tribe, never again worrying about various threats from the depths of the forest, only needing labor to survive by relying on one’s own hands.
To the honored His Highness Austin who rescued them siblings, and provided a life of stability now, even without the indoctrination of past brainwashing, Meng Bi holds unparalleled reverence for that highness.
Although he and the others are merely one of the many inconspicuous clan beastmen under His Highness Austin’s command, the highness cannot possibly know his name, nor necessarily knows there is such a Jackal Wolf People youth under his command who holds deep respect for him, yet Meng Bi is determined, henceforth to repay the great favor of the highness, even if sacrificing his life in the end.
"Teachers, transfer the children to the cliff under the Dragon Nest side! The enemies probably have attacked inside!"
Gazing at the fierce fighting qi flying around in the distance, Meng Bi hastily said to several pig-bodied grandmothers watching over the children.
If the enemies indeed attack here, then these beastman cubs’ power would only become a burden.
"Alright."
Several pig-bodied grandmothers also understand the urgency of the situation, organizing the beastman cubs inside City Hall quickly and heading towards the rear.
But at this moment,
Bang bang bang...
Successive footsteps emerged as a group of human mercenaries circumvented the Mercenary Captain Valen and Edward’s breached section of the wall, secretly infiltrated from another side, advancing towards the open area in front of City Hall.
"Not good, there are beastmen over there!"
One sharp-eyed mercenary saw, inside City Hall, the group of beastman cubs that were evacuating.
"Enemies are here!!!"
The Jackal Wolf People youth Meng Bi along with other beastman youths also saw them, immediately shouting, with sharp whistles echoing in the air, signaling an alarm and call for aid.
"No time left! Berkeley, Brown, you two go deal with them, the rest spread out and set fire! Quickly, don’t let these beastmen react!"
Seeing the whistle sound echoing in the sky, knowing they’ve been exposed, Mercenary Deputy Captain Murphy quickly ordered, immediately the team dispersed, heading towards their respective targets.
...
"Damn it! Enemies are here!!!"
Inside the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Fox-faced Man Quik, who originally led the last elite Dragon Nest Beastmen to help surround the Mercenary Captain Valen and Edward, instantly turned pale upon hearing the sharp whistle sound from behind.
Fell into a trap!
There is His Highness’s resting place there, and where the beastman children of the tribe are located, City Hall!
Fox-faced Man Quik intended to lead part of the beastman elite to break free, but the Mercenary Captain Valen and Edward seemed aware of Quik’s intent, their bodies burst forth with fighting qi again, the ground cracking vast expanses, shattered stones scattered like bullets, spider web-like cracks spread out.
For a moment, under the onslaught of the two, the Dragon Nest Beastmen army had to resist grudgingly.
"Damn fellows!"
At this time outside the tribe, the main force of the Dragon Nest Tribe was resisting the assault of five giant beasts, struggling to face the enemy, while behind them, they fell into the lure of these two fellows, once causing a huge disturbance, it would lead to a large collapse!
Moreover, the cliff at the far end, His Highness Austin is resting there!
"Go to hell for me!"
Fox-faced Man Quik, his eyes wide with rage, roared in anger, the ring in his hand sparked magical waves, ripples visible to the naked eye spread in the air.
Feeling the magical power fluctuation in the air, both Mercenary Captain Valen and Edward, seasoned warriors, instinctively dodged outside, seeing the ground they had stepped on moments before pulsating, black vines breaking through the ground, almost scraping by.
Both leaped to a distant spot, their bodies flaring fighting qi, violently smashing the extending vines into pieces.
However, before they could rejoice narrowly escaping disaster, the next moment,
Hoo hoo hoo!
Torrents of flame rose, sweeping across the sky, falling with extremely daunting momentum.
Seeing the gigantic fireball plummeting from the sky with astonishing power, both’s pupils narrowed, their fighting qi further intensified.
"Knight Secret Skill: Elemental Slash!"
"Earth Splitting Slash!"
Boom!!!
Two enormous light blades exploded forth, colliding with the enormous falling fireball, instantaneously erupting a terrifying explosion, the visible shockwave transforming into a whirlwind storm sweeping across, surrounding beastmen staggered back to dodging.
"Damn it!!!"
At this time Quik had almost exhausted all his tactics, but seeing the two merely panting, their energy heavily depleted yet not losing combat power, veins bulging on his forehead, eyes filled with unparalleled anger.
No way to return quickly now, those little rascals, you must hang tight!
...
"Go, quickly! We’ll hold them!"
At City Hall, seeing those two terrifying humans charging towards their direction, temporarily as the youth team leader, Jackal Wolf People Meng Bi shouted loudly to the beastman children retreating behind.
Simultaneously, the team of twenty-plus beastman youths gripped wooden spears tightly, charging towards the two ahead.
"Brother!"
Inside the beastman children team, Aisha just wanted to rush out, but a pig-bodied grandmother next to her swiftly embraced her body, Aisha only felt herself flying in the air.
She shouted loudly, struggled fiercely, but the pig-bodied grandmother embracing her held firm.
Meanwhile, the voice and figure of her brother were rapidly retreating.....

chapters.title: Chapter 129 - 125 Blood Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 129: Chapter 125 Blood Battle
Boom!
At this moment, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, as the mercenaries continued to set fires everywhere, scorching flames rose up and gradually spread out.
"Damn, what the hell is going on?!"
Mercenary Deputy Captain Murphy looked at his teammates who were running around setting fires, his face somewhat grim.
These houses were primarily brick and wood structures, and from the beginning, there were considerations for potential disasters like fires, with preventative measures like spacing taken care of.
What Murphy didn’t know was that the Dragon Nest Tribe designed it this way precisely because during a particular attack on a Centaur Tribe, the Fox-faced Man Quik had used a Flame Burst Technique that resulted in a massive fire, causing the entire Centaur Tribe to collapse, allowing the Dragon Nest Tribe to win that war easily, which led to the formation of their cavalry units.
From that battle, Austin saw the weaknesses in wooden and grassy structures, and upon returning to the tribe, he specifically instructed the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop to produce large quantities of bricks for the purpose of updating the construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s houses, and also to implement fire prevention measures in daily life.
It was precisely these arrangements laid out back then that made Murphy and the other mercenaries’ fire-starting efforts encounter unprecedented difficulty. It took considerable time to barely ignite a single house, but the isolated spacing made it hard for the flames to spread.
"Damn it, we have to continue!"
Gazing at the house behind him, with barely a few flames and smoke rising, Murphy felt a heavy oppressive feeling in his chest.
But even knowing that the longer they delayed, the more dangerous it became, there was no choice but to risk setting fires to cause greater chaos.
...
At the same time, at the City Hall.
Bang!
Accompanied by the loud noise, the sound of wooden spears breaking came, and the spears in the hands of the young Beastmen rushing forward were directly shattered, with several figures being blown away.
The difference in combat strength was indeed too great!
These young Beastmen, though trained, had bodies that had not fully grown, with strength even less than half of that of adult Beastmen. Yet their opponents were truly battle-hardened extraordinary mercenary professionals, and the elite kind at that. How could these young Beastmen possibly withstand them?
In no time, the young Beastmen team was easily defeated by two people. As fighting qi surged, everyone standing fell to the ground, the whole scene as effortlessly destructive as breaking dead wood.
However, when Brown and Blake had knocked down the young Beastmen in front of them, they suddenly heard heavy breathing, as a single figure swayed and stood up again.
Among all the wounded on the ground, only that single figure rose once more.
"Even if I must stake my life, I... must not retreat!"
The broken wooden spear was heavily thrust upside down into the ground, and leveraging that force, the teetering figure of Meng Bi suddenly stood firm, his bloodshot eyes fixed intently on Brown and Blake ahead.
Behind him lay the great His Highness Austin, who had granted them new life, and his sister!
No matter what, he could not fall!
In that moment, an indomitable will somehow supported that battered body, and Meng Bi, leaning on the broken wooden spear, stood up once more.
Drip, drip...
Drip by drip, crimson blood dripped from the gaping wounds on his body, with the deeply torn wounds even revealing the white bones underneath, his whole body drenched in blood. The excruciating pain surged through every muscle in his body like a tsunami, almost engulfing him entirely, yet in that powerful will was like a reef that remained unmoved.
Such injuries should not have allowed him to stand again, but Meng Bi had done it.
He dragged his shattered body and stood up once more, once again blocking their path!
He absolutely could not let them pass through here!
That unprecedented resolve completely took over his body, causing the nearly shattered young Beastman to stand up again from the brink of death.
"What?!!!"
Confronted with this scene, even Brown and Blake were shaken by Meng Bi’s insane and resolute will.
In their mercenary careers, their hands had been stained with no small amount of lives, yet this was the first time they’d seen a yet-to-come-of-age Beastman defeated once and stand up again with such unyielding force of will!
"Kid, do you really want to die so much?"
Brown, wielding the wolf fang club, looked at the jackal Beastman Meng Bi who stood before him with incredible willpower, his voice low.
What kind of willpower could it possibly take for a young Beastman to endure and stand before them with such a broken body!
But,
Though the will was shocking, they were not saintly soft-hearted people.
There were always enemies one couldn’t surpass in this world, and in reality, youthful passion didn’t always lead to success.
Brown raised the wolf fang club high above, casting a shadow that enveloped Meng Bi’s entire body, clearly about to smash his head in the next moment.
Just at this moment,
"I will bet my life with you!!!"
Blood oozed from his skin, dyeing Meng Bi’s fur a deep red, his broken left hand hanging powerless, yet those blood-colored eyes were filled with sheer madness and ferocity.
In the next instant, a wave of invisible majesty suddenly surged from Meng Bi’s blood red pupils, causing Brown to be momentarily stunned.
In the brief moment of Brown’s stupor, Meng Bi moved, darting forward like a cheetah, transforming into a blood-red shadow that leapt onto Brown.
Roar!!!
With a mad howl, Meng Bi opened his mouth, fiercely biting towards Brown’s neck, yet Brown was, after all, a battle-hardened elite mercenary, instinctively dodging at the moment he sensed danger, leaving Meng Bi to bite his shoulder, tearing off a large chunk of flesh.
"Ah!!!"
Brown cried out in pain, instinctively swinging his arm wildly, but Meng Bi clung like a maddened dog, his jaws locked on tight.
At the same time, Meng Bi thrust the broken spear fiercely into his own dangling left arm.
Splatter!
Blood spurted out, with the broken spear piercing through his thin arm, and subsequently embedding into Brown’s shoulder.
He intended to use such self-mutilation to secure himself to the enemy!
"Ah! Bastard!"
Brown roared in anger, his fighting qi burst forth, sending the spear that skewered Meng Bi’s arm and pierced his shoulder flying, while a raging torrent of energy blasted out, immediately sending the heavily scarred Meng Bi flying, and kicked him in the stomach, causing Meng Bi to crash backward like a cannonball.

chapters.title: Chapter 130 - 126 Awakening
chapters.content:
Chapter 130: Chapter 126 Awakening
"Ah! Damn guy!"
After kicking Meng Bi away, Brown didn’t pursue the victory. Instead, he staggered backward, clutching the horrifying wound on his right shoulder with his left hand, roaring continuously.
Unexpectedly, after years of life and death, he nearly stumbled here.
No way!
How could he be so easily intimidated?!
Every mercenary who’s been through life and death has a will as hard as steel. How could such a person become dazed just because of the brave tenacity of a Beastman youth who fights to the death?
Recalling the mental impact he suffered earlier, he looked incredulously in the direction where Meng Bi was knocked away.
He saw in the distance a massive hole had collapsed in the wall, scattered with broken bricks. From beneath the rubble, a figure emerged, breaking through the top debris.
He saw the Jackal Wolf youth, Meng Bi, covered in dust mixed with his own blood, looking extremely pathetic, but his reddened eyes, like those of a Magic Beast from the abyss, crazily stared at the two of them.
At this moment, Meng Bi stood on all fours on the bricks like an animal, baring his sharp teeth. A faint blood mist emanated from his body, like a fierce ancient Magic Beast possessing him, bringing an overwhelming and terrifying aura.
"This is..."
Observing the strange appearance of the Jackal Wolf youth in front of him, Brown’s expression shifted suddenly. Evidently, his earlier distraction was due to this aura’s impact.
"This is ancestral reversion!"
From behind, Blake gripped his longsword tightly, slowly walking forward to lean beside Brown.
Everything before had occurred in the blink of an eye, developing to this point before he could even offer support.
"If this bloodline reversion continues, we absolutely cannot let you live!"
Blake gazed solemnly at the Jackal Wolf youth within the ruins, covered in wounds yet with undiminished fierce aura, his expression heavier than ever.
To exhibit signs of ancestral reversion means that if this Jackal Wolf youth doesn’t die now, he will surely become a Legendary existence in the future!
Whoosh!
Blake leapt, his entire figure vanishing from the spot. The gleam of his longsword traced a long, snowy line in the air, appearing over Meng Bi in an instant.
The icy shine swirled, turning into a semicircular arc blade in the air, illuminating the sky as it descended.
At this moment, with Meng Bi just awakening and exhibiting the phenomenon of reversion, his body’s foundation was inherently poor. Coupled with his severely injured body, how could he muster any other power, and now he appeared doomed under Blake’s sweeping strike.
The bright light was already illuminating Meng Bi’s eyes.
The next moment,
Boom!!!!
Suddenly, an earth-shattering noise exploded between heaven and earth, rolling like ten thousand bolts of thunder sweeping in all directions!
Still suspended in the air, Blake suddenly felt an overwhelming pressure like a Vast Sea sweeping across the sky and earth, surprising him greatly as if he fell into an ice cave in midwinter, doused in a chill that froze through the body.
The prickling danger at his back made his entire body instinctively retreat, bouncing back!
At some point, black like ink and as heavy as a mountain, the clouds had nested over the entire sky, layers of dark clouds obscuring the heavens, making the sky within reach.
The black clouds swirled, forming a massive dark vortex above the sky, enveloping the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, making it seem like the whole area had fallen into an abyss, a vast dragon’s might filling every corner of the heavens and earth, weighing heavily on everyone’s heart.
At this moment, whether inside or outside the Dragon Nest Tribe, all the battles ceased involuntarily.
The team led by the Mercenary Deputy Captain forgot about setting fires, the Beastman team led by the Fox-faced Man Quik forgot about the siege, Edward and the Mercenary Captain Valen forgot about their fight, and even the battlefield outside the Dragon Nest Tribe began to cease.
Even the Giant Beast, as terrifying as a mountain, stopped struggling within the Beastmen’s net, blankly staring at the massive black cloud vortex directly below a cliff in the sky.
A terrifying presence was suppressing and gathering within the cliff, like flames suppressed for millennia, containing immensely powerful energy.
At this moment, that cliff became the center of the universe!
Crack!!!
Above the sky, a thunderbolt as thick as a barrel suddenly fell, illuminating the heavens, splitting the sky as it crashed upon the cliff.
Boom!!!
In an instant, it was as if the world collapsed, a massive explosion erupted, shattering the entire cliff into fragments, huge stones crumbling and flowing away in torrents in all directions.
Meanwhile, arcs of electricity and firelights flickered faintly within the swirling dust, a terrifying shadow slowly unfurled its wings, an expansive dragon’s might swept between heaven and earth, as if proclaiming its arrival to the world.
Whoosh!
The wings flapped, a giant flood swept open, the surrounding dust and stones were immediately sucked in and torn apart, clearing the sky.
"It’s so refreshing!"
Austin shook his head, stretched both arms and legs, just feeling an unprecedented comfort, his body filled with vitality, a sense of transparency as if every cell was breathing deeply.
In hindsight, this should be the first time Austin had truly slept, and the first time he could sleep deeply without worrying about his safety.
However, both his soul and growth trajectory were vastly different from ordinary Young Dragons, even his strength after sleeping had made a significant leap forward, compared to normal Young Dragons, an almost unimaginable anomaly.
"Although I’m not sure why, now I should be at Quasi-Gold level..."
Looking at his own body and feeling the boundless Magic Power within, Austin thought to himself secretly.
A normal Young Dragon at his stage would probably only be at Quasi-Silver level.
But Austin’s situation is different, perhaps due to his soul, or maybe because he often used Thunder Forging Body to stimulate cell growth, he traversed a path in three years that many Young Dragons take ten to twenty years to tread.
Still, whether such rapid growth is a blessing or a curse remains unknown.
However, whether it’s a blessing or a curse, it’s not something he can concern himself with right now.
"Hmm, has the tribe been attacked... Giant Beast... and humans???"
A moment later, Austin awoke completely from his slumber, naturally realizing everything happening in the Dragon Nest Tribe from his high vantage point.
The Giant Beast attack was understandable.
But why were humans able to pass through the vast Kawa Great Forest and appear here?

chapters.title: Chapter 131 - 127: Defeated and Fled
chapters.content:
Chapter 131: Chapter 127: Defeated and Fled
This Kawa Great Forest is almost comparable in size to Russia in Austin’s previous life, and the area where Austin is located is in a somewhat remote central position.
This place is over a thousand kilometers away from the Bloody Border. Despite there being many landless peasant mercenaries and others crossing the Great Wall into the wilderness to establish villages and survive at the edge of the Kawa Great Forest.
But in the area extending a hundred miles into the Kawa Great Forest, human activity has already disappeared, and even trade caravans from the human world dealing with large beastman tribes wouldn’t venture too deep into the dangerous Kawa Great Forest.
Thus, the presence of these humans here is particularly suspicious.
What’s more, the current plight of the Dragon Nest Tribe is likely related to these humans.
Looking down from above, now within the Dragon Nest Tribe, flames were rising from houses, the wall had collapsed to reveal a large hole, and numerous beastman corpses were strewn on the ground, blood splattered against the walls.
Smoke was billowing, on the brink of collapse.
Outside of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the beastman army resisting the giant beasts suffered heavy losses. Although they managed to suppress the giant beasts’ onslaught, and when Kobold leader Vini saw the Dragon Nest Tribe on fire, used the War Horn, the morale of the Dragon Nest beastman army did not collapse but rebounded, causing the giant beasts to retreat, with victory seemingly within grasp. However, even if the beastman army ultimately surrounds and destroys the five giant beasts, the overall combat strength of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe would be severely depleted.
"Hmph, courting death!"
This Dragon Nest Tribe took considerable effort for me to establish, and it was nearly destroyed by these humans. If I hadn’t awakened in time, wouldn’t the entire tribe have been breached and disappeared?
Moreover, thinking further, if I hadn’t developed this tribe and these humans found their way here, wouldn’t I have been killed in my sleep?
Thinking of this, Austin made no further pauses.
Whirl!
A tremendous whirlwind arose, and Austin’s figure swept into the sky with an overwhelming torrent, surging and engulfing the heavens.
But on the horizon, underneath the gloomy clouds, a colossal shadow hovered. It spread its wings wide, arcs of electricity blossoming in the air, with the thunder hidden within the dark clouds seeming to be stirred, growing even more violent, emitting a rumbling roar.
At this moment, Austin felt as if he had merged into the world, with the thunderstorm clouds above becoming part of his body, seemingly moving according to his will.
"Is this the result of the slumber and transformation..."
The Giant Dragon Race is almost nature’s favored children.
The Blue Dragon among the Giant Dragon Race is known to humans as the overlord of storms due to its unparalleled talent in controlling storm and thunder. An adult Blue Dragon walking the world can alter the weather of a city with its magic power, causing clouds as heavy as mountains to cover the sky, resonating with rolling thunder throughout the land, bringing forth an overwhelming storm as if heralding an apocalypse.
Though with Austin’s current growth and strength, he can’t yet freely change the weather, after half a month of slumber, he can still establish a connection with the storm clouds attracted by his transformation.
This slumber did not allow Austin to awaken new talent magic, but it gave him a vague feeling that he could connect with the storm clouds above and turn them into his power.
"Azure Thunder Descend!"
With a thought, the positive and negative charges in the clouds rapidly neutralized, generating countless blinding white lightning. At that moment, the dark clouds were illuminated to white by the thunderous lightning, with bolts of lightning crazily dancing across the heavens, containing incredibly terrifying destructive power.
But this wasn’t over; in the next moment,
BOOM!!!
With an earth-shattering blast, it was as if ten thousand thunders descended from the sky.
Under Austin’s initially awakened Blue Dragon authority, the thunderstorm from the sky was under his control, watching as bolts of thunder crashed down towards the mercenaries.
"Damn it!"
"Not good!"
"Get out of the way!"
BOOM!
Electric snakes fell from the sky, crashing down on the scattered mercenaries. One by one, mercenaries activated their fighting qi to resist and dodge, but despite that, many were directly entangled by the electric snakes, leaving them paralyzed on the ground.
"Its power is a bit weaker than the Thunder Strike Technique!"
Seeing the numerous mercenaries below get hit by the thunder and lose their strength to resist, Austin mused internally.
This move could likely only be used to clear out small fry, with its single-target lethality even somewhat inferior to the Thunder Strike Technique.
Without further thought, Austin flapped his wings, flying directly toward Mercenary Captain Valen and Edward. In the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, only the aura of those two was the strongest, and they were the only two who could withstand his thunder unscathed. Obviously, they were the leaders of these humans.
"Humans, if you don’t want to face my wrath, you’d better give me a reasonable explanation!"
Accompanied by a thunderous voice echoing from the sky, a massive shadow descended onto a dilapidated house, the created torrent extinguishing the fires around it, with a colossal current sweeping across the area.
"Edward, brother, let’s go!"
Seeing that terrifying shadow descending, the Mercenary Captain grabbed Edward by the shoulder and swiftly retreated.
Meanwhile, the surrounding beastmen were prostrating on the ground, welcoming Austin’s arrival, too slow to react to the duo’s decisive escape.
"Think you can run? Not that easy!"
After painstakingly building the Dragon Nest Tribe, it was nearly destroyed, and the instigators wanted to escape? Impossible!
BOOM!
With wings spread wide, Austin’s figure soared, newly matured dragon might sweeping powerfully, like the pressure of a mountain instantly crashing down on the fleeing duo.
"Go!"
In the critical moment, the black fighting qi on Valen surged violently, striking Edward’s body with immense force, sending him flying forward.
Simultaneously, Mercenary Captain Valen, carrying the vast pressure from above, crashed down and fell to the ground, the enormous shadow enveloping his body.
"Brother Valen!"
Edward shouted, but as Valen struck him midair, it also inflicted injury on his figure, sending him hurtling several hundred meters, crashing into the river, and getting swept away by the raging currents, disappearing without a trace....

chapters.title: Chapter 132 - 128 Post-War Integration
chapters.content:
Chapter 132: Chapter 128 Post-War Integration
"Human, tell me, why are you here!"
A voice calm like thunder echoed from behind, rolling like thunder, causing a constant roaring in Valen’s ears.
The enormous, heart-oppressing shadow was slowly approaching, carrying an incredibly terrifying aura.
"Hmph, evil Blue Dragon, don’t expect to get anything from me!"
Mercenary Captain Valen turned around, facing the shadow that obscured most of the sky in front of him. His hands instinctively gripped the axe tightly, speaking loudly between heavy breaths.
This was the instinctive fear of lower-level creatures facing higher-level ones, more so the fear that arises when confronting an enemy of much larger size.
"Hmph, no answer? Fine, someone will."
The huge dragon claw, filled with terrifying power, crashed down. The black bear phantom on the Mercenary Captain had just emerged when it was slapped to the ground like a mouse, causing a deep pit to form in the earth.
Seeing Valen, the mercenary captain, lying motionless in the pit, Austin didn’t spare another glance, his body swirling into flight, heading out of the Dragon Nest Tribe, where his Clan was fiercely battling five Giant Beasts. Austin would not let these painstakingly trained elite Clan members die in vain.
With Austin’s involvement, the morale on the side of the Dragon Nest Beastmen was instantly boosted to its peak. The Giant Beasts, already at a disadvantage, were completely routed and were soon surrounded and slain by the Beastmen.
As the Giant Beasts fell, the Magic Beast Storm Tigers on the forest’s outskirts had already left at some unknown time. The threat to the Dragon Nest Tribe completely disappeared, and the great battle concluded with a victory for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, in this unexpected disaster, while the Dragon Nest Tribe emerged victorious, it also suffered significant losses.
After the victory, the Dragon Nest Tribe began accounting for casualties. Nearly three hundred elite Beastmen perished directly in this conflict, and nearly two-thirds were injured, marking the tribe’s losses as grievous, even more so than the battle with the Blood Claw Tribe.
Despite this assault, the cohesion of the Dragon Nest Tribe improved, and the orc prisoners from the former Blood Claw Tribe fully integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
At least, after more than half a month of transformation, the Blood Claw orc prisoners not only refrained from causing chaos during the assault but also fought bravely, earning full acceptance and integration into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Aside from the regular orc army, the Extraordinary Beastmen suffered even more losses.
Since only the Extraordinary Beastmen could frontally withstand the Giant Beast’s attacks, serving as a diversion, the casualties among them were considerably higher during the assault on the Giant Beasts.
Initially numbering over sixty, only about thirty Extraordinary Beastmen remained, with more than half perished, and those left were all injured, their combat ability drastically reduced to the limit.
A large number of injured individuals once again filled the Dragon Nest Tribe’s hospital. Fortunately, with continuous accumulation and the experience from the last large-scale battle, the Dragon Nest Tribe had a good store of medical knowledge, and their treatment methods were well refined, though the stockpile of herbs was utterly insufficient, necessitating dispatching additional personnel foraging for more outside.
Thankfully, the Beastmen’s life force is robust, and those with minor injuries would heal naturally with simple care, while the precious herbs were applied to the severely injured, alleviating the pressure on herbal resources to some extent.
When it comes to the wounded, Austin attaches significant importance, personally inspecting during the post-battle gathering, and commending the warriors for their brave fighting spirit, as these Beastmen were fighting for him and were part of his Clan. Expressing timely care and importance was crucial.
In Austin’s view afterward, his behavior, partly sincere and partly performative, seemed effective, with many Beastmen moved to tears, enhancing morale rather than dwelling in the tragedy of their significant losses, bustling energetically in tidying up the post-battle aftermath.
This was no anomaly, given that Austin had established an entirely new Dragon Nest Tribe system, granting them a new way of life, with consistent indoctrination of loyalty and admiration into their minds.
For these simple Beastmen, Austin, who had experienced various informational bombards in a previous life, only employed some simple marketing techniques, which were enough to profoundly move these simple Beastmen.
Besides the losses suffered by the Dragon Nest Beastmen themselves, the entire settlement of the tribe also took notable damage during this battle.
Later, when the Mercenary Corps infiltrated the Dragon Nest Tribe, not only did they blow open a substantial section of the wall, but substantial portions of the housing, about one-fifth in total, were set ablaze by numerous infiltrating mercenaries.
Fortunately, Austin had precautions against fire disasters. The houses, constructed of wooden brick structures with spacing between them, prevented the mercenaries’ arson from causing a chain reaction, saving the remaining four-fifths of the homes.
Additionally, to prevent fire disasters and other potential troubles, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s provisions were stored in a semi-underground warehouse next to the state hall, avoiding any impact in this attack.
Nonetheless, despite these preparations, the damage to the Dragon Nest Tribe’s settlement was considerable, and rebuilding the one-fifth of the homes was a significant challenge.
Luckily, with the coming of cold winter, a large amount of Beastmen labor would become available, and squeezing together while repairing the houses posed no major issue.
After the great battle, the Dragon Nest Tribe swiftly entered the phase of post-war integration.
Originally governed through a military-civilian unity within a military-political system, the post-war integration process of the Dragon Nest Tribe proceeded rather smoothly without any significant disturbances.
The decision to implement military training and reform on the Beastmen proved highly suitable, greatly enhancing their combat prowess, organizational and productive capacity, as well as their post-war recovery abilities.
Through routine training, discipline had almost become ingrained in them, making it more convenient for Austin to strategically command these Beastmen, maximizing the strength of the Beastman Clan.
With various post-battle tasks completed, Austin finally found the time to interrogate these strange individuals who appeared inexplicably in his territory.
Despite the Mercenary Captain Valen remaining taciturn in the dungeon post-capture, not every mercenary shared the same resolve.
Upon learning the reasons from these mercenaries, Austin furrowed his brows tightly.
Their presence here was both a coincidence and an inevitability.

chapters.title: Chapter 133 - 129: The Reason
chapters.content:
Chapter 133: Chapter 129: The Reason
Crash!
Somewhere far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, in a rushing river, the utterly exhausted and drenched Edward grabbed onto a tree root on the riverbank. Using his last ounce of strength, he hauled himself ashore with a roll.
Having spent his final bit of energy, Edward lay flat on his back, soaking wet and disheveled, gasping for air as he stared up at the sky, his eyes seemingly devoid of spirit.
"Valen, my brother..."
Recalling that final moment, his hands involuntarily clenched into fists, nails digging into his flesh, and blood dripped down.
"It’s all my fault. I shouldn’t have let you take such risks..."
Edward’s eyes turned bloodshot, and his voice became choked.
Thinking back to that initial accidental friendship he formed with Brother Valen, and then how time and again during their adventures, Brother Valen took care of him, being more than a big brother to him, more like family.
But now, because of his own fault, that most respected Brother Valen found himself in the hands of that malevolent Blue Dragon, with little chance of survival.
And those mercenaries, after many days traveling together, had formed a profound friendship with him.
Yet now, it was all destroyed, everything gone!
Sorrow spread through Edward’s heart like a small venomous snake worming through his veins.
He was too arrogant, thinking that he could deal with that orphan dragon with his wisdom. It was his stubbornness that led to this, leaving the entire mercenary squad, including Brother Valen, without survivors.
Indeed, in Edward’s heart, those who fell into the hands of that evil Blue Young Dragon were destined to die, with no chance of survival.
The raid had caused heavy losses to the evil Blue Young Dragon’s clan underlings, and Edward knew nothing good awaited those captured by the Blue Young Dragon.
"Rest assured, Brother Valen, and all the members of the mercenary corps, I, Edward, swear here and now, even if it takes my entire life, I will annihilate that evil Blue Dragon, strip its sinews and bones, and let it die in agonizing howls with the cruelest means for your vengeance!"
At this moment, Edward’s Knight’s Sword had fallen somewhere unknown, so he picked up a sharp stone from the ground, slashed open his right hand, allowing the crimson blood to drip onto the ground as he gazed resolutely upstream, swearing a blood oath.
After resting for quite a while, barely replenishing his energy, Edward roused himself, suppressing the endless guilt in his heart, and determinedly staggered northward.
For messing up everything, ultimately costing the attacks of his former companions, Edward felt profound regret in his heart, but there was one thing he was sure of, that if the Dragon Nest Tribe continued to develop, it would certainly sweep across the Barbaric Land of the Kawa Great Forest, becoming a formidable adversary to the Southern Countries.
From the lessons of this failed raid, Edward understood this point even more.
With just some wooden spear equipment, in merely two years, it had shown such formidable power. If given time to develop, that evil Blue Young Dragon could grow into a massive Beastman Empire, which wasn’t impossible.
He needed to leave the Barbaric Land of the Kawa Great Forest and head to the Southern Countries, seeking the help of various kings and dukes.
He needed to tell them,
The crisis had arrived!
...
"A Half-Legendary Great Mage’s legacy?"
After interrogating the captured mercenaries, the news left Austin both astonished and furrowed-browed.
According to the mercenaries, roughly six months ago, the blond noble heir Edward had come to find the Mercenary Captain Valen, and spent a hefty sum to hire them to venture into the Kawa Great Forest, supposedly seeking a Half-Legendary Great Mage’s legacy.
Although the peril-laden Kawa Great Forest was a hazardous place, for the sake of gold coins, and also due to the decent friendship between the blond noble heir and Captain Valen, they accepted the mission to escort him deep into the Kawa Great Forest to search.
Even though the mercenaries said their raid on the Dragon Nest Tribe was purely accidental, when they found the place, they learned from small stray tribes about a Dragon Nest built by a Blue Young Dragon that had developed into a regional overlord within two short years. The noble heir Edward became curious and led his men to investigate, discovering the future threat of this Dragon Nest Tribe to the Human World, and eventually, tempting the mercenaries into launching a series of attacks, leading to this result.
On the surface, it seemed like a mere accident.
But Austin didn’t think so. Simply put, the Kawa Great Forest’s area was almost comparable to Austin’s previous life’s Russia, and the Dragon Nest Tribe’s occupied territory was but a drop in the ocean, so how could they coincidentally stumble upon the Dragon Nest Tribe?
Unless from the start, their route was aimed in this direction.
Moreover, within the Dragon Nest Tribe’s territory, a Mage’s relic indeed existed.
Not long ago, Austin found a Red Crystal capable of activating the Flame Burst Technique and a ring capable of activating the Vine Technique within that relic, both handed to the Fox-faced Man Quik, greatly enhancing his power.
From the relic’s condition back then, its owner left hastily due to certain matters, but may still have reached Half-Legendary status later, leaving behind extremely secretive matters, which by coincidence, ended up with Edward, eventually drawing in this squad of mercenaries.
It wasn’t just possible; it had to be like this!
What Edward was searching for was certainly related to the legacy of that Gold Level Great Mage.
From the beast skin notes back then, Austin didn’t glean much information, but from the sporadic phrases, it seemed that the Great Mage uncovered some astonishing secret, pushing the noble heir Edward to venture across mountains and rivers despite dangers, leading to the discovery of the Dragon Nest Tribe nearby, and triggering the subsequent series of events.
"Even if it was a calamity without reason, it’s inevitable. Damn, what on earth did that Mage discover, and what did he leave behind!"
Gazing at the reservoir lake not far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin’s eyes grew deep and contemplative.

chapters.title: Chapter 134 - 130: Disposal of the Mercenary Captives
chapters.content:
Chapter 134: Chapter 130: Disposal of the Mercenary Captives
Looking down from above, the lake reservoir that abruptly appears between the dense forest does seem somewhat peculiar. From the beast skin notes of that Gold Level Great Mage that Austin obtained earlier, it’s known that this lake reservoir seems to be a meteorite crater formed by something falling from the sky, akin to a meteorite.
Moreover, at the bottom of the lake, there exist some completely unknown secrets, at least that plant known as Ghost Grass, said to only grow in places where the Power of the World is exposed, is something Austin is currently unable to comprehend.
"This is simply... a disaster out of nowhere!"
Originally choosing this place as a lair was because he was born nearby and this location is relatively secluded. There aren’t many top predators like Magic Beasts or Giant Beasts, which allowed Austin to safely survive and grow up.
But who would have known that such a big pit was hidden here as well, first being the remnant of some Gold Level Great Mage, followed by the Blood Claw Tribe, and later on even a mercenary squad. It made things incredibly frustrating for Austin.
However, now that the Dragon Nest Tribe has already taken root here and started various farmland clearings, they cannot easily relocate. Even if they wanted to move, the stored food wouldn’t be enough to sustain them until they find another base for farming and producing crops, so there’s no choice but to continue on this path.
"Hmph, if I were given a bit more time to develop, what does it matter if there are greater dangers and challenges!"
He was able to create such a powerful tribe from scratch in just over a year. If he had a little more time, the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe would be even greater, so why would he fear anything?
Moreover, now that he has reached quasi-Gold Level strength after awakening from his slumber, coupled with the assistance of numerous trained clansmen under his command, he has sufficient power to protect himself within the scope of the Kawa Great Forest.
"However, perhaps now is the time to explore the secrets at the bottom of the lake..."
After pondering for a moment, Austin leaped up and flew toward the lake reservoir.
Whoa!
Upon reaching the sky above the lake reservoir, Austin plunged into the water, causing a huge splash.
In the world beneath the lake, with no more ferocious predators like Ghost-headed Crocodiles, the fish swimming in the water had increased, but the moment Austin entered the water, the fish immediately scattered in all directions.
"Perhaps, I could try container-style fish farming, and as for the boxes, I could simply weave them from bamboo or make them from rattan..."
Watching the large school of fish scatter around, Austin mused to himself.
However, there’s no need to rush this matter too much; after all, in the coming cold winter, he could still obtain a large amount of fish through ice fishing.
Shifting his thoughts, Austin no longer lingered and swam toward the depths of the lake.
This was already Austin’s second descent to the bottom of this lake reservoir. The first time was after he had slain the Ghost-headed Crocodile, and he had come here to investigate, but during that occasion, he was put to shame and fled due to the dandelion-like plants at the bottom of the lake.
This time, the underwater environment hadn’t changed much.
On the lake bed, dandelion-like magical plants gently swayed with the water currents, emitting an eerie blue glow. Blue seeds detached from their parent plants, gathering together in the water current, forming bands of light as brilliant as a stellar river, swirling above the lake bed, flickering on and off.
"This should be the Ghost Grass mentioned in the notes... Power of the World... what is buried beneath here?"
Austin hovered above for a long time, but he ultimately didn’t venture down to explore. The embarrassing scene from that day was still fresh in his memory.
Nevertheless, this time, Austin had a vague feeling that perhaps once he successfully advanced to Gold Level, he could use the abilities of a Giant Dragon to successfully break through the Ghost Grass’s blockade.
If that’s the case, then further exploration will have to be postponed for another time.
With his rate of growth and the magic stones in the Spider Cave, as long as he could digest it all, reaching Gold Level wouldn’t take too long. He could afford to wait.
Since that’s how things stood, staying here held no further purpose. Austin swiftly flew out of the lake reservoir.
...
"Your highness, those mercenaries are not weak, and guarding them requires more than one Dragon Vein Beastman to be stationed, which has somewhat weakened the tribe’s strength. Since they are of no use, should we just kill them directly to save manpower and food?"
When Austin returned from beneath the reservoir to the Dragon Nest Tribe, Vini, the Kobold who temporarily assumed the highest governance of the Dragon Nest Tribe, came to report.
After awakening, Austin had used the thunder amassed in the sky through tremendous Magic Power to unleash the Thunder Strike spell. Although it had a substantial scope for clearing troops, its power was still debatable, resulting in the majority of these mercenaries being captured by the Dragon Nest Beastmen rather than killed.
However, humans have changeable natures, unlike the simple-minded beasts, and it’s difficult to transform them like the Dragon Nest Beastmen. Also, guarding them has exhausted much of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s strength, so Vini came to inquire if they should just execute them to avoid wasting labor and food.
"No, these guys almost destroyed my tribe. How could I let them die so easily?"
Death is the easiest punishment, and moreover, even if mercenaries like Mercenary Captain Valen and others are tough and refuse to submit, there are certainly those who fear death and are willing to kneel.
Having ventured from the Human World into the depths of the Kawa Great Forest, they have proven themselves to have some strength and decent survival skills, making them quite helpful to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
What Austin valued even more, however, was the information in their minds, like maps, the distribution of various forces, and information about the Human World. Given Austin’s current situation, this type of information is hard to come by, but with these captured mercenaries, it becomes possible.
Even if they are as tough as Mercenary Captain Valen, there is still a value in exploiting them. They can be directly deployed into roles requiring laborious production, contributing to the building of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Of course, even those who are soft-spined need a bit of pounding before they can be used.
At least, they should be worked to the bone as slaves for a month, after which those willing to bow their heads can be singled out for ideological reform.
After all, it’s very likely they will have future dealings with the Human World, so it’s good to prepare in advance.
"But your highness, if that’s the case, we will need more hands to guard them."
Kobold Vini seemed a bit troubled. In any case, these mercenaries are all elites. If they find a chance to escape during work, their level of power alone cannot be suppressed.
In that case, it would be counterproductive.
"No worries, I already have a solution for that problem."

chapters.title: Chapter 135 - 131: Preparations Before Refining Copper (First Update - Seeking Subscription)
chapters.content:
Chapter 135: Chapter 131: Preparations Before Refining Copper (First Update - Seeking Subscription)
These mercenaries are no ordinary people. The strongest Mercenary Captain, Valen, even possesses Silver Low Tier strength, a power considered top-notch in some cities on the borders of the Southern Countries. The entire Mercenary Corps is not just any ordinary group; simply binding them with ropes makes it easy for them to break free and escape, hence a considerable amount of manpower is needed for their guard.
Only a new material, one more resilient than rope and suitable for making shackles, can reduce the need for a large number of Beastmen to guard them.
Regarding that material, Austin recalled a certain plan from not long ago — refining copper!
The initial conflict with the Blood Claw Tribe Branch was over a Copper Ore vein near the Blood Claw Tribe’s mountain. After the Blood Claw Tribe was defeated, Austin fell into slumber, delaying the commencement of copper refining due to personal reasons.
Now that Austin has awakened, everything in the Dragon Nest Tribe is back on a normal development track, and refining copper naturally becomes part of future plans.
Once copper artifacts are produced, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s combat and production capabilities will significantly improve, playing an unrivaled role in the tribe’s development.
The preparations for winter have largely been completed by the Dragon Nest Tribe. Crops like kudzu root in the fields are mostly harvested, while perennial plants such as Thorn Fruits are covered with a thick layer of straw to prevent them from freezing. Various fodders are prepared in the livestock enclosures, enough for the wild cattle in the barn as well as other livestock like wild rabbits and wild boars to overwinter. If feed runs short, they would simply slaughter some livestock when they are fattened up.
As for the damaged houses within the Dragon Nest Tribe, due to the necessity to air-dry the newly made mud bricks before firing them in the kiln, there’s no quick way to produce enough materials, so this has to be done gradually.
With plenty of manpower now available among the clan members, Austin gathered a large population to first refine some copper artifacts before the cold winter.
Thus, under comprehensive deployment, a large number of Beastmen transported a massive amount of charcoal down from the previous Smoke Tower hill. Using wild cattle to transport it to the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, where the Dragon Nest Beastmen have cleared up the place, built a base on the ruins. This base, centered for future copper refining activities, is directly named the Copper Mine Base by Austin.
A large amount of charcoal was transported to the Copper Mine Base, and simultaneously, Beastmen were dispatched there to start massive mining of Copper Ore from the surrounding Copper Mine veins.
It is worth mentioning that the captured mercenaries are one of the teams responsible for mining Copper Ore, assigned to the dirtiest and most exhausting tasks, leaving them dead tired every day. Although some mercenaries attempted to escape, they were thwarted by the Dragon Nest Beastmen. The one who attempted to escape suffered frightful punishment — collective isolation in the dark room!
Minotaur Saru, one of the guards, didn’t know what it felt like to be isolated in the dark room, but every mercenary who emerged from it appeared overwhelmingly grateful, diligently working from then on, with no hint of slacking off.
Vast quantities of Copper Ore were mined, piling up into small hills nearby.
Simultaneously, not far from the base, guided by the Goblin engineers in the Manufacturing Workshop, high furnaces of various sizes and shapes were erected, some one to two meters, others two to three meters — five in total, primarily to test which design performed best before determining the optimal model for mass production.
With charcoal, high furnaces, and Copper Ore all prepared, everything was ready; however, just as Austin prepared to begin refining copper,
the cold winter,
descended once again overnight.
The chilling Water Attribute cold wave from the endless ocean swept across the sky and earth like a tidal tsunami overnight. The sky, encased in somber clouds, saw vast snowflakes descending, carrying a bitter cold wave, transforming the entire land into a silver-clad landscape overnight.
"Alas, we can only halt for a while,"
Inside Dragon Nest, watching the massive snowfall and the transformation of the land into azure icy waterscapes by the distant cold wave, Austin could only helplessly stay inside Dragon Nest, waiting for the passing of the cold wave.
A cold wave that could transform the previous heat into a snow-clad winter wonderland overnight was something ordinary Beastmen could never withstand.
In the first few days of the cold winter, the world-freezing cold flow on the sky occasionally cascaded down to earth by air currents, risking freezing any creature caught in it into an ice sculpture. Only by staying indoors, insulated by the walls, could one survive until the falling cold air was neutralized by the ground temperature.
The frightening cold wave descending from the sky was referred to by the Beastmen living in the Kawa Great Forest as "the colorless Death God from the heavens." Some Beastmen call it the "Wingless Angel," descending silently and invisibly, unpredictable, rendering everything into ice sculptures before one could notice, truly terrifying and impossible to guard against.
Although this dreadful cold wave was threatening, it mostly resided thousands of meters high in the atmosphere, occurring with a low probability, and usually only existed in the initial days of the cold winter.
With time, the terrifying cold currents in the sky gradually dissipate, leaving the outside world white and snowy, yet losing the immediate threat of freezing into ice sculptures by falling cold streams.
Despite the low occurrence, its existence was undeniable. Austin had no intention of needlessly sacrificing his clan members; waiting a few days wasn’t a chore, hence no further actions were taken until the cold wave subsided, restarting copper refining.
During the initial days of cold winter, there was little to accomplish; Beastmen mostly stayed indoors, with even outdoor training canceled, resorting to practicing their Breathing Technique indoors.
Austin was not idle either. Seizing these leisurely days, he repeatedly stimulated his body muscles with currents generated by his Magic Power, trying to control the massively surged Magic Power post-awakening.
Austin didn’t know why his growth was so fast, achieving years’ progress rivaling that of a typical dragon juvenile over two to three decades, but he was certain that the self-developed current stimulation exercise played a significant role in his growth.

chapters.title: Chapter 136 - 132 Speculation (2nd update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Chapter 136: Chapter 132 Speculation (2nd update, please subscribe)
Zzz....
Inside the Dragon’s Nest, a gigantic shadow nearly filled the entire space. Arcs of electric sparks blossomed, tearing through the darkness with blinding light, and a piercing noise spread like the chirping of thousands of birds.
Electric light wove through the air, forming rings that hovered around Austin’s body, rising and falling, while fine streaks of electricity danced between the azure scales, stimulating cellular growth at a microscopic level, resulting in mysterious and profound transformations.
From a distance, it seemed like a giant beast controlling the thunder and lightning, lurking within the shadows, harboring an unimaginably terrifying thunder power.
"Roar... Seems like it’s already at the limit...."
After a long time, Austin ceased the electric stimulation around him and let out a low growl, secretly pondering in his heart.
Previously, using electric stimulation on his body, he could vaguely feel physical growth and the changes in Magic Power, but now it seemed to have reached a bottleneck. Despite continuous days of electrical stimulation, there was no noticeable change.
It’s like reaching a limit where no amount of training leads to growth.
"Oh well, it’s not bad as it is now." Below the Gold level, one can still stimulate growth through electricity, but after reaching Gold, it seems to touch upon certain domains not easily surpassed by mere cellular growth.
To have grown so swiftly within two or three years with this cheat-like speed is a great gain. Even if there’s no such fortune in the future, Austin feels he’s already profited and sees no cause for regret.
"However, perhaps electric stimulation is one reason for quick growth; my soul might be another."
Austin pondered silently in his heart,
Electricity can activate the Magic Power within magic stones, and through the inherent Authority of the giant dragon, it can activate the Extraordinary Seed in a common beastman, making them an Extraordinary Ability User. Thus, it’s not implausible for electricity to kindle the dormant Magic Power inside a giant dragon, significantly stimulating cellular growth.
Yet, if simple electricity could make a young dragon grow, this method would have been widespread among adult dragons over the millennia. But in Austin’s dragon inheritance, there’s no information on this, suggesting he might be an exception—perhaps due to the strength of his soul.
Of course, it might also be because dragons are naturally lazy. Given their innate advantage, being Legendary as adults, there’s no need to train during youth. Even being a slacker dragon, reaching a certain level leads to Legendary. Why strive, thus never discovering this secret?
"Forget it, these aren’t things I can delve into now; I’ll ponder it if I can understand it later."
Quickly, Austin set aside these many thoughts.
Though faced with a bottleneck and unable to break through quickly, Austin wasn’t anxious.
After his slumber, his strength had transformed dramatically. If facing Grom the grizzly bear from a month ago, there’s no need to use the electromagnetic cannon to crush him.
This is the dragon’s advantage; challenging above their class is one of the talents a dragon possesses as part of its Legendary Bloodline.
Besides, growth will naturally lead to breakthroughs in due time, so there’s no need to rush.
....
After a few days of secluded cultivation outside the Dragon’s Nest, the passing cold front had mostly worn out. In the next three months, the whole world would fall into a cold, snowy landscape, covered entirely by ice and snow.
But no matter how cold, it wouldn’t be like the lethal chill occasionally falling from thousands of meters high during the onset of the cold winter.
As time passed, various ferocious hunters like ferocious beasts and giant beasts that hadn’t prepared for the cold winter would begin to roam the icy land, making it extremely dangerous. However, for the current Dragon Nest Tribe, it wasn’t much of a concern. At least those fierce hunters couldn’t amount to anything before the colorless Death God, which they couldn’t possibly withstand.
During this time, Austin also continued his copper refining work.
If they could produce copper artifacts, it would mean the Dragon Nest Tribe officially entering the Metal Age, significantly improving work efficiency compared to the previous Stone Tool Age.
Not to mention if the Dragon Nest Legion could be clad in Copper Armor with bronze weapons, their strength could increase by several times. Just the production of various bronze tools, like copper sickles, axes, hoes, and bronze plows, would greatly advance the Dragon Nest Tribe’s various reclamation and production work.
It’s important to note that the Dragon Nest Tribe still relied on a mix of stone and wooden tools. Even if the wooden spears were made from tough materials, wooden tools lack the durability of stone or metal, especially hunting wooden spears, which would often be scrapped in one expedition, keeping the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop at full production capacity.
As for Stone Tools, never mind the difficulty in crafting them, a stone hoe could chip when it hits a rock in the soil, greatly hindering production efficiency. Furthermore, stone tools are hard to manufacture, accounting for a minimal portion of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s equipment.
Though several iron weapons were captured in battles, they aren’t much use for daily production in the Dragon Nest Tribe. Maintenance of iron weapons is also an issue in the tropical rainforest climate of the Kawa Great Forest.
If they could independently produce bronze, it would massively boost the Dragon Nest Tribe’s production and combat capabilities, marking an overall transition from the Stone Tool to Metal Age.
This is one of the reasons Austin took charge of this project personally.
Of course, the most crucial reason remains that, aside from Austin himself, no one in the Dragon Nest Tribe knows how to refine copper....
Of course, Austin didn’t know how to refine copper either.
In his past life, he once saw a video online where an expert smelted iron in the wild with bare hands, a process that was so stunning that he vaguely remembered some steps.
Though refining copper isn’t the same as refining iron, both are metals, so they should be similar, right?

chapters.title: Chapter 137 - 133: The Terrible "Death God" (3rd update, requesting recommendations)
chapters.content:
Chapter 137: Chapter 133: The Terrible "Death God" (3rd update, requesting recommendations)
It was learned from the knowledge of the previous life that the melting point of copper is lower than that of iron. Since that man built a blast furnace with clay and refined iron with charcoal, using the blast furnace to refine copper should also work.
Copper artifacts are too important for the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe. One could say it is a crucial material that changes the civilization’s production of the Dragon Nest Tribe. Even if the first batch fails to produce copper, even if constant attempts are needed, Austin is determined to produce bronze before this harsh winter ends.
After several efforts, the organization level of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe has already become high. With Austin deciding to restart the copper refining work, hundreds of beastmen were organized to cross roads blocked by snow and wind, heading towards the bronze ore base.
Fortunately, all the necessary preparations were completed initially. Charcoal, the blast furnace, and copper ore were all ready. Now, it’s only a matter of experimenting before moving into mass production.
During this harsh winter, because ice and snow have frozen the ground, many things couldn’t unfold, with virtually nothing urgent to do.
Just like the reconstruction work on houses, due to the cold winter’s freeze, as soon as water is splashed outside, it freezes into ice, making it impossible to work mud or dry it. Thus, brick making can’t continue.
Fortunately, there’s no need to worry too much about fire disasters during the cold winter. The beastmen can construct temporary wooden and grass structures to barely get through this harsh winter. After all, many houses of the Dragon Nest Tribe were burnt down in the previous mercenary attack. Although squeezing into the remaining houses can accommodate people, it is quite cramped.
The arrival of the cold winter brought problems not only with bricks not being able to be made and houses difficult to rebuild, but also with the extreme cold making the ground as hard as iron, making cultivation work impossible. Many work progress halted during this winter.
However, the arrival of winter isn’t entirely without benefit. At least, after the ice sheet freezes nearby lakes and reservoirs, the beastmen can start to fish by cutting through the ice. Due to last year’s vast planting and harvesting of arrowroot, there was also a large yield of kudzu vines.
These kudzu vines couldn’t just be set ablaze. Once the leaves were stripped off, the vines were boiled in a water tank to remove the flesh, then the leftover fibers were picked out and dried. Skilled female beastmen would then weave them into ropes. These ropes, whether for making nets or any other purpose, become extremely robust tools.
Austin actually remembers that hemp ropes were made from a plant called hemp. However, since Austin is not an omniscient god, he only knows the name and has never seen what it looks like in his previous life, making it hard to find a similar plant in this world.
But although hemp wasn’t found, the kudzu vines contain very tough plant fibers. After such processing, the ropes made are roughly similar in toughness to authentic hemp ropes.
Recently, the beastmen in the manufacturing workshop came up with an idea of weaving nets with the rope, then placing heavy stones along the edges of the nets.
