This way, when the net is cast over a river, the weight of the stones causes the edges to quickly sink, with the middle part forming a gap like an inverted cover falling from the water’s surface, capturing more fish.
Austin isn’t aware of this improved fishing net. If he were to see it, he would find it surprisingly similar to the fishing nets used by small private fishermen families along the river in his previous life.
These developments have never been taught by Austin, indicating that goblins are slowly entering a stage of self-reflection and research rather than relying entirely on Austin’s reproductions of techniques from his past life. Developing self-innovative abilities marks a solid beginning.
...
This time, Austin only took a hundred or so beastmen from the Dragon Nest Tribe for copper refining, considering the need to guard the Dragon Nest Base, and initial tests and experiments were required before large-scale production could commence, so not many beastmen were needed. A hundred was already quite a number.
After traveling over twenty miles, Austin mainly flew through the sky to prevent dreadful hunters like giant beasts or magic beasts from tracking them.
Fortunately, the path was uneventful. After spending most of the day, the beastmen safely arrived at the bronze ore base.
However, when everyone arrived, the sight before them left all the beastmen shocked.
Ice, a pale blue layer of ice covered the entire valley. Trees appeared as if they were ice sculptures or amber, thick layers of ice encased them.
Other places were generally covered in heavy snow, but here it was all ice. The whole valley was frozen as if even snowflakes became one with the ice, creating a dazzling crystalline world that revealed a frightening and silent stillness.
The dreadful chill still pervaded the surroundings, with the cold penetrating to the bone. Breathing in made it feel as if the nose had gone numb from freezing, and the lungs felt like they were being cut by blades.
"Colorless Death, huh..."
Austin kicked up large swathes of snowflakes, landing on the ground from the sky, looking towards the frozen valley terrain ahead, already understanding what had happened here.
When the cold winter suddenly came, with a terrifying cold front surging from tens of thousands of meters in the sky, a portion of the cold stream in the sky abruptly collapsed, with an alarming coldness pouring down from the heavens like a waterfall, freezing the entire valley into ice sculptures!
Only such a cold stream, falling from tens of thousands of meters high, would cause what the beastmen referred to as "Colorless Death," "the wingless angel fallen from heaven" to create such a terrifying spectacle—an entire valley encased in an iron-like ice sheet, with life nearly extinct.
This descending cold stream was truly horrific, its chill even killing plants in hibernation. Even after winter has passed and life reawakens, this valley terrain would still be filled with the deathly color of barren grey and yellow, as the coldness has slain even the plants that grew here.
This was Austin’s first time facing such a powerful cold stream of Colorless Death.
"Let’s go, let’s gather with the others first."
This valley was merely a place to store charcoal and copper ore, while the base where the remaining beastmen resided was not far off at the ruins of the Blood Claw Tribe Branch. Luckily, the collapsing cold stream did not reach the rebuilt living site at the Blood Claw Tribe Branch remains, allowing the beastmen stationed there to escape a calamity.
Of course, if there was a sufficiently dense house and a fire inside, this so-called "Colorless Death" would not be so lethal for the beastmen living inside.
...
PS: The third finished. Please vote for recommendations, monthly tickets, and give us some rewards.

chapters.title: Chapter 138 - 134 Opening the Furnace
chapters.content:
Chapter 138: Chapter 134 Opening the Furnace
The colorless Death God is nothing more than an avalanche-like cold current. However, this avalanche occurs high in the sky at an altitude of thousands of meters, and when this cold current falls from the sky and sweeps across the earth, freezing everything within its range, it dissipates in no more than a day.
Therefore, if living beings reside in houses or caves, the insulation provided by those structures would protect them from the short-lived cold current, especially since the location where the Dragon Nest Beastmen reside, the remnant site of the Blood Claw Tribe, is not the center of the cold current’s impact.
As expected, Austin quickly found the Dragon Nest Beastmen remaining at the base, totaling more than two hundred people, among which were captured mercenaries brought here for mining.
Due to the unforeseen arrival of the cold winter, over two hundred Dragon Nest Beastmen were trapped here. Fortunately, after the destruction of the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, there remained plenty of building materials on the site, so there was no major concern about materials for building houses. Additionally, since a large amount of food was stored in the Blood Claw Tribe Branch at the time, which the Dragon Nest Tribe temporarily did not value or want to transport over twenty miles to the Dragon Nest Base, the entire tribe base was stocked with food sufficient for the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s consumption.
Although the cold winter arrived suddenly, cutting off contact with the Dragon Nest Tribe, under the surveillance of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, coupled with the terrifying dangers hidden in the snowy and icy exterior, and considering that these mercenary captives were exhausted after several days of intensive mining work, with their strength less than thirty percent of its original capacity, and were guarded by several Extraordinary Beastmen, no trouble was made by them.
In fact, if these mercenary captives resisted, not to mention their poor chances of success, even if they did escape, it would be impossible to find enough food on the snow-covered land, combined with the extremely cold weather, basically leading to certain death. Staying behind offered at least a chance of survival.
The two hundred Beastmen remaining at the base were integrated with the hundred Beastmen brought by Austin, forming a small team of three hundred Dragon Nest Beastmen.
In this copper refining work, these three hundred Dragon Nest Beastmen were the main labor force.
The preliminary preparation for copper refining was nearly complete. A large amount of charcoal, copper ore, and the blast furnace were ready. In fact, if not for the sudden arrival of the cold winter that day, the copper refining could have started the next day.
"This weather... I wonder if we can even refine the copper."
In the sky above, thick clouds gathered, and large flakes of snow fell, covering the ground. Fortunately, after an entire day, the cold current within the base valley began to dissipate. However, clearing the ice layer extending over the blast furnace and charcoal ore piles was quite laborious.
"Let’s build a canopy to shield against the heavy snow first."
Watching the Beastmen mumbling as they cleared the ice and snow around them in the heavy snow, Austin furrowed his brow. In such heavy snow, not to mention starting a fire, even if the blast furnace were lit, the snowflakes falling from the sky might negatively impact the copper refining process.
Moreover, working in such heavy snow was indeed challenging for the Beastmen.
Therefore, some of the Beastmen were quickly assigned to go to the remnants of the Blood Claw Tribe to collect remaining building materials, bring them back to the valley, and then set up simple canopies to shield the blast furnaces from the heavy snow.
In this cold winter, the ground was nearly frozen as hard as stone, making it difficult to dig holes for wooden stakes. Fortunately, there were several Extraordinary individuals among the three hundred Beastmen. With their strength, using stones to break the frozen ground was barely manageable.
Before long, the Dragon Nest Beastmen had erected a simple frame for a canopy, then laid a large amount of thatch over the wooden frame’s top, and covered three sides to form a simple shelter against the snow.
Meanwhile,
Other Beastmen had cleared the ice layer covering the charcoal and ore piles, moving the materials inside the canopy.
"Start the furnace!"
Seeing the preparations complete, Austin did not hesitate and ordered the furnace to be lit.
Originally, after the materials were prepared that day, the copper refining could have started. Unfortunately, the weather did not cooperate, with the sudden arrival of the cold winter and the descending cold current, causing many problems that required further attention.
However, regardless of these troubles, the copper refining must begin. The Dragon Nest Beastmen were not short on strength, but the pioneering work had been delayed due to a lack of suitable tools. Entering the metal age would offer great benefits in terms of both strength and productivity for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Under Austin’s command, the Beastmen put the charcoal into the earthen blast furnace through the top opening. Once the charcoal filled one-fifth of the furnace, they added several pieces of copper ore, then covered it with more charcoal, repeating the process—layering charcoal and copper ore—before finally covering the top opening with charcoal as well.
Simultaneously, the Fox-faced Man Quik stepped out from the group. In this snowy, icy environment, lighting a fire with flint or wood was virtually impossible. Fortunately, Quik had a scepter capable of initiating the Flame Burst Technique, used here as an ignition source.
Indeed, Quik had the potential of a Warlock. With continuous cultivation after obtaining these magical artifacts, he could now simply control their power.
Buzzing sounds!
Quik raised his scepter, a faint red glow flickered within, and visible ripples of air undulated around the Red Crystal, as Fire Attribute Magic Power in the air began to concentrate.
The next moment,
Whoosh!
A scorching line of fire shot out from the Red Crystal, entering through the bottom vent and striking the charcoal at the base of the earthen blast furnace. Instantly, a visible flame blazed fiercely.
The line of fire persisted for a while, stopping only when the charcoal at the furnace’s base glowed red.
"Good, start the bellows!"
Immediately, a robust Beastman stepped forward, placed a makeshift bellows over the vent, and began vigorously operating it. As the air flowed in, the entire earthen blast furnace quickly roared into a blaze, with dazzling light shining through its cracks into everyone’s eyes.
When that robust Beastman tired, another took his place, continuing the cycle. After about an hour, the charcoal inside the earthen blast furnace was mostly burned up.

chapters.title: Chapter 139 - 135: Improvement
chapters.content:
Chapter 139: Chapter 135: Improvement
"How is it?"
As the charcoal burned out inside the earthen high furnace, the entire furnace was more than half empty. However, with the wood ash covering it, it was impossible to see the condition at the bottom.
At this moment, the charcoal had just burned out, and it was still very hot around the earthen high furnace. So, even though the Dragon Nest Beastmen were a bit anxious, they had to stand aside and wait for the furnace to cool down.
Fortunately, the cold winter had its advantages. The very hot earthen high furnace soon cooled down.
Quik touched the wall of the earthen high furnace and, seeing that it wasn’t too hot, reached into the vent below and pulled aside the tiles, revealing a sizable opening at the base of the furnace.
Reaching in through that opening, he took out one of the block-like objects beneath the wood ash, blew on it, and cleaned off the ash, revealing the yellow surface of the copper.
However, looking at this "copper block," Austin was not very pleased and instead frowned.
"Take out all the copper ore inside."
Following Austin’s order, the Fox-faced Man Quik reached into the furnace and took out several pieces of ore from the bottom.
It failed!
Looking at these half-copper, half-iron ores, Austin clearly understood that his first attempt at refining copper had failed.
He took one of the semi-finished products and squeezed it hard with his claw. It immediately crumbled like dirt, revealing the stone inside the thin layer of copper.
The copper inside the copper ore was only half-melted and did not separate from the impurities within, resulting in these semi-finished products.
"The temperature wasn’t high enough."
The temperature inside the earthen high furnace only caused the metal copper in the ore to become semi-fluid without melting into liquid, which failed to separate it from the stone and other impurities.
"No, could it be that too much copper ore was added?"
Looking at the failed copper ore in his hand, Austin was puzzled. The furnace design and method of refining copper ore were basically copied from a method he saw in his past life where an expert refined iron with bare hands. Since that expert could refine iron this way, and copper melts at a lower point than iron, why couldn’t this earthen furnace refine copper?
"Or, is it because of the different conditions in the Otherworld?"
Many ideas arose in his mind.
The heavy snow was still pouring down from the sky, and the shelter the Dragon Nest Beastmen built to shield the earthen high furnace from rain and snow wasn’t large, thus Austin’s body was exposed outside.
The snow was so heavy that Austin’s back was soon covered in snow. With a shake of his shoulders, the snow on top fell off with a rustle.
Watching the snowflakes falling around him, Austin suddenly had a sudden inspiration.
Snow,
Yes, it’s the snow!
In that video, the expert refined iron by sourcing materials in the forest during hot summer days. However, Austin was currently in the bone-chilling winter!
Austin’s eyes suddenly brightened as he guessed the reason why the first batch of copper failed.
It was the temperature!
The vent at the furnace’s base was meant to allow continuous airflow, bringing in a large amount of oxygen with the air to promote the burning of charcoal inside the furnace, thereby significantly increasing the temperature inside the earthen furnace.
However, Austin neglected that when the air entered the furnace, it also took away the heat generated by the burning charcoal.
Under normal conditions, the heat carried away by the wind is much less than the heat released by rapid oxidation and combustion of charcoal, resulting in a significant increase in furnace temperature due to the air blast.
But now, it’s not normal, but a frigid winter with temperatures dropping to minus twenty or even thirty degrees. Such icy air being blown into the furnace, even though the large amount of oxygen brought by the wind makes the charcoal burn more vigorously and generate more heat, the cold wind also carries away a large amount of heat, causing the furnace to be cooler, and thus unable to refine copper from copper ore.
"This is problematic..."
The current situation made Austin scratch his head, not realizing how much the cold winter would impact copper smelting.
However, having discovered the issue, the solution was clear.
It’s best to preheat the air before blowing it in, although it sounds simple, doing it is much trickier.
The original primitive blower was connected to the vent, and to preheat, Austin had to return to the Dragon Nest Tribe to get a ceramic pipe from the Goblins’ Manufacturing Workshop. This ceramic pipe was something the Goblins made after mastering porcelain making, only to find it useless and left it idle. Various other miscellaneous "artworks" were also left in a corner, and it took some effort from Austin to find it.
Using this ceramic pipe to connect the vent and the blower as a passageway between the two, meanwhile, Austin instructed the Beastmen to pile charcoal and firewood outside the ceramic pipe as fuel to heat it. This way, by the time the air flows through the ceramic pipe to the furnace vent, it would naturally get heated to some extent.
Although the constant airflow would prevent this method from heating the inflow air to any significant temperature, it would still fare better than air at minus twenty or thirty degrees.
After a round of redesigning and modifying the setup, by the time the earthen high furnace was filled with charcoal again, it was already nightfall.
Although eager to see the results of the modifications, with temperature dropping further at night and the strong external winds, it wasn’t a good time for copper smelting. Such time was bearable, so Austin ordered the Beastmen to have their meals and rest.
A night without words, and the copper refining continued the next day.
Igniting, heating the ceramic pipe, blowing air... step by step, the Beastmen waited quietly nearby, and the heat from the furnace made the surrounding air less icy.
With the Beastmen’s diligent cooperation, two hours later, the charcoal inside the furnace was almost burnt out, leaving only a small portion.
Austin and the Beastmen waited nearby. Before long, the charcoal inside the furnace was reduced to ashes, and half an hour later, the extremely hot furnace cooled down.
Then, a Beastman voluntarily opened the furnace base, took out what was inside.
"Success!"
With a strong blow, a rugged, irregular, dull yellow copper block appeared in front of them.
Looking at the copper block in the Beastman’s hands, after overcoming numerous challenges, they finally succeeded. A sense of satisfaction welled up within Austin.
However, he quickly thought of another problem.
The copper was now refined, but how could they make weapons?

chapters.title: Chapter 140 - 136 Difficulties
chapters.content:
Chapter 140: Chapter 136 Difficulties
If it were iron, subsequent forging would be necessary to form various weapons and tools, whereas copper is cast with molten copper.
However, casting itself is a hassle. Not to mention how to extract the molten copper from the high-temperature earthen furnace and pour it into molds promptly. In the current cold winter, the frigid air would immediately cool the molten copper upon contact, making casting even more challenging.
"Alas, what a pain!"
It was only now that Austin recalled the video he watched in his previous life. In it, the man who refined iron with bare hands in the wild just ended up with a chunk of iron without any method of forging it into weapons and tools afterward.
And now, although copper has been refined, everything that follows can only be designed by himself. Unfortunately, Austin isn’t very skilled in these engineering designs.
After pondering for an entire hour, Austin came up with various improvement methods in his mind. Although these methods appeared rather crude, they all had some potential for realization.
However, these methods all require the creation of new ceramic modules.
Under normal circumstances, he could have simply instructed the goblins to create the envisioned modules according to his ideas. But now it’s cold winter, outside it’s so cold the water freezes instantly, and even the first step of pottery-making—mixing clay—is impossible. Water added to the soil quickly crystallizes and precipitates from the mud, depriving it of any adhesive properties, and the entire mass freezes into a block of ice. In this situation, the first step of creating ceramic modules fails, making it impossible to produce them.
Besides the module issue, there are many improvements to be made to the earthen furnace, causing Austin to furrow his brows deeply.
Thus, Austin briefly explained various rough principles and then left the follow-up tasks to the goblins in the manufacturing workshop.
After all, the copper has been refined; how to make weapons and tools from copper blocks is merely a matter of time. Once the goblins have tried several times, they are bound to produce these copper-made weapons and tools.
After explaining all the upcoming directions in detail, Austin led the two hundred Dragon Nest Beastmen back to the Dragon Nest Base.
This was also Austin’s mistake. Without personal experience, he thought refining copper would be easy, believing that one or two successful furnaces could lead to large-scale copper industry, equipping the entire Dragon Nest Tribe with newly-made weapons and tools in a short time. But he didn’t expect it to be fraught with difficulties, and the initial goal was only half completed.
What follows is continuous experimentation to find a method to manufacture suitable weapons and tools during the cold winter. Completing such trials is impossible within one or two months.
Since it’s an experiment, there’s no need to station too many Beastmen here, wasting manpower.
Thus, there wasn’t much point in leaving too many Dragon Nest Beastmen, so Austin took two hundred Beastmen back, leaving about a hundred to be stationed there long-term.
This failure served as a reminder to Austin that one shouldn’t act too rashly. This time bringing so many Beastmen only proved to be a minor inconvenience. If it were an issue of life and death, the consequences would have been much more severe.
Of course, upon leaving, Austin also took the mercenary captives away from the Copper Ore Base, otherwise, controlling these individuals with only a hundred Dragon Nest Beastmen would be somewhat challenging.
Several days later, after organizing everything, Austin led the large group away from the Copper Ore Base, embarking on the journey back to the Dragon Nest Tribe Base.
This copper refining wasn’t a complete failure, at least copper has been separated from the copper ore. It’s just that due to the cold weather, progressing to the next step of forging is difficult.
Actually, if it weren’t for the cold winter, Austin believes staying there for one or two more days would naturally yield a forging method. But now, he could only leave it to the goblins to manage themselves.
...
The Copper Ore Base isn’t far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, about twenty miles. The Dragon Nest Beastmen can cover that distance in about an hour if they hurry. Although the heavy snowfall slowed them down, half a day’s journey sufficed to return the main group to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Nothing major happened within the tribe. As the cold winter began, nearly ten days had passed. The thousands of meters-high cold winds in the sky have been exhausted, and the snowfall has significantly reduced. Though still cold, it’s not as freezing as the first couple of days.
The dangerous phase has passed, so during this slower period of cold winter, groups of Beastmen were brought out for large-scale drills. Moreover, the daily military training increased, ensuring the breathing technique training wasn’t overlooked.
Overlooking the vast open ground, Austin found his mind relaxing as he saw disciplined and uniformly moving elite Beastmen units.
From above, previously forested wasteland stretches outward with rows of houses, forming a small city within the Kawa Great Forest.
On the vast snowy ground, the well-trained Beastmen formed a dense black sea, creating a thunderous roar.
Further away, fields under cultivation stretched outward.
Two years ago, this was a rippling unbroken green baren forest, and now, it had been transformed by Austin’s hands, creating a tribe, a city on this wilderness land.
Although in the entire process of establishing the tribe and later military training, Austin rarely participated, the origins of all this—from military reform, system determination, land cultivation—everything began with Austin. He brought the seeds of his past civilization here, nurtured them, enabling them to flourish and eventually grow to the current state, possibly even into mighty trees in the future.
Since copper refining can’t be achieved in one go, and the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe has entered the right track, Austin started considering ways to enhance his strength.
Although there won’t be many dangers for the Dragon Nest Tribe in the short term, there is a great secret hidden in the lake near the tribe, which during his last underwater venture, his sixth sense told him that breaking through the peculiar plants known as ghost grasses and seeing the deepest secret inside required reaching gold level life and the natural aptitude of a giant dragon.
Austin is very intrigued by what might be hidden in there.

chapters.title: Chapter 141 - 137 Otto
chapters.content:
Chapter 141: Chapter 137 Otto
It’s been more than ten days since the arrival of the cold winter. The heavy snow in the sky, initially driven by the turbulent magic power tide, has now settled down, no longer carrying the fierce momentum that seemed to bury the entire world.
Nonetheless, the entire land is wrapped in a blanket of silver, completely covered by the vast expanse of white.
Though the snow in the sky continues to fall, it has become much lighter. Meanwhile, the thick clouds that covered the sky for over ten days are starting to dissipate and thin out, suggesting that perhaps in a few days, the Kawa Great Forest, frozen for nearly half a month, might see a short period of sunlight.
"Gulu, it’s really comfortable!"
Swallowing the steaming, mushy food from the rough clay bowl, Otto hurriedly stuck out his tongue to lick the remaining warmth off the bowl’s surface to avoid wasting any food.
Finally, after licking away the last bit of mush, Otto sat down on a log, letting out a comfortable moan, his mouth lingering with the faint aroma of food and the taste of salt.
"I never thought a place like this exists in the world; my gratitude to the great His Highness Austin..."
Otto is a ratman. In a world like the Kawa Great Forest, governed by the raw law of survival of the fittest, the ratmen, a weaker race even compared to the kobolds, certainly do not fare well.
Physically weaker than kobolds, as timid as goblins, they are not only incapable of fighting on the battlefield but also flee when encountering formidable prey during hunts. Their survival can only be maintained by foraging for wild fruits, grains, or even gnawing on bark. Such races, even lowly slaves, are often despised by some tribes.
Ratmen have avoided extinction due to their rodent-like habits, breeding rapidly. Being omnivorous, during famines, they can gnaw on anything, even bitter tuber roots and bark, surviving even in the stench-ridden gutters.
From the time Otto could remember, his memories were filled with lowly hunger; chewing on grass and tree roots countless times. Having several days of wild fruits and yams is already a rare harvest for the tribe, allowing these lowly beastmen a chance to eat such leftovers, especially for a humble ratman.
Often, when the tribe’s harvest was poor, he’d lie on the grass, munching on bitter roots, fantasizing that the happiest life in the world would be to eat the sweet fruits and yams until full, without worry, alongside a piece of dried meat.
According to some elders, when one dies and returns to the embrace of the gods, they’ll lead a life of perpetual happiness in the Divine Kingdom of the Beast God.
Otto has never died, naturally unaware of what the Divine Kingdom of the Beast God is like, but he feels his current life is the best he ever imagined.
"Thanks to the tribe for driving me out, thanks to His Highness Austin’s benevolence."
Not long ago, with the arrival of the cold winter, Otto’s original tribe began a new round of purging the old and useless population. This year, the tribe’s harvest wasn’t good, so more "weak beastmen" were purged than usual, Otto being among them.
Those old and weak expelled population were considered useless or of little value by the tribe. Such is common among the beastman tribes surviving in the Kawa Great Forest, seen not as cold-blooded cruelty but as wisdom gleaned from survival struggles.
As for the expelled old and weak population, their fate was left to nature. A group of old, weak, sick beings wandering outside is virtually as good as dead, and nature uses such brutal ways to control the beastmen population within the Kawa Great Forest.
Initially expelled along with the old and weak, Ratman Otto was in despair. Without the tribe as a backup, the approaching cold winter aside, even the lurking dangers in the forest were enough to annihilate them all.
But fortunately, when they encountered danger, they stumbled upon a formidable hunting party, which brought them here, commencing a new life.
In this tribe, they were disbanded and regrouped with those beastmen who heard about the Dragon Nest Tribe and voluntarily sought refuge, undergoing military training transformation together.
Though the military training was arduous, with instructors often resorting to hitting and scolding, at least their bellies were never empty, even for the old and weak beastmen.
Not only could they eat to their fill, but the food compared to the grass roots and bark Ratman Otto used to eat was infinitely delicious, and these delicacies even had salt!
This was simply unbelievable. For a while, Otto felt uneasy, suspecting some sinister scheme among the Dragon Nest Tribe’s beastmen, worrying about being reared as livestock among other absurd thoughts.
After over half a month, as the military training progressed and Otto lived longer in the Dragon Nest Tribe, he finally put his mind at ease and developed an incomparable sense of belonging to the tribe.
Beastmen instructors told them that everything they now possessed, the wonderful lives they currently enjoyed, were all bestowed by the great His Highness Austin.
They should devote all their efforts to loving him, admiring him, revering him from the depths of their hearts.
Initially, Otto doubted these words, but as time passed, comparing the miserable past lives recounted openly by beastmen during military training to their current wonderful lives, the shared resonance led Otto and all beastmen to develop immense praise and worship for the great His Highness Austin.
Now, Ratman Otto even feels he would willingly die for his Highness.
"Bless you, great His Highness Austin."
Ratman Otto silently uttered in his heart, then placed his rough clay bowl back in a nearby basket filled with used dishes by his companions, these dishes cleaner than when first washed.
At this moment, a long whistle sounded across the snowy ground, signaling the start of military training again.
The beastmen gathered one by one, Otto quickly joined them. Before the cold winter began, they’d train while working, but now with fewer chores during winter, their training volume has doubled, seemingly to make up for the days they escaped training.

chapters.title: Chapter 142 - 138 The Role of Giant Beast
chapters.content:
Chapter 142: Chapter 138 The Role of Giant Beast
Despite the doubled training, Otto still persevered; he had no choice but to persist, as the instructor was watching from above.
If it were when he first joined the Dragon Nest Tribe, Otto might have had thoughts of slacking off, but now he absolutely had none. Anyone who dared to slack off would face the brutal disciplinary iron fist of the instructor.
Moreover, according to what Otto had learned during his past weeks living in the Dragon Nest Tribe, their meals as prospective members were actually the lowest in the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
Currently, the Dragon Nest Tribe is strictly divided into several parts: prospective members like them who have just joined and are still in the bootcamp transformation stage; those with weak constitutions not suited for combat, needing only a daily exercise for production Beastmen; Beastman militiamen with limited daily training but mainly tasked with various productive activities; Beastman soldiers who regularly train and hunt outside, serving as the main force in combat; and the most powerful of all, said to closely surround His Highness Austin, the Dark Dragon Guard and Dragon Vein Attendants.
Previously, only the Dark Elves knew some Breathing Techniques of the Dark World, so the Extraordinary Beastmen that were transferred were mostly Dark Dragon Guard. However, with the fall of the Blood Claw Tribe Branch and some Beastman Transcendents surrendering and swearing allegiance to Austin, contributing their Breathing Techniques, the numbers of the Dark Dragon Guard and Dragon Vein Attendants have now balanced out.
But this is beyond what Otto can know. What he does know and what fuels him with endless motivation are the different food standards among the Dragon Nest Beastmen. Even the lowest-level Beastman producers can have a small piece of meat with every meal.
As for the higher categories of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, he doesn’t have the delusion of reaching that level himself.
Ah, meat. Otto had only ever eaten a piece of bone with minor meat bits long ago, which was a treat given to him by a delighted tribal leader during a feast. That deliciousness was almost unforgettable in his life.
And more importantly, that small piece of meat was just a guaranteed ration norm. Becoming a Beastman producer also offers opportunities for work point rewards due to various diligence. Work points can buy tastier food. As long as there are enough work points, buying a large piece of meat to eat one’s fill is no problem.
If one day he could eat his fill with meat, he would be willing to die.
Precisely because of this, Otto consistently pushed himself.
One must know that within the Beastman Legion, there exists a Ratman scout team. If one day he could join the army due to outstanding performance, that would really be a leap to great status.
As he came to know, those Ratmen predecessors, before joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, were in equally low positions like himself but still went on to become important forces in the army. He may not be incapable of the same.
Harboring a small hope he dared not dream about for the future, Ratman Otto quickly returned to his position and continued the prior training.
...
During this period, the training regime for these prospective members of the Dragon Nest Tribe has increased significantly.
In fact, all this is not unrelated to the earlier series of wars.
First, there was the battle with the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, followed by the giant beast attack incited by mercenaries. Both battles cost the entire Dragon Nest Tribe heavily, especially with severe losses among the combat personnel.
Had it not been for the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s fanatical loyalty to Austin, they might have already been defeated under such severe casualty rates.
Although the Dragon Nest Beastmen battled bravely, winning both battles, the heavy casualties left the combat troops of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe halved, significantly reducing its strength.
In order to replenish the army’s strength, with the next generation of Dragon Nest Tribe not fully grown yet, these wandering Beastmen and other prospective members who joined became the most vital source for supplementing fresh forces.
Moreover, with the onset of the cold winter halting all forms of production activities, leaving abundant free time, these prospective Beastmen members have naturally been subjected to increased training volumes.
Additionally, the reason for augmenting their training volume wasn’t simply the severe losses suffered by the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion. During this period, the Dragon Nest Tribe also planned a project—a giant beast hunting plan.
"Your Highness, that’s the situation, what do you think?"
Within the Dragon Nest, the Governor of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Vini, was reporting the situation to Austin.
Previously, due to the advent of the cold winter, there had been an influx of wandering Beastmen in the wild, and with the current reputation of the Dragon Nest Tribe striking fear into tribes within a hundred-mile radius, following the spread of its fame, it immediately received plenty of Beastmen coming to pledge allegiance and join the Dragon Nest Tribe. In the ten days leading to the cold winter, more than dozens of wandering Beastmen came to join each day.
Thus, in the two major battles, although the Dragon Nest Tribe suffered many losses in Beastmen, its population growth was not slow. As a result, even though the Dragon Nest Tribe’s food supply was starting to strain, as long as the daily allocation was squeezed a bit, they could naturally make it through the cold winter and last until the next harvest.
However, with the propagation of the Breathing Technique, the cultivation of which required significant energy and consumption, even though Austin didn’t intend to increase the number of Dragon Vein Beastmen for now, the food needed for cultivating the Breathing Technique was still a sizable quantity. Unless Austin wanted the Beastmen to stop cultivating the Breathing Technique, the food supply couldn’t be reduced.
Amidst these circumstances, Vini came up with a solution, which was to hunt the giant beasts.
Long before the mercenary attack, the Dark Elves had led a hunting team to kill a giant beast approaching the Dragon Nest Tribe and dragged its carcass back for food.
At that time, Vini discovered that the life energy within the giant beast seemed quite abundant. Typically, the Extraordinary Beastmen who could eat ten pounds of normal meat at a time were full after eating just two pounds.
Moreover, not only did it fill them up, but after eating giant beast meat, these Extraordinary Beastmen seemed to have been strengthened to some degree.
Although such strengthening wasn’t apparent among the Extraordinary Beastmen, the physical constitution of ordinary Beastman soldiers did indeed improve after eating giant beast meat a few times. Initially, Vini wasn’t too sure about the effects of the giant beast meat, but when mercenaries attacked, drawing in five giant beasts that were eventually slaughtered by Austin along with the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen, the corpses became the food for the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen.
With the substantial base of giant beast meat, the strengthening effect of the giant beast meat became fully demonstrated, and Vini also discovered that this giant beast meat not only satiated hunger and strengthened Beastman bodies but also considerably facilitated the cultivation of the Breathing Technique.
Due to many such reasons, Vini came before Austin with a plan for hunting giant beasts.

chapters.title: Chapter 143 - 139 New Ideas
chapters.content:
Chapter 143: Chapter 139 New Ideas
Since the meat of the Giant Beast is so valuable, and clearing away the Giant Beast can make the environment surrounding the Dragon Nest Tribe much safer, naturally, there is a plan for this purpose. After all, no one knows if mercenaries might attack again in the future as they did before.
Moreover, during the cold winter when the land is covered in ice and snow, it’s the easiest time to spot the activities of Giant Beasts. Coupled with numerous Dragon Nest Beastmen idly resting in the tribe without any productive activities, this is the best time to hunt Giant Beasts.
"Giant Beast, huh..."
Listening to Vini’s plan, Austin thought for a while but couldn’t find any valid reasons to refuse.
"Alright, but be cautious when tackling the Giant Beast as they are very powerful. Try to bring along the Dragon Vein Beastmen; be prepared to minimize losses."
Austin did not plan to participate in hunting the Giant Beast but intended to give his full support, believing that having him safeguard the Dragon Nest Tribe would prevent any danger. Additionally, training his clan members further align with improving his clan’s strength.
"Yes, rest assured, Your Highness!"
Vini replied firmly, then excitedly left the Dragon’s Nest.
Watching Vini’s departing figure, Austin contemplated an important issue hidden within the Dragon Nest Army.
"The Extraordinary Beastmen are far superior to ordinary Beastmen, so regular military training and tactical drills are no longer suitable for them. I wonder how those in the Human World incorporate Warrior Mages into their armies?"
Considering the combat power of his clan, Austin began to think about the differentiation within his subordinates’ army.
With strict discipline and systematic training, the ordinary Dragon Nest Beastmen army was capable of confronting beastman troops several times their number in the Kawa Great Forest. This collective strength and discipline were vital for Austin’s clan, growing swiftly from a handful to their current status.
However, this training method significantly boosted ordinary Beastmen’s combat power but was somewhat inadequate for the Extraordinary Beastmen.
Military training represents the essence of warfare history over millennia from Austin’s previous world, and even though Austin was not a general, he could comprehend and adapt these essences to enhance the ordinary Beastmen’s strength.
But this only applied to ordinary Beastmen.
"Troublesome indeed, as in my previous world, there were no foundations for Extraordinary Abilities, making it impossible to reference. Meanwhile, the Human World is too distant, lacking opportunities to study the structure of Extraordinary armies here."
Even though trained Extraordinary Beastmen improved their combat power when cooperating as a military unit to some extent, Austin felt there probably existed ways to expedite their capability.
"Perhaps only when our forces expand to contact the border and truly confront the Human World’s military might, could we grasp something about it."
Most knowledge of marching formations is a secret passed down among nobles, and even the Extraordinary mercenaries captured by Austin lacked understanding. They merely knew that in various duchies within the Human World, Warrior Mages were independently regimented, but deeper secrets eluded them.
"No, although my previous reality lacked the foundation for Extraordinary Abilities, I can draw from the arrangements in fantasy works!"
Austin’s eyes suddenly brightened as he thought of an ingenious idea.
In the world of rich cultural works from his previous life, various films, animations, and novels surged, most engaged in worlds with Extraordinary Abilities, potentially offering inspiration!
But soon, Austin felt dispirited again.
Because in his mind, those entertainment works yielded little reference value.
Works like the Avengers, Hero Guild in One Punch Man, Fire Shadow Leaf Village in Naruto, World Government Navy in One Piece—all revolved around single force overpowering many, rather than group cooperation among Extraordinary individuals.
Though entities like Ninja Village or Navy were also military forces with many Extraordinary Powers within the framework, true teamwork in combat was scarcely mentioned, offering little reference.
As for those novels on some sites, whether fantasy or immortal hero tales, these protagonists dominated the world single-handedly, neither involving groups nor armies.
Did they mention some nation or faction in the background that needed formation and arrays among soldiers to exhibit Extraordinary soldiers’ potential, much like this world’s armies might? But without understanding that knowledge, even referencing purposes were absent.
"Exploring the way of battle formations is hard, but it’s possible to refer to other elements to boost the clan’s strength."
In One Piece, it’s rumored that the Navy Six Techniques were the most powerful body techniques created by summarizing all military techniques, though Austin was unsure of its correctness. The concept could still be adapted here.
For instance, during countless battles, experienced Beastmen could distill and merge their enemy engagement tactics, creating simple combat techniques, while referencing combat techniques release methods, eventually developing their species’ combat body techniques.
Moreover, initially, the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s combat experience wasn’t very extensive, directly borrowing from Navy Six Techniques to create their body techniques was feasible.
Since Austin’s Thunder Forging Body Technique and Electromagnetic Cannon were successful examples of borrowing from anime and novels, why not attempt others?
"Indeed, various principles interlink, especially in this world where Extraordinary Abilities manifest. As long as there is creativity, everything is possible!"
Inside the Dragon’s Nest, Austin’s eyes blazed with intense brilliance.
During this relatively idle cold winter, he seemed to find something interesting to do again. Since successfully transforming Beastmen, this marked his second attempt involving Extraordinary Power adaptation, promising another significant boost to his clan’s strength if successful.

chapters.title: Chapter 144 - 140 Experiment
chapters.content:
Chapter 144: Chapter 140 Experiment
The cold winter had already begun for half a month, and the giant beasts in the forest had become more active. For these enormous creatures, the cold chill outside didn’t have much effect on them; at most, it just made food harder to find.
Whenever this time comes, the range of movement of the giant beasts starts to expand. And when two famished giant beasts meet, inevitably, one will become the other’s meal, or they will fight to their mutual demise.
The giant beasts that roamed and reigned between the mountains and forests had no natural enemies, except for their kind. And once a tribe is discovered by a giant beast, what awaits is an unparalleled disaster.
This region, lacking strong figures, is a domain where the giant beasts dominate.
However, in this year’s cold winter, the era of rampant giant beasts has come to an end, because new hunters have set their sights on them.
Thanks to Austin’s efforts, the Dragon Nest Tribe had cultivated enough combat power. With well-trained troops, combined with dozens of extraordinary beastmen, and with the help of nets and various tools, the Dragon Nest Legion already had the capability to slay the giant beasts.
Two years of effort, and the seeds that Austin planted back then had finally grown to a certain level.
The Dragon Nest Tribe, which used to be under Austin’s wings, has now grown to the point where it can stand on its own even without Austin.
Who would have thought that the initially small group of seven Kobolds could grow to a regional dominator status in just two short years?
The matured Dragon Nest Tribe bared its fangs once again, but this time their target was the giant beasts rampaging across the snowy fields.
Not only to secure enough food and resources but also to ensure the safety of the Dragon Nest Tribe, after some preparation, Vini led most of the military strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe out to begin hunting giant beasts.
Initially, the old and weak beastmen who stayed in the Dragon Nest Tribe had some doubts about this giant beast hunting plan. After all, living in the Kawa Great Forest, the shadow cast by the rampaging giant beasts was enormous. The body as huge as a mountain, crashing through the mountains and forests, with an impact even the Magic Beast in the forest could not match.
But this doubt only lasted a few days until it dissipated completely under the impact of Dragon Nest Legion’s beastman soldiers repeatedly transporting back the corpses of giant beasts. Each victory not only brought a large amount of food and materials, showcasing the invincible power of the Dragon Nest Legion but also ignited the momentum and atmosphere of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, filling nearly the whole tribe with a thriving vitality.
Although at the beginning, the departing Dragon Nest Legion suffered losses due to unfamiliarity, subsequent battles allowed the Dragon Nest Legion, now more experienced, to hunt giant beasts without causing casualties among the legion soldiers.
Moreover, due to the previously painstakingly established medical system, after gaining some experience, nowadays, the treatment rate of the injured had reached more than seventy percent. Aside from those who died on the spot, most of the injured beastman soldiers were saved by the doctors referred to as "witch doctors" by the tribe’s beastmen. This further reduced the casualties of the Dragon Nest Legion by a certain margin.
...
The giant beast hunting plan not only brought a large food source to the Dragon Nest Tribe but also frequently encountered wandering beastmen or other beastman tribes while the Dragon Nest Legion was out searching for giant beasts.
At this time, the Dragon Nest Tribe no longer lacked food, so they naturally wouldn’t let go of these "wild" beastmen, capturing them in large numbers and bringing them back to the Dragon Nest Base, training and incorporating them into the Dragon Nest Tribe’s system.
And after half a month of continuous sweeping, the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe not only did not decrease due to hunting giant beasts but rather exceeded three thousand.
And while the Dragon Nest Legion achieved victory after victory, and the whole tribe developed positively, Austin also began his experimental research.
Initially, Austin occasionally chatted with the Dragon Nest Legion’s beastman members and started having them demonstrate their combat techniques in front of everyone, encouraging discussions with the hope to simplify these combat experiences into the most straightforward and useful techniques.
But after all, the Dragon Nest Tribe was newly founded, and the Dragon Nest Legion had only been established for a year. The combat experience wasn’t rich, and it was not as Austin had imagined, able to condense and combine all experience techniques into the finest body techniques.
"As expected, their combat experience is still not rich enough. It seems that to accomplish this, we have to take it slowly."
Regarding this, Austin, though somewhat disappointed, didn’t mind much. Since it couldn’t be done overnight, it would have to be gradual.
At least they could first study how to punch more powerfully, how to dodge faster, how to pierce with more damage, and then, later on, use these fundamentals to develop the Dragon Nest Legion’s unique battle body techniques incorporating the beastmen’s combat experiences.
In the future, there is indeed very great potential.
And this doesn’t mean that Austin’s attempt had no effect. Every time after returning from hunting giant beasts, the Dragon Nest beastmen would exchange methodologies on how to handle the beasts on the battlefield. This continuously enhanced the combat awareness of the Dragon Nest beastman soldiers, which was one of the reasons why, later on, the beastman legion continued hunting giant beasts with a decreasing casualty rate, eventually achieving almost no damage at all.
The time to create unique combat body techniques for the Dragon Nest Legion had not yet matured, so for now, they could only draw upon those imaginative techniques from the anime of past life.
And Austin’s choice was the Navy Six Techniques from One Piece: Shave, Iron Block, Moon Step, Gale Foot, Finger Gun, and Paper Drawing.
After all, it was one of the few systematic training methods in Austin’s memory and the principles of the techniques he could barely remember.
Of course, given the Navy Six Techniques were just techniques from a fictional work in Austin’s previous life, whether they could be recreated in the Otherworld was still unknown. Due to differing world frameworks, modifications were necessary, and they couldn’t be a direct copy.
But how to apply magic modification, and alter the Six Techniques to fit into the Fighting Qi System, all required Austin to conduct various levels of trials.
Taking advantage of the vast amount of time available during the cold winter, Austin began research on modifying the Six Techniques.
At the start, Austin gathered ten of the strongest extraordinary beastmen from the Dragon Nest Tribe and taught them according to the principles of the Navy Six Techniques in his mind, then had them perform the Six Techniques according to these principles.
And after three days of cultivation, without exception, all failed.
However, this did not discourage Austin’s confidence because he had anticipated such results. Without improvements or a systematic training method, it was impossible to succeed all at once.

chapters.title: Chapter 145 - 141 Foundation
chapters.content:
Chapter 145: Chapter 141 Foundation
For Austin, failing in attempting the Navy Six Techniques was anticipated, and it didn’t dampen his confidence. After all, the Navy Six Techniques are systematic combat body techniques from the One Piece World, likely developed by the World Government or the navy over a long period to surpass human limits. It’s impossible for Austin to casually replicate them in the Otherworld in just a few days.
Moreover, during these three days of attempts, through continuous observation and experimentation, Austin discovered some clues. He’s developed some ideas about it as well.
Based on memories from his previous life, Austin recalled the principles behind the Navy Six Techniques.
Shave is moving at high speed in an instant (0.36 seconds) by stomping the ground dozens of times to create explosive counter force, achieving the effect that makes one appear to vanish from a foe’s eyes.
Iron Block involves channeling strength into well-trained body muscles, granting iron-like hardness capable of withstanding bullets and blades, though with the flaw of immobility during use. However, Austin remembers Gabura from CP9 could move while using Iron Block, achieved by accelerating blood flow to quicken muscle movement.
In the One Piece World, it seems accelerating blood flow can yield greater power, demonstrated by Luffy’s Second Gear being based on this principle.
Austin isn’t keen on verifying if accelerated blood flow can produce such power, but he has some ideas and directions on it. Yet, his priority remains reproducing a version of the Six Techniques first.
Paper Drawing, a defensive technique within the Navy Six Techniques, involves shedding all bodily strength and using airflow changes from an opponent’s movements to control the body nimbly and avoid incoming attacks.
Within the One Piece power system, a similar power system to Paper Drawing is Observation Haki. Although Austin doesn’t know Haki’s principle, during Luffy’s training with King of the Underworld Rayleigh after the Paramount War, the principle of stimulating Observation Haki seems akin to Paper Drawing, as Luffy, blindfolded, evaded Rayleigh’s stick attacks by sensing airflow changes.
Moon Step is said to be an application technique similar to Shave, using rapid air kicks to generate strong counter force for hovering or flying in the air.
Gale Foot, by executing ultra-fast and powerful kicks, creates a vacuum to unleash slashing attacks on foes, easily slicing targets in half, and it’s the only long-range attack technique of the Six Techniques.
Finger Gun is claimed to have the power of a gunshot, concentrating all bodily strength in the index finger to unleash a strike with bullet-like power, easily penetrating the human body.
Austin remembers the principles behind the Navy Six Techniques, but these are ultimately body techniques from a fantasy work. Whether they existed or not is one thing, and even if they did, given the foundational environmental differences between the two worlds, modifications are necessary.
"In the One Piece World, it’s said that the Six Techniques require a certain physique strength to wield. Based on the naval principles, they are indeed beyond reach for warriors without extensive training and strong physical capabilities."
Austin knows that even CP9, touted as the strongest talents in eight hundred years, took years to fully master the Six Techniques, even with the World Government’s comprehensive training system and Rob Lucci’s exceptional talent.
To replicate the Navy Six Techniques unchanged in this world, knowing only the principles and lacking a complete training system, means Austin would have to explore step by step alone, a process taking at least ten years.
"However, compared to the One Piece World, this world possesses systematic extraordinary powers like Fighting Qi and Magic, and from these systems emanate combat techniques and spells. Perhaps drawing from the combat technique’s approach of channeling internal Fighting Qi could rapidly reduce the time to form the Six Techniques."
Though lacking a systematic training method, Austin still has Fighting Qi as extraordinary energy in this world, making techniques inspired by it likely easier to wield than purely relying on body techniques like the Six Techniques.
"Yet, even if Fighting Qi can lower the requirements for using the Six Techniques, physical fitness remains the foundation. Hmm, we’ve hunted numerous giant beasts recently, so let’s first intensify the training for the Dragon Vein Attendant and Dark Dragon Guard to strengthen their bodies!"
Even with Fighting Qi’s aid lowering the minimum usage threshold for the Navy Six Techniques, a certain level of physical fitness is still necessary, so Austin increased the training regimen of these extraordinary Beastman legions.
This training session isn’t a simple lineup exercise anymore but genuine physical training.
Since replicating the Navy Six Techniques from One Piece World is the goal, Austin doesn’t mind also replicating the training methods from there. After all, the Dragon Nest Tribe has hunted enough giant beasts to sustain the extraordinary Beastmen for intense training.
Thus, during the subsequent period, both the Dragon Vein Attendant and Dark Dragon Guard met with quite the misery.
Over three thousand push-ups, sit-ups, heart-pumping pounds ups, weighted running... Each modern training method was pulled out by Austin, and the training volume was at least ten times that of a regular athlete from Austin’s previous life.
Under such rigorous training, all ordinary Dragon Nest Beastmen were utterly shocked, with their first act every morning being to watch the extraordinary Beastmen undergo their arduous training.
Before determining the training volume, Austin naturally conducted investigations, making the training intensity for these extraordinary Beastmen close to their limits, leaving them exhausted by the end of the first day, collapsing into sleep.
But it doesn’t stop there, as the second day’s training surpasses the first day’s volume, with each day surpassing the previous day’s limits, constantly increasing the Beastmen’s training volume.
In Austin’s previous world, this approach wouldn’t work, but here, in the Otherworld where extraordinary abilities manifest, with scientific training plus enhancements from the flesh of ferocious beasts, the physical capabilities of extraordinary Beastmen improved continuously. Combined with the Dragon Nest Beastmen’s fervent worship of Austin, under unwavering belief, they keep breaking through, even surpassing Austin’s expectations in training effectiveness.

chapters.title: Chapter 146 - 142 Basic Combat Techniques
chapters.content:
Chapter 146: Chapter 142 Basic Combat Techniques
How strong is the potential generated by human willpower?
It’s said that to save a child falling from a high building, a mother’s speed can surpass that of a world champion. To rescue a wife trapped under a car, a husband can unleash the power to lift a vehicle weighing several tons.
In Austin’s previous world where extraordinary power had not yet manifested, this was true; in this world, the potential explosively unleashed by intense willpower is even greater.
And it happens that, through relentless indoctrination and subtle influences from various matters, every beastman in the Dragon Nest Tribe has developed unparalleled personal worship towards Austin.
Using a church structure analogy, a large portion of the Dragon Nest Beastmen within the Dragon Nest Tribe are Austin’s fanatical followers, especially within the extraordinary beastman legion of the Dark Dragon Guard and the Dragon Vein Attendants.
Their seeds of extraordinary power were granted by Austin, akin to divine blessings given by a deity. Their fanaticism for Austin is even more intense than that of ordinary beastmen.
Because of this, through repeated training, and relying on that intense belief, many extraordinary beastmen continuously pushed beyond their limits, keeping up with the increasing training intensity.
However, even so, after a month, only about twenty of those extraordinary beastmen remained, with the rest being eliminated for failing to keep up with the training pace.
During this month-long training, owing to scientific methods and the potent effects of giant beast meat, the strength of the extraordinary beastmen soared, particularly the twenty who persevered to the end. If placed in the Sea King World, Austin speculates their attack power would be at least above one hundred to two hundred Dao Power, making them superhumans, ten times stronger than an average human soldier.
Of course, training these elites consumed substantial resources from the Dragon Nest Tribe. If not for these extraordinary beastmen going out for giant beast hunts during training, the expenditure for their training alone might have depleted the Dragon Nest Tribe’s reserves.
With repeated hunts, the traces of giant beasts within a hundred-mile radius of the Dragon Nest have become scarce.
The remaining twenty beastmen’s attack power reached between one hundred and two hundred Dao Power, laying a foundation. Following One Piece World’s framework, they could begin training in the Navy Six Techniques.
Throughout this month of training, besides creating training plans for the extraordinary beastmen, Austin was not idle.
Indeed, he already had ideas for the magic modification of the Navy Six Techniques and had begun the transformation, only awaiting the final experimental stage.
To integrate the Navy Six Techniques into this world, Austin couldn’t spend ten years studying pure body techniques without a systematic training method. From the start, his goal was to combine Fighting Qi with the Navy Six Techniques, modifying them into combat techniques for this world.
Austin did not possess knowledge about combat techniques, nor did the beastmen in the Dragon Nest Tribe. Whether it be Austin or his extraordinary beastmen, their abilities were akin to talent magic and were not acquired through postnatal cultivation.
But that didn’t matter, as there were a group of mercenary captives within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After more than a month of tough slave struggles, when Austin showed the slightest hint, many mercenary captives naturally decided to submit to him, joining the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Submitting to beings different from oneself seemed unbelievable to Austin’s past self, and hard to accept as treachery among humans.
Yet, the truth reflects that, according to Austin’s previous world history of human civilization, the rise of nationalism and patriotism truly began among the masses after the Western Renaissance.
Prior to that, most lower-class people were indifferent to who their kingdom’s rulers were, really caring more about next year’s harvest, taxation, marriage, death rights, and everyday needs, without much concern for ethnic differences.
There wasn’t even a concept of traitors or collaborators, and no one felt it shameful to submit to different ethnic groups.
Before the awakening of nationalism and statism, the Manchu Qing managed to rule the vast Divine Land, governing millions of Han Chinese with only about a hundred thousand people.
But as foreign powers invaded and nationalism gradually rose, patriotism awakened among people, and even with East Japan’s then ten-fold national power over Huaxia, it returned with no success, battered on the fiercely resistant Divine Land.
This was true in Austin’s previous world, and it is also the case here.
Though this world boasts glorious extraordinary powers, its political systems still brim with the decay of aristocratic-peasant frameworks. Can one make a peasant understand the concepts of nationality, patriotism, or human-ethnic heroic duty?
No.
Peasants are thus, and mercenaries struggling and surviving under noble dominance are likewise.
That’s why, aside from some stubborn individuals, most mercenaries submitted to Austin, joining the Dragon Nest Tribe system without feeling anything wrong about it, given their minds lack the concept of ethnic differences.
With the mercenaries’ inclusion, Austin gained an insight into human extraordinary systems.
Unlike extraordinary beastmen or Austin’s talent magic, human warriors lacked innate talents. Their Fighting Qi and power were cultivated, as were their combat techniques.
This gave Austin significant insights into creating combat techniques.
After several days of research, Austin discovered that mercenaries’ combat techniques essentially activated powerful attack abilities by channeling Fighting Qi through blood vessels.
This means the combat technique’s destructive power is essentially the destructive power of Fighting Qi.
No wonder techniques like Tornado Slash, Charge, and Wind-breaking Slash can be used by anyone adept with Fighting Qi, as this is merely straightforward application of Fighting Qi.
These combat techniques crudely utilize Fighting Qi to cover weapons, generating great lethal power by only employing the power of Fighting Qi, without coordination with the body to fully unleash its capabilities.
Understanding this, although Austin felt somewhat disappointed, he also gained greater confidence.
Now what he seeks to create is a fusion of Fighting Qi and body techniques, forging a new combat body technique, whose application will certainly be more powerful than these straightforward utilitarian Fighting Qi combat techniques.
With the mercenaries’ usage of Fighting Qi as reference, Austin also gained direction on how to adapt the Navy Six Techniques for local modification.

chapters.title: Chapter 147 - 143 Preliminary Hardening
chapters.content:
Chapter 147: Chapter 143 Preliminary Hardening
According to the principles of the Navy Six Techniques, the difficulty of the Six Forms Body Techniques varies. Since modification is necessary, it’s natural to start from the simplest part.
Shave and Moon Step belong to the same category, relying on the explosive power of the legs to gain tremendous propulsion. As for Moon Step, if it requires kicking the air to gain sufficient upward reactive force, scientifically speaking, the speed of the foot’s kick needs to at least surpass the speed of sound. This is because, according to scientific theory, when an object’s moving speed approaches the speed of sound, it encounters a very strong resistance termed as the sound barrier.
Only the reactive force generated by the sound barrier makes it possible to rely on kicking the air to gain power for direction change or floating in Moon Step. The requirement for kicking speed is truly immense for this, and the same goes for Shave, which involves kicking the ground multiple times in an instant to rapidly move through accumulated reactive force. Not to mention whether this stacking of forces is even feasible, even if it were possible, the requirement for foot kicking speed is extremely high. With the current strength of the Beastmen, there’s still quite a gap.
Moreover, even with Fighting Qi modification, Shave and Moon Step in these six forms are rather complicated, and Austin is not considering them for the time being.
Of the remaining four techniques, without Shave for rapidly closing in, the Finger Gun technique, although it has some impact, doesn’t greatly enhance the current Extraordinary Beastmen. Moreover, mastering Finger Gun requires solving the problem of finger hardening; otherwise, swift stabbing will only result in breaking one’s own fingers.
As for Paper Drawing, which is akin to sensing airflow to evade in advance, given the coarse and impulsive nature of the Beastmen, Austin doesn’t think they could learn it quickly.
Therefore, Austin decided that the first modifications would be the Iron Block and Gale Foot of the Six Forms.
Regarding Iron Block, Austin remembers similar Hard Qi Skill martial arts from his previous life which, although unable to stop bullets, could resist fist and foot attacks at high levels. In a modern society without Extraordinary Power, they could achieve such a degree, so with Fighting Qi, it might be possible to recreate martial arts akin to the Golden Bell Shield found in novels.
Moreover, regarding the Hard Qi Skill, Austin knows a thing or two. It’s said to be developed through continuous striking and training, so that the muscles attain an iron-like state. Adding Fighting Qi, this Fighting Qi version of Iron Block is very likely to be realized and is one of the easiest body techniques to implement within the Navy Six Techniques.
As for Gale Foot, mercenaries already possess combat techniques like Earth Splitting Slash and Wind-breaking Slash. They have some foundation in the application of Fighting Qi, but they cannot perform long-range attacks.
If Fighting Qi is used in conjunction with the principles of Gale Foot, there’s a high chance to recreate such combat techniques in this world.
Of course, according to the principles of the Navy Six Techniques, Gale Foot also has very high requirements for kicking speed, but Gale Foot can be used with weapons to create a Slashing Wave. Before the physical capabilities of the Extraordinary Beastmen reach the limits required for Shave and Moon Step, Austin plans to directly adapt it into a weapon-slashing combat technique. When the Beastmen’s kicking speed catches up, they could then base further development on true Gale Foot.
"There are twenty people left, just enough to form two groups. One group will use clubs for body striking while developing the technique to enhance muscles with Fighting Qi, thereby developing Iron Block. The other group will first practice, stimulating Fighting Qi on weapons for hacking, then attempt combination with Fighting Qi, using Gale Foot’s concept to see if they can unleash Slashing Waves."
After pondering for half a day, Austin had already decided on the development direction of the Six Techniques.
Having made the decision, Austin did not delay, and directly divided the Extraordinary Beastmen into two groups based on their actual conditions.
Those with robust physiques and muscular builds were placed in the Iron Block experimental group, while those with developed arm muscles and swift, strong arm movements were assigned to the Gale Foot Slashing Wave experimental group.
The two groups quickly entered the experimental state without much delay.
Thanks to the previously hellish training, these Extraordinary Beastmen had already built a solid foundation, so training directly progressed.
In the Iron Block experimental group, the Beastmen had to practice daily by striking their bodies with clubs. As their muscles tensed and hardened, enhancing their defenses, they also adapted their skin muscles to external environmental changes while attempting to activate their internal Fighting Qi, channeling it into their muscles, and using external forces to stimulate the continuous fusion and coordination of Fighting Qi and muscles.
On the first day, the Beastmen in the Iron Block experimental group wailed incessantly, their entire bodies covered in bruises, looking very battered. Fortunately, the Beastman Witch Doctors had established a good treatment system and had decent experience with the bruises from club strikes. After applying herbal compresses and blood circulation massages, plus the life force of the Extraordinary Beastmen, they had mostly recovered by the following day.
The training intensity remained the same on the second day without increase, and the Beastmen again appeared bruised and battered. However, their injuries were slightly better than the previous day. Under external stimuli, as the Extraordinary Beastmen tightened their skin muscles, strands of Fighting Qi began instinctively converging towards the muscles and skin, improving some defense.
Day three, day four... with each passing day, the Beastmen’s situation improved. During this period, Austin did not have them work in isolation but had them share their insights with each other every night, facilitating discussions. Austin would then summarize and refine, constantly enhancing, to determine the best way to utilize Fighting Qi, and so forth.
This method of alternately refining and experimenting continued until the tenth day. In the Dragon Nest Tribe, ordinary Beastmen striking these hardened Extraordinary Beastmen with clubs couldn’t inflict any damage. Even blunt wooden spears failed to pierce their skin.
Previously, even Extraordinary Beastmen would inevitably flee embarrassingly when confronted by the combined forces of an ordinary Beastmen army.
But now, the Extraordinary Beastmen who underwent the Iron Block training could stand in the field with their hardened abilities, and several dozen ordinary Beastmen wielding wooden clubs couldn’t inflict any damage—this was simply incredible!
Of course, this does not mean the Iron Block experiment was successful. In fact, the Iron Block experiment was still in a very preliminary stage, just achieving basic hardening rather than being called Iron Block. In combat, it remains somewhat of a superfluous addition, still requiring further effort and improvement.

chapters.title: Chapter 148 - 144 Bronze
chapters.content:
Chapter 148: Chapter 144 Bronze
This initial hardening technique, developed from the insights of the Extraordinary Beastmen, can only be used when standing still, as it requires the body to remain immobile, essentially turning one into a large target.
At this stage, hardening can barely withstand the blunt blows of ordinary Beastmen, and fails to resist even the sharper Wooden Spear, let alone other sword-like weapons.
However, with this promising beginning, Austin believes that it will eventually be possible to develop a complete magic-modified Iron Block, akin to Gabura, which allows for mobility during attacks and even incorporating Iron Block into offensive combat.
The Extraordinary Beastmen in the Iron Block experiment group are continuously engaged in hammering training, but now they train with partners, rendering the strikes from ordinary Beastmen less beneficial for them.
The group is divided into two teams for training: one team focuses on resistance training while the other strikes, and then they switch roles after the training time is up.
During further development and training, the Extraordinary Beastmen in the Iron Block training group have begun to sense the linkage between Fighting Qi within their bodies and their muscle skin, repeatedly experimenting with harmonizing Fighting Qi with their physique, combining the most effective methods through continuous exchanges, gradually forming a battle technique prototype for Iron Block.
Soon after, when the Extraordinary Beastmen in the Iron Block experiment group use the Iron Block prototype, bystanders can even see the faint glow of Fighting Qi emanating from their skin, indicating that they have initially integrated Fighting Qi into the hardening, significantly enhancing their defense and gradually forming a battle technique prototype for Iron Block.
It is believed that over time, this Fighting Qi version of Iron Block will be capable of resisting sword and spear strikes and even Fighting Qi attacks, possibly extending to attack techniques based on Iron Block in the future.
The emergence of the Fighting Qi version of Iron Block indicates the possibility of the magic-modified Six Techniques appearing in this world, and Austin is thus excited.
Currently, he has not fully exploited the battle formation knowledge or other information on strengthening the Extraordinary Beastmen, so he intends to enhance the capabilities of the Beastman Transcendent before proceeding, planning in the short term to learn and emulate the navy in "One Piece" as a template, with Extraordinary Beastmen as leader officers commanding a group of ordinary Beastman soldiers, coordinating in combat to maximize their combined combat power.
Such cooperation is far superior to independent formation of armies from ordinary Beastmen and Extraordinary Beastmen.
In this military structure, the ordinary Beastmen have undergone rigorous training and their skills are adequate, though the Extraordinary Beastmen still require improvements in their combat strength.
The magic-modified Navy Six Techniques is presently Austin’s method to significantly improve the solo combat abilities of the Extraordinary Beastmen.
However, Austin’s excitement was short-lived; unlike the smooth progress of the Iron Block experiment group, the Gale Foot Slash Wave experiments encountered issues from the start.
"Weapons pose a real problem."
In this Fantasy World, there exist battle techniques similar to Earth Splitting Slash and Tornado Slash. These rudimentary techniques can basically be utilized with the presence of Fighting Qi within the body.
Based on these battle techniques, combined with the Gale Foot concept, it might be feasible to achieve a Gale Foot-like Slashing Wave for ranged attacks, potentially even more powerful than the original.
However, for a slash to be effective, at least a weapon resembling an Iron Sword, capable of enduring Fighting Qi and swift slashes, is needed!
Throughout various battles, the Dragon Nest Tribe managed to collect some Iron Weapons, but these were too few, mostly taken by the Goblins at the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop, and these weapons are mostly large items like Wolf Fang Clubs, Iron Rods, Iron Hammers, and War Axes of assorted designs.
Aside from these mismatched weapons not fitting Austin’s vision of a unified weapon army, the Wolf Fang Clubs and Iron Hammers are incapable of delivering slashes. Even the War Axes, which barely fit battle technique needs, only have a couple of small ones, insufficient for Gale Foot Slash Wave training for the Extraordinary Beastmen.
Ultimately, Austin ordered the Goblins at the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop to make ten Ironwood Swords from a wood similar to Ironwood for the Extraordinary Beastmen to practice slashing techniques and channeling Fighting Qi to the Ironwood Sword.
But Austin knows this is only a temporary measure; these Wooden Swords, though sturdy in texture, fall far short of real Metal Swords in sustaining the fierce Fighting Qi and rapid tearing slash force.
To acquire enough Metal Swords for the Extraordinary Beastmen to use with Slashing Wave, Austin once again focused on the Copper Refining Blast Furnace at the Copper Mine Base.
"Your Highness, according to your methods, we’ve produced copper, but the weapons made from this copper are useless...."
Beside the Copper Refining Blast Furnace, Goblin Gulu, in charge of this area, presented a dark gray-yellow axe to Austin, whose edge was already dented and sunken.
"This axe was used only once for chopping a tree and only managed to peel off a corner of bark before ending up like this."
After over a month of exploration, aided by Austin’s initial guidance, the Beastmen stationed there have overcome numerous challenges, finally refining copper and casting it into tools and weapons.
Yet the effectiveness of these tools seems far from satisfactory.
Perplexed, Austin examined the axe closely, noting the gray-purple hue revealed at the dented blade edge.
This is copper, rather pure copper!
Pure copper has good malleability, but unlike steel, it is unsuitable for manufacturing tools and weapons.
"Hah!"
Austin almost slapped himself; historically, weapons were made from Bronze, not pure copper.
