The copper refined through impure blast furnaces isn’t pure copper, as it contains impurities like copper oxide, differing greatly from Bronze both in composition and in hardness and sharpness, rendering these copper products unsuitable for weapons.
"Bronze requires adding some metallic elements, either tin or zinc?"
Austin furrowed his brow, but soon he found sufficient information from his past life memories.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 - 145: Copper Alloy
chapters.content:
Chapter 149: Chapter 145: Copper Alloy
Pure copper is actually not suitable for making weapons. In the history of humanity, what was first used on a large scale was bronze.
And bronze is an alloy of copper.
When Austin was in high school in his previous life, reading chemistry, perhaps they detailed the chemical composition of bronze alloys, but after so many years, Austin has forgotten more than half of this knowledge.
Although he forgot most of it, that doesn’t matter. When he read about ancient people smelting bronze, he was very curious about how those ancient humans incorporated those reactive metals into copper and how they smelted those reactive metals.
At that time, Austin went to check it knowingly, and it turned out that in ancient times, when smelting bronze, ancient humans often added some associated minerals from which copper was produced to copper ore. Those associated minerals were the necessary components to form bronze alloys. Furthermore, adding those associated minerals resulted in the bronze alloy having a lower melting point than copper, making it easier to refine.
As for what elements those associated minerals consisted of, Austin has mostly forgotten. Likely, those ancient humans did not specifically study the components of those associated minerals; as long as usable bronze tools could be smelted, who cared what elements they consisted of?
Since he remembered that smelting bronze required associated minerals, Austin naturally began to try and asked the Kobolds present to find other associated minerals in the copper mine.
Since the work of refining copper had started, Austin also found that Kobolds seemed to have a remarkable talent for mining and finding ore. Perhaps in the future, when looking for other ores, a Kobold exploration team could be specially established?
With their prospecting talent, the Kobolds quickly found the associated minerals different from copper ore and sent them to the blast furnace.
During this nearly a month’s time, the Dragon Nest beastmen not only developed a specific method for refining copper but also, according to Austin’s instructions, made a lot of copper material. Since there was copper material, Austin planned to directly put these refined copper into the fire, then add the associated minerals to the earth blast furnace for re-melting.
With the efforts of the beastmen, after exerting great Kung Fu for more than half a day, they finally manufactured a pale yellow axe.
"Not green? Could it be a matter of the metal elements of these associated minerals?"
Looking at the newly made axe, Austin’s mind was full of doubts.
Although it wasn’t bronze, from the refining situation, the melting point did indeed drop significantly, so there shouldn’t be any mistake.
"Take it and try it."
Even though it wasn’t the bronze he imagined, Austin still told a beastman to try it out.
So a strong Kobold took the axe to a nearby tree and started chopping it down rapidly. To Austin’s surprise, this axe was sharper than the stone axe and more rigid. In no time, a whole tree was chopped down, yet the blade of the axe showed no signs of wear.
"Your, your highness... we have succeeded!"
The Goblin Gulu, responsible for refining copper, looked at the axe with fanaticism, so excited that he was almost speechless. More than a month of hard work in this Copper Ore Base had previously resulted in copper that was unusable, leading them to believe they had failed.
But now, from this axe, they all saw the hope of success.
Austin didn’t speak. He took the axe, weighed it in his hand, and lightly flicked its surface with his claw, feeling it was not much different from the iron axes provided by the Dragon Nest tribe.
Although it wasn’t the bronze he imagined, its properties were similar to iron, and in this humid world, copper was better than iron since it didn’t require extra effort to prevent rust.
Actually, around the Dragon Nest tribe, all the tribes used weapons like wooden spears, stone hammers, and stone axes. Austin had only seen iron weapons a few times, like the iron axe in the hands of Lizardman Rodney and those seized from the Blood Claw Tribe branch, as well as the mercenaries’ weapons. It could be said that within a hundred miles, almost all iron weapons were in Austin’s Dragon Nest tribe.
All the beastman tribes living in the Kawa Great Forest were basically primitive civilizations of the Stone Age, with no foundation for metal smelting.
"First, follow the previous proportions and make ten great swords. Don’t slack off with the remaining work; it’s best to continue experimenting with refining these coppers."
Since these alloyed coppers were no worse than ordinary iron, he decided to forge ten great swords first for the Gale Foot experimental group of beastmen to use for training. However, Austin remembered that the best copper alloy weapons were still bronze, so he instructed the beastmen to continue experimenting.
Over time, the Dragon Nest beastmen around Austin were also influenced by some modern thinking from Austin. The cultivation of non-toxic mushrooms in the mushroom houses, the innovative manufacturing in the workshop, the establishment of the witch doctor treatment system, and even the formation of iron block combat techniques were largely the results of Austin instilling variable experiments, inductive analysis, etc., into the Dragon Nest beastmen.
By continuously experimenting with changing variables and synthesizing the results to find the optimal method, Austin’s modern thinking kept expanding within the Dragon Nest tribe. Though these invisible things seemed inconspicuous, the establishment of various systems in the Dragon Nest tribe was based on this kind of thinking.
With this foundation of thought, Austin didn’t need to teach them hand-in-hand; as long as the task of improving copper alloys was assigned, the beastmen would naturally experiment and improve continuously.
"It’s best if we can produce bronzes. For now, bronze weapons are the most suitable for the tribe’s current situation, and when developed to a certain extent, bronze is no less than some steel."
Holding the axe in his hand, Austin thought silently.
However, what Austin didn’t know was that bronze was initially not green. Newly smelted bronze was a golden yellow, and it turned green because after being buried in the ground for thousands of years, it constantly rusted and oxidized, forming a layer of verdigris on its surface. It was thus called bronze.
Therefore, it was essentially impossible for him to smelt green copper from the earth blast furnace directly.
Austin spent several days at the Copper Ore Base, and with the collective labor of over a hundred beastmen, they finally forged ten great swords, each successfully completed.
Afterwards, while Austin assigned the task of researching better copper alloys to the beastmen, he also ordered them to produce some copper alloy armors and manufacture some production tools based on previous techniques.
Having issued his orders, Austin returned to the Dragon Nest tribe with these ten great swords.

chapters.title: Chapter 150 - 146: Inspiration
chapters.content:
Chapter 150: Chapter 146: Inspiration
Ten "Bronze" great swords reached the hands of the beastmen in the Gale Foot Slash Wave training group, and the experiments on the Gale Foot Slash Wave resumed.
Although the progress here lagged behind the Iron Block combat technique, with the arrival of the large swords, everything finally got on track.
During this period, the extraordinary beastmen in the slash wave experiment group, despite being limited by their weapons, could almost perform a Fighting Qi Slash with wooden swords after nearly a month of practice. However, they hadn’t yet figured out how to create a vacuum wave by tearing through the air.
But Austin firmly believed that with the beastmen’s relentless training, success would inevitably follow.
After switching to new weapons and getting familiar with them for several days, thanks to their prior foundation, the beastmen could successfully attach Fighting Qi onto the great sword, producing slashes.
However, these slashes were just ordinary Fighting Qi application techniques. Although powerful enough to chop through a tree without resistance, they could not form a long-range vacuum slash wave at all.
"The principle of the Gale Foot is likely rapid contraction and extension of leg muscles, followed by a swift kick to compress air and create a sharp vacuum-like slashing wave... This seems a bit difficult."
Unlike Iron Block, where Austin’s previous world had physical references, the Gale Foot was completely fanciful. Human strength couldn’t make one’s kicking speed surpass the speed of sound.
Fortunately, Austin’s world was not one where the extraordinary had not yet emerged. Magical energy and Fighting Qi truly existed.
"Once Fighting Qi is released from the body, its condensed energy automatically disperses into the surrounding air, quickly diminishing. As a result, warriors in this world rarely have long-range attack methods. So, how can we combine the principles of Gale Foot with Fighting Qi to create a slash wave?"
Watching the beastmen in the field tirelessly striking the air, hacking hundreds of times before resting and continuing, Austin kept pondering.
This period had witnessed over a month’s arduous training. Initially, the beastmen returned home each day with sore, weak hands, relying on the Dragon Nest Tribe’s witch doctors and their herbs for relief. The terrifying training volume would have already broken them if not for their life force surpassing that of humans and their extraordinary beastman physiques.
Even so, after over a month’s training, the extraordinary beastmen of the Gale Foot Slash Wave experiment group could, at most, extend Fighting Qi two inches when slashing, stirring a bit of airflow, but had no clue for actual slash waves detaching from the blade.
Austin saw clearly that without a breakthrough in the right direction, ten or eight more years of training wouldn’t allow them to develop a real slash wave.
In fantasy novels, the protagonist trains swordplay in the deep mountains, swinging a sword ten thousand times a day, persevering without fail.
Ten years later, they draw their sword, splitting mountains and severing rivers.
Perhaps if the beastmen continued practicing for decades, they might achieve those fantasy novel effects. But by then, Austin might not care for such combat techniques as Gale Foot Slash Wave.
"Troublesome, but mainly, how can we keep Fighting Qi from dispersing and maintain its attack power outside the body?"
With high-density Fighting Qi, nature’s gradient diffusion law causes it to disperse in all directions once outside the body, rapidly diluting into nothing, thus making it lack much killing power.
This difficulty in achieving the Gale Foot Slash Wave was unlike that of Iron Block Combat Technique.
The Iron Block technique applied Fighting Qi internally, while the Gale Foot Slash Wave was a long-range flying slash attack.
"When casting magic spells like Fireball or Water Ball, the magic power within disperses rapidly while flying. However, mages condense and constrain it with their spiritual power, allowing spells to retain significant power when flying quite far, as long as they’re within the spiritual power’s range. Do I need to similarly constrain Fighting Qi with spiritual power?"
A thought suddenly occurred to Austin, but he quickly negated it.
"No, the nature of Fighting Qi and magic power is completely different. Fighting Qi cannot be controlled with spiritual power, or else warriors would have long become like mages with long-range bombardment abilities."
Austin pondered intensely but had not made any breakthrough for several days.
Watching the beastmen still diligently swinging their swords, Austin could not help but wonder if the creation of the Gale Foot Slash Wave combat technique was going to fail.
This day, out of ideas, Austin flew up, leaving the nest to clear his mind.
It had been two months since winter set in, and during these two months, Austin had focused entirely on refining copper and the Navy Six Techniques, unaware of how quickly time had passed.
Flying high and gazing down at the snowy, crystal-clear, magnificent earth below, his mood suddenly lifted.
With a loud roar and a rapid flapping of his wings, his body flew like wind and thunder across the sky at incredible speeds, even breaking the sound barrier and causing sonic booms in the air.
The resistance from breaking the sound barrier did not trouble his robust body at all. On the contrary, it exhilarated him to fly a considerable distance high up.
Since coming to this world, almost four years had passed. From fearfully contending with Blood Wolves for survival to establishing a foothold in the forest, gaining a foundation and a self-protective power, it felt like a dream.
"Whatever, I’ve endured many dangers before, and I can’t believe I won’t figure this out."
After venting in the sky, Austin even casually intercepted a flying giant beast on the way.
Back then, he had to avoid these creatures, fearing becoming their prey. Now, he could casually kill them, and even his clan could see them as mere quarry, a remarkable sentiment to reflect on.
After his excursion, a refreshed Austin flew back to the Dragon Nest Tribe. Approaching the tribe, he saw a group of young beastmen tossing stones into the snow like skipping stones over water, oddly playing with snow.
"A group of carefree children."
Seeing this scene, Austin sighed.
But just when he intended to look away, a sudden flash of inspiration struck him like lightning across his mind.

chapters.title: Chapter 151 - 147: Gale Wave Principle
chapters.content:
Chapter 151: Chapter 147: Gale Wave Principle
Obviously, the density of stone is greater than that of water. If a stone is placed in water, it will immediately sink. But why does it skim across the water when skipping stones?
Speed!
It’s speed! The speed carried by the stone allows a denser, heavier stone to skim across the water surface, and it’s only when the speed is exhausted that it finally sinks.
Austin’s eyes suddenly lit up with brilliance, and he had an epiphany.
"No, rather than speed, it’s about movement! The movement of the object changes everything!"
The stone’s movement allows it to defy convention by skimming across the water. If Fighting Qi could be moved in a way to sustain its high energy without dissipating, like the skipping stone on water, it could achieve powerful remote attacks!
Austin had no clear understanding of the essence of Fighting Qi. He only knew that it dissipates quickly after leaving the body. However, within and near the body’s surface, it’s unaffected. This phenomenon couldn’t be explained by mere diffusion from high to low concentration; there must be a more profound connection causing Fighting Qi to dissipate in the air.
But regardless of the relationship, movement can alter many physical properties. Austin’s analysis using the analogy of the stone skipping on water could be worthwhile.
"Movement can endow objects with different characteristics. The principle of Gale Foot is more about creating a vacuum wave with rapid foot strikes than just attacking an enemy. The vacuum wave allows the rapid movement of the air blade upon striking air, maintaining strong motion and retaining formidable slashing ability even after traveling long distances!"
From a realistic viewpoint, if a sudden vacuum appears in a localized space, the surrounding atmospheric pressure rushes into the vacuum area immediately, refilling it in an instant.
This characteristic is pretty similar to Fighting Qi, which also dissipates quickly in the air after leaving the body.
More importantly, aside from how Gale Foot’s vacuum slash wave allows for remote attacks, Austin couldn’t initially discern how the vacuum wave inflicted such severe damage.
But that fleeting inspiration enlightened Austin to a new world.
Perhaps the result is due to movement!
Not the vacuum wave’s movement, but the movement of airflow.
When water flows rapidly under high pressure, it can form a jet cutter that slices through metal and stone. Similarly, the movement of air can create astonishing effects.
In videos from his previous life, Austin once saw an experiment where airflow was accelerated to massive speeds using an air compressor, enough to sever a wooden log in seconds.
The principle behind Gale Foot might very well be the same!
Surpassing supersonic kick techniques cause extreme air compression upfront, forming a vacuum wave. Meanwhile, the airflow driven by the toe’s movement rapidly circulates along the vacuum blade’s surface at terrifying speeds surpassing the speed of sound.
During flight, the vacuum and airflow create a cycle and balance. The pressure difference between vacuum and atmospheric pressure maintains the rapid rotation of surface airflow. This causes the Gale Foot Slash Wave to advance swiftly while the small portion of airflow near the vacuum wave remains in high-speed motion until the vacuum wave is filled by air and dissipates, with the fast-spinning air blade losing momentum due to air resistance and fading away.
In Austin’s theoretical analysis, the Gale Foot Slash Wave consists of two critical components: the forming vacuum wave and the rapidly rotating air blade on its surface. Together, they form a perfect circular cycle, culminating in a remote attack technique like Gale Foot.
In this configuration, the rapidly rotating air blade is the main source of Gale Foot’s destructive power. It enables the vacuum wave to sustain itself briefly in the air and leverages the atmospheric pressure to convert its pressure differential into the air blade’s driving force.
"Gale Foot can utilize a collaborative cycle between vacuum wave and air blade to form a slash wave with powerful slashing ability. Can I create a magic-modified version, using detached Fighting Qi in combination with the air blade, to form a Gale Wave?"
Having clarified the cause and effect of Gale Foot, Austin’s eyes radiated with unprecedented brilliance.
"It’s certainly possible! Compared to vacuum, Fighting Qi as an energy can be controlled to move quickly, and combining the two to create a Gale Wave’s power will surely be stronger than the original Gale Foot!"
Understanding the principle opened everything up. The previously stalled Gale Foot Slash Wave experiment group moved to the next phase.
The first step in upcoming experiments is the Fighting Qi Sword, attaching Fighting Qi from the body to the sword blade.
Fighting Qi dissipates for unknown reasons after leaving the body. However, attaching it to one’s sword doesn’t cause this. In fact, within the realm of human warriors, many use techniques like Tornado Slash and Wind-breaking Slash, where Fighting Qi is attached to the sword blade to enhance its destructive power.
While attaching Fighting Qi to a weapon consumes it quickly, as long as the weapon is in hand, it won’t vanish like detached Fighting Qi that dissipates within tens of centimeters, increasing attack potency due to the weapon’s nature.
The first step of Fighting Qi Sword was mastered by all the test group’s beastmen within just a couple of days.
Previously, while the Gale Foot Slash Wave training group hit a bottleneck, the Extraordinary Beastmen in the test group hadn’t been idle. They practiced slashing thousands of times daily, trying to guide Fighting Qi onto the Bronze Greatsword and unleash it into a flying slash. Although with no results yet, each beastmen’s arm swelled from long hours of intense sword-swinging, laying a solid foundation for Fighting Qi Sword.
The second step involves rapidly driving and rotating the Fighting Qi attached to the sword.
This is no simple task, as Austin lacked a systematic training method for this. Even the combat techniques used by human mercenaries remained rudimentary, primarily focusing on Fighting Qi Sword as a basic means of applying Fighting Qi.
Without references, Austin had no choice but to let the beastman test group explore, exchanging insights daily to discover how to keep the Fighting Qi on the sword in motion.

chapters.title: Chapter 152 - 148 Gory
chapters.content:
Chapter 152: Chapter 148 Gory
As the days of experimentation wore on, the beastmen in the experimental group exchanged experiences and finally found a winding path in the midst of hardship, and it was through this path that they steadily advanced.
At the very beginning, the Fighting Qi attached to the great sword could only be emitted from both sides, and its speed was equivalent to just one or two levels of wind speed, consuming several times more Fighting Qi than it normally would. However, this seemingly slow speed opened a new door for the beastmen.
Due to the tenacity of Fighting Qi, when treated in this manner, the power of the Fighting Qi attached to the sword exceeded that of an ordinary Fighting Qi sword by over ten percent. Though it seemed disproportionate to the consumption, it indeed indicated the direction of advancement.
So the beastmen continued their research on this basis, evolving from simple emissions to the hope of transforming the Fighting Qi into a complete cycle between the two blades, thereby greatly reducing the consumption of Fighting Qi while ensuring its movement.
With a correct direction, combined with ongoing training and exchange among the experimental group of beastmen, they soon found a solution. The circulation of Fighting Qi attached to the great sword not only resolved the issue of high Fighting Qi consumption but also increased the speed of circulation and enhanced the power beyond that of a typical Fighting Qi Slash.
With the emergence of a breakthrough, the beastmen in the experimental group continued to advance, eventually seeing the dawn of remote attack techniques like the Gale Foot Slash Wave.
As long as the speed of the Fighting Qi attached to the great sword could be increased beyond the speed of sound,
No, even if it was less than the speed of sound, as long as it reached a critical point, it would be possible to develop a remote slashing wave similar to the Gale Foot Slash Wave!
The future is bright!
...
Meanwhile, somewhere in the forest.
Rumble!!!
The grotesque giant hand’s hulking body collapsed like a hill, wounds mottled with blood splattering onto the snow, creating a warm mist that immediately froze solid.
"Whew, managed to kill another one."
Looking at the collapsed forest around him, where more than half of the trees had fallen and the snow appeared plowed through, as well as the giant beast’s corpse lying on the ground, resembling a mountain covered in huge ropes, the mercenary deputy captain Gory let out a long breath, his weapon trembling in his hand.
Ever since they attacked the Dragon Nest Tribe, only to fail and be captured by Austin, they had become slaves, their lives crushed under heavy labor like brick-moving and mining.
After more than a month of grueling torment, despite being extraordinary professionals, they were nearly reduced to skin and bones.
They had attempted to escape, but their first few efforts were easily thwarted. The last time, after escaping the Dragon Nest Tribe and thinking they had made it, they were directly suppressed by Austin and enslaved once more.
Every failed escape came at a price. Just the thought of that frightening little black room sent chills down everyone’s spines. After Austin’s unparalleled power easily crushed and captured them again, most mercenaries lost all hope; they couldn’t escape, or even if they could, they would have to face the terrifying Blue Young Dragon.
Moreover, escaping into this icy and snowy world mostly only meant facing death.
Even after that, some mercenary slaves, still unwilling to give up, tried to conspire again, but were quickly betrayed by their former companions, hung on poles in the icy wild for three days, and were barely alive when finally brought down.
You couldn’t blame them. The repeated failed escapes and the cruel punishments that followed had already caused many companions to lose hope.
Just when all the mercenaries were enveloped in a melancholy atmosphere, thinking they would soon die in this Dragon Nest Tribe like wild grass, the Blue Young Dragon unexpectedly found them and gave them two choices.
One was to submit to it and become its subordinates, fighting on its behalf.
The other was to continue being slaves, struggling until their value was exhausted and they died.
Gory still remembered that dragon’s haughty demeanor, looking down at them as if it were gazing at a bunch of ants, completely indifferent.
Yet in their desperation, the mercenaries, like grasping at straws, naturally most of them chose to submit without hesitation, becoming a part of the Dragon Nest Race. Of course, there were a few stubborn ones who, like Mercenary Captain Valen, sneered at the notion.
But not every mercenary held an exalted human faith like Edward. Many of these mercenaries had fought their way up from the bottom, without the slightest notion of nationalism. This attack on the Dragon Nest Tribe was mostly because Edward’s words swayed them; they didn’t have that much of a "vanquish evil" saintly heart.
Besides, at the borders of the human world, weren’t there some countries that submitted to a giant dragon, paying tribute year after year? Why couldn’t they submit to a dragon?
Thus, most mercenaries were taken out of the slave cells and joined Austin’s forces.
In the first few days, Austin individually interrogated them, extracting their Breathing Techniques, combat techniques, various experiences, maps, and even the distribution of worldly forces, all documented thoroughly.
Subsequently, the mercenaries who had been thoroughly interrogated were incorporated into combat teams. Despite the fact that the main culprit of the assault was that pretty boy Edward, and these mercenaries, like Austin, were of the human race, that didn’t mean Austin was going to pardon them just because of shared ancestry.
Why should he care about shared ancestry? Even among humans, there’s plenty of warfare. Since they had already interfered with his interests, there would be no leniency.
Thus, although these mercenaries were pulled from the abyss of slavery, they were also placed in the fighting ranks, taking on the most dangerous frontline tasks. Fortunately, with the growing strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe and their rather abundant experience in hunting giant beasts, when the mercenary corps went out hunting together, there were no casualties; even injuries were quickly healed by the beastman witch doctor.
Over the months, through countless experiences, it felt like a lifetime ago. Some mercenaries, because Austin had pardoned them from the slave cells, were moved to tears, swearing eternal loyalty to His Highness Austin.
Regarding this phenomenon, Gory outwardly smiled and agreed, but inside he sneered relentlessly. He had no intention of staying under this dragon’s command until death...
Discarding the numerous thoughts from his mind, Gory quickly stepped forward to help clean up the battlefield.
"Speaking of which, haven’t we been exterminating giant beasts continuously? Why does it seem like the number of giant beasts hasn’t decreased recently, but actually increased? Rodrigo, was it always like this before?"
The Legion Commander, Lizardman Rodney, was evidently taken aback, and both his narrative and questioning tones conveyed the same curiosity.
"Is that so? The tribe hasn’t hunted giant beasts before. But it does seem like you’re right; why does it seem that the number of giant beasts has recently increased?"
Lizardman Rodney’s brows furrowed with noticeable confusion, having not noticed before, but now, thinking about it carefully, it did seem to be a problem.
Gory was also taken aback, having unwittingly stumbled upon a possible issue just by idly chatting.

chapters.title: Chapter 153 - 149 Inner and Outer City
chapters.content:
The area where the Dragon Nest Tribe is located is extremely barren in terms of magic resources. Hence, both magic beasts and giant beasts are relatively scarce. Without sufficient magic power resources, it is fundamentally difficult to support their survival activities. To sustain a giant beast's survival activities, at least an area of five to six kilometers is needed in this magic resource-lacking region.
Before this cold winter season began, Rodney, who mingled in this area for a few years, had encountered traces of giant beasts only a few times but had never actually seen the true appearance of a giant beast.
Although rarely encountered giant beasts, which relates to these beastmen intentionally avoiding such dangers, prior to this, within a radius of ten miles from the Dragon Nest Tribe, Rodney indeed saw no traces of giant beast activities.
It could even be said that the surrounding region was generally a peaceful place.Nᴇw novel chapters are publɪshed on novelFirｅ.net
However, now, not to mention the mercenaries attracting five giant beasts nearby seemed a bit odd. If five giant beasts gathered so quickly near the tribe, it indicates the number of giant beasts near the Dragon Nest Tribe has reached a certain degree. Yet, before this, the Dragon Nest Beastmen's production activities did not intersect with giant beasts, and traces of giant beasts were not found within a ten-mile radius around the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After deciding to hunt giant beasts later, Dragon Nest Beastmen often ventured out, hunting giant beasts heavily. But at this moment, thanks to Gory's reminder, Rodney realized that in this period, although Dragon Nest Beastmen had hunted quite a number of giant beasts, the number of giant beasts within the tribe's region did not decrease!
Such a situation is evidently unusual, and the only possibility is the increase in giant beasts due to unknown reasons, causing this series of circumstances.
Due to unknown reasons, when these giant beasts migrated in a certain direction, they passed by the area near the Dragon Nest Tribe, leading to an increased number of giant beasts around the tribe, resulting in the Dragon Nest Tribe continuously hunting giant beasts, yet the number of giant beasts showed no sign of diminishing.
"Gory, you've done well. After returning, go with me to report to Governor Vini, sir."
If the situation is truly caused by the migration of giant beasts, then it's not Rodney's concern alone. Why migrate, how many giant beasts will pass through the Dragon Nest Tribe area; any one of these factors might relate to the life and death survival of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Upon deeper thinking, Rodney would realize that starting a few months ago, the prey within the forest seemed more numerous than usual.
If wild animals also increased due to migration passing, then it is very likely that unknown reasons led to a massive migration of creatures, including the magic beast storm tiger that attacked the Dragon Nest Tribe initially, as well as those recently increased magic beasts, migrated past because of such unknowable reasons.
Of course, Rodney, who is somewhat careless, naturally wouldn't think so deeply; he merely instinctively sensed something wasn't right.
After tidying up the scene, Rodney hurriedly led a group of beastmen to bring back the giant beast corpse to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
...
Returning to the tribe, Rodney casually handed over subsequent matters to the tribe, then led Gory to the Inner City Governance District.
On the surrounding open grounds, newly joined beastmen were undergoing strict military training renovation in the ice and snow, with squads of beastmen patrolling around.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe developed, the population recently approached four thousand people, and the construction of the settlement continuously expanded. The Dragon Nest Tribe quickly reaching four thousand people can now be called Dragon Nest Town, vaguely divided into inner and outer city districts.
Of course, these aren't residential area divisions based on status, but because the Inner City District was built against a cliff, where the entire tribe's highest leader, the great His Highness Austin, resides.
Moreover, the Inner City District is purely a governance area; every evening, the middle and upper echelons of the Dragon Nest Tribe gather here to hold meetings, summarizing the previous day's experiences and achievements, and begin organizing the work tasks for the next day, managing the entire tribe comprehensively.
Inside the Inner City District is also the location of the entire Dragon Nest Town's largest warehouse. Food is one of the most valued things to beastmen in the Kawa Great Forest, naturally placed in the most secure location.
Therefore, the security in the inner city area is relatively stringent.
"Lord Rodney."
As Rodney led Gory into the inner city, beastmen guards on both sides promptly saluted.
"Lord, what's this?"
The beastman guardian glanced at Gory, the implied meaning in his eyes was self-evident.
Within the entire beastman tribe, due to the initial reason for their attack, the human mercenaries' status wasn't very high, only as ordinary soldiers. After Austin exhausted their knowledge value, these mercenaries temporarily had no usefulness to him, so the beastmen didn't particularly care for them.
Even because of the previous incident of attacking the beastman tribe, a small portion of beastmen still held latent hostility towards these human mercenaries, although given they were part of the same tribe, there wasn't any explicit targeting.
"I brought Gory with me to find Governor Vini for a matter."
Casually explaining, Rodney led Gory into the inner city.
The inner city buildings were noticeably better than the outer city, all with brick and tile structures, and through unified design, looked very clean and tidy, possessing a unique aesthetic.
Gory looked around, feeling refreshed.
"Truly unexpected that such a city was actually established by a dragon, likely not even some small cities in certain duchies could compare."
As a war criminal captive, after joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, Gory entered the inner city for the first time under Rodney's leadership.
However, despite the inner city being clean and beautiful, not inferior to some duchies' small towns, it was ultimately a city belonging to beastmen, with cultural and economic lifestyle differences. Therefore, Gory didn't develop unwavering loyalty to Austin, instead, he hoped to return to the Human World when possible.
"Hum ha!"
Not far away, a series of swishing sounds echoed. Gory looked over, his vision bypassed the governance hall, then saw behind it a vast open area, where several beastmen of strong aura continued to slash swords in the snow, and amidst obstructed sight, he faintly saw that dragon.
"Lord Rodney, what are they doing?" Gory curiously asked Rodney.
"Oh, them? I heard His Highness Austin wants to develop a combat technique, so he picked them for experimentation." Rodney casually replied as he walked.
Gory kept silent but pondered inwardly, straining his view for a broader sight before entering the governance hall.
The next moment, his eyes widened suddenly, filled with disbelief.

chapters.title: Chapter 154 - 150 Secret Techniques
chapters.content:
"Feel the Fighting Qi inside you, understand it, command it, make it move along the blade!"
On the vast snowy field, ten Extraordinary Beastmen were diligently swinging their swords in the wind and snow, the massive blades slashing down at great speed, producing sharp sword sounds, while waves of air blades were swept up.
Austin walked behind the Extraordinary Beastmen, constantly observing their sword movements and states, his calm voice echoing in their ears.
Recently, the Beastmen from the Gale Wave experimental group had finally managed to make the Fighting Qi cycle and flow along the sword blade, reaching speeds comparable to level five wind speed.
The rapidly rotating Fighting Qi attached to the Great Sword not only easily swept up air blades but also greatly enhanced the power of the rough combat technique of Fighting Qi Sword for the Beastmen.
The tough and sharp Fighting Qi cycled on the blade of the Great Sword, the feeling was as if a Great Sword turned into a chainsaw, its power not to be underestimated.
However, although it greatly enhanced the power of Fighting Qi Sword, the development of Gale Wave was still some distance away. At least for now, the Beastmen first need to be able to release the Fighting Qi attached to the sword blade.
Moreover, the Beastmen's sword-swinging speed was still far from achieving a vacuum and making the air blades rotate at supersonic speeds. The success in developing Gale Wave still had a considerable distance to go.
Yet, compared to the previous confusion, the Beastmen in the experimental group had advanced significantly, and Austin believed that if they continued, the successful development was not far off.
Suddenly, a sharp sound arose, the feeling like a rapidly spinning drill scraping on glass, and simultaneously a thin, eye-invisible slashing wave suddenly shot out, creating a line on the snow ahead.
"Hmm?"
Austin abruptly turned his head, seeing a leopard humanoid with spotted fur holding a Great Sword with both hands, staring in bewilderment at a finger-width, two-meter-long line in the snow ahead of him.
All the Extraordinary Beastmen stopped their actions, gazing at that leopard person.
After delivering that slash, the leopard person did not move, only closing his eyes to carefully recall the moment of bewildering action just now.
Austin said nothing, and neither did any of the Beastmen.Latest content published on noᴠelfire.net
The atmosphere was silent, snowflakes gradually falling from the sky, as all the Extraordinary Beastmen, including Austin, quietly waited.
After an unknown amount of time, the leopard person reopened his eyes.
"Your Highness, I understand now!"
The leopard person showed an excited look; during the repetitive sword movements earlier, his numbed and weary arms moved mechanically, yet at a distracted moment, he intuitively managed to slash that sword. By recalling that moment, he seemed to have found his direction.
"Your Highness, let me try it first!"
The leopard person looked at Austin, and with Austin's permission, he held the Great Sword and walked to a half-man-high rock a short distance away, stopping three steps before it.
The leopard person leveled the sword at the rock, the sword tip about twenty centimeters from it.
He took a deep breath, tightly gripping the Great Sword in both hands.
Closing his eyes, the Fighting Qi quickly flowed and spun on the Great Sword, producing a faint sound of tearing through the air, with dim light flickering.
After an uncertain length of time, the next moment,
Swish!
A dazzling white light flashed in the air, a crescent-shaped arc of light descending like a cold crescent moon from the sky, gradually dissipating into the air thereafter.
After swinging the sword, the leopard person gasped for breath,
while the rock ahead appeared to be sliced diagonally from above, with its upper half suddenly sliding off.
"So that's how it is!"
In that instant, the keen-eyed Austin clearly observed that at the moment of the slash, the leopard person somehow channeled the Fighting Qi to extend more than a meter beyond the sword tip, and the rapidly rotating Fighting Qi carried a powerful cutting force, slicing the rock as easily as cutting tofu.
This wasn't the effect of the Great Sword producing a Slashing Wave, but the Fighting Qi breaking from the sword carrier, extending attack range and causing damage.
Although there was still some way to go before achieving the concept of a long-range flying attack like Gale Wave, at least the leopard person had taken a huge step forward in being able to unleash powerful Fighting Qi off the sword,
just one more step, and the attacking method of Gale Wave could be successfully evolved!
....
Just as Austin had the leopard person share his insights for mutual learning, he did not notice that at the gates of the council hall, the Mercenary Deputy Captain stood on tiptoe to see everything, his face filled with disbelief and shock.
"Secret Techniques! These are Secret Techniques!"
Gory shouted frantically in his heart, barely resisting the urge to rush over.
The leopard person's slash that cut the rock in mid-air was seen by him, and further off, he also witnessed those Beastmen standing,muscles bulging like steel giving off a faint white glow, while several Beastmen with Wooden Spears broke each spear upon lunging.
During this time, he had seen the power of the two prototype Combat Techniques Austin kept trying to develop.
As a result, a tidal wave of ambition and yearning surged within Gory.
Secret Techniques, truly Secret Techniques, and that Young Dragon was developing Secret Techniques!
What are Secret Techniques? In the Human World, they are Secret Combat Techniques handed down through powerful noble families! They are one of the bedrocks of a strong noble line lasting millennia!
Secret Techniques possess power far beyond ordinary Combat Techniques, which is why powerful noble families can maintain lasting influence, and why their members can easily defeat warriors of the same level. The existence of Secret Techniques is a part of this.
Secret Techniques provide family warriors with formidable combat power, making it incredibly easy to challenge ordinary civilian warriors across tiers.
To Gory's knowledge, within the Southern Countries, the newly established twenty-year-old Eagle Duchy's King, Grand Duke William, possessed a family Secret Technique called the Golden Eagle Thirteen Strikes. Grand Duke William, with unparalleled talent, cultivated the Golden Eagle Thirteen Strikes to an incomparably powerful level, achieving overwhelming victories against Legends at Golden peak tier, even vanquishing a Legend, albeit an aged one with fallen strength nearing pseudo-Legend. Still, that battle made Duke William a household name and led to the establishment of the Eagle Duchy.
This is the power of Secret Techniques!
If he could obtain these two Secret Techniques and return to the Human World, Gory might have the capacity to become a noble, or even to establish a noble family of his own!
At that moment, Gory's heart was brimming with rampant ambition and desire....

chapters.title: Chapter 155 - 151
chapters.content:
"We must acquire those Combat Techniques!"
In an instant, Gory had made up his mind.
On this adventure, not only did all members of their Mercenary Corps perish within the Dragon Nest Tribe, they also became slaves, suffering for so long. Regardless of whether they could return or not, even if they could eventually escape, going back empty-handed was simply a crime.
"Perhaps, this is an opportunity."
Anyway, in the short term, they couldn't leave the Dragon Nest Tribe, so it was better to perform well and hope to gain these Secret Techniques in the future.
Despite the various allocation systems of the Dragon Nest Tribe being a revelation to Gory, whereby everyone who worked hard could receive food, unlike other tribes where the strong bullied the weak, abused the lives of lower-class Beastmen, and snatched food from them, it seemed like the Blue Young Dragon was incredibly benevolent.
But Gory didn't believe that the Blue Young Dragon was truly benevolent. If it were truly benevolent, who would hear the grievances of the Beastmen swallowed and killed in each expansion war? Although he did not understand, his instincts told him that the dragon was no different from those aristocratic vampires above; it was just that the dragon's methods were more sophisticated.
Gory also didn't think that the Secret Techniques spawned from the dragon would be easy to obtain, so he decided to lay low for now.
And indeed, as Gory expected, for both the Mercenaries and ordinary Beastmen, especially those Mercenaries yet to gain Austin's trust, acquiring the Combat Techniques developed by Austin would never be simple.
Regarding the developed Navy Six Techniques, Austin had decided that apart from members of the test group and future direct Imperial Guard deployments, anyone wanting these Combat Techniques must earn enough merits.
Not only are the Magic Modified Navy Six Techniques treated this way, so are future opportunities for Beastmen undergoing Dragon Vein Transformation.
When the Dragon Nest Tribe was initially established, to rapidly enhance the Clan Tribe's power, Austin had to implement a universal military regime, including even elderly women trained and incorporated into combat units.
If Austin had obtained the cultivation method for the Six Techniques and the means of transforming Beastmen at that time, he would have undoubtedly promoted it throughout the tribe, maximizing the tribe's strength.
At that time, Austin basically racked his brains to enhance the Beastman Race's power in a short time, and during the Extraordinary Bloodline Transformation of the Beastmen, those selected were simply the tallest among the short, with conditions set very relaxed, including Kobolds chosen for transformation without hesitation.
However, as the tribe continued to develop, through successive wars and annexations by assimilating wandering Beastmen, the tribe's population had already approached the four thousand mark. With such a large number, and the recent discovery of a direction for Bronze weapon crafting, this vast force could easily dominate the entire area of over a hundred miles; Austin need not worry about other dangers.
Furthermore, it was later discovered that maintaining the power of Dragon Vein Beastmen required a large consumption of meat, making the tribe-wide promotion of this transformation project extremely pressuring on food resources, eventually leading to a halt. Occasionally, only a couple of spots were awarded to those ordinary Beastmen who made great contributions, or Beastmen highly gifted in the Cultivation Breathing Technique.
Initially, after resolving some worries, and as the population of Beastmen increased, the distribution system had to undergo further reform. During the initial rapid development phase, many problems were masked by the fast-growing speed, but as time went by, those flaws would inevitably emerge.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe's system gradually improved, Austin had already decided that, unless focusing on cultivating core combat forces such as Dragon Vein Attendants, the Magic Modified Navy Six Techniques' cultivation method, Beastman transformation slots, and even the supply of precious materials like Bronze Weapons should never be given without compensation for contributions.
To gain power and core resources, one must exert more effort than others and contribute more to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Because Austin believed in one thing: things received without cost are often not cherished.
...Fresh chapters posted on net
Rodney brought Gory into the governing hall and immediately garnered attention from the top after presenting their findings.
Lately, the Dragon Nest Tribe had gathered many more wandering Beastmen compared to the previous year. It was initially thought that the Dragon Nest Tribe's reputation had spread, attracting so many Beastmen. However, there seemed to be another reason.
Through Gory's reminder, Vini and others gradually discovered some clues. According to those fleeing wandering Beastmen, before the cold winter season, the number of beasts outside the forest inexplicably increased significantly, making it impossible for them to safely gather sufficient food for winter in the forest, thus leading them to migrate outward, where they encountered many Giant Beasts and Magic Beasts along the way and were hunted heavily until they reached the safe area within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Previously, such situations rarely occurred, albeit occasionally some tribes in the Kawa Great Forest failed to store enough food before the cold winters due to various accidents, causing tribe collapse and Beastman wandering. However, this phenomenon of massive tribe collapse due to increased beast havoc leading to large-scale Beastman wandering was a first.
All the change seemed to have happened around six months ago.
Upon inferring the arrival of unknown danger, Governor Vini dared not make decisions alone and quickly reported the situation to Austin.
"Unknown danger, causing mass beast migration?"
Upon hearing this situation, Austin's brows furrowed but he could think of no reasoning and could only give orders.
"From today onward, increase the number of Beastman reconnaissance teams, probe outwardly, and find the cause of the anomaly."
Although the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe was said to cover an area of hundreds of miles, in reality, the tribe's population of only four thousand spread across vast lands was negligible; the Dragon Nest Beastmen's footsteps barely ventured far. The tribe's reputation spread mainly through Austin's identity as a Giant Dragon and the transmissions of scattered Beastman tribes nearby.

chapters.title: Chapter 156 - 152: Mutation
chapters.content:
The strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe is indeed formidable, standing as a dominate force among the many small tribes. However, due to its population size, it's impossible to cover the entire area completely. They can only intensify the search or see if they can find the source of the mutation among the surrounding beastman tribes.
"It seems the plan needs to be accelerated...."
Watching Vini's departing figure, Austin thought silently to himself.
Previously, due to the lack of sufficient power and food to expand significantly, Austin had been sweeping and annexing the surrounding beastman tribes, but it was basically limited to a range within a thirty-four-mile radius, and there wasn't any sweeping eradication, leaving quite a number of beastman tribes out.
Now, as the cold winter is about to end, with the introduction of large quantities of copper tools, the speed of beastman land reclamation will undoubtedly accelerate. At that time, more kudzu roots can be produced as food, and Austin believes that next year the tribe's population could increase to ten to twenty times its current size.
"If I can gather over a hundred thousand beastmen, then in this Kawa Great Forest, there will indeed be little danger that could threaten my own existence, but the most important thing now is to complete the magic modification of the Navy Six Techniques, and there's that unknown danger, it's always felt not so simple..."
Currently, Austin has developed the prototype of the Iron Block and the Gale Wave. Although they have certain power, they are not significantly enhancing the strength of the extraordinary beastmen for now, only providing some utility.
"The Iron Block is almost perfected, and the direction of experimentation for the Gale Wave is about three-quarters complete, but to significantly enhance the strength of the Dragon Vein Attendants, there is still a need for mobility."Chapters first released on NoveIＦire.net
Immediately, Austin thought of Shave.
If Shave can be developed, with Iron Block for melee defense, Fighting Qi Sword for melee attack power, Gale Wave for long-range, and adding a swift-moving Shave, the strength of the extraordinary beastmen would definitely be significantly enhanced.
"Before the end of the cold winter, Shave must be developed!"
Austin had a vague premonition that the unknown danger might appear after the cold winter next year, and to be prepared, the development of Shave in the Six Techniques must be hastened.
Using three techniques from the magically modified Navy Six Techniques to arm the extraordinary beastmen, these fully equipped extraordinary beastmen might even give Austin some trouble to deal with.
The most proficient and powerful extraordinary beastmen might leap to possess two to three times Austin's strength. Such a power is the greatest enhancement Austin can achieve in the short term.
Moreover, with the development experience of Iron Block and Gale Wave in the Six Techniques, Austin has gained some ideas for developing Shave.
"Purely based on the Gale Foot theory, if one wants to achieve instantaneous rapid ground kicking to gain reaction force for movement, then the kicking speed must reach at least sound speed; without long-term training, it is simply impossible. But if Fighting Qi is added, gathering it at the sole to explode multiple times in a short period to mimic Shave, this stacked power might be enough to achieve Shave!"
With an idea in mind, Austin immediately set to experiment.
With the successful development experience of Iron Block and Gale Wave, this development attempt will definitely be simpler than the previous two.
As Austin was transforming the three techniques and arming the core extraordinary beastmen, the Dragon Nest Tribe began dispatching large beastman squads to seek the source of the mutation.
Meanwhile, the mercenary deputy captain Gory, who did not want to return empty-handed, suppressed his thoughts of defection and began to actively showcase himself, hoping to be noticed and enter the core of the Dragon Nest Tribe to obtain those secret techniques.
Time passed day by day, and as the cold winter approached its end, the hints that were just speculation before finally became reality.
The number of surrounding beasts and those mountain-like giant beasts and terrifying magic beasts began to increase, to the point that the expedition teams sent by the Dragon Nest Tribe nearly perished in this perilous forest.
Though not yet a beast tide, the impact of a large number of beasts mixed with occasional giant beasts led to the destruction of many small tribes surrounding the Dragon Nest Tribe, causing a large number of fleeing beastmen to seek refuge in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This time, they had no qualifications to negotiate terms.
In the last mere month of the cold winter, the Dragon Nest Tribe's population increased by a thousand people due to this influx. Fortunately, the masses of passing beasts also brought with them a large amount of food, otherwise, the mere increase in beastmen population would have overwhelmed the Dragon Nest Tribe.
And as the days passed, the traces of beasts suggested that most of these beasts and giant beasts came from the west.
The mutation is likely originating from the west.
....
Bloody Border.
A beggar-like figure leaned on a broken, dirt-covered sword resembling a stick, gazing at the tall, grand city walls, with lifeless wooden eyes glowing brightly.
"Finally returned!"
His face was covered in dust, impossible to see his true appearance, and his cracked lips were bloodless. His hair seemed tangled with countless knots, his clothes were tattered, his arms and legs appeared fleshless, his body thin as paper, as if a gust of wind could blow him away.
He was Edward, after three whole months of struggling for life and death in the cold winter forest, had finally arrived here.
"Valen, my brother, rest assured, I will definitely cut off that damned dragon's head to avenge you all!"
The will to live that had supported him out of the forest erupted into a blazing fire of rage at that moment. Reflecting on the past three months, Edward was eager to immediately lead an army to chop that damned Blue Young Dragon into pieces.
Just then,
Wooo wooo wooo....
A massive horn sound came from afar, echoing through heaven and earth. Edward saw the originally city-bound people scrambling towards the city gates, while squads of soldiers began appearing on the walls, large amounts of military supplies were being transported up, and the gate soldiers were loudly calling for people to hurry over.
"What's going on, what's happened?"
Edward hurriedly grabbed an old man, who desperately tried to shake him off, but how could the old man's strength compare to Edward's? He could only turn his head around.
"Ah, why are you pulling me, hurry and run, those beastman brutes are here again!"
"Beastmen are attacking? What's going on, it's just past the end of the cold winter, this isn't the time for beastman attacks at all?"
Edward frowned deeply, feeling that something was very strange.
As far as he knew, beastman attacks usually happened a month before the start of the cold winter, attacking the Bloody Border to gather enough food from the Human World.
But during the cold winter, many beastmen were lost in the icy and snowy environment, and after the cold winter ended, as all things grew and prey exited their dens, the beastmen, with their significantly reduced population, had no worries about food. So why would they sacrifice themselves to attack the Bloody Border?
"That's years ago, for the past two years those damned beastmen have gone mad... Let go, if you don't leave now, it'll be too late! After entering the Border City, I'll talk to you, okay?"
The old man, helpless, could only plead bitterly.
Seeing this, Edward could only accompany the old man into the city first.

chapters.title: Chapter 157 - 153: Bizarre
chapters.content:
Including the time spent struggling to escape, Edward has been inside the Kawa Great Forest for at least more than half a year, and he has a relatively good understanding of the thoughts of the beastmen living in the vast jungle in the south.
In the forest, there is only one thing that is most important, and that is food. Some beastmen even value food more than grain.
Before the arrival of the cold winter, due to the rapid population expansion of beastmen in the previous nine months, most tribes would find it difficult to survive the desperate white cold winter relying solely on previously stored harvests.
To obtain enough grain and to clean up excess population, a month before the cold winter, many beastmen would come out of the forest in groups and attack the Bloody Border.
If successful, the beastmen can enter human territories through the breached defense line, plundering and acquiring a large amount of food. Even if unsuccessful, the significant loss in population reduces the pressure on the beastmen tribes' food consumption during the cold winter.
As for that month before each cold winter, beastmen invasions have almost become customary.
Except for the month before and after cold winter, it's usually a time of peace. The many beastmen tribes living within the Kawa Great Forest will not waste their power attacking the Bloody Border, for hunting wild beasts and gathering food also requires manpower, and tribes must retain some strength to avoid being swallowed by enemies.
Therefore, although beastmen invade the border every year, it is only concentrated in the month before the cold winter, and invasions rarely occur during other times.
Especially at the beginning of the end of the cold winter, when the ice and snow recede, a significant portion of the beastmen have already died in the cold winter, and the remaining beastmen are mostly starving. Moreover, after the cold winter, all things are revived, and wild beasts emerge from their lairs, making it a good time for hunting.
In the past years, after the end of the cold winter and at the start of a new year, the border is the safest time of the year.
But now, has everything changed?
The gigantic walls stand tall on the plains, rising like mountains, stretching endlessly. This is the most famous Bloody Great Wall at the border, an iron wall defense line established by humans over a thousand years, isolating the numerous savage beastmen of the Barbaric Land to the south of the Great Wall from the Central Earth World.
However, at this moment, Edward has no time to marvel at this enormously majestic structure. He quickly entered the Border City inside the walls, following the old man.
"A few years ago, as you said, the savage beastmen's harassment was focused in August and September before the cold winter began... But in these past two years, everything has already changed. Those beastmen have gone mad, launching large-scale attacks and harassment except during the immobile cold winter. Especially recently, those beastmen seem crazy, rushing up without regard for casualties..."Find the newest release on Nove1Fire.net
In the old man's rambling, Edward's brows furrowed even tighter.
Before entering the Kawa Great Forest, Edward had hired the Black Bear Mercenary Corps to enter the Kawa Great Forest with him, and although he felt something was wrong with the Border City at that time, he didn't dwell on it.
Upon entering the Kawa Great Forest, he noticed some signs that seemed to indicate super large tribes of hundreds of thousands or even millions of people were migrating towards the border. Some tribal stations were deserted, which allowed them to cross the "defense line" where beastmen were gathering, entering the central part of the Kawa Great Forest with little loss.
When Edward observed the signs of migration of those large beastmen tribes, he was somewhat puzzled, but considering it was already close to August and September, with the cold winter approaching, the migration and attack on the Bloody Border by a massive number of beastmen seemed normal, so he didn't pay much attention.
But now, it seems everything is not that simple.
"...Last year, during the most frenzied beastmen attack, it was said that there were millions of beastmen gathered outside the entire border Great Wall. Even Grand Duke William of the Eagle Duchy had to personally join the battle, barely holding the beastmen outside the Border Great Wall."
The old man recalled last year's event with lingering fear.
"Last year, that must have been after I entered the Kawa Great Forest. What exactly happened!" Countless questions arose in Edward's mind.
After so many years of tug-of-war-like wars, the beastmen south of the Border Great Wall should clearly know how difficult the Bloody Great Wall is to breach, yet they still acted without hesitation. There must be no reason for such actions to occur!
"Old man, thank you for your help."
Edward expressed his gratitude and then hurriedly left.
It is certain that some unknown changes have occurred in that savage land in the south of the Kawa Great Forest, leading to this series of events.
Now, restoring his identity is the most important thing in front of Edward. More information may only be truly known by the upper nobility. As for the damned Blue Young Dragon issue, he can only wait until he overcomes this current hurdle to address it.
...
Meanwhile, outside the Border City, dozens of miles away, in the vast and boundless forest, large groups of beastmen were moving silently toward the Bloody Border, dragging their families and carrying all their possessions.
The endless, dense mass of figures, possibly numbered in the millions!
This is a beastmen coalition army composed of several super-large tribes surviving at the Bloody Border. For some unknown reason, these super-large tribes, which used to act alone and even had numerous conflicts with each other, strangely united and moved slowly toward the Bloody Border.
This time, the beastman raid is larger than any previous one!
Shortly after, the massive beastman troops began to stop and rest. In the center of the beastman tents, several powerful and distinct beastmen leaders gathered in a large tent, while outside, groups of elite beastman guards were mutually wary and patrolled around.
"...The spread of those things is too fast; we have no time and no retreat. We must breach the human Great Wall within these months, or all our sons will perish!"
"...The Great Wall is not that easy to breach; what if we can't breach it?"
"...We'll see; if we can't, then let's negotiate with the humans. I think they wouldn't want to deal with those things either."
...
"How is the preparation of the rear base point, which concerns the safety of all of us?"
"...Our rear base points are mostly complete. But what about you, Blood Claw? Why is there no news from the southeast side?"
"...Hmph! Just take care of the area you're responsible for. We've already sent people to investigate on our side, and we'll notify you of the results!"

chapters.title: Chapter 158 - 154 Armed Beastman
chapters.content:
The cold winter has passed, and the Kawa Great Forest is welcoming a new phase of revival.
However, this year, the forest is shrouded in an uneasy atmosphere, as if something is about to happen. This feeling is especially strong for Austin, who senses the ominous signs of an impending storm.
This period is a good opportunity for hunting. In previous years, the forest was filled with various animals just waking from hibernation, but this year there are even more animals, including giant beasts, forcing the Dragon's Nest Army to increase patrol frequencies to nip dangers in the cradle.
"Something is definitely going to happen, perhaps those large tribes on the border know something."
Now, Austin's early followers from the Dragon Nest Race, the current Dragon Nest Tribe's first warrior, Lizardman Rodney, once lived in a large tribe on the border that was destroyed, as did the Fox-faced Man Quik, who has a similar origin. From them, Austin learned that since a few years ago, raids on the human Bloody Border by those large tribes have been increasing, and conflicts among the powers have also become more frequent.
At that time, Austin thought it was due to the Bloody Great Wall finally being perfected after hundreds of years, greatly preventing Beastmen from invading the human world for food, leading to "internal conflicts" among the Beastman tribes. Now, it seems this is not the case.
Austin also inquired with the Dark Elf Adinlek and captured members of the Blood Claw Tribe branch, but they only knew about the chaotic state on the border and nothing else, not even understanding why they established bases nearby.
Nonetheless, the information they provided about several large super tribes on the border beginning to unite and attack the Bloody Border was even more intriguing to Austin.
"What exactly is the danger?"
This perplexing situation instinctively made Austin feel uneasy, but the unease had not yet developed to a point of menacing dread. Moreover, with the Dragon Nest Race's development reaching this stage, Austin had some confidence in facing future dangers.
"Although I don't know what's happening, this could also be an opportunity."
With the rampant beasts, magic beasts, and giant beasts, apart from the Dragon Nest Tribe, nearby Beastman tribes were unable to ensure their safety, leading to a large population being annexed and absorbed by the Dragon Nest Tribe. The population of the Dragon Nest Tribe has now surpassed the 5,000 mark.
Moreover, with the Dragon Nest Tribe's current strength, the massive animal herds merely provide a large food supply for the tribe. Luckily, after every clean-up of surrounding animal and giant beasts, more herds would pass by in a couple of days, ensuring no food shortages due to the population surge.
"However, preparations must be made to face dangers; let's first implement the Beastman armament plan."
The magic-modified version of the Navy Six Techniques is now fully developed with three techniques: Iron Block, Gale Wave, and Shave. However, it still takes some time for the core Dragon Vein Attendants to master these techniques, and Austin's plan to arm the Beastmen naturally is about true armament.
After a whole winter's three-month development attempt, the Goblins have perfected the manufacturing process of Copper Artifacts. Though they haven't refined what Austin remembers as "Bronze," those Copper Alloy Weapons are not inferior to ordinary Iron Weapons.
With the end of winter, weather constraints vanished, enabling Beastmen to conduct large-scale blast furnace production work.Discover more novels at novel⦿fire.net
To arm the Dragon Nest Tribe's army, Austin diverted a significant amount of Beastman labor to copper refining, slowing down land reclamation work. However, using copper tools, farming familiar land is much easier than pioneering forestland. Despite many being pulled for farming, the speed of reclaiming and planting work has not decreased compared to the previous year but has accelerated instead.
But Austin has some concerns; if that unknown change affects the Dragon Nest Tribe, the tribe might have to relocate. Thus, today Austin didn't issue new reclamation tasks, only having the Beastmen plant on the previously reclaimed fields.
To maximize planting effectiveness, nearly every piece of land was planted with kudzu, with other grain seeds left only for reserves.
On the other hand, to realize Austin's vision of an armed Beastman army, at the Copper Mine Base, a large number of Beastmen constructed blast furnaces using local materials.
Then vast amounts of charcoal were produced, and together with the ore, were poured into the furnaces for large-scale smelting.
With copper axes, tree felling became much easier. The surrounding forest was rapidly disappearing, turned into raw materials for copper refining. Plumes of smoke rose from the blast furnaces, covering the Copper Mine Base's sky almost the entire day. In Austin's previous modern world, he would likely be caught the next day for air pollution and environmental damage.
But this is Otherworld, and such pollution hardly amounts to a drop in the ocean and is likely swiftly absorbed and purified by nature.
As the blast furnaces burned furiously, sets of heavy, simple copper armor, copper spears, copper swords, and copper arrows flowed from assembly lines, equipping the Beastman army.
After more than ten days, all Dragon Nest Beastmen army armament plans had been completed.
Looking at the vast open space, where ranks of well-equipped and spirited Beastman army stood, Austin's confidence grew stronger.
This fully metal-armed force is likely unparalleled in the entire Kawa Great Forest, only the unique possession of Austin's Dragon Nest Legion.
With the completion of the Dragon Nest Legion's armament plan, the Legion's strength has significantly increased. The impact against the recent rampages of wild beasts and giant beasts around is immediately apparent.
Before this, to minimize losses, every hunting army of the Dragon Nest Legion had to consist of at least 200 members when venturing out.
Now, with copper spears, copper armor, and other weapons and armor, even a hunting group of a few dozen Beastmen won't face unexpected situations, and their gains are not less than before. This greatly enhanced the mobility of the Dragon Nest Legion and significantly increased the hunting gains of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After arming the Dragon Nest Legion, the daily prey the Dragon Nest Tribe gained increased by several percent.
The effectiveness of metal weapons in hunting is so good that in wartime, their enhancement of other Beastman tribes' combat power would likely be even greater.
However, with the completion of the Dragon Nest Legion armament plan, Austin did not proceed to broadly re-outfit all Dragon Nest Beastmen, only producing a large number of copper spears for the Beastman militia, without fully equipping them with copper armor, while the remaining production Beastmen were only collectively assigned copper-made hoes, shovels, and other production tools.

chapters.title: Chapter 159 - 155: Sweeping
chapters.content:
Although the Dragon Nest Tribe hasn't equipped all its militia beastmen and production beastmen with armor and weapons, the tribe's warehouses have stocked a large cache of copper armor and weapons. Once war breaks out, they can immediately arm a Dragon Nest army multiple times the size of the current one.Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs novel✶fire.net
With the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe and its population surpassing five thousand, various beastmen races are interwoven together. Each race has its own distinct advantages. Thus, in the context of surplus combat strength, a policy where everyone becomes a soldier, adversely affecting production and life, is not appropriate.
Considering various factors, Austin has decided to implement an elite soldier policy, selecting the strongest and most robust beastmen from the large population and training them intensively to form the most formidable fighting force, the Dragon Nest Legion. Equipped with weapons and armor, this will generate a combat strength far beyond the ordinary legion's power.
Simultaneously, Austin is promoting Breathing Techniques within the Dragon Nest Legion to further enhance the beastmen soldiers' abilities. He selects the most outstanding among them to transform into Dragon Vein Beastmen and then picks the strongest from the core Dragon Vein Guard to undergo Magic Modification, substantially boosting the core combat power with the cultivation of the Navy's three techniques.
By advancing step by step in this manner, the resulting elite core even possesses one or two parts of his own combat strength. Combined with a large armed beastmen legion, this significantly bolsters Austin's confidence.
"I've developed Shave, utilizing the recoil from multiple bursts of Fighting Qi in an instant underfoot to move rapidly. Paired with Iron Block and Gale Wave, along with Fighting Qi Sword techniques developed during the Gale Wave process, the trained core Dragon Vein Guard now qualifies to stand alone."
On the vast square, looking at the densely packed, fully armored, spear-bearing, orderly standing legion below, and at the intimidating Dragon Vein Guards exuding an unparalleled aura at the front, Austin's mood inevitably brightens.
This is not even the Dragon Nest Tribe's greatest strength. Within the entire tribe, even the militia and productive beastmen have undergone military training and possess a certain level of military literacy. Although they are usually responsible for production rather than combat, if a crisis arises, arming them would turn them into a large group of well-trained, qualified soldiers.
"Although I don't know what this unease is, this is the best preparation I can achieve."
Gazing at the beastmen legion below, crafted entirely by his own efforts, Austin muses silently.
He steps forward, his massive frame towering over the scene, his enormous pupils reflecting the densely packed figures below. An invisible pressure spreads from him, enveloping the entire square, making the air feel several degrees heavier to all the beastmen.
"....Two years ago, there was nothing here! But today, two years later, you possess everything you couldn't imagine back then! Go forth and fight! For our glory!"
High upon the stone platform, Austin spreads his wings, his voice resonating like thunder.
"Long live! Long live Your Highness!"
A massive wave of sound rises overwhelmingly as the beastmen soldiers below display a fanatical look in their eyes, their shouting turning their faces red, and their copper spears rhythmically striking the ground.
After two years of constant indoctrination, these beastmen soldiers' loyalty to Austin has become similar to fanaticism, easily stirred by his words.
With weapons and armor in place, the long-prepared Dragon Nest Tribe finally sets out once again.
A large number of beastmen soldiers, fully equipped with armor and weapons, began departing Dragon Nest Town, launching attacks in all directions under the lead of the elite Dragon Vein Guard, conducting a sweeping campaign in the surrounding regions, attacking and annexing nearby beastmen tribes.
In previous upheavals, many beastmen tribes within a hundred-mile radius of the Dragon Nest Tribe collapsed due to an inability to fend off various external crises, becoming wandering beastmen eventually joining the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, the hundred-mile range is vast, with countless hidden beastmen tribes scattered like stars in the forest. A considerable number of beastmen tribes still survive, and the total population of all these tribes within the hundred-mile range exceeds thirty thousand.
To resist unknown dangers and with the recent abundance of wild animals providing an easy food source to support rapid population growth, Austin began a massive annexation of beastmen tribes within the extensive range, hoping to swiftly increase the Dragon Nest Tribe's population and greatly enhance its strength.
Under the copper-armored torrent of the Dragon Nest Legion, even tribes where Extraordinary Beastmen are rare are swiftly overwhelmed and destroyed. Teams of captives are sent into the Dragon Nest Tribe for military training and transformation, strengthening the tribe's power.
Besides gaining a large influx of new residents during this period, the Dragon Nest Tribe occasionally obtained unique finds from these small tribes, such as beastmen elites with self-awakened Extraordinary Abilities, beastmen priests with certain magical gift abilities, and some small tribes even produced "wizards" and similar figures.
Of course, these "wizards" are not true wizards. These beastmen "wizards" don't possess any real Extraordinary Abilities, but through long-term practice, they learned to identify certain herbs in the forest and understand basic healing techniques, thus gaining reverence and worship from their tribes.
Nevertheless, the integration of these beastmen "wizards" has somewhat strengthened and improved the Dragon Nest Tribe's medical system.
Beyond these gains, the Dragon Nest Beastmen Legion also collected various spoils like Totem Poles, Sacred Artifacts, Divine Stones, and other miscellany while sweeping through those small tribes. However, after Austin's identification, most were deemed useless and discarded in a corner of the warehouse, with only a couple carefully saved by Austin.
For example, fragments engraved with unknown lines and runes, a sacred artifact resembling an electric lamp worshipped by an ignorant beastmen tribe, which absorbs sunlight by day and glows at night, or a spearhead with twisted snake-like engravings...
Such items resemble nothing the beastmen, still living in an era of ignorance, could manufacture. Their origins remain an unsolved mystery.

chapters.title: Chapter 160 - 156: Touching the Mutation
chapters.content:
Austin couldn't discern the purpose of those mysterious artifacts, nor could he ascertain their origins. Clearly, the Beastmen couldn't have created these items.
Regarding those mysterious artifacts, after failing to find any clues, Austin stored them at the bottom of a trunk. This world's mysterious objects are too numerous, like the lake reservoir near Dragon's Nest that seemed formed by a meteorite crater, along with the things lurking inside; Austin couldn't figure them out yet, nor did he intend to uncover their secrets.
These things are best left to unfold naturally.
As the Dragon Nest Legion launched large-scale attacks, sweeping across the lands, various tribes collapsed under the relentless copper-armored torrents of the Dragon Nest Legion, resulting in a significant increase in the number of Beastmen within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
While Austin trained and adapted these Beastmen into the army, he also prioritized the prompt onset of production work to ensure a stable food supply for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
At the same time, Austin didn't ignore the unease in his heart.
