While the Dragon Nest Legion pushed forth in all directions, Austin pulled some of its elite forces and, centering around the elite Dragon Vein Guard trained with Cultivation Fruit Modified Three Techniques, formed an investigation team to explore westward.
Even before the investigation team set off, Quik and other Dragon Nest Beastmen had already discerned, through traces of migrating beasts, that most of these animals seemed to be coming from the west, hinting at an upheaval originating from there.
However, despite suspecting the unknown upheaval stemmed from the west, the Dragon Nest Beastmen reconnaissance team discovered no traces within at least a hundred miles of the Dragon Nest Tribe's domain.
Beastmen scouts noted, though, that the further west they traveled, the more apparent it became that these beasts migrated from west to east, with traces of beast herds or Giant Beasts migrating east growing more visible.
What might have caused these beasts to migrate, forcing even Giant Beasts to depart?
To decipher this situation, after equipping copper weapons, Austin selected the finest team from the Dragon Nest Tribe to explore as far west as possible.
...
At this time, about two hundred miles west of the Dragon Nest Tribe, a team of Beastmen, weary and dust-laden, rested amidst the dense forest.
"Rodney, we've been away from the tribe for over half a month and have traveled far enough that going further might prevent us from returning."
"Indeed, we haven't found anything along the way; perhaps there is no event occurring at all, merely our overly cautious concern."
The core Dragon Vein Beastmen of the team gathered together, conversing in council.
Since being tasked with investigating the source and leaving the Dragon Nest Tribe, they've journeyed for more than half a month, traveling light with few breaks, pushing at least two hundred miles from the core of the Dragon Nest Tribe with an entirely elite crew.
Having traveled this great distance without uncovering any clues, even team members had started considering reporting back instead.
One person spoke, followed by another, gradually swaying the leading Lizardman Rodney.
"Let's go for two more days; throughout this journey, you should have noticed that wild animals have significantly decreased. If there are no accidents, we might be close to the source... If we still find nothing, then we'll return."
Despite being somewhat tempted, Rodney did not agree to return.
In truth, beginning a few days ago, the surrounding wildlife started thinning out. At first, everyone in the team was both excited and alert, yet after walking several days, no abnormalities were discovered.
But Rodney clearly didn't wish to abandon the mission halfway.
Rodney's the leader; naturally, the Beastmen followed his orders, and thus the Beastmen continued onward.
Two days later,
"That range of mountains..."
From atop a towering ancient tree, Lizardman Rodney stood on a high branch, staring at the massive mountain range suddenly looming like a city wall, rising abruptly from the land along a north-south axis, obstructing the view ahead.
If they could climb the mountains, perhaps they could see farther.
Rodney pondered silently,
At such a height, visibility would be substantial; and if nothing could be found atop the mountains, they'd have to report back to Dragon Nest Tribe—the exploration mission thus marked a failure.The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the n̷o̷v̷e̷l̷f̷i̷r̷e̷.net
After a moment's contemplation, Rodney leapt from the trunk, landing on the ground below.
"Everyone, muster strength; if we find nothing upon climbing the mountains, we'll return!"
The originally weary Beastmen's expressions were suddenly revitalized, spirits lifting high.
Having marched rapidly in exploration, constantly dodging dangers within the forest, their stretched nerves were nearly at the breaking point, and returning for rest would be most desired.
"Let's go!"
The team headed toward the mountains, passing through a sunken plain when Rodney noticed beneath the fallen leaves were numerous fruit seeds. Upon closer inspection, the hills and basin were filled with what seemed to be fruit-bearing trees; however, given the recent ending of winter a few months back, the flowers had withered, leaving young fruits about the size of fingernails.
Rodney recognized a few of these trees, resembling wild apples from Austin's previous life; they aren't uncommon in Kawa Great Forest, though usually scattered sparsely. However, burgeoning so densely was rare.
"Be cautious; there might be enemies!"
Recalling the Dragon Nest Tribe's vine cultivation scenes and observing the densely fruit-laden area, Rodney cautioned the team against other Beastmen possibly planting this concentrated orchard.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen, wary, scanned their surroundings while carefully traversing the forest.
Inexplicably, it felt as though something might be hidden amidst the dense forest, obscured from view.
The journey remained uneventful, and their previous concerns appeared to be mere illusions.
Upon passing through the wild orchard and reaching the mountain foot, feeling slightly relaxed,
"Watch out, danger!"
Suddenly, pairs of glowing green eyes flared within the shadowed woods, shadows emerged from the dense forest.
"What's happening!!!"
These Dragon Nest Beastmen were seasoned veterans of Dragon Nest Tribe, accustomed to dreadful, fierce Giant Beasts, able to handle them calmly. But now, as the shadows sporadically appeared amidst forest trees, all Dragon Nest Beastmen, including Rodney, abruptly tightened their pupils...

chapters.title: Chapter 161 - 157: The Strange Gray Ape-Man
chapters.content:
Sometime unnoticed, the Dragon Nest Beastman team within the dense forest had been encircled by enemies, countless humanoid shadows appearing amid the forest shadows.
It would be fine if they were merely enemies; during this expedition, there were times they accidentally wandered into other Beastman Tribe territories and were besieged, but they easily broke through such encirclements thanks to their formidable skills.
Even when facing enemies several times their number, the Dragon Nest Beastman team led by Rodney, selected from the elite of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, would not feel much fear, as they are battle-hardened and powerful warriors.
But the scene before them clearly defied common sense.
The enemies encircling them were gray ape creatures, covered head to toe in fur, with long hands, hanging from the trees holding wooden spears.
Gray apes, living among various Beastman tribes in Kawa Great Forest, rank in the upper-middle tier. Born with strong limbs, they can confront ordinary middle-tier tribes undisadvantaged on flat ground. With superb climbing skills, they are extremely agile in forest leaps, even able to compete with higher-tier species like gray bears without inferiority.
Even Dragon Nest Tribe has gray apes, though typically they live on trees or in mountainous areas, collecting food easily thanks to their prowess. Thus, gray ape tribes are relatively stable, rarely disbanding into rogue Beastmen due to some reason.
The gray apes gathered by the Dragon Nest Tribe were only some old, weak, sick abandoned by their tribe, joining Dragon Nest Tribe by strokes of luck.
Rodney had naturally seen gray apes before and understood their strength as a species, but regardless of their might, gray apes are ordinary Beastmen; meanwhile, Rodney had been transformed by the grace of His Highness Austin and learned the "Beastman Three Techniques," surpassing common Beastmen in power. In addition, being elite himself, with other elite Dragon Vein Guard companions in the team, even doubling their number of gray apes posed no fear.
The true cause for awe among Lizardman Rodney and his team was the current condition of the gray apes!
Those eyes! Desiccated, deathly green like lifeless puppets, yet filled with madness and greedy desire. Pointed teeth pierced through decayed lips, staring fixedly at them as if they were giant walking meat.
More horrifying was their current state; gray furred bodies developed large patches of blue fungi, where it spread, fur dried and fell off, skin rotted exposing a stench, some parts even ate away muscles revealing skeleton beneath, flies buzzing around...
"What are these things!"
All Dragon Nest Beastmen present stood with bristling hair, gasping cold breaths.
The gray apes here, their faces stiff with no change, were unlike living beings, more like corpses rising from the earth, their skins rotting and molding as a result.
"Seems we're getting close to the truth..."
Rodney tightly gripped his Copper Greatsword; even the most dull should now suspect prior Beast migrations likely relate to these.
Being merely watched by these strange gray apes brought forth a chilling terror sensation.
That feeling, as if corpses climbed from Hell, stared lustfully at your flesh, chilling the spine.
"Hello, we are..."
In the cold tense atmosphere, Rodney tested speaking, though the odd creatures like dead bodies, he wanted to see if interaction was possible.
Yet the next moment,
Roar!!!
Among the odd gray apes, a leader larger and robust than usual, half its head decayed and most fur fallen, skin covered with blue fungi, roared.
The sound distinctly differed from normal gray apes, more like a broken wooden bellows forcing out a final wretched cry, chilling to the bone.Fresh chapters posted on novｅlfire.net
With its roar, eerie gray apes charged at the Dragon Nest Beastman team.
"Be ready, defend!"
Rodney's pupils shrank; with his order, prepared Dragon Nest Beastmen swiftly closed into a circle, raising copper spears two, three meters high, ensemble of spears surrounding like a hedgehog.
Yet faced with sharp spears, gray apes from the dense forest shadows charged without care, stiffly leaping directly onto them.
Thud thud thud...
In resounding flesh impacts, spears easily pierced the charging gray apes,
More horrifying still, the blood flowing from these strange gray apes was green!
But before Dragon Nest Beastmen could be alarmed, more gray apes continued charging, shadows leaping like waves nearly drowning them.
"Hold firm!"
Rodney took a deep breath, swinging arcs with his giant copper sword, any gray ape that approached was easily sliced in half by the Fighting Qi-imbued great sword.
Tightly packed Long Spear Array increased the number of gray apes on the ground, ordinary without piercing the long spear formations strictly trained to counter the Beastmen of Kawa Great Forest.
As time passed, under the assault of so many eerie gray apes, the entire Long Spear Array began to waver.
"Damn it, what exactly are these things!"
With one swing splitting two leaping gray apes, Rodney's face turned extremely grim.
These gray apes were too strange, fearing nothing, unfeeling pain, throwing themselves in despite severe damage, like undead coveting live flesh.
"This cannot continue; a breakthrough must be found, or it's troublesome!"
If facing other Beastman tribes, with the bravest few warriors slashed by the Dragon Nest Legion Long Spear Array, ninety percent of teams would collapse.
But these odd gray apes? Despite half lost and ground covered in companion corpses, they remain indifferent, charging like puppets without selves.

chapters.title: Chapter 162 - 158: Kill
chapters.content:
"A breakthrough..."
Even though the Dragon Nest Tribe's long spear array is formidable, under the relentless assault of these eerie gray ape creatures, after killing several times their own number of enemies, the Dragon Nest Beastmen have nearly reached their limit. If a breakthrough cannot be found, they will ultimately be defeated.
Rodney's gaze shuttled through the chaotic figures, finally fixing on the eerie gray ape leader who kept making strange cries.
In this world, Beastmen have a unified Orc language. Maybe the nasal sounds of Kobolds and Minotaurs are different, but they all understand the meaning to be similar.
It's said this unified language is a gift from the Divine, and throughout the Kawa Great Forest, practically every Beastman speaks this one language.
However, Rodney couldn't understand the strange cries of that gray ape. It didn't sound like communication but more like a twisted struggle, a ghostly wailing.
"It's him!"
Rodney's gaze was fixed on that guy compared to other gray ape creatures, the fungus on the gray ape leader was significantly larger, half his head had already rotted away, appearing to be more severely corrupted by those inexplicable eerie forces.
More importantly, despite Rodney not understanding his strange cries, from his reactions and actions, it seemed he was commanding the gray ape creatures' attack.
"I can only dare to try." Rodney calculated secretly, pondering deeply.
There was still a large distance between him and the gray ape leader. Numerous gray ape creatures blocked Rodney's breakthrough route, and Rodney also didn't think these eerie gray apes would simply let him break through and kill the king.
"Although I haven't completely mastered these moves, there's no other choice now!"
Rodney tightly gripped the Great Sword with both hands, raising it above his head. Inside him, Fighting Qi explosively surged, streams of air rising from beneath his feet.
"Shunpo!"
Bang!!!Content originally comes from novel_fіre.net
Thunderous sounds suddenly exploded, the Fighting Qi gathered beneath Rodney's feet continuously erupted several times, exerting massive counterforce.
The next moment,
Rodney's figure suddenly vanished, leaving only a large, spiderweb-like crack on the ground, a frenzy of air currents sweeping out violently.
"That is..."
All around, the Dragon Nest Beastmen widened their eyes, staring incredulously at where Rodney had suddenly disappeared before their eyes.
While the gray ape creatures rushing in, had no reaction at all, but in fact, they didn't need to react.
"Gale Wave One-Line Slash!"
In an instant, Rodney's figure appeared behind the gray ape leader,
A dazzling, white beam swept through the void in an instant, drawing from Rodney's original position, extending to Rodney's Great Sword. That light seemed to cut the whole space in half.
Along the way, those gray ape creatures that had leaped into the air were all split from the waist by an invisible weapon, even the surrounding trees were cleaved in two, slipping to the ground.
"That is... the Combat Technique developed by His Highness Austin!"
Witnessing this scene, all the beastmen widened their eyes, as the elite of the Dragon Nest Tribe, they knew about Austin developing Combat Techniques. Some in the team even cultivated these techniques, though time was short and they hadn't yet achieved significant results.
But no matter what, they never expected the power of these techniques to be so formidable!
The surrounding gray ape creatures also stopped,
Not because they were struck with terror by the sword into a stupor but because the gray ape leader's head was also being severed.
These eerie gray ape creatures seemed to lose command without the leader's directives, standing blindly where they were. Upon seeing the Dragon Nest Beastmen gathered together, they drooped their dry, green eyes, staggering towards the beastmen.
Without the leader, they still attacked the Dragon Nest Beastmen, but their pace was extremely slow, unlike before when they threw themselves forward like moths to a flame.
With this change, the Dragon Nest Beastmen let out a long sigh, gradually exterminating these sluggish gray apes.
"Cough cough..."
Meanwhile, Rodney stood pale on the ground, coughing up a mouthful of blood.
Shunpo, a magic-modified Combat Technique from Navy Six Techniques' 'Shave,' differed from its original body's pure movement. Shunpo uses Fighting Qi gathered beneath the feet to instantly erupt multiple times, generating counterforce for movement.
This instantaneous movement beyond visual perception exerts immense pressure on the body. Although Rodney successfully used it and slayed the gray ape leader with Gale Wave, the powerful pressure left his body severely injured.
"No wonder His Highness said, until the body reaches a certain level, not to overuse Shunpo; this pressure is genuinely terrifying..."
After resting for a while, Rodney returned to the team. By this point, the eerie gray ape creatures, without their leader's command, had been thoroughly cleaned out, leaving only a few struggling captives.
Around him came gazes of reverence. That prior sword strike was truly stunning, and beastmen are naturally inclined to admire strength. Thus, these gazes were unsurprising.
"How is it?"
Rodney looked at the few gray ape creatures tied with vines in the center, asking the companions around him.
"No way to communicate. They've turned into beasts, and their bodies are really eerie."
Watching the eerie gray ape creatures tied tight in vines, still frantically struggling like they lost their reason, Rodney fell silent.
Dried eyes, green blood, moldy and decaying bodies, lost reason, insane bloodlust... all these signs show that this is not simple.
Contemplating briefly, a flash from the sword, Rodney severed the captives with a single strike.
Facing the stunned gazes around him, Rodney's expression remained unchanged as he spoke:
"If we can't get answers, forget it. We don't have time to waste on them. Everyone rest up; soon we'll climb that mountain range. I have a feeling we'll find the answers there."
The Dragon Nest Beastmen had no objections, as Rodney was already the leader of this expedition, not to mention his previous display of strength had truly won over all the beastmen.
An hour later, the Dragon Nest Beastmen began their ascent towards the high mountain.
Unsurprisingly, atop the mountain lay a crumbling, decayed gray ape tribe, filled with many eerie gray ape creatures. Without their leader's command, they were easily slain by the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
After exterminating the gray ape tribe and reaching the highest peak, looking down toward the western region, all the Dragon Nest Beastmen sucked in a breath cold, falling into a deathly silence.
"Oh no... this is trouble!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 163 - 159: Erosion
chapters.content:
Standing on the mountain peak, wherever the eyes could see, there were endless hills and plains, and the sights of the front ground were all encompassed.
Yet all the Dragon Nest Beastmen standing before this scene were motionless, the mountaintop rendered silent and still.
The land is being eroded!
On the Forest Land, the green mist rose like flames, spreading slowly around, where the mist passed, vast expanses of dense forest withered, giant trees decayed and fell one by one, turning the ground barren and blackened, devoid of all vitality.
From high above, blotches covered the entire land like festering wounds on the skin, eerie green mist gathered into towering columns ascending the sky, like immense smoke columns reaching for the heavens.
From the mountaintop, the gaze penetrated those rotting spots on the ground, seeing shadows wandering helplessly like puppets without strings, including both Beastmen and wild beasts, gathering aimlessly, wandering around densely, showing no signs of life.
Rodney even saw several gigantic beasts being corroded, one with half of its head already rotten, revealing a grim white skull, its movements seemed rigid, but not fallen dead. Another had its belly swollen, white ribs piercing through from the inside, thick green liquid flowing constantly...
These did not possess the fierce aura that giant beasts previously encountered had, but were filled with an eerie sense of rigidity, decay, and death.
The feeling was as though the world ahead was a paradise of wandering undead ghosts, devouring all living creatures, leaving even the fearsome giant beasts, Magic Beasts, and plants on the ground not spared.
All creatures throughout the land were reduced to puppets of rotting corpses, though a vast number of beings were still moving densely on the land, it instilled a bone-chilling cold sensation in all Beastmen, as if facing a Netherworld filled with death.
Recalling those bizarre gray apes before, perhaps they were akin to those wandering creatures on the land, originally one of their own, eroded by some eerie power that awakened them from death, reduced to puppet zombies.
Facing this vast scene, Rodney felt as if the whole world was gradually being eroded by a terrifying and strange force, not only transforming the entire land into its desired vision but also infecting living creatures to manipulate them into puppets.
Marking the boundary of this mountain range, gazing westward, colossal columns of green smoke rose to the sky, densely rotting figures continued to wander and spread across the land, carrying the seeds of green smoke, seemingly intent on infecting the entire world.
The scene ahead was already thus, then what about the farther west?
Since last year, signs had already begun to appear, how much more would the western Forest Land become eroded? Would the entire western land be practically turned into a paradise for those monsters?
"Let's go back first and report the events to His Highness Austin."
Given the current situation, even the most oblivious Beastman knew things were dire, and the only way to make a decision was after reporting to His Highness Austin.
Such an all-encompassing eroding force was truly terrifying!
...
Meanwhile, the Dragon Nest Tribe was entering a phase of fiery development.
After more than a month's sweep, centered around the Dragon Nest Tribe, various Beastman tribes within a hundred-mile radius had been conquered, numerous Beastmen became captives, integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe and subjected to military reform training.
The tribe's population has now officially surpassed twenty thousand, with the influx of people, once training is completed, the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe is bound to experience a new surge in growth.
During this round of sweeping, Austin not only acquired several odd items, but also boosted the number of Extraordinary Beastmen within the tribe.
Within this hundred-mile radius, there are about a hundred Beastman tribes, varying in size; while the area Austin occupies rarely produced Extraordinary Beastmen, with such a large number, some would inevitably awaken Extraordinary Seeds independently, or lucky ones having ingested Magic Fruit to tread the Extraordinary path. These Extraordinary Beastman captives were, of course, treated differently, disciplined and trained to correct their previous dispositions, before being absorbed into the Extraordinary Beastman Legion.
However, as Austin saw it, the greatest harvest from this sweeping was not the twelve thousand Beastman captives, nor those bizarre and unknown creations, nor the handful of Extraordinary Beastmen, but rather a captive old Beastman Priest from a thousand-member Beastman tribe and the yield from that tribe.
This thousand-member Beastman tribe was considered a long-standing local community, not only did the tribe possess herbal knowledge providing a considerable supplement to the medical system of the Dragon Nest Tribe, but the old Beastman Priest also held knowledge of mysterious Extraordinary Abilities, albeit incomplete, it still supplemented the Dragon Nest Tribe's current deficiency in mysteries.Read full story at N0v3l.Fiɾe.net
This knowledge was, indeed, the most valuable treasure acquired by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Additionally, during the conquest of that Beastman tribe, Austin discovered a new food crop – the Otherworld version of taro.
Early in the construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe, to secure enough food and establish a solid foundation for the tribe, Austin began reclamation work, leading Beastmen to cultivate kudzu and other food crops within the forest from scratch.
The primary crop cultivated was kudzu, later, to ensure food security, Austin initiated a diversified planting plan, increasing the variety of food crops; however, aside from kudzu, other collected food plants yielded extremely low, only one-tenth of kudzu, resulting in later cultivated land primarily consisting of kudzu.
Back then, even though Austin obtained a piece of taro during the attack on one tribe, with only one piece, large-scale breeding and planting were difficult, for taro cultivation to stand alongside kudzu, it would take years at least, unexpectedly now finding the origin of taro in this thousand-member tribe, allowing this year's food crop to be divided between kudzu and taro.
This sweep clearing the Beastman tribes within a hundred-mile radius indeed greatly increased the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, yet the surge of population brought a certain degree of trouble to the tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 164 - 160 Dangerous Place
chapters.content:
The surge in population initially posed a tremendous food pressure on the Dragon Nest Tribe. The population of twenty thousand meant that last year's stored food was completely consumed.
Fortunately, for some unknown reason, large herds migrated past, and with the introduction of new bronze weapons, the hunting efficiency of the Dragon Nest Beastmen was significantly improved. They were able to continuously procure large amounts of meat from the forest every day.
At the same time, animal husbandry within the Dragon Nest Tribe also reached a certain level, coupled with the use of rope nets made from last year's harvested kudzu vines during the cold winter. They were also able to catch large amounts of fish from rivers and lakes, which, to some extent, alleviated the food crisis in the Dragon Nest Tribe, allowing them to barely sustain themselves.
During this period, the Dragon Nest Beastmen did not neglect the tasks of reclamation and cultivation.
Thanks to the successful crafting of bronze farming tools, the speed of reclaiming land by the Beastmen increased many times over. Both plowing and tree cutting speeds significantly accelerated. To further expedite the land reclamation, the newly captured Beastmen were driven to the fields to assist with the work while undergoing military training and transformation.
Under the extensive construction by all Dragon Nest Beastmen, the reclaimed fields of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe now spanned nearly over five thousand acres, extending from the plains in all directions. The crisscrossing fields evoked a sense of awe.
When the first crop of kudzu vines was successfully harvested, the entire tribe's food crisis was subsequently resolved. However, this was far from success, as the kudzu harvest alone could not completely support the consumption of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe. Beastmen still needed to hunt large numbers of wild animals from the forest every day.
The population brought tremendous food pressure to the tribe, simultaneously imposing severe housing pressure on the Dragon Nest Base.
Previously, due to the cold winter, it was impossible to make bricks by mixing mud, so no house expansions had been undertaken in Dragon Nest Town. During the cold winter, Beastmen continuously joined the tribe, and by the end of winter, the housing situation had become extremely urgent.
It wasn't until the Dragon Nest Legion launched missions all around, sweeping nearby Beastman Tribes, capturing Beastmen and sending them back, that the last straw broke the back of Dragon Nest Town. The existing houses could no longer accommodate so many people.
To meet the enormous housing demand, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe had to undertake major expansions.
Under Austin's guidance, squads of Beastman militia were deployed to build the town. According to the plan, the curtain walls around the tribe were directly dismantled. Meanwhile, the brick kiln on the mountain operated at full capacity, producing a large number of bricks daily, which were transported into the tribe to build wood and brick structures. These houses occupied vast tracts of land, turning the entire tribe town into a large construction site, expanding visibly outward.
"When constructing, pay attention to spacing between houses to ensure fire safety, and also consider the routes for movement and support between neighborhoods. If enemies infiltrate and cause disruption, the rescue teams need to be able to respond quickly..."
Standing on the high platform, looking at the expanded town below, which had become like a massive construction site, Austin instructed Vini at his side.
Because of the previous consideration for fire safety, the mercenaries' attempt to sneak in and cause chaos by setting fires did not achieve much. However, it did reveal some issues, like inadequate building layouts and the inability of the Dragon Nest Beastmen stationed within the tribe to provide timely support.
With the experience from last time, this time, the major expansion of the base naturally aimed to preserve the good aspects while improving the deficiencies.
"Yes, Your Highness." Now overseeing all various errands within the tribe, Vini nodded in agreement and recorded Austin's instructions.
"How's the progress on the sweeping operations? Have those tribes been thoroughly cleaned and annexed?"
Looking at the slowly establishing town below, which he built himself, Austin's eyes shone brightly.
Two years ago, when the tribe kinfolk went to war with other Beastman Tribes, the entire Beastman Tribe almost went all out, with the whole army in action, and he had to join them to prevent any accidents.
But now, who would have imagined that in just two short years, he only needed to sit in the Dragon's Nest and give a casual command, and numerous clan legions could sweep all directions, annihilating one force after another.
And all of this, the fact that his kinfolk Beastmen under him could achieve such a level, was all due to his own design and creation.
"Thanks to Your Highness's earlier decision to raise that pack of Blood Wolves with their keen sense of smell, they have practically cleared out the nearby tribes following their trail. However, within a hundred miles, there are still many dangerous territories we dare not approach."
In two years, the few Blood Wolf cubs Austin decided to bring back to the tribe had grown up, and the older one was barely hanging on. Although the originally planned Wolf Cavalry was no longer necessary after establishing the Centaur Tribe, the Blood Wolves' keen sense of smell was tremendously helpful to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
These Blood Wolves, raised in the tribe since they were young, had integrated with the Beastmen who raised them, becoming companions.
With the help of the Blood Wolves, whether it was herds of wild animals in the forest or Beastman Tribes hidden somewhere in the dense woods, they could be easily discovered. The success of this Dragon Nest Tribe's sweeping plan owed much of its credit to the Blood Wolves' keen sense of smell in accurately locating their strongholds.Check latest chapters at .ɴet
"Very well, you've done an excellent job... However, what did you mean by dangerous territories?"
Austin was somewhat puzzled. With the current strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, fully armored and equipped, hundreds or thousands of Giant Beasts have already been slain. What else in the surrounding area could threaten the tribe's Clan?
"These are perilous places filled with many dangers, like a swamp plain swarming with mosquitoes, a damp mountain gorge teeming with snakes, a forest perpetually shrouded in dark mist and miasma where it's said a powerful Ice and Snow Lord slumbers among the ice mountains... If we force our army through these places, we will inevitably incur significant losses. According to Quik and the people at the Witch Hospital, these are all Magic Power-rich areas, probably inhabited by extremely fearsome extraordinary creatures, posing immense danger."
In the forest, various dangers abound. The reason why outcast rogue Beastmen often find themselves facing near certain death and are almost never heard from again is not only because of the rampant wild animals, Magic Beasts, and Giant Beasts within the forest, but also due to the widespread existence of such perilous places.

chapters.title: Chapter 165 - 161 Target
chapters.content:
The territory Austin chose was somewhat remote, with scarce magic resources, but beyond a distance of ten miles, the environment slowly began to change, the terrain varied, and the activity tracks of various magic beasts and giant beasts started to increase frequently.
With the Dragon Nest Tribe at its center, a vast plain lay to the east, rich in water resources. Most of the beastman tribes broken through by the Dragon Nest Legion during this time were gathered there. As for what lay further east, Austin was unsure.
To the south were endless hills, but it's said that the farther south one goes, closer to the continent and ocean's junction, the harsher the weather becomes.
The terrain to the west was rugged, with mountains and forests interspersed with basins and peaks, creating treacherous grounds. Whether crossing those mountain ranges would lead to plains, Austin did not know, as he hadn't ventured far, it being safer to stay at the old nest before growing up.Find the newest release on novel~fire~net
Yet, with the beast migration, sensing the unknown threat from the west, Austin dispatched elite beastmen to explore and gather information, hoping the exploration team would soon return with clear intel on the terrain farther west and perhaps bring back news of the mutation's source.
As for the north, it was said that moving continuously northward, the climate gradually became temperate, closer to the temperate climate familiar to Austin from his previous life, eventually reaching the Bloody Border, the battleground of beastmen and humans on the thousand-year battlefront line.
In this ever-changing environment, the farther out, as the region expands, dangerous zones with varying environments naturally appear.
"Danger zones, huh? This might be an opportunity!"
Danger signifies opportunity as well.
Previously, the Spider Cave that Rodney discovered was also such a dangerous area, and after Austin led a team to clear out the spiders within, he obtained an entire vein of magic stones.
Now the essence of the magic stone vein, the most valuable magic crystals, had been extracted and consumed by Austin for his growth, leaving only ordinary magic stones, which could be used for extraordinary transformations for the beastmen, but for Austin, who was now at the quasi-gold level, they were useless.
Quasi-gold wasn't truly gold; it's more than a typical silver peak, yet still below gold.
To break through the bottleneck before reaching the gold level, one could either devour higher-level magic resources or rely on decades for a natural breakthrough with a giant dragon's innate growth power.
The latter, taking decades to improve, was clearly unacceptable to Austin, who sought rapid advancement by relying on a dragon's superior digestion capacity, massively consuming abundant magic resources.
"Dangerous places also represent tremendous benefits. If I could find several veins like the Spider Cave vein, I'd be confident to become a gold-level dragon by next year."
Once reaching the gold level, Austin's prowess would be considered a high-level force globally, greatly enhancing his security.
"Vini, mark out the locations of those danger zones, prepare accordingly. I'll act together with you and see if we can clear out one of these dangerous areas."
The thought was promptly followed by action, with an indescribable unease lingering in his mind as the exploration team didn't return, so Austin prepared to face a formidable enemy regardless.
If they cleared those danger zones and devoured the magic resources inside to become a gold-level giant dragon, it would be ideal.
Fortunately, as time passed, two months had gone by since the cold winter season. The Dragon Nest Tribe's affairs had nearly been settled, the beastmen captives mostly trained, the previous spoils fully absorbed by the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Beastman Legion fully armored, and morale high, excited to embark on a campaign with the great Austin, with each soldier feeling a fervent worship.
Two years ago, Austin began by gathering a ragtag team of wandering kobolds, settling here and gradually developing from a dilapidated small tribe and a young dragon weaker than a wolf—no one could have imagined this combination evolving into its present form.
For all this creation and the safekeeping, the shelter from hunger and cold, safe warm homes, and the happy life of having enough food each day, all were given by the great Austin.
To go on a campaign with the great Highness Austin, and to contribute their power for their revered leader was considered a very noble honor by all beastman soldiers.
Yet as Austin was about to gather his army to sweep through those nearby danger zones, several members of the beastman exploration team returned, bringing Austin chilling news.
....
Over two hundred miles away in the mountains, a giant shadow landed on the mountaintop in the midst of welcoming beastman troops, glaring at the dreadful world beneath the mountains, its pupils contracting sharply.
"Hiss, is this an Otherworld version of a biological crisis?!"
Previously, due to unfamiliar routes and avoiding various dangers, the Dragon Nest Beastman reconnaissance team took nearly half a month to arrive at the mountains and discovered a terrifying and eerie world beyond them.
Austin, having quickly grown with fast flight speed, wasted no time upon learning this news, locating Rodney and the Dragon Nest Beastman exploration team in over half a day.
Upon discovering the mutation of the world across, the exploration team dispatched several powerful extraordinary beastmen as an elite squad to report back, while most stayed at the cliff, gathering data and organizing to prevent the monster corpses crossing the mountains to invade the eastern plains.
After locating Rodney and others, Austin also witnessed the land being consumed by death and the terrifying scene of a corpse tide like the sea.
"What is happening? Has a zombie virus invaded?"
Frowning at the land being tainted by that strange green force, anxiety lingered.
No wonder an unease always resided within, catching sight of such a menace that manipulates not only beastman corpses but even animals turning them into puppets; how many creatures have been infected in the vast western plains? Austin didn't know, but understood it must be astronomical.
"Have you collected any information on those things during this time?"
Austin asked Rodney and others while their solemn report obliterated the last bit of hope within Austin....

chapters.title: Chapter 166 - 162: Zombies
chapters.content:
Their bodies rotting, mad, mindless, bloodthirsty, immeasurably strong, and sluggish in movement....
These symptoms are not unlike the zombies in Austin's memories, as if the zombies from the fantasy world of his past life have truly appeared before him, sending chills down his spine.
What left Austin even more silent was, to further confirm the situation, he subsequently instructed Rodney and others to catch a normal rabbit and simultaneously capture a mutated beastman.
But after the rabbit was scratched by the captured mutated beastman, it quickly began to have green eyes, growing green splotches on its skin and fur, its body started to rot, and it became insanely violent, trying to bite any living creature it saw, as though infected by a "zombie virus," becoming incredibly frenzied.
The behavior pattern of this thing was almost identical to the zombie virus from the entertainment works of Austin's previous life. However, due to some mysterious forces in the Extraordinary World, the real zombie virus seemed to show some differences.
There was no doubt that the erosion and infectious power of these eerie forces wreaked havoc among the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
"Where exactly did these zombie viruses come from?!"
Facing the impending dreadful crisis, Austin couldn't help but frown deeply.
If it truly is a zombie virus, how did they appear in this world, and for how long? If those extraordinary lives have also had their wisdom eroded, can it be confirmed that the upcoming crisis is indeed more terrifying?
A plethora of information was running and processing in his mind, from the initial migration of the beast herds. At least half a year had passed since the discovery of its clues, which meant these zombie viruses had existed for at least half a year.
No, that's not correct!
Before the Dragon Nest Tribe discovered the beast migration, Austin remembered Rodney, Quik, and others saying that a large tribe at the Bloody Border began frequently attacking the Border Great Wall a few years ago, with wars breaking out frequently between Beastmen and humans, and the chieftains of those large tribes seeming like madmen, refusing to stop until the Great Wall was captured.This content belongs to novel~fire~net
If everything is connected, could it be that those top super large Beastman tribes numbering in the hundreds of thousands had long discovered the inklings of a zombie virus and attacked the Bloody Great Wall at all costs?
"It's very likely that the Beastman tribes within the Kawa Great Forest are still in a primitive stage, lacking organized formation and professional Beastman armies, making them unable to effectively combat these zombie-like entities."
Without formations and without sharp metal weapons, if ordinary Beastmen get caught, they become infected and turn into zombies, consequently strengthening the enemy's forces. Only the elites within the Beastman tribes can barely resist, but against these zombie-like entities, even the elite Beastmen can only take down a few before potentially succumbing to the tide of corpses.
Fortunately, these zombie-like monsters have inherited the brainlessness flaw of zombies. Against a well-armed, well-trained Long Spear Array of the Dragon Nest Legion, they stand little chance even if they outnumber the troops several times over, especially since many Beastman Legions are already equipped with three-meter-long spears, armor, and Bronze Shields. Ordinary zombies are mere targets to be mowed down before them.
The tight armor and spear formations are best suited to deal with these enemies who charge forward with brute strength. As long as the zombie numbers do not exceed tenfold or even a hundredfold of their own, and as long as the Dragon Nest Legion does not get swallowed by the zombie tide, major issues are unlikely to arise.
"There's still a possibility to fight back..."
Gazing at the tide of corpses struggling to climb the mountain peaks from the plains below, Austin muttered to himself internally.
The zombie virus-like green force doesn't seem to spread through the air, at least since the Dragon Nest Beastmen have been here for some time without a single occurrence of infection, indicating that this eerie green force likely spreads through bite infection from infected individuals to uninfected ones.
"You all stay here, keep a good watch. I'm going to investigate."
After instructing Rodney and the others to stay put, Austin rose into the air before they could say anything and swiftly flew towards the infected land in the west.
...
Decay, desolation, large swaths of trees and underbrush vanished, rotting zombie beastmen, animals, and giant beasts wandering slowly through the forest, as though all life had been consumed clean, leaving no sign of vitality.
Flying above, Austin's eyes grew increasingly grave as he looked down on the scene of devastation.
The swirling smoke around him didn't alert his Sixth Sense, but the large zombie tide below undoubtedly presented a daunting challenge.
"With these things constantly spreading, to prevent them from affecting the Dragon Nest Tribe, they must be killed one by one. But their sheer numbers are absurd, with beastmen, wild beasts, and even magic beasts and giant beasts among them, what's the approach here?!"
This land is likely entirely overrun, with nothing left of normal organisms.
After pondering momentarily, Austin opened his mouth.
Blue Dragon Breath,
Roar! Roar! Roar!
A mass of gigantic bluish flame roared intensely, spurting from his mouth, stretching into a fire pillar over ten meters long in the air, crashing into the center of the zombie tide, instantly igniting dozens of zombie beastmen, while the others instinctively avoided and fled.
The breath power of a Giant Dragon, something Austin rarely used, as previously the magic power within him was feeble, with the produced breath no bigger than a fist and just capable of kindling a small flame, holding little power.
But now, as his body grew, the breath of the Giant Dragon became stronger, making it a suitable method for probing attacks.
With one breath, amidst the intense howling and rolling of those dozen zombies ignited by the fire pillar, they swiftly reduced to ashes.
"A weak bunch, though their strength is one or two points above ordinary Beastmen."
Seeing how easily they were burned to death, Austin silently assessed in his mind.
With the Long Spear Array Forest of the Dragon Nest Tribe, they should be able to handle it...
Subsequently, Austin shifted his gaze onto the other elite zombies, while examining the corrupted magic beasts, searching for ways to deal with them.
After several probes, Austin understood.
Those elite zombies infected by extraordinary Beastmen, though their brute strength advanced, with their lack of intelligence and reliance on brute force alone—even a team of ordinary Beastmen could handle them with a few vine nets. The giant beasts, too, with neither consciousness nor wisdom, could easily be tripped by Dragon Nest Beastmen using ropes; as for magic beasts, due to their Talent Magic, they were indeed somewhat harder to deal with.

chapters.title: Chapter 167 - 163 Pyramid
chapters.content:
The magic beasts' talent magic did not disappear because they were corrupted into zombies; instead, some strange mutations occurred. If only ropes were used, it would be easy for the talent magic of those mutated magic beasts to sever them.
However, it doesn't matter much. Although there were some mutations in the magic beasts' talent magic, their movements have become stiff and sluggish, targeting this weakness is relatively easy.
With the completion of the magic-modified Beastman Three Techniques by Austin, the strength of the elite Dragon Vein Attendants in the Dragon Nest Tribe has been greatly enhanced, dealing with zombie magic beasts below the Silver Level poses no problem.
After assessing and understanding the horde, Austin did not immediately turn back but continued forward.
He wanted to see how much of this land had been corrupted and whether he could discover the source further in.
As Austin flew swiftly, the green on the forest land became less and less, the entire land was spotted and pitted, like it had contracted a rotting syphilis, extremely disgusting, and at the same time, the horde on the ground became much sparser, appearing as if a large part of the horde had spread out in all directions.
Flying continuously, the scenery on the ground remained the same, only the sky seemed to be dyed a yellow-green by that kind of green smoke.
After flying for minutes, just as Austin was about to turn back, suddenly a huge shadow appeared on the ground ahead, vaguely, one zombie beast after another, zombie beastmen were either carrying rocks or giant logs, heading towards that shadow.
"Huh, what is that over there!"
Seeing that scene, Austin's eyes lit up, flapping his wings, he hurriedly flew towards that shadow.
Moments later, that shadow was already in sight,
it was a colossal pyramid building, with a tower body over a thousand meters tall standing on the distant horizon like a huge hill, one figure after another like ants, densely packed, constructing around it. From Austin's high altitude angle, it looked like a large group of ants building their home.
And those construction teams, indeed, were zombies with half of their bodies already rotted and empty eyes!
These brainless zombies of various kinds were actually being driven by some mysterious existence to build such a gigantic pyramid!
"What is going on here?"
Staring at such a bizarre sight, Austin suddenly felt a wave of dread.
What kind of power is manipulating all this behind the scenes!
Since when can zombies be driven?
Looking at the distant zombies carrying building materials in an orderly manner, the massive pyramid under construction, and the four enormous sky-reaching pillars around it, with strange and mysterious carvings, Austin suddenly felt a sense of a gigantic conspiracy rolling out of the darkness, as a massive black hand seemed ready to envelop the entire world.
Just as Austin fell into idle speculation, suddenly, a great danger, a great horror, causing his whole dragon body to shudder enveloped his mind, all his body hair stood on end, and his heart seemed to plunge straight into an abyss.
Buzz!!!
Then he saw on the pyramid's top, a circle of blue light visible to the naked eye rippling out from the void, transforming into a massive sweeping shock fan, a dazzling ball of blue light unknown as to when it had condensed, shot out instantaneously a sky-reaching blue light column, as if it shattered space, appearing instantly before Austin.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel⚑fire.net
In the critical moment, Austin only just managed to twist his body, majestic light brushed past him, that feeling of being like ice piercing the depths instantly made him feel as if he was staring into the abyss of death.
Boom boom boom!!!
Amidst earth-shattering loud sounds, the entire world seemed to fall into violent tremors, massive explosions boomed, amidst the blinding blue light, a mushroom cloud reaching the sky rose up, rising up into the cloudless sky, simultaneously a terrible shockwave swept past, large patches of soil were flung into the air by the airstream, ascending skyward.
Austin only felt as though he was caught in a torrent, his body swayed unstably in the chaotic flow, yet he saw a mountain range thousands of meters behind him directly blasted out into a huge pit.
Austin dared not linger any longer, his body sped away, flying at a speed surpassing his capabilities into the distance, disappearing in the blink of an eye.
Yet the unknown enemy atop the pyramid, for some reason, did not pursue him, the bluish-glow at the pyramid top quickly dissipated, the land once again fell into silence, as the surrounding zombies continued to work, even the prior massive explosion had not caused any pause.
...
A moment later, the disheveled Austin, having fled hundreds of miles away, finally stopped with lingering fear, landing atop a mountain peak.
"Damn it, what on earth is that pyramid! What are they building it for? What's with this zombie virus?!"
Austin instinctively felt that everything would not be that simple.
These zombie creatures possibly were some unknown things created to destroy the world, and simultaneously they enslaved masses of living beings as tools to build the pyramid, furthermore that pyramid under construction perhaps isn't even the end of all this.
It's very possible that there are more than one pyramid under construction further to the west, and why are they building these pyramids, aside from unleashing that level of terrifying attacks, are there other functions?
Regarding this, Austin knew nothing.
But he was certain, inside it might hold a greater conspiracy.
"The top tribal alliances on the border must know something, after returning, I must find a chance to see if I can contact them!"
When Austin was scouting before, he found that the power of the horde corroding the land wasn't much, with the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, it wasn't necessarily impossible to stop them, but now it seems, things are far from being easily resolved as imagined, at least that mysterious pyramid isn't something he can handle now.
Only taking a distant glance, he was nearly obliterated to dust.
The life-treasuring Austin now was having second thoughts.
"No wonder those large tribal alliances constantly flee to the human world, no, I must prepare a route of retreat."
With a gloomy mind, taking a deep look at the pyramid's location, Austin directly flew away.
...
At the same time in the copper ore base.
With the extensive commencement of copper refining work, the copper ore base was now thriving, high furnaces stood on the hillside flatlands, a large number of kobolds were mining in the field, extracting pieces of copper ore to be transported to the smelting site and poured into the high furnaces.
Inside the high furnaces, heat blazed fiercely, with copper slurry flowing out, molded into earthen patterns, every day a large number of weapons and tools were formed and transported to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Meanwhile, as the Dragon Nest Beastmen worked passionately at the smelting base, an elite troop of beastmen was slowly exploring over from afar....

chapters.title: Chapter 168 - 164: The Sphinx
chapters.content:
On a hill far from the Copper Ore Base, a disorganized group of Beastmen stood at the mountain top, looking at the bustling Copper Ore Base in the distance where numerous blast furnaces continuously spewed black smoke into the sky.Check latest chapters at net
"So this is where the base was initially established? It seems that Grom wasn't taken out by those things, but can anyone tell me whose force these Beastmen belong to?"
At the forefront stood a lion humanoid over three meters tall, with golden fur like cast gold, and a half-scarred, imposing head.
Just by standing there casually, the lion humanoid exuded a terrifying aura, causing the surrounding air to tense up, and a heavy pressure settled on the hearts of all the Beastmen.
"I don't know, maybe there's a very powerful Lord here, and Grom accidentally provoked him, so the whole tribe branch was destroyed."
"Possibly, look at the remnants of the base over there. It should have been the tribe's station at the time, only to be breached and destroyed, then partially rebuilt on the ruins."
Behind him, several Beastmen were chattering, starting to speculate about the situation in front of them.
They were the elite Beastmen sent by the Blood Claw Tribe.
A few years ago, to achieve a certain plan, they had the bears within the tribe lead a group of Beastmen to migrate southeast, hoping to find a suitable place to establish a bridgehead.
Finally, two years ago, with the strong support of the whole Blood Claw Tribe, whether it be population, weapons, or food, they were adequately supplied. Grom led a group of elite Beastmen and finally established a branch base hundreds of miles to the southwest.
With the continuous support from the tribe, the entire tribe branch rapidly expanded, growing from a tribe of dozens within a short time to over a thousand in just a year.
Just as the branch was about to stabilize, there had been no news from the branch for more than half a year starting from last year.
As those things became increasingly rampant, the tribe alliance had to migrate north, striving to break through the human Bloody Great Wall defense. Naturally, they couldn't let the rear become compromised, so the Blood Claw Tribe sent a small elite team to investigate, hoping to clarify whether it was destroyed by a powerful Magic Beast occupying the place or eroded and occupied by those things.
"Interesting, are they smelting iron?"
Looking at the busy scene in front where numerous earthy-yellow weapons were being cast, with piles of weapons and armor stacked like mountains, the lion humanoid showed a sinister smile.
Before coming, they had speculated that the Blood Claw Tribe Branch might have been overrun by those things, which is why they lost all contact. Initially, the lion humanoid didn't even want to come on this dangerous journey.
But unexpectedly, there was a pleasant surprise now.
In the whole tribe alliance, or even the entire Kawa Great Forest, apart from a few Beastmen who could forge weapons from some ores, the lion humanoid had never seen metal weapons being mass-produced so simply.
In his memory, it was only once when the lion humanoid accompanied a Beastman army to breach a human town that he saw so many weapons in a storeroom.
"Hiss, those are indeed metal weapons!"
Hearing the lion humanoid say this, all the Beastmen gathered their eyes on the mountain of weapons and armor produced by the Beastmen at the Copper Ore Base.
The tribe alliance's metal weapons mostly came from the spoils of the Human World. In this weathering-the-storm environment, there was no soil for smelting metals to emerge. Most Beastmen still used things like Stone Tools and bone implements.
Initially, when Grom led the team to establish the branch base, to show support, nearly half of the tribe's iron weapons were given to the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, but they didn't expect these iron weapons eventually became the materials for Austin to use electromagnetic cannon and obliterate Grom.
Metal weapons represent rarity and value within the Kawa Great Forest!
In an instant, all the Blood Claw Beastmen present showed a greedy look on their faces.
If they could capture all these Beastmen and take them back to the headquarters as slaves, how much armor and weapons they wanted in the future wouldn't be an issue?!
At this moment,
Dragon Nest Beastmen patrol passed by and saw the lion humanoid and all the Blood Claw Tribe elite Beastmen on the mountain top.
"Hey, where did you come from?"
A huge sound immediately drew the attention of the lion humanoid and others over.
....
The jackal wolf boy Meng Bi always considered himself very lucky,
Initially, to survive, he and his sister escaped the slave camp, trudging through the icy wilderness. Midway, they found a frozen wolf carcass which they survived on for half a month, eventually carrying his sister Aisha to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Then, their fate changed.
His dying sister was saved; they were taken in by the Dragon Nest Tribe. Under the protection of the great His Highness Austin, they ended the days of wandering and escaping from hunger and cold, living a life they wouldn't have dared to dream of before.
He was very fortunate. How many old, weak, sick Beastmen were expelled every cold winter? In that white icy wilderness, survival was almost ten to one, but he and his sister fortunately found that one in ten thousand chance and survived.
For saving his sister and himself, for this great Dragon Nest Tribe, Meng Bi was very grateful, even willing to lay down his life for Dragon Nest Tribe and His Highness Austin.
This was especially true since half a year ago, when Dragon Nest Tribe was attacked by mercenaries, Meng Bi stood out decisively.
Because he had His Highness Austin behind him, and because of his sister Aisha, the two most important things in his life were behind him, and because of this, he almost lost his life.
But fortunately, he didn't die,
Almost half of his body's bones were shattered, but it exchanged for the awakening of the ancient bloodline, commonly known as ancestral return.
From that day on, Meng Bi's name spread throughout the entire Dragon Nest Tribe due to his bravery, and more so for his ancestral bloodline.
Among Beastmen, there's a saying that every Beastman whose bloodline has undergone ancestral return is a lucky one blessed by the Beast God, and as long as they don't die, they are bound to achieve great power in the future.
Subsequently, Meng Bi, along with other brave warriors from that battle, were personally received and commended by Austin. All the Beastmen present were moved to tears, and Meng Bi was promoted directly to join the elite Dragon Vein Guard and was given the Beastman Three Techniques for training, becoming a talent highly cultivated by Austin.

chapters.title: Chapter 169 - 165 Attack
chapters.content:
Although looked up to by Austin, the jackal wolf youth Meng Bi did not become arrogant or complacent. Instead, because of His Highness Austin's regard, he felt only an ever-growing pressure on his shoulders.
In order to catch up with the progress, besides the daily training, he subjected himself to an additional fifty percent of extra training programs, hoping to solidify his foundation and forge a mighty physique, enhancing his physical strength.
Every day, tens of thousands of push-ups, sit-ups, frog jumps, a run of hundreds of kilometers... the volume of physical training was simply terrifying, and everything he did was to meet the basic requirements of the Beastman Three Techniques.
Among the Beastman Three Techniques, the most crucial for the effectiveness of any technique is physical strength. Only with strong physical strength can the techniques be used more frequently and achieve greater power.
With his current strength in a normal state, he meets even the lowest requirement for Iron Block.
The Beastman Three Techniques created by Austin are inspired by the Navy Six Techniques. In the original version of the Navy Six Techniques, without the boost from Fighting Qi, it all relied on the body's strength to achieve body techniques.
These body techniques, while extremely powerful, also impose high demands on the user's body.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel·fire·net
Take Shave, for example: if one's physical fitness does not meet the standards, even if one can kick the ground several times in an instant to achieve the speed of Shave, the body will endure immense pressure due to the powerful acceleration. If fitness does not meet the standard, there's a possibility of body collapse during swift movement with Shave.
Meng Bi is very aware that his physical quality hasn't even achieved the requirements of the simplest Iron Block.
Every time he thinks of the great power when those senior Dragon Vein Attendants utilize the Beastman Three Techniques, Meng Bi's heart surges with agitation.
As for the magnificent His Highness Austin who created these three techniques, he is full of admiration.
What kind of extraordinary wisdom is required to create such mighty Divine Techniques!
It's not just Meng Bi who thinks this way; every beastman who knows about the existence of the Beastman Three Techniques thinks this way.
To repay the favor His Highness Austin has shown to him, Meng Bi has set a small target: to master the use and skills of the Beastman Three Techniques proficiently within this year!
However, what restricts his use of the Beastman Three Techniques is not just the intensity of his body, but also Fighting Qi.
Regarding Fighting Qi, because Austin does not want to modify him at the expense of the benefits of the ancestral bloodline, the Fighting Qi within him mostly results from his own cultivation. There was no one-step Dragon Vein Transformation, so now the Fighting Qi within him is still very thin.
Just relying on the cultivation breathing technique results in thin Fighting Qi in a short time, which cannot meet the basic requirements of the Beastman Three Techniques.
It's precisely because of this that, although he performed exceptionally well during the mercenary attack battle and awakened ancestral bloodline leading to his promotion into the Dragon Vein Attendant team, Meng Bi knows that his strength is far weaker than an average Dragon Vein Attendant.
"Ancestral bloodline cannot control freely yet. Fine, today I decide to do five thousand more push-ups and ten thousand squats..."
On the open ground, the jackal wolf youth Meng Bi sweats like rain.
The Copper Ore Base holds a relatively important position within the Dragon Nest Tribe, as it is generally staffed with over ten extraordinary beastman elites for a long duration, and Meng Bi is one of them, having been stationed here half a month ago.
However, compared to other extraordinary beastmen patroling the surroundings or cultivating the Beastman Three Techniques, Meng Bi has been diligently training, improving his physical condition, hoping to meet the most basic requirement of the Beastman Three Techniques.
Currently, the intensity of Meng Bi's training is at least twice that of ordinary extraordinary beastmen.
In fact, after activating the ancestral bloodline, Meng Bi's strength would see a leap of improvement. With strong physical prowess, the Beastman Three Techniques would be at his fingertips, but unfortunately, except in crisis situations, he cannot actively activate the ancestral bloodline, hence his dissatisfaction.
Strong, become even stronger!
Only then can he repay His Highness Austin for his kindness and ensure his sister's safety!
As Meng Bi sweats like rain, striving to train himself, while the beastmen in the base come and go, making copper and iron weapons.
Boom!!!
A gigantic shadow, like a falling comet, descended from the sky and crashed onto the earth.
The earth shook violently, large swathes of soil were like being bombed by meteors, lifted like waves, creating a torrent whirlwind that blew fiercely, the air stream like a tsunami extending endlessly, sweeping to all directions.
"Who's your head! Get out here!!!"
A thunderous shout pierced the heavens and earth. Through the swirling dust, a strong wind swept over, tearing apart the haze to reveal a wildly arrogant, dominant figure.
A lion-headed man with a ferocious scar on his face, his body adorned in golden shimmer!
The lion-headed man stood in the center of a massive circular crater, the ground around him shattered like glass, spiderweb-like cracks spreading out, standing there emitting an oppressive domineering aura which impaired the breathing of ordinary beastmen not far away.
"Who are you!"
Though somewhat panicked by the overwhelmingly domineering lion-headed man, the Dragon Nest Beastmen patrol team swiftly ran forward, surrounded him with sharp spears in hand, while the surrounding beastmen miners scrambled back to their rooms, donning armor and grabbing weapons.
"I am Golden Lion Shiji of the Blood Claw Tribe! Are you the leader of this garbage? Kneel before me!"
The lion-headed man Golden Lion Shiji roared, stepping hard on the ground, emitting golden light from his body, soaring like a ferocious dragon into the sky, golden aura enveloping him as billowing vapor exploded upwards intimidating the heavens.
Boom!!!
Amidst a tremendous booming sound, vast expanses of land cracked as the terrifying aura swept all around.
In this Kawa Great Forest, a bigger fist is the truth.
Golden Lion Shiji firmly believes that as long as he kills the leader of these beastmen, he can recruit all of them under his banner and obtain the method for this mass production of metal armor and weapons—this is the raw survival law within a beastman tribe.
"A bunch of garbage waste, though I don't know how you managed to off Grom, but your Golden Lion master here is not someone who cannot even break through Silver level waste, watch the fist!"
Shiji spoke little, and he needed few words as this tribe seemed somewhat strange, but there were only about ten or so bronze-level extraordinary beastmen—the level of strength that could not resist he who had already achieved Gold-level Great Warrior!
Today, this tribe is doomed to be destroyed!
With a punch thrown, winds and clouds stirred!
At that moment, the rolling aura surged forward, golden Fighting Qi condensed in the fist and erupted, billowing golden waves like overturning tsunamis, about to engulf all the Dragon Nest beastmen troops present...

chapters.title: Chapter 170 - 166 Chaotic Battle
chapters.content:
BOOM!!!
The earth shattered, and currents of air roared, sweeping like a torrent. The foremost Beastmen were immediately blown away, crashing down loudly, leaving a gap in the Beastman military formation ahead.
"Be careful, Long Spear Array!"
An Extraordinary Beastman roared, and dozens of Beastman soldiers gathered together, forming a tight forest of spears, surrounding Golden Lion Shiji in the center.
At the same time, several Beastman Captains sprang out, their internal Fighting Qi igniting, rushing toward Golden Lion Shiji like raging bears.
Before finding a suitable military formation for the Extraordinary Beastmen, Austin intended to reform the Beastman Legion similar to the leadership of the One Piece Navy, where Extraordinary Beastmen lead a group of ordinary Beastman subordinates, coordinating with each other to maximize their fighting power.
These elite Beastmen acting as officers engage the enemy, while their subordinates provide support and distraction.
Six Extraordinary Beastmen charged out. Although their cultivation of Fighting Qi was short, Austin had also brought some scientific fitness training methods from his past life into this world. After rigorous training, each Extraordinary Beastman had significantly improved in strength.
With all six attacking simultaneously, their fierce momentum felt like a mountain crashing down, sweeping forward powerfully.
"Haha, a few scraps want to deal with your grandpa Shiji! Go to hell!"
Facing the combined assault of six Captain-level Extraordinary Beastmen, Golden Lion Shiji did not retreat but instead advanced, shouting loudly. His voice was like thunder, as if golden bolts clashing. Golden Fighting Qi swept out, like flames swirling around him.
"Die, die, die!"
Shiji roared repeatedly, his fists stirring like a storm, generating a whistling wind that left a sky full of afterimages, breaking through the air with a faint rumble like rolling thunder.
Bam bam bam.....
In the continuous muffled sounds, the six elite Beastmen at the Captain level couldn't avoid the attack. They could only put their hands in front defensively, but were struck by the sky-filling shadows, sending their bodies flying backward like cannonballs, leaving long trails.
"Not good, attack!"
Seeing the captains defeated, the surrounding Beastman soldiers did not rush forward with long spears in hand. The densely packed spear forest shimmered coldly, and beneath this tight spear array, the Beastmen stepped uniformly, surging forward without any chaos. Golden Lion Shiji, surrounded in the middle, felt as if facing a spear forest tsunami, a sensation of having nowhere to escape.
"Good!"
Seeing these Beastman soldiers, Golden Lion Shiji couldn't help but be slightly impressed.
In the entire Kawa Great Forest, all the tribal Beastmen fought by charging en masse, following powerful leaders. Their ranks were chaotic, where had there ever been such formations?
After years of battle, he had only encountered this feeling when facing elite human legions. This wild Beastman Tribe had such elite Beastman troops?
If he could subdue them under his command, wouldn't that greatly enhance the strength of his own forces!
"Get out of my way!"
He admired them indeed, but to make them submit, the only means was to defeat them all!
With a roar, like a rageful thunder breaking open the sky, the king of beasts' aura swept over. Shiji stomped onto the ground, his golden Fighting Qi exploded, rolling outward like breaking brittle branches, flinging large swathes of soil into the air.
Whoosh!
The air waves emptied with the sound of flowing water, Fighting Qi swept like a flood.
Like raging waves, like torrents, like boiling magma surging and flowing, the first Beastman soldiers who charged forward were immediately blown away, crashing down in the distance, while the Beastman soldiers behind were also swaying in the storm of the flood.
In just a face-to-face encounter, whether the Captain-level Extraordinary Beastmen or the Beastman formation, they were all at a disadvantage.
However, after so much bloody fighting and training, these Dragon Nest Beastmen forces were already unified with resolute will, showing no signs of defeat. As the comrades in front fell, those behind continued to surge forward without a trace of fear.
Meanwhile, outside the militiamen and Beastman producers were all armed and swarming in. Due to the rapid expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the entire tribe's population had greatly increased, and combined with the importance of the Copper Ore Base, there were currently over a thousand Dragon Nest Beastmen gathered.
Though at this Copper Ore Base only about a hundred were regular Dragon Nest soldiers, most were militiamen and Beastman producers, anyone integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe as prisoners had been well-trained before. Equipped with weapons and armor, although not comparable to the regular Dragon Nest Legion, they were far superior to other Beastman troops within the Kawa Forest.
With the delay from the Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers, the thousand Beastman militiamen and producers had now swarmed forward.
Extraordinary Beastmen are not invincible, even at the Gold Level. Before reaching Legendary, the Fighting Qi they use comes from within. Once the Fighting Qi is exhausted, they're only a few times stronger than regular Beastmen physically.
If there are a thousand Beastman soldiers, even if Golden Lion Shiji slaughters them all head-on, he would grow weary of killing and likely exhaust his Fighting Qi under such a siege.
If it were an ordinary Beastman force, Shiji could down a few of the fiercest individuals with heavy attacks and easily rout them with his overpowering presence. Yet, after the earlier clash, how could he not realize the prowess of this unknown tribe?
"What are you guys standing there for? Get moving!"
Golden Lion Shiji kicked a few advancing Beastman soldiers flying, his Fighting Qi surging out, sweeping through, blasting over a dozen more away as the densely packed Beastman horde surged up again, making him furiously shout in frustration.
"Hahaha, Shiji, even you have a day like this!"
"Being besieged by a bunch of little mice, what a disgrace!"
Along with hearty laughter, over twenty Beastman Transcendents charged out from the mountain forest. They were the Blood Claw Tribe's team who had come alongside Shiji, rushing at the Dragon Nest Beastman army like wolves and tigers.
With the addition of fresh forces, the Dragon Nest Beastmen instantly fell into a disadvantage.Follow current novels on NoveIＦire.net
"Damn it!"
Golden Lion Shiji's face also turned unsightly. He underestimated these Beastman soldiers.
It seemed that fool Grom indeed perished at the hands of this strange tribe. The Beastman soldiers in front of him, most had developed Qi Sensitivity, half a step into the Extraordinary Gate, plus their tightly coordinated spear formation, and those formidable Extraordinary Beastman Captains; only Silver peak Grom couldn't possibly have withstood it.

chapters.title: Chapter 171 - 167 Fierce Battle
chapters.content:
This elite force, coupled with such fearless prowess, even he himself might be caught off guard and suffer a fate in a ditch under this tribe's relentless attack, not to mention that fool Grom.
In just a moment or two, Golden Lion Shiji contemplated many things.
However, what he didn't know was that compared to a year ago, the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen had greatly improved.
A year ago, before Austin led the Dragon Nest Tribe Clan to attack the Blood Claw Tribe Branch, the entire tribe population was merely around a thousand, primarily comprising middle and lower-tier Beastmen races, and the Extraordinary Beastmen within the tribe were also newly transformed, with their power still in its initial stages.
But now, after a year of development, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe's population has exceeded twenty thousand, allowing them to select more outstanding personnel and supplement them with more training.
Moreover, after a year of development, Austin has introduced scientific training methods from his previous life into this world, promoting the Breathing Technique throughout the Legion, and created the Beastman Three Techniques from modifying the Navy Six Techniques. With these actions, the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastman Legion's strength has dramatically increased compared to the past.
Furthermore, during the cold winter, the Dragon Nest Legion set out to hunt various types of Giant Beasts, which not only brought battle experience to the Beastman soldiers but also significantly enhanced their physiques with the Giant Beast meat.
Now, any two or three ordinary Dragon Nest Beastman soldiers can even contend against the transformed Extraordinary Beastmen of a year ago. Such rapid improvement led Golden Lion Shiji to mistakenly believe that the Blood Claw Tribe Branch was wiped out by the "tribe" before him.
"Very well, let's cripple you first, then consider recruitment!"
Golden Lion Shiji wore a sinister smile as his Fighting Qi surged throughout his body, ready to burst into the beastman army for a massacre.
Just then,
"Iron Block: Mountain Collapse!"
A silhouette suddenly flashed across the sky with the speed of lightning, appearing in front of him, bringing down a power akin to lifting a mountain and crushing a peak.
BOOM!!!
Golden Lion Shiji only managed to cross his arms above his head when the massive force erupted like a volcanic blast, akin to a thunderous roar, resonating through the sky with earth-shattering noise as the immense power exploded forth!
Golden Lion Shiji felt as if an iron mountain had crashed down on him, and he was quickly embedded into the ground under the intense pressure, causing the surrounding soil to collapse from invisible pressure, with a massive surge akin to a tsunami sweeping outward, forcing the Dragon Nest Beastman soldiers nearby to retreat a few steps.
"Meng Bi?!!"
Seeing the Jackal Wolf Youth atop Golden Lion Shiji, the surrounding beastmen were all taken aback.
At this moment, the youth was nearly completely beastified, with blood-red pupils reflecting the Cross Beast Eyes, his hair bristling like steel cords stretching his skin, and his whole body burning with a red flame like a blood qi cauldron.
"Everyone, go help on the other side. I'll deal with this guy!"
Meng Bi's arms, forged like iron, pressed firmly onto Golden Lion Shiji, beneath whom the ground suddenly shattered like glass, with web-like cracks spreading outward.
"Good kid, it's actually an Ancestral Bloodline!"Thɪs novelꞁire.net
Shiji stared intently at the Jackal Wolf Youth Meng Bi, but his face revealed a fierce smile.
His arms, originally crossed, withdrew his right hand instantly, and with fearsome power, he punched forth like a cannonball, shattering the air and landing on Meng Bi.
BANG!
With a resounding thud, Meng Bi was sent flying, the ground crumbling like tofu, and the fine soil firing like bullets in all directions, as Meng Bi scraped out a deep trench on the ground.
Dust filled the air as their eyes met.
"Never thought I'd encounter a beastman with Ancestral Bloodline in a place like this... Very well, let me test your strength!"
Golden Lion Shiji clenched his fists, producing a popping sound akin to firecrackers, while he stared fiercely at Meng Bi opposite him.
Eyeing the towering over three-meter figure radiating constant terrifying aura, whose immense shadow seemed to block the sky before him, Meng Bi felt no fear, only a strong sense of battle filled his mind.
After triggering the bloodline, Meng Bi's physique and Fighting Qi had increased over tenfold, controlling such a powerful body, Meng Bi felt extremely confident.
The Beastman Three Techniques, which he would not be able to utilize normally, were now effortlessly performed, akin to walking and running. In this state, filled with battle intent, Meng Bi even instinctively improved upon the Beastman Three Techniques with ease.
