Earlier, his Iron Block: Mountain Collapse was an extension and improvement of the Beastman Three Techniques; he first used Swift Step to instantly move above Golden Lion Shiji, then exerted technique in mid-air using Swift Step again, kicking the air to gain downward momentum, simultaneously using Iron Block to crash down with tremendous force.
During this process, not only did Meng Bi instinctively use the Beastman Three Techniques seamlessly, he even utilized Swift Step as a foundation to demonstrate an air step that Austin had once theoretically discussed but hadn't attempted to complete.
"Swift Step!"
Meng Bi uttered few words, knowing his current condition was not ideal, as triggering Ancestral Bloodline comes at a cost; the acquisition of power comes with tremendous pain.
The sensation of magma flowing through the veins, scorching the muscles, meant he wasn't fit for a prolonged battle, and the longer the fight, the higher the likelihood of failure.
BANG!!!
The ground below collapsed and caved, as Meng Bi's silhouette disappeared in an instant.
Even with Golden Lion Shiji's keen observation, he could only see a streak of blood-red lightning surging towards him, and while still mid-air, the blood-red lightning swiftly spun.
Gale Wave·Swift Spin!
With his right foot as the pivot, Meng Bi spun rapidly like a drill, the blood-red light wave like crimson bands swirling, seeming to tear the air apart, along with fierce winds, drilling towards Golden Lion Shiji's head!
"Good timing!"
Golden Lion Shiji roared, his huge palms churning Fighting Qi, as if cast in gold, unleashed with more speed and fierceness, slapping the air like rumbling thunder, bearing the might to smash mountains and crush rocks, striking towards Meng Bi.

chapters.title: Chapter 172 - 168 Extension
chapters.content:
Like a hurricane, like thunder, wind and thunder surged, a force like a tidal wave roared across the sky, swirling backwards, carrying the power of shattering air as it erupted upwards.
Zzzzz...
The crimson drilling light collided with the golden sea-like fighting qi, causing the air to vibrate violently. The clash sounded like striking metal, sending visible ripples sweeping outwards in all directions like ocean waves.
Bang! Bang! Bang!
Under the immense force, the ground beneath Golden Lion Shiji's feet shattered extensively, rapidly spreading in all directions as powerful energy swept through, causing surrounding Beastmen soldiers to retreat.
"Heh, kid, you're still far off!"
Shiji grinned, a menacing smile appearing on his face.
His massive palms, like iron plates, had sharp claws extending from deep within his fingertips. The golden fighting qi rising around him surged violently through his palms, collapsing layers of airflow in an instant, forming a gale, as surrounding air rapidly converged, creating a massive vortex in the sky.
Boom!!!
Fighting qi like a vast sea swept across the sky, moving hundreds of meters within its radius, turning into a towering pillar of fighting qi, spiraling upward and forming a sky-reaching tornado!
Meng Bi was in mid-air, caught by the flow of fighting qi, and like a leaf in a storm, he helplessly swept up in the torrent of fighting qi.
"Aerial Step·Continuous Kick!"
Blown tens of meters into the air, Meng Bi kicked the air multiple times consecutively, his body bouncing in mid-air, soon disappearing with a whoosh, breaking through the tornado torrent and abruptly appearing in the high skies beside it with a crimson glow.
"Gale Wave·Sword Rain!"
Still in mid-air, Meng Bi took a deep breath, his feet kicking dozens of times in an instant, creating a series of crimson afterimages.
Each kick sliced through the air, forming consecutive vacuum slashing waves, merging with the fighting qi, turning into a blood-red barrage of swords raining down!
Whoosh! Whoosh! Whoosh!!!
Crimson gales bloomed in the sky like fireworks, then, like bullets shot from a machine gun, pierced the air with incredible speed and power, crashing down rapidly.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel★fire.net
Boom! Boom! Boom!
In the continuous rumbling, an area centered around Golden Lion Shiji was bombarded by the crimson slashing waves within a hundred-meter radius. Massive chunks of soil were blasted away, then shredded into fragments mid-air, with stones shooting out like bullets as smoke and dust soared, covering half of the sky.
In such an intense battle, the Beastmen around retreated further and further, watching the scene in awe.
"That boy Meng Bi can actually reach such a level!"
Among those present, the only Elite Dragon Vein Attendant watching the scene showed an expression of disbelief on his face.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe expanded, Austin allocated dozens of slots for Beastman modifications, raising the number of Extraordinary Beastmen in the Dragon Nest Tribe to about a hundred.
Among these hundred Extraordinary Beastmen, strengths varied, and the most elite were the twenty selected from all Extraordinary Beastmen for the Beastman Six Techniques development.
Being capable of undertaking the magic-modified development of the Navy Six Techniques meant their physical capabilities were top-notch within the Dragon Nest Tribe. After completing the Beastman Three Techniques modification, each Dragon Vein Attendant's strength advanced further, thus becoming the elite of the elite, known as Elite Dragon Vein Attendants.
The entire Copper Ore Base was stationed by an elite Dragon Vein Attendant named Pedra as the highest-ranking officer, overseeing the base's security defense.
Even as one of the top twenty experimental group members, Pedra was currently only familiar with using Iron Block and Gale Wave, just getting started with Aerial Step.
And now, this young fellow named Meng Bi not only mastered the Beastman Three Techniques but also integrated them and extended them into other combat techniques?!
"Remarkable! Moreover, the Beastman Three Techniques could be extended in such a manner with such immense power!"
Seeing Meng Bi achieve such a state after activating his Ancestral Bloodline, Pedra gasped in awe, his admiration for the great His Highness Austin deepening.
However, amidst his amazement, Pedra also felt a vague sense of unease. Judging by the current battle, Meng Bi indeed seemed to have the upper hand, yet Pedra somehow perceived the scales of victory tipping towards the enemy.
Pedra frowned, wondering why he felt like Meng Bi was about to lose.
Huff, huff, huff....
At this moment, Meng Bi was suspended in mid-air, having kicked out dozens or perhaps hundreds of crimson slashing waves, beads of sweat on his forehead, breathing heavily. The explosive pain within was nearing its limit, leaving him utterly exhausted, at his last breath.
"Huff, huff... did I win?"
Staring intently at the smokey area within a hundred-meter radius below, with the blood-colored flames wrapping around him about to burn out like firewood, the once fiercely burning flame seemed to be reaching its limit, about to extinguish, with his vision blurring and his swaying body about to fall.
By now, Meng Bi had reached his limit; activating the Ancestral Bloodline granted him over tenfold strength, and a body governed by a killing instinct, but at a cost of more than tenfold the consumption and a violent pain like magma flowing through his veins.
"I should have won..."
The previous move, kicking out hundreds or thousands of slashing light waves, was the strongest attack Meng Bi could currently muster, capable of obliterating even a Silver Level Extraordinary to dust under such intense bombardment.
However, just as Meng Bi's tense muscles were about to relax,
Boom!!!
With a tremendous roar, the vast smoke was instantly torn apart by a powerful invisible impact, revealing a gigantic crater on the ground within a hundred-meter span. With the terrifying impact, pieces of fractured stones and soil suddenly floated into the air as if losing gravity.
No one present had time to think, not even Meng Bi, before a sharp, piercing whistle instantly shattered the scene before him. A shadow shot out like a cannonball, tearing through the air with a screeching sonic boom, swiftly drawing a long dragon-like trail of air in the sky.
"Hahaha! Kid, that was a pretty good combat technique, but your skill is lacking!"
The air wave streaked across the sky like a sword, the ground upheaving along its path before Meng Bi could react. The golden-furred Shiji, stained with blood, appeared in front of him, crashing down with mountain-crushing force!

chapters.title: Chapter 173 - 169 Timely Appearance
chapters.content:
Boom!
An enormous sound akin to muffled thunder echoed, as if the air itself had been shattered. A terrifying power crashed onto Meng Bi, sending his entire body flying like a cannonball for hundreds of meters, flinging him out of the battlefield.
Boom boom boom!
One giant tree after another crumbled, the ground collapsed, and clouds of dust rose up.
At this moment, Golden Lion Shiji wasn't in much better shape, his entire body covered in wounds, as if he's been flayed alive, soaked in blood.
However, these injuries looked terrifying but were merely flesh wounds; they didn't even cut through the skin deeply enough to harm the muscles underneath.
After Meng Bi's powers returned to their ancestral state, he grew more than ten times stronger. His primal instincts in this state perfectly executed the Beastman Three Techniques, extending into various remarkably damaging combat techniques.
Unfortunately, his foundation was lacking.
Due to this weak foundation, even with a tenfold increase, the Beastman Three Techniques still couldn't be considered truly powerful. Perhaps the destructive force of Gale Wave was sufficient for Silver-level Extraordinaries, but Golden Lion Shiji was a genuine Gold-level Beastman Great Warrior.
As Meng Bi's kicks unleashed a sky full of Gale Waves, Golden Lion Shiji's vast golden Fighting Qi surged forth. Though unskilled in defensive combat techniques, he continuously expelled Fighting Qi from within, and merely this emitted aura was enough to fend off the sword rain filling the sky.
"To achieve this level at quasi-Silver, you should be proud, but today you must die!"
Endless killing intent filled Golden Lion Shiji's eyes, his face twisted with fury as he looked in Meng Bi's direction, his eyes fiery red, blood-like. To be beaten to such a state by a mere kid—though not greatly harmed—this disgraceful situation would be his greatest joke!
This kid must pay the price!
"Kid, I will make you die!"
Shiji crossed hundreds of meters in an instant, surging forward.
The dust was suddenly blasted away, revealing Meng Bi lying limp in the crater, arms broken, blood trickling from his mouth.
Too fast!
In an instant, the situation was reversed, even Petra had no time to react, as Shiji descended like a golden meteor to the ground, relying on the last sliver of consciousness, Meng Bi endured the pain of broken bones all over, and managed to flip over.
Rumble!!!
Covered in blood and like a meteor striking the earth, Shiji shattered large sections of soil, sending fragments flying skywards with the airstream, taking Meng Bi's severely injured body with it, tossing and rolling on the ground in dizziness.
If Meng Bi hadn't turned over at the last moment using that faint awareness, he might have been squashed like a cockroach on the spot.
But no time to celebrate; Shiji was relentless, determined to take the life of this young Jackal Wolf Person.
"Die!!!
"Sharp claws tore through the air, emitting shrill screeches, as they descended swiftly toward the head of the prone Meng Bi.
A terrifying killing aura coalesced on the sharp nails, the gleaming red fighting qi emanating from them like a frigid glow. Even a hard stone would be smashed like tofu under such force.
The elite Extraordinary Beastmen around were unable to rescue, and Meng Bi had exhausted all his strength, seemingly about to perish under Golden Lion Shiji.
At this critical juncture,
Boom!!!
Golden Lion Shiji felt a sudden lightning strike in his mind, slamming violently, stirring waves of shock.
At that moment, Shiji felt as if he were plunging into a chasm of despair, a terrifying sensation of impending descent into the Nine Netherworld Hell.
A frigid cold, chilling to the bone, enveloped Shiji in an instant, making him feel like a splash of cold water in the depths of winter, icy to the core.
"Who is there!"
Before anyone could react, Golden Lion Shiji sprang back and swiftly swerved his body to the right.
The sensation in that instant saved his life!
Rumble!!!
A true transformation descended, a pillar of dazzling blue light erupted from the horizon, its brilliance blanketing the sky, dimming the entire heavens and earth.
In one millionth of a second, the column seemed to pierce through the void, bringing rolling thunder from above, its terrifying power plummeting toward Shiji!
Boom boom boom!
Anything in the path of the blue light column—be it trees or rocks—was pierced in an instant, finally crashing like a meteor onto the forest land thousands of meters away, exploding with dreadful energy, forming a mushroom cloud. A visible shockwave swept like a tsunami, engulfing everything, toppling swathes of trees.Read complete version only at novel•fire.net
Golden Lion Shiji quickly leapt back, clutching his right shoulder with his left hand, horrified at the distant sky.
The sixth sense in that moment allowed Shiji to dodge a fatal blow from the light pillar. However, his shoulder was pierced by the terrifying blue light column, leaving a bowl-sized hole, blood flowing freely.
All Beastmen halted their actions, gazing toward the horizon.
Rumbling thunder roared across heaven and earth, and then a rolling cloud swept in from the sky, covering the sky as if it were toppling mountains and overturning seas, instantly shrouding the entire region, plunging everything into a darkened world, as if excluded from all existence.
Clouds heavy as mountains loomed overhead, seemingly within arm's reach. Everyone present felt a pressure radiating from the Blood Claw Tribe's elite Beastmen, feeling uneasy.
Whoosh!
A great gale howled, sending sand and stones flying between heaven and earth, amidst flashing lightning illuminating the sky, a massive shadow descended from high above, spreading an overwhelming dragon's wrath.
"Intruders, you are courting death!"
Staring down at the Copper Ore Base he'd painstakingly built, now battered in this battle with barely a fraction remaining, Austin felt an inferno of rage.
His most valued logistics base was destroyed to such extent, and the troops he had trained with great effort were severely crippled, losing thirty to forty percent in this encounter. Had he arrived any later, the entire base might have been utterly broken.
Especially when zombies appeared, at a time when Copper Armor and Spear were desperately needed, this incident was simply a death wish!

chapters.title: Chapter 174 - 170 Reason
chapters.content:
Austin was furious. Not long ago, when he went to the western lands to investigate the source of the anomaly, he was almost killed by the pyramid built by those zombies, making him no longer dare to approach the core areas like the pyramid closely and could only observe from a distance.
However, the more he probed, the more things he discovered that shocked Austin's heart and spirit. After spending several days, he couldn't even explore the extent of the anomalous land,
The vast area eroded by the strange green mist was simply too large. One could even say that the land to the west of the Dragon Nest Tribe had completely turned into a wasteland of apocalypse, a zone rampant with zombies, spreading outwards like a virus.
Despite experiments, Austin discovered that the zombie virus-like eerie power couldn't spread through the air. While it could spread through water flow, it was confined to surviving a period on the polluted, eroded wasteland before gradually zombifying. Living creatures outside the eroded wasteland would only be infected if bitten and injured by those zombie animals or beastmen.
But Austin also discovered that the eroded wasteland was gradually spreading outward!
Or rather, as the zombie creatures continued to move outward, the land was continually being eroded, gradually losing its vitality, turning into a wasteland of rampant decay.
It was certain that to resist the spread of the infected wasteland, one could only keep the zombified creatures outside, blocking their path, or completely annihilate all zombie creatures.
Although it's unknown exactly what the pyramid built by the zombies was or what was capable of such terrifying attacks, it was impossible for Austin to simply do nothing and move the entire Dragon Nest Tribe to escape.
At least the day he discovered the pyramid, Austin's body was already flying high in the air, several hundred miles into the wasteland region, where he found those things. For the Dragon Nest Tribe far away, such terrifying things weren't a threat for the moment.
Despite the grim prospects, Austin still decided to launch the Dragon Nest Beastmen to resist a few waves of attacks to test the situation.
The zombified creatures weren't frightening. At least from Austin's viewpoint, if a team equipped with neat Copper Armor and Spear in a Long Spear Array faced three to four times more zombified creatures of equal quality directly, they could still be victorious.
After zombification, a creature's strength indeed increased significantly, but they also lost the crucial intelligence. Austin's Dragon Nest Legion was not comparable to ordinary beastmen teams. After rigorous training, the tight-knit Dragon Nest Beastmen Long Spear Array was enough to render the opponent helpless. The foolishly charging zombie creatures ended only in easily being slaughtered.
Austin's Dragon Nest Legion wasn't like other tribes' beastman warriors. The scattered beastman zombies had no advantage other than sheer numbers against the Dragon Nest Legion. These Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers, formed through tough training, were also Austin's greatest confidence.
To strengthen preparations, Austin decided to start a large expansion once again, deciding to promote all beastman militia of the Dragon Nest Tribe to formal soldiers.
With many troops joining, the primary problem to solve was weaponry and armor.
To obtain more weapons and increase the Dragon Nest Tribe's weapon production, Austin directly flew to the Copper Ore Base, intending to learn the situation at the Copper Mine Base.
This was why Austin made this journey to the Copper Mine Base.This update is available on novel·fire.net
However, what he didn't expect was that just halfway there, he sensed the intense aftermath of a Fighting Qi explosion in the distance.
From high in the sky, Austin saw the battle within the Copper Mine Base, looking like tiny soybeans several kilometers away. The battle's aftermath not only destroyed most of the earthen blast furnaces in the Copper Mine Base but also continuously injured beastman soldiers. A young Jackal Wolf person with Ancestral Bloodline, whom he once cared about, was now teetering under the fierce attack of the enemy, about to fall to his death.
In such a situation, Austin couldn't endure any longer and immediately launched a modified version of the Thunder Roar Cannon, which shot out fiercely, traversing miles of the sky, instantly piercing a hole in the shoulder of the over three-meter-tall golden lion beastman.
Thanks to the magic-modified development of the Navy Six Techniques, Austin began pondering changes to his attack methods during his free time. Using the "Chidori" from "Naruto" as a blueprint, he relied on his natural control over Thunder to gather powerful Thunder Power in his mouth, condensing it extremely to form a laser beam the size of a bowl, instantly shooting out. Even over a distance of several miles, it still held terrifying power.
If it weren't for the golden lion beastman's natural, keen Sixth Sense saving him, his head would have been blown to pieces by now.
Boom!!!
Under the heavy mountain-like dark clouds, a gigantic Blue Dragon descended from the sky, thunder and lightning flickering all around, its blinding radiance tearing through the sky, as if bringing judgment to the world.
Golden Lion Shiji held his shoulder and looked up at the sky viciously. Ancient and solemn pressure descended with the gusty airflow, sweeping across heaven and earth, making it feel like a mountain was pressing down on his entire shoulder.
"Dragon! A dragon!"
Currently, Austin hadn't crossed the threshold of the quasi-Golden boundary, so his cultivation tier was somewhat inferior to Golden Lion Shiji's.
However, Austin belonged to the Giant Dragon Species, inherently standing atop with his top-level Legendary Bloodline!
Two years ago, when he was weak, Austin barely survived by relying on ordinary prey, even gnawing on dirt and eating bark to grow. Due to only absorbing magic power from the air and not devouring enough magic resources as a young dragon, his growth was far behind an average young dragon, and his strength was extremely poor. He only awakened a useless Talent Magic of Electric Shock Paralysis, incapable of dealing with even a first or second-tier pack of magic beast Blood Wolves, considered a failure among young dragons.
But during this period, Austin never abandoned using Electric Shock Paralysis to stimulate and train his body. After starting to manage the Clan Tribe, with the Dragon Nest Tribe's growth, it began with an incomplete magic beast Crystal Core of a Ghost-headed Crocodile leader, then a Blood Wolf leader, and then the magic crystal inside the Spider Cave.
Later, as the Dragon Nest Tribe became extremely powerful, he ventured out to continuously hunt giant beasts and slaughtered wandering magic beasts to obtain magic beast Crystal Cores, also gathering magic-power-infused plants and fruits back. With unlimited magic resources, Austin's tier quickly rose from Bronze Level to the current quasi-Gold level.

chapters.title: Chapter 175 - 171: Lord of Thunder
chapters.content:
Compared to other young dragons that can only reach certain tiers and realms during their twenties or thirties, Austin's growth speed is undeniably fast.
With personal growth and broadened horizons from various experiences, Austin has developed some conjectures after acquiring sufficient Magic Power resources that allow him to advance rapidly.
Firstly, lightning has an excellent stimulating effect on Magic Power, and Austin accelerated his physical growth through continuous electric body tempering. Subsequently, after absorbing enough Magic Power resources, he can grow quickly.
Secondly, Austin is not a native Blue Dragon but a Transmigrator, his soul is several times stronger than an ordinary young dragon.
Perhaps during the growth of the Giant Dragons, some discovered that electricity could stimulate the growth of a young dragon's body and level.
However, young dragons need a lot of time to sleep during their growth period, mainly because their souls struggle to mature.
The Giant Dragon Race has enviable longevity and powerful noble bloodlines, but while they are biologically strong, they naturally have flaws — the young dragon's soul requires a lot of time to gradually grow.
If trained with lightning during the young dragon stage to promote body development, the immature soul could become burdened by the powerful body, turning the dragon into an idiot dragon, losing out in the end. Perhaps that's why the Dragon Race's inheritance doesn't mention electrical stimulation aiding growth.
But Austin is different. Due to his transmigrated soul, it is naturally several times, even ten times stronger than other newly-born hatchlings. As it gradually merges with his body, it grows rapidly without the worry of the soul failing to keep up with the body's growth, causing soul collapse.
This conjecture is not without reason. It is a presumption Austin made based on his own growth. Compared with other hatchlings, he indeed needs very little sleep time, and he can clearly perceive the external situation.
Although powerful upon reaching adulthood, Giant Dragons are very weak during their youth.
This is precisely why, two years ago during his initial stage, Austin couldn't even fend off a wolf pack, but after rapid growth, he could challenge higher tiers.
Due to a weak body, many powers of the Giant Dragons are sealed during the juvenile stage. As the tier increases, the various powerful abilities in the dragon's bloodline begin to manifest gradually.
First, Dragon Might gradually forms, then control over the thunder and lightning roaming the sky and earth, sensing the water vapor in the atmosphere, and even commanding storms and clouds.
All this is the result of Austin's awakening of powers as a Blue Dragon as his tier elevates!Read complete version only at nοvelfire.net
Blue Dragon, the Sky Sovereign, a terrifying existence wielding thunder and storms.
Now, Austin is continuously awakening the Legendary Bloodline as a Blue Dragon, revealing various intrinsic powers hidden deep within him!
Creatures like Giant Dragons have an overwhelming suppression effect on beings below Legendary. Even though Golden Lion Shiji is a Gold Tier Beastman Great Warrior, Austin's overwhelming aura is above his!
It is precisely because of this that Golden Lion Shiji looked at Austin in the sky with extreme seriousness, feeling an intimidating suppression from head to toe.
Combat power beneath Legendary is not measured by level. For instance, the Jackal Wolf People youth Meng Bi, who enters the Ancestral Bloodline state, can barely reach the quasi-Silver Level.
However, Meng Bi learned the Beastman Three Techniques, extending and modifying them through instinct, enabling him to counter even high Silver-level opponents.
Yet Austin, being a Giant Dragon Species, continuously activates the powers hidden in the dragon's bloodline, imposing a more terrifying suppression on Golden Lion Shiji than what Meng Bi achieves through combat techniques to enhance prowess!
Proficient in controlling thunder and lightning, and combining knowledge related to electricity from his past life for personal use, Austin has created various thunder and lightning combat techniques of his own. Even with Golden Lion Shiji at peak condition, Austin could crush him effortlessly, not to mention now that Shiji has been severely wounded, with only half of his strength remaining.
"So, this is the Clan Tribe you've established! It was a dragon after all, no wonder not a single Beastman could return from the destruction of a subdivision..."
At this moment, a realization dawned on Golden Lion Shiji. When facing this tribe, he felt something was amiss. With the elite Beastman soldiers of this tribe, plus several Beastman Transcendents, it should've been enough to besiege Grom, yet the entire subdivision's annihilation without even one Beastman escaping seemed implausible. But adding this dragon into the equation, everything makes sense.
"The one who destroyed the Blood Claw subdivision was you, this dragon!"
Golden Lion Shiji's voice was categorical, pointing at Austin with his only intact left hand.
"Blood Claw Tribe, so you are with them."
High above, amid raging winds and a storm of sand and stones, Austin hovered, casting a massive shadow, his majestic voice resounding across the land.
"Since you're here for revenge, I'll send you to the Divine Kingdom to meet them!"
As the words fell, Austin flapped his massive wings, causing a visible torrent to rise like an upheaving tsunami.
Above the cloud-covered skies, myriad thunders erupted from the heavens, torrents of electrical serpents tearing through the sky, descending in thousands of meters of blinding blue light, illuminating the entire sky.
The whole firmament was covered with lightning.
The explosive thunder, however, under Austin's heart spirit sensing, obediently gathered before him, becoming a vast sea of electrical light.
Sizzling.....
Thousands of shrill bird cries accompanied the scene, electric light engulfing the sky, embodying a terrifying divine wrath, making the Beastmen on Blood Claw Tribe's side feel chills down their backs, with cold sweat streaming down, and Golden Lion Shiji felt an ominous sense of impending doom.
Unbeknownst, the Dragon Nest Beastmen and Blood Claw Tribe separated, each on a different side, leaving Austin with no further worries.
BOOM!!!
The enormous membrane wings flapped, bringing the heavenly sea of lightning crashing like a meteor, illuminating half the sky.
Even while still mid-air, as Austin willed authority, the sea of lightning gathered and spread over his enormous claws, forming a celestial Thunderclaw that seemed to shatter the sky, crashing down towards the Blood Claw Tribe people.
"Your Highness, Blue Dragon, wait, we didn't come for revenge! We have important matters to discuss!"
Under the world-ending momentum, they felt plunged into an abyss of despair in an instant, as a voice shouted in panic during the critical moment.
But before the words fully left their mouth, the dreadful sky-spanning thunder clapped down.
BOOM!!!
A blinding white light, covering the sky, erupted magnificently!

chapters.title: Chapter 176 - 172: Legendary Bloodline
chapters.content:
Legendary, a legendary realm standing at the pinnacle above countless living beings, that is already exalted, even transcending the mundane.
Before the Legendary, even warriors and great mages at the peak of Gold still run the risk of being surrounded and killed by ordinary armies, though it would require thousands of human lives piled up to surround and slaughter a powerhouse of Gold level.
But a Legend above Gold has already surpassed humanity, transcended the mundane.
In the Human World, any Legend would be respectfully treated by noble kings, even if they likely emerged from humble slaves or commoners struggling in mud for survival.
When one achieves a Legendary status, they are rightfully exalted, and their descendants take pride in having Legendary Bloodlines flowing through their veins.
A single Legend is sufficient to create a royal lineage, a kingdom.
Because the Legendary Realm is already a mastery of the laws between heaven and earth, wielding terrifying power borrowed from the might of the heavens and earth!
This power that commands the winds and thunder, not to mention ordinary human armies, even an entire brigade of Bronze-level Extraordinary could be like ants, easily obliterated with a mere gesture.
No matter how many there are, it has no effect.
Because the power that Legends can invoke from heaven and earth is almost infinite, there is simply no situation where their power could be exhausted by numbers alone, and any Legend has already transformed into a terrifying being beyond humanity.
Each Legend's experiences can serve as extended heroic tales, as they break through the shackles imposed upon them by heaven and earth with their human bodies, successfully wielding the powers of the heavens with mortal flesh, each being one in a million.
To become a Legend, one must perceive the operation of heavenly rules, comprehend the structure of laws, and ultimately transcend the mundane to step into the legendary realm that commands the rules of heaven and earth.
During this process, talent, luck, and effort are all indispensable, and the threshold before the Heaven-Reaching Dao has obstructed countless individuals.
However, all these difficulties apply only to humans.
There exist unreasonable bloodlines in this world, and the Giant Dragon Race is one of them.
They don't need cultivation or comprehension of laws; they just need enough Magic Power resources to accumulate, sufficient sleep duration, and their bodies naturally transform and grow, eventually becoming Legends upon adulthood.
This is because the Legendary Law is imprinted in their Bloodline from birth. As they grow, the Legendary Law sealed within their Bloodline gradually becomes unsealed, naturally entering the Legendary Realm.
It can be said, from birth, the Dragon Race has embarked on the path to Legendary.Google seaʀᴄh novelFɪre.net
From the moment a dragon whelp is born, its growth is the process of the Legendary Law continuously coalescing into form, eventually crossing into that realm.
Though Austin's current tier is only a quasi-Gold level, as a Giant Dragon Species, he has already awakened part of the power to control thunder and storm, he can command the wind and thunder, which is the result of those Legendary Laws rooted in his Bloodline gradually reviving.
With these powers of Legendary level, even though Golden Lion Shiji is a true Gold-level Beastman Great Warrior, in front of Austin, there is absolutely no room for resistance; both his aura and battle strength are comprehensively suppressed.
In the gloomy heavens and earth, hundreds and thousands of bolts of lightning tear through the sky, striking down with Austin's paw, shooting upward into the sky.
Rumble!!!
As the terrifying thunder claw crashes down, a horrific explosion erupts suddenly, like a volcano suppressed for hundreds of years suddenly erupting, visible torrents and tsunamis rise to the sky, rushing straight to the horizon, obscuring half the sky.
Amidst the rolling smoke and dust, the enormous lightning splits open, arcs of light flare in the smoke like unbreakable laser gale waves, along its path, large swathes of soil crumble, fragmenting into gullies, and then exploding like a storm.
Bang bang bang!
Overwhelming explosions suddenly erupt.
The suppression of Bloodline, the suppression of Law, coupled with the power of heaven and earth, the Blood Claw Tribe's Beastmen present had no resistance, only managing to plead for mercy, immediately swept into this terrifying attack, like clothes tossed in a washing machine, tumbling and rolling in the explosive torrent.
Until the thunder in the arena dissipates, a dozen scorched figures with only a single breath remaining fell from the sky, unable to rise again.
"Cough cough..."
Golden Lion Shiji struggles to stand but stumbles and falls to the ground, spewing a mouthful of blood, only able to pantingly lie on the ground, drained of strength.
At this time, the original golden fur of Golden Lion Shiji had completely disappeared, the charred fur making him look like a piece of charcoal, wisps of white smoke rising from his body.
If he were in his prime, sacrificing his life for the strongest attack, Golden Lion Shiji's battle strength would suffice to severely wound Austin.
But he was first exhausted by Meng Bi who erupted with Ancestral Bloodline, then Austin shot him from afar with an improved Thunder Roar Cannon, crippling his shoulder, rendering his full strength only capable of exerting forty to fifty percent.
Afterwards, as Austin commanded the wind and thunder with the Blue Dragon Bloodline, gathering the strongest thunder attack currently usable, Golden Lion Shiji was left utterly powerless.
"Blood Claw Tribe's Beastmen, give me a reason not to kill you."
From the sky, Austin descends on a gale, causing the surrounding earth to rustle and resound.
The massive shadow falls, covering their entire bodies, Austin's ancient and solemn voice echoes in every Beastman's ears, filled with composure and majesty, striking directly at their hearts.
Looking at these charcoal-like lying figures on the ground, barely alive, claiming to be from the Blood Claw Tribe, Austin's face shows no change, his gaze full of scrutiny.
In an instant during the prior attack, Austin slightly shifted the thunder giant claw, leaving these Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen alive, hence they were barely left with a breath.
And just at that previous moment, a Blood Claw Tribe Beastman's shout suddenly made Austin think of something.
When discovering the Blood Claw Tribe's branch before, various signs had already indicated something was amiss. The Blood Claw Tribe is a renowned super-large tribe near the Bloody Border at the fringe of the Kawa Great Forest, why would they fully support, establish a branch located in such a remote place?
Clearly, the resources nearby aren't very rich, and maintaining a tribe of over a thousand in scale would necessitate substantial material support from the headquarters, why undertake such a thankless effort?
Perhaps, these Beastmen in front of him could provide him an answer.

chapters.title: Chapter 177 - 173: Mutated Evil Spirit
chapters.content:
The Blood Claw Tribe Branch established in this nearby location has always had numerous suspicions surrounding it.
Although this place is relatively remote, with no supernatural areas around for hundreds of kilometers, perhaps the lake reservoir that seems like a meteor crater beside Dragon Nest counts as one, but it's obvious that the Blood Claw Tribe didn't expend great effort to establish a branch here for this reason.
Considering the combined distance of several hundred kilometers and the primitive survival methods of the original Beastman Tribe, under normal circumstances, it would take at least one to two years for the Blood Claw Tribe to possibly react and send people to investigate.
But now, within less than half a year, the Blood Claw Tribe's Beastmen have already arrived here to investigate the situation, showing how much emphasis the Blood Claw Tribe places on this branch.
Such emphasis is clearly unusual.
The only possibility can only be that the Blood Claw Tribe has other extraordinary plans in establishing a branch here.
The purpose of the Blood Claw Tribe's plan, the previous branch's leader, Grom the Grizzly, might know a thing or two, but in that battle, he was blasted to oblivion by Austin, leaving no trace behind. The rest of the Dark Elves like Adinlek and other Extraordinary Beastmen don't know much either. They were only told to follow Grom the Grizzly, heading southeast to find a place to establish a base.
Why does the Blood Claw Tribe want to establish such a base? Austin doesn't know, but combining the previously discovered continuously infecting wasteland and those zombies, along with the recent movements of those large tribes near the Bloody Border, Austin has vague suspicions.
Leaving them alive is to determine if these suspicions are correct and to learn more.
"Cough cough... Esteemed His Highness Blue Dragon... We came here not only to investigate the division's destruction but most importantly to probe the movements of the evil spirits..."
A Silver-level Blood Claw Beastman struggled to stand and respectfully spoke towards Austin.
"Evil spirits? What are they?"For original chapters go to novel·fiɾe·net
...
Several days later,
The Copper Mine Base that was previously destroyed by battle had undergone some simple repairs, the broken blast furnace being rebuilt anew, and the Goblins had made certain modifications to the earth furnaces based on previous experience. However, the newly mixed clay hadn't dried yet, to prevent cracks from appearing, they could only wait for the furnace to naturally dry before continuing copper refining work.
Even though copper refining couldn't proceed due to the furnace issue, the Beastmen didn't sit idle.
A large number of Beastmen excavated chunk after chunk of copper ore from the mountain and transported them to the copper refining site where the furnace stood tall. Meanwhile, massive trees were felled and burned into charcoal in the furnace, piled high like a mountain and placed on the open space of the square.
The circulating Beastmen were all well-organized, everything orderly and steady, waiting only for the furnace to dry before throwing themselves into copper refining work.
If not for the gigantic claw marks deeply embedded in the ground, with web-like cracks spreading from the shattered earth and the overturned massive clods of soil left uncovered, these terrifying battle scars yet to be concealed, one might have thought this tranquil Copper Mine Base had never suffered an attack at all.
The injured from that assault battle had basically been escorted back to Dragon Nest Tribe's residence for treatment, and the captives were also locked with heavy copper chains and shackles and taken away.
Though the whole tribe seemed peaceful, the power spread from the battle—the Beastman Three Techniques, the ancestral bloodline power of Meng Bi, the formidable strength of His Highness Austin—was widely discussed throughout the tribe.
The most obvious manifestation being that some of the young Beastmen categorized as militia began training hard in their spare time, hoping one day to showcase such demeanor before everyone and earn the qualification to join the Dragon Nest Legion to cultivate the Beastman Three Techniques.
The impact from the Blood Claw Beastman's assault continues to spread within the Dragon Nest Tribe, reaping admiration and belief from many of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Only, at this moment, Austin, residing in the Dragon Nest, found himself in a troubling dilemma.
The trouble bothering him was the news brought by the Blood Claw Beastmen, a revelation that shook his confidence!
Without exceeding Austin's expectations, indeed, the Blood Claw Tribe's plans were related to those zombies in the west.
No, or it could be said that the Blood Claw Tribe expended vast resources to establish the branch here primarily for those zombies and the spreading wasteland!
And all of this traces back to the start with the evil spirits.
According to the Blood Claw Beastmen, the appearance of zombies is connected to the evil spirits.
Evil spirits are entities that harvest faith through panic and eeriness, and when accepting faith, they become tainted with boundless wicked thoughts forming into malevolent spirit bodies.
Initially, spirit bodies can harvest faith similarly to divine entities, surviving and gaining power from faith, yet they lack divine essence, unable to become divine. During this period, they're highly susceptible to wicked thought infection, descending into thorough evil spirits.
Evil spirits coerced intelligent creatures to worship and sacrifice with faith in fear, harvesting faith by using panic as a weapon, accumulating their ethereal form with fearful faith, becoming nightmares for intelligent creatures. They then spread more fear to gain additional faith, utilizing the terror and struggle within souls to gain stronger sources of power.
And some evil spirits rely on blood sacrifices, feasting on living flesh, acquiring more powerful strength through sacrificing the living flesh of intelligent life forms.
Yet no matter the type of evil spirit, these inherently wicked beings are almost universally hated across the entire continent.
However, as long as there is demand, the soil for their survival exists.
Despite those who believe in evil spirits ultimately being harmed by them, in places like Kawa Great Forest, to survive and gain greater strength, some Beastman Tribes do worship evil spirits, obtaining more food by relying on evil spirits, growing stronger and ultimately becoming the very thing the evil spirits consume.
There are various kinds of evil spirits, among them, the existence of mutated evil spirits.
And this time, the source of the wasteland that appeared on the western lands and the numerous rotting infected zombies stemmed from a mutated evil spirit that surfaced years ago in an obscure corner.
No one knows when the mutated evil spirit suddenly appeared within a tribe inside Kawa Great Forest, resurrecting dead bodies through unknown means, absorbing vast amounts of fanatic faith, causing the entire tribe to fall, leaving no more circulating news.
Familiarly neighboring tribes went visiting...
The result was beginning to spread swiftly like a plague,
Launching a sweep across the southernmost lands of Kawa Great Forest, continually spreading far and wide towards all directions of the forest, sweeping progressively far.

chapters.title: Chapter 178 - 174: Preparing an Escape Route
chapters.content:
The mutated evil spirit's power spread throughout the Kawa Great Forest like a plague virus, and all the Beastman Tribes and even the living creatures caught up in it turned into living corpses, completely reduced to puppet slaves.
At the same time, wherever the living corpses swept through, the land also became contaminated and spread, turning into a rotten wasteland.
Large expanses of forest meadows vanished, and the surviving vegetation seemed to have been cursed in the most dreadful way, becoming hideous and twisted, as if haunted by ghosts trapped within. At nightfall, it became a dead land of the underworld upon their arrival.
By the time the major Beastman Tribes reacted, the unknown mutated evil spirit had already grown to a significant scale.
Conflicts naturally ensued. To suppress the evil spirit's expansion, several major Beastman Tribes united for multiple purges, but the result was constant defeat. The fallen comrades on the battlefield quickly became enemies.
After several major defeats, under immense pressure, the major Beastman Tribes began to unite, forming a Tribe Alliance, preparing to break through the defenses of the Bloody Border and enter the Human World to escape the disaster brought by the mutated evil spirit.
At the same time, when attacking the Bloody Border, to prevent the evil spirit's army from striking from behind, the Beastman Alliance decided to establish Beastman strongholds in various directions, hoping to delay and resist the evil spirit's army while serving as a warning line to probe the range of the evil spirit army's spread.
The Blood Claw Tribe Branch was one of those numerous outposts.
Each of the Beastman Alliance's outposts received substantial support from the tribes, with supplies of food and goods continuously pouring in. After establishing the outpost, the task was to prepare for war and to assimilate nearby Beastman Tribes, consolidating them into the outpost to enhance its military strength.
However, from the very beginning, these branch outposts were destined to be sacrificial pawns.
The Beastmen dispatched to develop these outposts were kept in the dark, sent to become cannon fodder to resist the evil spirit army!
In previous wars with the evil spirit army, the Alliance Beastmen were virtually wiped out in each conflict, so very few, only the upper echelons, were aware of the evil spirit's matters.
And those Beastmen sent to the outposts were teams completely ignorant of the evil spirit.
Except for the leader, they were entirely unaware of their mission.
It was precisely because of this that when Austin broke through the Blood Claw Division, he did not obtain any information from the subordinate Beastmen.
The rapid dispatch from the central tribe headquarters to investigate the Blood Claw Division's destruction was largely due to the fear that the evil spirit army had already spread nearby, posing a near-fatal crisis for the Tribe Alliance yet to breach the Bloody Defense Line.
"No wonder the previous reports mentioned turmoil around the perimeter of the Kawa Great Forest. So that was the reason..."
Austin fell silent for a moment, overwhelmed by all the information.
Combining the various prior pieces of information, everything became clear.
The appearance of the mutated evil spirit led to the birth of numerous zombie creatures, bringing catastrophic effects to the Kawa Great Forest. Masses of creatures fled and migrated, while the Beastmen who received the news first launched massive attacks on nearby weaker Beastman Tribes. Under the leadership of several super-large tribes, they established an alliance, planning to break through the Bloody Great Wall into the Human World and escape the dangers of the Kawa Great Forest.
"But can they really escape? Mutated evil spirit, zombies..."
Facing the current situation, Austin was deeply troubled.
Rather than being infected by the evil spirit's wicked energy, these living corpses resembled the result of a Zombie Virus from fantasy novel worlds of a past life, transformed through magic modification.
Bloodthirsty, hungry, feeding on the living, with immense strength, the only weakness being their heads... Even if the zombie army broke through the Bloody Great Wall into the Central Earth World, what then? Would the zombie army not follow close behind?
But right now, Austin did not have the power to change any of this. Even in the context of the vast Kawa Great Forest spanning tens of thousands of square kilometers, Austin was merely a small ripple on a vast ocean, one misstep and he might not even be able to protect himself.
"It seems necessary to prepare an exit plan. So far, signs of the zombie army have only been found in the southwestern direction, and nowhere else, so it might be worth exploring..."For more chapters visit NovєlFіre.net
Previously, Rodney and other Dragon Nest teams had explored west, but without a compass, they constantly drifted south. As it stands, their direction is in the southwest. For now, it is only in the southwest that Austin discovered the zombie army's existence.
Combining the location and the information obtained from the Blood Claw Beastmen, Austin roughly sketched out the current situation in the Kawa Great Forest in his mind.
Perhaps, only the west and south suffered the zombie army's sweep, with other directions still safe.
Though terrifying, the zombie army under the command of the mutated evil spirit couldn't possibly be invincible across the Kawa Great Forest's vastness. No one could claim complete understanding of this enormous forest; the zombie army might not overwhelm it effortlessly.
In vast jungle areas with complex topographies and expansive woodlands, who knows where a Legendary Lord of Magical Beasts or Giant Dragon might dwell? In the presence of such Legendary Domain entities, the zombie army can hardly act ferociously.
For this reason, even though Austin had reached the quasi-Gold level, he seldom ventured beyond a hundred kilometers from the Dragon Nest Tribe's territory, mostly staying within to build the Dragon Nest Legion, lacking any eagerness to explore the world beyond.
If he inadvertently intruded into some powerful being's domain, wouldn't it be a case of a wolf falling into a tiger's den? Caution was paramount; upon reaching the Legendary level, he could venture wherever he wished.
For now, the presence of the zombie army has only been detected in the southwest, indicating other directions might have mighty beings holding fort, or various reasons blocking the spread.
With this in mind, perhaps there isn't a need to head north beyond the Bloody Border into the Human world; migrating eastward or northeast might also be feasible.
Austin was privately contemplating his withdrawal plans, spending considerable effort finalizing them. However, he did not act immediately but temporarily set the plan aside.
Given the current circumstances, it wasn't yet dangerous enough to necessitate immediate relocation and retreat. At least, the zombie army was still more than two hundred kilometers away from his tribe, with mountainous obstacles in between. Considering the slow spread of zombies and wastelands, it would take at least a year or two for them to even approach the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Moreover, even if he intended to withdraw, the surrounding situation needed thorough investigation before making any hasty decisions.

chapters.title: Chapter 179 - 175 Plan
chapters.content:
Upon receiving the news, Austin felt as if the Dragon Nest Tribe he had established was on the brink of annihilation under the zombie horde, ready to be swallowed and destroyed at any moment.
However, after careful consideration and weighing the actual situation within the Kawa Great Forest, Austin's tension eased slightly; at least the situation wasn't desperate enough to require immediate escape.
Having painstakingly accumulated this property, fleeing directly would mean forsaking two years of effort. Moreover, even if escape was considered, who could predict if greater dangers would appear along the way?
After spending most of a day, Austin finally devised a counter-plan.
Step one: dispatch elite Beastmen to monitor the movements of the zombie army in the southwest and send several additional squads to ascertain their extent, thus providing reference for Austin's final decision.
Step two: send teams to explore to the east and north to leave an escape route for the future. Since zombies were discovered in the southwest, the west and south were essentially off the table; even retreat would only head towards the east and north.
Step three, and the most critical step: enhance strength.
Enhancement was needed not only for the Dragon Nest Race Tribe but also for Austin himself.
The discovered zombies, although incredibly strong and virtually indestructible unless hit on the head, had the flaw of being slow and lacking intelligence.
At least from the Dragon Nest Tribe's perspective, a well-trained team of Dragon Nest Beastman Warriors, equipped with Bronze Armor, holding Bronze Shields, and wielding three-meter Long Spears, formed a dense Long Spear Array that could defeat zombies several times their number without any loss.
The Tribe Alliance repeatedly suffered defeats against the zombie army, which, in Austin's view, was understandably expected.
In this primal great forest, even the top-tier, mega Beastman Tribes fought with chaotic charges led by their chiefs.
Facing zombies, the uncoordinated hundreds or thousands of Beastmen would quickly succumb, with weaker Beastmen scratched and turned into zombies. The battle saw an ever-increasing zombie count, leaving the chief, despite being mighty, fighting alone once his companions had transformed into zombies. Fighting Qi was ultimately depleted before the Legendary Realm, eventually being overwhelmed by the vast zombie horde.
But the Dragon Nest Legion was different; with tight formations, three-meter Long Spears, and Copper Armor defense, zombies numbering ten times fewer than the Legion were easily slaughtered like swine and dogs.
Now the Dragon Nest Tribe's Beastman count had increased to 20,000, most of whom were newly joined Beastmen, with some yet to complete their basic training.
Austin's task was to arm the entire Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen as effectively as possible, ensuring that both militia Beastmen and Beastmen laborers, and even the elderly and infirm, were fully equipped and trained for a potential war.
In addition to regular Beastmen, Austin also planned an intensive short-term training for the Extraordinary Beastmen, with various exercises, like push-ups, sit-ups, weightlifting squats, long-distance running, frog jumps, etc., multiplied thousands of times over, imposed on the Extraordinary Beastmen.
To learn the Beastman Three Techniques, a sufficiently strong body was required, and these exercises were intended to boost the Beastmen's Physical Fitness in preparation for future techniques.
During this period, besides training the Tribe Beastman Race, Austin decided to enhance his strength as well.
Ever since the day of awakening from deep sleep, Austin's Level had stagnated for six months, and the Magic Power Resources from the consumed Magic Crystals had already been digested. To progress, devouring more Magic Power materials seemed necessary.
The Magic Crystal Vein discovered during the Spider Cave clearance now contained only some Sub-Magic Stones; the densely compacted Magic Crystals had been entirely devoured by Austin.
Merely relying on the Beastman Legion to obtain scattered magic-infused minerals or Magic Fruits from the forest was clearly insufficient.
The Giant Dragon Race naturally bore Legendary Bloodlines, unlocking Legendary Law from their lineage's depths upon reaching maturity, directly entering the Legendary Realm.
However, the magic needed for a dragon's growth far exceeded human imagination, almost ten to a hundred times more than what humans required to cultivate to the same Level.
Although Austin was only breaking the threshold before Gold, the required magic was a substantial figure, and acquiring such Magic Power Resources only had one solution—to find another Magic Crystal Vein or another locale producing Magic Power materials.
Such sources of abundant Magic Power Resources were likely hidden within the dangerous zones of the Kawa Great Forest.
"It seems the plan to sweep the danger zones must proceed ahead of schedule."This text is hosted at NoveI-Fire.ɴet
Earlier, Vini reported during the sweep of nearby Beastman Tribes that signs of danger zones existed within a hundred-mile radius of the Dragon Nest Tribe. Austin had been intrigued but had delayed due to subsequent events, without initiating the sweep plan.
Now it appeared timing was appropriate.
For safety's sake, Austin decided to personally lead the team out.
"The plan to deal with the zombie army is barely complete, but handling those Blood Claw Tribe members is troublesome..."
Considering the completed plan, Austin remembered the captured Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen; if in previous situations, immediate execution wasn't an issue, but now it required careful deliberation.
"Perhaps, there's this way..."
Austin's eyes flickered, forming a plan for dealing with Golden Lion Shiji and other Blood Claw Tribe Beastmen.
...
Time swiftly progressed into June,
During the previous half-year, due to the inexplicable migration of beast herds, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe felt an underlying unease.
Thus, shortly after spring commenced, the tribe began thoroughly sweeping within a hundred-mile radius, capturing hordes of Beastmen and swiftly assimilating them into the tribal system, rapidly expanding the tribe's power.
During this period, the tribe also established the Copper Mine Base, producing numerous Bronze Weapons, essentially developing the Copper Mine area into a tribe division, becoming a crucial component of the Dragon Nest Tribe's structure.
Meanwhile, Austin began modifying Navy Six Techniques and successfully developed the Beastman Three Techniques, significantly boosting the Dragon Nest Tribe's strength.
Overall, as the first half of the year concluded, the Dragon Nest Tribe's overall power underwent a remarkable increase.

chapters.title: Chapter 180 - 176: The Achievements of the First Half of the Year
chapters.content:
In half a year, the military strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe has seen a leap in improvement, without much neglect in civil affairs.
Firstly, with the successful smelting of bronze, various bronze axes, bronze hoes, bronze knives, and so forth have been successively crafted. Equipped with qualified metal tools, the Beastmen have completely abandoned the previously used stone axes and other such crude and fragile tools.
With the help of metal tools, the efficiency of the Beastmen in clearing and farming the land has greatly improved.
In the past, chopping down a tree might take more than half an hour. Now, an ordinary Beastman wielding a bronze axe can fell it in less than ten minutes. Additionally, the robust and durable bronze tools no longer require the cautious care that stone tools once did, avoiding damage and delays in the work schedule.
The result of the greatly improved efficiency in clearing land and farming is that, with the passage of the first half of the year, the cultivated land within the entire Dragon Nest Tribe has surpassed ten thousand acres.
The large-scale farming led to significant yields, coupled with the recent migration of numerous animal herds. The Dragon Nest Beastmen frequently hunted outside and cleared Giant Beasts, collecting a great deal of meat. Consequently, the granaries of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe are now full. Even if the tribe does nothing at all, the stored supplies are enough to sustain the entire Dragon Nest Tribe for half a year.
However, while the vast tract of land was being cultivated, it also brought quite a few management challenges. Some of the cultivated lands are quite far from the Dragon Nest Base. To manage the lands better, the Dragon Nest Beastmen built one or two simple wooden huts next to the fields for resting during regular work breaks.
Apart from land cultivation, other internal affairs have also seen significant development.
Firstly, the livestock sector has achieved substantial prosperity.
In the first month after the end of the cold winter, due to a population surge in the tribe, the stored grain was nearly exhausted. Also, the kudzu and other staple crops planted in the fields could not be harvested in the short term. Thus, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe experienced a period of food shortage.
Fortunately, as the weather warmed and everything rejuvenated, the boars and rabbits huddled in hibernation during the cold winter in the livestock pens began to grow fat quickly with abundant food, significantly contributing to the tribe's food supply. Additionally, the forest's revival brought many wild animals out, and the Beastman Legion engaged in intense hunting of wild beasts and Giant Beasts, bridging the gap until the first season of kudzu was harvested.
The importance of raising wild boars and rabbits was thus highlighted. Moreover, as migrating herds continuously passed by, the Dragon Nest Beastmen, besides killing adult beasts, also brought the young back to the tribe for domestication in the pens.
With the addition of many young animals and the natural growth and reproduction of animals within the pens, the scale of livestock raising has expanded significantly. When the migration of herds halts, the livestock scale will be enough to provide substantial meat for the tribe.
Meanwhile, in addition to the domestication of meat livestock like boars and rabbits, the previously domesticated wild cattle scale has also increased.
The initial group of several hundred wild cattle has been entirely tamed by the Minotaurs. Due to the land clearing work and the introduction of bronze plows, various agricultural tasks have also seen considerable speed improvements.
Moreover, the domesticated wild cattle have played a significant role in the transportation duties of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In places like the Kawa Great Forest, naturally, there aren't smooth roads. The distance from the Copper Mine Base to the Dragon Nest Tribe isn't close, with a rugged mountain path spanning about ten to twenty kilometers between them.
When smelting copper at the Copper Mine Base, materials like charcoal can be sourced locally, but food needs to be transported from the Dragon Nest Base to the Copper Mine Base. Additionally, the crafted various copper items, such as tools, armor, weapons, and so on, need to be transported back to the Dragon Nest Base.
The entire Copper Mine Base has over a thousand Beastmen engaged in bronze-smelting production work, requiring substantial quantities of consumable goods like grains. Bronze itself is heavy, and transporting large numbers of bronze tools over distances of ten to twenty kilometers would require significant manpower if only done manually. However, now with domesticated wild cattle, it's different.
Wild cattle are extremely strong animals with formidable endurance and stamina. Using them for transportation has greatly eased the burden on the Dragon Nest Beastmen, freeing many from such heavy manual labor.
Austin noticed the excellent transport capabilities of the wild cattle, leading to plans for a forest expedition to establish bases for production activities. But with the emergence of zombified spirits, the original plans were shelved.
However, this does not mean the work of domesticating wild cattle has stalled. Given the recurring emergence of mutated evil spirits and zombies, Austin has already planned a contingency route, and during relocation, domesticated wild cattle will naturally be the main transport force.
Thus, during this period, the resources of the Dragon Nest Tribe have instead focused to some extent on the domestication of wild cattle.
The domestication of boars, rabbits, wild cattle, and other animals has yielded certain results. Meanwhile, in January, immediately after the cold winter ended, the Dragon Nest Beastmen began experimenting with fish farming.
After three months of preparation during the cold winter, the Dragon Nest Beastmen produced a large amount of kudzu rope. Using these kudzu ropes, they wove cage-like structures and placed them in lakes and reservoirs, followed by the harvesting of fish and concentrating on fish fry farming.
Fish farming is still in the exploratory stage, and figuring out which fish species are suitable for concentrated farming requires constant experimentation. Although the concept of cage fishing was relatively mature in Austin's previous life, he only knew the basic idea without the detailed information, necessitating continuous testing of many techniques. Hence, no satisfying yield is yet seen.The source of thɪs content is n̷o̷v̷e̷l̷f̷i̷r̷e̷.net
However, if the cage fishing project succeeds, the kudzu produced from farming will have a considerable recycling consumption method. Once farming is successful, it can yield a large quantity of fish resources, creating a new source of food.
Given the current situation, after half a year of fish farming, some progress has been made, providing a portion of the tribe's fish food supply regularly each month.
As long as the farming methods and fish species continue to improve, cage fishing will inevitably become another major food source for the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 181 - 177 Begin
chapters.content:
Apart from these, Austin's Dragon Nest Tribe also has a mushroom farm, which has now undergone a significant expansion.
During the month of food shortage, the importance of the mushroom farm, led by the deer-bodied Finn, became apparent.
After a year of exploration, the deer-bodied Finn has discovered a method to cultivate non-toxic mushrooms, achieving a 99% success rate, and under Vini's arrangement, began large-scale production with his subordinate beastmen.
Due to the low input, high output, and short growth cycle of mushrooms, they have become another important food source within the Dragon Nest Tribe, contributing significantly to the tribe's food supply during the month of shortage.
Moreover, the mushrooms themselves, after various culinary preparations, have won over many Dragon Nest Beastmen with their delicious and sweet taste, especially after a certain beastman chef, guided by Austin, created the incredibly tasty dish of chicken stewed with mushrooms, which became the top choice in the beastman canteen.
Even Austin himself, who originally fed on various magic substances, couldn't resist his cravings and had the beastman chef prepare special meals for him several times.
In six months, the achievements of the Dragon Nest Tribe were remarkable.
In both military and civil affairs, there has been significant progress. Compared to a year ago, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe has expanded more than tenfold.
However, Austin also understands that despite the current accomplishments, there is still a long way to go before reaching his envisioned level.
Moreover, now with the mutated evil spirit zombie army rampant, looking around, the landscape is filled with crises. With the current strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, they might rule in rural lands within a hundred miles, but once the zombie army sweeps through, they would inevitably have to flee in disgrace.
To prevent the kingdom he painstakingly built from being destroyed overnight, Austin decided to work even harder.
The first step was to address the issue of the captured Blood Claw Tribe beastmen. Austin decided to release two or three beastman captives from the Blood Claw Tribe, let them return to the Blood Claw Headquarters, and convey a decision to the Blood Claw Tribe chief.
That decision was that Austin and his subordinate Clan Tribe could replace the previous Blood Claw Division, monitor the zombie army's movements for them, and to some extent, snipe them.
The price for this would be that once the Beastman Alliance captures the Bloody Border, the Dragon Nest Tribe would be allowed to enter the Human World together to avoid disaster, and during the war, provide substantial war material support, such as magic arrows, weapons, and some transcendent beastman troops, etc.
Of course, all of this sounds noble, as if sacrificing for the Tribe Alliance, but in reality, Austin wouldn't really lead the beastman Clan to fight to the death with the zombie army, nor would he put all his chips on the Beastman Alliance.
It's necessary to resist a bit, relying on the rugged mountains to snipe the zombie army. After all, he spent a lot of effort to establish this base and wouldn't retreat and waste it easily, but if things turn unfavorable in the war, he would immediately retreat to avoid the zombie tide.
Before that, Austin also planned to send out several beastman exploration teams to the north and east to see if they could find another escape route, at least not putting all hope on the Tribe Alliance.
Meanwhile, Austin would prepare for retreat, including storing more food, training more wild cattle to achieve greater transport capacity, etc., so that if the zombie tide gets too close, he and his subordinate beastmen could quickly retreat and escape.
As for whether the Blood Claw Tribe would let go of the grudge of their division being annihilated, allowing him and his subordinate tribe to replace the Blood Claw Division's function, and whether the Beastman Alliance would agree to have him as a member of the alliance against the evil spirit zombies, Austin felt confident.
After all, the main focus of the current Beastman Alliance is still on the Bloody Great Wall. If they could get fresh forces to help resist the following zombie army's pursuit, it would be greatly welcomed.
Even if the Blood Claw Tribe wanted to stir trouble, the Beastman Alliance likely wouldn't agree, and if the Blood Claw Tribe truly led the tribe for revenge, it's not certain they could succeed. Even if they destroyed the Dragon Nest Tribe, they would still need to rebuild the base in this direction, a self-damaging thing that the Blood Claw Tribe chief shouldn't be ignorant enough to do.
Of course, Austin wouldn't solely rely on the rationality of the Blood Claw Tribe chief. Thus, before the few Blood Claw beastman captives left, Austin took them on a personal tour of the Dragon Nest Tribe's military parade.
Although some things were kept hidden, the display of the elite Dragon Vein Attendants and the elite beastman legion alone left the Blood Claw beastmen utterly amazed.
The information revealed in the military parade, combined with Austin's own strength, led the Blood Claw beastmen to estimate that even if the Blood Claw Headquarters attacked with full force, they might be able to destroy the Dragon Nest Tribe, but they would inevitably suffer heavy losses themselves.The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the NoveIＦire.net
As for the Blood Claw beastmen's reactions, Austin was quite satisfied, and after they had witnessed the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, he let them go.
Besides the intimidation from the military parade, Austin also planned to send a few people to follow behind them, to see if they could infiltrate the Beastman Alliance and gather information about the Blood Claw Tribe at any time.
With multiple preparations in place, Austin felt he had basically no worries and began to focus on other aspects.
As for the other captives from the Blood Claw Tribe, they were naturally locked together with the die-hard mercenary captives, forced to work for the construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe. Without a few months of hardship, they wouldn't have the opportunity to truly desire to surrender and join the Dragon Nest Tribe.
With the first six months of the year gone, to face the upcoming mutated evil spirit zombie tide, under Austin's leadership, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe began mobilizing, acting according to the previously established plan.
The beastman transcendents were gathered effectively, several teams were selected to explore toward the east and north, while a part of the elite beastmen went to the southwest to monitor the zombie army's movements and collect detailed information.
Meanwhile, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe entered into intense production work, striving to produce more food and manufacture more copper tools.
And a few days later, after directing and distributing a large amount of work, Austin led most of the elite of the Dragon Nest Legion and the remaining beastman transcendents to begin sweeping dangerous areas within the Dragon Nest Tribe region.

chapters.title: Chapter 182 - 178 Wet Bone Forest (First Update)
chapters.content:
The Wet Bone Forest, situated in a large basin surrounded by mountains, is a forbidden area that strikes fear into the hearts of nearby Beastman tribes.
From solitary wandering Beastmen to rampaging wild beasts, those who accidentally wander into the Wet Bone Forest never leave a trace.
The mist-covered land seems like a terrifying giant beast opening its mouth wide, devouring all living creatures.
Over time, even the fiercest beasts understood the danger within that area and began to avoid it, keeping a distance from its range.
Unexpectedly, the Wet Bone Forest's terrifying reputation turned it into an intimidating shield, making the areas nearby comparatively safe places.
Moreover, although the Wet Bone Forest is dangerous, as long as one doesn't venture deep inside, there is typically no danger. Some weaker Beastman tribes have thus settled near the forest, relying on the fearsome Wet Bone Forest as their backing to survive in this perilous world.
Even though the Wet Bone Forest inadvertently created a safe haven, the tribes camping nearby still greatly feared it. Every time they went hunting, they would automatically steer clear of the Wet Bone Forest when they approached it.
According to legend, unknown Demons inhabit the mist-locked Wet Bone Forest, and any living creature that steps into the forbidden area turns into bones, decaying in the soil.
In reality, the small, weak tribes living nearby occasionally experienced disappeares, with rumors claiming that Demons from the Wet Bone Forest carried them off to serve as food during the night.
Fear spread among the tribes, but unfortunately, the tribes that moved nearby were all weak, and leaving would likely result in death in the dangerous jungles by the next day. They could only live in this area, begrudgingly relying on the Demons of the Wet Bone Forest for survival.
Fortunately, the Demons' abductions from the Wet Bone Forest were infrequent. Compared to the perilous, lethal external world, living near the Wet Bone Forest was bearable.
Occasionally, some of the weaker Beastman tribes even began developing a primitive reverence for the Wet Bone Forest. When barely fed, they would offer sacrifices, perform primitive dances, and worship the Demons lurking in the Wet Bone Forest as if they were Divine.
But the Wet Bone Forest, after all, was not Divine,Original content can be found at N0v3l.Fiɾe.net
Two months ago, the fierce Dragon Nest Legion, led by Blood Wolf, surged along the scent trail left by the Beastmen.
The heavy armor, long spears reflecting cold glints, and strictly trained, unified formations surged forward like a black tidal wave. The little resistance present was like tiny stones dropping into a tsunami, vanishing instantly.
The next day, all tribes surrounding the Wet Bone Forest were destroyed, with all Beastmen captured and strung together by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, driven back to the Dragon Nest Base, leaving only ruins behind.
Through it all, the Wet Bone Forest showed no response, allowing everyone to leave.
Before leaving, the Dragon Nest Beastmen marked a circle representing a dangerous area on a crude beast-skin map, remembering this zone.
...
More than two months have passed since the crushing war. The signs left by the orc tribes previously stationed here have been mostly erased by the hot and humid forest, with only traces of the past ruin visible on the moss-covered ground.
Ratman Bill stood before the former village ruins, his gaze crossing over the ground's debris towards the unfathomable depths of the Wet Bone Forest, filled with unease as sweat dripped down his forehead.
Two months ago, he was a member of one of the Ratman tribes living here. After the Dragon Nest Legion's destruction and sweep, he was captured and taken to the Dragon Nest Base for unified transformation training.
When Bill was captured, strung together with his companions by a rope, and driven towards an unknown destination, he was consumed by despair.
Although he had never been a captive slave before, he had heard from the old Beastmen about how tragic the fates of war captives could be, especially for their weak race with a battle power of less than five, potentially ending up as food for the strong.
Ratman Bill was filled with despair as he was driven to the stunning Dragon Nest Base.
The massive fortress, bustling Beastmen, orderly housing, and the booming construction sites all showcased the Dragon Nest Tribe's strength.
The awe-inspiring Dragon Nest Town was so overwhelming that it washed away Ratman Bill's fear and despair. They were then abruptly gathered together, organized, and subjected to a round of "disinfection."
During "disinfection," Ratman Bill and his companions cried out in horror, fearing they were about to be washed clean and turned into food.
But it turned out he was completely wrong from the start.
Despite being captives, their actual treatment was far better than he had imagined.
There were no imagined whips, no hunger, no beatings, and certainly no slaughter like livestock. None of the desperate scenarios he imagined materialized.
In that month's captivity, they ate well and slept well, with daily meals consisting of large amounts of kudzu roots and bark boiled in a large pot until they became a mush.
Notably, it was purely genuine kudzu without any added bitter tree bark, weeds, or rhizome fruits. The kudzu fragrance almost made his mouth water even during training.
Moreover, most importantly, the kudzu-cooked food was unlimited!
In other words, they could eat as much as they wanted!
What a blissful life!
For those living in the lower strata of Kawa Great Forest like them, life was extremely poor, with daily meals sparse. Their daily food was a mixture of collected tree roots, grass roots, and bark, occasionally supplemented with bitter wild fruits that even birds wouldn't eat. Despite this, those fruits were rare delicacies for them.
As for kudzu, it was a more delicious treat above the bitter wild fruits. Containing a lot of starch, kudzu roots could fill and satisfy hunger with a slightly sweet taste, and for Ratmen, it was a supreme delicacy.
This delicacy was only brought out for tribal celebrations or sacrificial rituals to the Divine by the chief for communal festivity.

chapters.title: Chapter 183 - 179: Gathering Troops (Second Release)
chapters.content:
Yet this kind of deliciousness, on the first day of his captivity, as he waited excitedly in line for food, those lofty Dragon Nest Beastmen looked into the pot of kudzu root with expressions of disappointment.
He couldn't understand at all why some of the old members of the Dragon Nest Tribe showed disdain when looking at the kudzu root porridge in their bowls during mealtime. This was absolutely delicious kudzu root!
Kudzu root is so delicious, no matter how much you admire and enjoy it, it's never too much. How could anyone disdain it?
Really can't understand.
However, facing the fragrant kudzu root porridge in his bowl, Ratman Bill quickly threw these doubts aside and started eating the food in his bowl in large mouthfuls.
