After licking the kudzu root porridge in the bowl clean, Ratman Bill still felt unsatisfied and couldn't help but look towards the place where the food was being distributed.
Then, he suddenly noticed a fellow captive, who had just finished eating and licking the bowl clean, sneakily looking around. Then, taking advantage of most people not paying attention, he swiftly got back in line with his bowl!
But he wasn't the only one doing this. Not long after, another captive sneakily joined the back of the line, hoping to blend in and get a second helping of kudzu root porridge!
Ratman Bill was initially dumbfounded but then quickly became furious, his eyes burning with rage.
These dirty, shameless, despicable, brazen beastmen scoundrels, how could they behave like this? Where is their beastman pride!!!
Ratman Bill was beside himself with anger, his eyes continuously searching, hoping to see a Dragon Nest Beastman officer maintaining order appear.
However, those instructors had already left to eat, leaving only a few of the smaller beastmen to maintain order.
Bill thought carefully, realizing that in this way, he was at a disadvantage.
So, Ratman Bill, taking advantage of the surrounding people's inattention, decisively sneaked into the line waiting for food.
He couldn't let himself suffer, so he decided to go with the flow.
In his indignation and with a heart full of condemnation and disdain towards his other companions, Ratman Bill consumed a full five bowls of kudzu root porridge, almost to the point of being unable to stand up.
It was only later that Bill learned that beastman captives like them were actually not restricted on food.Thɪs ⓝovelFire.net
Because those kudzu roots, boiled with their skin in a big pot, were the lowest-grade malformed produce from the fields. Anyone who lived in the Dragon Nest Tribe for a period of time had no fondness for this perennial staple food, not to mention the broken food made from these inferior, defective kudzu roots?
Perhaps when they first joined the Dragon Nest Tribe and underwent a month of military training transformation, they were no different from the current Bill and others. But after living in the Dragon Nest Tribe for a considerable time and having solved their basic needs, naturally, they desired better-tasting, more delicious food.
Having enough delicious food to fill their stomach every day, and a comfortable house to sleep in at night, if not for the arduous daily training and heavy routine labor, Ratman Bill might have thought he had returned to the Divine Kingdom of the Beast God.
A month of military training transformation, followed by Ratman Bill being praised by the beastman instructors for his diligent training and work efforts, as well as his good political awareness, thus joining in the loyalty ceremony to His Highness Austin as one of the outstanding representatives among the beastman captives.
Bill continued to work diligently afterward, cherishing life in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Thinking back to the days of hunger and cold in the previous tribe, struggling for a meal from day to day, Bill was determined not to return to the past. He worked hard to express himself and contributed efforts to the construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
...
Looking at these ruins that almost disappeared in front of him and recalling the experiences of the past two months, it all seemed like a dream.
Two months was enough for the hardworking Bill to stand out, coinciding with Austin's decision to lead the team in clearing the nearby hazardous areas, setting their sights on the Wet Bone Forest, and requiring some native guides for this operation, among which the outstanding Bill was one.
Now Bill stood here again, his hand gripping the long spear, trembling slightly, with sweat pouring down his forehead.
After a month of military training transformation and a month of work solidification, Bill's mind had already become incredibly loyal to the great His Highness Austin, willing to risk his life and shed blood for His Highness Austin's grand cause.
But at this moment, facing the shadow that had loomed over him since childhood, Bill couldn't help but feel afraid.
This terrifying Wet Bone Forest was no simple place, shrouded in the shadow of fog, harboring terrifying horrors within.
Could the Dragon Nest Legion truly succeed in clearing such an evil forest?
Looking at the fog-covered Wet Bone Forest ahead, Ratman Bill couldn't help but feel anxious.
"Hey, Bill, hurry back, the battle is about to start."
At this moment, a familiar voice came from behind, belonging to one of Bill's beastman companions.
"Okay, I know, I'll be right there."
Bill quickly turned around and walked back towards the camp.
At this time, the outskirts of the Wet Bone Forest had been cleared by the Dragon Nest Beastmen into a large open area. A significant amount of weapons and supplies were transported here by buffaloes, with fences erected around the camp encompassing it simply.
Around them, the Dragon Nest Beastmen busily wielded weapons, transporting supplies, and distributing arms, seeming ready to advance.
Sure enough, not long after, with the sound of a horn, a large number of Beastmen gathered on the open ground of the camp, forming well-organized formations that looked sharp and angular.
As the formations adjusted, copper armor clashed, emitting a shattering sound. The sharp copper spears held in their hands pointed towards the sky like groves of sharp copper spear forests, exuding a tremendously powerful military aura.
At the forefront of the formation, the assembled Bill glanced unobtrusively towards the direction of the command platform.
Standing on the several-meter-high command platform were high-ranking figures of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For example, the Lizardman Rodney, whose body was several times taller than Bill, was the Legion Commander in charge of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe's legions and was the Tribe's foremost warrior.
Next to Rodney stood the smart and resourceful Fox-faced Man Quik, who assisted in managing various internal affairs of the Dragon Nest Tribe, and it was said that the Tribe's unique medical system was established by him.
Whether it was Lizardman Rodney or Fox-faced Man Quik, these two were both towering, high-ranking figures to Bill.
To the extent that in his two months of life in the Dragon Nest Tribe, apart from major official occasions like the ceremony marking the official integration of a class of trained beastmen captives into the Tribe, he rarely had the chance to see these two standing at the top of the Dragon Nest Tribe, ruling over tens of thousands of beastmen.

chapters.title: Chapter 184 - 180 Entering the Woodland (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
Whether it was Rodney or the Fox-faced Man Quik, Bill revered both of them immensely. Simply standing in such positions was a huge honor.
At the same time, it also sparked a yearning within Bill's heart.
According to what Bill learned from early Dragon Nest Beastmen, these two great figures were initially just ordinary Beastmen. But after meeting the great His Highness Austin, their fate changed, and they grew to become prominent figures among thousands of Beastmen.
If the positions were swapped, could I also become one of the fortunate ones?
Amidst admiration, a thought Bill dared not hope for suddenly emerged from his heart.
In truth, Ratman Bill was unaware that Lizardman Rodney, Fox-faced Man Quik, and the Kobold Vini still managing the Dragon Nest Tribe, were not favored by Austin simply because they were the earliest to join the Dragon Nest Tribe, nor was it nepotism. It was due to the experiences they gained from long-term management of the Dragon Nest Tribe's operational systems.
Currently, the three are indeed the most suitable Beastmen to manage the various operations of the Dragon Nest Tribe because, through two years of step-by-step training, they have been deeply influenced by Austin's modern thinking. They are far more familiar with the framework Austin set up in the Dragon Nest Tribe compared to other Beastmen managers, and among a group of mediocre Beastmen, they naturally stood out to handle the tribe's various affairs.
Initially, Rodney, Quik, and Vini's talents in their respective Domains among Beastmen might have been considered above average. Yet, through Austin's guidance and subsequent wealth of work experience in the tribe's early construction phase, they have surpassed other Beastmen in their respective Domains.
During the Three Kingdoms period in the Cao Wei forces, most renowned generals were relatives of Cao Cao. Was it because Cao Cao's relatives were natural talents as military leaders, inherently superior at warfare?
No, it was merely because being Cao Cao's relatives granted them more opportunities for leading troops in battle, providing more experience. Familiarity breeds skill.
Lizardman Rodney, Fox-faced Man Quik, and Kobold Vini are similar; their talents are not extraordinary, but their wealth of experience through training makes them excel.
Ratman Bill did not know that perhaps, as the Dragon Nest Tribe develops and management layers diminish, the thought he dared not hope for might one day come true...
As Bill was lost in thought, the Dragon Nest Division had already completed its assembly.
Rodney and Quik stood beside the high platform without further action, occasionally whispering to each other, patiently awaiting the arrival of the great His Highness Austin.
It wasn't long before,
Whoosh!!!
A tremendous airflow appeared out of nowhere, bending the surrounding trees, making rustling noises, and sweeping the fallen leaves away in torrents.
Simultaneously, a massive shadow suddenly filled the sky, crashing down on the high platform with dreadful might.
"My people..."
A deep voice resonated slowly, carrying overwhelming power and oppression. Austin scanned the orderly formation of thousands of Beastman Legion below, his gaze exuding undeniable authority.
Any Beastman who met his eyes felt as if a mountain rested on their shoulders, yet in their hearts, fervent admiration surged, straightening their postures and reddening their faces.
"Become my sharpest long spears, go forth, and fight for me!"Latest content published on novel·fire·net
Austin gracefully spread his wings; the gigantic membranes almost obscured the skies, his voice resounding like thunder, shaking every Beastman to their core.
"Oh!"
"Long live His Highness!"
"Fight for His Highness!"
The entire Dragon Nest Legion was collectively awed, the sound waves visibly surging like a tidal wave.
Austin, the creator of the Dragon Nest Tribe, single-handedly provided the Beastmen, who once struggled on the line between life and death, a comfortable living environment, granting them the longed-for life of happiness without fear, without life-and-death struggles, bringing a tectonic shift to their existence.
Simultaneously, from the military training reforms onwards, every Beastman captive was indoctrinated by those fervent believers, supplemented by some techniques Austin learned in his previous life for brainwashing, creating immensely loyal and fervent Beastman Clan members.
It can be said, every Beastman within the Dragon Nest Tribe is an utterly loyal subordinate to Austin, akin to some Divine fanatics.
"Advance, depart!"
Amongst the grand cheers, without saying much more, Austin directly ordered the march.
Before this, Austin had already prepared battle plans, having Rodney and Quik assist in commanding, ensuring all preparations were complete, ready for the military advance.
With Austin giving the order, the Dragon Nest Legion split into the tree division, like a Copper Armor torrent entering the Wet Bone Forest.
Watching as the Beastman Legion started to enter, Austin also took to the air, flying above.
Since the Wet Bone Forest is situated in a basin surrounded by mountains, the accumulated water vapor makes the usual mountain winds hard to penetrate. Coupled with unknown reasons, the entire Wet Bone Forest is shrouded in mist, obscuring vast distances.
Austin had flown high for observation before, but the towering hundreds of meters tall ancient trees and dense fog made it impossible for him to truly see the conditions inside the Wet Bone Forest.
Furthermore, with the fearsome reputation of Wet Bone Forest where no being entering has ever returned alive, Austin decided to deploy a massive army, advancing step by step, chopping down trees blocking the path to approach the core and clear this dangerous area.
Of course, though Wet Bone Forest is perilous, it hasn't triggered a mortal crisis in Austin's Spiritual Sense. Hence, he dared to lead the Dragon Nest Tribe's large forces into the forest directly.
As the Copper Armor torrent of the Dragon Nest Legion moved through the forest lanes, visibility due to the fog was greatly reduced, only showing up to ten meters of surrounding environment.
The forest, appearing unusually quiet, only echoed the clanking footsteps of Copper Armor and the sound of trees being chopped, evoking an eerie feeling.
"That's enough, set camp."
Feeling they had ventured about a hundred meters into the Wet Bone Forest, Austin looked around at the somewhat eerie environment, and commanded with a deep voice from the air.
The vigilant Beastman Legion halted, circled, and upon discovering nothing alarming, commenced to vigorously chop down the surrounding trees, clearing space for a camp base.
This was Austin's step-by-step strategy: never rashly advance until the true enemy is discovered.
Meanwhile, Austin's considerable form descended into the woods, beginning to carefully observe the environment within the Wet Bone Forest.

chapters.title: Chapter 185 - 181 Night Raid (First Update)
chapters.content:
Dark, damp, eerie—this was Austin's first impression of the Wet Bone Forest ahead.
Under the cover of towering ancient trees, the ground was covered with moss, and certain empty spots seemed slightly rounded and slippery. Other than the fern plants that reached half a person's height, there were no other plants on the ground.
The crooked branches of the surrounding trees appeared extremely menacing in the dark fog, as if some demonic creatures were hiding deep within.
The somewhat oppressive environment around didn't give Austin much of a feeling. Just entering a bit into the periphery, he hadn't noticed anything unusual so far, but considering the heavy, damp mist surrounding him, he had some guesses.
He estimated that living deep within the Wet Bone Forest were probably not demons, but some powerful tribes of magical beasts, particularly those with a water attribute.
Standing in the Wet Bone Forest, Austin could clearly feel that the Water Attribute Magic Power in the air was much denser than outside, making the entire forest environment extremely damp.
It was precisely this environment rich with Water Attribute Magic Power that attracted those tribes of magic beasts attuned to water, who occasionally ventured out to plunder beastmen from the outer Beastman Tribe as food, hence being referred to as demons by those beastmen.
However, creating such an environment likely wasn't the work of those hidden magic beasts, but rather because there was possibly some latent magic ore vein of water attribute or some powerful magic plants with water attributes within the forest, enveloping the whole Wet Bone Forest in layers of mist.
Whether it was a magical ore vein or those magic plants, things containing powerful Magic Power were beneficial for Austin's growth, which was the reason Austin selected the Wet Bone Forest as his first target.
Austin looked far into death, but his vision could only penetrate about fifty meters before being blocked by the fog and layers of branches.
The dense Water Attribute Magic Power made the water vapor in the air coalesce into thick mist. Combined with the mountain-ringed terrain surrounding the Wet Bone Forest, which prevented ventilation, the entire forest was shrouded in lingering mist year-round.
"Rodney, take a squad of elites to explore nearby, take the Blood Wolves, but don't go too far."
Returning to the camp where trees were being chopped and beastmen were coming and going, Austin called Rodney over to instruct him.
The Wet Bone Forest was unusually quiet inside, and danger surely lurked. It's possible that the magic beasts were watching them from the shadows, simply avoiding direct confrontation for the time being due to the large-scale entry of the Dragon Nest Legion and Austin.
"Yes, Your Highness."
Rodney selected the majority of elite Dragon Vein Attendants from the Dragon Nest Legion assembled for this expedition, forming a squad and bringing the Blood Wolves along, leaving the camp to explore the periphery of the Wet Bone Forest.
In fact, Austin didn't have high expectations for Rodney and his team's scouting. This was just a normal precaution, given they had barely ventured a hundred meters into the Wet Bone Forest. Discovering its secrets so easily was unlikely.
From the onset, Austin had already devised a battle plan for the Dragon Nest Legion, which was to advance step by step, relying on their formidable strength to push through and penetrate the entire Wet Bone Forest.
Meanwhile, the Dragon Nest Beastmen not only cleared and established a camp but also had the task of removing obstacles along their path. A large group of Dragon Nest Beastmen organized themselves to cut down the trees and ferns blocking the road, laying the chopped leaves and fern grass on the ground and placing the trunks horizontally alongside the road as barriers, forming a rudimentary boardwalk leading outside the Wet Bone Forest.
This way, even the buffalo-formed transport teams could use this to enter directly into the Wet Bone Forest, ensuring transportation with the exterior.
Of course, if Rodney and others could discover any additional clues, that would be even better. After all, the Blood Wolves had been tamed and now cooperated seamlessly with the Dragon Nest Beastmen, having contributed significantly multiple times.
Time swiftly passed, entering night,
The temporary camp's road to the outside had already been opened, building a makeshift road connecting it with the outskirts of the Disaster Forest.
A makeshift fence was also erected around the camp, with teams of beastmen patrolling the perimeter.
And at this time, the Rodney squad, who had been exploring and standing guard on the periphery all day, returned to the temporary camp for rest, having found nothing along the way.
However, what caught Rodney's attention was that the usually energetic Blood Wolves seemed a bit off when leaving the temporary camp, with their fur on their backs standing erect, occasionally growling at certain spots. But, as a bunch of beastmen cautiously approached, they found nothing.
This left a lingering shadow in Rodney's heart, prompting him to strengthen patrols in the middle of the night.
With the previous experience of the Spider Cave, the Dragon Nest Beastmen had already produced enough torches, ensuring there was no shortage of light during nighttime patrols. Teams of beastmen troops rotated patrols, taking turns and resting.
The night passed uneventfully, seemingly making their prior fears feel like mere illusions, yet no one relaxed because of it.
The next day, the Dragon Nest Legion ventured another hundred meters deeper.
Like the previous day, Rodney led the team to explore the periphery, while the Dragon Nest Legion set up outposts, cutting trees and constructing roads, connecting with the previous outpost.
The entire day remained uneventful, with nothing more than a bit of agitation from the Blood Wolves.
On the third day, Austin led the Dragon Nest Legion another hundred meters deeper.
As on the previous two days, Rodney led the exploration, while the Dragon Nest Legion built outposts, opening up roads and connecting with the previous outpost.
This was the sweeping plan Austin had set from the start—to advance methodically until the hidden enemies within the Wet Bone Forest were forced out, breaking through the entire forest.
The fourth day, the fifth day...
As the Dragon Nest Legion pressed forward step by step, the Blood Wolves within the group grew increasingly restless, and Austin could distinctly feel that the hidden enemies seemed increasingly unsettled.
"What could it be?"
Austin gazed deeply into the heart of the mist, looking at the forest shrouded in layers of fog, lost in thought.
By the sixth night, the enemies in the shadows could wait no longer.
Rustling...
In the darkness, massive shadows glided through the forest, pressing down the tall ferns to the ground, creating a rustling sound as they slowly approached the camp.
At this moment, the lead Blood Wolves of the patrolling team around the camp suddenly halted, their ears perked up, sharp eyes fixed on the deep darkness outside, and started howling loudly.
"Awhooo!!!"The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the NoveI-Fire.ɴet

chapters.title: Chapter 186 - 182 Giant Snake (Second Update)
chapters.content:
The fur all over the Blood Wolf suddenly stood up, facing the darkness with a low growl, as if confronting some terrible enemy.
The leading Extraordinary Orc Captain hurriedly grabbed the Blood Wolf's rope, looking into the depths of the dense forest where the Blood Wolf was growling.
"What's going on?"
All the Blood Wolves within the stronghold woke up accordingly, emitting low growls one after another, as the orc patrol teams within the stronghold became vigilant and alert.
Hiss, hiss, hiss...
A low, hoarse hissing sound suddenly came from the darkness, accompanied by the rustling sound of something rubbing against the ground, something was approaching!
But in the Wet Bone Forest, the mist in the air already blocked visibility, and coupled with the meager light from the campfire at night, it was impossible to see what was happening in the darkness outside.
Horror approached along with the sound, and a beastman transcendent snatched a torch from his subordinate and threw it into the dark depths where the sound came from with a swoosh.
As the flames illuminated the dark forest, it pierced through the thick mist to reveal the environment deep within.
Instantly, the pupils of all the patrolling orcs on site shrunk unknowingly.The source of this content ɪs net
Snakes!
Giant Snakes!
Snakes, twenty to thirty meters long, either gliding on the ground or clinging to trees, hung in midair, protruding their black tongues, constantly slithering towards the temporary stronghold, as many as twenty!
"Enemy attack!"
Accompanied by a shrill shout, a whistle made from bamboo emitted a sharp whistle, causing the entire stronghold tribe to stir at that moment.
Upon hearing the whistle, the Dragon Nest Beastmen sleeping in the tents in the stronghold instinctively jumped up, hurriedly donned the weapons and armor placed aside with clattering sounds as they rushed out in teams.
As the Dragon Nest Beastmen resting in the stronghold gathered, the giant snakes also neared the premises!
"Raise shields! Position spears!"
The night patrol was already prepared as they hoisted one-person high Bronze Giant Shields, forming rows, standing them upright at the front, while long spears protruded from the gaps at the edges of the Copper Shields, with sharp tips angled forward like a curled-up hedgehog protecting the camp stronghold behind.
Crash, crash...
One by one, giant snakes swept forward, abruptly collapsing the simple wooden fence around the perimeter with a thunderous crash, instantly breaking through the outer defenses.
Even though the outer wooden fences were merely simple constructions due to cautious tactics, they were still easily breached, showing the formidable nature of these giant snakes.
Hiss!
Along with the foul-smelling wind assaulting their noses, the black giant snake at the forefront flicked its tongue, emitting a harsh hiss, its originally agile body suddenly twisted, followed by the sound of the wind being sliced as a huge whiplash came crashing down from the sky.
Bang, bang, bang!
The tail of the giant snake crashed onto the Bronze Shields erected by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, with a resounding thud, a tremendous force akin to a tide crashing down, black snake scales scraping against Copper Spear, producing a sound of metal clashing.
Thump, thump, thump!
An entire row of beastmen was involuntarily pushed back a few steps by this strong force, but thankfully they stabilized immediately afterward, gripping their Copper Shields and Copper Spears more firmly.
"Hiss!!!"
The black giant snake screeched fiercely as its tail got slashed by the sharp Copper Spears, leaving cuts with blood seeping and dripping onto the ground.
Perhaps noticing the dire state of the attacking black giant snake, the other giant snakes also hesitated, slithering around the perimeter of the Copper Shields and Copper Spears, with scales scraping the ground and making rustling noises.
However, the Dragon Nest Beastmen would not allow them much preparation time, as the resting beastman soldiers within the stronghold had fully gathered, with rows of Copper Shields upright and sharp Copper Spears bristling, making the entire stronghold resemble a noble hedgehog instantly.
"Archers, fire arrows!"
With a command, the bowstring sounds whooshed, and sharp arrows shot out swiftly, covering the giant snake group with powerful force like rain.
Already during the conquest of the Centaur Tribe, Austin had the idea to establish the three major troops: Gun Shield Soldiers, Archers, and Cavalry.
Though at that time, despite obtaining the bow and arrow manufacturing technology from the Centaurs, arrow shafts were made from specific plants, requiring a lot of effort to make, making widespread use difficult, so the archers' project wasn't immediately launched.
But subsequently, with the Dragon Nest Tribe refining copper technology's improvement, they could make qualifying Copper Swords and Copper Spears, achieving technical reserves for large-scale production of suitable Bronze Arrowheads, allowing Copper Arrowheads to equip arrows with power not inferior to arrowwood-made arrows, hence Austin commenced the Archers Legion construction.
Yet, due to the new establishment of the archer troops, only a hundred people in the entire Dragon Nest Division were selected for trial at present, and now the arrow firing marked their debut.
Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh...
Arrow rain continued descending with powerful force, but hitting the giant snakes only made clinking sounds akin to striking iron armor, the sharp arrows merely scratched their scales, causing a couple of small wounds.
But this sufficed, as the arrows broke through the wounds, small but numerous, quickly covering the bodies of the snakes in the center of the arrow rain, with scales pierced by arrows, bodies filled with arrow shafts, and crimson blood streaming down.
"Hiss!!!"
A huge roar came from within the darkness, filled with powerful pressure.
Upon hearing the hiss, the snake group seemed to receive a command, snake eyes turning red, crazily swarming towards the Dragon Nest Beastmen Legion.
Rustle, rustle...
More than twenty giant snakes thirty meters long crazily charged forward, with a momentum seemingly overwhelming like a tide, full of terrifying intimidation.
"Soldiers defend, all junior officers, use Copper Shield Heavy Strike on their heads! Drive them back!"
From behind, the Legion Commander Rodney suddenly issued the order.
With the order falling, several elite Dragon Vein Attendants emerged from the ranks, holding Copper Shields in one hand and Copper Swords in the other.
Instant Step!
Almost simultaneously, with a dull sound, cracks opened on the ground, several figures vanished swiftly from the spot, flashing to the front of the giant snake group's assault in mid-air, forming a line in the air.
Iron Block·Heavy Strike!
The massive Bronze Shields positioned in front, then the figures simultaneously smashed down with the Bronze Shields, which acted like walls, forcefully striking the heads of the few giant snakes charging ahead.

chapters.title: Chapter 187 - 183: Four Forms (Third Update)
chapters.content:
The so-called junior officer is one of the military rank systems that Austin decided to implement temporarily within the Dragon Nest Legion.
To facilitate management, Austin directly divided the beastman soldiers in the Beastman Legion into three ranks:
Soldier, Sergeant, and Junior Officer.
Among them, soldiers are ordinary beastman soldiers, whether gun shield soldiers, archers, or cavalry, as long as they are still ordinary beastmen, as long as their fighting capability is below that of extraordinary beastmen, they are all ranked as soldiers.
Of course, those who achieve great merit are exceptions. Those who achieve great merit naturally qualify for a rank promotion to become sergeants.
However, if there truly is a beastman soldier who achieves great merit, Austin might also grant the modification to become an extraordinary beastman to the soldier who performed the meritorious deeds, thus qualifying him to become a sergeant.
Sergeants are composed of ordinary extraordinary beastmen.
At the same time, sergeants serve as leaders in the beastman troops, leading ordinary beastman soldiers into battle. They are the grassroots backbone of the Dragon Nest Tribe Legion, with a status above that of ordinary beastman soldiers.
As for the final junior officers, they are composed of elite Dragon Vein Attendants.
Elite Dragon Vein Attendants are the twenty extraordinary beastmen initially selected by Austin to experiment with the Beastman Six Techniques.
Their physical prowess is above that of ordinary Dark Dragon Guards, Dragon Vein Attendants, and other extraordinary beastmen. They are the elites among elites, and grasp any of the Beastman Six Techniques, with combat prowess far surpassing ordinary extraordinary beastmen.
Junior officers in the Dragon Nest Legion hold the position of officers among officers.
Any junior officer must learn any one of the Beastman Six Techniques to qualify.
And now, the few junior officers present were originally part of Austin's initial twenty-member test group, all of whom are already skilled in using Austin's modified Beastman Four Techniques powerfully!
The elite Dragon Vein Attendants proficient in the Beastman Four Techniques are several times as strong as normal extraordinary beastmen!
Each junior officer flashed through the air, brandishing the copper shields in their hands like indestructible walls, crashing toward the heads of the giant serpents.
Though this period of time seems long, from the moment Rodney ordered the elite Dragon Vein Attendants to flash in front of the serpent group, it took merely a second or two.
The extremely swift flashing speed rendered the serpent group oblivious and instantly struck by the massive bronze shields.
Bang bang bang!
In the midst of the muffled sounds of collision, air currents stirred, and several giant serpents running at the forefront were struck fiercely and sent flying backward with half of their heads flattened.
However, it wasn't over yet. The elite Dragon Vein Attendants wielding the heavy blow with the copper shield only paused momentarily in mid-air.
Beastman Four Techniques - Air Walk!
Originally, Austin proposed the concept of shaving and renamed it as Air Walk. Subsequently, in the battle at the Copper Mine Base, under the drive of battle instincts, the blood-returning jackal wolf youth Meng Bi used instantaneous steps as the foundation, with the concept of Air Walk as the core, to unleash a true ability to kick the air and gain power in the air.
After Meng Bi was healed, Austin obtained the terrifying correct usage from him and handed it to the junior officers among the Dragon Nest Tribe to improve and cultivate.
Now, the goal for the magically modified Navy Six Techniques has completed four techniques, becoming the unique Combat Skills Beastman Four Techniques in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The junior officers are in mid-air, kicking the air at a speed invisible to the naked eye, while numerous layers of fighting qi gathered beneath their feet erupt several times in an instant, stacking up immense power.
Boom!
The muffled sound of air rupture spread through the air, visible ripples oscillating outward from the use of instantaneous steps to kick the air. The elite Dragon Vein Beastmen gained a powerful propulsion force out of nowhere, and suddenly transformed into a vanished shadow sprinting toward the serpent group.
While still in mid-air, the bronze greatsword gripped tightly in their hands.
Swish!
Strands of white light suddenly lit up in the dark, forming a trail of dazzling cold light, the brilliant gleam illuminating the darkness, instantaneously flashing between the bodies of the launched serpents.
Gale Wave Slash!
Before the serpents could react, the serpent at the forefront, sent flying in the air, had already been slashed in half, split into two sections, with the foul blood splattering down from above.
Witnessing their companions at the front suddenly being bisected, the remaining serpents were all dumbfounded, suddenly stopping midway, coiling into clusters, tongues constantly flicking out, hissing at the few junior officers.
"So powerful!"
At this point, the Dragon Nest Legion behind it was also shocked to the core, staring blankly at the scene before them.
Each of these serpents being slashed were thicker in girth than a person's waist, with a length of thirty meters, standing upright to reach the dense forest overhead, with enough strength to crush a tree with a swing.
If it were them, this ordinary beastman army, wanting to slay serpents of this magnitude, even with weapons and armor equipped, it would require at least a beastman team of over fifty people to team up and a sacrifice of several lives to possibly kill the serpent.
Yet these terrifying serpents, in the hands of the junior officers, are like pigs and dogs without resistance, lazily sliced into two segments, the blood-drenched half corpses still twitching on the ground.
The nature of beastmen is inherently to submit to strong individuals; now, witnessing the power of the junior officers, their hearts are filled with infinite yearning, wishing someday they could reach such levels.
At the same time, for the great His Highness Austin who created all this, there is boundless fervent worship.
At this moment, among countless pairs of eyes gazing at the junior officers with passionate admiration, none noticed the concealed greedy and longing gaze.
"A secret technique, another secret technique!"
The former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory, who had joined the expedition, roared wildly in his heart, wishing to embody one of those junior officers immediately to gain those immensely powerful secret techniques.
If he could acquire these secret techniques and safely return to the Central Earth World, then his gains from this journey would be sufficient to make his strength soar, enough to support him becoming an aristocrat above others, and even establish a long-lasting family line!Get full chapters from N0v3l.Fiɾe.net
As a Silver level individual, Gory could see how, despite those junior officers only being at Bronze high tier level, the power ignited through those few secret techniques was not inferior to ordinary Silver level warriors.
Gory believed that if he could gain these combat skills and become proficient with their use, he could even use them to contend with Gold-level great warriors.
If possessing Gold-level strength, which duchy in the Central Earth World couldn't easily grant him a noble title?
A noble title, a set of eternally inherited secret techniques, either one is what the civilian-born Gory desires intensely, enough to create a family line that stretches for generations!
At this moment, Gory's gaze upon those junior officers brimmed with utmost desire.

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - 184 Yearning (First Update)
chapters.content:
Gory, born as a commoner, admired those lofty nobles from a young age, hoping one day to become one of them.
He apprenticed under a retired, disabled old mercenary in the village, learning a simple Breathing Technique. After activating his inner Fighting Qi seed with this technique, the old mercenary recommended him to the city to become a Mercenary Apprentice.
In the blink of an eye, decades passed. During this time, Gory killed thieves, slew Magic Beasts, and explored various ruins left by the strong. By chance, he acquired a potion crafted by a Wizard, which allowed him to successfully break through to the Silver Level.
However, that potion consumed the body's potential to gain Level advancement, meaning Gory could hardly progress further from then on.
Silver Level, in the Human World, is just of medium standard. Joining the army could earn him an officer's position, but thinking to rise from commoner status to nobility was simply wishful thinking unless he could make great achievements on the battlefield.
But in reality, for a common officer like him without backing, the most arduous and dangerous tasks in the usual wars fall to them, while opportunities for real merit are reserved for those with deep noble lineage.
Surviving narrowly in the army, retiring with wounds and in desolation, barely hanging on with the meager pension, is not the life Gory wanted.
It's better to continue being a mercenary outside. With his Silver Level abilities, he could assume a Deputy Captain position in the mercenary corps where strength is solely respected.
Years of mercenary life, except for occasionally envying the lofty nobles, had already worn out his childhood thoughts. Now, his greatest wish was to earn a lot of money, buy a large piece of land, and become a major landlord in the countryside.
Of course, that was before he was captured by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
From the day he witnessed Austin demonstrating the unfinished power of the Beastman Six Styles, Gory completely changed his mind, forming an intense desire for those Secret Techniques.
He saw the chance to change his fate and become a noble!
Gory knew that even if he could escape the Dragon Nest Tribe now, he would merely become a petty mercenary with life and death at the mercy of fate upon returning to the middle world, because having forcefully broken through to Silver Level with a potion, he had no future for further advancement.
Perhaps by struggling hard, begrudgingly surviving, saving up some money despite sustaining injuries, marrying a wife with unremarkable looks, buying land in the filthy countryside, becoming a landlord, only to have his injuries relapse in old age, confined to a wheelchair.
But now, if he could obtain those Secret Techniques, he was confident of demonstrating Gold Level combat prowess with his Silver Level ranking!
If he possessed Gold Level combat strength, then he would be among the high-level forces in the Human World, making it not so out of reach to acquire the lowest rank of baron.
Full of ambition, Gory decided to lay low.
To infiltrate the higher-ups of the Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe and gain access to the cultivation methods of those Secret Techniques.
Gory began to showcase himself proactively, striving diligently in various production work, wholeheartedly contributing to the development and construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe, hoping to thus establish meritorious deeds, attract the attention of the beastman leadership, and obtain the training methods of the Beastman Six Styles.
Vini and others noticed Gory's efforts, praised him several times, and included him in the legion as one of the officers, leading a team.
In this expedition to sweep the Wet Bone Forest, Gory, as a former Mercenary Deputy Captain, with extremely rich experience in exploration and wilderness survival, was brought along on this mission and held a consultative role in strategy.
Austin's cautious step-by-step strategy was partly due to Gory suggesting various potential dangers, many of which were hard to resolve.
Successfully entering the high-level view made Gory exceptionally excited because he saw hope for acquiring those Secret Techniques.
However, what Gory did not know was that his hope was destined not to be fulfilled for a long time.
Because before they owned territory with a sufficient human population, Austin would not consider admitting these mercenaries into the upper echelons and exposing them to the Beastman Six Styles.
Humans, by nature, are more complicated and convoluted than beastmen.
Moreover, Austin didn't sense the same loyalty and fervor from Gory as from the Dragon Nest Beastmen, nor did he feel any sense of belonging Gory felt to the Dragon Nest Tribe. How could he easily teach out the Beastman Six Styles?
These human mercenaries, at the very least, needed their bodies and minds to integrate into the tribe before Austin would let them become high-ranking members.
The powerful might of the Beastman Six Styles not only filled the hearts of ordinary beastmen with yearning, but the former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory also desired it intensely, creating a great longing among every Dragon Nest army officer present.
Previously, the Junior Officers and their Extraordinary Beastmen were basically on the same tier. Although the combat power of the elite Extraordinary Beastmen was stronger, being on the same rank meant the gap was visible.
But now, as their comrades began learning the Beastman Six Styles under the great guidance of His Highness Austin, the gap between them opened up completely, with no gap in sight.
Train harder, train harder!
Once their physical fitness meets the standard, after cultivating the Beastman Six Styles, they'll possess the ability to slay a Giant Snake in an instant just like the Junior Officers!
Within the Dragon Nest Division, observing the performance of the Junior Officers ahead, every beastman now harbored a deep yearning for strength.
"Hiss!!!"For more chapters visit novelꜰire.net
The Giant Snake herd, previously charging, was also deterred by such a scene, watching the beastman Junior Officers flashing back, not pursuing, hesitating uncertainly.
In the darkness, the fire crackled, with both sides standing in silent standoff,
The Dragon Nest Beastmen side exuded momentum, eager to rush forward and slaughter the Giant Snakes, but as the Legion Commander Rodney did not give the order, the Dragon Nest Beastmen had to remain within the formation, tightly gripping their weapons, staring intensely at the Giant Snake herd with fervent eyes.
The Giant Snake group coiled into a ball, tongues flicking in and out, massive heads bobbing in the air, hesitating whether to attack the enemy in front.
Hiss!!!
Soon, a screech filled with authority, like metal scraping, echoed from the darkness.
The Giant Snake herd, as if receiving an order, retreated like the tide, dissipating into the darkness.

chapters.title: Chapter 189 - 185 Dilemma (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
"Have they left...?"
Watching the giant snakes retreat into the darkness, the leader of the Dragon Nest Legion, Rodney, also breathed a sigh of relief.
Although the Beastman Six Techniques are powerful, Rodney, who has personally practiced these combat techniques, knows well that using the six techniques is extremely taxing on the beastmen's stamina and Fighting Qi. At this stage, the Dragon Vein Officers are not yet capable of continuous combat.
In this dark night, coupled with the thick mist, if the giant snake horde truly charged regardless of casualties, the entire Dragon Nest Legion would probably suffer heavy losses.
"Clear the battlefield, stay alert!"
Rodney waved his hand and issued the command for vigilance.
Although the giant snake horde has retreated, there's no telling if they might make a surprise return attack, so they must remain cautious.
Following Rodney's orders, some beastmen began to clean up the corpses of the giant snakes on the ground, while others lit torches and patrolled the perimeter to ensure the safety of the camp's stronghold.
Just after Rodney had arranged the post-battle matters,
Whoosh!
Suddenly, a massive air current stirred in the sky above. The lush leaves and branches split to the sides, casting a massive shadow that descended onto the scene.
"Greetings, Your Highness Austin!"
Rodney and other high-ranking beastmen quickly stepped forward to greet him, but Austin brushed it off and directly asked:
"How are things going?"
Even before entering the Wet Bone Forest, Austin sensed that although the forest was dangerous, the level of danger did not feel fatal.
At the time, Austin had speculated that the hidden demon beast race within the Wet Bone Forest might not be very formidable; it was just that the surrounding beastman tribe was too weak to discover their true nature, which allowed the forest's fearsome reputation to persist.
However, during the camping experience of the past five days, based on the anomalies from the Blood Wolf and the vague sense from deep within the forest, Austin couldn't help but suspect that perhaps his presence deterred the demon beasts from attacking.
To lure the hidden demon beasts from the depths of the forest to attack, Austin left the temporary stronghold on the sixth night and roamed the perimeter.
The result was as expected, the temporary stronghold in the Wet Bone Forest was indeed attacked.
"Report to Your Highness, three warriors from the tribal army suffered fractures from the impact force on the Bronze Shield, but there were no other major issues. A few contributing officers are slightly exhausted."
This night attack, although seemingly anticlimactic, was only so because the Dragon Vein Officers instantly killed several giant snakes, scaring off the invaders.
The initial black giant snake struck with its tail, and the incredible power not only repelled a squad of more than twenty heavily armored beastman gun shield soldiers, but those who directly bore the brunt of it had their arms dislocated and fractured under the crushing force while holding the Bronze Shield.
Fortunately, the toughness of the bronze alloy was sufficient; if it had been the previous Wooden Shield or Stone Shield, it would have shattered on the spot, and the powerful snake tail would have crushed the beastmen in the front row.
With the introduction of bronze alloy, it gave the ordinary beastmen of the Dragon Nest the confidence to confront such massive creatures like the giant snakes in group combat.
"Hmm, make proper arrangements for the injured warriors' recovery and discuss the next steps of our battle plan."
Austin nodded and said solemnly,
Instructing Rodney to take care of the current post-battle cleanup, then later convene to deliberate on the forthcoming strategy.
The fact that the demon beast in the Wet Bone Forest turned out to be a horde of giant snakes was unexpected, yet within reason.
Snakes inherently favor dark and damp places. This Wet Bone Forest, due to its environment, is enshrouded in thick mist year-round, the air inside is very humid, and the tall trees block out the sunlight, making it an ideal habitat for snakes to thrive and reproduce.
The occasional disappearances of inhabitants from the beastman tribe on the forest's outskirts are likely the result of giant snakes sneaking out at night, silently slipping into homes, and silently strangling and devouring the sleeping beastmen.
No wonder that after the Dragon Nest Legion's large-scale advancement into the Wet Bone Forest, the Blood Wolf grew increasingly uneasy, and Austin faintly sensed the surveillance from deep within the mist.
Snakes have nearly zero vision, relying instead on infrared sensing abilities, so the dense mist permeating the Wet Bone Forest's air is essentially irrelevant to them, enabling them to monitor the Dragon Nest Legion's every move from the unseen periphery.
Judging by tonight's attack, there must be a particularly intelligent leader among these giant snake hordes.
Fortunately, after tonight's attack, Austin and the Dragon Nest Legion now know precisely what lurks within this Wet Bone Forest, which is better than fumbling blindly.
As long as they know what demon beast race resides here, they can devise countermeasures accordingly.
"...If we want to conquer the Wet Bone Forest, we must completely eliminate the giant snakes hidden within the mist... Due to the nature of snakes, able to "see" other creatures in the dark, nighttime is their most advantageous battleground, so we must achieve victory during the day when we can exterminate the entire horde, ensuring none escape and hide in the jungle."
Within the temporary camp, the high-ranking officers of the Dragon Nest Legion gathered together, discussing the next direction of advancement. Former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory spoke eloquently before Austin and the beastman officers.
The Wet Bone Forest itself is shrouded in thick fog, leaving visibility hazy and limited to a range of ten meters, and at night, one can only see vague silhouettes in the dim light from flames.
Such an environment is naturally a snake's home terrain. At night, the Dragon Nest Legion is at a disadvantage; thus, war must be waged during the day.
"If a few giant snakes unfortunately escape and hide within the forest, it will be incredibly difficult to root them out, which would be detrimental to future resource development in the Wet Bone Forest."
Gory had some speculations about why Austin was sweeping through these dangerous areas.
To exploit the resources within the Wet Bone Forest, killing all the threatening giant snakes would be the best course of action.
"In that case, we must find the lair where the giant snake horde gathers, but this Wet Bone Forest is vast, with the thick fog hindering scouting, so how can we locate it?"
"How about luring the giant snakes into another attack, then send people to follow after they retreat?"
"No, the giant snakes' vision in the dark isn't impacted, and we wouldn't see anything without a light."
For a moment, the venue was abuzz with discussions, but most beastmen were frowning, unable to come up with a solution.
How exactly can they find the lair of the giant snake horde?

chapters.title: Chapter 190 - 186 Found the Nest (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
Hard, hard, hard!
The Wet Bone Forest itself is already the home turf of the giant snake group, coupled with their infrared detection capability, in this fog-filled woodland, they possess a cheat-like perspective ability.
Trying to find the giant snake's lair in this forest will take an unknown amount of time, let alone having to guard against the snake's raids along the way.
For a moment, all the Beastman officers inside the base fell silent, even Gory couldn't come up with a method to break the deadlock quickly.
With the strength of the Dragon Nest Legion, although they possess the power to forcefully break through the entire Wet Bone Forest, it's still unknown how many lives would be lost in the process. Even if they do break through the forest, if any fish slip through the net and swim in this fog-covered woodland, it would be even more troublesome.
At the moment, Austin had no good ideas either.
To crush the giant snake group in one move, one must find their lair, but in this kind of environment, it's impossible to deploy Beastman soldiers for a blanket search, and even assembling together for search would consume an unknown amount of time.
While deep in thought, the Beastmen sitting around the fire could not come up with anything.
Just as Austin was about to call off the meeting, he suddenly noticed in his peripheral vision, on the previous battlefield, two Blood Wolves sniffing around the ground stained with snake blood, occasionally licking the ground with their crimson tongues, and then looking into the distant darkness.
Suddenly, a flash of inspiration struck Austin's mind.
"Blood Wolves! Yes, the Blood Wolves!"
Giant snakes can sense enemy directions through infrared because the forest's fog poses little restriction to them, in fact, it becomes an advantageous home field for them.
While Dragon Nest Beastmen find their vision obstructed by the surrounding mist, it doesn't mean the Dragon Nest Legion lacks the ability to locate them.
Besides the Beastmen, the Blood Wolves are also part of the Dragon Nest Legion.
Blood Wolves, apart from seeing enemies with their eyes, can also confirm enemy locations through their sense of smell.
In this Wet Bone Forest, due to the foggy conditions, the Blood Wolves' sense of smell is somewhat dulled, initially only responding when giant snakes approached within a certain range of the base. Austin didn't let the Blood Wolves pursue due to various reasons, causing the Beastmen to inadvertently overlook this point.
But now, the situation is completely different from when they first entered the Wet Bone Forest.
Now, the identity of the enemies hiding inside the forest is clear; many worries no longer need to be feared, and the direction of the departing giant snakes can be tracked directly.
Moreover, the most important thing is the bloody scent from the injured giant snakes!
In the previous attack, the surging giant snakes were shot at by the Beastman archers in rounds of arrow rain. Although no giant snakes were killed, some scales from the snakes at the center of the arrow rain fell off, leaving them wounded and forced to hide behind.
After the snake group retreated, the bloody scent left by the injured snakes became the best marker!
"Everyone, be prepared to march quickly following the Blood Wolves' lead at daybreak; action must be swift to catch the snake group off guard!"
With this thought, Austin immediately gave the order.
The bloody scent can linger for a considerable time, and tracking closely behind the retreating snake group using the Blood Wolves should lead to the giant snake group's lair base.
And judging from tonight's situation, the one commanding the snake group in the darkness has certain intelligence. To conquer them, a rapid march must be executed to catch them unprepared!
...
The next day, the prepared Dragon Nest Legion set out thunderously, following closely behind the Blood Wolves, advancing quickly.
This time, Austin also soared in the air, moving along with the team; beneath, teams of Beastmen flowed like a torrent through the forest, an unstoppable force, destroying everything in its path.
The entire Wet Bone Forest area is a five-kilometer basin, and with full-force marching, they can cross it by midday.
Therefore, under Austin's strategic decision, the Dragon Nest Legion had abandoned the initial step-by-step cautious approach.
After marching for an undefined period, as the ground gradually turned into piles of round stones, the towering trees around began to become sparse, massive round paths appeared between half-height unknown shrubs.
At this point, the Blood Wolves at the front stopped, growling lowly at the front, pausing and restlessly facing forward.
"This is the place!"
Austin landed on a branch of a gigantic tree, gripping the iron-like iron claws tightly onto the branch, his gaze fixed ahead.
Under this dense white mist, the Beastmen's vision is limited to within ten meters, but being of the Giant Dragon Race's legendary bloodline, Austin's senses are several times stronger than those of ordinary races like Beastmen. In this thick mist, he can even see fifty meters away.
In his line of sight, a large fountain-like valley entrance loomed faintly, surrounded by unbelievably smooth round stones; it's uncertain whether these stones are naturally formed or manmade.
And at that time, surrounding the valley entrance, were massive pythons curling, each was twenty to thirty meters long, as thick as a barrel, no less intimidating than the giant snake group that raided the temporary base last night, with a number exceeding hundreds!
As for the leader of the snake group, due to the terrain and fog cover, Austin did not see it.
But it's certain that the leader of the giant snake group must be among them.
Moreover, based on previous signs, it's speculated that these giant snakes might be snakes that prefer nocturnal activities; now it's daylight, it's very likely all the giant snake groups are gathered in this pebble-filled valley.
"Bring the Blood Wolves, divide the teams, all warriors surround that valley entrance for me!"
With Austin's command, the Dragon Nest Legion down below immediately followed the Beastman Officers, dividing into four teams and dispersing in different directions.Latest content published on .ɴet
The central team, gathered with Austin, Rodney, Quik, and most of the combat forces, was responsible for the frontal assault.
As for the other three teams, they circled around, surrounding on three sides, waiting for Austin to lead the Beastman army to penetrate the giant snake group head-on, they would then converge to completely kill the escaping giant snakes.
"All units advance!"

chapters.title: Chapter 194 190 Snake Shedding Grass
chapters.content:
The Giant Snake Leader is at least a Gold Level Lord of Magical Beasts, and its innate magic must also not be weak, allowing it to dominate the entire Wet Bone Forest.
Unfortunately, from the beginning, the entire snake group fell into Austin's calculations. First, a thunderstorm cleared all its kin and helpers around it, followed by the Beastman army's assault to completely cut off its support.
In the end, even though Rodney got into some trouble due to his rashness, he successfully attracted its hatred, allowing Austin to find the opportunity to strike and successfully break its spinal cord.
Although the Giant Snake Leader with a broken spinal cord was not dead yet, its strength had greatly diminished, and with such a large body dragging it down, there was no chance of escape.
In the subsequent battle, with Austin as the main attacker and the Beastman Transcendents as support, they finally pinned the Giant Snake Leader to the ground not far from the valley entrance.
The aftermath of the battle between the two giants left the earth in a mess, with potholes everywhere, fissures as thick as an arm spreading out, stones shattered, and blood covering the ground.
During this process, the serpent leader, in its death throes, used its venom spray talent magic at the last moment, corroding the ground ahead into a large pit over ten meters wide.
Fortunately, the close-range assisting Extraordinary Beastmen were Beastman Officers trained in the Beastman Six Techniques, who used Instantaneous Step Flash to escape in the nick of time.
However, the terrifying poison emitted by the serpent's spray even contaminated the air, causing several Beastman officers in the distance to be too late to escape, inhaling the air and collapsing from poison.
Rip!
With a claw, the head of the Giant Snake Leader was torn open, and sure enough, a black Magic Beast Crystal Core was found inside.
Among the entire valley of giant snake magic beasts, only the Giant Snake Leader's body contained a Crystal Core, which was within Austin's expectations.
"Finally managed to kill it."
After extracting the Magic Beast Crystal Core from the Giant Snake Leader's body, Austin showed no intention of swallowing it immediately.
This black giant python's poison was extremely potent, who knew if the Crystal Core, concentrated with its essence, might be even more dangerous? Even though the Dragon Race's magic resistance is strong, it's not to the extent of being immune to everything.
After thinking about it, Austin tossed the Crystal Core to the Fox-faced Man, Quik.
"Quik, take this and study it to see if it has any other uses."
The Magic Beast Crystal Core is the crystallization of a powerful magic beast's entire strength and essence. Even though the Giant Snake Leader is now dead beyond doubt, the Crystal Core still holds the pressure of a High Tier Magic Beast.
In other words, as long as someone holds that black giant python's Magic Beast Crystal Core, ordinary snake animals would automatically submit and be commanded by it.
Moreover, within the Wet Bone Forest, the environment itself is suitable for the survival of snakes. Although the giant snake tribe has been wiped out, quite a few other snakes must still be scattered around. With this Giant Snake Leader's Crystal Core, moving or producing within the Wet Bone Forest would be much easier in the future.
Furthermore, centering on this Crystal Core and finding a method, there might be a chance to develop a Beastman that can command snakes—currently, the Dragon Nest Tribe doesn't have a snake race, but that doesn't mean it can't have one in the future.
With the death of the Giant Snake Leader, there's nothing left in the entire Wet Bone Forest that makes Austin feel threatened.
Leaving the aftermath of cleaning the battlefield to Rodney and others, Austin swiftly flew to the valley entrance where the Giant Snake Leader appeared, with Quik and a few Beastman Officers following behind, and the well-informed Gory also proceeding together.
"Is this... a karst cave?"
A dragon and several Beastmen flew down from above the massive valley entrance. With the demise of the Giant Snake Leader, the gray poison gas previously permeating the Giant Snake Valley also dissipated, the dust settled, and the view cleared up.
Though called a valley, it might as well be a giant natural karst cave.
Or let's say, the ground in this area suddenly collapsed, forming a giant sinkhole.
The exit above this sinkhole is not large, but the space below is substantial, with the entire pit looking like an upside-down bowl.
On the surrounding stone walls, long stalactites hang down from the top, and the ground is covered with smooth stones. It's unclear whether the pit was always like this or if the ground was worn down by the snakes living here.
Inside the pit, there are many charred snake corpses, obviously the young snakes directly killed by Austin's thunderstorm, and snake eggs scattered in shady corners not far away.
Perhaps moving the snake eggs back to the tribe would make for a fine delicacy.
Without staying long, Austin and his group headed straight for the depths of the pit. At this massive collapsed pit, in the distance, there was a huge and deep cave entrance leading to who knows where.
Yet, just in the depths of the pit, they could feel the continuous surge of dense Water Attribute Magic Power gushing from the depths of the cave entrance, filling the entire space.
Only by being inside this huge pit in the Snake Valley could Austin feel that the whole pit seemed like a fountainhead of Water Attribute Magic Power, continuously spewing magic power into the outside world.
No wonder the snake group chose to establish their nest in such a place, likely because a massive Water Attribute Magic Power vein opened a gap in the nearby area, making the magic power density around here significantly richer than other places.
"This is..."
Not long after entering the tunnel within the cave, Austin and the Beastmen stopped, with the Beastmen staring ahead in a daze.
Only to see, on both sides of the enormous passage ahead, densely packed gray snake shedding piled up, covering a large area, making one's scalp tingle just by looking.
However, even the fox-faced man Quik also saw it, the plant similar to white grass growing in this dark and damp place, surviving between the gaps filled with snake sheddings.
"This is Snake Shedding Grass!"
Each time a snake grows, it needs to shed its skin, continually discarding the old outer layer and growing new scales.
And when these snake sheddings absorb magic power from the air, a type of white grass-like plant grows using the sheddings as raw material, called Snake Shedding Grass.
In this world of extraordinary phenomena, Snake Shedding Grass has a very potent function for treatment and regeneration.
It's also the best-healing plant among all the herbaceous plants documented in the Fox-faced Man Quik's established medical system.
Quik quickly moved to the side, took out a bronze dagger, and cut a wound in his palm, causing blood to flow immediately. Yet, he seemed indifferent, without any frown, and carefully picked a leaf from a piece of Snake Shedding Grass in front of him, mashed it into a paste, and applied it to the wound.
With the infiltration of Snake Shedding Grass juice, the newly opened wound quickly stopped bleeding.

chapters.title: Chapter 195 192: Medicinal Materials, Ore
chapters.content:
"Indeed, it's Snake Shedding Grass, and its effect is much stronger than typical Snake Shedding Grass."
Quik opened his palm, and sure enough, the wound from just now had completely stopped bleeding, and the wound tingled slightly; it was estimated that it would fully heal in about half a day.
If in the Human World, this kind of Snake Shedding Grass would probably be top-notch material for making Healing Potions. However, there was no talent in the Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe for potion-making, so they could only use it externally like this.
"Not bad, this place needs proper protection to serve as a medicinal herb base in the future."
Austin nodded. He had also seen the effects of the Snake Shedding Grass. With this vast area of Snake Shedding Grass, if his legion were unfortunate to get injured during battles or giant beast hunts, they would have better herbal care.
Moreover, since Snake Shedding Grass has such vigorous regenerative life force, maybe it could serve as the main ingredient, supplemented by other herbs, to realize the method from Austin's previous life of using herbal baths to enhance the strength and physique of Beastmen.
Looking around, the entire large area was covered with gray snake sheddings, and white Snake Shedding Grass was everywhere, so there was no worry about running out of it.
If they could research the method of herbal baths from the past life, it would undoubtedly enhance the strength of the Dragon Nest Legion, especially in this world where the extraordinary manifests.
Calling over some Beastman Warriors to guard this area well, Austin and others continued their exploration.
The cave passage was huge, even Austin's several-meter-tall body didn't feel cramped inside. As they went deeper, passing through the large space of snake sheddings, what followed was a tunnel full of shining white bones.
Large white snake bones silently lay there, skeletal remains scattered everywhere, indicating this was likely a tomb-like resting place for the deceased Giant Snake colony.
Among the gleaming white bones grew some segmented, bone-like unknown plants whose effects were not yet known.
"These plants are indeed uncommon."
Quik crouched in deep thought, snapping a segment of an unnamed plant, causing a crisp snap, which, if not for the leaves on the branches, one might truly mistake for a bone.
"It needs to be studied well to see what the effects are."
The Snake Shedding Grass, which grew among the snake sheddings, had healing and recovery properties, so these unnamed plants growing from the snake bones should have some roles as well.
Austin nodded noncommittally.
This journey, regardless of the Snake Shedding Grass or these unnamed segmented plants, plus the many snake corpses obtained from annihilating the Giant Snake tribe, was already a massive gain for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, clearly, these weren't the reasons Austin originally decided to sweep through the dangerous area of the Wet Bone Forest.
Fortunately, as they went deeper, Austin could distinctly feel the increasing density of Water Attribute Magic Power in the air.
His goal was nearing!
"Here it is indeed!"
Having passed the Snake Bone Tomb and through a relatively narrow passage, the scene before them suddenly brightened like turning from darkness to light.
In the dim space ahead, blocks of dark blue stones were embedded in the surrounding walls, flickering with faint light, and the thick Water Attribute Magic Power permeated every corner of the space.
In the foremost area, the soil wall had been dug into a relatively large pit, and blocks of dark blue stones were faintly visible among the soil, hidden in the earth.
This was clearly a vein,
a vein of dark blue unknown Magic Ore, and the output of this vein was not small.
"What are these ores?"
Austin dug out a block of dark blue ore from the soil with his claw, sniffed it, and then directly threw it into his mouth, chewing it in big bites.
It tasted like toasted grain, crunchy.
The ore was directly crushed by sharp teeth and swallowed, Austin felt a gentle magic power gradually spreading from his stomach to his body, while the remnants were also ground and absorbed by his powerful stomach.
A decent taste, but at the same time, there was a metallic taste in his mouth.
"This is Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore."
The former Mercenary Deputy Captain, who had been standing at the rear, spoke, glancing at the dark blue ore with a trace of eagerness in his eyes.
"Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore is the main material for refining Water Pattern Iron. With Water Pattern Iron, you can create Water Attribute Extraordinary Weapons, and if Water Pattern Steel can be refined, it can even directly make Silver Level Extraordinary Weapons. A piece of Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore can be sold for at least ten silver coins, even several dozen, in any part of the Central Earth World!"
No wonder the United Kingdom repeatedly banned merchants from smuggling goods to the Beastman Tribes in the Kawa Great Forest, yet every year, numerous merchants risk danger and enter what is known as the Death Barbaric Land for trade, repeatedly defying the ban, as the resources within the Kawa Great Forest are abundant to such an extent.
Casually clearing a dangerous area can reveal a vein of such enormous value, transporting a single piece of Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore to the Human World would be worth at least ten silver coins. How many pieces of Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore were in this cave?
And beneath the soil of the Wet Bone Forest, which caused the phenomenon of fog enveloping it, how many ores were buried?
That surely was a huge, astronomical number!
At that moment, Gory's heart surged uncontrollably with greed,
but he quickly suppressed the greed in his heart, averting his gaze from the precious Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore.
Right now, the most important thing for himself was to gain trust and acquire the secret technique known as the Beastman Six Techniques. Although the Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore before him was valuable, he did not have the capability to transport the ores on a large scale out of the Kawa Great Forest.
"Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore, containing Water Attribute Magic Power?"
This thought flickered through Austin's mind, no wonder the taste was good.
If, in the future, there were dealings with human merchants, perhaps these could be used to exchange for purchasing some supplies, especially some Extraordinary Weapons.
Bronze Weapons were already regarded as excellent by the Dragon Nest Beastman Soldiers, but recent events had shown that Rodney's Bronze Armor couldn't withstand the attacks of the Giant Snake Leader, and even the painstakingly crafted Bronze Greatsword shattered in a short time.
In the future, when the strength of the Beastman Junior Officers increases, the gap in Extraordinary Weapons will be apparent.
However, if Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore truly had such properties, perhaps it could be given to the goblins to see if they could combine it with Bronze Weapons to craft Extraordinary Weapons.
These thoughts quickly flashed through Austin's mind and were then set aside.
While these matters would benefit the Dragon Nest Tribe, what's most crucial now is to devour enough Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore to advance to the Gold Level!
In the following days, Austin made arrangements and began devouring Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore inside the Giant Snake Cave Valley until the magic power within his body reached its limit and could no longer be absorbed.
Then, Austin fell into slumber.
This slumber,
lasted nearly three months!
....
P.S.: I've been chatting with a few friends all night, so the third update can't be done for now,
I'll try again tomorrow and see if I can do four updates.

chapters.title: Chapter 196 192: Border (1st Update)
chapters.content:
The Bloody Border refers to the region at the junction of the Southern Countries of the Human World and the southern Kawa Great Forest of the Seta Continent.
This area extends for hundreds of kilometers, and for thousands of years, the beastmen within the Kawa Great Forest have been engaged in seesaw battles with human soldiers from the Southern Countries in this area. The blood shed by humans and beastmen has nearly stained every piece of land red, hence it is called the Bloody Border.
To resist the invasion of beastmen from the Kawa Great Forest, several duchies in the Human World's south, bordering the Bloody Border, formed an alliance, relying on cities to establish a massive defensive line within the border area. They connected these cities with walls using a large number of enslaved farmers, ultimately forming the unbreakable Bloody Great Wall.
From the moment the Bloody Great Wall was established, it became the most solid barrier against the beastmen for the Southern Countries, and humans relied on the wall's defense to constantly expand towards the Kawa Great Forest.
Landless refugees from various regions, bankrupt individuals, fallen nobles, adventurers, mercenaries, bandits, and traveling merchants selling goods continuously gathered here, amassing a vast amount of wealth by exploiting the resources within the Kawa Great Forest.
However, while it is a paradise for the brave, it is also hell for the cowardly.
The land outside the Bloody Great Wall is not owned by any duchy of the Human World, thus it is free without legal constraints, an immeasurable territory.
With years of development, human footprints have even reached the outskirts of the Kawa Great Forest. Greedy human merchants have even engaged in commercial trade with some powerful beastman tribes.
A large amount of human activity in the border area, with various commercial and exploration activities, has plunged the Bloody Border into a bizarre prosperity.
However, all of this was shattered by the Beastman Tribe Alliance's attack more than half a year ago.
Since the end of the cold winter and the beginning of the new year, the beastmen tribes within the Kawa Great Forest have migrated explosively, the border areas fell one after another, and a massive number of beastmen directly reached below the Bloody Great Wall.
The prosperity of the past was wiped away, and almost all adult humans were drafted to the walls to fend off beastman attacks.
Trade routes were severed, resulting in substantial economic losses, but most importantly, following months of relentless attacks, the defending soldiers' morale has almost reached its limit, and a sense of impending doom shrouds the entire Great Wall.
Now, various major tribes within the Kawa Great Forest have formed a Tribe Alliance, gradually gathering over five million beastmen stationed below the Bloody Great Wall. Standing on the wall and gazing out, you see an unending series of crude camps and densely packed beastmen stretching into the horizon.
This is an unbelievable number, representing nearly fifty percent of the beastman population within the Kawa Great Forest participating in this war.
This is practically an all-out war, and it's said that the entire border of the Bloody Great Wall is under siege by the beastmen.
Yet, despite such a crisis, human leaders are still embroiled in power disputes, weapon supplies are hard to come by, and some human farmers have had to carry pitchforks to the walls for defense.
The air reeks of a filthy stench, mingled with the bloody scent of successive battles and the foul smell of decaying corpses, as an aura of despair begins to spread among the soldiers.
Meanwhile, in Bodun City,
the largest city on the Bloody Defense Line, within the City Lord's Mansion.
"Mr. Edward, the pressure on the defense line is very severe now. The Grand Duke can hardly get enough sleep each day, but he values your information highly and specifically sent me to find you, hoping your news will not disappoint him."
A middle-aged man dressed as a butler, wearing military attire, led the dust-covered Edward and his companions into the City Lord's Mansion.
"Rest assured, Mr. Butler, I am well aware that Grand Duke William's concerns involve the fate of millions at the border. If I wasn't confident enough, I wouldn't have sought a meeting with the Grand Duke so lightly. This is intelligence that my companions and I risked our lives to obtain, and it will not disappoint the Grand Duke."
Edward, along with a teammate, followed the butler into the City Lord's Mansion, speaking politely, without displaying any contempt despite the butler's position.
After escaping from the Kawa Great Forest, not having time to plan retaliation against that Blue Dragon, the Beastman Tribe Alliance came charging in with large forces, directly attacking the Bloody Frontier.
This war is not like the seasonal harassment of previous years; it is a full-fledged, life-and-death struggle.
Urgent dispatches from the Bloody Great Wall continually reached the various duchies, and Edward was also drafted into the military.
In the army, Edward met some good companions, reportedly from a well-known mercenary corps, now all drafted into the military. Due to his noble status, he became the officer leader of the team.
Because of Edward's strength, leading the team to victory again and again gained his companions' approval. Subsequently, during an order to aid other cities, the army was ambushed by beastman forces and was nearly wiped out.
Luckily, Edward was quick-witted and instead of retreating, chose a contrarian path, stealthily heading toward the Kawa Great Forest with companions, directly attacking a beastman tribe's base camp. This avoided post-battle beastman searches and ambushes, and in a surprise attack, they destroyed a poorly prepared beastman camp.
In that support battle, only they and a few others managed to return.
It was precisely because the beastman forces had set up ambushes along the retreat route in advance, and the beaten human army, fleeing to the city, stumbled into the ambush circle, completely ensnared.
Since that battle, the mercenaries fully committed themselves.
But this wasn't the end. After attacking a beastman camp, Edward discovered a hint of the beastmen's frantic actions. From an injured senior beastman left behind at the camp, he learned the reason for the Beastman Alliance's madness in attacking the Bloody Border.
At first, Edward was skeptical, but after continued investigation, he finally confirmed the truth of the information obtained from the beastman leader.
Because of this, he broke out in a cold sweat.
Mutated Evil Spirits, Undead Calamity, those are things capable of annihilating the entire human civilization!
Yet after calming down, a crazy idea emerged in his mind,
a method not only to resolve the war but also to counter the Mutated Evil Spirit and its Undead Calamity.
And this is also why Edward appeared in the City Lord's Mansion, about to meet with the supreme commander of the human allied forces on the Bloody Defense Line, Grand Duke William.
"That's good. If you can indeed resolve this beastman war, you will be the saviors of the millions within the Bloody Border!"
The butler nodded gravely, arranging for Edward and his team to remain in the lounge,
then entered the inner chamber to report to the Grand Duke.
...
ps: Uh... the chapter name in the last chapter was wrong; it should have been Chapter 191. Since it can't be changed, let's leave it at that.

chapters.title: Chapter 197 - 193: The 4th Talent Magic
