chapters.content:
In the border areas, the winds rise and clouds gather.
A destiny struggle concerning humans, beastmen, and mutated evil spirits is underway; the ship of fate is uncertain of its route, and an unpredictable great change is about to descend upon the battle line stretching for hundreds of miles.
And Edward, who triggered this great change, is displaying his capabilities on the power arena between beastmen and humans without restraint, and regardless of the outcome, Edward's name, having caused such a great event, will surely spread far and wide.
The soldiers at the bottom have no idea how this change will end, and Austin, who slumbers far away in the Dragon Nest Tribe, knows nothing of it either.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn NoveI★Fire.net
After nearly three months of slumber, Austin has woken up from his sleep.
This is Austin's second slumber, but this time, the slumber was much more urgent than the last.
This was not a good time to sleep, with the zombie army of mutated evil spirits in the southwest still unresolved, and the grievance with the Blood Claw Tribe at the Bloody Border unresolved; dangers could arise at any time.
But Austin also knew that only by further enhancing his own power could he gain enough strength to protect himself in the chaotic battles.
Of course, he was not entirely unprepared before his slumber.
Previously, he had ordered the Dragon Nest Tribe to prepare for a retreat and dispatched a large number of beastman officers to the southwest to monitor the movements of the zombie army of mutated evil spirits, alerting immediately upon any change.
The beastmen who went to investigate the Bloody Border were also prepared, ready to wake him up immediately should any irresistible danger approach.
Fortunately, everything was peaceful, and Austin successfully entered the Gold Level.
"Finally entered the Gold Level..."
On the cliff, Austin stretched out his wings as much as possible; the massive shadow almost covered the sky, casting a huge shadow.
After nearly three months of slumber, the large amount of Water Patterned Demon Iron Ore previously consumed was completely digested, leading to a new round of growth as magic power rapidly expanded.
Now, Austin's body has reached a height of six to seven meters, with the massive membranous wings reaching twenty meters in length, expanding over twice as much as three months ago.
And perhaps due to consuming the Water Patterned Demon Iron Ore, the water elemental magic power was digested while the remaining Magic Iron Ore Elements were also absorbed by the body's scale armor, used for the body's expansive growth.
The dark blue scales shimmered with a metallic luster, indestructible.
Even when struck with a Bronze Sword, the clash of sword and scales emitted a sound like the striking of metal, without leaving a white mark.
With Austin's current defense, even standing there allowing endless ordinary creatures to attack with swords wouldn't cause him any harm.
One could say, among the many beastman tribes within the Kawa Great Forest, he alone as a dragon could sweep across the armies, regardless of how many ordinary beastmen would attack, none could leave a mark, as ordinary beings had lost the significance of numbers against him.
Of course, that excludes the beastmen who have entered the Extraordinary Domain and those wielding Extraordinary Weapons.
Austin, relying on his exceptionally enhanced scale-armored body, can immune the weak attacks from ordinary beings but hasn't reached the level of immunity against Extraordinary Powers.
However, even so, it's already impressive; it's known that when humans enter the Gold Level, although their bodies can be enhanced to some extent, without special martial techniques or using fighting qi for defense, weapons can still inflict certain damage based solely on physical defense.
Even for Gold Level Great Warriors, a regular army could exhaust the fighting qi of a Gold Level Great Warrior to death, only a legend truly transcends worldly power.
"However, the power of the Giant Dragon Race's bloodline seems a bit too extraordinary."
Feeling the immense power within him, Austin found it somewhat unbelievable.
As he entered the Gold Level, the Legendary Law hidden within his bloodline unleashed some more of its potent power, successfully awakening a new talent magic skill.
With a thought, instantly, the sky changed colors, and layers of dark clouds rolled in, covering the entire sky, causing heaven and earth to plunge into darkness.
Whoa!!!
A massive airflow was stirred up as Austin took flight into the dense dark clouds.
In the sky, dense dark clouds covered, and amidst the roiling clouds, lightning flashed and thunder roared, endless clouds gathering in the sky, changing the previously clear weather.
At this moment, Austin felt like a fish in water, with the surrounding stormy dark clouds and thunder becoming part of him.
Never had there been a moment where Austin felt so clearly the power of wind, water, and thunder elements permeating the world around him, deploying them at will.
It felt like with just a thought, he could command the cloud storm covering the entire sky.
Super Storm!
This is the talent magic awakened by Austin upon entering the Gold Level, capable of summoning the power of wind, water, and thunder elements between heaven and earth, enveloping the entire sky in dense dark clouds, forming a super storm capable of destroying a city.
This is the fourth talent magic awakened by Austin after Electric Shock Paralysis, Thunder Strike Technique, and Electric Current Control.
It seems like another worthless ability.
At least from the perspective of the Giant Dragon Race, any adult dragon in this world would likely consider the four magics awakened by Austin; aside from the Thunder Strike Technique, barely having some power, the other talent magics are utterly useless.
Although this storm is named super, capable of destroying a city, its range comparable to a Forbidden Curse, the power greatly falls short of a Forbidden Curse.
The so-called Forbidden Curse can take down a legend if not careful.
But the destructive power of Austin's Super Storm seems world-shattering; its true power only affects extraordinary professionals below the Bronze Level, while those above Silver Level can resist this Super Storm using fighting qi.
As for Gold Level Great Warriors and Great Mages, the fierce winds and waves stirred by the Super Storm are merely a nuisance, posing no major threat.
This widespread dispersal of power, a large-scale spell requiring extensive magic power to summon, in the eyes of other mages or dragons, can't even compare to a regular Thunder Strike Technique.
However, that's only what others think.
Austin, on the contrary, felt the power of this fourth talent magic was beyond conventional understanding.
Because this Super Storm can truly be regarded as a simplified version of a Legendary Domain!

chapters.title: Chapter 198 - 194: Spherical Lightning (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
Back when Austin was just a quasi-Gold level, a trace of the power of a Legendary Law unsealed by his bloodline leaked out, which was enough to affect the weather, causing the sky to be overcast with clouds, bringing sudden wind and thunder, and utilizing the thunder generated from the clouds above to enhance the power of his Talent Magic.
However, the storm and thunder brought in by that trace of the Legendary Law were not controlled by Austin; they were merely the result of the leaking of a trace of the Legendary Law.
Moreover, every time Austin went all out, the reason he could summon up weather phenomena of clouds covering the sky was simply because the climate within the Kawa Great Forest was similar to the tropical rainforest climate Austin knew in his previous life. The entire forest was full of moisture in the air with frequent heavy rain, and that trace of the Legendary Law was just a trigger, prematurely stimulating the phenomenon of clouds and rain that was going to occur naturally in the forest.
If in any other place, three months ago, Austin simply would not have been able to casually evoke the degree of cloud and storm generation.
For example, if in a desert area, when quasi-Gold level Austin appeared, that trace of the Legendary Law could not evoke the weather phenomenon of storm and wind from the heavens and earth.
But after reaching Gold Level and awakening his fourth Talent Magic, Austin can summon a Super Storm in any place through his Talent Magic, causing clouds and rain to cover the entire world.
Even in the desert, bringing a large amount of rain to the dry sands, altering the local environment is not impossible.
Of course, if this Talent Magic was only capable of making his entrance cooler, only able to change the environment of a place, Austin would not value it that much, let alone call it a simplified version of the Legendary Domain.
Though the power of the Super Storm isn't extremely strong, what Austin values most about this Talent Magic is its ability to change the environment of a place.
And, the changed environment of that place is under Austin's own control!
The Super Storm itself is the result of the interplay of the elements of wind, water, and thunder, and since these three elements are under Austin's control, the resulting Super Storm is also controlled by him.
The elements of wind, water, and thunder that make up the storm are all controlled by Austin, and the entire storm domain feels like a part of his body, even like a domain he himself has created!
"With this Talent Magic, I can develop a powerful attack strategy."
Feeling his control over the entire Super Storm region, Austin thought to himself silently.
After activating his third Talent Magic, Electric Current Control, Austin developed powerful attack modes such as the Thunder Roar Cannon and Electromagnetic Cannon using it, and these techniques played a significant role as he grew.
However, Austin would not stop there.
While the Thunder Roar Cannon and Electromagnetic Cannon are indeed powerful, compared to a technique Austin had conceptualized in his mind from very early on, they're still quite inferior, and it's fair to say that their power cannot be compared.
If he could truly develop that technique, Austin would possess an attack method comparable to a Forbidden Curse with his Gold Level power.
That is—Spherical Lightning!
Spherical Lightning is a super weapon Austin read about in a science fiction novel in his previous life, its power hundreds, thousands, even tens of thousands of times stronger than ordinary thunder!
Compared to the destructive power of the intense light and heat produced by thunder, the destructive power of Spherical Lightning reaches the molecular level.
In the novel Austin read in his past life, Spherical Lightning had an extremely powerful offensiveness, directly invading the molecular structure of any object it touched, completely destroying and then reconstructing its original structure, a process that would instantly kill any living being, even causing a person struck by it to be turned into ashes in an instant.
Even during the time of Austin's previous life before his reincarnation, scientists hadn't figured out the reason for the occurrence of Spherical Lightning.ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ novel•ﬁre.net
When Austin awakened his third Talent Magic, Thunder Control, he tried producing the legendary Spherical Lightning through the gathering of lightning.
But what was formed by Thunder Control was merely a ball of lightning.
The reason is unknown, but Thunder Liquid, although it can gather under the authority to control thunder, is just a mass of lightning shaped into a sphere, not true Spherical Lightning.
For when Austin revoked his authority to control thunder, the mass of lightning, forcibly shaped into a sphere, dispersed and split into streaks of electric light, it was impossible to form a stable Thunder Ball.
It must be known that true Spherical Lightning can stably exist in nature.
Moreover, the "lightning ball" forcibly shaped had power vastly different from the Spherical Lightning depicted in novels, merely on par with ordinary lightning.
Due to several consecutive failures, Austin gave up the idea of creating Spherical Lightning.
But with Austin now having awakened his fourth Talent Magic, Super Storm, he now sees hope for successfully creating Spherical Lightning.
"Based on the data collected by scientists in my previous life, Spherical Lightning mostly occurred during thunderstorms. Now, by stimulating a Super Storm, I could create a thunderstorm area under my control... Within the entire Super Storm region, it's all my domain; every move resonates with me. As long as Spherical Lightning successfully appears in the storm, perhaps I can use it to complete the construction of Spherical Lightning!"
Sensing the thunderstorm area almost within his own domain, Austin's eyes burned with a fierce flame.
Once successful in creating Spherical Lightning and expanding its size by hundreds or thousands of times through the Super Storm region, the final vast Spherical Lightning would possess power even surpassing a Forbidden Curse!
As for the scientists in the previous life who didn't thoroughly research and understand Spherical Lightning, Austin remembers nothing of their various theoretical constructions of it, but that does not stop Austin from creating that immensely powerful attack method comparable to a Forbidden Curse in this world.
Because in this world, both material and,
simultaneously, idealism exist!
This world has the presence of idealistic power.
Magic is idealistic, and a Giant Dragon is itself a representation of idealistic power.
By combining idealistic power with the materialistic science of his previous life, Austin has successfully bypassed the need to master various scientific theories, mastering the Electromagnetic Cannon that was not applied in his previous life.
And this power of magical idealism is Austin's greatest confidence in his ambition to create Spherical Lightning!

chapters.title: Chapter 199 - 195: Anomaly
chapters.content:
In Austin's mind, he uses his own abilities to artificially create a thunderstorm area within nature.
Given that this area is under Austin's control, as soon as ball lightning appears, he can clearly perceive the principles behind its formation.
Even if the principles are unclear, as long as he can personally witness the formation of ball lightning, Austin can use his giant dragon magic talent to create ball lightning, perfecting this terribly powerful attack technique.
This power, which directly invades the molecular structure and completely dismantles and reshapes the original structure, has almost touched the source level of power. Whether in power or scope, it is not inferior to the forbidden curse unleashed by legendary mages.
Possessing an attack magic with forbidden curse level power is undoubtedly very enticing for Austin.
However, now is not a good time for experimentation.
Austin has just awakened and is currently above the Dragon Nest Tribe. If he impulsively uses the Super Storm talent magic to turn the entire area into a thunderstorm region, wouldn't he be ruining the hard-earned possessions he has accumulated?
"I should go down first."
Suppressing the impulse within his body, Austin descends to the ground. At this moment, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, Vini and other tribal leaders are already waiting beneath the dragon's nest for Austin's appearance.
Having just ended his almost three-month-long slumber, Austin wakes up to test his newly acquired abilities, yet he hasn't seen the people of the Dragon Nest Tribe or knows about the tribe's current situation. It's important to remember the complicated situation the tribe was facing before his slumber.
Even though he wants to develop new magic, it cannot be completed in an instant. The tribe's situation needs to be sorted out first.
The reaction of the Blood Claw Tribe within the Beastman Alliance, the degree to which the mutated evil spirits and zombie horde have spread, and the current development status of the Dragon Nest Tribe—these are all matters concerning tribal survival that need to be resolved at the earliest possible moment.
"Vini, did anything happen in the tribe while I was asleep?"
Landing in the center with a huge gust of air, Austin directly asks Vini in front.
"Your Highness, everything else is stable, except the southwest side brought a lot of trouble. If you hadn't woken up in these few days, we were planning to wake you directly...."
Vini shows a trace of worry on his face, while the other Beastmen seem to be forcing themselves to keep up their spirits, looking exhausted, and Rodney is still injured.
Evidently, while the Dragon Nest Tribe hasn't faced a life-and-death crisis during these three months, it's probably close to reaching its limit.
Kobold leader Vini leads Austin to the tribe's medical facility and begins reporting the situation of the past three months.
"Your Highness, after you fell asleep, the tribe decided to withdraw its forces and halt the raids on other tribes..."
With Austin, Vini narrates while walking.
Due to Austin's slumber, the Dragon Nest Tribe's combat power has decreased drastically, and coupled with previous continuous raids and annihilations, the tribe's population is gradually approaching the thirty-thousand threshold. The extreme population growth puts considerable pressure on the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For these reasons, the Dragon Nest Tribe has paused its external military expansion and started solidifying its foundation, focusing on internal affairs.
A large number of captured Beastmen, after military training and transformation, have joined the tribe as members of the Dragon Nest Tribe, participating in land reclamation, hunting, fishing, mining, and copper refining work.
For a while, due to the massive population engaging in production, the tribe's food production capacity rapidly increased, ushering in a new round of great development for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Meanwhile, Vini and other high-ranking members of the Dragon Nest Tribe didn't forget Austin's instructions before his slumber. They dispatched teams to seek retreat routes and monitor the Blood Claw Tribe, repeatedly embarrassed by the Dragon Nest Tribe, and the southwest's greatest threat, the mutated evil spirits' zombie horde.
They continuously solidified the tribe's foundation, increased the Beastmen's training intensity, manufactured a large number of bronze weapons, enhancing the combat power of Dragon Nest Beastmen to face the potentially looming war.
Initially, everything was calm and peaceful.Latest content published on NoveI~Fire.net
No news came from the Blood Claw Tribe at the Bloody Border. Instead, the Tribe Alliance acknowledged Austin's replacement of the Blood Claw Tribe branch, saying that if the Dragon Nest Tribe could indeed withstand the zombie horde from the mutated evil spirits when the Tribe Alliance breaches the Bloody Great Wall, they could offer a passage position to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
But regarding the Dragon Nest Tribe, they didn't hold it in high regard, only sending people to check every ten days or so to see if the tribe harbored any possible threats from mutated evil spirits, but didn't specifically focus on it.
Among Austin's other conditions, requests for weapons and manpower support seemed impossible. Even the inspection missions were brief, just a glance before leaving, with no intention of staying long-term.
This allowed the Dragon Nest Tribe to conceal its capability of mass-producing bronze metal weapons, preventing the Tribe Alliance from getting greedy and coveting this.
It also meant that when Austin really faced the zombie horde from mutated evil spirits, he would have to fight alone.
However, it didn't matter much. Austin had already hinted to Vini and the others that if they couldn't win, they'd still find somewhere else to retreat and flee.
With no reaction from the Blood Claw Tribe, the exploration teams heading east and north also found a rough safe retreat route.
Everything remained tranquil, with the Dragon Nest Tribe quietly developing and vigilantly preparing.
However, just half a month ago, a sudden upheaval occurred in the southwest, nearly catching the Dragon Nest Tribe off guard.
"Due to the zombie horde swiftly invading large territories in the southwest, the migration of large amounts of wild beasts resulted in an immensely terrifying wave of beasts. Terrifying giant beasts, powerful magic beasts, and countless ordinary wild animals constantly threatened the Dragon Nest Tribe's peace. During these days of conflict, the tribe's warriors suffered heavy losses. If not for the sweeping of the Wet Bone Forest discovering the cave tunnel where Snake Shedding Grass grows, which provided sufficient healing Snake Shedding Grass, they might have faced huge trouble."
Vini leads Austin to the tribe's medical department, where countless rooms house dozens or hundreds of wounded.
Most of these Dragon Nest Beastmen appear to have external injuries from wild animal bites, and each individual's expression looks extremely exhausted. Beastmen nurses come and go, applying the Snake Shedding Grass concoction to wounds to speed up recovery, while fractures and sprains are corrected with sticks.

chapters.title: Chapter 200 196 Pyramid Base
chapters.content:
The zombie army that was originally situated southwest of the Dragon Nest Tribe, slowly spreading outward, suddenly went mad half a month ago, expanding in all directions day and night.
In just over ten days, the mutated evil spirit's zombie army approached within a hundred miles of the Dragon Nest Tribe!
However, the first round of danger the Dragon Nest Tribe is about to face isn't from the zombie army crawling out of Hell, but from the beast tide triggered by the zombie army's expansion.
Since approaching within a hundred miles of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the mutated evil spirit's zombie army has returned to its original state, with zombies wandering leisurely outward.
Meanwhile, according to the feedback from Beastman scouts, it seems those zombies are constructing something, collecting rocks, wood, etc., and are being controlled to transport them in a certain direction.
The zombie army resumed its slow pace from over two hundred miles away, but the army has occupied a large area of land, causing numerous creatures living in those places to flee in large numbers.
The first crisis faced by the Dragon Nest Tribe is the beast tide caused by a mass migration of wildlife.
During this crisis, numerous beasts, giant beasts, and magic beasts passed one after another, and the Dragon Nest Tribe itself, being densely populated, was seen as prey by these ferocious and ravenous hunters fleeing their lost territories.
Even though the Beastman Legion continuously launched attacks, killing group after group of beasts, the Dragon Nest Tribe still suffered constant assaults.
Ordinary Beastman militia can't even go out for farming and production, and the tribe's production activities are greatly hindered.
Meanwhile, in defending against beast tide attacks again and again, even though there are quite a few Beastman Transcendents stationed, and though the Dragon Nest Legion is equipped with numerous bronze weapons and armor, in such intense combat, quite a few Beastman soldiers are injured and sent to the medical division for treatment.
Fortunately, the Dragon Nest Tribe obtained a large amount of Snake Shedding Grass after the last cleanup of the Wet Bone Forest, allowing many soldiers to receive excellent treatment, needing only a period of rest to recover.
Otherwise, just the beast tide prompted by the zombie army would have already inflicted considerable losses on the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Even though Beastmen have a stronger constitution compared to ordinary humans, in a place like the Kawa Great Forest, injuries are still prone to infection, and once infected, without treatment, the mortality rate for Beastman warriors is as high as fifty percent.
"Has the mutated evil spirit's army not approached again?"
Looking at the numerous injured soldiers, Austin asked Vini after comforting them.
The beast tide faced by the Dragon Nest Tribe has basically peaked, and with Austin's awakening, the rest poses no issue.
What Austin felt the most danger from was still the mutated evil spirit's zombie army that had approached within a hundred miles of the Dragon Nest Tribe!
"No, every day the undead wander aimlessly at the borders, while some sturdier undead constantly mine rocks, numbly transporting large rocks and wood back."
Recalling the bizarre behavior of those evil spirit corpses, many Beastmen present were puzzled and confused.
It's quite astonishing to make lifeless corpses move again, let alone command them to engage in production and construction!
Vini's words made Austin's heart jolt, and instinctively, he recalled the pyramid he encountered when deeply venturing into that infected wasteland...
An unease lingered in his heart.
"No, I need to inspect it myself!"
...
Above the heights, Austin's large membrane wings flapped as he swiftly flew through the clouds, constantly scanning the land below that was evolving toward wasteland directions with worry in his eyes.
Only to see on the ground, thick green smoke rising from the earth, eroding the land, causing trees to wither, wild grass to twist madly into mutations, and the soil to rot.
Zombies dragged their decaying bodies across the wilderness, the whole world seemed to lose its vitality, like a shattered doomsday scene.
After successfully entering the Gold rank, Austin's enhanced perception clearly felt beneath the earth, threads of sinister and enigmatic power spreading outward like a web network, while the green smoke rising from the ground evidently leaked from those networks of power.
"What the hell are these things!"
Three days of investigation left Austin's heart even more uneasy.
The land recently occupied by the zombie army is being eroded at an alarming rate by some mysterious and sinister force, as if some important aspect of the earth is being plundered by the evil controlling the zombies, transported through the underground networks toward the massive pyramid being built in the distance.
Indeed, within the hundreds of kilometers occupied by the zombie army over the past half month, an enormous pyramid is slowly being erected.
The huge pyramid has already constructed a base over a hundred meters, its outline gradually emerging, as gigantic zombies continuously haul materials upward for construction.
Gazing at the looming pyramid under construction in the distance, anxiety filled Austin's gaze.
The web-like networks of evil power beneath the earth spread outward from the pyramid base, forming web-like patterns covering the entire land beneath.
And the land eroded by the network seems to have something plundered from it, turning into desolate wasteland.
"It's like a virus, constantly spreading, eroding, making soil lifeless..."
Austin furrowed his brow, everything was too strange.
Undead-like zombies, commanded corpses, pyramids, dead earth...
What on earth is the evil spirit manipulating all these things?
After pondering for a long time, Austin could think of no answer.
But he understood one thing.
"Whatever it is, we must attempt to destroy the pyramid base!"
Based on previous experience, Austin already knew that once the pyramid is completed, the surrounding area within a hundred miles will again become a wasteland, a paradise for zombies and undead.
Moreover, once the pyramid is completed, countless zombie armies will launch a new assault, and then they will definitively affect the entire Dragon Nest Tribe!
"Let's first try if the electromagnetic cannon can resolve it."
Austin gathered a considerable amount of bronze, landed far from the pyramid on a mountaintop, gazed at the pyramid base in the distance, and began activating his ability.
Crack!!!
Lightning flashed out of nowhere, bright blue light instantly illuminated the entire mountaintop...

chapters.title: Chapter 201 197: Giant Tumor
chapters.content:
These mysterious pyramids should be the main culprit causing the corruption and erosion of the Forest Land.
With the pyramid at its core, mysterious dark energy traverses and spreads beneath the soil, forming a path that continuously extends outward, plundering energy substances akin to the vitality of the land, transforming it into a paradise for zombie activities.
Once a piece of land is completed, the zombie army will surge forth again to occupy a large territory and construct a new pyramid, eroding new land.
Austin didn't know what those mutant evil spirits were, nor what was going on with the endless zombie creatures on the wasteland.
But from the current situation, once the pyramid a hundred miles away from the Dragon Nest Tribe is completed, the land the zombie creatures will next plunder will inevitably include the range of the Dragon Nest Tribe's territory.
To fight or to flee, Austin had yet to decide.
However, fleeing without probing the gap between them, abandoning the hard-won Dragon Grass Tribe's foundation, was clearly not Austin's style.
At the very least, I need to test it out.
"Super Electromagnetic Cannon!"
Atop the mountain, Austin opened his mouth, and the massive membrane wings behind him unfolded like a shadow covering the sky.
The next moment,
Fizz!
Bolts of electricity flashed out of thin air, transforming into electric snakes that spread out, and the bronze components prepared on the ground were immediately attracted by an invisible force, floating in the air in front of him.
Upon the peak, arcs of electric light danced wildly like longs snakes, tearing through space while dazzling blue light illuminated the entire mountain. At that moment, it seemed as if the entire mountain was shrouded by thunder and lightning.
The zombies below detected the rumbling from the mountain top and began swaying toward it, but halfway up the mountain, they were annihilated into ashes by the lightning in the sky.
As the electric light atop the mountain grew increasingly blinding, there seemed to be a terrifying power accumulating in the air.
The suffocating feeling was akin to a volcano, repressed for millennia, about to erupt!
At a certain moment,
Boom!!!
An enormous pillar of dazzling yellow light burst forth, its blinding radiance engulfing everything, even dimming the very light in the sky, all the colors between heaven and earth coalescing into that single pillar of light!
The terrifying energy made even the air boil; that pillar of light seemed to pierce through space, bringing world-destroying energy as it roared toward the base of the pyramid being constructed.
Austin knew well the power of a complete pyramid.
The first time he saw zombie figures to the southwest, during an investigation deep into the wastelands, he happened to witness a pyramid under construction, resulting in him nearly being killed by an inexplicable energy emanating from it.
Because of that previous experience, Austin had been cautious over the past three days, constantly probing the outer perimeter but not encountering any counterattacks from the pyramid's base.
This also led Austin to understand that perhaps the base of the pyramid being constructed was yet incapable of launching an attack!
Thus, Austin boldly targeted the mountain's peak, firing an electromagnetic cannon straight at the pyramid base.
The enormous yellow light beam seemed to instantly pierce through a vacuum, spanning over a thousand meters, poised to shatter the pyramid base being constructed.
Yet at that moment,
The zombie army, dense like a black ocean previously transporting materials beside the base, suddenly surged up like flowing water, in an instant enveloping the entire base. At the same time, it grew and spread at a visibly rapid pace, transforming into a massive, grotesque, and decaying fleshy tumor thousands of meters high, covering and protecting the entire base beneath it.
"What!!!"
Though it sounds lengthy, all of this happened in just a moment. The tumor formed by countless zombie creatures completely enveloped the pyramid's base, and when the light beam of the electromagnetic cannon reached it, the massive terrifying tumor split open with a gigantic mouth, displaying grim serrated teeth, black pus draining down, the black gaping maw seeming as if it swallowed all light.
Gulu!
The enormous maw swallowed the firing electromagnetic cannon whole, the yellow light beam abruptly vanishing.
Moreover, simultaneously, the monstrous tumor abruptly swelled, quickly expanding like a balloon on its surface, bursting with a pop in an instant, oozing foul liquid sprayed everywhere, interspersed with rotten flesh plummeting down like rain.
"What... what the hell is this!?"
Austin stared blankly at the transformations ensuing in front of him, dumbfounded.
Now, the area where the pyramid's base was located was already enveloped by a twisted, grotesque tumor fleshy mass towering over a thousand meters high, yet that decaying tumor mass had already been blasted away more than half, as if a huge chunk had been scooped away with a spoon.
And as a large number of zombie creatures swarmed from all directions, continually merging into that massive tumor, the previously vacant spot was growing and restoring at a visibly rapid rate, restoring to one whole unit.
Originally zombies, and things like pyramids appearing in the Otherworld had already left Austin utterly shocked.
And now, this flesh-tumor-like zombie collective protecting the pyramid's base further broke Austin's worldview entirely.
With his good eyesight, Austin could clearly see the composition of the grotesque tumor, and it was precisely because of this that he felt an immense shock rising within him.
But within the giant tumor, the disgusting, sticky mucus filled every corner, seemingly melting part of each of the zombie creatures' decayed bodies and bonding them into one entity, with some eerie white skeletons still exposed.
It's like each decayed zombie has become a cell, forming this horrifying, grotesque giant tumor flesh mass with disgusting mucus linking them all!
And now, that giant tumor was continuously growing and restoring, completely encasing and protecting the pyramid's base within, like a real living entity.
Austin felt chills creeping all over him,
What exactly are these mysterious pyramids?!
Not only can they devour the power of the earth, but they also control zombie creatures to protect themselves, transforming zombie creatures into a tumor-like biological collective.
The feeling is as if the entire pyramid is a command brain system, issuing orders to all zombie creatures nearby, and if necessary, it can gather zombie creatures to form a new amalgamated life form.
And at the root of all these transformations, what sort of existence is the ultimate mutant evil spirit?
Soon enough, the enormous tumor had squirmed and processed back into shape, and from a distance, you could still see deep within amidst the decaying mucus-covered surface, one could make out the multitude of sinister white bones like tiny white ants...

chapters.title: Chapter 202 198 Biological Weapon
chapters.content:
Tens of thousands of zombie creatures have gathered into a terrifying giant tumor over a thousand meters high, protecting the pyramid's base below. Even Austin's full-force electromagnetic cannon couldn't break through the tumor's defense.
Watching that massive, sticky tumor constantly squirming, in no time, the large gap blown out by the previous electromagnetic cannon was completely restored.
Meanwhile, passages slowly surfaced at the bottom, and those zombie creatures began to haul building materials through the passageways like ants. Austin realized that he no longer had the means to destroy the pyramid's base.
"These zombies, including that pyramid, probably don't have intelligence and can only make instinctual responses to external dangers."
After observing for so many days, Austin had some guesses about the endless zombies and the pyramid base.
These zombies, along with the pyramid they're building, should be some kind of biological weapon, either plundering some life-like source from the earth or infecting it, directed by the mutated evil spirit lurking behind.
Or rather, these zombies, and the pyramid that controls everything, are specially designed biological weapons to achieve such a purpose!
Once the land is eroded by the pyramid's mysterious force, it becomes wasteland, where only zombies and some cursed, twisted mutant plants can survive.
"Before the pyramid is truly completed or armed with attack methods, it's my only chance to stop the zombie plague from spreading!"
The situation is critically severe. If the pyramid is allowed to complete and another wave of expansion erupts, the Dragon Nest Tribe will undoubtedly be within the expanding range of the zombie creature army.
Unless they completely relocate and flee, if they become surrounded by the zombie creature army, the only outcome is total annihilation.
"But at this stage, the strongest single-target attacking force, the electromagnetic cannon, is of little use."
Gazing at the shadow where the massive tumor looms, Austin's heart sank.
The giant tumor not only didn't dissipate with the cessation of the attack but instead, like a fungal plant, rooted itself in the soil, enfolding the entire pyramid base.
But materials collected by zombie creatures still continuously enter from the holes beneath the tumor, confirming that construction of the pyramid base inside the tumor continues unabated.
The earlier electromagnetic cannon shot made Austin realize that his attacks hardly affected the tumor.
Although one electromagnetic cannon blew away a fifth of the tumor, within ten seconds, the massive fusion of zombie creatures allowed the tumor to rapidly regrow to its previous state, while its outer slime started turning into a gel, hardening into a sticky black outer shell.
This eerie phenomenon reminded Austin of the words attack and evolution.
That tumor may not just be a collection of zombie creatures but a type of organism, one that evolves in response to attacks!
After being attacked by Austin's electromagnetic cannon, that composite tumor evolved a gelatinous shell on its surface to weaken the cannon's attack.
At the same time, inside the tumor, the zombie creatures operating like cells of its body were merged and liquefied into a viscous mass, with bone-white ant-like skeletons densely studding the tumor's surface. One even saw gruesome scenes of half-melted skulls gaping and wriggling.
The tightly compressed viscous mass, like dough, made Austin's electromagnetic cannon less effective.
This seems like an unsolvable situation.
The more it is attacked, the more that grotesque tumor evolves until Austin's electromagnetic cannon has no effect whatsoever.
"Damn it, the electromagnetic cannon is useless. Do I really have to prepare for evacuation?"
The electromagnetic cannon is Austin's most powerful attack technique at present.
Other than the electromagnetic cannon, no matter how hard he racked his brain, Austin couldn't think of a way to resolve the tumor problem, leaving him quite upset.
After years of struggles, Austin had built a substantial foundation within the Dragon Nest Territory.
He had established a Dragon Nest Tribe base of small city scale, nearly ten thousand acres of cultivated farmland, expanding mushroom houses, fish breeding boxes, livestock ranches, a Copper Mine Base, and, just recently, a Wet Bone Forest that had been cleared, providing the tribe with abundant Snake Shedding Grass and Water Patterned Demon Iron Ore.
This hard-earned land wealth cannot accompany the tribe in an evacuation, inevitably having to be abandoned, which would be a significant blow to the tribe's development.
"No, there's still a way!"
A flash of determination passed through Austin's pupils. The electromagnetic cannon is his strongest attack technique to date, but that doesn't mean it will always be so.
After nearly three months of sleep, Austin awoke and activated his fourth Talent Magic, conceiving a direction for developing an ability that might reach Forbidden Curse Level.
"Originally, I planned to develop Spherical Lightning later, but now it appears I must accelerate the development process!"
Once that attack capability rivals a Forbidden Curse is completed, possessing the power to fission and decompose at a molecular level, no matter how strong the tumor's regenerative abilities, it will perish under Spherical Lightning!
Gazing deeply at the dense horde of zombie creatures and the towering tumor in the distance, Austin turned and quickly flew away.
The pyramid, only having completed a hundred-meter base, would take at least two to three months to finish. During this time, Austin could complete the development of Spherical Lightning.
The only trouble is, cold winter is about ten days away...
As Austin left, neither the giant tumor nor the zombie army showed any reaction, just like the initial two or three days, allowing Austin to continually fly high for reconnaissance without any response.
They behaved as if specified by simple programming, unable to contemplate or retaliate, only passively defending until the pyramid's attack methods are fully constructed.
After Austin's departure, there was no change in the zombie creatures; they continued collecting and transporting large amounts of building materials into the pyramid from the tunnels below the tumor.
And that tumor stood quietly on the ground, motionless, like a blood-flesh-grown builder's nest construct, with zombies transporting materials in and out tirelessly.
Inside the tumor, the half-melted zombie creatures forming the tumor mass continued writhing...

chapters.title: Chapter 204 200 Attempt Failed (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
Rumble!
In a boundless forest, the sky overhead was shrouded with dark clouds, rumbling thunder reverberated between heaven and earth, and the heavy black clouds pressed down on the entire sky, seemingly about to collapse.
A torrential downpour descended from the sky, mixed with violent storms, as if the heavenly river had broken its banks, large swathes of trees were flattened by the hurricane, the entire forest land undulating like ocean waves.
Trees, unable to withstand the dreadful hurricane and storm, were continuously battered and shattered by the fierce storm; with a crashing sound, massive branches were torn in half, and then lifted by the fierce wind, soaring into the sky and swept into the turbulence.
On this expanse of land, electric snakes danced across the sky, since days ago this frenzied thunderstorm had not ceased, and the once densely interwoven forest trees were now sparse and shining, as if they had encountered the wild ravages of some gigantic beast.
"Still not working…"
Above the sky ravaged by the torrential downpour, amidst the heavy clouds, electric snakes danced wildly within the layers of clouds, shining with a piercing brilliance, transforming that entire area into something akin to a sea of lightning.
Austin glided through the clouds, surrounded by rampant electric light that spread out, permeating the entire sky.
At this moment, he had his eyes tightly closed, fully perceiving the thunderstorm weather emanating around him; amidst the ferocious storm, the elements of wind, water, and thunder were all reflected in his mind, as if he were in the midst expanding his senses, enveloping the entire area of the superstorm.
However, after attempting for three days and nights under the continuous thunderstorm weather, turning the forest below into a swamp, Austin still had no clue.
From the beginning, Austin knew that spherical lightning with such destructive power couldn't be developed so simply; otherwise, humanity wouldn't have had to wait until 2012 for the first scientific observational record of spherical lightning in human history from his previous life.
The probability of spherical lightning naturally occurring in a thunderstorm area might be one in a thousand or even lower, one in ten thousand.
Austin's confidence stemmed from the fact that within the domain range of the superstorm, the entire thunderstorm area covered by the superstorm, the meteorites combining the elements of wind, water, and thunder were within his sensing range.
He could even artificially alter the various environments of thunderstorm thunder, through various attempts, to achieve the principles scientists from his previous life proposed for the appearance of spherical lightning, to see if it could be successfully realized in nature.
In Austin's previous life, scientists proposed numerous hypotheses about the causes of spherical lightning formation, and Austin happened to be somewhat interested in this area, because he remembered some of those theories.
For instance, traditional theory considered spherical lightning to be a vortex-like high-temperature plasma, utilizing the centripetal force created by inner high-speed rotation balanced with external atmospheric pressure to sustain prolonged stability, or maintaining energy stability through chemical reactions among high-temperature mixed gases.
And the reason these vortex-like plasmas occur is because during the occurrence of branching lightning, the air temperature in the lightning channel is very high, causing water vapor in the air to decompose into oxygen and hydrogen, and under special circumstances, the lightning channel splits into several sections. Thus, splitting the air near the lightning channel into clusters of gas containing hydrogen and oxygen, forming bead lightning, when the branching lightning stops, the temperature of spherical lightning drops, hydrogen and oxygen recombine, releasing energy during recombination, producing light while releasing energy, sometimes this energy release phenomenon is manifested through an explosion, resulting in spherical lightning.
Or lightning striking the ground, where the intense high temperature causes the silica in the soil to evaporate and become ionized, forming spherical lightning in the special thunderstorm environment in the high sky, and so on.
Or ordinary lightning excites macro-electrons, causing "macro-electrons" to be excited from lower energy levels to higher energy levels.
Those once dormant memories deep in Austin's mind had become clearer with his slumber and growth, as the legendary bloodline within the giant dragon awakened.
And through those theories, Austin had methods to attempt creating spherical lightning, which was also where his confidence lay.
However, Austin underestimated the difficulty involved.
Perhaps because his ability to control thunderstorm is not precise enough, or perhaps there are issues with the speculative theories about spherical lightning from his previous life, but at least during these three days and nights of continuous attempts, Austin had no leads, nor any signs of realizing spherical lightning.
"Failed! I was too confident; perhaps those theories are not wrong, it's just that my own control of thunder attributes is not perfect... or perhaps there are errors in the theories posited by scientists of my previous life; spherical lightning is more complex than imagined."
With no leads after three continuous days, Austin's mood sank accordingly.
After these days of attempts, he understood that continuing would only rely on luck, on the one in a thousand, even one in ten thousand probability of spherical lightning occurring in nature.
"No, merely relying on the luck of spherical lightning naturally forming is too slim a hope, other methods must be contemplated!"
Relying solely on luck might take half a year, by then, who knows, the flowers might have already withered, by then, the wave of zombie creatures might have already swept and occupied the Dragon Nest Territory.
With the failure to complete the attempt at spherical lightning through scientific hypothesis theories of his previous life, he could only seek other breakthrough directions.
"But, what other method can evoke spherical lightning?"
Within the clouds, Austin descended beneath a cliff amidst the wreckage below.
The sky was still shrouded in thick dark clouds, and fierce storms mixed with rain poured down, splashing onto the earth, everywhere within sight seemed to face a storm of flying sands and rocks, an apocalyptic scene.
Austin did not dispel the superstorm caused by his talent magic, but quietly remained perched on the cliff peak, allowing the rain like a bullet shower from the sky to fall, icy raindrops splashing on his head, perhaps this might help clear his mind.
"Could it be, just to give up like this?"
If he couldn't develop spherical lightning in time, then the giant lump of zombie organisms couldn't be breached, and once the pyramid was completed, there would be no opportunity for a counterattack, meaning the Dragon's Nest territory, painstakingly established over three years, would be completely destroyed.

chapters.title: Chapter 205 201 Aura
chapters.content:
Nowadays, the electromagnetic cannon is Austin's most powerful attack technique, but it, however, is entirely ineffective against the giant zombie flesh.
To destroy the giant zombie flesh made up of countless zombie creatures, we must develop more powerful attack techniques, otherwise, the rapidly regenerating zombie giant flesh will remain unaffected.
Spherical lightning is exactly the attack technique comparable to forbidden curse level that Austin wanted to develop upon awakening from his slumber, and as his realm elevates, his bloodline soul fusion makes some vague memories of the past clearer, even recalling the scientific conjectures he once read about the formation of spherical lightning.
He initially thought that following those scientific theories and assumptions, combined with his own control over thunder, he should easily be able to create spherical lightning.
But as it turns out, he was overthinking it.
"Spherical lightning cannot be created in a short time, so I have to develop other thunder techniques. But what else could be more powerful than the electromagnetic cannon?"
In the midst of the huge storm, Austin pondered deeply.
What weapon from his past is extraordinarily powerful?
Nuclear bombs? Or maybe hydrogen bombs?
Austin is not interested in nuclear fission bombs, but he does have some ideas about nuclear fusion hydrogen bombs.
Nuclear fusion is the process where two small-mass atomic nuclei fuse into one heavier atomic nucleus under high-temperature and high-pressure conditions, releasing a large amount of energy.
On the surface, this seems unrelated to Austin, as he appears to lack the conditions to create that environment.
But Austin, who had read widely in his past life, knows that apart from using nuclear fission bomb explosions to create high-temperature and high-pressure ignition for nuclear fusion, there is another thing called a magnetic confinement device that can facilitate nuclear fusion.
The principle of the device is to first treat atoms to be in a plasma state, followed by magnetic field confinement to achieve controlled nuclear fusion within the device.
And in this world where magic and the extraordinary are manifest, the Blue Dragon, as the master of storms and thunder, possesses the legendary bloodline inherent in controlling thunder's power, could it focus lightning strikes to make substances transition from low energy levels to high ones, forming a plasma state, thus achieving the conditions for nuclear fusion?
Theoretically, there is a great possibility, Austin could exploit this theory to unleash nuclear fusion level attacks.
However, even if Austin manages to create nuclear fusion now, he dares not use it.
Remember, in Austin's past life, a single nuclear bomb was capable of obliterating an entire city, and according to Soviet scientists' measurements, the power of a small-yield hydrogen bomb exploding in the air surpasses Hiroshima's nuclear bomb by thousands of times.
This level of energy explosion, looking at Austin's current physical data, is entirely unavoidable.
If Austin indeed performs a nuclear fusion reaction to attack the giant zombie flesh, the energy explosion would surely eliminate the enemy along with him, such a dangerous thing is beyond his current control.
"The power of nuclear bombs is too great, completely uncontrollable, but aside from nuclear bombs, is there any type of weapon from the past exceeding the power of the electromagnetic cannon?"
Austin felt his head hurting.
He thought for a long time, still unable to find an answer.
"Then stop thinking, better to run away honestly."
Austin exhaled a long sigh, once he made up his mind, despite the reluctance in his heart, he felt a massive relief.
Actually, running away isn't that big of a deal, if the foundation is lost, so be it, life is more important.
Originally, he developed to this level relying only on seven Kobolds, and now the Clan possesses such a significant force, there will always be a chance to rise again!
Relieving the conflict within his heart, Austin began to appreciate the Super Storm he himself had triggered.
With his mind continually on edge these three days, he hadn't had the chance to carefully observe the power generated by his fourth talent magic.
Now, with his heart released, Austin on the cliff had the time to watch it closely.
Rumble!
Between heaven and earth, the thunder rolled in waves, electric serpents and flames blossomed between the dark clouds, and a level twelve hurricane mixed with torrential rain poured down from the sky.
The sky above was within reach, the thick cloud layers rolled and roared, severely colliding and crumbling into one another.
Rumbling!
The violently surging clouds above the firmament sparked strong air flow collision, abruptly, a huge tornado ascended straight towards the heavens, transforming into a towering black funnel, massive trees were caught in the terrifying tornado below, uprooted from the ground, in an instant, earth and dust flew, as if the apocalypse had arrived.
"Not bad!"
Looking at the extremely dreadful tornado ravaging between heaven and earth, Austin's face grew joyful.
Previously, the tornado's actions before and after its formation were sensed in Austin's mind, various cloud dispersions, air pressure principles, the operation of wind attribute magic power, he was fully aware of how this tornado formed.
With some more experiments, it's possible to artificially create such dreadful tornadoes.
If it adds such level tornadoes within the domain of the super storm, even Silver Level extraordinaries might be hard-pressed to move!
"Interesting, the whirlwind surprisingly can swiftly rotate air currents due to air pressure differences, while reverse rotating air currents maintain the tornado's shape, truly a rare spectacle, if spherical lightning could appear, it'd be even better."
Amid his joy, Austin sighed once more.
In a thunderstorm, the odds of tornadoes appearing are likely much like the odds of spherical lightning, yet regrettably, he has not captured the attention of the goddess of fortune.
While sighing, Austin's gaze suddenly narrowed, his entire body stiffening.
"Rotate, rotate..."
He whispered to himself, suddenly as if realizing something, a flash of insight struck his mind, stirring a storm in the ocean of thoughts.
"It's rotation!"
"The rotation keeps the balance, also maintains the shape!"
Numerous memory sceneries flashed across his mind, he recalled the flash of insight when developing the Gale Wave, departed fighting qi easily dissipates in the air, but once imbued with speed, it can cut through the air, maintaining its shape briefly.
Then what about thunder? How can thunder attribute elements gather together, maintaining their shape?
Scene after recall flashed in his memory, finally freezing Austin's memory footage on some anime technique he saw in his past life—
That endlessly rotating pellet!

chapters.title: Chapter 206 - 202: Dawn (1st update)
chapters.content:
When Austin awakened his third talent magic, Electric Current Control, he attempted to blend strands of thunder together to form spherical lightning.
However, the thunder ball forcefully bonded together by the power of his giant dragon legendary bloodline couldn't remain stable. Once Austin withdrew his talent magic control, the thunder ball, painstakingly fused together, would collapse. Despite the huge expenditure of effort and energy, its power was even inferior to the Thunder Strike Technique with similar energy consumption, thus Austin did not pursue further research back then.
Because he couldn't constrain the rampant thunder elements, creating spherical lightning through immense effort couldn't maintain its shape, and at most, it could only sustain basketball-sized spheres without expanding further.
Although the forcibly blended thunder ball possesses exorbitantly high voltage and intense heat, due to rampant plasma inside it, these factors would pose considerable threat but hold no practical combat value.
As he advanced to Gold Level, further unlocking the giant dragon bloodline, his control over thunder became more refined. Due to the unprecedented crisis the Dragon Nest Tribe faced, the development of spherical lightning was revisited.
Initially, it seemed like achieving spherical lightning might be easy by relying on those awoken memories and relying on scientific principles proposed by scientists of the previous world.
But facts proved that initially, Austin overthought it a bit.
The destructive power at the level of molecular disintegration, even at a quantum state that obliterates objects from the material world, was way beyond his current grasp or understanding.
"Annihilation at the molecular domain, perhaps even erasing from the material world, such attacks closer to the material essence, how could they be casually developed?"
A sudden realization dawned on Austin.
This level of power approached the realm of divine authority, and even if he reached the legendary level, fully unlocking the power of the legendary law within him, he would never master such power.
Whether molecular-level destruction and reconstruction or "erasure" from material reality, these powers had reached the root forces of the world's survival, beyond what Austin, even as a giant dragon, at merely the young dragon phase of Gold Level, could master.
Fortunately, Austin realized this not too late.
Between the somber heavens and earth, torrential rain poured down, mighty tornadoes soared skyward like a vast funnel sinking from above.
Seeing the rapidly rotating yet wind-column-aligned tornado, a flash of lightning struck through his mind, and suddenly a gleam of insight surged within Austin's heart spirit.
Motion, rotation!
Though thunder could be forcibly blended through the giant dragon's bloodline to form basketball-sized thunder spheres, it couldn't maintain its shape due to the fierce nature of thunder elements.
Could motion or rotation grant the capability to maintain its form?
The problem encountered when developing Gale Wave in Beastman Six Techniques, with fighting qi dispersal, resurfaced, and back then, Austin used rapid rotation to rend the air, achieving long-range attacks.
Now, could he integrate the rotation feature into thunder elements to maintain the spherical shape, thereby creating spherical lightning?
Countless memories from the previous life flashed through his mind, finally settling on an anime series.
That endlessly rotating ball—
Rasengan!
Could he use the magical field formed by Rasengan to confine the thunder elements within a sphere, maintaining a shape akin to spherical lightning?
This thought merely flickered in his mind, then deeply engraved itself in his subconscious.New ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄhapters are published on ⓝovelFire.net
For the anime named Naruto, which became a memory of the 90s generation, Austin remembered vividly, and after three months of slumber, as his soul gradually fused with the giant dragon bloodline within him, those previous life memories became exceptionally clear.
Since he could draw inspiration from One Piece's Navy Six Techniques to develop Beastman Six Techniques, could he also use the method of Rasengan from Naruto to constrain thunder elements and create spherical lightning?!
In that moment, memories like Chakra, nature transformations, and others surged forth, like images flitting across his vision.
"Chakra, magic power, thunder elements, thunder elements..."
Austin murmured as if losing his divine soul.
Chakra originates from the divine tree, also the amalgamation of physical and spiritual energies, capable of transforming into wind, water, lightning, earth, fire attributes.
And magic? Various from Chakra yet incredibly similar in some respects.
Magic is power generated by magic power transforming into forces like wind, fire, etc., and unlike the ninja of the Chakra system, magic casting relies heavily on spiritual power control, thus more precise than ninjutsu.
Both Chakra and magic, based on self-existence, create natural elements like wind, water, thunder, earth, and fire through nature transformations.
Is it possible to develop similar magic by drawing from the Chakra ninja system?
Moreover, in comparison to Chakra's ninjutsu, which emphasizes spiritual power control, magic evidently offers more finesse than ninjutsu—a magic developed by referencing ninjutsu might even boast greater power.
Regarding the alteration between Chakra's and magic's strengths and weaknesses, the notion merely flashed through Austin's mind.
He was now more focused on Naruto's protagonist signature ninjutsu, Rasengan!
In Naruto, the Fourth Hokage, inspired by Tailed Beast Ball, developed Rasengan, gathering high-density Chakra in hand, circulating it irregularly, and compressing it to form a hand-sized Chakra sphere.
Could the same technique be employed using magic power to create a magic ball?
In Naruto, Naruto Uzumaki, by incorporating wind attribute change into Rasengan, transformed high-density Chakra within into numerous wind attribute powers, forming an innumerable assembly of sharp wind blades, resulting in the S-Rank Spiral Shuriken.
If using magic power, could a magic ball similarly undergo nature transformation, converting the internal magic into thunder elements, thereby achieving spherical lightning in another aspect?

chapters.title: Chapter 207 - 203: Development (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
Even though the two systems' powers are different, and although Naruto is just a fictional anime within Austin, since the Navy Six Techniques can be magically modified into this world, there's no reason the Chakra system with similar power characteristics can't do the same.
The logic is understandable, and there's a great possibility of realizing this idea!
Although the resulting Lightning Ball and Spherical Lightning are likely not the same, simply condensing Thunder Attribute Elements into a sphere is almost similar to the way Austin forcibly condenses lightning into a Lightning Ball through using Talent Magic.
This kind of Lightning Ball is far from the power described in previous science fiction novels where molecules are disassembled and reconstructed, and even matter is turned into a quantum superposition state, "erasing" from the material interface.
But if it can truly succeed, sustaining a stable Spherical Lightning and using it for attack, its power would not be inferior, at least much stronger than an Electromagnetic Cannon or the simple Thunder Strike Technique.
"The temperature of lightning is several times higher than the surface temperature of the sun. If the lightning can be compressed and condensed through the Rasengan method, its internal voltage and temperature would surely surpass ordinary lightning!"
If the imagined Thunder Rasengan can truly be developed successfully, then the temperature generated by lightning alone would be enough to instantly crystallize sand and stone.
Additionally, the explosive power formed by forcibly compressing and condensing through the Rasengan, the impact formed by the extremely oppressed explosive thunder, the power unleashed is simply unimaginable.
At least those zombie creatures and flesh creatures would have no chance of resistance in the face of such power, whether it's the massive zombie tumor flesh or the pyramid base beneath.
Initially thought the development had failed, but unexpectedly found a glimmer of hope.
Many ideas flashed through the mind, and then Austin began to engage in intense development.
The imagined Lightning Ball needs to go through two stages of development.
The first stage is to control Magic Power, drawing on the Rasengan's cultivation method to construct the world's unique Magic Rasengan.
The second stage, on the basis of the Magic Rasengan, involves transforming a large part of the magic within the Magic Ball into lightning through the nature change of Thunder Attribute Elements to maintain the shape of the Lightning Ball.
After developing the Lightning Ball, Austin might develop a Lightning Ball similar to the Choodama Rasengan Ninjutsu to better suit the current situation.
Imagine, a Lightning Ball akin to the Choodama Rasengan falling from the sky, the massive tumor creature formed by zombie creatures would instantly turn to ashes under the extreme temperature and terrifying impact of the Lightning Ball, with the surrounding soil evaporating and melting in an instant, turning into pools of glass.
That would be the time when Austin's technique is truly completed.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn nοvelfire.net
Of course, that's just one possible future outcome; perhaps the Lightning Ball can only be developed to the size of a fist and cannot be expanded further. Anything is possible, and no one knows the outcome until the very end.
With the development plan confirmed, Austin began to engage in tense attempts.
Due to enhanced memory, Austin clearly remembers the three development stages of the Rasengan from the previous life.
The first step is to gather Chakra in the palm.
Austin is a dragon, but fortunately, he has front claws.
Both front claws spread open, as if holding an imaginary basketball, streams of magic surged out, condensing into a sphere between the claws.
The first step posed no difficulty; due to the Giant Dragon's talent, after trying about ten times, Austin found the feeling, forming a fist-sized Magic Corps between the claws, which quickly dissipated.
The second step is the further practice of the first stage, steadily and continuously releasing Chakra.
To achieve this step, the training method in the original work is to place a water balloon in hand, then release Chakra until the water inside the balloon moves randomly and bursts.
The world Austin is in is naturally not the modern science and extraordinary ninjutsu parallel world of Naruto. The Kawa Great Forest and the entire Seta Continent are truly in the Middle World Extraordinary World, where no balloons are available for practice.
Despite this, the impact is not significant. The use of water-filled balloons in practice is merely to achieve the purpose of stably and continuously releasing Chakra. The water ball effect is just for observation convenience, not essential.
In the world of Magic, the release of magic depends largely on Spiritual Power, and as such, a mage's fine control of magic greatly surpasses that of ninjutsu.
Although Austin is not a mage, his Giant Dragon Bloodline is much stronger than a mage's, born with the ability to awaken and control Talent Magic, so there's no problem in this aspect.
Thus, after attempting twenty to thirty times, Austin found the method to continuously and stably release magic and form a Magic Corps between the claws, requiring slight rotational output of magic to maintain the Magic Corps' form.
The second step posed no difficulties for Austin at all.
Next is the third step,
Prepare a rubber ball, maintain the released Chakra, and materialize it until internally and externally, it can directly destroy the rubber ball. According to Jiraiya, the toughness of the rubber ball is a hundred times that of a balloon.
After completing this stage, the Rasengan can already cause damage, though it can only inflict relatively light surface harm and cannot penetrate trees.
The third step proved somewhat challenging for Austin, given the absence of a rubber ball.
However, though there is some difficulty, it's not insurmountable.
The rubber ball is merely a tool for testing results in the third step of training; the main practice remains maintaining stable magic release, condensing it into a sphere, and materializing it. Also, to sustain the Magic Corps' form, the dual magic release must also maintain slight rotation.
The most crucial part here is materializing the magic and making it achieve some offensive power.
Despite the advantage of Spiritual Power, Austin spent over an hour to truly materialize the Magic Ball and grant it some destructive capability, at least stripping a large piece of bark when blasted against a tree.
Having completed the third step, the final step is:
Concentrating and releasing Chakra.
This final step is also the most challenging step in the entire Rasengan practice.
Combining all previous attempts, converge high-density Chakra in hand, continuously releasing it, rotating compressing into a mass, condensing into essence.
Massive Chakra compresses and rotates within a small sphere, akin to a miniature typhoon ball, generating power strong enough to penetrate trees and shatter rocks!

chapters.title: Chapter 208 - 204: Magic Power Rasengan
chapters.content:
When the final step is completed, a Rasengan can be formed, which compresses high-density Chakra into a ball that spins rapidly.
This step is not easy, because to concentrate high-density Chakra into a ball, you must maintain high-speed rotation of the Chakra in the palm and also sustain a stable input and the speed and direction of Chakra's rotation.
Under such circumstances, unless you have the talent for multitasking or have a ninja familiar through years of practice, it is hard to form such a powerful technique as the Rasengan.
In the original story, to solve this problem, Naruto had to resort to clever methods.
He summoned two Shadow Clones, with the main body maintaining the stable input of Chakra, while the clones sustained the high-speed rotation and speed and direction of Chakra's rotation.
After modifying the Chakra that forms the Rasengan into Magic Power in this world, there wasn't much change overall. However, compared to the destructive energy of Chakra, the Magic Power of this world appears more gentle, and with the meticulous control of Spiritual Power, Austin finds it easier to perform the Magic Rasengan.
Nonetheless, to concentrate and rotate a massive amount of Magic into a spherical shape, while simultaneously controlling three places in detail, Austin spent an entire day to develop the Magic Rasengan.
Above the cliff,
Austin's two front paws loosely formed a ball, large streams of Magic Power surged from his paws. Under Spiritual Power control, a rapidly rotating white ball the size of a ping-pong ball formed, resembling a swirling water vortex.
Swish, swish, swish...
The air was filled with a swishing sound like wind passing through leaves, caused by the fast flow of Magic Power in the air, where they rubbed and collided, vibrating the air to produce sound.
Next, in the following moment,
Buzz!
Suddenly, the halo beside the previous white sphere intensely condensed, and the threads of Magic Power spiraling ceaselessly at the edges suddenly collapsed, forming a magic sphere with a smooth and glossy surface, like Crystal.
A faint white glow illuminated the air, and the white ball of energy suspended motionless in the air, like a harmless white light sphere.
Yet only Austin, who controls everything, can clearly sense the kind of fierce Magic Energy gathering beneath its smooth surface.
"I did it!"
Looking at the Magic Rasengan quietly suspended before him, emitting a faint white glow, Austin felt a sense of joy rising in his heart.
Thinking back, when the spirit of youth burned within, he too hoped to shout "Rasengan" and then really have a Chakra energy ball appear in his palm, didn't he?
Coming to this world, unexpectedly actually being able to fulfill a regret from the past life.
"Go!"
With thoughts, the spirit drove the Magic Rasengan to fly out.
In the original story, the Rasengan was just a melee technique, even when evolved to Wind Style: Rasengan Shuriken was the same until Naruto learned Immortal Mode, gaining control of natural power's Rasengan Shuriken operation before enabling remote attack.
Only when the Rasengan came to this world, the magic-modified Magic Rasengan has already surpassed the original Chakra-driven Rasengan.
In comparison with Chakra, the compatibility and affinity between spirit and Magic are quite good,
Just like the Flame Burst Technique can perform long-range attack exploding upon hitting an object, not during its flight in the sky, where the highly concentrated Fire Attribute Energy doesn't automatically explode,
That is precisely because within the Flame Burst Technique contains Mental Power restrictions within the concentrated Fire Attribute Magic Power.
Austin's Magic Rasengan works similarly, highly concentrated rapidly rotating Magic within the Rasengan internally, like Magic exists spiritual constraints, enabling him to perform remote attacks.
The Magic Rasengan floated lazily through the air, its speed not very fast, akin to someone walking quickly, faint white light illuminates the sky.
Before long,
That Magic Rasengan abruptly plunged into the trunk of a large tree embraced by six to seven people, suddenly emitting a muffled sound, instantly collapsing into a face-basin-sized dent, swirling wood chips rising upward.
The next moment,
Bang!
With a muffled sound, the power of the Magic Rasengan wholly exploded, the tree trunk shattered immediately, breaking a huge gap, penetrating the entire tree trunk, on flat ground like a whirlwind was stirring, using dust and fallen leaves scattering, wood chips like dust powder scattered down.
"This power..."
Staring at the tree in front still standing, yet the tree core in the middle indeed broke open a nearly one-meter diameter huge gap, allowing one to see through to the other side, Austin's pupils slightly shrank.Thɪs novel(ꜰ)ire.net
This level of power is far stronger than Naruto's Rasengan in the original story!
Even though this is not unrelated to the fact that Austin infused far greater Magic Power than Naruto himself did, the affinity compatibility between Magic and spirit allows Austin to input large amounts of Magic without worrying about losing control.
But this kind of power indeed exceeded Austin's expectations.
At the moment of the Magic Rasengan's explosion, Austin clearly saw that the extremely condensed Magic didn't just disperse and explode, instead, under remaining spiritual guidance and rapid Magic traction, almost all the power was concentrated in a very small range, instantly producing immense tearing power.
At the moment of that tearing power's explosion, the entire tree core shredded into powder, then that force began slowly dissipating.
Although the attack area of the Magic Rasengan is not large, but precisely because of this, the Magic Rasengan explodes in a limited range having much stronger tearing power and penetration!
One could say, this Magic Rasengan technique, killing power is even not inferior to the Thunder Roar Cannon technique he previously developed.
"Unfortunately, the pure Magic Rasengan's attack speed is too slow, and this little range of tearing power isn't very effective against that massive zombie creature mass,"
Austin thought to himself.
However, this was within his expectations, what he truly planned to confront that massive zombie creature was a second-stage Rasengan formed by integrating Thunder Attribute Elements' property modification into the foundation of Magic Rasengan.
Moreover, it seems like the Magic Rasengan isn't completely without use.
"Since Magic can replace Chakra to form a Magic Rasengan, what about Fighting Qi? Could it also form a Fighting Qi Rasengan?"
Austin's eyes suddenly lit up.

chapters.title: Chapter 209 - 205: Deep Development
chapters.content:
Nowadays, under Austin's guidance, the extraordinary beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe have transformed the Navy Six Techniques of Iron Block, Gale Foot, Shave, and Moon Step into the Beastman Four Techniques.
Among the Six Techniques, Paper Drawing and Finger Gun, since Paper Drawing is similar to enhancing Sixth Sense, relying on the ability to evade through anticipating the air flow changes brought by the attack, such an ability cannot be trained overnight.
As for the Finger Gun, when there are metal weapons available, why use a finger to poke? Therefore, in Austin's view, there isn't much necessity for developing it.
Moreover, with the Beastman Four Techniques, the combat power is basically already formed, so Austin did not spend too much time perfecting the Beastman Six Techniques.
However, now, if the Magic Power Rasengan can be transformed into a Fighting Qi Rasengan, this degree of tearing ability might replace the Finger Gun and become a powerful melee attack method within the Beastman Six Techniques!
Instant Step/Moon Step + Fighting Qi Rasengan, getting close to the enemy in an instant, blasting them with a Rasengan ball, the powerful tearing force of the Rasengan might even be able to rip through Gold Level Fighting Qi Armor instantly!
"Hmm, after this matter is concluded, let's start developing the Fighting Qi Rasengan."
If the Fighting Qi Rasengan can truly be developed, it would remedy the shortcoming of a lack of strong melee attack methods for extraordinary beastmen, significantly enhancing their power.
Especially when the Instant Step, a rapid movement method, is combined with the Rasengan—it becomes the enemy's nightmare.
Remembering this idea for later, Austin continued with the research.
The immediate priority is still to complete the thunder attribute transformation of the Magic Power Rasengan.
Throughout the development of the Magic Power Rasengan, Austin largely referred to the anime Naruto, but in the original story, there were no Rasengan forms with thunder attributes.
In Naruto's original work, while it detailed Naruto's development of the Wind Style: Rasengan Shuriken process, that was solely chakra's wind attribute transformation, not thunder attribute transformation; the difference between the two is significant.
This means starting now, Austin can only rely on himself to complete the thunder attribute transformation of the Magic Power Rasengan.
"No problem, do it yourself, and you'll be well-fed!"
Austin had considered following Naruto's method, injecting wind attribute transformation into the Magic Power Rasengan to create a Wind Style: Rasengan Shuriken of magical power. However, magic power and chakra are not the same energy, making it impossible to replicate precisely.
Moreover, the Wind Style: Rasengan Shuriken form's power is strong, but if faced against the thousand-meter-high, monstrous flesh conglomerate formed by tens of thousands of zombie creatures, Austin doesn't believe the Wind Style: Shuriken can be very effective.
If, like an electromagnetic cannon, it blasts a large chunk of the flesh mass but rapidly regenerates within seconds, such an attack is essentially ineffective.Thɪs updatᴇd by N0veI.Fiɾe.net
The destructiveness of wind is always much smaller compared to thunder,
