and dealing with the monstrous zombie conglomerate that forms the pyramid that erodes the Forest Land requires power that can obliterate the thousand-meter-high beast in an instant!
Among the elemental powers of wind, water, and thunder that Austin can master, only thunder, several times hotter than the sun's surface, has such formidable destructive power.
Once he set a clear goal, Austin began hectic experiments.
The first step to confirm is whether to condense the thunder element into a Thunder Rasengan like a Rasengan, or to first create a non-attribute Magic Power Rasengan and then inject thunder attribute magic power into it.
This question did not hinder Austin for long. First, in the original work, Naruto completed a non-attribute chakra Rasengan before transforming it into wind attribute power through quality change.
Substitute wind with thunder, and the steps are roughly similar.
Secondly, Austin has carried out experiments respectively, showing that even though thunder, due to Austin's own Legendary Bloodline halo ability, gathers docilely to form a rapidly rotating Thunder Rasengan.
Yet, in reality, this Thunder Rasengan is not much different from the lightning ball Austin tried before; it immediately collapses as soon as he relaxes, merely simple aggregation and rotation, without the capability to maintain form or enhance power.
Therefore, Austin chose to initially create a non-attribute Magic Power Rasengan and then gradually transform it.
For this path, there is no previous experience to reference, even Naruto's development of the Wind Style: Rasengan Shuriken; its attribute change is wind power, very distinct from thunder, with hardly any references.
Compared to wind, thunder's power is stronger.
But with great strength comes violent and unyielding energy.
Unlike non-attribute magic power, lightning is extremely hard to control,
even with Austin's influence from his dragon race Legendary Bloodline and his talent magic of electric flow control, this ability is rough command rather than detailed control, making lightning impossible to be as docile as water flow.
The Magic Power Rasengan can condense and compress a vast amount of magic power to rapidly spin within a tiny sphere by relying on very precise balance.
When turbulent lightning is suddenly integrated into densely spinning magic power, it immediately disrupts the balance leading to the rapid dissolution of the Magic Power Rasengan.
Even with a tiny conversion of lightning, its turbulent nature can instantly damage the perfect magic power dynamic structure, leading to the explosion of the Magic Power Rasengan.
In successive attempts numbering dozens to hundreds, despite Austin's giant dragon physique, the thunder attribute transformation attempts of the Magic Power Rasengan left him exhausted, and the explosion's power nearly left him battered.
Boom!!!
Inside the white light ball, a streak of blue flashed as the entire Magic Power Rasengan exploded with booming force, the powerful magic power and the whirlwind that accompanied it blew Austin back several steps, and even the surface of his hard dragon scales added another scar.
"No! The power of thunder is too unruly to operate within the high-precision cycle of the Magic Power Rasengan!"
Hundreds of consecutive failures made Austin's mood a bit irritable.
Although the injuries from each failed explosion weren't serious, continuous damage left him looking battered.
"A stabilizing agent of sorts must be added, something that makes the explosive thunder power more docile!"
A divine light flickered within Austin's eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 210 - 206: Battle Plan
chapters.content:
A few days later, under the planning of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe, the production personnel have basically been evacuated, and important materials have been relocated to a new site a hundred miles northeast.
Now the whole Dragon Nest Tribe has become a militarized camp, filled entirely with combat personnel of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
A large number of weapons and armor have been equipped on Beastman soldiers, undergoing rigorous training day and night. The neatly aligned formations look like columns of ironclad torrents.
"How is the situation?"
"The rate of land corruption there is accelerating, and the undead creatures have started new movements. It seems they are about to begin the next round of expansion. We don't have much time left."
"...The envoy from the Tribe Alliance at the Bloody Border left yesterday. As for the support we requested, they said they would go back and ask for it."
"Damn it! They're truly treating us as abandoned pawns. What's going on at the border?"
"According to reports from the scout camp, the conflict war with humans there has been stagnant for half a month, and it's unclear what they are thinking."
In the central hall, all the high-ranking Beastmen and the Beastman Officers have gathered to discuss the future decisions of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
From multiple perspectives, the current situation of the Dragon Nest Tribe indeed doesn't look good.
The undead tide to the southwest is already stirring, poised to sweep across the Kawa Great Forest like a natural disaster, and at this moment, the Dragon Nest Tribe, right in front, would inevitably suffer a direct impact.
Even with equal numbers, or numbers ten times their own, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion relies on their powerful battle formation group combat capability, unafraid.
But the undead army isn't counted in tens of thousands, but rather covers an unknown area in the southwest of the Dragon Nest Tribe, an unmanageable quantity!
In the shadow of this kind of undead tsunami, the Dragon Nest Legion at most is only a relatively hard rock, ultimately to be drowned by endless waters.
Just as the Dragon Nest Tribe is about to confront the undead army in a bloody hand-to-hand battle, the Tribe Alliance, which was originally supposed to be a source of support, suddenly became indifferent, unwilling to even provide some material assistance.
From the news sent back by the rat-troop scouts, something unknown has definitely changed in the war at the border, not only causing the war between the Beastman Alliance and the human Southern Countries to stop, but also making the fear of the undead army among the Beastmen disappear.
"Forget it, don't worry about things over there for now. His Highness has already issued an order to prepare for a counterattack in three days!"
The changes between the Beastmen and humans at the border definitely contain many secrets, but the Dragon Nest Tribe no longer has the energy to pay attention to those.
"Finally going to act, that's great! Since those damn undead won't stay quietly in Hell, let's take their bones apart!"
With Governor Vini conveying Austin's command, the entire assembly hall was filled with excitement.
Previously, for safety reasons, Austin expressly ordered the Beastmen not to engage with zombie creatures, causing the Dragon Nest Beastmen to keep retreating from those slow-moving undead, feeling immensely frustrated.
Austin holds an extremely high reputation within the tribe, so the Beastmen naturally don't have any thought of blame towards Austin, but their temper with the undead isn't nearly as good.
Apart from a few sharp-minded Beastmen who can see the dangerous predicament faced by the Dragon Nest Tribe, the majority of Beastman Warriors present, and within the entire tribe, wish to slaughter those damn undead.
During this period, the Dragon Nest Beastmen, already filled with rage, are eager for action.
"Don't be happy too soon, I understand your feelings, but you must follow orders for this operation. This action is crucial to the outcome of the war, and our opportunity is this one-time chance. No one can disobey orders and jeopardize the operation!"
Seeing everyone's excited expressions, Vini immediately poured cold water over them. Once everyone calmed down, he began to slowly relay Austin's war strategy.The source of this content ɪs NoveI(F)ire.net
"Next is His Highness's war plan...."
This war against the zombie undead is Austin's first and only counterattack against the encroachments of the zombies, step by step pressing forward.
In this battle, either Austin can completely destroy the mysterious pyramid building that changed the environment of the earth, or he must retreat, leaving behind the legacy for which he has fought for years.
No matter how much importance is placed, if objectives aren't achieved, Austin won't continue to confront the sea of undead zombies hard-headedly, even if the Dragon Nest Beastmen suffer minimal losses in the battle amid the zombie undead sea.
The outline of this regular war strategy can be summarized with three phrases:
Feign east attack west,
Lure the tiger from the mountain,
Hit the dragon's heart directly.
Perhaps due to Austin firing a shot from the electromagnetic cannon, the mysterious pyramid is currently surrounded by a massive tumor lump of merged zombie undead flesh, protected under the Corpse Mountain, while the nearby region is also densely packed with zombie undead.
And because the Thunder Attribute change of the Magic Power Rasengan isn't perfect, during the preparation phase, Austin must find a quiet, undisturbed place, while not too far from the towering lump of flesh.
Therefore, the first step of the operation is to lure away the zombie undead gathered near the Corpse Mountain lump.
First, from within the Dragon Nest Tribe, the high-mobility Centaur cavalry legion attacks near the pyramid, aiming to cause the maximum slaughter in the shortest time, create chaos, then swiftly retreat, leading most of the zombie undead into the distance.
Once a large number of zombie undead are lured away, the group charge of the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion lying in ambush on the other side will clear a region near the Corpse Mountain lump in a short time.
Subsequently, Austin will gather power on the hilltop, releasing his developed strongest attack method at present, annihilating the lump of Corpse Mountain flesh and the mysterious pyramid causing the terrain abnormalities all at once.
The plan is perfect, but Austin also understands this is under the condition that everything proceeds smoothly.
Furthermore, the biggest variable in the plan stems from himself.
The Thunder Attribute change of the Magic Power Rasengan has not been truly mastered, or in other words, the Thunder Attribute change of the entire Magic Power Rasengan has only been developed to half.
Unfortunately, time waits for no one; even if developed halfway, Austin can only barely proceed.

chapters.title: Chapter 211 - 207 Beginning
chapters.content: Enable JavaScript and cookies to continue

chapters.title: Chapter 212 - 208: Luring the Enemy
chapters.content:
The army of zombie undead waits until the mysterious pyramids are completed and the earth's environment is altered before setting out again to attack and capture, perhaps due to some suppression within the natural forest.
And those mysterious pyramids corrode the previous natural land, transforming it into a suitable living environment for zombie creatures.
"Where exactly did those mutated evil spirits get this power from, why does it feel so alien?"
Below, the Dragon Nest Beastmen troops are gradually setting up camp, densely scattered in the mountain valley canyon, using the towering mountains to block the route to prevent being discovered by the zombie army.
At this time, Austin looked at the surrounding mountains that had not yet been corrupted into a wasteland-like environment, and couldn't help but think silently in his heart.
Recalling his previous combat observations with these undead zombie-like creatures, he increasingly found that these creatures were just like the real zombies in Austin's past-life movies.
Fortunately, although the number of zombie undead is large, due to speed issues, few Magic Beasts are infected, and even after infection, the Magic Power in them is drained, so they do not become more terrifying zombie leaders but are like ordinary zombie undead; hence, the strongest within the zombie undead tide are merely those infected and zombified Giant Beasts.
Moreover, due to the transformation, the gigantic bodies of the Giant Beasts move even slower, which is undeniably good news for the cavalry of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Otherwise, if those infected Magic Beasts also became creatures as swift as zombie dogs from Austin's past life, such swift speed would be a nightmare for Austin's current combat plan.
"What exactly is that mutated evil spirit up to?"
Since it can drive the zombies to build pyramids and consistently erode the land, there must be some purpose for the mutated evil spirit behind the scenes.
Austin couldn't help but ponder.
But at this stage, the information obtained is too little, and he couldn't figure anything out.
The Tribe Alliance, formed by hundreds of thousands to nearly ten million Beastmen gathered at the Bloody Border, was forced there by the sweeping wave of zombie undead, suggesting how vast the area occupied and ravaged by these zombies is.
In the vast and endless Kawa Great Forest, the zombie undead wave Austin and his Dragon Nest Tribe face is just a small corner, and they are merely small figures accidentally swept in.
The true focus is likely still on the Legendary creature domains hidden somewhere in the Kawa Great Forest and the orc army at the Bloody Border.
"Forget it, if the sky falls, the tall ones will hold it up; for now, the most important thing is to try to destroy that pyramid first!"
Austin shook his head, discarding unanswerable thoughts from his mind.Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs novel{f}ire.net
In the vast and boundless Kawa Great Forest, an area spanning tens of millions of square kilometers could already accommodate dozens of duchies if situated in the Central Earth Human World.
And in this enormous area, even Beastmen are not the absolute mainstream.
The true ruling dominators are the powerful Magic Beasts hidden in certain Secret Realms of the forest, such as some Legendary Level Lords or some rare and powerful races. On this vast land, there are not even a few of Austin's own kin surviving.
Those terrifying Legendary creatures are the mainstream power within the Kawa Great Forest!
Austin has not encountered those powerful species merely because of his relatively remote location, and since birth, he stayed nearby without wandering, thus the chance of encountering them is not high.
If any real problem arises, those Legendary-level existences would be the first to respond.
"Hopefully, destroying that pyramid will be able to curb the zombie undead's attack..."
After a moment of silence, Austin descended quietly from a height to avoid leaving any traces.
An uneventful night passed,
To prevent exposure, the next day, the battle plan officially started.
The first to set out was a cavalry legion of five hundred, all composed of strong centaurs.
With the continuous development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the population has now reached over thirty thousand, rendering it a medium-level tribe within the entire Kawa Great Forest.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe continuously assimilated more people, the population of various races within the tribe naturally continued to increase, with the number of centaurs gradually rising from previously a hundred or so to now over a thousand.
The cavalry selected from over a thousand centaurs may not all be elite, but compared to the zombie undead creatures, their mobility naturally has a significant advantage.
The cavalry unit first departs from the mountain valley, choosing hidden mountain paths to bypass from the fringe. When the cavalry legion reaches the other side, they will use bows and arrows to constantly shoot and lure, attracting more zombie creatures and leading them away.
Meanwhile, the elite of the Dragon Nest Legion, resting and gathering strength here, will charge forward once most of the zombie creatures have been led away, seizing a mountain nearby in the shortest time.
Austin will then execute his unfinished technique there.
...
Three hours after the cavalry legion set out,
on the other side of the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor's decayed woods, relying on the cover of remaining withered trees, a neat and orderly centaur legion gathered here, the atmosphere stern as iron, and the aura of war permeated the air.
"How about it, are you scared?"
The Cavalry Legion Commander, Centaur Chiron, looked at the trembling young centaur soldier ahead and asked gently.
"No, it's not fear, it's excitement!"
The young centaur said tremblingly, his face flushed red.
"Very good, ambitious!"
Chiron heavily patted the young centaur soldier's shoulder, then looked over each of the soldiers' faces, speaking loudly and clearly:
"I won't say much; in this battle, as the vanguard, even if we die, we must drag those undead frameworks over! For the great His Highness Austin, and for ourselves!"
"All troops, charge!"
With a command, the originally solemn and orderly cavalry legion charged forward, the sound of hooves on the ground rumbling in the air, turning into a black torrent that surged out of the fallen forest and rushed towards the hills packed with zombie undead.
As the sound of the hooves spread, in an instant, the zombie undead around the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor were all alarmed.

chapters.title: Chapter 213 - 209: Occupation
chapters.content:
"Roar!!!"
Beside the endlessly writhing Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, towering over a thousand meters high like a flesh and bone factory, a colossal giant beast with half its body rotted and its ghastly white ribs protruding from its waist let out a roar.
Immediately, one by one, the decayed undead zombies turned their heads uniformly towards the charging cavalry legion, their rotted eye sockets with worm-eaten eyeballs rolling, and fat maggots dropping from the eyes.
The terrifying eyes fixed upon the oncoming Dragon Nest Cavalry Legion, under the gaze of thousands upon thousands of rotted eyeballs, sent shivers down the spine.
If it were warriors from other Beastman Tribes within the Kawa Great Forest, they would have long since fled in fear under such circumstances, but the Dragon Nest Tribe's Cavalry Legion, akin to fanatical followers of Austin, showed no drop in morale.
"Just some mere undead frames, everyone, follow me to fight!"
The centaur, naturally half a body taller than ordinary beastmen or creatures, under the rapid group charge, resembled a high-speed, racing large truck. The sparse outer undead zombies were crushed to dust before they could even react to the terrifying impact.
"Shoot arrows!"
With a loud order from Chiron, the centaurs behind him, while running at full speed, firmly gripped their bows and arrows, shooting skyward. The volley of arrows swiftly covered the sea of undead zombies below.
Whoosh whoosh whoosh...
Under the large arrow rain, one zombie after another was either pierced through the body or had their heads punctured. In such expansive firing, almost every arrow struck the undead, though unless precisely hitting the head, these arrow storms did not inflict much harm on the undead.
Of course, the purpose of the centaur legion's archery was not to annihilate the enemy but to draw the hatred of a wider range, luring more undead zombies away from the vicinity.
With the fall of the first wave of arrows, the centaur legion split into two columns, making a sharp turn, galloping left and right while continually nocking arrows and shooting toward the dense zombies.
The range of the cavalry's attacks thus widened, drawing significant attention from large groups of undead.
Rumble!
Although peculiar, upon seeing these living creatures, the undead zombies instinctively charged towards the Dragon Nest cavalry.
From a high vantage point, the dense sea of undead zombies suddenly surged like a mountain flood, with the black tide sweeping forward, seemingly poised to engulf all the centaur cavalry.
At this moment,
"Retreat!"
With a sharp whistle, the cavalry turned and dashed back in the direction they came.
"Great, just like this!"
Chiron, looking at the myriad of distracted undead behind, felt exhilarated, constantly galloping forward.ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ novel⦿fire.net
The undead gathered beside the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, colossal like a flesh factory, had exceeded tens of thousands. In the face of such immense numbers, five hundred Dragon Nest cavalry were like a fist-sized stone thrown into a river, the ripples they stirred extremely limited.
But fortunately, they had bows and arrows. By relying on the bow's powerful range and splitting the cavalry for scouring runs, they maximized the draw of attention from the vast undead sea, successfully luring them away.
"Great, keep it up! Don't go too fast, keep them trailing!"
The Dragon Nest beastmen cavalry led the way, followed closely behind by the overwhelming tide of undead like waves.
As numerous undead creatures chased, the area around the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor gradually thinned out.
Meanwhile, neither the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor nor the Pyramid below showed any reaction.
It was only when the Dragon Nest Legion started charging that the Corpse Mountain slowly twisted, the rotting eyeballs on its massive tumor surface scanning what were to it merely ant-like centaur warriors.
Watching the centaur legion's departure, the undead halted their pursuit, standing quietly at the original spot.
...
Meanwhile, on the other side, within a secretive mountain valley, a large number of elite beastman armies gathered.
The entire valley was filled with an intimidating aura of military preparedness, with not a single sound to be heard.
Lying on the ground were many decayed corpses, zombies that had roamed here earlier, cleaned out before any signal could be sent.
"Your Highness, Chiron and the others have succeeded!"
Soon, several figures sprang from the other side of the mountains, kneeling upon entering and reporting.
"Just wait a little longer..."
Austin's calm voice echoed through the air, his gaze already fixed in the direction of the massive Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor partially hidden under the shadow of the mountains not far off.
The pace of regular undead was slower than that of goblins, and even more powerful undead could not move too quickly.
With the speed of the centaurs, as long as Chiron wasn't overly greedy and rash, there should be no loss.
Now it was time to wait until Chiron led the centaur cavalry to lure the undead army far enough away before making a move!
Within the valley, the atmosphere was noticeably tense.
After half an hour, calculating that they had lured the target far enough, Austin's eyes flashed with determination as he solemnly ordered:
"Transmit the order, attack!"
With the command, the army hiding in the valley sprang into action, over four thousand elite beastmen launching their charge like beasts out of a floodgate, rushing across the mountain and valley.
Perhaps due to the terrain, few zombie creatures lurked in this jagged valley, with well-equipped and well-trained Dragon Nest beastmen thrusting their sharp long spears into the zombies' heads with ease.
Groups of Dragon Nest beastmen, like killing machines, swept through unstoppably, easily eradicating all undead zombies in front of them.
Even though additional zombies surged in from all sides, it only took the Dragon Nest beastmen a bit of time to easily wipe them out against the invincible spear wall.
The Dragon Nest Legion, like the cavalry, emphasized speed—swift as a flash!
In no time, the mighty, almost meat grinder-like Dragon Nest Legion captured the target peak near the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor and established an impregnable defense.
At this moment, Austin stood upon the mountain top.

chapters.title: Chapter 214 - 210 Formation
chapters.content:
Under the sudden attack, the Dragon Nest Legion swept through like an autumn wind clearing away fallen leaves, the sharp long spears forming a forest that completely destroyed the zombie undead.
At this moment, the nearby zombie undead around the hill had been cleared by the Dragon Nest Beastmen. The dry ground was littered with rotten corpses, and the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion formed a tight and orderly formation at the foot of the hill, with long spears standing like a forest, creating an impregnable line of defense that tightly sealed off the area below.
The upheaval on the mountaintop also caught the attention of the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, and the zombie undead that were left behind without being pursued began to gather and surged toward the iron wall defense line formed by the Dragon Nest Legion.
Despite the cavalry's earlier efforts to draw most of the zombie undead away by various means, there were still tens of thousands of them remaining near the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor!
Tens of thousands of zombie undead charged, like a tidal wave crashing onto the defense line established by the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion. Yet, the tightly knit and solid bronze line, protected by giant copper shields, was something these scattered zombies could not penetrate.
Those seemingly invincible zombie undead sea tactics were like eggs crashing against a stone when confronted by the Dragon Nest Legion, who were well-trained and equipped far superior to the ordinary Beastman Legion, resulting in their utter destruction and misery.
In an instant, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion, standing motionless, seemed to transform into a flesh-and-blood slaughter machine, piercing through the heads of one zombie creature after another with their dense long spear forest.
...
Just as the Dragon Nest Legion engaged in a contact battle with the vast numbers of zombie undead at the foot of the hill and held the upper hand,
at the top of the mountain, looking towards the huge mass of Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor in front, Austin's gaze was extremely solemn.
This is the only chance, this battle must destroy these things in front!
Austin spread his wings, the large membrane wings extending in the air, casting a vast shadow over the mountaintop.
At this moment, he spread open his forepaws, holding them in the air as if grasping, and strands of white non-attribute magic power began to be drawn out from his body, continuously gathering in the air ahead, forming rotating streams of magic power in the air.
The air seemed to twist at this moment, the white magic power began to rotate, stirring the surrounding air, and forming a giant vortex several meters in diameter.
Swish, swish, swish...
With the infusion of massive amounts of magic power, there came a sound like wind blowing through leaves, and in just a moment, a gigantic magical Rasengan appeared in front of Austin.
This magic Rasengan, compared to the first one Austin attempted, was tens to hundreds of times larger, and the significant loss of magic power made even Austin, as a giant dragon, feel a bit overwhelmed.
Both spiritual and physical endurance had reached a taxing level, and this was still without the completion of the Thunder Attribute transformation.
But there was no other way; this single strike must unleash the greatest power and destroy the opponent in one blow!
Austin steadied himself, set aside external distractions, and focused all his heart and spirit on the massive magic Rasengan in front of him.
With the operation of spiritual power, the force at the core of the giant Rasengan began to rotate rapidly at an incredible speed, and the entire enormous sphere began to slowly contract, with the terrifying magical force gradually condensing inward.
The size of the magic Rasengan gradually shrank, the magic power increasingly condensed and compressed, with the rotating speed becoming more terrifying and the surface light growing ever more intense.
Eventually, the colossal magic Rasengan several meters in diameter shrank into a fist-sized compressed Rasengan, emitting a blinding white light, like a small sun falling into Austin's forepaws.
But that's not the end!
The next step is the most crucial and the most difficult. In previous attempts, Austin only succeeded in a regular Thunder Attribute nature transformation!
Only by completing that step, it could be considered a real success!
At this moment, Austin had set aside all other thoughts, focusing his entire spirit on the dazzling white magic Rasengan in front of him.
Within the center of this extremely condensed and compressed magic Rasengan, the vast amount of magic was compressed and spun to the utmost at a certain point, where a hint of blue light abruptly appeared in an instant.Fresh chapters posted on .net
The next moment, that blue light spread like an infection, instantly sweeping in all directions, altering the color of the entire extremely condensed and compressed magic Rasengan!
Buzz!
The space seemed to ripple faintly, and then the dazzling white light emitted by the extremely compressed magic Rasengan instantly transformed into a dreamlike blue glow, the white light washed over by the bluish hue.
But before the blue glow could spread, it was as if swallowed by an invisible force, collapsing inward suddenly, as if even the light was absorbed and swallowed into it!
In the void, there appeared an indescribable dazzling blue spherical crystal.
That spherical, fist-sized dazzling blue crystal was so mysterious and marvelous that it seemed to become the center of the entire world as soon as it appeared, as if just one look could even swallow the divine soul!
With the emergence of the dazzling blue spherical crystal ahead, the whole world seemed to fall into silence, the air becoming deathly still.
Simultaneously, the soil beneath Austin's feet collapsed under immense pressure, large chunks of earth cracking and spreading dense fissures in all directions.
That spherical crystal seemed to carry the weight of a thousand pounds!
"Success!"
Feeling the immense pressure coming from his body, with the imagined technique finally created, but Austin's eyes showed no joy; instead, they were even more solemn, cautiously controlling the internal balance.
It was far from the time to celebrate, as the compressed magic Rasengan held too much magic internally, and coupled with the Thunder Attribute transformation, the terrifying pressure hinted at was something even Austin couldn't possibly withstand head-on without being reduced to bones!
"Go!"
Carefully controlling the dazzling blue spherical crystal to fly out, it glided slowly through the air.
The bluish glow illuminated the sky, and at this moment, the world was silent, the oppressive force a thousand, ten thousand times stronger than before a storm, causing even those long dead, mindless zombie undead to forget to act, their decayed eyes fixed on the blue glow in the sky.
The dazzling blue spherical crystal wantonly cast its bluish glow in the air, leisurely flying toward the direction of the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, leaving a visible trail in the sky...

chapters.title: Chapter 215 - 211 Earth-Shattering
chapters.content:
Chapter 215: Chapter 211 Earth-Shattering
The flying speed of that Thunder Attribute Compressed Rasengan looked not particularly fast, leisurely like a balloon. However, in the next moment, it was already soaring above the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, giving one a sense of space-time disorder.
Gulu Gulu...
The thousand-meter-high Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor suddenly stirred like viscous water, with white skeletal frames inside, resembling ants from afar, making a creaking grinding sound. Massive chunks of flesh stretched upward, suddenly tearing open a menacing blood mouth several tens of meters long, stretching its body out towards the mystical and profound dazzling blue Rasengan in the sky, swallowing it whole!
The giant crack closed, and the Corpse Mountain Tumor began to contract, turning back into an enormous decaying tumor standing still.
Everything seemed unchanged, as if nothing had happened.
As if the Thunder Attribute Compressed Rasengan painstakingly condensed by Austin had been completely devoured, failing to stir even the slightest ripple.
The air was filled with silence.
But this silence did not last long,
Gulu Gulu....
Suddenly, the thousand-meter Corpse Mountain Tumor seated on the ground emitted loud gurgling noises as if its stomach was upset, while the entire mass of the Corpse Mountain, like a thick liquid, quivered violently, seemingly trying to burst something from within!
Standing atop the mountain, Austin’s pupils suddenly shrank, his voice booming through the air.
"Be careful! All defenses up!"
This was directed at all the Dragon Nest Legion, and although unknown why, all the Dragon Nest Beastmen instinctively assumed a defensive stance, raising bronze shields in front of them.
At a certain moment, the sound vanished between heaven and earth!
The massive Corpse Mountain Tumor suddenly swelled several times like a balloon, its vast shadow nearly covering the sky, seemingly inflated to its limit, on the brink of exploding in the next moment.
Every Dragon Nest Beastman witnessing this scene had their hearts in their throats, eyes widened.
But the swelling Corpse Mountain Tumor ultimately did not explode,
because in the next instant, an enormous blue light sphere suddenly expanded from within the Corpse Mountain Tumor, with the flesh and blood inside disintegrating into ashes at the moment of the blue sphere’s expansion.
In the silent world, the giant blue light sphere erupting from the earth obliterated everything utterly clean, with the entire Corpse Mountain Tumor being consumed and vanishing upon the sudden spread of the blue light sphere, melted like ice meeting intense sunlight.
Dazzling light blossomed between heaven and earth, with the enormous light sphere resembling an inverted dome from the earth, annihilating everything it touched without a trace.
Soundlessly and invisibly, the colossal Corpse Mountain Tumor was utterly annihilated and disappeared, leaving only that blindingly bright and concentrated light beam between heaven and earth.
"Damn it!"
The sound was the result of air vibrations reaching the eardrum received by the nervous system.
But why was there no sound?
Because even the intangible air, upon the sudden expansion and rise of the light sphere within, was instantly obliterated by the terrifying energy!
Austin’s pupils contracted swiftly, as an immense danger suddenly descended!
In that silent world, the entire world’s light dimmed at that moment, while the gigantic blue light sphere seemed to have reached its limit, with violent blue light erupting fiercely, transforming into a massive light column ascending straight into the sky!
As if a volcano suppressing for millions of years erupted, the terrifying thunder liquid transformed into a raging torrent of light ascending skyward, ostensibly penetrating the entire heaven and earth.
Rumble!!!
A thunderous explosion erupted, and the long-silent sound finally spread like a sweeping wave across heaven and earth. The earth writhing like ocean waves bursting upward, with large chunks of soil cracking and being tossed aloft, under the sweeping fierce airflow rising skyward!
The entire ground resembled a lake thrown into a deep water bomb, with enormous cracks appearing instantaneously across the land, shaking plates, massive soil and stones ascending, heaven and earth filled with flying sand and stones. Accompanied by the strong shockwave from the next moment’s explosion, gigantic soil plates thrown into the air crumbled inch by inch under the visibly circular impact, as though the apocalypse had arrived!
Under the terrifying impact, even Austin almost got swept off, body involuntarily retreating a few steps, grasping tightly onto a large stone on the ground, staring intently at the tumultuous torrent light column ahead.
Rumble!!!
Amidst the continuous violent sounds, the entire world seemed plunged into doomsday cataclysm, with that enormous thunder light column bursting forth from the suppressed ground, hurling vast amounts of thunder liquid high, piercing through the layered clouds in the sky, with surrounding convection continually exploding thunderously.
And near that enormous thunder light column, the earth was burnt and melted by immense heat, turning into splashing dark red magma, while the sand and stones mixed in the strong wind falling into the light column instantly evaporated.
The fearsome thunder light column raged for over a minute; fortunately, it ultimately didn’t spread and unleash in all directions but instead gradually dissipated away, allowing Austin to finally release his held breath.
Had the terrifying thunder light column from the earlier Thunder Attribute Rasengan explosion spread and exploded, the destruction would have wiped out much of the Dragon Nest Legion he painstakingly amassed, except for Austin himself, and he would have suffered severe injuries!
Now, the ground where the Corpse Mountain once stood had sunken into a massive pit several hundred meters in diameter, with the soil and stones inside melted away, emitting a dark red glow, resembling magma flowing slowly.
Further out, the surrounding ground was in even more disarray, extending outward battered and torn apart, with eruptive soil resembling forcibly ripped wounds.
"Finally succeeded!"
Seeing the scene before him, Austin exhaled a long breath.
Not only had the enormous Corpse Mountain Tumor vanished entirely, but the pyramid beneath it was also thoroughly destroyed.
Austin clearly felt the entire world had undergone some change, yet this change was indistinct and elusive.
"Rodney, quickly assist the injured, and check the casualties!"
Without pondering for long about what exactly changed within heaven and earth, once the raging storm slightly subsided, Austin flapped enormous wings and descended to the ground, commanding the remaining Dragon Nest Beastman warriors.
Even though the Dragon Nest Beastmen had assumed a defensive stance, there were still considerable casualties under such terrifying impact.

chapters.title: Chapter 216 - 222 Speculation
chapters.content:
Chapter 216: Chapter 222 Speculation
Under the previous bombardment, it was like an apocalyptic disaster unfolding, causing the entire ground to almost be turned upside down, with massive chunks of soil and rock rising into the air, and a terrifying shockwave sweeping all around.
Under such catastrophic destructive force, even Austin found it difficult to maintain the stability of his body, despite it being partly due to his own significant expenditure; still, the fearfulness of the aftermath was imaginable.
Despite Austin and his team launching their attack from a mountain a kilometer away, the sweeping shockwave still severely injured many Beastman, leaving the entire Dragon Nest Tribe’s unit almost universally wounded.
If it weren’t for having quite a few Beastman Transcendent individuals in the Dragon Nest Tribe who barely managed some remedial measures amidst the sweeping shockwave, the losses of the entire Dragon Nest Legion would have been greater.
At this moment, the mountain where Austin had previously stood was splitting open, with several massive fissures cracking through the middle, as if it were about to collapse.
The ground below was also a mess; the previously tight and orderly Dragon Nest army formation was scattered under that wave of shock—either blasted away, coughing blood from shockwave impact, or swept up by fierce air currents, or smashed by giant stones and soil falling from the sky, or swallowed up by huge cracks in the ground.
Over four thousand Dragon Nest Beastmen forces weren’t damaged by the zombie undead tide, yet they were more than half decimated by such apocalyptic scenes!
Fortunately, as rescue efforts continued, only a few unlucky Dragon Nest Beastmen died on the spot; most who couldn’t stand up were merely severely wounded.
"Thankfully, there are Witch Doctors in the tribe, whose healing experience is quite mature, and combined with the large amounts of Snake Shedding Grass obtained earlier in Wet Bone Forest, after a few days of recuperation, they’ll still be excellent warriors."
As one Beastman Soldier after another was rescued, Rodney, the Legion Commander who was coming and going for rescues on the desolate battlefield, also let out a sigh of relief.
This way, the losses of the Dragon Nest Legion weren’t as large as they seemed.
However...
Looking at the surroundings of fractured earth and then at the distance, at that massive pit slowly emanating red steam and light, Rodney felt an endless frenzy and supreme reverence for His Highness Austin, who created all this.
Not only did he feel this way, but other Beastman Warriors felt the same; not a single Beastman harbored any other sentiments toward Austin, who caused such massive casualties—there was only infinite reverence for that supreme power!
Before joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Beastmen mingling around the Dragon Nest Tribe were basically the lowest class, living a life with no food for the next meal, hungry and cold, like grass without tomorrow.
It could be said that almost every Beastman was a penniless commoner, struggling on the survival line, with the greatest dream being merely to have enough food every day to fill their bellies.
But ever since joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, everything changed.
The society Austin forged in the Dragon Nest Tribe offered them a stable life, granting them the opportunity to create wealth with their own hands and obtain food. These Beastmen were straightforward, knowing clearly whoever treated them well.
As for Austin, both ordinary Beastmen and Extraordinary Beastmen respected him genuinely from the heart.
Respecting the one who led them out of poverty and achieved being well-fed, respecting the one who granted them prosperity and stability, respecting the great His Highness Austin who led them to a better life.
And now, the kind of world-annihilating power Austin demonstrated further instilled a fervent belief in the Beastman soldiers, engrained with the concept that strength is respected in their blood.
"Your Highness, under your glorious wings, all that block us shall perish, may your glory shine upon more people struggling in suffering..."
In the post-war rescue efforts, a common Beastman Warrior stood amidst the desolate ground, gazing at the enormous wings rising into the sky, crossing his hands on his chest, silently and sincerely praying within his heart.
.....
Austin was not Divine; he naturally remained unaware of the thoughts of those Dragon Nest Beastman Warriors.
Upon seeing Lizardman Rodney rescue most of the Beastmen soldiers, and finding nothing else left on-site, he started to rise into the air, swiftly heading toward the direction of the pit.
During the previous explosion, the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor completely vanished, with even the ground soil being melted and evaporated, forming a massive pit, and its mysterious Pyramid was naturally completely destroyed; however, Austin felt the need to see it with his own eyes to be at ease.
With the Corpse Mountain Pyramid’s obliteration, zombies and undead around also vanished, as if they all had perished in the previous war.
"What exactly is going on?"
If that storm of blast alone had caused the demise of all zombie undead, that would be impossible; these undead beings, like the zombies in Austin’s imagination works from a previous life, if their brains aren’t destroyed, cannot be completely annihilated.
But why have all nearby zombies disappeared?
No, not disappeared,
The desolate ground bears quite a number of zombie undead, lying in disarray.
Yet they seem to have lost some sort of driving support, lying limp on the ground continuously squirming, as if they’re clockwork puppets having lost control.
Lost their desire for life, even though the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion has been scattered into tatters, barely maintaining a protective formation, those zombies still capable of moving who’ve fallen on the ground showed no movements.
Seeing them as if they’re invisible, as if the zombie undead tide furiously assaulting the Beastman Legion wasn’t them at all.
"Strange..."
Austin, noticing this point, clearly found it odd, summing up the previous occurrences, he had a feeling.
It felt as if that previous Corpse Mountain or the protective Pyramid beneath was the central brain controlling the zombies’ movements, controlling these resurrected zombie undead to crazily assault living beings, recklessly seizing survival space.
"Too bad, couldn’t get the chance to see inside the Pyramid."
Austin had a feeling that these Pyramids were not simple wooden and soil structure buildings.
They were very likely alive.
Like the previous protective Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor, hiding some flesh-like structure beneath the earthy exterior.
The Pyramid possibly wasn’t a building but a lifeform, a zombie-like lifeform resembling the Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor.
Rooted in the ground, constantly eroding it, widespread forming some network extracting some form of power from the earth’s soil, while transforming the Forest Land into something suitable for numerous undead lifeforms to survive, controlling some actions of the zombie undead.

chapters.title: Chapter 217 - 203
chapters.content:
Actually, when Austin first saw the pyramid under construction, he felt that the pyramid seemed more like a living creature than a building.
Just from a distant glance, his Sixth Sense almost felt as if there were a heartbeat inside it.
It seems now, this is indeed the case.
Moreover, the role played by these mysterious pyramids is not just that of a heart, but also a brain!
A brain commanding and controlling a massive number of zombie undead!
Thinking this through, Austin felt a chill down his spine, wondering what the entity that designed all this and hid in the shadows was planning.
Could it really be, as the Beastman Alliance thinks, a simple mutated evil spirit?
Austin didn't know, and these were things likely beyond his current reach.
"Gold Level, still a bit too weak!"
With Austin's current strength, he might not be lacking, but as the Legendary Law hidden within his bloodline began to gradually awaken, it made him even clearer about what kind of realm Legendary Level really is.
It seems only someone Legendary could qualify to participate in such a game.
"Aside from this Corpse Mountain Giant Tumor creature and the pyramid, these zombie undead share quite a few similarities with zombies from fantasy works from the last life. Could it really be a Zombie Virus from an Otherworld?"
Suddenly, Austin's mind began to wander aimlessly.
"Following the trope of certain novels, perhaps some lucky individual got hold of something that could traverse the heavens, and then acquired the Zombie Virus..."
In an instant, Austin had drafted a mental outline of a million-word novel.
Speaking of traveling to this world, I haven't read any novels for a long time, no internet, not even single-player games, and anime is even more out of the question.
Who knows how long it will take to build a strong nation, who knows when the Dragon Nest Tribe will develop into a cultural and entertainment golden age. By then, I might also be Legendary, and then I can retire, peacefully in my nest surfing the web and playing games, how wonderful.....
What seemed like nothing before, now after quitting the internet for so long, I might just be able to play a black-and-white snake game for an entire day.
In an instant, Austin felt an endless sigh in his heart.
Stop!
Suddenly realizing, he cast aside those aimless thoughts and continued to focus his heart spirit back to the present.
No matter whether it's the hidden hand behind the scenes unleashing the Undead Calamity aiming to sweep through the Kawa Great Forest and destroy the world, or the thoughts of wanting to surf the web, play games, and read novels, it all seems too far away for the current Austin, thinking too much is useless.
After reining in his wandering thoughts, the massive pit appeared before him.
A pit hundreds of meters wide suddenly collapsed into the earth, with half-meter deep cracks spreading outwards in all directions, smoke rising, and the soil and ground appearing as though a massive wound had opened in this place.
Especially terrifying was the soil at the edge of the pit, having melted away under an unimaginable temperature, and as the heat dissipated, the viscous dark red magma began to cool and solidify. At the very center of the pit, the stones below had even melted into glass.
"Such terrifying power!"
Looking at the giant pit before him, Austin's expression was extremely solemn.
This pit before him was merely the aftermath caused by the sudden expansion eruption of a Rasengan, the material at the core must have been evaporated instantaneously by the dreadful thunder liquid explosion.
The temperature of ordinary thunder itself is already several times that of the sun's surface, only because the thunder appears so briefly and dissipates easily upon exposure to air, it doesn't seem as powerful as it actually is.
Yet Austin's Thunder Attribute change, extremely Compressed Rasengan when exploded, produced a ball of rapidly rotating Thunder Liquid, that horrific high-temperature and high-pressure destructive power was enough to instantly melt and vaporize even sand and stone, let alone the blood-flesh creature of Corpse Mountain Tumor.
"Thankfully it didn't get out of control."
Seeing the dreadful power caused by his technique, Austin couldn't help but feel a moment of fright.
If there had been any error at the time, causing the Magic Power operation to falter, there would be nothing left of Austin, standing at the center, even before killing the enemy.
Back when developing the Thunder Attribute transformation of the Magic Power Rasengan, Austin tried countless times but failed due to the violent nature of the thunder.
In the end, to allow thunder to fuse, Austin had to consider adding another Elemental Power, an element that could act as a fusion agent - Water.
Though thunder was volatile, if it had a carrier, it would become docile, and thus Austin thought of Water.
Even with the plan, the fusion and development process did not go smoothly, and was fraught with difficulties.
Because under the bombardment of thunder, water would split into hydrogen and oxygen, and even ignite due to the temperature of the thunder causing a violent secondary explosion, far more dreadful than adding only Thunder Attributes to Magic Power Rasengan.
This was an unsolvable problem - to calm thunder, water had to be added, but the power of thunder caused water to decompose, thereby leading to explosions.
Ultimately, to solve this problem, Austin had to add Wind...
Finally, borrowing the scientific operation principle from his past life, Austin relied on a certain operational principle to solve this problem, ultimately forming a wind, water, and thunder elemental ratio of 1:2:7, achieving a weak internal balance in the Thunder Attribute transformation of Magic Power Rasengan.
With such great power, should I think of a cool and awesome name?
Austin seriously contemplated in his heart.Newest update provided by novel_fіre.net
Soon, he came up with an incredibly cool name.
"It's decided!"
"Super Invincible World-Destroying Compressed Wind Water Thunder Rasengan!"
Whew!
Letting out a long breath, Austin felt refreshed.
Even though the Super Invincible World-Destroying Compressed Wind Water Thunder Rasengan is very dangerous, one wrong move and even he would be sacrificed, he wouldn't use it lightly before mastering this technique proficiently.
But at least he's grasped an attack with power comparable to a Forbidden Curse.
Even a being at Legendary Level wouldn't come out unscathed from such a hit.
The current Austin can be considered to possess power capable of threatening Legendary Level creatures.

chapters.title: Chapter 218 - 214 Crystal
chapters.content:
Having gained such a trump card, despite its numerous usage restrictions, Austin still felt significantly more at ease.
Moreover, as he continued to grow, with the Legendary Bloodline within him gradually awakening, his understanding of Power and Elemental Power became increasingly precise. By then, he might perfectly control this immensely powerful technique.
Just the thought of wielding such strength in the future, conjuring hundreds of super invincible world-destroying compressed Rasengan made of wind, water, and thunder around him, tossing them out like free candy, turning the heavens and earth dim in an instant, a terrifying power wiping out everything, even Legendary Level experts could be gravely injured if not killed in the relentless bombardment.
Furthermore, the Rasengan could further advance in the future, and it could be Magic Modified to allow Fighting Qi to be used as well, taught to the Extraordinary Beastmen. By then, training hundreds or thousands of Beastman Officers, each capable of forming their own Rasengan and bombarding anyone they disliked, Austin could dominate a territory, living as a local tyrant, that would truly be a blissful life.
The power displayed by the super invincible world-destroying compressed Rasengan of wind, water, and thunder gave Austin immense confidence. Looking at the enormous transformed land turned into glass, years of apprehension about the survival environment vanished.
"At least now, I possess a technique comparable to the full-force strike of a Legendary Level combatant. No matter how many zombies come, I'll kill them all!"
Austin was clearly very satisfied with the results of the battle in front of him.
Without the Pyramid's control, he could clearly feel the unknown forces beneath the earth disappearing, while a certain power between the soil and the earth began to gradually awaken...
Simultaneously, without the Pyramid's control as the "brain," the bloodthirsty madness of these undead creatures had notably subsided, posing no threat whatsoever to the Dragon Nest Legion.
"Hmm, I must not let my guard down; I need to carefully monitor any disturbances in the southwest."
Recalling the time he almost got annihilated, a hint of gloom passed through Austin's eyes.
Neither the zombie undead horde nor the Pyramid established there could possibly form naturally; there must be something pulling the strings behind the scenes.
Who knows how they'll react now that I've destroyed this Pyramid lair...
Forget it, I'll see in the future.
Austin cleared his mind of thoughts; the Corpse Mountain and the Pyramid's foundation it was safeguarding had been completely obliterated, leaving nothing in the vast crater.
"However, I did achieve my goal this time."
Having destroyed the zombie undead horde's lair, there was no more threat; the remaining weakened undead wandering within a few dozen miles posed no threat to the Dragon Nest Legion.
"Where the zombie undead horde roams, whether Magic Beasts or Giant Beasts, most creatures have either been killed or driven away, and with the ground being corrupted, vast masses of trees have withered and collapsed. I wonder if sufficient Magic Resources can be found in those dangerous areas."
Dwelling briefly at the crater's edge, Austin suppressed his surging feelings and prepared to leave.
However, the moment he turned around, his gaze suddenly condensed, focusing on a spot in the crater's center.
"What's that..."
A wisp of smoke rose up and gradually waned, revealing at the center of the glassed and heat-radiating crater a slowly floating basketball-sized irregular crystal. With the dispersal of the smoke, it was fully revealed.
Within the irregular crystal, lines of light unfamiliar to him intersected slowly, like a chaotic mess kept together by a force, yet evoking a sense of smooth order. For a moment, the gentle luminance seemed to become the center of the world, absorbing all brilliance from above and below.
Whoosh!
Austin unfurled his vast membranous wings, creating a massive vortex, and soared toward the crater's center.
"What is this?"
Standing at the crater's center, gazing at the unknown crystalline substance before him, Austin's eyes were filled with gravity.
Danger!
A constant ominous warning echoed in his mind, but it wasn't the imminent danger of a blade poised at his neck. Instead, it felt like the dangerous heartbeat one gets when facing a truckload of dynamite.
Austin instinctively sensed that this colossal crystal concealed an enormous energy!
So vast that should it explode, he would surely be doomed!
Faintly, he even felt the surrounding space held a sense of being drained away.
It was as though the space around the crystal was repelled into void by an unseen, untouchable powerful force.
"Was it a by-product of the previous Rasengan explosion? No, that can't be! The power hidden within surpasses that of the Rasengan!"Get full chapters from novel⸺fire.net
Austin walked slowly around the floating crystal, scanning it meticulously.
He could distinctly feel space around him affected by this crystalline form, inducing a taut, twisted sensation.
What is this crystal? Where does it come from, and why does it harbor such formidable power?
Standing still, deep in contemplation, Austin wondered.
The earlier super invincible world-destroying compressed Rasengan of wind, water, and thunder had surely unleashed all its energy; naturally, it couldn't reshape into a more powerful vigilance.
"Could it be left by the Pyramid?"
The Rasengan wasn't possible, leaving only residue from the obliterated Corpse Mountain and Pyramid. Indeed, the crystal's origins likely relate to the Pyramid.
But why did destroying the Corpse Mountain and Pyramid yield such things?
Or is this crystal a convergence of some power?
Hundreds of thoughts raced through his mind in an instant.
Finally, Austin extended a claw, gently touching the crystal, and after no reaction ensued, he hesitated momentarily before grasping it in his claw.
"A pure energy form, and an unknown one at that. Its energy level exceeds even that of Magic Power!"
Having it in hand, Austin thoroughly observed and researched to draw a conclusion.
This energy from the crystal, Austin still didn't know its use. The energy level inside wasn't something he could covet for now.
His instincts told him even the Dragon Race's prodigious digestive power might burst upon consuming the mighty highly-leveled energy within this crystal.
"Better stash it away for now."
Suppressing the yearning within, Austin scanned his surroundings, finding no valuable remnants, then took to the air, flying out.

chapters.title: Chapter 219 - 215 Doubts
chapters.content:
After defeating that mysterious pyramid structure and the undead zombie creatures, the undead zombies within a hundred miles lost much of their threat without a "brain" to command and empower them. They were then easily divided and exterminated by the Dragon Nest Legion.
Although there were some errors in the plan, it was still relatively smooth. With the core of the nest destroyed, from now on, we only need to continually eliminate the undead zombies wandering between the mountains and forests.
Luring, dividing, surrounding, exterminating... all these methods used on the remaining zombie undead can be considered another kind of drill, wiping out the zombies in the forests, which can train a unit into an elite army.
In terms of loss, the Dragon Nest Beastmen didn't suffer much in this campaign.
Most of the injuries in the Dragon Nest Legion were caused by the shockwave from Austin's release of the three-attribute Rasengan, but thanks to the treatment with the abundant Snake Shedding Grass from the Wet Bone Forest, there are basically no major issues.
However, the gains from this war were also quite meager.
Against the enemy of zombie undead, the post-war gains, except for the unknown energy crystal Austin found in the remnants of the pit, were almost nothing.
Though Austin could sense the unknown strong energy contained within the energy crystal, he also felt that if he were to rashly devour it, that terrifying energy would certainly blow him apart.
"Now I am a Gold Level Giant Dragon, yet the energy within this crystal is enough to blow me apart, and there's no record of such energy in the inherited memories...."
In the Dragon's Nest, Austin looked at the unknown energy crystal suspended in front of him, his eyes flickering.
Is this thing some kind of core material used to create the pyramid, or is it a crystal core formed by absorbing the earth's power?
Upon closer inspection, he still found nothing.
In the end, Austin could only store it away for future consideration.
"The pyramid has been destroyed, and the zombies within the area it covered have been severely weakened. The Dragon Nest Legion will soon be able to clean up the remaining zombies, but... why is there still no response over there?"
Austin sat cross-legged on a gigantic platform, pondering silently.
On the day the pyramid was destroyed, to prevent other mishaps, Austin had already ordered the Beastman Legion to retreat and personally flew over a hundred kilometers to the mountains where the gray ape tribe's ruins, the first place the zombie creatures were discovered, were located, to scout the movements of those zombie creatures.
However, after days of observation, there was no movement at all, and even when Austin ventured into the depths to investigate another intact pyramid, he found no anomaly.
"Not long ago, the undead zombies spread through the southwestern gray ape tribe ruin mountains, covering a hundred miles and began to construct pyramids and erode the earth. Something is clearly driving everything from behind the scenes, but why hasn't there been any reaction since the pyramid's destruction?"
"Could it be that I'm wrong? Or is it that there really is no mastermind behind this, and all signs are just natural coincidences?"
After thinking for a while, Austin couldn't help but doubt himself.
But soon he denied his doubt, at least for now, according to the Beastman Alliance, the appearance of mutated evil spirits led to all this.
The source of all this originates from the depths of the Kawa Great Forest, from that mutated evil spirit.
"The Beastman Alliance's statement may not be reliable, or maybe those Great Tribe leaders leading millions of beastmen to escape and attack the border have other ideas... but there is one thing for sure, the counterattack between the Dragon Nest Tribe and the undead zombie sea is just a small wave in the grand battlefield."
"Millions of beastmen gathering at the border indicates that the rear of all the major tribes in the Beastman Alliance may have been overrun and occupied, so the areas covered by the undead zombie spread are definitely not few."
"In the vast Kawa Great Forest region, the number of living creatures is unknown. Among them, those extremely powerful races and tribes must also have those at the Legendary Realm, and the expansion of the undead zombie sea must have faced destruction by such powerful Legendary Level beings."
"The Dragon Nest Tribe is just an insignificant tip of the iceberg in that gigantic battle line, perhaps this is also why the pyramid's destruction here is not taken seriously."
Austin faintly speculated that the expansion of the undead zombie sea must have encountered such devastating destruction.
Perhaps the mutated evil spirit guiding and orchestrating all this from behind knows about the pyramid's destruction here but deemed it as something eroded into the domain of those at the Legendary Level and easily wiped out.
"If that's the case, then the Dragon Nest Tribe can face a period of peaceful development."
As the saying goes, when the sky falls the tall ones hold it up. The bloodline of the Giant Dragon Race makes any dragon upon adulthood reach the Legendary Level, and there absolutely are no adult wild dragons missing in the Kawa Great Forest.
Moreover, some top creatures may not even be weaker than Giant Dragons.
With those unknown legendary presences holding at the top, what's there to be afraid of?
Upon reaching Gold Level, the legendary law hidden within the Legendary Bloodline unlocked a bit more, making Austin more aware of the terror of the Legendary.
It's not something that can be amassed just by numbers, and even those mature pyramids would not pose any harm to Legendary creatures.Thᴇ link to the origɪn of this information rᴇsts ɪn novel·fire·net
It's just that... I don't know why those Legendary beings do not eliminate the undead zombie sea, and instead allow them to build pyramids, erode the earth, and transform vast forest areas, aren't they afraid that in the end, it might lead to total destruction?
Or is there some other purpose...
Austin pondered silently, looking at the unknown energy crystal before him, his eyes flickering.
"Beastman Alliance, border humans, legendary creatures... perhaps it's time to interact with the outside world, at least to gather some intelligence..."
Since birth, I've been sheltered in the nearby area without any external interaction, and those small tribes of hundreds living here for generations, what could they possibly know?
To learn more information, I must step out of the territory and engage in some communication with other powerful forces.
At least understand the situation outside, not remain blindfolded now when the Kawa Great Forest is facing a grand transformation of epic proportions.

chapters.title: Chapter 220 - 216: After the Battle
chapters.content:
It's time to communicate with the outside world. With my current strength, as long as I don't provoke those legendary figures, I can already ensure my own safety.
However, now is not the right time.
After the great war has ceased, the Dragon Nest Legion has entered a period of recuperation.
A large amount of Snake Shedding Grass was gathered from the Snake Bone Cave in the Wet Bone Forest, crafted into potions by Beastman Witch Doctors, and applied to injured beastmen. Under excellent medical care, in just a few days, most of the Dragon Nest Legion had regained their strength.
The revitalized Dragon Nest Legion began clearing the land a hundred miles away, once ravaged by undead zombies, conducting thorough searches, especially in dangerous areas. With the sweep of undead zombies and the Pyramid's erosion of the earth, most dangers had already dissipated.
Thus, while eliminating undead zombies, Austin ordered the Beastman Legion to explore those areas that hadn't been fully eroded and collect some magic resources from within.
Some hidden magic crystals and ores, deep within dangerous areas, were easily breached by the Dragon Nest Legion after most dangers had been dispersed, collected, and then transported back to the Dragon Nest Tribe's base by the buffalo team.
"Bone Forging Grass, Purple Crystal Flower, Gravel Gold Stone... Not bad, these are all important for the tribe."
In the plaza, as Dragon Nest Beastmen transported their spoils, Quik, the Fox-faced Man, walked through various magic materials, meticulously discerning them.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe expanded, numerous tribes were annexed and absorbed, and thus, some age-old secret recipes and techniques were collected, used in experiments, merged and incorporated into the Dragon Nest Tribe's medical system.
Over the years, the Dragon Nest Tribe developed a unique Otherworld medical system.
For instance, Bone Forging Grass could enhance the skeletal strength of beastmen, Purple Crystal Flower, when used with certain medications in a bath, could improve the constitution of beastmen, and Gravel Gold Stone, containing considerable magic power, loved by those heavily armored magic beasts, devoured in large quantities to enhance the defense of their scale armor.
These pieces of knowledge were the result of continuous experiments and expansions by the Dragon Nest Tribe's medical system, and the integration of occasionally discovered secret techniques from annexed tribes.
Many magic resources, whether for the cultivation of Fighting Qi or other physical training, had a very significant promoting effect.
The reason why those top large tribes could continuously produce endless strong figures was partly due to their possession of a large amount of magic resources.
"It's a pity, the quality of these items doesn't seem great, and quite a bit of magic power seems to have dissipated. But being able to obtain these is still not bad."
Perhaps due to the Pyramid extracting some elemental energy from the earth soil, causing the Forest Land to turn into wasteland, even those magic element-rich dangerous areas experienced a mass dissolution of vitality, leading to a significant drop in the quality of magic resources buried within.
Austin didn't care about these defective goods. Having just advanced to Gold Level, he hadn't yet metabolized a large amount of magic ore within his body, which would likely end up used on the Beastman Legion.
"Search a few more places, then prepare to withdraw. Cold winter will soon begin, don't let any accidents happen."
Quik said to the leading Beastman Officer beside him.
A hundred miles of land is indeed a vast area, and with the population of the Dragon Nest Legion, it's impossible to search every inch of that territory in less than two months. Therefore, there are quite a few undead zombies still wandering in the surrounding mountains and forests.
Furthermore, the distant sky had turned as if a massive ice block was suspended above, a sign that the Water Attribute Magic Power tide was sweeping over from afar. Although half a month later than usual, the cold winter was indeed about to arrive.
The white Death God crossing the border, along with the wandering undead zombies between the mountains and forests, required careful consideration and avoidance.
"Yes."
The Beastman Officer nodded and, as if recalling something, asked:
"Lord Quik, what about the temporary base we established in the northeast when we prepared to withdraw? And our companions there, should we summon them back?"
While Austin was in slumber, the Dragon Nest Tribe, following Austin's orders to prepare a retreat, established a temporary base about a hundred miles northeast. Subsequently, a large number of elderly and weak Dragon Nest Beastmen, along with substantial supplies, were transferred there.
That was the escape route Austin had prepared in case the counterattack failed.
Now, however, the "hard nail" Pyramid on the wasteland had been removed by Austin, and the remaining scattered undead zombies in the surrounding wasteland were no longer a concern, making arrangements for that temporary retreat base somewhat troublesome.
"Report this matter to Vini yourself, it's not within my responsibility."
Quik shook his head and began ordering the Witch Doctors to select and categorize the magic materials.
These civil matters were indeed outside his jurisdiction. Now the most important task before him was to categorize and store these magic materials properly, and plan how to apply them to the beastman soldiers to enhance the strength of the Dragon Nest Legion.
With these magic resources, even an ordinary Beastman Legion could achieve a considerable leap in strength. How to utilize and allocate them was Quik's responsibility.
Seeing Quik start leading a group of subordinate Witch Doctors to work, the Beastman Officer had no choice but to retire.
Actually, Austin already had a preliminary idea regarding that temporary retreat base.
He speculated that the destruction of the Pyramid might make the mastermind behind the undead calamity misjudge the strength on this side, possibly preventing the undead zombie tide from ravaging this area again.This text is hosted at .ɴet
Yet a speculation remains just that; the future might not necessarily develop in the desired direction, so it's wise to have a contingency plan.
To prevent unexpected occurrences, Austin had been observing the movements of the undead zombies in the fringe area recently, while the temporary retreat base in the northeast couldn't just be discarded.
If the mastermind behind the scenes became enraged by the Pyramid's destruction, the Dragon Nest Legion would at least have a place to withdraw to.
Additionally, the temporary base contained a large cache of materials. Although the buffalo had good transport capacity, shuttling back and forth like this was troublesome, and so Austin had decided to make the temporary retreat base the first branch base of the Dragon Nest Tribe. It would allow clearer control over the Dragon Nest Territory's scope and serve as an escape option for the future.
Of course, unless absolutely necessary, Austin naturally wouldn't easily abandon this main base foundation.

chapters.title: Chapter 221 217: Development Plan
chapters.content:
With the destruction of the pyramid building, the remaining zombie undead pose little threat to the Dragon Nest Legion. Seizing the opportunity before the onset of the cold winter, the Dragon Nest army began a rapid sweep of those dangerous areas, harvesting a considerable amount of substandard magic power resources.
These magic resources, when applied to the current Dragon Nest Legion, are sufficient to achieve significant enhancement.
Just as the Dragon Nest Legion began its final sweep and was preparing to retreat.
After monitoring that there were no unusual movements from the zombie undead on the other side of the gray apes' ruins, Austin returned to the Dragon Nest Tribe to sort out the many post-war affairs.
The first issue was the temporary retreat base. Faced with the pressure of the zombie undead tide earlier, Austin had to prepare a fallback route for the Dragon Nest Tribe. Most of the productive beastmen and beastman militia, along with massive supplies, retreated across mountains to a base a hundred miles northeast.
Now, with the cold winter approaching and the world soon to be locked in ice and snow, communication between the two locations would become difficult, making the immediate resolution of the temporary base's disposition essential.
"Now the tribe's population has surpassed thirty thousand. The area within our activity range is not enough to fully support the tribe's population growth; it's time to establish a base."
Using the temporary retreat base as the core, create the second base of the Dragon Nest Tribe, forming mutual support and protection.
In this way, if one side encounters a problem, the other serves as a backup preparation.
With the transport of wild cattle, the journey of over a hundred miles takes only two or three days, allowing exchanges between the two places and relieving the pressure on the Dragon Nest Base.
"This might be a beginning. With the base as the center, we can gradually establish bases in different directions, expanding in all directions, bringing vast land under control, and these base points can also provide a certain degree of mutual defense!"
Inside the Dragon Nest, Austin's eyes lit up.
In this primitive area with backward productivity, even with farming, land development, and bronze tools to enhance productivity, it's still difficult for a single base to support a larger population.
After years of development, a population of over thirty thousand already puts considerable pressure on the Dragon Nest Base.
Before the beast tide turmoil, the Dragon Nest Tribe's hunting teams had to travel tens of miles to hunt enough beasts. This round trip for the beastmen hunting team took one or two days, reducing the production efficiency of the Dragon Nest Tribe to some extent.
If part of the population could be dispersed to other places, the unexploited resources of new bases would be abundant, and they could absorb the surrounding tribal population, thereby significantly increasing the total population of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After much contemplation, Austin's mind formed a plan for the future expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Since there's a need to evacuate, the temporary base won't be able to be evacuated before the cold winter ends. It can serve as the first experimental sub-base; there's enough food stored there, so there shouldn't be any issues."
If that temporary retreat base can successfully establish itself, the expansion of Austin's subordinate clans will use it as a model, establishing tribal bases one after another, spreading like a net, occupying large tracts of land, and absorbing more beastman population.
"However, the defense there has issues. It consists mainly of relatively weak beastman militia, and defense structures haven't been set up. Troops should be dispatched before the cold winter to strengthen defenses against giant beast or magic beast attacks."
Here in the main city, with Austin overseeing, there shouldn't be any unexpected events.
He successfully launched the super Rasengan with three attribute nature transformations that day. Austin's understanding of the magic power of wind, water, and thunder attributes has reached new heights, along with his advancement to the Gold Level. Unless he encounters a Legendary Level existence, there should be no danger.
Once he fully masters the super invincible destructive compressed wind-water-thunder Rasengan, even a Legendary entity might not be able to confront it directly.
"So, that's the decision."
Having decided on the general development plan for the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin called for someone to prepare to announce it.
In the coming cold winter season, the main focus for the Dragon Nest Tribe is to safely get through it while enhancing strength during this period, using the substandard magic power resources collected from the dangerous zones of the wasteland to improve themselves.
Austin also plans to develop a Fighting Qi Rasengan for the beastmen to use as a supplement to the close-combat techniques in the Beastman Six Techniques. If possible, he also wants to develop a magical modification of the Navy Six Techniques' paper drawing to complete the final form of the Beastman Six Techniques.
The cold winter usually lasts for three months. After three months of hibernation and fully absorbing the gains from the last major war in the wasteland, the Dragon Nest Tribe's strength should see some enhancement.
After the cold winter ends, the Dragon Nest Tribe will use the temporary retreat base as the core to expand outward, eliminating and integrating surrounding beastman tribes and absorbing them rapidly.
The plan seems very good, but...
"I hope there won't be any problems with those mutated evil spirits. There are indeed Legendaries in the forest, but they probably won't pay attention to this side."
Austin thought contemplatively in his heart.
"But what exactly is going on with the Tribe Alliance? Why is there no reaction, and no envoys have arrived? How far has their war at the Bloody Border with the Southern Countries of the Central Earth World reached? Also, what about their front with the zombie undead army...?"
Thinking of the Beastman Alliance, countless doubts arose in his heart.
The Beastman Alliance's envoy initially told him that the Blood Claw Tribe had established a base at the Copper Mine site to achieve a blockade and warning against the zombie undead tide, preventing them from attacking the rear during the Tribe Alliance's assault on the border.
But now, except for a few visits by people from the Beastman Alliance after the initial period, there's been no further appearance.
This change inevitably made Austin suspect some kind of shift.
"Unfortunately, sending a reconnaissance team over there to gather information was a bit late. In the future, attention must be paid to this area of development, or... establishing an intelligence-gathering organization within the Dragon Nest Tribe?"
