Austin mused to himself silently, but one thing was certain: during the peaceful development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, there would definitely be a degree of support for intelligence gathering.

chapters.title: Chapter 222 218: Breaking the Waterfall
chapters.content:
Actually, before this, Austin had already dispatched beastman scouts to the border to gather information, observing the movements of the Blood Claw Tribe to prepare the Dragon Nest Tribe in advance.
However, due to time constraints, even though the Dragon Nest Beastmen infiltrated the Tribe Alliance, it was difficult to obtain high-level information. The only known fact was that the Beastman Alliance and the human border army had ceased all warfare beneath the Bloody Great Wall, with both sides in a standoff for nearly a month without any action.
It seemed like the human high command and the Tribe Alliance's high command had reached some sort of agreement and were in discussions.
The atmosphere at the Bloody Border remained tense with opposing forces facing off, though no battles had transpired.
The entire border had plunged into this eerie calm.
Regarding what had transpired between the high-ranking officials, and what the future holds for the Bloody Border, the Dragon Nest Tribe's scouts couldn't get in touch with it at all. The beastman high command seemed to deliberately conceal the news, wrapping the situation in layers of mystery.
Even the extent of the battlefield between the Beastman Alliance and the undead zombies could not be detailed. It was only known that the Tribe Alliance had recently redeployed a significant amount of forces, but the details were unknown.
Presently, the Dragon Nest Beastman scouts had access only to low-level personnel within the Tribe Alliance, with virtually no understanding of high-level information. It would take a significant amount of time to reach the upper echelons.
"According to those people, the emergence of the undead zombies was merely the result of a mutated evil spirit causing a wave, but it could never be that simple. Otherwise, it would only be the pyramidal undead creatures eroding the land, turning all that they invade into wasteland. Such destructive plundering of the earth couldn't have happened without a Legendary figure stepping in to stop it, but the undead zombies still occupied an incredibly vast region, threatening and destroying the living environment for millions of beastmen, forcing them to relocate without any action being taken. Everything is definitely not that simple!"
Regarding the power a Legendary Level could possess, as Austin's level improved and the release of his inner bloodline increased, he increasingly felt the terror of that power.
The endless sea of undead zombies might have some effect on Silver and Gold Level extraordinary beings.
But once a Legendary figure intervened, their vast power was enough to completely crush these corrupted creatures into dust.
With the sea of undead zombies' erosive nature on the earth, even a Legendary Level habitat would encounter the influence of this intense plundering. However, so far, the Legendary Level creatures within the Kawa Great Forest have made no moves to eradicate the endless undead zombies, which explains a lot.
Either the force behind these events possesses an incredibly terrifying power that even makes Legendary Level beings wary.
Or perhaps those Legendary creatures have ulterior motives, hoping to achieve something amidst this upheaval, with certain interests making those beings indifferent to the imminent destruction of the Kawa Great Forest.
Or perhaps a Legendary Level entity had acted, but Austin was unaware amid this vast and boundless front line...
Numerous conjectures, coupled with the anomalies at the Bloody Border, have made everything feel enveloped in a shroud of mystery.
"Forget it, no matter what schemes are afoot, the most important thing now is to lay a solid foundation, vigorously develop one's power, and possess enough strength to protect oneself amidst the unknown upheaval."
"The intelligence agency cannot fall behind. We need to assign people for special construction to prevent such blind situations in the future."
After organizing various clues in his mind for a long time, Austin, sitting cross-legged on a high platform, had an inexplicable gleam in his eyes.
"The Kawa Great Forest...not simple at all..."
The suspected lake reservoir transformed from an impact crater beside the Dragon Nest, those unknown magic artifacts, scattered miscellaneous remnants within the Beastman Tribe—all elements that should not appear in this Barbaric Land—all indicated that the Kawa Great Forest was not as simple as it seemed on the surface.
There was that Gold Level Great Mage, as well as Edward's mercenaries following in the teacher's footsteps—they all seemed to be searching for something.
The Kawa Great Forest harbors some secrets.
Austin himself had once sensed a miraculous and indescribable power in the world beneath the lake reservoir.
Originally, he planned to dive in for investigation once he reached the Gold Level.
However, with the current situation the Dragon Nest Tribe faced, he needed to preserve his complete combat power. The place beneath the lake reservoir could only be explored once the situation stabilized.
Next, the Dragon Nest Tribe would focus entirely on preparing post-war arrangements and getting ready for the impending cold winter.
And with each command issued by Austin, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe began to move, executing his plan—distributing forces, transporting supplies, fortifying positions, striving to complete the temporary bases before the cold winter arrived, and also initiating training for intelligence agents.
...
Just as the Dragon Nest Tribe started engaging in post-war organization, within a secluded mountain canyon in the Bloody Border Region.
A massive waterfall descended from the sky, with thousands of tons of river water crashing down from a thousand-meter-high cliff, resembling a heavenly river pouring down. Its formidable power even suppressed the air, producing colossal rumbling sounds akin to ten-thousand-thunder rolling.
At this moment, beneath the waterfall.
A towering figure stood at the gorge's mouth amidst the crashing white waves, standing firm under the unknown thousands of tons of pressure, issuing an earth-shattering roar.
"Roar!!!"
Within the gigantic roar, the air seemed to tremble as a surge of invisible energy suddenly exploded from that massive body, causing white water splashes to splatter in all directions, accompanied by a shockwave visible to the naked eye sweeping out.
In the next instant, the figure clenched its fists, and with immense palms like millstones raised towards the sky.
"Ooh la la la!!!!"
Two iron-like crimson arms punched repeatedly towards the descending majestic waterfall, striking faster and faster, until only afterimages could be seen. Each strike released Fighting Qi, piercing through the massive water flow, rolling upwards into the sky!
One punch, two punches, three punches... the colossal water flow and spray were shattered by the frightening Fighting Qi, ultimately forming a vacuum area tens of meters high at the top. The countless tons of turbulent water flow were also smashed into fragments by the terrifying power!
As the figure used human strength to contend against the majestic force of nature, a nearby procession, led by a figure exuding an awful aura of majesty, approached slowly,
A flag fluttering in the wind beside them bore the imprint of a huge, menacing blood claw, seemingly tearing through the sky.

chapters.title: Chapter 223 219 Royal Court
chapters.content:
On an unknown beast skin, the giant Blood Claw banner fluttered in the wind, symbolizing the Blood Claw Tribe.
The Blood Claw Tribe, one of the few top tribes on the outskirts of the Kawa Great Forest, with a population of hundreds of thousands, could rival some of the weaker duchies in the Human World.
Among this massive population, the number of Extraordinary Professionals continuously emerges, from Bronze, Silver to even Gold, these strong individuals are numerous. The powerful Lord of the Blood Claw Tribe has even cultivated a Bronze Level elite beastman guard of over a thousand members, making the overall strength of the tribe fearsome.
There are several such powerful beastman forces at the frontier.
If these powerful beastman tribal forces were placed in an equally powerful realm of the Human World, with the population area they control, they already have the qualifications to become a duchy.
At this time, a multitude of beastman tribes gathered at the frontier began to form an alliance to face the threat of the Undead Calamity from behind, which was the result of deliberations among the Blood Claw and several other powerful tribes.
The alliance of several large tribes almost controlled the whole alliance's voice.
The powerful Lord of the Blood Claw Tribe was one of the leaders of this alliance, with several high-level leaders deciding the future strategies and direction of the Tribe Alliance's war.
"Gross, your strength has become even stronger. You indeed live up to being the bravest warrior within my Blood Claw; your bravery is worthy of all beastman admiration."
On the mountains, looking at the figure under the waterfall bearing the terrible pressure, breaking the cloth, Rulga, the strategist of the Blood Claw Tribe, considered the most cunning, cruel, and terrifying in the eyes of humans, slowly spoke.
"Roar!"
Perceiving someone coming from behind, that massive and robust figure suddenly threw a punch, and the mighty Fighting Qi burst forth, the visible airwaves reversed the descending thousands of tons of water skyward, while that figure stamped a foot on the ground, shattering the rocks that remained hard after countless time's erosion, and the entire person shot up, crashing down beside Rulga like a meteor bomb.
The earth shattered under this mighty force, and the airflow mixed with dust swept open.
"Rulga, what are you here for, plotting some scheme again?"
Gross stood on the shattered ground, his sturdy muscles like wrought fine steel, bulging in ridges, his Fighting Qi released, and his dark gold fur dried instantly, his huge body resembling refined gold, stuffed with terrible, indestructible power beneath the taut muscles.
Gross shot a cold glance at Rulga, evaporating the water on his body, speaking in a muffled, deep voice.
For this person before him, Gross had mixed feelings.
On one hand, the Blood Claw Tribe's ability to grow to its current state owed much to Rulga's schemes.
But simultaneously, this guy never considered tribe members as companions, sacrificing thousands of lives to achieve a certain goal was not worth a mention. Before this, Gross had fallen victim to one of his schemes, evidenced by the huge, hideous scar across his chest.
Being recognized as the Blood Claw Tribe's foremost warrior, Gross, like most beastmen, had no fondness for calculations, which doomed his relationship with Rulga to be less than favorable.
"Gross, no need to look at me like that, this time it's on the leader's orders, the Blue Young Dragon that caused your brother's death last time, you're allowed to kill it now."
Rulga waved his hand to dismiss his guards, not looking at Gross beside him; his gaze drifted towards the endless sky beyond the mountain peak.
"I know suppressing your thoughts of revenge irked you before, but it concerned the tribe's future strategy, then was not okay, now it is."
"What are you up to again?"
Gross did not immediately agree with Rulga, his large eyes fixated on him.
Inheriting the beastmen's impulsive and straightforward personality, reaching the status of the top warrior in the Blood Claw Tribe wasn't achieved by being utterly foolish.
His brother Grom, during the advance to establish a foothold, was beset by a Clan led by some Young Dragon nesting nearby. At that time, Gross indeed thought of seeking revenge but was suppressed by Rulga.
Because, despite the Blue Young Dragon being just a Silver Level orphan dragon as per the search, within this Barbaric Zone of the Kawa Great Forest, the Dragon Race's power was not small either, who knew if rash actions would attract a big enemy to the Blood Claw Tribe?
Beastmen's nature was all about fighting when unsatisfied; however, Rulga was an exception, considering more from a benefit standpoint, which led the Blood Claw Tribe to grow from a moderate tribe to its present status.
At the time, Gross felt very aggrieved, filled with displeasure towards Rulga, eventually leaving the Blood Claw Tribe's base to come here, striking the waterfall, training himself away from the aggravation, and enhancing his strength.
"Give me a reason, don't think of fooling me easily."
Although Gross disliked pondering too much, it didn't mean he was purely foolish, he knew some things.
Now, suddenly allowing his vengeance, remembering Rulga's previous actions made Gross contemplate whether he had become a pawn to achieve some ends.
Seeing Gross's expression, Rulga understood that some explanation was needed today.
"Gross, both you and I know we exist on the Bloody Border merely because the Inner Domain Royal Court requires so..."
"No need to ask more, did you really think the humans erected the Iron Wall Great Wall at the edge of the Kawa Great Forest just to prevent our plunder before the winter?"
"Simply by seizing grain resources from the Human World, it's impossible to maintain the survival of millions of beastmen; our existence is merely as the court requires us outside as a buffer line.... But now, hmph, those self-considered noble purebloods think they have the power to break everything..... and we are used as discard waste, becoming for some thing's nourishing material."
Rulga snorted coldly, his face turning unpleasant talking about this matter.
The hundreds of thousands to millions of beastmen population in the frontier zone, abandoned just like that, while being used as raw materials; even if those people were the legendary pureblood, who would willingly go to death.
Mutant Evil Spirit? Ha!
"Inner Domain Royal Court, is that legend true? Does the heartland truly have a Royal Court established by those purebloods?"
Gross didn't notice these points but was instead focused on another, eyes wide with disbelief, and asked further:
"And, what do you mean by nourishing material, how does this relate to me killing the Young Dragon?"

chapters.title: Chapter 224 220: Conspiracy
chapters.content:
Among the beastmen within the Kawa Great Forest, there exists a legend.
According to the legend, many years ago on the Seta Continent, there was an incredibly powerful Beastman Empire, ruling over the vast continent, at a time when the beastmen were the masters of the entire continent, with the pure-blooded beastmen at the high levels almost dominating everything on the continent.
Later, for reasons unknown, the mighty empire suddenly collapsed, and eventually, its remnants fled from the center of the Seta Continent, escaping to the remote Kawa Great Forest in the south, a Barbaric Zone.
Among the beastmen, there has always been a rumor that the noble pure-bloods did not leave and vanish into the endless barbaric lands; instead, they established the Beastman Royal Court somewhere in the core inner domain, continuing the glory of that incredibly powerful empire.
Of course, a rumor is just a rumor.
In fact, for the low-level beastmen living on the outskirts of the Kawa Great Forest, with their capabilities, they simply cannot traverse the thousands of miles of dangerous terrain to reach the core area to verify whether the rumor is true.
Perhaps, in the hearts of many beastmen, the royal court in the legend is merely a yearning and yearning for a better life amid their difficult living conditions.
However, the lower beastmen are unaware, but those at the true top know much more.
The reason they can have enough resources to support a population of hundreds of thousands is only because of the support from those behind them.
Otherwise, ever since the establishment of the Iron Wall Great Wall at the Bloody Border, the beastman tribes have found it increasingly difficult to raid the human world to obtain large amounts of food supplies. If relying solely on themselves, without a sufficient food source, such a large tribe scale would have long since disintegrated.
As the strategist of the Blood Claw Tribe, Rulga is very clear about the position of these peripheral tribes.
Strong puppets to withstand the humans' buffer zone.
And now, for the so-called pure-bloods above them, these tribes have lost their usefulness.
If Rulga's words were heard by Austin, a storm might surge within his heart.
The existence of the so-called Beastman Empire and pure-blood beastmen, Austin has also heard from the Fox-faced Man Quik.
Later, from the notes obtained at the relic left by that Gold Level Great Mage, Austin learned that the Gold Level Great Mage initially intended to head to the Kawa Great Forest to search for the remnants of the former Beastman Empire and find those remaining pure-blood beastmen.
However, that Gold Level Great Mage searched within the Kawa Great Forest for years but still found nothing.
But now, in Rulga's words, the Beastman Royal Court truly exists and rules the core inner domain, with food supplies supporting those enormous top-tier tribes in the outskirts. How could this not astonish Austin?
Was it that the pure-bloods hadn't established the royal court hundreds of years ago, or had the royal court been long established but even the Gold Level Great Mage couldn't find any traces?
"Gross..."
Seeing Gross's reaction seemingly incredulous about the Beastman Royal Court, Rulga was speechless yet understanding.
As the first warrior of the Blood Claw Tribe, Gross might have the qualifications to know these things, but he probably wouldn't specifically go to understand them, and thus, his reaction wasn't surprising to Rulga.
"If you're interested in knowing more specifics about the Beastman Royal Court, go ask the chief yourself."
Gross thought for a moment, finding it troublesome, shook his head, and said in a muffled voice:
"Forget it, the royal court is the royal court, what does it have to do with me? Just hurry up and explain why you suddenly agreed to let me kill that Blue Young Dragon. If there's no reasonable explanation, don't think about using me."
"It's not really using. Haven't you always held a grudge against your brother Grom's death? This time, it's just letting you take revenge. Of course, this matter counts as a good thing for the Blood Claw Tribe."
Gross, being rash and stubborn, wouldn't turn back once he's set his mind on something, so Rulga had no choice but to explain in detail.
"The so-called mutated evil spirit is merely an excuse from the royal court. Do they really think everyone is a fool?"
"Those so-called pure-bloods are implementing a grand plan through those undead creatures. We don't know exactly what that plan is, but we can be sure that we've become a part of it... Ever since they started concealing the truth, we've been reduced to sacrifices, becoming nourishment for those things...."
As he talked about it, a flash of resentment crossed Rulga's eyes, and he continued:
"The reason we began the great migration, formed the Tribe Alliance, and attacked the Bloody Great Wall was all just to find a way to survive. At that time, I stopped you from attacking that Young Dragon because we couldn't afford to provoke other enemies under such circumstances."
"But now, we've reached an agreement with humans. If those humans don't want to face those undead armies directly, they can only strongly support us for resistance. And more importantly, those undead creatures have already spread to the area where that Young Dragon is."
"Gross, what do you think the prideful Giant Dragon Race would do if a Young Dragon died at the hands of those undead and became one of them?"
Gross pondered, his voice low like thunder:
"That Blue Young Dragon is supposedly an orphan dragon without parental care, but with the pride of the Giant Dragon Race, seeing their race's offspring becoming undead for battle, they certainly wouldn't hesitate to use thunderous means."
"That's right. The Dragon Race is a Legendary race, becoming Legendary upon maturity. If they take action, regardless of the reason, those big figures who've waited so long will definitely get involved, competing for the rich fruit..."
Rulga spoke in a quiet voice, seemingly with implications.
"After all, the fruit is ripe... and it can be picked..."
"But if found out, wouldn't I be in trouble too?"
Gross's voice was low, pondering something.
"Heh, as long as all the witnesses are dead and that dragon indeed becomes an undead creature, what does it have to do with us? After all, it's merely a Silver Level Young Dragon. During the Undead Calamity, even Gold Level magic beasts have died before. Don't you think so, Gross?"
Rulga spoke quietly, with a tone full of indifference.
After successive wars, the Beastman Alliance's high command is also aware of the characteristics of those mutated undead, resurrection upon death being one of them.
Even High Tier magic beasts of Gold Level will be infected and revived after death.
And this trait allowed Rulga to discover the space for manipulation within it.

chapters.title: Chapter 225 221: Power Sorting
chapters.content:
As long as that young dragon is killed, followed by arranging for its corpse to be infected with the power of the undead, creating an undead young dragon, in this way, everything can be blamed on the undead tide.
After all, it's just an orphan dragon, and upon seeing an undead dragon, it would only vent its anger on the undead, rather than waste time and effort to truly find out the truth.
Moreover, the purpose of this trip is merely to muddy the waters, planting a seed in the minds of those high and mighty Dragon Race.
Rulga has vaguely guessed the purpose of those purebloods in the Beastman Royal Court.
The Legendary existences traversing the Kawa Great Forest are also temporarily not dealing with the mutant undead that triggered all this, for certain reasons.
As long as balance is broken, then that so-called Beastman Royal Court will face a catastrophic disaster.
At that time, allied with humans and having reached an agreement, they will have sufficient power to overthrow those high and mighty pureblood lineages, even establishing a new order within the Kawa Great Forest won't be a problem.
Of course, these words will not be spoken to Gross.
"Gross, this is a very arduous task. I hope you won't disappoint us, and at that time, not a single one must escape, otherwise it could develop into a big trouble in the future."
Rulga said calmly to Gross.
Gross, the most powerful warrior in the Blood Claw Tribe, a title recognized rather than self-proclaimed, also representing his strong power that suppresses the entire Blood Claw Tribe.
Although as a being naturally of the Extraordinary race, he does not need to activate the Extraordinary Seed power to automatically enhance his strength, Gross has never relaxed his demands on himself. Instead, he has diligently trained, step by step enhancing his power while confronting the Heaven and Earth Power. His extraordinary strength has shone brilliantly in wars time after time, even having once fought and killed a Gold High Tier Ice Storm Bear Lord, earning the fame of the Blood Claw Tribe's first warrior.
His formidable power is a rarity among the Tribe Alliance, making him a powerful overlord in the outside world as well.
Furthermore, when the Blood Claw Tribe decided to send capable generals to establish a counterattack stronghold, it was Gross's brother Grom who was sent out.
Such a person has the strength and sufficient motive to kill the Blue Young Dragon.
This is exactly why Rulga came to find Gross to assign him the mission.
"Hmph, that young dragon is merely a Silver Level, killing it is not a problem, but it has over a thousand Beastman Race under its command, killing them all won't be so easy!"
A cruel glint flashed in Gross's eyes as he spoke confidently, as if killing Austin was as simple as squashing a fly.
In fact, he indeed thought this from the bottom of his heart.
Mere Silver Level, even if it's of the Dragon Race, so what?
He, Gross, is the famous first warrior of Blood Claw, a powerful overlord who once fought and killed a Gold High Tier lord!
Giant dragons, once mature, might be a big trouble, but during their young stage, it's also their weakest time.
"It's a pity, although it's just a young dragon, it's still dragonslaying, yet it cannot be publicized. Otherwise, it would have added to my dragonslaying achievements."
Gross's millstone-sized hand clenched tightly, making a crackling sound, feeling the enormous power within, he thought to himself.
This power of a double-headed punch is enough to tear off that young dragon's head!
"Rest assured, Gross, along with you on this mission are five hundred Blood Claw elites. Leave those small fry to them; you only need to deal with the strongest Blue Young Dragon."
With Gross's strength, combined with five hundred elite Blood Claw warriors, it's enough to sweep through any ordinary Beastman Tribe.
Dealing with that tribe of just a few thousand people, with the strongest being merely a Silver Level young dragon, would be an easy annihilation.
What a pity is that Rulga, for all his calculations, missed just one thing.
That is, the information about the Dragon Nest Tribe was already several months old.
And within those months, Austin's power had made a significant breakthrough.
Back then, to reduce suspicion, Rulga specifically reduced the frequency of the Beastman Alliance's envoy visits to the Dragon Nest Tribe to prevent anyone from tracing back to them. However, what he didn't foresee was that such a trivial adjustment became the biggest flaw in his calculations.
After nearly three months of slumber, digesting a large amount of Magic Water Pattern Ore, Austin's power had long since transformed, successfully stepping into the Gold Level.
Of course, with Gross being able to kill a Gold High Tier overlord, the outcome between the two remained uncertain.
...
At the Bloody Border Region, just as a conspiracy against Austin and his subordinate Clan Tribe was gradually forming, the Dragon Nest Tribe had already entered a phase of strategic retreat, consolidating their existing strongholds.
And while Austin delegated most matters to his subordinates, he began a new round of "seclusion."
Of course, this so-called "seclusion" wasn't in the true sense, rather it was Austin starting to organize and refine his own power to a certain extent.
"Magic Power, compared to the Silver Tier, has increased more than tenfold!"
When he first awoke, he was immediately faced with the pressing threats of the zombie undead army, forcing Austin onto the battlefield hurriedly, developing a semi-finished Attribute Magic Power Rasengan, leading the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion in the first counterattack against the zombie undead army.
Until now, the pyramid base of the zombie undead army closest to the Dragon Nest Division's stronghold had been completely destroyed, and the distant sea of zombie undead showed no signs of movement. The Dragon Nest Tribe had thus become secure, allowing Austin to finally truly begin a deeper integration and organization of his powers.
It was also then that he discovered his Magic Power had surged to such an extent compared to when he was at the Silver Level!
"Scale Armor Defense strengthened thrice, body size expanded by one time, and the sharpness of teeth and claws also enhanced to some extent, thus my close combat ability must have increased by at least tenfold."
Very strong!
Among the same Level of Magic Beasts, Austin's close combat ability likely ranks first class.
This is the might of the Giant Dragon Bloodline, the power belonging to a Legendary Bloodline. Meanwhile, the vast amount of Magic Water Pattern Ore Austin consumed before slumber cannot be overlooked as contributing factors.
Alongside the skyrocketing close combat ability, Austin's talent in magic had also leaped tremendously.
Awakening the fourth talent magic, Super Storm, simultaneously granting Austin control over both wind and water elemental powers, in addition to the thunder element.
It was precisely the combination of the wind, water, and thunder elements that gave birth to that destructive Attribute Transformation Rasengan move.
And thus, Austin evolved a kind of attack method with power comparable to a Legendary rank.
But this is still not enough!

chapters.title: Chapter 226 222: Wind Attribute Rasengan
chapters.content:
The Super Invincible Destroy Everything Compress Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan, despite its extremely powerful destructive force comparable to a Forbidden Curse, at the center of that Rasengan explosion, terrifying high temperatures and high pressures, along with the intensely rotating wind attribute cutting power mixed in everything, all materials touched by it would instantly vanish and evaporate, with the aftershock melting the earth's soil into molten glass.
But this technique, though strong, takes an incredibly long time to charge.
Back when destroying the Zombie Pyramid, Austin needed the help of his clan's beastmen to clear out a large area, providing him with a safe enough space to execute the technique.
That Rasengan did not exceed Austin's expectations, instantly demolishing the earth and completely destroying the Zombie Pyramid.
However, that was in specific circumstances; in actual combat situations, the enemy would not give you time to charge up such a move.
Hence, how to perfectly master one's own power, how to simplify the Super Invincible Destroy Everything Compress Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan to be usable in actual combat, had become urgent.
"Originally, to bombard fixed targets, the pursuit of extreme attack power led to incorporating Thunder Attribute's nature change into the Magic Rasengan, but now, the Rasengan formed by the nature change of Wind-Water-Thunder attributes, before my mastery reaches a certain precision, is still not suitable for combat..."
Austin was very clear about his current power, the Super Invincible Destroy Everything Compress Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan indeed powerful, but at this stage, it was not suitable for direct combat.
Changes must be made!
The nature change of the Thunder Attribute is difficult to incorporate into the Rasengan, yet in the original manga, the Wind Attribute's nature change has always been protagonist Naruto's trump card.
Wind Style: Rasengan.
Compared to the difficult control of Thunder Escape, Wind Escape paired with Rasengan has a more suitable compatibility.
In the coming days, Austin focused his heart-spirit on the Wind Attribute nature change of Rasengan. Compared to the nature change of Thunder Attribute, the Wind Attribute's nature change was smooth sailing.
This might be related to the successful development of the Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan, as it took Austin just a few days to develop the Wind Attribute Magic Rasengan.
Unlike Naruto's shuriken form in the original manga, Austin's Wind Attribute Magic Rasengan is a perfect sphere, with violent wind attribute power compressed and concentrated within a small ball, containing unimaginably terrible power.
In his previous life, Austin had seen a video.
If you simulate Jupiter's wind strength onto Earth, the rapid-moving wind blades produced could split a wooden plank in half!
And within this Wind Attribute Rasengan, the rotational speed of the wind element is thousands upon thousands times stronger than Jupiter's wind strength; during experiments, when the Rasengan with nature change of Wind Attribute explodes, it instantly unleashes a terrifying torrent.
The soil hundreds of meters around was instantly shredded and swept into it, like water rushing and spinning rapidly, eventually manifesting as a towering dust storm that rampages across the earth, pulverizing trees and rocks into dust.
As the power dissipated, a massive pit remained on the earth, its surface as smooth as a mirror, deeply sunken beneath the ground.
"This is... the power of wind!"
Standing atop the mountain, Austin silently remarked as he gazed at the massive pit below.
The power of wind, shattering everything, eradicating everything,
The instant explosive power tears apart all materials within its range, though not as terrifying as the Rasengan with nature change of Wind-Water-Thunder attributes, it is still exceptionally formidable, and a powerful one below Legendary Realm, hit by such a Wind Attribute nature change Rasengan, would likely be minced into meat paste.
"Very well, the Wind Attribute Rasengan has developed quite well, but there's still some distance from instantaneous casting, further optimization is necessary."
The Wind Attribute Rasengan's power is already adequate, the only flaw being the time needed to form it.
Currently, Austin requires at least a minute to form the Magic Rasengan and apply the nature change of Wind Attribute.
Such a long time is a bit slow in a tense battle, and experienced enemies won't allow you the time to form such a finishing move.
Thus, further optimization of the Wind Attribute Rasengan is necessary, such as shortening the time needed for cohesion, ensuring it cannot be interrupted even when interfered with by enemies during battle.
For the ultimate form of the Rasengan with nature change of attributes, Austin imagines relying entirely on mental concentration, freeing his front limbs and claws, to instantly form these powerful Rasengans in the void, and even multitasking, creating one, two, three... in an instant in the void.
Countless Rasengans with nature change of attributes would rise unprovoked in the void, continuously emerging, becoming a nightmare for any future enemy of Austin.
Of course, achieving such a level involves immense difficulty.
But every task has a beginning, so start with the Wind Attribute nature change Rasengan.
"Aside from improvements to the cohesion of the Wind Attribute Rasengan, perhaps trying out the water attribute nature change of Rasengan is worth considering. Currently, apart from these, improvements are necessary in controlling the skyrocketing magic power, managing thunder, and controlling wind and water elements, while developing some combat techniques suitable for me."
While reviewing himself, Austin realized there are still many tasks to accomplish during his "retreat" period.
Once perfect mastery is achieved over all the skyrocketing powers, and the Wind Attribute Rasengan can be freely formed through mental concentration, Austin's strength will undoubtedly undergo a transformative change.
Subsequently, Austin plunged into arduous "retreat" training, commencing optimizations in mastery over his skyrocketing power.
And soon after,
Several days later, the long-delayed cold winter finally arrived one day.
Vast water attribute magic power rolled down from the sky, enveloping the heavens and earth, with temperatures plummeting, the forest land froze visibly, and the sky rained down large snowflakes, a raging blizzard seemingly intent on covering the entire world!
In less than half a day, the whole world was engulfed in a crystalline cloak of silver and white, heavens and earth draped in a white hue.
Meanwhile, within the icy snows, the Dragon Nest Tribe beastmen began to hibernate, waiting for the most perilous days to pass.
Simultaneously, Austin took shelter within the Dragon Nest, quietly awaiting the passing of the cold front while reflecting on integrating his power.

chapters.title: Chapter 227 223: The 1st Stronghold
chapters.content:
In the early days of the cold winter, the forest land was filled with danger, a terrifying cold front draped across the high sky, and the "colorless Death God" occasionally fell from above.
Although the deathly cold falling from the heavens wasn't immediately life-threatening for Austin now, it was still better to avoid the cold and stay cozily tucked away in his nest.
The magic power, which had surged more than tenfold, caused Austin's control over himself to become rougher. He was unable to act with ease, and his newfound strength hadn't fully merged with his body.
During the days holed up in his nest, unable to experiment with the wind attribute Rasengan, Austin began to filter and train his own strength.
"If I can achieve a fine control over my own magic power, it will be quite significant for the improvement of the wind attribute Rasengan. At least, after I've mastered the control of my own magic power, the time to manifest it should reduce to some extent."
Silently in his heart, Austin mused within the Dragon's Nest.
Soon, before him in the void, a white orb of magic power suddenly appeared, floating in the air.
With a thought, Austin began to draw from the orb, threading it into a string the size of a cord. With the influence of his spiritual power, the white magic orb began to unravel into a coiled white magic rope in the air.
But that was just the beginning,
Soon after, the white magic rope in the air was split in two under Austin's spiritual power, pulling from both sides, unravelling further, and soon there appeared two magic lines as thick as chopsticks in mid-air.
A bead of sweat slowly formed on Austin's forehead as the two chopstick-thick magic lines hovered, trembling slightly, but they soon settled, quietly suspended in the air.
He exhaled deeply, spiritual power surged again, simultaneously controlling the two magic lines, and with spiritual power, tore them from the middle, turning two magic lines into four finer ones.
As the precision of control increased, Austin's hold became laborious, maintaining those four wire-thin magic lines in mid-air was showing signs of collapse.
Just as he intended to take it further, splitting the four lines into eight, the magic lines suddenly wavered, and instantly collapsed, dissipating in the air.
"Phew, is this the limit!"
Austin exhaled deeply, feeling utterly exhausted.
With all his heart spirit focused on the magic lines, not only maintaining their structure to avoid collapse, but also manipulating them, was more draining than fighting a battle.
However, despite the fatigue, it was worth it.
Just that brief practice had already allowed Austin to feel a further step in mastering his own strength.
If one day, he could draw out a magic orb into hundreds or thousands of fine strands like hair, then Austin's control over his own magic would reach an extremely high level.
With such a degree of magic control, forming a wind attribute Rasengan would be a mere trifle.
Thus, Austin immersed himself in a deeper layer of magic control training.
...
In the initial days of the cold front's passage, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe was also in a state of dormancy, barely venturing out.
Meanwhile, at the temporary retreat base, due to the collaborative efforts of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, enough houses were constructed before the harsh winter set in, and although the walls were unfinished, the presence of a large number of Dragon Nest Tribe elite beastmen prevented much worry about any unexpected incidents.
Several days later, the dangerous times of early winter had passed, and the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen emerged from their homes, fortifying their training while also engaging in tasks possible even in the cold winter.
However, compared to the headquarters, the Dragon Nest Tribe's first base was relatively busy at the moment.
After daily training, several Dragon Nest Beastmen went out in force, wielding bronze axes to fell trees, gathering up the enormous trunks, sharpening the tops, and erecting them around the perimeter of the first base's houses to establish a simple wall to prevent wild beast attacks.
"Be vigilant, report immediately if you spot traces of any giant beasts or magic beasts..."
In the open area outside the base, the Dark Elf Adinlek addressed the orc patrol team before him, giving them instructions and then letting them disperse to patrol.
As a mid-term Dragon Nest Beastman veteran, despite having many issues, Adinlek was the first to hand over the breathing technique of dark creatures, a feat that even if better were captured in the future, Austin would never completely forget Adinlek's contributions.
Moreover, the Dark Elf race inherently gains bonuses in vision and agility at night, as do those transformed into Dark Dragon Guards by the breathing techniques of dark creatures.
Consequently, Adinlek had become the commander of the not-very-prominent Dark Dragon Guards within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
And because of their keen hearing and enhanced night vision, they became part of the patrol team.
"This matter requires full alertness. According to His Highness, this outpost must be developed in accordance with the expansion model of the Dragon Nest Tribe headquarters, and His Highness's attention to the outpost is no less than that of the Copper Mine Base. If you still hope to meet His Highness's approval, you cannot relax your vigilance, and you must prevent any crisis from befalling your companions."
"Yes!"
Soon, the patrol team dispersed, scouting between the woodland to prevent any hungry magic beasts or giant beasts from attacking the orc producers working on site, averting significant casualties.
This was untouched virgin land, not comparable to the area near the Dragon Nest Tribe headquarters.
Only through a fresh round of expansion eradication could the first base be truly transformed into a secure outpost area.
A large number of beastman militia wielded their sharp bronze axes, felling the forest and transporting the felled logs back to the base as construction material.
Once the cleared forest land was prepared, after the cold winter passed next year, the land could be developed for farming, establishing a sufficient logistical system around the outpost.
Only by establishing a food supply system similar to the Dragon Nest Tribe headquarters could the outpost support round after round of annihilation wars against nearby tribes, rapidly strengthening the power of his subordinate clans.
The first outpost was precisely the first step of the Dragon Nest Tribe's expansion plan implemented by Austin.
If this step succeeds, then later using this as a template, outposts could be continuously established around the Dragon Nest Tribe headquarters, while also keeping the headquarters protected at its center, significantly improving the number and strength of his subordinate clan corps.

chapters.title: Chapter 228 224 Opponent
chapters.content:
Thanks to Austin's modern management, and the brainwashing propaganda work, a vast majority of the Beastman Race within the Dragon Nest Tribe have an immense faith in him.
This faith stems from a pure admiration from the hearts of the Beastman Race.
However, even a beastman cannot be completely like a robot; some Beastman Tribes have certain benefit-oriented demands apart from their internal admiration for Austin.
Dark Elf Adinlek is such a case. When he surrendered to the Dragon Nest Tribe, it was not because of some kingly aura of Austin, but due to Austin's mighty strength and the potential height he could reach in the future.
He is not like those simple-minded beastmen. Two years ago, Austin was merely a Bronze Level Young Dragon, and more powerful extraordinary races wouldn't consider pledging loyalty to a dragon of such weak strength without parental protection.
But Adinlek is different. As a Dark Elf, how could he have survived and arrived at the Kawa Great Forest's Barbaric Zone without a certain degree of intelligence?
In that failed battle, he saw Austin's army, which although still somewhat weak, was incredibly strong.
He was betting that the Dragon named Austin would not be like those proud, brainless peers, betting that the Blue Young Dragon capable of training such a Beastman army would eventually grow up and become a dominant leader!
Thus, the Dark Elf surrendered under Austin's command, offering his Breathing Technique heritage, helping to train extraordinary beastmen, and continually putting effort into the building of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Now, when Austin grows into a dominant leader, the benefits he would receive would undoubtedly be substantial.
In fact, the Dark Elf's gamble has already been half won by now.
More than thirty thousand Beastman Race individuals, the massive development of Martial Techniques, increasingly powerful Beastman officers—the military group formed by the Dragon Nest Tribe can be considered first-rate within the entire Kawa Great Forest.
Due to the developed farming, the Dragon Nest Tribe does not need, like other Beastman Tribes, to occupy vast forest lands to support a large population; in addition to Austin's stable development temperament, the Dragon Nest Tribe has not expanded outside the hundred-mile circle aside from clearing the surrounding area.
Therefore, the Dragon Nest Tribe's reputation only rules within this small area, but further away, it is not well-known, and other Beastman Tribes do not know of such a powerful military force hidden in this corner.
In the eyes of the Dark Elf, the Dragon Nest Tribe, in terms of reputation, might only be the ruler of a small valley within the entire Kawa Great Forest, but its actual strength truly possesses the ability to compete with large tribes.
In just two or three years, the development to the current level is simply unbelievable, completely beyond the Dark Elf's expectations.
Adinlek believes that in another ten years, another dominant force within the Kawa Great Forest will surely rise, and as one of the early founders, he will inevitably receive indescribable benefits.
"His Highness is nostalgic but also prefers capable people. That atavistic Jackal Wolf People youth is like that, catching the attention of His Highness from among the mediocrity, earning the chance to enter the Combat Techniques development team. To achieve a higher status in the tribe's future development, one must demonstrate more abilities..."
Very early on, the Dark Elf had this realization.
As a wandering mercenary, Adinlek had been drifting outside for years, possessing rich experience in outdoor survival and considerable experience in leading troops into battle, playing a significant role within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Especially in the early days, he often led the hunting team out for hunts, gaining numerous merits in various battles, with the corpses of many Giant Beasts standing as testament to his achievements.
But now, the Dark Elf feels his status is being challenged.
That damned human mercenary who should go to Hell, the former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory, has been hopping around in front of His Highness since surrendering out of cowardice.
Though reluctant to admit it, the truth is that the damned Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory's abilities are indeed commendable, especially in troop training, having a unique approach; along with extensive mercenary survival experience, he's adept at leading the Beastman army in the wild, gaining considerable merit.
Thus, Adinlek, with abilities similar to Gory, feels his status faces a strong challenge from the human mercenary.
"Damn guy, he better hope I don't get any hold on him!"
Thinking of that damned guy, the Dark Elf's face turns unhappy, internally cursing once.
The construction of the first stronghold concerns the Dragon Nest Tribe's outward expansion process; the Dark Elf knows its importance clearly, and following Gory's appearance, he needs to establish more merits in this expansion operation to prevent his status from being threatened.
"Everyone, be careful of the ice dropping overhead,"
In the snowy field, the Dark Elf walking in front reminds his team behind him.
With the cold front passing, the forest land is covered in a vast whiteness, the trees heavily cloaked with snow, while sharp ice spikes are hung suspended.
Though most creatures enter hibernation during the cold winter, some animals still hunt in the cold, and those active during the cold are exceptionally fierce creatures.
This area is unfamiliar, and to prevent attacks from wild creatures, they can only increase the Beastman's patrol frequency.
But during patrols, the most injuries are not from beasts' attacks but the sharp ice spikes hung on large trees, saturating the patrol with falling dangers.
To prevent patrols from receiving head injuries from the ice spikes, the Dragon Nest Tribe had to urgently gather a batch of Bronze Helmets, so the Dragon Nest Beastman patrol would wear them when venturing out.
Beastman patrols navigate through the forest, constantly patrolling vigilantly, keeping dangers excluded from the stronghold.
Unpredictable whens,
Whoosh!
A subtle sound suddenly arrives, hardly noticeable amidst the rustling of the patrol team, yet Adinlek's ears twitch intensely, his eyes sharp, swiftly drawing his bow and readying an arrow.
"Who!"
Before finishing the word, the sharp arrow in his hand is swiftly launched, like a bolt of lightning, shooting into the forest where ice spikes hang shrouded.
Thud!
A dull sound echoes, a flash of bloodred within the depths of the woods, as if something was hit, and Adinlek's subordinates look ahead with heightened alert.

chapters.title: Chapter 229 225 Cultivation Results
chapters.content:
"Wow, wow!"
An angry, unknown cry suddenly came from the depths, as if some creature had been enraged.
Immediately afterward,
Long spears whizzed through the air, shooting out from deep within the forest like a torrential downpour, enveloping the Dragon Nest Beastmen patrols.
"Be careful!"
The Dark Elf shouted loudly, his figure bursting into action, retreating rapidly,
while the Dragon Nest Beastmen behind him quickly sought cover, dashing to hide behind shelters.
The densely packed wooden spears rained down, embedding into the ground and tree trunks, but the Dragon Nest Beastmen were well-prepared to dodge, and with their leather armor and bronze helmets, only a couple of them were unlucky enough to get injured, without any serious harm.
At this moment, in the distant dense forest, small figures, almost like gnomes, wielding spears and bows, leapt out from between the trees.
"Form up, prepare for battle!"
Though sudden, the Dark Elf remained unfazed, and the well-trained Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers quickly relied on each other, forming a dense long spear array, warily watching ahead.
By this time, those figures had only just charged to the front of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Gazing at the half-human-height small figures, the Dark Elf's pupils suddenly contracted.
"Elves?!!!"
Elves never gather together to form tribes like the Beastmen; they never exist alone.
And these well-trained elves before them were clearly combatants or perhaps even an army.
Could it be that there is an Elf Kingdom nearby?
...
Dragon Nest Tribe, Back Mountain.
Austin stood at the mountain peak cliff, cold winds howling through, his gaze sweeping across a vast, snowy white landscape.
Yet, for him now, any scenery was all the same.
At this moment, he had his eyes closed, focusing his heart and mind entirely on splitting the magic corps in front of him.
Soon after, in the space around him, tiny magic lines hovered in the air, dancing with the wind, like a giant dandelion blossoming and expanding.
After a while, the dandelion formed by magic power started to stall, unable to continue splitting and blooming.
And Austin opened his deep blue eyes, exhaling a hot breath through his nostrils.
"That's as far as I can go for now..."
Looking at the enormous magic power "dandelion" in front of him, with its lines drifting in the wind, Austin's eyes were filled with a complex expression.
After a dozen days of training, he could now strip the magic corps down to hair-thin magic lines, achieving an extremely high level of control precision. Austin could even proudly claim that, among dragons of his age, none had the precision of magic control that he had achieved.
In fact, Austin wasn't without room for further improvement.
However, to improve precision further, the effort required would increase exponentially, and for now, higher precision magic control didn't offer much enhancement for Austin's current stage, making it not worth the extensive investment.
So Austin decided to stop there.
Being able to control his magic power to a hair-like level was already sufficient for him now.
"Indeed, higher precision magic control has a significant impact on the control of the Rasengan."
With a thought, a fist-sized magic vortex suddenly appeared in front of Austin, with magic power swirling, rapidly condensing into a magic Rasengan within just a few seconds.
"This condensation speed is at least four or five times faster than before. In close combat, even without attribute transformation, a pure magic Rasengan is still quite damaging."
With the effect of spiritual power, the magic Rasengan in front of him spun like a cannonball, shooting towards a massive ancient tree in the distance.
Buzz!!!
Upon impact, the magic Rasengan exploded fiercely; the terrifying force of magic generated a violent clean wind, blasting a large hole in the trunk of the ancient tree, with the subsequent force even creating a large pit in the solid stone behind it.
And afterward, another magic Rasengan appeared in front of Austin.
But unlike before, when it seemed effortless, Austin now had a look of solemnity on his face, extending both forepaws to control the direction of the magic power.
Buzz buzz buzz!
The air began to vibrate violently. Compared to the silent magic Rasengan before, the one Austin now condensed was astonishingly powerful. Intense wind blades vibrated in the air, creating a buzzing sound, while inside the core, it seemed to slice through space, creating a dazzling stream of light that was astonishing to behold.
After a few seconds, the magic Rasengan suddenly quivered, with power fully contracting to the core, and a halo appeared in front of Austin, the swirling round of light with attribute power almost reaching the limits of power.
"Vanish!"
With a mental command, a section of the wind attribute-transformed Rasengan before him changed, decomposing as a massive storm of airflow burst forth from it. Like a tidal tsunami, it swept across, leaving not a speck of snow untouched on the ground.
Ultimately, the wind attribute Rasengan before him completely dissipated, transforming into a massive release of magic power without causing any damage nearby.
Attaining this level already showed that Austin's control over the Rasengan's wind attribute transformation had reached a decent extent. With further training, he might even achieve the capacity to summon it spontaneously from the void, like his pure magic Rasengan.
"The result of this closed-door training isn't bad. High-precision magic control also aids attribute transformations of magic power. I wonder if further refinement in control will someday enable the creation of Spherical Lightning."
With this round of magic control training complete, Austin clearly felt that the achievement was not only an improvement in the Rasengan's control but also in his ability to expertly execute the wind attribute transformation of the Rasengan.
It's uncertain, however, when his control over magic will be refined to such an extent as to manipulate the explosive thunder energy, crafting a perfectly pure Thunder Attribute Rasengan.
Nonetheless, the current results were already quite pleasing.
Most importantly, his mastery over his own power has improved significantly. Where once ten parts of strength were needed, now one part was sufficient.
His control over the magic of thunder, wind, and water attributes had also greatly advanced.
"And truly, I hadn't expected the improvement of magic control precision to have such benefits."
Austin thought silently to himself, and with a mental command, threads of magic extended from the void, interlinking heaven and earth like a spider's web.
Above, the sky had somehow become shrouded with dense clouds, covering the entire sky and earth, and among the clouds, a mighty rumble echoed....

chapters.title: Chapter 230 226 Doubt
chapters.content:
Spiritual power began to spread along the web-like magic power, entering the void, using the magic power between heaven and earth as a carrier, enveloping the space within a radius of several miles.
"Is this the embryonic form of a domain...?"
Feeling everything within the few miles reflected into his mind, Austin couldn't help but ponder secretly.
Previously, the fourth talent magic was activated, capable of causing weather changes in a region of several miles, turning the area into a massive storm zone. While Austin was within this storm zone, he could perceive various flows of magic power, thus gaining some abilities akin to an embryonic domain.
However, now, as his control over his own power increased, strands of magic lines combined with some attributes of the fourth talent magic, enabling him to turn an area within a hundred miles into his own domain without activating the storm.
"Within this embryonic domain, the enemy's every move is almost under my control, one could even say that this simple domain is my home field!"
Upon perceiving the control over his domain, countless combat techniques immediately surfaced in Austin's mind.
If an enemy were to engage him within his home field, they would be at an innate disadvantage, let alone considering Austin's endless derivative abilities. As long as they can't defeat Austin in one blow, victory would most likely be his.
"In terms of attack, there is the Thunder Roar Cannon, Electromagnetic Cannon, Magic Rasengan, and various derivative property changes. For close combat, the domain provides support. Coupled with me being a legendary level entity as a giant dragon, my combat power surpasses that of ordinary extraordinary beings. So, as long as no legendary appears, survival is basically unhindered."
Organizing the combat means he possessed, Austin felt quite satisfied.
Compared to the days of trembling and hiding when he was weak, now he could basically walk across this land openly.
With his current power, as long as no legendary appears, there basically wouldn't be any problem.
Of course, Austin had already decided that before becoming a legend, he wouldn't wander around freely. After all, just from the fragmentary legendary law awakening in his bloodline, one could glimpse the terrifying existence of truly reaching that realm.
"But, why does the giant dragon bloodline conceal legendary laws, and how can they be passed down from generation to generation?"
Legendary, for ordinary creatures like humans and beastmen, is like an insurmountable barrier. Those who can step into that realm are incredibly rare.
However, the Giant Dragon Race can easily reach it, crossing that threshold, stepping into that realm.
Giant dragons do not need cultivation, they need not comprehend the origin laws of heaven and earth like humans and other ordinary creatures. Upon adulthood, the legendary law hidden within their bloodline automatically unlocks, allowing them to effortlessly enter the legendary realm.
Such disparity between biological levels is indeed too large.
This made Austin have to wonder where the Dragon Race's talent comes from, whether the legendary law in their bloodline is innate or due to other reasons.
If it's innate, at most, it's just the injustice of heaven and earth.
If it forms postnatal, for example, in the ancient era, if a dragon achieved the realm of a divine being or something, and from then on, the descendants of the Dragon Race had the ability to pass down the legendary law, that would be terrifying.
If that's the case, perhaps the secret of Austin's soul travel was detected by such an existence.
Or perhaps, his travel is just a pawn of some existing entity.
Thinking of this possibility, Austin couldn't help but shudder, feeling a sense of impending doom.
But soon, he figured it out.
"It shouldn't be like this..."
If it were truly detected, he would have been found long ago, and if he were a pawn, then with his current power, he couldn't resist such an entity and would have no choice but to obey.
For now, he was at least very safe.
"The matter of soul traveling, the specific reasons are still unknown. However, these legendary creatures of the Dragon Race also surely harbor many unknown elements to me."
Regardless of the origin of the legendary laws within the dragon bloodline,
The Giant Dragon Species, upon reaching adulthood, become legendary. Compared to ordinary beings like humans, they are unbelievably stronger.
However, the rulers of this world are not dragons, but humans!
The prime areas on the Seta Continent are all occupied by humans.
It's simply unfathomable; after all, beyond legendary, one cannot be exterminated merely by numbers.
Yet, with such a powerful group as the Dragon Race, their adults being legendary, how could they let humans ride over their heads to become continental overlords!
Mind you, not every dragon possesses the temperament of Austenite, who avoids trouble and seeks steady development. The majority of giant dragons, having a supreme bloodline, hold a high and mighty attitude towards lower beings, so why would these dragons willingly hand over the dominion of the continent to those lowly humans?
Or could it be that humans have some other confidence for becoming the continent's overlord?
Countless mysteries then welled up, but no matter how much he pondered now, it was of no use.
The specific reasons therein are beyond what Austin can touch at this moment.
However, Austin also gained some guesses from it.
This world is far from simple.
Even in the legendary realm, there are still things to heed, not truly free to roam between heaven and earth.
"Enough, thinking too much is pointless, at least in this vicinity, there's already nothing that can threaten my life. Once I've cultivated for another few hundred or thousand years, in the vastness of the world, I can come and go as I please, can't I?"
Shifting his heart and mind away from those complex matters, he focused again on enhancing his strength.
At least at this stage, regardless of the ceiling above, Austin's primary goal is still to continuously enhance his power and stabilize the development of his Clan Tribe.
The continent is vast, boundless; in this world, he is but a mere drop in the ocean. Even if he shines brightly, he would hardly be discovered as a grain of golden sand hidden in the desert, unless this grain grows to the size of a Golden Mountain.
And those are far too distant for him.
Returning his mind to his domain, planning to develop techniques based on his domain, Austin suddenly sensed some disturbances in the direction of the Dragon Nest Tribe within his domain.
His brow furrowed first, then his eyes widened in anger.
"Hmm? Courting death!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 231 227: The Battle Begins
chapters.content:
At a certain mountain peak, Gross, standing two to three meters tall like a giant iron tower, held an orc's head he had twisted off alive and casually tossed it aside. Picking up the bronze long spear beside the corpse on the ground, his gaze revealed a hint of interest.
The snow around was soaked with blood, with mutilated corpses scattered all around. Judging by their equipment, they were obviously the patrol of the Dragon Nest Tribe nearby.
Standing in the midst of the corpses, Gross picked up the bloody bronze long spear and examined it, then kicked at the leather armor on a nearby corpse.
"Interesting thing, but unfortunately too fragile."
Casually breaking the bronze long spear, Gross said indifferently. Meanwhile, he cast his gaze toward the not-so-distant city tribe below, his lips curling into a sinister smile.
"A decent tribe, but today, I am determined to annihilate you!"
As he spoke, a powerful aura began to appear behind Gross, emerging one after another, numbering nearly hundreds, as a murderous air surged into the sky.
This group was sent by the Blood Claw Tribe to kill and eradicate Austin and his Clan Tribe.
Their sole aim was to completely slaughter all the orcs and lure the undead here, turning all the Dragon's clan orcs and himself into those mutated evil spirits.
With Gross's top-tier Gold-level combat power, coupled with over a hundred extraordinary Blood Claw elites, it was enough to wipe out any medium-sized tribe.
Having traveled across mountains and rivers, enduring the passage of the harsh winter, they managed to arrive here to find their target, only to unexpectedly encounter a patrol team from the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Already filled with pent-up rage from the journey, Gross didn't hesitate at all, killing most of the patrol immediately, with only one human escaping.
The escape of that guy would indeed alert the Dragon Nest Tribe, thereby increasing the difficulty of the mission.
But, so what?
Although the Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers in the patrol had displayed a quality that wasn't ordinary, giving off an aura of battle-hardened elites,
They were still easily crushed by their overwhelming power.
For a mere troop of over a thousand Dragon Nest Tribe put together by a Silver Young Dragon, they believed there would be no accidents this time.
"Indeed, that guy runs fast, but that's all there is to it, go, kill them!"
Looking at the small human figure running toward the encircling wall in the distance below the mountain, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe also sounded a massive alarm, with teams of well-armed soldiers emerging from corners of buildings, gathering at the street walls.
Evidently, the human who escaped earlier had alarmed the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
There was no thought about why humans were present here, nor why they would serve that dragon.
Gross displayed a hint of a bloody grimace, flipping a bloodstained bronze long spear into his palm with a kick.
"Kill!!!"
Accompanied by a roar, Gross's aura suddenly surged, and blood-colored Fighting Qi erupted like a blazing flame.
Simultaneously, his arm, as hard as steel, grasped the bloodied long spear, hurling it forcefully forward.
Whoosh!
The next moment, a beam of blood light was cast down from the sky, breaking through the brick and wood structure of the city wall like a violent storm, instantly creating an enormous breach.
As the sand and wood shattered, the soldiers on the wall were blown away, swept up by the torrent passing through the road, as smoke and dust filled the air.
"Hahaha! Charge! Slaughter everything here!"
With the resounding noise that echoed across the sky, Gross leapt high above, like a blood-red meteor descending from the heavens, bringing with it an apocalyptic might and thunderous roars.
Rumble!!!
The blood-colored streak of light fell in front of Dragon Nest Town, crashing into the ground with a loud bang, causing large swathes of soil to collapse, and the ground shattered inch by inch as the terrifying current surged into the sky.
Behind him, strong figures with a powerful aura followed, rushing toward the Dragon Nest Tribe town, which had a massive gap broken in its walls, with unstoppable momentum.
No formation was needed, or any formation at all.
Under the charge of the exceptionally powerful Blood Claw elites, there was an overwhelming feeling akin to a tsunami approach.
"Enemy attack, engage!"
The attack was sudden, but the Dragon Nest Tribe's response was swift.
Moreover, most gathered here were elites of the Dragon Nest Tribe, readying their defenses in a short time.
Facing enemies daring enough to challenge the tribe with reckless provocation, the Dragon Nest Legion fearlessly launched its counterattack.
One by one, the Beastman Junior Officers appeared first using instantaneous step, while the Beastman officers led their troops mightily toward the enemy in an overwhelming charge.
No need for any communication.
Those on the Blood Claw Tribe side had already decided to eradicate all the orcs of the Dragon Nest Tribe, along with the Blue Young Dragon.
On the side of the Dragon Nest Tribe, there was undying hatred for the enemy daring enough to ambush them, violently breaking through the city's main gate and walls.
From the start, both sides had already engaged in a fierce blood battle.
Boom!
The two flood-like forces crashed into each other, six or seven Beastman Junior Officers joined forces, targeting Gross, the Blood Claw leader. The aftermath of the battle erupted, and the invisible Fighting Qi clash shattered the ground.
Meanwhile, other Beastman officers led well-equipped and trained troops to battle against the Blood Claw elites, with continuous casualties.
"Hahaha, excellent! Never thought I could meet foes like you in such a remote place!"
Despite being besieged by six or seven Beastman Junior Officers, Gross laughed instead of being angry. In an instant, he exchanged dozens to hundreds of blows, his body erupting with blood-colored Fighting Qi, blasting the unsuspecting Beastman Junior Officers away with terrifying force.
With the combat power of his own and the addition of the Beastman Six Techniques that surpassed the average Silver combat power of Beastman Junior Officers, they not only failed to overcome Gross, but were instead repeatedly repelled in a moment of explosive burst!
"Very good combat techniques, but unfortunately, this is as far as you go!"
The erupting blood-colored Fighting Qi not only pushed back the besieging Beastman Junior Officers, but the ground beneath his feet crumbled inch by inch, with visible energy waves rising from under his feet, making Gross's hair and beard flare with rage like a furious Demon God.
"Die!!!"
Repelling the Beastman Junior Officers in one move, the terrifying Fighting Qi erupted once more, forming a bloody crimson war bear behind him, roaring viciously.
Watching Gross about to strike, annihilating the several Beastman Junior Officers before him,
At that moment,
"You are courting death!"
Like the might of heaven, like purgatory, a colossal thunderous sound resounded from the sky, eroding heaven and earth like a flood, echoing throughout every corner of the world.
The entire sky darkened in an instant, as overwhelming pressure rolled in like tidal waves, sweeping far and wide.

chapters.title: Chapter 232 228 Battle (1st Update)
chapters.content:
The immense sound roared like thunder between heaven and earth, as if divine demons from above the nine heavens and below the nine earths proclaimed an immutable decree to all beings.
Rolling dark clouds shrouded the sky, and a massive figure descended from above the clouds with an overwhelming pressure like a mountain, stirring a colossal torrent between heaven and earth, as if the forces of the entire sky and land were being drawn in.
"What a formidable presence..."
Originally poised to explode with victory in his sight, Gross paused his surge of fighting qi for a moment.
His gaze was fixed on that dark sky in the distance, on the huge shadow descending from the sky, emanating a terrifying aura.
In an instant, his eyes focused intently.
Powerful, exceedingly powerful!
This was definitely not the level of a mere Silver Level. The oppressive force rolling in was as strong as the most formidable enemies Gross had ever faced in his life.
"Wasn't it said to be only at the Silver Level? How could it be this powerful? Or has the Blue Young Dragon grown to such an extent in just two short years?"
In an instant, many thoughts flashed through his mind.
However, this is just right!
"The stronger, the more interesting! Hahaha!"
Gross laughed heartily, his voice like a tsunami sweeping away mountains, while he stomped on the ground, unleashing a burst of unparalleled power from beneath his feet.
BOOM!!!
Like an earthquake, the ground collapsed instantly, as if crushed by an invisible force, causing large swaths of earth to crumble and bounce up.
The elite Blood Claw warriors around him were caught off guard by the crushing tremor and had trouble keeping their footing.
At the same time, with the forceful explosion, Gross shot up like a cannonball, heading straight for Austin high in the sky.
Facing that overwhelming pressure descending from the sky, Gross advanced without retreating, charging head-on!
"Die!!!"
Waves of vast blood-red fighting qi erupted from within his body, rising from his feet, making Gross appear like an angry golden Buddha.
The blood-red fighting qi spewed out around him and coalesced in the air, forming a gigantic blood-red phantom.
The phantom seemed like a fierce ancient deity from the primordial times, exuding a terrifying, murderous aura that permeated every corner of the horizon, causing all the Beastmen below to pause under its ferocious pressure.
"Long live Lord Grom!"
"It has appeared, Lord Gross's reversion to an ancestral form! This is the first warrior of our Blood Claw Tribe!"
As that blood-red, ferocious phantom appeared in the sky, the elite Blood Claw warriors became fervent, their eyes filled with fanaticism as they looked skyward.
The reversion to ancestral bloodline is a legend passed down among many Beastman races within the Kawa Great Forest.
The legend says that Beastmen blessed by the Beast God possess the powerful bloodline of their ancestors. If one can activate the ancestral bloodline within, not only can their strength increase drastically in a short time, but the door to becoming Legendary is almost opened to them.
Despite the lore's enticing allure, in reality, the occurrence of such a reversion is so rare—about one in several hundred thousand—that many tribes never witness this legendary bloodline ability in their lifetimes.
Grom's ability to dominate the entire Blood Claw Tribe and be willingly hailed by all Blood Claw Beastmen as the tribe's first warrior is not unrelated to his display of ancestral bloodline reversion.
It was through this reversion to an ancestral bloodline that Gross once slew multiple Gold Level Lord of Magical Beasts, one of which was even of High Tier Gold.
Such illustrious battle achievements earned him the respect and admiration of all the Blood Claw Beastmen.
Even other Beastman tribes harbor admiration for such a warrior.
Gross is considered a heroic figure, a paragon of pride for the Blood Claw Tribe.
And now, under the powerful Lord Gross, another glorious achievement is about to be added,
that is,
Dragon slaying!
To slay this dragon and earn the renown of a Dragon Slayer Warrior.
In their hearts, all the elite Blood Claw warriors are filled with unwavering confidence!
Meanwhile, high above in the sky, the blood-red, ferocious phantom was slowly solidifying.
He raised his head and clenched his fist!
A punch was thrown!
Endless blood-red light gathered, forming a fist capable of destroying space and all things in the heavens, like a massive mountain descending from the sky, crushing down towards Austin.
"Ancestral bloodline reversion, legendary seed!"
Facing the blood-red brilliance that was surging towards him, Austin's gaze grew solemn as he stirred the colossal torrent between heaven and earth.
After activating the ancestral bloodline, one's strength could multiply several times.
Although this burst was temporary, its mighty power needed no words to describe it.
Especially with Gross already being a Gold Level warrior rich in combat experience, this amplification was even more terrifying.
But, so what?
He, Austin, bore the legendary bloodline of the Giant Dragon Race!
"Begone!"
With a voice like rolling thunder, Austin thrust out a claw, like an iron claw cast in steel, seemingly tearing through space, carrying an overwhelming force like an all-enveloping storm smashing down.
BOOM!!!
In a sky-shattering collision, the entire world seemed to tremble, with the air visibly transforming into waves and surging in the high sky, then becoming a towering gust that toppled trees and lifted clouds of dust and debris.
Crackle!
At the same time, countless strands of azure lightning burst from Austin's claw, tearing through the air, with electric snakes writhing in the void, dyeing half the sky blue.
In an instant, swirling storm currents swept up, engulfing the sky with flying dust and stones, as if it were the end of the world!
The vast forces clashed in the air, evenly matched, neither side able to overpower the other!
Bang bang bang bang....
The sky seemed divided into red and blue halves, with two forces colliding, causing continuous explosions and sending intense torrents across the sky, transforming into a category eighteen windstorm spreading in all directions.
BOOM BOOM BOOM...
The shockwaves from the collision converged into a torrent, with the fierce wind blowing down the houses of the Dragon Nest Tribe. Meanwhile, from Austin's location, streaks of thunder broke the air and continually crashed into the ground, creating a series of explosions.
Hundreds of meters apart in the sky, yet the impact of their confrontation left the land in complete disarray.

chapters.title: Chapter 233 229: Lying (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
Under the immense impact, large swathes of houses began to collapse, and much of the town buildings in the Dragon Nest Tribe's station suffered varying degrees of destruction.
At the breach in the city walls, both the Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers and the Blood Claw Tribe elites were significantly affected, yet the brutal slaughter continued.
People kept dying, their blood staining the snow red, and corpses lay stiff on the ground.
Most of the collapsed city walls turned into a battlefield, amid dense clashes, the impacts of Fighting Qi exploded continuously.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers formed a tight military formation. Although their individual combat power was not strong in this Extraordinary battlefield, they could assist the Beastman Officers in encircling and killing the Blood Claw elites.
At this time, the Beastmen soldiers within the Dragon Nest Tribe were the elite chosen from tens of thousands of Beastmen of the whole tribe.
With strengthening from Giant Beast Meat and regular training, as well as the cultivation of various Breathing Techniques, these ordinary Beastmen soldiers had physiques several times stronger than regular Beastmen.
Additionally, with excellent equipment, small teams of a dozen formed a unit, capable of facing off against Bronze Level Extraordinary Beastmen elites.
The storm sweeping from the sky caused a brief pause in the bloody battlefield, but it soon became even more frenzied.
Lacking Grom, the Dragon Nest Tribe had a numerical advantage over the elite attackers from the Blood Claw Tribe, and their mid-to-high-level combat power was also comparable, overall giving the Dragon Nest Tribe an edge in battle.
In the brutal slaughter, Blood Claw elites were continuously being encircled and killed.
Rumble!
Up in the sky, the turbulent Fighting Qi surged, interspersed with lightning.
Seeing the prior collision's destructive impact on the painstakingly constructed town below, and with the Dragon Nest Tribe holding the advantage at the city gate, the general outcome of the battle seemed inevitable.
Austin then engaged while retreating, moving in a direction away from the tribe's station.
Grom, worthy of being the Blood Claw Tribe's first warrior, had an astonishing range of combat experience. After activating his Ancestral Bloodline, his combat power doubled, and his violent Fighting Qi blasted out. Within a short time, it was unclear how many hundreds or thousands of punches he had unleashed, his terrifying, raging punch force exploding with Fighting Qi, whipping up colossal waves in the air.
