The frightful power of these repeated collisions left even Austin's nearly impenetrable Scale Armor Defense with tingling claws.
This made Austin realize that the person before him was an unprecedentedly formidable opponent.
An enemy impossible to defeat in a short time,
To overcome him, Austin would have to go all-out, using every means at his disposal.
Even just the aftershocks from the initial exchanges had destroyed over half of the Dragon Nest Town below, so Austin couldn't choose a battlefield near here.
"Damn gray bear, if you have the guts, then come and chase me!"
Austin roared in a low voice, his massive wings fanning in the sky, creating a great torrent. Surrounded by the storm and lightning, he flew toward the distance.
"Hahaha! Want to pick a nice place for your grave, do you? I'll oblige you!"
Gross sneered, not caring about the situation of the war below. Landing on the ground from the sky, he stomped with one foot, and his whole form shot out like a cannonball in pursuit of Austin.
However, what no one noticed was that Gross, usually so direct in words and actions, casually glanced over the battlefield with a barely perceptible cold smile before his entire figure vanished.
With those two oppressive presences departing, the war outside the Dragon Nest Tribe immediately escalated in intensity.
"Crush them! For the prince!"
"Slaughter them all!"
Another fierce clash of over a thousand men occurred, the metallic clangs mingling with the splattering blood, painting vast stretches of snow red, and the ground littered with corpses.
Only death could end this war.
...
Meanwhile, at the hill where Austin had previously been cultivating, a terrifying aura rose, rolling in from the sky and veiling the white sky with dark clouds.
Amidst the vast torrents, Austin descended from the top of the air, landing instantly on a mountaintop.
Simultaneously, Gross followed closely, slamming down on a nearby mountain summit, his formidable power exploding and shattering the rocks atop.
"Gray bear, who are you?"
The gray bear before him gave Austin a vague sense of familiarity, yet Austin was sure he had never seen this person before.
Nevertheless, it was this person who led a group of elite Extraordinary Beastmen to suddenly attack his Clan Tribe.
It didn't seem like a spur-of-the-moment idea; it was as if there was some undying hatred, with the target appearing to be himself and the tribe he had developed.
Though Austin had transmigrated into a dragon, he considered himself inherently kind-hearted.
Over the years, he mostly stayed nearby, developing himself quietly, avoiding trouble. Even if his subordinates annexed and killed Beastmen from other tribes, it was the various Clans that were responsible; he seldom acted himself, and there seemed to be few Beastmen who died at his hands.
He considered himself a good dragon, whose bloodshed was far less than that of his kin.
How could such a kind-hearted dragon provoke this oblivious fellow into trying to kill him?
Austin felt a tremendous sense of indignation course through him, reaching into the heavens!
So he decided to ask about this fellow's background before beating him to death.
"My name is Gross, the first warrior of the Blood Claw Tribe! Blue Young Dragon, two years ago, the Grom you killed was my brother! Have you thought of how you want to die?"
Gross sneered at Austin across from him, as if looking at a dead dragon.
"So you're here to avenge your brother?"
Austin narrowed his eyes and stared at Gross opposite him.
"That's right! Today, whether you go to heaven or earth, you are doomed!"
Gross stared intently at Austin, his eyes filled with resentment.
Austin maintained his composure, nodding slightly, seeming lost in thought.
Avenging family, that was a reason.
But... something just felt off.
Staring into Gross's resentful eyes, a sudden enlightenment struck Austin as he suddenly said to Gross:
"No, you're lying."
Gross's eyelids twitched slightly, but his expression remained unchanged, showing no emotion.
Austin continued on his own:
"You're lying, you came here to kill me not for avenging that so-called brother of yours; the reason you want to kill me is because of something else, something that drove you to fury... and so you came to seek revenge on me. Perhaps, in this journey, there are other plans you need to fulfill."
"Oh, is that what you think?"
Gross gave no affirmation nor denial, his pupils contracted slightly, yet the previous resentment dispersed, as if nothing had happened.
He watched Austin intently, seemingly waiting for him to provide an explanation.

chapters.title: Chapter 234 230: Spy (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
Upon seeing Gros's expression change like that, Austin was even more certain of his suspicions.
When he initially planned to shift the battlefield, Austin clearly noticed the fight between the Dragon Nest Tribe and the invading enemy below. The Dragon Nest Tribe had already gained the upper hand, and the elite Blood Claw forces were obviously on the verge of being annihilated by the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
However, this fellow named Gros showed no reaction. Instead, he followed Austin's intention and shifted the battlefield together.
Austin didn't know what the purpose of activating those elite Blood Claws and their attack was, but this Gros clearly had high popularity among his subordinates, yet he didn't care at all about the lives of his comrades.
This kind of mentality suggests that he might be indifferent to his so-called brother's death. If he encounters the murderer in the future, maybe then he might act, but how could he have crossed mountains and endured the harsh winter just to seek revenge?
Perhaps in this world, there are people who disregard the lives of others but value their own family immensely, but intuition told Austin that Gros was definitely not such a person.
What further confirmed Austin's belief that Gros had another purpose in seeking revenge was the change in his character before and after.
During the initial battle, the impression of this fellow was of a straightforward, reckless beastman who wore his emotions on his sleeve.
Yet, after leaving the Dragon Nest Tribe's battlefield, Gros's expression gradually changed, filled with anger, resentment, distortion, and ferocity, looking at Austin with a deep-seated hatred.
The stark contrast between the before and after suggests this person named Gros must have been pretending all along, feigning simplicity and straightforwardness.
Only after leaving familiar subordinates did he show his true colors.
He was hiding his true personality.
Why disguise himself in front of his companions?
If it were simply about revenge, how could his reactions be so inconsistent?
All these factors together suggest one possible explanation for this situation,
which is that Gros is something like a spy, hidden within the Blood Claw Tribe for some purpose.
It's even possible that in this attack, Gros accepted some plan from the Blood Claw Tribe but made changes midway, like letting his accompanying subordinates be destroyed, to trigger a larger conspiracy.
If Austin knew the task Rulga gave Gros was to destroy Austin and all his clan beastmen, and if Rulga had decided to assassinate Austin, and considering Gros's actions of letting the elite Blood Claws be annihilated, one might draw further conclusions.
But what he knows now is enough for him to surmise certain things!
As one of the top tribes in the Kawa Great Forest, to think that the Blood Claw Tribe's champion is a spy is astonishing.
This conjecture is something nobody would believe if told.
But Austin remembered that famous detective from his past life who once said: in a case, the more impossible something seems, the more likely it is true.
Gros is very likely a pawn spy planted in the Blood Claw Tribe by certain forces!
As a spy, to remain hidden in the Blood Claw Tribe for so long without discovery shows that Gros is very adept at concealing himself.
Yet such an excellent spy, after leaving the battlefield, displayed a venomous glare at Austin.
This only indicates one thing: Austin's actions unintentionally disrupted a very critical plan of his, causing him to nearly lose his composure.
"Gros, you are a spy, a spy placed in the Blood Claw Tribe by other forces."
The moment he mentioned "spy," Austin keenly noticed a flicker in Gros's eyes, confirming his belief even further.
What was once speculation now, with Gros's reaction, is highly likely true.
"I must have unintentionally disrupted some of your plans, that's why you seek revenge, or at least that's one reason. You came to kill me with an even greater purpose in mind."
Austin began to recount his past experiences, narrating them thoroughly.
"Grom is your brother, so it's very possible he was involved in that plan."
"Grom was ordered to establish a Blood Claw division nearby, reportedly to set up a warning outpost, to monitor the movements of mutated undead, and if necessary, buy time for the Tribe Alliance."
"Your plan is related to this outpost, or rather this outpost is the biggest part of your plan. I killed Grom and replaced the outpost, becoming one of the Tribe Alliance's supports, causing devastating damage to your plan..."
"The outpost's primary function is to serve as a warning, could it be..."
Austin's eyes suddenly widened, filled with disbelief.
According to his analysis, there was a mastermind behind the undead zombie horde, orchestrating everything, a sentient entity guiding all these events.
And Grom and their plan were connected to the outpost, considering the outpost's role...
Could it be that Gros and his group are in league with the mastermind behind the zombies?!!
At this moment, Austin felt his heart race.
If that's true, the outpost being infiltrated means that when the Tribe Alliance beastmen attack the Border Great Wall, the undead zombie army would suddenly unleash a rear assault.
Given the characteristics of the undead zombies and the loosely organized Tribe Alliance, there's a high probability that hundreds of thousands or even millions of beastmen would be wiped out, becoming part of the undead horde!
If that mastermind really succeeds in this conspiracy, with millions in new forces, they could likely sweep across the entire Kawa Great Forest!
After Austin destroyed Grom's outpost and took its place, he quickly exposed the movements of the undead army to the Tribe Alliance, making the Beastman Alliance alert, thus the previous surprise attack plan naturally fell apart!
"You all, are actually people from the side of the mutated undead!"
Austin was filled with disbelief,
even though this hypothesis was uncertain, the reality likely indicates as much!
Mutated undead, Beastman Alliance, humans... Austin felt as if he was caught in a giant vortex.
"You, I really underestimated you, it's no wonder you could grow to this point as a mere orphaned dragon without parents... But so what, die now!"
As Austin finished speaking, Gros's face twisted fiercely, an aura of terror surged skyward, like a mountain fallen from the heavens, rolling toward Austin!
Austin's expression turned incredibly grave, surrounded by dazzling lightning, reflecting his extremely grim visage.
It seems his suspicions were indeed correct.
But what exactly is behind the undead army orchestrating all this?!!

chapters.title: Chapter 235 231: Inference and Doubt
chapters.content:
Austin was very afraid of death. Having died once before, he understood the preciousness of life even more.
It was for this reason that ever since Austin traversed into this world, he had been quietly developing his field in this corner, hoping to achieve invincibility before venturing out to explore and take a good look at this world.
In these years, he succeeded halfway—successfully advancing to the Gold Level, and his Clan Tribe had grown and expanded, with their combined military strength being top-notch within the entire range of the Kawa Great Forest.
Having built such a powerful military group, few outside knew about this strong tribal force in that area.
But he also failed halfway because the region where the Dragon Nest Tribe was located unfortunately became a stronghold for the Beastman Alliance to fend off the mutated Undead, attracting a powerful threat from Grom and others of the Blood Claw Tribe.
For self-preservation and development, Austin had to act first to destroy the Blood Claw Tribe's stronghold division, but at the same time, he provoked the top-tier force of the Blood Claw Tribe within the Kawa Great Forest and unintentionally disrupted plans of some lurking people.
Later, due to a relic left by a Gold Level Great Mage, human mercenaries found their way to the area near the Dragon Nest Tribe, discovered their secret, and were drawn to murder by the tribe's displayed potential.
To build such a massive tribal force from scratch within two years was indeed incredible, and what made Edward act without hesitation was the orderly discipline shown by the beastmen tribe during routine production activities.
It was a sprout of a new civilization, new power. From the orderly production of the Dragon Nest Tribe, he saw an immensely threatening power. Considering himself a noble elite, he naturally launched an attack on Austin for the interest of countless people.
Then, with the failure of Edward's attack and the death of the main culprit, the Dragon Nest Tribe originally intended to enter a new period of recuperation and development.
Unfortunately, at this time, a new round of crisis came face to face.
Countless zombie undead swept the land, and the Calamity spread to the vicinity of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This might have been a plan originally agreed with Grom in the Blood Claw stronghold, intending to use countless undead zombies to completely annihilate the hundreds of thousands of beastmen gathered around the Bloody Border in one go.
But unfortunately, Grom was killed by Austin, and the Blood Claw Tribe's stronghold was subsequently uprooted by Austin, who then used the Blood Claw people to establish contact with the Tribe Alliance.
Perhaps, it was exactly a series of unexpected changes later that caused the ultimate failure of the plot from the undead zombie side.
Austin was not privy to the prelude or consequences of these events, not having a God's perspective, and naturally, he didn't know many things.
However, his innate fear of death made him fond of pondering.
Especially under the immense pressure of the zombie undead Calamity, Austin began to think, piecing together the situation he was in using the few clues he had.
The Tribe Alliance, mutated Evil Spirits, humans... even suspected transdimensional travelers, the Beastman Empire, some mysterious organization, Pure-blooded Beastmen, even the Beast God—he had pondered over all these chaotic existences.
In his spare time, he ran hundreds of thousands of simulations regarding everything in the forest in his mind, and he even placed himself in various factions.
The reason he could infer from Gross's behavior that the Blood Claw Tribe's top warrior was a spy for the zombie undead side was not because he was possessed by Sherlock Holmes, but it was the result of relentless thought due to a strong survival instinct!
The intense survival instinct caused Austin, who initially believed power was everything, to begin using his brain to analyze problems.
Countless speculations, combined with Gross's bizarre changes, led Austin to those series of terrifying conjectures.
However, having made these conjectures and confirmed this point through dealing with Gross, Austin did not feel any happiness or pride, but rather an immense headache.
Compared to believing Gross and Grom were spies for the mutated Evil Spirit side, Austin hoped all these were just coincidences.
But now, Gross's reaction broke all his hopes.
Gross had a problem, a big problem!
And this meant that the Dragon Nest Tribe was about to get caught in a huge whirlpool.
However, now, he only had a glimpse of the curtain veiling the vast territory of tens of millions of kilometers of the Kawa Great Forest.
This war between the undead and the living, what was it launched for, and what were the hidden hands behind these multiple layers of curtains planning? And what were those lurking Legends doing? Why weren't they stopping it?
Too many questions were destined to go unanswered.
But merely from one or two arrangements on the zombie undead side, they could almost easily annihilate the hundreds of thousands of beastmen gathered at the Bloody Border, demonstrating the terror of those behind the scenes.
"Something's off, something's terribly off! Is this guy really a Beastman? He's even more cunning than treacherous humans!"
To infiltrate a super-large tribe and become the tribe's top warrior without any suspicion—it was surprising.
This guy named Gross is far too capable, comparable to the elite spies from Austin's previous life who've undergone numerous training, his cunning far eclipsing that of humans, making him seem more human.
Austin couldn't help but feel a surge of enormous doubt,
Where did the Beastmen truly come from?!
In the construction of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin had realized that the intellectual capability of the gathered Clan Beastmen seemed slightly higher than those of the smaller tribes, and after annexing and integrating those smaller tribe beastmen, they seemed to gain intellectual enhancement as a group.
In these years of construction, the beastmen had even been influenced by Austin's way of thinking, gradually transitioning towards modern society's high efficiency, and beginning various research and innovation, to the point that the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop could successfully produce exquisite armor, and they started seeking to forge stronger Bronze Alloy, combining some wild giant beast materials to develop more powerful equipment.
This autonomous ability to think, Austin initially believed was merely the result of his own influence.
But now, Austin couldn't help but question,
If Beastmen themselves didn't possess a certain degree of intelligence, how could they be able to mimic, learn, and innovate independently?
These beastmen didn't seem at all like the simple-minded, thick-limbed single-cell organisms depicted in fantasy works from his previous life; rather, beyond their peculiar appearances, the characteristics they exhibited were nearly indistinguishable from humans!
Yet at this moment, Austin didn't have the luxury to think more.
The enemy before him had already fallen right in front of him!

chapters.title: Chapter 236 - 232: Battle at the Peak
chapters.content:
Chapter 236: Chapter 232: Battle at the Peak
Boom!!!
Fighting Qi burst from Gross’s entire body like an erupting lava volcano, with bloody Qi surging out, transforming into smoke and rising to the sky. Within a radius of a hundred meters, everything was flooded with this unstoppable Fighting Qi impact, which surged like a tsunami.
"Die!"
The enormous figure, god-like and demon-like, suddenly rose into the air, with the tremendous power that exploded from its feet shattering the ground beneath it inch by inch.
Gross shot out like a massive meteor, tearing through the air with a deafening sonic boom. His entire body in the sky unleashed thousands of fist shadows that swept across the void, seemingly shattering the air.
"Angry and humiliated, are we?"
Austin’s voice spoke indifferently, and his figure rose into the air as well. His enormous wings whipped up a massive torrent, and the terrifying dragon’s might spread across the sky, covering the heavens with dark clouds and dimming the daylight, as if a mountain was pressing down on the air.
Zizz!
Lightning flickered in the void, as Austin, commanding the thunder, streaked across the sky. His colossal claws, capable of tearing space apart, encompassed half the world’s Power, crashing straight ahead.
Rumble!!!
Collision, impact, violence!
Explosions continuously burst in the air, with vast Fighting Qi shooting out like a tsunami. The airflow erupted with constant explosions, shaking the air as if like glass, quickly trembling, and about to shatter.
Gross unleashed hundreds or thousands of punches in a short time. The continuous fist shadows stirred the air into waves like a sea tsunami, containing a tremendous Inner Strength.
With relentless Cultivation, striking at waterfalls day and night, the terrifying force made tons and tons of waterfalls reverse upwards. Even if a mountain or a giant peak stood in front, it would be shattered.
Austin did not retreat either. Electric Snakes danced wildly in the void, with lightning shooting upwards like indestructible laser beams, sweeping across the earth and shattering it.
The lightning pierced, shattering the terrifying bloody fist shadows sweeping through the air like a flood, with the condensed Fighting Qi dispersing as they collided with each other.
This was pure destruction and explosive battle. One man and one dragon fought from sky to ground, charging left and right, with the terrifying forces from the collision sweeping through, annihilating large areas of forest into fragments, and hills and mountains crumbling under the powerful explosions.
The entire land was subjected to a saturation bombardment akin to doomsday, leaving the earth in ruins, with massive craters forming one after another, cracks crumbling and spreading.
Between heaven and earth, the aftermath of the Fighting Qi swept across the firmament and the earth, with the whole world feeling as if it had ushered in an apocalyptic disaster.
After Gross activated his Ancestral Bloodline, the Fighting Qi in his body surged, causing the aftermath of Fighting Qi to shake the sky, with an imposing manner no less than a Gold Level peak Great Warrior.
Meanwhile, although Austin had just entered the Gold Level, due to the Giant Dragon Bloodline, the Legendary Law within his body was gradually awakening. Even a trace was enough to grant him battle capabilities across different grades.
Above the sky, dark clouds rolled, blocking out the daylight.
Lightning exploded across the sky, with terrifying surges of Fighting Qi shooting down to the earth, causing terrible explosions one after another, with fiery flames erupting like a volcano.
At high altitude, the intense battle between one dragon and one man continued, neither able to overpower the other.
Though the situation seemed stalemated, Gross was becoming increasingly anxious.
Activating the Ancestral Bloodline for more Power wasn’t limitless; it had a time limit.
If he couldn’t kill his opponent within the limit, he would definitely be the one to fail!
"Damn it, what’s with this dragon, wasn’t it said to be only a Silver Level Young Dragon? How did it reach this level in just one or two years!"
Gross cursed in his heart, his iron-clad fists possessing the force to break mountains, suddenly striking out and colliding with Austin’s giant claw surrounded by lightning, producing the sound of clashing metal. A visible shock wave swept forth.
It seemed Gross gained an advantage, but it was far from defeat.
The activated Ancestral Bloodline had a time limit, but Austin’s Giant Dragon Bloodline did not.
On the contrary, in this close-combat fight, Austin felt his blood boiling, with a trace of Origin Law deep within the bloodline becoming active with the heated blood.
Invisible yet tangible momentum filled the void, with the power of thunder starting to become more potent, though imperceptibly, as the whole world grew more oppressive, as if something overwhelmingly terrifying was slowly awakening.
Gross was unaware of the changes occurring within Austin, but as an experienced warrior, he sensed if things continued this way, the outcome might not be favorable.
"Rasengan!"
Amid Gross’s momentary distraction, looking fierce like a raging lion, Austin seized the opportunity. While his massive steel claws blocked Gross’s fist, he opened his menacing maw.
The humming sound resonated, and instantly, a basketball-sized white Rasengan formed, with a fierce hurricane emerging, and he spat it out.
With the Rasengan distorting the surrounding air, it carried terrifying tearing Power and almost hit Gross directly.
Gross, the Blood Claw Tribe’s foremost warrior with rich battle experience, instinctively shifted his head at the critical moment. The terrifying Rasengan tore through the air, whistling past his ear.
Boom!!!
The dodged Rasengan struck the ground, unleashing a terrifying Power, with a giant ball of light colliding rapidly. The rotating Magic Power possessed fearsome tearing capabilities that shredded the surrounding trees and soil to pieces, creating a giant circular pit on the ground.
Feeling the astonishing momentum behind him, Gross’s heart filled with shock and anger.
If the Rasengan had hit his face, he’d be severely wounded if not killed.
Even barely dodging the frontal attack, as the Rasengan whistled past his head ripping through air, it still managed to cut off half his ear, with blood dripping from his shoulder.
Damn it! This dragon has such methods!
And the dragon might have additional strength!
I’ll go all out!
I can’t just sit and wait; I must fight with all my might!
In an instant, Gross steeled his resolve to fight desperately. The Fighting Qi in his body, which was about to deplete, suddenly surged again.
"Divine Blessing: Bear Fury!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 237 - 233 Collision
chapters.content:
Chapter 237: Chapter 233 Collision
Boom!!!
An overwhelming aura suddenly surged upwards, Gross seemed to transform into an erupting volcano, with scorching heat twisting the air and shocking the sky.
Suddenly, as if something terrifying within Gross slowly awakened, releasing boundless rage and fear, like a tidal wave crashing against the entire world.
At that moment, Austin felt a terrifying fear enveloping his heart, as if he was about to experience a sensation of earth-shattering destruction.
Inside the massive membrane-winged cave, the entire figure flickered as a shadow and retreated, spiraling and soaring tens of meters into the high sky.
Under the dark cloudy sky, the daylight dimmed, Austin’s wings spread open like a cross, with lightning bolts bursting forth, his eyes aghast while gazing at the enormous body exuding a terrifying aura on the ground.
"What is this!!!"
The blood-colored Fighting Qi erupting from Gross slowly shifted from blood red to gray-black, like world-ending flames of annihilation, fuelling an aura of fear and ominousness.
The phantom behind him was intensely solidified, more substantial than before, as if it was transitioning from illusion to real existence on earth.
The ferocious giant bear’s phantom suddenly opened its crimson eyes, exerting overwhelming pressure as if moving mountains and seas.
Terrifying, yet incredibly powerful!
From the increasingly solid shadow enveloping Gross, Austin sensed an intensely strong threat, as if he might perish the next moment!
"Hoo!"
Above the sky, amidst the stormy thunder, Austin exhaled a long breath, dense electric arcs spewing out between his nostrils.
In the icy winter world, the ground was covered by vast expanses of snow, white as far as the eye could see.
Above in the high skies, clouds churned, lightning and thunder roared.
Rasengan!
Before him, the void suddenly twisted, amidst the violent storm and thunder, a massive amount of Magic Power surged, forming an enormous vortex in the void, compressing the Magic Power into a basketball-sized Magic Rasengan.
While extreme compression of Magic Power was happening, wind attribute forces were gradually gathering within, transforming from non-attributed Magic Power to Wind Element within the highly compressed spinning Magic Rasengan.
Countless sharp blade-like wind elements amassed within the Magic Rasengan in front of Austin, the highly compressed spinning wind element power even altered the surrounding weather phenomena.
Visible whirlwinds spiraled around, with lightning bolts shooting, piercing the sky, an unsettling power intensely compressed and gathered.
Roar!!!
Perhaps sensing the pressure from Austin, an oceanic Fighting Qi erupted from Gross, like a volcano suppressed for ages, with air vibrating fiercely, surging outwards like a once-in-a-century gigantic tsunami.
Gross roared fiercely, veins bulging on his forehead, the surrounding ground cracked inch by inch, with fearsome airflow surging upwards, toppling large patches of soil, blotting out the sky.
At the peak of his aura, Gross attacked.
Divine Blessing: Bear Fury!
Whether it was truly a Divine Gift was unknown, but the extraordinarily powerful force explosively gathered at that moment truly broke through limits.
A colossal beam of light seemingly pierced the heavenly void, spanning three thousand miles, sweeping across from the earth to the sky, obliterating everything in its path, dimming and dazzling the world’s light.
Meanwhile, the Rasengan formed by Austin, infused with Wind Element transformation and amassed Magic Power, blasted out.
A powerful airflow swept between heaven and earth, with the storm permeating the heavens, electric arcs bursting, showing no inferiority in power and momentum.
Boom!!!
In an instant, it seemed as if the entire world froze at the moment of collision, creating a suffocating sense of oppression.
The intense pressure seemed to solidify space-time.
It resembled an instant, yet felt like eons.
Space shook violently like a mirror, with visible impact flashes sweeping explosively, as the fierce power clash finally commenced.
The immense and terrifying power’s collision erupted, with light akin to a blazing sun rising suddenly, swallowing the world like an overturning tsunami.
Under the horrifying explosive impact, the stormy thunder in the sky and the forest soil on the ground were destroyed like brittle debris.
Gross felt as if swept into an unstoppable energy storm, with his entire being cast hundreds of meters away by the storm before stabilizing.
A dreadful storm ravaged the surroundings, massive patches of soil crumbling, surging upward in the air, with flourishing jungles vanishing entirely, exposing bare soil.
"Did it die?"
Ten minutes later, a spot on the ground buried by soil and rubble exploded open, and Gross’ figure emerged.
Looking around, the ground within a range of hundreds of meters had been completely devastated by the previous blast impact, the formerly dense forest trees vanished, leaving bare broken soil with not a single blade of grass visible.
Smoke rolled, obscuring half the sky.
All was silent, leaving only this devastated land slowly rising in smoke.
The Blue Young Dragon seemed truly dead.
"What a formidable creature, in just a few years it grew to such a level... unfortunately, you took something that wasn’t yours... cough cough..."
Gross clutched his chest, his towering figure suddenly half-kneeling to the ground, spitting out mouthfuls of blood, his face pale like paper.
Blood splattered on the ground, dyeing the soil red.
He was severely injured, the phantom enveloping him long vanished, the overwhelming energy gradually dispersing and weakening.
Even against an enemy, Gross had to admit the dragon was indeed powerful, and remarkably talented.
Before leaving the battlefield, the hundred elite warriors of the Blood Claw Tribe were suppressed by its Clan and seemed on the verge of annihilation.
The elite warriors brought were the most valiant of the Blood Claw Tribe, each a Bronze Level Extraordinary warrior or higher, combined with years of campaign experience from the Great Tribe, they were elite among elites.
Yet those Extraordinary elites were being suppressed by a tribe raised by a Young Dragon, seemingly about to be wiped out.
This ability to lead and develop a Clan tribe, among the entire Giant Dragon Race, might not be matched even by an adult Legendary Giant Dragon.
Moreover, throughout the battle earlier, Gross noticed one thing.
Those powerful "Magic Bullet," were not the innate Magic of the Giant Dragon Species, but rather combat techniques created by the Young Dragon itself!

chapters.title: Chapter 238 - 234 Thunder Law
chapters.content:
Chapter 238: Chapter 234 Thunder Law
What a genius!
Many extraordinary races use self-awakened talent magic, especially the Giant Dragon race, who are so favored by the heavens that they have no need to develop other combat techniques. Their ever-awakening talent magic is enough to make them invincible.
The ability to create one’s own combat techniques is a rarity even among humans.
Yet this dragon has succeeded, and the magic techniques it created are incredibly powerful.
Even when he used the explosive power given by His Majesty, he nearly lost to the dragon.
If this dragon continues to grow, Gross is certain that it will become a legend in the future.
"What a pity, you did something you shouldn’t have done and took something you shouldn’t have taken."
After recovering for a moment and barely suppressing his injuries, Gross stood up again and looked at the shattered land ahead, muttering softly.
With just a few clues, he could deduce certain things; the intelligence of this dragon was beyond Gross’s expectation.
Unfortunately, it’s dead in the end.
Thinking about the mission that brought him here, Gross couldn’t help but sigh inwardly.
"His Majesty said that the thing can’t be absorbed below the legendary level and should still be inside the Dragon’s Nest..."
Taking a deep look at the ruins before him, half of the sky shrouded in dust, Gross turned to leave.
Given the greedy nature of dragons, the item should be inside the Dragon’s Nest.
And now, with the right timing to go back, estimating that the elites of the Blood Claw Tribe have already suffered heavy losses, they probably can’t completely annihilate the entire clan of that dragon.
As for the scattered clan members, they might reappear at some opportune moment...
Gross took a few leaps, ready to fly away, while his mind continued to ponder over the secret message from the other side.
Rustle!
A breeze suddenly rose beside him, brushing past.
Gross didn’t pay it any mind, thinking about how to deal with that Rulga guy when he returned.
Having stayed in the Blood Claw Tribe for so many years, he vaguely felt that the guy had started to suspect him. Perhaps this mission to annihilate the Blue Dragon had other calculations.
But fortunately, that idiot Grom is dead here, so there is an excuse.
The breeze gradually strengthened, dispersing the dust swirling over the huge, broken pit, revealing the surrounding scenery.
Gross’s figure suddenly paused, his wide eyes filled with disbelief.
The wind around him grew stronger, so much so that it made the fur on his body and the beast skins he wore flap noisily, and the pebbles on the ground began to roll and clatter under the force of the wind.
"This, this... how is this possible!!!"
Rustle!
Above the sky, thick clouds covered the entire sky, the dark clouds obscured the sun, touching the sky directly.
The whole world seemed to plunge into darkness, massive dark clouds surged and roiled, spreading out for miles.
But a mile away, the sky was bright and clear, the snow vast and unending.
The world seemed divided apart.
As if the sky Gross found himself under was rejected by the heavens and earth!
"A domain! A domain! Could there really be a legendary adult Giant Dragon behind that young dragon?!"
Gross’s head seemed about to explode; his body bristled with an icy coldness, like falling into an icy cave in the depths of winter, drenched head to toe in a bucket of cold water.
Actually, this was not a true domain.
It could only be considered a rudimentary feather form, riddled with defects within its range.
But now, Gross had no time to detect the flaws in the embryonic domain.
Because he could already feel the breath of the Legendary Law!
Rumble!!!
Between the clouds, deafening thunder roared constantly, bolts of lightning tore through the darkened earth.
The air felt as if it had been weighted down by a mountain, nearly crushing Gross into the ground.
The swirling dark clouds suddenly gathered together, forming a massive dark vortex skyward, light seemed to be devoured there.
A streak of light abruptly appeared from the vortex’s black hole, instantly triggering a tempest of thunder elements within the world.
As if ten thousand bolts of thunder shot from beyond the heavens, the thunder attribute power in space became active, arcs of lightning shooting skyward, slicing through the space.
"Gross, do you have any last words?"
From the pitch-black sky above, a familiar voice resounded, rolling across every corner of the world like crashing thunder.
"Blue Dragon, how could you!!!"
In the sky above, Austin hovered beneath the massive cloud vortex, storms and thunderstorms ravaging around him, ensconced within a terrifying and boundless cosmic catastrophe. Yet the rampant elemental energy from outside did not harm him in the slightest, as if he were a divine demon descended to the mortal realm.
A ray of light blossomed before Austin, like a long needle.
It floated quietly in the air, constantly flickering and changing, yet seemingly motionless.
Clearly, it was only a hundred meters above in the sky, but it gave Gross a sense of an endless distance between the realms.
The Law!
No doubt, it was the Thunder Law!
Though just a trace, that inescapable, unavoidable feeling could only be caused by the Law to suppress him so terribly!
It was a suppression above power level or tier!
"Ah! I don’t believe it!"
Gross roared in rage, his originally mighty body suddenly withered like drained of moisture, his fur became gray and sparse.
Fearsome fighting qi surged skyward, as if turned into a sky-piercing blood-red pillar, shaking the entire space.
His aura became as violently turbulent as a stormy sea, as blinding as a scorching sun.
He burned his own life, erupting all his life’s blood qi in an instant, intending to launch an attack that pierced through heaven and earth!
"Is this your last words."
The indifferent voice was full of aloofness, like a divine demon overlooking all living beings.
"Go!"
The tiny thread of Thunder Law, gathered from the blood within, swiftly descended from the heights.
In an instant,
all the thunder elements within the domain were stirred into a furious commotion, thousands of bolts of lightning crackling and splitting, while that sliver of Thunder Law in mid-air turned into a thunder pillar piercing heaven and earth, rallying thousands of Thunder Liquid, ferociously crushing towards Gross!
The final strike that Gross delivered by burning his life, a blow seemingly capable of shattering the sky, was utterly consumed by the unimaginable divine prowess of the Thunder Law, its ceaseless and infinite lightning grinding his strength away.
"Ah! His Majesty will not spare you!"
Gross could only manage a final, despairing scream, his entire being swallowed by the overwhelming thunderlight....

chapters.title: Chapter 239 235 Leaving (First Update)
chapters.content:
A tiny thread of the Thunder Law, barely the size of a hair, yet within the prototype domain created by Austin, it stirred the thunder attribute elements between heaven and earth, transforming into an endless sea of thunderous tides.
Gross was indeed strong, nearly breaking the limits after squeezing and unleashing his life force.
But the power of the Law is ultimately lofty, transcending the "human" level to become the Power of Heaven and Earth.
This is the suppression of hierarchy.
Coupled with the endless thunder between heaven and earth, humans without a source ultimately find it hard to resist the divine power, eventually being consumed by the sea of thunder.
A thousand bolts of lightning erupted, unleashing terrifying and boundless power.
A horrific explosion erupted, flipping heaven and earth as blinding light spread to cover everything, with the piercing brilliance permeating every corner, and the terrifying energy shockwaves expanded in all directions, devouring and destroying everything.
The massive tremor accompanied the blinding light, spreading dozens of miles away, reaching the first outpost of the Dragon Nest Tribe, where they could feel the tremor coming from the tribe's core.
More than ten minutes later, the erupting power gradually calmed down.
Sensing that Gross's presence within the prototype domain had completely dissipated, only then did Austin withdraw this domain.
The clouds above slowly dispersed, the light of day shone down, and the oppressive aura within the domain also dissipated.
Smoke and dust billowed, rising to cover half the sky.
The ground was fragmented and shattered, with the collapsed soil forming an irregular crater hundreds of meters wide, with cracks spreading in all directions, occasionally causing dirt and stones to fall from heights.
"It's over."
A mighty gust of wind blew away the dust at the center of the crater, and Austin's figure descended from the sky.
At the bottom of the crater, a charred head lay quietly embedded in the soil, its limbs and torso were already reduced to ashes in the thunderous bombardment.
"What a pity."
Indeed a pity, such a powerful beastman warrior, if he could have been subdued, he would have added an extremely strong force to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
But Austin understood well that Gross would never submit.
Even if he did submit, he wouldn't dare accept him under his command.
Therefore, he could only kill him thoroughly.
Who told him to provoke me?
"I didn't expect to gain such a harvest this time. Speaking of which, I really should thank this guy, the Thunder Law..."
In contemplation, Austin gathered his spirit, then a crack opened in the void before him, and an incomparably bright light burst forth, leaping uncertainly in the void like a living thing.
At the moment the light appeared, the thunder attribute elements in heaven and earth were stirred, with lightning cracking and exploding, and the clouds above gathered under an unseen force.
The Law!
The Thunder Law!
Austin clearly felt it, for when the thread of Law appeared, the thunder attribute elements between heaven and earth erupted into violent turmoil, and the Elemental Magic Power boiled at that moment.
"So this is the Thunder Law..."
A strange brilliance shone in Austin's eyes, which were filled with longing.
This was the innate desire of a creature for higher-level power.
During the previous battle with Gross, every collision seemed to ignite and boil Austin's bloodline within.
The Thunder Law hidden in the bloodline began to awaken under the fierce combat, finally materializing and manifesting in the world.
This was the origin of Austin's thread of Thunder Law.
Awakened in battle, condensed in battle.
With this thread of Thunder Attribute Law power, Austin's strength was significantly enhanced.
This battle, the awakening of a thread of Thunder Law, was undoubtedly the greatest reward of this encounter.
"The Thunder Law, so this is it..."
Although it was just a thread of Law, relying on his Giant Dragon Bloodline traits to barely control it, experiencing that near-origin power up close had given Austin many insights, furthering his understanding of thunder.
Mastery over thunder belongs to the power of the Blue Dragon, which is the result of the continuous awakening of the Thunder Law contained within the Blue Dragon's bloodline.
Sensing that thread of Thunder Law energy also helped Austin understand many long-standing doubts.
For example, the reason he could grow quickly within a few years was that he continually stimulated himself with electricity, drawing from his wild ideas of thunder tempering his body from his past life, and even when weak, the innate magic he released always carried a hint of Thunder Law essence, and it was this essence that continually modified his body.
As the Thunder Law essence influenced his body, it resonated with the Thunder Law hidden in his bloodline, constantly circulating and stimulating, thereby under the influence of the Thunder Law, his strength rapidly increased, with the Thunder Law within continuously enhancing.
Until today's battle with Gross, years of continuous stimulation finally broke through the final barrier under external pressure, activating a thread of Thunder Law.
The reason he could modify beastmen, activating the extraordinary seeds within ordinary beastmen, was precisely because of that trace of Thunder Law essence hidden in the lightning he created.
The Thunder Law essence resonated with the magic power within the Magic Stone, subsequently affecting the beastman bodies, thereby activating the extraordinary seeds within them.
This was how Austin was able to modify the beastmen.
"No wonder they say a Giant Dragon is a treasure trove; bathing in dragon blood nearly means the door to becoming a legend is opened completely. I see, the blood laws of an adult Giant Dragon have fully awakened and been released, so bathing in dragon blood is almost like facing the direct wash of the Law itself; how can one not reach legendary..."
Just thinking of this made Austin feel a chill throughout his body.
An adult Giant Dragon possesses Legendary Level strength, yet there are still people in this world daring to kill a dragon for its blood.
Once news of him awakening a thread of thunder origin got out, a young dragon at the Gold Level, possessing such a heavy treasure, could attract countless formidable beings.
"In the future, unless I can destroy the enemy completely, the Thunder Law must not be easily exposed!"
In an instant, Austin had made up his mind.
This thread of Thunder Law would be his greatest trump card.
At the same time, it would be his key to opening the door to the Law and stepping into the Legendary.
Until he had sufficient self-preserving power, he must not easily reveal it, or he would face utter ruin.
"Time to go."
Seeing no more living creatures around, Austin had no further attachments and was ready to leave.
Thinking for a moment before leaving, he grabbed the charred skull at the bottom of the crater, his massive form rising into the sky, flying toward the direction of the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 240 236: Handling the Aftermath (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
When Austin returned to the tribe, the war that had taken place in front of the Dragon Nest Tribe's stronghold was nearing its end.
The Beastman Officers, who had been trained and practiced the Beastman Six Techniques created by Austin, were enough to contend with the blood claw elites, with not much difference in high and mid-level combat strength.
However, in the battle of the lower-level strength, there was a one-sided situation.
The Dragon Nest Tribe's beastman soldiers had undergone strict and orderly training, their equipment was extremely sophisticated, and their numbers were several times that of the Blood Claw side.
As a result, the lower-level strength of the blood claw elites faced a one-sided situation and were quickly slaughtered by the Dragon Nest Beastman forces.
The regular Dragon Nest beastman soldiers who were freeing up teamed together in squads, and with the cooperation of the extraordinary Beastmen, gradually surrounded and killed the extraordinary among the blood claw elites.
When Austin appeared over the Dragon Nest Tribe, the soldiers of the Dragon Nest Tribe's war completely entered the victory-purging stage.
"Your commander has been killed, surrender and you won't be executed!"
With a thunderous roar, Gross's head fell from the sky like a cannonball.
The entire battlefield fell silent, the remaining blood claw elites were already in a slump and now offered no resistance, surrendering one after another.
The remaining blood claw elites surrendered, bringing this attack to an end.
This attack caused significant losses for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The sudden attack, combined with the Blood Claw Tribe's elites, resulted in greater casualties than the previous counterattack against the Zombie Undead Nest.
Besides the great number of casualties, the city walls surrounding the small tribal city collapsed during the battle, with no clear timeline for repairs.
Fortunately, the Blood Claw Tribe greatly underestimated the development speed of Austin's clan and the strength of the Dragon Nest Beastmen, leading to the complete annihilation of their dispatched elites by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
A large number of elites were lost at a particularly inopportune time, likely causing severe setbacks for the entire Blood Claw Tribe.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen began to clean the battlefield, burying the dead, sending the wounded for treatment, and collecting various weapons and resources on the ground.
The elite attackers from the Blood Claw Tribe were paupers, offering nothing of value, with scarcely one in ten surviving captives; recouping the losses after battle was impossible.
However, some relatively strong blood claw elite warriors had interesting weapons and leather armor on them.
Those weapons seemed to be made from the bones of some powerful magic beasts, with one or two runes faintly visible on the blade, suggesting treatment by some means to make fighting qi adhere more easily, and were also harder and sharper than bronze weapons.
The leather armor was similar, made from the hide of an unknown magic beast, with one or two faint runes and decent defensive capabilities.
To kill those few blood claw elite warriors, it took more than ten beastman officers working together, and even then, some were wounded before they managed to kill them, seriously injuring and capturing two.
Since these few strong blood claw elites used enchanted weapons, they likely had some understanding of them, which might help us explore some techniques for crafting enchanted weapons.
If that were the case, that would be great.
The Dragon Nest Tribe's warehouse still contains a significant amount of magic beast body materials, which, if converted into enchanted weapons, would significantly increase the Dragon Nest Tribe's strength.
As Vini and others commanded the beastmen to clear the battlefield, Austin brought out several blood claw elite captives for interrogation elsewhere.
In this survival-of-the-fittest Kawa Great Forest, being captured and surrendering was simply commonplace.
In this wilderness world without laws and moral restraints, wars among beastman tribes were unceasing, and it was common for weaker tribes to be annihilated.
In such chaotic battles, if the victors killed all the enemies immediately, there probably wouldn't be many beastmen left in the Kawa Great Forest in a few years.
In tribal conflicts, the defeated tribe would be annexed, and the captured strong beastmen would often surrender to the stronger side.
In this barbaric zone, there was no concept of shame or morality in surrendering.
Thus, Austin's Dragon Nest Tribe could rapidly develop and expand to its current size within just a few years.
Understanding the common flaws among beastmen, Austin certainly wouldn't allow this to happen again, at least not to his own clan.
Therefore, he introduced political indoctrination during daily training and, under his management, the Dragon Nest Tribe was thriving, winning the hearts of a large number of gathered beastmen and, taking advantage of the situation, instilling a strong personal cult within the tribe, elevating himself to a divine-like status in the hearts of the beastmen.
All the beastmen of the Dragon Nest Tribe could almost be said to be his fervent followers, their loyalty unmatched by any other tribe in the Kawa Forest.
The Blood Claw Tribe was the same; they lacked that consciousness and those methods.
When Austin and the Dragon Nest Tribe demonstrated their immense strength, the remaining blood claw elites quickly surrendered with little resistance.
Having already surrendered, interrogating the blood claw elites required little effort for Austin, who learned their mission from them:
Under Gross's leadership, they were to kill the blue young dragon residing in those mountains, completely eliminating its clan, leaving no survivors, and then guide the mutated undead to the Dragon Nest, turning that blue young dragon and its tribe into mutated undead.
Hearing the mission slowly revealed by the blood claw elites, Austin almost broke out in a cold sweat.
That meant they wanted to ensure his death!
Thankfully, aware of his own weaknesses, he had been quietly developing in the secluded area without causing trouble, focusing on improving his strength and that of his clan tribe.
Therefore, the Blood Claw Tribe greatly misjudged his strength, preventing their conspiracy from succeeding.
"The goal was to turn me into one of those zombie-like undead? And killing all the clan was to ensure no news got out... Why do that? Ah, turning a young dragon into undead would be a provocation to the Dragon Race, trying to involve them... Indeed, the Tribe Alliance surely knows some more secretive information..."
Despite his relief, Austin felt a sinking feeling in his heart.
After this attack, he realized that his comfortable and steady development days wouldn't last long.

chapters.title: Chapter 241 237 Plan (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
The shout from Gross before he died still echoed in Austin's mind.
Who was the "Majesty" he spoke of? Could it be the mastermind behind the undead calamity?
Also, what was the thing that shouldn't have been taken? Could my destruction of the pyramid lair have drawn the attention of the person behind the scenes back then?
There were many things Austin didn't understand.
He didn't have the slightest clue about the great storm of change happening within the Kawa Great Forest.
However, Austin understood that his carefree days were already numbered.
Leaving everything else aside, after annihilating the invading forces of the Blood Claw Tribe, the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe would inevitably be exposed, drawing the attention of the Beastman Alliance.
According to the confessions of the captured Blood Claw elites, this batch of elite troops constituted a significant percentage of the entire Blood Claw Tribe's strength.
The complete destruction of these elites, along with the death of the Blood Claw Tribe's first warrior, had severely crippled the tribe.
The significant loss of strength in the Blood Claw Tribe was sure to trigger a series of changes at the Border Tribe Alliance's territory.
According to the captured Blood Claw elites, the Beastman Alliance gathered at the border had reached some agreements with humans, receiving substantial support from them, while the Beastman Alliance ceased their war along the Bloody Border, turning to confront the undead army, even penetrating the core areas to destroy the controlling mutated evil spirits.
How the agreement came about, and what exactly happened, these elites were unaware of.
Gross might have known something, but now he's dead beyond rescue, and the information source is cut off.
Besides the reactions from the Blood Claw Tribe and the Beastman Alliance, the "mutated evil spirits" were also a problem.
Perhaps the puppet master behind the undead calamity had learned something, otherwise, Gross wouldn't have mentioned taking something he shouldn't.
Gross probably came seeking vengeance not only under the command of the Blood Claw Tribe but also to retrieve that thing as one of his objectives.
Reflecting on this, Austin's eyes flickered, and he looked thoughtful.
...
The Dragon Nest Tribe currently faces too many troubles, and there are too many mysteries destined to remain unsolved.
Austin is well aware that only strong power is the foundation for fearlessly facing any future upheaval.
So next, taking advantage of the remaining month or two of the cold winter, Austin began contemplating how to enhance his own strength.
Having awakened a trace of the Thunder Law during the battle with Gross, his strength had seen a significant increase, so there was no need to consider further raising his level in the short term.
As long as he could comprehend and master that trace of the Thunder Law, his strength could rapidly advance.
Once Austin could harness the power of that trace of the Thunder Law, he could then rely on its power to swiftly devour and refine magic power material, guiding its energy to temper himself, thereby stimulating his bloodline and rapidly increasing his level of power.
The power of laws represents a higher level of power.
Under the influence of such high-level power, there would be no bottleneck in Austin reaching the peak of the Gold Level; all that's lacking is sufficient magic resources to enhance his foundation.
However, the Thunder Law is not so easily comprehended; it's a chasm blocking the way to the legendary gates unless Austin takes decades or hundreds of years to mature, naturally awakening the legendary laws within his bloodline completely.
Otherwise, relying on that trace of the Thunder Law for self-comprehension, even if his bloodline has already awakened that trace of law, he's only slightly better off than other beings trying to comprehend the legendary laws, the difficulty remains very high.
The difficulty is high, but the rewards are equally great.
Because once he succeeds in fully comprehending and mastering the complete Thunder Law, the gateway to legend will fully open to Austin, his level realm rising instantly, without needing to wait decades or centuries to reach legend on reaching adulthood.
Austin began to slowly comprehend the Thunder Law, knowing it would not be a task completed in a day or two.
Meanwhile, Austin also started training to enhance the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe's clan members.
The first issue was equipment, especially those suspected to be enchanted weapons seized during this battle.
Once the elite of the Blood Claw awoke, Vini had the beastmen interrogate them and learned from these suspected enchanted weapon users that the equipment was indeed made from materials of powerful magic beasts.
However, they were just users; the true forgers were the mysterious priests within the Blood Claw Tribe.
As for how they were forged, they were unsure, only knowing that forging an enchanted weapon required considerable effort from the priest.
Knowing this, Vini and others could only keep this matter in their hearts, hoping for a chance to address it in the future.
Better equipment couldn't be produced, but for now, Bronze Weapons were sufficient for the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Since equipment enhancement was not possible, Austin looked into other possibilities for enhancing the Dragon Nest Beastmen's combat power.
"If the first base could be established successfully, then with the support from both places, the vast area could sustain a larger number of extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen."
Previously, due to food resource constraints, the extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen each required a lot of meat daily, and sustaining two to three hundred extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen was already the limit from herding and hunting wild animals from nearby forests.
Later, even after the Dragon Nest Legion battled continuously to kill giant beasts to obtain meat supplies, at most they could sustain around four to five hundred extraordinary beastmen during normal times.
It was due to these meat limitations that Austin hadn't rapidly expanded the extraordinary beastmen's ranks, nor undertaken large-scale extraordinary transformations of ordinary beastmen.
Over the past two years, the number of extraordinary beastmen, including those captured and rewarded with merits, had only grown to over three hundred for various reasons.
"Larger territory means more hunting grounds, and the current tribe's herding has reached a certain scale capable of producing more meat, making it time to expand the ranks of the beastman officers."
With the advent of herding, the Dragon Nest Beastmen Legion would deliberately leave young beasts during hunting to raise in farming grounds.
After two years of development, the farming scale had reached a certain level, providing a stable third of the Dragon Nest Tribe's meat supply daily.
With the stable meat supply from farming grounds, Austin had the confidence to expand the ranks of the extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen.
Though having decided to expand the extraordinary ranks, given the current cold winter period, large-scale transformations were not feasible, and would have to wait until after the winter.
Moreover, whether the first base could be successfully established was still an unknown.
Recently, news from there mentioned enemies seemingly near the base.

chapters.title: Chapter 242 238 Dragon's Nest Sports Meet (Part 1)
chapters.content:
Expanding the extraordinary team of the Dragon Nest Tribe is something that must be done.
Just when the Dragon Nest Legion swept through the dangerous areas ravaged by the undead, they brought back a lot of defective magic resources. Austin didn't care for these defective magic resources, so they were just right for transforming the beastmen, thus expanding the extraordinary team of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Now, with the awakening of the Thunder Law within Austin's bloodline, there are no longer any obstacles on the path ahead, except for the need for a large amount of magic resources.
Once the extraordinary beastman team of the Dragon Nest Tribe is expanded and given some training, they will form a formidable force that can sweep through various dangerous areas, collecting a large amount of magic crystals, magic ore, and other magic resources to sustain Austin himself, thus forming a positive cycle.
The Dragon Nest Tribe has grown to a point where it already has a certain capacity for feedback.
At least, under the leadership of a large and powerful team of extraordinary beastmen, they have the ability to sweep through some dangerous areas, and the collection of magic resources has naturally greatly improved, removing the need for Austin to personally gather the magical materials required for his growth in the future.
However, although it's imperative to increase the number of extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen, it cannot be accomplished overnight.
During the cold winter, due to the weather, there are indeed very few things that can be done.
In this icy and snowy environment, the prey in the forest lands hibernates and does not come out. Even though the Blood Wolves in the Dragon Nest Tribe have already reached a certain scale, it's still hard to find their traces.
Fresh meat is hard to obtain from the outside world, making it the wrong time to expand the extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen.
"At least, wait until the cold winter is over,"
During this cold winter, so many extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen are not needed at the moment, so Austin didn't feel discouraged.
It's just the right time to select suitable beastmen for transformation and conduct special training for one or two months, building their physiques to welcome the transformation after the cold winter in the best condition.
The stronger the beastmen, the better the effect of the transformation.
As for selecting the number of people, Austin naturally doesn't need to do it himself, just let Vini or Rodney handle it.
Regarding the method of selection, as long as the right people can be chosen, Austin won't be too concerned—he only wants the results.
So, Vini and Rodney, upon receiving Austin's task, had a discussion. Besides selecting a small portion of the slots for those beastmen who made significant contributions to the Dragon Nest Tribe, the rest were to be decided through a competition within the entire tribe.
In this wild world, beastmen inherently esteem power, and strength is revered. Not to mention that in the end, they could receive the key to stepping into the Extraordinary Gate.
The Breathing Technique can enable ordinary beastmen to break through the mundane gate and activate the extraordinary seeds within them, but for ordinary people to activate the extraordinary seeds through the Breathing Technique, it typically takes five to ten years.
In the Human World, extraordinary professionals are trained from a young age.
Here and now is an opportunity, a chance for them to ascend in one step, coupled with the beastmen's natural belligerence. Therefore, after the decision to determine the slots through competition was announced, a great turmoil swept through the entire tribe as soon as the news leaked out.
A large number of beastman soldiers enthusiastically signed up, and even extraordinary beastman officers wanted to participate, leaving Vini and Rodney a bit overwhelmed.
This was originally just a big competition to select transformation slots, and Vini and her group certainly wouldn't let the beastmen go wild, so they intended to suppress it.
Initially, under Vini and Rodney's explanation, the turmoil among the beastmen was about to subside.
But who knew these rumors reached the first stronghold under construction, causing the beastmen on the task of expanding the foothold over there to clamor as well, which finally alerted Austin.
Upon reflection, Austin realized that after traversing into this world for several years, he never really engaged in any recreation. Now that the beastman clan was emotionally charged, and since there was little to do during the cold winter, perhaps a sports event could be organized to both entertain them and stimulate the beastman clan's passion for training.
Thus, Austin decided to host the first Dragon Nest Sports Event within the Dragon Nest Tribe and informed Vini and her group to organize and manage it and to establish a rulebook.
Faced with the sudden whims of the big boss, Vini and her group had no choice but to start preparing for the sports event according to Austin's plans.
Fortunately, within the beastman tribe, there is also the tradition of challenging to claim the title of the first warrior, so Vini and her group expanded it based on their traditional beastman warrior challenge rules, which formed the outline of the Dragon Nest Sports Event.
It was simply deciding on a time, gathering all the beastmen from the Dragon Nest Tribe, encircling an open space, and allowing anyone to step forward and accept challenges from others as long as they displayed bravery and might.
A very rudimentary plan, so rudimentary it was downright pitiful.
Not to mention anything else, even the most basic elements like a referee's judgment and challenge rules were missing. It was just a matter of organizing people to clear an area to watch the beastmen fight on it.
Yet, even such minimal challenges were watched with relish by the beastmen.
When Vini reported the plan to Austin, Austin was perplexed.
What was this? Public brawling and onlookers? Where was the grace of a sports event?
Predictably, this plan was immediately rejected.
Ultimately, to host a grand sports event in the Otherworld, Austin personally took charge, drawing from past school sports events for various organizational planning and setting up various challenge regulations.
Firstly, determining the sports events.
High jump, long jump, marathon, relay races, etc., all aesthetic and competitive events were crammed into the sports event by Austin in one go.
These competitions rooted from the age of Earth, filled with competitive elements, surely wouldn't fare too poorly.
Aside from these competitive events, Austin also scheduled a single combat match during the climax period.
The so-called single combat match was a ring match.
If past sports events pursued rivalry, providing great spectating pleasure through fierce competition, then the final single combat match was a fist-to-fist battle, a contest erupting with hormones.
These fist-to-fist, blood-boiling battles, along with continuous advancements during the period, reaching the peak and acquiring the highest honor undoubtedly scratched where the beastmen itched most.
Austin believes that this sports event, improved by himself, is sure to be a great success.
During the combat match, those with outstanding performances would successfully receive the slots for transformation, thereby stepping into the extraordinary domain, aiming to maximize stimulating the beastmen's enthusiasm for battle.
Of course, the sports event comes with a restriction: primarily barring the participation of extraordinary beastmen.

chapters.title: Chapter 243 239: Military Parade (2nd Update)
chapters.content:
In a certain sense, Extraordinary Beastmen have already transcended the limits of ordinary Beastmen. If not restricted, the final winner would inevitably be an Extraordinary Beastman, and it would be the highest-level Beastman Officer.
Crushing ordinary Beastmen with absolute superiority, what kind of competitiveness would sports events have under such circumstances?
Austin's establishment of this sports event is not only to select talent but also to recreate and reminisce the atmosphere of past sports events, adding a touch of color to this culturally dry Otherworld; thus, Extraordinary Beastmen are naturally excluded from the sports event.
Under Austin's direct leadership, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe was mobilized into action.
Shortly after the raids, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe entered a fervent atmosphere.
To construct the venue, Austin personally led the Beastmen to level a large expanse of land, using gravel to build facilities reminiscent of those in past athletic competitions, while erecting a gigantic stage in the central square.
The cold winter season is indeed not suitable for construction, but under Austin's leadership, the Beastmen were full of energy, completing the construction of various facilities in approximately ten days.
Simultaneously, the atmosphere of the sports event reached its peak.
A large number of Dragon Nest Beastmen gathered together, including many Beastman soldiers and pioneers from the first outpost coming over.
The first outpost of the Dragon Nest Tribe is over a hundred kilometers away from Dragon Nest Town, and the snow-covered ground makes traversing difficult. Yet none of this could dampen the strong enthusiasm of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Initially, to accommodate a large number of old and weak Beastmen gathered at the first outpost, Austin had already organized preliminary competitions under simple conditions at the first outpost to select teams for the finals at Dragon Nest Town.
Even though the preliminary competition was simple, it caused a huge sensation throughout the first outpost.
In the Kawa Great Forest, Beastmen's entertainment activities were originally few and far between. The competitive projects infused with modern elements introduced by Austin instantly captivated the Beastmen's attention.
Standing long jumps and high jumps were fine; they were very thrilling for the Beastmen, but mostly just elicited roars and cheers.
However, projects like running sparked waves of fanatical cheers from the entire groups of Beastmen. Self-taught, they loudly cheered by the track, creating an earth-shaking noise.
Especially during the team tug-of-war matches, those Beastmen, with faces flushed red, roared loudly from the sidelines, seemingly more excited than the competitors, almost jumping in to join themselves.
The cheers were like tsunamis, traveling far and wide, prompting the Elves, who had frequent conflicts with the Dragon Nest Beastmen recently, to become vigilant, gazing towards the direction of the Dragon Nest Beastmen outpost, worried whether the Beastman Tribe was about to launch a full-scale attack.
The preliminary competition at the first outpost set a great start for the Dragon Nest Tribe's sports event.
It seemed that the Dragon Nest Beastmen were very enthusiastic about the sports event. Even in the days following the preliminary rounds, the atmosphere of fervor in the air could still be felt.
And after the selections at the first outpost were complete, the various competition facilities at Dragon Nest Town were also completed.
A large number of Dragon Nest Beastmen began readying themselves for the grand event set to open during the cold winter, with even many Beastmen stationed at the first outpost coming to the main town to watch.
Rodney and others were unlucky; because many Beastmen were unwilling to miss the finals and went to the main town to watch, the defense at the first outpost was somewhat vacant, forcing Rodney, as the Legion Commander, to lead a large number of elites to guard the outpost.
This nearly drove Gegroni and the Extraordinary Beastmen sent to guard the outpost to swear profusely.
Though they were not eligible to compete, they very much wanted to watch the event from the sidelines.
However, with enemies around the first outpost of expansion, it couldn't be left vulnerable to being breached. Therefore, they had to stand guard around the bleak outpost.
Just when Rodney, patrolling in the cold winter's icy environment, cursed some Beastman soldiers, vowing to severely train those deserters later, the sports event in the main town was preluding its curtain.
This was the first grand event held by the Dragon Nest Tribe since its establishment. The entire main city area gathered more than twenty thousand Dragon Nest Beastmen.
To further showcase the tribe's achievements, Austin specially conducted a military parade before the opening of the sports event.
Teams of strong Beastman soldiers, neat and orderly like an iron stream, marched down the walkway, moving in orderly steps, emanating a fierce aura that felt like facing the impact of a Steel Giant Beast.
The disciplined Beastman soldiers marched continuously down the aisle, persisting for more than ten minutes.
Although there wasn't the high-pitched music of the past, under those steadfast and orderly steps, the Dragon Nest soldiers displayed the elegance appropriate to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
These armies, grown from Austin's ideals of the past and flourishing in this world to ultimately establish themselves, were no mere window dressing.
In the era of cold weapon warfare, a tightly ordered and strictly disciplined team can be considered the cream of the crop, and troops trained from the distilled essence of hundreds to thousands of years of warfare summarized from the past have nearly reached the pinnacle of this world.
Even in modern military training, standing at attention and marching in step are very important elements of training, showing that the Beastman army trained in these methods is definitely not just decorative.
Especially in several wars where the Dragon Nest Legion demonstrated formidable power, almost becoming an unstoppable, terrifying black tide before ordinary Beastman Tribes.
"I never thought it could develop to this extent in the blink of an eye."
Above the high platform, Austin looked down at the elite Dragon Nest Legion continuously marching by, and the densely packed Dragon Nest Beastman Clan surrounding the square, his heart surged with satisfaction.
A few years ago, a newborn Austin merely had the strength to wrestle lions and tigers, hunt buffaloes and wild horses.
But back then, he was still young and could only reign over ordinary creatures. Even amidst a common pack of low-tier Magic Beast Blood Wolves, he had to avoid their edge.
Later, when he survived and grew a little, possessing the power to protect himself.
In pursuit of defeating his enemies, he began gathering and creating forces, developing and expanding through various means until he reached today's scale.
Thinking back on those days of hiding and comparing it to nowadays when merely issuing a command could mobilize the entire Dragon Nest Legion, even a Golden Level Lord of Magical Beasts couldn't act recklessly; it's all like a dream.

chapters.title: Chapter 244 240: Change of Mindset (3rd Update)
chapters.content:
Recalling scenes from the past, the hardships along the way, it all feels like a dream.
"Just seven Kobolds, and I managed to create such a massive Dragon Nest Tribe. Even an Empire is no challenge!"
In an instant, Austin felt an infinite confidence surge within him.
To create such a huge Beastman Tribe from nothing and gather and train so many powerful elites, he naturally had the right to be confident.
He firmly believed that whether it was the Beastman Alliance or the "Mutated Evil Spirit" controlling the Undead Calamity, they would one day become stepping stones for his growth and resources for his entry into a higher world.
While Austin stood on the high platform filled with ambitious aspirations, the governor Vini standing beside him was also full of complex emotions.
Thinking back to when their remnant faction faced desperate situations and accidentally entered His Highness Austin's territory, who could have imagined today's scene?
At that time, their greatest wish was just to survive the cold winter and take root under the prince's protection.
In the beginning, being able to fill their stomachs was their greatest happiness.
The world's changes, in just a few short years, in the blink of an eye, the Dragon Nest Tribe has developed to its current scale.
For Austin, who led all this, Vini's admiration had reached an unprecedented level.
During this period, with the constant absorption of outside wandering Beastmen, wandering Tribes, and their own population's reproduction and survival, the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe had already exceeded thirty thousand and was steadily approaching forty thousand.
At the beginning, he was just a leader of seven half-disabled defeated warriors, struggling to survive with his kind.
Now, he stood high, beside the great His Highness Austin, controlling the fate of thousands of Beastmen.
In the past, how did he dare to hope for such a day to come?
The enormity of the world's changes was nothing compared to this; Vini felt that this struggle would be unforgettable for the rest of his life.
Not just Vini, but all those who joined early, contributed significantly, and rose to the middle and upper echelons of the Dragon Nest Tribe expressed the same sentiments.
The hardships of a few years ago were still vivid, and now they had grown to become the overlord of a region, possessing the strength to change the balance of war power in an area.
Initially, many Beastmen had to submit under the sweeping force of the Dragon Nest Legion, but after continuous indoctrination and with the Dragon Nest Tribe's prosperous rise like the morning sun, every Beastman present was filled with a sense of pride.
"This dragon... perhaps, I should stay..."
Standing beside the high platform, one of the few humans in the Dragon Nest Tribe, original Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory, looked at the advancing Dragon Nest Beastman army below and suddenly felt a sense of confusion.
Back then, when he surrendered to the dragon's command, Gory's only thought was to save his life.
Later, seeing the powerful secret techniques created by the dragon, he began to perform earnestly, striving to gain more merits to earn rewards of those powerful combat techniques.
Now, having lived in the Dragon Nest Tribe for over a year, thanks to his relentless efforts and significant achievements, Gory had risen to the high ranks of the Dragon Nest Legion and was awarded a junior officer rank, commanding over three hundred Beastman elites.
And now, in the force of over three hundred he commanded, there were not only Beastmen but also original members of the Mercenary Corps.
Those original Mercenary Corps members were all under Gory's command trying to get by.
Meanwhile, the original Mercenary Captain, Valen, and a few die-hard non-surrendering members were still engaged in hard labor in various places like the prison camp mines.
Seeing the situation of original Mercenary Captain Valen and the fate of a few die-hard elements, most of the mercenaries who surrendered felt considerable relief; the Mercenary Corps had already fallen apart.
