Having experienced the power of commanding hundreds, Gory suddenly found that he no longer wished to return to the Central Earth World and continue living a desolate life.
With his achievements, he would soon be able to learn those powerful secret techniques, techniques far superior to commonplace Combat Techniques like Wind Chasing Slash and Earth Splitting Slash!
Initially, Gory planned to escape the Dragon Nest Tribe immediately after obtaining those powerful secret techniques, escape back to the Central Earth World, then work hard, using those techniques to succeed in some Duchy and gain rewards to become a noble.
Yet now, Gory's thoughts had changed.
Not to mention, even if he gained the secret techniques and increased his power, returning to the Central Earth World, without network connections, could he indeed simply gain a noble title?
How could he ensure those learned secret techniques wouldn't be targeted by greedy high-ranking nobles, how could he ensure his life-and-death-earned accomplishments wouldn't be credited to other nobles? Such guarantees seemed impossible for a common-born Gory.
Moreover, when the mercenary team was defeated and he surrendered to the dragon, the Dragon Nest Tribe's population was around a mere thousand, and the Blue Young Dragon named Austin was only of Silver Level.
But now, the population of the Clan Tribe had grown to near forty thousand, including many powerful Beastman Transcendent Professionals.
And that Blue Young Dragon named Austin had quickly grown to the Gold Level.
Such immense growth and change happened in just a span of one or two years.
In just one or two years, the Dragon Nest Tribe had developed to its present state. What if they had a few more years to develop further?
Undoubtedly, it would become a dominant force in Kawa Great Forest.
And Gory knew well, Austin's ambitions were far beyond this. Someday, when his expansion reached a certain extent, he would certainly launch a significant attack on the Central Earth World, turning human territories into his domain.
By then, the noble title he had dreamt of, the childhood dream of becoming a lofty noble, wouldn't it be fulfilled?
In a country established by a dragon, becoming a ruling noble didn't seem bad either.
Looking at the continually passing Dragon Nest Beastman elites below, Gory's thoughts slowly started to change.
As for the multitude of clans' thoughts nearby, Austin naturally couldn't fully understand each one.
Looking at the densely packed sea of people all around, the huge recurring cheers, the excitement and pride on each Dragon Nest Beastman's face, Austin understood that this pre-sporting event parade had been an enormous success.
The cohesion of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe had been greatly strengthened.

chapters.title: Chapter 245 241 Supplement of 6 Styles (1st Update, Monthly Ticket Request)
chapters.content:
The first Dragon's Nest Tribe Sports Meet was a resounding success. In a world lacking entertainment, the event stirred up a great wave within the tens of thousands in the tribe, deeply impacting every Beastman's heart.
Enjoying lively events is a common trait, and Beastmen are no exception.
Without previous entertainment activities, this opportunity became a floodgate for excitement, which poured out with fervor.
Even the less popular events like high jump and long jump, which Austin thought might be met with indifference, were warmly welcomed by the Beastmen. As for the marathons, tug-of-war, and solo arena challenges, the intense competitions fueled the Beastmen's enthusiasm, with cheers and shouts echoing aloud.
For several days, the entire Dragon's Nest Tribe was engulfed in an extreme atmosphere of fervor during the sports meet.
Austin also relished the intense feelings reminiscent of sports meets from his previous life, making him feel as if he had returned there. His minds, previously tightly wound, were relaxed over these few days.
Having traversed to this world for several years, developing to this stage wasn't easy; only Austin himself truly understood the hardships involved. This sports meet alleviated many worries in his heart.
This sports meet was organized rather hastily, and there were frequent accidents and injuries among the Beastman participants. Fortunately, with sufficient Snake Shedding Grass to produce potions, minor injuries weren't a serious issue.
Thus, the first sports meet managed to proceed smoothly.
Several days later, the first sports meet of the Dragon's Nest Tribe concluded grandly.
This grand event not only significantly sparked the upward spirit of the Dragon Nest Beastmen but also greatly solidified their cohesion.
Austin could clearly feel that after the sports meet, the atmosphere of the entire Dragon's Nest Tribe changed significantly.
This made Austin consider whether to organize another sports meet at some point in the future, including setting up some challenge events suited for the Extraordinary Beastmen.
With this idea in mind, Austin naturally planned to build this event into a grand celebration similar to the Olympics in his previous life.
However, no matter what he thought, the next event would not happen in the near future.
The Olympics in his previous life were held every four years; the Dragon's Nest Sports Meet should at least be every five years.
With the conclusion of the sports meet, the Dragon's Nest Tribe gradually returned to its normal life trajectory. However, in their leisure time, Beastmen had much more to talk about.
Stories naturally emerged about which warrior jumped the highest, who won first in the solo challenges, and who had the honor of a personal audience with His Highness Austin as a reward, spreading as gossip naturally does.
This sports meet, arguably the first of its kind in the Otherworld, was destined to be widely circulated among the Beastmen, and its aftershocks would linger long until the next meet overshadowed it.
And this was a good thing, as the adjustment brought by the sports meet at least made the Beastmen work harder in their training.
Time flew by, and more than a month of the cold winter had passed.
With the conclusion of the sports meet, outstanding Beastmen were selected for transformation, with selections finalized after the cold winter.
However, these selected, soon-to-break-through-the-ordinary-band Extraordinary Beastman Seeds had to undergo a period of tough training.
The sports meet's initial purpose was to select stronger Beastmen as seeds for transforming into Dragon Vein Beastmen.
To start from a higher point during the transformation period and not have them idle during the long cold winter, these chosen Extraordinary Beastman Seeds began arduous training.
The current training was several times harsher than usual military training, with a significantly increased workload, as all of it was in preparation for successfully activating the Extraordinary Seed.
The training wasn't short. It would last until the end of winter when spring revitalized the Forest Land, and the anticipated emergence of a large number of game could support the increased number of Extraordinary Beastmen in the Dragon's Nest Tribe, at which point their training might conclude, entering the stage of modification personally overseen by Austin.
With the start of the training, the Dragon's Nest Tribe also gradually returned to its routine and stable atmosphere.
Until the tribe fully recovered from the sports meet's excitement and settled into various routine production and training work, Austin also began to ready himself, planning to complete a research project that would significantly enhance the strength of the Extraordinary Beastmen.
That was the Magic Modification of the Navy Six Techniques.
Among the Beastman Officers in the Dragon's Nest Tribe, the so-called Beastman Six Techniques consisted of only four techniques Austin had modified and developed: Shunpo, Fright, Iron Block, and Gale Wave.
These four techniques were created by Austin, utilizing the principles of the Navy Six Techniques from fantasy novels of his previous life, after adapting them through magical modifications suitable for this world.
However, due to various reasons, Austin only managed to develop four of a complete set of the Navy Six Techniques, leaving Finger Gun and Paper Drawing not modified.
Finger Gun wasn't developed because the close-combat attack method of stabbing with fingers wasn't very practical compared to using a sword. Thus, Austin hadn't planned to develop it in the first place.
As for Paper Drawing, its function is similar to Iron Block, both being defensive techniques. The former is an evasive technique, while the latter is a brute-force approach.
The principle of Paper Drawing, when understood in reality, resembles techniques like hearing wind to determine position. However, such precise operations are somewhat challenging for the hard-headed Beastmen, so Austin didn't attempt it.
Nevertheless, as Austin's strength increased, his vision expanded significantly.
Not long ago, during the development of the Magic Power Rasengan, Austin pondered whether he could supplement the Beastmen's hand-to-hand combat capabilities by developing a Fighting Qi Rasengan, adding a powerful close-combat technique for the Beastman Officers.
If successful, the combination of Shunpo + Rasengan would deal severe damage to Gold Level Great Warriors, should they be caught off guard.
Subsequently, by dividing his own Magic Power, Austin honed an extremely refined Magic Power control ability, extending strands of Magic Power through the world, enveloping the entire spatial region to form a Domain prototype.
Through developing the Domain prototype, Austin had a sudden idea: could Beastmen integrate their Fighting Qi with the external air to achieve the effect of Paper Drawing or even beyond, reaching capabilities similar to Observation-style Dominance?
With the idea formed, Austin, somewhat possessing a perfectionist streak, naturally wanted to complete the Beastman Six Techniques.
Moreover, once the Six Techniques took shape, Dragon Vein Beastmen's power would see a significant boost.
Thus, after a brief rest post-sports meet, Austin gathered most of the Beastman Officers and Junior Officers to attempt the development of the Fighting Qi Rasengan and a Fighting Qi version of Paper Drawing.

chapters.title: Chapter 246 242: Still Not Enough (Second Update)
chapters.content:
When Austin initially developed the Magic Power Rasengan, he merely attempted over a hundred times and spent half a day's effort to successfully create it.
Originally, he thought transforming it into a Fighting Qi Rasengan would be just as simple.
But the facts proved otherwise.
Austin was able to quickly develop the Magic Power Rasengan because he himself possessed the bloodline of the Giant Dragon, giving him an innate advantage in both spirit and magical power control.
And these Beastman Transcendent beings were far inferior to Austin; how could they so easily develop the Rasengan?
Moreover, compared to magical power, Fighting Qi is even more difficult to control.
After nearly ten days, the Beastman Transcendents merely learned how to gather a whirlpool of Fighting Qi in their palms. Successfully forming it, condensing the scattered Fighting Qi to reach the Rasengan level, was still a distant goal.
Although progress was slow, Austin did not give up.
At least, the experimental development team's beastmen could gather a whirlpool of Fighting Qi in their palms. This indicated that the idea of the Fighting Qi Rasengan was correct; what was lacking was merely how to gather and condense the dispersing Fighting Qi to form a highly rotating, highly condensed sphere of Fighting Qi.
As it is said, practice makes perfect. With more practice, the Fighting Qi Rasengan can naturally be utilized.
But under the current situation of the Dragon Nest Tribe, there was naturally no balloon material for the beastmen to practice with.
Thus, Austin used an alternative method. First, he carved a round ball from wood, then had them hold it in their palms, stimulating the whirlpool of Fighting Qi to continuously compress inward. As long as the compressive force cracked and shattered the wooden ball, the foundation stage could be considered complete.
Using the whirlpool of swirling Fighting Qi to crack and shatter the wooden ball in their palms meant they could compress and condense the scattered whirlpool of Fighting Qi to a relatively solid degree.
And this powerful tearing force forms the foundation of the Fighting Qi Rasengan.
Achieving such a level of power means that the developed Fighting Qi Rasengan already has a certain level of destructive power.
The development of the Fighting Qi Rasengan is, after all, a form of offensive technique using Fighting Qi energy. It is not something that can be developed easily.
Austin set a general direction, then had the beastmen practice and discuss with each other, jointly researching how to improve it, and afterwards turned his focus mostly to the development of papercraft.
The idea for improving papercraft came from Austin's construction of his own domain prototype.
Though he understood well that truly getting the beastmen to learn how to construct a domain prototype would be almost as hard as climbing to the heavens.
Compared to developing the Fighting Qi Rasengan, papercraft development was more like working with iron: just strike!
Blindfold the eyes of the experimental group of Extraordinary Beastmen, then have another beastman strike repeatedly, let the beastmen in pain learn to sense airflow and enhance their Sixth Sense, thereby learning to use Fighting Qi to perceive the direction of enemy attacks.
After all, with many years of development, the Dragon Nest Tribe has established a unique unconscious system belonging to this world, and for sprains and injuries, the witch doctors of the Dragon Nest Tribe already have quite good experience.
On the first day, the beastmen of the papercraft experimental group had bruised faces, but after treatment the next day, they were mostly unharmed, ready for another round of beatings.
This time, the experiment went as Austin expected, and the beastmen of the papercraft experimental group significantly enhanced their sensitivity to attacks. Initially, out of a hundred strikes, ninety-eight landed on them, with the remaining two being dodged by pure luck.
After several days of pain and torment, the Extraordinary Beastmen had learned how to perceive and evade attacks in the darkness, with their instinctive intuition greatly strengthened, and eventually only eighty or so out of a hundred strikes hit them.
This was already quite an improvement compared to before.
As they continued, the experimental group of beastmen continued to explore through pain, eventually able to develop papercraft for perceiving the direction of airflow attacks using Fighting Qi.
Having passed down the rough development direction for both Fighting Qi Rasengan and papercraft techniques, further progress could only rely on time.
With previous experiences, Austin no longer needed to supervise them around the clock, and the beastmen were capable of independently proposing some ideas for improvement.
Seeing that the last two of the Beastman Six Techniques were unlikely to be developed within a few months amidst numerous attempts and summaries, and considering that the beastmen with experience outlines could also experiment independently, Austin decided to hand over the development tasks to them, and turned his Heart Spirit to other areas.
More than a month had passed since Gross, the first warrior of the Blood Claw Tribe, had led an attack.
Austin was fully aware that once the news of Gross's complete defeat spread, the Dragon Nest Tribe would face intensified pressure and possibly even greater danger.
Therefore, during this period, Austin completely focused on using all methods to enhance his own strength.
Increasing the number of Extraordinary Beastmen was one aspect, completing the Beastman Six Techniques was another.
At the same time, Austin had not neglected sorting out his own abilities.
The passionate battle with Gross had awakened a trace of Thunder Law, which belonged to Austin and could be activated from his bloodline and manifested into the world.
During this period, even during the sports meet, Austin had not abandoned comprehending that trace of Thunder Law.
Through more than a month of contemplative insight, Austin reaped substantial benefits.
Although that trace of Thunder Law appeared before him, it still generated a feeling of infinite remoteness, as if separated by numerous planes, even though it was right before him.
Fully comprehending that trace of Thunder Law might take who knows how many years or months.
However, after sustained contact and observation for over a month, Austin, as a result, significantly improved his strength.
Whether in terms of understanding and controlling Thunder, or mastery over other attribute powers, his abilities saw great enhancement due to his opportunity to directly view the Law Power.
That trace of Thunder Law was like a key, a key able to open the door to a new world.
Though Austin had not yet the qualification to use that key to step into a new realm, merely glimpsing the world through a tiny crack was already enough to broaden his horizons.
The present Austin, after being empowered by that trace of Thunder Law, perhaps facing Gross again wouldn't even require deploying a Legendary Law as such a mighty weapon to defeat and kill him.
Nonetheless, Austin felt this was still not enough!

chapters.title: Chapter 247 243 Law Application (3rd update, asking for monthly tickets)
chapters.content:
The Thunder Law is very powerful, belonging to the heavens and earth, a force like the majestic power of commanding thunder.
The sliver of Thunder Law awakened from his bloodline allowed Austin, even at the Gold Level, to catch a glimpse of the Legendary Level, rapidly increasing his control over various elemental powers.
But no matter how strong, there are limits.
As long as Austin hasn't comprehended the Thunder Law, hasn't gathered his own Law Power, or awakened the Law in his bloodline, then no matter how strong his control over thunder is, when he encounters those powerful entities controlling the Law, he is just a slightly stronger ant.
The Law is a higher level of power.
Austin needs a more powerful offensive technique.
Especially in such uncertain prospects, having more methods never hurts, as strength is ultimately the foundation for surviving freely.
The Super Invincible World-Destroying Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan, though its power is formidable, with destructive force almost comparable to a Forbidden Curse.
However, even after comprehending the Thunder Law and further mastering various attribute powers, Austin could only halve the time needed to condense this technique and greatly increase its success rate.
The time to condense it is still not short, and during the condensation, he can't move. Otherwise, one small mistake causing attribute magic power to become chaotic might result in an explosion that would likely engulf himself first.
This technique is at its best when dealing with stationary structures like pyramids.
Now, Austin needs a method that can be utilized even in intense battles.
Austin gazed at the sliver of Thunder Law within his body.
Although it's best not to reveal the Thunder Law in his body to the outside world, if it truly comes to a desperate situation, it wouldn't matter if it's revealed.
During the battle with Gross, Gross mentioned that he took something he shouldn't have, saying that some majesty would not let him go.
At that time, Austin thought carefully and took out the mysterious crystal he obtained after destroying the pyramid. Even after awakening a sliver of Thunder Law, Austin still felt that the power contained within the crystal was so mysteriously unfathomable.
It even faintly gave Austin a feeling that the power level of the crystal seemed to be above the Thunder Law!
For now, Austin couldn't make use of that crystal, but there was no doubt that as long as he had that crystal in his hands, and as long as he was exposed to the outside world's attention, danger would certainly continuously arise.
"Strong power is the greatest reliance for self-preservation!"
After a long contemplation, Austin decided to develop another technique, a powerful technique that also harnesses the Thunder Law as his ultimate trump card.
During the battle with Gross, just by driving the sliver of Thunder Law's power, Austin instantly obliterated the life-exploding Gross into ashes.
At that time, Austin's method of driving it was still very crude.
It was like a child throwing a knife to kill an enemy.
Integrating the Thunder Law into a certain technique would be designing a sword technique for the knife, allowing it to unleash its power.
"Now, continuing to comprehend the Thunder Law has started to become slow. Instead of spending more time on comprehending the Thunder Law, it's better to first invest some time in integrating the Thunder Law into a technique. That technique containing the Thunder Law will become my greatest trump card!"
As for whether this final trump card would reveal his secret of controlling the Thunder Law, that doesn't need to be said.
Once Austin needs to use this last trump card, it would mean that he is already in an extremely dangerous moment. Whether the secret of driving the Thunder Law is kept or not already doesn't matter much.
So, after arranging various affairs of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin, who had rested for more than a month, began another closed-door session.
During the cold winter, there's not much to do, and the Dragon Nest Tribe is basically in a recuperation phase.
Also, aside from the initial construction phase of the Dragon Nest Tribe, when Austin was busy handling tribal affairs, the Dragon Nest Tribe now has established a sufficiently perfect system, freeing Austin from various trivial daily matters.
The development of the Fighting Qi Rasengan and Paper Drawing Techniques were proceeding steadily and orderly.
During the cold winter, there would generally be no unexpected situations, so Austin found a relatively secluded place to start the retreat and attempt to develop a technique that could integrate the Thunder Law.
However, developing a magic technique that could bear the Thunder Law is not that easy.
Even at the Legendary Realm, people use the Law in a simple and crude way, directly using the Law to create a Domain and violently collide with each other.
The greatest principles are simple. Reaching this level of power already indicates a force that can break ten thousand techniques.
The deeper one understands the Law, it represents stronger power, and it's basically how Legendary strength is distinguished in this world.
Even at the Legendary Level, they use the Law in such a simple way, let alone Austin, who is only at the Gold Level?
Simple techniques can't bear the power of the Thunder Law.
Techniques like the Magic Power Rasengan, if the Thunder Law is integrated, it might collapse and dissipate the moment it's integrated.
This is power-level suppression, simply unusable.
Although this path is extremely difficult, compared to other Legendary powers, the one thing Austin does not lack is imagination.
The principles are universal, and from previous life, the anime and novels he watched can be referenced.
"The thing is, which technique should be referenced? At this power level, it seems there's nothing to reference."
Austin pondered, with many memories flowing like water in his mind, but struggled to find a suitable technique.
Also, Austin in the previous life was not a heavy anime fan. Excluding the deep understanding he had of Naruto and One Piece, he only watched a few other animes, and among these, involving the Law-level techniques capable of bearing this powerful power seemed absent.
"Anime doesn't have them. I wonder if there are techniques from the novels read in the previous life suitable for bearing the Thunder Law."
Compared to anime, the power level in the novels Austin read in his previous life is much higher, not to mention Law, including Divine, Space-Time, Heaven and Earth, the Path of Chaos, and various oversized power imagination — they are all present.
However, realizing those imaginations in this world is not easy.
After several days of closed-door contemplation, by combining various novels and anime, Austin finally focused on a certain technique.

chapters.title: Chapter 248 244: Trump Card (4th Update, Requesting Monthly Pass)
chapters.content:
In certain anime novels, there is a technique prepared primarily for challenging opponents of higher levels, known as the Sword Drawing Technique.
Gathering the essence, spirit, and energy into the sword still sheathed, constantly storing power, until the moment it bursts forth with its most brilliant sword light, striking with a blow that surpasses its own power to slay enemies of superior strength.
In many fantasy Xianxia novels Austin read in his past life, there were techniques similar to Sword Drawing Technique.
Like the Sword Pill in Xianxia, the Sword Containing in fantasy, they all continuously nourish the sword blade's power with spirit and energy over time, and the moment it blooms, its extreme power transcends its own limits.
Austin set his sights on techniques like these.
If he used that trace of Thunder Law within him as an invincible blade edge, nurturing it within using spirit, bloodline, and momentum — a myriad of mysterious powers — until it is unsheathed, then the power from that Thunder Law might just be enough to kill a Legend!
Although techniques like Sword Containment appear different from the style of the world he inhabits, the logic is the same, so trying it is worthwhile. If successfully nurtured, Austin will have an exceedingly powerful trump card!
Upon thinking about it, Austin, in his retreat, began contemplating how to nurture that trace of Thunder Law.
"Whether it's the Sword Drawing Technique, Sword Pulling Technique from anime, or the Sword Pill, Sword Containment in Xianxia, the first step is preparing a vessel—a good sword or a Magical Treasure Sword Pill—all of these are vessels. So what should I choose as my vessel?"
Given the strength of Thunder Law, it's impossible to use tangible items as its vessel; ordinary metals cannot withstand the formidable power of Thunder Law.
Austin found himself in a dilemma.
In the world he can currently access, there is no suitable vessel for Thunder Law.
However, having found a way to use Thunder Law, and if it can be realized in the future, the power of that trump card would be incredibly strong, something Austin was unwilling to give up easily.
After several days of thought, Austin found a clever solution.
Unable to find tangible material for Thunder Law, but what about a substance formed by conceptual things?
Austin thought of Thunderbolt Power!
After understanding that trace of Thunder Law, Austin gained further insight into Thunderbolt Power, enhancing his control over electricity.
In the Naruto anime, Uchiha Sasuke's lightning attribute change condenses electricity into a tangible Light Blade for attacks, the light blade having a tangible form, possessing sword-like attributes— even Orochimaru was amazed by this attribute change.
Over a month of contemplating Thunder Law, Austin was able to create similar attribute-changing Thunderbolt Light Blades.
Condensing conceptual thunder into a substance resembling a sword, he achieved the ability to create a tangible Light Sword.
Now, Austin plans to use the condensed Thunderbolt to forge a Thunderbolt Longsword with such substantive attributes, then use this Thunderbolt Longsword as a vessel to integrate that trace of Thunder Law, nurturing it within, forming a Thunderbolt Divine Sword.
Being a concept-like Thunderbolt Divine Sword, it can be like a Magical Treasure in Xianxia, typically retracting into the body and spitting it out when needed, making it easier to use in combat.
Taking enemies by surprise, severely injuring them in one move isn't impossible.
Enemies unfamiliar with combat in the Immortal World wouldn't expect a terrifying object to be suddenly spat out from their opponent's mouth.
Having found a solution, the next step was attempting it.
As for the attribute change of electricity, due to Austin's joint understanding of Thunder Law, it took only a short time to condense such a Thunderbolt Longsword.
This was an azure Longsword, its brilliant form shining radiantly, akin to an illuminating glass.
The moment the sword appeared, the surrounding space seemed to dim, arcs of electricity blooming like ripples in the surrounding void.
"Using thunderbolt as the form to bear the Power of Thunder Law..."
With deep contemplation, Austin began integrating Thunder Law into the Thunderbolt Longsword.
This wasn't a simple task, though Thunder Law shares origins with thunderbolt lightning; its superior-tier power frequently disrupted the original form of the Thunderbolt Longsword, eventually causing it to collapse.
To integrate it, Austin embarked on persistent attempts.
Once, twice, thrice... Austin sat atop the mountaintop, repeating the process countless times, the cold wind blew past but did not distract him, while the rolling sound of thunder echoed in the frigid winter between the icy heavens and earth.
Time slowly passed, an unknown duration elapsed.
At some point, the thunderous roar in the heavens above finally subsided, layers of rolling clouds dissipated, and the sky that had been obscured for a month revealed daylight once more.
On the mountaintop, Austin stood up slowly, exhaled deeply, his weary expression barely concealing the joy within.
"Finally, it's successful! A little more nurturing, and its power will be unimaginable!"
Feeling the constantly suppressed and accumulating power within himself, his heart finally settled.
This retreat not only resulted in the consolidation of an extremely powerful trump card, but during the continuous attempts, Austin's understanding of thunder also advanced to another level.
Now, even without the harmony of wind and water attribute powers, he can accomplish the magical power Attribute Rasengan's lightning nature change ability.
The Thunder Rasengan, among the three attribute powers Austin currently masters, was the hardest Attribute Rasengan to condense, and finally, he achieved a successful manifestation.
This was one of the achievements from Austin's latest retreat!
Moreover, the Thunder Rasengan's power was greater than the simple wind attribute and Water Attribute Rasengan, making it one of Austin's potent trump cards in close combat.
"Seems like it's been a month, I should head back now!"
With newfound confidence and greatly increased strength, Austin was in a good mood, spreading his wings, flying swiftly towards the direction of the tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 249 245: Dramatic Shift in Style (First Update - Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Although Austin was immersed in a closed retreat for cultivation, he was still somewhat aware of the passage of time in the outside world.
Unknowingly, more than a month had passed.
After spending over a month, he finally created the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, which contained the Thunder Law, and condensed it within himself, day by day accumulating power within it.
The Essence, Qi, and Spirit—the three treasures—were extremely concentrated in the heart, nurturing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword contained within the body, constantly polishing and nurturing it, accumulating power.
However, the consequence of this was that all of Austin's domineering dragon awe had disappeared without a trace.
Due to his aura being extremely restrained within, Austin appeared like an ordinary creature, even giving people a strange feeling due to his form.
This is also one of the side effects of nurturing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, which as an extremely compressed and condensed technique of spirit, Qi, and blood, emerges once and will definitely shake the world; this sword needs Austin to constantly polish and nurture it, whether it's continued spiritual power, magic power, Qi and blood power, or the external dragon awe, all become raw materials for polishing that sword.
With these powers as growth materials, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within will surely surpass the power of all means Austin can utilize.
If there is enough time to nurture, slaying a legend with one strike might not be an impossible feat.
However, the price of gaining great power is that Austin's style underwent a sudden and bizarre change.
The originally fierce and menacing giant dragon, after having its aura and dragon awe removed, appeared somewhat plump, and formerly Austin's stature and the aura of dragon awe he emitted complemented each other, displaying his supreme dominance.
But now, having lost that awe-inspiring aura and dragon awe, he appeared exceedingly strange.
"Your Highness, you've returned... pfft..."
This was Vini's first reaction upon seeing Austin return to the Dragon's Nest, hurrying to pay his respects.
Originally, Austin found Vini a bit odd but didn't think much of it, casually listened to his report on some recent events in the Dragon Nest Tribe, and then dismissed him.
However, Austin faintly felt something strange, as Vini's words seemed somewhat off as if he were suppressing something, and he walked away briskly afterward.
At first, Austin didn't pay much attention.
But as he interacted more with the Dragon Nest members, he increasingly noticed their odd behavior; if he didn't realize anything, then he'd truly be a fool.
Why did his former subordinates, who revered him as a deity, upon seeing him, their first reaction was to be stunned, then "pfft," as if they were enduring something intensely.
What does this mean?
When Austin walked past the lake reservoir by the Dragon Nest Tribe, he finally knew the reason upon seeing the reflection on the ice surface.
Although the reflection on the ice surface was blurry, it meant nothing to the dragon's vision.
However, at this moment, Austin wished he hadn't seen the reflection on the ice.
Austin stood dazedly on the ice, with the reflection of himself on the ice layer below.
The cold wind whispered all around, turning Austin into an ice sculpture, feeling the bitter chill.
"It's gone, everything's gone..."
Reflected on the ice was a chubby, adorably silly meat dragon, giving Austin the impression of a simple drawing like a child's hand-held Q dragon illustration.
Yes, that's exactly how he perceived it.
Despite Austin's tightly arranged scales and the radiant gleam, the formidable head enough to scare off any ordinary person couldn't stop the surge of such thoughts when he saw the reflection on the ice.
Gone, everything's gone; that mighty, awe-inspiring figure, the heart-stopping dragon awe aura, all vanished completely at this moment.
Like the autumn wind sweeping fallen leaves, leaving only a mess behind.
Austin intended to make a final struggle,
Thus he tried to make a fierce appearance, imagining his previously invincible entrance crushing scenes, taking a deep breath.
Evil Dragon Roar · Aw~~
The desolate cold wind blew past, as if a crow flew overhead, leaving a string of silent colons...
Poof!
Austin felt a blackout, immediately spitting out a mouthful of old blood, nearly collapsing.
The reflection on the ice gave him the impression of a plump meat dragon, clearly with a silly adorable look, yet trying to pose a "I'm super fierce" manner, desperately attempting an Evil Dragon Roar...
What kind of nonsense is this?
Adorable light shines through, relying on this to intimidate the enemy!
The style suddenly shifted from fierce and vicious to a childlike Q version style, especially the usually dominant moves and poses, at this moment turned into irresistibly comedic sketches.
It's over, everything's over.
Austin gazed at the sky, feeling the rest of his dragon life descending into an utter darkness.
Without the dominance and dragon awe, his existence was merely a comically silly meat dragon, far from being formidable.
In fact, an adult giant dragon after constraining dragon awe and aura, although lacking that suffocating oppressive feeling, the immense physique and ferocious appearance still sufficed to alarm ordinary people.
The normal giant dragon appearance ultimately has a formidable deterrence.
However, Austin is not a normal dragon!
Since breaking out of the dragon egg, Austin's full age is only five or six years, in the thousand-year lifespan of a giant dragon, merely having passed five or six thousandths, and Austin is nothing but in the toddler dragon's infant stage.
Because of using electric current to stimulate the physical body since young, the thunder law aura contained within the current accelerated the growth of the physical form, now Austin's form is not much different from a typical young dragon.
But the problem lies in the fact that an infant dragon is ultimately an infant dragon, even with accelerated physical growth, the infant stage appearance still exists.
The mind of twenty-plus-year-old soul Austin hadn't considered this point.
And in the past, due to the tier difference among giant dragons naturally exuding aura, especially when Austin began awakening the dragon awe, the Beastmen didn't notice this point either.
The powerful aura from the Dragon Vein concealed the infant traits on Austin's massive form.
Ordinary Beastmen dare not stare directly at Austin to carefully observe his exterior, let alone discover the infant traits hidden within the fierce form?
Even enemies in fight ignored this under the dragon awe aura.
However, now, with the nurturing of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword inside, Austin's entire dragon awe aura is extremely restrained, seemingly vanished, gathering momentum for the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within.
With the concealment of dragon awe aura gone, Austin's originally infant-like form was completely revealed.
And it was this very infant-like appearance that caused the dominant force master in Kawa Great Forest, in the eyes of clan members, once mighty, cool, brash, aloof, heartless, slaughtering mercilessly, establishing a tremendously powerful tribe force—the great His Highness Austin—his entire heart plunged into a dark abyss of despair....

chapters.title: Chapter 250 246 Dragon's Difficult Birth (2nd Update, Requesting Monthly Ticket)
chapters.content:
"The life of a dragon is difficult, how unfortunate it is!"
Inside the Dragon's Nest, Austin sulkily hides in the nest, sighing sorrowfully.
Presently, he has lost the courage to go out, having to hide inside the Dragon's Nest to eke out an existence.
Without his imposing presence and aura effects, Austin's childish form now is fully exposed, clearly visible to others.
He misses his sharp-edged appearance, misses the overbearing aura that made others shy from raising their heads easily.
Without the overlaying visual effects, Austin feels faint and about to vomit blood at the sight of his own adorable yet silly appearance.
Perhaps some female creatures might find his appearance irresistibly cute, capable of melting their girlish hearts, but Austin only feels his sense of shame going through the roof.
Despite Austin's towering size, casting a daunting shadow like that of a house,
But,
What's the difference between a fist-sized little yellow duck and a ten-meter-tall one?
If someone asked him this question, Austin would despairingly say:
None.
Your appearance is silly cute, no matter how large your size is, it cannot hide the fact of you being silly cute.
Actually, Austin is not without a solution to this silly cute appearance issue, as long as he releases his dragon's aura and grandeur again.
However, releasing the dragon's aura means he must stop nurturing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, which is a steadfast ultimate technique requiring constant accumulation, and if stopped midway, it would mean the failure of nurturing the sword.
Or rather, it wouldn't exactly be failed, but the Thunderbolt Divine Sword would merely embody the Thunder Law, without nurturing its potential, its strength would only slightly surpass that of techniques like Thunder Rasengan.
This result is unacceptable for Austin by any means.
"Alas, compared to a silly cute appearance, living is indeed more important!"
Compared to the life-saving means that is the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, he can only sacrifice his outward appearance.
After several days of nurturing, Austin can also feel the gradually rising aura power within.
If he continues nurturing for about ten years, defeating a Legendary might not be impossible, and by then, who would dare laugh at his unsophisticated appearance?
Such a strong technique, Austin certainly wouldn't give up easily.
"Well, going out with this kind of look, I bet others won't be too alert, and then pretending to be weak while delivering a fatal blow when the enemy lets their guard down, that's truly the way..."
Seeing the definite change in style becoming a reality, Austin couldn't help but wryly enjoy himself.
Indeed, with his current situation, without dragon's aura or an imposing presence, the silly cute exterior could potentially decease quite a few people.
It seems that the change in style is not without benefits.
Thankfully, when Austin originally established the Dragon Nest Tribe, and controlled the forces of the Dragon's Nest, he didn't solely rely on forceful suppression but employed various gentle methods to win the hearts of the beastmen.
Providing them with safe shelter and sufficient food, the better living conditions compared to before made all beastmen willingly submit.
At the same time, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin didn't forget to routinely brainwash, integrating the thoughts of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
It was for this reason that even after losing the fierce and menacing appearance, although it caused quite a stir among the Dragon Nest Beastmen, those who revered Austin as the Divine did not harbor any other thoughts, at most it was just a surge of gossip.
"These damn guys, seems like their training is still too little! I must intensify their training!"
Thinking about the previous gossip, Austin suddenly clenched his claw, crushing a stone into powder.
Although the style has changed to that of a silly cute baby dragon faction, the power remains terrifying; treating Austin as a silly cute large Young Dragon would be terribly mistaken.
Subsequently,
As Austin resolved to put aside his shame, the gossip among the Dragon Nest Beastmen started to decrease accordingly.
Because the daily training amount among the Dragon Nest Beastmen doubled, and after rigorous training the Dragon Nest Beastmen had no energy left to spread gossip, plus, Austin began walking more within the Dragon Nest Tribe, constantly displaying his "majestic" face before the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Seeing it often, although sometimes they couldn't help but chuckle, it had become a part of their routine.
Moreover, through this incident, Austin could clearly feel a further bond forming with the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Previously, Austin was aloof, with a godlike indifference, a high-cold image being like the Divine, dragon's presence vast, voice booming like thunder, deterring direct gazes.
But now, there is a trend of integrating among the beastmen, standing alongside them, stepping down from the lofty status into their midst.
And this, unintentionally, made Austin even more adored in the hearts of the beastmen.
...
As Austin strived to adapt to his new appearance, since the Blue Young Dragon set out three months ago, Gross and his group, "missing" for over three months, finally caught the attention of the Blood Claw Tribe.
"Impossible! Even if there's heavy snow blocking the way, Gross and his team should have completed their mission and returned by this time!"
Inside the Blood Claw Tribe, strategist Rulga frowned deeply.
Ever since dispatching Gross three months ago to slay the Young Dragon hiding in the mountain nest, it's been three whole months.
And in these three months, there has been no message from Gross and his team.
This might have been due to the arrival of cold winter, hindering message transmission, but a full three months without any news seems peculiar, knowing this timeframe should have allowed for Gross and his team to make one or two round trips.
Such a long period definitely indicates something unexpected.
"Could it be..."
Rulga appeared thoughtful, not knowing what he was contemplating.
"Someone, go bring Lambert to me."
Lambert, the second warrior within the Blood Claw Tribe, whose prowess only trails slightly behind Gross.
Gross' strength is extremely formidable, after an ancestral bloodline transformation reaching the peak of Gold-tier might; unless it's by individuals at Legend-tier or stronger, even severely wounded he'd still escape death, at the very least.
In Rulga's view, Gross likely encountered some trouble and got tied up.
Thus, he decided to gather Lambert, intending for him to lead a troop to search for and rescue them.
As for the task of slaying the Blue Young Dragon, it's best completed in passing; if not possible, then let it be.
As the cold winter nears its end, and the alliance plan with humans soon to be executed, it's crucial to ensure significant combat power to secure the Blood Claw Tribe's standings; even letting a Young Dragon escape won't hinder the plan much.
Gross wasn't solitary; he departed with numerous elite members of the Blood Claw Tribe. Lack of Gross and his elite would diminish the Blood Claw Tribe's capability noticeably, unfavorable to the tribe's interests.
Considering the strength of the beastmen subordinates Gross led, if they truly got into trouble, rescuing them wouldn't be a straightforward task.
Therefore, after summoning Lambert, Rulga personally allocated over half of the remaining elite Extraordinary forces within the Blood Claw Tribe for exploration towards the area occupied by the Blue Young Dragon.
Their main task remains exploration and rescue, while Lambert is puzzled by Rulga's advice to retreat immediately if things turn unfavorable.
This advice, seeming rather unfinished, left Lambert scratching his head.

chapters.title: Chapter 251 247: The End of the Cold Winter (3rd Update – Subscription Requested)
chapters.content:
Although he didn't understand, Lambert still decided to follow orders and led a part of the elite of the Blood Claw Tribe away.
The movements of the Blood Claw Tribe naturally attracted the attention of other tribes within the Tribe Alliance. First, Gross left with part of the elite, followed by Lambert, which significantly reduced the strength of the Blood Claw Tribe.
Among tribes, there is no concept of keeping secrets. As long as one is keen, they can gather information within the Tribe Alliance.
Lambert's unusual actions also caught the attention of several Beastmen placed by the Dragon Nest Tribe within the Alliance, who uncovered the purpose of Lambert's movements.
Back then, Austin, feeling the lack of his own intelligence capabilities, selected several elite Dragon Vein Beastmen for discreet training and deployed them into the Tribe Alliance.
These Dragon Vein Beastmen held a certain degree of power. Within the entire Tribe Alliance, they weren't weak. Starting from being mere soldiers, they quickly infiltrated the Tribe Alliance, holding relatively important positions in certain tribes.
Now, these pawns have finally demonstrated their value.
The Blood Claw Tribe never anticipated that before Lambert's departure, the news had already been swiftly sent to the Dragon Nest Tribe via a covert route stationed in a remote area outside.
In reality, the main members of the Tribe Alliance are Beastmen. Although Austin in his past life never worked as a spy or agent, he had watched enough spy war films, remembering some of the more straightforward espionage techniques.
This intelligence gathered from the essence of modern society's civilization naturally is beyond the simple-minded Beastmen of the Barbaric Land, who solved problems using brute strength, to easily detect.
Blood Claw Tribe's strategist Rulga, though notoriously cunning, could never have imagined that Austin had already placed spies here due to the disparity in intelligence.
In fact, regarding Gross's disappearance, he had some suspicions.
Perhaps someone was behind the dragon, and it's highly probable that Gross and his elite subordinates perished at the hands of that dragon's allies. In any case, Gross's matter is definitely linked to that young dragon.
As for Austin, even if Rulga were more cunning, his intelligence still only registered Austin at the Silver level, making it impossible to guess that Gross was killed by Austin.
This marks the disadvantage of lacking intelligence.
In truth, if anyone speculated that a young dragon could, within one or two short years, succeed in breaking through ranks, growing from Silver Level to being able to slay experienced Gold High Tier warriors, they'd likely be deemed insane.
Because it defies all logic and seemed utterly impossible.
However, this biggest impossibility turned out to be the true reality.
It's not that Rulga was stupid. To rise as one of the top strategists within the Tribe Alliance, managing a Beastman population in the hundreds of thousands, one can't be deemed as stupid.
It can only be said that outdated intelligence kills.
...
What transpired on the distant borderlands was unknown to Austin at the time. Before the information arrived, he perhaps would be wary of the Bloody Border but wouldn't devote excessive time or effort to it.
As time passed, when Austin had forged the Thunderbolt Divine Sword and had continually nurtured it internally, the cold winter which lasted over two months also came to an end.
The passing of the cold winter heralded the start of a new year again.
With the melting of ice and snow, the Kawa Great Forest revived with vitality. Some eager grass on the soil sprouted tender shoots before the ice above had fully melted.
Beasts emerged from their hibernation dens, and animals that had been hungry for over two months began foraging for food wildly in the wilderness.
The saying goes that the entire year's work depends on a good start in spring. Although the Barbaric Land doesn't have a spring in the strict sense, Austin habitually regarded the ten days after the cold winter's end and the ice's disappearance as spring.
With the arrival of spring, the Dragon Nest Tribe Beastmen, who had rested for over two months, began to stir and enter into work mode.
Austin didn't immediately start transforming the prepared Extraordinary Beastman seeds to increase the number of Dragon Vein Beastmen, as the demand to enhance the number wasn't urgent for the time being.
Moreover, since the cold winter had just passed and food was relatively scarce, the number of Extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen was a considerable burden for the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
For the Dragon Nest Tribe, the most crucial initial task was still the cultivation of food crops.
After all, food remained the most fundamental resource for maintaining the stable existence of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Now, the two major threats to the Dragon Nest Base have been substantially reduced with Austin's improved power, giving him the confidence for self-preservation.
The threat from zombie undead a hundred miles southwest was resolved. Since the destruction of the first pyramid during the expansion of the undead calamity, no further spreading had dared occur.
The region two hundred kilometers away had become barren wasteland, devoid of grass, as though some force had drained the vitality of the entire land. The number of roaming zombie undead had become sparse, seemingly transferred elsewhere.
At least for now, the threat of the zombie undead tide over there is not significant.
Meanwhile, with the continued internal nurturing of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword and the understanding of the Thunder Law enhancing his power, Austin also gained the confidence to face the Blood Claw Tribe directly.
Even if the Blood Claw Tribe sent more people, he was confident he could resist.
The Dragon Nest Base entered a relatively stable environment.
The two major threats looming over the Dragon Nest Tribe had been largely reduced, and the thousands of acres of farmland cultivated near the Dragon Nest Town couldn't be easily abandoned, so Austin had the Beastmen continue planting in the nearby fields, restarting agriculture around the Dragon Nest Base.
At the first outpost established by the Dragon Nest Tribe, there seemed to be an Elf Realm nearby, frequently clashing with the Dragon Nest Beastmen, and wars occasionally broke out.
As the cold winter passed, these conflicts with the elves also grew more frequent.
The instability over there made it difficult to conduct stable farming activities for the time being.
Coincidentally, the vast fields awaiting cultivation near the Dragon Nest Base required farming, where the environment was relatively stable.
Therefore, at this time when ice and snow melted from the Forest Land, Austin relocated half of the elderly, weak, and production Beastmen, who had previously retreated to the first outpost, back to the Dragon Nest Base to start farming in the wild fields.
During the counterattack against the undead calamity, Austin moved most of the elderly, weak, and productive Beastmen from the Dragon Nest Base to the makeshift post northeast, now the first outpost, in case they needed an escape route.
After the victory in the war, while some of the elderly, weak, and productive Beastmen gradually returned, the subsequent cold winter arrived, leaving a significant portion of them still at the first outpost.
Now, with stability returned to the Dragon Nest Base region, and with a significant base for cultivation in the prepared vast fields, it made sense to relocate most of the elderly, weak, and productive Beastmen back from the continuously conflicted first outpost for stable production activities.

chapters.title: Chapter 252 248 Farming Agriculture (4th Update, Request for Subscription)
chapters.content:
Every year, after the cold winter passes and spring revives, the entire Kawa Great Forest becomes bustling with activity.
Hunters, prey, magic beasts, giant beasts, beastmen... one by one, the creatures come alive on the forest land, adding vibrant and lively colors to the Kawa Great Forest.
With the initial retreat of the cold winter, many beastmen in the Kawa Great Forest, due to tribal poverty, are forced to wander in search of food and vitality in the forest land.
This year, as the Dragon Nest Tribe expanded, its mighty reputation spread all around.
Thus, many wandering beastmen passing by the area flocked to seek refuge, with some small tribes facing difficulties even bringing their entire clans to join.
At the very least, through interactions over time, nearby beastman tribes all know that once you become a member of the Dragon Nest Tribe, it means you can eat your fill every day.
Having enough to eat, for beastmen still struggling on the brink of subsistence, remains an immense attraction.
Indeed, during these times, along with newborns from the tribe itself, the population of the Dragon Nest Tribe finally surpassed forty thousand, steadily progressing toward fifty thousand.
From initially having only seven and a half kobolds to now dominating a region with a population over forty thousand, it's only taken about four years.
This progress not only leaves the beastmen who joined initially feeling shocked, reminiscing about the past in their leisure as if it were just yesterday.
Even Austin feels that this change is like a dream.
It can only be said that this is the timing, this is the trend.
Beastmen struggling to survive in the Kawa Great Forest live too difficultly. Not only do tribal wars persist for years without end, but they often teeter on the brink of mere subsistence.
When Austin leveraged his own strength to open up this piece of pure land for the Beastman Race and taught them how to obtain more food from the land, thereby freeing them from the worry of famine, such a secure and sustaining life holds immense attraction for the beastmen in the wild.
Moreover, after the Clan Tribe grew strong, Austin did not stop the process of arming the beastmen.
The well-trained Dragon Nest Legion continually launched attacks, sweeping the surroundings, annexing one tribe after another, and assimilating large numbers of captives into the system of the Dragon Nest Tribe, providing invaluable contributions to the tribe's expansion.
It's precisely due to these reasons that the Dragon Nest Tribe, established by Austin, has rapidly expanded like a snowball in just a few short years to its current state.
However, the rapidly increasing population also brought a strong food pressure to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In the past, there were several instances where the population surge led to insufficient grain to support the tribe's level of expansion. Fortunately, the food obtained from the wild forest was not insignificant, and supplemented by other means, they managed to barely survive one crisis after another.
Now, with the Dragon Nest Tribe's population surpassing forty thousand and the cold winter just departed, the food pressure looming over the Dragon Nest Tribe is also not insignificant.
Fortunately, with a certain foundation established, the Dragon Nest Tribe can alleviate and endure this pressure.
Moreover, this year, a type of food that could serve as beastmen's rations saw a significant increase.
That is bamboo shoots.
During the initial expansion phase of the Dragon Nest Tribe, there was once a food crisis where Austin led the beastmen to open up new food sources.
Among them, the two largest were tender shoots of ferns and bamboo shoots.
After boiling them, the bitter taste of the fern shoots and bamboo shoots can be removed, turning them into an invaluable delicacy that can also fill the beastmen's stomachs.
At that time, a special team was set up in the Dragon Nest Tribe to collect these items from the wild.
After developing a fondness for the taste of bamboo shoots, some beastmen continued to plant bamboo cuttings along the riverbank, hoping that in the future, they would grow and produce more bamboo shoots.
Now, after several years of growth, the areas where the beastmen planted cuttings have successfully grown into a large bamboo forest.
This year, as the ice and snow recede, bamboo shoots emerge from the soil, marking a time of bountiful harvests.
Now, bamboo shoots have become a part of the beastmen's daily diet. Although not the main sustenance, they significantly reduce the food pressure on the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Facing the food pressure of early spring, the Dragon Nest Tribe already has a set plan and does not need to expend much extra energy.
For the entire tribe, the most important thing remains the first sowing of the new year.
After several years of wilderness reclamation, the fields encircling the entire Dragon Nest Tribe have already expanded to a vast area of over ten thousand acres, and this area continues to grow.
Moreover, compared to the early phase of the Dragon Nest Tribe's development, where most of the reclaimed fields were primarily planted with the single crop arrowroot, the crops planted this year are significantly more diverse.
Understanding the harm of monoculture before having sufficient means to manage pests and diseases, Austin already had plans for diversified agricultural planting.
Back then, Austin searched within the forest for other suitable crops to plant.
Wild rice, Otherworld yams, earth rice, thorn fruit... Austin tried to plant all kinds of grain crops on the newly opened fields. However, whether due to reasons of yield or seed availability, they couldn't be planted on a large scale and were only tested in some fields.
Initially, the grain crop with the most promise to compare in yield to arrowroot was this Otherworld yam.
Unfortunately, at the time, due to problems with yam seeds, large-scale planting was difficult.
Now, after several years of development, following territorial expansion, Austin has instructed the Dragon Nest Tribe to continue seeking new crops, and the Dragon Nest Beastmen have put Austin's instructions into practice during their campaigns against other tribes and the expansion of the Dragon Nest Territory.
During this time, they also discovered grain crops similar to wild wheat, and before the cold winter, when conquering a beastman tribe, they also found the growing area of Otherworld yams.
Thus, this year's ratio of cultivated grain crops changed.
The planting area occupied by arrowroot decreased, and in this year's agricultural planting, arrowroot accounts for 65% of the total area.
Although it still holds the main portion, this situation won't change soon; the high yield and short cycle production advantages of arrowroot are not easily replaced by other crops.
Wild rice, wild wheat, and yams together occupy 30% of the total cultivated area, serving as a supplement to arrowroot, in case the arrowroot crop suffers significantly from pests and diseases, potentially triggering a food crisis.
As for the remaining 5%, it's replaced by miscellaneous grains like earth rice and thorn fruit.
These grains, although low in output, are very nutritious and, compared to ordinary arrowroot, are far more delicious, making them just the right thing to earn the beastmen's labor points.

chapters.title: Chapter 253 249 Intelligence (First Update Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
The beginning of spring cultivation marked a new chapter in the Dragon Nest Tribe's development for the year.
With the busy schedule of the beastmen, the fields they cultivated began to be adorned with tender green colors. If nothing unexpected occurs, this would certainly be another bountiful year.
While the beastmen were busy in early spring, Austin, as the Master of the Dragon Nest, found himself with more leisure time.
After years of development, the Dragon Nest Tribe has formulated a set of simple and feasible laws, allowing Austin not to have to personally handle many major affairs.
Unless the Dragon Nest Tribe faces an imminent crisis of destruction, don't bother me with trivial matters.
According to Vini, those were Austin's original words.
These days, while stationed in the Dragon's Nest, Austin spent most of his time honing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within him, using it as a medium to comprehend that trace of Thunder Law within it.
The winter seclusion had propelled Austin's strength to grow rapidly, and now, continuing to comprehend that trace of the Thunder Law meant an incremental understanding of thunder, unlike the explosive growth of his first encounter with the Thunder Law.
The deeper the learning, the slower the progress, and comprehending the Thunder Law is the same.
This is the bottleneck of the upper limit. As one approaches it infinitely, the progress becomes slower unless one day Austin can fully comprehend the Thunder Law and condense his own Law Power, reaching the Legendary Level to quickly progress again.
Though the progress is slow, Austin clearly wouldn't waste time. While daily honing and gathering strength, he comprehends the Law Power of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within him.
Even a slight enhancement in strength is a gain.
Besides, Austin also began to consume large amounts of magic resources.
With the advent of spring, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion went out hunting regularly, collecting herbs containing magic power, which are brought back as nourishment for Austin's growth.
Moreover, although the Water Patterned Demon Iron Ore in the Wet Bone Forest was mostly collected during Austin's last advancement, the remaining deeper deposits still require more manpower to mine but can steadily provide Water Patterned Magic Iron Ore.
The digestion ability of the Giant Dragon Race is tremendously strong, and once these magic-laden substances enter Austin's body, his Magic Power continually increases, steadily advancing his Level Cultivation.
Meanwhile, Austin did not forget to supplement the Beastman Six Techniques, planned months earlier.
Both the Rasengan and Paper Drawing have made gratifying progress.
After a series of explorations, the beastmen's Rasengan took shape, capable of tearing and crushing a wooden sphere in the palm.
Similarly, in Paper Drawing, members of the beastmen test group, even when blindfolded, could predict the enemy's attack direction by sensing the feedback of Fighting Qi, dodging in advance.
Both combat techniques have already shown signs of success.
In due time, as the beastmen test group's members successfully explore the cultivation methods for these techniques, they can be promoted, completing the supplementation of the Beastman Six Techniques.
Once the Beastman Six Techniques are completed, the strength of the Dragon Nest Beastmen will certainly reach a new level.
"Calm down, carefully feel the rotation of the Fighting Qi in your palms, and use your Spiritual Power to understand the process of the Fighting Qi being rotated and condensed..."
On an open ground within the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin was guiding the Extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen in perfecting the development of the Fighting Qi Rasengan.
At that moment, Vini, who managed the general affairs of the Dragon Nest Tribe, came hurrying over with a worried expression.
"Your Highness, there is an urgent report from the Tribe Alliance."
Upon hearing this, Austin's expression shifted. He recalled his intention to plant spies in the Tribe Alliance at the border; could it be news from there?
This was not a suitable place for discussion, so Austin instructed the Extraordinary Dragon Vein Beastmen behind him and then turned to leave with Vini.
"What's happening?"
Back in the main hall, Austin immediately asked Vini.
"Your Highness, according to the report, after Gross and others went out and didn't return, it caused unrest in the Blood Claw Tribe. Consequentially, the Blood Claw Tribe's number one strategist Rulga sent Lambert to search..."
Vini narrated while taking out a parchment from the tarp and handed it to Austin. These were some intelligence reports summarized by spies hidden over there.
This item was delivered by a Centaur after galloping over a thousand miles, and for crossing this dangerous vast area, Austin had also given the Centaur a scale imbued with his aura.
There was no other way. The Kawa Great Forest is full of dangers, and without pigeons for messaging, they had to rely on primitive manpower to transport information.
Even so, crossing such a long distance still posed various dangers. Even for urgent reports, the Centaur couldn't gallop at full speed, causing considerable time delays, which perhaps allowed the people in the Blood Claw Tribe to make their move.
"Hmm? Have humans gotten involved?"
Carefully reading the parchment, a hint of surprise appeared in Austin's eyes.
The sending of people from the Blood Claw Tribe was expected by Austin.
Gross was the top warrior of the Blood Claw Tribe, and with his hundreds of elite subordinates suddenly "losing contact," it would be strange if the Blood Claw Tribe didn't send people to investigate.
But why have humans gotten involved?
According to the parchment, when Lambert from the Blood Claw Tribe began gathering Blood Claw elites to set out, humans suddenly visited the Blood Claw Tribe. It's unknown what they discussed with the top ranks.
Subsequently, the dispatched team was mixed with human warriors. Fortunately, the Dragon Nest Beastman was alert and did not rush to send the information immediately after confirming the Blood Claw Tribe's movement, ensuring this crucial point of the humans joining was not missed in the sent intelligence.
"Why would humans send people over? It couldn't be for dragon slaying, could it? No, the Blood Claw Tribe's action this time has a determined purpose. Humans must have learned the Blood Claw Tribe's aim for sending people to accompany them. Could it be their target is me too?"
Staring at the parchment in his hand, Austin pondered.
His nature was kind, having barely interacted with humans, apart from the time Edward inexplicably hired a Mercenary Corps to attack...
Recalling that battle, Austin's eyes flickered with an inexplicable light.
During that battle, the mastermind Edward vanished, dead or alive. Could he have survived, and is he the principal reason for the humans' involvement this time?
For a moment, Austin considered many possibilities.
"Your Highness, how should we respond now? Should we mobilize the army and have the tribe enter a state of war readiness?"
Vini asked from the side.
"No need, I'll handle this personally."
Austin shook his head. The Dragon Nest Tribe was in the middle of spring cultivation and not suitable for large-scale mobilizations.
Moreover, he also wanted to see the extent of his recent significant progress in strength.

chapters.title: Chapter 254 250 Union
chapters.content:
Amidst the lush forest, a column of teams advanced forward in exploration.
With the departure of the cold winter, the forest floor revived with vitality. The dense jungle and the wild beasts hidden within significantly affected the team, resulting in their slow progress.
The leader, Lambert, was somewhat troubled. The poisonous insects and wild beasts hidden in the dense forest were already a hassle, but the bigger issue was finding Gross's whereabouts.
Since the day Gross left with his men, it had been over three months.
In the vast sea of trees, who knew where that guy had gone? Now they could only head towards the nest of the Blue Young Dragon named Austin, hoping to find some trace of him there.
Gross was most likely alive, but it was unknown what trouble had entangled him.
"Ska, I really don't understand why you decided to join our team for this search operation."
Among the team, there was a group of human warriors.
Lambert found it strange that the group led by someone named Ska decided to join them. Their goal was to retrieve Gross, so why were these people here?
However, despite his doubts, Lambert didn't oppose it.
After all, these humans were Extraordinary Professionals and provided significant support, but their strength wasn't enough to cause any upheaval in the team.
"There's nothing much to hide. This time you're seeking the First Warrior of your Tribe, and we're looking for a Blue Young Dragon named Austin who has nested there. Since it's on the way, why not go together?"
Ska candidly replied, unbothered.
In fact, Ska was somewhat surprised that it took the guy beside him half a month to ask.
"A Blue Young Dragon named Austin? Do you humans have a grudge against it? If so, you might be disappointed. Half a year ago, traces of the undead had already reached there. The whole Dragon's Nest might have already been engulfed by the sea of undead, and Gross's delay in returning could very well be connected to those undead."
The initial task Rulga entrusted to Gross was, of course, confidential. However, the movements of the Blood Claw elite led by Gross were hard to conceal, so a reasonable explanation was provided from the start.
It was since undead had appeared at the Blue Young Dragon's location, to prevent the undead from spreading, Gross personally led the Blood Claw elite to support the Blue Young Dragon.
Of course, if their plan were successful, they would claim that upon arrival, the whole Dragon's Nest had been breached by the undead, and the Blue Young Dragon along with its clan had been completely devoured and assimilated by the undead.
The execution was naturally Gross's doing.
But, being in a remote location, once the Blue Young Dragon and its clan were annihilated and the area ravaged by the undead army, no evidence would be left behind, and they could claim anything they wanted.
After all, it was an orphan dragon without a mature dragon to care for.
What Rulga and his lot needed was a pretext to involve the Dragon Race, a surface-level justification that seemed plausible, and there wouldn't really be anyone going to investigate the truth.
Only because of Austin's awkward status did Rulga and the others dare to scheme.
If it were a Young Dragon with parents to care for, even if the adult parents weren't always watching, who would dare to provoke a tiger?
These underlying reasons were naturally not something Lambert could tell Ska. He was only informed of the truth behind Gross's mission by Rulga before their departure.
Initially, he truly believed Gross was going to assist the Blue Young Dragon.
Before leaving, according to Rulga's speculation, something unexpected might have occurred during Gross's mission to destroy the scene that entangled him at that place, possibly being trapped by those undead.
The agreement to let these humans join was also a form of backup evidence...
Gross and his team went for rescue, which ended in failure and resulted in them being trapped nearby by the undead. Given this much effort, how could the Young Dragon's death be suspected as their doing?
"Let's hope it really is that way, so we won't have to take such a tiring trip again."
Ska was unaware of the internal reasons, only expressing his thoughts.
They weren't exactly thrilled about this journey.
But thinking about the favorite by the Grand Duke named Edward, and considering the great influence this mission holds as humans and the outskirts of the Kawa Great Forest worked together, Ska knew it was best for him to make this trip.
They continued onward without any further conversation.
Half a month later.
"The destination should be about a hundred miles ahead, right? Didn't they say a long time ago that the undead calamity had broken out? How come there seems to be no sign of it?"
Initially, Austin had connected with the Tribe Alliance, voluntarily serving as one of the defensive strongholds, and the Tribe Alliance had sent people to investigate. They were familiar with the area where Austin resided.
The surroundings were indeed remote and not particularly abundant in resources.
Based on information from over six months ago, traces of undead were discovered approximately two hundred miles southwest of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Subsequently, many things happened within the Tribe Alliance, and at the crucial point of reaching agreements with humans, various open and hidden struggles prevented further contact.
Based on projections, the area around the Dragon Nest Tribe should have been corrupted by wastelands.
Even when miles away, the conspicuous sight of rising grey-green death energy should be evident, but currently, no abnormalities were noticed.
Something's off, very off.
Wildlife was also abound in the mountains and forests nearby, showing no signs of migration.
It seems as if the undead calamity was halted.
"Could it be that the undead issue was resolved? And what exactly happened with Gross?"
Lambert wondered in his heart, exchanging a glance with Ska; doubt was evident in both eyes.
At that moment.
BOOM!!!
A thunderous explosion sounded from the sky, echoing across the heavens, reverberating in every corner of the sky and earth.
At the same time, pitch-black and heavy as mountains, the dark clouds rolled in like a tidal wave from the horizon, covering more than half the sky and quickly overshadowing the heavens above.
In the astonished gazes of Lambert and Ska, the entire sky was instantly cloaked with dark clouds, dimming the light, and the continuous roar of thunder rolled across the sky.
In the next moment, it was as if a solar tide emerged from the horizon.
Massive as mountains, vast as an abyss, the overwhelming pressure suddenly descended from the sky, crushing down as if to collapse their very bodies.
"What is this! A domain! Could it possibly be Legendary?!!!"

chapters.title: Chapter 255 251: Overwhelming Prestige
chapters.content:
Within a hundred miles radius of the Dragon Nest Territory, most of the Beastman Tribes have been defeated and assimilated, yet at the territory's edge, some scattered small Beastman Tribes still roam.
With the rise of the Dragon Nest Tribe, they began to purge the Magic Beasts and Giant Beasts wandering the forest, intentionally slaying many ferocious Hunters, making the nearby regions somewhat safer.
Therefore, these small tribes, living by gathering, scattered around, can maintain survival, and life is not as difficult as before due to reduced surrounding dangers.
For these Beastman Tribes living by gathering and scattered around, Austin currently has no intention of sweeping in to assimilate them.
Firstly, the fields being cultivated near the Dragon Nest Tribe's station are expanding further out, making it hard to care for them, and naturally difficult to sustain a larger population.
Unless the first stronghold expansion succeeds, using it as the core to connect vast land areas, thereby significantly expanding the actual control range of the Dragon Nest Territory, making it safer to cultivate more lands.
Otherwise, at the current stage, the Dragon Nest Tribe does not intend to increase the population burden.
Thus, these small Beastman Tribes surviving at the edge of the Dragon Nest Territory still exist, but judging by the trend, it may not be long before these scattered small tribes are also absorbed and merged.
In fact, they have no complaints about possibly becoming part of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
That day, while these tribal Beastmen were gathering food around the edge of the territory, the entire sky suddenly darkened in an instant, leaving the creatures of the vast area dumbfounded.
"Huh! Why did the sky suddenly darken?"
In the hot summer, due to Kawa Great Forest's rainforest-like climate, a heavy rain occasionally is normal.
But, no matter how it rains, there are usually signs of cloud covering for a few minutes.
Yet now, the sun was shining bright one moment, and a moment later, the entire sky had turned dark; they had never seen such a sight.
"It's nothing; it's probably going to rain."
The other Beastmen gathering in the woods also sensed something amiss and felt somewhat uneasy.
At this moment,
BOOM!!!
Suddenly, a vast majesty descended from the sky, covering the whole world.
It was like the calm before the storm, but a thousand, ten thousand times stronger!
Indescribable fear swept through every Beastman's heart; those struggling at the bottom turned pale, instantly falling to the ground, trembling.
In this darkened area, the Goblins living at the bottom directly turned pale, foaming at the mouth, fainting to the ground.
Like an abyss, like a sea! Like earth, like heaven!
An indescribable terrifying might surged like an overwhelming tsunami, suppressing the entire world.
Those ordinary Beastmen living nearby were affected, but those directly targeted by this might, like Lambert and other Blood Claw Tribesmen, felt boundless fear surge up.
Beneath the vast heavenly might that dimmed the entire sky, Lambert and others felt as small as ants before a sky-piercing mountain, the pressure above them almost crushing them into pulp.
Some Beastmen with slightly lower strength turned paper pale; under this fearsome might, they seemed about to collapse!
"What's happening? A legend? Is it really a legend?!!!"
Looking at the dark firmament covered by overcast clouds, endless fear grew in Lambert's heart.
Things seemed to be evolving towards the most dangerous place.
At this moment, a sudden, vigorous rolling of clouds occurred in the darkened sky above, and under the influence of a strange power, layers gathered and converged, forming a massive dragon shadow at the sky's edge!
