The shadow was hideously ferocious, casting shadows that turned every corner of the world into a dark abyss!
The black clouds overturned the heavens, and that horrifying dragon shadow seemed to emerge as a demon from the depths of an abyss, clawing and flailing, filling the world's vision, its pitch-black pupils casting a gaze that made every Beastman feel as if they were falling into the endless abyss of hell.
Bzzt!
Electric light rolled and exploded between clouds, ripping through the dimness of the sky and earth.
In the dark heavens between, a whirlwind swept, lightning flashed and thunder roared, flying sand and rocks, as if ushering in an apocalyptic disaster.
That huge Cloud Dragon, formed from black clouds at the horizon, gazed upon them; within its dark eye sockets, there was no sign, yet every Beastman's back dripped with cold sweat, as if falling into icy waters.
"You, get out of my territory!"
A majestic, domineering voice, like thunder, roared through every corner of between heaven and earth, along with the whirlwind, as if stormy seas crashing against everything in the world, leaving everyone utterly astonished.
Whose voice?
From where was it coming, could it be the father of that Blue Young Dragon? Wasn't that one an orphan dragon? What happened to those guys like Gross?
For a moment, numerous doubts flashed through his mind, Lambert felt as if he had fallen into an ice cave.
"S-sir, we are from the Blood Claw Tribe of the Tribe Alliance, this time here to support His Highness Austin to resist the Undead..."
Amidst the terror, Lambert hurriedly spoke out, stuttering.
In normal times, with a little thought, Lambert would know the best reaction now is to concede, turn around, say nothing, report back to Rulga in the Tribe, and slowly investigate the situation.
But under this sudden pressure, with too many uncertainties already clouding his mind, he never thought about the situation where Gross might have failed in his act.
"Support? Hahaha, don't you know that Gross, that overconfident fool, came here intending to kill me and ended up getting killed himself? If you don't leave, then die!"
The voice, thunderous, echoed through sky and earth.
Lambert was utterly shocked, Gross actually died, and moreover, died challenging such a powerful existence?
Countless thoughts surged within his mind; before he could react,
Rumble!!!
Amidst the continuous roar of thunder, thousands of thunderbolts bloomed in the heavens, piercing light ripped the sky apart, illuminating the entire world, even lighting up the dragon shadow formed by the rolling black clouds.
Then, abruptly, a terrifying invisible suction force appeared in the sky, dragging the myriad thunderbolts towards the giant dragon's forefront in a gathering.
Countless thunderbolts gathered, electric sparks tore the sky, but under that suction, seemed like the dying struggle, and in the next moment, formed a glowing orb emitting intense light.
The blazing light illuminated the heavens and earth, and at the moment that orb of light appeared, the entire world fell silent.
As if all rolling thunder was engulfed and absorbed by that orb of light!
The terrifying silence descended abruptly!

chapters.title: Chapter 256 252 Divine Might
chapters.content:
"Not good!!!"
Austin and the nearby Ska instinctively leaped up, feeling the terror akin to falling into a dark abyss. Their legs suddenly burst forth with immense power, shattering the soil beneath their feet.
The two of them quickly fled in opposite directions, their figures transforming into fleeting shadows shooting away in an instant.
With incredible speed, they vanished in a flash, leaving the Beastman subordinates behind completely unable to react.
At the same time, in front of them, the empty space appeared like a calm lake starting to ripple. Visibly, the waves spread outwards, as if the void was trembling.
Before everyone could even express their horror, the next moment,
ZZzzz!
A piercing screeching sound spread out, and they saw circles of electric light tearing through the sky, as if the void was suddenly being crushed by some force.
Immediately, the orb of light suspended in the sky vanished mightily, appearing swiftly before their eyes as if it traversed space.
Pupils of countless eyes rapidly contracted, not having had a chance to show expressions of fear.
BOOM!!!
With earth-shaking and sky-rending explosions, violent blasts erupted, and dazzling light like an endlessly shining sun engulfed everything around.
The brilliant white light expanded, and everything in its path, whether person or object, instantly turned to ash.
A massive white light sphere slowly rose from the earth, accompanied by intense ground vibrations, causing the entire world to lose its color.
Simultaneously, terrifying thunderstorms erupted around the enormous light sphere, bolts of lightning spontaneously generating from the void, shooting out in all directions.
BOOM...
Within a radius of several hundred meters, thousands upon thousands of lightning bolts exploded like laser beams, with chunks of earth crumbling and vaporizing under the bombardment of arm-thick thunderbolts, and fiery flames soaring into the sky.
Thunder Attribute Rasengan!
Initially, Austin wanted to change the property within the Rasengan to a Thunder Attribute, aiming to achieve the might of spherical lightning from science of a previous era.
However, Austin later discovered that Thunder Attribute bursts, even slight changes would immediately destabilize the Rasengan due to internal explosions, causing imbalance and subsequent collapse of the Rasengan, making Thunder Attribute modifications impossible.
To mediate the power within, he had to infuse wind and water into the Rasengan, forming a super invincible world-crushing compressed Wind-Water-Thunder Rasengan that amalgamated three attribute powers.
But now, with Austin's growth, and subsequently stimulating Thunder Law within his bloodline, his control power over thunder has increased greatly after constant understanding of Thunder Law.
Now, Austin can condense a Thunder Attribute Nature-changed Thunder Rasengan.
Although it doesn't produce the complete "disappearance" effect where matter attacks from existence like spherical lightning, eliminating everything at a rule level.
But this pure thunder destruction is already sufficient!
The Thunder Attribute Rasengan compressed from thousands of thunderbolts, its internal Thunder Liquid temperature is several times greater than the sun's surface, with its sheer heat enough to vaporize all matter nearby.
At the moment of explosive impact, the internal constraint of the Rasengan collapses, causing countless lightning strikes to shoot outward.
This terrifying explosion and thunder rampage persisted for quite some time, until the vast thunder within was exhausted, the light sphere rose from the ground vanished, and the intense vibrations ceased.
Billowing dust rose to the sky, covering half the firmament.
The mountain range where the team was previously located was directly shorn off by the burst of terrifying power, the surrounding earth already bombarded into an unevenly surfaced pit, with massive cracks spreading around like a spider web.
At the very center, molten dark-red soil flowed, emitting scorching light.
At the core, the soil even reached a degree of crystallization.
The smoke gradually dissipated.
It's over, everything is over.
Under such terrifying bombardment, even the soil within a hundred-meter radius suffered such disaster-like calamity, not to mention the gathered Blood Claw elite Beastmen and those humans?
Even though some stronger elite reacted at the last moment, fleeing in all directions.
But under such widespread bombardment, where could they escape to?
In the end, those who survived would likely be less than one in ten!
After some time, a large, pitch-black hand suddenly emerged from a pile of dirt, followed by a completely blackened shadow painstakingly crawling out of the earth.
"Cough cough...that damned Gross...cough cough...didn't expect this to be the ultimate outcome...that Blue Young Dragon...forget it, let's go back first..."
The scorched figure kept coughing, blood trickling from the mouth.
It was indeed Austin, the one who fled first.
In the moment before the Thunder Attribute Rasengan exploded, he narrowly escaped in the nick of time, evading disaster, but unfortunately was struck repeatedly by the spreading thunder strikes, severely injuring him.
This loss was incredibly grievous.
The enemy wasn't even confronted, yet the entire force was almost wiped out.
Gross and his people most likely all died.
Under the previous attack, now it's estimated that only one or two of his subordinates can barely be found alive, but given the current danger, Austin still resolved to retreat quickly.
He wasn't interested in the survival of Ska and those humans either.
The priority now is to run, the farther the better, as he wasn't willing to risk facing a second attack.
The Blood Claw Tribe's elite suffered two complete annihilations, even the tribe's first warrior was lost, causing severe damage to the tribe.
In future days, it likely won't be easy.
While the completely scorched Austin left behind his critically injured subordinates in the ruins and fled rapidly outward, disappearing into the distance.
At this moment, atop a certain peak near the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Austin also breathed a sigh of relief, the obscured flicker of mysterious light in his wide-open mouth was swallowed into his body, gradually disappearing.
Simultaneously, the vast and imposing presence around the world dissipated, and the clouds above scattered.
Thunderbolt Divine Sword!
The grand spectacle seen by Austin earlier, akin to the arrival of a legend, was precisely the result of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword nurtured in Austin's realm prototype revealing a shred of power!

chapters.title: Chapter 257 253 Growth
chapters.content:
After over two months of honing and accumulating power, with daily advancements in nurturing, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within Austin had amassed an incredibly immense force.
The sword momentum, suppressed for over two months, barely revealed a glimpse before it triggered earth-shaking changes.
An extremely powerful pressure swept across every inch of space between heaven and earth like a tsunami tide, resulting from the aura leaked from the long-nurtured Thunderbolt Divine Sword.
The power contained within that sword, after Austin's continuous accumulation of strength, was comparable to legendary!
"The power of this trump card seems to be even stronger than I imagined..."
Feeling the thunderbolt divine sword constantly nurtured within, its bloodline connection with him, Austin pondered silently in his heart.
The long sword, transformed by thunder, had gained a legendary aura after integrating a strand of the Thunder Law, and combined with the continuous suppression and accumulation, even Austin's dragon might was merged into it as nourishment.
The divine sword thus honed, in conjunction with the embryonic form of a domain he explored after his significant increase in strength, had a power not inferior to legendary.
Within the embryonic domain, a mere thought could change the celestial phenomena within. Under Austin's extremely precise control, the layers of rolling dark clouds formed as if a sky-swallowing dragon, together with the power emanated by the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, made one believe that a legendary dragon hid here.
"After this, there's probably no need to worry too much about the troubles from the Blood Claw Tribe."
A Thunder Rasengan from afar nearly wiped out the majority of Blood Claw elites led by Lambert. Coupled with the previous elites led by Gross, the Blood Claw Tribe was now severely weakened.
Moreover, with the earlier shown might, comparable to legendary power, Lambert would report Austin's strength to the Blood Claw high command upon his return, and the Blood Claw Tribe surely wouldn't dare to persist obstinately.
Furthermore, considering Gross's strength, the weakened Blood Claw Tribe could no longer pose much trouble to Austin, who had seen a substantial boost in strength.
Even without his involvement, the current overall strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe would suffice to fend off intruding enemies.
"However, though it may intimidate the surroundings, after this incident, there's not much chance of concealing one's strength anymore."
The prowess of Austin and his clan followers will undoubtedly spread with Lambert's defeat, and one can only wonder how the Blood Claw Tribe will eventually end up.
With this thought fleeting through his mind, Austin discarded it and flew towards the Dragon Nest Tribe's territory.
Regardless of the response from the Tribe Alliance, with his power and that of the current beastman clan followers, even exposed under the spotlight, they possess substantial confidence.
After all, the entire Tribe Alliance does not have a legendary figure.
If there were a legendary-level presence, the countless beasts scattered across the border would have long been unified.
Upon returning to the Dragon Nest, Austin's routine remained unchanged.
The beastmen in the tribe revered the mighty momentum that suddenly erupted from the sky, and upon learning it was caused by Austin, he became enshrouded in mystique among the beastmen.
Clearly possessing an adorable appearance, yet when erupting, it was like a volcanic explosion, echoing through the heavens.
Austin didn't pay much mind to the discussions and admiration arising from the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The entire clan tribe has already pledged loyalty under his leadership, and more reverence is merely icing on the cake.
The affairs of the tribe seldom require his involvement, so Austin continued into a state of honing the divine sword within.
By comprehending the Law of Thunder, his control over thunder greatly increased, reaching a level where he could cast a pure Thunder Rasengan, bringing him immense joy.
Especially after witnessing the power of the Thunder Attribute Rasengan, like a Thunderous Paste Lightning Ball forming under high temperature and pressure, melting and evaporating the soil, crystallizing rocks, its power exceeded that of the Wind Attribute Rasengan.
Tasting the benefits, Austin naturally would not give up on introspecting the Thunder Law, now progressing a bit slowly, but advancing daily, one day he would succeed in understanding and autonomously mastering the Thunder Law.
Concurrently, as the first round of spring tilling in the Dragon Nest Tribe concluded, the climate across the Kawa Great Forest adjusted over more than ten days, entering a true midsummer phase.
The entire forest land was vibrant with life, countless beasts roaming the mountains and forests.
Dragon Nest Beastmen, besides their hunts, began systematically clearing some nearby dangerous areas, obtaining numerous magic resource production points.
The magical resources yielded from these production points mostly went into Austin's belly, serving as his growth resources.
Within his bloodline, after awakening a trace of pinnacle-level law, Austin's bodily shackles seemingly unlocked.
The abundant magic resources entering his belly caused no indigestion. All magical resources were thoroughly consumed, steadily raising his level to Gold Middle Tier under massive magical resource infusions, with physical strength continually increasing, as if no bottleneck existed ahead.
Initially, when Austin decided to gather the beastman race and establish a tribe, he sought revenge against the Blood Wolves who bullied him when he was weak, while also intending to collect growth resources for himself once the clan tribe matured.
The magical resources required for dragon growth were enormous, and such cumbersome searches would be challenging for Austin alone to amass sufficient resources in a short time. His initial reason for gathering the clan followers was also to have tribe growth eventually feed back into himself.
Now, one of the original purposes of establishing the Dragon Nest Tribe has been fulfilled.
With the tribe's strength greatly enhanced, the Dragon Nest Legion is now capable of clearing those dangerous areas, turning each into safe resource production bases for magical resources, while also providing certain protective benefits from the gradually strengthening beastmen in the tribe.
"Who would've thought that in just a few years, one could develop to such an extent."
Regarding the rapid development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin couldn't help but feel the emotion.
A few years back, there were only seven and a half Kobolds under his command, danger was omnipresent all around, and even a slightest mistake could lead to ruin.
Who could have imagined that starting from those few Kobolds, the civilization seeds brought by Austin from his past life would be planted among them, took root, germinated, and spread, reaching today's scale in just a few years?
Even facing the top Blood Claw Tribe gathered at the border poses no fear.
No one expected, not even Austin who personally led everything, could have imagined this.

chapters.title: Chapter 258 254 Reaction
chapters.content:
Border region, the headquarters of the Tribe Alliance.
As the human forces within the Border Great Wall allied with the Beastman Tribe Alliance within the Bloody Great Wall, vast amounts of grain supplies were transported out of the Great Wall to serve as military provisions for the Beastman Tribe Alliance, causing the already grain-short beastmen to cheer loudly.
At the same time, the entire Tribe Alliance was fully equipped and ready, having prepared for a counterattack war.
Of course, their combat target this time was no longer the humans on the Bloody Great Wall, but the mutated undead from behind, who were the culprits that forced them to abandon their ancestral land and migrate.
The arrival of the first batch of grain unequivocally informed everyone that the human forces on the Bloody Border had already allied with the Tribe Alliance on the periphery of the Kawa Great Forest.
For the high echelons of the Tribe Alliance and humans suddenly reaching a reconciliation agreement, the lower-level beastmen were utterly shocked.
One moment they were in a fight to the death, the next they reconciled and united.
This swift reversal left all the lower-level beastmen somewhat at a loss.
However, as time went on, the undead army from behind finally spread forth, and some news about the undead also began circulating, enlightening some in the Beastman Tribe Alliance who considered themselves smart.
Humans, if they did not want to directly face the endless undead army that followed, supporting them was undoubtedly the most beneficial decision.
As the news of the spreading undead calamity began to spread, the initial excitement from the arrival of the first batch of supplies had quietly dissipated, replaced by greater pressure in the atmosphere.
Just as the beastman tribes were preparing to mobilize their troops and head back to counter the undead army.
Suddenly, the severely injured Lambert returned to the Blood Claw Tribe in a disheveled state.
He was alone, and none of the elite soldiers he took with him made it back.
The incident, and the disastrous defeat of the Blood Claw Tribe, was quickly spread throughout the Tribe Alliance with Lambert's return in short order.
"Have you heard? Those fools from Blood Claw went to provoke a young dragon, but unexpectedly, there was a legendary backer behind it, and the legendary figure personally took action, resulting in a heavy loss for those guys from Blood Claw."
"I knew it, you wonder how those guys from Blood Claw had such nerve. That's the Dragon Race we're talking about! Aren't they afraid of the Dragon Race causing them trouble?"
"Who knows, maybe they thought as long as they acted secretly, no one would know."
For a time, the entire Tribe Alliance was abuzz with discussions.
They weren't clear on the specifics, as the heavily injured Lambert went into recovery immediately after returning.
But soon, the detailed information was delivered by some Blood Claw elite who were lucky enough to escape and some humans, causing a great stir throughout the Tribe Alliance.
Legendary, it was actually a Legendary!
Although Austin's true form did not appear in that strike, just from the sheer force of it, there was a high possibility that a Legendary was involved!
And after this event, many beastmen realized that with the Blood Claw Tribe consecutively losing most of their elite twice, their strength had been severely impaired.
In large tribes like the Blood Claw Tribe, although the total population was over several hundred thousand, the number of elite extraordinary beastmen would definitely not exceed two thousand.
Moreover, those fools from Blood Claw even provoked a Legendary, let's hope those powerful figures do not intend to demolish them completely, or else the entire Blood Claw Tribe will surely be exterminated.
As such, the entire Tribe Alliance was engulfed in intrigue.
Meanwhile, the Blood Claw Tribe made no response.
With the severe damage to the Blood Claw Tribe, some information about Austin also began to circulate throughout the Tribe Alliance camps.
"It's said that young dragon rose in just a few years, quickly gathering a considerable clan force. Those guys from Blood Claw probably saw that young dragon struggling to survive and thought it was just a lone orphan dragon growing in the wild, only to end up breaking their teeth."
"To reach such a level, that young dragon is probably not simple, its appearance must be savage."
"You're right. I've heard that young dragon has a terrifying and fierce appearance, its scales clearly defined, its body agile, its wide wings almost covering the sky, and its gaze shoots out an imposing, awe-inspiring power, extremely frightening."
"It's said that any beastman would be intimidated by that young dragon's fierce appearance, not daring to look up directly at the majesty of the heavens."
"Truly impressive."
In their discussions, the beastmen already pictured Austin's ominously fierce appearance in their minds.
As the information spread, Austin and his clan's forces began to come into view in the Beastman Alliance at the border, with his reputation starting to spread in a smaller scope.
A burgeoning reputation.
Strong individuals inherently have the right to be remembered, especially when they emerge as a new powerful force in the eyes of the beastmen using the Blood Claw Tribe as a stepping stone.
Being exposed to the outside world has both advantages and disadvantages.
The advantage is that, unless there are other special reasons, there wouldn't be blind enemies challenging you anymore.
The disadvantage is being exposed to numerous gazes, preventing you from hiding and leveling up until reaching great success, and in future schemes, the Dragon Nest Tribe will inevitably be drawn into one whirlpool after another, willing or not.
...
Austin, far away hundreds of kilometers away, naturally could not know the reactions of the Beastman Tribe Alliance gathered at the Bloody Border.
Luckily, the distance was far enough, otherwise, upon seeing Austin's appearance, those border beastmen would have been shocked to their core.
Ever since a single Thunder Rasengan obliterated the elite from the Blood Claw Tribe led by Lambert, Austin knew that the threat from the other side of the Tribe Alliance was minimal.
Unless the entire Tribe Alliance united to attack at once, only the remaining Blood Claw Tribe on the border would pose no threat to Austin and his subordinate forces.
With Austin's strength significantly enhanced, he now had the confidence to confront those super-large tribes on the border.
The tremendous destructive power generated by a Thunder Rasengan a hundred miles outside the Dragon Nest Tribe was one of his sources of confidence.
At this time, with the Blood Claw Tribe retreating, the undead calamity from the southwest also halted, and even the vast hordes of undead in the wasteland were depleted.
The two major threats that had been looming over the Dragon Nest Tribe a year ago were now mostly unable to cause much concern, with the sense of danger dissipating.
The situation, for the most part, returned to a stable state,
seemingly ready to enter a phase of peaceful development.
However, Austin hadn't enjoyed peace for long before a piece of news forced him to mobilize once more.
In the first base established earlier, a large army of elves suddenly appeared, surrounding the entire fortress of the first base.
The conflict escalated!

chapters.title: Chapter 259 225 Siege
chapters.content:
A few days ago,
somewhere within a secret realm.
The sky was high and the clouds leisurely, a gentle breeze softly blew, and everywhere you looked, the entire secret realm space was peaceful.
A light wind swept through the mountains and forests, causing the wild grass on the plains to bow as if forming wave upon wave, and blooming flowers opened in the air, with a faint floral fragrance permeating the atmosphere.
This was a world full of flowers, grass, and trees, a peaceful natural space.
Unlike in the Kawa Great Forest, where resources were fought over and even trees battled to the death for sunlight.
If the outside world was a brutal arena of natural evolution, where the weak were meat for the strong, then this secret realm space was like a garden woodland where the god of love had descended.
Even the breeze in the air was peaceful.
This was the secret realm of the Elf Kingdom.
Yet at this moment, around the towering, sky-scraping mysterious tree whose branches spread out to obscure half of the sky and grow out into clumps of forest, the elves living in the entire secret realm were gathering.
Tens of thousands of elves gathered around the branches of the giant tree. These elves, who had lived among trees since childhood, stood scattered like birds on the winding giant branches, watching in solemnity the Elf Queen with long flowing golden hair, skin as white as jade, and a natural crown on her head, standing atop the tree.
At this moment, the population of the entire Elf Kingdom was gathered here.
The air was filled with a heavy, oppressive atmosphere.
This oppressive atmosphere shattered the previous peace of the Elf Kingdom.
"Subjects, evil has once again reached our doorstep, seeking to forever annihilate the followers of nature. After a millennium of evasion, it is inevitable to face the final reckoning. Since this is so, let us take up our weapons and deliver one last counterattack to those evildoers; the natural radiance shall never perish!"
The delicate Elf Queen raised her green scepter, emitting tiny green lights that spread like fireflies.
She gazed down at her subjects standing on the branches, her voice mournful, filled with a blood-weeping, despairing, and resolute cry that everyone could hear!
"For nature!"
"For nature!"
The elves standing on the trees below shouted loudly, and within the borders of the once peaceful Elf Kingdom, a desperate fighting spirit rose to the sky.
It felt like knowing you are nearing the end, but still determined to take a bite out of the enemy with desperation and ferocity.
The sound waves surged to the sky, shaking the leaves of the giant Mother Tree.
The Elf Queen's gaze swept over each of her subjects, old people, children, women... her eyes full of sadness.
Having fled for so long, they finally could not escape the fate of final extinction...
The Elf Queen's delicate face showed a heart-wrenching despair.
"Let's set out! Even if it means death, let us give those evil ones an unforgettable lesson!"
Her clear yet resolute voice echoed throughout the space of the Elf Kingdom.
...
The First Stronghold, within the newly established town camping site.
At this moment, outside the town camp that was under construction, tens of thousands of elves surrounded the outside densely.
The air was heavy, and war was about to break out.
"Have these elves gone mad?"
Within the First Stronghold, Dark Elf Adinlek stood upon the city wall built from rows of giant trees, frowning as he looked at the densely packed elves outside.
It was an all-out mobilization!
This was the first reaction of the Dark Elf upon seeing the external elf army, not only adult elves but even elders and children had taken up arms and gone to the battlefield.
Wasn't it just a partial skirmish before? How did it suddenly turn into this?
Moreover, the state of these elves seemed a bit off.
"Indeed, they've gone mad!"
Former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory also stood beside him, gazing heavily at the elf army outside, and said in a deep voice.
Such an all-out mobilization scene, this approach of everyone from young to old going to battle, that kind of momentum that seems like right before death.
Everything seemed utterly inexplicable.
Weren't we just choosing a spot to establish a stronghold?
Suddenly, a group of elves appeared to obstruct us, and during the tree-clearing process, these damn guys harassed us incessantly, but who knew they would act as if we had some deep-seated blood feud with them?
"Captain Gory, do you know what's going on with these guys?"
Although Adinlek internally harbored dissatisfaction with this companion who often snatched merits, outwardly, they got along well enough. Seeing Gory wanting to say something but stopping, he asked.
Elves, seldom seen by people for millennia, were only occasionally mentioned in some ancient records by Dark Elves.
In the Central Earth Human World, there might be more rumors and records related to elves, in some remote places, there also seemed to exist living Elf Realms.
"Elves are faithful to nature, extremely devoted to the growth and care of the natural environment. Perhaps our recent tree-cutting activities angered them, but..."
To clear a safe area and obtain enough building materials, large areas of forest land around the stronghold town were felled.
Looking out, the previously lush forest plains became a devastated mess.
This, perhaps, was the reason for angering the elves.
However, there was a sentence Gory had not spoken.
Perhaps massively destroying the forest environment indeed angered the elves, but it should never have caused such an all-out mobilization scene today, that kind of situation more like a mortal feud, as if knowing they were about to die and deciding to make a desperate final counterattack against the enemy.
But, was there a profound bitter feud between the Dragon Nest Tribe and the elves?
Vaguely, Gory felt something was amiss.
Probably not much.
After all, his understanding of elves was merely hearsay from minstrels; he had never truly witnessed elves.
The Dark Elf also felt something was amiss if that was all it took to erupt into such a life-and-death war, it would be too unreasonable.
"Let's forget about that for now. Secure defenses first. Since they've dared to initiate war, they must be prepared for complete annihilation!"
Within the First Stronghold, with large numbers of old and weak Beastman militia withdrawn to the garrison, most of the forces within the stronghold consisted of the Dragon Nest Tribe, a full total of eight thousand.
A well-trained military formation, excellent equipment, combined with a considerable number of Beastman Officers and Junior Officers, and they were defending the city.
Looking at it this way, it didn't seem like they would lose.
Elf forces surrounded a large number of Dragon Nest Beastmen inside the stronghold,
The elves did not act, nor did the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Before long, agitation arose among the elf forces, creating a path.
The Elf Queen and her surrounding guards walked through the path, standing in the midst of the army.
The Queen, with her exquisite face, raised her scepter high and commanded loudly:
"Attack!"

chapters.title: Chapter 260 226: Tug-of-War
chapters.content:
The final remnants of power in the Elf Kingdom began war with the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Outside the stronghold, Dragon Nest Beastmen and Elves engaged in fierce combat.
The Elf army seemed crazed, surging like tides, each Elf Warrior appearing indifferent to their own life, rushing forward desperately to inflict wounds on the Dragon Nest Beastmen, as if harboring deep-seated hatred.
The war began with intense close-quarters carnage.
The Beastman Legion of the Dragon Nest Tribe were shocked by the enemy's madness, their momentum momentarily suppressed.
However, their usual excellent training kept the Beastman Legion closely knit, raising a Long Spear Array to tightly combat the enemy, relying on the surrounding walls to maintain the defensive line, showing no signs of collapse.
"Kill!"
"Kill them!"
An Elf, eyes bloodshot with rage, rushed forward, disregarding the sharp Bronze Long Spear array, throwing a long spear in hand towards the Beastmen ahead.
Thud!
The spear pierced the eye socket of a Beastman, instantly penetrating the heavily armored Dragon Nest soldier, who fell to the ground bleeding profusely, creating a vacancy in the dense Long Spear Array, quickly filled by the backup troupe.
But the Elf met a grim fate too; before landing, several sharp Bronze Long Spears pierced him, blood splattering.
Even in death, the Elf stared at the Beastmen with blood-red eyes full of hatred.
On the battlefield akin to a meat grinder, the majority of the Elf army displayed such madness.
However, most of the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion wore Bronze heavy armor, making it hard to inflict significant damage unless hitting weak spots. The Elf army's casualties were much higher than those of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Though their momentum faltered, the Beastmen, armed exquisitely, stood like iron walls on the defensive line, causing the Elf army to crash one after another into a wall of blood.
On the battlefield, fierce aura rose as arrows fell from the sky, Long Spear Array stirred, blood spattered, corpses sprawled across the ground.
In this iron and fire clash, many lives perished amidst the warfare.
"Gale Wave Triple Kill!"
Rip!
Gory swung a Bronze Great Sword from above, the sword splitting into three shadowy figures in the air, with an unstoppable momentum, seeming to tear through the air.
Suddenly, three streaks of white light slashed across, with razor-sharp cutting power, sweeping in fan shape in front, extending over ten meters in range.
The Elves blocking in front were almost instantaneously felled or harmed as the three streaks of light swept past, sent flying, limbs severed by the sharp energy, blood spraying everywhere, clearing a large area ahead, riddled with shattered Elf bodies.
Not long ago, former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory gained the Gale Wave cultivation method through merits earned since joining the Dragon Nest Tribe, developing the powerful Triple Kill combat technique in the cultivation process combined with his combat experience.
Using it for the first time in battle yielded such remarkable success.
Despite obtaining the coveted Secret Techniques, Gory was not yet ready to leave.
For the Secret Techniques circulating in the Dragon Nest Tribe comprised six forms, each as effective as Gale Wave, and he had only learned Gale Wave, with five forms yet to be mastered.
Moreover, Gory had a lingering thought that if the Dragon Nest Tribe continued expanding at this pace, perhaps in less than ten years, it might grow to rule the entire Kawa Great Forest, establishing a kingdom.
Should he gamble on this?
Gory remained undecided, thus planned to stay for a while longer in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
At least, he needed to master the remaining five forms of the six forms.
"What's the matter with these damned fellows?"
The battlefield chaos soon dragged Gory's mind back to reality; seeing the Elf army charging fiercely again, Gory couldn't help but curse.
The longer the battle lasted, the more inexplicable it seemed to Gory.
Early in the first stronghold's establishment, Beastmen encounters with Elves led to conflict.
Due to the inability to locate the Elf's lair, only passive retaliation was possible.
Repeated conflicts weren't intense; many were harmed but fatalities were few, maintaining a low-intensity skirmish.
At that time, it was thought little of, by Austin, the Dragon Nest Tribe's Lord, included.
Establishing strongholds and claiming new territories naturally warranted retaliation from former territory owners.
Whether other large Beastman Tribes, powerful Lords of Magical Beasts, or Demon Beasts..... before stronghold establishment, Austin and the Dragon Nest Tribe leadership were prepared.
The surprise was merely due to the opponent being Elves.
However, no one anticipated the Elf's counterattack would suddenly escalate to such a degree.
Lose the territorial dispute and move elsewhere to continue development was the usual response.
Yet these Elves seemed to harbor mortal enmity against the Dragon Nest Tribe, unyielding in their vendetta.
"Do Beastmen and Elves have some deep-seated animosity?"
At initial contacts and conflicts, meeting Elves had similarly bloodied eyes, like seeing a father's killer.
Perhaps, Elves and Beastmen were indeed mortal enemies; otherwise, this situation wouldn't occur.
Vague suspicions brewed within Gory's heart.
However, how things actually were possibly awaited post-war outcomes, only determined after defeating the attacking Elves.
Reflecting on a strategy he previously proposed, Gory's lips curled slightly.
It remained unknown, after following his plan and defeating the Elf army, how great his accolades might be...
But patience was essential, as it wasn't yet the optimal moment.
"Slay! Exterminate these damned dwarfish creatures!"
Gory roared, gripping his Bronze Great Sword, charging first into battle with the Elf army.
Seeing their superior so valorous, the surrounding subordinates responded as if invigorated, charging forward yelling.
This battle's duration was uncertain, with the Elf army crazily assaulting the stronghold while the Dragon Nest Beastman army steadfastly defended like the Iron Wall Great Wall.
The battlefield seemed a meat grinder, grinding flesh back and forth.
As time elapsed, both sides showed fatigue due to the fierce struggle, the Elf army also exhausted from heavy losses.
At this moment,
"The moment has come, cavalry charge!"

chapters.title: Chapter 261 227 End
chapters.content:
The tug-of-war on the outskirts of the stronghold exhausted soldiers from both sides greatly.
Fighting to kill requires stamina, even for the bloodthirsty Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers.
In the blood-and-flesh tug-of-war, both Dragon Nest Beastmen and Elves reached an almost critical limit.
The Elf army, due to more casualties in the previous tug-of-war, found themselves at a disadvantage, with energy particularly depleted.
Just at this moment, the backup troops hidden by the Dragon Nest Tribe finally moved out!
Years ago, Austin divided the Dragon Nest Tribe's military into three corps by category: cavalry, infantry, and archers.
In the defense battles, infantry and archers played the largest roles; the previous tug-of-war was mainly led by infantry and archers, with the cavalry not yet seen.
The cavalry was hidden inside Stronghold City, holding back and waiting for the right moment.
In previous patrol conflicts, battles between Dragon Nest Beastmen and Elves hadn't see the cavalry because patrols in the mountains and forests weren't well suited for cavalry members.
But this didn't mean there were no cavalry within the first stronghold.
To maintain the transport link between the first stronghold and the Dragon Nest Tribe's base, thousands of Centaur cavalry often patrolled between the two places, ensuring the safety of transportation routes.
Conveniently, before the Elf army's siege, the Centaur cavalry had just escorted a convoy of supplies and were resting within the stronghold.
In the previous siege battles, the role of Centaur cavalry wasn't significant during defense.
With experience from the Human Worlds, Gory suggested keeping the cavalry hidden within the city, preserving strength, and waiting for the Elven army to wane and prepare to retreat, suddenly attacking to catch them off guard.
Additionally, the transport bulls had been organized, equipped with Bronze Armor, controlled by Dragon Nest Beastmen warriors, enough to assemble heavy cavalry.
Due to the intentional training by the Dragon Nest Tribe, the entire tribe had over two thousand adult bulls, being the pivotal transport force connecting the bases and strongholds.
Years before, Austin had trained heavy-armored cow cavalry, though training was discontinued due to cost-effectiveness issues.
Yet after that attempt, Beastmen gained some protocol for organizing heavy-armored cow cavalry.
Thus, two thousand cow cavalry plus one thousand Centaur cavalry assembled within the first stronghold, silently awaiting the right moment.
Three thousand cavalry silently hid within the stronghold.
Now, the time had come.
Following the "cavalry charge" command, the gates of the stronghold opened with a roar, kicking up clouds of dust.
And then,
Boom boom boom....
Continuous, low thunderous sounds followed, with the ground softly trembling.
Under the astonished gazes of the withdrawing Elven army, the Dragon Nest Beastman legion opened a great channel, and with rolling thunder, cavalry like a tidal flood approached, carrying the power to trample and consume everything!
Boom!
Caught off guard, the Elven army couldn't respond as the surging cavalry charged forth, directly colliding with them.
The front-line Elves were hit by the tsunami-like cavalry, churning them into minced flesh instantly.
Like a mountain torrent, the charging cavalry force was unstoppable for the smaller Elves.
In just a brief moment, the Elven army was directly pierced by the cavalry from end to end, like a cake sliced into two parts, unable to connect.
On the split road, bodies intertwined, blood and flesh flowed, a scene of carnage.
Now, the cavalry that had pierced through the Elf army turned around, showing their fierce claws to the remaining Elf remnants.
"It's over!"
In the middle of the army, the Elf Queen's face paled, her legs almost powerless to keep her standing.
At the moment the cavalry appeared, she knew this war was thoroughly lost, and she and her subjects were doomed.
Before the war broke out, there was still a sliver of hope.
But now, the last bit of hope shattered completely.
"Ancestors, is this the end of the Elven Kingdom's glory..."
The Elf Queen muttered pale-faced, distracted.
...
As the sun set, the war drew to a close.
The sunset was as bloody, painting the sky and earth in red.
The whole stronghold was devastated, and the outside ground piled with bodies, blood pooled into rivers, staining the land.
The Beastmen quietly walked across the battlefield, tidy corpses one by one.
Crows flew overhead, making bizarre cries.
This inexplicable war began with an Elf attack, ending with their defeat.
In the final cavalry charge slaughter, the previous tens of thousands of Elven troops ended with half fleeing, the remaining either dead or captured.
Not long afterward,
Whoosh whoosh!
The wind whipped up in the sky, bringing along a dark cloud that quickly covered.
Austin's enormous figure descended from the sky, and around came the Dragon Nest Beastmen high command who organized the battlefield.
"Was I too late..."
Looking at the surrounding scene, such a thought flashed in Austin's mind as he kept his face impassive.
After receiving the urgent report, Austin immediately flew over to the stronghold, only to find he missed the war after all.
Yet it seemed right, it appeared his side has won.
"First tidy up the battlefield, take care of the wounded, tally the damage, and then report to me."
Seeing Rodney, Dark Elf, Gory, and others approach, Austin instructed directly.
With Austin holding the fort, the stronghold naturally became much safer, urging the Dragon Nest Beastmen to quicken the battlefield clean-up.
In the end, from the tally, in this battle Dragon Nest Beastmen suffered 731 deaths and 2,123 injuries.
This death rate almost reached a ratio of ten to one.
It can be said this was the highest death toll since Dragon Nest Tribe was established.
However, in comparison, the Elf death toll was greater.
Due to the sharp weapons of Dragon Nest Beastmen and the final cavalry charge, many Elf bodies were shapeless and difficult to identify, unable to count accurately, but rough estimates were at least over ten thousand killed.
Almost ten times the Dragon Nest Beastmen casualties.
Moreover, four to five thousand Elves were captured, with more fleeing and difficult to trace.
Few captives were due to the Elves' desperate resistance.
But the more crucial reason was during their retreat; the Elf Queen suddenly brought out a mysterious Divine Artifact, creating a gigantic Wind Barrier, blocking Dragon Nest Beastmen's pursuit, securing enough time for numerous Elves to flee.
The loss so great made Austin clearly somewhat angry upon arriving.
Yet he knew the Beastmen had done well in this war.
Currently, the most important thing was to pry open the mouths of those captured Elves, to find out what all this was about!

chapters.title: Chapter 262 228 Remnants of the Kingdom
chapters.content:
Conflict and war are not uncommon in this barbaric forest region.
Wanting to occupy more territories, wanting to plunder more resources, and wanting to gain more, so that the Clan Tribe can strengthen more quickly, makes conflicts with other forces absolutely unavoidable.
The Dragon Nest Tribe has developed to its current state, having gone through countless wars, relying on the strategy of sustaining itself through war, which has allowed the entire tribe to expand to the extent it is today in a short period.
It was expected that the expansion of the first stronghold would meet with backlash from the local forces.
However, the behavior of these Elves was beyond the expectations of all Beastmen, including Austin.
Austin was eager to understand why the Elves made such a choice.
After all, in this barbaric world where only the strongest survive, isn't it quite normal to submit or flee if one cannot win? So why fight to the death?
Furthermore, these Elves appeared mysteriously and disappeared just as mysteriously, with no trace at all, leaving the Dragon Nest Beastmen unable to find any clues. Where exactly have they hidden their lair?
Soon, after interrogating the Dragon Nest Beastmen, a result was quickly obtained.
Among the thousands of captured Elves, not all were tough; some were willing to disclose information.
Just as Austin and others suspected, their entire Elf Kingdom held a grudge against the Beastmen, a deep-seated blood feud.
Long, long ago, perhaps a thousand years ago.
They lived in the central core of the Kawa Great Forest, with a population in the hundreds of millions, living in peace and happiness, establishing a paradise in the resource-rich core of the Kawa Great Forest.
The Elves cherished peace and loved nature; it was a peaceful country, a utopian paradise.
But then, a thousand years ago, peace was shattered.
The Beastmen launched a rebellion that swept through the entire kingdom, ultimately reducing the kingdom to ruins, and the Elf Kingdom that virtually ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest was thus destroyed.
The remnants scattered, fleeing in disarray under the pursuit of the Beastmen to the borders, barely escaping the hunt, and eventually hiding and settling nearby.
The once-prosperous kingdom was destroyed overnight, leaving their families shattered and people dead, with the remaining population being pursued thousands of miles by those Beastmen, their family and friends having fallen under the weapons of the pursuers, and the blood feud between them being indelible.
The Beastmen were powerful, and given the current weakened state of the Elf Kingdom, talking about revenge was impossible; they could only survive, struggling to recover their Primordial Qi.
The remaining Elves relocated here, relying on a "Mother Tree" snatched during the kingdom's destruction to prop up a vast Secret Realm Space, and established a Secret Realm in the vast forest for survival.
This Secret Realm is a space supported by all the trees in this area of the forest, and once the trees in this area are felled, the entire Secret Realm will ultimately be exposed.
When the Dragon Nest Beastmen suddenly established a stronghold nearby, the Elves naturally suspected the arrival of their great enemy.
Before the Elves could confirm the situation, as soon as the Dragon Nest Beastmen began building camps, felling large numbers of trees and undermining the foundation of the Elf Kingdom's Secret Realm Space, they were sure the enemy had arrived.
For the Forest Land is their base, so it must be an enemy familiar with their details who discovered their hiding place, meticulously clearing the forest trees.
No Beastman Tribe in the Barbaric Zone could possibly possess such a well-equipped and well-trained army of thousands unless it was traitors from the core area of the Beastmen.
Thus, a do-or-die war naturally erupted.
"Is this truly an unprovoked disaster?"
After hearing the reasons from the Elven prisoners, Austin could only feel speechless.
As the confessions of the Elves spread, the relentless, vengeful combativeness displayed by the Elves in this war was also explained.
It turns out they regarded us as their old enemy.
Building cities, cutting trees, and numerous well-trained Beastman troops made the Elves, who lived enclosed in a single space, believe that the Dragon Nest Beastmen were their life-and-death foes pursuing them.
According to the Elven prisoners, the seed of their only "Mother Tree" was already planted and could not be moved, and once they lost the Mother Tree, all the Elves' future would spiral into despair and destruction.
They couldn't escape, nor could they run.
With no escape, naturally, they must fight back desperately, leaving a profound lesson for their enemies even in death.
"Even though this war was caused by a mere misunderstanding, the conflict with the Elf Kingdom was bound to happen. The tribe needs to establish strongholds nearby and prepare for development, which inevitably involves felling the nearby forest trees."
Understanding the cause of the matter, Austin pondered silently.
The war was an unlucky occurrence.
But even for this misunderstanding.
The Dragon Nest Tribe suffered too many casualties; the Elf Kingdom must pay the price for this!
"Vini, go and pick a few clever Elves and send them back with a message for the Elf Queen."
Austin is a tolerant, pure-hearted, kind dragon.
He considered himself benevolent, cherishing life, disliking slaughter, and not wanting to see more lives lost due to warfare.
But his poor subordinates suffered heavy casualties due to the Elves' foolish actions.
This must be accounted for.
Thus, he gave the Elves in the Elf Kingdom a choice.
"You have only one path, and that is to unconditionally submit to me!"
With Austin's message, a few Elves who had been informed of the truth about the Dragon Nest Tribe were released, setting off on their return journey.
As for whether their surrender was successful, Austin wasn't too concerned.
Because whether they submit or not, the result would be the same, ultimately becoming annexed by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
If they genuinely refused, Austin would personally visit them to make them understand the principle that might is right.
Unfortunately, many Elves would certainly die in the process.
Alas,
Sighing for the lives that might be lost again in the future, Austin lamented, for he was a good dragon who disliked slaughter and loved all living things.
"The fallen Elf Kingdom, the rebellious Beastmen, the core area... it seems the undead zombie tide might originate from the core area. Could there be any connection between these?"
Watching the few released Elf prisoners gradually disappear beyond the stronghold, Austin pondered silently.
The remnants of the Elf Kingdom are destined to be annexed this time.

chapters.title: Chapter 263 229: 3 Days
chapters.content:
Austin is a good dragon.
Since his birth, the orcs who have died under his claws can be counted on one hand. Apart from those who insist on courting death, the kind-hearted and magnanimous Austin has hardly ever deliberately killed anyone.
Such a dragon, compared to those irritable Lords of Magical Beasts who kill innocent intelligent beings indiscriminately, can be regarded as an absolutely good dragon.
As for those orcs who died in the process of the Dragon Nest Tribe's expansion when the Dragon Nest Beastmen's army swept through,
Austin said:
It was the Beastmen of my Clan who did it, what does it have to do with me?
Isn't that right?
As for the hundreds of Blood Claw elites and humans who were killed inadvertently by a Thunder Rasengan before.
Originally, he only intended to attack the orc named Lambert and the human named Ska. You were so close to those two guys and got killed by the aftermath. What does it have to do with him?
Who told you to be so weak that the aftershock's energy killed you?
For these lives, Austin absolutely refuses to take responsibility.
He is a good dragon, a kind-hearted dragon.
But even a good dragon can't help it.
Those elves are so ruthless. After a big battle, nearly a tenth of the clan's Beastmen from the tribe base were lost, not to mention the countless injured.
Even if Austin is an exceedingly kind dragon, he can't just let it go after so much damage to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Unless all the elves remaining in the Elf Kingdom surrender and submit.
Once they become family, all those grudges will naturally disappear.
Wasn't it always like this before?
"Just right, since these remaining elves are remnants of the Kingdom and can still get that precious Mother Tree, there might be a royal among them, who must know something more about the core area, perhaps they can be asked one or two questions."
Initially, the tribes near the border claimed that the zombie undead tide came from a mutated Evil Spirit in the core area.
But later, upon careful consideration, it's easy to realize that things are not that simple at all.
Behind the zombie undead tide, there might be a mastermind with intelligence driving all of this.
If there wasn't intelligence, how could plans be designed, with the first warrior of the Blood Claw Tribe also being their spy?
Moreover, this mastermind has a certain level of influence.
At least, to make Grom submit, willingly acting as a spy placed in the Blood Claw Tribe, without certain skills, this would be impossible.
Austin is quite a distance away from the core region of the Kawa Great Forest. Based on estimations, if an orc were to traverse the distance, it might take at least half a year to cover it.
The vast distance also leads to a blockade of intelligence.
Information about the core area is entirely unknown to Austin.
Even though the Giant Dragon's inherited memory includes a rough map of the Kawa Great Forest, there's no interest in noting these minor insect powers in the wilderness.
Therefore, if the Elf Kingdom could be subjugated, and some information about the core area of the Kawa Great Forest extracted from the Elf Queen, it would be immensely important for Austin to understand the specific conditions of this wild region, and perhaps determine something.
Rebellious orcs, the Elf Kingdom, the zombie undead tide, the Tribe Alliance... among these, there might be some connections.
Of course, this goal is just incidental,
it is incidental.
Being a good dragon, how could he consider destroying an Elf Kingdom just to extract some intelligence?
After sending the captured elves back, Austin also dispatched some elite Beastman Officers to follow closely, gathering some information.
Oddly,
somewhere in the forest, the captured elves did something unknown, and suddenly a ripple appeared in the air, they seemed to have crossed space, as if entering another space directly from the ripple.
The next moment, the ripple in the air disappeared, and it was as if nothing had happened.
Except for those few missing elves.
A Beastman Officer probed a bit and found that the place seemed to have an invisible wall blocking the way.
Regarding this, Austin showed some interest.
However, he did not immediately make a move to personally test the strength of that invisible barrier's defense or the specific details of the Elf Kingdom.
Before doing so, he gave the Elf Queen three days to consider.
Three days are three days.
If they surrender directly by then, and he runs to attack their lair, wouldn't it be embarrassing?
It's only three days, waiting does not hurt.
This battle was too costly, even though it resulted in a ten-to-one outcome, it was the greatest loss ever for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Especially with so many wounded after the war, making the cleanup and organizing of the battlefield an intricate matter.
Cleaning up corpses, taking care of the wounded, restoring buildings, transporting materials... there are many such trivial matters, quite troublesome.
Austin stayed in the base, while the orcs did the tasks such as counting casualties, clearing the battlefield, and reflecting on the mistakes and oversights in this war under command.
This war, although the casualties were not low, was still done to the limit.
The Dragon Nest Legion is well-trained and armored in heavy armor, but thick armor does not cover every part of the body, and the elves' archery is naturally strong; hitting an eye socket from tens of meters away is not impossible. Coupled with the elves' desperate counterattack, achieving a ten-to-one casualty exchange rate is already quite good.
The most important thing is, the elves are not weak in magic either.
Excellent archery, various magic, along with desperation, such a coordinated elven army's combat power was almost unimaginable.
If it were any other orc tribe's army of the same number, it might not even be able to withstand the elven counterattack, let alone thousands or tens of thousands of casualties.
Though, despite this, this battle also exposed a problem with the Dragon Nest Legion.
That is, the Dragon Nest Legion is filled with warriors but does not have any magic output units!
"There is no rush for this. When the remaining parts of the Elf Kingdom are annexed, this point can naturally be completed."
Once this Elf Kingdom is annexed, not only can the entire kingdom's wealth be amassed but also many of its magical knowledge systems can be acquired and promoted within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Moreover, the Elf Kingdom itself has many spellcasters, who, after being slightly trained, can also be directly integrated into the legion to compensate for the lack of magical output capability.
Time passed slowly,
during these three days, the Dragon Nest Tribe remained in recuperation after the battle, and Austin made no move.
After three days, there was no news from the Elf Kingdom.
As expected.

chapters.title: Chapter 264 230 Sky Shattered (1st Update)
chapters.content:
"Such severe damage could have been avoided! Thousands of people! Thousands of our tribe will never return!"
"It's all because of you, you old fool! If it weren't for you insisting those beastmen were pursuers, how could this have happened?"
"You're no different, you damn old fool. Who was it that incited those young ones back then?"
"It's you, it's you, it's all you!"
"You should be responsible for the death of those thousands!"
At this moment, within the Secret Realm of the Elf Kingdom, the Elf Elder Council is mired in disputes.
The elders are arguing fiercely, almost coming to blows.
Since the elf prisoners returned to deliver the message to the remaining elves of the kingdom, the entire meeting has persisted in such a manner.
When the Blue Young Dragon's influence spread within the Elf Kingdom after the war, all the remaining elves experienced a mix of surprise, relief, and then anger.
The surprise stemmed from realizing that the attackers this time were not their old mortal enemies, not dispatched pursuers from the core region's traitors, stirring up a sense of post-crisis relief.
But simultaneously, they were angered by the brutal war caused by a misunderstanding, with only one-third of the elves escaping back after the final battle.
The misjudgment led to massive losses.
Originally, there were better solutions that could have been implemented.
But now, the Elf Kingdom has been driven further into the abyss.
The catastrophic war failure demands accountability, yet, at this moment, the highest decision-making body of the Elf Kingdom, the Elder Council, is caught in chaos, elders pushing blame, abusing each other.
With the enemy impending, the council is on the verge of collapse.
In the conference hall, the Elf Queen sits high on the throne, gazing at the quarreling elders below with bewilderment on her flawless, alabaster face.
Before the war began, launching the assault was the result of a unanimous decision by the elders.
And now?
Seeing the dispute continuing for three days and nights, the Elf Queen had no choice but to step forward.
"Everyone, please stop quarreling. This time, it was my fault. As the queen of the tribe, I failed to carefully consider before making a decision. The order for battle was given by me, and all responsibility lies with me."
The Elf Queen's words signified that she was taking all the blame for the war upon herself.
Her face revealed silent anguish and regret.
If, from the start, she hadn't given the order to commence the battle but had insisted on investigating thoroughly before making a decision, the casualties in this war wouldn't have been so severe.
As the Elf Queen finished speaking, the conference hall fell into silence.
Actually, everyone knew that each of them present bore some responsibility, but since the Queen was taking all the blame upon herself, there was no need to push it further.
"Elders, let's focus on the warning from that dragon. Three days have passed."
The Elf Queen said softly, burying her sorrow deep in her heart.
The topic finally shifted to the serious matter at hand.
Yet, this time, the argument was even more intense than before, with several short-tempered elders leaping up, slamming their palms on the table.
"We absolutely cannot surrender! After so many people have died, to ultimately bow to that ridiculous dragon is simply disgraceful!"
"No matter what, we retain the dignity of royal lineage; surrendering to a group of Wild Tribe is unacceptable—we'd rather starve, fall from the Mother Tree and die, than surrender!"
"But that Blue Young Dragon and its army are still camped outside; how can we deal with them?"
"We have the Mother Tree, the Secret Realm; the kingdom is our home ground! And we have the royal Sacred Artifact—if those Wild Tribes dare to invade, the kingdom's depth is enough to destroy them!"
Surrendering is not an option!
They feared those damn traitors only because the traitors knew their own depths and would come with restricting means.
But a mere Blue Young Dragon imagining it could obliterate them?
Absolutely impossible!
Within the Elder Council, a decision was made on Austin's final notice.
Despite one or two dissenting voices, they were of little consequence.
How could the bloodline of the ancient royal lineage truly surrender to a Wild Dragon and a group of beastmen?
Indeed, Wild Dragon and beastmen.
The once noble members of the Elf Royal Court, occupying the richest lands in the core region, ruling over millions of square kilometers, were entitled to look disdainfully upon the crude beastmen struggling at the fringes of the Kawa Great Forest.
Those lowly beastmen creatures appeared to the proud elven citizens as beasts—pigs and dogs.
Much like how city folk might regard country bumpkins from remote areas, the pride here is magnified hundreds, thousands of times between elves and wild, barbaric beastmen.
An elder, with a proud expression, exclaimed loudly in the conference hall:
"That dragon imagines we'll surrender and serve—it simply cannot happen. He'll need to break the Secret Realm Space upheld by the Mother Tree first..."
Before the words were finished,
Crack!
Suddenly, a faint cracking sound spread quickly.
Though faint, this sound traveled throughout the Secret Realm Space where the Elf Kingdom resided, clearly reaching every creature's ears.
No matter what they were doing or discussing, they heard this not loud but clear ice-breaking sound.
What is it?
The elves looked up at the sky in confusion, tracing the sound's origin.
The sky has collapsed!
Every elf who witnessed this opened their mouths wide, astonishment beyond verbal description.
But lo and behold, the sky was like a massive block of ice, with cracks spreading across like a spider web, emitting a crisp cracking noise.
The shattered fragments fell like snowflakes from the sky, resembling a heavy snowfall.
Amazement, shock, fear—countless emotions arose from the scene.
The spread of cracks did not last long, only for a moment,
Crash!
It was as if a sheet of glass was smashed by an Iron Hammer, and the sky abruptly collapsed, revealing a huge opening, where fragments fell swiftly like hail, accompanied by a massive, fearsome dragon claw glowing a ghostly blue, tearing through.
At the center of the claw, a huge azure energy light ball gradually dissipated.
That was the energy light ball that shattered the barrier!
Bolts of lightning cracked across the sky, as clouds gathered at the horizon without warning, the entire space whipped into a frenzy, swirling with sand and stones.
The daylight dimmed across the entire realm, a pressure beyond description slowly spread out, filling every corner of the space.
Like a looming storm, yet the oppression surpassed by thousands, tens of thousands of times!

chapters.title: Chapter 265 231: Overwhelm Heaven and Earth (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Amidst all the shocked gazes, the dragon claw that had pierced the sky slowly withdrew, and the hundreds of strands of lightning that had burst forth around it began to recede and disappear.
However, the pressure did not ease at all, instead it became even more oppressive.
The next moment,
a massive, ferocious dragon's head slowly emerged from the hole in the sky, its two front claws tearing at the edges of the rift in the sky, its gaze overlooking the Secret Realm Space of the Elf Kingdom like a Divine being gazing down at ants in the human world.
The pressure, vast as the sea, swept across, making the entire space feel as if a giant mountain had been placed upon it, suffocating people.
Several of the weaker elves immediately turned pale, drenched in cold sweat, and nearly collapsed to the ground.
Winds and clouds whipped up, streaks of lightning circled, the dim sky accentuating the massive, ferocious dragon head that seemed like a Demon God descended to the world, dragging the sky and earth into a chasm of despairing darkness!
"Little mice, I've found you..."
A low, icy, ancient and solemn voice, devoid of any warmth, echoed between heaven and earth, as if it carried the decree of the Heavenly Dao.
Deathly silence, no one made a sound.
The dragon's might was vast, making all bow down!
The pressure was so intense that it almost caused people to faint on the spot.
"Blue Young Dragon Austin, this is not the place for you to behave recklessly!"
Finally, outside the meeting hall on the Mother Tree that towered like a canopy covering the sky,
among the many high-ranking elves who had already come out, an elder shouted in a thunderous voice.
The voice trembled slightly, yet concealed its fierce determination.
In the face of such a broken Secret Realm Space supported by the Mother Tree, no one could remain calm.
"Oh, are you bargaining with me? Three days have passed, what is your decision?"
Austin looked down from the sky at the elves as tiny as ants, among the billowing clouds, his overwhelming might made him appear as towering as the sun blocking the sky and earth.
It gave every elf within the kingdom an immense pressure.
"Don't even think about it! The kingdom will never surrender!"
One elder grit their teeth and retorted loudly.
Unwilling, unwilling to be ruled by a Wild Dragon and a group of Beastmen just like that!
Moreover, based on intelligence urgently gathered in the past few days, that Wild Dragon was merely a Young Dragon, a wild orphaned Young Dragon with no parental care!
This would not make a good master, lacking the guidance of adult parents, not to mention whether it could smoothly cross into Legendary, even reaching adulthood was uncertain.
Their deeply rooted unwillingness and the arrogance once belonging to noble bloodlines made them overlook certain advantages of Austin, while amplifying his flaws.
"Fine, if you won't submit, then die!"
Like Divine judgment descending from the sky, filled with the Heavenly Dao decree that humans could not resist.
The words fell,
and from the deep hole in the sky, an enormous dragon claw suddenly stretched out.
In an instant, heaven and earth trembled, the sky changed colors, ink clouds surged.
Boom!!!
Flashes of lightning shattered the sky, an invisible and shapeless overwhelming aura swept in all directions, making the entire firmament feel crushed by an invisible force, rolling and falling toward all beings within the Secret Realm Space!
After Austin awakened his fourth Talent Magic, he devoted himself to research, not long afterwards he analyzed and comprehended from the Super Storm, gaining control over Wind and Water Attribute Powers.
Storms, lightning, rain, these are the domains Blue Dragons naturally have authority over!
With the fourth Talent Magic as the core, Austin, who mastered Wind Attribute Power, was at this moment displaying it to the extreme!
"One Claw Covers the Sky!"
As the dragon claw fell from the sky like a meteor, the surrounding void was already influenced by Austin's enormous might.
Strong gales were condensing in the sky, kicking up turbulent winds that swept the world, stirring the heavy clouds around, turning into a massive black vortex of clouds!
At that moment, every elf gazing at the sky seemed to be intimidated by the spectacle before them.
Cyclones of fierce winds swept between heaven and earth, the entire world seemed filled with swirling sand and stones, destruction and darkness, terrifying lightning tore through the sky and earth, creating a splendid scene as if doomsday was arriving!
"Can this really be resisted?"
Elves within the Kingdom's Secret Realm Space stared blankly at the edge of the sky, one elf's knees buckled, half-kneeling on the ground, face ashen.
Elder elves directly facing the terrifying destructive threat above the heavens felt as if great terror was descending, pulling them into a chasm of despairing darkness.
Just as the overwhelming claw was about to descend,
"Alas."
In a daze, it seemed all the elves within the Elf Kingdom heard a faint sigh.
Then,
Rustle...
The massive canopy that covered the entire Elf Kingdom, reaching thousands or tens of thousands of meters tall, the Mother Tree moved.
Thick leaves swayed like waves of a green sea, rustling, then tens of thousands of branches unfurled in the air, growing and extending.
Thick tree trunks entwined like living creatures in the air, twining into an enormous wooden tornado that reached the sky, moving to swallow the claw falling from above.
The powerful momentum was such that even the ferocious winds and clouds were torn apart by the immense wooden tornado!
Finally, fiercely colliding with the colossal dragon claw that seemed to overturn the entire sky!
Clang!!!
The crisp sound of metal striking reverberated through every corner of the world, like thousands or tens of thousands of tons of steel colliding under the immense forces, squeezing out a creaking screech.
At the same time, a visible shockwave at the point of collision in the sky spread out in all directions, causing the entire space to tremble violently like a mirror, as if about to shatter.
The terrifying shockwave swept through, instantly triggering a roaring tsunami hurricane within heaven and earth.
Trees were uprooted, smoke and dust filled the air, sand and stones flew, accompanied by lightning and thunder, plunging the scene into an apocalyptic abyss!
Crack, crack....
Large areas of trees shattered and fell from the sky, the towering wooden tornado continuously growing, continuously crushed by immense forces, the falling wood chips like an overwhelming snowstorm, seemingly about to cover the whole land.
Fortunately, not long after, the winds and clouds calmed slightly, and everything finally ended.
The dragon claw that seemed to crush the entire space finally exhausted its strength, suspended in mid-air, ultimately unable to continue descending.
Having lost the overwhelming aura of power, the massive dragon claw that was enlarged like a massive lens finally revealed its original size, suspended in the sky.
From the ground looking up, that world-flipping dragon claw appeared to be only the size of a fist.
However, the elves who witnessed all of this on the scene did not feel a sense of survival from the brink of death, instead were silent.
Just a fist-sized dragon claw had almost crushed and destroyed the entire Secret Realm Space.
This claw was blocked, but what about the next attack?

chapters.title: Chapter 266 232: Law of Wind (3rd Update - Subscribe Please)
chapters.content:
"A tornado of wooden branches..."
Beyond the sky, looking down at the towering giant wood tornado, formed by hundreds of intertwining branches, each several hundred meters wide, a silent thought lingered.
As Austin's sky-shaking claw was blocked, the giant wood tornado came to a halt mid-air, casting a massive shadow over the land while splintered wood fell from above, pattering down like rain and snow.
Despite the thwarted attack, Austin felt no discomfort.
Yet the giant wood tornado had clearly suffered heavy damage.
At the rupture atop, fine cracks spread between the intertwined branches.
Even though each branch in this massive tornado, formed by thousands of branches, was as hard as steel and the collective twisting power was indomitable, tearing even storms apart,
the colossal claw Austin commanded, formed by wind and thunder, was even more terrifying. If not for the continuous regrowth of the giant wood tornado, it might have been shattered in an instant by the vast cloud-empowered claw.
Nonetheless, after enduring Austin's attack, the giant wood tornado was already riddled with scars.
"Fairy Mother Tree."
Austin's gaze from the sky pierced through layers of space, landing on the enormous tree that supported half the kingdom's secret realm, standing unknown thousands of meters high.
In these three days, the Dragon Nest Tribe hadn't been idle either.
Detailed information about the Elf Kingdom had already been extracted from some captives.
To the elf race, the Mother Tree was incredibly important, one could even say it's the foundation of their strength.
After mating, male and female elves place the newborn elf under the Mother Tree, where the lantern-like large flowers would envelop the elf infants for nurturing.
Until one or two years later, when the flowers reopen, the elf infants would possess innate supernatural abilities.
Elves aren't born with extraordinary abilities, but through this process, elves can awaken the extraordinary seed, becoming extraordinary beings.
If an elf tribe lacks the Fairy Mother Tree, they can't produce enough spellcasters and warriors at all.
Even though elves have decent potential, with a higher self-awakening rate and a better chance of cultivating into extraordinary beings than ordinary beastmen, a tribe without a Mother Tree would inevitably degenerate into wild elves, at the lowest tier like the beastmen.
Besides being a powerful backing for the elf race, the Fairy Mother Tree also has another crucial ability.
It supports a secret realm space.
Through the secret realm space supported by the Fairy Mother Tree, elves can live peacefully outside the perilous wild forests.
"A sigh, is this a wise Mother Tree? Indeed, a remnant of the former royal family."
Generally, Fairy Mother Trees are not sentient and do not react to external attacks.
But this Fairy Mother Tree before them was evidently different.
Before the giant wood tornado spiraled up, Austin sensed a faint sigh.
All the elves sensed it too.
This Fairy Mother Tree likely has consciousness.
It's no wonder, as a remnant of the once ruling elf royal family over the entire Kawa Great Forest, a Fairy Mother Tree possessing unusual wisdom isn't surprising.
And this made Austin all the more eager to make this elf kingdom submit.
"Impressive power, but, as a tree, how could you perfectly harness your own strength."
If they refuse to surrender, then force them into submission.
Whoosh!
Suddenly, the sky darkened once more, and the surrounding void twisted under an invisible force, transforming into three swirling vortices around Austin, pulling in massive amounts of magic power and condensing into spheres.
Rasengan!
A long time ago, Austin's domain prototype had already covered the entire sky, turning vast spaces into his home turf.
In this home turf, magic power easily condensed, forming three enormous Rasengan like a round sun.
But it wasn't over yet!
Buzz!
Suddenly, the void fluctuated again.
From the Rasengan floating in the sky, each emitted a bright light, rapidly spreading and expanding, eventually becoming three gigantic Rasengan radiating blue, white, and translucent light.
This is the result of Rasengan's attribute change!
Three attribute-changing Rasengan of thunder, wind, and water now hung high in the sky, their terrifying power distorting the air.
Since awakening a trace of the Thunder Law in his blood and nurturing it within his Thunderbolt Divine Sword, through comprehending that trace of the Law of Thunder, Austin's power rapidly advanced.
Previously, it took at least half a minute to halt and condense the Rasengan for attribute changes.
Now, within the domain prototype constructed with strong magical control, he could condense them instantly with a thought.
"Let's try this."
Whoosh!
The three attribute-changing Rasengan plummeted from the sky, trailing fierce cyclones, twisting the space they passed through.
Their trajectory seemed disturbed by invisible forces, as the three different attribute Rasengan fell with chaotic motion, their light covering half the sky.
The immense pressure gave an overwhelming feeling of inescapability.
"Your Majesty, hurry to prepare the Sacred Artifact!"
The elf elders, upon seeing the three energy spheres with terrifying pressure falling from the sky, turned pale with fear.
And at this moment,
Whoosh!!!
The Fairy Mother Tree moved again, as the giant wood tornado suddenly dispersed, with branch after branch intertwining in the air, gradually forming into a gigantic wooden shield, shielding the Elf Kingdom below.
The patterns formed by the interwoven branches were visible to the naked eye, exuding an orderly, harmonious beauty, supporting the sky as the giant shield extended continuously.
Boom!
Finally, at one moment, the three attribute-changing Rasengan, affected by mutual influence, unpredictably and forcefully slammed into the wooden shield.
Composed of intertwining steely branches, the sky-shielding wooden shield, tens of meters deep, boasted a defense even stronger than the previous giant wood tornado.
However, this time, the Fairy Mother Tree's wooden shield didn't create another miracle.
The instant the collision happened, the three attribute-changing Rasengan expanded violently, their size growing tens to hundreds of times instantly!
