The tens of meters deep wooden shield, formed by layer upon layer of steely branches, was torn apart in the blink of an eye, pierced by the three enormous energy light spheres, raining countless wood fragments down like snow!
The thick wooden shield couldn't even withstand for a moment,
passing through like soft tofu, penetrated instantly!
Seeing the impending collision of the three massive Rasengan with the ground, their explosive power poised to destroy the majority of the Elf Kingdom,
at that instant, a wisp of breeze arose from the void, like a ripple across a calm lake.
In a blink, it expanded into a colossal wind wall, spanning the sky ahead, blocking the falling Rasengan!
"Oh?"
Outside the vast hole in the sky, Austin's eyebrow raised.
He sensed it,
that breath belonging to the Law.
The Law of Wind!

chapters.title: Chapter 267 263: The Power of the Sacred Artifact
chapters.content:
"The Sacred Artifact of the Race..."
In the vast opening above the Elf Kingdom, Austin's gaze penetrated through layers of light and landed on the intricately carved green longbow, glowing with a green light, that the Elf Queen held aloft.
Austin had also heard the words of that Elf Elder just now.
This was the sacred artifact of the Elven race, a longbow containing the Law of Wind.
Austin sensed that the Law of Wind within the longbow was summoning the surrounding power of the wind attribute elements, transforming into an immense wind wall to block ahead.
In one of the famous games from Austin's past life, the wind wall of the Gale Sword Master Yasuo could block the attacks of the enemy projectiles.
This was the power of the wind, the defense of the wind.
And now, the wind wall summoned by the Law of Wind contained within that longbow before him, its power could only be even greater.
This is the power at the level of law, a layer of power beyond the previous!
Boom! Boom! Boom!
Three enormous Attribute Rasengans ferociously crashed into the wind wall, and three rounds of dazzling spheres of light instantly expanded and exploded, erupting with earth-shattering power.
A hundred bolts, a thousand bursts of lightning bloomed instantly in that short moment. The crackling light seemed to tear through the space and the blinding brilliance illuminated the entire sky. With it, razor-sharp whirlwinds sliced and expanded in the vacuum, mixed with the lightning,
At the same time, on the other side, the Water Attribute Rasengan, gathered to the extreme, swept out.
The power of water, in the Water Attribute Rasengan, with a water flow spinning at an immeasurable speed, had the power to pulverize any steel in an instant.
The eruption of three terrifying forces merged above the sky, electric light, storm, waterfall interconnected, as if presenting a splendid scene of world-destroying devastation!
Anyone witnessing the tremendous power unleashed by the collision of those turbulent, raging three fearsome attribute forces in the sky would undoubtedly be deeply shocked and terrified by the overwhelming might sweeping over the world.
If that unleashed power were to crash onto the earth, even with the protection of the Mother Tree, the entire core area of the kingdom might be utterly destroyed in an instant amidst the ripping of those three terrifying forces.
Yet, despite such a powerful collision of forces, before that wall of wind, it had no effect whatsoever.
That wall of wind, like an indestructible barrier, blocked all the power unleashed by the Rasengan outside.
Despite the rampant, towering tsunami and flood created by the uncontrolled eruption of wind, water, and thunder, before that barrier of wind, it still could not make any headway.
"Indeed it is the power of a sliver of the Law of Wind, as expected of the former royal family, even in decline, their heritage is astonishing."
If there was still doubt before, now it could be certain beyond any doubt.
This is the gap in power levels, fundamentally unable to contend.
Just like the hardness between diamond and charcoal, despite the similarity in elemental composition, this is the difference at the essential level.
Perhaps only such a tremendously powerful kingdom that once ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest could create such weapons containing law.
In the absence of the legendary, few could contend with these remnants of the Elf Kingdom.
This is heritage.
Despite learning from Elf captives that during the orc rebellion of the past, war came too suddenly and resistance collapsed too quickly, their ancestors escaped in panic without taking more belongings.
But just the Elf Mother Tree and this longbow containing the Law of Wind alone allowed Austin to feel the strength of that Elf Kingdom of old.
"The power of law is a terribly troublesome thing for most non-legendary beings... too bad, I'm not one of them."
The force of three Attribute Rasengans at the Gold Level was already immensely powerful.
An ordinary gold facing just one would likely be reduced to ashes in the face of such overwhelming power.
If such a powerful attack was blocked, let alone other Gold Level attacks?
For the power of law, unless qualitative change is brought by quantitative change, non-law cannot contend with law.
Although Austin was still at the Gold Level, he had already mastered a sliver of the power of the Thunder Law, placing him at the same level of power as that longbow sacred artifact of the Elf Kingdom.
With the remnants of this Elf Kingdom before him, Austin had long been resolved to take them, even if it meant revealing some things.
"Having nurtured for two or three months, let's test your power!"
Using the Sword Drawing Technique as a foundation, sealing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword containing a sliver of the Law of Thunder within himself, constantly accumulating and nurturing it with magic power, dragon's power, and aura as resources.
Now, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword within had been nurtured for over two months.
Its might was revealed just slightly half a month ago, and the mere aura completely intimidated Lambert and other Blood Claw elites.
He was unsure to what extent the true power of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword had reached.
Now was the best time to test its power!
Only law can counter law!
Within the secret realm of the Elf Kingdom, seeing the Queen wield the racial sacred artifact to summon the wind wall, blocking Austin's three massive Attribute Rasengans, all elves felt genuine internal relief, many bowing their heads with hands crossed, praying words like "Nature bless us".
"Phew, we're safe. With the sacred artifact, even if that dragon is strong, as long as it's not legendary, it can't do anything to us."
"Damn Wild Blue Dragon, dared to break the secret realm space, invade the kingdom, and injure the Mother Tree, almost destroying the entire kingdom. We can't forget this grudge!"
"Yes, we must teach that damn wild dragon a harsh lesson!"
Seeing that safety was assured under the protection of the sacred artifact, everyone was filled with righteous indignation, with curses filling the air.
The Elf Queen's face paled slightly, hearing the words of the elders around, her brows furrowed.
Using the sacred artifact wasn't without cost. Just the brief moment conjuring the wind wall earlier had drained a third of her magic power.
Now, she could only use it two more times at most.
As if seeing the Queen's hesitation, an Elder spoke up:
"The noble royal bloodline will never surrender to a wild dragon or a bunch of wild beastmen! Besides, Your Majesty, didn't that wild dragon's attack fail to breach the sacred artifact's defense just now? The sacred artifact itself is the main offensive tool. As long as you injure that wild dragon, the kingdom's crisis will naturally be resolved!"
"That's right, Your Majesty, take action! Using the sacred artifact to slay the dragon is not impossible!"
Hearing this, the Elf Queen was about to respond.
However, at this moment,
Suddenly, the entire sky seemed to collapse under a vast, boundless pressure!
At that moment, within the entire Elf Kingdom, all elves felt an inescapable despair, as if plunging straight into a dark abyss, where even their souls were devoured by darkness!

chapters.title: Chapter 268 264: Wind and Thunder (Second Update, Seeking Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
At the moment when that Thunderbolt Divine Sword appeared before heaven and earth, the vast momentum and dragon power that had been suppressed for over two months erupted with a roar, the void twisting and rippling, even affecting the celestial phenomena.
This was the result of Austin's presence as a Giant Dragon and the nurturance of dragon power, like a volcano suppressed for thousands of years. When a crack appeared in the seal of the earth's surface, it immediately led to the explosive momentum that had been suppressed for months, sweeping through heaven and earth like a tsunami.
Swish!
In the clear splashing sound, electric light surrounded the sky.
That brilliant divine sword, as if a thousand blades and ten thousand thunders issued from beyond the heavens, suddenly appeared high in the sky.
Unknowingly, thick black clouds gathered around, the fierce wind surging around, thunder and lightning leaping and bursting all around.
When that strand of Law appeared in the void, it immediately resonated with the Law Power between heaven and earth. In vast areas of space, the Thunder Attribute Elements became volatile and active, as if a gigantic blazing meteor had fallen into the ocean that belonged to thunder, stirring up monstrous waves.
"Law! Law!"
When that incomparably brilliant Thunderbolt Divine Sword appeared in the sky above, all the Elves, including the Elf Queen, widened their eyes in astonishment.
That is the power of Law!
Only the power of Law can stir such vast waves and turmoil between heaven and earth!
Can the Sacred Artifact really withstand such power?
At this moment, a doubtful thought inevitably rose in the Elf Queen's mind.
But she had no way out.
When Austin summoned that Thunderbolt Divine Sword, there was no retreat for them. One side must completely fail to end this war.
With steadfast light in her eyes once again, the Elf Queen raised the Holy Artifact Longbow high, the radiant green light making the entire longbow float in the air, as the Elf Queen brought her hands together in front of her, half-kneeling on the ground.
The surrounding Elf Elders also knelt down, bowed their heads, and it seemed as if they were conducting some grand ceremony.
In the clear voice, filled with devout prayers slowly emerging:
"Spirit of wind in nature, please respond to the call of your people..."
Accompanying the Elf Queen's prayers, dazzling light burst forth from the suspended Holy Artifact Longbow, the light covering the sky.
Invisible waves spread and diffused along the space, and the wind in the entire kingdom moved, as if summoned by the Wolf King, gathering towards the direction of the Holy Artifact Longbow.
One, two, three...
Small, weak, strong, fierce...
Like thousands of rivers converging, streams of wind power vortices merged in the air, turning into a stronger storm, swirling around the Elf Mother Tree, like an immense wind-formed bell turned upside down, enveloping the Elf Mother Tree within.
The wind power condensed into substance, and with the continuous convergence of wind elements from all directions, it became increasingly solid, as if even space was influenced by the wind attribute power, forming an invincible giant wind bell defense!
This was the first time in a thousand years that the Elf Sacred Artifact fully unleashed its ability, the miraculous spectacle like a substance covering half of the sky "dome" made every protected Elf below feel an indescribable shock.
But it's not over yet!
The green light of the Holy Artifact Longbow continued to bloom, and although the storm bell it mobilized had strong defense, they were now facing another Giant Dragon who mastered the Law!
"Ancestors of nature, please grant me the power to repel the foreign enemies!"
With the devout prayer, the Elf Queen regrasped the Holy Artifact Longbow.
Gazing at the sky, drawing the bow and nocking an arrow,
The green light shone, pointing to Austin beyond the sky.
The Magic Power surged from within, condensing into a green arrow on the bow, the flickering emerald light swirling with halos, vaguely tearing the air apart.
This is an arrow purely condensed from the magic power within the Elf Queen, with a wisp of Law of Wind attached, granting the arrow extraordinary destructive power.
This is the holy artifact remaining in the Elf Kingdom, a longbow forged with the Law of Wind.
It doesn't need specially made arrows, even the most ordinary bamboo arrow, when attached with a trace of Law of Wind, would possess invincible power, capable of striking down all!
If the enormous wind bell covering the sky and enveloping the Elf Mother Tree and much of the Elf Kingdom was the defensive capability of the Holy Artifact Longbow, then granting the arrow invincible power was the strongest attack of the Holy Artifact Longbow!
She is both the strongest shield and the strongest spear!
"If it's just the breath of Law, it cannot withstand the attack of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword!"
Looking through layers of void, seeing everything in his eyes, Austin murmured softly.
He did not hold back,
A Thunderbolt Divine Sword, nurtured for more than two months, containing the power of the Law of Thunder, its destructive capacity was unknown.
"Go!"
With Austin's command,
The Thunderbolt Divine Sword, filled with strands of loose electric light, dense like a cobweb spanning the central sky, suddenly fell with space-shattering power, crashing down!
With lightning as its edge, forged by thunder, the sword momentum containing the Law fell,
Instantly, the momentum was overwhelming like celestial might, swallowing the power of the sun and moon.
That stroke, seemingly coming from beyond, plummeting down, traversed layers of space, at that moment becoming the center of heaven and earth, absorbing all the brilliance of the world.
"Nature, please grant me strength!"
At the same moment, a wisp of Law of Wind, through some mysterious connection, along with the rich breath of Law, infused into that shimmering green arrow.
Loosening the grip, the arrow shot out,
That arrow, like a meteor breaking through the sky, soared against the tide!
The verdant arrow let out a verdant cry, like a living being breaking out from the darkness, that green representing the vitality of all things, spreading over the entire sky, filling every corner of the void.
A long green tail flame, waving in the wind behind that meteor-like arrow, as it pierced through layers of void, was the trace of wind element tumult in the void!
In a blink,
Green and blue, two dazzling streaks of light traversed the space, instantly colliding with each other.
Point to point.
The entire world was divided into two distinct colors, clearly separated.
This is a confrontation between Laws, a clash of legendary powers above all creatures!
At that moment,
Wind and Thunder, two kinds of Laws,
Clashed with boundless power!

chapters.title: Chapter 269 265 Wind Law Origin (Third Update, Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Boom!!!
Two streams of light collided fiercely in the sky, immediately causing a world-shaking explosion.
The powerful energy collision caused the surrounding void to surge like a tide. Just the clash of auras alone incited the heaven and earth's energy field to rage like a tidal wave, sweeping through the entire Secret Realm Space, making the world seem to tremble unceasingly.
The space trembled like a mirrored surface, as if the entire Secret Realm Space was about to shatter and break apart.
A horrific energy storm swept across the sky and earth, turning the whole world into a sea of light; the wild winds and raging thunder shook the heavens and earth as if threatening to break the entire world apart to start anew.
But this was merely the surface!
Outside the Secret Realm Space, Austin, having awakened a trace of the Thunder Law, was fortunate to witness the even more splendid collision of deeper-level laws hidden within the fierce energy explosion!
At the moment the vast energy exploded, the Law of Wind on the arrow finally collided with the Law of Thunder within the Thunderbolt Divine Sword.
This resulted in a dazzling change hidden within the blinding energy explosion, indescribable in words.
The instant the two strands of laws intersected, the surrounding space was instantly repelled, forming a vacuum area of chaotic laws.
That vacuum area was only the size of a fist, hidden within the vast energy shockwave, and vanished as quickly as it appeared, following the annihilation of the laws.
Austin saw it,
Through the perception of the Thunder Law within his body, he clearly saw the process of that vacuum area forming and being destroyed in that instant.
The moment the two strands of laws converged, they immediately affected the surrounding void,
The surrounding space seemed like a membrane made up of countless vibrating arcs, repelled by the invisible force created by the collision of the Law of Wind and the Law of Thunder, forming a spatial bubble.
All material elemental forces were repelled, as if a vacuum bubble was forcibly born from the void.
At the same time, the two strands of laws collided like high-speed particles, instantly decomposing into countless arcs shooting skyward, resembling both colorless fireworks and countless lines decomposing and bouncing in all directions.
Those arcs clashed with each other, annihilated and merged into the surrounding void, triggering a more extensive riot of wind and thunder elements in the external space!
This was a collision belonging to a higher level of power,
Only those who truly understood the laws and entered the Legendary Domain could discover and comprehend the origin of power!
Though it was just a fleeting bloom, that incredibly splendid collision of laws was still deeply imprinted in Austin's eyes.
Unable to comprehend its manifestation or gain a greater harvest from it,
But having witnessed that moment of brilliance was enough to genuinely shock any being who hadn't yet stepped into legendary territory.
"This is the law..."
Austin murmured softly.
And at this moment, the clash between the arrow and the sword finally reached its climax.
The Thunderbolt Divine Sword, nurtured for more than two months, and condensed with the momentum of a dragon for tens of days, ultimately ascended a higher tier.
As traces of law aura were exhausted, the green arrows collapsed layer by layer, shattered by the Thunderbolt Divine Sword breaking through from the center.
The longsword's Sword God dimmed as well, with most of its power of laws consumed, but still carrying immense power like a meteor falling towards the massive Wind Bell!
Ripppp!
With the sound like the tearing of fabric, the massive Wind Bell, as if substantive, was torn open and crumbled.
The Thunderbolt Divine Sword descended unstoppably with electric arcs, tearing the space apart.
Neither the Elf Queen nor the many elf elders standing behind her reacted,
the Sacred Artifact Longbow in the Elf Queen's hands was sliced in two by the Thunderbolt Divine Sword falling from the heavens.
The Sacred Artifact was destroyed!
It couldn't withstand Austin's Thunderbolt Divine Sword's attack.
The result was both unexpected and inevitable.
That brilliant Thunderbolt Divine Sword was the splendor that Austin had spent more than two months nurturing, gathering power for tens of days only to bloom in an instant!
Pursuing a moment of radiance far beyond what a longbow weapon, merely placed on an altar for incense offerings, could compare to.
At the same time,
Crack, crack...
In the crisp sound of shattering, the brilliant blade of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword formed cracks.
Finally, having exhausted all its power, it shattered into countless fragments like glass, dissipating into nothingness in mid-air.
The longsword that Austin had invested substantial time and effort in nurturing, ultimately fulfilled its mission.
Completely breaking the Elf Kingdom's last resistance, along with the destruction of the Sacred Artifact, it wasn't in vain for Austin to have invested so much effort in it.
After all, it was a longsword transformed from the changing nature of thunder, which could be nurtured and cultivated again.
But the Elf Kingdom's Sacred Artifact, once gone, was truly gone.
"The Sacred Artifact, destroyed?"
Staring at the Sacred Artifact Longbow broken in two, the Elf Queen's eyes were filled with bewilderment.
And at this moment,
A strand of Wind Law Origin wound out from the broken longbow, slowly rising, drifting into the void as if entering the sea, ready to merge into the endless void.
"Wind Law Origin!"
Staring at the Wind Law Origin rising from the shattered longbow like smoke entering the heavens, about to merge into the Cyan Nether void, Austin's eyes gleamed with extreme eagerness.
The Law Origin is something capable of continuously gathering laws.
Austin had awakened a trace of Thunder Law Origin within his bloodline, thereby gaining the ability to control and use laws.
The relationship between Law Origin and laws is like that of a spring and the stream formed by spring water.
However, the endless spring water can gather into a lake, constantly accumulating at low points.
But laws can never gather like spring water; the more Thunder Origin Laws you comprehend, the more Thunder Laws you can use.
Just like the Thunderbolt Divine Sword nurtured by Austin, he could only condense a sword containing a trace of Thunder Law, unable to use more Thunder Laws to condense more Thunderbolt Divine Swords.
This is due to the connection dictated by the world's rules between Law Origin and laws, understanding only as much law origin as the amount of laws one can use.
"If I could obtain this trace of Wind Law Origin, then not only could I comprehend the power of the Wind Law, but I could also, like the Thunder Law, integrate the power of the Wind Law into my battle system, gaining a greater enhancement!"
Without much thought, Austin flew out directly, rapidly heading towards the Wind Law Origin about to merge into the Cyan Nether sky.
But, the way for Austin to seize this trace of Wind Law Origin!
Was like a greedy cat eyeing the fish in the water jar,
Longing yet out of reach.
What to do?
Seeing the Wind Law Origin about to merge into the void before his eyes, Austin was anxious.
Finally, at the moment it was about to dissipate,
Austin opened his ferocious mouth, swallowing the Wind Law Origin before him along with the air.
Regardless of whether it would work, or what the effects might be,
he gulped it down first!

chapters.title: Chapter 270 266: Law Digestion (First Request for Subscription)
chapters.content:
Swallowing that strand of the Law of Wind was just an instinctive reaction from Austin, having no method or means in his haste; he didn't even know what kind of consequences this would lead to.
Boom!!!
As the strand of the Law of Wind was swallowed into his stomach, tumultuous waves were instantly stirred up within Austin's body.
The Magic Power surged violently like tsunami tides under the urging of the Wind Law Origin, a level of power that was entirely beyond his current ability to control.
All around Austin, fierce and intense gales erupted from the void, transforming into tangible torrents, violently surging amidst the gloomy heavens between layers of heavy clouds, lightning ripping through the sky.
The doomsday-like scene instilled a terror from the depths of the hearts of all living beings present.
"My subjects, attack, crush them!"
Austin forcibly suppressed the rampaging wind attribute elements within his body, his deep voice rolling through the sky.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen army, long waiting outside, with Austin's command, poured forth immediately like a flood unleashed, like an iron flood gushing out from the breach.
Along the gap emerging in the collapsing Secret Realm Space, the Dragon Nest Beastmen army formally entered this utopian land.
Meanwhile,
Seeing from high above, the Dragon Nest Beastmen army sweeping within the Elf Kingdom, dismantling any resistance with ease, Austin didn't linger, using the last of his strength to soar up and quickly fly towards the direction of the Dragon Nest Tribe headquarters.
That strand of Wind Origin Law violently stirred within, causing drastic changes in the world outside.
Wherever Austin passed, terrifying cyclones were stirred up by the agitated Wind Law Origin, the sky covered with oppressive dark clouds, and vast forests toppled and blown away in the fierce gales, leaves and branches swept high into the air as if an apocalyptic calamity had arrived.
"I must return quickly!"
Feeling the incredibly agitated Wind Law Origin within his body, Austin was anxious at heart.
He had to find a safe place to properly handle that strand of Law Origin within him, otherwise, its continued rampage would lead even the body of a giant dragon to a great collapse.
The area within a hundred miles had already become the domain of the Clan Tribe under Austin's command,
but the safest place, without doubt, was the old nest.
However, given his current state of causing disaster at any moment and place, returning to the Dragon Nest headquarters was naturally impossible.
Fortunately, when he developed his Rasengan and understood the Thunder Law, Austin had been cultivating in a mountain range near the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This area had long been cleared out by the Dragon Nest Beastmen into a large, safe zone, becoming the place for Austin's daily cultivation activities.
This was constructed and maintained under Austin's orders.
In the mountains, there was a small mound, where an old enemy of Austin's was buried years before.
The Blood Wolf Leader.
During the initial two years of his infant stage, lacking in Magic Power growth, Austin had been unable to fight against the Blood Wolves as Magic Beasts, resulting in several hunts being interfered with and almost losing his life to their claws.
Later, swallowing his pride and bearing the burden of humiliation, Austin finally killed the Blood Wolf Leader with the help of the Kobolds, eradicating the Blood Wolves,
right in this mountain range.
Later, to commemorate his first major enemy in his dragon life, Austin had the Beastmen bury some of the Blood Wolf Leader's indestructible bones here, erecting a small mound within the canyon where the Blood Wolf Leader fell.
For remembrance.
As for why Austin unconsciously lingered here when developing Rasengan, cultivating the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, and understanding the Thunder Law, he didn't know.
Anyway, it certainly wasn't to dance on the grave of an old enemy.
A mere small wild wolf, for him now, could be crushed with a flick.
Ha, does he, Austin, look like a dragon so petty and vengeful?
...
Within the mountains, the dragon's aura generated during closed-door cultivation made surrounding beasts dare not approach, and being not too close nor too far from the Dragon Nest Tribe, it was the most suitable place to handle the Wind Law Origin.
Before long, Austin, riding the wind, returned to the mountains.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen guarding the periphery saluted as Austin descended with great momentum, and began quickly retreating to the more distant outer areas.
Clatter!
Austin landed atop a mountain's cliff, the Wind Law Origin inside his body already agitated to the extreme, as if to break forth from within his body.
The phenomena surrounding the mountains were influenced, forming huge and immense tornadoes, the entire mountain range shrouded under a cloud stretching across half the sky.
The light in that area dimmed, as if expelled from the world.
Good, it's safe.
Yet as over two months of cold winter passed, the previously half-destroyed mountains in various attempts had regrown with vegetation, lush plants covering the once-exposed hollows in the soil.
At the base of the cliff, where the Blood Wolf Leader had fallen, the lush grasses atop its mound swayed in the wind, growing vigorously.
Retracting his "unconscious" gaze, Austin's heart and spirit focused inward within his body.
That agitated strand of Wind Law Origin rampaged inside, damaging and leaving Austin with scars over his entire body, blood oozing from between the scales.
How to handle this?
Swallowing it in without much thought, only now realizing it was a major problem.
Austin's brows furrowed deep,
he was not yet a Legendary. The Law Origin was a higher level of incomprehensible power to him; if he could grasp it, Austin's strength would naturally greatly enhance.
But similarly, failing to resolve it would bring great trouble to Austin, even with his dragon bloodline.
Think quickly, what method should be used!
In his past life's memories, visions of countless fantasy martial arts animations and various fantastical thoughts flashed, seeking similar solutions.
However, Austin failed.
None of those novels or animations he had seen ever encountered such a situation.
"Only by borrowing like the Thunderbolt Divine Sword intricately borrowed the principle of the Sword Drawing Technique."
Shifting his thought process, Austin began to ponder.
The turbulent Wind Law Origin within his body continued its rampage, seemingly ceaselessly damaging Austin's body.
Internal injuries intensified, Austin's breath growing ever fainter.
Finally,
at a certain moment, gazing down at the mound, crowned with weeds swaying in the wind, Austin's heavy eyes brightened.
The old enemy, along with its flesh, became nourishment for his growth.
The Magic Beast Crystal Core within the Blood Wolf Leader's head, along with flesh, all of which initially hadn't belonged to him, but through devouring and digesting, became his own.
Then how could this strand of Wind Law Origin be devoured and digested to become his own?
Lost deep in thought, Austin's mind flashed with such a question.
Like the Spiritual Artifact or Magical Treasure in fantasy and xianxia novels, transforming an enemy's into something controllable through refining with one's heart spirit.
Perhaps,
he could treat that strand of Wind Law Origin as a Magical Treasure, refining it through heart spirit, thereby completely digesting it, gaining control over that strand of Wind Law Origin!

chapters.title: Chapter 271 267 Elf Surrenders (2nd update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Having thought it through, Austin sank into a trance, attempting to use Heart and Soul Refinement to control that wisp of the Law of Wind within his body.
His spirit descended deep into his body, where everything inside was reflected in his mind: blood vessels, internal organs, bones... But most importantly, it was that strand of turbulent and clashing Wind Law Origin buried deep within.
The moment his spiritual power touched that Wind Law Origin, he felt a kind of agitation and turbulence, filled with an incomprehensible force.
This force originated from the most fundamental power between heaven and earth, and just a single thread of it could cause the surrounding void's elemental power to riot collectively.
His spiritual power carefully wrapped around that Wind Law Origin within his body, then began to touch, soothe, and attempt to refine it...
Step by step, bit by bit, he cautiously began to make contact and refine it.
Fortunately, before this, Austin had tried to refine the Thunderbolt Divine Sword. Although there wasn't a specialized refining technique like in fantasy immortal cultivation novels, through experiential exploration, Austin had acquired certain refining skills.
Utilizing all his past experience and techniques, it wasn't long before that initially turbulent wisp of Wind Law Origin began to stabilize under the soothing influence of his spiritual power.
The crisis of his body exploding was finally resolved.
However, this was far from over.
Though the agitated Wind Law Origin had been calmed, there was still a significant distance from truly integrating and controlling it.
And now, Austin discovered a big problem.
To maintain the stability of the Wind Law Origin, a large amount of spiritual power must be used to soothe that wisp. This required continuous infusions of spiritual power.
It couldn't be interrupted.
This was an utterly unacceptable result. If he had to continually provide spiritual power to maintain stability, Austin's overall combat power would be greatly diminished.
Simple multitasking could sustain daily survival, but even in the simplest battles, it's impossible to fight while simultaneously supplying vast amounts of spiritual power to the Wind Law Origin within his body.
"This is like being adrift on water!"
As he refined over time, Austin further understood the existence form of the Wind Law Origin.
Incorporeal, immaterial, it wasn't a tangible substance, but more like a conceptual force.
Refining a magical treasure with heart and soul still involved the treasure having a physical form.
But this wisp of Wind Law Origin? There was no physical form, so it couldn't be refined like actual material substances. That he could soothe it with spiritual power was already quite an achievement.
"This won't do. I must find a suitable vessel to stabilize it, and only then can I truly begin to comprehend and control it."
A vessel to carry the law.
In an instant, Austin thought of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword.
By using the nature transformation of Thunder Attribute Elements, he condensed and compressed the Thunder Element into a tangible longsword, injecting the law within it to form a Thunderbolt Divine Sword imbued with law.
Drawing a parallel to the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, Austin thought about the nature transformation of wind.
However, no matter what, thunder elements have a tangible form that can be transformed into something solid through nature transformation.
But wind?
Incorporeal, immaterial, how could its nature transformation be converted into a tangible object?
Wind Blade, Wind Wall... perhaps these concepts could be drawn upon to create another sword similar to the Thunder Law.
However,
After attempting dozens to hundreds of times and failing, Austin finally understood that given time, he might be able to rely on the Thunderbolt Divine Sword method to condense another sword imbued with the Law of Wind.
But it was fundamentally impossible for a sword composed of Wind Elements to serve as a vessel for the Wind Law Origin.
A law is a law, and a law origin is a law origin.
The power of the Law Origin cannot be borne by mere elemental powers of the heavens and earth.
The attempts failed, and the path ahead seemed to be a dead end.
"Law Origin, Law Origin... the wisp of Thunder Law Origin within me originates from my bloodline. Perhaps my Giant Dragon Bloodline could serve as a vessel for the Wind Law Origin's power?"
Blue Dragon, the mythical master of thunder and storm.
It was said that even the mere release of their aura by an adult Blue Dragon could alter the very sky, bringing storms and thunder, and causing a deluge of rainfall.
Does this mean that the bloodline of a Blue Dragon contains the origin of wind, thunder, and water laws?
A Giant Dragon's capabilities are linked to the Legendary Law hidden within their bloodline.
As they grow, the Legendary Law within them gradually uncovers, finally allowing them to naturally step into the Legendary Realm.
The descriptions of Blue Dragons are always entwined with storms, thunder, and torrential rain, perhaps the result of the Legendary Laws of wind, thunder, and water being released!
If this is true, then it suggests that Austin's own Giant Dragon Bloodline might indeed be able to bear the Wind Law Origin!
Realizing this, Austin immediately began his attempts.
Earlier, he had treated the Wind Law Origin as a magical treasure to refine, but now he proactively drew that wisp of Wind Law Origin into his bloodline.
Inhale, exhale, inhale, exhale.....
Austin sat cross-legged atop the mountain peak, entirely focused on refining.
Outside, a tempest of wind and rain battered the land, lightning flashed and thunder roared, yet his massive figure remained steadfast and unmoving.
...
Meanwhile, as Austin began attempting to use his bloodline to refine that wisp of Wind Law Origin, the war within the Elf Kingdom was already reaching its conclusion.
As vast armies of Dragon Nest Beastmen marched in synchronized unison like a flood of iron into this crumbling Secret Realm Space, an overwhelming aura of malevolence swept through every corner of the space.
When a junior officer in the army executed a momentary step, vanishing while simultaneously unleashing a Fighting Qi Rasengan to obliterate a Silver-level Elf...
Once the true strength of the Dragon Nest Army was fully unveiled, as they formed martial arrays to slaughter with precision, the remaining Elves' resistance grew weaker and weaker, and their final lines of defense were overwhelmingly crushed.
The Elf Kingdom surrendered.
There was no way not to surrender. The Elf Mother Tree had suffered severe damage in previous attacks, the Holy Artifact Longbow was directly cut into two pieces, utterly destroyed, and along with the devastating defeat of the Elven Army three days ago, the entire Elf Kingdom had lost its capacity to resist.
With such an array of factors, when the Dragon Nest Beastmen Army effortlessly stormed to the foot of the Elf Mother Tree, the Elf Kingdom ultimately surrendered unconditionally to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The war was over,
and no one in the Elf Kingdom continued to resist. Even the Elf Elders standing beside the Elf Queen fell silent, saying nothing.
Even the multitude of Elf civilians had nothing to say. The scene of Austin's earlier actions was too awe-inspiring and terrifying, reducing them all to quaking fear.
All that remained was a sense of confusion about their impending captive futures.

chapters.title: Chapter 272 268: Successful Smelting (Third Update, Request for Monthly Votes)
chapters.content:
The powerful Dragon Nest Legion shattered the remaining resistance of the Elf Kingdom and completely occupied the entire Secret Realm Space of the kingdom.
With the surrender of the Elf Kingdom, the roadblock of the first stronghold expansion has also been completely removed, and no force in the surrounding area can resist the sweep of the Dragon Nest Legion anymore.
The future of the stronghold is bright.
Soon, once the stronghold is successfully built, it can form a flanked position linked to the main base of the Dragon Nest Tribe through transportation, while relying on the stronghold to implement the tribe's policy of continuous outward expansion.
With the anticipation of a bright future, the Dragon Nest Beastmen began to enter the post-war cleanup work.
Injury treatment, the reformation of the Beastman army, the completion of the camp... Many matters need to be arranged and completed one by one.
Of course, after crushing the elf resistance, the biggest problem Vini and others faced was the handling of the numerous elves and the disposition of this Secret Realm Space.
Austin entered a state of seclusion, so Vini and others found it hard to make decisions.
Thus, they decided to send people to occupy and station in this Secret Realm Space of the Elf Kingdom to monitor these elf prisoners.
At the same time, they chose to treat the elf groups differently.
All ordinary elves were classified as prisoners for either pioneering work or reconstruction and were all sent to work to contribute a portion of strength to the building of the Dragon Nest Tribe's stronghold.
The elves have the trait of being close to plants and also possess certain means to catalyze plants, which is very important for the pioneering and farming work of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, with Austin in seclusion, Vini and other high-ranking members of the Dragon Nest Tribe could only arrange for the unified training, transformation, and distribution of these numerous elves before speaking further.
Once these tens of thousands of elf prisoners had completed their disciplinary transformation under military training, Austin would decide, and then work tasks would be distributed to them.
Simultaneously, the upper echelon of all the elf kingdom prisoners were placed under house arrest.
Apart from the vast labor resource, the upper echelon of the Elf Kingdom also holds a significant portion of value.
Austin is interested in learning about the historical layout within the Kawa Great Forest a thousand years ago, certain information in the core area, and the conflicts and battles between elves and Beastmen.
Only by understanding more information can the direction become clear.
The mutated evil spirit, the destroyed Elf Royal Court, the core area Beastmen, and the undead wave that almost swept the entire Kawa Great Forest... Austin faintly sensed that there seemed to be a certain connection between them.
Perhaps the escaping royal elves from the Kawa Great Forest's core area know some secret information from a thousand years ago.
Therefore, the upper echelon of the elf kingdom was kept under house arrest in a specific area until Austin came out of seclusion to make a final judgment on them.
The development work of the stronghold proceeded in an orderly manner, especially after many elf prisoners were incorporated into the work, greatly accelerating the construction speed.
Using the initially established Stronghold City and the Elf Kingdom Secret Realm Space as the core, they continued to expand outward.
The Beastman army went out to sweep up one small tribe after another established nearby, simultaneously clearing away dangerous extraordinary creatures like Magic Beasts and Giant Beasts.
The production Beastmen, with the help of bronze tools, carried out extensive forest felling and land clearing, while elf prisoners were responsible for cultivating the cleared land.
Everything was orderly.
With the largest obstacle, the Elf Kingdom, out of the way, the construction speed rapidly increased, and the actual control range of the stronghold continued to extend outward.
In the hot construction boom, it's believed that soon the area near the stronghold will become self-sufficient and become the second important base for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
...
While the Dragon Nest Beastmen began large-scale development and construction at the first stronghold, Austin, who was in seclusion near the Dragon Nest Tribe's valley refining the Law of Wind, also made some progress.
"Finally succeeded!"
Austin let out a long breath from the clifftop, and the surrounding storm of thunder and lightning gradually dissipated.
As the thick clouds above gradually receded, the oppressive atmosphere also faded away.
After days of continuous attempts, Austin finally used his Spiritual Power, with his bloodline as a carrier, to integrate a trace of Wind Law Origin within himself.
After a thorough digestion and absorption,
just like the previous awakening of the Thunder Law Origin, that trace of Wind Law Origin also became his own.
From then on, Austin could also wield the power of the Law of Wind.
Greatly increased power!
Just as when he first awakened that trace of Thunder Law Origin, Austin's understanding of wind elements became more profound, and his ability to control wind attribute elements was rapidly improving.
This is the power of the Wind Law Origin, and it's precisely the reason Austin eagerly desired it, even at the cost of injury.
"Compared to the Thunder Law, the comprehension of the Wind Law is somewhat lacking, but the control of wind has genuinely improved significantly."
Feeling his keen sensitivity to the surrounding wind elements, Austin secretly thought in his heart.
Initially, after awakening a trace of Thunder Law Origin, Austin's control of thunder greatly increased, subsequently breaking through a certain bottleneck and successfully using the thunder attribute of Rasengan, becoming one of the most powerful Rasengan techniques Austin mastered.
Now, after refining and integrating that trace of Wind Law Origin into himself, Austin's change of Rasengan to the wind attribute also received significant enhancement.
Roughly estimated, if Austin were to use the wind attribute Rasengan again, its power could increase by at least 20%!
Moreover, the benefits do not stop there!
"Using the concept of Wind Blade as a principle, I wonder if I can create a Wind Longsword similar to the Thunderbolt Divine Sword."
This idea resurfaced in his mind once more.
If he can succeed,
with both swords drawn, wielding the power of wind and thunder simultaneously, the resulting power would not be as simple as one plus one.
"No, although the Thunderbolt Divine Sword is powerful, it also has some issues that need improvement!"
In the battle against the Kingdom's Holy Artifact of the Elf Kingdom, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, nurtured for only two months, was powerful enough to even cut through a Holy Artifact infused with Wind Law Origin in a direct confrontation.
The power was very strong.
However, the drawbacks were also apparent.
After that one strike, the fragile Thunder Sword Body had already collapsed and dissipated.
To nurture such a sword again, it can only be reforged and reintegrated with the Thunder Law.
This drawback needs improvement!

chapters.title: Chapter 273 269 Expansion
chapters.content:
The Sacred Artifact, capable of embodying the Wind Law Origin, is inherently extraordinary; it might once have been the weapon of a certain legendary figure from the Elf Kingdom.
The Thunderbolt Divine Sword, which Austin nurtured for over two months, could cleave it in one strike, which speaks volumes about its power.
Even a legend, if not cautious, could risk severe injury or demise if pierced by that sword.
Although the body of the Thunderbolt Divine Sword eventually shattered, its achievements were already remarkably impressive.
The nurtured state was still short in duration; had it been nurtured for another ten years or so, perhaps even the legendary would not dare to face its edge directly.
However, there were still flaws.
The Thunderbolt Divine Sword, once unsheathed, does not return; it perishes with the enemy, an exchange of destruction.
Flaws naturally need improvement.
With his ongoing exploration and reflection on nurturing the Thunderbolt Divine Sword, Austin gained a deeper understanding of this method and, combined with his previous experiences, had ideas on how to modify it.
"Formless from form, in the intangible form; perhaps, I need not be confined to the substantial mediums shaped by elemental attribute to forge the longsword."
Inspired by the Wind Sword that evolved from Wind Blade, Austin developed further ideas.
Previously, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword was based on the thunder attribute's Thunder Sword, then augmented by Thunder Law to enhance its power.
Now, Austin sought to employ another concept.
With Law as the bone, and element as the flesh and blood.
By condensing the Power of Laws, shaping it with Spiritual Power into a longsword form, and coating it with elemental power, a new Thunderbolt Longsword would finally be crafted.
The Wind Sword follows this pattern as well, with the Law of Wind as its core.
Thus, the two swords reside between form and formlessness, also able to be nurtured internally.
"The Law Divine Sword no longer remains a tangible object but a conceptual entity, so whether it shatters after being unsheathed doesn't matter; it can be recreated with a mere thought."
If this idea could truly succeed, then in future battles, there would be no need to worry about the embodiment shattering after a moment of eruption.
"Let's begin, the evolved form of the Law Longsword."
Austin closed his eyes, diving inward with his heart spirit, beginning his attempt.
Actually, he had already considered altering the existence form of the Law Longsword.
That Thunderbolt Divine Sword, nurtured for over two months, held incredible power; however, Austin sensed that its power had seemingly reached an upper limit.
The longsword formed through thunder attribute changes couldn't withstand power beyond its own level.
Nurturing it further might eventually lead to inevitable collapse.
Thus, the Thunderbolt Divine Sword had its limits, almost reaching them after being nurtured for more than two months.
In the mountains, Austin began his attempts repeatedly.
Once again, the sky was enveloped in thick clouds, filled with lightning and thunder, and this time, terrifying gale winds swept all around.
The mountain range remained undisturbed, allowing him to focus intently on the present task.
Should these attempts succeed, it would mean Austin could simultaneously forge another sword containing the Law of Wind while improving the Thunderbolt Divine Sword.
If the Wind and Thunder Swords could be successfully forged, Austin's prowess would ascend to another level.
...
Time slowly passed.
In the blink of an eye, more than a month had elapsed.
During Austin's retreat, the Dragon Nest Tribe had not halted its development.
The elf peasant captives were trained and transformed, integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe's Beastman system, significantly enhancing the tribe's strength.
With abundant labor resources, the vast fields cultivated in the first encampment and the first crop of kudzu had yielded a substantial harvest.
The elves, adept with plants, indeed proved to be skilled hands at cultivation.
Combining the Dragon Nest Tribe's years of farming experience with the elves' innate talents, the first kudzu harvest was bountiful.
The fields opened in the first encampment, coupled with the main base's nearby field harvests, provided enough grain to sustain the entire tribe for half a year.
Over three months of the scorching summer had passed, leaving five to six months before the cold winter, allowing several more kudzu planting seasons.
This year, ample grain supply was undoubtedly assured.
A bountiful harvest of grain remains the greatest joy for every sentient being surviving in the Kawa Great Forest.
Even the Elf Kingdom houses many impoverished elf peasants.
In the face of looming threats, the Elf Kingdom dares not expand extensively, thus relying solely on existing territorial resources to support tens of thousands of elves; naturally, this does not yield wealth.
With this bountiful harvest, the transformed elves developed a sense of belonging to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Now, even if the Elf Kingdom's upper echelons lift the confinement, rebellious elf elders won't garner much support.
With abundant grain, as part of Austin's expansion plan laid out in early spring, the Dragon Nest Beastman Legion set forth to sweep across the land.
Using the first encampment as the core, with numerous trained Blood Wolves leading the way, they began conquering one small tribe after another, escorting large numbers of beastman prisoners back to the encampment to bolster the Dragon Nest Tribe's beastman population.
The outbreak of sweeping warfare engulfed the area around the encampment in flames of conflict.
Many beastman tribes fiercely resisted, yet under the overwhelming strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe, they crumbled like dry leaves against a strong wind.
More beastman tribes, witnessing the immense power of the Dragon Nest Legion, directly surrendered.
In a short time, the Dragon Nest Tribe's population swelled once more.
Including the many elf inhabitants, the Dragon Nest Tribe's population skyrocketed to over eighty thousand in a short span!
Seeing further expansion could lead to indigestion, the Dragon Nest Tribe temporarily halted its expansion, turning focus on absorbing its current strength.
Transforming many captives into foundational strength was an extensive project, but fortunately, the Dragon Nest Tribe had long walked the path of external war expansion, thus possessing experience in all related processes.
With the Dragon Nest Tribe temporarily pausing its expansion, the surroundings of the encampment settled once again.
Yet, any smart beastman nearby knew this was merely a truce before the next round of warfare.
Following this expansion, the territory within a thirty-kilometer radius around the first encampment, dominated by the Dragon Nest Legion, was firmly under its control.
This meant the first encampment would be securely established, governing the nearby territory.
The encampment's expansion plan had already succeeded!

chapters.title: Chapter 274 270 Wind and Thunder Dual Swords (First Update, Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
The successful establishment of the first outpost greatly invigorated the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
The main settlement of the Dragon Nest Tribe had been developed for several years, carefully managed, with the surrounding hundred-mile area under their control.
However, this reached the limit of what the Dragon Nest Tribe could manage, and constraints from land production and the beastman population forced them to expand outward.
The outpost plan was essentially devised to acquire a forward base for expansion, supporting the continual outward growth of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Similar to the relationship between a main city and a satellite city, the main Dragon Nest settlement is the main city, and the outpost serves as the satellite city.
This expansion strategy, centered around the outpost, enables the Dragon Nest Tribe to expand outward with exceptional efficiency.
Step by step, relying on the forward outpost to attack or defend, they extend further to achieve expansion and exploration goals.
To strengthen the connection between the outpost and the main Dragon Nest Tribe settlement, Dragon Nest Beastmen invested considerable effort in constructing a road linking the two areas.
Of course, this road was merely a simple dirt path, not a labor-intensive gravel road or a stone-paved road.
Like paths in the mountains formed by repeated footsteps, it was merely cleared by Dragon Nest Beastmen into a straightforward dirt road through frequent use.
By training herds of wild buffalo for transportation, Dragon Nest Beastmen used this road to connect the two outposts, enabling substantial exchange and support of resources.
Bronze tools not yet produced by the outpost, various grain resources, and hunting squad's fauna resources from external tribes all traveled through this road for a certain level of transportation link.
With such a road, communication between the outpost and the settlement remained unbroken.
The success in opening the first outpost instilled strong confidence throughout the Dragon Nest Tribe.
It is believed that a new outpost will soon be proposed for establishment.
Using the main settlement as the core, multiple forward outposts will be continuously established, linked through buffalo transport teams, constantly expanding the territory of the Dragon Nest Tribe and rapidly boosting its strength.
The rapidly developing Dragon Nest Tribe did experience shortcomings.
The proportion of Extraordinary beastmen within the tribe was small, with overall strength not high.
Before the harsh winter, Austin selected some "seeds" for extraordinary transformation during the First Dragon Nest Games.
Austin, having awakened the Law Origin, would have a better transformative effect on activating extraordinary seeds with the beastmen.
Moreover, prior to this, the Extraordinary beastmen "seeds" selected had undergone preliminary training, providing them with a stronger foundation, and the post-transformation Extraordinary Beastmen would start at a higher level, with Austin's current strength allowing for more transformations.
Unfortunately, a series of events left Austin without time to focus on transforming beastmen, leaving the hundreds of selected Extraordinary beastmen seeds in standby.
Luckily, it won't be long, just as soon as Austin finishes his retreat, he can mass-produce elite extraordinary beastmen, significantly enhancing the strength of the Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe.
The several months' wait does not matter for a few more days.
With the Elf Kingdom's surrender, the Dragon Nest Tribe entered a steady development phase.
The zombie undead to the southwest did not further expand, seemingly "frightened" by the earlier removal of a pyramid, scarcely spotted moving within two hundred miles of wasteland.
Previously, Austin's successive defeats of the Blood Claw Tribe's elite did not evoke any reaction, with the Blood Claw Tribe remaining quiet, the Tribe Alliance busy gathering forces to face the impending zombie undead, not intervening in Austin and Blood Claw's enmity.
It was calm, without any conflict.
This rare stable phase facilitated the Dragon Nest Tribe's rapid development.
...
Meanwhile, at the mountain retreat where Austin was cultivating, the wild winds and thunderstorm gradually ceased, and the heavy clouds above slowly dispersed.
"Finally succeeded!"
Feeling the two incredibly powerful forces within him, Austin murmured softly.
Buzz, buzz, buzz!
With a slight thought, the void ahead rippled visibly, like a calm lake disturbed by two stones, and suddenly two swords, glowing brilliantly like a galaxy, emerged from the void, hovering before him.
These were new swords formed by focusing on Law, with elemental power as their flesh and blood.
With these two Law longswords appearing, the previously dispersed whirlwind and thunderstorm abruptly coalesced again, the heavy clouds above gathered once more, overwhelming the world.
Rumble!
Amid deafening thunder, streaks of lightning tore across the sky, a fierce gust arose, whipped up volumes of sand and dust, transforming the world into a turbulent storm, as if heralding an apocalypse.
The elements of thunder and wind were raging throughout the world!
The mere appearance of these swords in the world caused a dramatic change in the surrounding weather.
This was the power of these upgraded Law longswords!
"Regarding the Thunder Sword, let's continue using the name Thunderbolt Divine Sword. As for the Wind Sword, since the wind originates from the heavens and earth, we'll call it Celestial Wind."
Thunderbolt Divine Sword, Celestial Wind Divine Sword.
One commands the thunder elements of the world, the other commands the wind elements.
Each represents its own Law power, possessing mighty divine might.
"In my past life, there seemed to be a movie with the concept of Wind and Thunder Dual Swords unification, producing immense power. I wonder if my Wind and Thunder Swords could unify..."
Recalling Wind and Thunder Dual Swords, Austin pondered in his mind.
Dual Swords Unification, an idea prevalent in ancient martial arts novels and TV shows during his childhood, even a cartoon version with animals wielding swords from two to three, extending to seven could be unified.
Perhaps, it's worth a try.
However, Austin had little expectation for it.
Dual Swords Unification seemed simple, but in reality, mastering and merging two completely different powers to enhance their strength was complex.
Without understanding their principles, Austin had no basic guess or direction for trial and exploration.
Without a concept or direction, its complexity surpassed any technique Austin had developed previously.
However, the matter of Dual Swords Unification wasn't urgent; insight into the Wind Law Origin still required a long distance.
Just leveraging the Law power inherent in the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords was sufficient for Austin to significantly enhance his strength.
At least wait until his power hits a bottleneck before pursuing further advancement.
"Forget it, let's head back first!"
Two months in retreat made him feel rusty, necessitating some exercise.
Just as Austin prepared to spread his wings and leave, suddenly,
"Hey, big guy, how did you end up so large?"
A crisp, youthful, melodious voice unexpectedly echoed at his ear.
Austin was startled, feeling his hair stand on end with shock.

chapters.title: Chapter 275 271 Crystal Young Dragon (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Austin's heart was alarmed, nearly jumping in shock.
Someone silently approached him, and he hadn't detected anything at all!
"Who?!"
He suddenly turned his head, not knowing when a figure had appeared beside him.
It was a young dragon, a real young dragon.
About one meter tall, not considered small in the eyes of an ordinary beastman, but in front of the six or seven meters tall Austin,
it was like a human next to a big husky.
The young dragon sounded like a little girl, and her whole body was covered in scales that shimmered in the sunlight, like pieces of crystal.
A crystal young dragon.
No wonder, it was said that crystal dragons have highly innate space talents. No wonder this crystal young dragon could approach him without him noticing at all.
Piece by piece, scales like crystal, clear and sparkling.
Austin suddenly felt a strong impulse arising from his instincts.
To take this crystal young dragon back to his nest and hide her there.
Dragons are inherently greedy, especially fond of shiny things. Although Austin's mature soul usually suppresses this instinct, at this moment, seeing that sparkling crystal young dragon, he almost took her back as if she were a piece of crystal.
Barely managing to suppress this instinct, a thought suddenly flashed through his mind.
No wonder metal dragons and crystal dragons had higher status than five-colored dragons when seeking mates. After forming a pair, they could often see gold and silver crystal dazzling before their eyes; who wouldn't like that?
Dragons are inherently greedy, sharing a nest, perhaps often drooling over their mate's sparkling scales.
That image, unbearable to look at.
"Hey, big guy, what are you thinking?"
The crystal dragon's clear and sweet voice rang out just in time, interrupting Austin's wayward thoughts.
"Ah, nothing, nothing at all."
Austin quickly pushed aside the inappropriate images from his mind and came back to his senses.
"I always feel like you're thinking of something bad."
The crystal dragon looked at Austin with a gaze full of suspicion.
"No, definitely not. By the way, little sister, who are you? How did you get here?"
"What little sister? Don't fool me, big guy, you definitely aren't much older than me."
The crystal dragon girl pouted and stared at Austin, making him feel utterly bewildered.
"Avril, big guy you can call me Avril. I saw some lightning and thunder over here, so I came to see if there's anything fun."
Upon hearing this, Austin frowned, sensing that things were not so simple.
Young dragons are usually watched over by adult dragons.
Avril appearing here, does it mean there is an adult dragon's nest nearby?
This is not good news.
Although crystal dragons are of the lawful good alignment, leaving one's life in others' hands is not a good thing.
If careless, encountering an adult dragon with a slightly heavier curiosity.
Oh dear, how did this blue young dragon grow so fast, it's intriguing. Let's dissect and take a look.
Even if this world doesn't have any methods for slice research, being the subject of study wouldn't be any better.
"By the way, big guy, how did you grow so fast? So amazing, uncle Guppa said dragons mastering law powers in their young dragon stage are already very talented. You mastering law at such a young age is simply a talent among talents."
These words made Austin shiver internally.
That he could master law powers was seen through by the girl before him.
Austin's eyes flickered.
"I don't know either, seems like I ate something unknowingly before becoming like this."
"Oh, I see."
For some reason, the crystal dragon girl seemed a bit low.
What's this reaction?
Could it be like a child wanting to grow up quickly, seeing hope and then being ultimately let down?
So that's how it is.
"Avril, does your family live nearby?"
Austin probed.
"No, my home is very far away. Originally, I was going with uncle Guppa to that place with many dragons called Celestial Dragon Island. But halfway, we ran into some good friends, so we took a detour. Uncle Guppa and his friends were talking about some boring things, so I came out by myself."
Avril showed no defense, saying it all at once.
Indeed, adults visiting with kids and talking about this and that can be quite exhausting for naturally restless children, especially when adults talk for a whole day.
"Big guy, where do you live? How about taking me to your place to play?"
Just as Austin was about to speak in response to Avril, suddenly,
Splash!
In a sound like tides crashing, space rippled like a mirror shaking, layer after layer of space ripples collapsed inward, and a bald, burly middle-aged man walked out of the space.
"Alright, Avril, time is running out, we have to hurry on our way."
With a resounding sound, Austin felt as if a realm from above descended, covering the surrounding void.
As he remained unsettled, Avril puffed her cheeks and whispered:
"Clearly it was uncle Guppa who got sidetracked, and kept babbling for days, don't blame me for missing the time."
Though the voice was small, it was naturally impossible to hide it from the bald middle-aged man, who awkwardly touched his nose.
"Okay, this time it's uncle Guppa's fault. In the future, if Avril wants uncle Guppa to go east, then uncle Guppa will never dare to go west, how about that?"
"Hmm, that's more like it."
The bald middle-aged man couldn't help but pat Avril's little head.
"Don't touch my head, it won't grow big!"
Avril puffed her cheeks.
Ignoring her, he looked towards Austin.
"Avril, is this your new friend?"
"Yeah, yeah, the big guy is really nice."
Avril nodded, in her pure understanding, anyone she could converse with favorably was a friend.
"Already starting to involve law powers, hmm, little guy, reaching this stage in your juvenile period is very impressive, also a strange sword, huh? You don't have any parents to teach you?"
In the bald middle-aged man's gaze, deep as the star river, it seemed to see through multiple spaces, see through everything in the world, and all the secrets of Austin were laid bare before him.
This made Austin nearly break into a cold sweat.
Fortunately, the biggest secret he seemed unaware of.
"No need to be nervous, little guy, you already match the four words 'astonishing talent'; there aren't many geniuses among the Giant Dragon Race, and I naturally won't do anything to you."
As he spoke, the bald middle-aged man extended his hand, in a burst of radiant glow appeared a half-transparent dragon claw.
Then a certain scale from the dragon claw began to automatically detach, reflecting a deep luminescence.
"Little guy, a dragon growing to this stage in such a place is surely have gone through many hardships. Because of a mission, I'm about to leave and can't offer you much help. This scale is my gift to you."
With that, the bald middle-aged man handed the translucent scale in his hand to Austin, his gaze full of approval.
On Austin, he didn't smell any scent of an adult dragon.
Meaning, the little guy achieved his current accomplishments entirely by himself.
For such a self-reliant junior, being from the Giant Dragon Race, even if not of the same lineage, the bald middle-aged man wouldn't hesitate to offer some care.
If not for the tight mission schedule, he might even have taken him back for a good teaching session.

chapters.title: Chapter 276 272: The Final Tomb (Third Update, Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
"If there's anything you can't resolve in the future, you can take this scale and come to Celestial Dragon Island to find me. If it's within my power, I'll try my best to help."
"Thank you, elder."
Austin quickly expressed his gratitude and carefully put away the scale.
Although he didn't know what it was for, the fact that it was given so freely suggested it wasn't a simple item.
It seemed this elder wasn't so hard to talk to after all.
What a relief.
Austin secretly sighed in relief in his heart.
Luck was still on his side; all the worries he had before did not come to pass.
"Alright, time is almost up, Avril, let's go."
The bald middle-aged man nodded and looked at Avril.
A man and a dragon soared up, and the space above suddenly spun and collapsed inward, forming a massive void vortex.
The two figures flew towards the pitch-black void vortex.
At that moment, as Austin relaxed, a question suddenly popped into his mind.
Avril mentioned that they originally intended to go to that Celestial Dragon Island, but ended up diverting through here due to someone else.
Moreover, that existence known as Guppa, with unknown realm and power, had triggered Avril to come out because of negotiations with certain people.
What were they discussing?
Could it relate to the current situation in the Kawa Great Forest, especially the zombie undead tide sweeping through the entire forest land?
Previously, Austin had found it strange why no legendary figures had stepped in during the widespread zombie undead tide.
Could the negotiations between Guppa and certain people be related to this?
To become a negotiator, one's level and power must be at least beyond legendary!
Were the talks beyond legendary level targeting the upheaval in the Kawa Great Forest this time?
Austin instinctively sensed a feeling of unease.
"Elder Guppa, I have settled nearby and developed a Clan Tribe, but recently a mutant undead nearly swept through the entire Great Forest, even spreading nearby. Can the elder give me some advice?"
Connecting this to the situation in the Kawa Great Forest, taking advantage of Guppa and Avril not fully disappearing, Austin suddenly shouted.
"It's nothing much. If you don't get involved, there won't be any danger. The calamity unleashed by the mutant undead has reached its limit. Those high and mighty legendary beings have begun their final act to bury everything. Soon, they will face total annihilation."
A low voice echoed around, causing Austin's heart to tense as he listened carefully, not wanting to miss a word.
"This chaos is just the last counterattack before the insects' deaths... The continuation of that war is about to reach its final conclusion... The legendary figures fear the legacy left by those people, but the probing cannon fodder has already gathered, and everything will end."
The bald middle-aged man seemed to recall something amidst his dazedness, with a tone of regret, sighs, and indescribable emotions.
"Like the last shovelful of soil on a grave, when they perish, they become the final gravestone."
"No matter how great the achievement, it will one day fall to dust, becoming the grave of death, forever resting within the earth..."
The thunderous echoes between heaven and earth slowly faded, and the massive void vortex in the sky above closed and disappeared, as if nothing had ever appeared.
Austin stood in place, racking his brain.
At this moment, he far from comprehended every word of Guppa, but from Guppa's words, he detected some clues.
The initiation of the zombie undead calamity indeed had a mastermind behind it manipulating everything.
And those legendary existences watching from afar had begun to place their chess pieces, pushing the final situation forward to completely end all this in a war.
These two points are the information Austin could temporarily confirm.
Simultaneously,
According to the bald middle-aged Guppa's words, the masterminds behind the zombie undead calamity, which swept through the Kawa Great Forest and forced hundreds of thousands of beastmen to retreat and attack the Bloody Border, had always been the weak side?
Their actions were just the last resistance before the insects' death.
Now, they had reached a dead end.
No wonder after the destruction of the Pyramid and the interception and defeat of the vanguard of the zombie undead army, there was no further action from the zombies and undead as they retracted and defended.
So, it's because of these reasons.
Some doubts suddenly became clear.
The chess game promoted by the legendary ones is likely the upcoming grand counterattack by the Tribe Alliance of hundreds of thousands of beastmen at the border and the humans beyond the border.
No wonder the humans and beastmen, who harbored endless years of blood feuds, put aside their enmity. It's probably the result of the legends intervening.
These numerous Tribe Alliance beastmen, along with the humans who united with them, may be the probing cannon fodder Guppa referred to!
"Trouble, too much trouble!"
Guppa's words made Austin barely sort out some things.
However, when you solve one mystery, even more mysteries appear before you!
Who exactly are the masterminds behind the zombie undead calamity?
Why did they initiate a turmoil that swept through the entire Kawa Great Forest and yet were the weaker side?
What does fearing the legacy left by those people mean?
And the end of the last war, the last shovelful of soil on the grave that buries everything...
So many questions, too many.
Realizing the broad situation he faced didn't make Austin happy.
Because behind all of this, there was likely an even grander truth hidden!
And all of this almost made him shiver with fear.
"The counterattack should begin soon. In this war pushed by the legendary beings, exploratory and exhaustive, I'm better off staying on the sidelines and minding my own business."
Austin had already made up his mind not to get involved in these troubles.
"According to the Tribe Alliance's side, the zombie undead calamity was initially triggered by mutations of evil spirits in the core area. Although there's plenty exaggerated, it started spreading from the core is true... A thousand years ago, the Elf Kingdom that once dominated the entire Kawa Great Forest might know something."
Too many doubts urgently needed answers.
Gazing at the shimmering scale in his claw, Austin did not stay for long, spread his wings, and flew away.
Having won the war with the Elf Kingdom, the elves surrendered and submitted entirely.
More than two months have passed, and who knows the specifics of the Dragon Nest Tribe now.
Perhaps nothing problematic happened, and maybe they'll even provide him with some surprises.
However, compared to the surprises from the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin was more eager to uncover the ultimate truth from the Elf Kingdom's high command.

chapters.title: Chapter 277 273 Returning to the Tribe (Fourth Update, Request for Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Dragon Nest Tribe.
As the dominant center of the region within a hundred miles, the Dragon Nest Base, after years of expansion, has already grown to the scale of a small city.
Enormous buildings rise from the ground, with rows of houses stretching endlessly. The street planning is neat and orderly, making it particularly pleasing to the eye.
Beastmen walk the streets, with the ground clean and tidy; even the fallen leaves are swept away, unlike other Beastman Tribe gathering places where dung is scattered everywhere in street corners.
As a semi-militarized managed Dragon Nest Tribe, nowadays, with the rapid population growth, some aspects have been somewhat relaxed, but when it comes to discipline and hygiene, those are ironclad rules that will never be casually loosened.
At the beginning stage of Dragon Nest Tribe's construction, to maximally consolidate the power of the Beastman Race, the entire tribe implemented complete militarization management.
Unified arrangement, unified command, unified food distribution.
It's precisely this initial military management that allowed the Dragon Nest Tribe to expand and develop at an unbelievable speed.
But later, as the Dragon Nest Tribe's population gradually increased, especially after surpassing ten thousand, re-implementing unified militarization management was no longer suitable for this gradually huge military group.
Therefore, in daily management, the Dragon Nest Tribe gradually loosened its control over the Beastmen.
First was the distribution system, transitioning from collective food distribution to a work-points system, then based on the actual situation of the Beastmen, they were gradually divided into Beastman Soldiers, Beastman Militia, and Beastman Producers.
As time passed and the tribe's population rapidly expanded, this institutional change was further gradually improved.
Nowadays, the Dragon Nest Tribe system is military power as the main body, with various dependent Beastman Producers as auxiliary, complementing each other.
The implementation of the work-points system also represents the recognition of individual labor.
Beastmen with leftover work-points began to gradually engage in trading, and the recorded work-points assumed part of the currency function.
With the tribe's population further increasing, today, there have been some signs of a private economy within the tribe.
The Beastman leadership did not obstruct this because, having been around Austin for a long time, they were frequently instilled by Austin with some modern civilization knowledge to avoid forgetting some things, and they were told outlines for the tribe's development.
Included were some issues regarding the private sector.
In Austin's blueprint, if an Orc Kingdom could indeed be established throughout the entire Kawa Great Forest in the future, then the nucleus of that kingdom would never be complete militarization but a system focusing on the military as the main body, with private individual enterprises rising together.
Military power as the core, the populace as the foundation.
This is Austin's blueprint goal for that future kingdom, and the Beastman leadership is also aware of it.
With the increase in ordinary Beastman Producers, after wealth accumulation, things like private trade would inevitably emerge.
Therefore, when the tribe's private transactions appeared, the Beastman leadership did not stop it.
Of course, they did not encourage it either; everything was allowed to take its course naturally.
However, relative to some relaxations in areas, the tribe secretly tightened political education for the Beastmen.
Whether tightening or not actually doesn't matter. Throughout the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Dragon Nest Beastmen's worship of Austin and the cohesion towards the Dragon Nest Tribe cannot be compared to any tribe in the Kawa Great Forest.
These changes happening within the Beastman are hard to see.
But just by taking a look at the current Dragon Nest Tribe City, one can feel to what extent the Dragon Nest Tribe has developed.
Compared to two months ago, the tribal city has once again been greatly expanded.
Interconnected buildings rise from the ground, high walls enclosing rows of houses, with streets varying in an orderly layout.
One could even say that the Dragon Nest Tribe City now is the only civilized place within the Kawa Great Forest.
When Austin flew over the sky and gazed at the vast town below, a sense of pride surged in his heart.
This is the city he built!
From the initially destitute seven and a half kobolds, constructing simple thatched huts on trees.
To today, the prototype of a city is rising in the boundless sea of trees, vast fields spreading out in all directions.
Beastmen are walking and working within the town, and the entire tribe city is a scene of prosperity.
To have developed to this stage with nothing but bare hands, anyone has the right to pride.
The kobolds, who were initially protected under his wings, struggled to survive in the dangerous forest while holding wooden spears tremblingly against Ghost-headed Crocodiles, never imagined the scene today!
After a turn in the sky, the Beastmen below cheered enthusiastically.
Even separated by thousands of meters of sky, Austin could feel the fervent worship coming from countless Beastmen below.
Before long, Austin landed on the high platform in the center of the inner city, where Vini and other Beastmen were already waiting.
"Your Highness, you are back."
