"Hmm, Vini, Quik, and Rodney, you all did a great job."
Even just looking down from the sky, one could feel that robust upward momentum.
The Dragon Nest Tribe's development to its present stage is inseparable from their efforts.
Afterwards, Vini and others reported on some recent developments of the Dragon Nest Tribe, briefly summarizing the overall situation to Austin.
Recently, nothing major occurred within the tribe.
In the process of expansion and development, the Dragon Nest Tribe achieved everything smoothly, significantly enhancing its controlled region after successfully establishing the first stronghold, meanwhile clearing dangerous areas while sweeping nearby Beastman Tribes, acquiring numerous magic resources.
Overall, the Dragon Nest Tribe remains stable.
However, there are two rather troublesome matters needing Austin's direct attention.
The first is the need to raise the number of Extraordinary Beastmen. This transformation process mandatorily involves Austin. During the cold winter, hundreds of seeds were selected through events, and now with Austin's return, this issue can be resolved, enhancing the Dragon Nest Tribe's military strength.
The second is Rodney wishing to select some elves from the elf captives to train into a spellcaster team.
In the battle outside the first stronghold, the lack of spellcasters in the Dragon Nest Legion revealed its drawbacks. Now having overthrown the Elf Kingdom, it is the right time to select and form the Dragon Nest Tribe's own spellcaster team from the large number of elves.
For these two matters, Austin naturally had no reason to refuse, yet he did not immediately proceed.
Currently, what he most aspires to is meeting the Elf Queen, who has been under house arrest for over two months, to obtain information about the core area from the upper echelons of the elves.
A thousand years ago, they once ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest, so they must be knowledgeable about many things.
The unknown realm power of Guppa's words brought immense pressure to Austin.

chapters.title: Chapter 278 274 Meeting (First Update, Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
The Elf Queen Eve gazed out the window, maintaining this posture for quite a long time.
Since being captured, the Dragon Nest Beastman soldiers had escorted her and the Elven higher-ups to the Dragon Nest Tribe City, confining them in this room.
As the former queen of a kingdom, she naturally received preferential treatment.
The house was well-ventilated and bright, offering a view that encompassed much of the tribe from a high vantage point.
Although she couldn't leave freely, life here was not as bleak as imagined.
Looking at the former citizens of the kingdom, walking the streets with smiles on their faces, Eve's feelings were complex. She couldn't tell if she should feel grateful or sorrowful, as mixed emotions made her heart ache.
In the past, to escape the pure-blooded Beastmen's pursuit and to prevent their pursuers from finding their tracks, the remnants of the Elf Kingdom mostly hid within the kingdom's Secret Realm Space, rarely venturing out.
If not for the Beastmen establishing outposts, cutting down a large number of trees and shaking the Elf Mother Tree's foundation, leading the Elf Kingdom to mistakenly identify the Dragon Nest Beastmen as their pursuers, the elves probably would not have shown themselves so easily.
This approach of guarding the Secret Realm Space protected the kingdom's elves, but it also led to significant poverty among the lower-class elven populace.
Within this small Secret Realm Space supported by the Mother Tree, it was necessary to sustain tens of thousands of people.
At the same time, the limited land resources were largely occupied by the elven elders and other upper nobles.
The remaining small portion was the farmland upon which the elven commoners relied for survival.
The upper class pursued luxury, filling their rooms with intricately carved artworks, and planted beautiful flowers and trees on fertile lands, occupying most of the kingdom's Secret Realm Space but not engaging in production.
The lower-class elven populace struggled to survive on the limited barren lands and still had to pay a large share to the upper class.
The sense of peace and stability within the entire Secret Realm Space was just a façade crafted by the upper-class elven nobility, content with the status quo.
The true Elf Kingdom had already rotted away long ago.
Since becoming queen, bearing the fate of the race's continuation, Eve rarely saw the smiles on the faces of the elven commoners.
Eve did not understand grand principles but could clearly feel that her people were not happy.
Life was hard, and the atmosphere was oppressive.
But now?
When the kingdom space was breached, the army broke, and the Dragon Nest Legion marched in, Eve often imagined the miserable life her people would face.
In the Forest Land, the victors often liked to take the vanquished as slaves.
And among slaves, fewer than ten percent survived a year!
Those dark lives would forever haunt them.
The Elf Kingdom was completely destroyed from then on.
However, when the despairing Eve became a captive, confined in the Dragon Nest Tribe City.
As time passed, what she saw was more and more smiles on the once ordinary citizens' faces.
Genuine laughter from the heart.
This indicated that the natural people, turned captives of evil, had not fallen into the dark hell but rather attained a satisfaction hard to achieve during the kingdom period.
Is it laughable?
Laughable.
She, being the queen of all the surviving elven people, reigning over the kingdom's remaining elves, believed Nature's light could bring beauty to each of her people.
Yet she only brought them poverty and struggle, while under the regime of evil, joy blossomed.
Eve quietly looked out the window, the experiences over more than two months greatly shook her heart.
She stood there, dumbfounded, for a long, long time.
At some point, a Beastman soldier came to take her away.
Eve composed herself, remained calm, and also carried a sliver of curiosity as she left.
She was about to meet the legendary figure who, in a few short years, single-handedly built this vast empire.
Blue Dragon Austin.
...
The enormous great hall resembled a circular coliseum, with giant stone tiered walls surrounding it, sunlight streaming down from overhead, casting a vast shadow over the central platform and covering a large area.
A massive shadow stood towering at the top.
The face obscured by shadows was out of sight, but with a little imagination,
one could envision the horrific and terrifying figure hidden within the shadows, a darkness swallowing the world, plunging it into a chasm of despair.
A figure capable of terrifying a neighboring child to death.
"Greetings, Your Highness."
Eve half-knelt towards the terrifying, despair-inducing figure, offering the due courtesy to the one who had destroyed her kingdom and was now the master of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Eve looked down, unable to see the face.
Austin could sense that the elf queen before him had her own thoughts, yet he did not care.
"Elf Queen Eve, having stayed here for two months, you should understand, under my command, there has never been differentiation between races."
Austin observed the figure below, his deep voice echoed like thunder in the vast hall.
"Whether Goblins, Kobolds, Ratmen, Jackal Wolf people, Lizardmen, Minotaurs... regardless of their race, there are, to me, only two kinds of people: useful and useless. If you can satisfy me, I don't mind letting you continue to lead your people."
His voice paused, then lifted a bit.
"Do you understand?"
Eve remained silent, raising her head slowly, looking towards the giant shadow above.
The face was unseen, but from the outline, one could imagine the terrifying head hidden within the shadow.
Yet in Eve's heart, a sudden beacon of hope was born, marked with disbelief, her voice slightly excited.
"Thank you for your mercy, great Austin, Your Highness."
She understood Austin's meaning.
She could continue to be the queen within the Elven community, as long as she demonstrated sufficient value.
This meant the Elf Kingdom could become a vassal kingdom of Austin.
The Elf Kingdom could possibly continue to exist!
As the queen of the elven race, her mother once entrusted the kingdom's remnants into her hands, the monumental task of extending the kingdom's future.
If hope existed, how could Eve resign to let the kingdom fade into history?
Even if the Elf Kingdom became a puppet, even if the title of Elf Queen was merely nominal, Eve would not wish for this emblem of significance to vanish.
"Very well, regarding some matters next, I do not wish for you to conceal them."
What has been swallowed, Austin would not easily relinquish.
As long as the majority of elves were under his control, as long as the major part of the elven populace served him, as long as he could draft powerful individuals to form a spellcaster army under his command.
With most elves under his control, what did the nominal title of an Elf Queen of the Elf Kingdom amount to?
Austin had learned in his past life about methods to sideline a power structure, though he might not have seen pigs run, he had surely eaten pork.
```

chapters.title: Chapter 279 275 Beastman Royal Court (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
One hand holds a big stick, the other a carrot.
Austin deliberately gave away a false title, all for the Elf Queen Eve to reveal everything she knows.
The situation in the Kawa Great Forest is indeed quite complicated now.
Especially Austin and his Dragon Nest Tribe, who have expanded and grown to this extent in just a few years.
Although this development speed is quite astonishing, it also has many shortcomings.
One of them is the foundation of information.
Some information, which may be common knowledge for large tribes, remains elusive secrets to Austin, who rose rapidly in a short time.
"Eve, elves have said before that a thousand years ago, your branch of the elf race once established a massive elf kingdom in the heart of the Kawa Great Forest, ruling the vast forest land. Later, the beastmen rebelled, and you fled here, relying on the power of the Elf Mother Tree to hide. Then you encountered my soldiers, mistaking them for pursuing forces, and eventually, you launched the final war. Is that correct?"
Austin goes straight to the point without much preamble.
This information was obtained from the elven captives during the besieged warfare at the stronghold, and as for more detailed information, only the Eve before him might know.
"Forgive me, Your Highness, it was my oversight that offended you."
Eve covers her palm over her chest and bows in apology.
"What I need isn't these pleasantries. Tell me your history, the events before and after that battle a thousand years ago, and even earlier origins of your elves, in full detail. I will listen carefully, I have plenty of time."
The deep voice reverberated in the air, filled with an oppressive majesty.
Eve found Austin's demands somewhat strange, but she still slowly recounted what she knew.
All of this must be traced back a thousand years.
At that time, Eve was still a child, and much of what she knew was fragmented, spoken intermittently.
But at the same time, having experienced the great upheaval of the kingdom's downfall, Eve also had deeper insights into certain things.
A thousand years ago, or even further back, elves and beastmen lived peacefully together, and it seemed that there was an equally ancient covenant between the two races, a covenant dating back to unknown times.
And precisely because of this covenant, at that time, the elven royal family who ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest did not guard against the beastmen, which was the essential reason for the rapid collapse of the Elven Kingdom after the beastmen's rebellion.
Eve was unaware of the content of the covenant.
Back then, she was very young, merely an unfavored princess within the Elven Kingdom. During that massive beastmen rebellion, many of the royal family were killed, but she survived by luck, was raised to the queen's throne by the surviving elves, and eventually escaped to the nearby area to hide.
What Eve knew came merely from the occasional conversations of her parents, that it seemed to be a covenant from ancient times, incredibly important.
"A covenant, beastmen? And what happened afterward? Who currently occupies the central area, and after the rebellion, didn't those beastmen establish a Beastman Royal Court? Did some unforeseen changes occur later?"
Austin constantly revealed a look of doubt.
If there really was a Beastman Royal Court, then why is there no information about it?
At least, among the myriad races under Austin, numbering in the tens of thousands of beastman races, none had ever heard of a Beastman Royal Court within the Kawa Great Forest.
"There is, the Beastman Royal Court exists in the central area. They established the Beastman Royal Court shortly after overthrowing the kingdom."
As if hearing Austin's inner doubts, Eve continued to speak.
"The lack of circulated information is because they consciously block the news."
"Although the kingdom nominally ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest back then, in reality, the kingdom's citizens considered their bloodlines noble and treated the struggling half-beastmen outside the central area as if they were seeing beasts. Coupled with the extreme poverty of the beastman tribes around the borders, there wasn't a shred of benefit to be gained for the wealthy kingdom; thus, the kingdom adopted a policy of ignoring the beastman tribes outside the core."
"Later, after the beastmen struck back and toppled the kingdom, they also adopted the same policy, and even went further by deliberately severing ties with the beastman tribes in the barren outer regions. They only helped foster a few large tribes at the borders by supplying grain resources, which seemed aimed at letting them skirmish with humans to divert human attention."
Upon hearing this, Austin felt not relief, but even more puzzled.
"Why would those beastmen do this?"
So strange.
If he were leading beastmen to overthrow the Elven Kingdom, the next step would surely be to boast about it, thereby attracting numerous beastman tribes to rapidly expand the Beastman Royal Court's power.
Yet those beastmen deliberately severed ties with the outside world.
According to Eve, among the countless beastman tribes within the whole Kawa Great Forest, apart from those few super-large tribes on the border often engaged in tug-of-war with humans, none knew anything about the Beastman Royal Court in the central area.
Why were they doing this, essentially severing themselves?
"Because those beastmen connected with the ancestral covenant are truly pure-blooded."
Pure-blooded beastmen, the royal lineage among beastmen.
It is said among the beastman tribes scattered across the Kawa Great Forest, there once existed a tremendously vast Beastman Empire spanning the entire continent, established by pure-blooded beastmen!
"What!"
This time, Austin was genuinely surprised.
The first time he saw the name Pure-blooded Beastman was a few years ago, in a note left by a Gold-Level Great Mage.
Later, this matter even led a young man named Edward and a group of mercenaries to explore this place, resulting in conflict.
At the time, Austin had asked the Fox-faced Man Quik, and according to Quik, Pure-blooded Beastmen and the Beastman Empire were likely just myths conjured by the beastmen, and hence, he hadn't paid much attention.
Could these matters be related somehow?
Austin quickly pondered these thoughts in his mind.
"So, you're saying that currently, in the core area of the Kawa Great Forest, there exists a Beastman Royal Court established by pure-blooded beastmen, and it is providing support in the form of resources to nurture those few super-large tribes in the Border Tribe Alliance, right?"
Eve thought for a moment and replied:
"Those pure-blooded ones certainly established a Beastman Royal Court and occupied the place of the ancestors, that's for sure. As for those few super-large tribes tugging against humans for hundreds and thousands of years at the borders, they should indeed be supported by the Beastman Royal Court from behind."

chapters.title: Chapter 280 276 Empire Afterglow (third update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
No wonder!
If that's really the case, then the legendary vast Beastman Empire that spanned the entire continent might indeed have existed.
The Pure-bloods cutting off contact between the Royal Court and the myriad Beastman Tribes outside is probably to prevent further provoking the humans.
After all, with such gloriously unmatched feats of ruling the continent in the past, if the Pure-bloods were to unite the tens of millions of Beastmen within the Kawa Great Forest, the Beastman Kingdom they establish would surely become the target of hostility from the majority of human royal palaces.
Secretly supporting the establishment of super tribes like the Blood Claw Tribe at the border and frequently clashing with humans is probably another means of diverting attention.
Without the support of the Pure-blooded Beastman Royal Court, relying solely on raiding food supplies from the Human World at the border wouldn't be able to sustain the consumption of such massive tribal populations numbering in the hundreds of thousands to millions.
That Great Wall at the Bloody Border is said to have started construction a thousand years ago, and it might also be related to the Pure-blooded Beastman Royal Court at the core area. While guarding against the mega-tribes supported and established by the Pure-blooded Beastman Royal Court, it also guards against the Pure-blooded Beastman Royal Court deep within the forest.
"Perhaps, as Elder Guppa said, the protagonist of the bug's last counterattack before dying is these Pure-blooded Beastmen. The so-called continuation of the last war might just be the final end of the collapsing Beastman Empire war."
"And the zombie undead tide disaster sweeping across the entire Kawa Great Forest is something these Pure-blooded Beastmen pushed behind the scenes. The zombie undead tide army seems to be absorbing and synthesizing something very important to the Pure-blooded Beastmen with life as raw material, which is likely to become their capital to turn the tables, possibly part of their inheritance."
Wherever the zombie undead tide passed, life was extinguished, and the land became a wasteland.
And that Pyramid, in Austin's eyes, seemed like an altar.
An altar that uses boundless life as a sacrifice to obtain certain powers.
"Pure-blooded Beastmen see the surrounding Beastmen as savages. Even if they use them, they don't regard the Beastmen of the outer tribes as kin. Thus, the several mega-tribes at the border like the Blood Claw Tribe, which they supported, were deliberately calculated into becoming the raw materials of the zombie undead tide. Finally being exposed, they naturally faced backlash from the Beastman Alliance."
"No wonder the first warrior of the Blood Claw was suspected of being a spy. With the Pure-blooded Beastmen's prestige, this might not even be an impossibility."
Many things fell into place once Eve mentioned the words Pure-blooded Beastmen and Beastman Royal Court.
Things should be this way.
Many years ago, the continent-spanning Beastman Empire was destroyed for some reason.
The Empire's royal family, the Pure-blooded Beastmen, fled with a large number of Half-Beastman to the Kawa Great Forest, and settled and hid under an ancient pact with the Elf Kingdom.
Until a thousand years ago, the ambitious Pure-blooded Beastmen turned against their allies and launched a grand war against the Elf Kingdom, rapidly destroying it and occupying the core area.
Afterward, the Beastman Royal Court established by the Pure-blooded Beastmen consciously cut off contacts with the outside world, hiding well and setting up the outer defenses.
In recent years, the peaceful time ended.
For unknown reasons and unknown forces' interference,
the Beastman Royal Court faced an imminent crisis of destruction.
To retaliate, the Pure-bloods activated a massive undead calamity through the inheritance left by their ancestors.
This mutation of the undead calamity, like zombies, resembled a grand sacrificial ceremony, sacrificing the boundless life of the forest land, along with the death of the earth, to obtain their final reliance.
The Legendaries, wary of the inheritance left by the Beastman Empire back then, allowed the undead calamity to develop while they began to set up for the kill.
As the hundreds of millions of Beastman Alliance on the periphery reached an agreement with humans, probably now, the final setup counterattack war is complete.
"Yes, the note back then mentioned that the few remaining Pure-blooded Beastmen fled to the Kawa Great Forest. That was the last remnant of the Empire's royal lineage. As long as this war destroys the Beastman Royal Court, the once-gloriously unmatched Beastman Empire will also be completely buried. Those Pure-blooded Beastmen in the Beastman Royal Court are like the last clod of earth on the Beastman Empire's grave, about to fall."
Only at this moment did Austin finally understand the meaning of Elder Guppa's last words.
"No matter how great the achievements, one day they will fall to the mundane, becoming the purpose of death, forever resting beneath the earth."
That great achievement was likely the awe-inspiring Beastman Empire.
Even today, no country has been able to achieve the feat of ruling the entire continent as the Beastman Empire did back then.
From the current Central Earth's Human World, with its numerous human duchies, one can see a corner of the grand image of the Beastman Empire that once dominated the entire continent.
No wonder someone wants to completely eradicate the Beastman Royal Court, which carries on the Empire's afterglow.
"Just the war to clear the last remnants has swept across millions of square kilometers of the vast region of the Kawa Great Forest. It's truly unimaginable what kind of spectacular scene the final collapse of that vast Empire must have been."
Understanding the cause and effect, Austin couldn't help but sigh in his heart.
He wondered if he could, in his lifetime, establish a nation more glorious than the Beastman Empire of those days.
From under the starry sky, seeing all the land as one's territory.
"Your Highness, if there's nothing else, I'll take my leave first."
In the long silence, seeing Austin deep in thought, Eve prepared to leave.
"Yes, you may leave."
Austin waved a paw, signaling her to leave,
and as Eve turned, Austin casually asked.
"By the way, do you know the reason for the final collapse of the Beastman Empire back then?"
Her body suddenly went rigid.
This momentary rigidity allowed Austin to keenly perceive it.
The air felt a bit tense.
"Your, Your Highness, I..."
The Elf Queen Eve turned around, her voice stumbling.
Indeed, this woman knew something!
Austin narrowed his eyes, focusing on Eve below.
"Eve, I trust you wouldn't deceive me, right?"
With a thunderous sound resonating, a bit of dragon might was released, a terrifying pressure descended from the high sky, accompanied by an overwhelmingly dark despair, covering Eve's heart.
Silent, oppressive.
At a certain moment, Elf Queen Eve seemed to sigh, as if letting something go.
"Your Highness, I don't know much, but when I was very young, I once eavesdropped on a conversation between my father and someone behind the scenes..."
Eve hesitated for a moment, then uttered something that shocked Austin immensely:
"I suspect that long ago, both the Beastman Empire and the Kingdom were once blasphemers. This might be the biggest reason behind the unknown pact signed between the Pure-blooded Beastmen and the Elf race."

chapters.title: Chapter 281 277: Retreat Again (Fourth Update, Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
The so-called heretic refers to those who do not respect the gods and rebel against the Divine Church.
Unbelievers who do not believe in the divine are seen by the Church as lost sheep, and priests have the duty to guide these sheep in the right direction.
However, heretics are hated by every Divine Church, akin to the existence of Hell Demons.
Because they not only disrespect the divine, but also oppose them.
"Was the entire Beastman Empire heretics back then? What about your Elf Kingdom lineage?"
Austin seemed somewhat incredulous, but then suddenly understood.
No wonder the Beastman Empire eventually collapsed suddenly, and it is now difficult to find traces of the Beastman Empire left in the annals of history.
This world does contain true deities, with many Divine Kingdoms shining under the starry sky, the gazes of gods overlooking the human realm.
You may be an unbeliever or a follower of another deity, but you must never show any disrespect to the divine, even if another god is an archrival to your faith.
Heretics are the absolute enemies of every deity.
The entire Beastman Empire was established by heretics, which is truly hard to believe.
"I'm afraid during the collapse of the Beastman Empire, the lofty deities also intervened in this war, but where did the Beastman Empire get the courage to openly resist divine rule and build an empire spanning the entire continent?"
A perplexing question inevitably arose from the depths of his heart.
To create such a massive empire, the pure-blooded beastmen of the past certainly weren't fools.
Yet they still acted this way, perhaps possessing courage unfearing even the divine.
"Your Highness, this is merely a guess derived from conversations I overheard between Father King and Mother Queen discussing alliances, so it might not be the case."
Eve's expression appeared somewhat unnatural.
This isn't surprising, as every elf deeply believes in the God of Nature, viewing the God of Nature from the bottom of their hearts as their parent.
Every year, on God's birthday, the entire Elf Kingdom would hold a celebration lasting several days to repay their most beloved God of Nature.
However, now they are being told this.
Many years ago, their ancestors not only didn't believe in any deities but were famous heretics.
If that's the case, wasn't everything just a lie?
This is something nobody can accept.
Eve's reaction was understandable.
Next, Austin and Eve chatted in the great hall for a while longer, and after confirming the Elf Queen had nothing else to retain, he let her leave.
Even long after the silhouette of Elf Queen Eve had vanished, Austin stood still in place.
"How troublesome, the matter involves so much. Judging by the previous situation in the Kawa Great Forest where legends never emerged, it's estimated this time, the counterattack war to destroy the Beastman Royal Court might also have divine intervention behind the scenes. It seems better to stay in the tribe for a while; let those fellows resolve other matters themselves."
"Though once they had the courage to challenge the divine, even if the Beastman Empire eventually collapsed, the remnants of the empire probably still possessed enough strength to ensure their own survival."
"After all, though my current strength is not bad, in the face of a legendary divine-level war, I'm just a slightly stronger locust at best."
Having made up his mind, Austin decided not to participate in this war at all.
It's likely that cannon fodder will soon gather to counterattack, and having one more or less himself makes no difference.
Hopefully, all forces will severely damage each other, allowing him to reap the benefits afterward.
"Currently, the most important thing is to rapidly enhance my own strength."
A robust force is ultimately the most potent safeguard for self-preservation.
Especially since the entire Kawa Great Forest is about to enter a stage where a war impacting the entire forest land is on the horizon.
After carefully considering the upcoming plans, Austin then flew away.
...
In the period following that, the Dragon Nest Tribe continued to develop steadily.
The first stronghold was successfully established, and the surrounding farmland also yielded a harvest, with the first season's kudzu root achieving a bountiful yield.
Additionally, near the first stronghold, not only did they discover several orchards, but also three rivers, seven or eight lakes or reservoirs, and a very suitable plain for agricultural development.
The wild fruits in the orchards can be collected for food, and the river and lake areas, apart from having a large number of fish resources in the water, often serve as a watering place for herbivores, providing excellent hunting grounds.
Moreover, the large-scale development of the plain could provide more arable land for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
These all indicate that the Dragon Nest Tribe is about to enter a stage of significant output increase, with ample grains allowing them to support a larger beastman population, thereby continually increasing the population limit of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Rough estimates suggest that if the first stronghold is fully developed, it could sustain a population of at least over one hundred thousand.
Of course, this is under the premise of complete development, as the current development level of the territory near the first stronghold is only about one-tenth or one-twelfth.
Completing all development in just a few years is practically impossible.
The development planned for the first stronghold ahead requires little attention, simply executing the specific policies previously established steadily.
Once the first stronghold is fully developed, the Dragon Nest Tribe will inevitably undergo another round of expansion, pushing the beastman population to break through the hundred-thousand-number barrier.
Meanwhile, the Kobold Vini, the Fox-faced Man Quik, and other high-ranking members of the Dragon Nest Beastmen began to determine the direction of development for the second stronghold, while dispatching advance teams for exploration and investigation.
While the Dragon Nest Tribe was thriving, Austin also began his work.
Upon selecting the Extraordinary Seed from the previous cold winter season, among those chosen for meritorious reward, along with some later outstanding Demon Seed candidates, Austin performed extraordinary transformations on over a thousand total beastmen.
In the initial stages of the Dragon Nest Tribe's development, Austin did not understand the principles by which he could transform beastmen, simply believing it was the innate authority of the Giant Dragon Race.
As his strength increased, he has realized that this is the influence resulting from the Legendary Law hidden within the Giant Dragon Bloodline.
Now Austin has mastered two threads of Law, making the transformation effects naturally much better than in the past.
Thus, supported by abundant magic resources, over a thousand extraordinary clan members began to emerge from the transformation chamber, greatly enhancing the overall strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
These transformed beastmen clan members possess a minimum strength of intermediate Bronze level or above.
Such a vast number of extraordinary clan members, once even slightly trained, could join the main force of the Dragon Nest Legion, significantly boosting its strength.
After transforming the beastmen, Austin also handled some important miscellaneous matters within the Dragon Nest Tribe before finally having some free time.
However, there was no way he would remain idle doing nothing, never in this lifetime would he be idle.
The current situation in the Kawa Great Forest brought much pressure on Austin's strength.
So, with nothing much to do, Austin began to retreat into cultivation once again.
This time,
he intends to comprehend the thread of Wind Law Origin within his body, at least allowing his understanding of the Law of Wind to reach the level of his understanding of the Law of Thunder.
Only when the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords have roughly equal understanding of both laws will it prevent power imbalance and unleash even greater strength.

chapters.title: Chapter 282 278 One Month
chapters.content:
This time of retreat is mainly to enhance one's own power.
Apart from comprehending the Law of Wind, the elevation of one's own level is also essential.
Since the last period of slumber ended, Austin's level of strength has been gradually and steadily increasing. Under the accumulation of a large quantity of magic resources collected by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, he has now reached the intermediate gold level.
Intermediate gold level, Giant Dragon Bloodline, coupled with two strands of different law powers within the body, even when viewed across the entirety of Kawa Great Forest, Austin would not be considered weak.
However, in the face of the imminent great battle, this is still not enough.
This retreat, besides comprehending the strand of Wind Law Origin, aiming to reach the level of comprehension of the Law of Thunder, Austin also plans to elevate his level beyond high-tier gold.
For the Giant Dragon Race, as long as there are ample magic resources, the elevation of levels naturally won't have any bottlenecks.
And these vast magic resources rely on the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Initially, Austin established the Clan forces not only for self-preservation but also so that when the Clan Tribe grows in the future, it can gather enough magic resources for him.
Now, the Dragon Nest Tribe has undoubtedly become the dominant force in the area.
Within the legion, there are many formidable extraordinary beings, clearing some dangerous areas rich in magic and collecting the magic resources within is not a difficult task.
Collecting magic resources, Austin can do that himself too.
But the process is too cumbersome and time-consuming.
With the powerful collection ability of the Clan Tribe, it just saves the trouble of searching within.
And this also represents the beginning of the Dragon Nest Tribe gradually feeding back to Austin.
...
Time passes quickly, since Austin entered the mountain to comprehend the Wind Law Origin.
In the blink of an eye, more than a month has passed.
Atop the cliff, Austin sits cross-legged on the peak, a vast shadow is cast from the sky, covering most of the canyon.
As the Dragon Nest Legion continually sweeps the surrounding dangerous areas, they collect various magic-containing herbs, ores, magic crystals, and so on, and send them to the valley where Austin is to support his growth and consumption.
Currently, Austin's level is nearing the pinnacle of intermediate gold level, about to break through to high-tier gold.
Level strength has received considerable enhancement.
However, aiming to break through to high-tier gold, though Austin currently faces no bottleneck on his path ahead.
To achieve the transformation and enhancement, either he practices diligently and spends several years compressing and condensing the magic power within to naturally break through to high-tier gold.
Or he acquires higher-level magic resources, and while digesting these higher-level magic resources, induces a qualitative change in his magic power.
The former takes a little longer for Austin now.
As for the latter, high-level magic resources are not currently collectible by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Ordinary magic ores and magic herbs are already ineffective for me now. It's best to have a half-legendary Magic Beast Crystal Core, or some core containing vast elemental power, although such existences at these levels are difficult to defeat, even for me, needless to say for the Dragon Nest Tribe."
Not to mention how difficult it is to kill a half-legendary, these existences are rare in itself, and finding traces in the vast Kawa Great Forest is troublesome, with slim chances of discovering clues.
If things should go this way, maybe he really will need to spend several years slowly honing.
Several years is merely like a quick nap for the long-lived dragon race.
However, Austin ultimately isn't a pure dragon, he hardly ever sleeps. Just the thought of enduring several years makes him a bit uncomfortable.
"Forget it, let nature take its course then,"
It's an unavoidable situation,
he can only hone while being watchful to see if any traces of half-legendary Lord of Magical Beasts or super magic ore veins, magic elemental convergence areas are present in the Kawa Great Forest.
This time of retreat, reaching the peak of intermediate gold level strength is just one of the gains.
The greatest harvest of this cultivation is still the comprehension of the Law of Wind.
Relying on the strand of Wind Law Origin within, Austin has engaged in continuous comprehension for over a month, gaining insights into the Law of Wind equivalent to the Law of Thunder.
And this also signifies a balance between the powers of the laws of wind and thunder.
Repeatedly, due to the balance of the powers of the laws of wind and thunder, Austin has found the direction for the unification of Wind and Thunder Dual Swords to produce even more powerful forces.
A year ago, by referencing the ninja anime from a past life, Austin successfully developed magic Rasengan using the interaction of spiritual power and magic power.
At the same time, referencing the nature change of chakra attributes in the anime, Austin also completed the attribute nature change of the magic Rasengan, and based on this, successfully completed the super invincible heaven-defying compressed Wind Water Thunder Rasengan.
That Rasengan which destroyed the Zombie Undead Nest and the huge pyramid, is precisely the result of the fusion of wind, water, and thunder three attributes of magic power!
During the process of creating that Rasengan, Austin also gained considerable experience and insights in integrating wind, water, and thunder three attributes' powers.
Now, relying on past insights into attribute fusion, Austin has found the direction to merge wind and thunder two forces into one.
The unification of Wind and Thunder Dual Swords seems to have seen a glimmer of hope.
Of course, it is merely the direction, the road to success is still very far-reaching.
After all, law-level forces, despite only being a strand, in essence, they have surpassed the simple attribute powers.
"Although the unification of Wind and Thunder Dual Swords hasn't been developed successfully, my strength has at least increased by thirty percent!"
After sorting out the gains from this retreat cultivation, Austin is clear-hearted, and has a rough estimation of his own strength.
Moreover, as his comprehension of wind elements deepens, Austin, relying on some experience and knowledge from a past life, coupled with his current situation, has developed a rather famous auxiliary skill.
Downwind Ear.
Just like a certain deity in the celestial court from mythology, by relying on the ability of wind attribute elements, Austin can greatly enhance his own hearing.
Due to deliberate cultivation, Austin's mastery of his magic has reached a fine hair-like degree of refinement.
Afterward, leveraging this precise magic control and the fourth domain-type talent magic, Austin successfully simplified and merged talent magic to form a rudimentary domain of his own.
Wind aids the propagation of sound.
Due to this principle, Austin by combining his magical fine-scale operations within the rudimentary domain scope, as long as there is a hint of wind element anywhere, he can clearly hear the sounds transmitted from there.

chapters.title: Chapter 283 279: Elemental Lord
chapters.content:
Relying on the power of wind, Austin gained the ability similar to the Downwind Ear.
And based on this, he had some ideas for extending his abilities.
If wind can amplify those subtle sounds, allowing him to hear from afar, could it be used in reverse to eliminate his own sounds, reducing the noise of his actions to the smallest possible degree?
Silent Domain!
By using wind elements to completely erase the sounds he generates, creating a silent area, perhaps this could achieve unexpected effects when combined with Downwind Ear for espionage in the future.
Moreover, in the One Piece anime, powerful sword masters can hear the breathing among all things, thus discovering the enemy's weakness and ultimately severing them in one strike.
So, can the power extending from this ability ultimately expand to such an extent, to listen to the opponent's weaknesses, similar to the effect of Observation-style Dominance, and see through the enemy's attack openings in battle?
"An interesting technique, but with this approach, the fighting style seems to be somewhat off track."
Austin was momentarily troubled.
Austin is never short of ideas, and with ideas comes direction for developing power.
But if he built his own power system based on all kinds of ideas, it seems a bit odd in this world.
Other giant dragons either rely on a strong and unparalleled physical body or various Forbidden Curse Magic to deal with enemies.
But when it comes to himself, first it's Thunder Forging Body, followed by Electromagnetic Cannon, and then Rasengan and Law Flying Sword; carrying a flying sword to slash his enemies wasn't enough, now comes the Dual Swords Unification.
Facing those mage warriors of the world, this style seems quite out of place.
"Never mind, whether it's a black cat or a white cat, if it catches mice, it's a good cat. At least these advanced techniques based on ideas are far more powerful than the completely useless Talent Magic abilities I had."
Austin immersed himself in his heart spirit, beginning to test the Downwind Ear he'd developed.
Threads of magic power slowly spread into the void, as the prototype domain simplified from the fourth Talent Magic silently expanded to cover a range of several miles.
The wind elements, like elves, danced in the air, Austin seemingly able to sense the emotions of those elves.
Within the covered land, sounds echoed, and the originally dissipating vibrations in the air were transmitted to Austin's ears through the power of wind elements.
The cacophony of noises surged into Austin's ears in an instant, the sounds of the world he was in!
After a long period of time, Austin finally adapted.
Amongst the myriad of sounds, he could focus on the ones he wanted.
"So this is the world of sound..."
With his heart spirit wandering in this ocean of sound, Austin couldn't help but feel a sense of awe.
Utilizing the ability of wind attribute elements, like a combination of amplifier and transmitter, Austin heard countless faint sounds from afar.
Through this other means of perceiving the world, it had a much more novel experience and understanding.
Moreover, this ability might be extended for eavesdropping on information from miles away.
Just as he was about to exit this state, Austin's eyebrow twitched.
He heard some conversational voices.
"Is that the tribe established by the Blue Young Dragon?"
"It should be. Being able to repeatedly cause major losses to those guys from the Blood Claw Tribe, even taking down the first warrior of the tribe, only such an existence can establish such a foundation in this wilderness."
"Blood Claw, those guys are part of the alliance, could it be that the Blue Young Dragon might vent its anger on the alliance? The elders' alliance plan might be in jeopardy."
"It doesn't matter whether the Blue Young Dragon is willing to ally or not; regardless of the response, naturally the elders will worry about that. We're just the messengers."
"Look, are those planted fields, where did this dragon learn these things?"
"These must be planted with kudzu roots. Wow, so many!"
"Impressive. No wonder the Blue Young Dragon's clan tribe can expand so quickly. That's why."
"Perhaps, we could tell the elders, see if we can exchange for these farming techniques from the Blue Young Dragon."
"Hey, if that Blue Young Dragon dies in the counterattack war, then all these things along with his clan tribe will belong to us..."
Subsequent voices became quieter, as if discussing some conspiracy.
However, no matter how cautious they were, their words still reached Austin's ears without missing a beat.
"Alliance? These are people from the Tribe Alliance?"
From those voices, Austin guessed.
It should be. According to their conversation, it seems the war is about to begin, and the Tribe Alliance seems to have sent people to form an alliance with him, implying that they want him to join the counterattack war.
This suggests that the situation in Kawa Great Forest has reached a certain level.
"Let's go take a look first."
Unexpectedly, the first time using the Downwind Ear technique, he heard such an event.
Those Tribe Alliance messengers probably didn't realize their dark thoughts had been heard word for word by Austin.
Ha, still trying to plot against me?
Determined, Austin immediately took flight towards the Dragon Nest Tribe.
...
The arrival of the Tribe Alliance messengers didn't cause any ripples within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
As those messengers approached the Dragon Nest Tribe, they were received in advance by Vini, as informed by Austin.
Afterward, the beastman messengers were ushered into the main hall.
Within the main hall, no one knew what Austin discussed with the beastman messengers.
It's only known that after half a day of talks in the main hall, the Tribe Alliance messengers left the Dragon Nest Tribe with somewhat unpleasant expressions.
And their departure did not cause any ripples within the Dragon Nest Tribe either; the Dragon Nest Beastmen were busy with grand expansion projects, who had the mind to pay attention to them?
From above, Austin coldly watched the direction in which the Tribe Alliance messengers left, sneering inwardly.
He was already clear on much of the background of this war.
In this contest that might even involve the divine, did they really think he was a fool who could be so easily fooled into becoming cannon fodder?
The legacy of the Beastman Empire, just hearing the name indicates its significance.
Rather than getting involved in this terrifying war that even the legendary may not survive, it's better to lie low in the Dragon's Nest, growing stronger and developing stealthily. After all, this place is remote; hiding for decades or even a hundred years and achieving great success in divine skills before venturing out again isn't impossible.
"Vini, how's the tribe recently?"
In a month's time, the Dragon Nest Tribe has become even stronger.
The thousand extraordinary beastmen Austin transformed before his closed-door cultivation had already been trained into formidable combat power.
The military strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe has significantly improved.
At the same time, raids on external beastman tribes have been ongoing, resulting in a rapid increase in the tribe's population.
Everything is developing in a positive direction.
The power of the clan tribe is steadily rising, like a large tree growing robustly, extending its towering branches towards the sky.
However, not all development within the Dragon Nest Tribe has been smooth; just recently, one development plan encountered troubles.
And significant troubles at that.
"Your Highness, during the establishment of the second stronghold, the advance team suffered a severe blow, nearly completely wiped out."
Recalling the incident, Vini's complexion also showed a lingering sense of fear.
Obviously, he should have personally participated in the establishment of the second stronghold.
"What happened?"
Austin frowned slightly. Given the current strength of the Dragon's Nest Tribe, how could they have nearly been wiped out?
"Elemental Lord, a very powerful Elemental Lord!"

chapters.title: Chapter 284 280 Investigation (First Update, Please Subscribe)
chapters.content:
"Elemental Lord? Aren't elemental creatures supposed to stay in the Elemental Plane? Why would they appear in this kind of place?"
Upon hearing Vini's words, Austin was clearly a bit puzzled.
Elemental creatures are magical beings formed purely from magic elements.
Their bodies, structure, and even bones are composed of a single element.
These creatures, completely at odds with the Prime Material Plane, are irritable and aggressive, attacking any living being that appears before them.
Such creatures should not appear on the Prime Material Plane.
In fact, they aren't naturally occurring beings in the Prime Material Plane.
Elemental life forms are born in the Elemental Plane, where the entire plane is composed of singular magic elements; it is their birth and survival world.
Just like fish and water,
elemental creatures are the same. Appearing in the Prime Material Plane is akin to fish leaving water and appearing on land.
Of course, elemental creatures, relying on their formidable strength, can transform an area of the Prime Material Plane into a place where they can sustain their presence, which is a lot better than fish dying upon leaving water.
However, in the Prime Material Plane, the suppression they endure does not decrease at all, and they can only display a fraction of their power.
Therefore, the Prime Material Plane holds no attraction for elemental creatures; instead, it is full of disdain.
Given such an environment, why did the Elemental Lord appear in the Kawa Great Forest?
"I don't know. At first, we designated an area to the east on the map as the site of our second outpost, so we dispatched an advance team to explore it. They found the area had transformed from forest to an endless volcanic region."
"The advance team decided to investigate the volcanic region, but didn't get far before they were suddenly attacked by a group of flame-men humanoid creatures. Most of the team perished inside, leaving only a few members who barely escaped and couldn't bring back their comrades' bodies."
"Due to this incident, I led a hundred newly trained extraordinary troops to the volcanic region. At the very least, we needed to retrieve the bodies of the advance team."
"Following the guidance of the remaining advance team members, we found the area where the battle occurred, but there was nothing there, just some charred marks on the ground. We had no idea what happened to the bodies left behind."
"Finally, we decided to continue moving forward."
"On one side was the forest, on the other side was the volcano; dark red magma flowed through the cracks, and fire-red thorn trees flourished on the scorching land, with some creatures navigating through that massive fiery area."
"In a low red bush near the volcano, we encountered the fire-men humanoid creatures the advance team spoke of. Fortunately, this time, the party consisted of extraordinary beastmen above Bronze Level Middle Tier, and after paying a certain price, the army defeated the enemy."
"Initially, we thought everything was over; however,"
Vini's face showed pain and fear as he spoke.
"The scorching earth suddenly trembled, and a nearby volcano erupted violently, spewing vast magma into the sky, transforming into a rain of meteor magma that fell from high altitude."
Pain and self-reproach shone on Vini's face.
"The magma exploded, and flames spread, turning the entire world into a sea of fire, even setting the earth itself aflame."
"Casualties were heavy; over half of the hundred extraordinary troops perished, and most of the rest were seriously injured, barely escaping."
"Before leaving the volcano region, we saw within the rising and overwhelming smoke a colossal flame figure glimpsed, claws outstretched, and the intense heat distorted the surrounding space."
"Returning to the tribe, Adinlek deduced that the humanoid creatures that attacked the advance team were likely fire elemental creatures, and the last apparition was probably the Fire Elemental Lord."
After Vini recounted the Dragon Nest's major setback to Austin, Austin fell into contemplation.
Elemental creatures absolutely wouldn't appear on the Prime Material Plane without reason.
Even if a connection emerged between an Elemental Plane and the Prime Material Plane, elemental creatures wouldn't cross over due to their dislike for the environment there.
Unless there is some irresistible reason forcing them to linger nearby.
For example, some Great Divine Power Users who can traverse the multi-universe often like to capture elemental creatures from an Elemental Plane to keep at home, since elemental life is useful for purifying and concentrating the air's magic elements.
Under the influence of such irresistible man-made force, even if elemental life prefers not the environment of the Prime Material Plane, it can only become machines for purifying and concentrating magic power.
But if, as Vini described, a forest land area was transformed into an unending volcanic territory, this kind of result doesn't seem human-caused.
"I must see it with my own eyes and find out the cause!"
The change might affect Austin and his clan tribe development, so he had to ensure it himself.
The Elemental Lord might have a magic power-concentrating item that could allow him to undergo transformation and quickly reach the Gold High Tier stage.
Danger may also be an opportunity.
After staying a while in the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin took off and left the bustling tribe.
Because it was an investigation, Austin did not bring other beastmen, and headed alone toward the eastern volcanic area.
Upon arriving at the destination, Austin's first feeling was heat.
Even from afar, seeing the red earth on the horizon, he felt the overwhelming heatwaves.
Fire attribute elements were extremely concentrated in the vast volcanic area, causing the air to seem ready to ignite.
This was undoubtedly not a natural occurrence.
No one knew what ultimately caused this volcanic region.
"Is this the place?"
On the edge of the volcano-forest boundary, Austin landed on a hill, marveling at the green-red wondrous landscape below.
The green earth was an endless forest.
The red earth consisted of abundantly burned soil and sparse dark-red thorny bushes covering it.
The resilience of life allowed it to tenaciously grow even in such scorching arid volcanic territory.
The boundary of soil with red and green seemed to divide the sky world in half.
"A strange place."
After pondering for a moment, Austin spread his wings and flew toward the depths of the volcanic region.

chapters.title: Chapter 285 281 Elemental Crystal Core (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
In the air, the free-floating Fire Elements are especially abundant, creating a volcanic terrain right in this vast expanse of the Kawa Great Forest.
Austin randomly chose a volcano and landed on its edge, which was covered with black volcanic rock formed by the solidification of molten magma.
Beside him, a dark red ravine snaked down from the volcano's summit, with scorching magma slowly flowing through it. Even at a distance of ten meters, Austin could feel the wave of heat hitting him.
Yet even in such a dry and scorching volcanic environment, amidst the black volcanic rocks around, there still grew scattered, entirely red, incredibly resilient plants.
"Truly wondrous."
In Austin's previous life, most active volcanic craters were barren, let alone those extremely active volcanoes frequently flowing with dark red lava, ready to erupt at any moment.
But in this world, there are actually plants that can adapt to such intensely hot environments and survive under these harsh conditions.
Austin opened his sharp claws and dug into the hard volcanic ground, soon revealing several bright-colored metals among the shattered rocks.
Refined Gold, Mithril, and various other unknown metal minerals.
Austin went on to survey several more volcanoes, finding that the metal minerals embedded in the rocks varied somewhat, but the difference was negligible!
This realization led Austin to understand that this volcanic area was like a gigantic treasure trove.
"The minerals are so rich; this is practically a super-large gold mine!"
Such a wealthy deposit, and this vast volcanic region stretches endlessly; if humans knew about it, they would probably immediately launch a frenzied march towards it in Central Earth.
However, while this volcanic area is a very wealthy aggregation of Refined Gold and Mithril, these riches would only truly become valuable as wealth in the Human World.
In this Kawa Great Forest, even if Refined Gold, Mithril, and other metal deposits were extracted, they were just a heap of stones that couldn't be eaten or drunk.
"For the time being, these riches are of no use to the Dragon Nest Tribe, at least for now."
Austin wasn't dazzled by the wealth before him and continued to delve deeper.
So many minerals, plus these endless volcanoes.
It can basically be confirmed that this volcanic area has intersected with the magma layer beneath the earth, maintaining a constant eruption of lava, while also heavily saturated with Fire Attribute Elements.
This made Austin all the more curious.
Was this environment naturally formed, or was it the result of Elemental Creatures remodeling the surroundings after their arrival?
After pondering for a moment, Austin in the sky closed his eyes and sank into his Heart Spirit.
The Domain prototype was fully opened, beginning a thorough search within the volcanic area.
"Hmm? Where have the Elemental creatures hidden?"
Enveloping an area of several miles, various subtle sounds and movements were amplified in his mind.
Yet, within the entire Domain, there was only an empty space, with occasionally one or two Fire Attribute animals running around, but no trace of Elemental creatures.
After a moment of thought, Austin suddenly realized.
He had thought wrong. To Fire Elemental creatures, the Prime Material Plane is like an unbearably filthy sewer.
Despite this remodeled volcanic region, with a large concentration of Fire Attribute Magic Power in one place, the outside world still feels highly unpleasant. How could they roam around patrolling outside all the time?
Those Fire Elements should be staying in places more comfortable for them, while also being able to immediately sense when a creature accidentally enters their domain.
Austin contemplated for a while and made a guess.
Those Fire Elements are probably hiding underground, or rather inside the volcano, within the magma channels.
By residing underneath in the magma layer, they can avoid contact with the Prime Material Plane, and if anyone passes above, the sound would transmit to the magma, causing a large number of Elemental creatures to emerge from their nests.
This must be it, and Austin decided to test his theory.
He descended from the sky and stomped hard a few times on the rigid volcanic rock, causing the surrounding mountain peaks to shiver, stones cascading from the top, and the mountain body nearly collapsing.
Calm and composed, Austin maintained his stomping stance.
Not long after,
"Hiss!"
An angry hiss suddenly echoed as the flowing lava around the volcano's cracked surface began to churn, and then flames spontaneously appeared in the air, gradually forming into solid shapes, eventually becoming humanoid fiery beings.
They were the Fire Elements!
Life forms born of pure Elemental stars!
"Roar!"
Amidst sharp roars, hundreds of Fire Elements started charging directly at Austin.
Meanwhile, more Fire Elements continued to leap forth from the lava cracks, joining the assault on Austin.
Reaching over a thousand in number, they rushed like a Flame Storm, surging from all directions, seemingly intent on engulfing Austin completely.
Among the roaring flames, Austin's figure remained unshaken in the slightest.
"Too weak."
Austin shook his head slightly.
With a thought, bolts of lightning burst out of thin air, shining bright, forming clawing beams of lightning that struck out in all directions.
Bang! Bang! Bang!
The arm-thick blue lasers swept across, resembling pulsing longswords, causing each Fire Element to explode and shatter under the lightning, tearing apart and blossoming into firework-like sparks before dissipating entirely.
In an instant, the hundreds of thousands of surging Fire Elements were mostly swept away by the lightning, with the remaining ones frozen in place, no longer daring to approach further.
The Fire Elements may have low intelligence but not low survival instincts. Seeing their numerous companions so easily annihilated, none dared to take another step forward.
As the blue lightning around him faded, the surrounding surface of volcanic rock was left in tatters, with stones cracked and crumbling.
As the dust settled, the remaining Fire Elements, witnessing their many companions being obliterated with ease, dared not linger any longer, scattering in all directions.
Austin ignored those who slipped through the net, picking up a broken Crystal Core that resembled a Red Crystal from the ground to examine it carefully.
This was the Crystal Core left behind after destroying a Fire Element, and there were many more scattered on the pitted ground around him.
These should be the core essences of the Fire Elemental creatures.
Just like the Magic Beast Crystal Core within a Magic Beast, they are critical for sustaining life and exerting power, though compared to Magic Beast Crystal Cores, these Elemental Crystal Cores have more concentrated and purer Magic Elements.

chapters.title: Chapter 286 282: Complete Annihilation in One Move (Third Update, Subscription Requested)
chapters.content:
"The magic power here is much purer and stronger than the Magic Beast Crystal Core."
Placing the Elemental Core of the deceased Fire Elemental on his claw, he delicately felt the power condensed within it.
These Fire Elementals only had power roughly at the Bronze Level, relying on their own burning flames for close combat, yet their cores harbored magic energy that reached Middle Tier to High Tier of Bronze Level.
This is truly astounding.
"It must be the suppressive effect of the Prime Material Plane."
The Prime Material Plane wasn't very friendly to these Elemental Lives.
Prolonged contact with the outside world could lead to the "pollution" of their pure Magic Elements, not to mention their power exerted within the Prime Material Plane was only about thirty or forty percent of that in the Elemental Plane.
Truly unfortunate.
"Though their power is weak, the sheer number is overwhelming."
Austin let out a long sigh, unsure of how to react to the scene before him.
Knocking back the attacking Fire Elementals earlier did not make them retreat; instead, more Fire Elementals gathered to surround him.
They came for revenge!
Thousands of Fire Elementals turned the surrounding land into a burning Sea of Fire, the scorching heat distorting the air.
Meanwhile, from the mouths of volcanoes and cracks filled with magma, Fire Elementals continued to emerge and join the army surrounding Austin.
How expansive is the Sea of Fire comprised of surrounding Fire Elementals now?
It's impossible to count.
The numbers rise to thousands, touching the ground, reaching the sky; if it exceeds ten thousand, it becomes boundless.
Now Austin is engulfed by an endless Sea of Fire Elementals.
At the same time, among the infinite Sea of Fire Elements, some elite Fire Elementals—larger than usual ones—roared angrily at Austin.
These elite Fire Elementals are quite numerous; roughly one in every hundred is an elite Fire Elemental, with energy fluctuations at about the Silver Level.
"Such a large number seems more like a Fire Elemental Race."
Austin appeared somewhat puzzled; initially, he thought this area was an ancient site left by a Great Divine Power User who could traverse the Multi-universe.
Due to some reasons, the Fire Elementals inside ran out, eventually forming this vast Volcanic Cluster Domain.
Yet now it seems that is not the case.
Because it is a complete Fire Elemental Race, which is far different from the Elemental Life captured and imprisoned by Great Divine Power Users for personal decoration; they would only capture powerful Fire Elementals to transform their environment, not bring along so many weaker ones.
So where does this Volcanic Cluster Domain and the multitude of Fire Elementals come from?
While Austin was pondering, accompanied by a fierce roar from a Fire Elemental General—a stature even greater than elite ones like a Flame Demon composed of golden lava—
In an instant, the entire Sea of Fire Elements began to move, countless Fire Elements charged at Austin.
The overwhelming force seemed to obliterate everything in its way.
Facing the terrifying sight of the tumultuous sea of flames surging towards him, Austin's heart trembled slightly, then he felt a sense of relief.
Earlier Vini and others were also besieged, likely only at the periphery, not arousing such a massive commotion of Fire Elements.
If they had gone as deep as he did into this level of Fire Elemental Sea, not a single person would have managed to escape.
"This quantity of Fire Elemental creatures, plus their burning nature, might make even a Great Warrior at the golden peak struggle to survive an overpowering siege."
Austin silently strategized, meanwhile spreading his wings, creating a mighty burst of air, soaring his massive form upward.
"Fortunately, I'm different."
Watching Austin ascend to the sky, the surrounding charging Fire Elements seemed stunned, staring blankly at the sky.
Meanwhile, elite Fire Elements and Elemental Generals fired fireballs angrily at Austin in the sky, only for the fireballs to be torn and shattered by the gusts generated by him before reaching.
Looking at the tumultuous Sea of Fire below, Austin suddenly felt a distinct pride.
Kind of like,
Hehe, I enjoy the sight of you wanting to attack me, yet feeling powerless.
Austin soared across the sky, each flight over a spot agitated the Fire Elemental army below, leading one to question whether they'd explode from anger.
After circling a few rounds like this.
"Alright, now that I've had enough fun, let me grant you a farewell."
Austin suddenly paused in the sky, wings spread wide, resembling a massive cross suspended high.
Boom!!!
Amid deafening thunder, arcs of electricity shot out in all directions.
Simultaneously, this eternally clear sky suddenly greeted with a rare thick cloud.
The dense cloud layers roaring above seemed to wrap over the entire heavens.
A massive hurricane swept through the world, accompanied by thunderous roars, seemingly heralding an apocalypse.
The Fire Elemental army clearly felt uneasy, looking at the clouds and lightning above, they became restless.
Among the Fire Elemental army, the tallest and most fierce Elemental General appeared hesitant,
Yet before it could decide,
The judgment had already arrived!
Thunderstorm Storm!
Boom!!!
Amid earth-shaking blasts, thousands of bolts of lightning erupted across the sky, arcs of fire and light unfurled, transforming the sky beneath the clouds into a magnificent sea of lightning.
But it wasn't over!
Instantly, among the thousands of lightning strikes in the heavens, a single bolt struck from the sky, piercing through all realms, obliterating a large swath of Fire Elements in one blow.
This was just the beginning,
With the first bolt of lightning, the second, third... countless bolts struck down within moments, the blinding lightning turning the entire area into a Thunderstorm field.
Boom boom boom...
Continuous thunderous blasts annihilated Fire Elements one by one under the furious lightning, the speed of the strikes deprived them of escape, clearing swathes effectively.
This fierce Thunderstorm endured for quite a while before ceasing entirely, leaving the volcanic grounds below full of pits and fissured volcanic rock.
Numerous cores left by the slain Fire Elements, like Red Crystals, littered the ground.
Throughout this Thunderstorm, the entire Fire Elemental army was nearly wiped out, with only a few elite Fire Elements barely surviving, heavily injured, their flames dimmed.

chapters.title: Chapter 287 283 Lava Giant (Fourth Update – Request for Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
The army of fire elements, numbering tens of thousands, capable of encircling and killing high-tier golden warriors, was thus annihilated by nine-tenths.
This is the power of the law!
In the face of the legendary, numbers basically become meaningless.
Although Austin's own level is now only at the peak of middle-tier gold, a distant leap from the legendary realm, he has long awakened a trace of the law origin of thunder and has reached a certain level of understanding of the thunder law.
Relying on the power of the law, Austin directly induced the riot of thunder elements within the prototype of the domain, coupled with his own talent magic, achieving such a large-scale thunderstorm attack.
"This time, it should come out."
Austin glanced down at the battlefield, no longer paying attention, instead focusing on the surrounding volcanoes spewing dark red lava.
He was waiting for the appearance of the elemental lord that Vini and others had once glimpsed in a flash!
Fire elemental life is subjected to severe suppression and weakening in this Prime Material Plane, its strength probably only about three or four tenths of its peak period, but from Vini's description, that revealed strength was enough to shock.
According to Austin's speculation, the fire elemental lord hidden beneath layers of volcanic veins is likely to have one foot stepped into the legendary.
If he can kill it, the energy gathered in its elemental core will surely reach unimaginable levels.
If he can devour such a core, the magic power within Austin will surely undergo a transformation, entering the level of high-tier gold in one leap, elevating his strength dramatically.
Moreover, even merely stepping into the legendary domain involves understanding the existence of law, Austin might be able to devour a new law origin, mastering new law capabilities.
The trace of wind law origin devoured last time, although caused Austin quite a bit of trouble initially, after devouring and refining it, his strength improved dramatically.
This soaring strength made Austin slightly addicted.
"If it was in the Elemental Plane, or facing another normal half-legendary, I would turn and leave without hesitation, but unfortunately, you came to the Prime Material Plane where your strength is significantly weakened, making it the best time to hunt."
Austin's eyes flickered, vigilantly watching the volcano below, waiting for the fire elemental lord to appear.
This was the reason he came here to investigate.
Living in a place like the Kawa Great Forest, especially with a war sweeping across the Barbaric Territory looming, no one can ignore an opportunity to rapidly enhance their strength.
Moreover, it's a severely weakened half-legendary, offering a great chance to crush it.
Earlier,
Austin was scouring the surroundings to find the traces of the fire elemental lord.
Otherwise, does one really think he was showing off his flight capabilities in front of these low-intelligent fire elemental creatures?
Humph,
Being smug among a group of fire elements,
Austin could not possibly be such a shallow dragon.
It's just a pity, the fire elemental lord hid too well, Austin flew and searched within tens of miles without discovering the hiding place of the fire elemental lord.
Thus,
Left with no choice, Austin launched this thunderstorm attack, slaughtering many fire element creatures to compel the irritable elemental lord to reveal itself.
"It's coming!"
Suddenly, Austin sensed the fire element concentration in the air rapidly rising, as if the surrounding air was about to ignite.
At the same time, an oppressive feeling rose from beneath the ground, like a volcano suppressed for millions of years, about to erupt!
Austin immediately soared into the sky, heading higher.
Higher, he wanted to reach higher ground!
Boom!!!
Suddenly, a thunderous loud noise erupted from the ground, like the earth veins splitting, the ground covered by black volcanic rock suddenly collapsed, huge rock fragments shattered, dark red lava welled up from the web-like cracks, swallowing the hovering black volcanic rock.
Swoosh swoosh swoosh...
Blazing flames soared up, turning the entire ground into a lake of magma in an instant, like a huge bleeding scar on the earth.
"Roar!!!"
Accompanied by an ear-splitting roar, blazing sonic waves erupted, repelling the air.
The rolling bubbling magma surged violently, stretching and twisting like a living creature in the high air, coalescing into a lava giant over twenty meters tall!
The lava giant's blood-red eyes gazed at the sky, the magma flowing on its body like molten wax, the red flames stretching out in the air, forming a towering fire tree.
"This is..."
Seeing the giant below, Austin's pupil shrank suddenly.
From the lava giant, he felt an overwhelming sense of suffocation!
Half-step legendary!
Although not stepped into the legendary realm, the lava giant already possessed part of the legendary level's might!
The fire elemental lord had finally appeared!
"Great!"
At this moment, a trace of excitement and frenzy flashed in Austin's solemn eyes.
Sure enough, his assumption was correct, even in the Prime Material Plane, the half-legendary fire elemental lord was subjected to severe suppression.
And this gave him a chance to hunt this terrifying creature.
"Come on, let me see your weight."
Without waiting for the lava giant to move, Austin took the initiative, manipulating spiritual power to drive magic power to expand and spread in the void, transforming the surrounding space into his domain.
Whoosh!
Under the gloomy sky, the space in front of him suddenly twisted, turning into giant vortices as if the space itself twisted together.
Vast magic power surged from his body, gathering in front of the vortices under the trend of spiritual power, swiftly spinning to eventually form translucent, differently colored, yet shiver-inducing attribute Rasengan!
Five Rasengan spanned in the high air before him, their terrifying might seemed to impact the surrounding void, faintly causing imperceptible tremors and distortions.
"Go!"
Austin's wings suddenly flapped, stirring up a huge gale between heaven and earth, five immensely powerful attribute Rasengan trailing long tails of flame, crashing down like meteors.
At that moment, the skies seemed to darken, the entire sky pressing down as if with the fall of the five Rasengan.
"Roar!!!"
The fire elemental lord roared furiously, angry flames rising.
This flying lizard, not only does it not flee, it dares to fight back, simply the greatest provocation!

chapters.title: Chapter 288 284: Severe Injury (First update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Five meteoric Attribute Rasengan descended from the sky at lightning speed, creating tides visible to the naked eye on the earth and sky, exploding with unparalleled power.
The Lava Giant barely had time to react before the five Attribute Rasengan seemed to bypass space and arrived at its location.
BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM!!!
A massive roar shook the heavens and earth, as five solar-like rings rose from the flat ground, stirring waves and surges in the surrounding void, with a terrifying tearing force that seemed capable of shattering even magma.
Storms, thunder, floods.
Various horrifying natural disasters swept across a range of hundreds of meters, bolts of lightning shot out, hurricanes lifted magic power-transformed water by the hundreds of tons, turning it into torrents and tsunamis to strike everything around.
The tall and mighty Lava Giant was instantly covered by countless storms and thunder, as magma collided with a large amount of water, creating fierce hissing sizzles, boiling smoke rose enveloping the surrounding space, spreading into the sky.
The Lava Giant seemed to have suffered a severe injury within the formidable power of the five Rasengan.
However, in the next moment,
A dark red light suddenly bloomed within the dense steam, spreading out and dyeing the surrounding white steam red, painting the entire space in a dark red glow.
Hum Hum Hum!
Initially just a speck of light, it erupted in an instant, as the dark red lava burned in a flame storm and swept toward the sky, incinerating all the lightning, hurricanes, and water vapor generated by the Rasengan explosion.
Gulu Gulu!
Unknown thousands or tens of thousands of tons of magma erupted thunderously, seemingly burning and melting even the air, as the Lava Giant slowly rose from the earth, its blood-red pupils gazing through the flames at Austin, an endless fury bursting forth instantly.
High above in the sky, Austin suddenly sensed a threat from above, his massive wings rolled with force, the Wind Attribute Elements beneath him stirred a vast gale, and his enormous figure swiftly vanished in midair like a chain of afterimages.
Simultaneously, as a ring of dark red light bloomed from the Lava Giant's body, the fire elements in the volcanic area within miles were densely accumulated, producing extremely strong fluctuations.
Meteor Sky Burst!
Magma spheres with diameters of meters suddenly plummeted from the sky, breaking through layers of clouds, leaving long fiery tails as they launched a comprehensive saturation attack on the earth.
Whish Whish Whish!
Like numerous meteors, densely packed, veiling the sky and sun, setting the entire sky aflame in red.
The entire range within miles was enveloped by this lava rain.
BOOM BOOM BOOM…
Incessant lava stones crashed onto the earth, like hundreds of tons of explosives detonating, raising blistering flames, shattering the black volcanic rock on the ground.
With the help of Wind Element, Austin's speed reached its peak, a series of afterimages darted evasively in the air, dodging the dense meteor rain assault.
The Fire Elemental Lord's animosity toward Austin was clearly at its zenith, as the surrounding void's Fire Attribute Elements boiled like a sea, wherever Austin appeared was immediately besieged like a storm, turning the surrounding soil and earth into a sea of molten lava.
This relentless bombardment continued for quite a while until the Lava Giant withdrew a large amount of Elemental Power, the flames on its body dimmed considerably, before it paused to catch its breath.
At this moment,
"Opportunity!"
The previously fleeing Austin keenly detected the stiffness in the Lava Giant when it ceased the scope of its forbidden curse-like magic.
A critical opportunity!
Seizing the moment it became stiff, Austin decisively used his long-concealed trump card.
Buzz!
As Austin soared in the sky and opened his mouth, a vast, grand, ocean-like pressure descended suddenly, like the dawn's sun illuminating the entire world.
The Lava Giant instinctively sensed danger, about to react within its rigid state.
However, at this moment, Death God had already arrived!
The Wind and Thunder Swords, nurtured and honed with momentum magic power for over a month, finally unsheathed at this moment.
Two tiny ripples flashed and disappeared in the void, then split open suddenly, two streams penetrated through layers of void, abruptly arriving beside the Lava Giant.
This is the power of the Law of Wind and Law of Thunder.
No elaborate or beautiful techniques, just a simple straightforward stab.
Yet this Law-level attack made the Lava Giant turn pale, feeling the descent of a terrifying death crisis!
Slash!
In an instant, two enormous holes appeared on the Lava Giant, towering over twenty meters.
Looking through from one side, you could see the sky through the two giant apertures on the Lava Giant.
The two massive round holes connected, almost cutting the Lava Giant in half!
Soar!
The two Law Divine Swords vanished like ripples in the wind, instantly returning to Austin's body.
Gazing at the imposing Lava Giant before him, Austin's pupils contracted sharply.
"This is!"
