Through the two large apertures on the Lava Giant's body, Austin saw a goblin-sized figure, its entire body ablaze with dazzling white flames, embedded within the Lava Giant's torso.
Elemental Lord!
This should be the true form of the Elemental Lord, the awe-inspiring Lava Giant outside was merely a guise draped over it!
Though relying on the Lava Giant's shell, the Elemental Lord narrowly avoided a fatal blow at the last moment, it was still severely injured by Austin's two Law Divine Swords that were nurtured for over a month, and the white flames on its body dimmed.
A chance not to be missed!
Austin immediately flapped his wings, flying toward the waning Lava Giant's Elemental Lord, a giant Rasengan flickered with ghostly blue light beneath his claws, aiming for the exposed Fire Elemental Lord's final strike.
But at this moment,
Crash!
Several-meter-tall Fire Elemental Generals leaped out from the sea of lava below, blocking Austin's path.
For Fire Attribute Elements, they are immune to all Fire Attribute damage and can convert it to their life value, so the previous Meteor Sky Burst unleashed by the Lava Giant didn't harm them.
These Fire Elemental Generals, with energy levels roughly around Gold Level, fought desperately to block Austin's advance, sacrificing to buy time for the Elemental Lord!

chapters.title: Chapter 289 285: Recovery (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
"Get out of the way!"
The massive Thunder Rasengan spun rapidly under the claws, and the resulting voltage caused the surrounding void to crack with lightning.
Rumble!
Austin wielded the Thunder Rasengan, tearing through the void, with bolts of electricity sweeping across, unleashing terrifying destructive power. Even the Gold Level Fire Elementals of general grade couldn't withstand the laser-like electric beams ripping through space, turning to ash in moments!
However, these Gold Level Fire Elementals of general grade did manage to slow Austin's advance.
Just as Austin's momentum was hindered, dark red lava flowed over the Molten Giant's body, and a circle of red light suddenly burst forth, sweeping and scouring the surrounding space.
Austin, who had been advancing rapidly, suddenly felt a pressure descend, and space seemed to pause for a moment.
Instinctively, he wanted to dodge, but the target of the explosive red light wasn't him, but the Fire Element creatures gathered around the Molten Giant!
Bang bang bang...
In a continuous series of thunderous rumbles, hundreds and thousands of Fire Elements around the Molten Giant instantly exploded, even the Fire Element generals blocking Austin could not escape the fate of explosion, disintegrating into masses of pure Fire Elemental Energy.
At the same time, the pieces of crystal cores left after the Fire Element explosion, glinting red and containing potent Fire Elements, shattered completely, transforming into a large amount of tangible Fire Element energy, spreading throughout the surrounding space.
Simultaneously, a tremendously powerful invisible suction force emanated from the Molten Giant, causing large quantities of Fire Elements to be absorbed into its body like a vortex, forming an immense fiery vortex around.
All of this happened in the blink of an eye,
When the massive Flame Storm formed by Fire Elements was absorbed completely, the two large holes on the Molten Giant's body restored as if time had reversed.
Simultaneously, the previously enfeebled aura of the Molten Giant was completely restored, even giving Austin a feeling of being stronger than before!
Go!
Upon seeing this scene, Austin decisively hurled the Thunder Rasengan beneath his claws towards the Molten Giant.
With a powerful flap of the membranous wings, aided by the Wind Element, his entire body ascended straight up, drawing a huge arc in the air, darting away.
"Roar!!!"
The Molten Giant roared, its voice visibly shaking the heavens.
Watching as the Thunder Rasengan descended with rolling thunder, it raised its dark red fist, flowing with tons of magma, and punched forward into the void.
Boom!!!
The very air seemed to burn through and melt, as massive magma erupted in an instant, carrying intense heat energy, at an incredibly rapid speed like a giant beast opening its mouth, swallowing the incoming Thunder Rasengan in an instant.
Gulu!
Enormous quantities of scorching magma spread over the descending Thunder Rasengan, engulfing it completely.
Along with the muffled sound of thunder reverberating within the liquid, the giant Molten Giant Fist, which doubled in size after swallowing the Thunder Rasengan, suddenly emitted a very intense white light from within.
The entire dark red Molten Giant Fist also swelled, like a balloon about to burst.
Yet, the swollen Molten Giant Fist did not explode in the end.
As a series of rolling thunders spread out, the energy within the Thunder Rasengan was completely consumed by the searing rolling magma, incinerating to nothingness.
The terrifying temperature of this lava even swallowed the thunder itself!
The Molten Giant surveyed in all directions, searching for Austin's trace.
Only, by then Austin had already flown far away, leaving only a black dot on the horizon.
"Roar!!!"
The Molten Giant roared in fury, pounding the ground around madly, causing volcanoes to boil up under its terrifying might, spewing magma pillars, and rolling gray-black smoke rose, covering half of the sky.
Clearly, Austin's escape had driven the Elemental Lord into an extreme rage.
No matter how furious the Elemental Lord was, Austin, who planned to leave temporarily, wouldn't foolishly return to clash head-on again, vanishing into the sky, leaving the Molten Giant raging in place.
...
Soon after, atop a mountain peak at the edge of the volcanic region, Austin descended from the sky with a gust of wind, creating a torrent at the mountain peak as if a flood was unleashed.
Gazing at the volcano cluster behind, concentrated with Fire Element, Austin began to take a brief rest, recovering his magic power, while also contemplating the gains from this battle.
"It's indeed no surprise a being with one foot in the Legendary Realm; even with only two-thirds of its full strength remaining, it is not something an ordinary person can deal with."
When the Molten Giant finally used the surrounding exploding Fire Elements to repair itself and recover its injuries, Austin knew this trial battle had concluded.
Having used the two Law Divine Swords, nurtured for over a month, now the swords could only serve as a relatively powerful attack method, rather than as a killer trump card.
Exhausting his most powerful attack and still not slaying the enemy, while the opponent could restore its injuries by absorbing its companions' strength, dragging it out like this, as long as the Fire Element creatures under the Fire Elemental Lord were not completely eliminated, eventually, it would be Austin who would be worn down.
Therefore, without hesitation, Austin turned and left.
"Though I expected this, it's still a bit frustrating."
Originally, Austin's purpose in this venture was just to investigate the Elemental Lord's details, having been prepared for a long-term siege and did not expect to slay the opponent in one attempt.
After all, it was a Half-Legendary, bordering the Legendary Realm.
Even if the Fire Element faced strong suppression in the Prime Material Plane, he did not hope to easily succeed in annihilating the Fire Elemental Lord, Austin had even planned to summon the Beastman army to help encircle and kill after reconnaissance.
However, after a fierce battle, and even using the Law Divine Swords nurtured for a month, aside from not yet utilizing the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords Unification he was still exploring, Austin had basically given his all.
Yet even so, he still had to retreat first, which made Austin obviously somewhat unwilling.
Nevertheless, no matter how unwilling, one must face reality.
"It seems this time I need to bring the Beastman clan members, let the Extraordinary Beastman Army draw the attention of the Fire Elemental Life, pulling them away one by one and then eliminating them individually, this way, it should counter the Elemental Lord's ability to absorb Fire Elemental regeneration."
Reflecting on this entire battle, Austin began to ponder his gains.
Although he couldn't successfully kill the Fire Elemental Lord, at least he had gathered enough intelligence, and next, it was about making a battle plan based on this information.
"The newly reformed Extraordinary Beastmen just recently joined the army, and spellcasters among the elves were assembled recently to form a Spellcaster Legion, this time, it's about time to bring out the reformed Dragon Nest Legion to train."
After thinking it over thoroughly and ensuring nothing was missed, Austin then soared into the sky, returning to the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 290 286: Elite Deployment (Third Update, Request for Monthly Votes)
chapters.content:
Austin's return did not bring much turmoil to the Dragon Nest Tribe, though the orcs in the tribe couldn't help but shout with excitement when they saw the enormous figure flying over from Sky Mountain.
"Is that His Highness Austin?"
Amidst the cheering crowd, a skinny goblin looked up at the giant figure in the sky, knelt on the ground, and bowed towards Austin flying overhead, his eyes filled with reverence.
As a weak goblin who had just recently joined the Dragon Nest Tribe, he was full of curiosity about everything in the powerful tribe.
At the same time, for the one who created everything, allowing them to escape hunger and hardship, in the simplistic mind of this goblin, an unparalleled devotion towards the immensely great Lord Austin resided.
"Yes, that is His Highness, the greatest Blue Dragon Lord in this world. Back then, the Dragon Nest Tribe was far less prosperous and powerful, there were only a few kobolds and a couple of ramshackle houses. Who could have imagined that under His Highness's leadership, it would grow to such a scale in such a short time? One day, His Highness will surely become a mighty ruler renowned across the continent."
The goblin captain ahead of the frail goblin also looked toward Austin with devotion and reverence, as if he were facing a divine being.
This goblin captain was once an insignificant, worthless goblin, like a weed that could perish in an unnoticed corner at any moment.
Hunger and danger were the themes that ran through the lives of these lowly beings in the entire Kawa Great Forest.
Later, Lizardman Rodney gathered some companions along with some wandering beastmen to establish a tribe, and he was fortunate to become one of its members.
Subsequently, the tribe established by Lizardman Rodney was defeated by the then Jackal Wolfman Tribe, the whole group dispersed in retreat, and the goblin captain followed Lizardman Rodney in wandering, foolishly attacking the newly established, dilapidated Dragon Nest Tribe which then only had seven kobolds.
That battle had a lifelong impact on him.
After being captured post-battle, they were pardoned by the great His Highness Austin, who assimilated them into the new Dragon Nest Tribe, making him a member of the great Highness's army.
The goblin captain could be considered a veteran figure from the time the Dragon Nest Tribe was established.
He witnessed firsthand how the Dragon Nest Tribe expanded under Austin's leadership, embarking on the road to dominate all directions.
The little goblin, once holding a broken wooden spear, shivering in the cold wind, fearfully charging with the leader, never imagined he would one day get the chance to participate in such a magnificent history of the tribe's rise?
And indeed, he is one of the many bystander roles in that epic story.
The deeds of following His Highness to battle in all directions, diligently undertaking construction efforts are capital enough for the goblin captain to boast for a lifetime in his remaining days.
....
Of course, Austin was unaware of the psychological activities of the two goblins among the many orcs below.
Upon returning to the tribe, he started to gather the high-ranking members of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Vini, gather the Extraordinary beastman army, prepare for war, and ten days later, we'll set out collectively against the Fire Elemental Lord."
When the first order was issued, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe started moving.
Now, with the expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the whole clan tribe has grown to a huge extent, enough to support an army composed of Extraordinary beastmen.
From external recruits, self-awakened Extraordinary beastmen, those personally transformed by Austin, and spellcasters selected from among the elves.
In total, the entire Extraordinary army numbered over two thousand, representing the elite among the military forces of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In this war to clear out the fire elements, ordinary beastmen weren't of much use, at most they could clear the battlefield afterward; facing all fire elements above the Bronze Level, only the amassed Extraordinary army of the Dragon Nest Tribe would be the real main force for the purge.
Hence this war almost mobilized the entire Extraordinary beastman force of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The whole Dragon Nest clan tribe quickly entered a tense emergency war state, preparing for the upcoming assault on the Fire Elemental Lord.
A large amount of materials began to be mobilized, armor and weapons, as well as healing potions, were quickly amassed in large quantities.
It's worth mentioning that the annexation of the Elf Kingdom brought numerous benefits to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After all, it's a remnant of the Elf Kingdom that once ruled the entire Kawa Great Forest and had developed for a millennium within the secret realm space supported by the elf's Mother Tree.
Thus, within the Elf Kingdom, not only was there a relatively complete magic inheritance, but there was also some simple knowledge and inheritance in pharmacy, alchemy, and extraordinary weapon crafting.
With the successful annexation of the Elf Kingdom, a wealth of knowledge was consolidated into the Dragon Nest Tribe, with its profound heritage being digested one by one.
The biggest beneficiary among them was the healthcare department of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Previously, the medical system established by the Dragon Nest Tribe followed the path of herbal treatment known from the past, and after several years of development, they had gained quite some experience and insights into treating common illnesses as well as understanding some basic principles such as the properties of drugs and their interactions.
With the sharing of the Elf Kingdom's pharmaceutical knowledge, the foundation of the healthcare department of the Dragon Nest Tribe was further enhanced.
Utilizing that pharmaceutical knowledge, the healthcare department successfully developed a new type of healing potion using Snake Shedding Grass.
Just a small bottle of it can rapidly restore life in a short time, which has an immensely powerful significance for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Similarly, the same applies to alchemy and extraordinary weapon crafting.
Relying on the experience gleaned from previous attempts in crafting Bronze, and combining it with some knowledge of extraordinary weapon crafting, the goblins successfully designed a method to craft extraordinary equipment from Magic Water Pattern Ore.
The extraordinary weapons and equipment crafted through this method, although very rudimentary, would be seen as a waste of resources by human world alchemy masters, still proved far more resilient than ordinary bronze weaponry, and additionally contained water attribute destructiveness.
Water restrains fire, so these weapons and equipment containing water attributes can play a highly significant role in this war against the Fire Elemental Lord.
Within these ten days, a considerable amount of manpower of the Dragon Nest Tribe was directed toward potion and extraordinary weapon crafting.
The previously cleared dangerous zone, Wet Bone Forest, underwent extensive development, with large quantities of Snake Shedding Grass and Magic Water Pattern Ore being harvested and subsequently refined into numerous healing potions and extraordinary equipment.
With the mobilization of countless resources, amidst this tense preparation, ten days passed in a flash.
After ten days,
The fully equipped elite army of the Dragon Nest, led by Austin, valiantly marched toward the place of the Fire Elemental Lord.

chapters.title: Chapter 291 287: Re-engaging in Battle (First update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Given the capabilities of the Elemental Lord, unless the surrounding fire elements are entirely cleared, or unless those fire element creatures are lured away from the Elemental Lord,
otherwise, every time we bring it to the brink of death, it regenerates with a single skill, making it impossible for Austin to drag it to death.
The main combat task of the Dragon Nest elite legion is to lure the fire element creatures away during Austin's battle with the Molten Giant formed by the Elemental Lord, drawing them away for cleanup.
The best scenario is to clear all the Gold Level Elemental Generals, preventing the Elemental Lord from recovering after a massive injury.
Of course, the legion mainly assists from the periphery, just drawing some attention.
Under the Molten Giant's Talent Magic, like the Meteor Sky Burst with its massive attack range, only about a dozen Beastman Junior Officers who master the Beastman Six Techniques can assist Austin in close combat.
Only those Junior Officers who master the Six Techniques can avoid the bombing lava in case of a Meteor Sky Burst.
On their road forward, Austin carefully laid out the battle plan.
The Dragon Nest Extraordinary legion hurried to the destination at full speed in just a few days.
"Hope everything goes smoothly,"
gazing at the endless red flames ahead, Austin thought to himself.
For this battle, Austin not only drew a large number of elites from the Dragon Nest Tribe,
but also completed a new trump card within ten days of preparation.
Although it has not yet stabilized, its power is no less than the explosive force unleashed the moment the Law Divine Sword is unsheathed.
The land before them, where lava had cooled and solidified into black volcanic rock, bore little trace of the previous battle.
The Fire Elemental Lord had vanished.
Along with numerous fire element creatures, they had hidden in the lava beneath the volcano, leaving no trace.
In front of them was a volcanic region quietly spewing hot lava. Thick smoke billowed upwards, while resilient, red shrubs grew on cliffs where lava could not reach, bringing some vitality to this scorching land.
"Looks like I'll have to make the first move and lure out the Elemental Lord."
Behind Austin, the Dragon Nest elite legion stood ready, their aura fierce,
like fearsome giant beasts quietly lurking, about to reveal their sharp fangs.
"Attack!"
With no more words, Austin waved his hand to advance.
In the battle plan, the Molten Giant, which was the Elemental Lord's shell, was too powerful. If it broke into the army formation, it could cause significant casualties.
Therefore, Austin was the first to act.
Once he lured out the Molten Giant from the volcano and held it down, apart from a few Beastman Junior Officers mastering the Six Techniques to join the confrontation, the remaining Extraordinary Beastmen would split into squads to lure the fire element life forms away from the Elemental Lord's battlefield.
When luring the fire elements, they should try to make a larger disturbance, ideally drawing out the fire element creatures from beneath the surface.
Austin spread his wings, creating a massive torrent, and in the breeze of the wind element, flew towards the depth of the Volcanic Cluster Domain.
As Austin flew away, the Dragon Nest legion behind him began to move with a slight delay.
"This is it."
Suspended at a certain high altitude, Austin was right above the place where he had previously battled the Fire Elemental Lord.
"Get out here!"
Abruptly, the void twisted into vortices, and with a substantial injection of magic power, a series of Rasengan formed, floating in the surrounding space.
Whizz! Whizz! Whizz!
Rasengan after Rasengan suddenly fell from the sky.
Tearing through the air, they carried violent whirlwinds.
Rumble!!!
Amid continuous booming sounds, massive energy light balls rose one after another from the ground below.
The explosion's energy rotated violently, constrained into spheres with incredibly powerful tearing capability.
The frightening energy burst stirred massive waves in the air, causing the entire ground to tremor violently, shaking incessantly.
"Roar!!!"
The massive tremor finally stirred the Fire Elemental Lord lurking underground.
With an earth-shattering roar, a volcano erupted, and dark red light spread over the sky as a massive amount of magma poured out like a torrent, flooding the land into a magma sea.
Just as Austin expected, after blasting out the Rasengan, the familiar aura incensed the Elemental Lord hidden in the lava.
Elemental creatures are inherently irritable and exceptionally aggressive, especially when they are provoked after Austin recently severely wounded it. How could the Elemental Lord not be infuriated?
Bubble bubble!
Dark red hot magma surged, forming an enormous hand in the air, shrouding Austin high in the sky with the Molten Giant's immense anger.
The dark red lava blocked the sky, aiming to slap Austin in the sky like a fly.
"It's coming!"
Under the engulfing lava hand in the sky, Austin focused, flapped his wings, and with the surrounding wind element swirling, his massive body vanished like shadows, rapidly dodging the enclosing space before the lava hand could strike.
Rumble!!!
A missed strike, the ground cracked, and dark red lava spurted out, melting a significant amount of volcanic rock.
At this moment, Austin, having nimbly flown behind the Molten Giant, saw that it had no defenses at its back, with no further strength to respond.
A great opportunity!
Seizing the chance, Austin made another move.
Buzz buzz buzz!
The space before him distorted continuously, and one Rasengan after another appeared.
The glow then spread, painting layers of colors in space, with each Rasengan instantly completing its attribute transformation.
Bang bang bang!
Each Attribute Rasengan tore through space like meteors, crashing onto the Molten Giant.
Terrifying attribute energy exploded with incredibly intense tearing capability. The exploded torrential forces ravaged, tearing apart most of the Molten Giant's back.
The enormous Molten Giant, over twenty meters tall, had its back blasted with several massive holes in an instant!
"Roar!!!"
Seriously injured, the Molten Giant howled in pain,
simultaneously bursting into dark red light, a ring of dark red light immediately enveloping the sky, stirring the fire elements in the void space into a tumultuous tide.
This was a sign of a Talent Magic being cast!
Flame Storm!
In the next moment, enormous fire tornadoes arose from all around, bearing immense heat, sweeping in all directions.
Austin, having no time to dodge, was directly swept into the Flame Storm, hit by a thunderous impact, his entire body knocked back in the fiery torrent, flipping back hundreds of meters away.
He barely flapped his wings to stop his rapidly retreating form, hovering in the air, stabilizing his posture before being slammed to the ground.
Despite making adjustments, Austin, surviving the direct attack of the Flame Storm, also suffered considerable injury.
His body surface was scorched by flames, with scorched blood faintly flowing from his scales.
Just in the first round of engagement, both sides plunged into the fiercest confrontation!
Meanwhile, at the periphery, the Dragon Nest Beastman elite legion also closed in, deliberately luring the surrounding fire element creatures away from the battlefield.

chapters.title: Chapter 292 288: Encirclement (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
"Kill! Charge!"
While Austin was fiercely battling the lava giant, the Extraordinary army of the Dragon Nest Legion had already stepped into the area, continuously engaging with the fire elements emerging from the magma, deftly shifting the battlefield towards the perimeter.
The robust beastman transcendent warriors, clad in extraordinary armor made from water patterned demon iron ore, wield weapons crafted from the same material, their shield almost like a wall blocking the front.
The weapons and armor imbued with water attribute power are incredibly restraining to the fire elements, with each strike virtually equal to a critical hit, while the scorching damage from the fire elements barely poses any threat to the extraordinary armor imbued with water attributes.
A solid line of heavily armored beastmen transcendent warriors formed a steel defense line, turning into slaughtering machines akin to meat grinders.
One slash per fire element, the scattered elemental crystal cores are everywhere.
In the coordinated hunting of the team, the close combat beastman transcendent warriors are slower in slaughter compared to the elf spellcasters behind the steel defense line, which is true wide-scale slaughter.
In this volcanic region, the air is poor in water elements, yet the water attribute attack magic condensed here deals double damage to the fire elements.
An ordinary water arrow technique, unable to pierce even stone, yet the condensed water elements are like deadly poison to the fire elemental creatures.
Accompanied by the elf spellcasters wielding magic staffs behind the beastman warriors, a barrage of water arrows shot out of the sky, felling one fire elemental creature after another like cutting wheat, almost leaving no enemy standing after one round.
Beastman transcendent warriors and elf mages cooperated to turn the surroundings into a slaughter Asura pit of fire elements.
Fire elements died continuously; in this Prime Material Plane, the fire elemental creatures suffered from strong suppression and couldn't exert their true power, perishing within the Dragon Nest Legion.
Even the elite fire elements were easily slain by the noncommissioned officers commanding one or two Beastman Six Techniques.
With heavy shields like iron towers, beastman officers spearheaded like wild bulls, shattering the earth and lifting a torrent with force that deflects the attacking fire elements like a shield plaque.
Beastman officers, swift as specters, flashed ten meters in the blink of an eye, shredding fire elements along the path with sheer power before they could see clearly.
The so-called officers in the Dragon Nest elite legion are above captain level transcendent beastmen.
The strong prevail, the weak fall—this is how Dragon Nest Tribe beastmen ranks are chosen.
No beastman who received an officer rank is weak.
As for junior officers, they are the strongest among the strong, mastering six techniques beyond their level limit.
Although mastering only one or two moves of the Beastman Six Techniques, in battle, the beastman officers wield these skills as if by arm, integrating them into the voice of combat style, substantially enhancing their true power.
With the powerful beastman officers at the helm, the Dragon Nest elite warriors and mages combined forces for output.
The entire battlefield leaned towards a Dragon Nest elite legion advantage.
In terms of weaponry and mastered combat techniques, the Dragon Nest beastmen side held an absolute upper hand.
In this clash of iron and fire, the side of the fire elemental creatures suffered a crushing defeat.
Quickly, the battlefield was divided, as Dragon Nest elite units led by noncommissioned officer captains began to split into teams, segmenting and dispersing across the immense war zone.
As the war progressed, unnoticed, elite squads of the Dragon Nest Legion began leading large numbers of fire elements away.
A massive circle formed on the battlefield far from Austin and the lava giant's combat zone.
A large army of fire elements was like sand on the ground, mostly swept by an unseen hand to the perimeter, unknowingly distancing from the fierce battle between the two terrifying giant beasts at the center.
...
"The law, it's the Fire Elemental Law!"
Shaken and injured again by the flame storm, Austin finally perceived the true nature of the sweeping red glow.
The lava giant ahead, during the casting of Meteor Sky Burst, would scatter a ring of red hot light around, exerting a mighty pressure.
When Austin initially unsheathed the Wind and Thunder Swords, severely wounding it, relying on devouring a massive amount of the Essence of Fire to recuperate, its body also shone with such explosive light when crushing subordinates' elemental lives.
Additionally, as it just cast Flame Storm with its back towards Austin, red oppressive light also enveloped it.
No wonder it felt somewhat familiar initially; it turned out to be the power of law!
Only with the power of law can such devastating talent magic be launched in this Prime Material Plane, a place of great suppression, causing such cataclysmic momentum.
"Indeed, this half-legendary elemental lord contains the Flame Law Origin within. Only the law can ignore the suppression of elemental life in the Prime Material Plane, producing such formidable attack power!"
Ideas rapidly flowed in Austin's mind as he soared in the high skies.
Despite this, Austin didn't lose his courage for battle, feeling a surge of excitement instead.
If that's the case, as long as he slays it, he not only can complete metamorphosis through its elemental crystal core, stepping into the gold high tier rapidly, but also can devour the remnant Flame Law Origin, hence gaining mastery over the Fire Elemental Law?
A wave of excitement surged internally, wind elements encircled, his entire gigantic figure turned into streaks of afterimages swiftly flying through the emptiness.
Avoiding the lava giant's attacks, Austin would occasionally seize chances to land a few rounds of Attribute Rasengan on the giant's massive body.
The cumbersome figure of the lava giant couldn't catch swift as wind Austin, nor evade Austin's Rasengan assaults.
The lava giant's attacks consecutively missed, shattering the ground, magma splashing, yet not harming Austin in the slightest.
Despite the lava giant's unique nature, the outer volcanic magma is merely a mantle armor created by the fire element lord for self-protection, even if its upper body is smashed, as long as the core is untouched, it can recuperate using the infinite magma beneath.
However, under Austin's incessant unwinding attack, the lava giant eventually became worn down, its aura dimmed, although furious at Austin's provoking moves initially, the giant's attacks became sluggish as its aura waned.
One blue dragon, one lava giant battled, Austin relied on speed to kite and wear down.
Finally, at some point, the lava giant unleashed a widespread flame shock, deeply repelling Austin.
Simultaneously, red light burst from its body, intending to reuse its trick of destroying subordinate fire elemental lives to recover its own state!
Bang! Bang! Bang!
As the red light swept, the law's oscillation spread; amidst consecutive muffled sounds, nearby fire elements along with their elemental crystal cores shattered, seamlessly transforming into pure fire elemental energy floating in the air.
Meanwhile, a tremendous suction appeared on the dim lava giant's body, drawing the ambient fire elemental energy like a vortex into its body, swiftly restoring its aura.
However, the next moment,
The lava giant, having swallowed all the surrounding fire elements, apparently stiffened.

chapters.title: Chapter 293 289: Flame Law (Third Update, Request for Monthly Votes)
chapters.content:
The devoured fire elements are insufficient, which is quite awkward.
After crushing the surrounding fire elements, the aura on the Elemental Lord only recovered halfway, far from its full peak. Compared to the first battle with Austin, where a single skill could completely restore its aura, it's a significant difference.
The Molten Giant Beast's scarlet eyes stared blankly around; the ground held no more elemental life, only a few dozen scattered because they were too far and weren't attracted away by the Dragon Nest elite troop, had become nourishment for the Molten Giant Beast's previous self-repair.
It stood there dumbfounded, feeling a vast expanse of white emptiness around.
The Fire Elemental Lord instinctively felt something was amiss, but couldn't pinpoint what exactly was wrong.
Even as the Fire Elemental Lord, it hadn't broken free from the realm of elemental life, impulsiveness, anger, and extreme aggressiveness are their nature; encountering situations, they never think with their simple minds.
"Hmph, how could I possibly challenge you here again without preparation!"
Seeing the Molten Giant Beast standing dazed, Austin coldly snorted, obviously irritated by the shameless recovery skills of the creature before him.
If not for that Talent Magic of devouring kind to restore its own life, Austin might have already slain it during the first encounter, without having to bring over a large number of Dragon Nest Tribe elites in the end.
Though the Dragon Nest Tribe elite had gained the upper hand in this war with the fire elements, the resultant shockwaves from the battle with this Molten Giant Beast still resulted in many elite casualties and injuries.
There was no other way.
To kill this Elemental Lord, some sacrifices had to be made.
"Warriors of the tribe, attack with me!"
With a roar, Austin charged down from high in the sky with immense power, his wings flapping, stirring up a huge whirlwind.
A gigantic Rasengan gathered in his wide, grinning mouth, then transformed into an Attribute Rasengan in an instant, shooting out like a cannonball, striking the Molten Giant Beast still in a stupor.
"Charge! For the great His Highness Austin!"
Simultaneously, the Beastman Junior Officers, waiting at the periphery, following Austin's command after the Molten Giant Beast's aura weakened, charged forward like ferocious tigers released from their cages.
With the Molten Giant Beast's aura weakened and movements slowed, the Beastman Junior Officers used instant steps and air steps to dodge the beast's attacks, effectively dealing damage.
Boom! Boom! Boom!
The Rasengan exploded on the Molten Giant Beast, the explosion force shaking its enormous body violently.
Meanwhile, at the feet of the Molten Giant Beast, the Beastman Junior Officers moved through the void like lightning across the magma-filled ground, unleashing a torrent of attacks while the Molten Giant ignored them momentarily.
"Gale Wave: Chaos!"
"Gale Wave: Bird!"
"Gale Wave Hundred-Line Kill!"
Green energy slash waves lashed through the air, tearing it apart, wildly attacking toward the Molten Giant's massive feet.
More Beastman Junior Officers used air steps to leap high, soaring tens of meters into the sky, attacking from above, sending slash waves cutting into the Molten Giant's back.
In front of the towering, twenty-meter-tall Molten Giant Beast, these dozen-or-so Beastman Junior Officers seemed as small as mice to human eyes. But these mice relentlessly attacked, continuously breaking down the lava making up the Molten Giant, further weakening its aura.
"Roar!!!"
The Molten Giant roared towards the sky, its furious flames burning fiercely; its lava-formed body lit with a visible red glow as the fluctuations of the laws invigorated the nearby fire elements.
In battle, even ten buzzing flies around you would drive you insane.
Let alone these ten 'mice' capable of causing you harm?
Especially when the one being harassed is the notoriously short-tempered Fire Elemental Lord.
The mighty tiger has fallen to the lowlands, bullied by mere dogs; how dare these dozen or so Silver Level mice presumptuously challenge its authority, they truly think a Half-Legendary's majesty is as fragile as a tofu shell!
Infuriated beyond measure, the Fire Elemental Lord unleashed its internal Flame Law, turning the entire space into a boiling realm of fire elements.
Meteor Sky Burst!
It's determined to blast these damned mice to ashes!
However, consumed by rage, the Fire Elemental Lord overlooked the ever-watchful significant enemy before it.
Just when it was about to cast its Talent Magic successfully,
"Rasengan!"
In the distant sky, Austin abruptly flashed like lightning, his claw bearing a Rasengan with a diameter of one meter, suddenly appearing before the Molten Giant.
Riiiip!
The Rasengan, glowing white, suddenly turned to a deep azure, with lightning flashes tearing through the void.
The Rasengan, transforming its attributes in an instant, pressed against the Molten Giant's chest!
From the moment the Elemental Lord started to cast Meteor Sky Burst, it felt something was wrong.
But before it could react, Austin had already charged in with the Thundering Rasengan, aiming directly for its chest, watching its red pupils contract violently in its sight.
Boom!!!
Terrifying energy erupted, a halo of light blossomed in the void, the steel-hard body made of solidified lava was instantly torn apart by the overwhelming force, with emitted thunder like rotating rings of light, slicing through like laser beams, cutting large chunks of condensed lava.
All along, Austin treated the Rasengan as a long-range attack tool.
But now, upon personally delivering the Thundering Rasengan into the Molten Giant's body, Austin truly sensed the terrifying power contained within it!
The terrifying force instantly pierced through the Molten Giant's chest, revealing the Elemental Lord wrapped in white flames that stood over a meter tall!
At this moment, the Elemental Lord, interrupted mid-casting, suffered from spell failure backlash, further sustained severe damage from Austin's direct hit with the Thundering Rasengan to its core.
However, this is not enough for a kill!
The moment Austin saw the Elemental Lord up close, he knew ordinary means wouldn't slay this creature.
The Elemental Lord's core seemed constructed by the Flame Law Origin.
To completely kill it, ordinary power isn't enough.
Only a law can fight against a law!
"Restrain it!"
Austin roared immediately, disregarding the backlash from the Thundering Rasengan and the surrounding molten rock's searing heat, spread his wings, and rose skyward amidst the Wind Element's swirl.
At the same moment, following Austin's command.
Clang! Clang! Clang!
Massive chains suddenly danced in the air like dragon serpents, within an instant binding the wounded Molten Giant's hands and feet. Each Beastman Junior Officer, gripping the chain's other end, was like a nail securing them firmly to the surrounding ground.
The Molten Giant, with half its chest collapsed, was immediately fixed by chains, unable to move.

chapters.title: Chapter 294 290: Assassination (First update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
At the same time, Austin's figure darted like lightning, and in a breath, he soared to the sky above a thousand meters.
High above, Austin gazed down upon the earth, his eyes sweeping across with the majesty of a Divine vision.
His divine might was unfathomable, as deep as the abyss and as vast as the sea!
Unbeknownst to anyone, a massive cloud as heavy as a mountain had already shrouded the sky, covering the entire space, dimming the light as if excluding the whole world from heaven and earth.
Buzz!
In the void, ripples arose, and slowly emerged two mystically profound Law Divine Swords, indescribable by mere words.
At the moment those two Law Divine Swords appeared, the entire sky shook, as if causing a turbulent upheaval in the void.
Simultaneously, Austin gently closed his eyes in the high sky, his heart and spirit merging into his mind, strenuously controlling the changes of the two Law Divine Swords.
Power imitates Magic Power, and the spirit serves as Divine Sense.
Through the convergence of two similar powers, Austin began to drive the fusion of the two Law Divine Swords, inspired by imaginative concepts from fantasy novels he had seen in a past life.
As the intangible Magic Power and Spiritual Power drove them, ripples spread through the void, and the two forged Law Divine Swords underwent mystical changes.
It was like entering an invisible, indescribable, unspeakable state.
In that state of emptiness, the forces of wind and thunder continued to intersect and merge, forming an even more violent and powerful force!
"Wind and Thunder Fusion!"
As Austin's mind willed it, the two Law Divine Swords, drawing their Vacuum Power, descended magnificently from beyond the heavens.
Like a comet across the sky, they stirred up a vast river, and the star river descended from beyond the heavens.
Simultaneously, during their descent, the energy from the two Divine Swords surged into the nine skies, lurking beneath the nine lands, blending with the Celestial Secret Aura.
Like Tai Chi's yin and yang, eventually merging completely at one moment.
With the convergence of wind and thunder, all the forces of wind and thunder finally vanished, and the two Law Divine Swords overlapped at one point, forming an even stronger power!
Dual Swords Unification, complete!
That was an indescribably brilliant radiance, like the great sun falling from the nine heavens, filling the entire void with a dazzling glow, flowing like the tide.
That sword, carrying an immeasurable might that shook the universe and could annihilate heaven and earth, descended towards the lava giant, immobilized by the Magic Power Water Pattern Steel Chain.
As they watched that boundless and endless sword light fall,
the lava giant's scarlet eyes flashed wildly, feeling as if the gates of hell had opened at this moment, with the scythe of Death God descending upon them!
Death!!!
In a critical moment, the lava giant roared ferociously, struggling mightily, while the Fire Elemental Lord at its core tried to escape the shell towards the outside world.
But, it was too late!
That sword, infused with the dual forces of wind and thunder, seemingly pierced through layers of space's mirror in an instant, reaching right before them instantly.
Rumble!!!
A vast light exploded, like the Milky Way pouring down; large swathes of earth vanished, heavy air currents rose up, lifting a massive amount of volcanic rock, obscuring the sky and the sun.
Billowing smoke and dust rose up across the sky, turning half the sky gray-black; visible hurricanes swept up, streaks of lightning sweeping across the void and earth, akin to the arrival of a magnificent scene of an apocalyptic catastrophe.
Land and sea rose and fell, and the thundering scene rolled on for quite a while before gradually dissipating.
As the dust in the air was gently swept away by the breeze, the scene before them unfolded into view.
On the previously unbroken volcanic land, now appeared a bottomless abyssal crevice; small stones at its edges fell into the chasm without producing any sound.
This was a sword mark slashed out by the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords Unification, stretching for thousands of meters, like a massive gaping scar on the earth.
In the high-altitude, Austin panted heavily, using his Spiritual Power to summon back the two almost invisible Law Divine Swords, merging them back into his body to nurture again.
The power of the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords Unification was indeed immensely powerful, comparable to the divine might exhibited at the moment a Law Divine Sword unsheathed after nurturing for at least half a year.
But at the same time, the consumption of spiritual power and Magic Power was enormous.
After executing this move, even with Austin's advantage of being a giant dragon by species, his inner Magic Power and Spiritual Power were more than half drained, with half of his combat strength gone.
However, despite the great cost, the results did not disappoint Austin either.
"Finally dead!"
Both the lava giant and the Elemental Lord were reduced to ash under that single sword.
All that remained was a flame-like essence slowly rotating, as brilliant as a galaxy, yet like a burning rose of flame, emitting an alluring radiance.
This was not an Elemental Crystal Core but an Elemental Essence!
Unlike the Elemental Crystal Core left by ordinary Fire Elementals upon death, the Elemental Lord's was a mass of Fire Elemental Essence, oscillating between tangible and intangible, emitting a terrifying fluctuation.
Austin descended from the sky, surrounded by the gathering Beastman Officers.
Previously, the wind and thunder sword did not aim at them, and the highly concentrated power did not spill out; only those too close were slightly embarrassed by the residual attack, without much damage.
Seeing this, Austin nodded and reassuredly shifted his gaze to the Flame Essence left after the death of the Elemental Lord.
With a gentle flap of wings, under the lead of the Wind Element, he glided like a feather, landing lightly beside the Fire Elemental Essence.
"Such intensely concentrated Magic Power can actually form this shape!"
Though the Magic Power Essence before him seemed but a small mass, in reality, the power contained within this small clump of Fire Elemental Essence was nearly a hundred times the total Magic Power in Austin's entire being!
It's well known that with Austin's dragon bloodline, the Magic Power contained within his body is at least ten times that of an average human Gold Level Great Mage at peak, thus the Fire Elemental Essence contained within is as vast as an ocean.
Moreover, this Fire Elemental Essence is a level-up stage of Fire Elemental Magic Power!
Austin had a feeling that, by absorbing this Fire Elemental Essence, his Level Realm could break through to the Gold High Tier level in a short time.
However, caution was needed.
At least, in his current not fully-restored state, it was not yet time to devour and refine this Magic Power Essence.
Yet as Austin was about to put away this Fire Elemental Essence,
suddenly, he sharply sensed something.
"Not good! The Flame Law Origin is rapidly dissipating!"
At this moment, within the Magic Power Essence left after the death of the Fire Elemental Lord, the Flame Law was rapidly dissipating into the void, and the Flame Law Origin of the entire Fire Elemental Essence was about to completely vanish!
The dissipation was so fast that Austin had no time to think it through in detail.
Ultimately, Austin had to do something insane once more.
Opening his mouth, he swallowed the Fire Elemental Essence whole!

chapters.title: Chapter 295 291: Deep Sleep (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
This isn't the first time Austin has directly consumed the Law Origin.
Long before this, he had devoured and refined a wisp of the Wind Law Origin as if it were food, integrating it into his own bloodline.
The successful refinement of the Wind Law Origin marked a shortcut for Austin to ascend rapidly, relying on the consumption of Law Origins to understand the Laws.
This method of quickly enhancing one's power was something Austin deeply desired.
After successfully refining the Wind Law Origin, Austin's strength had increased by several levels compared to before.
Thanks to his skilled control over the Wind Element, his speed had also increased by several times.
It was the power of the Wind Law that, during previous battles, enabled him to evade the attacks of the Lava Giant time and again with the swiftness granted by the surrounding Wind Elements.
If not for the insight into that trace of Wind Law power that gave him a significant boost, the battle against the Elemental Lord would have ended with more than just embarrassment, but with a thorough defeat.
Having witnessed the power of the Law, Austin had no intention of giving up on the Flame Law Origin within the Fire Elemental Lord.
Austin's desire for the Flame Law Power was even above his focus on enhancing his Level Cultivation.
Thus, when he discovered the Flame Law Origin within the Essence of Fire rapidly dissipating, Austin, in his eagerness to enhance his strength, swallowed it whole.
However, this action resulted in significant trouble.
This was completely different from the previous trace of Wind Attribute Law Origin.
The previous consumption involved only a trace of the Wind Law Origin, with nothing else included.
Moreover, by then, Austin had already begun mastering the power of the Wind Element and had developed a Wind Attribute Rasengan using its properties.
At that time, Austin's control over the Wind Element had reached a fairly sophisticated level.
But now,
The Fire Elemental Essence that Austin swallowed contained not only the nearly depleted Flame Law Origin but also a vast ocean-like amount of highly condensed Fire Elemental Power!
The massive Fire Elemental Energy exploded within his body, crashing through every barrier within Austin's body like a tidal wave, as if about to burst from within.
Simultaneously, the Flame Law Origin within began to riot, causing a tempest of Fire Elements to surge throughout the void inside and outside of Austin's body.
"Roar!!!"
Flames spewed from Austin's eyes, nostrils, and mouth, his body's original dark blue color now covered by the substantial accumulated heat of the Fire Elemental Energy, emitting a dark red glow.
The air around his body was densely saturated with Fire Elements, the searing temperature like molten lava, making the air seem as if it might ignite.
His entire dragon form was like an iron block heated to red-hot, radiating intense heat.
Moreover, with the strike of immense Fire Elements and Flame Law, Austin felt as if each cell within him was ripping apart, every inch of bone tearing and crushing, like streams of molten lava coursing through his veins, burning his flesh and bones to ash.
He had never mastered the power of Fire Elements, nor did he possess any Talent Magic for Fire Attributes.
Austin's knowledge of Fire Elements was nonexistent.
At this rate, the only outcome was a body rupture and death!
Feeling the dire situation within his body, Austin had no time to give instructions for aftermath matters. Driven by a powerful survival instinct, he flew up and plunged into a nearby volcano.
At the center of the immense volcano was a caldera spanning several hundred meters, filled with boiling lava, with bubbles popping in the deep red molten rock.
This was a world of magma, as well as the place housing Austin's lifeline.
Austin plunged like a massive stone from the sky, splashing large waves of lava. The surrounding molten rock spilled from fissures along the edges, forming a bright stream of lava down the volcano.
"I will soon enter slumber; decide in the tribe as you see fit."
Barely maintaining a shred of consciousness, Austin's deep voice echoed from the smoking volcano.
Without waiting for the Dragon Nest Beastmen's response, he rolled in the flowing volcanic lava and swam directly toward the depth of the volcano.
The searing magma scorched Austin's body; though the dragon's bloodline had strong magic resistance, Austin was not a Red Dragon born in magma. The burning pain from the magma lashed his mind like tsunami waves.
Combined with the internal turmoil from the Fire Elemental Essence, it was a predicament both internal and external.
Thankfully, after sinking to the volcano's bottom, the massive amount of Fire Elemental Essence and Flame Law began to calm slightly, although still violent and conflicting, but at least no longer threatening to cause him to explode.
"Next time, even if I, Austin, am beaten to death or thrown off a cliff, I will absolutely never again willingly consume any Law Origin or Elemental Energy!"
With this last thought of exasperated resolve, the survival instincts of the dragon within Austin began to take over his consciousness.
A heavily injured dragon can recover through slumber.
Now, faced with immense danger, Austin began to enter slumber, allowing his body to adjust on its own.
Soon, everything before him slowly sank into darkness.
The volcano's mouth calmed down as if nothing had happened.
...
At the same time, as Austin fell into a slumber, a commotion arose within the Dragon Nest Elite Legion in the Volcanic Cluster Domain.
"His Highness has fallen into slumber; what should we do next?"
"First gather the army to eliminate all the Fire Elements here, and then send people to establish an outpost, ensuring His Highness' sleep is not disturbed in the slightest!"
With brief deliberation, the Dragon Nest Elite Legion came to a decision.
Subsequently, under top-down coordination, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe began to move.
A large number of Beastman soldiers entered the Volcanic Cluster Domain, under the leadership of extraordinary Beastmen, to eliminate one Fire Element after another.
Meanwhile, around the volcano where Austin slept, many Beastmen constructed layers of defensive fortifications using water and volcanic ash.
As an early substitute for concrete, the constructed fortress with volcanic ash had a certain level of defensibility, and the Dragon Nest Beastmen even considered transporting some volcanic ash back to the Dragon Nest Tribe City for future construction work.
The construction of the outpost wasn't near the volcano where Austin fell asleep.
Due to the harsh climate of the volcanic region and the lack of supplies from the outside, the guards around the volcano where Austin slept were essentially all elite forces.
Thus, the main forces established a new outpost at the boundary between the volcanic area and the Forest Land, beginning a new cycle of clearing and farming, crafting the second Dragon Nest Tribe outpost.
Compared to the barren, arid Volcanic Cluster Domain with its scarcity of resources,
the resources from Forest Land facilitated enough supply for the Dragon Nest Legion from the outside world.
Once the outpost is successfully built, sufficient food can also be obtained from the Forest Land.

chapters.title: Chapter 296 292: Expansion (Third update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Due to Austin's slumber, when constructing the second stronghold, the Dragon Nest Tribe began to shift a large portion of the tribe's resources towards that location.
The goal was to create a secure environment for Austin, who was still in slumber, to ensure safe and secluded conditions.
For the His Highness, who created everything for the Dragon Nest Tribe and lifted the beastmen out of hardship, no amount of reverence from the beastmen could be too much.
Thus, within a short month, the Dragon Nest Tribe constructed a sizable gathering place at the junction of the forest and the volcano.
Almost half of the military forces of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe were stationed here.
Plans for expansion and consolidation, along with clearing dangerous areas, were essentially canceled, focusing instead on providing the utmost protection for His Highness Austin at the second stronghold.
Meanwhile, deep within the volcano, beneath the defensive fortifications atop the volcano where Austin had fallen asleep, gathered the vast majority of beastman officers.
This portion of the military power accounted for more than half of the Dragon Nest Tribe's forces.
Aside from the necessary guard force, most of the defenses at the first stronghold and the tribe's main city were assembled here.
The highest alert of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe!
During this period, some powerful magic beasts passed by, but before anything could happen, they were slaughtered by the formidable Dragon Nest Beastmen, becoming food for the beastmen.
Preventing magic beasts from entering was also one of the protective purposes of the beastman army.
While the Dragon Nest Legion guarded Austin's slumber, the second stronghold expanded day by day.
Simultaneously, agricultural efforts began around the stronghold, considering it was quite distant from the Dragon Nest Tribe Main City, and relying solely on buffalo transport to bring food was not viable.
Relying on transportation alone was too demanding.
Self-sufficiency and establishing a food source were imperative for the second stronghold.
Fortunately, there was a substantial river within the forest, allowing for land reclamation and cultivation with abundant water supply.
Furthermore, due to the volcanic cluster domain nearby, the plentiful volcanic ashes erupted in prior years enriched the soil in the forest land with rich minerals, making the soil extremely fertile.
As a result, the first season of arrowroot yielded a bountiful harvest.
This marked the entry of the second stronghold into a state of self-sufficiency.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen, while cultivating land, also searched and explored nearby areas for useful resources.
During this process, the Dragon Nest Beastmen discovered the various refined gold and mithril magic minerals embedded within the volcanic rocks, which were carried from the deep earth veins by volcanic magma, with particularly abundant reserves.
Additionally, the beastmen found gold, iron ore, sulfur, and various other common mineral materials.
Such rich volcanic mineral deposits, if found in the human world, could potentially incite a frenzied kingdom war.
However, for the beastmen of the Kawa Great Forest, these items were neither edible nor drinkable, and their current forging technology could not utilize refined gold and mithril to craft weapons.
The Elf Kingdom was very poor, having hidden in the Secret Realm Space for a thousand years to evade the Beastman Royal Court's pursuit, thus lacking any opportunity to encounter such high-tier magic mineral materials like refined gold and mithril.
The newly established Dragon Nest Tribe was even more so; the entire tribe's forging industry was initiated by Austin.
Consequently, these incredibly rare materials, difficult to find in the outside world, were merely lamented by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, who then ignored them.
The greatest wealth in the eyes of humans was thus disregarded by the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Compared to those temporarily useless dead objects, the Dragon Nest Beastmen valued far more a type of crop that could serve as food, growing among the many red plants in the scorching dry land of the volcanic cluster domain.
A plant referred to by indigenous beastmen as the Mountain God Fruit.
This plant grew vine-like stems similar to arrowroot, sprawling across the ground, with fiery red leaf stalks, and roots beneath the soil that bore fist-sized fruits rich in starch.
If Austin were present, he would realize that this Mountain God Fruit closely resembled the sweet potato from his previous life.
Thriving in the hot arid region, a single Mountain God Fruit plant could yield a significant amount of food, comparable to the output of arrowroot.
It's foreseeable that the Mountain God Fruit would inevitably become another novel grain crop for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Incidentally, the discovery of the Mountain God Fruit owed to the reckless actions of a local indigenous beastman tribe chief.
The fiery red Mountain God Fruit was not absent in the volcanic cluster domain, but the Dragon Nest Beastmen would rarely consider digging up each plant to assess its suitability as food; if no accidents occurred, they might not discover this secret for several years.
But as the Dragon Nest Tribe constructed the second stronghold, the noise stirred up alarmed a nearby indigenous beastman tribe.
This indigenous beastman tribe chief recently became a quasi-silver Beastman Transcendent, about to step into the Silver Tier level realm, feeling extremely spirited, gathering population, leading the tribe to expand to over a thousand members.
Since there were no other powerful Beastman Transcendents nearby, this indigenous chief, based on his continuous undefeated myth, developed an illusion that he was immensely strong, surely born to be the Beastman King.
Indeed, he considered himself the Beastman King.
He could be called the Dragon Beast Heaven.
Therefore, when the Dragon Nest Tribe established a stronghold on his territory without his consent,
the tribe chief became furious.
He led the whole tribe of over a thousand people, heading aggressively towards the second stronghold of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
As a result, he encountered a Dragon Nest Beastman Officer leading a patrolling elite team midway.
Thus, this indigenous tribe met a tragic fate.
The Dragon Nest Beastman Officer effortlessly crushed the tribe chief, killing him within a few moves.
Afterwards, the Dragon Nest Beastman Officer ordered his team to round up the remaining trembling beastmen, tying them up with ropes one by one, annexing the tribe that had delivered itself to them.
Pitifully, the indigenous tribe chief died before achieving victory, his towering ambitions instantly flowing downstream.
During the annexation of this tribe, the Dragon Nest Beastmen discovered that the tribe's location was in a highly concealed mountain pass, and the site was easy to defend but hard to attack; had the tribe chief not acted recklessly, the Dragon Nest Tribe might not have managed to annex this beastman tribe in a short time.
Also, during the takeover process of this tribe, the Dragon Nest Beastmen uncovered the secret of the Mountain God Fruit, adding it to the various grains being cultivated.
...
The Dragon Nest Tribe's second stronghold was thus successfully developed amidst minor upheavals, smoothly allowing the Dragon Nest Beastmen to establish themselves nearby.
And the second stronghold, like the first stronghold, was interconnected with the Dragon Nest Tribe Main City, with the three locations forming a strategic triangle, greatly expanding the territory accessible to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In such tranquility, the Dragon Nest Tribe developed steadily and expanded reliably.
Time flowed gently, and before long, half a year had passed, as several seasonal harvests arrived, the year reached its conclusion.
Cold winter, quietly arrived one night.

chapters.title: Chapter 297 293: Awakening (Fourth update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
The cold wind, sharp as a knife, blew down with the falling snow from the sky, painting the earth in a thousand-mile span of silver white.
The entire Kawa Great Forest was enveloped in the bitter chill of the winter, as far as the eye could see, it was a vast expanse of white nothingness.
Only in this volcanic region was it an exception.
Perhaps it was because of the abundance of fire elements gathered in the air here, even the cold currents of winter could not influence this place, with no snowflakes falling from the sky, making it stand out sharply amid the icy landscape.
No, at least, there was an influence.
But as seen, the once freely flowing lava had partially solidified upon contact with the air, with a dark red glow faintly shining from the solidifying rocks.
Evidently, the part in contact with the air solidified due to the low temperature, although the inside was still a scalding hot magma.
After all, it was winter, and the temperature of the air in the volcanic cluster domain was considerably lower than during the summer.
Compared to the freezing world outside, the temperature within the volcanic cluster domain was merely around ten or twenty degrees, far from reaching the freezing point.
Due to the influence of the volcanic cluster domain, apart from occasional snowflakes being blown over from the forest land and melting in mid-air, there had been no further precipitation in the area.
Come winter, for a warmer and more comfortable living, some beastmen in the second base even built some rudimentary resting cabins within the volcanic region, not fearing a sudden eruption that might engulf both them and their homes.
And some beastmen also found that the temperature within the volcanic cluster domain allowed some wild vegetables to survive during winter where the volcanic ash gathered.
With the forest land covered in ice and snow, bringing the snow here to melt and water the wild vegetables was not troublesome.
Thus, some beastmen directly planted some wild vegetables in areas with more soil, ensuring fresh vegetables could be eaten during the cold winter, adding a splash of life to this desolate world.
"His Highness has been asleep for half a year, hasn't he?"
At this time, beneath the gigantic volcano where Austin slumbered, a beastman guard posted at a defensive fortification spoke to his companion.
"Yes, it's been half a year. This time, His Highness has been asleep much longer than in the previous two times. I don't know when he will wake up, hope nothing goes wrong, may the Beast God bless him."
The beastman looked back at the still volcano with a deep breath, starting to pray within.
Ever since Austin left a message of his impending slumber half a year ago, the volcano had remained silent.
During this past half year, the Dragon Nest Beastmen busied themselves nearby, from constructing defenses to posting guards, with Austin having had no response from within the lava.
This kind of situation inevitably made the loyal Dragon Nest Beastmen somewhat anxious.
After all, what's inside was scorching, molten lava. A normal beastman if not careful might fall in and turn to ash. Who knew what mishap might occur inside?
Meanwhile, due to Austin's slumber, the Dragon Nest Tribe had to halt large-scale expansion, withdrawing a massive force to safeguard the vicinity.
Thus, during this more than half a year period, the Dragon Nest Tribe's primary focus had been on internal affairs, maintaining existing scale while addressing issues encountered during tribal growth.
After all, under Austin's leadership, the Dragon Nest Tribe had developed rapidly. Having settled down to solidify the foundation was a wise decision.
Pausing the tribe's growth slightly to deeply excavate the Dragon Nest Tribe's current potential and rigorously develop the controlled territory was just as crucial as fast expansion.
Addressing emerging internal issues at least prevented complications from becoming entrenched, averting many problems.
...
As the Dragon Nest Tribe steadily developed,
at this moment, within the volcano,
inside a lake of dark red glimmering magma.
Gulu gulu!
In the volcano's mouth, searing bubbles rose from the magma's bottom, floating upwards and bursting at the surface, this cycle repeating indefinitely.
Everything was extremely calm.
In the lower part of the magma lake, a massive shadow lay quietly sleeping in the molten depths, the surrounding searing heat continuously scorching that gigantic form.
Indeed, it was Austin in his slumber.
Yet, even magma that was said to devour flames was helpless against Austin who rested in it.
The searing heat underpinned that shadow's azure scale armor, which now grew increasingly lustrous and resplendent.
What Austin didn't know in his slumber was that in these past months, the previously swallowed essence of fire and flame law were resonating with the surrounding magma, persistently tempering his physique.
In Austin's growth journey, to facilitate quick advancement, he had engulfed a massive amount of magic ore and various magic potions and crystals.
Despite a dragon's formidable digestive capability, there still remained a significant accumulation of magic power and mineral residues left undigested, settled within Austin's body.
Though these accretions had little impact on Austin's current rapid development, they would surely cause issues down the line.
This was the pitfall of seeking hasty advancement.
But now, after recklessly absorbing the essence of fire, the unleashed massive amounts of fire elements and flame law origins were vigorously coursing within his body, in synergy with the extreme temperature of the external magma.
It was as though two iron hammers persistently forged Austin.
Under the formidable impact of fire elements, Austin resembled an iron ore brimmed with impurities, being hammered and forged thousands upon thousands of times, expelling the impurities while metals and minerals coalesced into bones and scales, with accumulated magic within penetrating into the flesh and blood under intense heat.
In this process, Austin's dragon body underwent comprehensive refinement, with both the defensive power of scales and his strength significantly elevated.
It could be said that through this round of refinement, Austin's dragon body was now comparably stronger than a century-old young dragon in every way.
Of course, it could not compare to an adult giant dragon, for they undergo qualitative transformation upon reaching legendary status, which was not merely about enhanced defenses.
In any case, this was a blessing disguised in hardship, with the original ailments which had accumulated now becoming the sustenance for his growth.
The mere body refinement itself contributed to a power increase of no less than thirty percent for Austin.
Moreover,
with an even more formidable dragon body, Austin's future prospects have become increasingly vast.
However,
the refinement of his dragon body was merely an incidental benefit of recklessly devouring the essence of fire.
This bodily enhancement could only be deemed a pleasant surprise.
The real gains lay in two other aspects.
Level and Law.
These two were Austin's initial goals in slaying the Elemental Lord.
And it seems now his original objectives are nearing fruition.
Underneath the molten rock, Austin slept quietly, during this period of dormancy, his physique undergoing rapid transformation, the oppressive aura continuously rising, resembling a lurking prehistoric beast in the deep mountains.
After an indeterminate amount of time,
that massive shadow abruptly moved, the closed eyelids slowly opened.
As those crimson pupils fully opened,
at this moment,
outside the world, a mass of black as ink, heavy as a mountain cloud suddenly gathered, billowing layer upon layer, shrouding the entire sky, cloaking the heaven and earth.
Rumble!!!
The wind gale wailed, lightning rent the sky.
A colossal, terrifying aura descended between heaven and earth, inducing sheer bewilderment and dread!

chapters.title: Chapter 298 294: Harvest (Fifth Update, Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
With Austin's awakening, the external world's weather suddenly changed.
Under the heavy clouds, the sky over the volcano dimmed, as if it was excluded from heaven and earth.
Wind and thunder gathered, and the earth surged with internal fire.
An invisible shockwave swept through the world, stirring a massive elemental tide.
At this moment, whether it was the beastman officer defending near the volcano or the Dragon Nest Beastmen Legion at the forest's edge, they all looked toward the area of that peak.
"His Highness has awakened!"
Accompanying that oppressive force akin to a forthcoming storm, a pressure hundreds or even thousands of times stronger swept through like a tsunami, dark red magma burst open, splitting and scattering in the air, while above, a storm connecting heaven and earth descended with thunder and lightning ripping through the void.
Like a primordial giant beast, slowly rising from the magma lake amidst the dancing wind, thunder, and lightning, flames erupted.
High in the sky, Austin slowly spread his wings, immense divine might unfolded.
At this moment, that enormous figure seemed to become the center of the world, absorbing all gazes between heaven and earth, overshadowing all brilliance above and below!
"It's finally successful!"
Though his dragon body was in slumber for half a year, Austin was well aware of how poor his physical condition was back then.
Fortunately, at his growth rate at the time, he was about to enter a slumber, followed by an outburst of the essence of fire and Flame Law, severely injuring himself and triggering his body's protective mechanism to enter hibernation early.
Upon waking from this slumber, not only did all previous injuries inside him vanish completely, but his level cultivation also improved significantly.
"Golden High Tier pinnacle, plus the Flame Law Origin, not bad."
Although this recklessness was very dangerous, the gains after the danger were undoubtedly immense.
The level increase not only saved Austin years of honing, but also further advanced his own level.
Most importantly, now, by devouring the essence of fire left by the Fire Elemental Lord, he mastered the Flame Law.
The power of the law is ultimately the most important.
After thoroughly releasing the long-dormant momentum, Austin deftly descended from the sky, surrounded by the wind element, landing on a solid volcanic rock.
However,
At the moment Austin applied a bit of force to steady himself, that enormously large and incredibly hard volcanic rock instantly shattered with a crack, splitting into pieces in no time.
"This is..."
Only at this moment did Austin discover the changes in his own body.
The azure scales exuded a metallic luster, the previously somewhat rounded edges now sharp and distinct. The entire dragon body had grown to over eight or nine meters, the enormous body overshadowed everything, and its weight had increased several times!
The feeling was like transforming from a wooden structure to an iron one.
Austin knocked his scales with his forepaw, faintly hearing a sound of metal clashing.
If before, his body scales were as hard as rock, now they were entirely transformed into an iron-clad physique!
"Didn't expect such a benefit."
Reflecting on the cause and effects, Austin understood in his heart.
This should relate to the essence of fire and Flame Law Origin he devoured back then.
The external blazing lava and surging internal fire element forged his body like ore, finally condensing it into the current steel-like physique.
"A pleasant surprise."
It's not just an improvement in defense and strength, even the total magic power increased drastically after his body was tempered.
The Thunder Forging Body technique previously stimulated his body, but as Austin's strength increased, its effect waned. Now perhaps magma could be used for further tempering.
Austin couldn't help but think.
"Golden High Tier pinnacle, powers of three law origins, coupled with the tempered strong body, once I sort things out, I might even be confident to battle a genuine, unrestricted Half-Legendary!"
Feeling the overwhelming power within him, a surge of confidence involuntarily rose from the depths of his heart.
Standing high, looking at the endless mountain ranges in the distance, Austin felt the shackles on his shoulders lighten even more.
Half-Legendary, already half a step into the Legendary Realm.
Such an existence is almost at the peak within the entire Kawa Great Forest.
If it were the previous Austin, although he could escape from any threat below Legendary, he would have to abandon the Clan Tribe that he arduously built and flee disgracefully.
But now, even against a genuine Half-Legendary, he wouldn't have the slightest fear.
Perhaps he could even escape from a Legendary.
Both safety and stability have greatly improved.
This adventure was worth it!
Just as Austin's thoughts drifted, the Dragon Nest Beastmen were rapidly gathering below the volcano.
The disturbance caused by Austin's awakening had naturally alarmed the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
As the undisputed master of the entire Dragon's Nest, the vast tribe's founder, such an event as the end of his hibernation was naturally to be visited in homage.
Seeing this, Austin directly flew down from the mountain peak.
How long he had been asleep, how much time had passed, how the tribe was doing, he didn't know.
He needed to understand well.
...
With Austin's emergence, the previously tense atmosphere of the Dragon's Nest Tribe began to ease, and the news quickly spread across the entire Dragon's Nest Tribe, causing quite a stir of cheers.
The Dragon Nest Beastmen, deeply reverent to Austin, were genuinely thrilled by his safety.
Meanwhile, the war status was also revoked.
Most of the beastman soldiers started returning to the Tribe Main City, dispersing to various defense zones, and began clearing the giant beasts and magic beasts rampaging during the cold winter.
In the cold winter season, there are always some ferocious hunters who failed to store enough food in the hot summer, prowling around the forest terrain.
These starving hunters are extremely dangerous, and to prevent them from attacking the tribe settlements, the Dragon Nest Legion had to regularly patrol and clean up the periphery.
Now with Austin's hibernation over, the second stronghold doesn't require so many guards, thus a large force was redeployed to join the guarding and clearing of the Tribe Main City and the first stronghold.
Recalling when Austin was still weak, when the Dragon Nest Tribe was newly established, the entire Clan Tribe had merely a handful of members, during the cold winter they could only huddle in their nests to avoid danger, trembling with fear.
Yet, within just a few years, the elite beastman legion could not only venture out freely but also actively strike against those hunters posing potential threats to the tribe.
Transforming from shivering prey into rampant hunters.
The vicissitudes of life, as such.
During the half year when Austin slept, the Dragon Nest Tribe maintained a stable development.
Since the Dragon Nest Tribe adopted a contraction strategy, without large-scale expansion, but carefully managed internal affairs, there was nothing particularly noteworthy over the entire half year period.
Various pioneering farming, military training, recruiting wandering beastman population, etc. have become conventional practices during the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, with no need for Austin to worry.
Thus, following a simple report from Vini, Austin left the general affairs to them after ending his hibernation.
Today, the Dragon Nest Tribe has most of its affairs decided by a few senior elders voting, similar to some kind of council system, with representatives in civilian affairs, military, medical, manufacturing, and other departments.
Major affairs, in the absence of Austin, are typically decided by these representatives' votes.
Unburdened by the tribe's complex management affairs, Austin did not immediately return to the Dragon Nest Tribe Main City.
While in slumber below the volcano, Austin felt,
An unease hidden deep within the magma's veins.
He needed to explore this place,
Why was there elemental life here, what exactly was the source of everything?
Without clarifying certain things, Austin truly felt restless.

chapters.title: Chapter 299 295: The Ruined World (First update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Rumble!
At the bottom of the Volcanic Cluster Domain, the scorching lava echoed like the tide.
Austin, like a giant swimming fish, dived deep into the magma layer.
With excellent eyesight, he saw the lava area ahead, where brilliant glows circulated, like a giant vortex twisting in the void.
It seemed as if the space beneath the magma was in turmoil at that point.
"This is it!"
This was the source of the upheaval in Austin's heart during his slumber.
What could it be?
Austin flapped his wings, arriving before the void vortex, contemplating in his heart.
The appearance of the Fire Elemental Lord and numerous Fire Elementals in the Prime Material Plane was likely related to this void vortex within the lava.
He had explored the entire Volcanic Cluster Domain and only found this anomaly at this location.
"The Power of Space is surging, could the other side be a Fire Elemental Plane?"
Austin pondered involuntarily.
Perhaps a Fire Elemental Plane created this loophole connecting to the Prime Material Plane, allowing the Elemental Lord and numerous elemental creatures to breach into this world.
But still, something seemed amiss.
