Austin didn't dwell on it. He stared dazedly at the void vortex.
If indeed the other side is an Elemental Plane, does it mean there are many Half-Legendary creatures like Fire Elemental Lords there?
Might he be able to lure them into the Prime Material Plane, where their strength would be significantly weakened, making them easy prey for him?
In an instant, hundreds or thousands of plans flashed through Austin's mind.
Go take a look.
Austin felt a bit eager.
If he could indeed lure eight or ten Half-Legendary Fire Elemental Lords and then hunt them in the Prime Material Plane, his path to becoming Legendary might not be far off.
Think and act!
Thus, Austin flapped his wings and darted toward the void vortex.
As his body touched the spatial vortex, Austin distinctly felt a repelling force, as if it was preventing him from entering.
"Can't enter?"
A sinking feeling crept into Austin's heart. No wonder the Fire Elemental Lord and those numerous fire creatures hadn't left the Prime Material Plane; their retreat was cut off.
Just let it go.
However, just as Austin was about to give up and leave, a thin force within him suddenly flickered and vanished.
"What was that?"
The trace of thin power appeared and disappeared too quickly; Austin only felt a vague familiarity, but the next moment, the void vortex suddenly burst with powerful attraction, swallowing his entire body instantly.
Not good!
His vision suddenly went dark. The light around him vanished rapidly, giving the sensation of being spun rapidly inside a washing machine.
Austin struggled to resist, feeling a powerful force tearing at his body, as if trying to rip him apart.
If not for his dragon body having been tempered and becoming incredibly strong, he might have been severely injured at the first moment.
Fortunately, this change came and went quickly, in just a breath; all the anomalies disappeared. Austin, like a stone, spun down from the sky, crashing onto the ground.
Boom!
Like a heavy iron statue swirling down from the sky, cracking the ground open and raising a cloud of dust and smoke.
He hastily scrambled up, warily scanning his surroundings.
No danger.
However, as the world shifted, the previous magma lake had disappeared, as if he had entered another world.
A world that is dying.
The dim sky shrouded the land, giving an extremely oppressive feeling. The land's soil was dried up, the corpses of plants and trees lay scattered, devoid of any signs of life.
Bleak, gray, as if the whole world was heading for its final end.
This was the impression the world gave Austin the instant he surveyed his surroundings.
And indeed, the entire spatial world was only about four or five kilometers in circumference.
At the edges of the space, the whole world was crumbling and dissipating in the chaotic currents outside, turning to ash, with even the space crumbling within the gray fissures.
This spatial world is dying!
Moreover, it's nearing its final moment of demise.
"It's not an Elemental Plane, what a trouble."
Looking around, Austin's heart sank.
Even though he hadn't seen an Elemental Plane, he knew it would never be like this.
"The Fire Elemental Lord and those Fire Elementals must have escaped from here. Does this mean it's a spatial world of some Great Divine Power User traversing the Multi-universe?"
Austin pondered heavily.
Then, how to get back?
The void vortex that brought him here had disappeared; the entire spatial world seemed established within chaos, continually dissipating under chaos erosion.
The retreat was gone. Must he and this spatial world be eroded by chaos and dissipate into nothingness together?
For a moment, faint regret sprouted in Austin's heart.
He should have realized earlier.
If the void vortex led to an Elemental Plane, why would the Fire Elemental Lord and its race leave and relocate to the Prime Material Plane?
To them, the Prime Material Plane was like foul, stinky water to fish.
Some irresistible power must have driven them to abandon their homeland and live in polluted water.
While the Fire Elementals fled the place, he rushed in.
However, the trace of regret only flickered briefly.
Wasting time regretting past actions was not Austin's style.
Since I've come, let it be. Exploring might unveil a grand opportunity for ascendance.
Thinking of this, Austin's mood improved.
He stepped forward, walking slowly onward.
In this dilapidated, near-destroyed spatial world, in the center, obscured by a forest of gigantic, demon-like dry trees clawing at the sky, seemed to lie a structure.
It, too, was the most noticeable part of the spatial world, perhaps containing some answers.
Cautiously moving through the dry forest,
No surprises.
Soon, he arrived at a former garden.
The former.
From the dead, withered corpses of flowers, plants, and trees, one could vaguely see the garden's past glory.
But, ultimately it had perished.
There was no vitality, only withered, yellow-leafed plants remaining.
Much like this spatial world nearing its final demise, the plants shriveled, like sunset's elderly.
Just as he was about to leave, suddenly,
Whoosh!
An arrow of water shot out, striking Austin's tough scales with a metallic clang.
This water arrow packed the punch of some small-sized bullets.
But in front of Austin's scales, it couldn't even leave a white mark.
"Water Elemental? Since when!"
He turned abruptly, his expression immediately growing serious.
Unbeknownst to him, a midnight-blue Water Elemental stood behind a withered old tree, its mouth wide open—it was the one that had just fired the water arrow.
A Bronze Level Water Elemental alone couldn't make Austin serious.
But one by one, Water Elementals began appearing from between the surrounding forests.
At the same time, a vast Elemental Power surged through the decayed Celestial Secret Force Field, with a torrent of powerful Water Attribute Power sweeping across the sky.
Water Elemental Lord!

chapters.title: Chapter 300 296: Water Element (Second update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
Like the Fire Elemental Lord, the Half-Legendary Realm Water Elemental Lord.
And under its command, there are tens of thousands of water elemental creatures.
They emerged from between the forests, slowly encircling around.
"What the hell is this place?!"
The appearance of these numerous water elements made Austin certain that the Fire Elemental Lord he had previously killed must have escaped from here.
At the same time, they detained both the Half-Legendary Realm Fire Elemental Lord and Water Elemental Lord, along with so many great elemental creatures.
Who exactly is the master of this broken world?
Without giving Austin much time to think, the water elements in front of him launched an attack.
"Roar!!!"
A tremendous roar echoed, as the Water Elemental Lord stirred up massive tidal waves in the void, surging towards Austin's direction.
At the same time, the army of water elements under its command launched attacks on Austin, with Water Arrow Techniques shooting out obscuring the sky, like a dense storm.
Any creature below the Legendary Level would probably have to avoid such overwhelming attacks.
Crash!
Amid the huge sound of the tides, Austin felt like he was the enemy of the entire world at that moment.
However, Austin was no ordinary being.
As a giant dragon, he naturally possessed many advantages that other beings could not have.
"Hmph, if it were half a year ago, I would indeed have trouble dealing with you, but now!"
Austin snorted coldly, flapping his massive wings to create a wild gale, as his enormous body soared into the sky.
Just as he ascended, the tsunami roared and surged, covering the area where Austin had first stood.
The massive tidal impact caused large swathes of withered trees to screech in agony, snapping under the torrents and being swept away beneath Austin's form.
However, the tsunamis raised by the Water Elemental Lord were ultimately limited, and once Austin flew high into the sky, all the tsunamis became futile.
Even the Water Arrow Techniques fired by the tens of thousands of water elements failed to hit Austin, as he perfectly dodged all attacks.
"Not much different from the Fire Elemental Lord."
Austin realized,
that even in this unknown broken world, the Water Elemental Lord seemed weakened by some force, perhaps only three or four-tenths of its full power.
Just like the Fire Elemental Lord before.
Half a year ago, to handle the Fire Elemental Lord, Austin had to use all his means, even pulling the Dragon Nest Tribe army onto the battlefield for hunting assistance.
But now, after a significant power increase following his slumber, Austin had the confidence to single-handedly kill the Fire Elemental Lord!
"Thunderstorm!"
From high above, Austin let out a deep roar, his wings beating, and the massive membrane wings spreading wide in the air.
Simultaneously, the laws within him were activated, causing the entire Celestial Secret Force Field to tremble, and the wind and black thunder elements surged violently.
Rumble!
The thunderous roar of lightning echoed through the sky and earth, accompanied by blinding light tearing through the sky.
Fierce hurricanes swept between heaven and earth, the exploding thunder split and crackled within the dark storm.
A spectacular scene as if the end of the world was about to arrive!
As Austin invoked his Talent Magic, it seemed as if thousands of strands of lightning blossomed above the entire sky, and in an instant, they all poured down from the heavens.
Boom boom boom!
Bolts of lightning struck down from the sky, connecting with each other like a chain of lightning, creating an immensely powerful attack.
One by one, water elements shattered and crumbled under the barrage of thunder and lightning, including the towering Water Elemental Lord, enveloped in thousands of bolts, its body immobilized by electric paralysis.
Thunder restrains water!
Though the Water Elemental Lord didn't disintegrate like other water elements at first sight, it still lost its ability to move amidst the spreading lightning!
Austin didn't know if a potential elemental incompatibility existed in this world, nor did he have the time to ponder such unrelated things.
Press the attack!
That was the first thought that emerged in his mind.
Buzz buzz buzz!
The void began to twist under an invisible force, and within a breath's time, five or six Rasengan with a diameter of one meter appeared, the rapidly rotating Magic Power emitting a whooshing sound.
Soon, the light enveloped them, and in an instant, attribute changes aligned with Austin's will occurred within the Rasengan, as multicolored Rasengan appeared high above, with such terrifying power that even the vacuum seemed to distort.
"Go!"
Without hesitation, Austin flapped his wings, and six differently colored Rasengan suddenly plummeted from high above, with long fiery tails, crashing down onto the Water Elemental Lord.
Boom boom boom!!!
A series of continuous explosions sounded, as the Water Elemental Lord was instantly engulfed by erupting flames, thunder, storms, and other powerful Magic energies.
The entire ground quaked violently for a while, the visible shock wave sweeping out, lifting swathes of earth, and a hurricane arose.
The intense explosion aftermath lasted for quite a while before finally subsiding.
Upon closer inspection, there seemed to be no more movement.
However, just as Austin slightly relaxed, suddenly,
Swish swish swish!
Dozens or hundreds of water whips suddenly extended out from the smoke and dust, piercing through space, interweaving into a net in mid-air, attempting to entangle and bind Austin.
Seeing those twisting water whips like serpents slithering towards him, Austin was alarmed but showed no sign of tension, as he lightly flapped his wings, gracefully shifting his massive form through the air before the water whips could reach him, making them miss their target.
At this moment, Austin opened his giant mouth, preparing to counterattack.
Since thunder could restrain water, and during the assault on the fire element, Water Attribute Magic dealt double damage to the fire elements, would Fire Attribute techniques, in turn, inflict more damage on the water elements?
With that thought flashing through his mind, Austin occupied no more hesitation, as a vast amount of Magic Power gathered at his will in front of him, forming a huge Rasengan.
But it wasn't finished yet; a spark of flame flickered at the center of the Rasengan and then swiftly spread and expanded, covering the entire Rasengan.
The transformation of the Fire Attribute Rasengan!
As the internal flames completed their transformation, the rapidly spinning Fire Attribute Power perhaps reached thousands to tens of thousands of degrees Celsius, with the air temperature abruptly rising, the searing heat nearly contorting the void.
The next moment, the massive Fire Elemental Rasengan, carrying overwhelming heat waves, descended onto the Water Elemental Lord enshrouded in smoke and dust.

chapters.title: Chapter 301 297: Church (Third update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
The intensely concentrated Fire Element, within the Rasengan, spins at an unbelievably rapid speed, producing a temperature that even a meter away can melt steel, not to mention the terrifying high heat generated inside the highly condensed Fire Element.
It's like a small sun falling from the sky, shaking the firmament, its radiant light sweeping the entire dim earth like a tide.
At this moment, the Water Elemental Lord, as tall as a small mountain, is pinned to the ground by the wildly dancing electric snakes shot from all directions. The paralyzing effect of the current has an amplified effect on the pure Water Element-bodied Water Elemental Lord.
It can only watch helplessly as the scorching Flame Fire Rasengan descends from the sky, bringing with it a surge of heat that directly impacts its body.
BOOM!!!
The Flame Fire Rasengan bursts explosively, first rising into a gigantic, rapidly spinning blindingly bright spherical light on the ground. The visibly crashing shockwave impacts heaven and earth like a tide, and the terrifying waves of fire sweep upwards, instantly clearing a large area.
FWOOM FWOOM FWOOM...
Hot flames curl and twist in the void, raising the temperature of the entire broken world space.
After a while, the flames burning all around finally dissipate, but the withered vegetation has already turned to ash, and even the soil on the earth has been burned through to a dark red, with a radius of ten meters around the center point liquefied into a thick layer of glass-like lava, emitting a hot glow.
Residual flames crackle and burn among the dried-up woods.
Austin gazes into the distance, and the Fire Elemental Lord at the original spot has vanished, leaving only a mass of dreamy blue, galaxy-like Essence of Water!
This is the core of the Water Elemental Lord, condensed with the vast Essence of Water using the Water Elemental Law Origin as its spine.
Austin descends from high above, looking at the alluring Essence of Water in front of him and sensing the rapidly dispersing Water Elemental Law Origin within it.
After some thought, he bites his lip and decides to open his mouth and swallow it.
Despite the disastrous consequences after swallowing the Essence of Fire last time, which left his body in severe injuries, it took him quite a while to recover through slumber.
Even though the lesson from last time was still fresh, Austin couldn't help but covet the Essence of Water before him.
After all, the Water Element is not like the Fire Element, less violent, it should pose no issue, right?
He had once wielded a Water Attribute Rasengan and already understood the gentle nature of Water Elemental Power, which was precisely why Austin decided to swallow the Essence of Water before him.
As for himself, who seemed to have sworn not too long ago to never consume any Elemental Energy Essence or Law Origin:
Did I? Was there really?
Absolutely not.
He swallowed it in one gulp, Austin stood at the spot, awaiting the impact of the vast Water Element and the Law of Water.
One second, two seconds, three seconds...
Except for a bloated stomach feeling as if he drank a bellyful of water, nothing happened.
Austin was perplexed, could it be that he did not swallow the Essence of Water and the Water Law Origin?
Could it be fake?
Where was the intense pain? The explosive sensation from elemental impact? That feeling of living and dying?
Whenever he consumed a Law Origin, he was overwhelmed by the rampaging Elemental Power, making him feel like he's dying, why is it different now?
Austin focused inward, his spirit scanning through his body.
The Water Element and Water Law Origin didn't want to engage with him, and even rolled its eyes at him.
Austin stood there, pondering for quite a while and finally understood the reason.
No major aftermath, for two reasons:
Firstly, compared to the wind or fire he formerly consumed, the Water Element is relatively more docile.
Especially without the mixture of other forces, the Water Element behaves like a quiet beautiful man.
Using Daoist terminology, water represents gentleness.
Because of its gentleness, the impact wasn't intense.
Unlike the previously consumed wind and fire, which, once devoured, were like wilful mustangs resisting desperately as if their virtue was being encroached upon.
Secondly, Austin has become stronger.
Not only in terms of Level Realm advancement but also in mastering Law Control.
After the last absorption of Essence of Fire, and the refinement beneath the magma lake, Austin's Dragon Body has been greatly enhanced.
A stronger physique has given him even more powerful sealing suppression capability.
To the devoured Elemental Power, if Austin's body used to be like a wooden prison, now it's forged from steel.
"That's good, in the future it will be much easier to devour and refine Law Origins."
Austin was quite pleased.
One can't help but be pleased, after all, nobody is a masochist.
If one can devour and refine peacefully, why go through torment?
"However, to thoroughly refine it, I still need to go back and take the time to grind slowly."
Swallowing into the belly does not mean that Austin has refined the vast Elemental Magic Power and Attribute Law Origin into his own.
Currently, he has merely set them aside.
"Speaking of this, once I return, I should be able to master the Law Divine Swords of four attributes. I wonder if relying on the Law Divine Swords of four attributes, an attack mode similar to the Immortal Slaying Sword Array can be formed."
Upon applying the Law Divine Swords, with the number of mastered laws increasing, Austin does not intend to follow the path of Wind and Thunder Dual Swords Unification, going all the way to three, four, or even five sword fusions.
Perhaps later, the Multi-Sword Fusion could be explored to massively enhance attack capabilities, but developing other techniques based on the Law Divine Swords is also very necessary.
The Immortal Slaying Sword Array was one of Austin's initial thoughts.
That sword array, originating from the primordial chaos, was said to be unbreakable by anyone but the Four Saints.
Perhaps a slightly modified version of my own, capable of being broken only by four Legendary rank individuals, would be ridiculously formidable.
"But wouldn't that be overdone, others take down a Saint with a single sword, while you struggle to fight a Legendary rank, or maybe a broken Four Spirits Sword Array could work as well."
"Cyan Dragon leading thunder, White Tiger leading wind, Vermilion Bird leading fire, Black Tortoise leading water, the Four Holy Beasts precisely correspond to thunder, wind, fire, and water laws, this idea is workable."
Austin's thoughts wandered broadly for quite some time before reining in.
Adjusting slowly when I return, the most critical matter now is to find a way out.
After composing himself, he continued to explore forward.
Walking along a path, passing through dense withered trees.
Austin arrived at the fragmented and ruinous plaza.
A massive plaza with cracks everywhere, the indeterminate flooring material dull and crumbling, covered with dust, cracks filled with weeds, abandoned for who knows how many years.
At the end of the plaza stands a church.
A dim, desolate, and collapsed large church building.

chapters.title: Chapter 302 298: Divine Kingdom (Fourth update, please subscribe)
chapters.content:
The church was very old, with parts of it collapsing, and the walls covered in dust, looking abandoned for an unknown length of time.
Weeds were overgrown, and the buildings were dilapidated, just like the crumbling, abandoned churches Austin had seen in some Western horror films in his past life.
However, the towering structure still faintly displayed its former glory.
"Church, what exactly is this place?"
Austin furrowed his brows.
A world on the brink of destruction, a being suspected to traverse the Multi-universe, an Elemental Race, and this church…
Various speculations flashed through his mind.
Yet, he found no clues.
Inside, there might be the answers I need to know.
Staring deep into the church, a feeling suddenly arose in Austin's heart.
After pondering for a moment, Austin walked forward.
Step by step, there came a rustling sound all around.
No danger, seemingly over-cautious, yet Austin remained completely uneasy.
Passing through the shattered church door came a long corridor hall.
Vast, and eerie silence.
An unmistakable rotten smell permeated the air, as if Austin smelled the scent of the end of all things.
On both sides of the corridor stood angel statues.
But these angel statues were broken, their wings behind shattered, heads and feet missing, full of cracks, as if smashed by a hammer.
These broken statues were arranged very neatly, almost letting one see through the river of time the majesty of their glorious past.
"Where exactly is this place?"
With deep curiosity, Austin slowly walked forward.
This path was filled with darkness and solitude, accompanied only by the statues of fallen angels, seemingly endless.
He did not know how much time had passed,
Finally, the scene before his eyes opened explosively, becoming spacious.
This was the end of the Divine Hall.
There, an old priest was kneeling on the ground, confessing to a half-destroyed statue of a Divine on the high platform.
The old priest was very old, even turning his back to Austin, he could see the skin wrinkled like tree bark.
A beam of light shone from the top, enveloping the figure of the old priest.
The whole Divine Hall gave a feeling of warmth and harmony.
Anyone who saw the scene before them would feel a genuine sense of peace.
However, Austin indeed felt a chilling sensation rise from the bottom of his heart.
Because the figure of the old priest was illusory.
Just like a beam of light's projection.
But Austin knew that this world should not yet have holographic projection technology.
So, the old priest should be a ghost, a specter.
The old priest seemed completely unresponsive to Austin's arrival, continuing to confess to the collapsed Divine statue on the high platform in the Divine Hall.
The whole hall echoed with the old priest's calm, reassuring voice.
This slightly comforted Austin, feeling that even if it was a ghost, it might be a benevolent one.
Austin remained silent, and the old priest ignored him.
He did not know how much time had passed, just as Austin could not help but speak.
Whoosh whoosh whoosh…
Suddenly, the sound of wind came from all around.
It seemed like something was quickly approaching!
Austin's gaze sharpened, only to see black figures seemingly flowing out from the darkness, like Asura phantoms, with grinning faces flying from all directions.
Darkness, darkness devouring everything, like shadows peeled off from the darkness, with unsettling grins exposed.
Faintly amid the wind, Austin seemed to hear something singing.
Like devilish whispers full of seductive allure, darkened Divine Souls.
"What is that!"
Looking at those ink-black figures surging from the dark like a tide, seemingly about to engulf him along with the entire Divine Hall.
A heart jolt for Austin, inside his body the Thunder Law instantly activated, moving the Thunder Element through the void.
Crackle!
Bolts of thunder were born in the void, sweeping across like tearing space apart, those shadows under the thunder's strike vanished like sun-melted snow with eerie howls.
He did not know if hundreds or thousands of bolts of lightning exploded at this moment, the entire Divine Hall illuminated by the lightning flash.
The ink-black shadows like tides around were smashed into ash by the thunder strikes, and the distant ones seeing this seemed so scared, dispersed immediately like birds and beasts.
Serenity returned all around.
The aged priest was still confessing.
If not for the faint feeling of being watched by something from the dark, Austin might have thought everything just now was a hallucination.
"Old father, what were those just now?"
Weighing his words, Austin asked.
"...Divine Abominations."
Unexpectedly, the old priest stopped his confession, his ancient scratchy voice echoed in the air.
That feeling, like a puppet about to wind down, producing the final sound, seemed full of a sense of bygone history's weight.
"Divine Abominations?"
Austin slightly frowned, this term he seemed to have not heard before.
"Just as stars shining in the starry sky may fall… the almighty Lord… can also fall… once the lambs' faith collapses… seduced by the devil… they become Divine Abominations."
With the old priest's residual soul's hoarse voice intermittently echoing in the surrounding silent space, it nearly stirred up stormy waves in Austin's heart.
What do these words mean?
Could it be that the lofty Divines would one day fall to death from the exalted sky?
This is simply unimaginable!
Astonishment filled Austin's heart.
Suddenly, he recalled the bizarre state of this spatial world, with an incredible suspicion arising in his mind.
"Could this be the former Divine Kingdom?"
The dense voice emerged from his mouth, Austin stared meticulously at the phantom of the old priest ahead.
The old priest did not respond, continuing to silently face the collapsed Divine statue on the high platform, looking repentant.
Silence is the best answer.
Indeed, this was once a Divine Kingdom, now a fallen Divine's domain!
Only in a Divine Kingdom, would there be Elemental Lords and numerous Elemental Races.
Because only the timeless, endless Divines would have time to capture countless Elemental Lives to adorn the glory of the Divine Kingdom.
Only in a Divine Kingdom, would there be such a grand church Divine Hall, almost an entire space world built around it.
The shadows outside the Divine Hall were likely once countless Heroic Spirit Warriors who battled for the Divine.
They were once fervent believers of the Divine, granted eternal life in the Divine Kingdom after death.
However, when the Divine fell, the faith sustaining their hearts collapsed in a single moment, ultimately degenerating into Divine Abominations wandering in darkness!
Just what kind of upheaval happened for even the seemingly immortal Divines to eventually fall?!!!

chapters.title: Chapter 303 299: Promotion (Fifth Update, Request for Monthly Ticket)
chapters.content:
What exactly happened, even the Divine fell among it, the Divine Kingdom broken and collapsed, and the once heroic believers fell, turning into Divine abominations?
Why on earth did a Divine Kingdom fall near the Kawa Great Forest?
Countless doubts surged from the depths of his heart, Austin stared at the old priest in front of him, his gaze full of inquiry.
However, the expected answer was not given.
"Child... you have faith within you... this is why you could come here."
The remnant of the old priest became illusory at this moment, but his consciousness seemed to regain clarity.
It was like a final gasp of clarity.
"The Lord abandoned us... the most important thing in the Divine Kingdom has been taken away... you being able to come here... is guided by destiny, and also your opportunity."
The old priest's voice was intermittent, and his illusory figure began to flicker, as if he might disappear at any moment.
"Unfortunately, there's nothing left here... let me give you a final push."
As the voice fell, the old priest turned around.
Underneath the wrinkled face, there were eyes wise beyond comparison, as if seeing through everything.
That gaze seemed to pierce through the river of time.
In that instant, Austin seemed to see a young man rising from insignificance, battling the heavens and the earth, finally leaving a mark in the river of time.
Epic!
At that moment, the thought suddenly flashed through Austin's mind.
The old priest before his eyes was actually an Epic Remnant Soul!
Only an existence of Epic Level could leave footprints in the river of time.
Legendary, merely a legend of the present.
But Epic, could leave traces in the river of time, a saga sung through thousands of years!
This Divine Kingdom, was like a tomb about to collapse.
And the Epic Remnant Soul old priest before him, was like the last Tomb Guardian!
Thoughts surged violently in Austin's mind.
And at this moment, the old priest and Austin were separated by a distance of a dozen meters, and he pointed with one finger.
That finger seemed to traverse through layers of space, shimmering with tides of brilliance.
No, it should be said that the space of a dozen meters between Austin and the old priest was compressed into a mirror.
That illusory finger appeared before his eyes, pierced through the mirror, and pointed at Austin's head.
Austin, clearly eight or nine meters tall, like a massive small mountain.
The old priest before him, no more than about 1.7 meters.
In front of Austin, just like a baby before an adult.
Yet at this moment, in the blazing tides of light, Austin only felt the old priest before him become incomparably towering, countless shadows behind him forming an epic that spanned the river of time.
Under this vast and magnificent power, Austin felt more like an infant.
Austin did not resist, nor could he resist.
Just a remnant soul on the verge of collapse already suppressed him, motionless.
It was an indescribable power, a divine might above time!
Clang!
When that illusory finger touched Austin's head, he seemed to hear a crisp echo of metal clashing.
Soon after, a mysterious and unfathomable sensation spread throughout his body.
As if a barrier had been broken through, Austin's aura poured out like a flood bursting through a dam.
Half-Legendary!
The old priest's remnant soul pointed out, allowing Austin to directly surpass the peak of Gold, stepping into the realm of Half-Legendary!
This was simply unbelievable!
Feeling the surging, tide-like power within his body, feeling the rapidly growing Law Origin, waves of shock surged in Austin's heart.
Epic above Legendary was actually so powerful?!
What Austin didn't know was that this finger that sent him into the Half-Legendary wasn't as simple as it seemed.
That was the last gathering of Time Power by the Epic Remnant Soul old priest, and it was the old priest's gift to Austin who had accidentally barged into the Divine Kingdom at the last moment.
Moreover, during the process of enlightenment, the vast Essence of Water that Austin had previously swallowed also played an extremely important role.
The old priest's finger that pierced through space also refined the Essence of Water and the Water Law Origin he had swallowed, the tremendous energy produced interacted with the Time Power of that old priest's finger, pushing Austin's level cultivation to the bottleneck of the peak of Gold, ultimately shattering the wall blocking the path to Legendary, leading directly into the Half-Legendary Realm with the remnants of Time Power.
If not for the prior Essence of Water, the current level cultivation could only rise to the extent of the peak of Gold.
Even so,
But it was enough to see how powerful the Epic above Legendary was!
"Child, this is the last power sustaining the Divine Kingdom, rather than letting it linger, awaiting death, and ultimately disintegrating into nothingness, it is better to welcome its end early and fulfill its proper role."
The old priest's figure grew increasingly illusory, taking out a crystalline sphere the size of a ping-pong ball from the void, passing it to Austin's claw through overlapping spaces.
Austin's pupils suddenly contracted, it seemed he had seen this thing before!
Without giving him more time to think, with the extraction of that crystal, the entire Divine Kingdom suddenly shook.
The entire ruined world of the Divine Kingdom actually accelerated in its collapse, disintegrating at a speed visible to the naked eye, dissipating into the chaos!
Huge cracks crossed the sky of the Divine Kingdom, even the cathedral and Divine Hall started to collapse.
The Divine Kingdom was collapsing!
"Alright then, child, I know you have many doubts in your heart, but for now, go back."
Perhaps not wanting to say,
Or perhaps there was something that couldn't be said.
Austin clearly felt that the old priest did not intend to say much to him and was about to send him off.
Suddenly, Austin felt a powerful spatial tearing force act on him.
The void spun, transforming into a giant vortex.
Before Austin could say anything, his entire body was swept into the vortex of void.
And at this moment, the massive cracks in the Divine Kingdom's space finally reached the Divine Hall, slicing through heaven and earth.
At the last moment before leaving, Austin saw the old priest's remnant soul in the crumbling world of the Divine Kingdom through layers of the void.
Becoming infinitely weak and transparent, yet the previously deep and wise eyes were now filled with confusion.
"Even the Divine... cannot break destiny... child, the old era has passed, I hope you... can break through that destiny predetermined for us..."
A faint sigh echoed in his ears.
Next, an incredibly magnificent scene appeared before him.
He saw the collapsing Divine Kingdom fall like a waterfall, in the chaotic current, finally collapsing into a plane, a line, then a point, and finally disappearing into the void.
And with a plop, Austin fell directly into a scorching lava lake.

chapters.title: Chapter 304 300 Mysterious Person (First Update - Request for Subscription)
chapters.content:
Dragon Nest Tribe City.
Since the day I emerged from the Divine Kingdom and witnessed the demise of a divine realm with my own eyes, several days have passed.
Inside the Dragon's Nest, Austin is summarizing and sorting out some of the events that occurred earlier.
Once, a Divine fell nearby,
which made Austin feel horrified.
No matter what happened back then, once the news of a fallen Divine's realm leaks out, countless Adventurers will surely swarm to the area.
The nearby region will certainly be turned upside down by numerous visitors.
And my secrets might be completely exposed to countless gazes.
Fortunately, things aren't as bad yet.
After some investigations and interrogations.
According to the native Beastmen living near the Volcanic Cluster Domain, the volcanic region has existed there for a long time.
Maybe a few hundred years, maybe a few thousand years, or perhaps tens of thousands of years.
No one knows when that area formed, only that it has always been there for a long, long time.
Among the various bizarre terrains within the Kawa Great Forest, the entire Volcanic Cluster Domain isn't conspicuous amidst the vast Forest Land of millions of square kilometers.
A Divine Kingdom falling from the Starry Sky, if not near the final collapse stage, would hardly form a breach in the weak parts of space.
Even a Legendary would probably not discover a Divine Kingdom wedged in a spatial rift.
Otherwise, if a Divine Kingdom couldn't hide itself, countless Divine would have been defied and conquered long ago.
This suggests that the Divine Kingdom beneath the Volcanic Cluster Domain likely hasn't been discovered.
If undiscovered, everything remains fine.
Moreover, according to those native tribes, those Fire Elementals only appeared in the Volcanic Cluster Domain in recent years.
Also, unless a powerful creature capable of influencing them enters, those Fire Elemental creatures usually stay beneath the magma layer, hidden and not coming out.
This information is crucial.
This means that Austin might be the first to discover the anomaly in the Volcanic Cluster Domain.
The native Beastmen near the Volcanic Cluster Domain didn't see any Extraordinary Beastmen; they probably wouldn't venture into that newly dangerous area, nor contemplate the peculiarity of Fire Elementals appearing there.
Beastmen living at the base level on the Kawa Great Forest, struggling between life and death their entire lives, wouldn't know what those Fire Elemental creatures are even if they saw them.
Combining all the information, a rather definite result can be obtained: the matter of the Divine Kingdom's exposure that Austin worries about is basically unnecessary to fret over.
For the time being, this vicinity remains safe and secretive.
I can still hang in there for a while.
"However, a few years ago..."
Austin pondered, silent without knowing what he was thinking.
During this period, something seems off.
It appears that the source of all the chaos in the Forest Land caused by the undead apocalypse in the Kawa Great Forest happened just a few years ago.
Moreover...
In thought, Austin casually took out two crystals and observed them closely before his eyes.
Overall, they are crystal clear, their composition unknown.
Focusing his gaze for a closer look, he would faintly hear chants in the void between existence, possessing a sort of hypnotic power, as if the Divine Soul itself were being absorbed.
The two crystals contain a power Austin cannot comprehend.
And this power seems to be of the same origin!
The difference is that the one on the left, crystal-clear, contains no impurities, exceedingly pure.
When gazing at it, the sound entering one's ears is like being in a cathedral with sacred hymns being sung, filled with holy radiance.
Whereas in the one on the right, darkness subtly flickers at its core, and the sacred chanting in the ear carries an eerie feeling, as if countless twisted souls were praying and praising the Lord.
"What exactly are these things..."
The one on the left is what Austin obtained from the Divine Kingdom, the last power left by the remnant soul of the old priest to maintain the existence of the Divine Kingdom.
The one on the right, however, was obtained after Austin's team obliterated the Zombie Undead Nest, using a super invincible world-destroying compressed wind-water-thunder Rasengan to annihilate that enormous Pyramid.
The two crystals, while similar, are vastly different.
But regardless, Austin instinctively senses a definite connection between the two!
"The Epic Remnant Soul mentioned that the most important thing inside the Divine Kingdom had already been taken away. Who could that person be? And what did they take? Is the undead apocalypse sweeping through the entire Kawa Great Forest related to that mysterious person who took away the most important thing from the Divine Kingdom?"
Austin believes that the undead apocalypse is very likely directly related to the person who took the crucial thing from the Divine Kingdom.
Otherwise, why would the crystal obtained from the remnant soul of the old priest be so similar to the one obtained after destroying the Pyramid?
It gives him a feeling of being from the same source.
These two crystals are very likely to originate from the Divine Power Crystal of the same Divinity.
Meaning the owner of that Divine Kingdom, the Divine who fell for unknown reasons.
Linking multiple storylines, some inferences involuntarily arise in his heart.
Many years ago, an unknown Divine fell, and the Divine Kingdom high above the starry sky crashed onto the Prime Material Plane.
The Divine Kingdom that drifted in the void's crevices ultimately fell beneath the Volcanic Cluster Domain in the Kawa Great Forest.
Among the heroes in the Divine Kingdom, some couldn't bear the Divine's death, ultimately falling and becoming Divine Wraiths.
Afterwards, likely, a great battle occurred within the Divine Kingdom after the Divine's demise.
A battle between those heroes who could maintain their sanity and the Divine Wraiths.
Eventually, within the entire Divine Kingdom, only an Epic-level old priest remained, along with a few Divine Wraiths.
Presumably, this is also why Austin did not encounter any other powerful Divine Wraiths in the Divine Kingdom.
Those powerful Divine Wraiths likely had been directly slain in the fierce war.
And the old priest, whose wick was burned out, could no longer purge the remaining Divine Wraiths, only stay in the Divine Hall repenting.
After that, who knows how many years passed.
A mysterious figure entered the Divine Hall and took away the most crucial thing maintaining the Divine Kingdom's operation.
And that figure must have a close-knit relationship with the fallen Divine.
Otherwise, they would never know the location where the Divine Kingdom fell and could enter it at will.
Perhaps at the last moment, as the Divine Kingdom's final Tomb Guardian, the old priest didn't even have a chance to stop them.
"The Lord abandoned us..."
Recalling the old priest's words, and all the somewhat strange actions the old priest took later.
Austin vaguely seemed to understand something.
However, the speculation was too shocking; Austin could only press it down in his heart.
"It is probably that mysterious figure who took the thing maintaining the Divine Kingdom, leading to the Divine Kingdom's contact with the Prime Material Plane amid its collapse, causing the escape of the Fire Elemental Lord and the Fire Elemental Race."
The front and rear connections all tied together at this moment.
And that mysterious figure is very likely the culprit of all the chaos in the Kawa Great Forest in recent years.
They might be people from the Beastman Royal Court.
Or perhaps that figure cooperated with pure-blooded Beastmen from the Beastman Royal Court, sparking this great calamity sweeping through the Kawa Great Forest, even though the pure-blooded Beastmen didn't know their identity.
The ultimate truth, perhaps only the Beastman Royal Court at the core collapsed area might possibly know.
However, Austin instinctively felt it was likely more of the latter.

chapters.title: Chapter 305 - 301: Seclusion Again (Second Update Asking for Subscription)
chapters.content:
Chapter 305: Chapter 301: Seclusion Again (Second Update Asking for Subscription)
The general origin of the Fallen Divine Kingdom is probably like this.
However, Austin had another question.
"The kingdom falls from the starry sky, its light illuminating the entire sky, which must have attracted countless attention. Even Legendary Level beings couldn’t pinpoint where the kingdom finally fell, but epic beings attuned to the power of time would definitely notice some clues. Why, after countless years, has that kingdom still not been discovered?"
Doubt suddenly arose in his heart.
The fall of a divine being is no small matter. It is said that the divine beings are related to the most basic rules that compose the world, the very foundation of the Prime Material Plane’s stability.
When they die, the Divine Kingdom suspended in the starry sky falls like a meteor, the sky weeps with blood, and such a massive disturbance can be felt across the entire Prime Material Plane.
Although the Divine Kingdom’s ability to hide is strong, after the death of a divine being, the broken kingdom can’t conceal itself from the senses of epic beings who wield the power of time.
Epic Level beings can find the location of the kingdom through the traces of its fall.
Any kingdom, especially one belonging to a fallen divine being, would drive even an epic being to madness!
However, the kingdom beneath the Volcanic Cluster Domain remained concealed for unknown years, until recently when a mysterious person took the most important thing from it, causing the soon-to-collapse kingdom to be exposed.
This doesn’t quite add up.
Why wasn’t the kingdom discovered right when it fell?
Suddenly, a chilling possibility arose in Austin’s mind.
Unless,
on that day, not just this one divine being died!
With the fall of the gods, the stars trembled and scattered in all directions.
Countless stars fell from the starry sky, dispersing to various places of the Prime Material Plane, the entire sky dyed red with blood, and heaven and earth mourned.
A countless number of meteors fell from the sky, and their falling locations couldn’t be recorded or calculated.
It’s very likely that it was a war in which countless divine beings perished.
It might have even swept across the entire Prime Material Plane, with corpse mountains and blood seas everywhere, and no one cared about the fallen Divine Kingdoms.
Only such an occasion could allow a fallen divine being’s kingdom to remain hidden for countless years, until the moment it voluntarily revealed itself!
The result of this conjecture made Austin’s scalp tingle with fear.
He felt an overwhelming terror envelop him, which he had to suppress with difficulty and bury deep within his heart.
"Even the gods have died..."
Austin looked up, his gaze deep as he stared at the sky above.
If his guess was correct, he already knew the owner of that Divine Kingdom beneath the Volcanic Cluster Domain.
When he entered the Divine Hall, Austin saw the huge, half-collapsed emblem on the cathedral.
Witnessing the old priest’s shadow and the experiences along the river of time behind him, that divine being’s emblem appeared and vanished.
That was the Beast God’s emblem!
In the Kawa Great Forest, the countless lower-level Beastmen, in their difficult struggles, never stopped praying to the Beast God!
The Beast God may have fallen.
Therefore, no matter how sincerely the struggling Beastmen prayed, it would never elicit a response.
And the Fallen Divine Kingdom beneath the Volcanic Cluster Domain might have belonged to the former Beast God!
Austin suddenly felt the pressure on him intensify.
The mysterious figure that took the most important item within the Beast God Divine Kingdom, the Beastman Royal Court at the core, the undead calamity sweeping through the entire Great Forest...
All these intertwined in his mind, forming a massive, dense spider web, covering the entire Great Forest area, ensnaring all creatures within, making escape impossible for any caught in it.
No wonder those lurking behind the Tribe Alliance, pushing everything forward, were so cautious among the Legends.
They probably had long noticed that the Beastman Royal Court occupying the core was not so simple.
It remains unknown whether some divine beings are orchestrating the downfall of the Beastman Empire remnants this time.
"Desecrators, could the fallen divine beings be connected to the former Beastman Empire? If such a great war causing countless divine beings to fall truly occurred, what role did the Beastman Empire play in it?"
More and more questions arose in his mind,
Elf Kingdom, Beastman Empire, alliances, fallen divine beings, divine war, waves of undead calamities, and the "preordained fate" uttered by the old priest’s remnant soul before leaving the Divine Kingdom...
Austin instinctively felt that there was a massive secret behind all these, but lacking information, he couldn’t make any guesses.
"Hah, well, these matters are beyond my reach for now."
After pondering long without any clues, Austin sighed, burying the many questions deep in his heart.
Some things can’t be changed, even if one knows about them.
Faced with epic beings and divine presences wielding the power of time, what can a small Half-Legendary do but quietly watch from the sidelines and hope not to be crushed?
Fortunately, this war engulfing the entire Kawa Great Forest seems unlikely to attract such terrifying presences.
"Even if the old Beastman Empire was indeed linked to the brutal war causing divine falls, the current Beastman Royal Court is nothing more than the remnants of the old empire..."
"Covering the tomb with the last shovelful of dirt is but the last ripple of the old war. No matter how far-reaching, no great force might get involved in this water muddle."
This counterattack to erase the Beastman Royal Court’s core may already involve the Legendary personally, so there’s no need to worry too much.
"But ultimately, strength is one’s true foundation!"
A glow of determination passed through Austin’s pupils.
Many previous speculations may be inaccurate, but Austin had already understood one truth.
Only by becoming stronger can one grasp their own life and destiny!
Even though Austin had now reached Half-Legendary, within the Kawa Great Forest, nothing could threaten his life.
Even against a Legendary, he could escape.
He no longer has any survival worries at all.
But it’s still too weak.
Even gods high above, deemed eternally unyielding, could fall one day. How much less could a mere Half-Legendary survive?
Feeling the pressure of the times, Austin began to intensely enhance his own strength in seclusion.
Indeed, not long after waking from a slumber, Austin planned to seclude for cultivation again.
After delegating tribal matters to his Beastman subordinates, Austin once more retreated for cultivation.
Fortunately, it was now the cold winter period, the entire tribe had nothing significant going on, and he didn’t need to watch over constantly.
This allowed him to focus wholeheartedly on improving himself in seclusion.
Currently, Austin possessed the four laws of wind, thunder, water, and fire within him.
Yet, besides the laws of wind and thunder, he hadn’t honed the others well, and his grasp of the Law of Water and Flame Law remained at a very low level.
This seclusion, Austin aimed to continuously comprehend the two laws, letting the laws of water and fire reach the level of control he had over wind and thunder.
At the same time, he intended to forge the divine swords for the Law of Water and Flame Law, completing four Divine Swords with distinct attribute powers.
Once all four Law Divine Swords were crafted, he would begin developing the Four Spirits Sword Array, massively enhancing his own ability.

chapters.title: Chapter 306 - 302: Magic Power Control Precision (3rd Update, Request for Subscription)
chapters.content:
Chapter 306: Chapter 302: Magic Power Control Precision (3rd Update, Request for Subscription)
The saying goes, when you’re in the martial world, you have little control over your own fate.
The changes in the situation might involve oneself, and only strong strength is the fundamental basis for standing one’s ground.
Previously, there were several times when I almost got caught up in the vortex of this vast war.
If it weren’t for relying on my own strength, how could I peacefully cultivate and improve in seclusion?
The turmoil is spreading, and with each new thing Austin experiences and uncovers, he gains a deeper understanding that the source of this upheaval sweeping across the Kawa Great Forest is not simple.
If you want to stay out of it and protect yourself, only greater strength can be your most solid backing.
At this moment,
within the valley where Austin often secludes himself for cultivation.
"The Law of Water and the Law of Fire, although already fused into my bloodline, my comprehension of these two Elemental Laws is still at zero. Additionally, the Level Cultivation has rapidly increased from Golden Middle Tier to Golden High Tier in a short period, and then quickly to Half-Legendary. My control over my own power is still quite rough and needs further practice."
Austin sat cross-legged on the mountain peak, planning his previous gains and identifying the problems he needs to solve.
The first things to improve on are undoubtedly the mastery of the Water and Fire Laws as well as the surging power.
After some thought, Austin decided to first control his suddenly increased level of power.
After all, understanding the laws isn’t an overnight task, and better control of my surging Level Cultivation strength also helps in comprehending the laws.
So in the first few days, Austin began practicing various techniques.
From close combat to various long-range attacks, and the release of various Attribute Rasengan, Austin executed them all one by one, then improved based on his insights.
For a time, the entire mountain range echoed with booming sounds.
Many mountains were leveled by the aftermath of Austin’s training.
During training, he discovered something quite amusing.
Standing on a certain mountain peak, then suddenly outputting forward, regardless if it’s Rasengan or Electromagnetic Cannon or Thunder Strike, releasing them all.
After several rounds of impact, the peak ahead was forcibly blasted open in the middle.
Standing high up, looking at the clear path ahead created by his own efforts, a sense of accomplishment welled up within him.
Push mountains aside, sever peaks, shift mountains, fill the sea.
The power that once only existed in fantasy is now truly in his hands, and he feels an unprecedented satisfaction.
After several days of simple, crude training, Austin has generally adapted to his surging power.
At the very least, he could simply control the power size when using techniques like Rasengan.
However, this is not enough.
At least not for Austin.
Therefore, he proceeded to the next step of advanced training.
Splitting Magic Power.
In previous seclusion, Austin relied on the training method of splitting Magic Power, dividing a lump of Magic Power into hairs to greatly enhance his control over his own strength.
At that time, after splitting training, not only did he increase the power of techniques like Rasengan while reducing consumption, but he also formed a Domain prototype through combination with Talent Magic.
Now, Austin has reached the Half-Legendary Realm, already able to condense a Domain.
Moreover, the Magic Power within his body, both in energy level and quantity, has undergone a tremendous enhancement.
Compared to the time when he was just at the Golden Low Tier, the difficulty of controlling his own Magic Power has increased more than tenfold.
After the splitting training, Austin became very interested in how far his enhanced precision in magic control could reach.
Thus,
next, the mountainous region that was booming all day became quiet.
Austin sat cross-legged on the mountain peak, white snowflakes fell from the sky, landing on him, staining a white touch, resembling an ice sculpture.
Like a hermit sage, his heart as still as water.
Motionless, his Heart Spirit seemed completely immersed into his heart.
A mass of Magic Power floated in the void in front of him, beginning to be squeezed and split under the action of invisible Spiritual Power.
Two lines, four lines, eight lines...
The Magic Corps in front gradually split, becoming a greater number of coarse Magic Lines.
In this process, as the Magic Corps was split into eight parts, the coarse lines split using Spiritual Power began to tremble, and cold sweat appeared on Austin’s forehead.
Finally,
With a pop, the arm-thick, crooked, irregularly sized Magic Lines suspended in front began to collapse, sweeping up a gust of wind on the ground, clearing away the surrounding as well as the snow on Austin.
"Failed."
Austin opened his eyes, somewhat weary.
Compared to before, due to the great enhancement in Magic Level and quantity, the Magic Corps activated were both powerful and turbulent.
During splitting, even a moment of unstable Heart Spirit could cause it to disintegrate.
The difficulty has increased more than tenfold, to say the least.
However, Austin did not give up.
If it doesn’t work the first time, the second will do. If the second doesn’t work, then the third, fourth... As long as he continues to try, the degree of control over his own Magic Power will surely improve quickly, reaching a certain level of precision.
After a short rest, Austin closed his eyes again.
Sinking into his Heart Spirit, a flowing Magic Power mass appeared in the void ahead, surrounded by the invisible Spiritual Power enveloping the surrounding void.
He began to try again.
Once, twice, three times...
As time passed, from the beginning where the arm-thick line would fail and collapse, then to cable-like size, next to chopstick, and then toothpick...
Step by step, the precision of Austin’s control over Magic Power improved at a speed visible to the naked eye.
Meanwhile, the overwhelmingly strong aura pervading the surrounding void also began to gradually recede.
The presence that once was enough to frighten ordinary creatures into trembling, now only exudes a sense of dominance that would make ordinary Beastmen feel awe.
This is the result of increased precision in controlling Magic Power, allowing Austin to freely control the presence he emits.
If one day, Austin reaches an ultimate level of control over his Magic Power, he might be able to completely conceal his aura.
Since the last six months of tempering in the lava, Austin’s once youthful body has been honed to a more pronounced form, no longer needing to use presence to highlight his valor.
Concealing aura would be no issue either.
Time slowly passed, in the blink of an eye, half a month had gone by.
During this half-month, Austin finally managed to split a mass of Magic Power to the fineness of a strand of hair.
This fine level of control is already sufficient.
To go further would require more time and more effort.
For the current Austin, the cost-effectiveness of enhancing strength this way isn’t very high.
Thus, Austin stopped training in this area.

chapters.title: Chapter 307 - 303: Law of Water (4th Update, Seeking Subscription)
chapters.content:
Chapter 307: Chapter 303: Law of Water (4th Update, Seeking Subscription)
After Magic Power was split to the hair-thin level, Austin discovered that the amount of Magic Power consumed in using Rasengan and other various techniques had decreased to around seventy or eighty percent.
At the same time, the power not only did not decrease, but in fact had a certain degree of enhancement.
Most importantly, this hair-thin Magic Power control allowed Austin’s spirit to use this precise Magic Power control as a medium to vastly consolidate the extent of his expanded Domain.
Although, it cannot achieve the Legendary feat of making the entire Domain one’s own battlefield.
But with the current strength of Austin’s Domain prototype, it is definitely stronger than ordinary half-Legendary level.
"Not bad."
Apart from the above gains, continuous training in Magic Power splitting for more than half a month greatly enhanced Austin’s spirit and elevated his physical control to a higher level.
Magic Power splitting training concluded, roughly estimated, Austin’s strength was increased by another notch.
It also provided a considerable benefit for his subsequent cultivation.
"Next is to comprehend the power of the Flame Law and Water Law Origin."
Austin immersed his Heart Spirit, continuing his cultivation.
During the cold winter, there were no major events.
Currently, the Dragon’s Nest tribe can solve any issues on their own, without needing him to intervene personally.
Having already fallen to the status of an Overlord Level force, coupled with the completion of the Beastman Six Techniques and their dissemination among Beastman Transcendents, the strength of the Beastman Transcendents has been greatly enhanced, even Gold Level Lords can’t cause much harm to the Dragon’s Nest tribe.
Now, with Austin combining forces with his Dragon’s Nest tribe, their strength is no less than any super-large tribe within the Tribe Alliance.
The Dragon’s Nest tribe hasn’t achieved the same fame as the Blood Claw Tribe simply due to Austin’s strategy of building high walls and accumulating resources while gradually advancing his position.
Moreover, more than half of the Dragon’s Nest tribe’s food comes from agricultural development, including various mushroom cultivation, animal husbandry, fishery, etc., combined, there isn’t much need for survival territories, thus avoiding large-scale conflicts with the outside world.
Up until now, the wars initiated by the Dragon’s Nest tribe were merely small regional conflicts.
They laid a solid foundation and constantly cultivated Inner Power.
Awaiting the war that will scourge the Beastman Royal Court, when the world’s attention shifts from the Kawa Great Forest, it will be the best time for them to reveal themselves.
The Dragon’s Nest tribe expands steadily, in three strongholds.
Austin naturally felt at ease cultivating, striving to enhance his strength as early as possible.
Sometimes, he thought, he must be the most diligent Giant Dragon ever.
What’s those of his age doing?
They’re probably taking a long nap.
Sometimes he truly envied other dragons.
Luckily, diligence truly pays off.
Currently, Austin is merely around seven years old, yet his strength has reached the Half-Legendary Realm, and he possesses the power of the Four Elements Law.
At seven, considering a Giant Dragon’s lifespan extending over a millennium, it is not even one percent, still unable to shake off the status of a Young Dragon.
But he already has an enormous physique of eight or nine meters tall, just a half step away from entering the gate to the Legendary Realm, traversing a path that other dragons can’t finish even over hundreds of years.
Those same age Young Dragons under their parents’ protection might just reach Silver Level at best.
Recalling the hardships he endured along the way, Austin sighed deeply.
"The luck of the diligent shall not be too bad."
On the mountaintop, Austin gave himself a sip of past life’s motivational soup and began to immerse his Heart Spirit in comprehension.
Originally, Austin relied on devouring and refining the Law Power acquired, which did not belong to him.
Although the old priest’s distant finger directly refined the Water Elemental Law Origin within Austin, drastically enhancing the constant Law Origin power inside him.
But ultimately, they aren’t his own, he can only use them, unable to comprehend.
If the Law Origin were a knife, then the Flame Law and Water Law are like a child’s knife for Austin, only able to wield it haphazardly.
When Austin comprehends the power of the Flame Law and Water Law, it’s akin to someone who originally didn’t know how to use a knife learning a Sword Technique, greatly enhancing both utility and killing ability.
Moreover, the benefits of comprehending Laws not only improve the effectiveness of using Law Power.
Most importantly,
If he can fully comprehend a Law Origin between heaven and earth, it can serve as a stepping stone, allowing him to enter the Legendary gate in one stride!
A complete Law Origin is the threshold to the Legendary gate!
The current comprehension of the Law Origin within is the foundation accumulated on the road to the Legendary gate!
This is also why Austin tirelessly spends a great amount of time on comprehending Law Origins.
His spirit immersed in body, enveloping the Law Origin within the bloodline.
Starting with the Law of Water,
Austin’s spirit seemed to sink into a world of water, everywhere in sight was a sea of water.
Standing at the center of the water world, he started to feel the power of the surrounding water.
Time in the outside world slowly passed by,
The snow in the sky fell and then rose, cycle after cycle.
Austin remained motionless, his spirit immersed in the ocean of Law Origin, ignoring the snowflakes on him.
It’s unclear how much time has passed, Austin’s entire body seemed to be covered by ice and snow.
In a daze, half a month had passed.
Only then did Austin wake from his slumber, shaking off the snowflakes, white snowflakes rustling and falling.
With previous experience in comprehending Thunder Law Origin and Wind Law Origin, coupled with Austin’s cultivation reaching the Half-Legendary Realm, his speed in comprehending unfamiliar Law Origins has also increased significantly.
Currently, his comprehension of the Law of Water has reached a relatively deep phase.
Roughly comparable in degree to Thunder Law and Wind Law.
Comprehension speed inherently slows down, now almost reaching a limit, without chance opportunities, continued comprehension might not yield much more improvement.
Therefore, Austin decisively halted his comprehension of the Law of Water.
"Water Attribute Rasengan’s consumption is lower, its power even greater, and can even utilize the power of the Law of Water to induce a tsunami-like magic ability."
Austin sensed his internal situation, and clearly understood the gains from this comprehension of the Water Law Origin.
Combat strength increased by another notch.
However, that’s still not enough.
Austin closed his eyes, spirit immersed in his body, beginning to comprehend the Fire Law Origin.
Once he finishes comprehending the Fire Law Origin, when the power of the Four Elements Law is achieved, he will then condense two more Law Divine Swords, completing a total of four.
Thus, he can also start constructing the Four Spirits Sword Array.

chapters.title: Chapter 308 - 304: Law Resonance ( - 5 Requesting Monthly Tickets)
chapters.content:
Chapter 308: Chapter 304: Law Resonance (Chapter 5 Requesting Monthly Tickets)
Fire, this is a world made of fire.
Austin seemed to be within the great sun, surrounded by intensely hot flames, as if they were about to burn him to ashes.
Hot, incredibly hot.
It felt as if his body was about to ignite, merging into this world of fire.
Austin endured it all without moving, experiencing the power of this fiery world.
Because he knew, this was merely an illusion produced by his own spiritual insight into the Flame Law.
Unlike the world of the gentle and soft Water Law Origin, every thread of air here seemed filled with an extreme fury, as if ready to tear and burn everything.
Austin understood, this might be related to his natural lack of ability with the Fire Attribute.
Among the four laws Austin currently mastered,
The Thunder Law was the earliest mastered, and it awoke with his own bloodline, because even though thunder is more violent than fire, Austin still easily comprehended and integrated it into his understanding.
The Wind Law Origin came from the outside, but as the Giant Dragon mastered the power of the wind element due to their flight, when Austin fused with the Wind Law Origin, the insight was also natural.
The same was true for the Water Law, the fourth successful awakening of Talent Magic, with part of the Super Storm being composed of rain itself.
As the master of lightning and storms, the Blue Dragon, shrouded in dark clouds wherever it goes, also possessed a certain level of water control ability, thus understanding the Water Law Origin was not difficult either.
What was truly difficult was the Flame Law that Austin was now confronting.
The Blue Dragon bloodline did not have an innate control over fire.
Thus, in order for Austin to comprehend the Flame Law Origin, he had to face the direct impact of the Flame Law and start from the beginning, advancing his understanding step by step.
Time passed slowly during Austin’s insight.
The feeling of being in the flames every day was not comfortable, let alone trying to comprehend the Flame Law while being roasted by fire.
This was even more challenging.
But Austin endured it all.
Through this difficult process of insight, there were indeed benefits.
Facing the scorching of the Flame Law Origin, Austin’s spirit was tempered like pure gold forged by intense fire, becoming more resilient.
As days passed by, over half a month later, Austin finally opened his eyes again.
The insight into the Flame Law, succeeded!
Looking at the flickering flame that spontaneously gathered in the void in front of him, Austin felt as bright as this fiery blaze.
His hard efforts were not in vain; the gain from understanding the Flame Law Origin was considerable.
Not only did it strengthen his spirit during the process, but after understanding the Flame Law Origin, several fire element techniques naturally emerged.
Sea of Fire, Flame Shock, Flame Burst Technique...
With proficient control of the fire element, he could easily perform these techniques through some simple manipulation.
"Very good, now all Four Major Elemental Laws are complete!"
At this moment, there was a hint of excitement in Austin’s eyes.
Back when he tried to condense thunder into a sword shape, granting it the Thunder Law, and nurturing the Sword Drawing Technique, Austin had thought about the day when multiple Law Divine Swords would unite, forming an incredibly powerful sword array.
At that time, what he most wanted to replicate in this world was the Immortal Slaying Sword Array.
But later, thinking that the Immortal Slaying Sword Array could only be broken by Four Saints, and he could only handle Legendary beings.
That would lower his standing quite a bit.
So he set his sights on the Four Spirits Sword Array instead.
So-called Four Spirits refers to the Cyan Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Black Tortoise.
In ancient times, dragons were considered the sons of heaven, ruling the world, wielding thunder as heavenly punishment, thus Cyan Dragon ruled thunder.
No issue there.
Then the White Tiger ruled wind, Vermilion Bird ruled fire, and Black Tortoise ruled water.
Thus, the four attribute powers gathered together.
Austin had a feeling that if he could really complete the idea of the Four Spirits Sword Array, its power might exceed his imagination!
And this was just one way the Law Divine Swords could be used.
The success of the Wind and Thunder Dual Swords Unification gave Austin hope for the successful unification of three or even four swords.
And once the Four Swords Unification succeeded, the amplified power would become unbelievably strong.
At that time, carrying the four Law Divine Swords, with the Four Spirits Sword Array for defense, and Four Swords Unification for attack,
he could challenge his quivering enemies: Who else dares?
Just imagining that scene filled Austin with motivation.
But... it seemed this was becoming more and more offbeat...
Others who crossed into this fantasy world stood in knightly armor, wielding Forbidden Curse Divine Artifacts.
Yet here he was, running around wielding Law Divine Swords, dealing with sword arrays and unifications in an immortal fantasy style.
Austin thought about it, but couldn’t find an answer.
So he gave up thinking.
Then started to condense the Fire Law Divine Sword and Water Law Divine Sword.
With the previous experience, this time was relatively easy, and within a few days, the Fire Law Divine Sword and Water Law Divine Sword formed a stable shape.
With a thought, the four Law Divine Swords floated in the void.
BOOM!!!
Accompanying the appearance of the four Law Divine Swords, merely the release of their aura triggered the Celestial Secret Aura to surge like a violent tide, sweeping across several miles.
The heavens and earth seemed to tremble continuously, as waves rolled on lakes and seas, earth fires erupted, and fierce winds and thunder swept through the world.
"This is..."
Austin’s expression was solemn.
Because, in his perception, strands of aura in the sky and earth above were each drawn by the four Law Divine Swords, as if splitting the entire world into four realms, yet subtly linking everything together, forming a complete.....
Circle!
The four powers seemed to repel, yet also converge!
"What’s happening?"
Austin frowned deeply, this change before him was beyond his expectations.
However, this did not seem to be a bad thing.
"Thunder, wind, water, fire, these four elemental powers seem to generate a mysterious resonance and connection, perhaps, the envisioned Four Spirits Sword Array can truly be created!"
His assumption was correct!
The four elemental powers can truly resonate and connect!
Staring at the four Law Divine Swords stirring up the heavens before him, Austin’s gaze became extremely determined.
As long as he could clarify the connections between these four powers, he could build the rough framework of the Four Spirits Sword Array and finally realize the Four Spirits Sword Array completely in this world!
Thinking now leads to action.
Thus, Austin poured all of his spiritual power into analyzing the four Law Divine Swords before him.
By studying the convergence of the powers of the four Law Divine Swords and the melding of Law auras, he might find the law among them!
Just the fusion of their auras was enough to create such a world-shaking power.
Austin could not imagine, once the Four Spirits Sword Array was fully completed,
the extent of power it would achieve!

chapters.title: Chapter 309 - 305: Turmoil
chapters.content:
Chapter 309: Chapter 305: Turmoil
Time slowly flowed by as Austin was in seclusion, contemplating.
It was impossible to comprehend the linkage between the four Law Divine Swords’ powers and create the Four Spirits Sword Array in this world without spending a considerable amount of time.
And during Austin’s period of seclusion and enlightenment, the Dragon Nest Tribe remained peaceful.
In the cold winter, the tribe took in many wandering Beastmen and was transforming them through military training, turning them into members of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
At this moment, the population of the entire Dragon Nest Tribe had already surpassed ninety thousand, approaching the milestone of one hundred thousand.
As the Dragon Nest Tribe grew stronger day by day, asserting dominance over a vast area with an invincible stance, it naturally gained the envy of many Beastmen struggling to survive in the vicinity.
Moreover, the Dragon Nest Tribe was generally open to Beastmen who sought refuge, whether captives or wandering Beastmen, as they all had to undergo a month of military training and transformation, ultimately becoming warriors of the tribe, regardless of their original state.
Thus, with the rise of the Dragon Nest Tribe, more and more Beastman Tribes began to merge into and seek allegiance with it.
Initially, merging with the Dragon Nest Tribe was the last resort for poverty-stricken tribes that lacked food and couldn’t survive the harsh winter.
But as the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe grew, coupled with the ample treatment that allowed these previously impoverished tribes to fill their bellies, more Beastmen began to entertain the idea.
Although some Beastmen were suppressed by the elders of their tribes, Beastman Tribes around them could barely maintain stability.
However, when some of the lowest-tier Beastmen could not resist the temptation and risked everything to escape,
certain seeds began to take root.
Initially, lower-level slaves fled, yearning for a better life, and reached the sanctuary of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The Dragon Nest Tribe accepted these runaway slaves, providing them with enough food while starting their military training transformation.
The elders, chiefs, and other senior members of the external Beastman Tribes, out of fear of the Dragon Nest Tribe, dared not take any action.
They could only secretly keep a tight grip on the slaves within their tribes and brutally nail captured runaway slaves in front of all the tribe’s Beastmen as a deterrence.
Initially, this method of killing the chicken to scare the monkey was effective.
The hearts of the slave and impoverished Beastmen were suppressed by this harsh means.
The Beastman elders and chiefs were very satisfied, nipping certain things in the bud.
However, what the Beastman elders didn’t know was that their actions were like adding more gunpowder to an imminent powder keg.
The good times did not last long.
Subsequently, a seemingly insignificant incident occurred, like a small spark, that directly ignited the powder keg and swept across a large area, altering the layout of the Beastman Tribes surrounding the Dragon Nest Tribe.
The matter was simple,
In one Beastman Tribe, a Minotaur slave escaped and fled to the Dragon Nest Tribe.
After a month of military training and transformation, the Minotaur shed its previously emaciated frame, quickly becoming a robust Minotaur due to the ample food, and because of its strong physique, it became a member of the hunting backup team, essentially a prospective Beastman soldier cleaning up the hunting grounds.
One day, while the Minotaur was out hunting with the Dragon Nest soldiers, it was spotted from afar by some companions from its former tribe who were gathering.
Back then, the Minotaur had planned to escape with these companions, but they were too afraid of the tribe elders’ brutality and did not follow through.
Now, seeing their former companion doing well while they still remained as slaves prone to beatings and scolding,
the Beastman companion felt unbalanced and was later beaten half-dead by a tribe elder for no particular reason.
That night, unable to contain his grievances and dissatisfaction, he spoke out.
Other Beastman slaves from the same place also said they couldn’t live like this anymore.
The more they complained, the more dissatisfied they became.
When the dissatisfaction reached its peak, that night, a large-scale slave revolt erupted within the Beastman Tribe.
From that riot, as the benefits of joining the Dragon Nest Tribe spread, greater turmoil began to unfold among the Beastman Tribes in the nearby regions.
Thus, a tiny spark ignited the resistance.
In the Dragon Nest Tribe’s sphere of influence, every Beastman Tribe nearly failed to escape the fate of a grassroots uprising.
The great collapse had begun.
Previously, there was no choice.
Beastmen leaving the tribe couldn’t possibly survive alone in the perilous Forest Land.
They needed to band together to achieve a certain degree of safety.
But now, a better option was laid before them.
To fill their stomachs, to live safely.
These two points were sufficient.
Yet, tribe elders and chiefs sought to prevent the exodus of slaves and numerous low-ranking Beastmen through ruthless means for the sake of their own power and wealth.
Rebellion naturally ensued.
Within the Dragon Nest Tribe’s sphere of influence, one after another, Beastman Tribes collapsed amid the turmoil. Large numbers of grassroots Beastmen, after resisting the oppressive rule of tribe elders and chiefs, began heading toward the Dragon Nest Tribe.
This development left the current Governor of the Dragon Nest Tribe somewhat stunned.
At one time, to quickly increase the population, the Dragon Nest Tribe had to relentlessly expand, diligently attacking and annexing other Beastman Tribes, assimilating the populations of conquered tribes completely.
It was through numerous wars that the Dragon Nest Tribe reached its current level of strength.
Yet now, without expending a single soldier from the Dragon Nest Legion, the border Beastman Tribes collapsed, and the Beastman population rapidly increased.
Reflecting on the past and seeing the contrast with today,
indeed left one speechless, as all could be said was that the world is unpredictable.

chapters.title: Chapter 310 - 306: Strange State
chapters.content:
Chapter 310: Chapter 306: Strange State
This great collapse of the external Beastman Tribe occurred before the cold winter, and it was precisely this massive influx of Beastman population that allowed the Dragon Nest Tribe’s population to break through the 90,000 mark, moving towards a count of 100,000.
The substantial growth in the Beastman population did not cause much trouble for the Beastman Tribe.
All work had precedents, and with the Dragon Nest Tribe’s rich experience in absorbing members, they quickly incorporated the numerous wandering Beastmen into their ranks after the great collapse.
