Guppa was well-versed in the recent war in the Kawa Great Forest, possibly even directly involved; otherwise, he wouldn’t have warned against involvement before departing.
It’s unclear why the Crystal Dragons are connected to this matter and what place they intend to visit, referred to as Celestial Dragon Island.
Austin is quite interested in the Celestial Dragon Island that Guppa and his group invited him to.
Unfortunately, it’s not the time to poke holes in the tiger skin, making it difficult for Austin to inquire deeply about too much, lest the facade falls apart.
The envoys from the Beastman Alliance stayed here for a day and then departed.
They headed straight back to the base camp.
After such an incident, it’s inevitable that they must return to report, especially since the key combatant, the dark-striped Tiger Beastman Vira, has perished. The next joint campaign will certainly require another strong figure to suppress those beastmen powers.
Austin did not obstruct them, watching the envoys depart while a weight lifted from his heart.
A Half-Legendary is dead, along with the tiger skin of Celestial Dragon Island backing.
In the future, the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe shouldn’t encounter any obstruction from those major forces.
When news of the Half-Legendary’s death spreads, regardless of the external turmoil it may cause, at least for the Dragon Nest Tribe, there will be a relatively stable period for some time.
Patiently developing for a few years, one day, Austin might ascend to Legendary status, able to roam freely, and the Dragon Nest Tribe could take advantage of the post-war lull to directly rule over the entire Kawa Great Forest.
"Let’s hope everything goes smoothly."
Watching the Alliance envoys leave, Austin thought quietly.
The Beastman Royal Court in the core area was virtually besieged globally, with numerous Legendaries secretly orchestrating the whole thing, seeming destined for defeat.
Yet, Austin felt a vague uneasiness.
He recalled the Fallen Divine Kingdom beneath the volcanic cluster domain near the second outpost of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
That’s most likely the Divine Kingdom of the Fallen Beast God, and judging by the reaction of the old priest’s remnant soul back then, someone associated with the old priest, or something else, took the most important thing from that Divine Kingdom.
Also, the mysterious crystal acquired after destroying the Pyramid...
Possibly, the person who took the item has joined the Beastman Royal Court and, using some unknown method, has instigated this grand war.
However, according to the Elf Queen, weren’t the Beastman Empire and the Elf Royalty allies back then and all deemed god desecrators? How did the pure-blooded beastmen of the Royal Court then end up associating with the Divine?
And those Undead, which Austin viewed as essentially zombie-like creatures transformed in this world, where did those pure-blooded beastmen acquire these things?
"Forget it, today’s counterattack is fueled by numerous Legendaries from behind the scenes, and there might be the tactics of the Divine as well, concerning the descendants of the Empire established by god desecrators, it’s nothing worth fretting overtoo much.
Thoughts twisted into knots in his mind, Austin shook his head and pushed the multitude of thoughts away.
As long as he remained uninvolved in this war, with the Dragon Nest Tribe in a secluded area, they should face no significant trouble.
He’s already decided to stay low during the war years.
...
With the departure of the Beastman Alliance envoys, the Dragon Nest Tribe began cleaning up the aftermath and reconstructing Dragon Nest Tribe City.
This attack was led personally by the dark-striped Tiger Beastman Vira, swiftly cutting down the patrolling beastman troops before they had time to signal, allowing for an unimpeded advance.
This revealed the Dragon Nest Tribe’s inadequacies in defending against such super-powerful entities.
To address this issue, the Dragon Nest Tribe has decided to establish a watchtower on the mountaintops surrounding Dragon Nest Tribe City for external observation.
At least they could receive pivotal information before the enemy strikes.
Meanwhile, the architecture of Dragon Nest Tribe City also poses quite a challenge.
Initially, to prevent fires, Austin instructed the beastmen to construct houses with a mixed wood and brick structure.
Back then, manpower was insufficient, preventing a full transition to brick and stone structures, relying on these wood-brick hybrid houses for interim solutions.
During a mercenary invasion later on, infiltrating human mercenaries started fires throughout the tribe city, and these houses played a significant role in preventing uncontrolled fire spread.
But now, these wood-brick hybrid houses are clearly not suitable for the Dragon Nest Tribe’s current situation.
In earlier years, in the hot and rainy climate of the Kawa Great Forest, some supporting wooden beams had already begun rotting, becoming rather dilapidated.
After Vira’s previous assault, numerous houses collapsed under excessive weight.
No casualties were caused, but reconstruction is necessary.
Giving the need for rebuild, naturally, the choice is to opt for the best available.
Austin plans to replace the wooden-brick hybrid houses in Dragon Nest Tribe City entirely with brick and stone structures to strengthen the city’s resistance against external shocks like storms.
Fortunately, with the Dragon Nest Tribe’s population boom, human resources aren’t as stretched as they were initially, supporting the new wave of reconstruction work.
With Austin overseeing the tribe, the Dragon Nest Tribe embarked on a massive reconstruction.
Meanwhile, various production and farming efforts haven’t ceased.
Land cultivation continues, with large amounts of food crops yielded from newly cultivated fields, serving as a vital factor for the Dragon Nest Tribe’s rapid expansion.
The grain output from farming allows the Dragon Nest Tribe to accommodate more people and expand its territory further.
Food production through farming has become a vital source for sustaining Dragon Nest Tribe’s development.
During major reconstruction, the tribe hasn’t halted its external expansion efforts.
Now, in the area surrounding the main Dragon Nest Tribe location within a hundred miles radius, there are virtually no other beastman tribes, and beyond a hundred miles, because of food transport considerations, it is regarded as an expedition, posing many inconveniences.
The outpost plan is innately one of expansion’s original intents.
Leveraging outposts, consolidating the territory they hold while using them as strongholds for continuous outward expansion.
But as time progresses, the second outpost has now reached the limit of population capacity and territorial occupation, further expansion would require more effort and energy, becoming futile, thus they plan to establish a third outpost.

chapters.title: Chapter 322 - 318 Knowledge and Technology
chapters.content:
Chapter 322: Chapter 318 Knowledge and Technology
The tribe is gradually becoming stronger, as the development of its territory expands, it is slowly spreading its influence externally.
A vast amount of territory has been incorporated into the control region of the Dragon Nest Tribe, with dangerous beasts, magic beasts, and giant beasts within the territory being cleaned out one by one by the Beastman Legion.
Large swathes of area have become a paradise for the peaceful development of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For the next long period, the environment in which the Dragon Nest Tribe develops will basically be stable.
What the Dragon Nest Tribe needs most for its development is time.
Fortunately, after Austin slew the Half-Legendary Realm dark-striped tiger man Vira and pulled a tiger pelt from Celestial Dragon Island, the Dragon Nest Tribe is about to experience a relatively stable period.
External wars will not disturb this remote corner.
In any case, relying on that tiger pelt in his back, Austin has already extricated himself from that war.
Or rather, it is precisely because of the broad-reaching war outside that Austin and his Dragon Nest Tribe have drawn away the majority of attention.
As long as they develop quietly during the war period, there will basically be no problems.
As for the timespan of this war sweeping across the entire Kawa Great Forest, by Austin’s estimation, it won’t end for several years.
Not to mention the lengthy time needed for the tug-of-war with the Beastman Royal Court, even just the preliminary preparations for gathering a coalition of the various Beastman forces within the Kawa Great Forest require at least over a year.
In this uncivilized Barbaric Zone, with no unified government and endless war between the various tribal powers, if not for being subdued by strong power, gathering a large number of Beastmen may not be accomplished in a year.
Moreover, after gathering the Beastman army, various logistics coordination and the subsequent tug-of-war with the Beastman Royal Court would extend the war for several years with no way of ending it.
These few years will be the golden phase of development for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
With the absorption of the remaining wealth from the Elf Kingdom, the Dragon Nest Tribe now has replenishments in areas they lacked, like crafting extraordinary weapons, alchemy, potion-making, and spellcaster inheritance, supplemented by the rich Magic Resources within the Kawa Great Forest.
I believe that within these years, the overall strength of the tribe will see a significant increase.
Of course, since the Elf Kingdom’s defeat was so abrupt, much of the profound knowledge essence didn’t survive, and coupled with the fact that the elves stagnated over the subsequent millennia, the already scant technology faded over time, leaving only the most basic public knowledge.
Whether in alchemy, potion-making, or extraordinary weapon crafting, it is at most entry-level technological heritage, sufficient only to train an Alchemy Apprentice or attempt basic potion making.
But even this is enough.
Even apprentice-level knowledge is enough to greatly enhance the strength of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Various introductory potions, primary alchemy materials, and basic extraordinary weapons, though elementary, are far better than having no foundation at all.
The basic extraordinary weapons crafted are always more effective than those ordinary bronze weapons.
The basic potions concocted through alchemy are more potent than common herbs.
Although basic, these items have already crossed the barrier of being extraordinary.
However, the material costs to craft these extraordinary items remain quite high, requiring materials imbued with Magic Power to produce.
Even with the mobilization and collection capacity of the Dragon Nest Tribe, it is impossible to gather too many magic-infused materials.
Moreover, up till now, the Dragon Nest Tribe has yet to cultivate many talents in potion-making or extraordinary weapon crafting, so these items remain in short supply for the tribe; it’s impossible for every individual to have an extraordinary weapon or a potion bottle.
In such circumstances, bronze-forged armor and weapons, along with commonly harvested and processed everyday herbs, remain the prevalently used items in the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Now, the goblins in the manufacturing workshop have begun trying to use iron ore to forge steel weapons near the volcanic cluster domain around the second base, making use of the rich mineral resources of the volcanic area nearby.
Once the forging of steel weapons and armor succeeds, it will only be a matter of time before they replace the bronze armor and weapons on a large scale.
Still, even steel weapons lag considerably behind the true extraordinary weapons.
Even with the goblins making significant improvements to the steel forging techniques, replacing the rare extraordinary weapons is impossible.
For the foreseeable future, extraordinary weapons will primarily be allocated to Beastman officers and Beastman transcendent beings, while ordinary Beastman soldiers will be outfitted with steel weapons.
The potent magic alchemy potions will only be prioritized for critically injured personnel.
For a long time to come, the scarcity of production capacity will keep these extraordinary items from becoming widespread, and this situation will persist for quite some time.
"Steel, potion-making, extraordinary weapon forging..."
In planning for the future, Austin specifically highlighted these areas.
Though the knowledge technologies absorbed from the Elf Kingdom are foundational, for the Dragon Nest Tribe, they represent an unparalleled gain.
These foundational knowledge harvesting means a leap from zero to one for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
With these extraordinary power insights from the Elf Kingdom as a base, the Beastmen can gradually elevate and develop more detailed and superior technologies through continued experimentation.
Back then, the development of the Beastman Six Techniques, the successful forging of bronze weapons, and the establishment of a medical herb system were all achieved through trial and error identification of a correct path.
Now, it’s the same for the knowledge riches from the Elf Kingdom.
Those more profound knowledge technologies can ultimately be understood through relentless exploration, potentially crafting a research framework suitable for the Dragon Nest Tribe.
With solid foundational groundwork over several years, absorbing the knowledge wealth of the Elf Kingdom, plus Austin’s guidance with some modern thinking theories, what kind of outcomes can be realized is something Austin eagerly anticipates.
Having determined some of the general developmental directions for the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin turned his attention to the establishment of the upcoming third base.
The first and second bases have expanded to their limits, signaling the time for the third base to be developed.
But just before Austin could finalize the location for the third base, Vini and Quik came together to pay respects, revealing some information that swayed his thoughts, causing his original steadfast decision not to participate in the war to waver.

chapters.title: Chapter 323 - 319: Earth-Shattering Secret
chapters.content:
Chapter 323: Chapter 319: Earth-Shattering Secret
At the very beginning of the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin felt that the Fox-faced Man, Quik, seemed to have some secret.
At that time, he just thought that Quik was probably from a Great Tribe, and there was no need to get to the bottom of it. As the Dragon Nest Tribe gradually expanded and all sorts of affairs increased, Austin put it out of his mind.
Unexpectedly, one day, Quik, under the collusion of Vini, came to Austin to confess.
According to Quik, he came from the core of the Forest Land and once served the Beastman Royal Court.
Of course, he was just a nameless low-level soldier, like the Beastman Armor in a background story.
However, with his wit, he managed to gain quite a decent status among the lower-ranking beastmen.
A role similar to a flattering follower of a Beastman army captain.
However, it was this role that led Quik to accidentally discover some core secrets of the Beastman Royal Court during an unexpected event.
He disguised it well later on and wasn’t found out.
But not long after, the Beastman army to which Quik belonged received orders from above to leave the core area and go to search the Outer Domain of the Kawa Great Forest for some strange large-eared creatures, namely elves.
Now it seems that the mission of the army Quik belonged to back then was to search for the remnants of the Elf Kingdom that had escaped years ago.
Unfortunately, after a thousand years, the traces left by the Elf Kingdom’s escape had long disappeared without a trace.
In the vast region of the Kawa Great Forest, trying to find their traces was like looking for a needle in a haystack.
And Quik’s army, likely due to a one-in-a-million chance held by the pure-blooded Beastmen of the Beastman Royal Court, was not very prioritized. Ever since the army left the core area with the mission, they never received any supplies or support.
The Royal Court’s army searched outward, and the perilous Forest Land continued to inflict heavy casualties on the army, until during an attack by a swarm of bone ants, Quik fled in panic, getting separated from the Royal Court’s army.
Later, Quik met Rodney, and a series of events began.
Austin wasn’t much interested in the arduous experiences Quik went through during the search.
What truly shocked Austin and made him plan to overthrow his previous plans and personally join the war against the Beastman Royal Court was the secret Quik revealed about the Royal Court!
An earth-shattering secret!
The Beastman Royal Court might possess a method of traveling across worlds!
And moreover, it might very well be the Doomsday Plane they were entering, from where the undead zombies originated!
Being a native of this world, Quik certainly wouldn’t know what a Doomsday Plane is.
All this, Austin deduced from Quik’s speech.
According to Quik, a Beastman friend he made at the Beastman Royal Court was a guard at a valley warehouse.
During a casual conversation, Quik’s Beastman friend boasted in front of him, using some bizarre items from the valley warehouse as talking points, like an iron horse that roars when drinking pungent water, some strange iron bars that automatically spray fire and cause death, and in his fear, he also leaked words like "resurrected from death, with rotting flesh-covered moving corpses."
Quik couldn’t understand those bizarre "magic items" at all, but he understood that within the Beastman Royal Court, there was an enormous colossal decayed soldier army.
According to that Beastman friend, each colossal decayed soldier was hundreds of meters tall, looking like a mountain from afar.
These colossal decayed soldiers gathered together, forming an Iron Wall Great Wall guarding the Royal Court. When needed, these colossal soldier troops would break through the sealing rock layers outside, delivering a disaster-like blow to the enemies.
Quik was shocked by the Royal Court’s secretive power and also feared being implicated, hence he proactively reduced contact with that Beastman friend.
Later, it was heard that the Beastman friend encountered an accident and died in a mission.
Feeling cold-hearted, Quik focused more on hiding himself and only left the core area when dispatched to search for the remnants of the Elf Kingdom.
Although Quik was merely reiterating his Beastman friend’s words, Austin’s scales almost stood on end.
Despite lacking concrete evidence, his innate intuition told him,
The Beastman Royal Court might truly possess a method to travel to the Doomsday World and obtain certain items from it!
The undead zombies might actually be real zombies!
It was precisely this deduction that stirred within Austin a strong urge to explore the core area.
If the Beastman Royal Court indeed had a method to travel to the Doomsday World.
Then, using that method, could he return to the world of his past life?
Even now no longer human, Austin still longed to go back and see his homeland.
Moreover, most importantly, the ability to freely travel worlds almost meant a chance of transcendence!
It was only with great difficulty that Austin managed to suppress his urge.
"It’s not the time yet, various legendary beings, possibly even the Divine, are watching this war. It’s not my time to get involved yet."
Even if he went, the results he wanted might not be attainable.
Competing in front of so many Great Divine Power users, Austin wasn’t sure he’d have the protagonist’s aura, and be the final winner.
Nevertheless, though he pressed down the notion, a seed had already deeply taken root in his heart.
The war in the core area, he would ultimately get involved.
This required thorough preparation, but fortunately, there were still likely a few years before the final decisive battle.
Austin began to organize his thoughts.
"Traveling the Doomsday World... I wonder what method they used to achieve this. If it’s true that they can travel and bring back certain things, perhaps that groundbreaking explosion was a nuclear bomb."
His thoughts rapidly churned in his mind.
Information, Austin needed information that could help him make a judgment!
All of this was just his speculation after all.
Everything Quik knew had been uncovered, who else might know about the Beastman Royal Court?
Suddenly, Austin thought of the Elf Kingdom.
Perhaps the Elf Royal Court, which made an ancient alliance with it, might know something.
"According to Quik’s words, it seemed apparent that the Beastman Royal Court only decided to seek out the remnants of the Elf Royal Court about eight or nine years ago. That period coincides with the initial emergence of the undead zombies, and the mystery man took something essential from the Beast God Divine Kingdom to maintain the kingdom... All these changes seem to have occurred around that time period."
Numerous thoughts flashed rapidly through his mind, and Austin frantically sorted through this information mentally.
"In that case, perhaps something happened during those years that put immense pressure on the Beastman Royal Court, prompting them to try various methods of self-rescue. At that time, it’s possible that the Legendaries had already decided to overthrow the pure-bloods’ Beastman Royal Court established in the core, and began various probes and actions."
"Only this could drive those pure-blooded Beastmen to such frenzied action."
But why do they want to recover the remnants of the Elf Royal Court?
Could it be that the Beastman Royal Court still hopes the Elf Royal Court will uphold that so-called ancient alliance?
The Elf Kingdom must have secrets.
Some secrets that could enhance the Beastman Royal Court’s power, otherwise, in such a crisis, the Royal Court wouldn’t recall the Elf royals they’d betrayed millennia ago, and even expend efforts searching for them.
For the Beastman Royal Court, the remnants of the Elf Kingdom are of such importance, and there’s also that ancient alliance from long ago...
The Elves, perhaps, hold some insights into the Beastman Kingdom’s cross-world travels.

chapters.title: Chapter 324 - 320 Mother Tree
chapters.content:
Chapter 324: Chapter 320 Mother Tree
One has to admit that the secrets about the Beastman Royal Court from Quik’s mouth indeed left Austin utterly shocked.
If not for Quik’s information, no matter what, he would never have guessed that the Beastman Royal Court possessed such ability!
Although all of this was merely Austin’s conjecture based on Quik’s descriptions.
But from the current signs, this possibility has at least over fifty percent likelihood.
Crossing worlds, obtaining massive supplies from another world.
Could this be the legacy of the Beastman Empire from back then?
Austin couldn’t help but ponder.
Unfortunately, the intelligence is ultimately still too sparse.
For the powerful empire that once ruled the entire Seta Continent and rivaled the Divine, it only exists in bits and pieces of descriptions, with no actual records.
"Since the Elf Kingdom and the Pure-blooded Beastmen share a mysterious ancient alliance, the Elf Kingdom should know some secrets. The connections between the elves of that time and the Pure-blooded Beastmen must have been even closer, perhaps the Elf Kingdom also knows a thing or two about world crossing."
However, the Pure-blooded Beastmen back then retaliated too quickly, and the fall of the Elf Kingdom was likewise swift.
At that time, the Elf Queen was still just a little girl, and moreover, a branch relatively distant from the royal line; those so-called elders left were not the high-ranking members of the Elf Kingdom back then.
The true high-ranking members and most of the elf royals died in that rebellion.
The Elf Queen didn’t deceive me; she indeed revealed everything she knew, this was Austin’s intuition.
The intuition of the Giant Dragon is very keen, and the Elf Queen had no reason to hide anything.
However, as it is, the clues are caught in a dilemma.
When Vinek and others withdrew, Austin fell into deep thought.
The clear path ahead gradually became shrouded in fog, and it seemed as though everything had entered a dead end.
Pure-blooded Beastmen, elf royals, Blasphemers, Alliance, Fallen Beast God, various legendary forces, humans, the Divine...
Recalling the cause and effect, the entire Kawa Great Forest now seems like a gigantic quagmire, entangling all the forces as if it had become the center of all turmoil.
Should I really get involved in this war?
That method of crossing worlds might allow me to return to my homeland for a look.
Even in my current form, without mastering the Transformation Technique, there’s no way I could return to the original world.
However.
The method of crossing planes is really attractive to Austin, and his intuition tells him that if he misses this opportunity, he will regret it for a lifetime.
In Austin’s heart, he wavered.
"Regardless of whether to go or not, first find out some situations to avoid becoming a pawn or sacrifice in the future, or, there’s someone... no, something that might know some inside story."
According to Quik’s words, the Beastman Royal Court is definitely not simple.
The counterattack war won’t end overnight, there’s no hurry, there’s still plenty of time.
Currently, the most important thing is intelligence information.
The remnants of the Elf Kingdom might have missed most of the things, but there is a tree, perhaps it knows the cause and effect.
The Elven Mother Tree!
That day, Austin left the Dragon Nest Tribe, flying towards the direction of the second base.
There, the former Elf Kingdom station was connected with the second base, relying on each other to form the second base tribe.
The Elven Mother Tree has always been growing there, relying on the power of the surrounding forest land, supporting the space where the Elf Kingdom survives.
Shortly after, Austin appeared above the second base.
Gazing down at the towering trees below, Austin’s eyes flickered.
At first, when attacking the Elf Kingdom, the Elven Mother Tree had intervened, blocking Austin’s Attribute Rasengan attack.
At that time, Austin seemed to feel a sigh.
Just later, he didn’t think much of it, especially when he had just consumed the Wind Law Origin and was about to find a place to refine it.
Once the Wind Law Origin was refined, those trifles were already left behind.
Now it seems that this Elven Mother Tree very likely possesses wise consciousness.
And this is precisely the reason Austin came here.
As a crucial plant maintaining the elf race, perhaps the Elven Mother Tree knows more about certain things than the Elf Queen.
Possibly, the purpose of the Beastman Royal Court’s army searching the remnants of the Elf Kingdom back then was precisely for this Elven Mother Tree!
...
At this moment, inside the hall where the Elven Mother Tree resides.
The Elf Queen is kneeling before the branches of the Mother Tree, sincerely praying in her heart.
Since the Elf Kingdom was annexed, she was subdued by Austin, and the Elf Queen has always lived in seclusion near the Mother Tree, attending to it daily.
All she could do were tasks like these.
To the elf clan within the Dragon Nest Tribe now, the Elf Queen is the clan’s representative, symbol, and seal, high above, akin to the role of a priest serving the Divine in a temple.
In fact, after more than a year of integration, the elf clan has already merged into the Dragon Nest Tribe in all aspects.
The elves are naturally kind and skillful in agriculture, with weaving and other crafts also being quite good. Various alchemy, weapon forging, which were not originally the Dragon Nest Tribe’s techniques, are among the few sources of spellcasters within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Better living conditions have led the elves to continuously split up, tying themselves more closely to the Dragon Nest Tribe’s original system.
Currently, the elf race, within the Dragon Nest Tribe, resembles the concept of merged nations in Austin’s past life, with cultural differences only noticeable during certain grand festivals.
Having shed her responsibilities, the Elf Queen now dedicates herself to caring for the Mother Tree.
The Mother Tree, the cornerstone for the continuation of the elf race.
Caring for the Mother Tree also aligns with the current position of the Elf Queen.
After praying, she opened her eyes.
Gazing at the enormous tree in front of her, which dozens of people could barely encircle, impossibly tall, supporting a sky-covering canopy, appearing even more lush after the kingdom’s incorporation into the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Elf Queen Eve also felt somewhat complicated.
The Mother Tree nurtures the next generation of elves, and its energy doesn’t come out of thin air.
Various Magic Ores, Magic Materials, and even the droppings of Magic Beasts or Giant Beasts are sources of magic nurturing the next generation of elves by the Mother Tree.
But during these thousand years of hiding and enduring, the elves were confined within their kingdom space, weakened to the extreme, restricted from going out. How could they bring enough Magic Resources to the Mother Tree?
One must admit, during that thousand-year period, most of what was consumed to nurture the elf children was by the Mother Tree autonomously absorbing Magic Energy from the forest land.
And they, just like vampires, were leeching on the Mother Tree.
Until the kingdom was destroyed, the situation began to change.

chapters.title: Chapter 325 - 321: The Origin of Beastmen
chapters.content:
Chapter 325: Chapter 321: The Origin of Beastmen
Before the Elf Kingdom was assimilated, the impoverished kingdom was unable to provide the Mother Tree with enough Magic Resources, leading to its gradual withering day by day. The leaves turned yellow and fell, the branches became sparse, and fewer buds grew each year.
The Elf Queen had long been worried about the Mother Tree’s condition, watching helplessly and feeling anxious, but besides adding to her worries, she could do nothing about it.
During the millennia of hiding in exile, the Elves had lost their courage to forge ahead.
Nesting in the kingdom space supported by the Mother Tree, receiving its protection, they had lost the courage to venture outside.
Using the excuse of invincible and powerful foreign enemies, they cowered under the Mother Tree’s protection, eking out a living.
They couldn’t even gather the Magic Resources that the Mother Tree needed for growth.
Before that, they were like a group of vampires, existing by sucking the lifeblood of the Mother Tree.
Surviving in the kingdom space by relying on the Mother Tree’s centuries of continuous contribution.
But all of this changed after the kingdom’s downfall.
The Elves, who were assimilated into the Dragon Nest Tribe, found a new life under its system.
For the newly established Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe, struggle, enterprise, and striving embodied the spirit of the tribe.
The once somber Elves, after undergoing military training and transformation by the Dragon Nest Beastmen, began to face the challenges of life with a new attitude.
Under these circumstances, relying on the Dragon Nest Tribe, the Elves gained access to a variety of discarded Magic Power materials.
Parts unwanted in Magic Potion materials, slag left from forging Magic Ore, magic-infused soil from veins, and even excrement from various Magic Beasts and Giant Beasts—all considered waste by the Dragon Nest Beastmen—became fertilizer for the Mother Tree’s growth.
Thus, the Mother Tree was freed from the predicament of insufficient resources.
These items, difficult for the former Elf Kingdom to obtain as Magic Resources, were easily accessible for the Dragon Nest Beastman Tribe, conveniently providing a place for daily waste disposal with the Elves’ help.
Owing to this, after the Elf Kingdom’s assimilation, the Elves received a large amount of Magic Power waste from the Dragon Nest Beastmen, allowing the Mother Tree left here to flourish even more vibrantly.
An ample supply of Magic Power waste brought many changes to the Elf Mother Tree.
If the past was a fading, twilight obsession, the present Mother Tree exuded an aura of vibrant vitality.
Looking at the more flourishing Mother Tree after becoming part of the Dragon Nest Tribe,
And thinking about the many Elven citizens now, whose faces bore heartfelt smiles, made the Elf Queen Eve feel her own ineptitude even more.
During her reign, she couldn’t provide a prosperous and stable life for her people, nor a healthy living environment for the Mother Tree; instead, they gained all this after the kingdom’s downfall.
What an irony this was?
She was unfit to be the king of the Elven race.
"Sigh... child, you are not to blame for all this; you need not be so hard on yourself, taking all the responsibility onto your shoulders."
As the Elf Queen was repenting in her heart, a gentle, soothing voice, reminiscent of a mother’s, resonated from the depths of her heart.
The Elf Queen Eve was taken aback, and she looked up in astonishment at the Elf Mother Tree before her.
From her intimate connection with the Elves, intuition told her that the voice from the depths of her heart came from the Mother Tree right in front of her!
But before Eve could say anything, the gentle voice echoed again within her:
"Child, a distinguished guest has arrived, please return."
Within the gentle voice, the Elf Queen felt a mild force act upon her, allowing no room for negotiation, and she was promptly ushered out of the grand hall.
As Eve felt puzzled,
simultaneously,
Whoosh!
A massive torrent swept across the high sky, causing the lush branches of the Mother Tree to rustle, rising and falling like green waves.
Feeling the majestic Dragon Power from the sky, the Elf Queen Eve knew,
it was the Lord of the Dragon Nest Tribe, His Highness Blue Dragon Austin, who had arrived.
Outside, Eve, who was sent out, bowed to the Mother Tree and the enormous figure that landed next to it in the sky, then withdrew with complex thoughts.
"Greetings, Your Highness Austin, Little Tree thought you would come much sooner after that battle, but perhaps I thought too much."
The gentle voice resonated within Austin’s mind,
communicating through Spiritual Power, making the voice’s gender indistinct.
"That was my oversight; I should have visited sooner, to pay my respects to you, O elder."
Despite being the victor himself, and knowing that the Elf Mother Tree had surrendered to him as a captive, Austin bore no conceit.
After all, the tree before him had grown for at least a millennium.
Compared to its age, he was just a child, and addressing it as an elder wasn’t unfitting.
"Your Highness, such a title as ’elder’ is too grand for Little Tree."
After some pleasantries, they discussed the recent situation of the Elf race.
During the conversation, Austin learned that the Elf Mother Tree indeed knew a lot of things.
Owing to the Mother Tree’s way of production, it could pass on some important information from the previous generation, similar to the Dragon Race.
Given this, Austin dove straight to the topic.
"I’m curious, what was the relationship between the Elf race and the Pure-blooded Beastmen a thousand years ago? And what exactly was that covenant with the Pure-blooded Beastmen? If you know anything, elder, could you please tell me?"
"This story is long."
The Elf Mother Tree’s voice was filled with sighs, as if recalling memories from an ancient past.
"Does Your Highness know what the original nature of the Pure-blooded Beastmen and the Elves was?"
Austin shook his head.
These things, he indeed did not know.
The Dragon Race’s inherited memories contain many survival techniques and some common knowledge.
These things could be learned from the scholars on the Seta Continent with a little inquiry.
Austin listened intently.
He knew that the Elf Mother Tree wouldn’t ask this question without a purpose.
Indeed, the voice of the Mother Tree soon sounded in Austin’s mind:
"Long, long ago, on the Seta Continent, Pure-blooded Beastmen did not exist, nor did the Elf race. Even the Half-Beastmen, who now commonly live in the Kawa Great Forest, did not actually exist."
"We were, in fact, designed and created."
"Pure-blooded Beastmen were originally designed and created as war weapons. The Elf race, including myself, were also designed and created as tools for production. And the Half-Beastmen were the failed experiments during the process of designing and creating Pure-blooded Beastmen..."

chapters.title: Chapter 326 - 322 The Disappearing Arcane Mages
chapters.content:
Chapter 326: Chapter 322 The Disappearing Arcane Mages
"A creation designed?"
Upon hearing the words of the Elf Mother Tree, Austin was utterly stunned, his eyes filled with shock.
Pure-blooded Beastmen were designed as war weapons, while Half-Beastmen were merely failures in the process.
The Elf Race was also a designed producer.
How is this possible!
The words of the Elf Mother Tree almost overturned Austin’s hard-earned worldview established in this world.
Who exactly possesses such terrifying means to create new races in this world?
Moreover, among the created races, pure-blooded Beastmen as battle weapons even once established a Beastman Empire spanning the entire continent!
This is simply unimaginable.
"What kind of beings created you? Were they Divine?"
Full of doubts, Austin asked aloud.
In this world, perhaps only the Divine could create a race, and it must be a Divine with strong divine power to have such ability.
However, as soon as the words left his mouth, Austin realized something was wrong.
According to the Elf Queen’s words, years ago, pure-blooded Beastmen and the Elf Race were blasphemers.
If the creators were Divine, how could these two races become blasphemers?
Clearly, their creation was not by the Divine, but very likely by the Divine’s enemies.
The second base point, the Fallen Divine Kingdom below the Volcanic Cluster Domain, flashed through his mind.
"No, it was not the Divine, but the enemies of the Divine, the Arcane Mages."
Sure enough, the Mother Tree gave a negative answer.
"Arcane Mages?"
Unexpected, yet logical.
Arcane Mages are a group who pursue the path of science, exploring the mysteries and truths of the world, naturally at odds with the Divine.
Moreover, to them, creating races that should not exist through experiments is not impossible.
In the Dragon Race’s inherited memories, these people are described as madmen, though it seems Arcane Mages have not appeared on the Seta Continent for a long time.
Were they suppressed to extinction?
"Indeed, it was the Arcane Mages, long ago, who claimed to share the rights under the starry sky with the Divine."
The Mother Tree seemed to gaze at the sky, her eyes seeing the distant past, slowly recounting an ancient history that had occurred in this world.
"Once, Arcane Mages who pursued truth created an incredibly glorious civilization, their footprints traversing every corner of the Multi-universe, unveiling hidden truths and creating countless brilliance."
"It was a supremely glorious era, Arcane Mages stood high, shoulder to shoulder with the Divine, a vast Sky City like a continent, floating among the stars, adjacent to the Divine Kingdom, stars shining."
"Whether it was the Elf Race, pure-blooded Beastmen, or Half-Beastmen, they were merely part of the brilliant works of the Arcane Empire."
"Initially, the purpose of designing elves was to help Arcane Mages produce and cultivate Magic Potions, while pure-blooded Beastmen were the humble scavengers created to clear resisting pests in the Multi-universe, and Half-Beastmen were just failures in the process of creating pure-bloods."
"At that time, Arcane Mages ruled the Multi-universe with invincible divine might, and even the Divine dared not face their brilliance."
"Then, war broke out."
"A war between Arcane Mages and the Divine spread across the Multi-universe, countless material planes were obliterated, the Divine Kingdom fell from the sky, countless divine beings perished, yet ultimately the war ended with a pyrrhic victory for the Divine, ending the era of Arcane Mages’ glory."
"The Divine, although victorious, were also badly affected, with most divine beings perishing, and the rest falling into slumber, only remnants of divine power responding to prayers on the continent, causing the Seta Continent to enter an era without gods."
"Twilight of the Gods, is what later generations called that war."
"The Arcane Council extinguished, gods fell into slumber, the Seta Continent, deprived of powerful realms, fell into chaotic warfare, where various races battled for supremacy of the continent."
"Later, amid the warfare, the two branches inheriting the Arcane Mages’ legacy from the previous era, pure-blooded Beastmen, and the Elf Race began to join forces."
"On the Central Earth Continent, pure-blooded Beastmen, originally designed as war weapons, combined with inheriting most of the Arcane Mages’ legacy, allied with the Elf Race, causing races already gravely affected by continuous wars between the Divine and Arcane Mages to no longer resist, retreating under pure-blooded Beastmen’s attacks, establishing a gigantic Beastman Empire. Meanwhile, in the south of the continent, the Elf Race likewise occupied vast forest lands, dominating the entire southern continent."
"An alliance was formed at that time, a pact concerning the two created races, in that era, they joined forces."
"As the deities faded, the Beastman Empire rose in that era, continuing for a millennium, ruling the continent with its glory."
"Yet mysteriously, several thousand years ago, the vast Beastman Empire suddenly collapsed overnight, simultaneously, the Elf Royal Court was heavily damaged, retreating into the Kawa Great Forest."
"The surviving pure-blooded Beastmen mixed among the numerous Half-Beastmen, escaped to the Kawa Great Forest, sheltering by surviving in the forest, under the protection of the also mysteriously damaged Elf Kingdom."
A vast history of the world slowly unfolded before Austin’s eyes as the Elf Mother Tree narrated.
As if taking him to that epic era, witnessing the rise and fall of civilization’s history.
This enormous amount of information, concerning the shifts of the Seta Continent from ancient times to the present, made Austin unable to come to his senses for a long time.
This Elf Mother Tree, despite having an age spanning a millennium.
Yet the lineage of the Elf Mother Tree almost merges all experiences and memories into the seeds of the next generation, allowing the new generation not only to contain everything experienced by the previous generation, but even being some wars’ eyewitness from remote ancient times.
Therefore, the Elf Mother Tree seems to have personally experienced numerous ancient events, including the war causing Twilight of the Gods, vividly visible.
Regarding the conversation, particularly the epic-like history on the Seta Continent, Austin was filled with awe and amazement.
Never expected, everything had such a chain reaction.
The rise and fall of a Beastman Empire was intimately linked to the previous era of Arcane Mages.
And those Arcane Mages who rivaled the Divine, what majestic demeanor they must have had!
After a long time, Austin managed to calm his turbulent thoughts.
"May the senior know if the Arcane Mages of those days left any method or artifact to traverse worlds?"
Thinking it over, Austin asked the question he most wanted to know.
And he shared some information he heard from Quik.
"To traverse worlds? It is said that after achieving epic status, one can transcend time and space, sense the boundary of the main matter realm, and start exploring the Multi-universe. But I do remember one thing that can allow ordinary people to traverse the boundaries between worlds."
"It is the Arcane Council’s supreme creation: the Gate of Truth!"

chapters.title: Chapter 327 - 323: Gate of Truth
chapters.content:
Chapter 327: Chapter 323: Gate of Truth
"The Gate of Truth, the highest achievement constructed by the powerhouses of the Arcane Council to exhaust all truths in the world. I have heard that the gate contains all the truths of the universe, surpassing all divine artifacts as a Chaos Artifact."
"Back in those days, the Arcane Mages spread fear across the multiverse, collecting resources from countless planes and dispatching pure-blooded Beastmen to cross the world’s boundaries to clear those planes of rebellious natives, relying on the Gate of Truth."
"That gate was the core object used by the Arcane Mages to dominate the multiverse."
"However, during the Twilight of the Gods, the Gate of Truth was shattered in the final battle, and the pure-blooded Beastmen acquired some of its fragments. It’s estimated that after all these years, they have researched something out of it and are using it to traverse planes."
The Fairy Mother Tree is not very clear about the actual situation.
Even with inherited memories, it is not omniscient. In the previous era of the Arcane Mages, its inherited memories were just another among numerous minor entities in the background.
Only the publicly known and widely proclaimed matters could the Mother Tree know a little about from its memories.
The truly important secrets were always beyond its grasp.
"So you’re saying, the Beastman Royal Court at the forest core gained the ability to traverse planes using fragments of the Gate of Truth from back then?"
The highest creation of the Arcane Mage Era... If I can learn these secrets from the Fairy Mother Tree, then what about other forces? Do those legendary or even epic existences also know the same secrets?
A cloud of doubt loomed over the heart.
If in this grand battle, those legendary beings behind it all know of the Gate of Truth, Austin doesn’t believe he can stand out to reap the greatest reward.
To contend with legendary epics, with his current half-legendary strength, he is still far from enough.
"Your Highness need not worry too much, even if they can traverse planes, the Beastman Royal Court only holds part of the fragments. Even if they can barely use them, a large cost is likely required. Otherwise, in this dangerous situation, why do the pure-bloods not directly use the remaining power of the Gate of Truth to cross into another world to hide and live? It must be the limitation of the cost."
Seeing Austin frown, the Fairy Mother Tree could not help but explain.
"Moreover, besides the supreme creation of the Arcane Mages, the Gate of Truth, there’s also the Plane Teleportation Array. This array is an improved version of the Otherworld Birth Array, mastered by demons, and, by spending a great cost, also holds certain world-crossing capabilities. It may not necessarily be the power of the Gate of Truth."
This explains why the competition might not be too fierce.
After all, if it were the complete Gate of Truth from back then, it would be a Chaos Artifact above all divine artifacts, naturally attracting covetous eyes from countless beings.
But now, what the Beastman Royal Court holds is only a fraction, greatly diminished in capability. Moreover, there is an alternative in the Plane Teleportation Array, making legendary beings capable of devising their own methods.
The pressure suddenly eased a lot.
However, the actions of the Beastman Royal Court still drew countless attention.
After all, no matter how incomplete, it remained a supreme creation of the Arcane Mage Council from back then.
Thinking this over, Austin’s thoughts became more active.
Perhaps in the coming years, he could elevate his cultivation level to legendary, and then partake in the war to divide the Beastman Royal Court.
Suddenly, Austin had a thought, pondering a question.
"A few years ago, the Beastman Royal Court sent an army to search for the elf race, at a time when the pure-blooded were at a crisis. Could it be that the presence of the elf race could help them resolve their crisis? Do you know why they sent for the search?"
"Perhaps, it was for little me."
The Fairy Mother Tree thought for a while, saying uncertainly.
"After the kingdom was destroyed and fled from the core area, all the wealth was left there, leaving us remnants hiding nearby. It seems I am the only one who could attract the pure-bloods’ attention."
"Oh, why is that?"
"It should still relate to the Gate of Truth. Though I’m unclear about the detailed whereabouts of the fragments after its shattering, the starlight scattering across the starry sky is somewhat recorded in the inherited memories. Coupled with the innate talents of the Mother Tree, we might find some fragments of the Gate of Truth scattered back then, to repair the fragments held by the pure-bloods."
With earlier conjectures in mind, the line of thinking became smoother.
"Perhaps, those pure-bloods really entertained the idea of fleeing to the Otherworld, but due to the limitations of the shattered Gate of Truth they possess, they sought out me hoping to find enough fragments to repair it and escape this world."
The Fairy Mother Tree gazed at Austin, carefully speaking:
"Actually, Your Highness, I originally let Eve take root and stay nearby because the inherited memory hinted that a relatively large fragment of the shattered Gate of Truth had fallen here. It was hoped to draw upon the power of the forest land to find it, to help the Elf Kingdom rise again. But unfortunately..."
The Fairy Mother Tree did not continue, clearly having failed in its plan.
Perhaps due to the passage of time, positions also shifted, or some other reasons. In the end, it couldn’t find that fragment of the Gate of Truth.
Then, one dragon and one tree continued to converse for a while.
But the following dialogue no longer held much value.
Afterward, Austin took his leave.
This trip proved to be very fruitful.
The Arcane Era, Twilight of the Gods, Beastman Empire, Elf, Pure-blooded Beastmen, Half-Beastman, and the Gate of Truth.
All these outlined the vast historical landscape of the Prime Material Plane.
The conversation revealed so much information, to unravel the current situation in Kawa Great Forest from such complex relationships, Austin needed to return to the tribe for a thorough analysis.
And then.
The Dragon Nest Tribe entered a phase of low-profile development, quietly cultivating agriculture while establishing a third base. The Dragon Nest Beastmen army swept through nearby wild Beastman Tribes, incorporating many Beastman captives into its system, enhancing its strength.
The tribe developed day by day, and its strength was growing.
As for Austin, ever since conversing with the Fairy Mother Tree, he has primarily kept a low profile.
Constantly watching the war situation within Kawa Great Forest while striving to enhance his own power to the fullest extent.
Time passed quietly over the next half a year.

chapters.title: Chapter 328 - 324: Half-Year Recuperation
chapters.content:
Chapter 328: Chapter 324: Half-Year Recuperation
During the past half year, the Kawa Great Forest has been in chaos, with many scattered factions forcibly integrated and starting to gather at the Allies Headquarters.
Throughout this process, conflicts and skirmishes among the various beastman factions happened frequently, plunging the entire Kawa Great Forest into chaos.
The blade’s fierce fire spread to every corner of the Forest Land.
However, the outside turmoil did not affect the Dragon Nest Tribe at all.
Perhaps due to the presence of the Celestial Dragon Island backing, or perhaps due to the deterrence of Austin slaying the half-legendary dark-striped tiger man Vira, during this half year of development, the Dragon Nest Tribe did not encounter any trouble from the outside.
The tribe developed peacefully, and Austin also worked hard to enhance his strength during this time.
The previously consumed Power Law Origin, after refining for half a year, finally successfully integrated into his body.
Unlike other Elemental Laws, the pure attribute of the Power Law is much harder to refine, costing Austin considerable effort, more difficult than refining other Law Origins before.
Of course, the rewards after refining were greater as well.
Under the augmentation of the Power Law, the body that had been refined by volcanic lava was further strengthened, with not only enhanced scale defense but also the force within becoming sufficient to crumble the soil and land.
With pure physical power, Austin’s giant dragon race talent, along with the enhancement of the Power Law within, has reached the peak of the Half-Legendary.
Even against a true Legendary, Austin dares to wrestle in terms of raw physical power.
Although, it is only in terms of physical attributes.
In this half year, besides refining the Power Law, the power of the nurtured Four Spirits Sword Array has been further enhanced.
The power of the four Law Divine Swords nurtured with magic momentum within the body for half a year is unknown to Austin.
But at least, if Austin were to face the dark-striped tiger man Vira again now, the Four Spirits Sword Array formed by the four Law Divine Swords would not be easily shattered.
However, Austin also realized that solely relying on the Four Spirits Sword Array made his strength somewhat singular.
The Four Spirits Sword Array is for defense and trapping and lacks a powerful offensive technique.
Thus, while nurturing the four Law Divine Swords, Austin did not forget to explore the direction of merging the four swords.
With the Rasengan of the four-element attribute fusion, Austin gained direction in exploring the merger of the four swords.
Having similar prior experience, it was naturally much easier.
Austin has already made significant progress in the fusion of the four Law Divine Swords.
Overall, after conversing with the Elf Mother Tree for half a year, Austin’s strength increased by at least twofold.
Unfortunately, despite the substantial increase in real power, his level cultivation showed no progress.
It’s unclear whether the consumed magic resources were too low in level or if he encountered some issue himself, but Austin’s level remained at the Half-Legendary Realm, with no breakthrough over the half year.
One could say it’s a give and take.
In this half year, besides Austin’s increase in strength, the scale and power of the Dragon Nest Tribe also developed to a certain extent.
With the popularization of the Beastman Six Techniques and the completion of training for the first batch of modified beastmen, the Dragon Nest Tribe lacked nothing in terms of mid to high-end combat power.
Under sufficient mid to high-end combat power command, the surrounding beastman tribes were no match and were easily conquered and annexed.
The dangerous areas within the territorial range were also eliminated one by one, with vast amounts of Magic Ore and Magic Plants developed.
Currently, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s dominance over surrounding territories reached a new height.
At the same time, in terms of ordinary beastmen, the third outpost was completed, greatly increasing the area of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s actual control while the total population of the tribe exceeded the 130,000 boundary.
This time, the development of the third outpost did not require Austin to intervene again.
Relying on the powerful Dragon Nest Legion and extraordinary squads, the Dragon Nest Tribe easily cleared the Lord of Magical Beasts settled near the outpost and seized that area.
Then, a major sweep began.
Near the third outpost, beastman tribes were conquered one after another, with thousands to tens of thousands of beastmen captured.
The vast population resources provided ample workforce for developing the third outpost.
In a short time, the third outpost was firmly established nearby.
Large-scale land reclamation and farming, along with vigorous development of animal husbandry and fishery, ensured the Dragon Nest Tribe had no lack of food, drawing more impoverished beastman tribes to join voluntarily, absorbing more beastman population.
The tribe’s development was flourishing and magnificent.
Looking at the intertwined systems, there already seemed to be the shadow of a kingdom emerging.
With time, much no longer required Austin’s personal involvement; the seeds casually sown years ago had grown sufficiently self-sustaining.
Seeing his strength increase to a certain extent, and the Dragon Nest Tribe stable with no major issues,
Austin shifted his gaze elsewhere.
The lakes and reservoirs near the Dragon Nest Tribe.
One day, after talking with the Elf Mother Tree, Austin had a rough understanding of the current state within the Kawa Great Forest.
In any case, if a great war were to erupt, it would not end in a few years with the pure-blooded beastmen’s strength.
Therefore, Austin planned to raise his strength to a certain level before engaging, ideally reaching the Legendary Realm.
Currently, Austin has reached the Half-Legendary Realm. After digesting the Power Law Origin, he found it difficult to make progress and would not consider getting involved in that turmoil for now.
However, during that conversation, aside from the history of the Arcane Mages and pure-blooded beastmen, there was another thing that caught his attention.
That was the Elf Mother Tree mentioned that it settled the Elf Kingdom nearby to find fragments of the Gate of Truth that had drifted here in the past.
The Elf Mother Tree couldn’t find them.
But Austin had some ideas.
That was the lakes and reservoirs near the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Years ago, Austin acquired a beast skin note left by a gold-level great mage.
It recorded some matters concerning the lakes and reservoirs near the Dragon Nest Tribe.
One of them was the revelation that the lakes and reservoirs in the Lush Forest were not naturally formed but resembled craters caused by a falling star.
That gold-level great mage also used some methods to obtain a skeleton from the crater’s depths, gaining some demonic artifacts of the Divine Artifact type.
At that time, Austin had the idea of exploring the lakes and reservoirs.
However, due to the terrifying nature of the mysterious ghost grass at the lake’s bottom, his several exploration attempts ended fruitlessly.

chapters.title: Chapter 329 - 325: The Gate at the Bottom of the Lake
chapters.content:
Chapter 329: Chapter 325: The Gate at the Bottom of the Lake
After a certain slumber at Gold Level, Austin originally thought that his body could resist the eerie flames caused by those "dandelions."
However, after several experiments, the facts proved that he was overconfident.
A few strange flames in the water could be barely endured, but when the quantity increased to thousands, breaking through the ghost grass blockade without the protection of the Legendary Domain was impossible.
It was precisely for this reason that Austin’s previous attempts always ended in near failure.
But now, he has regained the confidence to venture again.
After arranging some basic strategies for the Dragon Nest Tribe, Austin began to infiltrate the lakes and reservoirs near the Dragon’s Nest.
Starlit glimmers shone at the center of the lake, with clusters of ghost grass swaying with the currents, like flowing galaxies in the dark lake bottom.
Everything was exactly the same as several years ago.
No, something was different; the fish that lived nearby, and relied on the consumption of those rising "dandelions," had scales that began to emit a faint glow.
"Is this... mutation?"
Or perhaps, radiation change?
With doubts, Austin continued to dive.
As the massive shadow descended, the surrounding fish scattered quickly.
As they darted around, Austin seemed to sense an almost imperceptible ripple in space.
Was it an illusion?
Without lingering, he continued to dive deeper.
Soon, as he reached a certain boundary, countless ghostly blue "dandelions" below ignited like exploding stardust, transforming into a tsunami of torrents rising toward Austin.
"These damned plants again."
Watching the dense ghostly blue starlight rise from below, reminiscent of previous embarrassments, Austin’s expression turned grim.
The current momentum was far more terrifying than before.
However, he was no longer his former self.
Crash!
The sound of waves surging suddenly came from below the water, and numerous Divine Swords faded out from the void, their energies interconnecting to form a spatial field.
Austin did not unleash the Law Divine Sword’s accumulated aura, which he’d nurtured for more than half a year. The power of the Four Spirits Sword Array was far from its peak, achieving only about thirty to forty percent of its combat strength.
But at this level, it was enough.
Roar roar roar...
Dense starlight impacted the space of the Four Spirits Sword Array, erupting in countless ghostly blue flames outside, like a wildfire aiming to consume everything.
Yet beneath these flames, the surrounding waters showed no sign of boiling, indeed peculiar.
These blue flames were not mere fire.
Seeing the Four Spirits Sword Array begin to shake under the impact of the blue flames, Austin didn’t linger, directing the sword array deeper inside.
At the lake bottom,
The ghost grass grew like strands of hair, extending tens of meters long, rooted below like fur.
Austin rushed into the lake bottom, as if entering a world of blue fibers.
Each strand of ghost grass seemed stimulated, twisting towards the space of the Four Spirits Sword Array as if trying to bind and strangle the intruder.
Without delay, he continued to plunge at high speed, escaping the pursuit of the ghost grass above.
In just a breath, he reached the bottom.
Here, he was at least five hundred meters deep, facing unimaginable pressure.
Yet what lay before him shocked Austin greatly.
The ghost grass above was not growing in the lakebed soil but sprouted from the void, rooted in the void eating space’s power as nourishment!
As Austin descended, the space at the bottom rippled visibly, spreading waves outward.
Before Austin could react, as if drawn by the spreading swamp, it swallowed him and the Four Spirits Sword Array instantly.
The ghost grass surrounding hesitated momentarily after losing its target before dispersing.
Quite soon, tranquility was restored, as if nothing had happened.
...
Like being sucked into a vortex, the dense spatial power around constantly squeezed Austin’s body.
The violent tumbling almost made him dizzy.
Instinctively, Austin was about to unleash the Four Spirits Sword Array to break free.
Yet in the next moment, everything spun around, and he found himself in a wondrous space.
The entire space seemed like an enormous vortex tunnel, with vacuum distorted by a peculiar power, forming a massive dome overhead.
"Where is this..."
Austin’s gaze suddenly focused.
Because at the far end of the space, a door appeared.
The door was only a phantom, yet it stood before him, gathering the essence of myriad paths, with light shining from the end of the world, accommodating all beauty and grandeur, like the world’s limit, the end of all things.
Staring at the gate in the distance, Austin’s eyes glimmered.
The door was incomplete, only a substantial base remaining, with cracks like dog teeth, webs stretching upon it, unimaginable conflict must have been severe to cause such destruction.
Yet even with just a base, it still conveyed the sense of being a door.
Upon seeing it, one could immediately sense that it was a door.
As if etched into time, it wasn’t in the past, present, or future.
After pondering briefly, Austin slowly walked toward the base.
Until he stood before it, still nothing changed, only brilliant light converging in the void, flashing indescribable profound glow.
"Is this the Gate of Truth?"
Even if incomplete, one could still feel its dreadful divine might.
It’s hard to imagine its full state back then and the miraculous power it held.
"Let’s leave this here and ask the Elf Mother Tree later about using it."
Deciding so, Austin thought it best to let the Gate of Truth’s base remain here.
Who knows if this thing poses a danger? Better secure the usage method and investigate further.
After all, it’s been submerged for years unnoticed; safest to leave it as is.
Who knows if bringing it back to the Dragon’s Nest might evoke spatial fluctuations sensed by enemies, attracting great foes?
Austin is a cautious dragon.
But just as Austin was about to turn and leave.
Suddenly, the gate seemed pulled by some force and swooped toward Austin.
"What!"
Startled, Austin’s pupils contracted.
However, as the Gate of Truth moved, the surrounding space and time seemed frozen, compressing him into immobility.
As if traversing through multiple spaces, the door then penetrated Austin’s body, settling into the deepest realm of the spirit sea.
There resides a soul wholly distinct from this world.
Boom!!!
With a flicker in the Gate of Truth’s base core material, the gate crashed there directly.
"Damn!"
With this final thought conveyed, Austin’s consciousness fell into an endless abyss of darkness.

chapters.title: Chapter 330 - 001: Otherworld
chapters.content:
Chapter 330: Chapter 001: Otherworld
Central Plains, Celestial Essence Sect.
The cold wind was like a knife, howling through the courtyard, and the biting chill made the young servants standing there shiver incessantly.
"Our Celestial Essence Sect has been established for four hundred and thirty-two years. We never keep useless people within the sect. The sect has supported you for ten years, which is already more than generous. As servants, you must have the consciousness of a servant, and do good work for the disciples and elders of the sect. One day you might catch the elders’ attention and be accepted into the sect."
In front of the courtyard, a middle-aged man with dark skin was baring his teeth as he loudly lectured.
This person had an average build and a smooth demeanor, clearly playing the role of a steward or manager within the sect.
As he finished speaking, the young servants in the field stirred restlessly.
The Celestial Essence Sect was one of the top prestigious sects in the Central Plains. If one day they could truly attract the attention of the elders and be accepted, it would indeed be a meteoric rise.
From then on, they could roam the martial world freely, carefree across the world, wielding a sword as they journeyed afar, which is the dream of so many youths.
With an expressionless face, the dark-skinned middle-aged man glanced at the group of servants below, all bearing hopeful expressions, with a flash of disdain in his eyes.
These words can only deceive these inexperienced fellows in front of him; it’s merely some empty talk meant to incite them to work harder. Actually believing it is truly laughable.
Don’t they look at their own origins? Do they really think they can climb high from their position and be accepted into the Celestial Essence Sect?
The servants in front of him were primarily descendants of various servants within the sect who swept and tidied up.
Their status was, in fact, not much different from the offspring of some influential families.
Even somewhat lower.
After all, the offspring of influential families could ultimately rely on loyalty to be promoted to the management level and leap into a position envied by others.
But a sect is different. A sect recruits disciples from the outside world, and the loyalty of the disciples is fundamental to the cohesion of a sect.
As for these generations of servants serving the sect?
Why would they need you to be loyal when your task is cleaning and mucking out?
At this lowly status, the elders within the sect, for the sake of face, wouldn’t truly accept a servant as a disciple.
That’s lower than those peasants.
"Now, let’s begin assigning duties. Those named should report to their respective senior brothers..."
Without saying any unnecessary words, the dark-skinned middle-aged man took out a book from his pocket and started reading the names within.
One by one, the names of the young servants were called, and they were subsequently led away.
At this moment,
in the crowd, a servant-clad Li Hu, with an unremarkable appearance, looked around at the group of ancient people and the nearby ancient architecture, his gaze bewildered.
Just a moment ago, he was exploring the bottom of the lake, observing the fragments of the Gate of Truth. Unexpectedly, he was struck by the Gate of Truth the next moment, causing him to spin around and land in this ancient world.
What is going on? Did he transmigrate again?
In his previous life, he had clearly read many similar novels, so this completely unfamiliar environment didn’t leave him too bewildered for long.
He then began to ponder his current situation.
"Li Hu, huh? What kind of lousy name is this? Forget it, let’s settle down first and then talk."
From today onwards, he could only initially accept the name Li Hu.
With a brief adaptation, Austin accepted the reality of becoming Li Hu.
But before he could fully grasp his current situation, a voice rang out:
"Li Hu, report to Senior Brother Zhao at the Miscellaneous Task Hall in the Library."
The dark-skinned man’s instruction decided Li Hu’s fate for the time being.
Li Hu did not resist and followed the arrangements, going with the flow, waiting to understand the situation of this world first.
There was neither any oppression nor defiance; everything was calm. Li Hu found Senior Brother Zhao and from that day on became a servant cleaning the Library.
From then on, Li Hu began his life of cleaning the vast Library.
The Library, akin to the sect’s library and Scripture Hall.
It held a large amount of martial arts history, sect miscellany, various experiences from disciples’ journeys, and many sects’ basic martial arts.
Of course, these were just basic martial arts. The basic martial arts of every sect in the Central Plains were approximately similar. The true profound inheritance was held by the various Grand Elders of the Celestial Essence Sect, so although the Library held hundreds of thousands of books, its status was not particularly high.
After all, if accepted by an elder, naturally a teacher would personally guide them. The basic martial arts across various sects were much alike, so there was no need for confidentiality.
This is precisely why a servant descendant like Li Hu could enter and clean the Library.
Since the books in the Library range from important to unimportant.
It’s all trivial.
Cleaning the Library was an extremely laborious and unrewarding task. With hundreds of thousands of recorded books, classic historical collections, basic martial arts, various booklets, and magazines, managing them alone consumed much effort daily, let alone dusting and mopping, which left one exhausted.
Moreover, the disciples visiting the Library were primarily outer sect disciples without any backing, making it a poor place for networking, essentially a troublesome and unrewarding position.
Within half a month, the servants cleaning the Library alongside Li Hu began maneuvering to leave, leaving only Li Hu, a chatty skinny monkey, and a foolish-minded servant named Dasha still within the Library.
Li Hu actually wanted to leave too, but unfortunately, it was practically impossible.
Because Li Hu’s father was a minor character.
What is a minor character?
His real name was unknown, others called him Li Si; his height and appearance were probably poor, fortunate to have married a kitchen maid. It’s said that he was skilled in archery and sincere, but even at over thirty, he could only serve tea to senior brothers. He died at thirty-six, due to breaking an elder’s snuff bottle by mistake, punished to kneel for two days and nights. After death, the sect gave him a thin coffin and tossed it into the disorderly graveyard, never stepping out of the sect gates more than twenty miles in his life. The martial world? His martial world was sweeping, chopping wood, and serving spit for heroes.
Li Hu was the son of such a minor character.
When he was born, his mother died in childbirth, and upon hearing the news, his father mistakenly broke the elder’s beloved item; hence he became an orphan, randomly fostered within the sect, until now at thirteen or fourteen capable of working, continuing to contribute to the sect.
Even if he wanted to leave, lacking money and connections, Senior Brother Zhao would certainly not release him.
He could only continue as a servant cleaning and sorting in the Library.
Fortunately, with his soul switched, Li Hu’s nature was resilient, considering the arduous task of maintaining the Library as self-training. Back when he was born in the Main World, he lurked in water for two days and nights to hunt a deer, even eating soil when starving.
Above all, the vast books, travel notes, and various basic martial arts within the Library are indeed the best place to understand this world, aren’t they?
For Li Hu newly arrived in the Otherworld, the Library was the best starting place possible.

chapters.title: Chapter 331 - 002 Library
chapters.content:
Chapter 331: Chapter 002 Library
After entering the Library as a servant, besides sweeping and cleaning, Li Hu read extensively about the history and origins of Martial Arts in this world, along with various books on the Eight Extraordinary Meridians and Basic Martial Arts, leaving almost no book unread.
Regarding the Extraordinary Power of this world, Li Hu had already gained some understanding.
According to legend, in ancient times, humans mimicked tigers and leopards, learned from nature, and cultivated the first trace of True Qi, thus beginning the path of Martial Arts.
Later, through changes in dynasties and the development of ages, it gradually formed today’s Martial World where the righteous sects of the Central Plains are thriving, while the Demon Sect lurks in the damp, poisonous insect-infested lands of the south.
For many years, the Demon Sect had constant friction with the righteous path of the Central Plains, ambitiously trying to invade the Central Plains.
Simply put, there was confrontation between the righteous and the demonic in the Martial World, with a tense situation.
However, matters of the Demon Sect had nothing to do with Li Hu, who was sweeping in the Library.
Proficient in the essence of survival, Li Hu, after roughly understanding the Martial Arts of this world, began practicing Martial Arts.
In the Library, hundreds, even thousands of Basic Martial Arts Secret Manuals were collected. Although there were no advanced secret manuals, Li Hu was apparently more interested in these basic martial arts.
The Nourishing Essence Technique, an ordinary technique for refining Inner Power True Qi, a common commodity in the Martial World.
The Body Strengthening Skill, adapted from Five Animals Qigong, a basic external technique with the effect of strengthening the body.
These two were the martial arts Li Hu prepared to cultivate.
They were also the martial arts Li Hu carefully selected after reading hundreds or thousands of basic martial arts in the Library.
"To rely on this world’s original Martial Arts System, there’s simply no way to go back! I have to carve my path."
When Li Hu began communicating with the Gate of Truth in his spiritual mind, he had no choice but to decide to carve his own path based on this world’s Martial Arts System.
Li Hu, or rather Austin,
after more than half a month of sorting things out, had roughly clarified his situation.
The Gate of Truth, after crashing into his mind that day, caused some unknown transformation, directly bringing his soul to this world, thus falling into a state of weakness.
With the Gate of Truth in this state, Austin could weakly sense the connection between the Main World, but relying on its residual power to return was out of the question.
It’s as if there’s an unbreakable barrier, preventing the Gate of Truth from bringing his soul back.
That barrier should be the constraint of heaven and earth space.
Therefore, to return, he must shatter the vacuum constraint between heaven and earth.
Moreover, perhaps due to the Laws of Heaven and Earth, Austin did not feel the presence of any Magic Power Energy between heaven and earth.
In other words, this world did not have the foundation of Magic Energy’s Extraordinary Power.
To break through the spatial constraints, the only way is to rely on this world’s native Martial Arts System to achieve the level of Void Shattering.
At that time, after breaking through the void, perhaps he could rely on the power of the Gate of Truth to return to his main world’s body.
"An unexpected disaster."
Regarding the unexpected situation with the Gate of Truth, Austin was also helpless.
Fortunately, in his previous life, he was also an Oriental, had some understanding of Wuxia culture, and did not feel much discomfort.
Although, after living in the Western Fantasy World for so many years, he now occasionally felt a little strange.
"Even the highest Divine Skill Secret Manual of Celestial Essence Sect, the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, only historically leads to the Grandmaster Realm at most, and doesn’t reach the final destination. This world’s Martial Arts is too narrow, unable to reach the other shore. One must absorb the essence of Martial Arts from the entire world, and demonstrate it personally, only then might there be a chance to reach the world’s limit."
In this world, Martial Arts starts with Postnatal Qi Cultivation, then Innate, Grandmaster, and finally the cultivation above all, the Grandmaster above all others.
Generations of martial artists developed and advanced, yet throughout history, there has never been one who broke through beyond the void shattering level.
Since this world has no path, Austin could only carve his own path.
With his eyesight and realm, having been exposed to Law Origin, he had already surpassed the several levels of the strongest martial artists in this world.
Despite the different systems, in terms of profound Dao Origin, Austin’s vision was still far ahead of this era.
As the saying goes, a blank paper is easy to draw on,
by relying on the common martial arts of Nourishing Essence Technique and Body Strengthening Skill, and entering the Extraordinary Domain, absorbing the concepts and essence of other martial arts, he might carve an even bigger and farther path.
In truth, the simpler and more ordinary the martial arts, the more capable it is of encompassing all.
....
Thus, during the day, Li Hu swept and organized the Library, and at night, he took advantage of a little spare time to roam in the ocean of various books, while also starting to cultivate two martial arts.
Perhaps due to the experience of crossing over, Li Hu’s Spiritual Power was at least eight or nine times stronger than ordinary people, and he could even use it to have the effect of introspection.
The strong Spiritual Ability allowed Li Hu to precisely control every meridian and muscle, conducting even more precise cultivation.
It was precisely due to this that Li Hu’s cultivation speed of the two martial arts was almost a thousand miles a day.
And after cultivation, Li Hu’s physical quality became stronger, and his speed in the daily cleaning and management work of the Library was greatly enhanced, allowing him to devote more time to reading and cultivation.
Time,
passed day by day in the routine of daytime sweeping, and nighttime reading and practice.
Unknowingly, a year had passed since Austin crossed over to become Li Hu.
