In this year, it was said that among the batch of servants who started with Li Hu, someone named Zhang Feng, recognized for his extraordinary talent by an Elder, was accepted as a disciple, thus rising to become a disciple of the Celestial Essence Sect.
This event caused quite a stir within the entire Celestial Essence Sect, and among thousands of servants, it sparked a lot of enthusiasm.
In the following half year, countless servants worked hard to showcase their greatest enthusiasm, hoping to become the next fortunate one.
However, all the hustle and bustle outside had little to do with Li Hu.
In this year, he mostly lived a life that revolved around the canteen, the Library, and the dormitory.
He did not make friends, nor would anyone try to befriend someone relegated as a drudge in a Library.
The allocated Senior Brother Zhao in the Library had no incidents either, and his presence was rarely felt.
Among the Library servants, the talkative Skinny Monkey also got transferred away due to a connection with a Senior Brother, so only Li Hu and the slightly deranged Dunce were left among the library’s servants.
Isolated from the outside world, as if being isolated outside the Celestial Essence Sect.
Yet, Li Hu didn’t mind, for the Library was a rare quiet place amidst the tumultuous outside world.
In the spring warmth and autumn chill, summer heat and winter cold.
In such a quiet year, Li Hu’s cultivation realm quietly broke through to the Innate.

chapters.title: Chapter 332 - 003: Studying and Cultivation (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 332: Chapter 003: Studying and Cultivation (First Update)
A year into cultivation, he directly entered the Innate Realm, using only two of the most basic and ordinary martial arts to break through. Such an achievement, if known to the outside world, would certainly cause a huge stir in the martial arts community.
Not to mention anything else, just Li Hu entering the Innate Realm at the young age of thirteen or fourteen would be enough to astonish a vast number of people in the martial world.
You should know that the youngest among the current martial artists to reach the Innate Realm is Celestial Sword Manor’s successor, Dao Yuange, who is twenty years old.
This age for the Innate Realm has already broken the record for the youngest ever innate powerhouse in martial arts history.
However, Li Hu entered the Innate Realm completely quietly.
After entering the Innate Realm, life remained much as usual.
He ate when he needed to, slept when he needed to, worked as he needed to, showing nothing out of the ordinary.
Among the thousands of people in the Celestial Essence Sect, no one was aware that their sect now had an additional Innate master.
Within the library, there were many disciples coming and going, but Li Hu, who often appeared in a corner of the library sweeping and organizing books, was like an invisible person, not attracting anyone’s attention.
"Have you heard? That servant-born Zhang Feng won first place in the outer sect competition and, after a year of cultivation, has already broken through to the Postnatal Fourth Layer!"
"I heard, Fang Pingqing has lost a lot of face this time."
"Hmph, that damn servant brat, really don’t know why the Elder accepted him into the sect, making it so there are always some lowly servants with delusions of grandeur..."
One day, while returning to the library after eating, several voices talking idly came from afar.
Some Celestial Essence Sect disciples were gossiping during their cultivation break.
The subject was the ambitious Zhang Feng, a servant-born disciple in the same group as Li Hu, who was later noticed by an Elder and exceptionably accepted into the Celestial Essence Sect.
Then a series of events unfolded, starting with Zhang Feng’s background clashing with some henchman, after winning, he was challenged by a more powerful underling’s relative, and following that, he provoked Fang Pingqing, the top of the outer sect...
Zhang Feng’s name and cultivation soared with each successive conflict.
It is said that Fang Pingqing has connections in the inner sect too; it seems likely that once Zhang Feng enters the inner sect, others will come looking for trouble with him.
Li Hu had no interest in paying attention to anyone; his mind was set, determined to shatter the void and return to the Main World, but the past year’s dramatic antics involving that guy were so noteworthy and frequently discussed by others that even Li Hu, who was focusing on quiet cultivation, had become familiar with that individual’s rise to prominence.
Calmly, Li Hu left without drawing the attention of those gossiping disciples.
For Li Hu, this was nothing he cared much about.
Even though Zhang Feng’s path seemed reminiscent of protagonists from novels Li Hu had read in his past life, Li Hu had little intention of ingratiating himself or participating in such ’plots’.
What situation awaited in the Main World was a complete unknown to him; he also didn’t understand why he came to this world or what his status here was.
Under such circumstances, Li Hu couldn’t afford to spend time on participating in various ’stories’.
He needed to forge a path quickly, shatter the void, and rely on the Gate of Truth within his soul to return to the Main World.
Back in the Book Pavilion, sweeping, dusting, organizing books, taking on one task at a time, moving slowly, occasionally the outer sect disciples coming to borrow books would pass by him as if he didn’t exist.
Yet if one were to observe carefully,
they would find that in Li Hu’s every movement, even his breathing seemed to resonate with a certain rhythm.
Walking, breathing, sweeping—they were all aligned with a sort of pattern.
This was a technique Li Hu developed by combining the Nourishing Essence Technique with the Body Strengthening Skill, as well as referencing numerous Basic Martial Arts Secret Manuals, allowing him to cultivate at any time and place.
He practiced while walking, practiced while going about his day, even while lying down and sleeping.
All the time engaged in cultivation, integrating techniques into everyday life.
Li Hu was able to step into the Innate Realm within a year, largely thanks to this martial art.
Meanwhile, during the process of sweeping and wiping, Li Hu was using his Spiritual Power in three ways, mentally browsing the books on the shelves.
After stepping into the Innate Realm, his Spiritual Power had further expanded, now able to cover the entire library, penetrating the books, and extracting information from them.
Despite the vastness of the library, containing tens of thousands of books, and Li Hu’s powerful Spiritual Power granting him almost photographic memory, understanding and fully comprehending a Basic Martial Arts Technique took no less than a day’s work for each book.
Even as his Spiritual Power quickly grew, and his reading capacity simultaneously increased, over the past year, Li Hu had only thoroughly read around two to three thousand books.
Moreover, these included various travel journals, disciple adventure tales, memoirs of sect elders, and other assorted topics.
Compared to the entirety of the library, this was merely one percent.
Trying to integrate the entire world’s path, to reach the shattering void, without reading and understanding the basics of the whole world, is completely impossible.
Time passed slowly as Li Hu continued to read and cultivate.
Another year went by,
Within this year, the once widely known Zhang Feng broke through to the Postnatal Seventh Layer and further boosted his reputation in the Celestial Essence Sect’s large competition and sparring duels with other sects, entering the inner sect.
Zhang Feng’s name had nearly become synonymous with fame in the Celestial Essence Sect.
In the entire Celestial Essence Sect, no disciple didn’t know Zhang Feng, who learned martial arts two years ago, maintained a pace of breaking three realms annually, shocking people—a rising star.
However, he also attracted much more powerful enemies because of this, even offending several elders.
The whole Celestial Essence Sect was bustling because of him.
But none of this had anything to do with Li Hu.
In the second year in this world, Li Hu maintained his previous year’s lifestyle, staying mostly secluded.
Sweeping, cultivating, reading.
No face-slapping incidents, living peacefully and quietly day by day.
While cultivating, he continued to comprehend the true meaning of martial arts.
Over the course of the year, Li Hu’s cultivation reached the pinnacle of the Innate Realm, just one step away from Grandmaster.
In the Celestial Essence Sect, apart from the Grandmaster-level Grand Elder who stood as the sect’s pillar, no one else had strength surpassing Li Hu.
With Li Hu’s strength, he was comparable to the Sect Leader of Celestial Essence, ranking among the top and leading experts in this martial world, possessing a prowess akin to a martial elder, yet the entire sect remained unaware.
Li Hu also did not boast.
The outer sect disciples who frequently borrowed books from the library also did not realize that the young man sweeping and dusting beside them possessed power magnitudes beyond theirs.
Another fellow library worker dubbed ’Second Fool’ wouldn’t think to worry about unrelated matters either.
Watering, sweeping, organizing books.
No one paid attention to such an insignificant person.
Over a year of deep cultivation in the Book Pavilion, Li Hu had already read through one-third of the books.
His strength growing, his Spiritual Power even more powerful, increasing the speed of his reading as well.
However, the smooth path of cultivation also met a bottleneck.
The books and martial arts in the library were only basic. The Martial Arts Techniques, when involving the Innate Realm, reached their limit, and barely touched on anything at the Grandmaster threshold.
Even in the memoirs of the Celestial Essence progenitors and elders, there’s no content related to Grandmaster.
Li Hu speculated, the Grandmaster threshold is likely a sect-orchestrated secret tradition.

chapters.title: Chapter 333 - 004 Three Years as Grandmaster (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 333: Chapter 004 Three Years as Grandmaster (Second Update)
The Library, in the end, is not a very important place within the Celestial Essence Sect.
The various martial arts within it are just basic materials in the entire martial world, and the martial arts secret manuals above the middle level of the Celestial Essence Sect could never be stored in such a place.
That Li Hu was able to cultivate to the peak of the Innate Realm relying on the hundreds of basic martial arts secret manuals in the Library, was already considered extremely incredible by outsiders.
As for the secrets above the Grandmaster level, those secrets that concern the rise and fall of a sect, and the sect’s secret teachings, would only be tightly held in the hands of a few high-level sect members like the Sect Leader and the Inheritance Elder.
Even though, with his own realm and the scattered descriptions in the books of the Library about Grandmasters, Li Hu could deduce the techniques of the Grandmaster Realm by himself.
But, it was still not enough.
Wanting to shatter the void and create a path to a realm never tread upon by his predecessors, such difficulty was indeed overwhelming.
Being able to rapidly enhance his cultivation through a high realm did not mean that Li Hu could create another path in this world out of thin air.
He needed to learn.
To learn the knowledge and experiences of predecessors, to integrate various ingenious ideas from the forefathers, and to go one step further in creating a path of void shattering that belonged to him on the foundation of this world.
Thus, Li Hu’s spiritual power began to disperse, starting to expand beyond the Library.
When in the Main World, Austin, who comprehended the Law of Wind, had developed a method of listening to the voice of the wind, forming a secret technique similar to Downwind Ear.
Although this world had no Magic Power, nor the Law of Wind.
But the combination of sound vibrations and wind allowed Li Hu to eavesdrop through powerful spiritual power.
By referencing and improving on some techniques of enhancing hearing mentioned in tens of thousands of books in the Library, Li Hu successfully enveloped the entire Celestial Essence Sect under his surveillance.
The secret teachings of the Grand Elders, the various secrets between sects, the hidden locations of some critical inheritances.
Countless secrets were eavesdropped by Li Hu.
By learning stealthily, Li Hu absorbed the essence of various martial arts from the hands of Celestial Essence Sect Elders, drawing from their profound meanings, step by step solidifying his foundation in martial arts.
Meanwhile, in the dead of night, relying on powerful spiritual power and martial arts strength to sneak past patrolling personnel like a ghost, he infiltrated hidden places and perused the various secret teachings of the Celestial Essence Sect.
Even the highest heart method of the sect, the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, was memorized word for word by Li Hu.
The Celestial Essence Sect indeed well-deserved its reputation as a renowned sect in the Central Plains, with a variety of ingenious martial arts, each differing from the other, and some martial arts involving the power of Yin Yang Water and Fire, although rudimentary and lacking, the underlying concepts gave Li Hu great inspiration.
For example, the Fiery Palm essentially involves the transformation between True Qi and flames.
As well as the Cold Ice Profound Palm, Fiery Sun True Skill, Yin Luo Claw, etc.
These transformations of True Qi properties are somewhat similar to the natural element transformation of non-attribute Magic Power in the Main World; however, the activity of True Qi ultimately cannot compare to Magic Power, unable to directly condense into Fireball-like techniques as Magic Power can.
Attribute damage for True Qi can only be considered secondary.
This interesting aspect of Inner Power, Li Hu directly noted it down, as if he cannot cultivate to shatter the void in the future, he might be able to use the Four Spirits Sword Array from the Main World, using external power to shatter the void.
This counts as a fallback for the future.
Various martial arts gave Li Hu great enlightenment, causing the Nourishing Essence Technique he cultivated to flow toward the direction of myriad ways converging, continually accommodating new cultivation technique ideas, and perfecting itself.
The one that played the greatest role in this was the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, the sect’s secret masterpiece.
As the sect’s iconic secret book, it is the supreme martial arts of the entire Celestial Essence Sect.
In the history of Celestial Essence Sect, more than one Grandmaster has achieved the state of enlightenment through this Inner Power Heart Method; it can be said to be a divine skill secret manual that points directly to the Grandmaster.
Its underlying concept is, more than anything, to harmonize between the human heart and the Celestial Heart, to perceive the power of heaven and earth nature, to gather the world’s majestic power into oneself.
The concept alone surpasses the various martial arts Li Hu gleaned from the sect elders by several levels, providing him with the greatest help.
This martial art gave Li Hu a particularly peculiar feeling.
It seems that the Celestial Essence Sect’s founding ancestor who left this martial art, had already touched the limit of a Grandmaster.
Perhaps, had explored the bottleneck of the next realm.
Celestial Being!
That is a realm that the world of martial arts history has never reached before.
Li Hu had no intention of switching to the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, because he felt that even if he truly cultivated the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual to the highest level, and broke into the Grandmaster, it would still be unlikely to shatter the void.
Thus, Li Hu, using the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual as a foundation, incorporated various concepts and profound meanings into his Inner Power.
With knowledge beyond the limits of this world, and powerful spiritual deduction abilities.
The Inner Power Li Hu cultivates today is no longer the original Nourishing Essence Technique; it’s an Inner Power method based on it, absorbing a large amount of martial arts essence.
This martial art, created by Li Hu himself by observing numerous martial arts and through extraordinary insight, is already a rare supreme skill in the world.
Now, having absorbed some of the concept’s essence of the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, it’s elevated further.
Time,
Thus passed another year with Li Hu sweeping through the Library, listening to whispers around the Celestial Essence Sect’s gates, secretly learning martial arts secrets, and refining his own cultivation technique.
A year later, with the Nourishing Essence Technique as the core, Li Hu integrated a vast amount of martial arts essence from the Celestial Essence Sect, creating a powerful Inner Power that surpassed the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual, ultimately achieving great success in divine skill, naturally breaking through the bottleneck of the peak of Innate, entering the Grandmaster Realm.
Everything fell into place quietly and silently.
In absolute silence, no one knew there was already a second Grandmaster within the Celestial Essence Sect.
Moreover, this newly promoted Grandmaster was unbelievably young.
Yet, despite the breakthrough to Grandmaster, standing among the top masters of this world, Li Hu’s life was without the slightest ripple.
He still read books, cultivated, and managed miscellaneous tasks.
In the Grandmaster Realm, through powerful spiritual power to manipulate True Qi, it was easy for him to clean the Library thoroughly.
Li Hu then devoted more time to studying martial arts and cultivation.
Striving for cultivation, reading more books, hoping to reach the realm of void shattering as soon as possible.
The entire Celestial Essence Sect had basically no secrets in his eyes, with the foundation of a whole sect, it was enough for Li Hu to cultivate to the Grandmaster Realm.
After he integrated the martial arts of the entire Celestial Essence Sect to create that divine skill, the path for a Grandmaster was already a smooth one.
Next, what he needed to do was cultivate.
To continue cultivating until breaking through to the Grandmaster, or even to a higher realm.
Three years to achieve Grandmaster, Li Hu had already become one of the top level masters in this world, but he had no intention of leaving the Library to experience the outside world.
He needed to reach void shattering faster and return to the Main World, not having time to play games of wandering the martial world, acting chivalrous and upholding justice.
Unless there was no further progress, then Li Hu would go down the mountain, seeking greater opportunity for advancement.
In the third year when Li Hu calmly achieved the Grandmaster realm, many things happened within the Celestial Essence Sect as well, with the reputed protagonist Zhang Feng’s fame spreading throughout the Sect, and beginning to show his edge in the martial world.
First participating in the martial competition of the major factions in the Central Plains and winning first place, later braving several adventures, thwarting a certain Demon Sect conspiracy, with the title of Celestial Essence Sect’s foremost young talent beginning to spread across the world, with allied forces all saying that the Celestial Essence Sect had a promising future.
During this period, Zhang Feng also made numerous enemies, once even attracting an enemy at the Grandmaster level, requiring the Grand Elder to take action.
Looking at his experiences, it can be said that he is like a jinx, causing trouble wherever he goes.
Meanwhile, Li Hu, as a Library servant, continued to sweep peacefully.

chapters.title: Chapter 334 - 005: The Shattered Path (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 334: Chapter 005: The Shattered Path (Third Update)
The winds of change sweep through the martial world, as the old generation passes away, new conflicts arise.
In the blink of an eye, three years have passed.
During these three years, Li Hu finally finished reading all the books in the library, mastering various basic martial arts. He didn’t miss the tens of thousands of volumes of canon history collections and the travel journals of the ancestors of the Celestial Essence Sect.
Philosophical reflections from certain Daoist sages and ancient sages led Li Hu to some enlightenment.
In the mundane life of reading and sweeping, Li Hu’s mindset elevated to a new level.
The impatience of his early days dissipated, and through reading, cultivating his character, he gained a hint of the Daoist tranquility and naturalism.
Nowadays, if Li Hu were to return to the main world, even though his martial arts power might not be inheritable due to his body and the world, the spiritual cultivation he acquired from reading tens of thousands of books over these years would be a great gain.
A strong spiritual cultivation aids in leveling up.
When he returns to the main world, the legendary bottleneck blocking him will not be so immovable and difficult to overcome.
This unexpected journey brought him a big trouble, but if he could get through it, it would also be a significant gain.
As he improved his mindset at the same time,
Through reading tens of thousands of books over three years, his heart and mind became clear and wise, his cultivation realm silently broke through to the Grandmaster Realm.
Grandmaster, already at the pinnacle of the world.
Looking across the entire martial world, only three people have reached the Grandmaster Realm.
The leader of the righteous path, the master of Celestial Sword Manor, the Celestial Sword Elder, the Demon Sect Leader Jue Wutian, and the carefree wanderer Hai Wuya.
These three stand at the pinnacle of an era, watching the rise and fall of the times, deciding the destiny of sects and eras.
But now, the martial world is unaware that the three have become four.
A lowly servant sweeping the library in the Celestial Essence Sect.
Li Hu broke through to the Grandmaster Realm, yet no one knows. Scanning the entire Celestial Essence Sect, the highest martial arts cultivation belongs to the ancient master, the aging Grand Elder of the sect.
With Li Hu’s skills, if he doesn’t want others to know, no one can detect it.
One could say, the entire Celestial Essence Sect has become his backyard.
None of the thousands in the Celestial Essence Sect would ever imagine that there’s such a terrifying powerhouse hidden within their sect.
In fact, regarding the vast Celestial Essence Sect, they might not even recall or know of such an insignificant servant.
Li Hu feels indifferent about the Celestial Essence Sect’s neglect.
He also doesn’t have any notions of a vulnerable grandmaster. In these six years at the library, each and every action has deeply ingrained itself into his martial practice instinct, being here is fine, no need to change location.
Living alongside the books in the library day and night, Li Hu subtly regards each book as his friend.
Coming to this world was just an accident.
Li Hu has no intention to become famous throughout the world; he knows very clearly what his path is, which is to shatter the void.
And now, after six years of diligent cultivation, his cultivation has reached the zenith of martial arts in this world.
Grandmaster, already the highest realm in the history of this world.
There’s no road ahead in this world.
The rest is up to him to pave a new path, a road directly towards shattering the void.
Having read tens of thousands of books in the library, Li Hu already has some ideas.
In the hundreds of years of the Celestial Essence Sect’s existence, occasionally there were extraordinary individuals with ideas, creating secret techniques that even impressed Li Hu.
Combining these with the fantastical notions of some fantasy novels he read in his previous life, Li Hu has conceived several ideas for shattering the void.
For example, compressing True Qi within his body, until its quantity changes produce qualitative changes, ultimately generating power comparable to the shattering level.
Or seeking the ultimate principles of heaven and earth, harnessing the power of the sun, moon, and stars to cleanse himself, pursuing transcendence through the power of the Dao.
Or, like in immortal fantasies, forming a Martial Arts Golden Core, attracting tribulation, thereby gaining the power to ascend.
If Li Hu’s any idea were shared with outsiders, countless martial artists would dismiss it as mere fantasies of idle people.
These paths transcend this martial world, surpassing its martial arts, appearing more like imagination.
But how would ordinary people know that when martial arts reach their extreme, how different is it from legend?
Moreover, these three paths are merely extensions and deductions from failing secret techniques found amongst the tens of thousands of books in the Celestial Essence Sect’s library.
It can be said that any path has a certain foundation.
But Li Hu is not eager to personally attempt to create these paths.
Years of polishing his mindset have dissipated his initial impatience, making his actions more cautious.
The most important thing is that his own cultivation level has just entered the Grandmaster Realm.
Since the founding ancestor of the Celestial Essence Sect who left the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual managed to explore the extremes of the Grandmaster and the threshold of the Celestial Human Dao, it means that while the Grandmaster is the pinnacle of martial arts history, it hasn’t reached its ultimate limit yet.
He still needs to cultivate further until reaching the extremes of the Grandmaster, or break through to the unprecedented Celestial Human Realm.
Only when reaching the ultimate limit of martial arts in this world, when there’s no way forward, will Li Hu try those paths.
Because only standing in a higher place can you see further.
Touching the limits of this world, one is qualified to speak of pioneering a new path of shattering the void.
Furthermore, these ideas are ultimately just ideas, not mature systems, creating a Heaven-Reaching Dao is incredibly difficult.
Reaching the end of this road, then paving another.
It will always be easier.
For three years, Li Hu quietly swept the floor in the Book Pavilion, while the seemingly protagonist Celestial Essence Sect disciple Zhang Feng after years of cultivation, entered the Innate realm in one stroke, breaking the record of the youngest age to enter Innate set by the sword gentleman of Celestial Sword Manor.
Later, during his travels in the Central Plains, various plot developments unfold, rescuing damsels in distress, attracting admiration from various heroines, making enemies of aristocratic disciples, breaking through Demon Sect conspiracies, exploring ruins and receiving martial arts inheritance from a dying elder, discovering treasures and acquiring divine weapons in caves...
Recently, at the martial arts assembly, he defeated the martial world’s sword gentleman Dao Yuange, becoming the leader of the younger generation in the martial world.
He was renowned nationwide, becoming the personal disciple of the Celestial Essence Sect’s Grand Elder, gaining the affection of countless martial heroines and sect sisters, practically reaching the peak of life.
To this, Li Hu, sweeping the floor in the library, just smiled knowingly.
No matter how it looks, it’s like some ancient web novel tropes, but it has nothing to do with him.
The Celestial Essence Sect was abuzz with excitement over the emergence of a genius, and the martial world was stirred by Zhang Feng, but none of it affected life in the tranquil library.
Since it doesn’t affect him, Li Hu naturally has no intention of getting involved.
However, the unchanging life was ultimately broken.
Shortly after Zhang Feng reached the peak of life, the old master of the Celestial Essence Sect passed away, shattering the last pillar of the sect.
On that day,
One of the four Demon Venerables of the Demon Sect, the Cyan Dragon, led a large number of Demon Sect followers to strike the Celestial Essence Sect.
With the only Grandmaster fallen, the crisis of sect extermination is imminent.
The peaceful life of cultivation was ultimately shattered in an instant.

chapters.title: Chapter 335 - 006 Extermination of the Family
chapters.content:
Chapter 335: Chapter 006 Extermination of the Family
"Kill!"
The Demon Sect attacked the mountain, plunging the entire Celestial Essence Sect’s mountain gate into chaos.
Blazing flames roared between the buildings, the clashing of weapons rang out one after another, and the cries of battle filled the sky.
One by one, the disciples of the Celestial Essence Sect fought bravely, but the demonic might escalated, with defensive lines being broken, leaving behind a multitude of corpses.
"Ancestral Master, the descendants are unworthy!"
Gazing at the sect engulfed in war, its resistance crumbling, the Celestial Essence Sect Leader cried out mournfully in the central hall.
With a legacy of over four hundred years, many grandmasters emerged from its ranks, making it one of the top righteous sects in the Central Plains.
But today, it is being destroyed by his own hands!
"Sect Leader! We are willing to make a last stand!"
"Fight to the death with the Demon Sect!"
In the great hall, the assembled elders and core disciples shouted fiercely, filled with a spirit ready to face death unflinchingly.
"No, you are the last seeds of the Celestial Essence Sect. I will hold them off! You must flee quickly. Near the library is a path leading down the mountain. Do not return until you reach the level of a grandmaster! The legacy of four hundred years rests on your shoulders!"
At this moment, the cries of battle approached.
Within his senses, a powerful and dark aura was soaring, rushing swiftly towards the direction of the main hall.
Disregarding everything else, the Celestial Essence Sect Leader called out, striking with his palms. An invisible True Qi transformed into a gentle yet irresistible force, pushing the numerous disciples present towards the back of the hall.
"Go quickly! Elders, follow me into battle!"
The sorrowful voice echoed throughout the grand hall, filled with a momentum of facing death head-on.
Boom!
A vast aura unfolded within the hall, sweeping like a tsunami. The air currents trembled in the void, pressing forth with a rolling force, making the entire hall seem to shiver.
The Celestial Essence Sect Leader and the few remaining elders behind him soared like meteors, gathering powerful energy as they rushed out of the hall.
At this moment, everyone was fully unleashing their innate level power.
This was a fight to the death!
Even at the cost of their lives, they needed to leave a glimmer of hope for the seeds of the Celestial Essence Sect!
However, just as the Celestial Essence Sect’s elders and others, harboring the resolve to die, flew out of the hall—
One of the four demon lords of the Demon Sect, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, had already arrived!
"Hahaha! The Celestial Essence Sect is truly in decline! With that old fogey dead, only you incompetent juniors are left. In that case, to prevent you from sullying the sacred land’s name of the martial world, let the Celestial Essence Sect be erased from the world today!"
A voice, resonant like a great bell, instantly echoed between heaven and earth, seemingly imbued with majestic magic power. It surged like a tide, rolling from the sky like a mighty torrent.
The deafening sound caused the sect leader and elders, who had just flown past the hall doors, to have their breaths caught, almost vomiting blood.
But that wasn’t the end.
"Great Sorrow Demon Palm!"
Accompanied by a thunderous voice akin to divine wrath, the light dimmed in the skies outside the hall. Strange phenomena erupted abruptly, seeming as if an enormous demonic figure several zhang high sat in the void, its demonic seal reaching to the hearts. A terrifying demonic hand conjured countless phantasmal shadows, covering the skies as it descended upon the Celestial Essence Sect’s leaders.
Boom boom boom!
Thunder roared, powerful energy swept, the Celestial Essence Sect Leader and the innate elders had no power to resist, being blasted away.
Swooping figures hadn’t even crossed the hall’s threshold before being sent flying back!
Meanwhile, the powerful residual palm force, its True Qi reverberating, filled the surroundings, making the entire hall rumble like a terrifying thunderclap.
The tremendous explosion echoed around, causing half of the hall to collapse with a thunderous crash!
Tiles crumbled, beams shattered, and wooden splinters fell like snow, scattering dust in all directions.
"Pfft!"
Falling to the ground along with the collapsing debris were the Celestial Essence Sect Leader and elders who were sent flying back, spitting a mouthful of blood.
With just one clash, several high-tier innate martial artists couldn’t even resist, falling like decaying wood in utter defeat.
This is a grandmaster!
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, one of the infamous demon sect grandmasters in the martial world!
"Celestial Essence Sect, so that’s all it amounts to."
With a cold and eerie voice, a withered, sharp-featured middle-aged man suddenly appeared.
His speed was such that he seemed to flash over, crossing several spans to appear amidst the mostly collapsed grand hall.
Glancing around at the crowd, he indifferently flicked his fingers a few times. Sharp black energy shot out, piercing the heads of the elders who had fallen to the ground, their breath withering.
Pop pop pop.
Their heads exploded, and the Celestial Essence Sect elders lay scattered on the ground, blood and brains smeared everywhere, with no breath left.
Witnessing this, the elite Celestial Essence Sect disciples retreating from the hall felt their eyes tear up in rage.
Among them was the cherished disciple, Zhang Feng, of the Celestial Essence Sect.
Though in the sect’s rise, he faced a lot of suppression, he had many family and companions.
The lively little junior sister, the gentle senior sister, the master with a sharp tongue and a soft heart, the solemn sect leader, and the long-passed grand elder who held high hopes for him, tirelessly covering up his troubles!
But now, everything had turned to ashes under the Demon Sect’s assault.
"Demon Sect, one day I will repay this enmity tenfold!"
Perhaps Zhang Feng’s gaze was too intense with hatred, catching the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s attention from afar.
"So there’s still a bunch of little rats. Today our sect aims to annihilate yours, how can we let you escape."
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable leaped, seemingly traversing tens of zhang to suddenly appear in front of the fleeing Celestial Essence Sect disciples. With a casual wave, a towering tsunami-like giant wave surged towards them.
The divine might swept forth, leaving no chance of escape, no room to dodge!
In this moment of crisis, a figure dashed forward.
"Go!"
It was the Celestial Essence Sect Leader, hanging onto a breath of life, arriving just in time, grabbing Zhang Feng, while simultaneously pushing the surrounding disciples out of Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s palm force range, then flying away.
Bam!
Though Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s palm force had not yet dissipated, its aftershock struck the Celestial Essence Sect Leader’s back, immediately inflicting serious injury, blasting him like a cannonball into a tall building behind.
Boom!
The walls exploded, splinters flew.
Through the massive breach in the wall, fallen shelves could be seen, books scattered all around.
This was clearly the Celestial Essence Sect’s library.
"Hmph, since you wish to die so much, I’ll send you to King Yama ahead of time!"
Because of the Celestial Essence Sect Leader’s intervention, those disciples of the Celestial Essence Sect managed to scatter and flee.
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s face darkened. With a cold snort, his form swooped like a poisonous serpent, swiftly covering dozens of zhang, suddenly passing through the gaping hole in the wall to enter the library.
Sweeping his gaze around, he saw not far away the Celestial Essence Sect Leader, gravely injured and collapsed, blood gushing from his mouth.
Just as Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable was about to strike to kill him, his actions suddenly halted.
Unbeknownst to when,
the surrounding space echoed with the rustling sound of sweeping,
In the empty and desolate grand hall, a shadowy figure slowly approached from the depths of the dim bookcases.

chapters.title: Chapter 336 - 007: Take Action
chapters.content:
Chapter 336: Chapter 007: Take Action
Outside the Library, the entire Celestial Essence Sect was engulfed in a blaze of battle.
A large number of Demon Sect disciples charged forward, accompanied by the clashing sounds of weapons and earth-shattering shouts of battle, corpses lying scattered, blood flowing like rivers.
All the mountain gate buildings of the Celestial Essence Sect were in ruins, as the Demon Sect followers surged like a pack of wolves, bringing unprecedented destruction to the mountain gate. Some buildings had even caught fire, black smoke billowing into the sky.
However, at this moment inside the Library, the atmosphere was completely different from the external world filled with murderous intent and chaotic warfare.
Peace, tranquility.
As if isolated from the chaotic world, standing silently.
Vast and desolate, quietly profound.
A servant slowly walked over from a distance, holding a simple broom that had lost almost all its bristles.
Sweeping the dust from the ground, one stroke at a time.
As if everything outside had nothing to do with him, the entire Library was enveloped in a peaceful and serene air.
Out of place with the external world.
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable instinctively sensed something amiss.
Yet he couldn’t pinpoint where it was wrong.
As one of the rare Grandmaster Level experts in the current Martial World, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable had an extraordinarily keen sense of danger since childhood.
It was precisely this keen intuition that allowed him to evade countless dangers in the harsh and brutal Demon Sect, eventually rising to become one of the four Demon Venerables, a high-ranking figure within the sect.
However, today, the intuition that repeatedly helped him escape danger seemed shrouded in mist, becoming obscure.
Incredibly bizarre.
As Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s expression flickered with doubt and uncertainty.
The sweeping servant had already reached him.
When sweeping broken bricks and wooden debris on the ground, the servant stopped, looking around.
His gaze touched upon the wall with a large hole in front, the floor strewn with rubble, and the messy scattered books around, his eyes filled with confusion.
After a long while,
His eyes cleared once more.
His dark pupils, like a deep Starry Sky, devoid of any impurities.
"Venerable, are you one of the Demon Sect from the south? Celestial Essence is already defeated, the sect’s Grandmasters have fallen, Elders and disciples have suffered heavy losses, no longer able to resist your sect’s matters, can today’s events end here?"
The calm voice pulled Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s thoughts back to reality.
Looking at the unremarkable young sweeping servant before him, who seemed unable even to grasp the situation, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable spoke indifferently:
"Oh, what if I say no?"
"The Buddhist scriptures say, put down the butcher knife and become a Buddha immediately, as heaven has the virtue of cherishing life. Celestial Essence is defeated, nine out of ten disciples are gone, further slaughter is of no benefit. I believe Venerable will agree."
The young servant earnestly expressed, his eyes shining with a gleam.
"Buddhist scriptures? I am a demon, the enemy of the Buddha after all!"
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable showed a mocking smile, his deep voice spread out.
Before the words were completely out, his figure suddenly flashed like drifting clouds, his right hand reached out into the void, black True Qi condensed into the Yin Luo Ghost Claw, carrying a dark Senluo Qi, lowering the surrounding temperature, and clawed towards the servant’s head.
Moments ago it was all smiles and pleasantries, but in the next instant, it was full of murderous intent.
This claw came too fast, in a blink of an eye the chilling Yin Luo Ghost Claw was just a few feet away from the servant’s head!
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable did not hold back at all, going all out, he even used the Demon Sect’s ultimate skill.
For the inexplicably appearing servant before him, he instinctively felt something was off.
This sense of unease made him decide to nip this threat in the bud.
In this world, almost no one could withstand a Grandmaster’s full-force sneak attack.
The servant in front of him would be no exception,
Seeing the ordinary young servant about to perish under this claw, at this moment,
"Alas."
A sigh, Li Hu shook his head, his broom slowly drawing across the ground.
His movements weren’t fast, compared to the toppling Yin Luo Ghost Claw, it was more like an old man leisurely practicing Tai Chi.
However, what seemed slow, instead was ahead, completed the stroke before the Yin Luo Ghost Claw descended.
Fast and slow, at this moment seemed to achieve opposite effects,
As if the flow of time in that area had changed.
Whoosh!
All of a sudden, before Li Hu, appeared an invisible, intangible three-foot wall of energy, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable only felt as if he had crashed into a wall of copper and iron, unable to advance an inch!
No, with his Grandmaster Level cultivation, he could still break through a copper and iron wall with one palm.
But the invisible barrier before him, caused his Yin Luo Ghost Claw to freeze in midair!
Utterly shocked and without time to react,
Li Hu pulled back the broom as if filled with some mysterious trackline.
Boom!!!
In an instant, powerful energy raged fiercely as gigantic waves surged forth like a tempest in the ocean, rolling up an immense torrent, sweeping in countless rubble, dust, and wood chips.
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable was about to retreat, but was hit in the chest by the great wave, crashing through the large hole in the Library’s wall, being flung out.
Thud, thud, thud!
Forcing himself to stabilize mid-air, landing on the hard granite ground outside, leaving a trail of shattered footprints.
Steadying himself once more, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable looked gravely ahead at the Library.
Who is that kid after all, and what technique is this?!
The large hole in the wall, like a gaping dark mouth of a monster, seemingly ready to devour everything.
"Greetings, Venerable!"
At this moment, the Demon Sect followers in black night-wind clothing gathered around, facing Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, kneeling on one knee.
From a distance, some powerful Demon Sect members were also flying towards this direction.
Glancing at the Library ahead that seemed to hide some evil spirits, then at the many Demon Sect members behind.
Gritting his teeth, his expression changed several times.
"Men, prepare oil and fire, burn the building in front, if anyone comes out, kill without mercy!"
This time, Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable accepted the Sect Leader’s order to annihilate Celestial Essence, it was also the first large-scale operation of the southern Demon Sect in ten years.
If he couldn’t exterminate all the Celestial Essence Sect people, he might be seen as lacking ability by the Sect Leader.
Moreover, with many Demon Sect members around, it gave him the confidence to deal with that mysterious young man of unknown depth.
Whoosh!
In a few breaths, a team of Demon Sect members drew flaming arrows.
Bending bows, nocking arrows.
Formed in rows, facing the Book Pavilion ahead.
At this moment,
"Alas!"
Another sigh, but this sigh, compared to the previous one, was exceptionally long, full of helplessness from breaking the calm life, and more showing pity for those about to die.
Before the Demon Sect members could think of its meaning,
Boom!
Suddenly, an earth-shaking aura rose up into the sky, shooting straight to the highest heavens, causing the entire sky’s light to dim at that moment.
Divine might omnipresent, as if heaven and earth!
The terrifying, boundless pressure rolled towards all beings.
"Grandmaster!!!"
Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable’s face showed unprecedented horror, his figure stumbling as if about to crash to the ground, his eyes filled with disbelief, his voice becoming sharp.
How is this possible!

chapters.title: Chapter 337 - 008: Graceful Departure
chapters.content:
Chapter 337: Chapter 008: Graceful Departure
No matter what, the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable could not believe that at the very last moment when the Celestial Essence Sect was about to be destroyed, a peak-level supreme martial artist appeared!
That is a Grandmaster, after all. In today’s martial world, at this time, there are only three such people.
In these twenty years, it has been these three who dominated every change in the world’s situation!
The pinnacle of martial arts in the world, almost surpassing all existence!
Recalling everything that happened earlier, how could the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable not realize that the seemingly ordinary servant sweeping the floor was the hidden grandmaster who unleashed this terrifying aura!
But how is that possible!
That unknown kid sweeping the floor in the sect is actually a Grandmaster?
However, no matter how absurd the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable found it, this vast and terrifying aura in front of him was something he felt only on the Demon Sect Leader, Jue Wutian!
The absurd thought proved to be true!
The vast and boundless aura surged into the sky, instantly stirring the cosmic changes!
As the expansive aura unfolded, the terrifying force overwhelming the heavens swept forth. Inside the library, it seemed as if a fearsome primordial giant beast was slowly awakening, opening its eyes that could subdue heaven and earth, delivering immense oppression to all beings!
At some unknown time, a pitch-black, mountain-heavy cloud enshrouded the sky above.
The surrounding light dimmed at that moment, as if about to plunge into an infinite abyss of darkness.
The hundreds of Demon Sect followers surrounding the library, facing the increasingly terrifying oppressive aura in front of them, felt as if a mountain pressed down on their backs and their hearts were gripped by an invisible giant hand, forcing their bodies to retreat in terror.
At the same time, everyone on the scene had their pupils contracted, their scalps numb, and an inexplicable sense of great terror and impending doom surged from the bottom of their hearts.
Horror, ominous!
The Demon Sect followers with their bows and arrows were so frightened that their faces turned pale, their bows and arrows dropped directly to the ground, and some even had mental breakdowns and fainted in fright.
This is a Grandmaster!
Just the eruption of aura alone prompted a change in the cosmos, making people not even dare to think of resisting!
The Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable looked at the phenomenon ahead, feeling the endless fear from the depths of his soul, with horror and disbelief on his face, he stumbled back a few steps.
Then, he suddenly shot forward, turning into a long black streak fleeing away, leaping tens of yards away before the many Demon Sect followers could react, vanishing into the crowd, like a bolt of lightning streaking down the mountain.
Without a care, he directly abandoned his subordinates around him,
He only wanted to escape this place as quickly as possible!
A Grandmaster stands at the pinnacle of martial arts, wielding unparalleled power to shatter mountains and sever ridges.
Even though the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable is a renowned grandmaster-level expert in the martial world, deemed a mighty figure anywhere in the martial arts realm, he still has no confidence in facing a grandmaster-level powerhouse.
Escape!
Immediately escape!
If the mission fails, it fails; even if he becomes marginalized within the sect, he must escape immediately!
In the blink of an eye, the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable had already fled several hundred yards from the library, about to cross the shattered gate of the Celestial Essence Sect.
The terrifying grandmaster behind him did not pursue.
The Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable felt a sense of joy at escaping death, but also a sense of resentment.
When returning to the sect, he would report this matter to the Sect Leader, perhaps even embellish the story a bit.
Even if he cannot take revenge on that kid himself, being forced to flee in such a sorry state today, this grudge cannot be left unavenged!
In any case, since he managed to escape with his life this time, he resolved to take revenge. If he could not convince the Sect Leader to personally take that damned guy’s head as a chamber pot, then he would not be one of the four Demon Venerables of the Southern Demon Sect, the Cyan Dragon!
However, just as the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable was full of malicious thoughts, planning on how to sow discord when he returned.
The mysterious aura from the library, interwoven with the void, resulted in endless changes in the celestial secret aura.
Huā lā lā!
One vortex after another gathered in the sky, raising a fierce storm that pierced through heaven and earth, shattering the dense surrounding dark clouds.
The black cloud in the sky enlarged due to the vortex, seemingly turning into a tornado-like whirlpool, with the pitch-black color spreading ominously, engulfing the surrounding airflow, seemingly devouring even the light as the heavy cloud whirlpool consumed it, making the sky dim rapidly.
But this was not the end!
The dense clouds were abruptly gathered by an invisible force, layer by layer, transforming into an enormous cloud hand above the sky like divine punishment, descending from the nine heavens!
The heavens possess five energies, the earth forms four seasons!
Reaching the grandmaster level in the realm of divine communication, one clearly perceives the five energies and four seasons and mastering Wind and Thunder Divine Techniques is no difficult feat.
It is precisely because they can wield the Power of Heaven and Earth and turn it into their own strength that grandmasters hold the supreme position in the martial world!
The Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, in his rapid escape, suddenly felt a strong sense of foreboding, his heart chilled as if facing an apocalyptic catastrophe.
He turned around in terror,
only to see behind him, in the sky, a giant hand woven of clouds, Thunder, and lightning covering the heavens, shrouding the void, like the Five Finger Mountain in Buddha’s hand, suppressing him like the Monkey King.
The pitch-black palm, like a collapsing and falling sky!
"No!!!"
The face of the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable showed unparalleled terror as the surrounding void seemed frozen, fixing him in place, unable to escape or evade!
He only managed to let out a final scream before that terrifying cloud hand descended with majestic divine power!
With no ability to resist, the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, one of the four demon venerables of the invincible, mighty Demon Sect, was crushed into the earth like a fly swatted flat by that giant cloud hand!
Kaboom!!!
Amidst the earth-shattering roar, the entire mountain gate of Celestial Essence Sect crumbled, huge rocks and soil collapsing, forming a gigantic palm print dozens of yards long, deeply embedded in the earth.
Meanwhile, dust and soil rose in large swathes, obscuring the sky, and in an instant, the earth was filled with flying sand and stones, as if ushering in an apocalyptic disaster.
The tremors between heaven and earth lasted for some time before they subsided.
The Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, under this single palm across hundreds of feet, was completely reduced to flesh.
The entire Celestial Essence Sect was plunged into dead silence.
Many Demon Sect followers stood dumbstruck, unable to hold onto their weapons, which dropped to the ground unnoticed.
"Invincible, unbeatable! What kind of martial arts is this, is it an immortal technique?"
"Legendary martial arts, reaching the utmost, possesses the power to connect heaven and earth; the rumors were true!"
"I... I won’t fight! Even the venerable got crushed by a palm. Whether I stay or leave makes no difference!"
Some Demon Sect followers muttered in a daze.
Some Demon Sect followers, terrified by this myth-like spectacle before them, dropped their weapons and ran off in horror.
Soon, fear spread to all Demon Sect followers attacking the mountain. Many felt weakness in limbs, abandoning weapons, fleeing helter-skelter.
In no time, the countless Demon Sect followers who had previously ravaged the Celestial Essence Sect disappeared completely, leaving behind only a desolate ruin scattered around.
Within the library, the severely injured Sect Leader of Celestial Essence Sect stared blankly, stunned at the young servant still slowly sweeping the floor not far away, unable to comprehend.
The remaining disciples of Celestial Essence Sect also stood dazedly, bewildered.
Zhang Feng was no exception,
everyone remaining in Celestial Essence Sect was completely lost.
The entire Celestial Essence Sect was deathly silent.
When the gaze of the remaining people accidentally touched the direction of the library, they all tightened inwardly, dared not look directly, and turned their gaze away.
Soon, after the sweeping was done.
Li Hu placed the broom in the usual corner, opened the library door, and stepped out.
Behind him, the door leaves closed automatically, with an invisible force lifting the previously collapsed shelves, restoring each book to its place.
Everything reverted to its original state, except for the large hole that had been broken in the library, though the surrounding debris was also swept clean.
As the sun set, the blood-stained sunlight outside the library spilled across the land.
Li Hu walked with steady steps, casting a long shadow behind him, heading towards the distance.
"Life is like a dream, also like illusion; morning creeps like dew, evening blooms like sunset; caught in the worldly haze, thousands of causes and effects, born and extinct, freely meandering..."
His steps weren’t fast, but seemed to shrink distances, disappearing from everyone’s sight in the blink of an eye, leaving only a clear song echoing in the heavens, lingering for long...

chapters.title: Chapter 338 - 009: Shocking the World (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 338: Chapter 009: Shocking the World (First Update)
"Celestial Essence Sect’s grandmaster-level Aoki Elder has passed away, and the Demon Sect launched a surprise attack on the mountain."
"A mysterious grandmaster appeared, saving the day; with a single palm strike, he annihilated one of the Demon Sect’s four mighty Demon Venerables, the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable!"
"Rumors say the recently appointed grandmaster was but a floor-sweeping servant of the Celestial Essence Sect, who revealed breathtaking cultivation prowess at just nineteen years old!"
That day near the Celestial Essence Sect, countless carrier pigeons flew, numerous horses ran to death, spreading explosive news across the world.
Like a bolt from the blue in the martial arts world, all across the land it caused a sensation, shaking the very foundations, and turning the martial arts world into a bubbling cauldron, thoroughly boiling over.
Unknown and unseen, one becomes famous overnight.
In short, this encapsulates the life of the most prominent, widely discussed, and intensely debated new grandmaster from the Celestial Essence Sect who emerged suddenly in the martial arts world.
From the day Li Hu struck with one palm against the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, showing an immense hand of legend across the sky, killing the infamous Cyan Dragon, and driving back the Demon Sect, then left swiftly,
the news spread to the outside world, instantly causing a sensation throughout the martial arts world.
Along with numerous incredible stories and details emerging, the name Li Hu spread rapidly, shaking the world.
Fame brought shock to the entire world overnight.
No announcement has ever stirred such intense discussion and spurred topics so widely.
The protagonist’s legendary story is truly unbelievable, beyond imagination.
Countless eyes turned to the Celestial Essence Sect, digging out information on the new grandmaster.
Every martial artist who saw the details found them incredibly baffling, unable to comprehend how this person ascended to the pinnacle realm of grandmaster-level martial arts.
"Orphaned young, raised in the Celestial Essence Sect, became a floor-sweeping servant at thirteen, then swept floors below the library for years, solitary and withdrawn, few in the Sect knew him..."
A plain name and simple background.
Not a disgrace, never rejected in marriage, no elder oppression, nor did he encounter any scheming against him.
For years, his routine consisted only of sweeping, eating, sleeping in a monotonous cycle, with no signs of martial arts practice or guidance from any renowned master.
Among countless background characters supporting the rise of protagonists, he remains one with an unnoticed name.
Yet such a commonplace servant suddenly displayed the pinnacle of martial arts prowess, achieving a realm countless dreams of at a tender age!
If not for the death of the old grandmaster bringing about the Demon Sect’s attack, perhaps neither the Celestial Essence Sect nor anyone in the world would know a grandmaster had emerged on the martial arts scene!
Everyone who heard this news felt as if they had seen a ghost, preferring to believe they were dreaming instead of accepting that such a grandmaster-level expert surfaced abruptly.
Is there anything remarkable in this resume?
No!
Swept floors for years and then reached the absolute pinnacle of martial arts?
Ridiculous, not even novels dare write such a tale.
Even more shocking is that even if the new grandmaster began cultivating within the womb, at most he has only reached eighteen now!
In such a short time, he achieved earth-shattering accomplishments, reaching a realm countless martial artists of previous generations failed to attain throughout their lives, enough to make any talented martial artist hide their face in shame.
"Barely nineteen yet dominates the world, reaching the pinnacle, all my decades of bitter cultivation amount to what?!"
An elder in the martial arts world during a breakthrough banquet into the Innate mid-stage was left speechless upon hearing the news, expressing embarrassment.
Half a life of cultivation inferior to a youth.
If it were anything else, even Celestial Sword Manor’s Sword Prince in the Innate mid-stage surpassed numerous forebears but remained within reason, elders in the martial world at most sighing that the waves of the Yangtze push onwards, without being so disheartened.
Grandmaster-level, the distance too great, leading to despair, shattering one’s resolve.
"A mere servant and slave before reaching adulthood exceeds the martial world’s peak, probably making him the first in history!"
"I foolishly believed myself a genius in the eyes of townsfolk, now revealed as merely a frog in a well."
A newly rising martial prodigy hears the news and weeps, covering his face.
"My sect also has a similarly solitary servant who has swept for fifty years, I wonder if he’s made it to grandmaster level, might I still have time to become his disciple."
Youth, quick-witted.
The martial arts world is bustling, amidst strange concerns seemingly mixed within.
Within days, various sects and families saw turmoil with numerous sweeping servants troubled by youths seeking to become disciples, leaving them terrified yet puzzled, feeling harassed.
Some families were so disturbed that elders grew angry, punishing dream-chasing youths by making them squat under the sun all day.
But even the full day of squatting brought news.
In the Scripture Pavilion of Shaolin Temple, indeed, there is an unnamed sweeping old monk who hides as a grandmaster-level expert.
It’s said when the old monk was discovered, faced with visiting monks, he seemed utterly bewildered, unaware how he was exposed.
With Shaolin Temple’s news, family sects’ youths grew even more excited, some elders couldn’t resist going to investigate.
Of course, these bits of news were mere interludes amidst the bustling martial arts world; most eyes remained on the newly departed grandmaster.
Those with insight know well what a newly risen grandmaster signifies.
The formerly three-way stand-off becomes a division into four factions, meaning balance is broken, a sign that world order is about to shift dramatically!
Yet, unexpectedly for the leaders fretting day and night,
since the departure of the new grandmaster from Celestial Essence Sect, he has vanished into the masses, with no news henceforth.
Just as he once guarded the library silently for years, thereafter no information emerged, seeming to treat martial world fame as dirt.
Even with endless discussions in the martial arts world about the legendary grandmaster, with time the topic’s intensity gradually waned as the person did not stir.
Some say the "sweeper" sought no fame, now secluded in the secluded valley.
Others claim since the "sweeper" killed the Cyan Dragon Demon Venerable, it drew the arrogant Demon Sect Leader Jue Wutian to kill him in desolation, his body lying in the wilderness.
Speculation abounds, without consensus.
In a flash, three years passed.

chapters.title: Chapter 339 - 010: The Origin of Martial Arts
chapters.content:
Chapter 339: Chapter 010: The Origin of Martial Arts
Three years later, outside Xiangyun City.
These days, the area outside Xiangyun City has become lively.
Martial artists from afar have braved hardships to come here, inch by inch searching the vast forests for something.
These martial artists come in strange numbers, as Xiangyun City isn’t a Martial Arts Sacred Land nor the site of any martial arts gathering, yet the sudden influx of so many martial practitioners has left the mountain villagers perplexed.
Fortunately, among this large number of martial artists, there are many gallant heroes who treat riches like dirt, often spending lavishly to hire strong young men from the villages to venture into the Vast Mountains as guides, giving the villagers a rare opportunity to earn a considerable amount of silver coins.
The reason for this large gathering of martial artists is a rumor spreading across the martial world.
It is said that a Hunter, while evading a predator, accidentally stumbled into a secluded valley and discovered a mysterious White Jade Stele, bringing out a mostly destroyed ancient Cultivation Bamboo Scroll.
A capable individual in the martial world translated the first five characters of the scroll, which read:
Martial Arts Origin Scripture!
This incident stirred up great waves in the martial world, even rivaling the emergence of the mysterious Celestial Essence Grandmaster three years ago.
Because the Martial Arts Origin Scripture is tied to an ancient legend about the origins of martial arts in this world.
In the martial world, it is commonly believed that the origin of martial arts dates back to the earliest ancestors who mimicked tigers and leopards, following nature, and cultivated the first wisp of True Qi, thereby opening the path to martial arts.
Subsequently, through the changes of dynasties and the passage of time, it evolved to the flourishing diversity we see today.
This explanation is generally accepted by martial artists, and some major sects have even recorded it within their doctrines.
However, alongside this widespread belief, another theory circulates.
It is said that in ancient times, the ancestors mimicked tigers and leopards, fighting beasts in the White Water Black Mountain, but what they learned as "martial" was merely ordinary combat techniques, lacking any mystical elements of martial arts, nor did they cultivate True Qi.
What truly introduced Qi Cultivation in martial arts came from an extraordinary individual before the ancient Qin times—the Martial Ancestor!
Legend has it that back then, the Dao Ancestor and Martial Ancestor were exchanging teachings under Purple Bamboo Mountain, when one day a strange stone descended from the heavens and landed outside Purple Bamboo Mountain.
The Dao Ancestor comprehended the strange stone, observed the ways of nature, and thus obtained the Tao Te Ching, marking the opening of the great path.
The Martial Ancestor sat in meditation for seven days and nights, copying the patterns from the stone, and suddenly achieved enlightenment, thus paving the way for Qi Cultivation in martial arts.
Later, they debated for three days and nights, and the disciple of Dao Ancestor, Guan Yinzi, inscribed all the teachings of the two sages on the bamboo scrolls, naming it the Martial Arts Origin Scripture.
However, when the last word was inscribed and the scripture was completed,
heaven and earth reacted, with howling winds descending, akin to the wails of thousands of vengeful spirits, and blood rain fell from the sky.
Amidst the upheaval of wind and thunder, purple lightning struck down from the sky, obliterating most of the bamboo scroll that recorded the Martial Arts Origin Scripture.
The Dao Ancestor remarked, "A divine object is born and inevitably suffers the jealousy of heaven; the heavens wish not for its completion, there is no need to force it."
The Martial Ancestor also said, "The great path has fifty, and the heavens evolve forty-nine, leaving a thread of opportunity; this is as it should be."
Thus, they did not record it again.
Afterwards, the Martial Ancestor spread his teachings across the land, and martial arts began to flourish, gradually evolving into the state of Divine Land Martial Arts today.
The reason the Martial Ancestor fades from official history is said to be because, after achieving mastery in martial arts, he entered the Imperial Palace and, with unimaginable abilities, slew the ruler of the Liang Kingdom, the overlord of the Seven Kingdoms, under the watchful eyes of many, and single-handedly subdued the Seven Kingdoms, standing above worldly power.
After the Martial Ancestor vanished, the descendants of the Seven Kingdoms, feeling it too humiliating, burned books and buried scholars, erasing the Martial Ancestor’s name from history, leaving only fragments in unofficial histories, becoming a legend in the martial world.
Although it’s just a legend, as the saying goes, where there’s smoke, there’s fire, perhaps in the distant ancient times, there really was such a Martial Ancestor.
Now that the Martial Arts Origin Scripture has emerged, how could it not attract the attention of martial artists?
But if it were only that, if merely some unofficial history of the Martial Ancestor surfaced, it might not have stirred such a storm.
After all, not everyone is interested in delving into history.
But this time involves the Martial Arts Origin Scripture, which is said to be rejected by heaven and earth!
According to legend, the Martial Ancestor, as the founder of martial arts under heaven, blessed by heaven and earth, reached an unparalleled realm that transcends even the Grandmaster level, surpassing all worldly powers!
And if one could obtain the Martial Arts Origin Scripture, they would unravel all the mysteries of martial arts, and even the most dull-witted could swiftly reach the ultimate pinnacle of martial arts.
This is the revelation that truly caused an uproar in the martial world, leading countless martial artists to flock to Xiangyun City.
The villager who obtained the Martial Arts Origin Scripture disappeared without a trace after selling it to the Treasure Pavilion in Xiangyun City, along with the ruin of his village.
Following that, the Treasure Pavilion also fell prey to a mysterious attack, turning to ruins overnight, and the Martial Arts Origin Scripture vanished without a trace.
Initially, it was just rumors, and although they aroused some interest, it wouldn’t compel countless martial artists to abandon their pursuits and rush to Xiangyun City.
What truly set things off was an incident half a month ago, involving the sole survivor of the Hongfu Escort Agency massacre, Zhang Zhiqi, who miraculously escaped with severed meridians. Somehow, he gained near Grandmaster-level cultivation and stormed the Taihang Mountain, annihilating the Taixing Thirteen Bandits who had slaughtered the Hongfu Escort Agency decades ago.
How could a person with shattered Dantian and severed meridians acquire such martial prowess overnight?
It truly makes one ponder deeply.
Later, it was discovered that during the mysterious attack on the Treasure Pavilion in Xiangyun City, Zhang Zhiqi happened to be in Xiangyun City.
After extensive investigation, it was concluded that on that very day, Zhang Zhiqi, who begged his way to Xiangyun City, fortuitously acquired the incomplete Martial Arts Origin Scripture amidst the chaos and received a great fortune, achieving astonishing cultivation powers and avenging his enemies.
This sparked a frenzy in the entire martial world.
Numerous people who dream of leaping to greatness became excited, eager to seize the Martial Arts Origin Scripture.
But after vanquishing the Taixing Thirteen Bandits, Zhang Zhiqi vanished without a trace.
With no other choice, in pursuit of further opportunities and the chance for that leap to greatness, countless martial artists gathered outside Xiangyun City, hoping to find the secluded valley that lucky Hunter had reached, hoping to discover the relics left by the Martial Ancestor, even if it were just a fragment of the Martial Arts Origin Scripture.
Hence, during this period, a large number of martial artists have gathered here, continuously exploring the mountains outside Xiangyun City.

chapters.title: Chapter 340 - 011: In Front of the Gate of the Celestial Being (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 340: Chapter 011: In Front of the Gate of the Celestial Being (Third Update)
Outside Xiangyun City, amidst a bustling crowd, inside a quiet courtyard, Li Hu sat on a stone stool, holding a half-charred ancient bamboo slip in his hand, and sighed helplessly.
"Master, this matter arose because of the servant. Allow me to go explain clearly to those people."
At this moment, a young man dressed as a servant standing respectfully beside Li Hu stepped forward and spoke.
This person was clearly only about twenty years old, yet his face showed a weariness unexpected for someone of his age.
If someone familiar were here, they would surely be shocked, for the young man attending Li Hu was surprisingly Zhang Zhiqi, who had recently stirred great waves in the Martial World from the remnants of Hongfu Escort Agency!
"No need for that. Although these people have disrupted my plans, having them scout is not bad. The mountains outside Xiangyun City stretch for hundreds and thousands of miles. If I were to search alone, who knows when I’d find the place. If they can locate it, that would be excellent."
Li Hu shook his head slightly, speaking in a faint voice.
He tidied up the Martial Arts Origin Scripture in his hand and looked at the young man beside him.
"You need not do so. Although I granted you this strength, it was merely to find someone to test my skills. It was your luck that you survived and broke through to a half-step Grandmaster. Moreover, you offered the Martial Arts Origin Scripture to me. There is no debt between us."
His indifferent voice flowed like clear music in the air; Li Hu no longer looked at the person before him and slowly stood up.
With a few steps, he disappeared outside the door in an instant, as if shrinking the earth into inches, leaving only a faint voice resonating in the air.
"Go, you have avenged your great enemies. Do not demean yourself; I do not need a servant..."
"Master!"
Zhang Zhiqi was greatly alarmed, yet Li Hu’s figure had already drifted away, completely disappearing from his perception.
He stood motionless for a long, long time before bowing deeply towards the direction Li Hu left.
"Master teaches me Techniques, guides me onto the path, helps me to avenge, with grace as heavy as a mountain; how could a mere booklet be enough to repay?"
Zhang Zhiqi’s eyes reddened slightly, tears streaming down.
Alas, Li Hu had already gone far away.
The speculation in the Martial World was correct; the Martial Arts Origin Scripture was indeed acquired by Zhang Zhiqi that day.
But the Martial Arts Origin Scripture was not the cause of his transformation into a half-step Grandmaster; a mere ancient bamboo slip, even if influenced by the Purple Thunder Power, couldn’t possibly grant someone Heaven-Reaching Cultivation overnight.
If it truly could, the original lucky Hunter who first obtained the Martial Arts Origin Scripture wouldn’t have left no bones behind, and the Treasure Pavilion managers wouldn’t have perished under mysterious attackers.
...
Li Hu, drifting away, faintly perceived Zhang Zhiqi’s reaction behind him,
but he did not care.
During these three years, he transformed countless times and traveled everywhere, sometimes as the Shaolin Firework Head Monk, chopping wood and burning fires in the kitchen for half a year.
Sometimes he transformed into a merchant, selling local specialties on the street before Celestial Sword Manor.
Other times he became a barefoot doctor, traversing the South Wilderness Mountains.
In these three years, he practically traversed the entire world.
From the Sacred Land of Martial Arts at Shaolin Temple, to the seven major sects of the Central Plains, and even the Demon Sect Forbidden Cave, countless places have seen his shadow.
Simultaneously, with extremely powerful Spiritual Power’s help, every sect, every family, all their archived books and secret martial arts manuals have fallen into Li Hu’s hands.
The various secret martial arts of the entire Martial World were all explored and acquired by him, assimilated within himself.
This is the effect of extremely powerful Spiritual Power. Although various Talent Magic in the Main World cannot be utilized in this non-magical world, Spiritual Power, except for its physical endurance limit, has no restriction.
Even due to different Martial Arts, the powerful Spiritual Power has formed an effect similar to Divine Sense in Cultivation.
And it is because of this immense Spiritual Power that Li Hu not only acquired ninety-nine percent of the Martial Arts Secret Manuals as if in a realm without anyone, but comprehended them thoroughly, assimilating them within himself.
No one in the entire Martial World knows that their cherished martial inheritance has been utterly stolen by an unremarkable, ghostly wanderer, becoming his own possession.
And having assimilated ninety-nine percent of today’s Martial Arts essence, Li Hu’s Cultivation has reached the pinnacle unobtainable in worldly Martial Arts.
The pinnacle of Grandmaster!
Residing in this Realm, he can already touch the unseen yet existent ceiling above.
If he could break through the ceiling’s bottleneck constraints, he would enter another Realm—
Celestial Being!
The Celestial Essence Sect’s founder who left the Celestial Heart Treasure Manual only deduced the possibility of the Celestial Human Realm’s existence.
But now, Li Hu has truly seen the existence of that Realm, and stands before its door.
Li Hu’s strength is now undeniably the foremost in the Martial World.
However, Li Hu cares not for fame and fortune within the Martial World, having not acted for three years, leaving outsiders completely unaware.
Unfortunately, even though Li Hu has ascended to the peak of Martial Arts and thoroughly studied the secret manuals of ninety-nine percent of the world, possessing unfathomable knowledge, he still has no clue on entering the Celestial Human Realm.
To pave a direct path to breaking space-time, besides great wisdom and determination, one must at least reach the ultimate pinnacle of Martial Arts, only then having the possibility to pioneer with an advantage.
To achieve this goal, transcend the world.
The Martial Arts Celestial Being is the precondition for his testimony before that.
However, the barrier before Celestial Being remains insurmountable.
While Li Hu was pondering deeply, he inadvertently traveled to Xiangyun City and watched an interesting drama.
A fortunate Hunter survived disaster and acquired a treasure, the greedy Treasure Pavilion managers murdered to seize treasure, acted rashly and leaked the news, leading to the intervention of the hidden Demon Sect in the city.
Ultimately, amidst the chaos, it fell into the hands of Zhang Zhiqi, a disabled beggar for years.
Li Hu recalled the world’s rumors of the origin of Martial Arts, thinking of tracing back ancient origins that might reveal the hint to break into the Celestial Human.
Thus, he appeared before Zhang Zhiqi, proposing a trade to acquire the Martial Arts Origin Scripture.
This was the true situation.
The Martial Arts Origin Scripture merely recorded the words exchanged between the Dao Ancestor and the Martial Ancestor discussing the Dao years ago, with half of it already erased by Purple Thunder.
Although the mutual discussions within transport Li Hu through space-time, back to ancient times hearing two greatest ancestors’ lectures, the weave of various ideologies made him gain tremendously.
Yet, in reality, the Martial Arts Origin Scripture doesn’t possess such destiny-altering capability for ordinary people.
"Dao Ancestor and Martial Ancestor indeed possess the innate Saint demeanor. Just a few words recording their conversation already pointed me towards breaking through to Celestial Being. Their Cultivation has surely exceeded Grandmaster! Now, I’m just missing a hint to break into Celestial Human—that’s the extraterrestrial stone that fell beside Dao Ancestor and Martial Ancestor!"
Clearing his heart of clouds, Li Hu now found his direction, quickly stepping outside the city, his figure disappearing into the crowd.

chapters.title: Chapter 341 - 012: Jue Wutian
chapters.content:
Chapter 341: Chapter 012: Jue Wutian
Southern Wilderness,
the Demon Sect headquarters, Demon God Mountain.
Gloomy clouds enveloped the heavens and earth, and the entire Demon God Mountain rarely saw the sun throughout the year, as if the Nine Netherworld had descended upon the mortal realm.
It is said that Demon God Mountain was where Chi You was defeated and beheaded during the ancient battle with the Yellow Emperor, thus tainted by demonic blood, becoming despised by heaven and earth, never to see daylight again.
After the Demon Sect lost the struggle against righteousness in the Central Plains, they established their sect’s headquarters here, ruling over a hundred thousand miles of the South Wilderness Mountains.
Wooooo!
Between heaven and earth, the eerie wind howled, as if thousands of demons and spirits were wailing in the world.
That night, the sky above showed not a single star, torches on Demon God Mountain coiled and stretched like a dragon, illuminating every corner of the sect.
At this moment, within the entire Demon God Mountain, all high-ranking members of the Southern Demon Sect gathered here, waiting respectfully.
At a certain moment,
Whoosh!
The dark clouds above were stirred by a mysterious force, causing layers upon layers to converge into a massive vortex reaching through the heavens and earth at Demon God Mountain.
