Henceforth, to Li Hu, in the Martial World whether Grandmaster or Postnatal Martial Artist, it holds no meaning.
Celestial Being, akin to the spokesperson of the world’s heavens!
Li Hu’s gaze reaches into the void, the void ahead extends infinitely, seemingly seeing through the limits of the world.
"On the Martial Arts path, Refining Essence and Qi, this is the road created by Martial Ancestor over thousands of years."
"This road reaches an end, no further shore."
"To shatter the void, I must rely on myself, create a new road to validate the Great Dao!"
Though, this world’s Martial Arts cannot shatter the void.
This does not mean Li Hu’s efforts over ten years were wasted.
It is by cultivating Martial Arts that Li Hu reached the pinnacle of world Martial Arts, only at a higher summit can one see farther.
He unveiled a fragment of truth through the world’s various secrets.
Li Hu has ideas.
To improve Martial Arts, to develop a path to shatter the void.
When facing no path ahead, one can only forge a path forward.
Yet, this is not easy, he needs to organize ideas formed over ten years, to find the most likely road.
Using Martial Arts as the foundation, create a transcendental path.
And then, Martial Arts spread throughout the world.
Preferably, transform this Martial Hero World to one of fantasy or immortal heroism, a world capable of transcendence.
If Li Hu were still a Grandmaster, this would be an impressive yet fanciful dream.
But having read nine-tenths of all Martial Arts, undergone transformation, entered the Celestial Human Realm.
Celestial Being, one who commands heavenly power.
In this world, able to see through the principles of worldly operation, commanding earthly divine might, Li Hu could even self-title as Celestial Emperor!
And this is his greatest confidence in contemplating the transformation of this world!
In the Deserted Valley, Li Hu’s eyes swirl with clear light, formulating a series of plans in his heart.
And then, his presence quietly disappears into the void.
None knows, in the place where Dao Ancestor and Martial Ancestor once sat and discussed Dao, someone quietly entered the Celestial Human Realm, something none reached since the two ancestors.
With Li Hu’s disappearance, the Deserted Valley again falls into silence.
As if during thousands of years, nothing has ever occurred.

chapters.title: Chapter 352 - 023 Foundation Stone
chapters.content:
Chapter 352: Chapter 023 Foundation Stone
Five years later, deep within Jade Capital Mountain,
a secluded and expansive courtyard stood quietly amidst the vast, rolling mountains.
Jade Capital Mountain, the first among the five sacred peaks of the Central Plains, has long been the site of imperial sacrifices, imbued with the fortune of Heaven and Earth, its landscapes picturesque and its spiritual atmosphere harmonious, attracting many Daoist recluses for their cultivation.
This grand courtyard was established many years ago by a high-ranking noble as a place for peaceful retreat away from the mundane world.
Unfortunately, after that noble’s family fell from grace, the courtyard naturally changed hands to others.
Five years ago, a mysterious young man purchased this courtyard.
Most of the original servants were given a sum of money and then dismissed, leaving only a few lonely or homeless ones to stay behind and manage some of the external affairs.
Since this mysterious young man bought the courtyard, he has often stayed indoors, with no notable friends visiting, frequently secluding himself deep within the courtyard doing unknown things, forbidding anyone from venturing further inside, even the original servants could only clean the periphery.
Occasionally, only an old Daoist from the nearby White Cloud Temple would come over for a friendly visit.
The behavior of the courtyard’s owner naturally stirred speculation among the nearby villagers.
However, the owner has dealt fairly in the past when buying and selling vegetables and other goods, and unlike the oppressive scions in other places, he never harassed the common people, which was considered a blessing by the local villagers.
On this day,
deep within the courtyard, in a grand hall adorned with a Yin Yang Tai Chi Diagram and filled with Daoist aura, Li Hu sat cross-legged on a meditation mat, completing his practice and exhaling deeply.
Mist condensed into Sword Qi and shot out, seemingly slicing through the very void before dissipating slowly after a moment.
In front of him, a massive alchemy tripod stood at the center of the hall, its heat gradually dispersing to the surroundings.
Upon lifting the lid, a rich fragrance of elixir wafted out, permeating every corner of the hall.
At the center of the alchemy tripod, several flawless, radiant pills hovered, exuding an alluring elixir scent.
Li Hu took out a pill and swallowed it directly.
With the refinement of True Essence inside his body, the potent medicinal power spread out, replenishing a trace of the Primordial Qi he had consumed in an instant.
Don’t underestimate this mere trace—in terms of Li Hu’s Celestial Human Realm, which is vast and seemingly infinite.
If it were an ordinary Postnatal Martial Artist, one pill would be enough to replenish the consumed Primordial Qi.
Even for Innate, Grandmaster Level experts, the effect is remarkable.
"It’s finally done!"
Putting the pills from the alchemy tripod back into a jade bottle, he gazed at the fruits of his five-year labor in the palm of his hand, a smile of delight appearing at the corners of his mouth, his eyes filled with joy.
Using the Nourishing Yuan Pill as an aid during cultivation at least equates to ten days of effort.
With these pills that can substantially replenish a martial artist’s Qi, the speed of Refining Essence and Qi will increase by ten times or even dozens of times!
"The Moon Star Grass has been successfully cultivated, and with the Nourishing Yuan Pill derived from Moonwalking Grass, great things can be achieved!"
Even with Li Hu’s disposition, he couldn’t help but feel a stir of excitement at this moment.
Five years ago,
after advancing to the Celestial Human Realm of Martial Arts, with no further progress, Li Hu began to seek the path to shatter barriers in this world.
After much consideration, he decided to spread martial arts under heaven, to create a mystical immortal path based on martial arts.
But this path was not easy.
Firstly, there were issues with this world itself.
Ever since the Martial Ancestor pioneered the martial path of Refining Essence and Qi thousands of years ago, no one has transcended the Celestial Human Realm to establish a new lineage, causing a fundamental advance in the world. This is not due to the lack of geniuses throughout Divine Land’s thousands of years but rather the restrictions of the world itself.
Refining Essence and Qi means internal refinement, transforming essence into Qi.
Unless one is an exceptionally talented genius able to harmonize essence and Qi, martial artists require substantial quantities of meat or medicinal materials to replenish the Primordial Qi they consume during Qi cultivation.
Otherwise, excessive cultivation would lead to a depletion of bodily Qi, making the great path all the more elusive.
Li Hu was able to advance from nothing to Grandmaster in just six years thanks to his powerful Spiritual Power, allowing him to fine-tune operations so that the Nourishing Essence Technique and Body Strengthening Skill complemented each other, drawing in Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi to replenish himself.
Even so, during the early stages of Qi Refining, Li Hu more than once had to rely on the Celestial Essence Sect’s kitchen.
If it were anyone else, not to mention becoming a Grandmaster,
it would be impossible to reach the Grandmaster Level in just six years without adequate resources, and Refining Essence and Qi would otherwise reduce a person to nothing.
Unless one is a genius naturally blessed with rapid cultivation speed and martial arts comprehension, backed by a great power and supported by countless centuries-old medicinal materials, along with various pills to enhance power and other such advantages combined.
Otherwise, a regular person practicing straightforward perseverance without rest would need at least sixty to seventy years just to break through to Grandmaster.
This timeline assumes continual training without rest; otherwise, these calculations should be doubled.
Considering all these stringent conditions, how many have met them in the thousands of years of martial arts history?
The scarcity of resources at the base, constraints on Refining Essence and Qi, have kept the number of high-end martial artists at a significantly limited range.
In the entire Divine Land martial world, each era produces no more than five Grandmasters, and even fewer than fifty at the Grandmaster Level.
Historically, every successful societal transformation has come from the bottom up, driven by a strong grassroots base, enabling active change.
In such scarcity of high-end martial power, how can Divine Land’s martial world enact a transformation or cause an evolution in martial arts, catalyzing a rise in the world?
Because of such restrictions, throughout thousands of years, even though many divine skills and brilliant ideas emerged in the martial world, they couldn’t spread due to the world’s limitations, fading into the river of time, unable to change martial arts development or push the world’s advancement.
The economic base determines the superstructure.
Without a solid foundation, even if Li Hu created more divine skills, even if he developed a mystical immortal path, what use would it be if no one can cultivate it to a profound realm?
Not everyone is like Li Hu, who, wielding powerful bonuses, could ascend to Grandmaster Level with the simple Nourishing Essence Technique.
Without enabling individuals to cultivate some of his experimental cultivation techniques to high realms, how could Li Hu rely on the martial world to test the broken path he created?
It is precisely because of this, seeing this flaw in the martial world’s development history, that Li Hu decided to make a change.
The Star Moon Grass and Nourishing Yuan Pill were products of this decision.
Just like the food chain in biology, only a vastly enriched primary producer base can sustain more life.
Starting with the Star Moon Grass and Nourishing Yuan Pill, by significantly enhancing a martial artist’s ability to replenish the Qi consumed during Refining Essence and Qi from nature, by relying on elixirs to rapidly boost martial artists’ cultivation speed, it lays the foundation for martial arts to thrive and undergo transformation.
After five years of effort, I have finally developed the cornerstone for changing the world today.

chapters.title: Chapter 353 - 024 Elixir
chapters.content:
Chapter 353: Chapter 024 Elixir
Li Hu stood up tall, his steps as if shrinking inches, and in just a few breaths, he walked into the inner courtyard.
In front of him, in this secluded clearing, a medicinal field had been opened up.
On it grew sparse and uneven plants, with leaves resembling the starry sky at night, the Star Moon Grass.
The servants were always forbidden from entering the inner courtyard.
This was because of the entire garden of Star Moon Grass.
It is the primary material for refining the Nourishing Yuan Pill, and also the key for Li Hu to change the Divine Land Martial Arts, elevating the Martial Hero World to a fantasy Xianxia world.
"Simply relying on the power of starlight and moonlight is ultimately not enough. We must find a way to concentrate the power of starlight and moonlight around here at night. Only then can the cultivated Star Moon Grass grow more luxuriantly. I wonder if, when the concentrated starlight and moonlight reach a certain level, it will produce the legendary Emperor’s Liquid."
"The transformation of plants cannot stop. Although the achievement of five years only successfully transformed the Star Moon Grass, other types of plants cannot be abandoned. I must try more, strive to transform more kinds of spirit medicine to provide for the development of alchemy..."
Gazing at the sparse Star Moon Grass in front of him, Li Hu secretly calculated in his heart.
Five years ago, Li Hu began to travel the world, searching for something that could change the world. After several years, he finally found it growing in the high mountain tundra of the freezing ice plateau in the southwest—a grass plant that absorbed starlight and moonlight, capable of replenishing a martial artist’s primordial Qi.
Li Hu meticulously researched its growing environment, using methods as wondrous as a celestial being, akin to an earthly immortal, to catalyze its growth and gradually improve it, until it could finally grow in normal environments, and then brought it back to the Central Plains, naming it Star Moon Grass.
In the martial world, there were also martial arts secret techniques practiced by absorbing the power of starlight and moonlight. Back when Li Hu was sweeping and cultivating quietly in the Celestial Essence Sect’s library, he had also thought about a divine skill art based on the absorption of star moon energy.
If it were Li Hu’s previous material world, the light from stars and moons at night would naturally hold no energy.
But in this world, the Power of the Constellations truly exists. The starry sky above contains extremely vast energy. Although that energy is greatly consumed passing through layers of atmospheric protection, the mere trace that leaks out is enough to support the growth and reproduction of Star Moon Grass.
Through the transformation by Star Moon Grass, the violent Star Evil Energy scattered from above the nine heavens is converted into primordial Qi between heaven and earth, continuously strengthening the world’s foundation.
Ultimately, only with a sufficiently robust foundation can it sustain Li Hu’s plan to transform the martial hero world in his mind.
In the span of five years, Li Hu, using mysterious methods akin to celestial beings, both cultivated Star Moon Grass and integrated medical tomes from around the world, becoming proficient in the five energies of the human body, yin and yang operations, and exploring the method of using Star Moon Grass to concoct cultivation elixirs.
Through five years of exploration, Li Hu finally succeeded not only in cultivating Star Moon Grass that could survive in ordinary conditions but also in figuring out a fundamental alchemy dao technique.
The Nourishing Yuan Pill was the fruit of that successful experiment in alchemy.
"It’s just a pity that the cultivation of the Star Moon Grass still requires certain conditions and is somewhat difficult to breed. Moreover, due to the Star Evil Power being blocked by the atmosphere, it takes at least three years from planting to maturity, and it still needs further improvement."
"However, it is sufficient for now. Over these five years, I’ve also developed cultivation techniques of the fantasy Xianxia type that allow rapid advancement using the Nourishing Yuan Pill. It’s time to start laying the groundwork."
He has already completed the conditions needed to change the world.
What remains is how to widely spread it across the world.
Although Star Moon Grass and the Nourishing Yuan Pill are excellent, directly giving others the means to cultivate them is out of the question, as they might suspect ulterior motives behind such free benefits.
So the promotion requires careful planning.
"Perhaps, I should establish a sect?"
Li Hu frowned slightly. The thought of establishing a force in this world was something he really didn’t want to consider.
Forget it, he thought. Rest and consolidate the harvest of these past five years first. This matter can be revisited later.
Li Hu put aside the worries in his mind.
Then, the voice of a servant came from outside the courtyard:
"Young Master, the Baiyang Daoist from the White Cloud Temple is here to visit."
White Cloud Temple stood not far from Li Hu’s secluded courtyard. Initially, that old Baiyang Daoist seemed very interested in Li Hu’s arrival. After a few casual visits, Li Hu discovered that this old Taoist had cultivated for most of his life, mastering various pharmacology and alchemy techniques, and thus was not stingy with their friendship.
Though Li Hu’s fame in the martial world was widespread, he had only appeared in public two or three times. This world was not the same as the modern one full of information, where famous celebrities could upload a photo and become world-renowned, being recognized wherever they went. As a result, few in the martial world truly recognized him, let alone an old hermit like Baiyang.
Of course, most critically, Li Hu was the only one in thousands of years to advance to the Celestial Human Realm, with power and divine prestige akin to a Martial Arts Celestial Emperor.
With such a gap in levels, if he chose not to show himself, others simply couldn’t recognize him.
Though in daily life Li Hu was very restrained, reaching a realm of returning to simplicity, the divine couldn’t be gazed upon directly. If he chose to hide, no one under heaven could find him.
"Understood, go entertain him for a bit, and I’ll be there shortly."
The Baiyang Daoist was deeply versed in medicine and alchemy dao, though the elixirs he concocted were mostly potent pills and remedies for injuries, far from the Nourishing Yuan Pill, and even further from the alchemy technique Li Hu had founded after years of contemplation.
Nevertheless, both medicine and alchemy require not just talent but ample practice.
The practical experience of the Baiyang Daoist had provided much assistance to Li Hu.
And through their mutual exchanges, the two had become friends.
Now that his alchemy technique was established and Star Moon Grass successfully cultivated, Baiyang Daoist’s help was indispensable.
A moment later, having tidied himself up, Li Hu emerged from the back hall.
In the hall, an old Taoist with white hair and beard was already seated in the guest seat.
"Haha, as soon as I entered, I heard the magpies chirping joyfully overhead and smelled a rich fragrance in the air. Did you have any gains today, my young brother?"
Stroking his white beard, Baiyang Daoist greeted Li Hu with a smile upon his arrival.
"I knew I couldn’t hide it from your dog’s nose. This is the result of my years of research. Take a look."
Saying this, Li Hu turned his hand over and took out the jade bottle from earlier, tossing it over to the Baiyang Daoist before sitting down to drink tea.
"This elixir has a nice aroma. Seems like you’ve had some significant gains recently!"
Even though the jade bottle had been sealed with beeswax, threads of fragrance still leaked out.
"Tsk, even knowing you’ve had a breakthrough recently, such things shouldn’t be casually thrown out. What if it breaks?"
While muttering, Baiyang Daoist opened the seal.
Immediately, a rich aroma wafted out, and just by inhaling it briefly, he felt an impending breakthrough within his cultivation, which had stagnated for years.
"This is!!!"
The serene expression on Baiyang Daoist’s face changed drastically in an instant.
After all, he was an innately skilled martial artist, so what kind of elixir was this!!!
Just a single whiff of its scent made him feel as if his bottleneck was loosening, on the verge of a breakthrough!

chapters.title: Chapter 354 - 25: Dao Ancestor
chapters.content:
Chapter 354: Chapter 25: Dao Ancestor
The old Daoist Baiyang had spent his entire life crafting elixirs, and naturally, he had keen insight. The newly brewed nameless elixir before him was truly within the scope of a divine elixir.
Even Shaolin Temple’s treasured Great Rejuvenation Pill couldn’t possibly compare to the terrifying effect of this elixir.
In a daze, the old Daoist Baiyang recalled when Li Hu arrived here five years ago.
At that time, his courtyard in the deep mountains began a massive relocation, and having cultivated for half his life, he suddenly had a feeling about this new neighbor being extraordinary. So, he took the opportunity of the other’s housewarming to deliberately establish a relationship.
He then discovered the young man was beginning to delve into the techniques of alchemy, which hit Baiyang’s interest.
You should know that in the Martial World, such skills are really not much appreciated by ordinary martial artists, considered as lowly, unrefined arts.
Baiyang had cultivated for half his life with a honed proficiency in alchemy, a skill more or less known only to himself on regular days. Now, with the sudden appearance of a kindred spirit, how could he resist? Driven by his heart’s inclination to teach, he couldn’t help but guide and engage in exchanges.
The friendship between the two was thus established.
Old Daoist Baiyang knew this young man had great talent in alchemy because, within half a year’s effort, he had exhausted all of Baiyang’s half-life alchemy experience and was basically untaughtable, even being able to teach in return.
But no matter how talented, there must be some degree of limit, right?
The elixir in his hand—how could this be possible!
This is definitely an entirely new elixir, a recipe that could change the entire Martial Arts world!
Within just five years, how could this young man have reached such a level?
The old Daoist Baiyang fell into a trance, with a feeling akin to being the waves behind the Yangtze River, crashing upon the waves before, washed ashore on the beach.
Now, he no longer understood the world.
First, there appeared the once-in-a-millennium peerless demonic genius Jue Wutian, and then the overwhelmingly brilliant Grandmaster Li Hu.
Despite a lifetime of cultivation, he and others were no match even for a single finger of this youth.
Now even his most skilled artistry, alchemy, was overshadowed by this young man from God-knows-where.
He was old, truly old.
In his heart, the old Daoist Baiyang sighed continuously.
The complexity in the old Daoist’s heart was naturally unknown to Li Hu.
"This bottle of elixir is a gift to you, old Daoist. I also have a compendium of new alchemy techniques I’ve organized over the past five years for you, as thanks for your care to me during this time."
Saying this, he took out a booklet and handed it to the old Daoist Baiyang.
The old Daoist Baiyang solemnly received it, composed himself, and couldn’t resist flipping through it.
After a while, he closed the booklet, his face full of amazement.
"Extraordinary talent! You intend to forge a new path of alchemy. In the future, the Martial World will surely witness the rise of a new lineage of Pill Sect!"
Compared to the old Daoist’s method of using firewood to craft elixirs, the alchemy basics in this book seemed almost miraculous.
The bottle of Nourishing Yuan Pill, although its effect was greatly enhanced due to the Star Moon Grass,
Even without the Star Moon Grass, with this basic handbook on alchemy, the old Daoist Baiyang believed that soon, he would be able to use ordinary ingredients to concoct pills comparable to Shaolin Temple’s Great Rejuvenation Pill!
In a thousand years, based on Li Hu’s accomplishments, he could be known as the Pill Ancestor!
"Alas, your gift is of great importance; I know myself best. In the beginning, even if I didn’t share those alchemy experiences, you could’ve figured them out by yourself."
With a gesture, the old Daoist Baiyang stopped Li Hu from speaking further and continued:
"Having received such a grand gift from you, I’m truly undeserving. But having seen and memorized your alchemy technique, I can at least offer you a reasonable recompense."
"Old Daoist, you don’t need to do this. These things are of little concern to me."
Li Hu declined, as he had no intention of hoarding his knowledge.
When he initially developed alchemy, it was to strengthen the foundation of the Divine Land Martial Arts, to conduct experiments in world ascension, and to forge a path of shattered voids.
If he could propagate the Star Moon Grass and alchemy in a short period, he would be delighted beyond measure.
However, the old Daoist Baiyang seemed not to have heard him, continuing to ask on his own:
"Little brother, did you know, back when the Martial Ancestor pioneered martial arts and the Dao Ancestor once also established a lineage?"
"Oh, Dao Ancestor?"
According to legend, thousands of years ago, the Martial Ancestor and Dao Ancestor debated beneath Purple Bamboo Mountain when a meteorite came from the heavens. The Martial Ancestor observed the stone for seven days and nights to develop martial arts and Qi cultivation.
This martial arts legend had already been widely spread since the emergence of the Martial Arts Origin Scripture five years ago.
And in that unnamed valley, there were two meditation cushions, the Dao aura filling the valley, and that meteorite from beyond the skies.
Based on the valley’s conditions, Li Hu was certain that there were few discrepancies from the actual events.
However, Li Hu always had a question.
This question remained unanswered despite traveling the world and using Divine Sense to explore countless books.
That is,
The Martial Ancestor pioneered martial arts and Qi cultivation and was hence known as Martial Ancestor,
Then what about the Dao Ancestor?
Why is the Dao Ancestor called the Dao Ancestor?
In historical texts, traces of the Martial Ancestor, like the dominance among the Seven Central Plains Countries, still existed.
But the Dao Ancestor seemed to have emerged from thin air.
Aside from the debate with the Martial Ancestor below Purple Bamboo Mountain and the creation of the Martial Arts Origin Scripture, there were no other tales of the Dao Ancestor.
Like a historical phantom that suddenly appeared, everyone naturally called him the Dao Ancestor.
Very strange,
No deeds yet naturally called the Dao Ancestor.
Moreover, when the two ancestors debated at Purple Bamboo Mountain, the Dao Ancestor should have also gleaned something from the meteorite. But why has no Dao Ancestor lineage or inheritance ever appeared in this world?
Thus, when the old Daoist Baiyang mentioned the Dao Ancestor, it immediately captured Li Hu’s attention.
"Actually, a long time ago, I don’t know exactly when, but the Dao Ancestor did have a lineage, just like the Martial Ancestor’s martial arts and Qi cultivation. Then a great change occurred; I don’t know what happened exactly, and probably no one in the Martial World knows either. But after that, the Dao Ancestor’s direct lineage vanished from this world."
"Although the Dao Ancestor’s direct lineage disappeared, some offshoot branches survived. Due to that great change, ancestors avoided declaring it. These offshoots were passed down internally from generation to generation, unbeknownst to the Martial World."
"Our White Cloud Temple is one of those offshoot branches of the Dao Ancestor’s lineage."
"Alchemy, array, divination, Eight Trigrams, Qimen Qi Fortune Divination... all these things thought of as martial cons are actually true, part of the Dao Ancestor’s offshoot lineage."
"My alchemical methods are one of those inheritances."
"Unfortunately, after thousands of years, many inheritances have been lost or remain incomplete. I spent half my life thinking I was supplementing the Dao Ancestor’s ancillary alchemy technique but compared to you, it’s a joke."
"I lack talent and holding onto it would only bring ridicule, so I’ll willingly pass it all onto you. If you could complete the Dao Ancestor’s lineage, it would put my heart at ease when I meet our ancestors from the White Cloud Temple after I pass."
Originally, Li Hu intended to decline the old Daoist Baiyang’s offer.
But upon hearing the words ’Dao Ancestor’s offshoot lineage’, ’Qimen Dunjia’, and ’array’, he could no longer shift his focus away.
If arrays and Qimen Dunjia could help, they might significantly enhance the starlight and moonshine in the medicinal fields, thus realizing the maturity and large-scale cultivation of Star Moon Grass!
Moreover, he was genuinely intrigued by the Dao Ancestor’s offshoot lineage.
What exactly happened back then that caused the existence and lineage of the Dao Ancestor to disappear from history?
And back then, what matter remained from an entity of the same level as the Martial Ancestor? Could it reveal a glimpse into the charisma left behind by the Dao Ancestor?
Furthermore, during their time, the Dao Ancestor, who was an equal to the Martial Ancestor, must have left behind something significant. Could it help to restore the lost legacy of the ancient traditions?
When the old Daoist Baiyang brought up the Dao Ancestor, it immediately drew Li Hu’s focused attention.
"In truth, a long time ago, I can’t recall when, but there was a lineage from the Dao Ancestor too, like the Martial Ancestor’s martial arts and Qi cultivation. Later, something drastic happened. I don’t really know what it was, but probably nobody in the Martial World knows for sure. After that, the direct lineage of the Dao Ancestor vanished."
"But the auxiliary branches of the Dao Ancestor’s lineage still survived because, due to that great change, our forebears didn’t dare declare it. These auxiliary pathways have been handed down secretly from generation to generation, and now they are not known in the Martial World."
"Our White Cloud Temple is one of those offshoot branches of the Dao Ancestor’s lineage."
"Alchemy, array, divination, Eight Trigrams, these signs you mentioned, these techniques are indeed the offshoot lineage of the Dao Ancestor."
"My alchemical techniques are one of the handed-down inheritances."
"I spent half my life thinking I had completed the Dao Ancestor’s auxiliary art of alchemy, and now compared to you, that’s simply a joke."
"Unfortunately, over thousands of years, many inheritances have been lost or remain incomplete. I thought I had completed the Dao Ancestor’s auxiliary art of alchemy, but compared to you, that is simply laughable."
"Nevertheless, I will pass everything I know to you. If you can complete the Dao Ancestor’s lineage, I can rest in peace when meeting the ancestors of White Cloud Temple in the afterlife."
Initially, Li Hu intended to decline the old Daoist Baiyang’s goodwill.
But upon hearing the words ’Dao Ancestor’s offshoot lineage’, ’Qimen Dunjia’, ’array’ his attention could no longer shift away.

chapters.title: Chapter 355 - 026: Strategizing the World
chapters.content:
Chapter 355: Chapter 026: Strategizing the World
"Then I won’t be polite. Since you, the old Daoist, don’t hide anything, there are still some Star Moon Grass in the courtyard. You can transplant some back, and I can also teach you some planting techniques."
Back in the day, Li Hu traveled the world, peeking at Martial Arts books primarily from large sects and grand families.
Sects like the White Cloud Temple, hidden in deep forests, are countless throughout the Jade Capital Mountain range, and Li Hu could not scour the entire world inch by inch.
Since the old Daoist Baiyang is such a tactful person, Li Hu naturally couldn’t take advantage casually.
The old Daoist Baiyang nodded, feeling both joyful and complex inside.
However, that day, he copied a portion of the Dao Ancestor’s branch arts within the temple and soon immersed himself in Li Hu’s Alchemy.
Li Hu didn’t linger either; he started researching upon receiving the copy.
In the blink of an eye, another five years passed.
During these five years, Li Hu finally understood many techniques in the Dao Ancestor’s branch inheritance and filled in the missing parts based on his understanding.
Utilizing the Qimen Dunjia Array, Li Hu established an array akin to the Spirit Gathering Array to gather the radiant Power of Starlight and Moonlight at night, enhancing the Star Evil Power in the medicinal fields to catalyze the growth of Star Moon Grass.
With this, Li Hu’s preparations were nearly complete.
The next day, Li Hu visited the old Daoist Baiyang, exchanging what he had gained amidst various gazes of envy, jealousy, and hatred, leaving behind some copies.
Afterward, Li Hu bid farewell to the old Daoist Baiyang, closed the courtyard where he had lived for ten years, and left Jade Capital Mountain.
Coming into this world had already been twenty years; Li Hu embarked once more to roam the world.
But this time, it wasn’t to peer into others’ secret manuals or search for medicinal spirit herbs; it was to start deploying plans across the world.
Utilizing the enlightenment from the techniques of Feng Shui and Qimen Dunjia Array, combined with the power of earth and mountains, Li Hu would arrive at a place and create Secret Realms akin to those in fantasy Immortal novels.
Using the earth as the base, and the energy of mountains and rivers as materials, he created one Secret Realm after another hidden within the Wilderness Forest.
Through Li Hu’s modifications, the Secret Realm would fully converge the Power of Starlight and Moonlight from above the Nine Heavens, then cultivate a myriad of Star Moon Grass and other Spirit Plants transformed by his celestial techniques.
These Spirit Plants would solidify the rich Star Evil Power into tremendous Primordial Qi within the plant, becoming the primary spirit medicine for refining Elixirs like the Nourishing Yuan Pill.
At the same time, within the Secret Realm, Li Hu left behind techniques he created, resembling those powerful attack moves in fantasy Immortal stories.
As Li Hu moved, Secret Realms began to be established, leaving behind techniques once only imagined.
Just waiting for a period, allowing the Secret Realm to develop and form, will emit great brilliance and produce significant noise, indicating to people within a hundred miles that this Secret Realm has matured, treasures emerging.
And when treasure seekers have scoured the spirit medicine and inheritances within, Li Hu’s array established with the mountain river will automatically operate and close.
Just like this, circulating repeatedly, gradually enhancing the Martial Artists’ strength in this world step by step.
This is Li Hu’s strategy to spread Martial Arts throughout the world!
Time passed within Li Hu’s step-by-step deployment, during which he also encountered many people and matters.
The years in the Martial World rush people to age; generations of young heroes rise, creating one Legendary saga after another, though all this had nothing to do with Li Hu.
He was like an observer of the world, executing strategies while sowing the seeds of growth in this world.
Yet he wasn’t as indifferent as the Heavenly Dao.
Occasionally, witnessing the sins in the world, he wasn’t stingy about lending assistance, sometimes even leaving behind some inheritances, sowing a thread of hope into the world.
For instance, while passing through a certain city where gangsters broke children’s hands and feet, abused young beggars for money, Li Hu wasn’t stingy about casually eliminating those gangs, healing the children’s wounds, and leaving behind one or two life-saving Martial Arts moves.
Wherever there is light in the world, there will naturally be darkness.
Li Hu wasn’t some virtuous figure trying to eliminate the darkness of the world; he wasn’t that idle.
However, if encountered, he naturally wouldn’t hesitate to lend assistance.
Also, feeling amused at times, he would hand a Martial Arts secret manual to someone appearing with auspicious fate on the roadside or give pointers to a dissatisfied beggar to change their life.
He was like an old monster wandering through the world, watching the Martial World like the ebb and flow of tides.
With such a mindset, another five years passed in the blink of an eye.
In these five years, waves were stirred in the Martial World due to Li Hu’s mischievous dispersal of Martial Arts secret manuals.
Seeing a resolute village lad receiving Daoist’s guidance on Profound Skill wasn’t uncommon.
Those Martial Arts, similar in inheritance to the Martial Arts legacy yet differ in power and advancement.
His mischief must have brought countless storms to the Martial World.
If this world were a novel, and the protagonist were to defy destiny, pacifying the chaos in the Martial World, Li Hu would undoubtedly be the final mastermind villain behind the scenes.
After five years of planning, the arrangements around the world were mostly completed.
However, the maturity of the first Secret Realm was still some time away, so Li Hu returned to Jade Capital Mountain, establishing a field and releasing news that he would soon lecture the Martial Artists of the world for seven days here.
This news instantly stirred the entire Martial Arts world.
Fifteen years ago, Li Hu, who defeated Jue Wutian, was faintly known as the world’s top expert.
Now, fifteen years have passed; although Li Hu has been inconspicuous, everyone speculates on his level of strength.
At less than twenty years, he was already unparalleled in the world, let alone now?
Probably now, Li Hu’s strength is truly the number one in the world!
Such a Grandmaster lecturing, especially an open lecture, is unprecedented; how can it not cause a tremendous stir in the Martial World!
Numerous Martial Artists who received the news flocked to Jade Capital Mountain, and for some unaffiliated individuals, this lecture was seen as an incredibly important opportunity, arriving early at Jade Capital Mountain.
Just when all eyes were gathered on Jade Capital Mountain, the three Grandmasters in the Martial World, the Demon Sect Leader in the south Jue Wutian, the Celestial Sword Elder from Celestial Sword Manor, and the carefree man from East Sea Bibo Island.
Suddenly joined forces to challenge Li Hu on Jade Capital Mountain.

chapters.title: Chapter 356 - 027: Three Grandmasters
chapters.content:
Chapter 356: Chapter 027: Three Grandmasters
Crash!
In the void, three grand and towering figures hovered above the firmament, their gaze fixed on the immense mountain peak rising to the sky in the distance.
Their majestic aura spread out, causing the nearby void to tremble.
A tremendously powerful aura seemed to fill the heavens and earth, attracting numerous awe-filled gazes from the surrounding shadows.
The three Grandmasters who once subdued the world have come together today!
Even the most clueless in the Martial World felt an impending storm, a sense that a massive tidal wave was about to overturn the entire Martial World.
"Old Tian Jian, I didn’t expect you to actually come. Aren’t you afraid the Martial World will accuse you of colluding with the Demon Sect?"
In the void, Jue Wutian, with an aura as dark as an abyss, had grown even stronger than he was fifteen years ago.
At this moment, his gaze was sharp as he looked at the white-haired and dark-robed old Tian Jian, his voice sinister.
"To think, once holding the seat of the world’s number one, and the leader of the righteous path in the Central Plains, has now fallen to colluding with the Demon Sect. Truly, life is unpredictable!"
"Young Wutian, save your worries. Fifteen years ago, you were defeated by that person. I wonder if you still have the strength to lift your fists once more."
Tian Jian stood in the void, upright like a long sword piercing the heavens.
His face, lined with wrinkles, remained calm, eyes closed, hands folded, and his old voice indifferent and unchanging.
"Hahaha, I am well, no need for an old man destined to be abandoned by time to worry. If you’re not convinced, you can have a bout before facing that person."
Jue Wutian’s gaze towards Tian Jian was deep, carrying a hint of killing intent.
"If you wish to fight, I will accompany you. I want to see if, after more than twenty springs, you can still withstand one of my sword strikes."
Tian Jian remained with his eyes closed, responding indifferently.
In an instant, the air seemed to solidify.
Killing intent filled the sky.
"Enough, Junior Brother Jue, Fellow Daoist Tian Jian, the enemy is at hand. We should abandon past grievances and work together to face the enemy."
Seeing the conflict about to erupt, Hai Wuya from the East Sea had to speak up.
"Hmph, traitor. One day I will take your head."
Jue Wutian snorted coldly, his gaze full of killing intent swept over Hai Wuya, before moving away.
Eventually, he spoke no more.
Fifteen years ago, after fighting that person, he knew quite well the strength of that young man named Li Hu.
Even after fifteen years of arduous cultivation, he knew his strength was still not enough to match him.
Therefore, the Alliance was necessary.
Only by combining the forces of the three Grandmasters standing at the pinnacle of the Martial Arts could they possibly suppress that person.
Enduring a temporary loss was nothing, as long as they could remove that obstacle, then no one in the Martial World could prevent him from dominating the Central Plains Martial Arts.
Tian Jian, the old man?
Hmph, just a withered bone in a tomb!
The three of them each harbored their own thoughts, but the immense pressure from Li Hu forced the three opposing forces to unite.
Even if they couldn’t truly align their minds, the combined power of the three at the pinnacle of Martial Arts was enough to dominate the entire world.
The air was silent.
Time slowly passed amidst this deathly stillness.
At the foot of Jade Capital Mountain, Martial Artists who came to listen gradually arrived, and the number of Martial Artists gathered there increased.
Seeing the three towering figures blocking the front of Jade Capital Mountain, the martial artists sensibly kept their distance.
As time passed, the number of Martial Artists gathered at the foot of the mountain reached tens of thousands.
Some discussions started to arise.
"Grandmasters, at the peak of Martial Arts, the four Grandmasters who stand at the pinnacle of the Martial World have all gathered here. Even if we gain nothing today, just witnessing such a scene is enough!"
"Indeed, any one of the Grandmasters would usually be like a hidden dragon, and today they all gather at Jade Capital Mountain. It’s truly a grand event in the Martial World."
"Speaking of which, why did those three come together? Did the sweeper Li Hu offend the other three Grandmasters at the same time?"
"It’s understandable for the Demon Sect Leader Jue Wutian. Fifteen years ago, he suffered a humiliating defeat at Xiangyun City, even losing the four Demon Venerables. With his personality, revenge is certain, but it’s puzzling to see him rope in Tian Jian and Hai Wuya."
"Indeed, Grandmaster Li hasn’t offended Tian Jian or Hai Wuya since his rise. His few battles have been against the Demon Sect, which is indeed strange."
"Ha, could it be that Tian Jian and Hai Wuya, seeing Grandmaster Li’s strength continuously growing, are afraid that one day, he might overshadow them, so they’re preemptively..."
One raggedly dressed martial artist, with a pointed face, joked.
However, before he could finish his sentence,
a clear sword hum suddenly resonated across heaven and earth, closing in abruptly, echoing by the ear.
The void rippled like waves for a moment, a fleeting ripple shimmered and vanished.
Scree!
In an instant, the surrounding void seemed to be sliced open, and that martial artist, along with dozens around him, were swept into that terrifying invisible Sword Qi, torn in half.
Blood gushed out.
Forming rivers on the ground.
The surrounding crowd retreated in fear, staring at the bloody scene ahead, enveloped in silence.
"Misfortune comes from the mouth, a Grandmaster cannot be insulted, and how could the likes of you irrelevant people casually discuss a Grandmaster."
Hai Wuya coldly swept his gaze over the frightened crowd, his voice devoid of any emotion, resonating through the void.
The one who acted was Tian Jian, seeming as if he had done something trivial, his expression unchanging.
At that moment, every Martial Artist’s heart was filled with fear and reverence.
Just a single joke, leading not only to that person’s death but also affecting dozens around him.
Killing dozens with a word!
This was the Celestial Sword of the old Tian Jian,
The Heavenly Dao is merciless!
"Heh...."
Jue Wutian cast a fleeting glance at the white-haired, ethereally immortal Tian Jian, his gaze deep, with a tone of sarcasm, as if pondering something.
After this event, none dared make a sound.
At the foot of Jade Capital Mountain, a deathly silence enveloped the tens of thousands.
The air was filled with oppression, and not even the corpses on the ground were dared to be cleared away.
No one knew how long this dead silence lasted,
Soon, a path suddenly split open on Jade Capital Mountain, shrouded in a misty cloud, as if exuding immortal light, a figure emerged from within.
It was a Daoist Child, appearing six or seven years old, holding something like a letter.
Under the gaze of all, he walked down from the mountain gate, unafraid.
"That kid Li must be scared, only sends a child to meet death."
Tian Jian’s eyes remained indifferent, looking ahead, his voice devoid of any emotion.

chapters.title: Chapter 357 - 028 A Calligraphy Sheet
chapters.content:
Chapter 357: Chapter 028 A Calligraphy Sheet
The Celestial Sword Elder’s gaze was indifferent, looking at the Daoist child as if looking at a dead person.
There was some commotion among the surrounding martial artists.
"Is Grandmaster Li about to concede? I wonder if the lecture can still proceed as planned this time."
"Probably not, with the three Grandmasters joining forces, who in the world can withstand them?"
"Indeed, although Grandmaster Li is astonishingly talented and young, standing at the pinnacle of the martial world upon his debut, ultimately he stands alone and weak."
"It’s a pity we’ll come all this way for nothing, but witnessing such a scene will be enough for me to boast about for a lifetime."
Although the previous sword strike of the Celestial Sword Elder had intimidated many martial artists present,
ultimately, someone couldn’t help but express their opinions.
However, compared to before, the surrounding martial artists were much more restrained, as the pile of bodies cut in half and the blood yet to dry starkly warned everyone of the consequences of careless words.
"This lecture might end without a result, hopefully, Grandmaster Li can hold another one next time. A Grandmaster level guidance, even a glimpse from the outside, would be enough, what a pity."
"Yes, it’s a real pity this time."
Amidst the murmurs of regret, no one had hope for Li Hu.
This was normal, for as strong as Li Hu was, there was still a limit.
In the path of martial arts, the further one advanced, the less the gap between those of the same level.
In the postnatal stage, a genius postnatal martial artist battling more than ten ordinary postnatal martial artists of the same level was not a difficult task.
But at the Grandmaster level, two newly ascended Grandmasters could usually defeat a veteran Grandmaster who had been immersed in that realm for many years.
This is because,
every Grandmaster was once an astonishing figure in the martial world, a figure of renown in their youth.
The experience to become a Grandmaster martial artist is nothing short of legendary.
To emerge victorious among tens of thousands of martial artists, each is considered a paragon of their era.
As the martial realm advances, the gap between those of the same level naturally reduces.
It’s true of Grandmasters, let alone great Grandmasters?
Every great Grandmaster is a living legend in the martial arts world.
When they are present, the world is silent.
With the arrival of the three great Grandmasters, it wasn’t a question of winning or losing; if Li Hu could escape alive from the three Grandmasters’ combined might, it would already shock the world.
Beneath Jade Capital Mountain, a kind of martial artist felt regret in their hearts.
The outcome, decided the moment the three Grandmasters appeared.
No one held any hope for Li Hu, even if his past achievements were showcased; no one was optimistic about this conflict.
In the eyes of many, a Daoist child descended from Jade Capital Mountain, calmly approaching the gate, paying respects to the three Grandmasters suspended in the air.
In a youthful voice, he said:
"Seniors, having traveled from afar, the ancestor specially tasked me to bring something to greet you."
With that, he lifted the illustrated text in his hand.
"Is that kid scared, so he sent you, a child, to deliver an apology letter?"
The Celestial Sword Elder stood with arms crossed, standing distantly in the void, said indifferently:
"You may go back, tell that kid surnamed Li to immediately leave Jade Capital Mountain, hand over the Martial Arts Origin Scripture and his entire heritage, abolish his martial arts, and from now on, never return to the martial world, and we can spare his life."
The voice was filled with condescension,
like a high-up noble showing pity to a roadside beggar.
Sparing his life,
was already an exceptional grace from the Celestial Sword Elder.
All around was dead silent, every martial artist felt a sense of oppression, an innate fear.
The Celestial Sword Elder, although always a leader of the righteous path in the martial world, only the seasoned old martial artists knew, that high-up individual’s disposition was not good.
The law of the jungle, survival of the fittest, was starkly displayed before all martial artists.
The Daoist child remained unmoved,
in the eyes of all, he clumsily opened the illustrated text, face towards the three.
In the void, the three Grandmasters observed this with indifference.
But soon,
they regretted it,
that deep-seated regret.
If life could be lived again, they swore they would run as far as possible.
Before that Daoist child opened the illustrated text, they would never set foot on Jade Capital Mountain even for a step!
On that ordinary sheet of paper, a stack of which could be bought for two taels of silver on the street,
was a word written with an ordinary brush, ordinary ink—
GET OUT!!!
When the paper opened, the word "GET OUT" appeared in the void.
The next moment, boundless light burst forth from the paper, stroke by stroke, as if connecting with the essence of heaven and earth, as if a decree from the Celestial Emperor, bringing imperial might to all living things!
The sky exploded, and immediately a vast and mighty aura surged forth, permeating the universe, filling the heavens and earth!
At that moment, the three great Grandmasters, renowned across the world,
immediately felt an immeasurable pressure assaulting them, a weight incomparable to the lands and seas of the world.
It was pressure from the whole world, as if facing the hostility of the entire world!
"Ah!!!"
In a daze, the three only felt as though they were facing a towering giant Celestial Emperor that filled the entire universe!
That immense and imposing figure merely glanced in their direction, and instantly boundless killing intent enveloped them, the whole world plunging into a dark abyss!
DEATH!!!
A bloody character for death overshadowed the sky, as if the heavens were collapsing!
This was truly the law from the spoken word, their frenzied spiritual sense wildly warned them of a fact:
If they couldn’t stop it, they would die!
In a moment of crisis, the three unleashed the most powerful techniques they have ever mastered.
"Heaven’s Intention is Elusive!"
"Netherworld Divine Domain!"
"Boundless Vast Sea!"
The Celestial Sword Elder could no longer maintain his demeanor, as the longsword in his hand roared forth, transforming into a stream of light in the air.
This sword, as if resonating with the will of heaven,
seemed endowed with earth-splitting power, coming from the alternate void, cutting through and tearing the layers of space at that moment.
This was the ultimate move of the Celestial Sword Elder, the most dazzling, pinnacle of swordsmanship in the world.
Simultaneously, Jue Wutian seemed to transform into the Netherworld.
A colossal black hole swallowed all the light within a hundred-foot radius of the void, engulfing souls along with it, creating a massive void where existence seemed to vanish completely in that region.
After fifteen years, Jue Wutian’s Netherworld Divine Skill advanced, as if turning the world into an Asura battlefield!
Hai Wuya at this moment turned into the Vast Sea, the sky and clouds changed dramatically, as if the sound of countless waves reverberated through the void.
The whole firmament transformed into a vast sea and blue sky, a tidal wave surging like the sky collapsing, engulfing everything ahead!
The three killer moves were the most brilliant displays of the martial world,
presenting a force that seemed to shatter and destroy the whole world.
However,
in the face of the word "GET OUT" emanating an immense power that bridged heaven and earth and brought the supreme decree of divine retribution to the realm of humanity, as if the Celestial Emperor descended to the mortal world,
it was like smashing against a great indomitable god of ultimate command,
CRACK!!!
In an instant, the longsword that had accompanied the Celestial Sword Elder for decades shattered into pieces, its force obliterated by the formidable power emanating from that one word.
Jue Wutian’s Netherworld was instantly erased into nothingness, the massive gravitational force dissipating in an instant.
Hai Wuya’s Vast Sea Power was instead reversed like a tsunami, consuming all the resistance of the three like a tidal wave.
In an instant, the surrounding space seemed to collapse piece by piece, as an overwhelming force swept away all their resistance like dried wood,
leaving the three Grandmasters as fallen stars, propelled backward and striking the distant mountains with a thunderous crash.
All around fell dead silent.

chapters.title: Chapter 358 - 029: Immortal Gods in the World
chapters.content:
Chapter 358: Chapter 029: Immortal Gods in the World
Under Jade Capital Mountain, thousands of martial artists seemed to have their throats clenched, unable to make any sound.
In the distance, beneath the collapsed mountain peak, huge stones and soil rolled down, burying the three Grandmasters in the soil.
It was extremely tragic.
Those with keen hearing could still hear the rasping breath of the buried Grandmasters, like a broken bellows, along with the sound of them spitting large mouths of blood.
The three Grandmasters, who had previously shaken the firmament with their majestic presence, were now declined to the extreme.
Like dying old men, about to reach the end of their lives.
This is the manifestation of grave injury on the brink of death.
The crowd of martial artists stood there dumbfounded, motionless, staring straight at everything in front of them, eyes filled with bewilderment.
"What happened?"
A martial artist murmured in his heart, bewildered.
A paper with a crude word "Scram" managed to effortlessly crush the three renowned Grandmasters, leaving them gravely injured and on the brink of death?
How could this be possible!
If before today, someone told them that in this world, there existed such a piece of paper, which once opened, even the Grandmasters at the pinnacle of the Martial Arts realm could hardly resist its edge.
The person hearing this would simply think that person is crazy.
Utter nonsense, no one would believe the words of such a lunatic.
Even now, having witnessed this scene firsthand, some martial artists still found it hard to confirm whether all of this was just an illusion.
But, no matter how unbelievable, from the Daoist Child descending the mountain, opening the paper, to the three Grandmasters being blasted away without any resistance and embedded in the mountain peak.
Those who witnessed it all were forced to believe that this was reality!
Under Jade Capital Mountain, a deathly silence pervaded as thousands of martial artists stared at it all, like dumbfounded, silent statues.
Before this, they were still contemplating how Li the Grandmaster would respond when facing the combined attack of the three Grandmasters.
Would he humiliate himself and surrender, agreeing to their conditions?
Or would he fight back, even if it meant leaving a lasting injury to the opponent?
If he chose to fight to the death, how magnificent would be the battlefield’s grandeur when four Grandmasters battled with all their might, how terrifying the power, and how dazzling the display?
Under the joint attack of the three Grandmasters at the peak of the Martial Arts realm today, how many moves could the one on Jade Capital Mountain withstand before being defeated?
Some martial artists even speculated whether Li the Grandmaster had taken advantage of the delay to escape far away when the Daoist Child descended the mountain.
But no one expected that the one atop Jade Capital Mountain would respond in such a manner.
He didn’t even need to act personally, merely sending a Daoist Child, incapable of fending off a chicken, with a piece of paper, effortlessly defeating the three Grandmasters into grave injury.
The word "Scram," casually written, contained a heavenly punishment-like supreme power, and the three Grandmasters, standing at the pinnacle of the Martial World, had no resistance, all their earth-shattering moves obliterated face-on.
What kind of formidable power is this?!!!
An unimaginable method, comparable to the Celestial Emperor’s divine might, even the most fantastical martial artist could not fathom what level that one had reached to possess such earth-crushing means.
What kind of realm had that one reached to have such power!
Like a living Immortal God!
"Dear guests, the malicious guests have left. The Grandmaster has declared that the lecture will begin in ten days. Please prepare yourselves."
The Daoist Child slowly put away the piece of paper, addressing the assembly in a young, tender voice.
After speaking, without waiting for any response from the deathly silent crowd of martial arts figures below, he turned around and slowly walked toward the mountain.
As he reached the summit, the mist on Jade Capital Mountain automatically gathered, blocking everyone’s view.
The Daoist Child’s figure gradually disappeared into the mist-covered summit of Jade Capital Mountain.
In the original place, only a bewildered, silent group of martial artists remained.
...
Under Jade Capital Mountain, a piece of paper defeated the Grandmasters.
The events of that day quickly shook the entire Martial World.
This news was too shocking and too unbelievable.
But in the face of reality, they had no choice but to believe.
"That one’s methods always exceed people’s expectations time and again!"
"Invincible, with just one word, gravely injuring and nearly killing the three Grandmasters, such divine means make him invincible in the world."
"Too powerful. Three hundred years ago, Grandmaster Yan Kuangtu fought two other Grandmasters of the same Level and was undefeated. That battle has kept Yan Kuangtu’s name alive for three centuries and is praised as the strongest person in a thousand years. Now it seems, Yan Kuangtu is far less than that one!"
"Such miraculous means, that one must have broken the limit of the Grandmaster, which none have broken for thousands of years, reaching a realm above the Grandmaster, mysterious and unreachable like an Immortal God, otherwise he couldn’t have easily defeated the three Grandmasters. I must attend this Immortal God’s lecture!"
With the outcome of that battle spreading, Li Hu’s name immediately gained worldwide fame, sparking huge discussions in the Martial World.
Because of the terrifying strength displayed by Li Hu in the drama under Jade Capital Mountain, many martial artists dared not even mention his name, instead referring to him as "that one."
Unlike the stunning debut from the Celestial Essence Sect, unlike the unexpected defeat of Jue Wutian.
The battle under Jade Capital Mountain has thoroughly established Li Hu as the number one in the world.
Or rather, not just simply the number one.
The miraculous method of injuring three Grandmasters with one word made many martial artists believe that Li Hu had transcended the pinnacle of Martial Arts, reaching another level.
That level is like the difference between an Immortal and a human.
"That one has already become a person like an Immortal God above all life!"
Indeed, anyone who witnessed firsthand what happened under Jade Capital Mountain would not think the three Grandmasters were on the same level as that one, let alone the weaker themselves?
That is the universally recognized Immortal God standing above all life!
Amidst the hustle and bustle, many martial artists who initially didn’t plan to attend the lecture at Jade Capital Mountain put down their matters and headed there.
Throughout the vast Martial World, whether a fresh young hero just emerging or a hidden master in various places, or famous Grandmasters, a large number of martial artists gathered, almost half of the Martial World’s martial artists converged on Jade Capital Mountain.
Even the southern Demon Sect quietly sent people.
The eyes of the world are gathered on Jade Capital Mountain.

chapters.title: Chapter 359 - 30: Preaching to All Beings
chapters.content:
Chapter 359: Chapter 30: Preaching to All Beings
A massive crowd gathers at Jade Capital Mountain.
With so many people, disorder is easy to arise.
Especially with these hot-blooded figures from the Martial Arts world, incidents of drawing swords and killing over a verbal dispute are not uncommon.
Moreover, with more than half of the vast Martial Arts world gathered here, it is inevitable that there are many enemies among them. Confrontations and vendettas are not rare when enemies meet and their eyes blaze with hatred.
However, within these ten days, beneath Jade Capital Mountain,
no one has dared to cause a major disturbance.
It is all due to that deity-like figure on Jade Capital Mountain and the immense anticipation martial artists hold for the teachings of someone who has transcended the current Martial Arts realm, prompting the natural maintenance of order.
Any confrontation that might lead to chaos is quickly halted by seasoned veterans from the Martial Arts world.
The methods displayed by that figure are akin to those of Immortal Gods, so having the opportunity to sit and listen to his teachings, what a rare chance is this?
If one could use this to elevate their Martial Arts even further, who wouldn’t value such an opportunity?
With self-imposed restraint, even though the number of martial artists under Jade Capital Mountain grew over ten days, stability was maintained throughout.
Of course,
the restraint of the martial artists beneath Jade Capital Mountain is not unconnected to the terrifying pressure emanating from the cloud-shrouded summit.
That feeling is like the watchful eye of the Heavenly Dao, observing their every move from above.
Like pins and needles on their backs.
Time passed quickly,
ten days later,
Jade Capital Mountain opened, and a streaming glow of multicolored light flowed forth, stretching across the sky.
Amidst the celestial light, the stairway ascending to the peak of Jade Capital Mountain seemed to extend infinitely, reaching far into the endless depths, as if directly connecting to the Celestial Court.
Amidst the tense anticipation of countless martial artists, a clear voice filled with mysterious Dao resonance suddenly echoed in their minds:
"This is the Heaven-Ascending Ladder of 108,000 steps. Those who reach the end, regardless of age or sect, may receive my personal transmission."
In a simple statement, a storm of emotional waves surged through the hearts of these martial artists.
As contemporary figures in the Martial Arts world as well as throughout the development of Martial Arts over thousands of years, these individuals stood at the pinnacle, transcending mortal beings to reach the Divine Realm,
such a being’s personal transmission—isn’t this an alluring temptation!
RUSH!!!
Instantly, countless martial artists charged toward the Heaven-Ascending Ladder like floodwaters bursting forth, boiling and surging with excitement.
"Ah!"
However, the moment they set foot on the street leading to the heavens, a mountain-like gravity pressed down on each martial artist; some who were weaker and impatient were immediately crushed and fell, tumbling down the stairs, covered in bruises.
"Something’s strange, be careful!"
Through the firsthand experiences of the initial vanguard, the martial artists behind were forcibly calmed.
After hesitating, those entering the 108,000-step heavenly street gradually slowed down, becoming less impatient and better prepared for re-entry.
The crowd was vast, converging like a reverse-flowing river.
At this moment,
at the top of Jade Capital Mountain, in an incomparably vast White Jade Space.
The sky above,
the surrounding void reflected true vacuum-like ripples, as if Li Hu was seated in another dimension. His clear gaze pierced through numerous layers of void, witnessing every scene on the street beneath him.
His expression was as still as an ancient well, much like the Heavenly Dao observing the lives struggling between life and death.
This was a trial he had set up.
The 108,000 steps, created through a combined array and his supreme methods, were both an illusory and a real training experience.
The gravity weighing down on martial artists automatically adjusts according to each individual’s strength. It is more like an illusion technique that transcends the boundary between fantasy and reality, originating from within one’s heart.
Only those with great perseverance and determination can pass the first ten thousand steps of the Heavenly Ladder.
As for the remaining eight thousand steps of the Heavenly Ladder, in addition to the physical pressure, many internal demons lure martial artists, and only with great perseverance can they break through everything and reach the end, completing the journey through the 108,000-step Heavenly Ladder.
Of course,
this 108,000-step Heavenly Ladder test is only there to select from among the crowd those suitable for Li Hu’s creation, based on his lifelong study and Martial Arts insights, of the fragmented void Dao techniques.
These techniques are not just experiments; each one embodies a significant portion of Li Hu’s life’s Martial Arts essence.
Besides those with great perseverance, determination, and persistence who pass the 108,000-step Heavenly Ladder, the eliminated martial artists are still able to attend this lecture.
The 108,000-step Heavenly Ladder is merely a combination of illusion and array formation. Once eliminated, they are automatically transferred to this White Jade Space.
And these eliminated individuals become targets for Li Hu’s broader dissemination.
As time ticks away,
quickly, one bedraggled martial artist drenched in sweat appears in the vast White Jade Space, followed by a second, a third, and more and more.
An hour later, all martial artists who participated in the Heavenly Ladder trial have appeared within the enormous White Jade Space.
With a clear and resounding chime filled with boundless Dao resonance from above the sky, a world of glowing light unfolds, revealing a figure ethereal as an immortal, slowly manifesting in the void, seemingly isolated by an Alternate Void.
Like an Immortal God, even more so like a Dao Ancestor.
Sitting cross-legged in the void.
The entire White Jade Space instantly falls into silence.
Below him, seven people are seated on prayer mats.
Those seven are the martial artists who passed the 108,000-step Heaven-Ascending Ladder.
Among them are men and women, the old and the young, even a farmer’s son with no martial skills.
But every one of them had eyes filled with incredible resolve.
"You have done well. After the lecture, you may inherit my full transmission."
Li Hu’s gaze lightly swept across the seven, his voice echoing within the void.
"Thank you, teacher."
The seven stood and bowed in respect.
Li Hu waved his arm, an invisible force stilled the entire audience.
The lecture then began.
On the first day, Li Hu began with the origins of Martial Arts, from Refining Essence and Qi of the Postnatal to Refining Qi and Spirit of the Innate, advancing to the realms of Grandmasters and Supreme Grandmasters.
From low to high, he thoroughly explained the Martial Arts system.
That very day saw over a thousand people achieve breakthroughs in their realms.
On the second day, Li Hu began to discuss the Dao of Heaven and the principles of diminishing surplus and supplementing deficiency.
In the world, the Great Dao and its principles flow, all of which became clear as lines on a palm under Li Hu’s lecture.
Once again, individuals broke through realms that day, including Grandmasters and a newly advanced Supreme Grandmaster.
On the third day, with Martial Arts and Heavenly Dao already expounded, Li Hu moved onto the path of the Martial Arts Master breaking the void.
If the first two days still belonged within the realm of martial arts, then the following days gradually transitioned to magical modifications, creating a fantasy system of battling heaven and earth based on martial arts, culminating in the ultimate sublimation of void fracture.
On the fourth day, the focus shifted towards an immortal hero style.
The crafting of Immortal Arts emphasizes Divine Cultivation, employing the training of Divine Sense and the tempering of one’s True Essence to undergo a qualitative transformation, from Qi Refining to Foundation Establishment, then the Martial Arts Golden Core, Nascent Soul incarnation, advancing toward the final transcendence through Heaven’s Tribulation for metamorphic ascension.
In the last three days, Li Hu also discussed legacy teachings left by Dao Ancestors, Alchemy Dao, Qimen Dunjia, Array Techniques, Mechanisms, and other supplementary arts.
Among these, Alchemy is a particularly important new system.
Shortly thereafter, when the Secret Realm he had once laid out in the world emerges, Alchemy will be the most crucial support for the Martial Arts System to branch into fantasy and immortal hero narratives!
Seven days later, the lecture concluded, and Jade Capital Mountain closed.
The great transformation of the world began.

chapters.title: Chapter 360 - 31: The Beginning of Great Change
chapters.content:
Chapter 360: Chapter 31: The Beginning of Great Change
The teachings on Jade Capital Mountain have brought an unparalleled sensation to the Martial World.
For thousands of years, the Martial Arts System had developed continuously, yet it never transcended the bounds of Postnatal, Innate, Grandmasters, and Grandmaster Grandmasters.
The path of Refining Essence and Qi, pioneered by the Martial Ancestor in ancient times, has continued to this day.
Like a great tree, the Martial Arts philosophy established by the Martial Ancestor serves as its trunk, while the martial arts developments over thousands of years have become the flourishing branches and leaves that extend from it.
No matter how flourishing the foliage becomes, it cannot escape the constraints of the trunk’s system.
However, Li Hu’s teachings on Jade Capital Mountain have opened another path.
Based on martial arts, yet transcending its realm, opening a Heaven-Reaching Dao far above!
Such mastery, wandering the nine heavens, entering and exiting the Netherworld with Immortal Gods techniques, inspires boundless reverence in every martial artist.
God of Martial Arts, Saint of the Mortal Realm!
Now, Li Hu on Jade Capital Mountain is universally recognized by the martial artists as a holy being transcending all worldly existence.
And because of Li Hu’s open teachings to learners of all kinds, people in the Martial World refer to him simply as that one.
Moreover, Jade Capital Mountain has become the unique holy place in the hearts of all martial artists today.
As the teachings concluded, Jade Capital Mountain closed, and countless martial artists carried Li Hu’s philosophies across the world, like sparks, spreading the seeds of extraordinary enlightenment throughout the Divine Land.
The Martial World found itself in an extreme bottleneck for a time.
Martial artists were digesting the insights gained from the teachings on Jade Capital Mountain, starting to try new Laws, delve into Alchemy, Qimen Dunjia, Mechanical Techniques and more auxiliary skills.
At the same time, countless martial artists were putting more energy into waiting.
Waiting for the great opportunity for all martial artists of the world, as mentioned by that one before the end of the Jade Capital Mountain teachings.
Before leaving Jade Capital Mountain, that one had this to say.
With the limits of Heaven and Earth, even though he had pioneered the methods of shattering the void and crossing tribulation ascending through two Dao systems, due to the lack of Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, even the mightiest path would be hard to prove.
However, he had found a way.
During his travels across the world in the past, he saw a place of beautiful geomancy, and using the geomancy of the mountains combined with a Qimen Dunjia Array to draw upon the starry sky, he established a series of Void Heaven Secret Realms within a subspace.
Within these secret realms, the vast starlight and moonlight suffused the universe. There, he cultivated Star Moon Grass to transmute a great amount of Star Evil Qi into Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, and this Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, along with the dense starlight and moonlight, would in a few years give rise to countless Spirit Plants and Spirit Medicines.
Additionally, in a location within the secret realm, he left detailed inheritances of various Cultivation Techniques, as well as some of the Divine Weapons and Elixirs he had forged, all precious cultivation resources.
A few years later, once the secret realm matured, it would open automatically.
At that time, anyone in the Martial World could enter.
All the treasures within would be theirs for the taking if they are fated.
Such things, like myths and legends, would have in the past been dismissed with scorn by ninety-nine percent of those in the Martial World upon hearing the news.
But after the events of defeating the Three Grandmasters with a single word, transcending the Void Outside the Sky, and then the teachings at Jade Capital Mountain pioneering the Immortal Gods Dao,
After experiencing so many wondrous occurrences, no martial artist would dare question that one on Jade Capital Mountain anymore.
Because of this, numerous martial artists in the Martial World were preparing eagerly, waiting for the secret realm to open, so they could seize a great fortune, bringing calm to the land.
It must be known that at Jade Capital Mountain, the content of the seven-day teachings only laid the foundation, presenting a complete system for the people, allowing them to explore forward along the established framework, just like the Martial Ancestor’s founding of the path of Refining Essence and Qi.
But among these, there were no detailed cultivation techniques.
After all, not everyone is a genius capable of creating a suitable system reaching the pinnacle of the Dao in a short amount of time; such talents are scarcely found.
Compared to techniques created by others, they preferred to trust the ones left by Saint Li Hu, who achieved unparalleled realms, pioneering the two Dao paths of Fantasy and Immortal Heroes.
Moreover, within the secret realm, there were countless natural treasures, arts inheritances, various Divine Weapons, Spiritual Objects, and Elixirs?
Any of these, should they be obtained, could sustain a family lineage for a thousand years.
In comparison to immediate gains and losses, it was better to prepare well and be ready to reach for a big opportunity when the secret realm opened.
Time passed slowly in this calm.
With many eyes eagerly watching,
The first secret realm finally opened on a certain day three years later.
It was reported that on that day, celestial light shook the heavens, penetrating the nine skies, spreading a massive vibration far and wide.
Even a thousand miles away, one could vaguely see the phenomenon in the distance.
Instantly, the entire Martial World was in an uproar.
In a short time, the secret realm located in the remote mountains was filled with more than half the martial artists of the Martial World, even attracting those from gangs who knew only simple Kung Fu, unwilling farmer’s sons, and even descendants of scholarly families.
Countless people surged towards the direction of the secret realm, one could say the opening of this secret realm captured the attentions of everyone in the world.
Crossing the threshold of the secret realm,
was like crossing space, entering a different world.
This world too had blue skies, white clouds, and as far as the eye could see, there seemed to be no end.
This was a world within an array space, existing between illusion and reality, yet truly present, overlapping with the world.
Within the secret realm, the atmosphere was dense to the extreme, almost condensing into raindrops.
This was because the vast Star Evil Qi from the starry sky was absorbed and transformed by the altered Star Moon Grass and similar Spirit Medicines, generating effects comparable to paradise and sacred grottos.
When creating the secret realm, Li Hu, in order to gather more Star Evil Qi, not only utilized arrays to transform the secret realm into a funnel-like environment for absorbing starlight and moonlight, but also pierced through the dense atmosphere blocking the starlight and moonlight, allowing the entire secret realm to face the vast void directly, devouring the endless Star Evil Qi.
Under the surging aggregation of the vast starlight and moonlight energy, along with the function of Spirit Medicines modified by Li Hu, a large quantity of starlight and moonlight was converted into Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, creating a secret realm with abundant Primordial Qi after years of accumulation.
"Such dense Primordial Qi, this place can truly be called a paradise and sacred grotto!"
"Hiss! Such strong medicinal effects, a random weed on the ground contains the Primordial Power of ordinary herbs! This secret realm is so terrifying!"
A martial artist casually picked a weed, tried it, and felt the immense energy inside, showing an incredulous expression.
"Using the Alchemy techniques passed down by that one, refining the Spirit Medicines in this secret realm into Elixirs could even support breakthroughs for tens of thousands of martial artists!"
"The stones here have also mutated, hiss! After being infused with dense Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, ordinary stones have turned into Spirit Materials, which with Artifact Refining Techniques could even create Extraordinary Magical Treasures! If placed three years ago, this would be akin to Meteorite Iron for Divine Weapons!"
"Treasure, this is like a massive treasure trove!"
"Too terrifying, this secret realm has no visible end, that one indeed ascended to Immortal God status, surpassing the ordinary world! To have been able to create such a formidable place, and there are even more similar secret realms laid out by that one beyond the Central Plains throughout the land!"
"Hurry, there are more treasures deeper within, and the lineage manuals left by that one!"
Countless martial artists scrambled and spread out to explore and search in all directions.
The entire secret realm, like a massive treasure trove.
Especially since Li Hu of Jade Capital Mountain pioneered Alchemy and Artifact Refining, it could be said that everything within the secret realm, even a handful of soil from the ground, was natural treasure capable of enhancing martial artists’ strength!
The secret realm was vast, even an Innate Martial Artist could fly in one direction for three days and three nights without reaching the edge.
