As such a vast secret realm became scattered with martial artists spreading out, it started to divide off.
Be it the Wilderness Forest, deep caves, damp swamps, or endless deserts, signs of martial artists began to appear in various terrains.
In the secret realm, various natural treasures began to be harvested by martial artists one after another.
And as martial artists dispersed throughout this vast secret realm, conflicts began to gradually emerge.
However, within this secret realm.
The most dangerous enemies are not fellow human martial artists!
"Be careful!"
"Ah! What is this thing!"
A team of martial artists was looking at ripe Vermilion Fruits glowing with a red light, when a shadow flashed through the sky, the entire space seemed to crack open a seam, and among them, a martial artist was sliced in half!

chapters.title: Chapter 361 - 032 Demon Beast
chapters.content:
Chapter 361: Chapter 032 Demon Beast
"Be careful! Old Wu is gone!"
"Damn, what the hell is that thing!"
A corpse, severed in half at the waist, lay on the ground, blood splattered everywhere.
The faces of the people were filled with fear, their weapons clenched tightly, as they gazed in terror at the yellow shadow ahead.
"Is that a leopard?"
On the trunk of the Vermilion Fruit tree ahead, a creature the size of a house cat, covered in spots, was crouched on a branch, slowly licking the blood off its paws.
Its pupils, glowing with a green light, swept over the group, its grim mouth curling slightly into a mocking human-like smile.
Terror, dread!
In an instant, a chill ran down the spine of every martial artist in the group.
Their backs were chilled!
As if plunged into an ice hole in the dead of winter, a bucket of cold water poured over their heads, a chill surged from the soles of their feet, freezing their blood in its veins.
"This, this... is a Cat Demon!"
Whoosh!
Suddenly, the creature on the branch vanished, transforming into a flash of yellow lightning and rushing into the crowd.
Swoosh, swoosh, swoosh!
The sharp claws restored in mid-air, as if tearing through space; the martial artists’ weapons crumbled like tofu, shattered upon contact, and sharp powerful energy instantly sliced their bodies into pieces, blood splattering everywhere.
As if entering a no man’s land, in an entire team of martial artists, no one could withstand the might of that little creature’s claw.
"Ah! I quit!"
"Run! Run quickly! It’s a monster!"
In an instant, the team suffered heavy losses, the remaining martial artists’ legs trembled, unable to even hold their weapons, which clanged to the ground as they fled in panic, rolling and crawling in all directions.
"Damn! Get back here!"
The large, scarred leader, his face fierce, was immediately enraged and shouted angrily:
"Whoever the bastard dares to run again, I’ll kill his whole family when I get back! Get back here!"
This group of martial artists was merely a band of bullies from some small town, used to oppressing ordinary people by strength in numbers, but when faced with such a ferocious creature, how could they have the courage to stay?
Even with the leader’s anger, those guys ran no slower.
Amidst the scar-faced man’s rage, suddenly, it felt as if some weight had been added to his shoulder.
Angrily turning his head,
he met a pair of mocking eyes.
The little creature stood on his shoulder, at some unknown moment!
Clang!
The scarred leader’s knife fell to the ground, his teeth chattering with fear.
"Divine, Immortal...."
Riiip!
Before he could finish his words, a shadow flashed by, causing only a slight ripple in the air.
The scarred leader’s head flew off, and from his smooth neck, a spray of blood gushed forth.
"Meow!"
The few remaining people had already fled far away, and the little creature did not give chase, fading silently amid a few leaps into the lush branches and leaves of the Vermilion Fruit tree.
On the spot, only a heap of mangled corpses remained, and blood that stained the soil red...
As the blood seeped into the ground, tendrils slowly emerged from beneath the soil, white threads sprouting to cover the bodies lying on the ground.
Within the time it took for an hour to pass, the maimed bodies on the ground seemed to have all nutrients drained from them, like mummies dried for millennia, turned into dust and scattered across the surrounding grassland.
Upon that tree, the Vermilion Fruits became even more bright red and vibrant...
The scene that unfolded on the Nameless Prairie was merely one of the many microcosms of poison within the Secret Realm.
There were mammoths like mountains, charging wildly.
The great tiger, calling upon mountain winds.
In the sky, a giant eagle, its feathers hard like iron plates, could kill with silent swiftness.
And in the desert, the terrifying swarm of ants devoured everything, in the forest, the man-eating demonic flower vine.
Various terrifying creatures, even Innate Level experts, in this perilous Secret Realm, might not make it out intact.
Even approaching the central area, where power, Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, and starlight mists gathered the most.
The dangers hidden within were even more terrifying!
Even Grandmaster Level experts could not necessarily remain unscathed!
Countless martial artists fought in the Secret Realm world, lives lost in its depths.
However, there were also many lucky ones who, after defeating those dangerous Guardian Beasts, obtained rich resources.
Not only did the heavenly materials and earthly treasures they guarded have strong effects, but even the bodies of the exotic beasts greatly aided in the enhancement of the martial artists.
Quite a few martial artists, under such abundant Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi and ample resources, broke through their barriers, significantly increasing their strength.
At this moment, the entire Secret Realm had become a brutal trial ground.
At every moment, scenes of all life’s various states unfolded.
...
On Jade Capital Mountain.
Li Hu sat cross-legged in the void, the energy around him surging, like immortal aura swirling around.
In the void before him, a mirror spontaneously appeared, reflecting scenes from the opening Secret Realm miles away.
"Demon Plants, Demon Beasts... However, in just ten years, it’s impossible to develop so quickly, right..."
Watching those evolved beasts with various Divine Artifact abilities in the mirror, Li Hu frowned slightly in thought.
Though the Secret Realms I created, due to various reasons, had very abundant Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, everything inside, whether plant or beast, was merely ordinary at the time.
Since the first Secret Realm was established to its current opening, it’s only been over eight years.
In such a short time, to see the emergence of this new demon beast tribe is indeed hard to believe.
Unless some powerful force is driving it all.
"A push from the Heavenly Dao..."
Li Hu gazed into the void, his sight seemingly piercing through the universe, spanning nine heavens and ten lands.
For a long time, he spoke softly into the empty void:
"Sensing an opportunity for advancement, so instinctively pushing it all, can I understand this as you picking the fruit?"
The Secret Realms he created back then were continually evolving, constantly absorbing the vast energy from the starry sky, while relentlessly expanding.
Like fruit growing on a tree, forming continually.
When ripe, they will merge into this world, drastically altering the world’s environment and causing enormous expansion as the vast regions integrate.
In this world, Li Hu has forgotten how many Secret Realms he established.
And when these numerous Secret Realms "mature" and merge, the entire world’s territory will expand dozens or even hundreds of times.
At the same time, the vast Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi will cause an upgrade effect on the world.
However, the initial intent behind creating the Secret Realms was not for world ascension and consumption.
Strictly speaking, this is the Heavenly Dao picking my fruit.
As Li Hu’s cool and profound voice echoed in the void,
he seemed to faintly feel an impression, a sensation surged into his heart.
It was like,
a young and innocent child, caught stealing something by an adult, but stubbornly refusing to give it back even after being caught.
"Never mind, unfortunately, it’s all the same destination in the end, this time I’ll let it go, but be cautious of my wrath if you do it again without my permission."
Li Hu shook his head slightly.
Fortunately, his goal in creating Secret Realms was to transform the world, then cast his influence across the land, opening paths for ascension or shattering through boundaries.
This naive Heavenly Dao’s actions align somewhat with his own goals, so there’s no need to be overly concerned.
However,
this Heavenly Dao, is quite interesting.
Li Hu’s eyes flashed, then closed as he entered meditation and cultivation.

chapters.title: Chapter 362 - 33: The Struggle of the Great Era (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 362: Chapter 33: The Struggle of the Great Era (First Update)
In the space isolated from the outside world, Li Hu was deep in thought.
Heavenly Dao Consciousness, or perhaps the consciousness of all living beings.
He clearly felt that this consciousness was still in its nascent stage, like an ignorant child, curiously exploring everything in the outside world, while instinctively absorbing what was beneficial to itself.
Li Hu didn’t really mind that it was promoting the expansion of the Secret Realm and absorbing the fruits it bore.
After all, the world’s devouring of numerous Secret Realms and its evolution were instrumental in advancing his path of breaking through and ascending to propagate the great Dao.
Li Hu was more curious about when the subtle spark of intelligence in the Heavenly Dao Consciousness had emerged.
Clearly, when he initially ascended to become a Celestial Being and was in harmony with Heaven and Earth, his perception was that the Heavenly Dao was merely like a mechanical program, following the most ancient Law of the jungle, the survival of the fittest, coldly and mechanically driving everything forward.
But now, it seemed that this Heavenly Dao had gained a hint of nimbleness.
Although that intelligence was only akin to that of an infant, it was genuine intelligence.
"Heavenly Dao Consciousness, Consciousness of All Living Beings..."
A sense of clarity arose in Li Hu’s heart.
If the world were equivalent to a human body, then the Heavenly Dao Consciousness would be like the soul of that body.
And all the living things within the world, including humans, beasts, plants, and everything, were akin to the myriad cells within a body.
The philosophy of a previous life stated that the human body is a microcosm, and this was indeed quite accurate.
The cycle of all things in the world is similar to the cycles within the human body.
Li Hu had come to this world and became a part of it, though as part of countless life forms, his individual importance was negligible.
However, when he ascended to become a Celestial Being and experienced sublimation, as a part of all living things, this trace of sublimation was like a spiritual mechanism, bringing a billionth probability of change to the vast consciousness of all living beings, giving rise to intelligence.
"Indeed, as an amalgamation of Heaven and Earth, to it, whether humans, plants, or animals, are just cells within its body. There is no distinction of good or bad, nor any differentiation of intimacy or distance. The great Dao is impartial, and promoting plants and beasts to evolve into demon beasts is only natural."
In this way, some doubts were naturally resolved.
However,
both the Martial Ancestor and the Dao Ancestor should have transcended Celestial Beings back then, reaching a mysterious and inscrutable Realm.
So why, at that time, did they not cause the consciousness of all living beings to produce intelligence?
And what about that strange stone from beyond the heavens?
Where exactly did it come from?
What happened back then, why was there not a single trace or record left about the Dao Ancestor, as if an invisible hand had wiped clean all records, leaving only the deeply ingrained title of Dao Ancestor in people’s minds?
As for why the Dao Ancestor was called the Dao Ancestor, no one knew.
And back then, where did the Dao Ancestor and Martial Ancestor go? Did they die of old age in the Hidden Valley, ascend to the Immortal Realm, or hide in some corner of the world, smiling at the rise and fall of worldly events?
No one knows.
Even now, as Li Hu’s power grows day by day, he himself does not know what Realm he has reached, deciphering the mysteries of Heaven and Earth, yet he cannot deduce the reason.
"Forget it, I am not an archaeological historian. Even if something really happened in ancient times, so what? What I need to do now is break through the world’s constraints and leverage the remaining power of the Gate of Truth to return to my original form."
Slightly shaking his head, he suppressed the myriad thoughts in his mind.
Li Hu was not particularly interested in pursuing the truth hidden in history back then.
The immediate task of spreading martial arts across the world and transforming it was what truly required attention.
With a wave of his sleeve, the void ahead shifted, like a whirlpool on a lake surface, rippling with waves and turning into a mirror.
Through the mirror, Li Hu’s gaze swept over, monitoring everything happening within the Secret Realm, observing the development of the seeds he had sown.
...
The years in the Martial World age people, one generation of youth replaces the old.
This had always been the cycle of the Martial World for thousands of years, with geniuses born in every era, dominating their contemporaries with renowned prowess in the Martial World.
There were also prominent figures from previous generations who retreated into obscurity, disappearing from the Martial World.
Stories of influential figures never cease, and neither do the tangled webs of grudges and feuds.
This is Jianghu.
However, ever since that one person on Jade Capital Mountain subdued a Grandmaster with a mere note three years ago, expounding the Dao to the world and opening the path to eternal life,
the entire Martial World has been set ablaze.
The era of the Martial World has since ended.
Following this is an era of great contention for the new generation!
Countless martial artists, whether young prodigies or retired veterans from secluded mountains, all became frenzied for the opening Secret Realm.
The rich Heaven and Earth Spiritual Qi, bountiful heavenly materials, immensely powerful Divine Weapons, Divine Pills that could propel one to great heights, and the Divine Skill Secret Manuals pointing directly to the Daoist Techniques.
Noble families, sects, and countless martial artists surged into the Secret Realm in search of resources.
If possible, no one would refuse eternal life, no one would refuse to traverse the Netherworld and soar through the nine heavens.
Struggle, conflict.
Survival of the fittest, the strong prevail, this is the characteristic of the era of great contention for the new generation.
But, in this new era,
humans are destined not to be the sole actors on this stage of Heaven and Earth.
When martial artists, seeking opportunities in the Secret Realm, suffered great casualties, when those who escaped came back with rich spoils, when they tearfully recounted their near-death experiences against terrifying demon beasts,
everything within the Secret Realm gradually revealed itself to the world.
It was vast, abundant in Primordial Qi, with heavenly materials and treasures everywhere, home to countless terrifying demon beasts, where many martial artists perished in the jaws of those fearsome creatures.
The information brought back by escaping martial artists shook the entire world.
Especially the news about those powerful demon beasts, possessing immense strength, that even Grandmaster level experts, if encountered, might not escape uninjured.
And the most terrifying part was, those Great Demons possessed very high intelligence!
The release of this news caused a worldwide uproar.
Until this moment, only then did the world truly realize that a new era was about to descend!
This was an unprecedented major transformation in the human world for thousands of years, where humans could cultivate for eternal life, and humans in the world would no longer be the only rulers.
In this treacherous and unpredictable world, some were bewildered and at a loss, while others forged ahead relentlessly.
As time passed, one by one, martial artists returned from the Secret Realm, and the vast Secret Realm began to gradually unveil its mysterious veil.
To better explore, a naturally established small town quickly rose near the entrance of the Secret Realm, becoming the frontline base for various forces exploring the Secret Realm.
Many martial artists, wandering swordsmen would purchase information within the town before entering the Secret Realm, trading Divine Weapons, Elixirs, etc., and various resources harvested from the Secret Realm would circulate to every corner of the world through the town.
Gradually, the town transformed into a massive Market.

chapters.title: Chapter 363 - 34: Market Evolution (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 363: Chapter 34: Market Evolution (Second Update)
Relying on the abundant resources produced by the Secret Realm, various Spirit Medicine and Spirit Material, and Demon Beast corpses flow through the frontier of the Secret Realm, then spread to all corners of the world.
With a large number of transactions taking place, a new type of market, evolved from a small town, began to rise.
Disciples and masters of Sects, descendants of prominent families, wanderers of the Martial World, people from all walks of life gathered in the market, bringing massive crowds to the area.
At the same time, as the teachings of Li Hu at Jade Capital Mountain spread, some talented individuals who grasped a little essence of Alchemy and Artifact Refining, claimed themselves as Alchemists and Artifact Refiners, set up shops in the market, handling resources brought from the Secret Realm by various wanderers of the Martial World.
They refined Spirit Medicine into Elixirs that could enhance Cultivation, and crafted Spirit Material and minerals into Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact that greatly boosted individual power.
The market became an important transfer station.
Elixirs and Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact are ultimately closely related to Cultivation and power.
Therefore, with the Secret Realm’s abundant output, Alchemists and Artifact Refiners also started to gain attention and develop.
If not for the talent required in Alchemy and Artifact Refining, along with the need for substantial resources for practice, the conditions to become a true Alchemist or Artifact Refiner would not be so harsh, and Alchemy and Artifact Refining would likely have already become basic skills learned by Martial Artists.
With the advent of Alchemists and Artifact Refiners, the once invaluable Divine Elixirs and Divine Weapon began to appear extensively on the market.
Many years ago, a Great Rejuvenation Pill from Shaolin Temple that increased twenty years of Power was still an unattainable legend in the Martial World.
Sword Casting Manor had to spend the energy of three generations of Master Swordsmiths over a century to forge a single Divine Weapon.
But now, with the rise of new Alchemists and Artifact Refiners, those previously unattainable precious treasures began to appear in large quantities.
As long as you can bring enough Spirit Medicine from the Secret Realm or precious Spirit Minerals and Materials, and prepare sufficient compensation, any Alchemist or Artifact Refiner could provide you with a Spirit Pill comparable to the efficacy of Shaolin Temple’s Great Rejuvenation Pill, or a Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact comparable to Sword Casting Manor’s peerless Divine Sword.
This is the progress of the era, also the result of Li Hu’s teachings.
Aside from Alchemists and Artifact Refiners, various side arts like Array Masters, Talisman Masters, Mechanicians, Puppet Masters in the market are also gradually rising.
In previous Martial World duels, the outcome was typically determined by one’s Power and Martial Techniques.
But in today’s new era of great struggle, perhaps when you exhaust your opponent, they might suddenly swallow an Elixir to restore Primordial Qi, or suddenly unleash a powerful Talisman for a reversal kill.
In this grand epoch, in battles among Cultivators, Martial Arts is no longer the sole determining factor of victory.
Elixirs, Divine Weapons, Talismans, even Arrays and Puppets, all constitute part of the combat power.
The emergence of various new items has brought significant impact to the ancient combat methods of the Martial World.
This impact is gradually spreading from the market to the whole world.
Because relying on the Secret Realm, and its numerous output resources, Alchemists and Artifact Refiners can produce more Elixirs and Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact, spreading across the world through traveling merchants.
Under the collision of this grand era, ancient techniques will inevitably be phased out due to falling behind.
In various regions within the Secret Realm, various dangerous Demon Beasts and lurking peers are the most perilous enemies for Martial Artists exploring the Secret Realm.
In the Secret Realm’s brutal and bloody battlefields, only greater combat power forms the foundation and assurance for Martial Artists to stand firm.
For Martial Artists exploring the Secret Realm, they are more inclined to accept various Elixirs, Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact, Mechanical Puppets, Arrays, and other items that could greatly enhance their combat power.
Over time, while ancient traditions of the Martial World still exist in farther places, the Secret Realm and market have already become the forefront of melee with Elixirs, Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact, Talismans, etc.
This is the progress of the new era, which no one can resist.
Of course, while Elixirs and Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact can improve Martial Artists’ strength to some extent.
These are only supplementary means.
The truly important thing is one’s own Cultivation.
If the gap between Cultivation Levels becomes too large, the effectiveness of these external items becomes very limited.
Aside from the rise of Elixirs, Divine Weapon and Magical Artifact, Talismans, Arrays, Mechanical Puppets, and other new things.
With the opening of the Secret Realm, changes in Martial Arts Techniques have also appeared.
In battles with the Secret Realm’s Demon Beasts and various dangers,
Martial Artists exploring the Secret Realm began to discover the traditional Martial Arts were not very effective against enemies.
Therefore, these fighters at the forefront started trying to improve and enhance their Martial Arts according to Li Hu’s teachings, progressing significantly toward fantasy and the Immortal side.
Li Hu has made clear two paths at the Jade Capital Mountain lectures.
Martial Artists only need to follow the foundational systems provided by Li Hu, making appropriate improvements to convert their martial techniques into fantasy or cultivation techniques, greatly enhancing their power.
During the gradual transformation process, each Martial Arts technique improved had different effects.
For a time, in the frontier market established relying on the Secret Realm, a situation of a hundred flowers blooming appeared.
As this serves as the forefront of the world-changing battle front.
The existence of the market has become one of the places Martial Artists from all over the world must visit to broaden their knowledge.
Even if Martial Artists do not enter the Secret Realm to explore, while traveling the world, they inevitably come to this market to see and broaden their horizons.
During this period, numerous stories naturally unfold.
Certain disciples from small remote Sects and families, upon entering the market, are like country bumpkins entering the city, dazzled by all the new items.
When the Martial World they remembered was still in the era of blades and swords clashing, Martial Art competitions, and passionate Martial World,
Suddenly, seeing various powerful Spirit Pills, Magical Artifacts with incredible powers, various mysterious Talismans, Arrays, Mechanical Puppets, and seeing people fly with swords outside the market, their True Essence forming wings to soar the skies, what an experience it was.
The worldview built from childhood was challenged to an unimaginable extent under such circumstances!
The feeling was like walking out of the poorest primitive tribe in Africa, into the center of a modern city with towering skyscrapers.
It was like ancient people from a previous era seeing cars and planes for the first time, being completely astounded.
Not long ago, a hidden family’s genius, carrying the mission to shock the world and uphold the family name, descended from the mountain, intending to become famous worldwide.
After hearing about the Secret Realm and the market in the Martial World, they eagerly ventured to the market.
Their experiences almost shattered their Dao Heart.
After half a life of practicing Martial Arts and honing Inner Power, mastering the Seventy-Two Weapon Techniques, practicing diligently daily, they emerged to uphold their name, only to find this world was a fantasy Immortal world capable of anything.
What a frustrating realization.
As the era proceeds, the market established relying on the Secret Realm continues to push forward amidst this clash of new and old perspectives, constantly growing.
With the continuous evolution of the cultivation system, the influence of the market is also gradually increasing.
On the frontier of this Secret Realm, initially, it started as a small town, solving the accommodation and food needs of Martial Artists exploring the Secret Realm.
But soon, with the large output of heavenly treasures from the Secret Realm and the transactions taking place, it gradually formed into a market.
Ultimately, the market continuously developed, rapidly forming into a giant city.
Countless eyes from around the world focus here, becoming the newest forefront of the world’s great transformation.

chapters.title: Chapter 364 - 035 Celestial Emperor Position (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 364: Chapter 035 Celestial Emperor Position (Third Update)
Time slowly passed, and in the blink of an eye, three years had gone by.
With the opening of the first Secret Realm and the establishment of the first Market, various Cultivation Systems gradually upgraded, marking the beginning of a brilliant and glorious era.
In this era, the old Martial World had already ended, and new Legends were gradually unfolding.
Li Hu’s initial arrangements also began to gradually bear fruit.
One after another, prodigies of the era and lucky individuals gained the opportunities left by Li Hu, starting to stand out and show their own brilliance in the new era, stirring up the world.
And Li Hu, still high above on Jade Capital Mountain, silently watched all this from the shadows.
Just like the hidden mastermind manipulating the changes in the world.
The entire Divine Land World steadily moved from a pure Martial Hero World style towards a fantastical Immortal Hero Dao style.
And during this period, Li Hu also collected a large amount of sample materials through the Cultivation paths of countless Cultivators, beginning to perfect the two transcendence paths he had created.
However, there were some unexpected events in between.
"I didn’t expect that it would turn out this way in the end..."
On Jade Capital Mountain, Li Hu, as if suspended in a different dimensional space, revealed a look of being at a loss whether to laugh or cry.
Everything he did in this world was to achieve the purpose of shattering the void or Crossing Tribulation and Ascending, breaking the world’s constraints on himself, and then relying on the Gate of Truth deep within his soul to return to the Main World.
However, the pathway to shattering the void had not been completed, and the attempt to Cross Tribulation and Ascend had not yet been undertaken.
Li Hu now, however, had already acquired the ability to leave this world in advance.
That’s right, the world’s constraints on him had vanished.
He could already return to the Main World through the Gate of Truth deep within his soul now!
"Does this count as the flowers not blooming despite deliberate planting, but the willows growing without intent?"
Li Hu was somewhat speechless.
All of this, to speak of it, was still related to the transformation of the world.
In these three years, with the opening of the Secret Realms, a large amount of Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi began to flood into various parts of the world.
At the same time, the Secret Realms produced a large amount of Elixirs crafted from heavenly materials and earthly treasures that enhanced Cultivation.
There was also the exploration of fantasy-style, Immortal-Dao style Cultivation Techniques.
All these reasons allowed the power of a large number of Martial Artists to improve, ultimately raising the strength of the entire Cultivation Realm by one level.
This era of grand competition, in another sense,
was the hidden hand Li Hu leveraging unparalleled methods to stir up the wave of Spiritual Qi Revival.
What Li Hu did, even though it was only for himself, was precisely because of his actions that Heaven and Earth were given an opportunity to ascend, and the mechanized Heavenly Dao developed wisdom.
This kind of behavior brought about great merit to Heaven and Earth.
As he spoke of the Dao to all beings, opening up the great path for them, he was later favored by Heaven and Earth.
Therefore, as the world gradually ascended throughout these years, Li Hu imperceptibly gained the fortune and position akin to that of a Celestial Emperor.
This was feedback from the Heavenly Dao Consciousness to Li Hu as the strength of the entire world continued to elevate.
The Secret Realm established by Li Hu was picked by the Heavenly Dao Consciousness, but it was not without compensation.
The Heavenly Dao Consciousness’ compensation was granting Li Hu the Heaven and Earth Authority to manage all beings, essentially the Celestial Emperor Position.
As Celestial Emperor, he ruled over everything in the world.
This was also the Heavenly Dao Consciousness’s affirmation of him, as well as the reward for picking the fruit that Li Hu had planted.
Of course, even without the Heavenly Dao’s confirmation,
Li Hu, given his impact on the world, naturally held transcendent privileges as the world ascended.
Much like Hong Jun in the novels of ancient legends in his past life.
The Heavenly Dao Consciousness’s affirmation was merely the icing on the cake.
And under this transcendent position, Li Hu possessed the ability to transcend the world.
The world’s constraints on him had completely disappeared.
This resulted in Li Hu being able to return to the Main World through the Gate of Truth deep within his soul.
"Is this what it means to achieve sanctification through merit like in the ancient legends?"
Originally, he was wholeheartedly focused on developing the pathways of shattering the void and Crossing Tribulation and Ascending, yet the unintentional fruits he planted led him to achieve his ultimate objective unexpectedly.
This can only be said to be unexpected, yet reasonable.
Li Hu’s Celestial Emperor Position was in place even before the awakening of the Heavenly Dao Consciousness.
And after all, the Heavenly Dao is the collective consciousness of all beings, and the grand way is fair; even though it developed awareness, it would have no personal bias.
The relationship between Li Hu and the Heavenly Dao Consciousness was akin to the relationship between later shareholders and founders of a company.
Li Hu was the founder, the helmsman, possessing absolute managerial rights, while the Heavenly Dao Consciousness was a shareholder with ownership but without management rights, which rested with Li Hu, who held the Celestial Emperor Position.
Moreover, in this world, Li Hu’s Celestial Emperor was far superior to the Heaven Emperor Haotian in the legendary ancient world.
No one could bind him.
"It’s a pity, though this world is good, it’s ultimately not the world I’m meant to linger in forever."
For a moment, Li Hu felt an urge to remain in this world indefinitely.
But quickly, this thought was cast aside.
Because, although he could act with impunity in this world, undefeated in the realm,
what difference was it from a Martial Artist dominating a village or a pond?
The stage he needed was a bigger world beyond, a greater Multi-universe!
And all of these were not what this world could offer.
"Let’s leave for now; so many years have passed, I wonder how the other side of the Main World is doing."
Li Hu pondered for a moment and had already made up his mind.
It’s just a pity that after staying here for so many years, he really had some reluctance.
Li Hu sighed softly, his gaze somewhat deep.
However, the next moment, an inspiration suddenly flashed through his mind.
"Although I am merely returning to the Seta Continent, it doesn’t mean I have to abandon this world! This world still holds great value, especially as it is currently undergoing intense transformation, and after its ascension is complete, the benefits will only be greater, not to mention that I currently occupy the Celestial Emperor Position, of which completely abandoning would result in too much loss!"
Unwilling to give up.
Thus, Li Hu thought of a compromise.
Within the body in this world, he would leave a strand of Split Soul as an extension, overseeing the world, to wait for the day he returns to reap the harvest.
The Martial Hero World naturally didn’t have the operation of Split Soul, but the Immortal Hero Dao that Li Hu created did.
Slicing off a piece of Split Soul hardly affected the main body.
After all, even after the Divine Sense was split, it could regenerate automatically.
And as his Divine Fragment, it could also oversee this world and direct all the progressive transformations.
He acted immediately upon thought.
Li Hu promptly began retreating to split his Divine Soul.
After several days, he successfully sliced off a strand of Divine Soul.
Once he confirmed there were no issues,
he sent a message through the void, instructing those disciples he had taken under his name to descend the mountain, and notifying the Daoist Child on Jade Capital Mountain that he was about to go into seclusion.
Subsequently, Jade Capital Mountain was completely sealed off.
Li Hu’s body was controlled by the Split Soul.
And Austin’s Spiritual Body, by invoking the Gate of Truth within his mind, returned to the main body in the Main World.

chapters.title: Chapter 365 - 36: Return and Harvest (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 365: Chapter 36: Return and Harvest (First Update)
BOOM!!!
The void trembled, brilliant light filled the eyes, flowing like a tide.
Suddenly, it seemed as if something had crossed dimensions, crashing into the sleeping giant shadow.
In an instant, the giant beast in slumber.
Suddenly opened its eyes.
Blood-red light burst forth in the air, sweeping like a tide, filling every corner of the void.
A terrifying aura awakened, spreading throughout the surrounding space.
"Back!"
Twisting his neck, feeling his familiar body, Austin breathed a long sigh.
There was nothing unusual about his body.
His soul had spent thirty to forty years in the Martial Hero World. If time flowed the same way in the Main World, thirty to forty years without eating or drinking—even though the Giant Dragon Race can sleep for decades—would leave the body as a skeleton if returned unprepared.
Fortunately, the worst-case scenario did not occur.
Just a little unfamiliar with his body, but he quickly recovered.
Looking around, aside from the disappearance of the Gate of Truth’s base, nothing else has changed.
The traces left when he entered this space were still fresh, indicating it hadn’t been very long.
Perhaps, the flow of time between worlds is different?
Soon, Austin composed himself.
"After all the hardships, I’ve finally returned!"
Taking some time to readjust to his body, Austin mused inwardly.
The unexpected travel was simply an unforeseen journey in his dragon life.
His foundation remains in this world.
Luckily, the gains from this trip weren’t bad.
Firstly, within the Split Soul, there was still a faint connection present.
Though separated by vast distances between worlds, relying on the Fragment of the Gate of Truth within his soul, he managed to achieve mutual sensing.
Very well.
Although specific information couldn’t be transmitted, retaining a sense was already very good.
After all, the Celestial Emperor Position, ruler of worlds, and the world undergoing elevation—
The grand opportunities involved are not easily encountered.
In the future, with time, he can use this connection to return to that world and reap some benefits.
With the most important gains preserved, Austin felt content.
Secondly, it’s about the martial arts honed in that world.
The Martial Arts Cultivation left with Li Hu’s Divine Fragment in the Martial Hero World.
The extensive martial arts knowledge and the formidable realm he once reached were brought back together.
However, upon attempting cultivation, it proved futile.
Martial arts cannot be replicated in this world.
Perhaps due to differing world rules, neither the martial arts’ inner power nor Li Hu’s self-created mystical fantasy martial arts techniques could be cultivated here.
The outcome was anticipated.
After all, this world does not have the concept of meridians.
Of course, he tried it himself, realizing the dragon’s physique and beastman, human physique were different. Only testing Clan cultivation could truly confirm it.
However, Austin did not have high expectations.
Nevertheless, this doesn’t mean the martial arts knowledge absorbed in the Martial Hero World is useless.
In that world, he transcended martial arts, becoming a creator of his own grand path.
Even if inner power true Qi cannot be refined, there’s still fighting Qi.
This world doesn’t have chakra, yet he could still borrow its principles to create Magic Power Rasengan.
Power resembles principles; using these experiences to establish a new system is not difficult.
Especially for Austin.
With the experience of creating mystical fantasy martial arts, adapting fighting Qi for cultivation is simple.
Plus, elixirs, artifact refining, array techniques, etc.,
Even if they can’t be realized here, using principles, a new system can be created.
The decades of experience and knowledge wealth from the Martial Hero World are one of the biggest gains from his trip.
Aside from the above, the last gain is the elevation of his realm and vision.
In the Martial Hero World, Austin held the Celestial Emperor Position.
His strength gradually surpassed that of a Celestial Being as time passed.
At that time, Li Hu didn’t know what realm he had truly reached, but at least he could sense his power was comparable to Legendary in this world, advancing towards Epic!
This means,
Through this journey, Austin’s vision stood above the Legendary Realm!
Spiritual soul cultivation is not based on physical power.
Returning to his body, the spiritual soul gains were entirely brought back from the Martial Hero World.
Before the crossing, though Austin’s body had reached the Half-Legendary Realm,
The higher Legendary Realm remained elusive.
A bottleneck as insurmountable as a chasm lay ahead.
But now, with Austin’s soul returning to his body, the path ahead was clear as day.
The grand path was wide open, no bottleneck remained.
Given sufficient Magic Power, he could ascend to Legendary in no time!
Moreover, the soul gains weren’t just limited to this.
Because he had reached a higher realm, his understanding and use of power deepened.
Just like a former Grandmaster, even if the realm regressed, possessing deeper martial arts understanding, his strength surpasses others of the same level.
Ignoring other factors, this higher level of power understanding alone could increase Austin’s strength by more than a fold!
And with his body’s cultivation level enhancement, this increase would grow.
"Though this crossing was a dangerous accident, a slight misstep and I would’ve been trapped in the Martial Hero World forever unable to transcend, the great danger paired with immense rewards."
For a while, towards the unwelcome guest in the depths of his soul’s sea of consciousness, Austin felt conflicted.
Despite the substantial gains, unless necessary, Austin wouldn’t employ that thing again.
This time luck held, taking his soul to the Martial Hero World, at least offering a chance for transcendence.
If he were dragged to a modern world with Extraordinary hidden, that would be real trouble.
No superpowers, unable to cultivate or transcend, his end would be trapped in those worlds, aging and dying.
These probabilistic experiments, it’s best not to attempt.
"However, if the components of the Gate of Truth could be found and restored, could dimensional travel through the Multi-universe be done freely, resolving the flaw of going without return?"
Austin pondered silently in his heart.
Suddenly, he thought of the Beastman Royal Court at the heart of the Kawa Great Forest.
The Pure-blooded Beastmen there hold some fragments of the Gate of Truth!

chapters.title: Chapter 366 - 037: Target Planning (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 366: Chapter 037: Target Planning (Second Update)
"I wonder how far the war on the other side has progressed now."
Before Austin crossed over, the allied forces had already suffered a blow that seemed to come from a nuclear attack, and the amassed army was completely devastated under the cliffs in the core area by that terrifying explosion.
After that massive defeat, the allies once again drafted the beastmen from the outskirts of the Kawa Great Forest, gathering a large beastmen army in preparation for a second counterattack.
Austin was very interested in the Fragment of the Gate of Truth held by the Beastman Royal Court in the core area.
Especially considering how much he had gained from his previous journey to the Martial Hero World.
If he could use the fragment to complete the Gate of Truth and restore its ability to traverse between worlds, it was an opportunity Austin simply could not refuse.
However, he wasn’t completely reckless.
"This matter needs to be carefully planned out."
In such a high-stakes war, being able to cloak himself under the guise of Celestial Dragon Island was already a stroke of luck.
To seize any benefits, thorough preparations were necessary.
Moreover, his own strength was somewhat lacking.
Not reaching the Legendary realm, he was still merely a high-level enforcer.
Hadn’t he slain the envoy from the allied forces, the Half-Legendary dark-striped tiger man, Vira?
Yet the allied forces showed no reaction at all, right?
The tiger skin he wore could only be a temporary deterrent, and not a permanent shield. In the case of any unexpected events, ultimately, he could rely only on his own strength.
"First, enhance my strength. At least reach the Legendary stage before the great battle, to qualify for reaping benefits amidst the chaos!"
In an instant, Austin had made up his mind.
Due to the crossing, the path to the realm ahead was clear, with no obstacles, except for the lack of sufficient Magic Power.
"The location of the Dragon’s Nest is rather remote, and even if the whole Dragon Nest Tribe is mobilized, gathering enough magic resources is difficult, unless destructively mining the various Magic Ore Veins, but that’s impossible; depending solely on the Clan Tribe to gather magic is still a bit slow."
Austin began to ponder.
To elevate his strength and collect more Magic Power for his breakthrough, additional auxiliary methods were needed.
In the end, Austin turned his gaze to the numerous martial arts memories he had brought back.
"Perhaps, I can perform a magic modification on a martial art that devours the Magic Power between heaven and earth for support."
In the Martial Hero World, there existed a heretical martial art that absorbed others’ power for one’s use.
Back when Li Hu traveled the world, he naturally acquired and studied this martial art.
Unfortunately, no matter how it was researched and optimized, the issue of chaotic True Qi from absorbing others’ power couldn’t be resolved.
That path was too narrow, unable to reach the other shore.
In the end, Li Hu had to modify it to devour Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi for one’s own use.
Unfortunately, the human body was too fragile to withstand the massive, explosive Primordial Qi’s erosion, and unprocessed Primordial Qi entering the meridians would only blow a person to bloody pieces.
Ultimately, that martial art came to an unsatisfactory end, left untouched by Li Hu in a corner.
"The human body is fragile and can’t withstand the influx of Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, but the body of a Giant Dragon is different. Moreover, my original body has been tempered by lava and further compressed and refined by the Law of Power, making it almost as tough as a Divine Weapon, fundamentally unafraid of Heaven and Earth Power’s impact."
"What’s more, while the Heaven and Earth in the Martial Hero World is filled with Primordial Qi, this world is imbued with Magic Power, which, unlike uncontrolled Heaven and Earth Primordial Qi, can be manipulated with strong Spiritual Power."
"By altering this technique to a Secret Technique that devours the Magic Power of heaven and earth, perhaps I could greatly reduce the time needed to accumulate magic power and advance to Legendary!"
A decision had already been made in his heart, but Austin was not in a hurry.
Apart from his cultivation level, he also needed to enhance his combat methods.
The divine sword forged with the Law still resided within his dragon body, being nourished by the dragon’s might and vast Magic Power.
Initially condensing the Law Divine Sword was a result of delving deeply into the concepts from novels he had read in his previous life, trying different approaches.
Now, after decades of experience in the Martial Hero World, he also learned about numerous secret techniques in the Martial World for nurturing the Law Divine Sword.
With his expanded perspective, the way to nurture the Law Divine Sword had to be improved, and he had even better methods now.
Then there was the issue of the Four Spirits Sword Array.
Previously, when Austin crafted the Four Spirits Sword Array, he merely relied on the mysterious connection between the four Law Divine Swords and the imagined images of the four Holy Beasts to stabilize it, thus achieving the sword array.
This method was extremely crude, akin to primitive humans sharpening a Wooden Spear as a weapon.
He knew how it worked but not why it worked, so he had to strain to make do.
But now, everything had changed.
In the Martial World, he had studied the discipline of array creations passed down by the Dao Ancestor.
His understanding of arrays was crystal clear.
In Austin’s current view, if he organized the layout of his simplistic Four Spirits Sword Array according to an array structure,
its power could increase at least threefold!
Lastly, there was the application of the Law of Power and the development and application of the combination of the four swords.
All these required Austin to devote time and energy to research.
"So the next plan is to seclude myself, organize various knowledge systems, and boost my own strength as quickly as possible!"
After setting the upcoming plan, Austin stood up.
With a complex gaze, he glanced around the spatial area and then turned to leave it.
As soon as he stepped out, the space beneath the vortex seemed to lose some sustaining force, collapsing like a waterfall.
The spatial fluctuations shook violently, causing the ground to tremble faintly.
Clearly, without the support of the Gate of Truth, that space had collapsed.
At the bottom of the lake reservoir, nothing else remained.
He didn’t linger for long and flew swiftly towards the water’s surface.
Returning to the tribe, Austin summoned a beastman, and only after inquiring did he learn that merely three days had passed.
In the Martial World, three to four decades had gone by, yet in the Main World, it had only been three short days.
The time difference was indeed astonishing.
Fortunately, due to Austin’s regular seclusion and cultivation, most major affairs had been handed over to Vini and other high-ranking beastmen, so there were no disturbances from his absence in those days.
However, as the Dragon Nest Tribe developed rapidly and expanded, Vini and other high-level Dragon Nest Beastmen were starting to find their management capabilities stretched to the limit.
It was nearly ten years since Austin established the Dragon Nest Tribe and gathered the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
In ten years, from having only seven and a half Kobolds, the Dragon Nest Tribe had grown to over 130,000 individuals, marching toward a population of 150,000.
The Dragon Nest Tribe’s territory had expanded to a fourth outpost, connecting to form a vast area.
An enormous region, with a massive population.
In the Human World, it would even compare to some remote, weak Duchies.
This was reaching the limit of the talent and management ability of Vini and the other high-ranking members of the Dragon Nest Tribe.

chapters.title: Chapter 367 - 38 Two Years (Part 3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 367: Chapter 38 Two Years (Part 3)
This is the limitation of talent.
Perhaps Vini, Quik, and Rodney have been growing all along, but their growth simply cannot keep up with the development speed of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Learning to manage requires talent as well, especially in the rapidly expanding situation of the Dragon Nest Tribe. To keep up with the degree of development, talent becomes all the more important.
This needs to change!
The Dragon Nest Tribe follows a military group strategy with military force at its core and production as a complement.
In the entire Clan Tribe, the army occupies the main part.
In terms of production, it is also organized and managed militarily during opening expansion and basic large-scale production.
Every Beastman, whether a wandering Beastman or a captured Beastman, old or young, must undergo military training transformation before becoming a member of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In this military system, each Beastman in management has struggled up from the bottom, carrying a lot of military style.
This semi-militarized group brings significant benefits to the management of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
High-efficiency execution and a militarized management system are the foundations for the rapid expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, no system is perfect.
After the initial stage of rapid expansion, especially with the sharp increase in population, base development, and land area growth, if one lacks certain talent, it is nearly impossible to sort out a large amount of affairs in an orderly manner.
Back then, Kobold Vini was merely the leader of a destitute and near-extinct Kobold tribe.
Fox-faced Man Quik and Lizardman Rodney had similar origins.
If they had not met Austin, they would have remained insignificant wild Beastmen in the vast region of the Kawa Great Forest, dying unknown, with no one ever remembering them.
Initially, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe had less than a hundred members, struggling to survive in the perilous forest. Who would have thought that the small Clan Tribe would grow to what it is today?
No one would have or dared to imagine.
Their talents were just among the ordinary.
If not for standing on Austin’s windfall, they could never have soared.
They understood this, and as the increasing affairs of the Dragon Nest Tribe became overwhelming, they had to submit their resignations to Austin.
"Your Highness, your loyal servant can no longer handle the increasingly complex government affairs. Please entrust the position of Tribe Governor to someone capable."
Inside the hall, looking at Vini deeply bowing his head, Austin’s heart was also complicated.
Although most of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s development strategies were formulated by himself,
Vini also played a significant role in the tribe’s development process.
At least, it spared Austin from being entangled in these tedious matters, allowing him to focus wholeheartedly on cultivating his strength in seclusion.
No merits are without hardships.
However, personal talent is ultimately a limitation.
If given a dozen years of experience, Vini might grow into a competent leader through extensive practice.
But as the Dragon Nest Tribe develops rapidly, those who cannot keep up are destined to be eliminated.
"Vini, you..."
Initially, Austin intended to comfort him and then promote some high-level Beastmen in the tribe to ease his burden.
However, at that moment, Austin suddenly conceived an idea.
During the days in the Martial Hero World, Li Hu laid the foundation for his future deification and sanctification by scanning countless books with his powerful Spiritual Power.
So, is it possible to borrow some secret techniques from that world to try to complete a spiritual connection of certain knowledge and memories, and instill them in others?
If possible, directly transferring certain management thoughts and concepts he encountered in his previous life into Vini’s mind, would it directly enhance his management talent?
This idea is worth a try!
"Vini, I have seen your loyalty. You should continue in this position for now. If it’s really unsustainable, first promote a few smart subordinates to help share the workload. I need to continue to retreat and advance for a period, and we will talk again when I emerge."
Another matter popped up.
To solve these issues, it’s necessary to first absorb and digest the knowledge foundation from the Martial Hero World and adapt it locally.
Austin became more eager to absorb the gains from the Martial Hero World.
He needs time.
Fortunately, with the Celestial Dragon Island as a shield, the environment around the Dragon Nest Tribe remains stable for now.
Thus, Austin continues his retreat.
The Dragon Nest Tribe continues as usual, rapidly expanding, reclaiming land, and clearing and assimilating wild creatures while vigorously developing occupied territories, collecting a large amount of Magic Resources to supply Austin’s strength enhancement.
The Water Patterned Demon Iron Ore from the Wet Bone Forest, the Refined Gold and Mithril from the Volcanic Cluster Domain, magic-infused fruits found in the wild, and some Magic Crystals produced in the wilderness.
All these are collected massively by Dragon Nest Beastmen.
And then provided to Austin in seclusion.
Meanwhile, Austin devours Magic Resources while organizing the extensive knowledge system in his mind.
Martial Arts Secret Techniques are organized and optimized through comparisons with Magic Power Fighting Qi and others.
During this digestion and exploration process, Austin’s foundation also steadily strengthens.
Even though Austin’s dragon form prevents the cultivation of many martial techniques, and the fundamental Laws of the world make it difficult for Beastmen to cultivate those Inner Powers.
Yet various knowledge systems greatly enriched his understanding of power.
In this modifying process, the collision of different Extraordinary systems offers him immense inspiration.
His strength, in such a situation, grows stronger day by day.
As time slowly passes, the Dragon Nest Tribe develops steadily, and in the blink of an eye, two years have gone by.
In these two years, while Austin absorbs the Magic Resources supplied by the Dragon Nest Tribe, he continually digests and modifies the knowledge system from the Martial Hero World, creating a new cultivation system centered on Fighting Qi, Spiritual Power, Magic Power, etc.
After two years of effort, he has digested over ninety percent of the accumulated knowledge.
Simultaneously, his Level Cultivation has reached the pinnacle just below the Half-Legendary level.
Only a half-step away from crossing the bottleneck ahead and entering the Legendary Realm.
From birth to Half-Legendary peak,
in all, Austin’s body’s age is merely ten years.
Ten years, just a step away from entering Legendary.
This rate of improvement is truly astonishing!
Not to mention that for long-lived creatures like the Giant Dragon, it often takes decades or even centuries to advance a Realm.
Even among humans, nearing the Legendary in a decade is incredibly shocking!

chapters.title: Chapter 368 - 039 - Significant Progress (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 368: Chapter 039 - Significant Progress (First Update)
Of course, this speed increase did not come without a price.
The price was the consumption of a large amount of magic resources that the Dragon Nest Tribe could obtain from the forest.
It can be said that Austin’s cultivation level is the result of being accumulated with a large amount of magic resources.
The Dragon Nest Tribe played a tremendous role in this process.
If Austin were to collect the vast magic resources from the forest on his own, it would take years of effort.
It would even need more time due to the complexity.
Moreover,
during these two years, Austin transformed a cultivation technique from the Martial Hero World into a secret technique that could directly absorb magic power from between heaven and earth.
After improving that secret technique, Austin could directly absorb a vast amount of magic power from heaven and earth, refining it into his foundation and upgrading his cultivation level.
The magic absorbed through that Heaven-Devouring Secret Technique did not fall short of the magic resources supplied by the Dragon Nest Tribe.
However, even so, it was only enough for Austin to elevate his cultivation level to the peak of Half-Legendary.
This vast amount of magic power seems enormous.
But in fact, it’s just the normal requirement for the Dragon Race’s advancement.
A normal young dragon, in its early growth phase, has its parents’ care, and resources like magic crystals are almost never lacking.
Moreover, the growth of an ordinary giant dragon considers centuries as a basic unit.
A casual slumber can last for dozens or even hundreds of years.
Under normal circumstances, a dragon takes at least two to three hundred years from birth to adulthood.
That is to say,
Austin’s current Half-Legendary peak level should spread over two to three hundred years to be normal.
The large amount of magic resources he consumed, averaged over two to three hundred years, is not particularly stunning.
But he compressed the time to advance to the peak of Half-Legendary into just a decade, so it appears that the consumption of magic resources is incredibly huge.
In this world, Austin is probably the only exception.
Due to his traversal, his soul did not need to grow in slumber.
At the same time, born in the wild,
without the shelter of a parent’s safe haven, his desire for power was extremely intense.
When young dragons of the same era were playing under parental protection and sleeping soundly in the Dragon’s Nest, Austin was already surviving independently in the perilous wilderness, struggling amidst the dangers of magic beasts, giant beasts, and other terrifying predators.
Precisely because of this, when young dragons of the same era were still taking advantage of their bloodline advantages idly, Austin was striving diligently to elevate his level of cultivation.
One step at a time, to seek survival in this chaotic wilderness.
Perhaps, it was due to witnessing Austin’s mindset, which was completely different from other young dragons, that Guppa was willing to associate and provide protection after only one chance encounter years ago.
The Giant Dragon Race has been complacent for too long, having a kind of unparalleled pride due to their bloodline, to the extent of not seeing their own flaws.
With their innate talent to reach Legendary adulthood strongly, they did not have to work hard to achieve the pinnacle of worldly force.
But precisely because of the bloodline’s shackles, power comes too easily, leaving them naturally lacking struggles necessary to reach the true pinnacle.
The Giant Dragon Race has many legends but extremely few epic ones who truly stand at the pinnacle of this world’s power.
Today, the Giant Dragon Race is gradually exiting the stage of the Prime Material Plane.
Guppa might have seen some new possibilities for the next generation of dragons in Austin.
Perhaps, he hopes that Austin’s growth will bring about a slight change to the Giant Dragon Species.
"Half-Legendary peak, still lacking a bit."
Regarding Guppa’s kindness back in the day, Austin naturally did not have much time to ponder.
Currently, within the great hall, Austin examined his own strength.
Over the past two years, aided by continually absorbing magic resources, his cultivation level had also risen to the peak of Half-Legendary.
Simultaneously, the substantial foundational knowledge from the Martial Hero World was reorganized over these two years, transforming it into his own strength suitable for this world.
In addition, there is also the understanding of the laws.
With a higher-level perspective, Austin’s understanding of the laws improved rapidly.
The Law of Thunder, the Law of Wind, the Law of Fire, the Law of Water, and the Law of Power, obtained from devouring the strength of the dark-marked tiger-man Vira.
Understanding of these five Law Origins reached a very profound level.
As a Blue Dragon, with the Blue Dragon Bloodline containing the hidden origins of both the Law of Thunder and the Law of Wind.
This means that once Austin advances to Legendary, he will be able to comprehend and awaken, achieving complete mastery of two Law Origins.
The other three laws will also become more in-depth.
Mind you, a typical Legendary powerhouse can completely grasp only one or two Law Origins at most.
But as soon as Austin enters Legend, he will automatically master two Law Origins entirely.
Moreover, he is very deep into the other three Law Origins.
This indicates that once Austin enters the Legendary Realm, even as a newcomer, he will stand among the strong within the Legendary Level!
"The nourishing method of the Law Divine Sword has been improved, the array effects of the Four Spirits Sword Array have been enhanced, and combined with deeper laws, the absorption of the Martial Hero World’s background of decades—all this, with my current strength, even a Legendary Level being might not necessarily defeat me!"
Rasengan, the Law Divine Sword nurtured for two years, the Four Spirits Sword Array, Four Swords United, the Law of Power forging the body...
With all these enhancements, Austin now possesses the combat power of the Legendary Level!
Even when facing a real Legendary, he does not fear in the least.
The Law Divine Sword, which has been nurtured for over two years, has now accumulated extremely terrifying power; once unleashed, combined with the Four Spirits Sword Array and techniques like the Four Swords United, it could instantly deliver heavy damage to a Legendary.
In an instant, Austin’s confidence swelled significantly.
"Regrettably, I ultimately couldn’t entirely step into the Legendary Realm; otherwise, I would have had more assurance in this current scheme!"
Somewhat regretful.
Though the bottleneck before Legendary had long since disappeared for Austin,
to undergo the Legendary transformation, the required magic power accumulation is indeed too massive.
Even other dragon races accumulate enough over two to three hundred years.
Despite the collection by the Clan Tribe and his own secret technique of absorbing the world’s magic power, there remains quite a considerable distance from reaching the level of transformation.
"Forget it, achieving such an improvement is already quite extensive."
Two years of seclusion, significant advancement in strength!

chapters.title: Chapter 369 - 040: Current Situation of the Dragon Nest Tribe (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 369: Chapter 040: Current Situation of the Dragon Nest Tribe (Second Update)
Two years of secluded cultivation did not bring advancement to the Legendary realm.
Although somewhat disappointing, Austin was not greatly surprised.
There’s no way around it; to rapidly ascend to Legendary status requires obtaining extremely pure magic material, like last time’s advancement to Half-Legendary when he acquired potent magic power material.
For example, an Elemental Core of Legendary level.
Back then, Austin led the Dragon Nest Beastmen to eliminate the Fire Elemental Leader in the Volcanic Cluster Domain and consumed its Elemental Essence, thereby advancing to Half-Legendary.
And now, if he wants to advance to Legendary in a short period, only a Legendary-level Elemental Essence could help him improve.
Or, a Magic Beast Crystal Core of Legendary level could also work.
This is a higher-level metamorphosis, requiring higher-level energy to fulfill the demands of one’s transformation.
Otherwise, even with the magic resources gathered by the Dragon Nest Tribe, despite having a Secret Technique for devouring the world’s magic, it would still take at least over ten years to gradually achieve a breakthrough.
No choice; though the Dragon Race is powerful,
This mighty power is not without cost, and the immense dragon body requires a massive accumulation and refinement of magic power.
The inherent talent of Giant Dragons results in them possessing hundreds to thousands of times more magic at the same level compared to humans.
Thus, to advance in realm, the magic resources consumed naturally need to be hundreds to thousands of times greater.
With gains come losses, the world is very fair.
"Elemental Essence from a leader is rare, and a Legendary-level Magic Beast Crystal Core is hard to obtain; it seems we’ll have to wait for future opportunities."
Even a magic beast without intelligence will undergo metamorphosis upon advancing to Legendary.
If a Golden-level magic beast’s intelligence remains beast-like, then upon transforming into a Legendary-level magic beast, its intelligence becomes nearly human-like.
Some Legendary-level magic beasts even learn Transformation Techniques from human mages, turning into humans to mingle and play in the human world.
In this situation, obtaining a Legendary-level Magic Beast Crystal Core is as hard as climbing the sky.
Legendary realm, seeking urgently cannot achieve.
But it doesn’t matter; anyway, with his current strength, even a Legendary doesn’t intimidate him, plus he has the backing of that Celestial Dragon Island, allowing quite a bit of calm time without needing to rush.
Taking a long breath, Austin decided to end his seclusion.
Two years in seclusion, his limbs had become somewhat numb.
Uncertain about the current state of the Dragon Nest Tribe after two years of development,
It’s time to go out and take a look.
Thinking of this, Austin spread his huge wings, took flight, and left his place of seclusion.
...
In the span of two years, the development of the Dragon Nest Tribe was rapid.
Its population had already broken through 200,000 people, gradually approaching 300,000.
Population explosion among Beastmen!
The cause for this was not just the absorption of new Beastmen.
Many new Beastmen were born within the Dragon Nest Tribe, and a large number of native births contributed to the swift increase in the population of Beastmen in the tribe.
And during the population boom, the number of bases established by the Dragon Nest Tribe had reached seven.
Seven bases, centered around Dragon Nest Base City, spread outwards like a web.
Large expanses of territory, centered around the bases, interconnected, firmly grasped.
As many monsters, beasts were cleared, vast plains were expanded upon.
With the help of elves, the Dragon Nest Beastmen engaged in large-scale land reclamation, benefiting from the excellent climate of Kawa Great Forest to achieve abundant harvests every quarter.
Now, regarding food, the Dragon Nest Tribe had thoroughly freed itself from the constraints of food scarcity.
Without the shackles of lacking food, it meant that the Dragon Nest Tribe’s military actions were more liberated.
As one by one, Beastman tribes outside were conquered and integrated, with their population merged and trained within the military system, laying the foundation for the perpetual strengthening of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
At the same time, the spread of the Breathing Technique through the merit point system and some Combat Techniques improved by Austin had increased the number of Extraordinary individuals, rapidly strengthening the tribe’s overall power.
With abundant food production from inside, and well-trained, battle-hardened military elites from outside.
Additionally, civilians responsible for production.
The systematized Dragon Nest Tribe had developed into the embryonic form of a kingdom, and this kingdom prototype had combat strength several times that of some smaller duchies.
And now, the Dragon Nest Tribe truly became a local dominant force.
Renowned far and wide.
Every year, numerous wandering Beastmen voluntarily came to join, while many impoverished Beastman tribes surrounding, faced with desperate situations, surrendered and accepted transformation into the Dragon Nest Tribe.
For in the face of nature’s disasters, the Dragon Nest Tribe was their only lifeline before impending death.
Because of this, during these two years, the percentage of the Dragon Nest Legion’s military actions to sweep and conquer other forest Beastman tribes had decreased progressively, as those familiar with the Dragon Nest Tribe’s reputation simply surrendered upon the Legion’s arrival.
For many struggling Beastmen standing between life and death, joining the Dragon Nest Tribe marked the beginning of a beautiful life.
Unable to fear the dangers of the forest, without worry of never returning from seeking food within the forest, without concern for lacking food today and none tomorrow, ensuring safety and fullness daily.
Such life was an irresistible temptation for Beastmen struggling below the poverty line.
Some bottom-tier outdoor Beastmen even eagerly awaited the day when the Dragon Nest Legion would arrive nearby, hoping to join the tribe.
Under this mindset, the willingness to resist among outdoor Beastmen was extremely low.
Consequently, the Dragon Nest Tribe’s allocation of military power for conquering outdoor Beastman tribes steadily declined.
Currently, the Dragon Nest Legion’s main combat targets had shifted focus to the various monsters within the forest.
Trolls, giant beasts, wolf packs, goblins, and other monsters traversing the forest significantly impacted the Dragon Nest Territory, especially those boars always inclined to destroy the crops planted by Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Of course, clearing these nearby forest monsters was the ordinary Dragon Nest Beastmen army’s responsibility.
As for the most elite Extraordinary troops, they faced the hazardous zones within the forest, clearing groups of monsters with destructive power like magic beasts.
The magic resources expended by Austin for strengthening were sourced from the magic ore veins seized by the Extraordinary Beastmen troops during their monster nest clearing operations.
"Fortunately, it seems Vini has put some theories I transmitted to him into practice."
Austin soared high above, looking down at the earth below, with fields stretching far and wide, lush with crops.
Roads extended from the base city outward, spreading into the distance.
Connections among Dragon Nest Tribe base city and its bases relied on these developed roads for transportation.
Beastmen and elves worked uniformly under command in the fields.
And beside the roads, the Dragon Nest Beastmen army was arranged in tight formations, swiftly passing through.

chapters.title: Chapter 370 - 041 Development (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 370: Chapter 041 Development (Third Update)
From a high vantage point, whether observing the city’s construction or the movement of the beastmen, the entire Dragon Nest Tribe appears orderly and exudes an unusual aesthetic, embodying the early form of a kingdom tribe.
Gazing at the bustling beastmen below, a sense of accomplishment welled up within Austin.
A decade of struggle, starting from scratch.
Finally, he had established a force of his own on this wild land!
Recalling the past, when he had just been born, struggling to survive in the perilous forest, he dared not venture too far for fear of encountering formidable enemies in the dangerous wilderness.
Those scenes of struggling to survive remain vivid in his memory.
Two years later, the slightly grown-up Austin encountered a defeated, wandering, and near-extinct Kobold tribe.
For survival, he decided to take in these few Kobolds as his clan.
From that moment on, he embarked on a path of rapid development.
Who would have thought that in just eight short years, the Dragon Nest Tribe, built on the brink of destruction of the Kobold tribe, would grow to its current state?
Step by step, as if it was a lifetime ago.
Austin soared high, not revealing his form.
From south to north, he wanted to see with his own eyes the empire he had built.
Today, the Dragon Nest Tribe has evolved into a stable military group system.
The ordinary beastmen militia is responsible for tilling the land, planting grain with the elves, while also handling routine patrols and simple guard duties.
The entire food supply of the Dragon Nest Tribe now primarily comes from agricultural production.
Besides cultivated grain dominating, livestock farming, fishing, and cultivated mushrooms contribute a portion to the Dragon Nest Tribe’s food supply.
Particularly in animal husbandry, relying on the taming of some docile wild animals, it has now reached a certain scale.
The tribe’s meat supply, apart from external hunting, largely comes from this animal husbandry.
Furthermore, the tamed wild cattle, horses, and some Earth Rhinoceros Giant Beasts have made significant contributions to transportation.
The Dragon Nest Tribe relies on the powerful transportation capabilities of these beasts to tightly control seven strongholds and expand outward, integrating the main city and strongholds into a cohesive unit, significantly strengthening the tribe’s power.
Apart from food, the next focus is tool manufacturing.
One must acknowledge that Austin’s decision to establish a Manufacturing Workshop to bring together skilled Goblins to focus on tool-making was a wise one.
As time spent in the workshop increased, the Goblins’ craftsmanship continually advanced.
It was as if they awakened an attribute in technology.
Various innovative tools gradually emerged from the Manufacturing Workshop.
From early wooden spear processing platforms to water wheels for irrigation, to the blast system of the bronze and steel furnace.
In every aspect of the Dragon Nest Tribe, all sorts of tools produced by the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop facilitated the productive life of the Dragon Nest Beastmen.
Especially after annexing the Elf Kingdom.
The technologies possessed by various elves were assimilated, further enhancing the foundation of the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop.
Until now, having completed various technological accumulations, the Goblins, even following some of Austin’s ideas, began researching the power of steam.
Recently, the Goblins have started attempting to create early steam engines.
Of course, the prototype steam engines, with unresolved leakage issues, are practically useless.
A severe accident almost occurred not long ago, nearly causing significant casualties.
Despite the challenges, Austin holds considerable expectations for it.
Once the steam engine is successfully developed, it would then be possible to establish railway lines utilizing the forest’s abundant mineral resources, relying on the railroad’s formidable transportation capabilities to integrate the Dragon Nest Tribe’s strongholds and rapidly expand outward.
The steam engine is indeed a hallmark of the Industrial Revolution.
Once the technology accumulation of the First Industrial Revolution is completed, how far can the Second and even the Third Industrial Revolution be?
As the Goblin Manufacturing Workshop completes various technological accumulations and attempts to develop steam engines, progress is made in other areas as well.
The military capability needs no elaborate description,
With the development of steel blast furnaces and sufficient steel armors and weapons, the well-trained Dragon Nest Legion forms an unstoppable iron-clad torrent on the battlefield, with no opponent able to withstand this elite and terrifying force.
This is comparable to the elite legions of certain human duchies.
At the same time, investment in Extraordinary Ability Users did not diminish.
Relying on Austin’s modified breathing cultivation techniques and the improved Beastman Six Techniques upon his return, every extraordinary beastman is elite amidst elites with extremely potent combat strength.
The improved Beastman Six Techniques, besides having strong offensive power, also possess the ability to modify physique and cultivate Fighting Qi.
If one could cultivate all six techniques to a profound level, they could undergo a metamorphosis and gain advanced abilities, although none of the Dragon Nest Beastmen have reached that realm yet.
The military power of the Dragon Nest Tribe has generally advanced along with the tribe.
In addition to these, a relatively important system within the tribe is the medical system Austin had someone establish.
After years of development, accumulating various treatment experiences over the years, Dragon Nest Tribe’s medical system has reached a relatively sophisticated level.
Especially after Austin returned from the Martial Hero World, the comprehensive Chinese medicine system greatly inspired the medical system in the Otherworld.
Even the human civilization of this world solely relies on priests’ divine techniques and alchemists’ healing potions for treatment, unlike the complete medical treatment system of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
In this regard, the Dragon Nest Tribe is undoubtedly more advanced than human civilization.
At least for the broad ordinary populace, neither the divine techniques of priests nor the healing potions of alchemists are affordable.
Falling ill means death.
In the slums, with cases of fever, the cheap doctors there only resort to bloodletting treatments.
Whether in agriculture, military power, manufacturing workshops, or the medical system,
Each of these constitutes the main force of the Dragon Nest Tribe, supporting the entire tribe’s rapid expansion and development.
Austin spent the whole day, finally touring the entire domain of the Dragon Nest Tribe.
As he brimmed with pride, ready to return contentedly,
Suddenly, a plume of thick smoke rose into the sky in the distance, accompanied by flames.
It was in the direction of the newly established seventh stronghold.
"Could it be an enemy attack?"
This thought flashed in Austin’s mind, and after only a moment of hesitation, he immediately flew towards that direction.
Even from a considerable distance, he could still sense the wave of Fighting Qi conflict explosion.
Whoever that damn fellow is, daring to attack Lord Austin’s territory!
He must make those accursed enemies realize the outcome of offending Lord Austin!

chapters.title: Chapter 371 - 42: Frost Giant (Fourth Update, Requesting Monthly Tickets)
