chapters.content:
Chapter 371: Chapter 42: Frost Giant (Fourth Update, Requesting Monthly Tickets)
The seventh stronghold of the Dragon Nest Tribe has been established hundreds of miles northeast of the main city.
That area is close to a plateau.
Further north, the temperature becomes increasingly cold, reaching a glacial plateau.
The Dragon Nest Tribe established a new seventh stronghold nearby due to a rather large magic crystal vein in the vicinity.
At the same time, the level of magic power in the surrounding area is relatively dense, with a good production of various magic resources.
If you go deeper into the glacial plateau, you can gain even more varied types of magic ores.
It can be said that this area is a relatively rich resource point.
However, areas with abundant resources naturally attract stronger enemies.
On the glacial plateau, there is a group of Frost Giants inhabiting it.
These Frost Giants living on the plateau are extremely powerful in both physique and strength, with a violent temperament and a strong tendency for combat, frequently fighting even among their own tribe.
But due to their inclination for cold environments, they rarely venture down the plateau to loot.
Plus, since the Dragon Nest Tribe’s military strength is not weak and Austin urgently needs magical resources, the Dragon Nest Tribe decided to establish a new stronghold near the magic crystal vein.
Anyway, the magic crystal vein is at the bottom of the plateau, quite a distance from the Frost Giant Tribe, so there shouldn’t be any trouble.
When the Dragon Nest Tribe established a stronghold, the nearby Frost Giant Tribe noticed the Dragon Nest Tribe’s new stronghold.
Relying on teams transporting bison, wild horses, and Earth Rhinoceros Giant Beasts, a large amount of food supplies was sent near the stronghold.
Simultaneously, the Dragon Nest Beastmen began constructing houses, defense works, gradually developing the stronghold.
Apart from this, they also merged with nearby native beastman tribes.
While acquiring a large labor force, they found suitable crops for the local climate.
Then they cultivated farmland and planted crops in the cleared fields.
With mature experience from colonial development systems, the seventh stronghold steadily got on track, and some grain crops began to yield, gradually forming a self-sufficient stronghold tribe system.
The formation of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s stronghold beneath the glacier was observed by the Frost Giants on the plateau.
Initially, the barbaric Frost Giants didn’t care much about the little people beneath the glacier.
However, as the Dragon Nest Tribe’s stronghold developed.
Its population grew, its activity range expanded, naturally grabbing their attention.
When the Frost Giants observed, they eventually discovered the Dragon Nest Tribe’s extremely rich food reserves.
This cannot go unchecked!
Even though the Frost Giants are the undisputed overlords on the glacial plateau, the environment means that even dominating the plateau, the hunting produced is not rich. At times, these highly digestible Frost Giants in hunger would have to chop down trees to chew as bread.
The abundant food supplies of the Dragon Nest Tribe’s stronghold naturally incited the Frost Giants’ greed.
Before the cold winter arrived, the raid was bound to happen.
On this day,
Gigantic figures with rough animal hides covering key parts, wielding unknown beast bone weapons, their skin ice blue, resembling enlarged primitive humans like Frost Giants descended the mountain.
Their steps on the ground made the earth rumble.
The Frost Giant’s ranks appeared chaotic, akin to a band of wild robbers, devoid of any discipline, basically charging en masse towards the Dragon Nest Tribe’s stronghold.
Yet, even without any formation.
Just their giant figures alone exuded an overwhelming suffocating force!
"Soldiers! Take up your weapons, the time has come to show loyalty to the great His Highness Austin!"
On the simple city wall, former Mercenary Deputy Captain Gory raised his extraordinary weapon, shouting to the densely arrayed Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers behind him.
Among these Dragon Nest soldiers were some former companions from Gory’s mercenary corps.
They were among the few humans in the entire Dragon Nest Tribe.
"Long live His Highness!"
"Long live His Highness Austin!"
Below the wall, the neatly arrayed Dragon Nest soldiers showed no fear, raising their weapons and shouting loudly in unison, creating an echoing roar.
The beastmen soldiers eligible to join the development of the stronghold were seasoned elites.
During their previous military careers, they had slain giant beasts, and these approaching beastmen attackers weren’t enough to scare them.
"Prepare, as usual, annihilate them!"
Gory endeavored to rally the Dragon Nest Legion’s spirits, but inwardly cursed his misfortune.
He had barely climbed to the tribe’s upper echelon, appointed as the master of development.
Unexpectedly unfortunate, encountering a Frost Giants raid.
Even if the Frost Giant’s attack could be repelled, the war losses would be considerable, and unlucky circumstances could even lead to a breakthrough of the stronghold.
This, undoubtedly, would become a blemish on the record.
Gory enjoyed life within the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Being an early member, he was now considered upper echelon, wielding significant power in Dragon Nest Tribe.
With the rapid expansion of the Dragon Nest Tribe, the former thought of escaping with a secret technique has long vanished.
What could he do upon returning to the Human World?
Continue being a mercenary with unpredictable future?
Better luck could lead to joining a duchy’s military, surviving countless near-deaths to earn military merit, and eventually some discerning noble lord noticing him, promoting him briefly before retiring him with a simple title once his value was spent.
This lifestyle was not what he wanted.
Compared to his status in the Dragon Nest Tribe, he wouldn’t give up everything to return to being a day-to-day mercenary.
As for his loyalty issue not being human-centric, that’s not a problem.
Many human stewards served Golden Giant Dragons in this world, and compared to them, his position in power was far superior.
Once the Dragon Nest Tribe expands and reaches the borders of the human race, there won’t be a lack of human companionship.
He, Gory, was not shortsighted.
"Attack! Hit them hard!"
As the Frost Giants closed in, Gory spit a mouthful and ordered loudly.
Instantly, goblin crossbows on all sides of the wall fired a volley of sharp arrows like lightning, piercing the Frost Giant’s skin, causing immediate cries of agony.
Simultaneously, the Dragon Nest Legion within the wall started striking out.
War erupted with a roar!
As the battle raged violently,
At this moment, on the glacial plateau.
The strong Frost Giant leader Albuda stood on high, observing everything unfolding on the battlefield below.
"Master Albuda, the sniffer dogs say, the little folk tribe beneath the glacier belongs to a blue dragon in the southwest. Wouldn’t our direct assault anger that blue dragon?"
At this time, a Frost Giant warrior behind him voiced a question.
"No big deal, just a little blue dragon after all. Augustus, have you forgotten our ancestors who defeated the white dragons living on the glacier and conquered them as our backyard dogs!"
"If that blue dragon dared to come for revenge, so be it, I’m tired of raising white dragon pets, time for a blue dragon dog!"
The voice boomed like thunder, reverberating through the air.
Albuda swung his Bone Hammer twice, his voice filled with haughty disdain.

chapters.title: Chapter 372 - 43: Fierce Battle (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 372: Chapter 43: Fierce Battle (First Update)
Albuda naturally has his reasons for pride.
The Frost Giants, although not blessed with the Legendary Bloodline of the Dragon Race, are still considered one of the top Extraordinary Bloodlines.
Especially in the growth of young Frost Giants, it is filled with coldness and cruelty.
From the moment they are born, after their first feeding, Frost Giant infants are thrown outside to face the natural baptism of the glacial winds.
Their parents remain indifferent to the cries of the babies.
Only those who survive until the next day qualify to live within the tribe.
This cruel selection among the Frost Giant tribe, even though they have a natural high resistance to ice and snow, still results in a high mortality rate among newborn Frost Giant infants under such brutal natural selection, with only one out of five surviving.
Such a harsh selection process is due to both tradition and the scarcity of food on the Glacial Plateau, forcing the Frost Giants to act this way.
Through this fierce survival of the fittest, the surviving Frost Giant infants are the most gifted and will grow to become the strongest warriors.
However, passing the first hurdle of birth does not guarantee a stable life going forward.
The growth of the Frost Giants is filled with bloodshed and battles, from childhood to maturity.
In childhood, they learn combat techniques under the supervision of their parents, sparring with peers of the same age.
In their youth, they must venture into the depths of the ice fields alone.
They must battle against nature, hunting a powerful Magic Beast as their coming of age ceremony.
Having endured such cruel experiences, countless strong individuals and numerous legends emerge within the Frost Giant tribe.
Though not like the Dragon Race, who become legendary upon reaching adulthood,
The battle prowess of the battle-hardened Frost Giants is terrifying!
How could the Dragon Race, who rely on their bloodline to automatically ascend to legendary status without much fierce combat, compete with them?
Many years ago, the Glacial Plateau spanning thousands of miles to the north was originally a gathering place for a group of White Dragons.
But now, the Frost Giants have become the rulers of these lands.
It was the King of Frost Giants, once living in the barren icy corners, who led the tribe to seize survival space on the highland glaciers, pushing the scattered White Dragons into retreat.
Some newly born White Dragon hatchlings were captured and tamed, becoming pets like dogs.
The Dragon Race is proud.
Even among their kin, they do not compromise on this pride.
This pride makes them solitary creatures, only coming together for mating and nurturing offspring, or with the establishment of a family system by an Ancient Dragon—otherwise, herds of Giant Dragon Species are unseen.
Most Dragon Race members prefer solitude.
This habit disperses their strength, making it difficult to consolidate.
In reality, if the White Dragons on the Glacial Plateau were to unite, they wouldn’t be oppressed by the Frost Giants. A cohesive tribe wouldn’t be driven into the corners after years of war.
But alas, such is the nature of dragons.
Even if White Dragon hatchlings are enslaved by Frost Giants, unless faced by extreme racial purists, no dragon seeks trouble from these Frost Giants unless they are kin.
Moreover, the power of the Frost Giants isn’t weak.
Thus, despite the Dragon Race having one of the top-tier bloodlines in the Prime Material Plane, they remain suppressed on the Glacial Plateau, consistently retreating during conflicts and wars.
For centuries, the Frost Giants have maintained an upper hand over the White Dragons due to their numbers and formidable combat power.
Albuda’s tribe has also been summoned by the King of Frost Giants to deal with White Dragons.
They hold little awe for the Dragon Race, emboldened by centuries of victories.
What is there to fear from a single Blue Dragon!
...
At this moment, outside the stronghold.
"Charge! Crush them! Seize all their food!"
The Frost Giants shouted loudly. Their footsteps created thunderous sounds, causing the earth to tremble as if mountains and seas were collapsing.
Heavy crossbow arrows shot out from the corners of the city walls, each penetrating the Frost Giant’s skin, spraying blood.
These heavy crossbows, redesigned by the goblins in the manufacturing workshop and infused with enchantment techniques from the Elf Kingdom, possessed demon-breaking capabilities.
Previously, these heavy crossbows were used to aid in hunting Giant Beasts and for defense around the city’s stronghold.
Though now, the raiding Frost Giants felt the power of these heavy crossbows.
"Damn it! Destroy those heavy crossbows!"
A giant roared, their voice shaking the heavens.
The Frost Giants, towering at least twenty or thirty meters high like buildings.
The penetrative force of the demon-breaking heavy crossbows is strong; unless they strike the head, such injuries aren’t fatal enough for them.
But the pain is inevitable.
"Roar!!!"
A giant roared, casually uprooting a boulder several meters long from the ground, and hurled it toward the heavy crossbows on the stronghold defenses.
Bang!
A section of the simple defensive wall collapsed, and the heavy crossbow atop it was completely destroyed.
"Ura! Ura!"
The Frost Giants roared, their morale soaring.
"All officers, take note, our enemies are not those brainless Giant Beasts! Have the army hold them off; Junior Officers and Officers, unleash your full power, kill them!"
With one heavy crossbow destroyed, Gory looked grim.
The stronghold defense had prepared a total of ten heavy crossbows, and now with one destroyed, only nine remained.
The resources required for each heavy crossbow are immense.
The losses were heavy.
Thankfully, aside from one Frost Giant finding a boulder, there were no more throwable objects.
Braving the powerful penetrative force, the Frost Giants charged forward.
Like an avalanched flood, they neared the stronghold.
"Charge! For the great His Highness Austin!"
The Dragon Nest Legion charged out.
A brutal melee ensued instantly.
The Frost Giants wielded massive weapons, crushing a row of Dragon Nest soldiers into pulp with each hit.
Even though the Beastman soldiers wore Fine Steel Armor, under this terrifying power, it provided no defense, being crushed into a lump of metal along with their flesh.
The ferocious battles turned rivers into blood.
Yet the sacrifice of the melee soldiers wasn’t in vain. Within the stronghold, arrows rained down on the Frost Giants like a storm.
Meanwhile, as the Frost Giants swung their weapons, drained of old strength and lacking new, a group of Beastman Officers leapt into the air. White Fighting Qi flickered with sharp light on their weapons, suspended above, flashing around the Frost Giants.

chapters.title: Chapter 373 - 044: Frozen Cold Wave (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 373: Chapter 044: Frozen Cold Wave (Second Update)
Silhouettes tread the air, instantly flickering to the side of the Frost Giants.
Weapons imbued with sharp Fighting Qi whirl and spin in the air freely, each blade edge sharp enough to cut through the air, slicing open massive wounds on the Frost Giants’ bodies.
Their massive bodies grant the Frost Giants unimaginable power,
but at the same time, their enormous size hampers their swift movement.
Faced with the Beastman Officers stepping upon the air, moving with the speed of instant teleportation, the Frost Giants’ reactions can only be described as sluggish.
"Damn flies!"
One Frost Giant, under the assault of the Beastman Junior Officers, finds its body covered in open wounds, drenched in blood, suffering severe injuries.
That Frost Giant goes berserk, wildly swinging its weapon in the air, the howl of the wind stirring the air like a hurricane tsunami.
It wants to kill all these fly-like little beings!
The Frost Giant swings its weapon with a force like mountains crashing in waves, the powerful energy smashing down on the ground, causing the very earth to crack open.
The enormous Bone Hammer carries unimaginable power; even ten or more officers combined can’t withstand it.
Yet, it’s too slow!
Both the speed of the attacks and the obvious swings before an attack are sensed in advance by the Beastman Officers, avoiding them.
In their rage, the Frost Giants strike wildly; the heavens and earth shatter, and rocks shoot out like bullets.
The officers swiftly weave through the air, occasionally delivering fierce slashes that instantly slice through the Frost Giant’s skin, tearing and severing its enormous tendons.
Its hand tendons severed, hands hanging limp, and the tendons at the back of its heels severed, it staggers and kneels onto the ground.
Bleeding profusely, it roars in anger but its breath weakens to the extreme.
Finally, when a powerful Beastman Junior Officer swoops in with a flash of light, slicing through and removing the Frost Giant’s two eyes with a single strike,
that Frost Giant is completely rendered useless.
But it’s not over yet; in the distance, Gory leaps forward, shooting out like a missile.
In mid-air, the whole body transforms into a rapidly spinning blade, slicing through the void in an instant, spinning rapidly along a graceful arc to the back of the Frost Giant’s head.
With razor-sharp Fighting Qi clinging to the longsword, it slides effortlessly along the gap between the Frost Giant’s cervical vertebrae as if cutting through butter, causing the gigantic head on its massive body to suddenly fall off.
The immensely powerful Frost Giant is beheaded in a matter of moments!
And this is just a corner of the battlefield.
The Beastman Legion serves as the main force to attract attention, while arrows rain down from the sky, and Beastman Transcendents hidden around seek opportunities to inflict heavy damage on their foes.
Brutal!
This is an incredibly brutal battle!
The Dragon Nest Beastman Legion sacrifices their flesh and blood, using their lives to pin down the Frost Giants head-on.
Meanwhile, the Frost Giants suffer grievous wounds under the attacks of the wet-behind-the-ears officers, as if experiencing a thousand cuts.
Occasionally, a companion’s head is cleaved open from behind,
decapitating them.
At this moment, the Frost Giants likely did not expect that attacking a mere Dwarf tribe, which seemed like easy prey at first, would end with them hitting a rock, suffering severe blows and injuries.
"Damn dwarves! Crush them!"
The Frost Giants go into a frenzy.
In just one encounter, their comrades are more than half damaged, and the sight of the injured comrades is horrifying.
Despite everything, there are Frost Giants who step forward, directly advancing towards the stronghold.
Stepping over the Dragon Nest Legion below, their immense power shakes the void, exploding the wall with a resounding crash.
One after another, Frost Giants rush into the stronghold with just a few strides, causing massive destruction.
Houses collapse, and flames ignite from unknown origins, beginning to spread in all directions.
"Damn it!"
Seeing those few Frost Giants rush into the stronghold wreaking havoc, Gory, the highest-ranking officer in charge of the Seventh Stronghold, gazes with bloodshot eyes.
However, the pressure on the battlefield intensifies with the Frost Giants’ rampage, making it impossible to offer support.
In their fury, the Frost Giants’ destructive power escalates to another level.
Within a radius of several miles, one can’t see an intact piece of ground, the surrounding cracks spreading widely, and the earth pockmarked, caving in.
The Dragon Nest Legion, amidst this ground-shaking upheaval, struggles to maintain formation.
Dust rises to the sky, shaking to the heavens, staining half the sky with ochre.
Gory grips the Great Sword, flashing swiftly and rotating through the air, deftly cleaving another careless Frost Giant with his formidable Great Sword.
He strikes once again, slashing down another!
Yet, surrounding him, the Frost Giants remain plentiful.
Gory is about to move out, to hunt those inattentive Frost Giants on the battlefield.
At that moment, a huge shadow suddenly envelops him, powerful oppressive force rolls in like a tsunami, as if the entire sky behind him has collapsed!
"Damn insect, daring to kill my subordinates, you’re courting death!"
BOOM!
A mighty sound like thunder rumbles through the void, the sound waves turning into a tangible storm sweeping through the air.
Gory, under the impact of this terrifying aura, stumbles, nearly tumbling off the Frost Giant’s corpse.
"What!"
Looking up, he sees a giant twice the size of an ordinary Frost Giant appearing in front of him, its massive body blocking the high sky, casting a dark abyssal shadow over everything.
"Die for me!"
A gigantic bone club swings down from the high sky, azure light gleaming, nearly illuminating half the sky.
"No way!!!"
Vast ice attribute magic power condenses on the bone club, the surrounding air seemingly about to freeze.
Gory can clearly sense that once this tremendous power erupts, it will affect the surrounding environment!
No time to think, Gory instantly flashes away.
BOOM!!!
The bone club, as massive as a hill, crashes down from the sky, azure light blossoms high above like a vast sea tide, enveloping the void.
At that moment, Gory, still horizontally sweeping through the air, feels as if time itself is frozen by the extreme cold, thoughts stagnating.
CRASH!
Amidst clear, resonant clashes, ice crystals spread across the ground, alongside bursts of azure light, sweeping out in all directions.
The frost current rushes forth, and even the Dragon Nest Beastmen Soldiers are affected by the unbearable cold.
Yet this frost current sweeping through the entire encampment barely affects the Frost Giants on the battlefield!
It’s a nightmare!
"My tribesmen! Crush them for me!"
Albuda hefts the Bone Hammer back onto his shoulder, roaring orders to the Frost Giants on the field.
And at this moment,
affected by the Frost Cold Current, the Dragon Nest Legion side finds even the powerful Beastman Transcendents’ actions and thoughts severely delayed by the cold.
The entire Seventh Stronghold is on the brink of defeat and destruction!

chapters.title: Chapter 374 - 045 Critical (First Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 374: Chapter 045 Critical (First Update)
Under the azure halo, the cold currents howled, and the Dragon Nest soldiers were all oppressed by this ubiquitous icy airflow.
But in the same battlefield, the Frost Giants, who had lived on the plateau since childhood, were not affected at all; instead, they thrived in this cold tide.
The originally stalemated and brutal slaughter scenes suddenly leaned towards the Frost Giants.
"Ice Law! Damn, this is a Half-Legendary power!"
Gory flew through the air, his forehead covered in sweat.
Centered on Albuda, the azure Magic Power spread out, gathering into a cold current that impacted the Celestial Secret Aura, as if dragging the entire world into a cold winter.
Only the power of Laws can change the celestial phenomena of a land!
"Only a Half-Legendary can fight a Half-Legendary, but His Highness Austin is still in secluded meditation and sleep; the Dragon Nest Tribe simply cannot resist!"
For a moment, numerous thoughts surged into Gory’s mind, countless ideas flashing through his heart.
His Heart Spirit was chaotic.
Facing the Frost Giants, the Dragon Nest Tribe was already at a disadvantage.
Now, adding a Half-Legendary level Frost Giant leader made it impossible to continue the fight!
"At present, the only option is to retreat!"
At that moment, Gory had already made up his mind.
But would the opponent let them go so easily?
Rumble!!!
Under the suppression of the Frost Cold Current, the Frost Giants began the massacre of the Dragon Nest Legion.
The enormous power wielded whipped up winds in the air, shattering the earth and soil.
A vast number of the Beastman Legion perished under the swings of these Frost Giants, without the slightest ability to resist.
"Damn it!"
Watching the one-sided battlefield, Gory’s eyes bulged, almost tearing apart.
But on a battlefield of this level, he was utterly powerless!
"Ula Ula! Kill them all!"
The Frost Giant leader Albuda roared loudly, his voice resounding to the heavens.
On the battlefield, the Frost Giants became excited, showing ferocious expressions.
"Ula Ula!"
Each Frost Giant roared to the sky, their enormous voices seeming to shake even the heavens and earth.
No one could survive after killing their comrades.
Among the Frost Giant community, although internal strife was fierce, they were extremely united when facing outsiders.
This was precisely why the Frost Giants could dominate the entire Frozen Plateau, driving away the White Dragons that previously resided here.
This battle,
Those comrades who seemed to face a thousand cuts and slashes, the bodies of relatives and friends whose heads were directly chopped off, still lay on the ground, reminding them.
Such heavy casualties, the Frost Giants would not believe the war’s responsibility lay with them.
I come to take your things, and you dare to resist instead of obediently offering all your food?
In the end, causing such severe losses to the tribe!
Revenge, revenge is a must!
Even during the war against the White Dragons, the Frost Giants had never suffered such painful casualties.
Only the bloodiest revenge on this tribe can showcase the majesty of the Frost Giants to the outside world!
"Don’t let a single dwarf escape; kill them all, use their blood to memorialize our fallen kin!"
Albuda’s voice roared to the sky, filled with a landslide of murderous intent.
On the battlefield, the remaining Frost Giants responded loudly, wielding their gigantic weapons to crush the Dragon Nest Legion, immobilized by the cold current.
Flesh and blood flew, shaking the earth and mountains!
Accompanied by the Frost Giants’ sinister laughter, Dragon Nest soldiers continued to die.
"It’s over!"
Watching the Frost Giants rampaging through the army formations, Gory’s face showed despair.
The enemy’s strength was simply unstoppable.
Moreover, the other side clearly had no intention of sparing prisoners, determined to wipe them out completely.
The entire Dragon Nest Tribe outpost fell into a state of terrible despair.
"Warriors of the tribe, lay down our lives for the great His Highness Austin!"
Since there was only one path to death, they would stake their last breath to leave a profound lesson for the opponent!
Gory was the first to charge forward, battling the Frost Giants.
With Gory’s rallying call, the remaining Dragon Nest Tribe soldiers reignited their fervor.
Even at the cost of their lives, they would tear a piece of flesh from the enemy!
The desperate counterattack of the Dragon Nest Tribe soldiers immediately inflicted certain casualties on the Frost Giants.
That kind of readiness to die, ignoring life and death, caused great trouble for the Frost Giants.
"Hmph, a futile struggle!"
The Frost Giant leader Albuda coldly snorted, like thunder exploding in the air, shaking the void.
Including Gory, all the Dragon Nest soldiers felt a tremor in their hearts; the cold snort seemed to emanate from the depths of their souls, causing them to groan, almost spitting out blood.
But it wasn’t over yet,
Albuda, the Frost Giant leader, took a step forward,
In an instant,
The earth abruptly cracked and sank, layers of soil collapsing under an invisible force.
Azure radiance swept towards all directions like a tidal wave.
That extreme cold turned into a tangible torrent.
Wherever it passed, layers of ice covered the earth and soil, as if the entire world was enveloped in ice.
Gory was also sealed within a layer of ice.
Albuda, carrying the massive Bone Hammer on his shoulder, approached Gory, who was covered in ice.
"An ant is always an ant. If you dare wave your arms at the Giant Dragon in the sky, you must be prepared to be crushed to pieces! With your unwillingness, repent in Hell for me!"
The massive Bone Hammer lifted high, smashing down on Gory, frozen and unable to move!
In his pupils, the enormous Bone Hammer gradually expanded, obscuring the sky.
At that moment, just before death, countless thoughts flashed through Gory’s mind.
From his birth, inheriting power from the elders in his youth, then journeying outside, eventually becoming a mercenary, and now holding a high position with authority...
It’s rumored that before one dies, they will see the most important things in their life.
So, what was the most important thing to him?
Suddenly, in Gory’s mind appeared the noble figure he saw in his childhood, followed by some mercenary comrades, then a person he parted with at some point, and finally, himself standing in front of countless gazes.
Finally, there was a towering shadow blocking the sky.
At that moment, he suddenly understood.
In this moment of impending death, he finally saw his true inner self.

chapters.title: Chapter 375 - 046: The Grand Ideal of a Small Person (Second Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 375: Chapter 046: The Grand Ideal of a Small Person (Second Update)
For a long time, deep within Gory’s heart, there lay a profound confusion.
Why was he willing to stay in this Barbaric Land, willing to fight alongside the Dragon Nest Tribe, rather than returning to the Human World?
Was it for status, power?
No, in this deserted Barbaric Land where even humans are scarce, the so-called lofty power, leading a group of Beastmen, becoming a Commander among them, is a joke.
Nobility, power, status, honor... these things only hold meaning in front of one’s kin, only in the Central Earth Human World.
Even if he commanded an army of Beastmen, what difference was it from claiming kingship before monkeys?
All along, Gory was self-hypnotizing.
If he returned to the Human World, he would lose everything he currently possessed, continuing his life as a drifting Mercenary.
Even if he relied on extraordinary strength, fortunately achieving merit on the battlefield, and was luckily noticed by a higher-level noble, if his merits were not completely stripped away, he might retain a small part to become a petty noble in a remote area, ultimately establishing a family lineage using the secret techniques learned from the Dragon Nest Tribe.
Compared to now, with authority in hand and a position of leading an army, he didn’t want to go back to that life of harsh struggle with an unknown future.
He believed that was what he truly wanted, so he stayed with the Dragon Nest Tribe, not seeking an opportunity to escape, but striving for the growth and development of the tribe.
Yet at this moment, as life was reaching its end.
Gory finally saw through all appearances and saw his true heart.
Because of fairness and equality!
Within the Dragon Nest Tribe, he experienced a fairness and equality of personhood that he had never felt before, which did not exist in the continent’s mainstream!
...
As a child, in tattered clothes, Gory knelt by the roadside, his head pressed into the dirt, waiting respectfully as the high and mighty noble was escorted by servants and passed through the center of the road with his grand horse-drawn carriage.
It was then that a seed was planted in his heart.
Later, he learned the Breathing Technique from a retired old man in the village, and during conversations, learned that the old man had once been a minor civilian officer in a Duchy, who had made significant contributions in war.
But eventually, because he was a civilian without any backing, his merits were directly stolen by a noble officer, and he was instead accused of greedily seeking personal glory, stripped of his officer position, and demoted to an ordinary soldier.
Furious, the old man left the army, later becoming a Mercenary to make a living, and finally retiring to his hometown to live out his final years.
At that time, young Gory once again felt that suffocating power on his shoulders.
Unknowingly, the seed planted within him began to sprout.
Later on,
Gory accepted the old man’s letter of recommendation and went to the city to make a living, becoming a Mercenary himself.
During his mercenary career, his horizons broadened, and he saw more of the world.
A noble youth, on a bad day, galloping horse down the street, accidentally killing a child on the roadside.
An old farmer, who worked diligently all his life but, in the end, lost everything because he could not pay taxes, forced to beg at the street corner.
A former mercenary companion, fortunate enough to be recruited as a servant by a noble lord, yet beaten to death with clubs as the family pillar because the young master accidentally injured his hand during play.
From childhood to adulthood, all these experiences gave Gory an innate ambition.
He wanted to become a noble, to be part of the ruling class, to be above the common people!
But this path was too difficult.
So, when Gory was captured by the Dragon Nest Tribe, when he saw the powerful secret techniques within the tribe, he was willing to stay, hoping to acquire those powerful secret techniques as a stepping stone to becoming a noble in the future.
However, amidst his constant efforts and struggles.
Some things had unknowingly begun to impact Gory’s heart.
Different Beastmen might have different talents.
Within the Dragon Nest Tribe, Beastmen also respected the strong.
But within this tribe, each Beastman was equal in terms of personhood!
No one would oppress you because you were born a Goblin, nor would anyone allow you to kill others with impunity because you were a Black Bear person of strong lineage.
Your achievements, no matter how humble your origins, would be recognized and praised by all.
Your mistakes, even if you were one of the founders, would be met with the same punishment.
In the Dragon Nest Tribe, Beastmen might differ in talent, strength, and position, but every Beastman living in this tribe was equal in terms of personhood!
"So, this is my true heart, unknowingly, I have completely integrated and identified with the Dragon Nest Tribe...."
Only those who have experienced hunger understand the importance of being well-fed.
Only a beast bound by chains knows the value of freedom.
And only someone who grew up in a world of "born inequality", constantly seeing nobles and privileged classes above the commoners, in a world full of cruelty and oppression,
Upon first encountering that deep-rooted fairness and equality would have Gory’s heart and soul completely captured, making him genuinely stay in the Dragon Nest Tribe, dedicating all his strength to its rise.
Austin would never have thought that some unconscious concepts cultivated during his previous life in a civilized modern world would have such a profound impact on Gory.
To him, fairness and equality.
In the training reconstruction before the Beastmen integrated into the Dragon Nest Tribe, these were concepts never deliberately nurtured, yet they were constantly penetrating into their daily training, deeply rooted in aspects of everyday life among the Beastmen of the Dragon’s Nest Tribe.
In Austin’s view, officers and soldiers eating and living together, clear rewards and punishments in the military, were very commonplace.
Yet, these modern thoughts unconsciously implemented throughout the tribe provided Gory with a world-shaking shock,
Also making Gory genuinely recognize the Dragon Nest Tribe he fought for.
These things, invisible even to Austin, inadvertently changed Gory’s entire life.
"I truly hope that one day the Dragon Nest flag could be planted in my homeland... Your Highness, I won’t be able to help you... achieve the grand mission..."
In a blur, time seemed to slow down.
Gory seemed to see that enormous Blue Dragon flag flying high in the sky.
Under that enormous flag, countless people gathered like a sea, wearing heartfelt smiles of happiness.
Covered in ice, Gory closed his eyes.
Accompanied by the roar of the Frost Giant leader Albuda, the massive Bone Hammer came crashing down!
At that moment,
Whoosh!
A circle of thunder suddenly appeared in the void behind the Frost Giant leader Albuda,
Initially the size of a basketball, it suddenly expanded and spread out in all directions with force.
A radiant brilliance rippled, a thunder-surrounded claw, as if probing from the Alternate Void, came crashing down from above!
"You speak well, dare an ant punch at a Sky Dragon? But who gave you the courage to provoke me?!"
Accompanied by a thunderous roar that echoed across the heavens, that sky-covering dragon claw seemed to come crossing realms from the Alternate Void and, while Albuda was caught off guard, grabbed his head and smashed it to the ground like a meteor!

chapters.title: Chapter 376 - 47: Massacre (Third Update)
chapters.content:
Chapter 376: Chapter 47: Massacre (Third Update)
Boom!!!
In the midst of a giant roar, Albuda’s massive head was suddenly slammed to the ground by a tremendous force.
Like a meteor crashing down, the earth shattered and collapsed, large swathes of soil were lifted into the air by the airflow.
Rip!
Dazzling electric light shot out in the void, tearing and shattering the rising giant clods.
At that moment, accompanied by the violent surge of energy flow.
The explosive power swept outward like a tsunami, and Gory felt himself caught in an unstoppable flood, the ice covering his body shattered instantly, tossed far away.
"This is!!!"
Gory, like a rag doll, fell to the ground, tumbling over several times.
However, he paid no attention to his injuries, his gaze firmly fixed on the sky.
At some point, the sky had been covered by thick and dark clouds, rolling layer upon layer, seemingly overturning the whole world.
Under the dim light of the sky, electric light blossomed in the void, slicing through the vacuum.
A gigantic shadow, as if covering the sky and hiding the sun.
In the midst of this encircling electric light, it appeared indistinctly, as if crossing over from another dimension, its very appearance threw the Celestial Secret Aura into chaos, stirring the celestial phenomena like tidal waves, threatening to shatter the entire sky!
The Frost Giant leader Albuda was directly pinned to the ground by a giant dragon claw, forced into a close encounter with the earth.
Electric arcs and firelight surrounded and shot out, the ruinous power erupted, shattering layers of earth and soil, unleashing a terrifying torrent impact, instantly causing Albuda’s head to bleed from his seven orifices under the overwhelming impact.
In a single moment, the Frost Giant leader Albuda was completely dazed.
His head, under this terrible power strike, seemed to turn into mush.
Austin’s iron claw, as if cast from steel, pressed on the Frost Giant leader’s head, its presence thunderous, under the backdrop of the violent energy, appearing like a Divine Demon descended to the mortal realm.
All the surrounding Frost Giants froze.
Completely unprepared by this sudden situation, not knowing how to react.
Austin’s authoritative gaze swept the surroundings,
At this moment, the stronghold had turned into ruins, the Dragon’s Nest army suffered heavy losses under the brutal assaults of the Frost Giants.
More Beastman soldiers left no bones behind under the Frost Giants’ attacks!
"You all are seeking death!"
Gazing at the severely damaged stronghold, an unprecedented fury exploded within his chest.
Since the establishment of the Dragon Nest Tribe, when had there been such a tragic loss!
In this Frost Giant’s assault alone, at least a thousand soldiers died under their attacks!
The unprecedentedly tragic battlefield completely ignited Austin’s wrath.
"Four Spirits Sword Array!"
Whoosh!
In the void, the immense energy from within the universe’s four poles suddenly ascended like great suns plunging into rivers.
Like four gigantic pillars supporting the sky, enveloping and encompassing the entire space.
Four Law Divine Swords rose from the void, instantly summoning the roar of wind and thunder, causing the void to tremble!
The entire world seemed sliced away into the outer realm by the space supported by the four Law Divine Swords!
An unimaginable majestic force erupted before the void, vibrating the heavens and earth like a violent tide.
What is this?!
The Frost Giants around looked around blankly.
In this disordered sensation of spatial division, all they felt was that the surrounding space seemed to have turned topsy-turvy.
Bewildered and at a loss.
At this moment,
Rip!
A subtle ripple of spatial fluctuation crossed the void, like an insect skimming over a calm lake, causing negligible ripples on the water’s surface, disappearing in a flash, entirely imperceptible.
Time and space seemed to freeze in that moment.
The next instant, all the Frost Giants engulfed within the Four Spirits Sword Array were severed like butter cut by a knife, falling apart piece by piece!
From Austin’s appearance to the explosion of the Four Spirits Sword Array, to the slaying of all Frost Giants, it was merely a matter of a breath; except for their leader Albuda, the attacking Frost Giants were completely annihilated!
This is one of the results of Austin’s two-year seclusion.
Absorbing all the essence of knowledge from the Martial Hero World, and undergoing certain imitation improvements to the system of this world, resulted in the extraordinarily powerful improved version of the Four Spirits Sword Array!
The invading Frost Giants, relying on their formidable Extraordinary Bloodline, had a cultivation level of at least Gold Level or above.
Add to that their massive size, a group of dozens, would gang up and kill even a Legendary Level giant dragon.
But at this moment, in front of Austin’s Four Spirits Sword Array, they were slain in a fleeting moment.
This does not mean that Austin’s power has surpassed the Legendary.
Instead, the improved version of the Four Spirits Sword Array, plus two years of accumulated power, has an almost massacre-like overwhelming effect against enemies with lower strength.
This is but one of the powers of the improved Four Spirits Sword Array!
At this moment, the Frost Giant leader, pinned under Austin’s feet, had just woken up from his stupor.
He witnessed the massacre of his tribe.
"Roar!!!"
His eyes bulged, bloodshot with rage, his mighty roar erupted with an unstoppable force like a mountainous avalanche.
The power unleashed in that instant, even Austin’s real body could not withstand!
The Frost Giant leader Albuda stood up like an ancient titan, roaring towards the sky, his deafening voice filled with blood-curdling despair.
"Damn reptile! You are courting death!!!"
The prime fighters of the tribe, utterly exterminated here.
This signifies that their tribe is about to vanish completely on the Glacial Plateau!
This is a mortal feud, a genocidal vendetta.
No one knows if there is regret in Albuda’s heart at this moment, but what fills his heart now is boundless killing intent!
An ice-blue halo bloomed, as if dragging the entire world into winter, shimmering ice spikes spread across the ground, extending in all directions, seemingly freezing and covering the whole world.
"Damn lizard! Die for me!"
Accompanied by an earth-shaking roar, the enormous bone hammer in hand shimmered with icy blue light, descending towards Austin like a hill.
Power surged like mountains overturning, stirring the void like raging torrents.
Austin sneered, spread his wings, and his giant figure soared into the sky.
In all directions of the sky, the phantoms of the Cyan Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Black Tortoise flashed and vanished, converging into heavenly light that connected heaven and earth, the four streams of light coalesced together.
Merging in the void, transforming into a world-splitting Sword Momentum, suspended beyond the heavens, crashing down on Albuda like a meteor from the sky!

chapters.title: Chapter 377 - 048 Annihilation
chapters.content:
Chapter 377: Chapter 048 Annihilation
BOOM BOOM BOOM!!!
Sword light surged violently, the void trembled like tides, as if the entire world were shaking.
Accompanied by the earth-shaking sword light crashing down, the condensed blue light also rose like a meteor, shooting skyward.
A needle point against a wheat awn!
Two vast energies collided in an instant.
For a moment, the world seemed to flicker.
The next moment,
BOOM!!!
The entire sky seemed to be ripped open by a huge hole, the sharp aura turning into long, deep cracks.
The layers of celestial phenomena in this space were shattered by the exploding energy, and the wild winds and dark clouds in the sky dissipated instantly!
However, in the next moment,
within this distorted space, akin to being sliced apart, terrifying energy erupted, waves of vast energy surged as if tearing apart the surrounding void, layer by layer.
The entire sky seemed to transform into a sea of raging energy, with terrifying energy shockwaves sweeping across the sky, centering on the point of collision.
On the ground, Albuda, the Frost Giant leader waving his giant fist skyward, felt an immense and boundless power coming from the bone hammer, as if about to crush him into smithereens.
Under such immense power, the surrounding earth shattered and collapsed, burying half of Albuda’s body in the soil.
Under the ripple of terrifying energy on the sky, it felt like the entire sky was pressing down on him, almost crushing him to pieces!
"Ahhhhh!!!"
Albuda roared wildly, his entire body burst with airflow, azure brilliance swept skyward, cold currents seemingly freezing and solidifying the surrounding space, stirring up a terrifying ice storm.
However,
Crack! Crack!
With the crisp sound of breaking, visible cracks suddenly surfaced on the massive bone hammer.
In Albuda’s horrified gaze, the cracks, like a spider web, quickly spread across the bone hammer made from the bones of an unknown magic beast, covering the entire hammer in mere moments!
"No!!!"
Only managing to leave behind his final words, the vast radiance pierced through the sky, shattering his weapon into countless fragments with unmatched might, fully engulfing the Frost Giant leader Albuda.
BOOM RUMBLE!!!
The terrifying explosion rippled, the momentum shaking the sky, as if the entire world was about to collapse and be annihilated by this sweeping tidal force!
The terrifying aftershocks lasted for quite some time, with the sword array space created by the Four Spirits Sword Array seeming to be cleaved apart, everything only returning to normal after some time.
As the power dissipated, Austin retracted the four subtly manifesting Law Divine Swords into his body.
With a shimmering brilliance, the Four Spirits Sword Array space disbanded, and the dust and smoke in the world scattered away with the gentle breeze.
Even with the spatial cutting and sealing, the aftershocks at most did not extend beyond the surroundings, yet in the center of the battlefield, the layers of earth were completely smashed and collapsed.
A massive crater stood silently, with soil and ground collapsing in a radius of several hundred meters, and the edges of the crater stretching out like canyons.
This is the true power possessed by the Four Spirits Sword Array!
Before traversing the Martial Hero World, the Four Spirits Sword Array created by Austin was merely a simple application of the Law Power echoing among themselves, like primitive people picking up simple stone tools from the ground as instruments.
However, after experiencing decades in the Martial Hero World, Austin established the Mystical Fantasy Xianxia Dao, gaining an extremely profound understanding of arrays.
Particularly when, on that occasion, to upgrade the world, they directly used the landscape and earth veins as array materials, swallowing the vast energy in the starry sky to transform and enhance the world’s Primordial Qi concentration, achieving the world upgrade result.
Such earth-shattering means demonstrate the depth of understanding Austin has achieved in the art of arrays.
Despite returning to the Main World, due to world laws, many aspects cannot be used.
However, whether it’s Magic Power or Primordial Power, their relationship is comparable to the relationship between Spiritual Power and Divine Sense.
Even if the system’s powers are different, they are common in certain directions.
After two years of seclusion, Austin has successfully absorbed all the gains from the Martial Hero World, completing the transformation of the relationship between the two.
And the Four Spirits Sword Array also received a fundamental enhancement.
Now, under the improved version of the Four Spirits Sword Array, its power is so immense that with just a flick of a hand, it can annihilate an entire Frost Giant clan, and even slay a Frost Giant leader at the peak of Half-Legendary in a single strike.
The Frost Giant clan that attacked this time possessed enough power to besiege a mature White Dragon.
Yet under the Four Spirits Sword Array, they still turned to ash with ease.
This powerful means are something Austin could not have achieved before he modified the Four Spirits Sword Array after traversing the Martial Hero World.
Gazing at the devastated scene ahead, the remaining Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers stood dumbfounded, staring blankly at everything before them.
This overwhelming power, even an army of over ten thousand would be of no use!
According to legends, once one crosses the Legendary Boundary, they rise high above the clouds, soaring above the mundane world!
Now it seems, even if there is a gap, it is not far off.
"This is the power of Law; could it be that His Highness has already advanced to Legendary..."
Gory gazed at the enormous figure, his expression dazed.
Whether it was due to being frightened from narrowly escaping death or being shocked by Austin’s incomparably powerful force, he wouldn’t know.
"His Highness Austin is indeed a dragon capable of accomplishing great undertakings."
Back when mercenaries attacked the Dragon Nest Tribe, they saw the dangers the Dragon Nest Tribe posed.
At that time, Austin’s level cultivation was only around gold.
Who could have thought that in just a few short years, he would reach such heights!
This is simply an anomaly.
Not to mention the Dragon Race; even from the perspective of short-lived humans, this level of progress is considered incredible.
"You’re called Gory, right? Faced with enemies far stronger than yourselves, your performance was commendable. Clean up the battlefield, relay the message back to the tribe, gather support and endurance, properly bury fallen comrades, and finally gather all operable soldiers. Dare to destroy my tribe, I shall give them a profound lesson!"
Just as Gory was in a daze, a powerful voice sounded like thunder in his ears.
Gory immediately stood upright, saluting.
"Yes, Your Highness!"
Then, Gory turned away, starting to direct the remaining Beastman soldiers in cleaning up the devastating battlefield.
Given the degree of damage to the base, it looks like it will take at least half a year to rebuild.
Watching Gory depart, directing the Beastman soldiers to clean up the remnants of the battlefield,
Austin turned around, flew down, and landed in the center of the crater.
At the center, a band of azure ice was gently swirling, emanating a cold blue light...

chapters.title: Chapter 378 - 049: Assault into the Den
chapters.content:
Chapter 378: Chapter 049: Assault into the Den
Crystal clear, the azure ice band congealed from ice shards slowly rotates in the void.
Its lush greenness makes one feel as if they are beholding the most beautiful thing in the world.
However, if one assumes it’s harmless just because it’s beautiful, they would be gravely mistaken.
Ripples, visible to the naked eye, waver in the void.
These faint yet visible shock waves are signs that the surrounding space is also congealing.
Frost Law Origin!
Not just a trace, but over eighty percent of the Frost Law Origin.
The Frost Giant leader’s level cultivation was already at the pinnacle of legendary, with only a slight distance from the gates of being legendary.
It is for this reason that the Frost Law Origin comprehended by Albuda has reached over eighty percent.
If it were any other half-legendary powerhouse, after killing their opponent, the law origin left behind would usually dissipate into the world unless captured by special means or containers.
But Austin is different; he can not only devour the exposed law directly but also refine it for his own use.
His enormous body lightly lands in the center of the crater, without stirring much wind.
Facing the Frost Law Origin hovering before him.
He swallowed it in one gulp.
Crunch crunch...
Like a cold front freezing over, visible ice blocks spread across his body, enveloping most of Austin.
In that instant, Austin felt as though his mouth and tongue were numb, frozen without any sensation.
However, he didn’t mind.
Within his body, Magic Power circulated.
Under the massive refining of Magic Power, the Frost Law Origin slowly integrated into his body.
About half an hour later, there were basically no more issues.
To fully refine it would take some time, but as of now, it wouldn’t affect any of Austin’s actions.
Another law power added to his arsenal.
Although it didn’t seem particularly useful at the moment, having it was better than not.
Thinking about it.
The initially refined frost law was activated, a cold current spewing from his mouth, glowing with an azure hue, the air seemingly frozen and solidified.
Splash!
Amidst the crisp, clear sound, the ground ahead was covered with a layer of white frost under the spew of the cold current, spreading across a hundred-meter range, ice blocks forming and turning that fan-shaped area into solid permafrost.
Looking at the frost-frozen ground ahead, Austin felt reasonably satisfied.
Though, for now, he couldn’t think of its method of attack.
But regardless, being able to wield an additional law origin is always good.
At least, in the hot and humid Kawa Great Forest, sometimes when it’s too hot, it can serve as an air conditioner to cool down his lair.
While Austin was digesting the Frost Law, Gory, along with the remaining beastmen soldiers, had almost cleared up the battlefield.
The injured comrades were rescued first, and a space not yet destroyed was cleared, serving as a simple infirmary for basic care.
Then came the countless corpses on the battlefield.
Due to the colossal size and immense power of the Frost Giant, many soldiers were utterly defenseless, their armor smashed flat, let alone their fleshy bodies.
The casualties were heavy.
As they cleaned up the battlefield, there was an air of heaviness among the beastman soldiers.
Due to Austin’s influence, the Dragon’s Nest Army bore traces of his previous life’s military.
Unity, cooperation, and a deep bond among comrades,
The camaraderie among Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers was unmatched by any army of this era.
Even Austin could feel the profound sadness among them.
The unexpected joy of obtaining a trace of Frost Law Origin vanished without a trace.
In a heavyhearted mood, they cleared the bodies, and under Austin’s supervision, they conducted a solemn burial for the deceased soldiers.
After that, the revenge began.
Though the invading frost giants had been slain by Austin, the hatred could not simply disappear.
The invading frost giants, regardless of gender, were all main forces of adulthood.
This indicated that remnants of this tribe still existed on the Glacial Plateau.
This attack led to the near-collapse of the seventh stronghold, with over half of ten thousand Dragon Nest Beastmen lost—you can’t just let it slide without retaliation!
Moreover, for the seventh stronghold to establish itself, frost giants nearby couldn’t be allowed to take root again.
Thus, after the burial and a brief night’s rest,
Austin led the remaining forces straight to the Glacial Plateau!
The thin oxygen on the Glacial Plateau, the biting cold wind, could not halt the steps of vengeance.
Finally, after half a day’s search, the Beastman Officer under his command found the Frost Giant Tribe located under the Glacier Mountain.
Without any hesitation, Austin led the Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers to assault the Frost Giant Tribe.
It’s clear that during the attack on the seventh stronghold, this Frost Giant Tribe had gone all out, with all the young and strong buried under Austin’s Four Spirits Sword Array.
All that was left were a group of frost giant cubs, some middle-aged frost giant women tending the children, and an injured young frost giant.
Besides that, there were a few young white dragons, minds wiped by unknown means by the frost giants, losing their stature and greatly weakened, reduced to near beasts.
As well as some clans living nearby subdued by the frost giants: snow wolves and ice wolves.
This bit of strength was nowhere near enough in Austin’s eyes.
For this reason, this ambush came without any unexpected setbacks.
Under Austin’s formidable power, the remaining scant resistance of the Frost Giant Tribe was directly suppressed.
After Austin annihilated the resisting young frost giants with thunderous might, the remaining frost giants, and those captive clans and white dragons, were taken prisoner without resistance, their expressions filled with immense terror.
During this period, it wasn’t without defiant frost giant cubs, but after Austin executed the two most unruly ones with swift ferocity, the rest completely surrendered.
This group of surrendered elders and children—they wouldn’t be killed for now.
But they also wouldn’t be entirely forgiven.
As relatives of those who attacked the stronghold, their future lies in offering their strength under the Dragon Nest Tribe’s oppression, repaying their family’s crimes in full before earning the right to freedom.
Under the hateful gazes of the Dragon Nest Beastmen soldiers, these elder and young frost giants, with their hands and heads tied to ropes, were strung together and began their journey down the mountain.
The young white dragons, stripped of their intelligence and reduced to beasts, along with the reliance clans, were also captured, following behind.
As the captives departed,
Austin ventured into the Frost Giant Tribe, searching for anything of value.
